author: Enrique G. Cruz
title: Echo "no" show?
content: Has potential . I believe with future firmware upgrades will make this device more reliable and usable. I guess for me the main disappoint for me is the fact their is very little video content. That's whole reason behind adding a screen to this device is to be able to view video content. No youtube support and videos they do have are not the best. You do have access to movies if you have prime but that's only if your subscribed to the service. The audio is better but not by much. Don't expect to fill the room with bass because it's not what's it's meant for.  Overall I can't complain too much as I got this device when it was on sale at 149.00,. I think at its normal price of over 200.00 is really overpriced for what it can do. I say stick to the next generation echo and wait for the 2nd generation show to make its debut.

author: steve
title: Looks a little dated but we are very happy with it
content: We like it very much so far it's been our expectations we kind of wish it was a little more of a modern design it seems a little bulky and clunky but other than that it is a nice device and seems to work well

author: Michael H. Charles
title: A good product that will get better
content: All things considered, I think it’s a great product. I would like a way to learn how to use it better, as well as all of the echo products. I would like it to be able to connect to my phone and show videos that I’m looking at on my phone, but I haven’t figured out if that’s possible. I think as things improve these will be really excellent products for use around the home.

author: Denny Thomas
title: The digital assistant is truly amazing once you enable the skills necessary for your personal ...
content:
The Amazon Echo Show is a must have in your house. The digital assistant is truly amazing once you enable the skills necessary for your personal liking.

I do agree with some reviews that the inability to access YouTube and a web browser is disappointing. But that's doesn't take away from the unlimited abilities that the Amazon Echo Show provide.

The skills are unlimited and there being created all the time. No one has all of the answers during  course of their day, family and kids.

The Amazon Echo Show certainly supports a family or personal use in the manner and it's a source of enjoyable entertainment.

The drop in feature is a little intrusive, if you don't want people from your contact list or other Amazon Echo Show owners on your list to drop in without warning. However, your able to turn that feature off.

As with any electronics, do your research online about the unlimited ability of Amazon Echo Show, so that you're able to fully enjoy and understand the intricacies that make this digital assistant a must have in your home.

author: Happy
title: Echo Show - Black
content:
i wrote a review within hours of opening the box. I was sent an email to review the product but when I sent it, it bounced back saying the product was not out yet. So here was my review:
  Echo Show arrived late afternoon. Played with it all evening and spent the evening having the device read one of the books in my library. I could not figure out how to get news from Los Angeles. The only news it would deliver was NPR from Washington D.C. Was really looking for an update on local fires. I am sure I will figure it out.
  Like the changing background and the notification sound when I speak. Setup was very simple. I am going to setup the second unit in the kitchen. The kitchen has an area with a desk and work area, so this will be a perfect spot for recipes while in the kitchen and music or homework help while at the desk. This is a definite 5 star out of the box.
  It has been a week now, and I love this thing even more. It reads my Audible books, gives me the news, keeps my market list, sets my alarms and so much more. Don't know how I lived without it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Another great device from Amazon - wish it could do more - and perhaps it soon will
content: I am a big fan of Amazon's gadgets.  Have owned Echo devices for several years.  So I was thrilled that a screen has been added.  So far though, I haven't found enough content that utilizes the screen in such a way that it makes this 5 stars.  The ability to video chat with other Echo Show or Alexa App owners is nice, as is watching Amazon content, and I gave it an extra star for those capabilities.  Having some issues with it pulling up my calendar when I ask it to show my calendar.  But if I ask what my next appointment is, the display will show a scroll of my calendar events.  These little quirks will get resolved but it is a little frustrating.  Would also love ability to watch ESPN via a subscription or live morning news while in the kitchen or getting ready in the morning.  Either I haven't figured out how to do that, or it isn't able to  - yet.  And that is why I love the Echo products.  The possibilities are exciting.  The price point is worth the exploring and taking the journey.

author: O'Leary
title: Received this as a Christmas gift and was very excited ...
content:
Received this as a Christmas gift and was very excited. However it does not have English Canada as an option, so I used USA option.

It will not allow me to find any skills as it says I have the incorrect language for my country set, but I can’t change it because it is not an option in settings. I could not set up
My echo dot for the same reason.

It will tell me the time and date, the weather, answer the questions it shows on the screen as suggestions, and that is about it. It keeps telling me to bs into settings and set the correct language.

Very frustrating to say the least.

author: Glen Verber
title: At best okay
content:
No service without prime.
With prime limited,
But Amazon will let you spend more money.
Alexa doesn't respond properly 25% of the time to the simple command STOP.
All in, nice for an old man that lives alone, usually time to get to some music.
However you are better off setting something up with you tube if you are young and smart.

author: Ed Hammond
title: Sweet screen, but sound quality could be better
content:
Great for cooking in your kitchen and playing games.
Sound quality is not as good as my original echo.
I use the kitchen timer all the time

author: S. Tiouti
title: Wait for an update and debugging!
content: I had an Echo and echo the issues others have had with voice recognition.  It will not stop when I say Alexa stop or Alexa home. We sometimes have to unplug to get it to stop. The sound quality is not as good as with echo tower I had before. I have to turn up the volume on stations and music.  There’s no help either in app. The show isnt giving me much of a show to enjoy.

author: Nancy & Greg
title: Sound is not as good as Echo 2nd generation
content: Sometimes Alexa ignores comands or hears something completely different than what we are trying to say. Yes we did the voice training.  It is fun though. I watch Amazone prime movies in bed.  When I get a compatible doorbell and security system I can watch my front door from my bedroom.  Echo dot 2nd Generation on porch near laundry, Echo 2nd Generation in livinh room and show in bedroom.  Entire house is covered.  I have ASK MY BUDDY Skill in case someone gets hurt home alone.

author: Gordon
title: Needs alot of work to be more useful with the screen
content: Basically a glorified Echo. Needs alot of work to be more useful with the screen. Also amazon needs to do better at working with the skill creators to insure they work properly on their devices. For example I had alot of issues with the Ring skill and Arlo skill. I suggest getting the regular echo unless you want webcam abilities.

author: KK
title: Pretty cool as it is, but could be much better with more apps/skills
content:
I got my wife several Echo Dots and an Echo Show for Christmas this year.  I like the Echo Show, however, I think much of its potential remains untapped.  I understand that it's still relatively new, and that much of its potential may lie with third parties building skills for it, but Amazon should strongly encourage companies to build skills specifically for the Show.  For example, Netflix does not currently work with the show.  Neither does Plex.  having these two apps on the Show would instantly mean a 5-star rating from me.  It would also be great if I had some way of reading my email from the show.

I also wish that recipes were easier (since our Show is in the kitchen).  I uploaded all of our personal recipes to allrecipes.com since there is no simple way to have the Show access those locally, but even then, the displayed recipe disappears after a few seconds, and you have to tell the  Show to find it again.  It should stay on the screen until you're done.

I really like the music apps, and the drop-in, telephone, and video-calling functions are wonderful.  With just a few more apps/skills focusing specifically on the video capabilities of the Show, this could be a really great device.

author: Bibi Garcia
title: Lots to like..
content:
There are lots to like and I do mean lots.
But there's lots more to figure out too. Still learning my way around the commands. Favorite is music, news, video and call options.

author: Msladybug13
title: We got a lemon
content: Defective.  Purchased for my daughter and son in law as a first anniversary gift.  It’s only 4 months old and they are now having to send it back in for the second time to see if it can be repaired- AGAIN!  Come on Amazon- send them a brand new one!!

author: Blueberry Hill
title: Brightness control suggestion
content: Echo show is very cool. Love it. Just one suggestions.  I initially set up and used my Echo show at night. Great. But my house has a lot of glass and light. In the morning, I couldn't see anything on the display unless it was talking and highlighting letters. Even then, they were very dim.  So I asked it to turn up its brightness. It said it didn't know about that, I should check the app. I did. Didn't find anything about it.  I emailed for help and got the answer -- the brightness and other controls are at the top of the screen IF you swipe.  Well, that was great, but it was so dim that I couldn't see the top-of-screen controls, not even in a dim corner of my house, so I had to wait until night time.  Then, when I could swipe and see the controls, I saw that it had arrived set all the way to "dim."  Amazon, why not set it at full "bright," or even half-way, so that in daylight, a person can see to adjust it?  Other than that, great.  PS This will be my last-ever review for Amazon. I posted a one-star review on a terrible product from a terribly seller. Amazon took it down. OK, they have that right.  But they also removed the review link from my purchase record, so that I can't post another that they might accept.  I personally consider that to be censorship.  My future merchant choices will be based on that opinion.

author: JUST ME
title: Hummmmmm
content: Highly disappointed, it’s a roll of the dice that this device understands what you say, do what you say or says ok indicating it has done what what you said, but it actually did not. Sometimes I’m  literally standing right next too it.

author: VEGGIEIB from Illinois
title: Loving It!
content: I'm Loving the Amazon Show as I can view my Ring Pro Live Feed/Video! Even though it was Refurbished or used - it looked brand New! No cosmetic imperfections at all.

author: Kit10
title: Lost substantial value since Youtube was pulled
content:
I agree with a number of users who find little value in an Echo Show since Youtube was pulled. I really like Amazon, and have a whole house wired with Echo products (about 7 various Echos). And I was interested in the new Echos that are smaller than shows, and cuter, but now, without youtube, it's just about useless and over-priced.

If Amazon were to add their own Youtube type service (since they stream video, why not?), or start selling Google products and fix their relations with Google as to get back this service, I would easily give the Echo Show 5 stars.

I totally miss "Alexa, show me videos on eyeshadow tricks" and such. Ugh!

author: K S
title: Love the music!
content: This was a gift to me, not something I would have bought myself. I know I'll never make complete use of it, but I do love being able to tell Alexa to play certain kinds of music while I read, and to tell me some current news, ask about the weather, etc. Just hope she's not listening to me and reporting everything!!

author: D. Evans
title: Incredibly useful and a great buy
content:
I received my Echo Show as a Christmas gift from my wife. If only Alexa could have captured the look on my face. This thing is amazing. The setup is a breeze and within minutes I was thinking of things to aske Alexa. To date I have also hooked up my living room light to switch on and off with voice controls (seperate plug required). Oh the possibilities!

Thank you Alexa for making everything easier: shopping lists, reminders, timers. She does it all.

author: John Miller
title: I love this thing
content: I love this thing!  We have a few echos in the house and this is a welcome edition. It’s great to be able to view our outside cameras and the weather in the screen. It’s also cool that the words populate the screen when playing music.

author: Comp_Vet
title: Wish I could afford a dozen of them
content: I can't wait to start using it even more when I have some personal friends who have the Shows as well.  I have a business associate I've used to verify how everything works and now I've decided to act.  I live in Florida and my best friend is in Tennessee.  He doesn't even know it yet, but I'm buying him a Show this weekend as a gift.  He's always complaining he can't get me because my phone isn't charged. ( and it's usually not. )  Problem over!  Don't have to worry about dead battery.  Now, even though he lives in Tennessee, he can just  "drop in" on me, even visually, here in my Florida home.

author: JaLisa Johnson
title: JETSET FREAKING AWESOME- Not made for technically challenged 😩
content:
Everything and more- I'm a tecccchhhyyyy gadget junkie. I brought 2 to get the deal. I'm ordering 2 more. The drop in feature is FREAKING AMAZING. Anyone who has less than 4 stars needs to stick to phones. I have an echo dot in my bathrooms, a Echo in my kitchen and now echo show in 2 bedrooms.

Talk about watching your kids all day or house while at work.

I can't even talk about the apps for music, YouTube channels I couldn't watch before.

THIS IS IT!

Can't wait for next 3 releases. Everything great starts somewhere and I been waiting for my JETSON box!

author: Dana E. Baze
title: If you get one that doesn’t work don’t hold your breath for a replacement
content: It worked for a few months. Then it was having problems, speakers would crack and pop. I’ve now been dealing with Amazon for 4 weeks and it hasn’t been replaced. I sent it in for repair and it was sent back broken again. I’ve spent over 45 minutes on the phone each of the 3 times I have called. Not thrilled to say the least

author: English
title: Helpful and entertaining!
content: I like to use the Echo Show when I am in the kitchen, and have cooking questions.  I also use it to play my fav music when I am in the kitchen.  The kids ask Alexa millions of questions! I am still discovering much more things that she can do!

author: Suz
title: Great New Device!
content: This speaker is terrific. As soon as it arrived I set it up on my kitchen counter. I want to use it for online recipes. I already have an echo.  I signed up for unlimited music and played Nat King Cole's The Christmas Song.  It was buzzing so I moved it to another outlet. Well, I finally realized that they have plastic over the speaker. Once it was removed the sound was amazing!  My husband was very impressed by the sound. I can't wait to make some music playlists. My grandkids love selecting songs like the SpongeBob Theme Song or popular tunes and dancing.

author: SANTEE MARK MUNOZ
title: Five Stars
content: Love it...! My kids like playing with the games and learn math from the games

author: wlshirer
title: Limited usefulness to consumers.  Lots of data for Amazon.
content:
Really fairly useless.  Gives limited information that you can get just as well from your phone.  Do you really need another electronic device that provides (and captures your) data?

I got one, set it up (easy to get going, clumsy to make useful), and then didn't use it.  No one in my house used it including my teenage daughters.  In fact, they often unplug the device because it's just too Orwellian for them.

Forgot to return it during the return period.  Will be going up on eBay.

author: William C.
title: In the end it’s just another tech toy
content: Very easy to setup and the picture quality is perfect. My son loves the fact that he can stream his favorite movies/shows from this device. I like how it can play my favorite news sources. Having said all of this, it’s really just a toy. It does show me my work calendar events, but so does my phone and computer. Therefore, it’s not really necessary, but it’s certainly entertaining to have one.

author: Jess
title: Too limited
content: If you stick to the few things alexa "can" say /do, I guess its  pretty cool.... yet There are so many things that need improvement with this device. Starting with the search engine.... unbelievably poor. Does not play any YouTube or music videos. Music selection limited. Link to my Amazon account is the worst, asking to show options of some product is a complete hassle. Really needs a lot of work.

author: Yvonneras
title: Bad product with lines on screen
content: I have been so disappointed in this overall product. I have had it 2 months when the screen started having lines in it which i have learned that this is a common problem. I called Amazon echo and they want me to send it back so they can fix it. That's fine except they emailed me a link for a label that i have to print then find a box to send it back and during this time i will be without my echo show. Not happy at all when they know this a problem that has been happening with this product.

author: Jeanine
title: Replaced alarm clock with this
content: Excellent Gadget.  Yes, you can replace your alarm clock with this unit - but it does not have battery back up - so if you lose power - she goes away for a while until the power comes back.  So if you need that comfort of alarm having battery back up - not for you.  I LOVE IT!!!  Sits on my nightstand, I can call my kids on it on their phones or other Echo devices, add things to my shopping list, see my calendar when I am getting ready in the morning so I know what to wear, see people at my Ring front door, get lyrics to a song, so many things I use my Amazon Show for.  Wish I could give her a different name, have a few Alexa devices in my home, so the names are all taken!  She has a great speaker, and if you want to watch a video really quick, perfect instead of turning on TV.  I like the fact she is linked to all my skills, and my Amazon account.  Makes it very convenient.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Allows me to Contact My Mother
content: I ordered this because of the ability to call my mother when I am not home.  I live with her and take care of her, but there are times I need to be away from home.  Her eyesight is not good enough to use a cell phone and we don't have a lan line.  I have been able to contact her twice to let her know to open the door for the therapist who was on the way for a therapy session.  I can see what she is doing by dropping in from the Alexa app on my phone.  I need to place more of these around the house so I can look in on her when I am away from home.

author: liesam
title: The Echo has a way better speaker/sound than the Show
content: I was not wholly impressed with the Echo Show. There are times where you have to speak to it several times to get it to understand you (while the other Echo picks it up fine). It does not play well with the wifi for some reason and is very slow at returning responses. I was able to get the video calling to work once and then it refused to call anyone again without saying the other person was unavailable. The Echo has a way better speaker/sound than the Show. I have an Echo, Echo Dot, and the Echo Show and the Show it my least favorite. The other Echos seem to work much more efficiently.

author: Joshua Schneider
title: 0 for 2
content:
I love the Echo Show!  I have had two defective ones.  To the point where I had to have my replacement replaced, and Amazon didn't know what to do.

When it works, its great!

author: Lauren Brown
title: Isn’t as innovative or helpful as advertised
content:
I bought this for video chatting with my family, which has worked out well. But it doesn’t do much more than that, tells me the weather and plays my music streaming services. I can’t upload my own music to amazon anymore so I can’t play my own personal albums without buying them from Amazon. I’ve tried using some of the skills (their version of apps) and haven’t had success with ANY of them. They just pushed the devices over the holiday without a very broad or successful skill base. Just look up amazon skills and read a few reviews, hardly any of the skills have more than a 2 star rating. Oh, and it won’t run YouTube because that’s owned by google and they have a competing product.

Oh! Also, it requires a smart phone to use the video calling/messaging service! I was hoping to downgrade to a basic call/text phone this year and I can’t!

author: Sue
title: Pretty Nice
content: I was hoping this new Echo Show might be a bit smarter than my old Echo, but alas, if i had a penny for every time she said "sorry, I don't know the answer to that question" I'd have a nice little coin stash saved. The display screen is very clean and clear. I do use it to call my daughter who lives several states away. The picture usually digitizes over time and we have to end the calls. That might be a wifi problem, still have to look into it. It is nice to adjust my shopping list as you can actually have the list o the screen. The regular Echo you had to have her read out the whole list to know what was on it. I've only used it once to watch a prime show, might have to start doing that more. The sound is good, still have difficulty getting the correct songs to play. I'm learning it's how you phrase your requests that get the best responses.  Over all I'm pleased.

author: Sam Angello
title: The echo show Is an amazing Product. I have one sitting on my desk ...
content: The echo show Is an amazing Product. I have one sitting on my desk And it's like I have a friend I can ask questions too All day long And get answers. echo show was great For showing you how to spell words Or do Mathematical calculations. Owning a production company We useThe echo To check the weather To know what are guys are going to be facing. Or quickly look up Phone numbers. I would definitely recommend Buying one

author: Alaskanman
title: Like having your own personal assistant!
content: I love using the show.  I have it set up so that every morning I ask Alexa to start my day.  It recaps my weather, the current news headlines, tells me how long my drive is to work.  My grandson loves Alexa and constantly has her telling him jokes.  I have not set my home up with automation but that is another capability of the device.  I like the show because of being able to watch the news and seeing the dynamic content offered.  The only negative that I have seen is with one skill in particular.  The BBC skill sound is so much lower than everything else that when it plays you can’t hear it and have to adjust the volume up and then turn it back down when its done.  Other than that would definitely recommend!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great product but Amazon needs to add a speaker feature ...
content: Great product but Amazon needs to add a speaker feature to the phone app for drop in sessions. When you drop in (basically video conference) the phone app does not have a speaker phone button so you can hear the audio fronm the echo show on speaker phone mode. The audio plays through the phone ear piece, but you are looking at at the phone screen so you have to put the phone to your ear, kinda useless for video calling.

author: Cathy from Seattle.
title: Cool new part of my kitchen.
content:
Love my new echo show,  bor it is not as easy as my first round scho. The u.s. more if a learning curve.  I like that it displays recipes and many other things on its screen.  I love putting on music while I work.
I am awaiting results of recent complaint that Alexa listens to conversations.... right now I turn it off if we want to be private!

author: Mk
title: Easy to setup and use!
content: I am still learning all of the things that I can do with the Echo Show.  I am starting to rely on it more and more.  I found the ambient sounds are a great way to help me fall back asleep when I wake up in the middle of the night/morning.  Also, love the timers (I use it when I am coloring my hair; using products on my nails that require drying; and just in general when I need to do something at a specific time; Also, the Echo Show was very easy to set up and pair with my cell phone.  Very user friendly.

author: Beth
title: Life Changing for My Elderly Mother with Dementia...and Me
content:
My mom is 82 and has dementia.  She lives 10 minutes away from me in a senior living community and I spend time with her most days. I got the Echo Show primarily because I love to travel every couple of months but I hate to leave my mom without our regular visits because she always goes into paranoia mode when I'm gone trying to cancel bank accounts (she's very creative about tracking down the bank phone number), etc, etc.. Frankly, I just hate to leave her feeling alone and I'm plagued with guilt.  I love the idea of her being able to see me when I'm gone and to be able to share pictures with her.

Setup was easy but getting this to work was more complicated than I'd planned.  I won't go into the details here but, to sum it up, Amazon had a difficult time changing the phone number on our personal account to mine from my daughter's even though I first changed our business account phone from mine to my husband's.  We're small business owners. I made the changes online but somehow they weren't recognized.  I spoke with Amazon reps a few times and was really disappointed even though I had always felt fantastic with my Amazon interactions before. They kept wanting to transfer me to other departments.  Echo because I couldn't accomplish what I wanted there and Whole Foods because I couldn't go in store and have them pull up my Prime account by my phone number. I finally got an absolutely amazing Amazon rep who, although new, told me she would leave me until she had conquered...and she did!!!  I wish I could tag her in this because she was a hero.

Yesterday I was finally able to figure out the Echo Show.  I video called myself on the Show from my cell phone since I don't personally own any Echo devices.  I downloaded the Amazon Photos app (which I didn't know existed before) and shared photos with the Show.  Suffice it to say that I was really proud of myself.

Then today...brought the Show to my mom along with a simple Alexa command sheet that I'd laminated so she would save it.  Bright pink paper.  She practiced some of the commands like  "Alexa, what day is it?" type of stuff and she was thrilled.  She loved the photos that slowly moved across her home screen.  She was absolutely over the moon with the results of "Alexa, play Perry Como songs.".  (I didn't even know she liked Perry Como!) There were lyrics for some of the songs and she sang along. My heart was smiling and breaking at the same time.

Then...my youngest son "dropped in". This required no interaction from my mother.  That would be very hard if she had to figure out how to answer.  He has an Echo but dropped in from his phone so it could be a video call.  She was so happy!!  We're in NC and he is in Boston and she got to see the view from his 11th story apartment and take a "tour" of his apartment.  This was priceless beyond words.  Taking her to unfamiliar places causes extreme confusion so I rarely take her anywhere beyond our home base.  She was so thrilled to be able to sit in her recliner and see where my son is.  My daughter in LA dropped in next.  Same priceless reaction.  Now I need NYC son to get the Alexa App.  Mom doesn't have a cell phone anymore because she wasn't using it and a smart phone would be beyond her capabilities.  Now she has all the functionality she needs through the Echo Show.  I'm so, so happy!

I haven't tried this out yet for my original purpose to connect when I travel but seeing Mom sing along with music, ask Alexa what the weather was and what day it was, observing while she interacted with two of her grandchildren who are hundreds of miles away...well, that was priceless to me.

author: Thomas Shuey
title: Great job Amazon.
content: I love this new Echo Show. As a older person it's pretty straight forward and doesn't require pushing this or that to do what you want. The video is clear and crisp but mostly it's nice to see my family and talk, it's almost like being there with them. As far as the size, I like it. It sets on my desk just fine and doesn't take up much room. I know there is face time on other devices but, all you have to do is tell her and she will hook you up with no additional steps.

author: wenfei
title: Great device for a desk top
content: I have mine in my living room, but rarely use all the features. The camera can see the whole room so privacy is reduced. I have to walk up to it in order to use the touch screen. The speakers seem weaker than the standard echo. All this leads me to believe that it is better suited at my desk than on a countertop or living room. It's a great device if placed correctly.

author: kevinry
title: It does everything the Echo does, and more. Read the details.
content: It does everything the Echo does, and more. Although I haven't and probably won't use the video functions. I had hoped that the display would be allow for more customization. It does not and is very limited. I would like the clock and weather to display in large text all of the time, it only displays in very small text. It also always has a line that says "Tell Alexa to do this, or that", tips at the bottom of the screen. I would like to see that go away, but it won't. Sound quality is good, not as good as the big Echo, but good enough. I bought it on sale and think I got value for what I paid. I would have been disappointment had I of paid full price.

author: Edna Perry-Hancock
title: SHE SEEMS TO HAVE A BIG PROBLEM.
content: Alexa is like a toddler that is having a hard time understanding language and I have my history recording with my response and hers.  She has been having a lot of problems lately.  Also out of the blue she will start saying something about nothing that I have talked about.  Last night, she told me twice where she thought I was located and she was nowhere close but said it twice using the same thing she had said already.  I was just sitting here watching TV.  The Virginian was on.  Then if I am watching a movie that is free, she will interrupt and start reading a story from Audible that is totally unrelated to what I am watching and will not go back to it although I am telling her to resume and state name of movie and she will tell me I am currently listening to Audible which sounds like to me she has a pretty serious problem.  She plays the correct music but I did not spend the money for something I already have access to.  Can someone give me a call and see if there is an update or something you can send her.

author: it is me
title: Only thing it is good for is being a weather station
content: I feel Echo show is just a tool for Amazon orders. So many times when I ask it things it does not know. If I ask it to play some music selection it pays all b side songs and nothing popular or known. I asked it today to play "Sweet Caroline" and it said it couldn't, I did not catch the  reason. Only thing it is good for is being a weather station.

author: Brian in CA
title: Way better than expected, but if you're paranoid don't get it because smart behaviors means the Show is trying to be helpful
content: Way better than I thought it was going to be, I thought I was buying an overly expensive clock radio for my bedroom. The sound is great in the morning, the silent information about weather/time/news headlines is MUCH appreciated, and it looks nice. The smart dimming/brightening due to ambient light and activity is aided by the camera, I realize, but WOW is it slick! I've even bought stuff from Amazon with it, which is the last thing I expected to do. I'm not a music in the morning person, but it sure is nice to say "Alexa, play Beethoven" and then follow that with "Alexa, turn off the music in 20 minutes" at night. Imagine trying to program a clock radio to do that, when even getting the time correct is such a pain!

author: Patrick Kato
title: Just lacking one thing...
content: I bought this to replace my ancient alarm clock I get back in 1998.  It's a huge improvement by leaps and bounds.  It has a touchscreen display that I can use as a digital photo frame, it plays music at an acceptable quality, it can turn off my lights with Alexa, and much more.  I really do like it but it lacks just one thing... a snooze button.  Unless I'm missing something, I have to say in my groggiest voice, "Alexa snooze" every time I want to get in an extra 9 minutes (x4) in the morning.  If it just had that, I'd give this 5 stars and I would even consider buying the newest version if it had the all mighty snooze button.

author: Phillip M.
title: Great Home Assistant
content: I purchased the Echo Show to replace my Google Home and I do not regret the purchase.  The Echo Show does so much more.  I am able to view my Nest Outdoor cameras, adjust my Nest thermostats, and drop in on my kids in the Game Room to let them know dinner is ready.  I can do all of this while preparing dinner.  It has been amazing and I do not think we have tapped into all the possibilities yet.  An absolute great buy!

author: CHRATCAL
title: Nic etoy
content:
Liked the screen the most because I could link it to my Ring Door Bell and see the front door.
Alexa has a lot to learn, still, but we have fun with it. Like the calendar feature and the music. She sometimes has problems with my accent.
Would prefer the clock to be larger and show the Day and Date,nucht just the time and weather.

author: Mike D
title: Cloud cams hook up instantly!
content: This little box does everything you need. I think it’s the best assistant available. We use it for new flash, work schedules, shopping list,  recipes, and and reviewing my Cloud cams and Ring cams.  It is truly a wonder box.  I have it in my kitchen and listen to my favorite music while I cook.

author: kelly bailey
title: Not at all happy.  Returned it.
content: It does not support You Tube.  It will play antiquated movies on Prime that you will never watch.  Without integrating with You Tube, it is a dot with a screen.  I got it today for Christmas and sending it back tomorrow.

author: Becki H
title: Love this Show
content: I love this Echo. Always shows me amount left on timers, notifications and voice mail scroll on screen when they comes in. Very happy with purchase.

author: Harvey J. Johnson Jr.
title: GREAT NEW ADDITION TO THE ECHO FAMILY
content: Great IA, more complete of the Echo items. The addition of a visual design feature makes this Amazon Echo a more informative (knowledge) device. Give it a request to play a song, you can here it, and now see the lyrics if you want to sing along. This alone helps in the knowledge of what the real words are and not ones that dad thought they were.  LOL.  It's new and I'm still learning about all the great things it is able to assist in my every day life.  GREAT NEW ADDITION TO THE ECHO FAMILY !  Yes five stars

author: Mark B. Todd
title: LOVE IT!!!!!!
content: I love how this has helped automate my home. I also love that it get smarter every day and learn us more so we do not have to repeat ourselves. I also love how my 3 grandsons 600 miles away can easily call me and see me any time they want without their parents having to open a program or hold a phone for them.

author: C. Williams
title: As good as the standard echo, but not much more
content: I am a huge fan of the echo series and own an echo, two echo dots, a tap, and now the echo show. The show can do everything that the other echos can, but it seems to be just a little bit slower in executing any voice commands. The 2 stars comes from the lack of screen use. Camera support is pretty terrible. If you look at any of the camera skills, they all have bad reviews because of how laggy they are. If you can get them working, the feed is around 10 seconds behind the live view. Amcrest in particular is bad, and unless you pay a subscription fee, you can only have one camera that is viewable. Other cameras let you have more, but the lag time is still there. Overall, I use this the same as the standard echo, so it is hard to justify the extra money for a screen, when the best feature (in my opinion) is sub par.

author: R. Farrer
title: Great addition to the Echo family
content: We recently got an Echo Show and put it in the kitchen (where we previously had an Echo Dot) and find it to be a great addition to our house. The kids love that music shows the lyrics and I don't mind it either. We have only recently started to play with calling other Echo devices but the idea of being able to do a video call hands free is appealing. The speaker quality is pretty good and it is loud enough to play over our old, noisy, dishwasher. I think the Show is a great addition to the Echo family and can't wait to see what new features and skills are added to utilize the screen.

author: mike joseph
title: One Star
content: Stopped working after one month

author: Yabadabadoo
title: Without "You Tube" Still Great!
content:
Assuming that YouTube is not longer on the Echo Show. As much as I like "You Tube" I can promise you will not miss it if it's not longer there.
There are plenty of streaming options out there, including Amazon Prime video to enjoy it. I personally believe the situation eventually is going to change, perhaps for better.
Two great company will embrace each other to please their customers.
Buy it now while the price is good.

author: Payton
title: Nice addition to our alexia fam
content: We use this to "facetime" with my sister and was a gift from her. What's really nice and unexpected is that you can play movies and videos as well. So when the kid wants to watch something we can put it on his "tv"

author: Amazon Customer
title: the sound is good and the screen quality and size are fine in ...
content:
bought this for my wife so she can see who is at the front door with cloud cam, video conference with her sister out of state, watch movies or youtube or news music weather etc.. while cooking cleaning or washing dishes in the kitchen.

the sound is good and the screen quality and size are fine in the kitchen since you are standing right over it. it feels very durable and high quality. easy to config like the dot echo etc..

 she loves it and now i want one too.

author: sandy w
title: Best gadget ever
content: Love this product! Handy as a timer, an encyclopedia and a karaoke machine.  Bravo.

author: 4k
title: If you have an echo dot, that wwould need to be moved at another room of the house.
content: Have it set up the next day after Christmas and started seen and talking to my kids.Picture is sharp and sound is great. Like it when I'm listening to music. Will update more later after I am able to check all the features.

author: Debbie
title: Love this device
content: It does everything I want me hs decent sound. I am hooked on my morning flash briefing before getting up. The one downfall is I like some of the stock photos but cannot chose one that shows all of the time. It goes to black screen and just shows the clock. Boring

author: Bronte
title: Useless for use with Ring doorbell - takes at least 10 seconds to bring up the door view.
content:
Bought the Echo Show as it was advertised by Amazon to work with the Ring doorbell.  In truth, it works but it takes so long to load and show you the door there is no one there by the time it brings up the picture.

This is a complete waste of money to work with a door monitor.  I'm using in an apartment and the time from the motion sensor going off and the picture showing on your Echo Show is over 10 seconds.

I do love the screen.  But the time to answer your questions again is very slow.  My regular echo has answered before it even starts to answer the same question.

author: Andrew
title: So much potential, but will it ever be taken advantage of? Probably not..... :(
content: I’m really hoping for skills that take advantage of the shows touch screen. There’s an incredible amount of untapped potential locked behind the restrictions. Make use of the best part of having the show and enable skills to navigate by touch please!

author: Cody
title: Not nearly as cool as I thought it would be
content: Not nearly as cool as I thought it would be. Not as smart as i thought it would be. I have to use google on my phone to look up a lot of things still. Which isn’t a big deal, but if that’s the case, why did I buy this thing?  Speaker isn’t that great on it. Voice command could use some work still. Like that I can link a camera to it. Haven’t done it yet, but hopefully it will work.

author: Amazon Customer
title: My new best friend.....
content:
I really love my Echo Show... We have become really close... I ask her and she has the answer. She plays all my songs and she plays the best thunderstorm at night.(try the thunderstorm)….

Great product....

author: Cal Heilig
title: I like it.
content: This has been a nice addition to the kitchen.  I like it better than the regular Echo.

author: Jeanne Kerwin
title: If I can return this unopened item
content:
I did not realize I had to have a contract for this device.
ECHO and Alexa...my husband and I are retired and not very knowledgeable.  I ordered the Alexa Show for him for Xmas, but would like to return it.  It is never opened.  Please let me know if I can return the Alexa Show and stand, as we do not have basic ECHO/Alexa in our home and cannot afford the monthly rates.  thank you.

author: Jonathon
title: Works great for most things but does not process audio nearly ...
content:
Works great for most things but does not process audio nearly as well as the Echo Dots that we own. Often, a neighboring room's Echo device will pick up and correctly process what we have said, while the Echo show fails. Might help to display what context you are currently in.

Very responsive otherwise and the screen looks great. Find ourselves using it more than our dots... unless they overhear.

author: LegalGal
title: Just love the show
content: Just love the show.  I love that the show displays my google calendar.  As a busy professional, I have to calendar everything.  And it is nice to see my schedule "pop-up" days before.  I have two shows.  One is in the master bathroom.  The other show is in the kitchen.  And one reason I put in the kitchen is because I love the timers.

author: KingofWhoa
title: I feel like she knows less than the original Echo when it ...
content: I feel like she knows less than the original Echo when it 1st came out. She also seems to have bugs & randomly says stuff when everything is quiet in the room or she will seem to be listening when you ask a question but then the blue line just disappears. It can be frustrating. We have the original echo & the dot which seem to have less issues.

author: Russ McConnell
title: Echo Show G1 sucks
content: Do not buy 1st generation Echo Show, they are awful.  Sound sucks, screen crapped out on me in 45 days and there's evidently no warranty??? I actually threw mine away, can't believe it.  I was a huge Amazon shopper until this, I've decided switched over to Wal Mart.

author: Rowester
title: Alexa can keep you on track and do it without touching anything!!!
content: We have such a good time asking questions, playing games and listening to music.  My grandchildren are always asking for her to play one of their favorites.  It works for us.  It was a gift.  At first we didn't know what to do with it, but as we had it longer we realized that it would help us with games, listening to music, making a shopping list, a timer for the cookies in the oven - without touching a thing, reminding us of doctors appointments and even what we need to do like get our grandson off the school bus.  Sometimes when our family gets together we are in an argument about something and then we ask Alexa and she give us the answer.  We also call someone without touching a thing and talk as in speakerphone.  What an ingenious invention!

author: D. Handel
title: It would be better with YouTube
content: Love the karaoke style sound lyrics,  hate thst i can't see you tube videos.

author: Ans
title: Great addition to Echo family, still needs better webiness.
content: The Echo Show 'double' we bought during the promo has worked to near perfection. We put one upstairs and one in the kitchen. The pair have completely replaced our home intercom. Now we just drop in on the kids playing upstairs -or set timers or alarms for them get on the bus or get in bed. They watch Amazon Kid shows on it when the adults are occupying the TV.  Most mornings we have music playing during breakfast. It really has become a central piece in our tech friendly home. We just wish she was internet friendlier getting info or could jump straight to a YouTube video. There are few more annoying things than Alexa saying I can't help you with that or I don't know.

author: Marsha A. Maloney
title: Best Device for Home!
content:
I just love this device. I had the original Echo, which was fantastic but being able to see things on the screen is a huge plus!  I use this everyday.
Anyone would love having one in their home.

author: James H. Menasian
title: Not that simple....
content: I should first state that I am not tech savvy, and that I have owned a smart phone for less than one month.  That said, hooking up my EchoShow (which was a gift) was not that straight forward.  In particular, I had bought devices that I thought would automatically connect, that did not, without my first buying an additional bridge.  I haven't given up hope completely; I just ordered two Wyze cameras.  I'm keeping my fingers crossed that I will be able to hook them up correctly....

author: AM_BC
title: Worth Paying more for the Screen
content:
Love this unit.  Keep it in the kitchen, listen to music, answers questions, sets timers, reminders, and controls the lights and thermostat.
You will need to buy a separate bridge to control the lights.  Really like having the screen verses our Echo Plus and Echo Dot units.

author: J. Nelson Thornton
title: Don’t waste your time not ready for release
content:
I have had this replaced 3 times in the past two weeks.  Don’t waste your time. I have the original Echo, two of them as a matter of fact they work perfect! The show did for the first two months now it looses the command somewhere and responds “ I’m sorry something went wrong” in an endless cycle till I unplug the device. Maybe they can fix the next edition. Sorry this one is a total waste of my time the three replacements were no better.

Sorry

author: Joel Hagy
title: Good product - a little expensive
content: I like it for the ability to control household items (TV, lights, thermostat) - just make sure that Echo works with whatever automation you have.  I wish it had Bluetooth to play my own music, but you can link it to your streaming services (Pandora, etc).

author: seth
title: Was An Excellent Product
content:
Simply wonderful. Does so much more than I could've expected...

Update... After a few months of owning this I had started to experience problems with the screen. It flickers. All online fixes for this were just temporary resolutions. There is no permanent fix for the screen flickering.
With the Echos Show 2 now available I believe there will never be a fix and all Echo Show 1 owners are stuck with defective devices.

author: Dura
title: Why make a screen and not allow other media apps?
content: The voice recognition software and OS are garbage. If it has not been used in an hour or so it can take saying a command 3-6 times before it stops telling you it does not know a device. Several times it has turned on or off the wrong device or banked the commands and turns something on and off over and over 30 seconds after giving the commands. The hardware is great but the software supporting it makes it a worthless device. If you want to get angry at a POS electronic device then go ahead and get it.

author: Mark L.
title: Me like 'em
content: I have two. Then the price drops !

author: Kindle Customer
title: Strobing lines on the screen
content: The Echo Show started developing strobing (periodic interference lines across the screen) after about three months.  Power recycling seemed to make them go away for a time.  However, after going to sleep overnight or while traveling, the strobing re-appeared.  It appears to be getting worse as time progresses.  I would like a replacement, but the option is not available in my orders even though the order page says replacements may be available until July 20, 2019.

author: TheBogWitch
title: Amazing speaker sound.
content: I love the Echo Show - we use it primarily for music.  The sound is phenomenal, and if you have the Amazon Unlimited Music plan, you'll be set on anything you want to hear.  We've had some issues with the Alexa to Alexa video calls, but we've been working on ironing out the issues.  I have a lot more to learn about the machine, but so far, so good.

author: Laura Holt
title: I love Alexa in whatever form she comes in
content: I love Alexa in whatever form she comes in.  The speaker in my Echo dot was is amazing that I had high expectations for the speaker in the show.  I do think it's better than in the dot, but only marginally so.  I probably would have given it 5 stars if the speaker had been a bit better.  Still, very happy with the show.

author: Joseph FUller
title: The Show is a Great Echo Device
content: The show is a great addition to the Amazon lineup. The timer is a great function. Recipe display works well. I was surprised that the screen was small compared to the overall size. And the microphone does not seem to be as sensitive as the dots we have nearby. I like the scrolling info being displayed all the time. That info is sometimes useful and yet not obtrusive. I look forward to linking this show with others in the house or with family members in other houses.

author: Chanimal
title: Have 12 Dots - this is a GREAT addition
content: 2nd one I purchased. I have the SPOT and this is much nicer--especially at the $100 off pricing. Like a super Echo or Dot--graphics add a lot. Much better speakers.

author: RCJ
title: Excellent product.
content: Excellent product. Setup easy and straightforward. Had to setup the dish app that it would not recognize. Would like to have date on home screen along with getting off the alexa try on the home screen. Operates better than i thought. Would recommend this over all the alex items available.

author: JHC_InHim
title: primarily to listen to music but do enjoy the visual aspect of the Echo Show
content: I use it all the time, primarily to listen to music but do enjoy the visual aspect of the Echo Show.  It was a gift from my kids! I have two other Echo Dots that I use almost constantly in different rooms.

author: Adrian M.
title: Good product but...
content:
I liked this product but after using it for a couple of days I sent it back. I don’t know why they didn’t make this more as a tablet based.
 It was hard for me to navigate in prime video. It was only showing me a curtain list but I couldn’t view all the movies or tv shows.
This product would be better if you could open apps and install what you want.

author: Christina K. Morales
title: Sound NOT GREAT. Everything else good.
content: Love the features. HOWEVER--- I use our show downstairs between my kitchen and living room. I MISS THE SOUND! The sound on the SHOW is NOTHING like the sound from the Echo. If it werent for the connection to our Front Door, I would move my Echo back. I miss the boom boom sound.

author: A. Ladd
title: Nice design easy on eyes
content: This is a good design purchase when calling Alexa with a command item now to can view the details it's pretty cool like when requesting a song to play you can view the words to the song in real time..

author: Kindle Customer
title: Five Stars
content: This device is not only useful, but fun!

author: CT
title: Disappointed
content: I like the screen  I use it with my ring cameras, I love playing music with some songs  it displays the lirics. The problem I continue to have it doesn’t recognize my area I live in therefore it won’t say the temperature for the area. Since I purchased the echo show it throws off my echo tower.

author: CMoses
title: Apple Guys Who Loves My Amazon Echo Products
content: I am an Apple guy, but am tired of waiting for them to catch up to Amazon in the assistant/home automation. I have loved my Echo Show thus far. Sound quality is good, and the screen option is awesome. We have an HD indoor security cam we are using as a baby monitor, a couple smart outlets, etc. My son loves asking Alexa what kids shows she has, and I love the recipes and trivia games you can play with Alexa. What I love most is that Amazon makes it clear on any Alexa certified products what is needed to connect to your setup. They have done a great job with the Echo line. I have already bought a Show, Dot, and will soon get a Spot.

author: R. Brownell
title: Surprised how much I've enjoyed it so far.
content:
I have now had my Echo Show for two weeks, I wanted to play with it for a while before writing a review.  This is my 9th Echo device I've purchased and I'd say so far my favorite.  I placed it in the kitchen as that's where we seem to use the Echo the most.  I had to upgrade my Foscam to a Nest Cam to take advantage of some of the features. While some may not see the need to say "Alexa show the front yard" I really like that it pulls up the cam within a few seconds showing the walkway to my front door. I plan to upgrade my Skybell doorbell to the Ring for this same reason.  We've also used the screen to watch a recipe being put together on YouTube, great way to visually walk through step by step and not have to worry about getting your dirty fingers all over the iPad.  I also really like the feature that I can add pictures via Prime Photos and create a slideshow of my own pictures instead of a single picture or stock photos. My family has really enjoyed this feature as we've pulled pictures from years back and now get to enjoy them again.  One feature I wasn't sure I would care about but have come to enjoy is the lyrics showing up when you play music, sometimes those songs we never truly understood now all make sense!

A couple of Features I'd like to see added/improved:

Ability for the doorbell to ring automatically through the Show so you can see who is at the door without having to ask.
Bloomsky to update their app to give you the ability to pull the device info on the screen w/out asking for it. Also would like to see it have the daily video show up.
CNN, ESPN, and other update providers to have quick videos when you ask for an update.
The long rumored/awaited Sonos connection which we're hearing is  a month or so away.

author: Commander
title: Alexa is the new love of my life!
content: I have a new love in my life and her name is Alexa!  Seriously--where has she been all of my life?! My boys and I have created a sort of Jetson's/1984 home by using Echo products to control remind/monitor/assist with many things.  Now, I just need to find a way for Alexa to clean the kitchen and fold laundry! Then we'll be set!

author: Deanna LaPrade
title: Not very interactive...
content: Amazon should program alexa to be more interactive!  Every command or question a person has, Alexa does not understand unless it is specifically programmed in the system - geared more for Amazon.  Very disappointed I purchased the Alexa show...probably will return and get Google.  Amazon really needs to program Echo to understand more commands and be willing to allow device to access sites such as Youtube.

author: S. Isom
title: Great edition to the house
content: I love my echo show.  It gives me my flash briefings, the weather, recipes, wakes me up, plays music to put me to sleep, answers questions, reminds me of things I have to do, makes calls, gives me little known facts, quotes bible verses, etc.  It was easy to set up and only goes out when my internet goes out.

author: DubJenks
title: Easy and intuitive to use + getting smarter
content:
This is my first Echo device, although I own a lot of other smart tech in my home. The Echo Show is easy and intuitive to use. I have two devices and mostly use them for playing music, watching YouTube and controlling my smart lights (z-wave and Phillips Hue bulbs). I also use it as a baby monitor to veiw the NestCam in my son's nursery.

I have used the Drop-in feature a few times. It's easy to use and works well. Contrary to some reviews, I don't think it's creepy at all. You can control "who" can drop-in, so only my wife and I use it (for now) on our kitchen Echo. The device in our bedroom is limited to serve only as an intercom so we can talk to each other from different parts of the house.

Amazon did a nice job with this device. It looks nice on the countertop and seems to be getting smarter and more capable each month. The speakers sound great as well.  I plan to integrate more smart tech over time. I'm especially looking forward to integrating/connecting it to my Sonos system, which is reported to be in the works. I highly recommend the Echo Show and will probably buy a few as Christmas presents for family members.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Voice feature stopped working
content:
After 3 months this past weekend 9-22-18 asking Alexa to play 80's music it went beep and a red line across the bottom lit up as well as a red light. turned it off hoping to reset it...no luck unplugged it no luck. It will still play stories if I touch the screen. Not at all pleased. I would expect it to give a number to call for technical assistance. Update...after leaving the review within 3 hours I was contacted by an Amazon rep who walked me through the issues, and Alexa is back large & in charge. OUTSTANDING customer support !!

I figured out with their help Vodka and Alexa don't play well together it had been muted by someone and we had no idea.

author: TJ
title: Amazing sound, easy to set up and the screen is as clear as a TV.  We love it!  Worth the money!
content: Bought this for Christmas for my 10 year old grandson that loves music.  The sound is amazing and just as easy to use as Alexa.  The screen is crisp and clear.  So many functions! It’s sturdy and easy to set up

author: Valerie C.
title: not impressed
content: I already have a cell phone a tablet and the computer in my home. I do not see what this can do for me that those can't. It also does not do it much of anything unless you have attached it to your cell phone via the Alexa app.

author: Chris
title: Great product
content: Remember the technology does have drawbacks and Patience is a virtue I was having trouble setting up and can’t help support both times I called it was absolutely sublime I help was on point and completely consider this product is a great buy

author: andy dubitsky
title: No complaints
content: Seems pretty cool for still being in it's infancy.  Still not sure what to DO with it.  I can turn lights on all by my big boy self so that's of no use. It has some music and some video type apps... Maybe Alexa and I just aren't compatible.

author: Gary26
title: It's that good.
content: I wonder how I got along without it.  It's that good.

author: Ashlee
title: The best of the echos yet!
content:
Ahhh!! There is so much I could say about this amazing amazon Alexa echo show. First of the size is really nice. We have had now for a month or so and love it. Alexa is a good listener for sure.
This new echo show has replaced our old alarm clock, it’s crazy because I totally feel like we have a smart house now. Haha

Pros:
•bigger screen
•volume goes up higher
•Alexa is smart, and can do a lot
•easy to personalize
•quickly to install
•can upload app on phone which is recommended!

Cons:
•hard to restart and update WiFi password
•the directions are hard to read.

Overall, I am so happy with the purchase of buying this. I feel like I have a smart house now since I have 3 of these! Hehe it’s definitely recommended to have at least one of these!

author: James E. Thompson
title: Works Great!
content:
Echo Show does work as advertised. Alexa does work better than Siri. I do wish when Alexa doesn't have a skill for a task or don't know how to do what is asked - the AI could be better at saying that it doesn't have that skill instead is just saying it doesn't know; a bit frustrating.

It would be great - but I haven't found it , yet - if Amazon had a place where you could learn a step-by-step way of creating Alexa Skills. I have done a cursory search but haven't found anything.

author: Silver Surfer
title: It show my front door and whatever I want my ...
content:
It show my front door and whatever I want my cameras to show.
It does not allow YouTube videos which  I think is 90 percent of its use.
I cannot add skills or websites that I want because of its limited capabilities

author: srfarmer
title: Maybe not good for a grandmother
content: I got this for my grandmother so we can communicate using the video feature. While it worked, it wasn't as user friendly as it could be. I liked that it was pre-configured and connected to my account remotely. The reminder feature worked well so I could set reminders for her to take her medicine. For someone that doesn't have a computer at home, this can be a good alternative for someone to ask questions, get the weather, etc...

author: Raymond K. Reviews
title: There're reasons I take pictures of return items.  The one I sent back was mint.
content: I bought the 2-Echo Show set when they were on sale for nearly half off, not realizing, like I should have, that the Gen 2 was about to be unveiled and come out soon, because that's how they seem to do things.  So I said "oh well", I'll have the Gen 1's until the Gen 3's or better comes out.  A few months in, one of them starts flickering.  Have you, both of these Shows never leave the place they're sitting and are in both in mint condition.  I sent the one in that was flickering and got back this beauty tonight.  There are about 5 small dent areas around the rim of it and about half of the entire face that the speaker holes are on has a weird film/discoloration that can't be cleaned off.  I got sent back a terrible refurb for my mint item.  So far, the second one has updated and is working so we'll see how long they last.  Lucky if all the way through warranty If all goes as it has.  Shame I got back a bad looking item for a manufacturing defect.

author: Courtney Kerr
title: Terrible quality
content: I’ve had my Echo Show less than 6 months and the screen is constantly going in and out. It flickers and has lines through it 99% of the time. It continues to get worse. Very upset with this product seeing how much it is and how quickly it broke. I have no kids and it simply sits on my counter. This is totally unacceptable.

author: Derek Browning
title: Catch it on sale...
content: I caught this on sale for $120. As an Alexa enabled device with good sound it was a decent addition to the house (we have two dots and an echo). Conferencing and announcement capabilities are great (available on other alexa devices as well). I've been underwhelmed by the "show" part of it. We have several kindle fires, so I was expecting it to have similar functionality as a tablet, but videos are very limited and/or complex to get to, and saying "alexa play..." seems to confuse her as to whether you want to watch or listen to something, so you get sub optimal performance from both. I'd really like to see a software update that opened things up to watch YouTube, Netflix, etc. As of right now I wouldn't recommend this device, but am happy with having alexa as a member of our household.

author: Al Miner
title: Tepid.
content: I seem to ask questions that are not assimilated yet.  I also bought Music Unlimited, which I like, but it is only allowed on the one device.  So, I'm not disappointed, but it does not deserve a glowing review, either.

author: MyaBlu
title: Only has Amazon information, and basic trivia abilities.
content: Does not have the level of intelligence to justify the cost. Alexa, can you play music across multiple speakers. Reply: Hmm, I can't find any songs for across multiple speakers. Alexa has no information on Alexa. I wanted to control a sound bar with Alexa, but anything available that is not junk is way over priced ($600, $800). Alexa lost internet connection, reset any devices Alexa had stored, what a pain. No internal battery so can't move device when streaming. Adding new devices and capabilities? Really? A lightbulb or outlet is all they come up with. Now that Amazon has significantly raised the cost of Prime, we consumers deserve more from them. And Alexa will not shop on any website other than Amazon, so no comparison for prices. Theses Alexa devises are for one purpose, buying more from Amazon. So if you truly want a smart home, you won't find it in Amazon Alexa, no matter which of their devices you buy. Impossible to afford the devices, subscriptions to devices, and Amazon subscriptions.

author: VRW
title: I got it at first and I liked the Youtube integration
content: I got it at first and I liked the Youtube integration, today Google has stopped that.. So now its an oversized plastic box with nothing interesting that the standard echo cant do... I bought it because of youtube integration, it was great keeping up with the hurricanes and live news streams.. Now? Well if I knew that Amazon was violating the TOS for the youtube API I would have never got it. Its to late to return it, so I am stuck with it making payments on it every month... This is Amazon's fault and they should give me my money back!

author: GURUGUY
title: Horrible - 1 star is 1 start too many.
content: I love Alexa, but this device was a total DUD - The screen started messing up after less than a month.  I sent it back to be repaired, and it was returned in worse shape than before.  While the Alexa voice part still works, the screen is just horrible, the picture is marred by blue and white horizontal lines and is mostly faded.  I would not buy one of these again.

author: anonymous
title: This is a fun little gadget
content: This is a fun little gadget. I'm not very technologically savvy so I haven't utilized a lot of what it can do. I do enjoy playing Jeopardy, listening to Sirius XM, and asking it questions instead of going to the computer for answers. Looking forward to a long relationship!

author: dee
title: I love this Echo show
content:
ooooooooooo man!  I love this Echo show.  Keep it by my bed to watch movies at nite!  Use it just like my Echo.
This is fantastic gift for a senior citizen or any able or disable individual to use as a phone without an
actual phone.  I paireed it to my phone and it copied my contacts and now I call family and friends without having
to pickup and dial my phone.  It is great for a sick or disable person that need to call someone without
looking for their phone number.  And great for thiem to listen to music or watching a movie.  I just love
it!  I am thinking of getting another for my office.

author: Jeff
title: Kitchen staple
content: Nice to have this in the kitchen to assist during cooking, both for music and recipes. The screen is a nice resolution and touch sensitive.

author: T. Bourne
title: Very limited
content: High hopes, but it is very limited to what it could do, wanted to stream vids from my computer and access internet for weather, etc. If this thing could tie into Dish now Id be all over it as a great small tv for the kitchen, and be able to call up recipes from my main computer. Expensive for what it does.

author: Iniysa
title: Worth the Money
content: Bought it half price with a payment plan. Love this, for the most part. There are things I think it should be able to do but can't yet. And some bugs need to be ironed out, but what it does do is worth the money.

author: NJJ  Erasmus
title: Wait for the kinks to be ironed out.
content: I'm unable to connect to Hue with my Alexa Show. Not impressed with this device. I recommend waiting for version 2.0. Very disappointed.

author: HHunter502
title: Echo Show-Lacks compatibility with Sync
content: Echo Show is said to work with certain apps but,NOT!!! Cozi state works with Echo Show, but the Cozi Family’s doesn’t very well, Amazon needs to go back to drawing board, it would be such a needed piece of technology, but it lacks the essential, please fix. Cost of the Echo Show was  marvelous . Got Echo Show to take on shopping list but that is all so far, adding items to list has long lag, and it not my router being slow, my provider speed is !GB, speed not a problem, but before new items is updated on Cozi is very slow. Help is needed to get it updated to A1 working conditioning.

author: Steve L
title: Good at what she can do.
content:
I got it as a Christmas present.  I honestly expected it to be much smarter than she is.  Expecting to be able to google more and Wikipedia less.
She will make a good personal assistant, music player, weather info etc once I learn more about using her.
But she cannot answer most questions that I ask.  Asked her what time zone are we in?  And many others that I cannot recall now.
She has great sound and she is quick to find the odd music I ask for.  Pretty cool how many things can interface with her.  The screen has high resolution.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Defective device
content: Very disappointed in this product.  Less than 6 months I had to return for repair due to lines across the screen and Amazon deregistered my device without my knowledge and now claiming they don't have a replacement and will not give me an answer on how this will be resolved.  Very poor service on all fronts.  Oh and I know of another person with the same issue in regards to the defect in the device.

author: csull1948
title: Great to use as a mini stero..
content: As an older adult (70) was looking for something other than a radio for my husband (72) to listen to without having to use CD's...  This is great as you just tell it to play whichever musician you would like to hear...  I also like to ask it various questions and most of the time Alexa knows the answers...

author: Amazon Customer
title: Helps paralyzed communicate
content: My boyfriend is paralyzed and is able to now call and communicate with me for the first time via the Echo Show since accident by himself.  I can drop in and speak with him anytime.

author: Jessica
title: Entertainment
content: This is great not only is it compact but the convince to connect to music movies and so much more great sound an the touch screen with voice command  it was loved by the whole family thank you for installments that made it easier to try it out I’m so glad I did.

author: Steven V.
title: A wonderful device
content: A wonderful device that not only plays music, videos, gives you the weather but is also like having a talking computer that's full of info on everything.  It also plays games and the sound is pretty nice too.

author: joshua thompson
title: Bad buy
content: Don’t buy it.  Horrible user interface and can’t do much on it

author: Amazon Customer
title: Search isn't great, headlines are buzzfeed style
content: One of the main reasons why I bought this device was to put in the kitchen and use for looking up recipes.  The device is surprisingly bad at this. I know there are apps that may be added to the device, but basic search for things like this are lacking and really should be a core capability.  The device also likes to show headlines that are these eye-grabbing but completely useless headlines.  If you're interested in the type of headlines that you would get from a real newspaper, you will be sorely disappointed and I have not found a way to change it.  Great for listening to music when you don't want to pick out a station or for setting a kitchen timer, but overall pretty disappointing in the functionality.

author: Steve
title: Known Issue uncorrected.
content: CAUTION! Known issue with the screens on these units.It  appears to be going uncorrected. Screen develops lines and flickering. Do a search for Echo Show lines on screen and you'll see the many users reporting the issue. Even with replacement units the problem happens again.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Clunky UI experience.
content:
There are a lot of pros however, I feel that it lacks UI customization. Users should be able to completely customize the look and feel of the experience. Currently you have to download skills for screens savers etc. which is a clunky process. Open Alexia app > find skill > enable/disable skill.
Why can’t you just do this from the device itself? So, because of the clunky user experience of home automation on this device I rate it three stars.

author: John Kafel
title: Not a bad device overall
content: If you have any other Alexa enabled device, you'll like the Echo Show.  It's great for answering our Ring doorbell and listening to streaming audio.  Decent audio.  Makes a pretty good alarm clock as well.  I knocked it down a star, because I wish I could turn off the annoying "Ask Alexa" nags.  Amazon needs to make that a option on a future software update.  If you could turn off the Alexa nags, it would be a five star device.

author: Brenda French
title: Fun
content: We have fun with this. Asking her this and that. Playing music and videos. Shopping on Amazon. We expect our other electronics to do the same but they don't respond. Lol

author: CTinCT
title: Everything i loved about original Echo & so much more!
content:
I was lucky enough to get an Echo invitation when it was first introduced.  We ordered 2 more since then.  We love them.  So when I saw the email about the Echo Show, I ordered 2 that day.  It has everything I love about the original, but the screen makes it so much more.  Being able to see things like my calendar, Alexa deals and answers to my questions is so helpful since it gives me time to peruse at my own pace.  The sound quality is amazing and the picture on screen is clear and crisp.  I am very impressed and happy with my Echo Show.
I did not receive any discounts for my review.

author: R. Boling
title: Want your kids seeing full frontal porn?
content: My 11 year old daughter asked Alexa to "show new pictures" and this is what our show displayed! With how bad this thing is with understanding basic English why would it even be capable of displaying such images? Now we have a very expensive box not being used as we can't trust having this in our home.

author: Brian
title: Works great and does so many things
content: Works great and does so many things. Love the screen though it could be bigger.  Sound is really great for its size. Has many free skills that you can get for free.  It does sometimes answer the television but most of the time it does its job.  I recommend it if you are into home artificial intelligence...

author: justjayhere
title: At $100 off I had to get one!
content: I have the HD Fire 10" Tablet with the Show Mode Dock and like it for the bedroom, so I decided to get this as the main device for the house. It sounds pretty good on it's own but I pair it to my UHD bluetooth speak for the mobility benefits. That way the Echo Show can stay it the main area etc. The built-in Mic array works very well even with music playing fairly loud. I'm still getting use to phasing things correctly so I searched the Internet and found a Cheat sheet to print out to refer to in the mean time.

author: F. Tippett
title: Limited capabilities, LIMITED !
content: Reviews of this product that depict YouTube viewing are "incorrect". Amazon and YouTube.  Buy a Echo Dot (or 2) and an Amazon Fire HD 8" - Alexa capable tablet and take your Honey out for dinner on the money you'll save.  Plus the tablet is mobile, battery powered, so you travel watching downloaded movies, and let tge kids play games.  Need a big, 120 volt run paperweight?  Buy the Echo Show.

author: Steve P
title: Clock feature too small
content: I bought the Echo Show to replace a Nucleus I’ve been using for a couple of years. I liked that the timers would display unlike the Nucleus. Turns out for me that the clock function on the Echo Show is too small and not nearly as easy to see across the room so I’ve switched back to the Nucleus.

author: B. Walsh
title: She used to love using the computer to Skype but she can't do ...
content: My mother has mobility problems and low vision.  She used to love using the computer to Skype but she can't do that anymore.  She recently returned home after a hospital stay so we want to keep in touch with her and my father.  This is great.  They already loved the Echo and Dot -- they use them all the time (including turning the lights off and on).  With the Show I can drop in from work or home using my phone and see her as well as chat.  We are still working out how to allow my sister and brother to use it for video but I think we can work it out.  I can also put pictures up for them to see which they love.  They are delighted every time we we learn more about the functionality of this tool.

author: Spencer T. Hancock
title: nice product and fast shipping
content: This piece of equipment is great.  I love being able to ask questions about anything and being able to listen to music just by asking and even seeing the lyrics is wonderful.  I wish my Dad was alive now to see all the technology we have, he would have loved it.

author: DKitchen
title: Very disappointed.
content: I purchased this because it claimed that I could watch You Tube. This feature is not available. Very disappointed.

author: vgarzione
title: This is the most awesome piece of electronic I have ever brought
content: This is the most awesome piece of electronic I have ever brought.  I use it primary for listening to music.  I use it non-stop.  It is loud enough to hear thoroughout my house.  I wish they could hold up leaving one outside.  I would buy it again

author: Chicago, IL
title: LOVE MY ECHO SNOW
content: Love my Echo Show!  Plugged it in and it literally activated itself.  I'm still playing around, but so far it does everything my 1st Alexa does and more.  I can actually watch How To YouTube Videos while at my computer and follow along easily.  I have Prime Photo so I easily have a rotating image gallery.  It even found who on my contacts has an Echo and allows me to send messages with ease!
