It even lets me know that I have packages arriving and what is on my calendar...can't wait to see how this baby evolves.

author: Phillip Williams
title: Makes me look like i got him a cheap gift
content: Ordered this for a christmas gift for my husband, The screen already is not working it flickers the entire time. Makes me look like i got him a cheap gift. Ugg........ I can't return it of replace it according to amazon.

author: Robert Pinder
title: Good.
content: I’ve had an echo, dot and tap for a long time, so I made the jump to the show. The speaker is noticeably lower quality sound than the gen 1 echo, the screen is nice but I haven’t really found a use for it. I plan to get a few remote cameras and connect in the near future. The mic seems more sensitive, which is good. I like it, and bought it on sale.

author: Sergio
title: No Netflix or anything else. Sometimes loads prime videos
content: I find it disappointing this Hong does far less than a much cheaper tablet. Probably my fault for buying it... I assumed it would be so much more...

author: Judy
title: I love it!
content: This is my first Alexa device and I'm still learning to use it. I love it. The only knock I can give it is that the sound is good but not great on when playing classical music, but since the speakers are so small I'll accept its limitations. Other types of music sound fine. I like seeing the words of the songs as they play. I look forward to learning new ways to use the Show.

author: Ray
title: Nice technology.
content: Product was easy to install and is easy to use.  The picture and the sound quality is GREAT.

author: Aaron Corbitt
title: If you want a better built Amazon product, sorry it doesn't exist. Buy this now! Or in pairs!
content: Had to get the deal on two of them! Super loud speakers, actually heard and understand me better than the original Evho and Dot by far. Drop in video calls are so much easier than Ip cameras with 2way intercoms. Half the time i just use this instead of Skype or even my cell phone. I don't even use my Firetv in a room where my Shows reside any longer. Only downside is lack of YouTube official app no thanks to the 2nd placers, but you can watch 5he sane videos from it with the web based version as seen on other Amazon devices or your game systems these days, so it's not so bad. I need to trade in for a Spot until the price on these cone down to at least what they are when they sell two of these on special. Best working product Amazon makes so don't stress the price. These are better than having Alexa open a box of cats and getting an hours worth of meowing instead of the usual quick cheap cat sound! Doo it!

author: Mark jones
title: Nice
content: I love my echo show. Ordered the newest Generation recently. Can anyone help me though? I cant stop it from showing sports highlights and my photo highlights on my home screen. I asked it to do this but now I dont want it...

author: KMom
title: No parental control options available - big bummer!
content:
I was super excited about this product until I discovered that it doesn't allow for any parental controls (unfortunately, this wasn't realized until we were in the process of getting them setup). We purchased these as a way for our kids to interact with family and also to function as a modern-style clock radio. With access to our parent account purchasing abilities, videos, and other miscellaneous information, this devices is unusable for us.

Another big downside is that we can't have all of the devices playing the same music simultaneously like Sonos speakers.

author: jay
title: So far not impressed!
content: Cool idea and well built and attractive but slow and so far doesn't do much and very slow and hard to use with cameras. Cell works much better with cameras Alexa has huge lag with 4 different cameras all recommend for Alexa show. Thinking about returning....

author: Marcel vdB
title: See all my Arlo cameras and Ring door bell with voice command.
content: Excellent device, lot's of features and nicely built. However, PLEASE allow push notifications at least from selected applications. I have Echo Show at my bedside and it would be great if I could get a notification when there's motion detected on my Arlo camera or Ring door bell.

author: richard betita
title: Love it
content: I really like it, very simple to set up, and looks cool next to the bed. Best alarm clock ever. I tell it to play classical music when the TV goes out at night, and it puts me right to sleep or ask it to read me a book. Light is soft enough don't even notice it during the night. Wish it had a sound effect for meditation or sleep. Or does it?

author: Melosource
title: My parents are 89 and 90 and do not have a smart phone. It indicates the wave would work with ...
content: The mothers day commercial shows where a elderly relative receives an echo dot (wave) and can visually talk to her family.  Unfortunately it is not that simple.  I purchased a wave for myself, sister, and parents (3 different states) with the intention of being able to talk visually between the 3 of us.  My parents are 89 and 90 and do not have a smart phone.  It indicates the wave would work with a land line.  They do have wi-fi which os needed.  However the directions indicate a need for a smart phone or the use of another accessory, Echo connect, for the land line.  This would have to be purchased.  After talking to the help desk twice (I was disconnected and never called back the first time) it seems you can not do visual calls without a smart phone and the Echo connect will not do the trick either.  The other features I assume would work ok without a smart phone, but that is not the main reason I purchased this.  Very disappointing, especially form Amazon, based on the commercial and the fact that I assume many elderly folks do not have a smart phones.  My folks were elated that we were going to do this but now......

author: Scott Andrews
title: Yes Yes Yes
content: I'm been an Echo user since the beginning and have own every version. This one is by far the best when it comes to sound quality and adding the screen really take Alexa up a notch!

author: C.
title: Welcome to the Show
content: It is basically an Echo with a screen but the screen does have some features and functionality which make it nice to have in certain areas of the household.  We use ours in the kitchen and it works well there.  Nice to have when you want a recipe or something like that.  Maybe stream a movie while cooking.  In the future if we installed cameras it will work nicely as a central area to view cameras since this is one of our main living areas in the house.  The speakers seem of good quality and works nicely when streaming music, etc.  Would be nice if it had the ability to rotate without having to buy a separate stand but besides that we are happy with our purchase.

author: Michael S Dutcher
title: Like that it can scroll through our Amazon photos in ...
content: Use the Ring skill all the time. Like that it can scroll through our Amazon photos in screensaver mode. Very handy having our Google calendar events scroll across the screen as a reminder. Good sound too.

author: Josie
title: Easy to use even for elderly
content: I got this after reading another review in which the reviewer loved how he was able to drop in on his elderly, sick mother.  My own mom just started chemo yesterday and with 2 of her children overseas, 2 out of state, and 1 - me 30 minutes away I figured I would see if it's something her and my father would be inclined to use.  I bought one for myself to try out and took it over to their house on Father's Day.  What a treat for my parents to be able to see their children on Father's Day.  They couldn't say enough good about the technology and how amazing it was to be able to chat like that!  So much better than telephone or other "hangout" options other platforms offer.  My dad is sold and I will be ordering one for them today!

author: Renata Berni
title: I’m in love!!
content: I was a little concerned after reading some reviews but the show just arrived and I loooove it! I have had the echo since before it came out (I was one of the trials) and my husband just dropped it so I decided to try the show. It’s my new kitchen companion!! It gets really loud and I can watch videos on Vimeo, or songs with lyrics. It also reads you books.

author: JKStewart
title: Drop in video feature is great.
content: It's ok.  I like that I can use the drop in feature to see family while talking to them.  The call quality is great.  We also use the echos for in home intercom system and that feature aorks great also.  It doesn't play Netflix's and it is difficult to get certain vexios and movies to play.

author: Pandora M. Wertz
title: I do not have a smart phone so I saw no use for it
content: I do not have a smart phone so I saw no use for it.  I can get the same info from my computer or my iPad.  Music from cable TV or my iPod or car.  I unplugged it and put it in storage.  Plus I do not like automatic charges placed on my credit card (for the Echo music).  Sorry, it isn't/wasn't my thing.  I did a "Chat" and canceled the music and told the rep that I was unplugging it.  He was very kind and said I would be reimbursed and there would be no further charges.

author: kevin sarno
title: Very nice
content: I did like the echo show a lot. The sound was better then I thought it was going to be  and my son loves asking echo to answer his questions or play songs. And the picture quality was very nice to. I got the show to be a nice alarm clock and to play some music with. Over all it's a lot nicer then I thought it was going to.

author: Ron
title: I had higher expectations
content: I purchased the Alexa Show with higher expectations.  The good is that it controls my smart switches with little delay.  My hope is that it would answer simple everyday questions by searching the internet, much like a google search engine.  Too often I get the response "I'm sorry, I don't know ... "  I was also hoping to find useful "how to videos" however I get the "I'm sorry, I don't know ..." again.  When I bought it, it was linked up with YouTube, however after looking I found that YouTube is no longer compatible with the Show.  I do like the news flash updates, other than that the screen is virtually useless.  I also found out that you need to have android 6.0 or higher.  My phone is about 4 years old and it is not compatible because it is running on an older software version.  I contacted Amazon and they basically told me that I need a new phone. If I had to do it over again I would have purchased the google home which would have controlled my smart switches and been able to search the internet and would have saved about $100.

author: AceysWildflower
title: Frustrated
content: Frustrated with sound quality and customer service. I  receive this as a gift at Christmas time I have been on hold with customer service about a half an hour each time my mother-in-law had a similar experience two times, four times reset until this the last time when we were told that it needed to be away from the wall, microwave, windows and the clicking should stop.  One of the main reasons we purchased this device was for video conferencing across the country and for listening to music.  Both difficult to do when the sound quality cuts out every 30 seconds or so randomly Disrupting the conversation.  Loved it for the 1st 2 months.

author: MFormichelli
title: Echo Show is Awesome
content: We love our Echo Show. With the ability to play music (and show the lyrics), videos, movies from Prime, video call, and link into our smart home the Echo Show is an incredibly powerful personal digital assistant and a great source of entertainment while household chores. I personally love that I can pull up a recipe on the  screen when cooking. My wife and I also use it to intercom with the other echo devices. My only complaint is that there aren't apps to interface with other online video streaming services.

author: horse girl
title: Save your money--get the regular Echo
content: We have many Echoes in the house--just bought a couple more Dots so we could have a home intercom system, which is great, btw. However, the Show doesn't live up to the expectations of the others. The touch screen is unreliable at times and the reaction time is slow. Granted, all the Echos are not instant, but this is even slower than the sound-only Echoes. Also, it has more trouble hearing what I'm saying than the other Echoes. I don't know if this a "training" issue or if it's a fault in the microphone and AI. Sometimes the screen goes black or it won't play the video I select (usually a night/sleeping video--this is on the table next to my bed). I'm not sure why it does that. I also wish that I could choose to make it go dark. The light can be too much for me at night, so I do cover it with a washcloth to darken the room, even with the brightness settings to the lowest. I do like that I can see the weather on it and items that might interest me and it's fine doing all the stuff that the sound-only Echoes can do. It could be so much better, but it's not there yet.

author: Ron Davis
title: Great start!
content:
I am not an advanced user but it is almost worth the price just for being able to tell it what to add to my shopping list.  We also use it to stream music and while it doesn't have the sound quality of a dedicated music device it works nicely for what we listen to.

Now I need to go out and buy the rest of the devices I need to automate my home.

author: jjon
title: Cute
content: Possibly this system is a little overrated. It’s cute. I guess I need to see what else is expected of this product by years (2018) end. Who knows, It could become the one.

author: Terry Trimble
title: Cool Device!
content: We got this Echo Show to better facetime with our grandson.  This feature works great but this Echo does so much more!  Don't forget to check out the Alexa app store on the Amazon website.  There are hundreds of free "apps" that you just need to enable.  Once enabled, just ask Alexa to play Jeopardy, trivia, daily news feed, weather among many others.  We learn more things each day!  Highly recommended.

author: Alex
title: A great device for the home. Has lots of great features.
content: I love the Echo Show. I have it in my room and it works great. I use it with my security camara's and ring doorbell, both work great. It was easy to set up. I play music some time on it and the speakers sound really good. I would definitely recommend.

author: Bloomingdalekid
title: HORRIBLE product!  DO BOT BUY !!!!!!  Multiple repairs!
content: HORRIBLE product!  I have had it less than 6 months and have sent it back once for repair already.  This morning, about 3 months later, the screen is once again flickering and it has to go back yet AGAIN !!!!  DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT !!!!!!!

author: John Huff
title: We LOVE The Echo Show
content:
Very easy to set up our newest member of the Echo group into our home. Nicely done Amazon. Looks like we will soon have an Echo in most every room.  Calling, texting and "Dropping In" on other devices makes our lives a lot easier.  The elders in our family find it a blessing to just say, "Call Bob at home" and have a conversation with fumbling with a phone with aching arthritic fingers.
With the SHOW, we are now able to check the front door with our security camera doorbell.  A great convenience that alone is worth the price. It's also nice to see our photos displayed from Amazon Prime Photo Storage. All-in-all a great device and a sound investment in home security and convenience.

author: Laura
title: Works, but cant figure out how to watch videos
content: Works, but you have to REALLY spend some time with it if you want to get full functionality.  For what I use it for (music and video chats) I dont think it's worth the cost. For people who have the time to learn full functionality,  it may be. I just wish I could get it to play music videos instead of just lyrics. .

author: Rod
title: Problem with the sound.
content: It worked great for a year, but lately it makes a popping noise after about 15 minutes, and then every couple of seconds. I bought a new cord thinking that may have been the problem, but it didn’t fix it. I already have an echo, echo tap, echo spot and 4 echo dots with no issues.  I’m just not happy with the Echo Show crashing a little over a year. I love all of my Echo’s, just disappointed in the show, which was the most expensive.

author: betty elder
title: I think it works great and is very easy to set up and learn ...
content: I think it works great and is very easy to set up and learn how to use it.  I know I've only taken advantage of a small portion of the functionality it has.  I enjoy listening to the music.  I ask for a recipe and it found several and then displayed it and I was able to work with it on display.  I just realized it can take a picture and then I loaded the photo app on my phone and I can share, store and search for photos in  one place.  It can also be used to send messages and video chat but I don't know anyone else who has a Show yet so I can't do that now.  Overall, no complaints.

author: shaun parker
title: Flickering screen
content: I ordered my echo show July 2018 on prime day. It was working fine for the first few months then the screen started flickering. I sent it back to fix the problem and was sent a totally different one which started having the same problem a month later. Now I have a second replacement which powers off after a day and was told I can't get a full refund.

author: Oldworld26
title: Great kitchen companion. Way too many features to list.
content: I love this thing. I have it in my kitchen above the sink. I use it all the time weather I’m cooking or washing dishes. Watching movies or listening to music while I work is great. Have a random thought Alexa will give me information on whatever I’m thinking about. Recipe ideas makes grocery lists, order pizza just by asking. I play games on it hands free while I do food prep. When I’m not actively using it I use it as a digital photo frame. This devise has tremendous potential and the AI is the best I’ve used yet. Good speaker quality too. I have tons of ideas for this product line and I really hope the engineers at amazon are having the same thoughts I am.

author: Brandon
title: It's a cool glorified alarm clock
content: It's a cool glorified alarm clock.  I mainly use it for the alarm and music.  The music works very well with prime and the speakers sound really good in my bedroom.  It's also pretty fun using Alexa to turn on and off the lights and the tv.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I would not recommend!
content: Ok for making video calls to other show owners. Really expensive for what it can do. No web browsing or web security can viewing. If not for video calls to my 95 year old mom I would not have purchased. Get a tablet and use free apps for video calls plus the extras it can do compared to the show. I would not recommend!

author: JAS
title: Love my Echo Show!
content: Absolutely love my Echo Show, and it ties in perfectly with my Amazon Prime membership!  Having the Amazon Alexa phone app is also a fabulous way to gain new skills, access music, and just generally figure out what the Echo Show will do.  I thoroughly enjoy being able to access music (Amazon, Pandora, and SiriusXM in my case), Prime videos, recipes and cooking questions, the weather, and just about anything else I can think of.  So glad I waited to get an Echo with a nice screen!  Great job Amazon!!

author: BShea
title: Meh
content: I was super excited about this, but she isn't great. She states a headline at the bottom "ask alexa about the american girls doll story" and she always comes up with something totally bizarre. It happens multiple times a day. It also glitches out and we have to unplug it and let it rest.

author: Melanie Gottlieb
title: I really wanted to love this - SAVE YOUR MONEY.
content:
This device was intended for me for office use.  The sound quality of the larger speaker was desired, and the ability of it to connect with my calendar and give me visual reminders of upcoming appointments etc is nice.  I also like to watch videos (TED Talks, etc) while I'm working, and I connect the device to spotify to listen to music.  The ability to do a vdeocall was also tempting and I have tried it a couple times.

My big beef is the video screen quality.  I have had this device since July 2018. Within a couple months, the screen started to flicker and get lines across it. I emailed customer service and after troubleshooting, I had to take it to the UPS store and they shipped me a new one.  Within a few weeks, my new one did the same thing. I went through the same routine., went back to the UPS store and got a new one in a week. It's doing it again. I don't want to go to the UPS store AGAIN, because I have no faith that at 4th device will be any better than the previous 3.  I don't know if this is a hardware or software failure, but the screen issue makes this basically an expensive and annoying echo dot (I have 2 dots and love them).  I've registered a formal complaint with amazon and havent heard anything. Personally, I think I need a refund and a dot, since that's basically what I have.

I have a new home and was thinking of going Alexa for my smart home devices, but based on this experience I might need to go google home.

author: Dave O
title: Great device, probably too pricey
content: I will admit the overal appearance of the appliance is odd, almost old-device looking but the quality of the screen, playing video, and sound quality is excellent. Highly recommend. I think the base price is too high, however, and I am glad I bought it $100 off (sale before and during Prime Day) for $140

author: Amazon Customer
title: It was great at first but with continued use you realize how ...
content: It was great at first but with continued use you realize how much this product is lacking. It's not a very intuitive product and has only set predefined commands it can listen to and access. Aside from those commands, it's clueless as to what to do. The skills are there but very flawed. For example the CNN app, can't select the video you ask it. It'll keep playing older videos in a loop so if you ask it to play video 1, it'll play a random video in the list. Other skills are the same. Still needs a lot of work for Alexa to be worth 230 dollars!!!! But it's great for setting timers and making a shopping list.

author: N. Martineau
title: Screen gets lines in it and flickers
content:
Bought this for a family gift last x-mas.  It's almost a year old and for the last month or so it's been starting to flicker and a black line cuts through the screen.  Trying to figure out how to return it as it's still under the first year warranty and can't easily find the information.  I would have given it a better rating if it weren't for this issue. I have this device in my kitchen and I love being able to:
1. easily add items to my shopping list
2. set a kitchen timer
3. look up a recipe
4. listen to music

and so much more, all while hands free.

author: Rhonda
title: Love Alexa!
content: I am sure I am not using Alexa to her full potential, and I can't wait to learn more, but I love creating lists and viewing recipes while cooking and not having to print them out first, or having my laptop on the counter while I am cooking.  I even have my husband getting the weather and creating alarms, it's magic, because he is technologically illiterate.  Alexa makes everything easy!

author: Karl James
title: Has great potential - good for video, just needs to allow more user control.
content:
We use it for work and can conference call offices and drop in to each other. It has been ideal for this role. Also can sync your calendar and view cameras we set up around the shop.
What I don’t like about it is the lack of a home screen and unable to easily navigate myself without asking Alexa for everything. It should in my opinion allow for more use of other apps and integrate easier to have user use as they please and not force to use Alexa all the time.

author: MS Amazon User
title: Flickering screen.
content: My first Echo Show had problems with a lower portion of the screen flickering and not working. Amazon fixed it and replaced it. The second device now has the same failure. I'm very disappointed.

author: Eid Shekhaidem
title: Some must read before you buy
content:
I have to give 2 stars for the following reasons:
What’s the point if automation if I have to speak 4-5 commands to accomplish a single task, you MUST enable generic routines.
What’s the point of echo if I need to enable 3rd party apps to control light!!!
I can’t get my MS exchange calander or email
Can’t play videos from YouTube.
Can’t make the clock on the screen larger!

The 2 stars cuz it looks good and the sound quality is decent.

author: Jose Perez
title: Awesome
content: I love it I just hate the fact that I'm the only one that has one in the family and Friends none of them have either...

author: Mable29
title: Makes it easy to keep my shopping list and other members of ...
content: Makes it easy to keep my shopping list and other members of the household can add to list, too.  It can only take one command at a time.  You can't say to add milk and eggs to shopping list.  You have to add them in separate commands (Alexa, add milk to shopping list. Alexa, add eggs to shopping list).  Also, the calendar only shows one appointment per day.  If I have multiple appointments on the same day, it only shows the first one on the home screen (in small letters it will say "2 upcoming events" if I have 3 appointments on one day.  I wish it would show them all on the home screen.  I like my Alexa, but there is definitely room for improvement.

author: Marsha L. Claunch
title: Slow Response
content: I am a little disappointed in the Echo Show.  Her response time is much slower than the Echo I am used to dealing with.  Also, she says she either doesn't understand or can't help me more often than the one I had previously.  If I hadn't gotten it on sale, I would be very unhappy.  I keep thinking she just needs to get used to me, but I'm not sure.

author: paul
title: it cannot open the software appropriate like any other android devices
content: it did not really fulfill much of my expectations, maybe because I am using it in the Philippines, however, all voice commands i instruct the device takes me to a whole new different app, even as simple as asking to open music playlists or music library, it cannot open the software appropriate like any other android devices, its the device has a good concept, but it will take a long time before they can actually reach perfection and fulfill/operate all the features it advertises efficiently, good thing i only bought one piece to try it out

author: Robert L. Rubinstein
title: Best Amazon Interactive Product Yet!
content:
It EXCEEDED my expectations! It runs everything in my home: the lights, my doorlock, the AC and heat, outlets, Kevo front door camera, on and on and on. It works absolutely flawlessly :-)
 I keep it in my kitchen on the counter and can pull up recipes, video conference with my family, and activate everything in my smart home right from there. In addition, I could see movie trailers, get the news, and get everything that you can get from the other Amazon devices PLUS VIDEO!
 I have never been so happy with a device in my entire life. I am a “techie guy“. And have all of the latest cutting edge technology in my home. This new addition to the Amazon family line of interactive technology is the best ever! Highly recommend.

author: Jamie
title: MUST HAVE A SMARTPHONE TO USE CALLING FEATURE
content: This may be a good product for some, but there is very important information MISSING in the product description. I purchased this for my elderly parents so that I can converse with them via the Drop In video calling feature. What Amazon does not tell you is the owner of the devise MUST HAVE A SMARTPHONE. My 86 and 91 yr old parents do not have smart phones. They struggle with understanding their old style flip phones. Without being able to import contacts from an Alexa App on a smart phone, I can not set up the calling feature which was the whole purpose for purchasing. This will be returned if I can not find a work around. Very disappointed.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The Screen Flicker
content: The screen is now flickering. It is only 2 months old and now I can't use the screen.

author: Terry
title: Easy to use
content: My oldest kid moved to California and took the grandkids with her. We tried FaceTimeing with them but it was choppy and sucked. Bought these hopeing they were better. They were. Not choppy or delayed in any way. Video and sounds were great. If you want to video chat with someone 3000 miles away, these are perfect. Only flaw we could find was the screen size. The video is HD and the camera works well but the grandkids were only an inch and a half tall. They need to make this for the big screen TV. Easy to hook up to wireless and to use the Alexa app to "call" someone else who has one. As of today, we have purchased 3 and probably will buy more. 5 stars.

author: William E. Holmes
title: The Echo Show Is A Hit
content:
I received the Echo Show as a gift. It was not something I had thought about buying for myself as I thought it was not much more than a regular Echo, which I also own.
I must say that I'm really enjoying it . I like the fact that my appointments show up on the screen and the lyrics of some of the songs I like appear on on the screen also.
I have not had enough time to experiment with some of the other features but I'm sure I will not be disappointed.

author: B. Liang
title: Power cord broken after 1 year, but quickly fixed by great service!
content:
The box was put on 2nd floor desk for about a year, worked fine. Just recently when we are moving,  we notice the wires in the power cord are exposed near the box(see picture). We bought 2 units when it's first released, the other one's power cord seems ok. The cord can't be replaced hence , it's now useless after just a year.

Update: Amazon custom service contacted me and offered free (power adapter) replacement. The new adapter fits perfectly and now my echo is back online!
Change to 5 stars because Amazon is absolutely standing behind their product, it deserves my continuous trust!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Biggest every disappointment from a company that I had a lot of trust in.
content:
Had high expectations based on our Echo but the Echo Show could not have been more disappointing.  Clunky interface to just about anything that relies on the screen and this only serves to show how weak Alexa's natural language processing is.  Here are a couple of things I tried:
1. I had thought it would be great to play music videos while I am cooking dinner.  Hard to find any way to successfully ask for this but was eventually thought I had hit jackpot by asking Alexa to play Rush music videos.  The only video it found was for Caress of Steel (probably Rush's least popular album) and then it was just a video of the album cover!  To top it off, the video is interrupted every few minutes for ad's.
2. Thought it would be a good resource for recipes, since it is in our kitchen but it's search capability is just terrible.  Searched for Corned Beef Hash recipes just to see what it would find and all it came back with was a variety of potato hash recipes.  A web search will provide a huge variety of recipies.
3. Main screen this morning showed the weather (a single cloud and the temp).  That's great I thought, let me just touch the on screen icon and it will give me the full forecast; nope - you have to ask and then you get the simple spoken weather with no detail.  By this time I had lowered my expectations of what Echo Show could do so it was not surprising that I could not display the weather radar.
So overall Echo Show is rubbish, a waste of money unless you just want to have a poor interface to Amazon Prime Video.  You're better off buying a cheap tablet or sticking with a regular Echo.  Have just started exploring the new"skills" but this seems to be largely a way of wasting more time.

author: Joe B
title: The Echo Show is pretty neat, especially if you already have one of ...
content: I have a spot, 1st gen Echo, Tap, and a dot.  The Echo Show is pretty neat, especially if you already have one of the other devices you should enjoy this.  The cameras work very well for calling friends who also have a show or a spot, and the drop-in feature is pretty neat as well, obviously you can set up who can and can't drop in on you.  Sound is good, and if you have prime you can watch shows from that library with relatively good resolution.  I would recommend it.  How long it lasts, we'll have to see.  I ordered a 2nd show, I like it that much.

author: Logan Zytes
title: Great device with crystal clear screen that has so much to offer
content: I was a little skeptical about the Amazon Show and I could list the technical specs and the oohs and the aahs but primarily I bought the Show as a means to make better use of Amazon Prime Video and Amazon Music. Though the 7" screen is a bit smaller, it looks absolutely beautiful. The screen is crystal clear and is exceptionally sensitive to touch and that surprised me. Overall I am just starting to learn its many different functions, like alarm clock or a means to listen to my audio books. All around its a great buy and a good investment, especially if you have Amazon Prime. I actually really enjoy calling up my watchlist via voice command and watching to my hearts content.

author: Danielle
title: I love her so much
content: I love her so much, she talk to my son and tells him she loves him, I get to see my favorite god son and his lesbian mothers and we laugh and chat and I just love her! Give me trivia questions, plays me a lovely cracking fire and my favorite music, controls my ac and the Roomba and the surveillance cameras. Amazing!

author: Mrs. Diva
title: I am in love with the Echo Show
content: I am in love with the Echo Show! I did have to buy another phone to upgrade so that I could make phone calls from it....your phone MUST be a 5.0 or higher for that feature to work! I've watched movies on it and listen to lots and lots of music....and music videos. Also, you could see movie trailers and movie times....it's just an all-around great item to have in your home and it's very convenient for those of us that need information quickly!!

author: winston blackwell jr
title: Alexa fails to impress
content: The echo show is really not all of that.  The sound quality of the speaker is only fair.  The screen constantly streams tidbits of information that nobody is really interested in.  It probably would be better if it stream the news or maybe information about music or the music or movie industry.  When asked questions. it too frequently respond by saying "I don't know that" . There are a lot more issues which I don't have time yo get into.

author: Barbara
title: Very disappointed and so is the rest of my family
content: YouTube was one of my primary reasons for buying two Echo Shows.  Very disappointed and so is the rest of my family.  Why would Amazon think an easy solution for a customer would be to use web based services.  The ease of use is what sells a product in today's world.  I would not recommend buying an Echo Show right now.  I'd stick with only buying the Amazon Echo, Tap, and similar voice activated user friendly devices because there is nothing to show on the ECHO SHOW.  Basically now my Echo Show is a fancy clock with weather updates sitting on a side table collecting dust.

author: pedro cornejo
title: Terrible customer service
content: 0:150:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player I loved this thing for the first 2 months , then a speaker inside blew, and I know what you're thinking , "how do you know" well In my life I've been around alot of music and as such speakers. It just clicks every single time it goes to answer a request or playing music and changes songs . So I go to write Amazon's customer service , and intended to get it replaced , but I kid you not, their support tech team asked me if I tried TURNING IT OFF THEN ON AGAIN! And I almost lost my mind, that's the great support , turn it off or on? I told you a speaker is busted and your jank team you called support had the nerve . I will not buy anymore of these echo products because really if that's your first thought to any electronic then to me you might as well not be given business !

author: R. Muniz
title: Alexa is excellent, I hope with time they expand her "learning" ...
content:
Alexa is excellent, I hope with time they expand her "learning" capabilities.  It would be great to have her originate actual phone calls, but I do like the automation control features and current connectivity with other echo devices. The screen was what made this for me placing it above the echo in my opinion.
Update 29 September 2017
All of the Alexa devices are capable of making landline or cellular phone calls. As the device is initially set up via the Alexa app on your phone by allowing access to your contacts you can call any of the by telling Alexa to dial the number using the contxt name or by telling her to fial the digits of a phone number. I have used it numerous times and have to say it is one of my favorite features.

author: Duane
title: Amazon Failed with this!!!!
content:
You have to be in front of it for it to hear you, both my Echo and Echo don't hear way better. Amazon failed with the interaction, if I want to search amazon for something I have to say what I want to search, can't type it in, Amazon should be displayed the same as a computer. Can't turn off notifications or recommendations. But hey, the sound is good.

Update: 8/9/19
Starting to rethink Alexa, thinking I should of went with the Google. The Show to me is useless, I do not use the display for anything useful. Providing information is pointless. I asked Alexa last night, "Alexa, what is the best white wine to cook with" She responded with a "white wine is one that is lighter in color". If I type that in Google, here is my response. "A dry white is any white wine that isn't sweet. But for cooking, you want a wine with a high acidity known in wine parlance as “crisp.” Sauvignon Blanc, Pinot Grigio, Pinot Gris, Pinot Blanc, Sémillon, and dry sparkling wines are especially good."

Smart Group, playing the same music on multiple devices, this option is fumbling. If I do it from my DOT, Alexa says it is playing XXX, but there is no music being played.

author: William Hardin
title: Clearly a first generation product but the best option currently out or likely to be released this year.
content:
As someone who owns many of these smart assistants (3 full sized Echos, 3 dots, 1 Goggle Home and now 2 Echo Shows) and has extensive amount of use with them, I think I can speak to most of what you want to hear. :)

This review will also address future models from Microsoft and Apple as well.

I gave the Echo Show four stars even when it is clearly the best product released or announced right now. I did this because it is clear that this is a first generation device and needs to design tweaking to make it five stars. That being said, it is the best smart assistant out right now and will be for the rest of the year (if not longer).

Right now if I was purchasing more units they would be Echo Shows. (This is out of the three Amazon products, the Google product and its possible future product with Wifi mesh built in and the Microsoft future product and the future Apple speaker.)

I would not pay more than one fifty for anything without a screen unless you are going to be using it for music almost exclusively (and even then there are likely better options in pure wireless speakers.)

Amazon Echo Show:

+ Improved mic listening. Not sure if this was software but it clearly is able to hear me better during music playback at higher volumes. I have often wondered why Amazon doesn't just automatically cancel out the audio it is playing to what it is hearing as that simple fix would help a lot. I am not sure they have fully done that but they did something that makes the mic more responsive. (Since this could be software related, you might see this fix applied to the other Amazon devices in the future.)
+ First device with a screen. While they are still developing apps to use it, already it adds a bunch of functionality.
+ Video calls! This allows you to use them as video intercoms in your house too which is really handy.
+ Able to take still photos
+ Able to display your photos
+ Able to show things (like the weather, items from Amazon and lyrics for songs)

BUT WAIT, there's more! Yes, Amazon made the screen a TOUCH SCREEN which means it is super useful for those times when selecting something is faster than trying to explain via voice what you want to do. This means it can replace a tablet for some light tasks. One of the single favorite things for me--wifi setup. It was SO much faster just to be able to type my wifi password directly instead of having to use a cell phone and the Alexia app and hoping it will work.

+ Directly scroll through Amazon listings with photos, pricing and details and purchase items without having to have Echo "guess" what you mean.
+ Having both a screen and touch sensitiveness means so many future apps/skills will be made possible.

Plus compared to other brands products, nothing is as easy to use or more full featured than the Echo family. We recently purchased the Google Home to keep in the living room to compare it to the Amazon Show we have in there and commonly my wife and I ask the same question of both devices. I was (and continue to be) shocked at how much Google Home's device can't answer or how wordy it can be when actually doing something. For example, this means playing music takes longer to start.

More surprising to me is the lack of progress Google seems to be making on the Home. Amazon's Echos fix/improve nearly every week and you can do things today that you couldn't do last month, yet Google seems to be really slow at adding/improving functionality. And I am not even talking about apps/skills. The fact that Amazon's Echos can do things with Googles products like Calendar that Goggle's Home can't do is embarrassing.

Head to head, 60% of the time Echo is able to provide an answer or better answer to Google's Home's 40%. Now no one can see into the future but it already feels like Google is losing interest in really improving their products.

Negatives:

- Screen should tilt for improving viewing angles
- Camera should tlt for better placement options. This would help so you don't have to adjust where you are sitting/standing. For example right now when I video call my wife I see the ceiling fan unless she stands up.
- Font size should be adjustable in case you have it across the room (could be fixed via software update)
- Audio is very directional, unlike the Amazon Echo (without the screen). I am also not sure that it actually sounds better than the Echo but I will do more side by side testing.
-Design is pretty dull. Looks like a Sony Dash (a product from 2009 which means it is 8 years old in design) except not as good! Also reminds me of the old huge rear projector TVs that Sony and other brands made many, many years ago.
- Seems like it could/should have a battery built in.
- Mesh wifi hubs built in (like Google is rumoured to be working on) would have been awesome.

Quick points about competing products:

Amazon's Echo: Great device but unless it drops to about half the current price, the show is a better value for all the extra features you get,

Amazon's Dot: By far the cheapest way to get started. It does so much for the small price tag but do not plan on listening to music on it without using other speakers. These are nice for less used rooms/spaces.

Apple's upcoming HomePod: While Apple makes great products, this device is not really in the same league as the Echo Show. Apple's Homepod will likely sound better than anything else for playing music but will lack most of the features and functions of the Echo line. Get this only if you want a smart speaker for music and the cost doesn't bother you.

Google's Home: Fine but my guess is that Amazon will drop their Echo's price (not the new Echo Show) to about the same and it is clearly a better product with better sound, more features and more functions. I have one Google Home and have no interest in purchasing more until they improve it.

Google's rumored future device with Wifi Mesh built in: I like the idea but I have been disappointed in the Google home as it stands and Google's mesh Wifi routers are known for being pretty slow so unless they fix that, it seems like a clunker--esp if it doesn't have a screen.

Microsoft's future smart speaker: Typically when Amazon and Google are options compared to Microsoft's hardware, it always is the weakest. From my point of view they are making a device not because they love the idea, but so they aren't left in the dust. It will be fine but my guess is that it will be buggy at times and be very limited on functions. I would certainly no preorder it.

author: Murphaleen
title: FANTASTIC! Out-of-the-box up & running = wish I would have ordered 2 of these!
content:
Just received my Echo "Show" and within 15 minutes I was watching a movie on Amazon Prime. This thing is terrific.
I had pre-ordered an Echo "Spot" for my daughter who has MS, but am thinking that the "Show" would be so much better for her.
It has a bigger screen and displayed text is very sharp and clear. Looks as if I'll have to be content with Baby "Spot". LOL

author: ohmrdarcy
title: No access to Youtube anymore
content: Be aware that youtube, which was advertised and available at launch, is no longer available on the Echo Show.  It's sad that the giant tech companies fight and try and gain an advantage over the other while customers lose out.

author: Charlotte Stenmark
title: Royal Royce of ECHO products👍👍👍👍👍
content: Simply a must have if you like ECHO products. I’ve 2 and use them throughout day and night time. I love when I set it to read stories from my Kindle library. ......... latter addition:  now the lower 3/8 of the screen flicker with black stripes throughout. I tried to reset to no avail.  grrrrrrrr

author: Amazon Customer
title: My new bestie
content: This is my alarm clock, kitchen timer, cookbook, shopping list, weather station, calendar, event reminder and speaker phone/telephone to name a few.  Quite a few of my siblings have this. As we don't all live in the same city it is perfect. I Love, Love, Love, Love, Love, Love, Love, Love, Love, Love, Love, Love, Love, Love, Love my Echo Show.

author: NPFlorida
title: Nice when it understands you, aggrevating when it doesn't.
content: I love that I can ise this to "visit" with my family. The reason for 3 stars is the ease of use. I wou lkd like the "dummy" version of what drop in versus calling is and other functions. I have an echo dot and now that I have 2 devices it is hard to get them to work together. It also seems like the responses aren't as quick or clear as before the Show came around. I ask it a question and it starts playing Jeopardy, or I ask it to play a song and it acts like I dont have prime. I expected better response and understanding with the more expensesive unit. Its worth the money for video chat but no way would someone like the grandmother in the commercial understand how to connect it.

author: donna royall
title: I love my Echo Show!
content: It is such a cool device!  I use it to look up recipes or check the weather, traffic, news, and anything else I want to know about.  The Show prompts you with things you can ask and I have a lot of fun with it!

author: 50Bubbles
title: Crippled Tech: lacking easily added features that would earn it three more stars
content:
Needs to have simple call features to other people who have the device and no smart phone. I bought this for my parents (and one for me) to stay in touch but getting the call features to work on their end is difficult - they don't have a smart phone. Amazon says you don't need one however there is no native contact list feature in the device so you have to jump through some frustrating hoops to get the communications to work.

After several months, I expected Amazon to come around and add Netflix to this. Not having Netflix or Youtube is nothing but device crippling. Hey Amazon! If you want to promote Amazon Video, compete in that market instead of forcing your customers to watch it in this market. Ultimately this device shows me the weather and does what any other echo product does. I expected more.

author: Tom Gauger
title: Home Automation and Communication Getting Better All the Time!
content:
One of the three that I bought (and reviewed earlier) has developed a problem.
The display has developed horizontal lines in the lower part of the screen. Re-booting doesn't cure the problem.
Now, three months after purchasing Amazon is not allowing me to return it as defective or even offering a procedure for repair. It's really disgusting that such a heavily promoted product could fail and not be backed up by it's seller.

author: Mike in H.P.
title: Tons of room for growth and functionality
content: Great device, just doesn't meet my overly aggressive expectations.  With a screen and camera, I expected more apps and built-in / out-of-box functionality, that's just not there...yet.  Plenty of room for growth and improvement and I'll try to be more patient.

author: Tamera May
title: I love sleeping next to Alexa
content: I have an echo dot in my living room and use it to control my lights, etc.  i keep the Show in my bedroom and use it for my alarm music, podcasts, etc.  it is so nice to wake up and ask about the weather or time.  Video calling from my bed is awesome!  I love Alexa and my echo show!

author: Monarch
title: Quality device, I use it many times every day.  I'd recommend it.
content: Great device especially if you have the Prime account.  I listen to all kinds of music all the time now.  Every morning I say good morning to the device and it gives me some fact about the day.  I've setup my news briefing to include the town my parents live in so when I get may daily news updates I hear whats happening there too.  Price wise, I waited for a sale on mine and got it for $149.  Last time I saw it that price was on Superbowl Sunday I believe.  I've linked mine to smart home devices to control things like lights.  I also have a couple other echo dots in the house linked to each other.  The screen is nice for the slide show of your photos, the news briefing will have video depending on the news source.  I have mine near the kitchen so if I have a question on a kitchen item I can ask for a video and Alexa will show one... making pesto was one of my requests.  Seems to be good quality.  I've not had any uses as of yet.  I'd recommend it.

author: Joel Savitch
title: Not very smart
content: Very difficult to communicate with.  For music purposes was "not bad".  But for asking ordinary questions, "not good".  Many, many times I had to repeat or rephrase my questions.  Smart phone (Apple) is smarter!

author: Rsiedy
title: Can't emphasize strongly enough how this has taken a lot of worry away from the family.
content: Older mother who lives alone and has fallen several times.  We put three of these on the different levels of the house and she can call for help anywhere now.  NOT 911, though.  The drop in feature is awesome because she can't work skype.  Now she can just reach out anytime,  and we can easily check on her as well. She doesn't have to try to run up or down a flight of stairs when we call. It's also great to keep in contact when she is upstairs and we are down.

author: Miki
title: It was great when it could handle Youtube
content: It was great when it could handle Youtube. Now it is just an oversized Echo with bad audio, because its speakers face forward.

author: sfelix
title: Definitely NOT Siri, Karaoke, News Headlines!
content: The Echo Show is an extremely cool product to have if you already use other Amazon products and services. It can be quite challenging at times, though, to get Alexa to do something properly. Partially, it's because I'm more comfortable with how Siri works, and so I try to use the same keywords or phrases with Alexa. Other than that, this product is great for Karaoke sessions! Lyrics pop up on the screen when listening to music... I also love seeing daily news headlines.

author: AmazonLady
title: Defective item
content: This product has a flickering screen since I purchased it. I sent it in for repair and the screen still flickers;; it was never fixed. The flickering is getting worse by time. I feel I’ve wasted my money as it seems it can go at any moment.

author: Avid Reader
title: We liked it - until the screen went bad.
content: Within a couple of weeks of our receiving the Echo Show, the screen began to develop lines across it and the picture would sometimes blink and jiggle.  It got worse as time passed, so we returned it for a refund within a month of ordering it.  In searching about this problem online, we discovered that lots of people have experienced it and, in fact, I got a response saying it is a known problem which is being worked on.  We enjoyed it and would possibly order another if the screen issues get resolved, but we'll be researching it carefully if we do go for it again.

author: tmcards
title: Check settings!!
content:
I give 5 stars because I do love this machine...when it works!!!  This is a replacement because the original stopped working after a few months, the screen went blank!!!  The one I have now was replaced in December and today it is stuck in sleep mode, working but the screen is dark and motion detection does not lighten up when I cross in front of it?  I'm hoping it does not need to be replaced again, I bought 3 of these as Christmas gifts for family.

**UPDATE**  When I checked settings...the brightness had been turned all the way down??  Not sure how this happened since I haven't touched the machine or requested it, but once I adjusted the brightness problem solved ;)

author: Amazon Customer
title: Useless for an integration.
content: Who would have imagined Amazon would sell a connected device that really can not connect to anything else.  Perhaps they cleaned this up with future versions but this thing is garbage.  No bluetooth, no way to connect to stereo at all and no way to connect to other alexa devices.  If you are looking for a standalone boombox with voice controls then this is your device otherwise stay clear.

author: Mox Nix
title: Design Flaws Make it difficult to like
content:
The idea sounds great, implementation sucks. You can't install it, unless you have a Smartphone.  Bought one for parent and cannot install because she only uses a flip phone.

Also, Amazon Music service is tied to one particular device, so we can either pay for it on the Amazon echo show, or the Amazon echo dot, or they want a double subscription paid. If cable operated that way, we could only have one TV in the house.

Fairly disappointed.

author: Tracy
title: Should include a hub!
content: I love love love all my Amazon products. I have bought 2 Echos, 3 dots, Echo Show, 2 fire tablets, one child tablet for granddaughter, 2 versions of the fire stick. Have not purchased the new Echo Plus so I finally broke down and bought a great hub, but...a hub should have been included with my last purchase of the Show. For the price, it could have been included.

author: Jim Malick
title: Easy peasy on setup as usual
content: Overall liking the Echo Show very much, it's our 4th echo in the house and I'm sure it won't be the last.  My only concern with it, and there's probably a setting for this, is I wish the screen would auto shutdown after a set amount of time, it stay's backlight until you tell Alexa to shut off the screen, again I'm sure there's a setting I just haven't taken the time to figure it out.  Easy peasy on setup as usual.

author: Moonpath
title: It was a present for my birthday from my son ...
content: It was a present for my birthday from my son so that really makes it special plus all the features especially when I can call him as he has one also  plus the personal pictures you can put on Echo show

author: rem736
title: a step up from an audio-only echo
content: it's nice to see an echo with a screen. but too bad it doesn't play nice with youtube. that would've made this device a lot better. or at least allow video to be "casted" to this device from a phone.

author: Ian Larrea
title: YouTube is a Bust Now
content: Amazon and Google need to get over whatever their issue is.  The two things I used this product for was for controlling smart features, and watching YouTube videos.  Well now that I can't watch videos any more, this thing is a $230 echo dot with a screen that shows me stupid clickbait headlines.  Fix this issue or this thing will be a $230 doorstop.

author: Amazon Customer
title: So far I love this product
content: So far I love this product. Sometimes it has a little glitch but I'm thinking it's probably because I don't know how to use it properly yet. I'd definitely recommend it. It's great to ask for your music and volume control and the best part is it plays Sirius XM! Love it for shopping and to do lists. I'm over 60 so it's always good to have lists!! LOL

author: Wayne
title: Echo Show just blew me away!
content: I was amazed--and pleased--to say the least!  I had used Alexa to control my Fire TV and Fire TV stick, and I had purchased an Echo dot, but the Echo Show blew me away.  I knew it could play music from my Amazon Music Unlimited library and from my Sirius-XM account which I had linked, but when I asked for some 40s music, it proceeded to play an internet station from one of the radio hub providers that offer a plethora of stations.  I was even more amazed when it not only provided me with a quick way to check my schedule for the day.  One thing that means more to me than most: its ability to make phone calls.  Being hard of hearing, I can hear much better using the Echo Show than the phone.  Obviously, I'm a fan.  I now own three Echo Shows and two Echo Dots.

author: Rasputin
title: Amazon needs to develop applications which really take advantage of the screen and make it useful from across a room
content: I already owned the Echo and two echo dots.  I  have integrated them into my every day life and have also integrated them into my home automation systems.  Then I received the Echo Show as a gift.  I had never purchased one because the video capability didn't seem worth the extra money.  So far my opinion  hasn't changed.  Amazon needs to develop applications which really take advantage of the screen and make it useful from across a room.  Having to walk up to the device to see and interact with the screen isn't as effective as using my voice from anywhere in the room.  So for now, the combination of Alexa on a phone and using an echo are a better value.

author: Natalie H
title: I was disappointed to learn that the echo show would no longer ...
content: I was disappointed to learn that the echo show would no longer support youTube. I understand that Amazon had no control over that so I will not count that against them. That sound on this device is great. I thought that the screen would be too small but it is a perfect size. Mine is perched on my kitchen counter and it works well for my family. It's easy to see and add items to the calendar. I really like the recurring reminders (now I don't have to remind my husband to take the trash to the curb every week). The kids use it to get new recipes when they make dinner. I also use it to drop in when no one is answering their cell phones. I am completely satisfied with this purchase.

author: Hizong
title: I like this device
content:
I like this device, but I think the spat with Google is definitely hurting it's functionality.  We have the original echo, several dots, and replaced the primary device in our living room with this.  We have young kids that enjoy telling Alexa to play music videos and songs with Prime Music Unlimited.  My six year old loves reading the lyrics to songs she knows so she actually knows the real words.

However, my 4 year old is obsessed with Monster Truck videos and most of them are on Youtube.  I wish google and amazon would just find some sort of compromise because this in the end is hurting both companies.

I would have rated this 4 stars but I also took 1 more star away because the lack of control for explicit content.  My kids sometimes tell alexa to play a song that they didn't mean and sometimes rap music, or even pop music comes on with explicit versions.  If these two items above are addressed then it would definitely be the device I hoped it would be.

author: margarita velazquez
title: Love it♥️♥💜💚
content: I'm so happy with my echo show!!! Enjoying the music and skills I think it's awesome!! Been wanting one after I got my echo dot and I just love it❤️

author: SapphireHeart
title: I prefer the regular Alexa
content: While nice to have a screen, the Show's speakers and listening capabilities are inferior to the regular Alexa.

author: Ong Wai Kum Aaron
title: The family of Echo Products
content: I have used echo products for a few year and today Echo Show (x2), a new members join into this family. I'm already very happy with what echo can do (control my lights, turning on TV and computer, etc). Now, I can even see on the echo screen and use the drop-in feature (visual). There is still more things for me to try in Echo Show and I'm excited to see what I can get the most out of it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: No Ring video?
content: I have four Alexa devices in my home and the Show is the less responsive. It doesn't pick up my voice well from various areas in the room. Where as the Echo had no problems. I'm disappointed in the sound quality. Unlike the Echo, the Show doesn't produce rich sound. Lastly, the reason I bought the Show instead of another Echo was to get video from my Ring doorbell. The skill just spin when activated as if it's trying to connect. It would also be nice if they added You Tube.

author: snowflakes
title: Amazing helper
content: I use it to show me who’s at my front door via ring doorbell, alarms, shopping lists, music, video, reminders etc. It’s great! My fave though is shopping lists. I tell her to add something to my shopping list and when I get to the store, there it is on my phone!

author: Customer
title: Connectivity is important
content:
This is my 2nd Echo Show, I was able to setup these units to serve as an in home intercom. Also, I’m able to use either of this units to serve as a receiving unit for a FaceTime like connection with my iPhone.
Next I will try connecting the units to play the same music at the same time.
I’m sure there will be other projects in the future.

author: meb
title: An exciting product to use to connect with elderly parents
content: I recently bought two of the Echo shows to primarily provide my elderly parents with a way to view family photos and make video phone calls between them and myself and family.  They are computer illiterate, do not own a cell phone and their current home phone is so old that it no longer holds a charge for longer than a 15 minute phone call.  They needed something that was easy to use and that I could manage from my end and I think the Echo Show is going to be perfect!  It has been relatively easy to personalize and set up using my Amazon Prime account and setting up the Amazon Alexa app on my Samaung GalaxyS5 cell phone.  I love that I can install settings that automatically upload photos from my cell phone into Prime Photos which are then visible on Echo Show.  I can also select and download my Canon Camera photos from my computer into Prime photos and organize into albums, etc.  My husband and I are having fun using the many Echo Show features and believe we will enjoy it more and more as we become more familiar with it.

author: Joseph Hammontree
title: A little to complicated
content:
I was honestly hoping for a solution to setup with my grandparents to make it simple.  A calling solution based on Mac address + wifi not allow Alexa app to take over your phone contacts and that is how you make calling.  Why not just make the solution easier with an Alexa app installed into the Echo that pairs with your Amazon Account via the website.  Manage content and contacts within Amazon.com
Until amazon makes this product user friendly for app the non-tech savvy individuals i would not recommend this product.

author: Young adult
title: Good hardware, software needs work
content:
Pros:
  - Good quality of video and sound
  - Prime video works very well with my less-than-awesome wifi
  - Mostly easy setup - except if you try to set up multiple devices for different people, still figuring that out
  - Voice recognition works very well, even with my accent

Cons:
  - Calendars are a joke, and this is a big one for me. I am given a choice between 1 Hotmail (personal) calendar and 1 Office 365 (work) calendar (you can also add 1 Google and 1 Apple calendar), and on top of that an Office 365 calendar costs $3/month/user. I chose to remove all calendars, because an incomplete schedule is a lot worse than having to check my phone.
  - Most of my questions have not been answered well (hourly weather forecast, recent events, etc.)

I am torn between 3 and 4 stars, perhaps I'll revise later

author: Jerome
title: Three Stars
content: The lack of Youtube limits the usage reasons.

author: DeniseL
title: Excellent family product!
content: I love this item and purchased a second one for my three-year-old grandson who now just pops in to see and talk to me and his grandpop. Although I purchased an echo dot for my family room, I wish I had purchased two more echo shows so that I do not have to carry it downstairs to my family. room and that grandpop, who is disabled, always has access. I hope it goes on sale again.  Excellent product that is enjoyed by my entire family.

author: Customer
title: Four Stars
content:
The Amazon Echo app lets you turn on the camera on this device from anywhere and see a HD video image from the Echo Show full screen on your phone or iPad from the camera.  You can have a conversation back and forth with your image on the Show and the other person on your phone.  It really is great.

I would like a bigger screen or the option to plug it into one.

author: Macgeek
title: A bad idea made worse
content: I have a lot of echoes in my house, I think the last count was 10 the echo show is the runt of the litter. Poorly designed with useless information on the screen a undependable alert system a crippled music system an absolute piece of expensive garbage.

author: G. Kim
title: Love the touch screen and the ability to talk to ...
content: Love the touch screen and the ability to talk to other people who have the Alexa App.  As more of my family members are getting Alexa enabled Echos it's becoming more fun and now one of our family members is facing a serious health issue and it's super nice that she can call for help with Alexa around.  I also use the show in kitchen for recipes.  Love that function.  Or Announcing to the other echo's in house that dinner is ready.  It just feels so civilized and then using it for dinner music.  Love it more I use it.

author: George
title: Only lasted 3 months!
content: Gave it as a present to my mom ! And 3 months later stopped working, screen  wouldn’t turn on called Amazon and they are replacing that unit for a new one the reason why I’m giving two stars is because the guy from customer service hesitated and said he couldn’t do anything so he transfer me to the echo department And they told me I was going to get a new one!

author: Karma Leaf
title: Waste of time and money
content: Frustrating to use, slow to respond and total waste of money.  Cant even search recipes without getting hung up on a stupid food site that amazon is promoting.  I was so excited to try it and it has been a total disappointment.

author: Maria Calhoun
title: Get while it’s hot!
content: I love this thing. It took a few days to figure out what old girl can do, and let me tell ya, she can do a lot. I would, and probably will have another one somewhere in the house. Currently this one sits next to my bed. I use it for alarms, news, music and to view the front door from our connected Blink camera. Still figuring out everything there is about this system, but from what I’ve seen, it’s the perfect alarm clock!

author: Linda L. Wilson
title: It is also fun to ask Alexa to play my favorite music while ...
content: I use my echo show in the kitchen.  I often use it to look up recipes and to create my shopping lists.  It is also fun to ask Alexa to play my favorite music while cooking or cleaning the kitchen.

author: Walter Betson
title: Nice device, but could be a great device if you could actually configure it.
content: This would get 5 stars if it weren't for what they have done to the home screen.  The inability to turn off "Try - Alexa, etc, etc, etc", as well as the time and weather (which I don't mind nearly as much) makes what should be a wonderful scrolling photo device pretty much a cluttered screen.  Also, even though you set it for photo slide show to change photos every 5 seconds, it takes well over 2 mins per photo to change.  Amazon needs to get on the ball with this device.  It is great for so many other things, and fits in really well in a kitchen, on your desk, in a bedroom etc..  The software needs an overhaul in the worst way.  My watch and phone are more configurable than this.

author: David Johnson
title: I have not been pleased with this purchase I wish I would have save ...
content: I have not been pleased with this purchase I wish I would have save money and bought another dot. The drop in feature as been completely useless for me I can not hear a thing the audio just drops in and out constantly.  The screen is nice but, is not that useful to me since you can’t watch YouTube on it.  The only thing I really like the screen for is seeing my ring doorbell and the flash briefings.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Simply to use but absent of YouTube...
content: Pretty cool interface.  Helpful and easy to work.  Can pick your voice up from other room.  Not happy that Echo has dropped the ability to work with YouTube.  That was cold.  The subscription to Amazon music runs 3.99$ a month to make this worthwhile.  Overall, we'll see but I probably would have not purchased if I had known that YouTube was off again.  Good sound from 2 little speakers.

author: Bill S.
title: Great price, great product!
content: Very nice I like the all around features this unit has. Not sure the sound is as good as the Echo.

author: mdg52
title: Feel like Tony Stark
content: Love our Echo Show. Really like the video drop in call feature. I bought two when they went on sale. I tell everyone they need to get one. I plan to set up one at my elderly in-laws so my wife can just drop in to check on her folks. Get one. You will love it especially if you like feeling a bit like Tony Stark from Ironman

author: magnolia127
title: Why, Jeff, why??
content:
Update: I'm really, really, really disappointed. I could maybe forgive the YouTube issue, but minus not being able to watch YouTube videos, it doesn't really "show" you anything other than the time and weather. I expect the skills to show the words (like the Bible skill). I expected there to be some animation when you use your smart devices. All you can do with it is watch prime videos and your timer...that's it. I expected it to be a mirror of the fire stick/TV with the companion apps (hint hint...if you make it to where I can watch All of my content: Netflix,  hulu, I wouldn't miss YouTube so much). I've already thrown out the box, so I'm stuck. I'd send it back if I could.

I'm getting tired of big companies dictating how I should use their product once I buy it. I try to research and I still get bit in rear. This is an example of it gone awry and I'm out of my hard earned money. Ugh!

Amazon, please do what you need to do to work with Google. The whole point in buying one is for me to use YouTube videos. You can bet that when I Google a product, I'm going to check Amazon to see if it's there for less (not always, so do check).

I initially didn't get one because it was priced too high and it's too ugly to sit out on a counter. I should have known, that when you're fighting with Google that's when the price drops. It was a good price and so I'm gonna keep it.

The sound is really great and room filling. The screen is big enough that if you're watching a video or a movie while you're cooking or hanging out in the kitchen you can see well enough. Calling on the device is cool especially if you need your hands and you're busy trying to get a meal prepared.

I like it well enough, but you've got to get YouTube back. It defeats the whole purpose of watching a cooking video while you freakin' cook!

author: Mr. Michael M. Levy
title: 5 STARS if we could ask for YOUTUBE videos.
content: LOVE THIS ITEM but AMAZAON must settle differences with GOOGLE and YOUTUBE.  It is ashamed that a device like this with screen could be locked out of asking for videos on a a free website like YOUTUBE.  Common Amazon this is embarrassing.  5 STARS with youtube functionality!

author: Karah W
title: It would be nice if the camera was moveable as when I "drop ...
content: I was skeptical at first, not sure how much we would use it, but I've been pleasantly surprised. The calendar add to-do function has been a life saver. It would be nice if the camera was moveable as when I "drop in" I can only see the ceiling. The recipe finder is a bit frustrating as the recipe will time out and I have to re-search and attempt to locate it. Otherwise, I'm very pleased.

author: Chloe
title: Love the Alexa
content:
Love the Alexa!!

You'll still need Google for a lot of things but it's nice to see my family pix, for the kids to easily add things to grocery list, the speaker is actually great for the size.

author: LoAnna Hernandez
title: Buy this Echo, don't waste your money on the others, especially if you are working on make a "smart" home.
content: I wish I would have purchased this Echo Show before the smaller ones! I love how I can see the front door because of pairing it with my "RING" doorbell and how it shows videos of whatever I ask...it even shows the lyrics of the song that is playing...please go on sale again so I can purchase more! "hugs"

author: Ivan T
title: its video compatibility isnt the greatest, you cant connect to your netflix account nor ...
content: Well, its video compatibility isnt the greatest, you cant connect to your netflix account nor youtube, or hulu.  It seems to only play amazon streaming. It keeps saying search alexa app for video streaming but it doesnt allow you to really search it. But its ok. I enjoy it, video calling is good too. Sound is a bummer, its no where as loud as the Echo Plus.

author: Cinemabon
title: FRUSTRATION, EXASPERATION, INSANITY
content: Not only is this thing extremely difficult to set up but I found it exasperating and frustrating when I tried to link my video. For example, it only lists FOUR things that will stream video - Fire TV, Frontier cable, Optic HUB and Dish TV. That's it! Online, some guy in a video says it will connect with my Roku. "Just click on the link" he says. BUT THERE IS NO LINK ON THE PHONE APP!!! And when you go to Amazon for help, THERE'S NO HELP VIDEO TO SET UP THE DARN THING UP!!! So I went to Youtube and some kid is jumping up and down because he so excited, he wants to make a video call. NO HELP. Some guy is so excited because he has the first on the block. NO HELP! No one knows how to make an informative set up video with INFORMATION!!! I'm going to keep searching. I'm not giving up yet. But this thing may end up back at Best Buy. I can't link my Amazon Prime account. Alex keeps saying, "You must link your account on your app." BUT MY APP DOESN'T OFFER A LINK!!!

author: Richard Kaiser
title: Except for that, Mrs.  Lincoln... how did you like the Show
content:
I have 4 echos - echo, tap, and dot.  I like them and use them a lot.  Well designed, perform well.  Trying the Show was a "why not?
The "Show stopper" for me was the constant stream of on-screen notifications and ads.  Looked for ways to turn it off or, at the least, customize it  No can do.  Other users have mentioned things that sorta, kinda, shut down the screen but... not for long.  Nothing worked for me.  It comes back jabbering at you whether you want it or not.
I returned it.  Got Amazon's usual good service on the return.

Other characteristics:.  The screen is bright, clear.  Feels small.  To me an "echo with screen" goes against what echo is.  You talk to and listen to it.  Don't need to look at it.  That's the real strength of what it is.  In my opinion.

author: JBorion
title: Love alexa. And the speakers are pretty good!
content: Love it. Works great. Alexa is the women. But seriously. But it on sale like i did. U wont be disappointed! Oh and the speakers are actually really good. I listen to music on it more than anything else now. Its just super convenient

author: Rivka
title: Love My Echo Show
content: I'm still getting to know Alexa and my Echo Show, but so far I love them both.  We listen to music and a few radio shows and the speaker on the Echo Show is great.  The Amazon Prime Music has a large selection and the lyrics display on the screen for most of the songs which is fun.  Alexa is a nice addition to the household.  After linking my Google calendar and then picking skills that helpful or interesting Alexa now keeps my grocery list current which is available on my phone when I'm at the store.  I log my daily blood pressure reading by just telling it to Alexa.  She tells jokes gets the news and reminds us to feed the dogs.  I also like that I was able to personalize the screen so we have a nice family photo on the screen as the default.  I'm sure as we get to know Alexa better we will only lover her and the Echo Show more.

author: Myamoto1
title: Love the Show
content: This took the place of a "regular" Echo in our kitchen. So far this has done everything the Echo did, plus you get the bonus of a screen to provide you info. Timers are easier, recipes are available, lyrics are visible for songs and you can stream Amazon movies, etc - what more could you ask for?

author: George D S
title: As grandparents who life in Florida and Canada the video ...
content: As grandparents who life in Florida and Canada the video of our kids and the grandchildren in California is priceless.  We just take the device to our current location and hookup to our current internet connection.  The most significant benefit is that out youngest grandson is able to know who we are even though he was a baby when we last saw him.  When we travel to California again this winter he will already know who we are...priceless.

author: Queenie
title: I love my Echo Show!!!!!!!!
