content: I love my Echo Show!!!!!!!!  I bought one for my brother and now we can actually see each other when we talk.  I love the movie trailers as well.  I highly recommend this product.

author: Ray
title: Nice, but needs to be able to show YouTube videos
content: I have three Echos, and like that they can be networked to play the same music at the same time. I like that I can ask the Show to show me my front and back door security camera. I HATE that because of a pissing contest Amazon has with YouTube I can’t see YouTube videos on my Show.

author: Darlene Walsh
title: Five Stars
content: Cool nice to see music lyrics and shopping list and sooo much more I still have to learn

author: UMWarEagle
title: Great Extra Addition to the Family
content: We have enjoyed the addition of this device to our Echo family.  This is our third such device (we have an Echo and an Echo Dot).  It is nice to be able to see things on the screen, rather than just hear them.  This one sits in the kitchen and it is great to use it for recipes while cooking.  My son had found Wild Kratts on it and enjoys using it as an extra TV.  Unfortunately, we do not have any friends or family that have one so we have not had the opportunity to us the Drop In conferencing as much.

author: Johninct
title: Version 1 of echo with screen
content:
I think this has added many features that the screen less echo lacks
It was much easier to set up then other echos
Love to be able edit and see my lists and alarms
I Wish it had ability to darken screen ( other then sleep mode )
Overall good device I bought three so my family can make video calls.

author: Betty Lennard
title: Easy easy setup. Just plug it in.
content: I have a amazon dot, echo and now the echo show. I love this item. It so nice to be able to see responses. It adds a whole new experience to amazon products.

author: A Few Minutes In Voice
title: I love them I own 2!
content: I love the Echo Show it is a great device! It connects with Amazon Prime Video to stream stuff from that service and it is a touch screen device for more interactive operations. I recommend waiting until they go on sell then looking for a used one I got my second one for $120 dollars.

author: Galen Travis
title: Save your time and money.
content: No browser, youtube functionality has been nuetered. No improved utility over an Echo.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great product, the angle needs work.
content: Echo does a very good job at just about everything you ask. I rated it four stars because it's the weird angle the camera has. I had to put something behind it to prop for good video while the kids chat with the grandparents.

author: Edgar D Hettrich
title: Better user set up and guides are needed.
content: I enjoy it but is isn't as intuitive to use.  The literature and instruction on how best to utilize it is lacking and making calls to others that have it don't always show up on the video screen. If you already have Amazon accounts it seems to get confused or it's just me.

author: JadeMercury
title: We love Alexa!
content: Bought one for my honey for his birthday and it was at the time a buy one get one half off. All in all it was a great deal. They are better priced now. But I didn't want to wait. I see him playing games with Alexa...lol Its kinda cute. He loves it, but he always shops on his phone in his favorite chair, if I only could get him out of that chair. Great product, oh yes he also hooked it up to 2 stereos in 2 different rooms. I love when the music comes on it plays in both areas and it sounds great. He loves playing with electronics so this birthday present was a winner.

author: Ruth I.
title: Pre-selected videos is not what I wanted
content: I thought I could use it to view YouTube videos of my choosing. Apparently not.Aside from that it works just like the other two Echoes I already have ....but it's a nice speaker.

author: JD Winty
title: If you like these devices, you cannot go wrong with the Show....
content: I got one for my wife on Xmas and she absolutely loves it!  She had the dot before this hooked to an external bluetooth speaker.  She was one of those people who really didn't see herself liking (much less using) a smart speaker but after getting the dot, she was hooked.  I had mentioned the Show to her and she didn't really see it being any better than the dot, more like a novelty.  Well once again, after she got it, she is enamored with the thing.  I have it connected to our Nest Cams and she loves being able to just say "Alexa, show me the front door" and the camera image pops up.  I moved the dot into the game room along with the speaker and the speaker is more than enough for music and such in just the bedroom.  She likes the function where the words come up during the song along with background information.  She uses it as her main alarm clock now as well.  I got this for 149 during the holidays and it was a good deal for that amount.  I myself like it a lot but cannot see myself buying it for 229.  If it comes down again, I would be hard pressed not to buy another one.  If someone doesn't like the show, I will happily exchange my 2nd Generation Echo with you!

author: Chris
title: The Visual Side of Alexa is Great!
content: I am really impressed with the Echo Show.  It is very easy to use and setup.  The quality of the screen is excellent as is the audio.  Highly recommended.

author: chunkybeefstyle
title: Amazon is winning the voice assistant wars for now
content: I don't care that Amazon is eavesdropping on my banal conversations, tracking my purchases, house occupancy status, and listening choices, and that the show can see me picking my nose when i think no one is looking. It is hard not to be disappointed when i go somewhere else and can't tell alexa to turn off lights, play music, or tell me the weather. We've had the first gen echo for a while now, and this one has better sound, better mic, and the display works nicely as an info station.  Have not used the video function as much yet, but i anticipate it will be value-added.

author: JayReese
title: Arlo camera issues
content: Ok, I'm pissed! I bought this device for the sole purpose of displaying my Arlo cameras. For some reason it doesn't seem to be compatible, even though advertised otherwise. I already have pretty much every other Echo device so this one was needed for video purposes only. I wish I would have read the reviews before buying. Now I feel SOL! They need to much an update pronto!

author: CJ
title: Very helpful!!
content: I love it!!! My boys and their families  bought it for my birthday! I really have fun with it. Only thing I couldn’t get it to do is cook dinner. It could tell me how! Thanks kids!

author: Steve Reed
title: I now see YouTube has been disabled on the device making it useless for my intended use
content: This was purchased to use in the kitchen to view cooking videos and recipes. I now see YouTube has been disabled on the device making it useless for my intended use. Looks like a return is coming as well as a cancellation to my YouTube subscription I pay for monthly.

author: Royce Brown
title: It's very good for $129
content: I got this at the discounted price.  It's very good for $129.  I don't think I'd pay $249 for it.  Sounds good and when I asked how to cook asparagus in the oven it played a video for me.

author: Trevor S.
title: WAS great before the new one got released
content: Is Amazon making the show worse on purpose to try to have me buy the new one? I'll just stop using alexa. Things as simple as "alexa call dad" when I haven't changed ANYTHING in my phone or show and it worked PERFECT yesterday it can't do. And it's not hearing me wrong because it is telling me I don't have dad as a contact when it is CLEARLY on my phone. What a waste of money. Fix this issue.

author: Hershal W.
title: like adding a device for very soft spoken people
content: I wish it had night vision!!! Also it need more this added to help the disability people, I sure it sales would go up three times as much, like adding a device for very soft spoken people. It would be great if it received calls I well, I don't see why I should have to buy connect to make calls and the reviews for that device are not to great. Amazon help and thank you for doing so far what you did.I would pay more for an app that did these things.

author: Brad Pski
title: All my family have loved theirs for their own various reason but thank you ...
content: I decided to get one for each of my close family members so it's easier for us to keep in touch. Voice commands instead of buttons has made a huge difference. All my family have loved theirs for their own various reason but thank you AMAZON for helping one family connect a little easier.

author: Melissa
title: I love tech toys and this one is fun
content: I love tech toys and this one is fun.  I would like Alexa to be a little more interactive.  Im sure the programmers are working hard on her updates so that some day she can carry on a conversation.

author: Suzanne D Fragiacomo
title: I absolutely LOVE it!
content: I never thought about getting one.  This was a gift from my daughter and son in law.  I absolutely LOVE it!!  My 2 year old and 8 year old granddaughters call me all the time and I can see their precious faces each day.  I can also see their baby brother.  It is amazing. Oh yea, I can also watch/ listen to a movie while I cook, listen to the radio and so many other cool things!!  Two thumbs up!!

author: jvp
title: Horrible experience, horrible device quality, horrible customer service
content: I purchased three of these to use to speak with my father who is hard of hearing and to use for my small business with remote employees.  Within two months, my device went completely haywire, fritzing, black lines on the screen, flashing, etc.  When I called to have it replaced, the process is to send back the device for Amazon to try and fix it.  So I will be without the device I paid for for 2-3 weeks, unable to use it to talk with my dad or my employees, then get back something refurbished.  I would not buy again.

author: Joseph S. Wolfson Sr.
title: So nice to see so much stuff
content: My wife loves the pictures of food and the recipes and videos that show step by step how to prepare meals.  We have three dots but this tops them all in all aspects.  Love love love it !!!

author: SimFanatic
title: Very pleased with my Echo Show
content:
Some background about me so my review will have more context with which to judge this review.

I'm a 68-year-old retired Marine and retired teacher. I've been dabbling with computers since the mid 1980s -- I've built several and have cobbled together components with parts from used electronics stores. I've also done some minimal programming in a number of languages. That said, I'm often as challenged by emerging technologies as anyone of my generation. I had not previously owned an Echo device.

I ordered my Echo Show December 22 and it was promised for delivery December 28. It arrived today -- December 24 -- thank you Amazon! Packaging was more than sufficient and was easy to open with my arthritically challenged hands.

In anticipation for my Echo Show's arrival, I loaded the Alexa App on my iPhone-6 and familiarized myself with it. Also, knowing that I wanted to capitalize on Echo's voice commands, I also installed a third-party app, called TRIGGERcmd (see Alexa skills) on my iPhone and PC. This allows me to open PC programs, like Photo Shop, Word, Chrome, and Facebook, all with voice commands via my Echo Show. I also ordered a TP-Link lightbulb to use in a bedside lamp that's placed inconveniently. I can now control the bulb by a simple voice command via my Echo Show. As my overall mobility is impaired, this is a godsend for me.

Once unpackaged, my Echo Show was surprisingly easy to setup -- I was completely connected and fully operational with 5-10 minutes. The fully guided voice recognition routine required another 10 minutes. Within 20 minutes of having plugged in my Echo Show, I made my first hands-free phone call to my daughter's non-Alexa equipped cell phone. I merely told Alexa to "Call [my daughter]. Sound quality from my end was excellent, and she said the same, even when I was not directing my voice toward the Echo.

I subscribe to Amazon Prime, and at this minute listening to a lengthy playlist from Amazon Music of one of my favorite singers. While the quality is not as good as my high-end audio system, it's still pretty darned good for a device the size of the Echo Show, and I will be using it a lot.

Obviously, I've been using my Echo Show for only an hour, or so, but I have no problem giving this product five stars because its performance and overall functionality have already met or exceeded my expectations.

author: betsy wyper
title: Echo Show is a Tech Masterpiece!
content: The show is so ultra advanced that I haven’t even conceived ofcehat it could potentially do! It is an outstanding speaker.... full, rich sound and much louder than my other Bluetooth devices. It can function as a small Tv and it is self standing , so you don’t have to sit and hold it . You can ask it to play a song off the top of your head and Alexa will display the lyrics.. just like karaoke ! She does not display lyrics with your iTunes playlist. I can make calls thru Alexa using my contacts , so if for some reason I have locked myself in a room or fallen and hurt myself I could call out to Alexa to call anyone on my playlist. By far my favorite function is that Alexa will read aloud to me from my Kindle! Many books are not available on Audible but are available on kindle . Alexa reads them somewhat robotically and thstvtskes a little getting used to . However, it a fabulously s service and it is free! A minor set back though iscthat you cannot fast forward, rewind or repeat . I’m pretty sure that will be added. Another slight drawback is alexa’s Research abilities. She isn’t quite google or Siri when it comes to research, but hey! that’s why I have an iPad and a phone! So, gotta go.. Alexa is ready to start chapter two andceill read me yo sleep...,

author: Manda
title: Every kitchen needs one!
content: I moved this video one to the kitchen and now I use it all the time. From pulling up a recipe so I don’t have to get my dough covered fingers on my phone to watching videos while doing dishes.

author: JEM
title: Great picture & Sound
content:
Echo Show is the best Echo yet.
Great picture plays videos. Best sound of all Echos.
I have 4 Amazon Echos.I recommend them to everyone I know.
I control my Sony TV-Sony Receiver-Cable Box-Lights-Wall Plugs and more.

author: Ryan Johnson
title: Keeps getting better!
content: If you're a fan of Echo you need to have this. Being able to actually see your schedule, lists, news, and now video calling to others with echo or the echo app... it's really fun.  I have three echos of varying typed now and this is by far my favorite. Highly recommend getting Philips Hue lights throughout your house as well they are amazing with echo. It also controls fire tv now too.

author: mary h ghent
title: It stops all the time.
content: This echo Show does not work right, neither did the first one. I have called them about 10 times and they always told me something different. One time they said i had it to close to an appliance Than I had it to far away from the WI FI. Then they said that they were fixing the problem with all of them, the excuses went on and on. I guess I have to live with this.  They said they would replace it but why would i want another one if they have not fix the problem.

author: Elizabeth Kreiger
title: Product just stopped working.
content: I love the first Echo Show we bought - and it is still working. This second one we bought in July just stopped working - it just stopped being on or being able to be turned on.died. And Amazon does not make it clear what one can do if this happens. So we got a few months use out of it - not a good value. And I do not know how to "contact the seller". Does anyone out there know?

author: Roy Cossairt
title: Great face to face chatting
content: Great for face to face chats and fun for silly interactions. YouTube doesn't work so limited in scope. Misunderstands requests or questions frequently. Learning more about what it does do continually and am looking forward to getting a smarter home online and working.

author: Don
title: Amazon Echo Show
content: Awesome product.  We love the quality of the sound that fills the room.  I’ve never experienced sound that clear.  Apps interface well with it, and it with them.  It can go to iTunes and play Rush Limbaugh on our local Radio Station.  Caution, don’t say anything that sounds like “Alexa” because it will answer looking for instructions.  Haha.

author: Linda Rickerson
title: so good. This was an addition to our home
content: So far, so good.  This was an addition to our home, as we already had an echo dot.  The range of the voice recognition is great.  As with all Alexa devices, sometimes she does not understand what you are saying, numerous times, which is frustrating.  We bought this mainly to use with a netvue  orb camera which is compatible in our nursery.  It took an hour to set up and link to Alexa due to a glitch in enabling the skill.  I am not sure which end the fault is on, but it surely was not easy to do.  Product is also much more bulky than anticipated, the back reminds me of the original flat screen tv's that no one can get rid of now because they are so heavy.

author: Adi
title: I do dig the Show
content: I bought this for my kitchen and I have not been disappointed. Is it a necessity? No. But is it fun? Yes. It sets timers, allows me to do dishes while singing to 80s pop and finds recipes for me. I also really like the ingredient search for evenings when I need inspiration. I can ask it to find recipes using "noodles and twinkies" and it does it's best! The speaker is good and the million mics it has hidden on its person always hear me comin'

author: Tiki
title: I do love it. Still learning how to work it
content: I do love it. Still learning how to work it. I really hate it that most new devices don't come with detailed instructions any more. I wish it had a book to tell you how to drop in, how to call other people who have a echo show. It's been hard to figure out. Other than that we love it so much we got my boyfriend's mom one for Christmas so she can start video calling us to see her granddaughter. They get a huge kick out of being able to do video calls with each other.

author: Mike Halphen
title: Won’t work with YI Cameras
content: Really like the show sitting on my end table. It’s right next to me when I sit on the couch and I’m able to see the weather or watch a how to video on you tube plus so much more. One of the best features is I have a ring doorbell and I can just say Alexa show my front door and I can see in a beautiful screen my front yard and door area. The bad thing I’m not happy about at all is amazon says it works with all wi do cans sold on their site. This is not true or sorta not true. I bought 2 YI dome cameras. They work ok but if you enable the skill the only thing you can do is turn the camera on or off. You cannot see it in the show screen so if you want to check on your baby or children’s room this will not work with these cameras. It’s a bit of bad advertising from amazon that is rare but I have let them know but it still says works with cameras sold by amazon. Buyer beware.

author: gvsandrs
title: High hopes dashed. Rushed to market; device not ready
content: Expensive clock; should not have went to market just yet. It really did not meet my expectations. The only way to video call was that the other person online had to down load or have Alexa. Couldn't do a lot of other things like connect to internet to show receipe for 'whatever"; you had to download all these 'apps'. Calling it something else doesn't make it anymore fun. Would do better to sync with a phone device so whatever was on your phone was automatically loaded to Echo. It wouldn't even sync  smoothly with my Arlo cameras which it said it would do. Camera views was frozen or never connected. And yes I have top of the line wifi router and separate modem. Returned both devices. One was for my kitchen 'helper' and the other for bedroom to monitor security cameras.

author: Dale Bishop
title: Great screen
content: surprisingly good screen, all of the talents of my other Alexa devices with the added benefit of video. Still a shame that you can't watch Youtube on it. Be really nice if this got worked out

author: Kindle Customer
title: Fun purchase.
content: It's fun.  Alexia and I are still getting acquainted but so for so good. She does not like for you mispronounce her name but we've gotten pass that issue.  Glad I ordered it.

author: Bev
title: Love it!
content: I got the Dot at Christmas time just to try it.  When I saw this one, it was a good price so I had to try it.  I'm still in the process of learning all Alexa does on this machine, but so far I'm not stumbling to badly.  Alexa even helps me when I think I've messed something up.  I'll be hooking this up with my son's family so we can communicate more often, but that will be in a few days.  I have faith that Alexa will get me setup!

author: Jason Stark
title: Well worth the market entry price
content: Awesome. Can't wait for even more skills. The addition of a screen makes echo ecosystem even more useful.

author: tg
title: Constant Clock Please‼️
content: I’m an Alexa Freak! I own a few and give them as gifts. My show: like the Alarms, video features, visual lists. Don’t like that my clock isn’t CONSTANTLY visible. That’s my BIGGEST gripe but it’s major for me to have a visual clock as I listen to music or watch stuff. Thanks.

author: CHAMELEON
title: Very Good to be able to listen to Every single song ...
content: Very Good to be able to listen to Every single song at any time in Amazon's vast library. We're only just beginning to know everything Echo Show has to offer. Well worth the price!! Alexa is very helpful.Great for listening to Audible books also!

author: amanda
title: Lots of fun
content: My daughter and I played and played with this thing the first day it arrived. We love it. We've been looking at different things she will work with for the house. I've put some learning material and fun things on her. I know we haven't even began to see what all it's capable of yet, and it's fun learning new things it can do!

author: Theresa Zeniecki
title: Great product
content: I love tbe Echo Show. I use it mainly for music but it cones in handy to use for questions. Still learning all of its capabilities but I tell her to start my day for an overviee of news and weather.  She sings, tells jokes, play games...

author: Lucy
title: I like the fact that my young grandchildren can call me ...
content: I like the fact that my young grandchildren can call me whenever they need to talk to me. They don’t have to ask their parents to call for them.  My husband likes it for the weather and the sport and stock updates. I like it for the music and the recipes.  We are still learning and teaching it new skills. Having fun with it

author: Rachelle S. Crosby
title: Very Handy!
content: Love how easy it is to access music, current news, biographies, weather, etc. The only thing I don't like is that we can't name our devices what we want. It's annoying when we have the TV on and they say the word, Computer, or Alexa, and then the Echo goes off, trying to "help" us out! LOL! I haven't figured out how to do everything on it yet. I'm still figuring out if I can make it play a playlist from Amazon. So far no luck. I do love that it can show me my calendar, or tell me what's on it. It's also great for recipes, as it can show it right on the screen. I did get another one to go upstairs, but you can't play a different song upstairs if something else is already being played downstairs.

author: love2golf
title: Ring doorbell and amazon Show
content: Sounds like a great pairing. A screen with Alexa. The ring doorbell says compatible with Alexa. That is only partially true. You can see the camera but that's it. Does not come on when someone rings bell. A lot of times you have to tell it multiple times to get it to connect.I think once they get the details working it could be a real game changer in the home automation. But for now it's a expensive toy.

author: ChrisNorthJersey
title: If you thought Alexa was useful before... just get one of these
content:
I was already a fan of the Echo.  The whole family was really... My 3 year old just got super excited because Alexa finally understands when she tries to talk to her.  Adding a screen was the best thing that could've happened.  In the month we've had "new Alexa" in our kitchen ("old Alexa" moved up to the bedroom) we've already been loving the extra dimension the screen adds.  A few highlights:

*  For those songs that aren't in Amazon prime that we're dying to hear, there's a great chance they're on YouTube, and the Show can now pull them up in a snap
*  I was travelling on business last week, and used the Drop-in feature to visit with my wife and daughter when I had breaks in the day.  That alone made it worth the price.  A friend of mine bought one for himself plus 2 more for his parents and sister who live further away.  Now they can easily video chat.
*  I was pleasantly surprised that it's smaller than I thought it looked in the pictures.  That makes it fit really well in a spot formerly occupied by a radio.

The screen also adds lots of closed-captioning for music and news, and essentially makes a whole new batch of Alexa skills possible that weren't before.  Everything has been working as well as the original Echo so we're really happy with it.

author: Kristina B.
title: YouTube streaming is no longer a feature... not worth the $229 price without this widely advertised feature!
content: I recently purchased the Echo Show after having seen the promotional video featured through your product's description. One of the features that specifically sparked my interest in purchasing the Echo Show was the ability to view YouTube videos. However, I have since learned that the Echo Show is no longer able to stream YouTube videos! This is very upsetting, as this was the primary selling point which sold me on the Echo Show... without this feature, I would not have paid the $229 selling price! More concerning though is that your promotional video, which clearly advertises the ability to stream YouTube videos through the Echo Show (at about 1:23 into the video), is still available through your product description... that is false advertising!  If the ability to stream YouTube videos through the Echo Show is not reinstated, Amazon should offer a credit to prior purchasers offset the value of the product due to the inability to stream YouTube videos!  As reflected by the volume of complaints Amazon is likely receiving as a result of this, there are many customers which likely would have not purchased the Echo Show at the current selling price of $229 without the feature of streaming YouTube videos.

author: JJ67
title: LOVE it!
content: I just LOVE my echo show. So easy to set up and has turned out to be a very handy, and useful little device. I originally purchased just to listen to music easily and video call family out of state, but very quickly I found out so many other useful things it can do and does for me. Loved it so much I bought two echo dots for other areas of my home.

author: Russ Lefebvre
title: Flickering screen
content:
Had this for awhile but finally just unplugged it.  The first one I got started flickering and it was located next to my chair so was very noticeable.  I searched online and did all the reset options but still flickered.  Called support and they sent another one.  That started flickering within weeks and I just turned it away.  Finally did the reset options and called again and the tech said to give it a few days and he'd call me back.  Never did and now it just sits unplugged and on the floor.

Additionally, I have 2 echo dots and a full-size echo around the house.  I noticed that even though you're suppose to be able to have more than one echo they seem to just conflict with each other and I'm having to repeat the commands over and over until one of them responds.  Happened with this Echo Show too.

Update 9/29/18

So, about 10 minutes after I posted the review above (where I originally gave it 2 stars) I got a call from Amazon Tech Support.  We spent some time reviewing the items that I had and how some of them were offline (I had unplugged them because of the conflicts) and some were not updated with latest software.

Plugged the Echo Show back in and did an update.  So far the flickering has not returned.

On a side note, I got a Ring door camera and had set up the Alexa Ring option on the app and with the Echo Show that works great.  I just say "Alexa, show me the front door." and I have video of the outside.  I don't have to even use the Ring app.

author: Shirl
title: When more people also get Echo Show it will be great. We received it as a gift and really ...
content: So far we have only used it to converse and see a few relatives and were very impressed with it. When more people also get Echo Show it will be great. We received it as a gift and really like it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Nice Table Weight
content: This device is completely worthless.  We've had it 30 days and it doesn't work.  I've spent hours with customer service trying to get it to work.  Don't get me wrong, I can make it respond to me with Alexa skills but none amount to anything worthwhile.  And the screen has lines through it so anything that appears on the screen is distorted.  We bought it to use with the Ring video doorbell.  There is a video delay so that it won't show the front door until after the person is walking away AND there is no way to speak through it.  Basically, I've spent $230 on a paper weight. Please do not fall for the marketing and make the same mistake we did.

author: MaryAnn Q
title: Love the video
content: I really like the echo show.  I ask Alexa questions everyday.  She always knows the answers.  Also play music everyday.  I have not tried anything else yet but plan to.

author: Casie H.
title: Very dissapointed
content: At first we loved it. Now the screen is so glitchy it's unsightly. It started having problems about 2 months after we got it. Bought it on the payment plan and still haven't paid it off. Didn't even Outlast the 6 month plan Amazon offered. Poor execution on what would have been a great problem. Reviews saying the same are all over the internet.

author: Joansete
title: Love this
content:
It is an amazing machine. You can ask anything that you want.
You have to have an amazon account, music on it to play it, or you can have your Pandora account too.
My kids enjoy talking and asking things to Alexa..!!
(& I personally think that Siri is completely jealous)
lol
Joan

author: Sherri
title: Kitchen Assistant
content:
This is my third Alexa since the original one came out. I have the first Echo, a Dot (with another one being shipped soon!) and this one. I actually can’t imagine my life without Alexa. From timers and alarms, adding things to my shopping list, getting reminders and my morning Flash Briefing, listening to music and my Audible books, turning on the light when my hands are full, and entertaining our 3 year old granddaughter with silly jokes that she goes home and tells her mom and dad, I’ve know that I’ve just barely scratched the surface of what Alexa can do.

My husband was talking about Black Friday sales on some other voice activated assistants but I told him that I can’t imagine anything working better for me than Echo. I’m not switching.

I have the Show on my kitchen counter and I love it. I use it for general kitchen things like measurements and keeping me company with music or a podcast while I cook. The stories that pop up are really fun too.  We have Sonos speakers all over the house and I can control them with Alexa. I’ve also used the Show to video chat with my granddaughter and the quality is a lot better than when we do it on my phone. I’m pretty sure I’ll never be without the Echo (the Echo Auto is definitely going to be on the list soon. I’m very excited about that!)

author: Brandon
title: Five Stars
content: Nice upgrade to the original Echo

author: Robert R. Whitfield
title: Echo Show is a very innovative product. The technology ...
content: Echo Show is a very innovative product. The technology installed in the show is very advanced and it's adaptive capabilities are endless.

author: sparky
title: What a fun, useful device. I like it even more than I expected!
content: I'm having a blast playing with this Echo Show. Be sure to Google how to access the hidden web browser, YouTube videos and Netflix. It's pretty easy to do.

author: David Duley
title: Needs a web browser
content: This needs a web browser. The audio is great. The screen is marginally useful if you don't have a friend with a show to make video calls.

author: Paula Whitlow
title: Priceless
content: Bought it so I could talk to my grandson out of state. For that alone it is amazing. He can go to his Alexa and call me I can read him stories and show him the pictures as I’m reading he can pretend to read his books to me and show me his pictures. Not to mention I have Alex synced with several devices I can control just by speaking! I would love to talk to someone in development. As a nursing director I have an awesome idea to create a med-Alexa to use in hospitals

author: Hermes Franqui
title: Entertaining but still needs software development
content:
These are good devices that still require more development. As an example, they can play Amazon's wide list of music and show the lyrics while playing.  However, if you ask to identify the song from lyrics you may know, the devices are totally lost.  If Google is presented with even a small subset of a song's lyrics, it returns several versions of the song(s) which have matching lyrics.

The devices also show a very limited command of "search" capability when you stray away from purchasing questions.  That said, IF Amazon continues to develop the capabilities of these devices, they will become as useful as they are presently entertaining.

author: David Brainard
title: My Favorite!
content: I find the Echo Show to be such a delight ! And I'm just scratching the surface of all that it will do. Some day, when I have a spare day, I'd like to wear  Alexa out with requests. I even enjoy when she goofs up (speaks when not spoken to). She sings quite well too! I have tons of gadgets and the Echo  Show is by far my favorite.

author: Zai Bell
title: A Dissapointment
content:
I got this to listen to iheart and Pandora mostly rather than use my phone. it can't find my stations when spoken most times, so if I do it manually it will find it . . . And play 40% of the time. It usually has an error and won't play.
Pandora. I have unlimited skips and replay but not on the echo cause why? I don't know if it's Pandora refusing to let me even though I pay the subscription or if it's Amazon in a bid to get me to use their music.
Either way guess who's gone back to just using a cell phone and Bluetooth speaker, this user. If I could return my echo and get my money back I would because there is no other feature worth keeping it. The drop in works well, when the app works properly. It will turn stuff on and off alright but the cost isn't worth that.
I expected better.

author: James Ramsay
title: Can't watch YouTube
content: Works great as a  Calendar or daily planner also the speaker is nice and works well with Amazon prime music can be used as a alarm and you can watch prime movies &Tv

author: Ed
title: Adding another at home
content: My second "show".  Gets a lot of use for alarms and reminders as well as streaming a few tunes.  While I don't use many of it's capabilities it's become a tool the family enjoys so it was time to add a second unit.  Nice deal o. The first generation unit, didn't feel the need to step up on the newer generation.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Fantastic Technology
content: Awesome! Echo dot with a screen. Can take selfies for you. I use in kitchen for recipes and to listen to music when cooking (and I am a guy). Plus I like the visual on time and weather. Plus it scrolls family photographs as a background. Fantastic use of technology for how I do things.

author: Dsyoh
title: Almost Great!!
content: Love the product idea. Super easy to set up & get started, a breeze to do routine tasks (set alarms, timers, add items to shopping/to do lists, play music, get news, just about anything it's supposed to do). The sound is good where Imhave it sitting, not tinny at all as some have found. There is one thing I HATE & it would keep me from recommending it to anyone - you cannot delete from the nice screen the continually running suggestions of what to ask Alexa. Unless you have her turn off the screen totally which I do when I go to bed. And it's too bad bc it's like a continuously running advertisement or set-up guide. Not attractive. The echo show was on sale prior to Prime day for less than the Echo, so I figured I was getting a great deal for my money when trying to decide which device to start out with. Because of the ever present script it's not a nice device to look at, I would not buy it again, or recommend - go with the Echo. I may still exchange the product.

author: Jrgts
title: Surprisingly convenient and I find myself using much more than I thought!
content: Surprisingly convenient and I find myself using much more than I thought I would. Audio is terrific and the screen is very sharp. Try to buy it on sale and you won't​ be disappointed.

author: McWiseheart
title: Great way to keep connected!  As easy as answering the phone, maybe more...
content: This has been a terrific investment.  We got it for my mom, she lives in an assisted living facility at 95.  She had used her pc to Skype with the family, but the accessibility of the Echo Show, and ease for all family members to use, makes this a great way to keep connected.

author: Dawn
title: Good deal
content: The item has a few minors scratches on the speaker but overall is in good condition. Easy set up, no issues to date. Added to my existing echo system.  So far overall pleased with the purchase.

author: Jacob
title: Great before the YouTube fiasco
content: I loved this when I first got it- I liked my echo dot, and liked the idea of having a screen so I could do things like watch YouTube videos and amazon video. However, even though YouTube was a major part of their advertisement strategy, the feature to watch YouTube videos on the show has been inexplicably pulled without warning. For me (and I’m sure many others) this makes the screen near useless. Now, I’m left with 130$ left to pay on this device that no longer serves any added capacity from my echo dot. I saw amazon dropped the price of this now worthless product to aleiviate new customer concerns, but this does nothing for the pissed off customers amazon created by its failure to keep YouTube. Unless that issue is fixed (which is reportledt going to be no time soon) save yourself some money and get an echo dot or the new echo with a smaller screen.

author: Karen Simonson
title: Amazing--Fun and Educational!
content: This is amazing! We find we're using it multiple times each day. Alexa is one smart cookie! We have the Echo Show in our kitchen, an Echo Dot in the Master Bath and garage and Echo in our office. We can turn lights on and off, communicate as though we had an intercom system or listen to great music. This is not only fun but it's very useful. You can get an update on the stock market, news, temperature--way too many things to try to list. We received this as a Christmas gift and can't thank our son enough!

author: ARG
title: Echo show
content: I bought this item to connect with my new granddaughter, I bought in December 2018, it was easy to set up and seemed to work well but in June the screen became fuzzy with lines, my son said it was broken although it still seems to function??  I am disappointed it didn’t last longer considering the amount I paid!

author: Beck
title: Very disappointed YouTube is no longer supported
content: Very disappointed that YouTube is no longer supported. Did not realize that until after I purchased the Echo Show. That was one major reason for me to purchase it. Now it’s just a glorified Echo.

author: Amazon Customer
title: SO MUCH FUN!
content: LOVE seeing the lyrics to my favorite songs pop up!  This will probably replace the necessity of hiring a DJ for our next party.  The only thing I don't like is SOME songs they don't have the rights to print the lyrics.

author: Chris
title: Audio isnt good
content:
Audio isnt good
1. Not sure if i got a defect one but the audio is static and bad when the volume reaches half way.
2. Big
3. Quality is okay
4. Had issue with the microphone

author: Retha Fooks
title: Echo show is great!
content: I really enjoy the Echo show. I can listen to the ocean sounds or music to ease off to sleep. Or use it for a mini karaoke party. Makes a great alarm clock and so much more

author: Andrea Hyden
title: Not impressed
content: We have a regular Alexa, and bought this hoping for much more than it offers.  I’d stick with Alexa, and use an iPad for other information you’re looking for.  I was hoping for more videos, recipes, shows to watch while cooking, etc.

author: Chris mullican
title: I am really happy with the show overall
content: I am really happy with the show overall. It is great for looking at receipies in the kitchen, watching our security camera, as well as all the other functions of the echo.

author: sjh1031
title: A good start
content:
I like having the ability to ask for information & to be reminded of things that pop into my head. However there are days when I don't use it at all.

It would be more useful if I could  personalize the news items displayed automatically on the screen.

I find it useful but not essential.

author: rt_guy
title: Show should be a NO-SHOW
content:
Let me star off by saying I LOVE Amazon. I have 3 dots, 1 echo, 1 show, and 4 fire tv's. So I am VERY experienced at Amazon products.i have been a early adopter to all of them and am very comfortable using them in my daily life. We are not "newbies" to voice recognition and have used it for several years
 We  love out original echo, Alexa  became part of the family. We used her all the time for everything from music, to helping with homework. So when the new "Show" was announced  I preordered... I was excited about the possibilitys. So we  moved the "new" alexa show to  where our original Echo was located in the living room...
Nothing but problems, when we had non before... The voice recognition on this model is horrible, I used to be anywhere in our living room/ kitchen (open floor plan) and she would recognize my voice and command.  Now you have to be right in front of her. I am assuming it is due to the new shape and placement of microphones.
I also have her connected to my wemo switches throughout the house which work perfectly from all the other echoes in the house, the show, I give a command to "turn on the ____ light" and I get a response she doesn't understand, I say the EXACT  same command, then all of a sudden you hear "OK". It always takes 2 requests to do the command.
Then there is the sound. The new show if far inferior to the original when it comes to sound quality. The original had very decent sound, the new Show sounds like a cheap speaker system.
Simple things which used to be simple such as setting timers and doing math questions have become a struggle...
Lastly... The amount of times she turns herself on with random responses when I never asked her anything. The room can be totally quiet, no tv, no one talking and she comes on and says something like here is your "npr news"
As far as the "show features" there are some cool things like the photo frame and video clips (those are the reason I am giving 2 stars rather than 1).
Do yourself a favor, skip the "Show" and stick with the original echo, the show simply IS NOT worth the money, I am very close to taking her offline and going back to the original. For me it's to late to return... Hopefully this will help some people make the right choice.

author: Catherine A. Savage
title: can't get help or product support
content: after a couple months, my screen has horizontal wavy lines. Can't find any help or get product support. Other than that, the sound is very good

author: Greg T
title: Alexa, Show me YouTube videos..... Oops, you can't anymore.
content:
I am writing this review after today's changes to the ability of the Echo Show to play videos from YouTube. Gone. No longer there. Yesterday, if you asked "Alexa, show me videos on outer space?" You'd get a large number of interesting choices. 95% of them YouTube. Today, ask that same question, and there are only a few and they don't even meet the search criteria.  Big brouhaha between Amazon and Google and we, the consumer pays the price. YouTube is banned from Echo Show and on January 1, fire devices lose the too.

The Show has several nice features. Losing the ability for informational videos is a ripple in the pond.

Hopefully, the "legal access to this type of information will be restored.

author: Susan
title: Echo Show would be the perfect video phone for aging parents. But Amazon support limited.
content:
Update 8/25:  Good news:  Problem solved.  Turns out the folks that were trying to call me had an old cell number (as well as the current one) for me in their contacts.  Echo Show was trying to use the old one (though that was not the number I registered with Amazon.)  Bad News:  Amazon was not the one to figure it out.  My Niece did when I asked her to try to contact me.
Updated to 4 stars for the device.  This would have been so perfect to call my Mom
Update 8/04:  Still nothing from Amazon.  When I email I get "technical team is still investigating"....frustrating
Update: 7/28  Stars reduced to 1.  Still no solution (or attempt at a solution) from Amazon.
So sorry to have to do this, but I figure this is how I can get a response.  I am an Echo lover, however I added the Show to my list of devices and now nobody can call me on any of my devices.  I called Amazon on 7/14 and after talking for an hour to their first line help guy who had the canned "did you turn it on..." responses it was supposedly elevated to Design.  Have not heard back.
Fortunately drop in works, so the person I most need to communicate with can still get me.  But I am used to amazing customer service from Amazon so am very disappointed that such a huge flaw in their device is being ignored.  I am prepared for it to be user error, but nobody has pointed anything out that might fix it.

author: Alex Burt
title: Better Ring Support Please
content: Rating would have been higher but owning something and not being in total control  of what you want it to do is totally frustrating. Not being  able to turn off functions (try this!!) Is almost a deal breaker. Ring support for first gen doorbell would have been nice,if you had a asterisk about lack of support I would have bought Ring 2  first. Love the video calling it's like being in the same room. Quality audio for it's size,hope you keep improving on software as it seems the sky is the limit for producing great products.

author: Samantha
title: Still love Echo Show!
content:
Update: 7 months later and we STILL love the Echo Show. We use it daily and are tempted to buy another one for upstairs. Everyone that comes over loves it. It connects with the Ring Doorbell buy saying “Alexa show us the front door” — The features get better.

We debated the Echo products for a while because we're an Apple home. We thought the Echo products wouldn't be compatible so we held out... until this Christmas! We added the Echo Show and other Echo devices throughout our home. Wow, we love these guys. We love the Show so muhc we got our parents one too. My mom just set her Show up and called us from Alaska. I realize we could have just called each other on our other devices, but the show is out and in the kitchen. It will make keeping in touch so much easier. I like to keep my phone on silent, but hate missing called from parents, now that is solved. We love the intercom features too. Being able to "drop in" on the basement when our kids are fighting or  reminding them again it's time to get out of bed! It's got a great sound for music-- I don't even know if I have watched TV since I added the show to the kitchen. Plus how fun is it to have the lyrics! Our kids think they're rock stars. Another cool featured with the Show is that it calls iPhone! Just ask your friends and family to add the app to their phones.
My few cons: The contacts-- some people I don't want on my Alexa contacts list, but I just turned their Echo options off. Also wish it came with a stand that you didn't need to buy separately.
All in all-- Seriously, we have had so much fun with this thing over the last 3 weeks. I highly suggest giving Echo Show a try.

author: C. Slagle
title: Great Alexa addition to keep in touch with family
content:
We were looking around for a birthday gift for my father and figured he would and Echo because he loves listening to his Blues music while in the kitchen and the lists, timers, and other functions would be a nice addition he would enjoy. I saw that the Echo Show would be released in 4 days and thought that it would be an excellent way for us and his grandkids to keep in touch since we live on opposite sides of the country....so we bought two, one for him and one for us.

We received our Show on the day they were released and setup was a breeze. My father was even able to get his setup without any help from me, which is a huge plus! His only hang-up occurred when he had to verify his phone number, but after a day or so he called me up on the Show and we were able to video chat without any issue. We're currently working on upgrading his internet connection to accommodate video chatting, but so far we're very happy with our purchase. If this works out we plan to purchase one for each of the grandparents.

We keep the Show in our kitchen and use it exactly how we used our Echo, for timers, weathers, news, shopping lists, and most of all music. We have put our Echo in the bedroom and use it as an intercom as well. Just recently for Prime Day we bought a Dot to put in our daughter's room, so we'll see how she likes that.

Very happy with the product so far.

author: NKMCD
title: (Updated) Calls/Drop-in not working well with phone app - Amazon is still fixing it
content:
(Updated 8/13/2017)
It is ALL USELESS for us... DISAPPOINTED...
For the purpose of having the echo show in the room of our elderly family member and drop-in from relatives, sadly, it does not work.

Amazon is supposed to be fixing on this issue with a ticket#, and I am still waiting for their solid update (after several follow-ups from our side).

You can't hear loud enough on your phone app, when calling/drop-in from phone App to the echo show.

I really hope it would be fixed before the return deadline.
-------------------
(Previous Review)
Is nobody else having a problem with the call volume?

We purchased an echo show for the drop-in purpose with an elderly family member.
Only the drop-in feature (with video) is the exact reason we made this purchase.

On the phone (App), we just cannot hear (voice call, video call and drop-in) between iPhone App and echo show.

Just 2 ft away from the echo show, we can hear loud and clear on the echo show.
But, on the phone, we barely hear what the other says into the echo show.

After several contacts with Amazon helpdesk, we returned the first one and tried the replacement.

The same thing is still occurring with the replacement hardware.

Calls (voice, video and drop-in) between the App and echo show works, but you can't really hear what the echo show side is saying.  Putting your ear to the phone is the only way to get sufficient volume level.  What's the point of the video call, if you have to put your ear on the phone, showing your ear on the echo show screen?
With voice-only calls, we tested several times on the speakerphone, sadly, the same - you can barely hear.

The person we wanted to gift the echo show is not likely to yell all the time for the conversations.  She is more like a whispering, gentle old lady.

We don't think we'll keep this, but we might to try the second replacement to see if that solves the issue.

author: G. FAKE
title: My already obsolete echo show
content: I like my echo show.  I use it constantly.  Next I want to try setting up a screensaver with photos.  I also use it for my grocery list, alarms, and reminders.  My only complaint is that they (all 3 of them, echo,dot, and show) tend to blurt out things, even in the middle of the night in a quiet room.  They just start talking or sometimes playing some radio station or something.  I can't figure it out, especially when I assigned them each different wake words.  I'm a little pissed that I no sooner purchased the show, Amazon comes out with something better about 2 months later!!!!!!  I'm immediately the owner of old technology I would SURELY lose my money on it should I try to sell it or trade it for credit.  That SUCKS!!!!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very disappointed in this because the cheaper echo spot has several ...
content: The show has no clock options! All you get is the small clock at the top of the screen. Very disappointed in this because the cheaper echo spot has several clock options. It seems like a simple thing to include so I'm not sure why it was left out. Would love to have a full clock option for when it is just sitting idle.

author: A. Argentum
title: Annoying "Try Alexa..." notifications cannot be turned off!
content:
Annoying "Try Alexa..." notifications cannot be turned off from screen.  Big turn-off for those of us who do not like vampires of our attention.  I know exactly what features I want to use on the Echo Show.  I DO NOT want suggestions for anything else.  Ruins the novelty of having a screen.

I like having my pictures run in the background... until I see yet another "Try Alexa..." notification.  The device incessantly tries to nudge you into trying features regardless of whether you have already tried them and regardless of whether you are interested in them.  This is a big corporation using psychological tricks to encourage you to buy more from the big corporation.  That is normal, except for the part of having a screen in your home with non-optional Amazon advertisements showing in a constant rotation.

Me: "Alexa, is being fodder for Amazon's advertisements optional?"
Alexa: "Sorry, I'm not sure about that." (= No)

author: B. Brooks
title: Great addition to the Echo family.
content: I will state it first that I did not buy the Show from Amazon, I got it at Target for a great deal.  Now that being said, it is a welcomed addition to my Echo/HA network and plays nicely with all my other products. (Wink, Ring, etc) I will say that the sound quality is not as good as the original echo and the volume levels are different, but that being said, it still sounds great and one would not know the difference if you never owed an Echo. I do like the display and the ability to see all my activities on it (shopping list, etc) I think since it is still relatively new we will see more pluses to owning it time goes by and more skills are developed for it.

author: Bellemead
title: Not Recommended
content:
Update: I'm returning the device as there is still no way to turn off the text ("suggestions") and my 30 days id's almost up. Never buy version 1 of anything. If they fix it I might repurchase.

Device is OK but the home screen is cluttered and busy with text that you can't turn off.  If you want to display your photos they can barely be seen because of the time, temperature and the text.  If you turn off the trending topics you get an endless stream of Alexa tips but there's no way to turn off the text.  Maybe they should test the O/S before releasing it to the public.  I saw the flaw right out of the box, called tech support and listened for 30 minutes while the rep guessed at ways to turn off the text none of which worked.  I asked for a supervisor and was finally told that you can't turn off the text.

author: John
title: Nice!
content: So far I like this a lot. Good sound and video quality, plus I learned the command necessary to turn off the display at night! 😃

author: Jennifer
title: Great Alexa interface!
content: I have dots all around my house, but I keep this echo show in my bedroom.  It is really nice.  It auto dims to not be too bright at night - and switches to just the time and temp during that mode.  It has nice graphics for most interactions and plays video during the daily briefing.  It can be a picture viewer if you have pictures in your amazon photo library...  and you can set the back ground to be any picture you like.  It also has a built in camera, so you can see your room when you aren’t home from your Alexa app using the drop in feature. The speakers are good too.

author: Tony
title: Still getting used to it.
content:
I'm kinda divided on this. I guess I'm still in the "Gettin' used to it" phase. I like certain aspects of it and not so much on others. I like watching YouTube videos "... Who's on first... and watching Luciano Pavarotti performing " Nessun Dorma" or "Pagliacci"... is great. However I think the the original "cylindrical" Alexa had better sound. The "Show" seems to me to be more one directional, whereas the original was more omnidirectional.
I do like that I can talk with my sister face to face. Like I said, I guess I'm still in the "Getting used to it phase". I think as time goes, I'll like it more and more.

author: King Tony
title: Good, not great.
content: I have been using Alexa since the original beta release. As much fun as it has been over the years, I decided to finally upgrade to the newest model. I purchased this one for my room and the spot for my son's room on the thought of using it as a built in monitor, or a way to call my three year old while sitting at work. The functionality and everything works great. My only complaint is occasionally the do not disturb settings will not take the screen down and I have to manually turn on do not disturb. A minor inconvenience, but not a reason to return it. The only real let down is the over all volume. The original Echo could be heard playing no matter where you were in the house. This dual speaker design just does not compete with it.

author: Oliver
title: Huge Potential; Microphone Array and Buggy Software are Unacceptable.
content:
I was part of the pre-order group - REALLY excited to get this product. It has amazing potential but I believe it is inherently flawed. I have two gripes:

The microphone array is facing towards the back of the device because the top of the device is slightly angled. It causes the device to only hear me 50% of the time or less. This was an upgrade from the original Echo which had the 360 array that was completely horizontal and 'surrounding' the device; it heard me 100% of the time, even when I spoke softly or even from around a corner in another room. I have my fingers crossed that they can enhance the functionality with the software but I would expect that the hardware design is driving the problem.

The software is incredibly clunky. I understand that they are working with a screen and have added touch functionality but the original Echo responded almost instantly whereas the Show will stick for up to two minutes before responding or simply not responding at all (it will show the color bar to indicate that it is processing but then do nothing afterwards).

What I do like is the integration with my smart home. I can view my Nest Outdoor cams and the quality is great, both video and sound. I also like how many of the skills have become significantly more interactive thanks to the screen. And the ability to see video associated with my daily briefing is a nice feature.

I recall that the original Echo was improved dramatically over time thanks to regular updates. So I am hopeful that the Echo Show will live up to it's potential.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Eco Show Steals the Show Despite Hiccup
content:
IT IS A MUST BUY!

Despite Google disabling YouTube capability unexpectedly, the Eco Show is still a great product. Although I had initially purchased the Eco Show for this reason, I gave it a chance and I am pleased to say that I am a very satisfied customer. The device is user friendly and syncs beautifully with some of my other household items. I am looking forward to the updates that allow texts to be sent from Alexa devices, access social media, Netflix and Hulu. I love it!

author: C. Myers
title: Super cool
content: I love my Alexa, I wish it were a bit more like searching google, but it still is nice to have. I bought the cylinder one first, but it cannnot display the time so that’s why I bought this one for my bedroom and I love the scrolling lyrics when I play music!

author: Linda
title: I really did want to love it. Maybe it’s the warranty.
content: I love the echo. I have 7 devices in 4 rooms! I’ve bought echos as gifts for friends, and although I was never enamored by the echo shows bulkiness, I bought 2 of them anyway. 1 device had issues from the start. Bad screen -after several calls, amazon agrees to take it back. They don’t see the problem and send it back. Problem occurs again and they swap it for new refurbished model. Replacement shuts down every 2 days and now another replacement. I’d stay away from this model, clearly it needs some imrpovements,

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good product
content: As with all my Echo products I love them! It is so nice to ask Alexa to turn on my lights or turn off the TV. Mine is connected to my AC, door lock, lights, TV etc. I like being upstairs and if someone comes to my front door I can talk with them and then unlock the front door all from inside the shower. I can even have it make a phone call.

author: Sunbear
title: What happened to the Echo Show?
content: Until recently I used the Show for all the same functions as my other Echo devices and especially for the screen display. The display was large enough, especially the time, for me to see it across the room with either glasses or contacts and, in a lighted or dark room. About a week ago the display size reduced and dimmed and I could not find a way to increase it back to the original setting and brightness. Please don't tell me this is due to the new 10" model because programming can detect what device is being used and set default parameters accordingly. In the future, if the settings are going to be modified from the original randomly then I am lowering my rating.

author: VoltesV
title: Ease of use
content: The amazon echo show met all of our family needs.  We use it as an intercom between different echo devices.  We can video chat with grandma on her alexa app on her phone,  my daughter listens to amazon music and sings along with the lyrics on the screen,  we can view our arlo cameras from the show and the screen is large enough for my daughter to watch her anime shows on amazon prime, she also uses it to watch music videos from vevo and youtube.  We liked it so much we purchased a second one for the living room.

author: FelixTheCatastophe
title: Should be called "Echo No Show". Won't play YouTube content.
content:
What a waste of money. It won't play YouTube. It tries to find videos on Daily Motion, which are mostly pirated content, not much for kids and crappy quality. I mean, what's the point of this without YouTube? Sure Amazon just filed a patent for "AmazonTube", but lets face it, it'll be a decade before 'Amazon Tube" has the depth and breadth of videos and content that YouTube has. What a waste. UNTIL AMAZON AND WORK THIS OUT WITH GOOGLE'S YOUTUBE... DO NOT BUY THIS!

You have been warned.

author: Joshua S. Spell
title: I can't understand how the brilliant engineers at Amazon could have taken a device with ...
content:
I can't understand how the brilliant engineers at Amazon could have taken a device with such promise and bungled it so horribly.

Let's get the Pros out of the way:

Great video quality
Loud sound
Ability to interact with smart devices and especially outside security cameras
I'm sure the video calling, drop in, etc is great but I didn't get it for that.

Now, the bad:
Prime Video controls are horrid. I had apparently watched the first few episode of House at some point, so when I told Alexa I wanted to watch House, it insisted on starting me on Season 1 Episode 5. No matter how I phrased it, it would not play Season 1 Episode 1. I couldn't even started Ep 5 and just tell it to go back an episode.

Worse, forget about browsing for video. Alexa will show you the top 25 (if I remember right) choices, and that's it. You basically have to use a computer to create a watchlist, and then hope that Alexa will update in a reasonable timeframe so you can play it.

Once you finally do have a video on that you want to watch, god forbid if you have to pause it for more than a minute or two. Do that and the screen goes back to the home screen, and you lose wherever you were in the episode you were watching.

All of this presupposes that Alexa actually plays what you want to watch on the Show, and doesn't take over your FireTV if you have one.

The most aggravating thing about the Echo Show, however, is the intrusive "Things to try" at the bottom of the screen. The only time it goes away it seems is when you're watching video. Set up a nice slideshow for your screensaver? That's nice. The bottom third of the screen will be covered by something stupid like "Try asking Siri to speak like Yoda." Same if you're trying to follow lyrics while listening to music. After contacting customer service directly, I was told this was not something that can be disabled. I am most likely going to be returning the device because of this. Considering that people have apparently been complaining about it for the year this thing has been out, I doubt they'll be changing that any time soon. Apparently Amazon thinks we are all morons and can't decide for ourselves whether we need a constant tutorial.

Finally, Amazon boast about these being Bose speakers. If I were Bose, I wouldn't want my name associated with this device. Is it loud? Sure, but it can also get very tinny or ever have a very nasty buzz at times.

All in all, I am extremely disappointed with this device and feel ripped off, even though I got it on Prime Day for only $129.99 and the Amazon rep gave me a $30 credit because she too was annoyed by the "things to try" thing and felt bad she couldn't do anything about it. I really wish I'd have gone with the Plus instead.

author: Crystal M
title: The volume is great and being able to read and see what I ...
content: It was what I expected! The volume is great and being able to read and see what I asked is the reason I gave it 5 stars! I especially like the drop in. I can keep and eye on my 89 year of mom!!

author: Janet
title: Cool concept just not quite ready
content: I like the show it was a gift from a family member, its easy to set up but the only thing is you cannot do video chat unless the other person is also set up with a echo show or cell phone with plenty of data. I could be wrong but they need to all have echo accounts to chat. So I don't use it that much the Dot for the money is probably a better first step.

author: Nairda Willis
title: Fun fun fun
content: Wonderful and fun interactive companion to have in your home. Fun for kids and adults alike. I am constantly inquiring of Alexa. The show adds more fun visuals than the echo alone. Highly recommend as an addition to the echo family of products!

author: Rose G Sparkman
title: It is amazing. My husband and I will be having a ...
content: It is amazing. My husband and I will be having a conversation and wonder about something. We just ask Alexa. So much fun. We have set alarms, asked the weather for the day.  Plays some amazing music. Shows movies from Amazon Prime. Reads books to you. We are really enjoying it. It was a gift from my son and his family. Better yet.

author: Bywayz
title: Easy connection for our family
content: We have Echo Shows in our home, the homes of our two daughters and their families and in my office -- and it is a fun way to quickly connect with loved ones.  With 5 grandkids 8 and under, there is always hot news to share with us.  And although we all have smartphones, the larger screen, stability of the unit and audio controls make this a frequently used "connector"

author: Rae Brooks
title: The sound quality is poor
content: The speaker sounds like its blown.  I bought 2 of them, because I thought that the first one that I purchased was defective.  Then the second one I bought had just as poor sound quality.  It has a lot of potential and for the amount of money that it sells for it should have better sound quality.

author: JV84
title: Amazon Refuses To Address The Echo Show's Most Annoying Feature
content:
Imagine if you bought a great new flatscreen TV only to discover that phrases like "Try CSI:Miami!" were going to be displayed continuously over all your shows and there was nothing you could do about it.

Welcome to the Amazon Show where - no matter which and how many of your favorite photos you have on the the display - they'll all be marred by an endless series of generally useless, insipid suggestions - "Try, 'Alexa, tell me about puppies!," "Try, 'Alexa, what's your favorite skyscraper?" - and there's nothing you'll be about to do about it.  Yes, nothing: there's no toggle to remove this 'feature' despite months and months of customers complaining about it.

Amazon has hobbled a product which otherwise has real potential and clearly, they could not care less.

author: Faye Gonzales
title: Not working
content:
I have been having problems with the device
I have had to call the customer service department 3 times so far due to the echo not responding.  I have done everything they have told me to do and it's not working

author: Cooper
title: Reasons NOT to Buy an Echo Show
content:
An Echo Show does not indicate when you have a notification. Where the original echo shows a rotating yellow ring when there is a notification, the Echo Show has no colored line or an icon of any kind to let you know there is a notification. Amazon Echo Tech Support confirmed there is no indicator and stated that we must ask the Echo Show for notifications. So the user has to remember to ask the device. This makes it a very inefficient assistant. In fact I become the Echo Show's assistant when I have to prompt it to read my notifications.
I only get notifications 4 or 5 times a week, but to get them in time to react to, for example, an upcoming delivery notice, I would have to ask repeatedly, every day, if I have any notifications. It would be so much better to walk through front door or into the room and see a moving yellow line letting me know that I have a notification to check.

Similarly, any missed calls or messages that are left on an Echo Show do not have a colored line indicator. On an original Echo there would be a green ring visible on the Echo so the user knew there were messages or missed calls. On the Echo Show, there is an indicator, but it is a tiny green chat bubble in the top right hand corner of the screen with an even smaller numeral indicating the number of messages/missed calls. It blends easily into the background and becomes lost. It does not grab your attention the way a flashing green line would do.
One would have to walk over to the device and look for the indicator. Again a not very efficient assistant since we have to wonder if we have messages and then go and look for them,  instead of being visually informed the moment we catch a glimpse of our device. Echo Shows have blue lines and red/orange lines and white lines, so why isn't there a nice yellow line to tell us we have a notification or a green line for messages and calls?

The Echo Show also continuously displays “Things to Try” by putting suggested queries on the screen such as “Try ‘Alexa, show me funk music.’” These suggestions change continually and can be very annoying. Tech Support tells me they cannot be turned off. If I had known about these deficiencies and annoyances, I would not have purchased an Echo Show.

author: Ed Jones
title: Glad I waited for this version
content: Although I thought I would be using this to play YouTube videos in the background while doing other things, it seems Amazon & Google can't play well together so... I really like my "flash briefing" and the variety of "skills" is growing daily. I'm using this to control various items in the vicinity without issue. Setup and daily use has been completely pain free (but, I have a tech background so your use may vary). This might be a review in progress as functionality is added/removed. In lieu of the YouTube failure, Twitch is working well and my prime shows sometimes make an appearance. Can't wait to see what's next from Amazon

author: Tony DiSalvatore
title: Things to try... very annoying
content: The constant reminder of “ things to try.. “ are very annoying and cannot be disabled. Ruins what is a pretty good product. There is no way to disable the text.

author: Lawrence M. Hinman
title: The first thing that amazed me is that I couldn't control the messages that ...
content:
I've only had by Echo Show for a week.  I have several Echos and Dots, and I thought I'd replace my NixPlay picture frame and Echo with a single device that does it all.  Someday this will be possible, I'm sure, but I'm not sure it's within reach with the Echo Show.

The first thing that amazed me is that I couldn't control the messages that show up on the screen except for my calendar, etc.  I really don't care whether "Church Goers Get Wooed with a Loyalty Program" or "Firemen rescue baby deer."  The sound quality is fairly good, as is the (small) screen.  But it's not clear when any of that is an upgrade from the regular Echo.

In addition, it appears that users cannot have the screen turn off completely and turn back on in proximity, something my Nest thermostat as well as my NixPlay do.

Ultimately, I'm sure all this will be worked out--but when ultimately will arrive, and whether it will depend on hardware improvements, is unclear.  Many of the critical/negative comments on this thread seem true to me.  I'm not sure it's worth keeping.

author: BB Q
title: Sound is only so-so
content:
Disappointed in the sound - I expected it to match up to the sound of a Bose radio and it does not. Weak and a bit tinny. Alexa also seems to have some difficulty finding songs in my Amazon music library.  Bluetooth connection is working well for me so I mostly use that. Multi room music is a very nice feature.
I also wish you could change the wake word to whatever you want instead of being restricted to 4 choices.  Amazon keeps bragging about all Alexa's skills - they should be able to make this possible.

author: Potters Mark Ltd
title: Purchased Second Show (That's Show Business)
content: Very good product! Still needs further skills.  I especially use it for medication reminders.  The visual reminder remains until I dismiss it.  I still have been unable to communicate with the ring doorbell.  I gave it 4 stars because it still doesn't have all the features that I want. I feel confident that further improvements will move this to five stars.

author: June Matherne
title: Alexa is my new "best friend".
content: She will always answer me when I ask a question.  She knows what the weather is going to be for the day?  She can also tell you a well known fact for that day, tell you a silly joke, give you directions, recipes, set a timer, etc.  Most importantly she can call people on your contact list for you when you are too busy to get your phone.  Oh, and don't forget that she can make your grocery list on your phone so that when you reach the grocery store all you have to do is go to her app on your phone.  I absolutely love her.  Thanks to Phil, Steph and girls for giving her to me and my husband as a gift.

author: M. Luns
title: A clear step DOWN from the original Echo tower...
content: I have the regular Echo in my living area and used it daily. The sound was amazing and it responded quickly.  I mistakenly thought the Show would be a step up and got it during Prime Week.  Wow, what a disappointment.  First, the sound is much lower quality than the tower, the speakers are only right in front whereas the Echo tower it seems to come from all over.  Also, the Show just doesn't seem to get as loud as the tower.  Second, its hard to tell if she's listening to you unless you go stand right in front of it and look at the screen. Third, for some reason her response time is slower than the regular Echo.  I often think she didnt hear me, then she finally responds.  Fourth, she frequently just doesn't work. I set the timer, it says its running, then it doesn't go off. This has happened several times.  You try to look at something on the screen, and it says "unavailable".  Fifth, I was hoping to watch casual shows while Im in this area of the house,, but the screen is so small as to make this useless, again, unless I go stand right in front of it.  I missed the return window by a few days, but Im unplugging it anyway and putting the regular Echo tower back in.  The Show is that bad.

author: zenpond
title: like it, but a few months in the screen is wonky
content: like it in general, but only a few months into ownership the screen stays unstable in the lower third, with shaking and lines in the display.  Rebooting and down time doesn't fix it. Audio has been fine.

author: Dr. M. Bond
title: Alexa Show is not very Intelligent! Be careful before you buy.
content: So Far I am not impressed. I can't (or it won't) play my music from my iPad or Computer. If I say "Alexa" play radio YXYZ station it doesn't understand or plays a station I don't want to hear (from somewhere else). I find myself using it less and less. This is not AI. This is LI (lacking intelligence). There's no help available to solve the problems.

author: Hammer
title: Great size and great functionality!!
content: Love it!  Just the right size.  Not near using all capabilities yet; however, the drop in feature is great - just like an intercom and can be video intercom if you have the correct device on the other end.

author: Richard M.
title: I find myself swearing at her responses pretty often and telling her she is either flat out ...
content: Alexa is no Google.  I find myself swearing at her responses pretty often and telling her she is either flat out wrong, just really dumb or a bad listener.  She really test my patience.

author: Robert B. Lemelson
title: broken monitor, under warranty, tortuous replacement process
content:
within 2 months of purchasing the echo, the screen started glitching- the images wavered and jumped around and stuttered. It still works, but is difficult to look and read the text on the screen.
