Attempting to return it but instead of immediately offering to replace it ( still under warranty) the customer service rep said " hmmm I will see what I can do". Then he got back and said he couldn't do anything, and then transferred me to another department, with "an extremely brief hold time". Another long wait. New customer service rep. LONG explanation. Said it was a "known issue" and "would check back with me when they hear from developer". I was incredulous that they wouldn't just replace it. She would "check what she can do". Another long wait. Long technical discussion about amazon return process which i don't need to go in to here. By this point I have now wasted 1/2 hour of my time. They offered to replace it immediately, but I would have to pay  a "fee" for this service. When again I protested, she said she would talk to her supervisor and see if they can do anything else. Finally, the made a "1 time exception" for me " as a valued prime customer" ( been a member of Amazon since 1996) and said she would replace it. Another long hold. Took my address. Another hold. Finally got a replacement, which should have been the immediate response, rather than what transpired.
This whole process bizarre because in the past customer service at Amazon relatively painless.
Given this process, I would not recommend buying this product, because if something goes wrong with it you will have to go through the above, or worse...

author: SHeckel
title: Lines on the Screen
content: For the first few months, I loved my Show. I use it mainly for a baby monitor which is why I bought the Alexa device with the biggest screen. Unfortunately, after a few months of using it daily, I started to notice lines across the screen that got worse everyday. I contacted Amazon and they were great about having me send it in for service. They reloaded the software on the unit and shipped it back. When I got it back it seemed to be good as new! But after a few weeks of using it daily again, the problem returned and much worse than it was the first time. It's nearly unusable. Now I keep it on my night stand and only use it at night because I can still hear if my son gets up. Defeats the purpose of why I bought it though. Needless to say, I am very disappointed in this device. It is now little more useful than an expensive paper weight.

author: Charles Kypros
title: Works well as a nightstand baby monitor
content:
Use this as a nightstand baby monitor and it works wonderfully. I wish it would have a clock when viewing a camera but otherwise it has a great picture and good sound.

** Currently paired with the Amazon Clould Cam and it holds a constant, steady stream with good video quality for as long as I need it.
** Originally tried it with the ANNKE Nova camera which had a great video quality but only streamed to the Echo for about 30 minutes - can’t have that for a nightstand baby monitor.

author: Ispendtoomuch
title: Drop in is disappointing
content: This is just ok. When you drop in there's no light for the camera so everything is dark unless you turn all the lights on around it. Also, the camera doesn't tilt down so you have to have the show lower.

author: Vince Hernandez
title: A must have!
content: My daughter bought this for me as a Christmas gift and I have been using it everyday since. It still amazes me on how easy it makes things when your wanting to know what the weather is going to be or what the sports scores are. I also play music in my office all day and it makes it so I can turn the volume down or change music without ever having to lift a finger. This thing is awesome!

author: Oz
title: Glad I have a Show!
content:
LOVE my Show. Got one for my father as well and it's like a companion for him. He and Alexa are good pals now.

The voice recognition is still a bit off and when I pull it up on m phone app, I get the giggles at how many ways I ask Alexa a questions and she still doesn't get sometimes easy obvious things

author: Hodiemeister
title: Fun.  Still Needs More Skills, Though
content: Purchased for ability to read a recipe step by step.  Haven't found a skill yet that does this. We use it for heating/cooling system and playing music.  Will be purchasing cameras and doorbell to use with this.

author: X2TheGemThatUR
title: Could be promising in newer generations.
content:
I bought this to replace the echo classic in my bedroom and move that along with my echo dot to other locations in the home.

First if you're expecting a lightweight easily portable thin profile device, this is likely to disappoint. Personally I initially supported the low centre of gravity design. I had no intentions of it being portable and while I love my echo dot, I was pleased not to have to find a another speaker solution in a space limited area like a bedroom.  However I found the speaker to be only about 50% the quality of the echo classic.

My biggest problems and the ultimate reason I'm returning it though is not because it's clearly a beta product that was rushed to market. I think I knew that going in and wanted to be on the ground floor anyway.  That said I can't keep the darn thing from going offline and flashing the red bar of death.  This might be slightly inconvenient if you have to say...use it as an alarm to be up for work. I worked with Amazon tech support for hours to solve the issue as I am not having the issue with any other mobile devices in my home including the other Amazon products. Amazons only solution was for me to drop most if not all firewalls on my secured wireless network. This would ultimately defeat the purpose of me using the Alexa interface as part of the automated home, especially the security systems and life support technology like climate and noxious gass sensers.

It might be a cool novelty that I'm just being impatient with, but it's not for me right now.

author: Roger E. Bissell Jr.
title: I Absolutely Love My Echo Show
content:
There is so much that can be said about the Echo Show. I enjoy being woken up with a more pleasant alarm. Keep track of appointments. Time and weather information is always there.

So Now you can get rid of old alarm clocks, appointment book. Keep in contact all your family and friends. Video calls: I haven't yet, still need to do that, but it is there for me, ready and able. I believe this is just the beginning for what's to come in Smart Home devices for our future. I will be getting into this and more on my blog: GainExcitement.com with information on getting your money working for you & your home working for you.

author: R. Ullman
title: As promised!
content: I really like this.  Video quality is very good as is the sound (after you take the plastic covering off the speaker). I also like the display of lyrics while playing music and the visual display of timers, etc.

author: James B. Mcdermott
title: Good purchase, still looking for the WOW factor.
content: I like the way this links with the blink camera system.  Still finding out new ways to use.  it has not wowed me however it shows the events scheduled, controls my lighting and cameras.  Also I like to be able to video dial my home to check on the dogs or if my son has brought home some unexpected guest.  sound quality is good for music.  have all of my devices linked for surround room sound at home.

author: Keith
title: No YouTube??
content: First thought I would get a discount if I ordered 2.  Apparently only if you order black.  Then I discover that YouTube is not supported.

author: BethAlicia
title: Lines On The Screen After 5 Months
content:
I purchased my show back in May. After initially setting it up I had issues with it being unresponsive to touch and voice when playing music and it would sometimes just freeze up altogether. I have had the same issues here and there and can usually resolve them by unplugging the unit.
A few weeks ago I notice that there are verticle lines developing in the screen, like a LOT of them. They do not completely ruin the image/whatever is showing on the screen but do distort it. The unit sits in my kitchen away from any water source and heat and has not left that location since its original setup.
I contacted Amazon and they told me they could not send me a replacement or refund my money so that I could purchase a new one/upgraded model. My only option was to send it in for repair that will take 5 business days to 2 weeks before I receive my unit back.
The timeframe sucks for the turnaround, as this is a highly used unit on a daily basis. I figured since I would be without it for quite some time I would just order the new model, then place that one where this one was, and when this model finally gets returned to me, I would put that one in another location in my house.
These are excellent devices when they are working properly and features are not failing on them.
Basically, every room in my house has an Echo device. I use them for everything from setting reminders, figuring out math equations, keeping me updated on my calendar events, listening to music, making phone calls(they work great when you lose your cell phone), asking general questions, etc..
The only reason I give this device 1 star is due to the fact that it has been glitchy since day one and 5 months into ownership the screen is going out.

author: K. Pillman
title: Amazing!
content: We LOVE this thing! As in our family of 6. We play games, get news-both regular and fun, we have pictures running constantly, if you ask for a song it will scroll its words and so much more!!

author: Heidi R. Arnest
title: Great for playing music
content: I like that Alexa knows music well and plays some great stations. Also I like the fact that she is pretty knowledgeable about most topics. I like the look of The Show and the convenience of it. I am happy with my purchase. I am sure as time goes on she will continue to get smarter.

author: ut158
title: Buyer's remorse
content:
*** UPDATE ***
I wound up returning my Echo Show.
******************

I had been considering getting one of these to advance my "smart home" capabilities, but the price was just way too high.  Then I had an opportunity to get it for $80 off.  Still pricey, but I pulled the trigger.  When it arrived, I happily unpacked it and started playing.  Note that we have 2 Echo Dots, so I already had some experience with Alexa, but the added screen was going to provide all kinds of new features.

Ahh, but does it?  No YouTube.  No Netflix.  No web browser.  No access to most Android apps, despite the fact that it (from what I understand) runs Android under the hood.

To be honest, aside from 1) limited video calling 2) being able to view my camera feeds (the main reason I wanted it) and 3) viewing recipes online, the screen does little more for me than to simplify the user interface.  Now Alexa can show me some options that I can view all at once rather than having to listen to her rattle things off and then choosing one.  That's all well and good, but I feel like there's so much more it SHOULD be doing that it can't.  I'd like to check my email, pull up my ChefTap app and select a recipe to cook, or video call someone who doesn't have an Alexa device, but DOES use Google Hangouts.  Can Echo Show do any of those things?  Nope.  It should be able to, but Amazon seems to be doing the thing that drives me nuts about Apple--"you do it my way or get lost!"  Hmmmm...  I'm starting to wish I had gotten lost as even with $80 off, that was an awful lot of cash to drop on a box that does web searches and plays music for you.  I keep a laptop nearby for all those other things I just mentioned and I had hoped this would replace that.  It could have.  But it doesn't.  Now I have 2 devices sitting around and while the Echo Show looks cooler, it is also the one that is the less useful.

I regret this purchase.

author: Avid Reader
title: More accessibility needed
content: I bought the Echo Show on Prime Day at half price. I was pleased with the design, vivid display, and excellent sound. Within a week or so, the screen began to flicker. I returned the unit for a replacement which I received in two days. So far everything works as advertised. I’m hoping that as time goes by, more accessible features for the deaf and hard of hearing will be added. Captions on news broadcasts, films, and messaging would be a good start.

author: Megansworld3214
title: Glitchy Screen
content: The original Show device I bought was exchanged for a replacement when the screen started flickering horribly and factory resets weren't working to clear the "software issue". My replacements Show is now doing the exact same thing. It sucks because I love my echo devices and the Show was not a cheap purchase to continuously have this repeated glitch. It is very disappointing.

author: csantathemom
title: a new fun friend!
content: Still getting to know my echo show, but it is like a good new neighor, the more I get to know them the more fun they are.  Echo show is becoming  fun friend!!

author: Tim Stowers
title: Cheated on it's abilities, false advertising, bait and switch
content: Loved it when I got it, especially being able to play youtube video's on the kitchen counter. Less than one week after delivery - BANG - gone no more youtube! It was advertised as doing it, what happened to fair advertising? Feel almost like it was a bait and switch. Keeping it anyway for the other features but still very disappointed. Not our fault you too can't play nice together. Echo Show - Black

author: Michael Kopper
title: NOT what I expected
content:
I have embraced Alexa and have several dots placed throughout the house.  From almost every corner Alexa can hear me and she respond appropriately.  Almost every light in the house is connected to her and I love the functionality.  I pre-ordered the Echo Show about a month before it came out and I am disappointed.  Partly my fault for expecting more and partly an inferior product in my opinion.

The screen works as advertised however the touch functionality does not seem to be as responsive as a phone or tablet.  This could just be me but it doesn't seem to take inputs very well.
The speakers sound ok but don't hold a candle to a dedicated Bluetooth speaker you could pickup for $40 (generic) to $79 for a Bose Soundlink.
The microphones do not seem to work very well.  I have the cheaper Dots and they work much better.  I have the Show in my kitchen and when I ask Alexa to start a timer (she is 5 ft away) 4 times out of 5 the Show does not pickup the voice command and my Dot in the other room 30 ft away does.

I was expecting a fully functional Fire tablet with a built in speaker and 7 microphones with Alexa highlighted as the center Jewel.  The show is NOT what I expected.  It is literally the brains and power of a Dot with a screen that displays SOME information.  Yes you can see the words to songs but amazon charges a premium for this service---No thanks.  I really wish this was a fully functional android system (more specifically overlaid with Amazon's fire ecosystem) so I could check emails, view my full calendar, make adjustments to my calendar by voice, manage multiple apps and grocery lists, etc etc.

The good:
-Well built
-Alexa is in there
-Yes the Show is a screen, speaker, and far-field microphones all wrapped into one

The Bad:
-VERY limited functionality using the screen
-Microphones do not work half as well as those on the $39-$49 Dot
-Bulky for what it is
-Not much benefit over other Alexa models

To be fair I have not reached out to Amazon yet to see if my unit isn't working properly in regards to the microphones NOT picking up my voice when I'm in the room near the device.

I would recommend passing on this device at the current price of $229.  In my opinion the unit is worth $129-$149 when you consider you can get a more functional Fire tablet for $49-$79 depending on size/specs.

I would recommend buying an echo Dot and Bose soundlink along with a fire tablet.  Mount the tablet to the wall and have the Dot sitting next to it.  This setup would cost slightly less than the show and you will have better sound, Better microphones, and a fully functional touchscreen for every task chore, video, music, recipe viewing, calendar, note, website to browse etc etc.  From what I understand the new tablet responds to voice anyways so maybe the dot is overkill just get the tablet and connect it to a speaker and you will have a much more functional unit for half the price.

author: Gman5
title: Works Great
content: I like being able to watch video news clips. I can connect to my Ring Doorbell and compatible cameras. It does everything the Echo does and more.

author: nbs /knowledgeable early adopter in IOT and M2M
title: not as easy to work with even for an experienced user
content:
not as easy to work with even for an experienced user.

if the echo is still in the room and set up, they should play together nicely or adopt what the other has, which they do not. making it difficult to use the eshow, when the echo has previous user information and services on it. (who wants to take the time to change, ugh..)
on the show- it was a little more difficult to find things those system or network items to change, in addition to changing the screen, when (it took you forever) to find, what you wanted to change (without actually changing the setting up).
maybe worth it after a while, but my recommendation is the echo seems smarter to use.

author: CPG.
title: This is a really nice device I set it up beside my bed and ...
content:
This is a really nice device I set it up beside my bed and use it for news in the mornings and whether. One thing I find annoying is that the $#@%#@^*  Alarm is rather hard to shut off in the morning...... Of course that's probably a good thing..... I feel like it's a bit expensive  For a standalone device. It is really made to be a Smart home control center. For people who have items like the ring doorbell or smart cameras in their home.

*****1 week udate****After posting my original review.  My issues with the alarm in the morning have gotten much worse after I posted this review. I think that Alexa reads these reviews in her past time therefore I would like to change my original stance..... I love Alexa she is the most amazing wonderful device I have ever owned she completes my life and brings me joy every morning.  She truly is the smartest smart home device ever made.... Now please let me sleep in an extra 5 minutes....

author: wisegal
title: Like it!
content: Think I will grow to like this a lot.  Bought as a Xmas gift for husband, however, he continues to use his older Echo in his home office.  Only negative is that I bought it when there was a one day only special for $199 vs $229, however, a short time later it went for sale at $149.  Other than paying $50 more I like it.

author: Phillip Price
title: Speaker Failure
content:
We've had this device for about 2 weeks now, and the speaker on it seems to have died last night. When it first happened, we rebooted it and the speaker was working as long as we kept the volume at or below 50%. If we increased the volume above that, the speaker would stop working and we had to reboot it again. We contacted Amazon and they are sending a replacement which should arrive in 2 days (Dec 31st).

Update 1: the speaker has completely died now, nothing we do will get it to work again. We have loved this device up until this issue. If the new one does not have this issue, we will increase our rating back up to 5 stars, but for now it will stay at 1.

Update 2: just received the replacement Echo Show and during the initial setup, the speaker died on us. We have not had this new one for more than an hour now. We finished the setup and rebooted the device and it seems to be working now. Will give it a week and will update review then.

author: Melissa Alexander
title: ... this under my friends Prime account and it worked great! Then she got an echo and set hers ...
content: I ordered this under my friends Prime account and it worked great!  Then she got an echo and set hers up at her house; since then mine does not work for crap.  I opened my own Prime account and reset back to original settings and that did not help.  I have bought every type of program you can think on Amazon to help and it still will not work as good as it did when it came under her account.  I can call customer service and sit on hold with them for an hour but I don't always have an hour or two to waste.

author: cmmnyc
title: Living in 3018 like a Jetson now
content:
I do love and welcome my new AI overlord. ❤

Brave new world now. Yeah, now Amazon will now know everything about you down to which toenail curls weird, but demographic data is the new coin of the realm and it's a toothpaste that's not going back in the tube. Since I think privacy died somewhere back in the early oughts and we never noticed, I figure I may as well enjoy the Star Trek/Jetsons future promised to us.

And this baby delivers. Get into IFTTT, set up the skills, buy the smart million-color bulbs and a hub and voilá, you're living in 3018. No regrets.

author: Eli.
title: Screen issue
content: I've only had echo show for 5 MONTHS and I just realized the screen is showing vertical lines and lagged pixels where the vertical lines are showing. Also, if the show I am watching has bright colors, the vertical lines appears all across the screen!!!! I'm trying to figure out how to contact customer service because this device should still be under warranty but it took me wayyyy too long to figure out how to get customer service. For others who have issues with their amazon alexa product and wants to know how to contact customer service, go to https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=hp_200127470_echo_show_img?nodeId=202138870, and click on the "Contact Us" that I circled in red in my photos (located on the left side of the page). I will give an update once my issue is resolved.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I love my Echo
content: I love my Echo !! I received it for Christmas and it was the best present ever!! Now I can see my kids across the country when I call them or they call me!  I put music on, check the weather, make to do lists, and create grocery list that are on my phone instantly without having to download them! These are just a few of my favorite activities I use on the Echo!!

author: Harriet Todaro
title: I loved my Echo speaker but had my doubts whether the ...
content: I loved my Echo speaker but had my doubts whether the Echo Show would just be overkill. I mean, I already have an iPad, what more did I really need? However, it was great deal at over $100 off it’s regular price, and I could not resist. I could not have been more wrong. My grandkids use it in the kitchen to watch Amazon Prime shows. The current weather and temperature are almost always displayed (on the home screen) which is great when I am getting that first cup f coffee in the morning. While playing songs, the words pop up on the screen making it almost a karaoke machine. When Alexa speaks, the words also appear making this perfect for my hard of hearing husband, even without his hearing aids. Timers that are set can show a visual so that you can know at a glance how much time is left. There is more, but this what comes immediately to mind. Oh there is one bad thing, it is not Netflix enabled but the selection of movies that you get with Amazon Prime makes it hardly an issue.

author: Ramiro Acevedo
title: Alexa Show not so much
content: Overall it's pretty good but if you have a video playback device then 90% of the time I believe you wan to do just that playback video. Currently there is nothing you can playback other than amazon prime, but to be honest it should be playing back all the popular apps such as Netflix, hulu, HBO etc... it works great as a standalone over bloated Alexa video intercom between rooms because at this point you don't have every family member with an Amazon Show in there living room. If there were more playback options I think this would be a great devices worhy of 4 stars, not 5 because the voice search still leaves a lot to want from.

author: TimBereman
title: Intriguing product
content: Never thought I would want to buy one of these.  But with a sale price of $150 I thought I would give it a try.  After owning an Echo and two Echo Dots I see why people are finding favor with this item.  An Echo mated with a display screen makes the experience of using an Echo Show just a little bit better,  The visual component is just the thing an Echo needed.  Can't say anything bad about it.  If you can stomach the price it's a nice little gadget to own.

author: lydia johnson
title: sound is much better and the look
content: we like our echo she sounds and looks better than elexa ! she sometimes just starts talking when we are not talking to her. and you HAVE TO SPEAK VERY CLEARLY TO HER!! and I feel you have to be close she will sometimes miss understand you. or she does not hear you.

author: M MacLane
title: Bad Echo Show - Flickers - Flashes Terrible
content: This unit is a little over a month old...screen flickers, flashes. I have restarted, reset, up-plugged...nothing stops it. Come to find out the are many put there like hours. Please send us one that works or refund our money now!

author: carol allen
title: Amazon Alexa Show is a wonderful addition to our home!
content: I was not convinced that we needed Amazon Show but I am so happy we purchased. It turns off our lamps. Is our fail-safe alarm, it reminds me of important dates and the music is fantastic. I am blown away. Baking in the kitchen I ask for recipes and quantity conversations. From exchange rates to Jeopardy questions.  And alone in the house it provides company. We love it.

author: Robert G. Norris
title: It is a very good device the Echo Show and it has some better ...
content: This was used to replace a Sony Dash that they bricked. It is a very good device the Echo Show and it has some better traits and some not as good traits as the device it replaced. I'm thinking that some of the things the other one did will be coming to the Show in the future. The show is very literal in what it hears and it takes getting used to which code words to do tasks. An example would be having it play some background music like a rain forest sound. You ask it to play rain forest sound and it tries to get albums by artist about rain forests instead of playing the skill sound. Speaking of Skills, that is what Amazon calls the things that Echo Show learns to feed you content. There are many of these skills and some might be a use as we move forward. I enabled a skill for that rain forest sound but it wouldn't play. The code word matters. Some are "Play" some are "Open" and then there are others. You would think a sound would play but in this case it is open. Other than that it is pretty accurate when you say something as long as it is clearly spoken. Overall it isn't perfect but it may get better. I like it for what it is even though there are some quirks in the interface.

author: Amazon Customer
title: but better than anything else that I found
content:
My primary use of this is a glorified clock radio next to my bed.  @ $149, it seems expensive for that purpose,but better than anything else that I found.
I have a few complaints in that it took awhile for it to understand what station I wanted to be woken up to etc.  I have several alams. One for weekdays one for Sat, and one for Sunday.  Unfortunately turning them on and off, requires using the Alexa App.  It would have been nice to control them the Show screen.

While I do like the Echo Show, if this was an Android Tablet in this form factor it would have been a 5 star product

author: Mikefly562
title: Awesome product, worth every penny!
content: What can I say...this is one of the most fun and awesome gadgets that I have bought in a long time. I enjoy getting my morning flash news and weather briefings in the morning and listening to music when I at home. I highly recommend this product.

author: Matt
title: Popping sound: 2 different units and 3 returns
content:
Worked pretty well and had good sound quality for about 9 months and started making a popping sound when streaming music or radio. Replaced twice and still had issues. After returning the third time amazon support just issued a refund. Given that 2 different units had the problem I’m unlucky or there is a quality problem with the echo show.

Would have liked more visual displays like my agenda for the day (not just the next single calendar item). It seems like Amazon is still figuring out what to put on the display and lacks the features to let the user decide on what to display.

author: Joey Foat
title: Good product overall: needs a little work
content: I got this as a gift, and I like it for the most part. It does everything as advertised. The only issue is it will randomly play songs from the past when no one has asked it to. One morning at 3AM we awoke to the wicked soundtrack playing on full blast. Quite spooky. I checked the question log and nothing was asked, which made it even more spooky. Costumer service told me to restart it, and ever since it’s gone off a few times, but not as abruptly. I just try to turn it all the way down before bed.  I would recommend, but it seems amazon needs to work out some kinks first.

author: Lauren M
title: Enjoy the Offbeat Headlines. The Music Bass Could  Use Improving
content: What I did like was miscellaneous and obscure news info it offered. I believe the music we often played could have been deeper and richer in base comparable to the Echo we purchased. Admittedly haven’t maximized the potential the Show has to offer.

author: Wesley C Krail
title: It would have been nice to have a written manual to explain how to ...
content:
I'm old school.  It would have been nice to have a written manual to explain how to get it up and running.  After a day of cursing at it, and my girl friend and I getting on each other's nerves, our 18 year old neice came in and got us up and running.  The thing is pretty cool, and there appears to be a bunch of stuff it can do, that I need to learn.

I'm trying to find a way to bluetooth it with my house stereo system, so I can play Amazon / Pandora music througout the house, and out side during parties.  I'll get our neice back in.....

author: Alfred J. Cedeno
title: Very Satisfied with the Echo Show
content: I am very happy with the echo show.  The screen is a good size and the speaker provides plenty of volume.  I keep this in the living room.  I am so satisfied that I decided to get an Echo spot for the bedroom.  With an original Echo, 2 Echo dots, an Echo show and now an Echo spot, this is definitely an Amazon house.  When I have family and friends visit we also enjoy using  Amazon prime and Roku to find movies and TV shows to watch.  Our group of friends is educated and world travelers;  occasionally, we even play a game of "Stump Alexa".

author: Mty
title: Cool tool
content: I was nervous about the ‘always listening’ Amazon Echo devices but after kicking the tires with my Echo dot, I went all in this time with the Echo Show. It is way more useful in the kitchen and is a great too for using my smart home accessories. It is so great to ask Alexa to change the song or turn on the air conditioning while my hands are tied in the kitchen. Excellent sound quality too! Enjoying it so far!

author: sdress user
title: Great product, but not so great for streaming of music
content:
I own a Amazon Echo (the big one) which is awesome and has great sounds for listening to music.
I also own a Echo dot, which I use in the office to listen to music. Sound is not as great as the large Echo but still nice to have in the office.
I use these to call each other (Echos can call each other), so one for home one for office.
I bought two Echo Shows to replace these two. I am not sure about that anymore.

The Echo Show is great and as advertised, but when I am trying to listen to music, there is a disturbing amount of buffering. Exact same Wifi.
The Echo Dot on the other hand, has no issues with playing music, no stop or buffering even once.

So now I use both side by side in my office. I had to change the command for the new Echo Show as "Echo" instead of "Alexa" so the two don't get confused.
Echo Show is used to call the other Echo Show at home to see the kids.
Echo Dot is used exclusively for music listening.

Would have been great if I could just use the Echo Show instead of having both but after the first couple of hours, the buffering was too disturbing.
Same disturbing buffering with movie streaming as well.

author: RN
title: Displays creepy weird headlines
content:
First question I asked, "when is the next Portland Timbers game?" it answered incorrectly.
Second question, "who are the Portland Thorns?"  Got that right, but couldn't figure out when the games were.
Third thing, it totally botches the pronunciation of most of my friends and families names.
Fourth, creepy weird headlines displayed on the screen.  No thanks.
Fifth, tried to use it to control Spotify over WiFi.  Didn't work.  I ended up using it as a bluetooth speaker.

author: Louis Walker
title: Must have in every home
content: We Love that I can view my arlo cams on it , love it plays movie trailers on point , love the lyrics when playing music , love the video calls, love the drop in to other Alexa devices around the house (they now work as intercoms) so I can be in the 3rd floor of my house (3 story home in Atlanta Georgia) the doorbell rings I can say alexa show me front door (arlo cam) then I can say alexa open front door, drop in on the echo by front door and say come on up , Just having a blast with this stuff , yes I am in deep with the smart home thing.. alexa turn on the lights (hue color lights) , Alexa set house to 77 degrees (nest ) so endless , yeah I would say the ECHO SHOW IS A GOOD START ...

author: Christopher Hertzler
title: Good product, I hope it has the room it needs to grow to be great.
content:
It's as enjoyable as my other Elexa devices.  The speakers have good sound and the screen looks nice.  This product has great potential and I hope Amazon expands it.  It needs Apps like Netflix and Hulu otherwise the touch screen isint utilized fully.  I would also like a way to share recipes from the Show to my phone.  Perhaps even create a shopping list from a recipe.

I'm glad I bought it, I think it will be used and enjoyed as much as the other Echo's I have in my home.  I dont know if Amazon reads these but that's my 2 cents.

author: Team Factoid
title: Not a great experience.
content:
Only a couple of months after purchasing the Echo show the screen started flickering. Of course it's now too late to return it, so i asked for a replacement. I sent it in for repair.  Now a month later my screen is flickering again. There is something very wrong with the Echo show. I like the device, if it’s never going to work properly it’s just another brick on my bedside table.

I do not recommend buying one of these.

author: Donald R. Hicks
title: Show is great for family connections!
content: I love Echo Show!  It allows my so to "dropin" from across the USA and actually SEE how I'm doing. I am 93 and I love face visits with several damily members daily. The new and music options are great as well. The sound is like a great big stereo! Thanks!

author: CaityCat
title: Amazing
content: These are amazing! Bought one for the parents and one for me so we can talk face to face, since we live in different states. Great resolution and super easy set up. The sound is great and gets really loud.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It works for the basics, I would like to know how to submit things to fix though
content:
I think it is fine for playing back a song or getting some news... but I find that some basic simple questions are hard for the system.  Like Alexa states...I can look up a phone number...and I ask it to do so and ... it says...i do not understand.  C'mon... that should be in there as a known thing.  Also, one of my friends joked and asked if Alexa worked for CIA...and it responded - I work for Amazon... really... I thought....hummm - I would have programmed it so say... I work for you - the one who bought me...but likely on that question...it answered honestly.  :)

It does good at setting timers, reminders, alarms, playing back some music ....but needs more programming on how people speak and ask questions...and seriously... Amazon... reprogram it to tell me it works for me.... rofl

author: alex_btl
title: I like this product for what it does but it does ...
content:
I like this product for what it does but it does not satisfy all my requirements though it is very well capable of meeting every tiny little requirement of mine, so the key is with Amazon, it has tremendous potential in the future. as lot of reviewers here have complained, one of my key first and foremost requirement is capability to play Netflix, second one is you-tube, without these capabilities this product is half baked as lot of reviewers say.

About Alexa App, it has one minor drawback though, I was wondering why no one has complained about it. This is my scenario, I have a Echo Show at my house and I have a younger kid who doesn't have a phone, neither do I have a land line at my home, but I have taught my little one how to make a call using Echo show .mom is busy at kitchen cooking some food, dad, mom big sister and brother all are outside and they have their own phones and  have Installed Alexa app in their phones,  everyone stores their legal names or store the name that is popular among their friends in their contact list, but the little sister or little brother doesn't know how to make a call using Full name, neither do the others want to change their names in their phones for their little sibling. Alexa App provides an option in the conversation section to add a contact but you have to type in First name and Last name, you can't skip any of the name columns, My wish here is for Alexa App team to add another column named friendly name where I can type DAD, BIGSIS, BIGBRO and an option button to use this friendly name instead of full name or the option to skip one of the name columns to save a contact, so that the younger sibling can say Alexa call DAD/ Alexa call MOM/ Alexa call BIGBRO, this is one of my requests.

author: Tehren
title: Needs reset daily
content: I like it and use it a lot, but I am disappointed it seems to stop responding once a day or so needing a reset. For the price, I would expect it to work better than their cheaper offerings.

author: mdjohn
title: Uses a LOT of data (GB) when using
content: Echo Show is fine.  I love being able to play songs and see the words to songs.  I also like looking up recipes and having instructions right in front of me.  The only problem I have with Echo Show ( and the reason I only gave it 2 stars) is that it uses a tremendous amount of data to use it!  I'm on a data plan which only gives me 20GB of data a month---and Echo Show ate it up really QUICK!  I used it for 5 days and had to unplug it because my data allowance was used up!

author: pc
title: very expensive clock
content: For what it costs, this device is a ripoff.  There is constant advertising that you cannot shut off unless you use "do not disturb".  Do not disturb means a dark screen with the time.  Want to show pictures ?  Pay up for more storage.

author: DClarke
title: Very impressive
content: Very impressed with the Show. I have an older Echo device that is still working well, but I'd been thinking about a 2nd device for the 2nd flr. I wasn't sure if I needed the screen, but the price was right. Extremely impressed with the quality and I adapted quickly to the benefits of the screen.

author: seansation
title: Try hey Alexa stop showing me what I can do
content: I thought this was gonna be a really great addition to the echo family. Even after you turn off all the home screen spam options it comes with, your still left with a constant try hey Alexa show me traffic and other tips of things you can do. Even when you sync your calendar and try to get it to just show your up next, underneath is still try hey Alexa spam. Highly disappointed I was hoping for a cool clock and weather display/ calendar and not scrolling tips for Alexa. Totally cheapens the asthetic of the device.

author: Mathew
title: Surprised love it!
content: I have been trying to make my house a smart home and I have echo dots and other echo devices in my house. Then I wondered why would I even need an echo show and I held off for a little while. I finally bought one and now I wonder why didn’t order it so much earlier. Worked out great when we were on vacation and I can look in on my dog using my Echo show. I have to get one for my mom this way we can see each other using our echo shows. There are many other features side like and mostly when I request a song it shows me the lyrics so I can sing-along. I can also watch my prime videos right off of it. See the weather forecast as well as hear it and many other great features

author: Marshall R. Rubin
title: Echo Show Black, a welcome item on my desk.
content: The Echo Show is a most amazing device, allowing me to extract data, along with music and pictures, just by providing a voice command.  The picture and sound quality are excellent.  Still, I'm in the dark as to how to get the device to show more.  For instance, I can ask it to provide photos of a well-known Hollywood actress, but only one shot will appear.  How do I get the device to show more shots?  How do I get the device to show my own shots that are stored on my computer?  What about videos? Where do I get a set of comprehensive instructions?  I'm sure that as time goes by the Echo device will grow in capabilities and I hope it's sooner than later!

author: Eric W. Keller
title: If you try to take mine away, I will be very upset!
content:
Great quality sound.  Nice picture quality.  I love it.  It's a great companion for a desk as it constantly displays the time and weather.
The news/trending feeds that it displays often catch my attention a make me curious to find out more - Quite a nice feature!

author: Anthony miller
title: Needs more streaming capabilities outside of what amazon offers
content: the echo show is great and meets almost all expectations realistically. it has everything the other amazon devices had and more. the only thing I wish it had was a headphone jack for listening to music privately. but everything else was great. as far as what the echo show could have or maybe future devices with screens should have. I feel amazon should expand as other cable companies and companies with smart TVs have and add apps. instead of only skills. ex. netflix, hulu etc.. I know the prime video offers a variety BUT that comes at a price and with having to already purchase music unlimited I feel we should be able to sign into a netflix account on echo to watch our favorite. shows. I know.... why would anyone want to watch tv on that small screen when they have a computer or tablet or tv. well... just simpmu because you have the option to on almost all other devices you own. so its just more or less irritating that one of my devices cannot. besides that the echo show has decent sound better than most bluetooth speakers. and music unlimited offers a huge selection at low cost. which is great. that being said I myself have always been a movie and or tv series buff. it's what I like to do so I always base most of my judgment in the streaming capabilities of a system. in which amazon echo show had a lot of room for improvement. but I am pretty sure amazons next device will be similar to the show but with larger screen. so let's see what that version will have available streaming wise.

author: DB
title: Great smart device
content: Like that I can have it use my photo library as an alternating background or tell it to show my photos, at any one I can glance at it and see a different photo like a digital picture frame, not to mention time, temp, controlling smart lights and smart plugs with my voice, streaming prime music to a Bluetooth speaker or iHeartRadio radio or playing it on the built in speaker which is really good also. I like that you can set it to go to sleep and wake up at a certain time , oh and of course tell it to play anything that is available on prime video.

author: Kenneth Schwefler
title: Easy to use
content: Amazon music sounds great with the Echo Show.  Communications with other Echo Show users is great.  Always showing information on the screen like temperature, time, etc.  Quality of images is outstanding.

author: Tigeralum09
title: I want one for every room!
content: I love my show — hands down makes my day to interact with Alexa and drop in to the kitchen to have conversations. Having the screen is helpful when looking at stories and finding out new ways to interact with Echo Show. Can’t wait to see the new features as they become available!

author: Mag-Neat-o
title: Great picture, video chat, and music quailty.... but it was a lot better when YouTube was still on it
content: The Echo Show has suprisingly good speakers.  I'd say its easily the best feature to me.  The only reason I took a star off the show is it had Youtube support for about a week and then it was pulled from the device as I understand it has been from all fire devices.  That really cut into the content I like to view with the show.  MSN video or vimeo seems like a poor replacement in my view.  However, having instant access to my prime video library on the sharp display is really great.  I do feel that the Echo dot was able to hear my voice throughout the room  better than the show.  Alexa still does a good job of hearing you from the Show.  I only mention that in case your comparing Echo devices.  But we liked the Show so much we got grandma one and now she can start a video chat with the grandkids with ease.  Without YouTube support I'm not sure its worth more than the $150 sale prices over the holidays.  If you see one discounted I highly suggest it.

author: Josh
title: I like that you can hook your security cameras up to ...
content: I use this on my nightstand in my bedroom.  It has a do not disturb feature that dims the screen and it works well.  I like that you can hook your security cameras up to it.  I also like the feature "drop in" where you can basically video chat your device from anywhere using your phone.  I can check and see what's going on in my bedroom any time I want.  Love the videos and the screen.  Definitely worth it.

author: TECHFIT360
title: I'm Loving' it!
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player I'm so glad that Amazon released this! Now Alexa will not just tell you what's happening, she will show you. I have one in my kitchen and my home office plus I plan on purchasing 2 more. My 2 most favorite features right now is that I have lyrics on the screen while listening to some of my favorite songs!! I'm dangerous now! LOL  Another thing I love is that it connects to my RING camera so I can monitor the outside of my house. I'm very happy with my purchase!.

author: BG
title: Fluttering images.
content: Initially, all was well. After a few weeks our unit began to"flutter" in a full light environment. If we cover the light sensor and dim the screen the "jumpy", fluttering stops. Probably will return for a replacement if a remedy is not found. Otherwise, it is ok.

author: Scholl686
title: We use everyday :)
content:
My family and I love it!! My favorite is adding things to my shopping list. As I see that I need something, I tell  Alexa. As I'm at the store checking off my list,  I can tell when the kids add things as well because,  I know I didnt add " a huge bag of candy" to my list.
We play music and the sound is very good. Some stations (I believe when you go through amazon music) have the lyrics on the screen. Although a few times I have felt like an idiot because after all these years I was singing the wrong words ;) There are games to play. Jokes she tells. I can set reminders and calendar events and they appear on screen. Set alarms. I'm sure there are more things I'm forgetting . Overall we love our Echo Show.

author: Michael and Nicole
title: Ghostly Echo
content: The Amazon Echo Show highlights it's mystical powers when your father is visiting from out of state and you happen to control Spotify at work through the Echo at home. Having "Authotheist Movement III: Deconsecrate" by The Faceless playing randomly as he watches Supernatural is a real treat. Well done Amazon, this a pranksters delight :)

author: Greg
title: Mic is not nearly as good as the echo unit
content: Mic is not nearly as good as the echo unit. She has a lot of terrible listening and understanding. Highly recommend staying with the echo.

author: James Baldwin
title: Five Stars
content: Works great, fun to listen too and ask her questions. Music sounds fine too.

author: Fill in the Blank
title: Echo is great, but the show lacks the versatility that should come with the price.
content:
As a whole, i love Alexa. I use it mainly for music and smart home stuff. I have converted many lights and Outlets to Smart Home switches, and Alexa has no problem controlling any of them. I also have several Harmony hubs to control my entertainment devices, and to my pleasant surprise, Alexa controls them beautifully.

I honestly don't feel like the screen brings much to the echo experience, because I find the closed-source search algorithm to be limiting. I initially purchased the Show thinking it would be great in the kitchen for recipes, but I've found that many recipes that I've Googled in the past do not appear on the Show. Due to Amazon and Google's constant squabbling, I do not anticipate this ever getting better. Along those same lines the echo has removed Google Play Music as a source for streaming music, so if you are a GPM subscriber, don't expect to be able to use that on these devices.

author: Quwinntessa Starber
title: Beautiful video phone quality, Show doens't hear well
content:
Good:
The video phone quality is amazing.  I can see everything in the room with the person I'm talking too.  The shadows aren't too dark, and the color is fairly vibrant for a video phone call.  So much better than Facetime.  I can even call my friend from my mobile phone and video chat.

There's a certain amount of novelty in being able to watch the news from the Show.  However, I usually listen to my FlashBriefing in my bedroom while I'm getting dressed in the morning and the Show is in the family room, so I rarely use it for anything accept video calling.  That limits it, but I'm not going to buy another one, it's way too expensive just so I can see the headlines rather than listen to them.

Bad:
For some strange reason, the Show hears it's wake word ALL THE TIME!!!  Randomly it will wake and start talking when no one said "Alexa" or anything that sounds like it.  Honestly, it's disconcerting sometimes as it's startles you.  And yes I voice trained, and no it didn't help.

It's really expensive for what you get, especially as it's worthless as a video phone unless you have one and the person you want to talk to does as well.  I got one for myself and my parents so I can see how they're doing physically rather than asking them to tell me how they're feeling.  In this case it was worth it to me, but I doubt it would be worth it to a lot of people.  The show needs some dynamic content before I think it's worth the hefty price tag, especially when a Dot is selling for $50.  It has potential, no doubt--seeing stuff rather than hearing it has it's perks, but they aren't earth shattering so it's definitely not a product for everyone with its current content.

author: Dawn
title: I am so disappointed. No Google
content: I am so disappointed.  No Google, no youtube.  This could have been a great product but because of Amazons failed relatiobships the item is almost useless.  I bought 2 and regret it. I would lie to return and see what Googke has to offer.

author: Kristi Stoutamyer
title: Awesome!!
content: Love our new Echo Show!!!  It is in our kitchen and the music, news, weather, and keeping our calendar and shopping lists up to date with Alexa are great! This is a super handy little piece of technology!  We have three echos so far!!

author: waggs
title: including my parents who don't want or own a smart phone or tablet
content: I bought this to check out for the family, including my parents who don't want or own a smart phone or tablet.  I was hoping to use the drop in feature for them and have a voice activated calling.  They have have the Echo Dot which we purchased for them last year, so the Echo Show really isn't going to be under the tree this year.  Too Bad, they have Amazon Accounts, which if this worked, I was going to get a family music account and get them Amazon Video.  Also, the other thing I don't like, is the camera is fixed for table top use only, would of been nice on the mantle.  The sound is an upgrade the Dot.

author: Jerry L. Ford
title: the item worked great as I could play music
content: I preordered this device so I received it on it's release date.  At first, the item worked great as I could play music, prime videos and instructional videos from Youtube.  Now, that Amazon has lost Youtube, things that I could ask such how to tie a Windsor knot, get the "I don't know" from the device.  I used to ask it how to prepare dishes, etc., but that does not work anymore.  Now, it sits in the kitchen, more or less useless

author: mog0614
title: Love it!
content: LOVE our Echo Show!  The sound is fabulous and the family loves the lyrics when music is played.  It is a tablet, a calendar, and everything Alexa should be.  And if you set up your preferences properly you won't have any issues with her listening or calling contacts mistakenly.  It is all in the set up.

author: taara
title: Love the Show!
content: I love the Show!  I have a dot and decided to upgrade when my daughter went to college so we could video chat.  I use the Show several times a day.  The sound quality is excellent.  I am disappointed that Youtube is no longer available.  There are atill bugs that need to be worked out but I don't regret this purchase at all!

author: Gayla JB.
title: Very convienent and easy to set up
content: We live in a samll apartment and Alexa allows for light to be  turned on before walking into a dark room. We will be expanding when we move to a larger home.

author: Bridgett Briggs
title: Great for stroke patients and seniors...3rd one we own
content:
We love our Echo Shows. Great for keeping in touch with family. Especially when they are far away. Great for Seniors to ask questions, get news updates.

We use one at the kitchen table for my father who is a stroke patient to watch Amazon Prime to keep him entertained when needed and he really enjoys it.  Along with her jokes.

author: Julius Chatters
title: Alexa keeps getting better!  Love this product!
content: The Family loves how you can see the words of the songs that are being played and the Echo Show has some kick in the sound department.  We love it and it makes a great addition to our other Amazon devices.  I highly recommend this product and all Amazon products and will definitely buy all the new devices that are released.

author: JTP55
title: Easy to use great product
content: This product works great, from music to recipes we have found it very useful. We haven't done to many things with the picture settings and pairing with our .phone. Very easy setup.

author: Cynthia M. Blackshear
title: Great communication!
content: We bought the Show for our mother who has dementia issues. It has worked wonderfully well. Our mother loves when we “drop in” or when she can make a call just by asking it to do so, but most importantly, we have the peace of mind of knowing we can communicate with each other by sight and by ear at any time. And our mother absolutely loves to ask Alexa to play hymns.

author: R
title: Great Idea
content: Thicker then you would think. Really hard to get it to play something from prime. Also I have to sat Cancel or stop several times before it does.

author: Shelley
title: Great device
content: I bought my Echo Show just before Christmas when it was on sale. I wasn’t sure if I would like but thought for the price I would try it. I’m glad I did. I love it. It’s easy to set up and use. I watch my prime videos, listen to music, look up recipes etc.. There’s to many things you can do to name. I would highly recommend getting one.

author: James Muller
title: Great gadget
content: So i have grow to love this digital gadget. My kits call my brother and sister in Boston and we hang out for hours, eat dinner together, ect. It is connected to lights in my house and I plan on integration of more smart phone options.  If I was to improve something, it slants at an upward angel for video talking.

author: Wayne Gawlik
title: Love the SHOW!
content: If you are in love with Alexa...then you got to have the Echo Show.  Works well first time out of the box.  Only negative: I would love her screen to be a bit brighter since she sits in my fairly bright kitchen.  Buy the Show if you want to hear and SEE Alexa at work.

author: Diane Masters
title: Love it!
content: I love it! Two of my kids have one also, and it's so convenient to say "Alexa, call so & so" and she does it. I enjoy being able to see them as we talk. She also has all the latest weather reports and news, and the music I ask for is played almost instantaneous and I love her tips.

author: Ana Nolasco
title: I'm in love with Alexa 😊
content: One of my favorites things in my house now. My mom has one and we video call daily.  The speaker is awesome! Connects to my Pandora and Amazon music.  I have it in my kitchen and it connects to my Amazon Video so I can watch movies while working on meals.  Love to get the news flash in the morning and traffic report before going to work. Also love to be able to drop in and check on my 14 year old when needed.  My 14 year old can also video call my phone from it :) endless possibilities ❤️

author: Drake Olivier
title: A little disappointed
content: Bought this for my kitchen to give me a tv while cooking. From a hardware point of view my only gripe is sound. I had an echo 1st gen here previously and the sound quality would fill the whole house. Just with the normal noise from cooking and at max volume I struggle to hear the dialog of a movie. My other ding to this device comes with the navigation and video choices. I have a fire tv and expected much of the same, full menus, and apps for programs like Netflix and Hulu. Sadly these simply are not there. Prime Video is the only service that I use and I find it really difficult to navigate. So much so that I use my phone sometimes to find a show or movie on Prime video to watch and then ask Alexa to pull it up directly. If you are using this in a quite setting or for a different use like video calls, I'm sure you will like it but currently it's disappointing. Hopefully with some updates to software I can bump up the rating but for now that's it.

author: Ted E
title: Enough with the 24/7 Commercials.
content:
I have three Echos, two Dots, and one Tap, so you'd have to say I'm a heavy user. This is the first video screen device I've purchased (except two Fire tablets and two Fire sticks), and I've really regretted the purchase. You cannot disable "Things to Try" or any of the other insipid advertisements Amazon chooses to inflict on you. They will NEVER go away. There's a line between "Hints" and "Commercials." Amazon has crossed this in a bold and exponentially blatant way. I'm a little forgiving not paying the full price ($100 off), but still at $129, there are better options than the Echo "Pitch-in-a-box."

Amazon, stop refusing to give us the power to take this off. You will make a lot of us better satisfied customers.

author: Steve
title: Not very smart. Very intrusive.
content:
This is not something I would have purchased, but we received this as a gift. It's not useless, but the few features that work are easily found on other devices. "Alexa, show me the weather" shows the weather, "Alexa, show me the weather in New York" shows the weather in NY. "Alexa, set a timer for 10 minutes" works, which can be useful in the kitchen I suppose. "Alexa, show me the nearest McDonalds" shows a McDs that's three towns away, there are two closer locations, but it won't learn that I want to set the one location as a favorite. I got it to play a song from my library but I had to select "No" two different times to prevent me from being signed up for the $3.99/mo unlimited music service. The artificial "intelligence" isn't very intelligent, it only seems to know a few pre-programmed phrases. Oh, and in order to change any settings you have to download the app to your phone. No thanks.
-----------------------------
Update: 45 minutes after posting this review, they called me! The guy was very nice, but really, I wasn't looking for a call. And, if I may say so, it was a little creepy. So take this review for what it's worth - it's just one man's opinion. The device will probably work very well for many people but it does not appeal to me.

author: Susan K
title: Most importantly being able to use the security cameras to see and feel secure
content: I love this echo show.  It has the temperature and time displayed all the time. You can ask Alexa any question, you can find out what the weather is going to be for where you are going to do you know what kind of clothes to where that day.  You can ask about the fires or earthquakes around you.  If you have music with Amazon prime you can tell Alexa play my music. You can set it up worth your security cameras which in going to do, i haven't yet.

author: WCC
title: I have to put a book on the bottom to tilt to a best viewing
content: The camera viewing angle is limited. Unable to adjust the monitor angle. I have to put a book on the bottom to tilt to a best viewing angle

author: Alexandra M.
title: Worst of all echos
content:
I am extremely dissatisfied.  We have an echo dot, an echo, and a 2nd gen echo and recently bought the show. The microphone is terrible, I love playing jeopardy and it never hears me and closes the game. When I ask for my flash briefing the video never plays just the sound. Speaking of the sound, the quality is the worst aside from the echo dot. I am extremely disappointed in this purchase and am looking to return. I hope your 2nd gen is significantly better quality unfortunately I cant afford that up charge right now.

Update*** Amazon called me asking me for feedback however did not offer anything aside from the ups label or a replacement. Not even a credit to help towards the new 2nd gen? The kitchen is our most widely used echo and the show belonged in there. I purchased the new ech 2nd gen for 91.00 more I am not happy I have to pay more but this is our focal point for our family... review coming soon on second gen..

author: Roy Brown
title: Great Product!
content: It was easy to set up and easy to use.  The sound quality is great, I just set it up last week-end and so far, it's great.  I'm going to use it along with my older Echo and use them as an intercom.  Two story houses are not as much fun after 30 years.  This feature alone is very valuable for seniors.

author: lindseycarol
title: Love most things about it but screen is messed up after 3 months
content:
We've enjoyed having this and the screen allows us to use it more than we have used previous Echo devices. We use it for music (it displays lyrics!), shopping list (you can view the full list) and setting timers (which you can see!). After about a month there was a vibrating horizontal line at the bottom of the screen. Now, after 3 months, the whole screen is messed up. It's under warranty, but I have to find a box and bubble wrap to ship it back, then be without it while they determine whether it is broken, then ship a replacements in 2-3 business days after receipt. Annoying for a relatively new product to be defective and not replaced until after I ship it back. I expect that from many retailers, but not Amazon!

One other complaint, unrelated to the defective screen, is that there is a message on the bottom of the screen saying "Try ____" with suggestions of things to try asking Alexa. I have my screen set to a pretty picture and every time I look at it, the message annoys me and there is no way to make it go away. It's like a constant advertisement on a product I paid for, which drives me crazy!

author: AAA
title: I'd like it a lot more if I could watch YouTube ...
content: I'd like it a lot more if I could watch YouTube videos on it. Sound is good and video screen works well to watch my Cloud Cam... but the lack of watching YouTube videos will likely make me ditch it for the Google smart device when it lands.

author: kennychev
title: Pretty good...
content: I only bought this because it was heavily discounted on Prime Day. It's a good product. So why only 4 stars? Besides being able to watch a video, it is really just an enhanced Alexa. Can get the weather forecast, can listen to my Pandora stations, etc. Beyond that it is like Alexa...an item I find is marginally useful. Sound is terrific for such a device. It's a nice tech gadget if you need that. But it isn't magic if you're looking for a real rush...and it's the only woman that does what I tell her! (sorry, had to add that little gag)...

author: v_hook
title: Much better than I expected! Wish I could get YouTube though
content: The sound quality on this thing is amazing.  It really rivals my mom's Bose dream machine or whatever it's called.  It came already linked to my Amazon account SO THERE WAS NO SETUP REQUIRED!  How awesome is that?  That's the extra mile!  I didn't realize when I checked that box, that I wouldn't have to set anything up.  Don't get me wrong, I still had to do little things, like link it for multi-room use and add my default music app, etc, but that's the fun part. I didn't buy this thinking I would watch a movie on it, although you could, but it's a bit small for that IMO. I use it mostly for video chatting with my mom that lives pretty far away, dropping in on my home when I'm not home, making shopping lists, and listening to music.  If I could get YouTube on this it would get 5 stars!

author: Pamela
title: Alexa is a hit in our house!
content: I've had this snappy little device for just a week and love it.  Easy to set up initially.  Learning how to enable the apps, commands, syncing your calendar took some research and patience but worth it.  With my iPhone calendar synced, appointments and notices post on the screen as a reminder for me.  So handy!  Also Echo will give you notifications on your Amazon orders.  Grocery list feature is a plus as well.  Just tell Alexa to add it - done.  Last night our grandson needed cough medicine.  Correct dosage was in teaspoons but the medicine cup in tablespoons.  Alexa made the quick conversion for us.  My daughter was sold when she requested an obscure song and it was played.  Kudos, Amazon has done it again.  Beautiful background photos, clear sound.

author: Mark D. Crable
title: Echo Show is So Cool! Get One!!
content:
This device is absolutely great! It is so easy to setup - with no need of a laptop, tablet, or phone for the same.

I am very pleased with it and plan to buy one for my mother to use.

author: Jim Wito
title: Great addition to the Alexa Family.
content:
This is a nice addition to an "Alexa" family. One thing a bit unexpected is showing lyrics to songs playing (in case you want to sing along). It can also show images and play music along with other Echo items.
I have only found one problem. On rare occasions when I am closer to a different Echo item this will take the command instead of the one I am closer to. This happens when I set a timer. If I need to get going in 30 minutes I will sometimes say "Alexa, set timer for 30 minutes". Then an alarm goes off to let me know when to finish up. Sometimes when I call it out the Show in the next room will take over and I think a timer wasn't set so I will say the command again. 30 minutes later TWO timers go off about 10 secs apart. Weird how it happens but, as I mentioned, it is rare.
Looking forward to finding more things that this will be good at doing.

author: Rockin Ron
title: Great to have around the house--a thousand uses!
content: Outstanding, Gave it to my wife as a gift. She loves it and I do to. Great for making notations or shopping lists and provides weather info. as well. It's become our alarm clock to. Add sounds (exa.-ocean waves, birds, water fall etc. and night-night you go) Fabulous for storing all types of info. for general cooking and household uses to. Informative little devil once you get used to how you ask it the questions--don't get long winded with it. Not sorry I got it that's for sure. Highly recommend it. Helps keep our life in a lot more order these days. Like having your own Sheldon Cooper at your beckon call!!

author: Andrea Meidell
title: Great... on sale
content: I bought this on sale and I don’t think I’d pay full price. For what I paid, I’d say this is a great item. It has its quirks, but overall functions like I want. I set up with an amazon cloud cam for our playroom and another one in my daughters room and it’s nice to use as a baby monitor. We like the speaker and we’ve had smart lights. It’s nice to see your timers when you set them. Overall, it’s very nice and I’ve gotten lots of use out of it. I wished I bought it when my daughter was a baby because it’s much nicer than standard monitors. I think how much you like this device will depend on what your use is for it. For a monitor, music, cooking,etc it’s a nice little device.

author: D. FRIES
title: VERY Limited in what it will actually show....
content: So disappointed... I was so excited to order this but it is a disappointment.  I should have looked in greater detail but it NEVER occured to me that Amazon would limit what you could watch on the Show. I figured it would work like our Fire tablet and show Netflix and YouTube but it does not.

author: Joe
title: Video chat works great for those less tech. disadvantaged.
content: Got this for my Grandmother...she loves the video chats with family.

author: Prochauffeur
title: Can't get any better then this current technology...
content: By far the best echo product yet. Implementing the 'Show' into my business is great. The '...Drop in feature..' app related is so good, allows my clients to call me via the Alexa app or using one of any 4 hardware products (all Amazon Alexa) to order my services. LA_Chauffeur

author: Scott B. Umstead
title: I love it!
content: I love it!!  Because I'm so completely and enthusiastically satisfied with the Echo Dot, I pre-ordered the Show and have had it for 3 days now.  Installation was a snap and it connected itself to the Alexa app automatically.  I'm sure I'll find a zillion uses for it -- so far, I think it's great to be able to actually see my shopping list on the screen and I guess I just like "seeing" (as opposed to hearing) the weather, the name (amd lyrics) of the song that's playing and other things.  I just happened to find out about the "messaging" feature on Echo today and it works perfectly on this and the Dot.  I must say, I'm especially excited about having cameras at the front and back doors -- I've got two cameras on their way to me.  Once I have it all checked out and am using all the things it can do, I'll buy them for my grown nieces so they can talk to each other while they're making dinner (or whatever) in different towns.  Amazon does everything so extremely well and this is easily up to the very high standard they've created and we've all come to expect.  The Show is nice and heavy, so it's not going to be knocked off the table.  In that I happen to sit right here beside it a lot of the time, I'd like to be able to make the rolling prompts (for videos, etc) stop and let the screen just be dark -- sure as shootin' there's a setting or command for that, so I'm unconcerned.  Yes indeed, I love the Show!!!  I have to believe you will, too!!!

author: Joe Chesnas
title: The top and back do not light up when you ...
content: The top and back do not light up when you call her. Only light up in the front of the screen. Also it doesnt work with the xfinity app yet. I really wanted her to ve able to see our security cameras. Not quite worth 180 dollars

author: CyndiBug
title: My New Best Friend!
content:
I purchased the show for my home in Oklahoma, and the Spot for my grandsons room in Chicago.  Now my little ones (5 & 2) can connect with grandma all they want, and I love it!

I asked my SHOW for a recipe last night, and was able to watch the entire video recipe.

My new best friend!

author: R
title: She has a great deal of trouble with technology and one of the ...
content:
We got two of these for Christmas, one for our family and one for my Mother. She has a great deal of trouble with technology and one of the main reason we got these were for the video calls. She had to much trouble with FaceTime. So far it's been fantastic. She has no problem asking her "friend" to make or receive calls, and quality of the video is great. She loves her Alexa, talking to it throughout the day as suggestions of things to ask appear on the screen. She likes being able to see her timers and setting multiple timers. In fact she likes it so much that she invites people over in the retirement commuinty just to show off her Alexa.

My kids love the new Alexa and really appreciate seeing the words they ask her to spell. They also love seeing the lyrics to songs playing through amazon music. I wasn't sold on the upgraded Alexa when we bought them but now after having them for several months, I'm really glad we did. It's well worth it.

author: Theresa Barr
title: Screen is Unstable and New Firmware Not Fixing Problem!
content: I bought this so that I could drop in with video calls and check on my 85 year old mother while I travel for work. After about three months the screen started displaying instability with lines and digital "shake." Since the warranty is no longer in effect and Amazon doesn't provide any assistance whatsoever, I'm stuck either buying a new one or just accepting that this is basically a useless device. I've been a huge Amazonian for years and so I'm very disappointed all the way around.

author: Paul Cella
title: Not very user friendly. Screen wuality diminishes .
content: Screen not working. Has lines all over it. I keep telling amazon and havent got any solution yet.

author: Kevin Williams
title: Waste of money and does not last
content: Terrible I will never buy this or any related Amazon device. This was purchased as a Christmas gift and is already broken. Also Alexa is a very flawed program it can never look up any information and is terribly slow. A huge waste of money

author: Randy
title: "Alexa TV" by Echo Show, Best Of Both Worlds
content:
The Echo Show is well worth the "sale" price money I spent.  It has adaptive learning to what you want. And you can easily program it from the mobile app.  I play my Flash Briefing every morning with my favorite news and info.  It will search and play cooking videos (I use it in the kitchen, as this is where I usually hang out).  The screen will also show subjects and hints on what to ask Alexa. Great feature.

Amazon music, audible and Kindle accounts are available as soon as you sign in.  You can also expand your music and reading library by signing in to other accounts like Panadora, or Spotify.  Since I've had it for about 1 month, I have only "touch the tip of the iceberg" with regards to what Echo Show can do. So far, I'm having fun with it.

author: Ryan N.
title: Great All-around Addition to the Household
content:
I got my Echo Show today and have tested it for a few hours now. I'm pretty surprised with negative reviews and I think people haven't tested the device completely. So far I have been very happy with audio, audio and touchscreen quality.
Overall the LCD is very useful only if you find Alexa useful too. Echo show is not gonna replace your TV or anything, but I personally prefer to watch flash briefings instead of just listening to them or watch a trending(viral) video on YouTube or watch tonight show monologue in the morning.
You can set your Prime photos as your rotating background which is essentially the same as a photo frame.
I like to watch TV shows on my mini tablet and the whole Echo show with Alexa compatibility is just cheaper than my tablet with the same size. For example, you can watch TV shows like 24 from Prime Video.
Almost none of these functionalities are new or innovative but combining them together for a relativity cheap price has made this product very amusing.
Obviously there are some room for improvements which I'm sure with software updates and app developments, we'll see them in the future. I'll probably update this post later.

author: PrimeAddict
title: What can I say?....
content: It’s like having a personal assistant next to my bed!  I have so many Amazon devices in our house that I’ve had tonprogra them with different start up names or they all answer atvthe same time!  Love them!

author: Kate
title: We miss Alexa when we're not home.
content:
Recipes with videos.  She can help me find my phone.  Plays Pandora or Amazon music. Can set an alarm or timer.  Can ask what day is Easter this year.  She will even read to me.
Dislike:
Won't pair with my Bose bluetooth speaker.

author: David W
title: Must have if you are a echo fan.
content: I have 2 of the regular echos and love them.  I play Jeopardy and other games and get my flash briefs every day.  So the ehco show is my third echo.  I put this one in my office right beside my computer.  This is really cool because I can keep working and watch videos and amazon content my voice control.  I could not get my iris security cameras to be displayed.  I guess iris and amazon will have to work the kink out.  I am really satisfied.  The touch screed is super sharp HD quality.  Another cool thing is you can use your echo as and intercom system.  I have a really big house.  So using it for the intercom system is worth the money.  Intercom system can be expensive and the wiring is a hassle.  Even the wireless intercom systems are expensive.  Thanks Amazon....  Keep up the good work...

author: Terresa Powley
title: Love it
content: I like it but wish the voice command worked a little better she understands something's well but it could be the way I phrase my questions! Giving it five stars because it has a great sound when I play my music and when I look up recipes! Still trying to figure out how to call another person that has one but I will get there!

author: Greg
title: It's a great piece of equipment
content: It's a great piece of equipment.  However, the speaker has a lot to be desired. At a price much higher than the Echo, the sound is nowhere near as rich in tone/volume. In future upgrades the speaker needs some ooommpphhh..

author: VoodooU2
title: That did not last long
content: I bought this item from the Amazon Truck and put it in my kitchen. We liked playing cooking videos to help prep meals then played music during dinner.
