We added to our already existing Alexa system.  Less than 6 months old and the video display began to glitch and the Alexa system started answering at random.  Now I am trying to find my receipt so I can send it back and get a working one or a refund.  Please help with the problem.

author: DaBrun
title: Basically a countertop videophone and awesomeness
content: Functional and fun to use, purchased a second for my parents whom have fallen in love with it.  They were never fully impressed with the original echo I have, but this one won them over. This is essentially the videophones we’ve been waiting for. I know we’ve been able to do this with smart phones and tablets for a while now but the form and design lends itself so much better as a countertop accessory that stays put. Much better and more functional than dealing with a tablet or smartphone in regards to recipes and cooking.

author: Peteruski
title: Not great for a relative that doesnt have their own Amazon account.
content:
Bought 2 of these: one for home and one for my Mom, who lives in assisted living.  I was a bit disappointed in that you cannot manage these as individual devices.  You manage Alexa as a whole, for all the people on your account and all the Echo devices on your account.  So, if you have 3 people on your account, then all their contacts get sucked into your collective Contacts file for the entire account.  So, you all could have the same contact, but with different names, etc.  And, my Mom, who doesnt have an Amazon account, nor a smart phone, nor an email address, now had this big pile of contacts in her Echo Show.  And she effectively had the same settings as my Show.
Bottom line: Amazon needs to allow you to manager each Echo device individually and not create one large conglomeration of contacts.

author: uids
title: Alexa aint no Google
content: I like the weather options but Alexa search compacity needs improvement. She aint no Google. Alexa gets our requests probably around 20% of the time. Currently Alexa doesn't do YouTube either. This is a huge drawback and why The echo show dropped in price.  International radio via tune in is awesome but again her search engine, its like pulling teeth to get to anything.

author: Maureen Croft
title: Big problems with data privacy, caller ID, contacts etc. Mainly a Data mining tool
content:
I bought this for my 91 year young mom, but she was unable to set it up herself because she doesn’t have a smartphone. So I had to buy a $420 plane ticket to install it.

Then when I did arrive in NY to install it, found that the device will only use the contacts on my husbands smartphone in Seattle, and his Washington state number show up on the caller ID when she calls her friends.

I had to ask him add each of her friends onto his phone in Seattle for her to be able to make calls on her echo show in NY

Now hubby gets calls on his business phone for people trying to call mom back. Everyone is confused and it’s very awkward.

And amazon will not allow anyone to use their app to call moms echo show without allowing Amazon to download their entire contact list.  So my family will not call her echo show because they won’t give up their entire address book

She enjoys using it as a hands free speakerphone, and playing music and videos.

But video calling is not useable by anyone but me because I’m the only one willing to give up my whole address book - most people we know balk at this, and understandably so.

author: Jimmy CASTLE
title: this is not like an Ipad or tablet it is strictly use for ...
content: The echo show isn't worth the price you I paid for it. this is not like an Ipad or tablet it is strictly use for ordering on amazon. or you can use it as a baby monitor or use it as a phone. it is a waste of money and shouldn't be sold for more that $100. it looks cool and all but it does the same thing as the dot save your money.

author: SingleAttorney
title: You'll use it more than you think
content: I love this. I bought it primarily because it was significantly discounted on Prime Day, but my expectations weren't very high. I wasn't sure that I would really use it much, especially since I already have 3 "regular Alexas" (Echo) in my home. I was also concerned that it wouldn't be loud enough since I use my other Echos primarily for music. Man, was I impressed. The sound seems to be on-par with my other Echos and I've come to use it more than I thought I would. I love being able to read the lyrics on the screen.

author: CARRIE
title: WONDERFUL!
content: So easy to set up and use! my kiddos can even use it. I like how parents can adjust the settings to ensure it is kid friendly. So many features to list, but surely worth the money. We really enjoy talking to family out of state. So easy to keep in touch with the 'drop in' feature.

author: C
title: Amazon Echo Changes Things
content: Our household has 2 Amazon Echoes, 5 dots, and 2 shows. We enjoy the features and especially the skills Alexa performs. Once you’re used to the drop in feature...it is the coolest thing! (The sound and color of the ring around your product becomes familiar, so it’s not scary or freaky, like you might think.) The ability to talk to anyone in the house or even by phone is another plus. Prime video is my best friend when I’m simply waiting for a timer to go off for dinner to be done. The alerts for packages and deliveries from Amazon is great to have, so that you know when you can expect shipped products. My family only has good things to say about the Echo products. We have had very positive experiences!

author: Luke
title: If you have one or two echo's, you're missing out by not having the Show.
content: It's just awesome. If you already have an echo or two (or 3 in my case prior to the show, plus a firetv stick), the show is a no-brainer. It's really helpful with the screen; you can see all your devices without pulling up your phone. You can see your lists, watch previews, get recipes, and my favorite: drop in on the house when you're not home to make sure no one has broken in. I'd recommend to everyone. Other than these devices (and the FireTV Stick), I'm completely in the Apple ecosystem, from the AppleTV 4K, thru the laptops, the airports/timecapsules, down to the iphones. All of these work really well together and I've never thought to myself, "God, this would be so much easier with an Apple Homepod (or whatever their smart speaker is called). The only thing that I'd like to see is Apple Music and iTunes available on the Echo without having to use your iphone to bluetooth to it. That being said, that's Apple's fault, not Alexa's, as I'm sure she'd gladly welcome them on her network.

author: cfmotta
title: Alexa can "SHOW" me the world, shining shimmering splendid...
content: Thoroughly enjoy this little device. Despite all the reviews that fault amazon for making this new addition to the alexa line of personal assistants too bulky I say boo.  Show me another gadget that can do a fraction of the things this little guy can do and then we'll talk about aesthetics!

author: antman
title: Exited About the Future of this Product.
content:
Found it more far more useful than expected. Bought 2, and can use as a visual intercom via the drop in feature.  Lock my self out of the house and used the amazon app on phone to drop in and get the family's attention inside (drop in on phone app works from on celluar data also).  Play mostly kids songs, kids videos, flash video briefings, audiobooks.  Finding very useful in daily life.  Found "hidden" setting by swiping from top very useful.
 Also find annoying to always turn, thinking of buying some kind of lazy Susan turntable (probably should have been built in).

FInal thought -  wish bigger.

author: Mary Hughes
title: Love Alexa Show
content: I love Alexa Show.  I still have a lot to learn about her.  I wish I knew how to get her to use my name. I actually find myself saying goodnight and good morning.  Very happy with this purchase.

author: Jesus Lopez
title: We love it and now with the screen we can see ...
content: We love it and now with the screen we can see videos or pictures or life feed from our security cameras....

author: Chad Hicks
title: I love that it shows me what is on my calendar ...
content: My husband bought this for me as a Mother's Day gift and I am loving it. I love that it shows me what is on my calendar for the next day, reminds me of my reminders, and just easy to use, and it was just as easy to set up. I already owned 2 Echo's and a Echo Plus, so I am a Alexa fan.  The volume is great on it as well. An as far as the YouTube not being on there, I could really careless about that as I have my phone, computer, and TV's i can use for YouTube.

author: Jenifer W.
title: Love it!
content: I liked it so much I bought both my daughters one for Christmas, that way we can just drop in anytime for a chat.  The grandkids love it too....it's so nice to have them call me, especially the younger ones who don't have cell phones yet, and peace of mind that if anything happens they can always call one of their parents or their aunt, or me.  I also like the fact that it plays music on demand, so I can fill the house with anything I like to hear.....and it's like having someone there all the time, to ask questions, remind me or appointments and things I need to do, love it!

author: J.phipps
title: It answers questions if you ask it the right way.
content: Still learning everything she can do so this isn't a complete review but I like it so far. We have a lamp and TV controlled by it so far and it's cool to be able to tell it what to do and I love the drop in feature it let's me check the house when we are away.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Reconnected!
content: Reconnected! I bought 2 and placed one next to my recliner while I am temporarily recuperating and one on my husband's home office desk.  I love being able to tell mine to call my husband and we can show and tell as we talk.  I am hoping to add me kids who have echoes and apps but they apparently have to activate the messaging on their apps before the contacts will populate. Btw, the sound is wonderful and it also will show my security cameras.  Super addition!

author: cheryl t
title: It's really fun.
content: I really enjoy the Echo Show. However,  I would really love it if it had YouTube, then I would have given 5 stars. OMG, I just discovered that another website is selling this for $179.99. That made so angry that I wanted to return it and purchase it from that other website. The only thing stopping me, is that I can't bear to part with it even for a short amount of time.

author: Zak Haque
title: Want something that will randomly wake you up at night? Get This!
content: This thing was amazing the first few months of owning it. Then the fun started. It randomly turns on lights at 3am, it will speak without anyone talking (really love the 2am multiple sorry I didn't get that) now its 10 months old and its more possessed then a horror movie. Dont bother with it. You will regret it immensely. Especially if you value sleeping.

author: lindamcconnell
title: BEST GADGET EVER!!!!!
content: I love this!  I love this.  I haven't taken advantage of all the features, but I'll explain why I bought this.  My mom has the early signs of dementia and does not know how to use a telephone at all.  She can't dial, she doesn't know how to pick up and hang up.  She lives in CT and I live in GA.  I set this up in her apartment in her assisted living.  Mine is on the table next to my couch.  All I have to do is say, "Alexa, drop in on ........."  It has a soft tone on my mom's end and within about 5 seconds a picture appears.  I'll call out to see if she's in.  If not, I hang up.  Most of the time she is somewhere in the apartment and can hear my voice.  I have to verbally lead her to the unit so I can see her, but if she didn't want to move we can hear each other fine.  In fact I've talked to her while she is in her living room and this unit is by her bed in the bedroom.  To be able to see and talk to my mom without her having to pick up and hang up things she can't do is a gift beyond words.  I do all the work, logging in and hanging up.  It's a dream come true.

author: Edward St Clair
title: Wish i didn't buy a Echo Show
content:
I had the echo show for about a month then the screen starts flickering, it's worse then not as bad then worse again. Customer service was great they provided the return label so I could return it, great I thought, well, they sent me the same unit back claiming it's repaired. It worked fine for a couple of weeks and now it's doing the same thing, UGGHH
 Normally my review would be good the only thing is now there is no way for me to contact Amazon letting them know I'm having the same issue with their product so I hope they read this a offer me a replacement I no longer want this unit as it is truly defective

author: Nick Luke
title: Tricky product with a lot of downside
content: This product has A LOT of potential, but it unfortunately does not meet my expectations.

author: Deb Noel
title: Limited Functionality
content: This could be great with more functionality. Right now, it doesn’t do a whole lot more than a regular Echo. If I leave it showing the view from my Ring Doorbell, the doorbell doesn’t work because Alexa took over the camera.  Amazon needs to give us the option to turn off the annoying tips and obscure headlines that continually clutter the screen.

author: jilljill
title: Awesome!
content: Love this! Grandkids love "dropping in" on us to chat and show us things they are doing.  Love that there is no subscription fees to use (unless you use unlimited music). Able to snyc with your personal calender / shows on screen / reminds you of all appointments for yhe day.

author: Lance Liebgeld
title: Creepy and Unreliable
content: Meh. Misunderstands almost every command and pushes HEAVILY toward Amazon products even when it's painfully obvious that you don't intend to use those services. Do not recommend. On the plus side, the sound quality is good.

author: Thomas Alexander
title: Love Love Love
content: Love my Echo Show. Alexa is amazing and now on the Show "she" can display lyrics, photos, etc. The speakers are amazing and fills the room. Bought on Prime Day so got a great deal, so worth it.

author: Shopper100
title: Won't blow away your tablet - wonderful for the physically disabled.
content:
I'd like to start by saying that The Show was a gift. I also own an Alexa and The Dot.

PRO's

* The Show has a large base and it will not fall over easily and its impossible for it to fall over on its own.
* The Show appears to be solidly built although I am skeptical as to whether it could survive a fall.
* If packed well, could be ideal for travel as you can have an alarm clock, weather and Prime Shows and movies to watch.
* The speaker has a rich tones - audiophiles may not be happy (see below) but this is a hifi device.
* Setup is easy and The Show only has three buttons - its quite user friendly.

CONS

* This kills me - no 3.5mm jack! So, if you opt to use the video chat feature there is no privacy - external speakers only.
* All audio and video chats etc are saved on Amazon's cloud for the purpose of improving the device. Really? Why?
* Screen does not appear to auto-adjust and appears to be dark when viewed in a darkened room.
* Screen is in a fixed position - this is not a device that is not lap friendly. It is designed to sit on a shelf or table.

Conclusion:

Amazon may very well be onto something with The Show. However, in this day and age, many other devices, stream music, play our movies etc it simply is not going to blow the doors off of your tablet....The greatest gift that this device offers is "voice control." If you have a physically disabled loved one who has a sound mind but an ailing body - this little device can open up the digital world to them.

author: Bruce D. Verfaillie
title: A neat gadget
content: It is what it is. Fun gadget to have but not earth shattering. Bought for 129.00 which was a good deal. Still a 70's design. Kind of boxy but I like the Amazon gadgets so had to try it out. Good sound and works good with Nest cameras.

author: S.D.E.
title: So far so good. I like that I can change the wake ...
content: So far so good.  I like that I can change the wake word.  Seems to be very easy to set up third party devices.

author: joanna baillargeon
title: I love my echo show
content: I love my echo show. My husband can talk to me from his cell phone while he’s at work. We could never do that before because he has an android user and I am an Apple user.  I use it to check on my son and watch YouTube videos. I love it when you play music It displays the lyrics on the screen.  we use all of our Alexa devices regularly but this is by far our favorite!

author: Lauren
title: LOVE!
content: I bought this one because my friend has one and her and her husband could't recommend it enough. After playing with mine for a week my mom and dad bought one too. It's awesome!

author: Billy B.
title: Nice, but...
content:
I planned on using my Echo Show to view family pictures when I'm not shopping, listening to music or  accessing information. All was going well until I couldn't eliminate the on screen advertisements (cards). After doing some research without any positive results, I called customer service. I spoke with two reps (both very pleasant) and was finally told that the advertisements are there to stay.
The advertisements are suggestions such as "Ask Alexa..." or "Try...", and they are always on (ALWAYS). I've had Echo devices since they were first rolled out and I feel like I'm somewhat proficient at using them. I don't need or want these cards polluting my family pictures.
I will be returning the device if they don't come up with a work around on this very soon.

author: Sally Jones
title: Nothing But A Glorified Intercom System
content:
This is an good product IF you think of it as a intercom system or maybe a digital picture frame. If you want a product to do anything more, buy a Google Home. The passive Drop In video chat feature I could use for elderly family is the only reason I considered keeping this. In most instances where the person on the other end can navigate technology, the feature would just be creepy. Overall, the Show was a surprising disappointment.

Google Home intuitively does what this doesn't do even after four steps and a series of enabling instructions. Having access to only the Amazon apps and content since they pulled YouTube is frustrating and annoying. I have worked with both Amazon Echo and Google Home. For my uses, Google Home is just better in the vast majority of instances, but the Echo Show was my most irritating Amazon device so far.

author: Joe Falk
title: We love the look and feel of the Echo Show
content: We love the look and feel of the Echo Show.  The one criticism is that the news headlines that rotate on the Show's screen are beyond lightweight.  They are banal.  Replacing them with, for example, CNN news headlines is not an option.  Hopefully, that will change one day.  More substantive headlines are available aurally, but not visually.  With that said, the Show is otherwise a very nice addition to the Echo family of devices.

author: Gary E Stewart
title: Not worth the price
content: This unit is four months old and the script has began a very heavy flicker with multiple horizontal lines.  I expected more from Amazon.  No easy way to return.  Amazon does not offer a return button with the order.

author: Sonora
title: We are becoming accustomed to each other.
content:
I set up my new ALEXA SHOW last night; I bought it during the Prime deal of priced at $129.99 from orig retail of $229.00. It’s seems to be working well and, I consider the clarity of the screen fine, very useable. The response/reply time to a query is (happily) faster than my ECHO Plus. Admittedly, I’ve gone a little ALEXA nuts, I have the ECHO PLUS and the SHOW in the same room, my LR, which is open to my DR and Kitchen, but, they serve two purposes. The ECHO PLUS just hasn’t been as sharp a responder to my voice & requests as the DOTS (in my bedrooms) are and this new SHOW is, but, I do prefer listening to music from the ECHO PLUS. If the SHOW hadn’t been marked down to such and agreeable price, or/and hadn’t had the BLINK SMART HOME Skill I would not have bought it.
I connected the BLINK SMARTHOME Skill, did a successful Discovery resulting in the camera's showing on my list of connected devices. All good, except the SHOW would not work w/the Skill very well. It could only go to only 1 of my 2 cameras and the view was very blurry. I tried re-setting the SHOW a few times and even placed it near the modem to see if that got it working correctly. Nope, it didn't. So, I just placed the SHOW back on my couch side table and did not mess w/ that Skill the rest of the night. All other aspects of the SHOW worked fine.
In the morning the Skill was working as intended. During the night the SHOW and the Skill, apparently, came to terms and had a solid handshake. I've asked Alexa to show me my Hall camera, and my Door camera 3 times; it only took a few seconds for each request to result in a clear view of each area. So, it just needed time to assimilate, I guess.  Lesson: don't get anxious if it doesn't work well, or at all, at first. As long as all are set up and the cameras are shown after Discovery, just give it time for the SHOW and the SKILL to connect well.
Also, the SHOW does not have to be sitting next to your modem for the Skill to work. I have it across the room, approx. 22’ away and its working fine. If you have a truly large distance from one to the other you might need to plug on a Wi-Fi extender near the SHOW to attain a stronger connection.
The only reason I did not give it 5 stars right now is because I still haven’t heard the audible alert on my SHOW, which is supposed to happen per BLINK customer support.  I’m only getting the audible alerts on my phone app, but, I do not want to keep p/u my phone to view activity when I’m chillin’ on the couch. That’s why I bought the SHOW, for the BLINK SMARTHOME SKILL. So, as soon as the audible alerts start happening, I’ll change to a 5 star rating.

author: karen smoot
title: Love the screen !
content: I love it !  It has so many features that I have not yet taken advantage of, but am looking forward to exploring.  I love the Echo Show as I play music often and I really enjoy seeing the lyrics to the songs.

author: Stormageddon
title: Detrimental to the Alexa experience without Youtube support.
content:
Ever since youtube support was lost, the usefulness of the video aspect of this product has been questionable at best, and actually detrimental at worst.

For example, if you want to purchase something off amazon; it won't acutally tell you what you're about to buy.  You have to be at the screen and look.  It won't just tell you from across the room.

The best part of this little beautifully-built device was the ability to watch short clips of things.  Without that, it leaves watching full-length videos off amazon prime (which I have a TV for) and external video devices (including any smart doorbells, which are dumb video cameras at best to this thing)

I purchased these when they first came out and has a sale on purcahsing 2 together.  I feel like i got burned and would return them if i still could.

author: Ken Leyhe Sr.
title: This device is nothing more than a $200 alarm clock and weather station.
content:
This device is nothing more than a $200 alarm clock and weather station. Almost any usable functionality has been "retired". You cannot view youtube or upload your own music to Amazon.
Prime video is an experience that will leave you wanting to throw it through a wall because there is no interface. You can either chose one of the 10 videos it offers you or you must know the exact title of what you want to watch.
Music works well with lyrics for many titles but you will need to subscribe to Amazon Music, TuneIn, or Spotify, as I said, they have retired the ability to upload your own music.
Video calls are spotty at best often freezing or dropping altogether.
Echo game skills offer almost no video support other than a single
The worst, absolute worst, is the speed of the Show. It is SLOW!!! My other Echos work seamlessly while everything on the Show takes at least 5 to 10 seconds. I have to count to 10 after saying the wake word before it will begin listening.

Go with an Echo or Echo Dot, this is a waste of money even after a year of being on the market.

author: ShopTinker
title: It's worth the money!
content: I really enjoy the news headlines that scroll across the screen.  The weather forecast  are good to as it gives multiple days. Mainly I enjoy hearing a  song and watching the lyrics scroll across the screen and watching music videos is pretty awesome.

author: Kathryn Kelly
title: Great for music!
content: I love this and I got a great deal on the price too! I think the sound is great. I mostly use it as an alarm clock, to check my child's room at night via our camera, and for background noise when I sleep. I think the speakers sound great too when I play music on it. Very happy to get such a great deal. I keep discovering new things it does that I didn't even know about.

author: Mike Jonkers
title: Multifunctional Echo Show helps to simplify life.
content: My wife and kids enjoy using our echo show, it has become a handy addition to our busy lifestyles! There are many functions it can accomplish, from showing recipes to playing music while we cook. There are many apps that can be loaded, to my smartphone, that Alexa adapts into its usage. I bundled that with an iCloud webcam and am able to view it with both my smartphone and echo show.

author: Ozarker
title: Easy Setup
content: The Echo Show was easy to set up and get it started.  It is amazing as to what it can do for you.  Recognizes voice commands easily.  We are glad we purchased this.  The one negative on the product is it constantly has text near the bottom of the screen that tells you to have Alexa thy this or that.  Apparently there is no way to turn this off.  We do enjoy being greeted by the time and temperature outside on the home screen.

author: Tsukasa Hiiragi
title: Great but then developed horizontal lines after a year!
content: We got a Echo Show for Christmas 2017 and it was very useful to us, but has since developed a screen issue with horizontal lines and video display generally looking awful,  no matter restarting seems to fix it so be warned that this seems to be a common issue for the generation 1 shows.

author: Amanda
title: Fun at first but doesn’t work as expected
content:
Update! Eco show is starting to glitch out a lot and have to reset it every other day. The screen just starts glitching and warping and then it’s fine after a reboot.

The eco show started out real nice. But often times miss understands me. “Alexa shut off all the lights” I’m sorry what devise would you like. “Alexa, shut off all the lights” ok. Have to tell her 2-3 times. And occasionally the screen glitches out and has issues and I have to restart it a lot.

author: Meet Me in St. Louis
title: Amazing
content: While I loved Alexa....this is a whole new level. Love it. Fun to watch movie trailers. Weather is so much more complete. When you listen to music....the lyrics appear. Still discovering all Echo Show can do. Highly recommend. Takes Alexa to a completely new world.

author: Debra
title: My kitchen buddy!
content: What I like most is that when I walk in the kitchen I feel like I have everything I need including a greeting from my grandkids. Their photo is always on and for that reason I really love the Show. Other reasons are that I see news briefs, know the time, play my music, get answers to any questions, view recipes, view instructions, make lists , interact with it, and on and on. It really is like having a buddy in the kitchen!

author: Karen
title: love it
content: Oh my gosh!!! Love this gadget.So much that I bought one for my daughter.My daughters best friend saw hers and she bought one,now her husband is buying one for his office.! Your welcome Amazon!! Anyway,we use this every single day for a multitude of things.Recipes,drop ins and music.etc.etc.etc.

author: A. Lewis
title: BUYER BEWARE
content: I purchased this product in July 2018. First month it worked great. Then the screen began flickering. After doing everything tech support suggested, Amazon asked that I ship it back for repairs in November 2018. It came back after repairs and now in December 2018 it is flickering.  Do not buy this item. Amazon will not refund or replace it. I usually have great service from Amazon on everything but not on this. The device is flawed in some major way that cannot be fixed. Amazon has really let me down on this purchase.

author: C McA
title: Alexa keeps getting smarter, and I kept learning better ways to interact with her!
content:
We love our Echo Shows. It sits on the kitchen counter and has become a cornerstone of our daily activities. Now that you can name timers and set multiple timers at once I no longer use our oven or microwave timer at all. At first I thought the "how many teaspoons" type questions would be a gimmick but I routinely wind up asking for Alexa to clarify some measurement.

I setup the app to know where my office is, and each morning wind up checking how long the commute is. On at least two occasions I've gotten a response that included a different route than normal and known to avoid the highway since there was an accident.

Most of our interactions with Alexa are asking to play some music. Our daughter loves this feature, and thankfully is still being very polite to Alexa, even ending her "Alexa, play Moana" with a "Please"! I'm so proud.

The game changer has been "Alexa, Play Frozen on the FireTV" and "Alexa, Pause the fireTV". This keeps me from searching for a remote and makes it much easier to occupy a little one while pulling something out of the oven. We use it for turning on and off some smart lights as well but the control of the TV is the smart home item I like the most.

Recipe skills could use some work. A few of them are okay, and All Recipes lets you save things so long as you setup an account with them.

Sad that youtube is not working on them anymore :(

author: Dennis Rogers
title: A big step up
content:
Love the show. In everyway is better than the standard tall echo.

The show has miles better sound and the screen is nice.

I give it 4 stars due to lack of skills yet to use the screen and unlike  the older echo, unless you talk to echo facing you cannot see the blue light, so need to have a sound to indicate she listened to your command.

The orginal echo has the blue light around the whole top so could visually see she listened.

Apart from these slight negitives the show is better in every way.

author: Willee
title: Love it!
content: Can't get any better than this! Plug it in, enter Amazon info and your router info. All set. Took all of 4 minutes. It's just like googling the web plus with video. Quality of video very good. At night, the display shows the time but it is dim enough not to bother your sleep.

author: Tammy L Thompson
title: Exactly what I wanted
content: I love this. I can set an alarm by talking to Alexa, or request her to play music, tell a joke, update me on the news... things are unlimited.

author: Ellyanne
title: So far my favorite
content: So far this is my favorite Alexa device. We received the Show as a gift and already have Echo Plus and a few Dots as well in the house. This Show is great and I haven't even had a chance to enjoy all the features. Being able to call and talk/and see our family via the Show is one of the best features. Recipes with video. Photo slide show. I could go on and on but my absolute favorite feature is to be able to watch Amazon Videos while I'm cooking in the kitchen. I can catch up on my favorite shows and get dinner completed without bothering anyone in the family. Love the Show!!

author: John Daum
title: ALEXA ECHO SHOW DOES NOT PLAY REMINDERS UNLESS YOU DISMISS PREVIOUS ONE
content:
Anyone else out there think this is BAD DESIGN on AMAZON's part?  The Echo Dot and Echo Show act differently when it comes to REMINDERS.
I an a frustrated engineer who wishes he could get through to the development team.  I two Amazon, "Alexa" Echo Shows with the expectation to set and manage reminders for my aged mother... and also to demonstrate the Echo Show capability to the 300 residents at her independent living facility.  After placing the Show into operation, it seemed it was just what she needed.  My siblings and I love the "drop in on Mom" feature and face to face conversations without her having to do any computer operation on her end.

After a few days I received complaints from Mom that "I missed 'ABC' and 'DEF' because I did not get reminders.  Could you please program reminders?".  Well, guess what...  when a Reminder pops up on the screen and audio, it stays there, blocking all other Reminders until the current Reminder is dismissed.  So, in order to get the Echo Show to act like the Echo Dot, I had to buy a Dot and tape in on to the back of the Show, copy the reminders from the Show to the Dot to make it appear like the Show is doing Reminders like it should.

It really SUCKS that REMINDERS DO NOT PLAY PROPERLY ON THE SHOW.

author: Corey Grueber
title: Worth it.
content: Cool device. I love all the features and different ways to connect with my smart home. Video screen is big enough for my use. Sound from music is really good. I'm anxious to keep adding devices and pushing the limits. Alexa seems to get smarter with use. I'm very satisfied.

author: DE
title: I tried it out and was soooo happy with it (because at that time YouTube was still ...
content: No YouTube... no point in purchasing. At least for my purposes. And I bought 2 of these paperweights on sale in August to give to the kids at Christmas. I tried it out and was soooo happy with it (because at that time YouTube was still accessible). However they open at Christmas only to find that YouTube no longer part of the deal. Alexa cannot “show me” anything. The “show” part of the Echo Show no longer works for our purposes. And since I was “smart” and bought it early, I’m stuck with it. Fix this amazon. I’m pretty much hating google too for this mess as well. I’d highly recommend NOT buying this until you see that they have consistent and stable support of YouTube.

author: Kevin Hake
title: Fantastic device.  Very pleased.
content: I love this thing.  I use it as a bedside clock, and thought it might be overkill for my needs, but I am SO glad I purchased it.  It's my first Alexa device, and I am already spoiled by the convenience.  The ability to pick any Amazon song/station is fantastic, and I am amazed at all of the other things Alexa can help with.  The ability to control my lights and fan (with some extra accessories) is also fantastic.

author: Neal
title: Nice product, but has it's drawbacks!
content: I'm somewhat pleased with the product.  Voice recognition is impressive.  Works fine out of the box.  But without a manual (book), it's difficult determining acceptable word phrases.  Also, limited existing calendar compatibility.  Discovers compatible devices only within 32', a Bluetooth limitation.  My house is a ranch with approx. 2200 sq. ft. on one floor.  With most devices in the family room (other side of house), I'll need to relocate my echo show.  Just wish it used WiFi OR Bluetooth!

author: JoAlaska
title: It’s just ok. Not what I thought.
content:
It has its pros and cons but mostly it’s just an expensive alarm clock. I thought I could use Netflix and or YouTube on this device and I can’t. It’s pretty limited on its functions unless you pay more to use Amazon’s services which I don’t think are the best compared to alternative.

Trying to go back to your task or switching tasks is bizarre on this device as well.

The device itself has a nice quality picture and the voice commands/speakers function very well. It’s just too bad they’ve monopolized mostly only their media on it.

I’m too lazy to return or else I would. I was just happy they reduced the price by $50 and got a price match.

author: Paula E Shubat
title: Handy addition to the house!
content: I just set up the Show recently in my kitchen and already am having a ball...great for music, videos etc but its particular charm is being able to ask for things spontaneously-don't have to get out the phone or tablet when a random thought starts to bug me...I like being able to customize the screen etc

author: Alan Arnold
title: I might try another brand
content: I would estimate that well over half the questions I ask it cannot answer. Examples... local business phone numbers,  open a website- it cannot help you. The list is enormous. I ask it to call numbers in my phones contact list and it can't help. I ask to add a song to my playlist and it can't do it. Maybe I'm just old and don't know how to do these things but it always says go to the alexa app ... but where ?? Disappointed.

author: Terri Carlson
title: Not worth having in my opinion
content:
It plays music and sounds good. Also like the "drop in" feature. Have used that a lot. But that is the end of the good things I have to say. "Humm, I'm not sure" seems to be "Her" favorite thing to say. Single instructions and/or small questions is all it can handle. If you want to add a song to your favorites... you better say "Alexa, ( wait a second or two ) add this song to Favorites"
Because if you say "Alexa, (mandatory wait time) add this song to MY favorites". You get the "Humm, I'm not sure", or something very similar to that. Little things like that happen all of the time. Honestly, I was in a rush to adopt new technology... This product is not what you think. It's a dumb computer that forgets who you are after "TRAINING" it 2 or 3 times.

author: RichardJ.Minichiello
title: EchoShow better then Google Home
content:
glad that Amazon came out with this device. The music sound is very good and having the lyrics on the screen is another plus. video calling , information center, see and hear news, makes a shopping /Task list so you can remember things, alerts, . It comes in White and Black and for songs all you need to do is ask ALEXA play The Best songs of today and it starts to play. I also own the GOOGLE HOME , The ECHO SHOW is 100 times faster and better .
 in speed to answer a question, play a song ,search the web for cooking recipe with different choices faster then GOOGLE and you can see it on the screen ..Need I say more.  Not to say that Google doesn't have its good qualities .
I think Echo does all that Google does and more.
I hope this will help you with your dission to Buy the ECHO SHOW

author: Renee Day
title: Love it. They call me creepy stalker mom
content: Just to be able to "drop in" on my kids to  catch them in the kitchen fighting over the remote is priceless. Love it. They call me creepy stalker mom. I call it tactical visual interference.

author: readnrider
title: Major privacy invasion problem with calling
content: In order to use the video calling / drop in you must let Amazon access and upload ALL of the contacts on your phone. Think about it - they will know your doctors, your lawyer, all of your friends, every business you call regularly, all of your colleagues. Unacceptable! They need to program the ability to choose to input just selected contacts that you actually would video call, so you can restrict it to family or very close friends. I was given this device with the idea of talking to a grandchild. Amazon doesn’t need to know every medical specialist I’ve ever called so I can talk to my grandchildren.

author: Customer Review
title: ” the software on this one is not up to date and the bottom right corner of the show looks like it was dropped at some point
content:
Returned our last show so we could get the pricing on this one (amazon significantly reduced the price 2 days after we bought one, so we returned it and bought another)

Shipping was fast but the echo show is not responding to voice commands, won’t even wake up when saying “Alexa...”  the software on this one is not up to date and the bottom right corner of the show looks like it was dropped at some point.

author: Angel Rodriguez
title: Great Buy!!!
content:
Very impressed by this device.  Specifically like the fact that I can add family photos to it and have a slideshow going.  Also being able to watch movie trailers instantly.
Looking forward to Amazon's next Alexa device. Only con, it could be less expensive.

author: cju747
title: Great product
content: Arrived quickly. Packing was perfect! Item is better than I expected!! My wife is in love with this device and has used this for recipes and music so far!

author: SheilaT
content:
This is just an unusable paperweight without utube.

Doesn’t support Utube anymore. I have no use for this block now.

As of today the album that played for me for a month will no longer play. It just ask some dumb questions whenever I request. I'm Pissed off now!😡😡

It does resume lol
Update 7/21/17

I have to remove 2 stars because there are so many things this new $229 Plus tax item cant do- Pause fast forward, rewind next just to name a few & the $49 dot does all this plus more. I spent too much $ just for a screen

I received this about 30 minutes ago😊 Setup took about 15 minutes or less looks great on my kitchen counter. Responsiveness is very good. Every command works well & sound and video is superb. I have 2 dots 1 echo & now the show😄

author: Erica Parker
title: Its just an all aroynd fun gadget
content: I just love the echo speakers point, blank, period. & now with the screen on the Echo Show it just gets that much more fun. I prob usually the dominos ordering skill the most, when I'm not just joking around with her asking her silly questions. It's just an all around fun gadget. Oh & the total room is a plus when it's cleaning day, & all my echo speakers are all linked while I'm moving around the house from room to room jamming to the same song.

author: Josh
title: Started out pretty useful but has progressively become less useful over the ...
content:
Started out pretty useful but has progressively become less useful over the last year with the loss of support for YouTube, and the lack of understanding of functionality still actually shown on the screen.

For example, on the screen today it says: "Try 'Computer open the Fireplace skill'". If you say "Computer, open the fireplace skill" the response isn't to open a skill, it is to say "I found a few matches - do you mean 'Fireplace video 10 hours, ambient sounds', 'Fireplace sounds', or 'Cozy fireplace'?". I responded "Fireplace video 10 hours." and was met with "Which skill do you want to enable?" on an endless loop. It just doesn't work very well any more, even with its own advertised features on screen as you're using it. Disappointing.

author: Jason
title: No YouTube is disappointing.Get it back!!
content: I am an early adopter if the Echo and was really happy to see it get a screen. It offers info at a glance as well as showing my favorite photos. The sound is good due to the twin speakers and the overall size if the device is good. With that being said I am not impressed with the Bing powered search. I never use Bing because it is just bad.... really bad. Then there is the YouTube issue. I thought about buying the Show late last year but didn’t because YouTube was pulled. I did buy the Show later partially because of the YouTube work around. I thought I was good to go. I get my Show and YouTube. Blocked again! I like the Show but, someone needs to put on their big boy pants and play nice.

author: Amy B.
title: Love it!
content: Big fan of this item, shows lyrics while playing music, gives you headlines in case you want to see the news stories or videos, scrolls your photos if you want so kind of serves as a digital frame and so much more!  Alexa still has some learning to do and many times I feel like she should search the web rather than just making her “I don’t know” sound but I’m sure that will be always improving.  Overall a great purchase that the whole family enjoys.

author: Gary Reid
title: Echo Show not much to show
content: I kinda like the idea of a screen to look at. But in the long run there is not much need or use for it. Not that much interesting to see. Had I not purchased at a sale price, I probably would have never purchased it at the full price of $229.

author: steppin vouf
title: Show or no show that is the question.
content: My difficulty is I dont have a cell phone,and now you cant download the alexa app on a Mac book air.  SO I am stuck, unable to program my echo show properly. In my opinion you should be able to tell the echo show what you need done. and the echo show does it. every time i ask for something I am referred back to the alexa app.on your mobile device, which I cannot access.To me this is not intelagence but dependence on other equipment to function.Every thing today is pushed to the phone,  because the phone has been made accessable,  to all those who wish  to gather information

author: Twepeh
title: Not sure how to select what photos are visible.
content:
Nice, but I can't search for photos of things.

Also,  I don't know how to adjust what prime photos are shared and what is not.  So I had to turn off Prime Photo sharing!!

Help!?

author: Caroline3d
title: Wonderful communication device.
content: My husband has been assigned to work in another state for a lengthy period.  We decided to get two of these ($100 off when two are bought--Thanks, Amazon!).  He has one, and my son and I have the other at home.  Every night, we "drop in " on each other.  Subjectively, it seems to be better than Facetime or Skype.  Maybe because it was specifically bought for that purpose--and has now a "dedicated use".  Also, it's so SciFi, because you can program the wake word to be "computer".  All other features of all the other Echo devices are also available on Echo Show.

author: Nize
title: The speaker sounds great! Overall
content: I bought this for my wife and she loves it.  Heck, my daughter loves it, too. In fact, I’ve been getting top stories off it while I’m making coffee in the morning.  The speaker sounds great! Overall, for the price, it’s a slam dunk for a kitchen-style internet appliance.

author: Michael G.
title: Face to face calling - Grandma sees her grand kids every week now!
content:
Thank you Amazon for "Prime Day" for Grandma's gift. Now Grandma can see her grand kids every Friday for Shabbat and light the candles together, all hands free and on a bigger screen (compared to cell phone).

Con: Camera is not high quality, resulting in pixels (squares) of remote side. Image is ok, just not sharp. Definitely could not be used for conference calling if imaging is important. Camera does not work well in low light. (Note: I have a high speed internet connection of 200 meg down and 25 meg up, remote side has 150 meg down, 15 meg up - internet is not an issue).

Use: High speed internet

author: Ross Barentyne
title: A Little Disappointing
content: It's great to be able to see things like reminders, events, flash briefings, videos, etc., etc. It has all the features of the regular Echo plus all the visual aspects which make it very handy. In spite of the claims, My main disappointment and the reason I can't give it more than three stars is the sound. I thought the sound would be much better than my regular Echo, but it isn't; maybe not even as good. I have a Bluetooth speaker that's no wider than the speakers on the Echo Show, and that Bluetooth speaker is much, much better. So buy it for the visual aspects, but don't buy it just for the sound; you'll be disappointed.

author: Maria T
title: Works well
content: I wish that there were some better clock features for whenever the screen is off without having to go into Do Not Disturb mode however overall we are pleased with this we have been using it mostly as a slideshow of our pictures but the smart features on it are great as well.

author: K. Vitalis
title: Awesome - love it💕
content: We have previously  purchased 3 echos plus 4 Dots for Christmas gifts and deceided to purchase the show ( in white) for our kitchen and we absolutely love it- love how it shows the 7 day weather forecast for our area plus recipes and how it changes pictures, and it also turns on our family room light.  I will never again be without one of the echo products.

author: Rahul V.
title: Great for video chat, would like more touchscreen functionality
content:
The Echo Show has totally changed how we keep in touch with our parents. Our parents are still very comfortable with the ‘landline’ and like having a single place that anyone can contact them. Now, we have a really easy way to video chat with them and do it all the time.

The biggest drawback is the Echo Show doesn’t make much use of its touchscreen and it doesn’t have a traditional touch base navigation. While Alexa voice is nice to interact with, it would be nice to have some touch features too.

author: Sandbagger
title: Day 1 review: I liked my Echo. I like my Echo Show even more.
content:
Day 3: Alexa gets stupid or loses functions?
Since I made a point of noting the ability to browse Pandora channels in my Day 1 review, I have to note that, two days later, this function has  suddenly disappeared. Now "Alexa, show me my channels on Pandora" gets the response "Sorry, this isn't supported on this device." Drop the word "me" and say "Alexa, show my channels on Pandora" yields "What do you want to hear?".
---------------
Day 1: First day with the echo show.  I'm pretty pleased with it.  Some observations that I think have not been hit in most reviews:
* Sound quality seems similar to that of the Echo cylinder.  Good for a desktop listening experience, not impressive if you want to fill a room with sound.
* The Show does have an ambient light sensor (using the camera?) so that the screen dims as the room lighting goes down. When I darkened the room at night to work at my PC, the Show display dimmed to the point where I could just make out the time, and not the background photo at all.
* Much has been made of the Show displaying lyrics when playing Prime music.  That doesn't appeal to me, but when playing music from Spotify, Pandora, and My Music on Amazon, the Show displays the song title, artist name, album art, and a progress indicator.  That's really nice when listening to playlists - I was always asking my Echo cylinder "Alexa, what's that song?"
* Alexa has always been weak at recognizing the names of some of my Pandora channels. With the show, if Alexa doesn't recognize the name, I can ask it to display my Pandora channels and select them from the Show touch screen, It's good to have a fallback that does not require me to pull out my phone and fire up the Alexa app, then work my way through multiple screens to get my selection.
* Some newsfeeds are now accompanied by appropriate photographs.
* You can set the Show to use an album from Amazon Prime Photos as a slideshow when the device is inactive.  AFAIK, other photo servers cannot be used.

author: Linda D.
title: It's something you will use EVERY DAY
content:
Features I like best include:  The ability to play music in multiple ways.  It will play either a single song or shuffle through many songs by the same artist/group.  The sound quality is very good and I can tell Alexa to make louder or lower.  I spent the first week trying to recall all of the music I listened to when a teenager.  It was great fun.  It's been extremely helpful to ask about the weather for whatever location I want.  Wish it would include 'wind chill' and 'wind speed' since I have to go outside and feed my horse. I've set up a 'to do list' and a 'grocery' list.  I've used it as a 'timer' when cooking in the kitchen.  I've used it as an alarm clock in unusual way.  It's possible to set up multiple 'alarm' times.  I set a "laundry" alarm time to put clothes in the dryer while already having an morning wake up alarm.  I need to set up alarms to remind me to take my medicine.  It's also nice to have this in the bedroom to ask what time it is since you don't have to open your eyes it's easier to go back to sleep.  The sound that the timer and alarm make is unique and loud enough to hear from another room.  I can't hear the stove, oven, or microwave alarm if I'm in another room with the TV on.  The alarm doesn't stop until you dismiss it.  Less burnt food!
I still need to set up my two devices so they can work as an intercom.  I also need to set up my Ring doorbell and use Alexa Show to see who's at my door.  I REALLY like calling someone.  The conversation is both clearer and louder (if desired) than what any phone can provide.  The person I'm calling also reports better sound quality.  I probably have arthritis in my hand and it's wonderful not holding a phone.  I'm calling distant friends and relatives more often.
Dislikes are user issues and not equipment performance.  I didn't know what an App was or where to get it.  I've never gotten one before.  Since I have bought 2 of these, I know I should be able to have them play the same music in different rooms if I like.  I know someone calling me can't be answered using Alexa unless that person does something on his/her cell phone.  I know there are other things like setting up the devices like an intercom is possible but don't know how to do that.  I know that I should be able to set up my Ring doorbell and answer the door and see who's there.

author: Y. Eide
title: Echo is the best.
content: I love my Echo and never thought this amazing electronic can do so much. It answers my question and most of all keeps me updated in certain news, temperature/forecast, calendar appointments, and also the beautiful scenes that shows itself,etc. I highly recommend this Echo to anybody.

author: Carol Ann Rees
title: My new Echo Show !!
content: Love .. love my Echo Show .. It’s my fancy alarm clock and, tells me the morning news !!  I also have it connected to a indoor camera for security.  What’s not to love about this .  I find myself saying “GOOD NIGHT & GOOD MORNING ALEXA.”  And she answers me.  My husband even thanks her !!  Waiting for her to say “Your Welcome.”  Great purchase to add to my Alexas stuff.

author: Willy Doitt
title: A Perfectly and Gorgeously Packaged Steaming Turd
content:
What would be the sense of writing another two-star review, when there are already 742 of them. They cover just about all of the shortcomings I quickly discovered when I received my Echo Show as a Father's  Day present. Aside from not being able to adjust the naration speed of my Kindle books, let alone not be able to read them in text format, Alexa doesn't even recognize the word "Kindle" when spoken to her. (I was hoping she would give me some options for accessing my small library of Kindle books. Lotsa luck with that! )

I did get a kick out of Alexa reading my X-Rated Limericks collection Kindle book. She pronounces all of the nastiest four letter words with perfect rhyming inflexion. And yet, refuses to play certain rap songs!

On the positive side, it came in a beautiful package with absolutely perfect tear-off sealing tabs.

author: Malia G.
title: Love it! Setup was super easy and the speaker ...
content: Love it! Setup was super easy and the speaker sound quality is awesome. I'm really enjoying the display of song lyrics while my favorite music is playing. Can't wait to try out the other features!

author: applewoman
title: Hello GiGi
content: This is wonderful for my far flung family,  Keeps me in touch  so nicely and kids can call Grandma so easily.  I love all the verbal access to my lists and calendar.

author: Cynthia Funegard
title: We have for other Echoes and they all work fine but they are not the echo show
content: We cannot get this product to work at all. We have for other Echoes and they all work fine but they are not the echo show. This one does not give the reminders at the correct times and the alarms almost never work. It is all jumbled and whenever it gives a reminder it will not start what we were listening to again for example the radio on TuneIn. It is absolutely a nightmare. We very much regret buying it and it is a total waste. We're very surprised because of the other ones work very well and we use them constantly. Whenever we try to turn something on like a podcast or just the radio it seems to wake up and deliver and rapid-fire succession many many stored up reminders and alarms. This is horrible and we wish Amazon will contact us about it.

author: marc archambeau
title: Meh, not very functional
content:
Its new tech, not worth $200.
Alexa misunderstands me 90% of the time. Also has difficulty finding old music artists or classical music.

Now I understand that it is designed for the masses....but really......I'm from illinois my accent would bore a sloth to death.

Alexa won't learn.  Saves my grocery list provided I pronounce things like a moron. Same with asking her to turn off the screen.

Am told it can play prime movies and movies I own.....go figure she doesn't understand.

Great for weather, lists, calls to/from my phone......but all of these super features are non existent.

author: Madelyn Bree
title: Great way to keep in touch with Grandma
content: I purchased two units, one for me and one to take to Australia for my mom who is 85 and not at all savvy with technology. I just got back from my trip to Australia and it works great with mine here. Because my mom doesn't have a cell phone, I downloaded a second cell number (an app) and set her up on Amazon. Then registered her with the second cell number. It all works great. She no longer has to push buttons or remember things, I typed up a little note and stuck it to the top that says Alexa dropin on Samantha and also Alexa skype Roland, she has no problems now and is so happy to be apart of the family again. This has been invaluable to me, a few times I had tried to call my mom and she forgot to hang up the phone properly so I couldn't get through for a couple of days, she also fell once and was laying on the ground for 4 days before anyone found her, this may not be the only answer but along with the panic fall pendant and daily calls with this I feel happier knowing she is ok. She had purchased a smart Samsung tv a couple of years ago because it had the skype app but they took the app off the tvs, she can finally speak and see her son, grandkids and great grandkids in Germany now and be apart of the family again.

author: Anthony Versace Giuseppe
title: It has extreme potential
content:
So first off, let me start by saying, my family and I are all Apple everything. MacBook’s, Apple TVs, Watches, all iPhones, etc. You name it. We use it. But once I saw that the Echo Show had a screen I was so GAME, this was also after the HomePod from Apple was released (no screen). I wanted to try it out so badly, I have a few regular speakers but never bought a home smart speaker before, so this was entirely and completely new for me, and let me tell you, so far so GOOD.
Just like Apple, the packaging was very nice, lots to open and unwrap, all clean and dust free. The set up was okay, it took a while but my Wi-Fi is not the best so It could have just been personal reasons. And once it turned on I was like, “uhhhh what do I do now”. It was just a screen and nothing really happened besides a little video beforehand on what it can do. I started to ask it questions and downloaded different skills and what not and it became easier to use.
The quality of the audio is amazing, it gets very loud stays very clear. The 7in screen is also very high definition, as well as the 5MP front camera. I then downloaded the Alexa app and video chatted some people which was so awesome to do so in the kitchen as I was just cooking and cleaning, etc. It felt very futuristic.
Now if you’re looking for something mind-blowing and life changing this is not for you. This is a massive step for the Echo devices and I am very happy to own one. It’s enjoyable and easy to use. The more skills you download the more I found out it can do so much more than I really thought. I like the news apps and the sound making apps.
Aesthetically speaking it looks so sweet, clean and futuristic just sitting in my kitchen with the home screen always on and ready to be talked to. And I probably love that the most. Just a little "smart-home-TV-speaker" just chilling in my kitchen. This device and future ones have so much potential in the home and can really change the way we live. I really enjoy being an early adopter of technology to see which direction we are headed in and this is a great start.  Amazon is seriously killing the game and I am so excited for their future! Another PLEASED customer!!

UPDATED- (7/12/17)
-The Alexa app, sorry to say, but it's absolute garbage. The UI is okay but it has a lot going on and it isn't too helpful. It's very slow and when you tap some settings it says it doesn't work, or check your connection, etc. Every option you press on the app must load and buffer which is very annoying. They really need to fix and update the app because that's where you manage 100% of what you're doing on your Echo Show.
- I wish it worked with Apple Music ha ha ha... wishful thinking. I know.
- I love the “Do Not Disturb” setting. You can turn it on/off from your Echo Show and the Alexa app. I don’t want friends/family video chatting (dropping in) on me drunk at 2:00 am when I am sleeping.
-I like that you can change the background home screen, but wish it was brighter. I can’t really see it too much.
- “Voice Training” never works for me and I want it to work!

UPDATED- (8/29/17)
-I turned on the voice purchasing feature and it’s easy to use. The only thing I do not like is it will show one item and then you must say Alexa next, Alexa next, Alexa next as it’s going through each option 1, 2, 3, etc. It’s a lot of work. You can just use the screen to swipe through the items but I want to use my voice not my fingers. Also, the password option is nice because you have those friends that come over and say “Alexa, order 10 Xbox’s and then your bill is $3,000.00 and it’s not funny…
-I added my work to the address list and it’s a great feature to show you the traffic and how long it would take to get to work. It also shows alternative routes on the same page. Very useful.
-I still use Amazon music everyday with the lyrics on the screen, very cool to watch.
-I downloaded a few games to play by myself and with others. It’s fun but not very practical sitting around a little box with people playing games on it.
-The video calling/dropping in is my all-time favorite feature. I use it all the time and my family drops in on me all the time and I’m like oh hello there! Awesome feature! But you need to be safe and careful with it. Make sure you read on what it does and how to turn it on/off for certain people.

UPDATED- (9/27/17)
YouTube is NOT supported anymore on the Echo Show AHHHHHHHHH! If you like to watch music videos, cooking lessons, etc or just free music in general you can't anymore.

UPDATED- (10/19/17)- **FINAL UPDATE**
**Here me out on this one. Due to features being removed, the app not working seamlessly with an iPhone and the lack of skills that actually will help someone with their day to day lives, I packed up my Amazon Echo Show and will not be using it furthermore.
-This is NOT by any means a bashing negative review full of hate, it’s a review by an honest regular tech user and someone that enjoys new technologies. The Echo Show has a long way to go and this is only generation 1. Think of it as the iPhone 1, or generation 1 of anything. Future improvements only make the product better, and that’s what I’m going to wait for. There are many skills that are not useful and more gimmicky so to speak, to have you download it and use it when it’s actually not improving your day to day life.
-The software needs some major upgrades that make it easy to use and navigate(The Echo Show and the Alexa App). With the removal of YouTube, there is no reason for me to have a screen because I will not be watching any other video content on it while sitting in my kitchen.
-The hardware of the device is great. The screen quality is HD as well as the high megapixel camera for video chatting. The speakers are crisp, loud and very clear.
-if I were to recommend this device to someone I would recommend it to someone that wants a nice quality speaker that you can use with your voice.

author: Neil Ghodke
title: YOU TUBE is a must.
content: YOU TUBE is a must. Disappointed that it is not available on Echo Show anymore.

author: nesnet
title: Great unit - Needs more flexibility
content: My only complaint is that you can't disable Alexa hints on the home screen. They're screen clutter to me. It should be far more adjustable, and let the end user determine what he/she needs to display on the home screen. Provide more flexibility for control, and it would be a solid 5 rating. Give us a choice.

author: P. B.
title: Very handy item.
content: This is a useful addition to our home.  The grandchildren love the video screen.  The ability to control lights and the t.v. are awesome. The only drawback is we have a rather small house, and sometimes multiple echoes answer us.

author: Bron
title: Very nice!
content:
I love my Echo Show which I just got yesterday. It's pretty much as described here. I waited awhile to see how things went with it, but then decided to go ahead and "jump in" as they say. Certainly, there's room to grow, but the current experience is very good, especially for PRIME members. I will be updating this review as I have more experience, but I wanted to post today to highlight one new development.

As of late today (9/26) Google has blocked the Echo Show from accessing YouTube. Now I have been using my ES to watch YouTube and it's great, so this is very disappointing. Amazon and Google have given conflicting statements. So we'll wait and see what happens. However, I think Google is making a huge mistake by doing this. Google is just begging Amazon to set up a competitive service of their own by doing this. Amazon could easily create a YouTube like service for the Echo Show.  Sure, YouTube has a huge lead and it would be tough, but Amazon has everything they need to set up a similar service and I bet they could do it fairly quickly if they choose to do so. But let's hope they work things out soon and YouTube returns to the Echo Show.  [***Update: While losing this feature is disappointing, the Echo Show still has a lot to offer, including things like CNN, Prime movies/videos, and so on. So I think some of the reaction here in reviews is a bit overdone. I am using my show every single day and getting a lot of value out of it. Even when just listening to music, the visuals (album art, song and album titles listed, time line, are all very welcome - like on a tablet. The most apt comparison I can think of is the old Sony Dash, only with more potential. And who doesn't think Amazon is going to address this one way or the other?***]

Meanwhile I've got Prime Videos, Movies and TV I can watch and that all works great. Some people think the screen is too small, but I have watched videos on small screens for years now and have become quite happy and used to it. If it's sitting on your desk about 20 inches away, believe me, it's fine for casual viewing. I watched "Ex Machina" last night and enjoyed it very much. [***Update: Have watched many more movies and vids and still loving it.***]

The Echo Show has a great deal of potential, but is already a lot of fun and very useful right out of the box. Setup was simple and easy. I had no trouble at all. Speakers sound pretty good and the screen looks nice. Oh, and the new musical "device grouping" available is fantastic. It was very easy to create an "Everywhere" group and add my Echo Show and older Echo in it and now I can say "play <music> everywhere" and listen on both devices. I plan to add more devices later. It's a very useful and superb feature. [Still loving this new feature!]

One thing I learned quickly, is that it would be useful to be able to swivel my Echo Show (since I use it close by on my desk, but would be just as useful in a kitchen, for example). And so I did some research and found this very inexpensive and nice turntable that fits my ES perfectly: Lazery Collections Gripped Bottom Cabinet Turntable Lazy Susan (9-Inch) -- it has a nice soft, rubber pad and non-slip rubber feet - perfect!

All the many skills are even better on the Echo Show. Especially lists and reminders. The CNN Videos ("Open CNN") are great. Usually updated within the last 2-6 hours (plus many older clips). Often same as those linked by online news stories. It also seems to stream video ("Latest Video") delayed by a few hours which is nice.  Very convenient way to check on latest news events and the video and sound quality is excellent. The CNBC skill is also very good ("Open CNBC"). Audio with visual text. Market news, updates, and quotes and was real time when I checked. Nice!

Prime movies are great. Prime music is great. I can listen to all my CD or mp3 music purchases ("autorip"), Prime music (millions of songs), and the music I have uploaded as well. Nice! So far, I'm very pleased. More to come as I have more time with my new ES!

*** Update: See updates above. I am still enjoying my Echo Show very much. I use it every single day. And it will only get better.

author: George Hayao
title: Love my Echo Show, but my wife doesn’t!
content: I love my Echo Show, but my wife doesn’t! She kept unplugging it when it was in the kitchen, being paranoid and thinking Amazon was listening in and feeding the information to the government or Illuminati. So now I keep it in my bedroom, where I don’t care if the government is listening in...

author: Terence Lowery
title: Tone quality superb!!
content:
Waking up is not always easy. "Alexa, play some mellow Mozart.."  Ahhhhh, there ya go!!
This is the mellowist "Roomy" I have ever owned, other than my "Roomba"...

author: RobinH
title: Good interactive, intelligent Amazon device with lots of features and new ones added all the time.
content: I have really enjoyed having my Echo Show on the kitchen counter. I get all my daily updates first thing in the morning as I fix my breakfast and have fine tuned the flash briefing with the things that are most important to me. I do wish there was a greater integration with my iPhone, however, for receiving messages and calls. I do like the fact that I can make direct calls through the Echo interface though. That's especially handy when I'm cooking or cleaning in the kitchen and want to make a hands free call. I do believe I would enjoy it more if more people that I know had one or had the add so that we could video call. However, despite my suggestions, the cost of the Echo Show is a bit high and most everyone uses different means of video chat already, such as FaceTime so are reluctant to add yet another app to their devices. I do have an issue finding that many of my questions for Alexa receive the "hmm, I'm not sure about that" response if it's a web info type search. I think my favorite features are the recipes, local news and weather, timers, audio books, integrating smart home devices, and fun games like Jeopardy and Guess the song. With all that being said, I do feel like new and better options are being added consistently to make this a very user friendly device.

author: Frank Hill
title: No directions for use with PC
content: The Echo Show is a very handy and versatile unit when it's used in the "stand alone" mode but complete instructions and an app. for use with a PC don't seem to be available.  Most of the information seems to be directed for use with a smart phone.  Demonstrations on YouTube show many uses for the Echo BUT NOT HOW TO MAKE IT WORK !  The book by C.J. Andersen also is directed for use with a smart phone.  I won't be able to get complete usefulness with the ECHO until an app. and instructions for use with a PC are available.

author: Douglas Taylor
title: We bought this so our kids and us could easily video chat with family
content: We bought this so our kids and us could easily video chat with family. There is no where to keep this in order to do that. The way it's titled up makes even a waist high location unable to get the whole family. My wife who is five foot barely makes it in the screen from our counter top. It would be much better if the screen/camera was adjustable, because it's no fun leaving it at knee level or having to move it for calling people.

author: Rick R.
title: Multiple Show units on Single Account cannot be isolated to an individual by Unit name
content: I love the echo products but have learned now that I have activated multiple Show units on my account that they ALL respond to anyone trying to reach me as the naming process does NOT mean anything to anyone except Amazon tech.  If my daughter "drops in" on me, she'll often reach my mom, etc.  Tech support after many hours of efforts fessed up that this is a problem that does not yet have a solution.

author: David Moloney
title: Good for the kitchen but ours doesn't pick up your ...
content: Good for the kitchen but ours doesn't pick up your voice very well. I have it up on a bar and many times or spot or one of our dots hears me from another room before this does.Directional mics I think may be the problem. We like it but I'm putting a dot back in the open kitchen diningroom and livingroom and designating this to the kitchen only so I don't have to keep repeating myself.

author: Larry Berg
title: This product will change the world
content: I honestly believe you have changed the world. People will look back and say this is a major technological shift. It exceeded all expectations. I am looking forward to every new upgrade.

author: JCK
title: Great product!
content: Love our Echo Show.  The sound is great and it's nice to be able to show a photo slideshow on the screen.  Has all the features of the tradition Echo, but with better sound quality and a crystal clear screen.

author: Prime Player
title: Best Echo product yet!
content: Absolutely love the calling and drop-in features - actually, I love those on my Echo and Echo Dot, but adding the screen brings an entirely new experience. Since we have set up our Echo Show, our kids have been able to call their grandparents and Aunt (both also own Echo Shows) almost daily for a quick check-in. Being able to do a quick video call, that is hands-free makes the experience very cool. This is the best Echo product yet!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Be careful!!!Defective and refuse to replace
content: After a couple of months usage, screen starts flickering and there are lines going across the screen. Required to replace the defective item but Amazon doesn’t allow you submit a request until you speak to tech support. And then tech support refuses to replace it if after you unplug and plug the power back in, the problem temporarily goes away. Amazon! Do you have to unplug your TV, your fridge, your computer, your iPad, your phone to temporarily fix any issue? If it does, how annoying would it be to your every day life. No one is ever going to buy a convient product like Echo for more inconvenience in life! Defective product and rude customer service!

author: Beverly Braaten
title: I love Alexa
content: I am totally addicted to my Alexa Show. I can “drop in” on my grandchildren to wish them a good school day. I am keeping my calendar there, grocery list there and have enabled many skills so I can listen to many of my favorite programs and channels.

author: RetiredAndLovingIt
title: Definitely recommend for my purposes!
content:
Some history first: I had a home automation system installed about a year ago that included two intercoms with video monitors. We have had only problems with this system that was off-line far more than it was working as advertised! I ordered two Echo Shows in desperation and they are working very well! The only time the intercom in my husbands workshop didn't work was when he needed the power cord to test something else he was working on. Once plugged back in it was back online instantly. It was necessary to create a new amazon account for my husband and list his account as part of my "household." Now when I need to talk to him I just ask Alexa to call him! Works great! I also like that I can view the cameras, the ones that I installed and are not part of the automation system. It works pretty well but is a bit slow initiating. Whether that's Echo or the cameras themselves, I haven't delved into as yet.

All the other function of this Alexa work as advertised but strangely I find I use it far more than the Echo dots that I have in various rooms throughout the house.

For my needs, this has been the perfect solution! I am now talking with an audio visual expert to remove the entire home automation system and install something (still to be determined) that works through the Alexa app.

author: Expert Opinion
title: Stuck at echo logo after OTA.
content: Piece of junk is stuck at the echo logo after OTA.  Will return soon.

author: Jessica Henry
title: I love Alexa!
content: I love Alexa! My echo show stays in the kitchen where she helps me get my day started with the weather and some music, and maybe a joke. When I get home, she might help me find a recipe, play one of my shows on Amazon Prime, or play my favorite artist's music.  I can call my mom or my brothers, or any of my other friends who have an echo show. Love it!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Don't Buy Till Amazon Comes Out With A Better Version
content: She can't do much that I would like her to do.  Basically can only use her for music.

author: Oscar Camacho-Waters
title: The sound is good! At times its comes on out of no ...
content: The sound is good! At times its comes on out of no where or when there is a sound that sounds like alexa or echo will turn on the echo show.  At times it comes on out of no where when there is no sound.  I was washing dishes and Alexa came on saying "I couldn't find that to your question?!" Also a lot of her responses are "hmmm I don't know that?!  "I'm not sure?! Siri does know a bit more answers.  You do have to speak clearly and when there is no background noise.  Its hard when you have 6 kids.  Video is awesome, the drop in the other echo dots and nest cameras is awesome along with linking to the sonos.

author: hotatsixty
title: Over-hyped
content: So far, not sure.  I am disappointed that Google is ending accessibility.  Fingers crossed that it will grow on me before time runs out.

author: Ben
title: Amazing sound quality
content: This has been a great addition to my smart home setup. The screen is clear and the speaker sounds great. My only disappointment is that I cannot get it to play Netflix.

author: Karl B. Pritchett
title: Nice, but wonky after only 4 months.
content:
I've been really happy with the Echo Show until the past few weeks. The screen has gotten wonky. By wonky I mean it gets all jumpy like an old TV with poor reception. I need to unplug the unit and let is sit a minute and then plug it back in. It will work fine for a few days and then the vertical lines come back. Not very happy right now.
