We'll see how Amazon handles this problem.
Stay Tuned.

author: Victoria Magee
title: Careful of the screen developing static and lines
content: So I've had this for a couple of years, and of course right after the return policy had expired with Amazon, the screen started getting lines across it.  Many times I can barely make out what's on the screen.  I tried to take a video and picture, but it would only let me post the picture on here for you to see.  While Alexa herself still works....I bought this particular item to see what's on the screen and many times I cannot make out what's on the screen (when looking at security cameras, video chatting with family, etc) which makes this device no better than a DOT.  I had high hopes.  If you google it, you will see others have had the same issue and are stuck like me.  You may want to get an extended warranty (if there is one) as I would hate to see you purchase an expensive DOT & after 6 months have a screen that really is hard to see thru the static and wavy lines across the screen.  Bummer.

author: Ronald C. Mervine
title: Great focal point in our Kitchen
content:
We are huge Amazon Echo fans. While we are primarily an Apple Ecosystem, I standby these Echos as they been in our house since day one. Aside from one Echo, five Echo spots, and one Echo spot, I wanted this Echo Show for a while, but never wanted to purchase it at full price. I waited for this to be on sale and ended up getting this product.

As you may know this is touchscreen, but we hardly ever touch it as we use voice commands.  The video concept is great as I use it sometimes to talk to my wife as I am traveling. I really like the Jeopardy Skill with this. It almost looks like Jeopardy on TV.

There is one feature I don't think that gets talked about too much and that is the calendar feature. As you get closer to an event, your event comes up on the screen automatically. So you have that kid's birthday party coming soon, well now you get gentle reminders as you are in the kitchen. It will come up and tell you. I never thought about this feature until I saw it.

It's also great for looking up quick recipes. It's also great for seeing what movies are playing there with the trailers. One accessory I will recommend looking at is a rotating stand for it. We have an open kitchen/family room concept. So it's great rotating it as you move to the other side of the kitchen island.

The only deterrent is the full price that Amazon is asking for this.

author: Arthur, King of the Britons.
title: Worthless since December 2017.
content:
What do you expect your echo show to do, that your echo spot/show (or other alexa enabled speaker) cannot?  Well, it can video chat. That's handy... I guess? It can play Prime TV/movies... if you don't have a TV, or just have a fetish for tiny screens.... but otherwise, all it is, really, is an echo dot with a screen... and why is that? What happened in december 2017 that basically turned this device into an ADA compatible smart speaker, instead of a smart screen? Google pulled Youtube.

Now, I recognize that this isn't (entirely) amazon's fault, and I gave them the better part of a year to correct it, but with the announcement of the Gen 2 echo show, I thought it was high time that I wrote this review and point out that any use-case that you might think you have... for instance watching cooking shows in the kitchen, or using the show like a voice-interactive recepie book... things that are literally the main selling points of this device, they went MIA when google broke this device and Amazon has yet to come up with their own content to even attempt to replace what was lost.

Alexa's recipes suck. When you say "alexa, show me how to make ________" it will show you pictures of multiple recepies and say "tell me what you want..." And that's it. No matter what verbal command I try, "alexa, show me the 3rd one" or "alexa, show me "red's famous chilli" or "alexa, yes" it does not provide an actual recipe... so that feature is worthless.

Most of the rest of the features that utilize the screen require you to spend money... for instance, it won't let you "watch live TV" unless you have a login for the "live TV app." Which, again, I don't fault them for, but i'm not going to pay $50/month JUST to get CNN live.

So, how do I actually use my $200 echo show? In real life? Well, I use it the same way I use a dot. Setting alarms, asking questions, turning the lights on and off... Listening to music/Audiobooks. (and on that front at least, the show DOES have a good speaker for it... I noticed that the new model has rear facing speakers. I wonder what on earth they were thinking there?) but mostly, without Google/YouTube, all the things I want to do with echo show: Watch movie trailers, product reviews and demos, whatever... That content just ISN'T AVAILIBLE anymore and my single, most commonly used command is "alexa, screen off" How sad is that?

author: Justin A Cochrane
title: it was clear how great the Echo Show is
content: Being an Apple dominant house I was skeptical at first when we purchased an Echo Show.  However, within minutes of plugging it in, it was clear how great the Echo Show is.  Enjoy being able to get news briefing in the morning while making breakfast and easily play music.  We have only had for a couple weeks and are constantly learning new features.  Our 3 year old son loves asking Alexa for the weather and to tell him jokes.  Next step is to add additional Echos around the home.

author: Popeye
title: Depends on what you use it for
content: It's easy to set up, understands and speaks clearly. I haven't set up any smart devices like lights yet. I am a little disappointed that it wasn't really clear in the advertising that it can only call other people who have Alexa or that it will only access music from paid services. I thought it would access the playlists in my linked devices. Fun, but not quite as useful as I had hoped.

author: RZhivago
title: Love my Echo Show!!
content: This is an item everyone needs, a must have.  Excellent video and sound.  Easy to use.  Sleek modern design.  Easy setup.  Thank you Amazon for another innovative product that makes life so much easier.

author: B
title: Until 2017/09/26 Echo Show would play YouTube videos by asking "Alexa play funny cats on YouTube"
content:
Amazon has failed to provide basic video support for the device, i.e. YouTube.
Until 2017/09/26 Echo Show would play YouTube videos by asking "Alexa play funny cats on YouTube".  However after 09-26-2017 Alexa responds with "YouTube not supported on Echo Show".

Speculation: this is because YouTube videos would just play, without commercials, it was the way the internet should be on a appliance / purpose built device like Echo Show.  Google has likely blocked the device based on the http request info provided that identifies it as Echo Show vs. a standard computer web browser.

Amazon can resolve this by working with Google (yes a competitor) to create an Alexa skill to play YouTube videos.  Until then I'll be returning my Echo Show(s) as this feature 'removal' significantly decreases Echo Shows value.

author: B. Jackson
title: Impressive, yet awaiting further software updates for improvement.
content: Waiting for further updates, impressive, yet in need of improvements. Sound quality is great. Great picture. Does not always work with Arlo cameras, sometimes showing no picture and just audio, also unstable connection. Undetermined to be a Echo Show software issue, skill problem, or Netgear Arlo streaming malfunction.

author: Duke Demchuk
title: I like this tool
content: I like this tool, it’s fast at turning on my lights and updating my ecobee4 but it’s starting to flicker on the bottom part of the screen (called amazon support and reset, gonna call again due to that didn’t fix it)

author: tamarasshop
title: Works great
content: I have the alexa fire cube so I had to change the name of this to echo. I have alarms set and reminders. You can look stuff up. Its great!! I will be buying another to send to my sister so we can chat.

author: Thomas
title: No exchange or refund after 30 days...Screen problems are documented...
content: Unit is less than 60 days old and the screen is shot. I called customer service to find out I have to send it back for repair. Unreasonable...I asked for a replacement and they refused...Service Rep's were difficult to understand...

author: Susan J. Beeseck
title: It's remarkable
content: I like everything about my Echo Show. I honestly can't think of anything I don't like about it. It's really amazing. I love the music I'm able to listen to. The selection is endless. Just say the name of the song, and voila. My friends took one look at mine, and ordered one for themselves. I highly recommend purchasing this. Great for all ages!!!

author: B
title: GET IT BEFORE THEY SELL OUT!
content: I bought it just to make phone calls. Moved the tower to the livingroom so the kids can intercom. Dot plays music in the restroom and limits showers..looking forward to traveling with tap. Yes, I am a huge fan. My cat loves the cat sounds and fish aquarium. I listened to the beach, rainforest, thunderstorms and was instantly sleepy. CALLED MOM, set the alarm for weekdays, arranged a routine, and daily reminders. Looking forward to Alexa starting my day. WHY DON'T UOU GAVE ALEXA? She knows who God and Jesus are via wikipedia. THE COMPETITOR DOES NOT. So, if you want..what you want, when you want it..you deserve this hands free experience. YOU CAN USE THE PHONE from across the room. Get the Connect, and Show or Spot and Dot..set up the cameras, dim the lights and ride the music. You friends may never leave.

author: Marcie J. Bober-Michel
title: We love our Show!
content: Love my Show (I now have two of them, along with several other Echo devices). We do wiish it had an HDMI port, but the Fire TV (Ultra HD) is now our way to browse thru the security cameras on our big screen TV. We really like the Show's display (recognizing that the next version will likely have a larger screen and seem less boxy) -- and the sound quality is quite good as well.

author: MACK
title: Mixed emotions!
content: I luv the Show, it also sounds great. I'm upset that YouTube is no longer licensed on the Show. Hopefully this is rectified  or supply a better option to YouTube. I've spent a good amount throughout my house on Echo show, echos and dots. Please fix somehow!

author: Angeliclink
title: Would be nice if the picture would show when it's idle
content: I have a hard time pairing it with plugs, you have to touch the screen if you want to sing along with the music. Background screen only comes on when you call Alexa then it goes out. Would be nice if the picture would show when it's idle. I'm sure I need to practice more, but as of right now I don't see the convenience for the money. If my thoughts change I will post, but as of right now I should have just been happy with the 3 Echo's I have.

author: Kristine Riddle
title: Echo show
content: Great fun and so useful.  I like the screen I can see my shopping list which is cool lyrics from songs etc. In general Alexa is a fun and fabulous tool and I enjoy it very much

author: jordan davidowitz
title: Great so far will get better I am sure
content: Going to be a game changer over time. Like the news feature. Amazon bought ring last week so hopefully they will make it so you can talk back to person at door and hopefully they make response time better.... also need a better baby monitor Option the amazon camera is not there yet. But potential is endless with this product.

author: schmackdaddy
title: Excellent video and sound quality
content:
This thing is awesome.  I thought my echo dots were the greatest, but the show is awesome.

 I travel a lot so I got it to video chat with the kiddos.  The video and sound quality are excellent.  The kids also like the fact that when they ask it to play music the words come up so they can also  karaoke.

author: Rice Rice
title: Started well , bugged out
content:
The first week or so of our new Echo Show was amazing. We could listen to music, my son could watch his prime video shows at the counter, we even used it to stream the front porch camera.
The problem started with the background display. We have chosen the option to cycle through 'on this day' photos from our amazon account. I first noticed it had been stuck on a photo from a few days prior and not cycling. No big deal. Then the video streaming from prime videos would only play for a few minutes before returning abruptly to the home screen. Music glitches in and out.
As we said, we were really happy initially, but seems amazon still has a ton of coding bugs to work out with this thing.

author: Patrick D. Dudley
title: - The device seems to be a little bulky in the back maybe a slim/sleek version without losing video or sound quality would be a good upgrade. - A larger screen without increasing the ...
content:
Overall the Echo Show is a high-quality device both and sound and picture clarity.  Here are a couple of things I believe Amazon should consider for the next version of the Echo Show.
- The device seems to be a little bulky in the back maybe a slim/sleek version without losing video or sound quality would be a good upgrade.
- A larger screen without increasing the overall size of the Echo Show would be a welcomed upgrade.

author: Mike K
title: Display Screen failing after two months.
content:
The Echo Show works great, but after just two months (and the return period has expired) the top 2 inches of the display screen is now flickering. I’ve contacted customer service and after being passed-off to two different Reps, all they can tell me is to reboot the device, I’ve emailed Amazon again and I am requesting a refund.

After searching the internet I see display flickering is not unique to my device. There could’ve been a bad batch of display screens. If it’s not a widespread issue Amazon should simply refund those customers with bad displays, if it is a widespread issue effecting thousands of customers I can understand why Amazon will not issue a refund and will continue to delay addressing the problem.

author: Amazonian
title: Fun but without instructions.
content: Once up and running it has been fun to have. Needs a  Amazon web link to in depth video on set-up since included instructions are for the most part useless. Know it can do tons more than what I use it for but unlike my brother I don't live for electronic gizmos. Programing "if this then that" isn't my thing. Wish it had its own phone book instead of using mine. Makes it hard since everybody"s phone book is organized differently or not as inclusive of extended family members or friends.

author: T W
title: Disappointed
content: I have to admit I was very disappointed with the Echo Show that I got for Christmas, which surprised me as I already owned the Echo as well as the Dot and loved them.The Show has a lot of glitches (ignores questions, stops games in progress) and does not respond as well as the Echo does. However I really wanted it so that I could see my recipes on Pinterest (instead of using my phone) but the Show does not let me access Pinterest. It does offer some recipes from Allrecipes but not nearly what you can access or store on Pinterest Also when you ask to see what is on Amazon Prime she only shows you 25 shows...the same 25 shows each time you ask. So if you want to see some thing else on Prime you need to ask for it by name. Also it would be great if you could stream other providers such as Netflix. Overall I would rate it as just ok. Hopefully Amazon will provide updates to resolve these issues.

author: Myyrdraal
title: Report Your Defective Device
content:
Device screen glitched after 2-3 months of use. Changed brightness level and screen glitched, resulting in defective return and refurbished replacement.

No Youtube play.

Lack of connected video apps outside of the Amazon ecosystem.

author: Barefoot20duchess
title: perfect! no regrets, wise buy
content:
i was hesitant to buy this and has been on my wishlist for so long. the price was the one thing but with the $100 discount was a big difference and same price as the echo spot with big screen difference.
quick delivery. secured packaging. what amazes me is the touch screen, voice recognition, options, and sound.

author: Wanderer81321
title: Amazing Sound!
content: My wife loves this. I have 2 echo, and 1 Dot. My wife wanted the SHOW so she could sing along with the words. The sound on this device is incredible. When she wants more power she blue tooth’s it to our sound system and she now has a full on sound system blaring through the house! Definitely a good purchase.

author: Felickz
title: The wedding ring I have been looking for!
content:
What an awesome accessory to the show - perfect size auto adjusting wedding band.  Made out of QUALITY rubber.  I quickly unboxed and took the band off the USB cable and it hasn't left my finger since.  Annoyed by those ads for $40 rubber rings from crowdsourced companies.. this one comes for free + cost of show!  Perfect for working on electrical... i have previously popped a 100A 24VDC breaker with my ring:: oops.  Worried about getting de-gloved ( if you don't know don't Google it) - this features break away design.  My leather steering wheel is all scratched from my old band, my new car will not suffer the same fate!  I have been in the ocean,  chlorinated pools, taken a few showers, worked on greasy cars - still looks new!

Even bought a second show so I could have two!

Amazon, will you sell these rubber bands separate?

author: Patrick Glose
title: Round two
content: I had to send it back because the video was choppy, even for displaying basic stuff like weather.  It's fine now, but I like my Google display better (has youtube).

author: ceb
title: Five Stars
content: fun, new Alexa  experience.

author: DPaq
title: Good, not great
content: It is great to play music on or ask questions to. It doesn't always hear me and I have to repeat myself multiple times (it's set up in the middle of my apt, easily accessible). One day it disconnected itself from the internet and wouldn't work, within less than a month of having it. That was odd and a bit worrisome for the future.

author: Rym K
title: Excels as an office tool
content: Works great as a conference phone. The speakers and mic array seem to be at no disadvantage from the other circular designs. Amazing option for a home office version of echo or anywhere you want to review compatible cameras

author: Amazon Customer
title: So Disappointed.
content: Can not get info. App is for other Alexa devices but not the echo show. No info. or help is available. I bought two of these and regret it deeply.

author: katrina
title: So easy to use
content: What did I ever do without my little family of Echos?  I have 3 dots, one of the original Echos ( large one ) and now the Echo Show. So easy to use, set-up, figure out and everything plus more, you expect with an Amazon Echo product. I named the Echo Show my Ms Show-n-tell and she is exactly that.  She shows and tells me everything I ask of her.  I also bought a wall mount for her but I like her better on the counter tilted a shade backwards sitting on the mount. Nothing but good words from me and I promise you will enjoy having yours ! Tons of cues that run on the screen at the bottom like happening now, trending things, weather, things to try. You can change the wallpaper with your photo's. the sound is great and when you connect all your echo products like mine are, when you play music the sound echo's thru the house. My dots and show saved me a bunch of money as I was going to have speakers installed in my home for music, now I don't have to. You are going to be happy with yours !!!!

author: P Crume
title: Best gift ever!
content: I bought four of the Echo Shows during the Prime Day special (got a $100 discount on each!) for myself and my three children as early Christmas gifts. It’s been one of the best purchases I’ve ever made! After we all got used to how to use them, we have found them to be an exceptionally good way to communicate! We have had some great conversations and fun times using the many features it offers. All of us are staying in touch much more often now than we used to. My grandson calls whenever he wants which is a plus for us since we live in New Mexico and he lives in WA State, as do our other children. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of speakers on the Show. The sound is great and truly amazing!  We use our Echo Shows to communicate on a daily basis...actually sometimes several times a day! My husband, who is not a super techie guy, enjoys using it too to do his favorite...talk sports with our sons!  I am so glad I decided to get these as gifts...we’ll worth the price.

author: Grafangel1art
title: I love the future.
content:
I am really starting to love this. I had a few echo dots and was interested in some more advanced tech. I bought this on sale, and that made it worth it for me. I am uncertain whether the product is limited in it's capabilities or I am limited with how I use it. I do however think it is really fun to have and explore. I really want Alexa to learn my name and feel more personal. I also wish I could figure out more use for the screen. I am a fan though and can't wait for more developments.
The unit is sleek and not too big or too small. It has a nice sized screen which goes dark at night. The clock is perfect and the alarm is pleasant. I love the animated screensavers but wish there were more.

author: Jessica
content:
I like being able to play music and audible books.  I like that I can set it to remind me of meds.

I dislike just about everything else. It is so frustrating asking it to do things and it taking five times to get it right.

author: Symon Fenix
title: conflicted
content: Love the sound.  Deep and rich. Need to make the clock bigger at night. Or ha e it connect to your in-house PnP devices for the backgrounds. Love the connection to my BT speaker but hate that once you do, the Show speaker stops working.

author: Tommy
title: Cool so far, needs one major feature...
content:
So far this seems like a pretty cool product, i'm still a bit confused with the Amazon calling feature and how to ask it to call what, for example i have a echo show at home in my kitchen and in my office downtown.  I want to call my home so i suppose i just say Alexa, call..."the name of the home device" but im not really sure.

Also, id like to see some type of PIN feature or lock feature, for example when i leave my office technically my employees could walk in and say Alexa show me the living room cam and see my living room, when i leave my office it would be nice if i could lock the unit somehow so i wouldn't have to worry about people possible looking at my cams or going through my calendar, photos etc...

author: Lamar Childers
title: Not Bad, can use some improvements but a fun device nevertheless.
content: My Echo Show arrived in the mail very fast. I ordered this yesterday around this time and the package was here the next day about roughly 12 hours after I ordered this on Amazon. The best thing about this device is the premium sound of the speakers which is really superb. The Voice comands is good but not great, the design of the device is a little bland but not ugly. The device is easy to use and it is fun to use. The echo show still has some room for growth and improvements but over all, it will do for bow.

author: K. Bennett
title: we love the personal touch this has allowed
content:
This is my FIFTH Alexa device but first with a screen. We put it in the kitchen and the screen has added a dimension we could only speculate about before.
- I have customized the desktop screen to be a photo of our family, we love the personal touch this has allowed.
-Many songs are played with the lyrics scrolling by; pure joy as you can sing along while preparing dinner?
- you are shown purchase options, the weather and so much more.

This barely describes it but we love it!

author: Dianne
title: Defective unit
content: After about a month and a half unit started to have flashing lines across the screen. Amazon will not replace only option is to return. Why am I going to pay full price when I got a discount on prime day??? Other than that it is useful and good sound quality. Makes things easier in the kitchen and other daily tasks. Review would have been higher, but the fact that Amazon isn't going to stand by their product and replace a defective unit caused me to drop my review.

author: TJ
title: Ehhh
content: Functional but stupid. Never can answer my questions. Takes a lot of time And research to customize. I still can't figure out how to save my music stations. its not syncing to my other dot's.  I'm not a fan. It's also tripping, as in cuts in and out while in use.

author: Julie Fey
title: Audio and video great, wish the screen was larger
content: My son got the Echo Show for me and I love it. When we video chat for the first time I was impressed with the audio. His voice was clear and loud enough for my hard of hearing Mom to hear easily. The video was also great. The only drawback was the size of the screen, I hoped that it would be a little larger but that's not a big problem. Overall it is a great addition to the no savvy tech person. Easy set up and use. It would also be cool if you could cast it to a smart tv.

author: Bob Hughes
title: Perfect for my Senior Mother
content:
I have about a dozen echo devices in my home I was looking away to communicate with my mother in her senior living center

this is perfect I have it just as one of my devices and I can drop in on mom there at her house completely hands off

It is part of my Eco devices but it's hooked up to moms Wi-Fi brain dead easy to set up

author: HC
title: Mot ready for primetime
content:
Wish it was better. Needs to connect to more devices like Belkin cameras
Nest thermostat took over a day for Alexa to find
Music feature is good
Trying to get Alexa to play a video kept giving me Kindle books
Hope this is not the next amazon phone fiasco

author: Kindle Customer
title: Buy a Fire tablet you'll be happier.  This is junk.
content:
Buy a fire tablet, it can do more.  They have limited the video streaming {NO Netflix, YouTube, funimation and etc THAT works on normal fire TV}... further more getting it to show specific shows or episodes is like pulling teeth.

They limited the functionality in the hopes of getting people to be more reliant on there streaming.  Wish I did not buy this.

author: Joanna
title: Kids love to call grandmom and see her on the screen
content: I cannot leave without my Alexa!!! I bought 2, one for my mom and one for myself for Christmas! Kids love to call grandmom and see her on the screen. My daughter watches her Baby Einstein on it and my son watches Amazon videos on it. I get all my recipes sent by Alexa directly to my phone. Not to mention that she helps me out to find my phone when I can't find it by calling my number!!! Best purchase ever!!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Adware-like suggestions on the bottom of the screen cannot be turned off.
content: Yes, it does what it says it will do... sound is good, video is good, touchscreen menus are easy to navigate; however, like many others, I am annoyed by yet unable to turn off the "Try this" feature that shows on the screen almost all the time. For over $200 this device should be something that peacefully sits in my house and does what I want it to do, not forcing me to read ad-like bloatware-style (un-removable) suggestions I do not want to see. This device would be 4 stars + if they would allow customers to turn off that singe feature. Yes, it's that annoying. I don't want to look at a clock and see suggestions. I want to see a clock. I don't want to look at what song is playing in Pandora and see suggestions, I want to see just the song. ... and so on. If I want to look up what the device can do, that's in the menus, I can do that. I can use Google. I can use Amazon Help. I do *not* need to see suggestions all the time. Please, Amazon, allow customers to turn this off.

author: ehuey62
title: Not ready for the real world
content: It’s ok. I don’t see the excitement because of the limitations and poor sound quality. I have more problems with repeating myself or Alexa can’t find what I want. The phone function still need some work and video quality is sub par for this day and age. I expected more or at least a fully functioning device that could control my smart home better. The calendar function doesn’t integrate well with Outlook.

author: John Brand
title: I am very disappointed in the echo show
content: I am very disappointed in the echo show.. I bought it because I was under the impression that I would be able to watch YouTube videos.. Not the case.. In reality, it really doesn't do anything more for me than the echo.. Would not recommend..

author: Ricky
title: Poor voice recognition
content: I had high hopes for the Echo Show, but it has one glaring flaw. Unless you're nearby and facing the Show, the voice recognition is terrible.  I have mine in the kitchen and when I'm in the living room, it's about 12 feet away and I'm facing it's side.  It hears my commands maybe 60% of the time while my original Amazon Echo which is in the bathroom much farther away has no problems hearing my commands in a normal tone.  That really surprised me.  None of the special features of the Show, including the display, are enough for me to recommend purchasing it over the Amazon Echo 1st generation.  I'd happily trade this one in for another 1st generation Amazon Echo.

author: Sagsma
title: Has potential but may stop working after 30 days!
content: Bought to use as a toddler monitor and for basically everyday news, weather, music, reminders and alarms etc. great device until it stopped working after literally 4 weeks! There goes my 30 days return!

author: Mark B.
title: I searched to see if Google Home is going to come up with a screen like Echo Show
content: I wasn't sure if I'd keep this or not when I know very well that YouTube is not supported. I thought I could use Vimeo instead. The only thing that sets Echo Show apart from Google Home is that this one has a screen. I searched to see if Google Home is going to come up with a screen like Echo Show. After reading an article that Google Home will have a screen sometime in 2018, I decided instantly to return Echo Show. No matter how wonderful Vimeo can be, it is not a match to YouTube. If Google Home could come up with a screen with YouTube supported, I am more than willing to wait another calendar year to buy it.

author: beach bum
title: great product, but drop-in comes automatically enabled, so you must turn it off yourself if you don't want this feature.
content: I love my echo shows and my other ten amazon devices..but wanted to make everyone aware.  Your amazon software AUTOMATICALLY has enabled the drop-in feature on all your devices.  If you don't want this, you have to go into the phone app and turn to off, for each device.  And amazingly, drop-in has  has been re-enabled without our intervention, perhaps by the calling function being used, which I think is supposed to be different than the drop in?  So if you value your privacy, check this setting on each device occasionally. If someone knows of a way to disable all devices at one time, please let me know!

author: timothy g kelly
title: Great for elderly parents!!
content: Outstanding product! Bought for my mom and family so that my elderly mom, who cannot use her hands to call or recieve calls, can communicate with us.  I did need to buy her a basic cell phone but never even take it out of the drawer! This product has given me back my mom!

author: Labrie Family
title: Easy to use for any busy person/family
content:
Looks nice and sleek. Great to use daily. The app (apple iPhone) works well with it. So many great uses, lists, reminders, timers, calls/drop in, and with multiple ones you can use Alexa as an intercom system in your house!
Just wish Youtube would be available on it. And it doesn't seem to "know how to answer" a lot of Google-able things.

author: Linda
title: I love the new Echo Show I purchased two of them ...
content: I love the new Echo Show I purchased two of them one for myself and one for my mother, she loved that she's able to just call me if she fell and I'm able to see and check in on her frequently, I'm thinking of purchasing a couple more they're nice to have in your home in different rooms I would recommend these to everyone

author: Amazon Customer
title: Drumrolllll..... THUD
content: I gotta think Amazon must pencil push these reviews. Or perhaps I’m the only guy that bought a lemon...Idk..... At first I thought it was too far from my WiFi signal but I’m pretty sure it doesn’t need WiFi to tell me how much time is left in my timer. It was a swing and a miss purchase for me. That’s just one example of how it frustrates the heck out of us (we aren’t old people)

author: kris redick
title: I love the idea of them
content: I got 2 echo shows and I love the idea of them. We got them to replace our video baby monitor. Again, I love the idea but sometimes the performance leaves something to be desired. Some times when I say "show me the nursery" it goes right to it, and s ok sometimes it takes 4 or 5 attempts to get a connection. Aside from that its other features are pretty cool. We use the video chat from the upstairs bedroom to the down stairs kitchen or even from our cellphones when one of us is out and about. I like the visual representation of the weather and other little things like that. It's also great for quick entertainment for children and cartoons. If they could just expand a few of the available features on the Alexas in general but especially the show since it has a screen. Over all I think I would do it again if I had the choice.

author: Wu
title: I love this Echo Show
content: I love this Echo Show. I had the Echo last year and found it was great to listen to music, news, weathers and order from Amazon but the Echo Show moves up another level where I can see all the lyrics and sing along. I can call my friends and chat over the Echo Show. I am sure there will be more apps in the future. Love this and highly recommend this to everyone.

author: D. H.
title: Great way to chat by distance!
content: My wife actually uses it. I asked her how she'd rate it and she gave it 5 stars of 5 stars. All I know is we use it all the time to "face time" with our adult children and our grandkids. It's fun.

author: zteacherC
title: Go get you an Echo Show !!
content: We are in LOVE with our Echo Show! Just wish more friends had the Echo Show also, so we could "facetime" with each other. But it is SO much fun and we LOVE the added touch screen versus the Echo dot or dot plus.

author: Lori
title: It's a nice addition to my home.
content: I had it in my living room but moved it to my bedroom. It's so easy to ask Alexa what time it is or to play some music without having to get out of bed or turn on a light. I like the way it dims automatically when I turn out the lights. The sound quality is pretty good, but not great.

author: Alice M. Grove
title: Love the Echo Show!
content: The longer I have the Echo Show the more I love it!  Every day I am discovering something new it can do.  The speakers are excellent and the visuals are so sharp and clear.  It continues to surpass all my expectations.  What else will Amazon do next?  I can hardly wait..

author: R
title: It's Amazing!
content: I received this a s a gift and this device is amazing, we love the ability to see the song lyrics on the screen, watch movies while cooking, follow recipes while baking. The sound quality is excellent. I also have a 1st Generation Echo which I always thought sounded good, but this thing is even better. Also the microphone is much more sensitive and accurate. I can say "Alexa" from upstairs and it can hear me and do what I tell it to! I also like that I can link the Echos together and have the same music playing in each room. Its a pretty amazing device. If your think about getting one, do it!

author: Joe Zinck
title: Echo show is a lot of fun to have in your kitchen. I recommend this product for any home.
content: We use the product for communicating with out of town family, news, weather, music, etc. The app however needs considerable work. It is slow, difficult to navigate and not very intuitive. My home stereo has bluetooth available but I can't get the Echo show to connect. My Ipad and apple phone connect no problem.

author: Jason M Shearer
title: Game changer for our family
content: We were looking for something to help stay on top of the schedule of our busy family and the Echo Show fits the bill.  They boys can see sports schedules and more.  They love playing science trivia and it adds a completely new dimension to our smarthome.  The video drop-in feature is awesome and I can see a few family members getting these for Christmas to keep in touch.

author: L. Tope
title: Still loving it
content:
I’ve had my Echo Shows for quite some time now.  Have one in my kitchen and one in the bedroom.  I have many connected home devices (mostly wink products) and they work perfectly with Echo.  I like the new routines in which I can say “goodnight” and it turns off all the lights in the house and turns on my fan and tells me goodnight (although it would be nice if there was a random assortment of what it says).

My wish list:
Better App- I use the shopping and to-do list a lot but I think the app could be so much better as your home control station and planner
Recipe Box- This would be super convenient for my kitchen Echo if it would leave open the recipe and I could ask for it to read the next line.  Even better if they would partner with HomeChef and have their recipes and I could pick my future orders.
Water Proof Echo- This would be awesome for in the shower and outside.  It would need to be a beefed up version of the tap.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Your kids will love it!
content: We love everything about it. And we don't know all I'm sure that we are still learning how to use Echo Show. Our grandchildren love it, They are always asking her questions. I like that I walk into the kitchen in the morning and I just ask her the weather for the day, Or if I was to hear music I just tell her what I want to hear and she will play. We are so happy with the Echo Show.

author: HsinY
title: I have this on the kitchen counter and my husband ...
content: I have this on the kitchen counter and my husband use it to watch video or catch up news when he is eating his breakfast. I'm looking to get another for my home office.

author: MyTai
title: Best Echo! Just get it
content: There is nothing I can write about the Echo Show that has not been covered by reviewers and critics alike.  So, just get the Echo Show there is no way you will or can be disappointed!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great buy, use it everyday!
content: Love this! Use it for alarms, timers, music, and recipes. Alexa doesn't have the cabailities as Google does, and there are a lot of things she cannot answer. Also I originally bought this so I could watch YouTube, but YouTube no longer partners with Amazon, so that was a bit of a disappointment. Overall, still glad I bought it, and use it everyday. Speaker is great and gets pretty loud for my studio (500sq ft).

author: P. Waters
title: Smooth, wonderful music player, and video cam viewer
content:
Great asset to my home's kitchen. We can see the weather, outdoor temperatures, play music and view our video camera all by voice activation. Game shows are fun and trivia shots are a novel feature. The device will be tied to my smart home apps slowly and carefully.

Slow is smooth and smooth is fast...

author: Dennis C. Berry
title: No wonder they discontinued it.
content: MIne worked for about two months before I had to send it in for a "repair". The screen was flickering which was a common problem. They re-loaded the software and sent It back. Then it worked for about three weeks before the symptoms returned. Now it flickers for around two hours every morning then starts working. It's past the warranty period now and I know I should have kept returning it until it worked but I had the feeling it would never work correctly and didn't need the hassle dealing with it. Life is too short so I consider it money wasted. Amazon should buck up and send me their new model in exchange but somehow I don't see that ever happening. Don't buy this, new or re-furbished.

author: Langston
title: Nice Aleza tool
content: Nice product, I recommend taking a look into the newer generation.  It has quite a few new perks.  I bought this one for my best friend as a gift and she likes it.

author: GABRIEL MEDRANO
title: The Amazon Echo has been upgraded.
content: I'm loving my new Echo Show. The video screen adds so much more value and potential. Movies, tv shows, song lyrics, all extra features that are available with the Echo Show. Oh, it also has a built in camera for taking pics.

author: California gal
title: The Does-All Echo Snow
content: We got it as a Xmas gift.  Very cool and useful.  Alexa seems to talk with you rather than at you.  She answers questions.  When asking the weather report, you get a three day picture of the the forecast, lots more music than the regular cylinder Echo, Echo Show asks you printed questions if you are interested to inquire.  Great useful item. Gives ideas about upcoming important events, and many etc. items.  Love it.

author: D. Reisinger
title: Buy one for you...one for the Grandkids!
content: This thing works...and is getting better every single week! Each week it’s updated with more skills and learning capability.

author: Schukai
title: Echo Show
content: Love the Echo Show, am discovering new things it can do everyday. Super easy to set up and I'm not that knowledgeable when it comes to electronic gadgetry! Just ask my kids! Very good quality.

author: Ronald L. Babb
title: New review - great prodyct
content:
Now that YouTube has been restored to the Show, it is back to being a much used device.  The YouTube access is still a little difficult, A!was defaults to Amazon's music and videos and won't willingly search YouTube but you can force it.

When I first got it, it was great!  Used it in the kitchen watching instructional videos of what I was preparing.  Without YouTube, I don't use it except as a timer.  What a waste.  A Dot would work the same.

author: Patricia Gonzalez
title: How to program it?
content: Hi haven’t been able to program it. And I’m not sure how it work.  I’m not sure how my granddaughter got it to play a  song. But the volume is not a good  Quality.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Visibility
content: I love my Echo show.  I love that I can see my appointments/events on the screen the day before.  I love looking and seeing what Alexa comes up with on the home screen.  My google home device would only beep for reminders, I now just use google home for music.  Way to go Amazon with Echo Show.

author: Debbie Rinaldo
title: this a great find.
content: we got this for my brother with dementia.. he can now see his family when they speak.  you can buy two at a cheaper price.  this way each person in the family has one.  this a great find..

author: jose rivera
title: Accuracy
content: is lacking Accuracy,  the same with the amazon cube you give a verbal command & end up doing something else, very frustrating, not everyone have a irish speaking accent, it need a more verbal accent accuracy for people of tick accent  & different countries especially spanish speaking people is very important that customers get this improvement via firmware or some kind of update, it will not bee fare that amazon release the same amazon echo show or cube with this capabilities instead of giving us the people how overedy got the item a update of some king all of this amazon automation products have a big potential but amazon  be wrong if customer have to pay all over for the same product wee mite bee better of with samsung know coming with their product or google not talking apple but me but me personally would prefer for amazon to have this accuracy products

author: Trish
title: Good speakers
content: I bought this after visiting a friend who had one and it is great.  I understand the frustration of not having YouTube though.  Still good to have-love seeing the words to songs and if you have the Ring doorbell-you never have to get up from your chair...laziness at it's best!  LOL  All in all- a great product with good speakers.

author: Growing old in Canada
title: Family has a music battle war frequently.
content: Awesome device. I bought it at half price.  Love the way it flawlessly interprets commands from a long distance.  The speaker quality is great.  Perfect companion to Spotify and Philips hue. The only thing I would improve is the angle of the camera.  It is pointed too high.  Lots of things to love about it.  Wish it would have more options in names that you can give it.

author: David
title: I would definitely buy again
content: Works great for phone calls to grandparents so they cam see the grand kids. Music,movies,everything is fantastic except figuring out key words to say to Alexa to get it to play the movie or song. (Watch Big Jake) change Big Jake to any movie available to instantly watch the movie. If a movie is unavailable you can purchase the movie. Also has great sound for being so small.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Doesn't last long for the money spent.
content: Well...I enjoyed the Show for the past 8 months but now I can't even listen to music because it keeps cutting out ( and this was my main use for it). I had it going through a Bluetooth receiver to my sound system. I replaced the receiver a couple weeks ago because I thought the was the issue. Nope...the Bluetooth is going on the Show. I'm not happy as I paid close to $200 on this-- I would've hoped it would have lasted longer than this. Unfortunately, I have many echo devices in my home and I'm holding my breath that they will last longer than this did. I don't think I'll be purchasing any more Echo products in the future. I'm so disappointed.

author: L. M. Keefer
title: Especially Love Listening to Audible Books on This
content:
While it's fun to ask the weather, or ask Alexa how to say something in French, what I love MOST about this is to listen to Alexa read my books I have purchased on Audible.

The volume can be raised loud enough to hear the book's content in another room.

I listen while I clean, which makes the cleaning go much faster and more pleasantly.

I was listening to books on my laptop in the home.  My laptop doesn't have the volume or tone quality Alexa has, so I had to listen extra hard, and carry my laptop around which is annoying.

I can work without interruption with Alexa and she can stay in one place.

author: J. Hassler
title: Great Potential Squandered
content: Works great with my Nest camera but ridiculous that Amazon has not resolved feud with Google who continues to block YouTube on the device.  Additionally, the menu system for Amazon Music navigation thru the display is basically non-functional and useless.  So much potential with this device but largely wasted to date.  Holding out hope for a meaningful firmware update to bring this to life but not holding my breath.

author: Yogi (Alexandria)
title: Nice product...still experimenting with it
content: Love it.  my brother purchased it for my birthday. not sure what I was expecting but it right now it is working great for me.  I am able to talk to my girlfriend in California.  Right now we are planning to cook together.

author: USMC
title: The screen is awesome!
content: After being on the fence for months the recent sale was enough to convince me to pick it up. I loved my original Echo but having the screen helps me out so much more to be able to pull up video from my ring products to having the temp and clock as well as different headers flashing across the screen, plus it acts as a digital picture frame. I guess the only con would be price.

author: Uncle John
title: Good addition to alexa family.
content: Great new way to enjoy alexa. Still has some problems. I bought this thinking I can view my ezviz cameras . no way still trying . have to call support email was no help. I do feel all will work out. I will update when I find out more.

author: Maryland_Res
title: Screen/Display issues! Lines across screen
content: Experiencing strange screen behavior! Screen pixelates and is distorted. I can unplug the device to reset it and issues is resolved for a period of time but the issue returns!  Will reach out to Amazon tech support to address or replace the device.

author: C.R.
title: Love it!!! But get rid of the annoying "Try Alexa and "Flash Briefings" from the home screen!
content: First and foremost, I love the Amazon Echo. It's like having your own personal assistant, or having that, hey remind me to, person around which comes in handy when you forget things quickly as life seems to move fast these days. I already own an Echo and an Echo Dot and decided to give the Show a try. As with the other devices I love it....with one annoying exception which is why I'm giving it 4 stars. I love the fact that you can upload your own photo to be shown on the home screen. BUT, as I've read some of the other reviews and I know I'm not alone here, PLEASE GET RID of the, "Try Alexa" suggestions and the "Flash Briefings" that pop up on the home screen. It's very distracting and annoying. I mean seriously, if I want to try something I'll ask the device to try it. And I really don't care that Themed candy was handed out at the UN (which just popped up on the screen). If I want flash briefings, I'll ask. If anyone from the "UPDATE DEPARTMENT" is reading this, please get these things off the screen. Or give us an option to turn them off. KEEP the time and weather though, that's actually the only cool thing. It would be great to simply listen to music and be able to look at the photo you uploaded without all the distractions popping up.Until then, I'll leave the screen dark. Fix this, and it's 5 stars hands down!!!

author: Tech-mom
title: Is it really worth it?
content: Not much useful.  Drop in is good, but would be better if price point was lower so I can buy it for my parents and others.

author: R. Fuller
title: Visuals really benefit overall functionality of the Echo
content: Nice upgrade over the original Echo. The ability to see the content opens up additional ways to use and interact with Alexa. Especially with the tickler screens that provide small bits of content you may be interested in. It moves the Echo from being a box that you have to initiate contact with, to one which can show you what it has to offer and let you decide what to explore.

author: Barb Smith
title: All of Alexa and MORE!
content: FAVORITE:  “Alexa, show me the garage” LEAST FAV:  I stay awake watching the home screen text, and talk to Alexa while husband has wireless headphones on watching TV. I tell her “volume 2” so he won’t be bothered. Funny stuff in old age.

author: Shirley A. Powers
title: The Echo Show answers so many media questions
content:
There is nothing I dislike.
I use it for prime movies and TV originals; phone calls and quite frequently to stream music.

author: Jessie Massey
title: Great display, great sound!
content: We expanded our echo family to include the show, after realizing the spot would be too small for me to read while in the kitchen. I’m very glad we made the investment. I love pulling up recipes and watching trailers on it while cooking. Plus, my kids can easily get cooking tips with just a voice command. I truly feel the Echo Show is a must for every kitchen. The large display definitely makes it worth it! And the sound is amazing.

author: Xtrm302
title: Camera
content:
Fun device but needs minor updates..like Alexa...show camera. Appears it only works from phone app in Drop In mode or we need a 2nd show or spot.
I highly recommend.

author: Elias Makris
title: Shaky Screen
content: I liked it a lot but being that I only bought it in December and it is February 16 and the screen showed shaky lines all over and started failing I’m very disappointed. It means it wasn’t very good quality.

author: Aaron
title: the sound quality/speakers are amazing. I would easily compare it to my Bose ...
content:
Though I don't use the screen very much and don't feel it makes a large enough impact to make for a selling point, the sound quality/speakers are amazing. I would easily compare it to my Bose Soundlink Mini 2. Can play audio very loud and without compromising audio quality.

Speakers alone make this purchase worth every penny.

author: Jason P
title: LOVE!!! Best Amazon Echo product you can buy for your KITCHEN!
content: Pull up recipies, video, video call!!! What else could you ask for at this price? Do not hesitate if you are on the fence this thing is so much fun.

author: Todd Koniezhny
title: Very cool, fun interactive product
content: Love the Show, use mine on a daily basis and can do so many cool and fun things. Picked it up when it was on sale, totally worth it.

author: R. Eydenberg
title: Good overall, can get even better with updates.
content:
Let's start this review at where I was when I made the purchase...that was skeptical.  I am happy to say that after living with the show for 3 days now I can positively say that this device is a great companion to the original Echo and has potential to an unbelievable product.  Here are my pros and cons so far:

Pro
-High quality screen, albeit just a smidge small
-Good audio playback, I would say slightly better than the original Echo
-Integration to other Echo's to create playback groups is awesome
-Screen in general provides a whole new experience (skills like Jeopardy are awesome and the lyric playback feature when you have music on is great.
-Nice compact footprint, photos make this look bigger than it is.
-Photo booth feature is great for parties

Con
-Recent loss of support for YouTube
-Settings limitations (ie. I would like the home screen photo that is linked to my Amazon Prime Photos to change more frequently.  This should be able to be user defined to operate as a photo frame, however this is not the case.  You can work around it by activating a slide show, but that's an extra step that should not have to be taken.  I'm sure this can be fixed in an update...wink wink!

Overall, it has been a great experience so far.  I look forward to features that may be added in the future.

author: BLC
title: LOVE IT! Works as posted
content: Had it for a week almost. LOVE IT! Works as posted. Only thing so far I would change... on the next version it is able to rotate 360, for when you are talking on a video call, surfing or watching a video. Its easy to move for viewing.

author: Diane S.
title: This is a GREAT way to communicate
content: We love this, we are now able to see the grandkids and chat, walk around, make dinner, have a cup of tea while doing so. I t is GREAT, the picture is great and it is easy enough that the kids can call us on their own. We called our daughter who was chatting with her in laws from Montana, she answered on her cell and we could see her, the in laws and they could see us! This could NOT have happened without the Amazon Echo.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I love my Echo Show
content: I love my Echo Show; it has a wealth of information.  I have the ring doorbell and I purchased the Echo Show so that I could see my front door and it works perfectly!!!

author: Adam Shields
title: Some really dumb software decisions, but mostly okay.
content:
I am glad I bought it because it is easy to use for video calling and my parents can't seem to figure out Skype or FaceTime. But it doesn't do several pretty basic things and they are software/design issues.

First primarily I want this to be a video phone between my children and my parents. But this should also be easy to for my parents to use as a video phone with the other grand kids and it is not. Everyone else has either a kindle fire or an iPhone/ipad that can have an alexa app loaded onto it. But basically it is impossible to use for video call to a non-alexia device.

And even my own iPhone can't easily call my own Echo Show without using drop-in. I don't want to use drop-in, I want to use it as a video call, with a real ringer and the ability to answer. But if I am calling a Echo Show on my own account (both mine and my parents are on my account) the only option is drop-in, even if drop-in is disabled.

My 4 year old isn't too bad at using it after a couple of weeks of trying. For Prime videos, I have defaulted to using the watch list because the Echo is dumb about choosing a show when some seasons are on prime and some are not. It will almost always say they can't be watched because they some of the seasons are not available. A similar problem with shows you have purchased. I can get the Show to play them if they are on my watch list, but not if I just ask for them to be played.

Also I wish there was a way to set up parental controls on a device without setting up parental controls in the whole account. My parents have a kindle fire on my account. But if I set up parental controls on the Show, then my parents have to log onto their fire to prove that they are of age. Yes I could solve some of these problems if I kicked my parents off of my Amazon account. But I don't want to do that. My dad likes to be able to read on his kindle and fire, but can't get to books easily. So he asks me to push books to him. That is easy enough for me to do as I have it set up, but it requires that I leave parental controls off of the account as a whole.

I have played with adding smart plugs and a smart light to my house to be controlled by the Show. It works about 80% of the time as it should. Which is annoying. I don't expect perfection. But sometime I just want things to work the way they should.

Also having a Fire TV stick in the same house as the Echo Show is annoying. When the Echo starts thinking you want it to show something on the Fire TV, you basically can't get it to limit it to the Echo Show.

The summary version is that like most Amazon products (except the eink Kindle line) this feels like a beta product. I don't want to pay $300 for two Echo Shows and then wait for stuff to work right.

author: Kirk Walker
title: Not easy to set up for my elderly parents
content:
I purchased two of these exclusively so that my elderly parents could make and receive calls.  They do not have a mobile phone, so I cannot set up the Echo Show for them to receive calls.  This could have been the perfect phone solution for people with poor vision and dexterity, or with Parkinson's Disease.  Regular phones can be difficult to use for those who can neither remember nor see phone numbers but remember names. This device cannot be used properly by those without a mobile phone.

Update: Amazon called me within minutes of posting this review and offered some work arounds. Great customer service!  The device can be set up on my account as one would for a child with just a few contacts.  One can also use an old smart phone and a cheap temporary SIM  card, just to set it up.

author: Jarrod Blackwell
title: Could've bought 6 Echo Dots...
content: Based on the preview video that was released for the Show, I bought 2 to put by our bed to watch our 5 month old daughter. The "Alexa, show me the Nursary" seemed like a great idea, and I am already a fan of my Echo and several Echo Dots. But what is less obvious from the video is that the cameras used for the baby's bed appear to be Netgear Arlo and do not support audio. They must be using a traditional baby monitor for audio and when they hear the baby cry they ask the show to let them see the camera. For us, the time that it takes to do that we could just walk to her room. So the devices aren't exactly doing what I thought they would. I purchased an EZVIZ mini pro camera for the baby's bed and the EZVIZ app supports audio and only had about a 4 second delay and the Show doesn't support audio and has about a 25 second delay. It's really disappointing. The Show is cool for the little music and video things that it does, but I am either going to have to find a camera that will do what I want or find some other task for the Show to do.

author: Phillip
title: Not ready yet
content: My favorite thing is being able to start an audible book or music right before I go to bed. Very easy to use. Unfortunately, I haven't found much else that's useful to do other than that and controlling my lights. Phone calls I still prefer with my phone as no one else I know has a show for video calls.

author: KSMcClan
title: ... item at my work party & so far I love it! I'm still learning all of it's features
content: I just won this item at my work party & so far I love it! I'm still learning all of it's features, but my favorite so far is that it connects to my Ring doorbell so I can just say "Alexa, show me the front door." Can't wait to see what else it can do.

author: Walam
title: VIDEO CALLING AT ITS BEST PLUSI MPROVED SPEAKER QUALITY
content: A TRULY GREAT UPGRADE.  THE VIDEO CALLING USING ALEXA PLUS THE SUPERB PICTURE QUALITY MAKE THIS A PRODUCT ALL FAMILY AND FRIENDS SHOULD OWN!

author: baa
title: Popping sounds
content: My son bought this for me for Christmas.  I have used it about three weeks. Now I am getting popping and no sounds after it is on for a while. I tried several things and still after about 10 minutes it starts again  Couldn't find any answers on line so he is taking it back to the store. I would love it if this hadn't happened

author: Chesti
title: This is awesome, it does exactly what it’s intended to
content: This is awesome, it does exactly what it’s intended to, And I use for everything not only music but it also it reads me the news, weather and if I’m reading or writing and I forgot or don’t know the spelling of a word there is echo (Alexa) to save and there are other features u can tweak but out space to talk about, just get this thing it will be a good appreciated investment...

author: William B.
title: Good for face to face calling.
content: We are happy to be able to easily talk with our kids on a decent sized screen. Easy to get weather updates etc. Disappointed that it seems limited in search capabilities, and is mostly aimed at " trending" news. Might be more. Pleased as I work more with it. Bottom line, it does what I bought it for.

author: Sandra Robinson
title: Easy to set-up, easy to use
content: We love Alexa. Purchased for Christmas as a gift to us!  Easy to set up, easy to use.  No issues at all. I love the fact that she can pull music from my iPhone and play whatever we ask her to play.  The lists and reminders are wonderful.  Makes life so easy.

author: AWV
title: Little difference
content: The speech recognition is not as good as the omnidirectional original tower version of Echo.  Making it a nuance at times. Other than video there is little difference.

author: Bill G.
title: Echo Show & siblings light up our world !
content:
The gadget lovers gadget !

Echo Show expands on the echo line by adding video pizazz to an already excellent product design series . . .

Don’t beam me up Scotty . . . There’s  finally intelligent life down here.

We have multiple Echos, Dots and now 3 Shows online in our Office, Home & Shore house . . . using voice remotes and all the wake words . . . its not only fun but has upped or productivity 3 fold !

We’ve integrated security and a myriad of automation controls as well.

###

author: M Marvin
title: We then tried to use commands that you can’t do on a Gen 1 Echo like watch videos
content:
We live in a household with a Gen 1 Echo and a Gen 2 Echo along with several Dots. We got this to “upgrade” our Gen 1 in the bedroom.

We immediately tested it along side our Gen 1 for audio quality. The Gen 1 was louder and had a more solid base and subwoofer.

We then tried to use commands that you can’t do on a Gen 1 Echo like watch videos. As several users have pointed out, there is no YouTube. So instead of loading other video repositories on the web, it attempts to load YouTube and then errors out.

***UPDATE*** 48 hours after connecting the device, it did begin to correctly react to requests to play videos.  I suspect there was a software update that ran and now points it the video repository (not YouTube) that Amazon uses.  The videos are good quality and definitely improves the overall value of the device.  i have updated my review to 3 stars.

The one saving grace is that the lyrics displaying while songs are playing is cool.

My return window closes on January 31st. If the YouTube issue is not fixed by then, I will be returning mine and going back to the Gen 1 in the bedroom.

author: Michael M.
title: Fun gadget to have and can do a lot of ...
content:
Fun gadget to have and can do a lot of things including connecting to your Google calendars but it does not have true internet capability as you would know it in the form of a Microsoft Edge or Explorer, Google Chrome or any other application that gets you into the cloud. You can video conference different rooms within the home or to friends and family who live across the block or across the country.  There are several apps (Amazon calls them "Skills") that you can download for free which help expand the usefulness of the device.  It is great for music fans and is obviously designed to work best with Amazon Music.  It is easy to pick up on how to use all the functions.

The biggest problem is that the disputes that Amazon and Google are having with each other is preventing YouTube from being displayed (at least as of the time of this review on 12/09/17).  If your primary reason to purchase a Show unit was to be able to use it in the kitchen and watch food prep videos via YouTube you are at least temporarily out of luck until Amazon and Google can come to some sort of terms.  At this point you may as well save your money and just use your tablet or phone.

It could also become a very expensive paperweight if you purchase thinking of being able to connect into the "Google World" and the two mega companies cannot agree on how to work with each other and Google decides to cut off all access to their services from any of Amazon's products which would include the entire Echo family of products.  If they can learn to play nice together this would be a fantastic product.

Until Amazon and Google establish a cease fire agreement I can only give a rating of 3 out of 5 stars.  It would be a 5 out of 5 if I would know the two companies will come to some sort of mutual understandings and put the customers of both organizations ahead of their petty schoolyard arguments.

author: Bill P.
title: The screen is not worth the aggravation!
content: Within a few months the screen started to distort and flicker. Contacted customer support, they asked me to send it back for repair because return date had expired. Received it back, within two weeks the distortion and flickering has returned more than original issue.

author: Gary
title: Love mine
content:
I have it sitting next to my desk and can add some many reminders the  minute I think of them plus the music is terrific
I am looking at connecting to a smart hub in the near future

author: minnesota
title: Fun to have Alexa
content: I bought one for my daughter and liked it so much I got one.  I can find any song for my 3;year old grandchild which has been a wonderful experience.  As in : “Who Put the Bomp in the Bomp Shoo Bomp Shoo Bomp Who Put the Ram in the Ram a Lama Ding Dong”  That was the hit song around here this week.  Alexa is very good at helping find obscure songs and the Toddler Time series of music is very well curated.  Took about 10 seconds to plug it in and get it going.  The speaker is incredibly good.  And I can find all my favorite classical music.  Recommend to everyone.  I use it everyday.  Very small sits in the counter nicely.

author: John Carey
title: Better than expected!
content: The sound quality is better than I expected and it keeps showing me things it can do that I had no idea.  My latest surprise was when I had it play some music and it showed the words like karaoke!  Sweet!  Also, with cameras around the house I can view anywhere with a vocal command.

author: Shachi Rana
title: Echo Show surpasses expectations.....
content: Wish the screen was slightly larger, however the quality of the videos and sound are excellent.  I use these Shows as the new intercom system in my home.  I prefer the black color to the white but the white Shows don't look that bad either.  Love the different skills that Echo show has, and the additions that Amazon keeps doing every day.

author: need to know.
title: Like it going to buy another. only downfall I wish it was compatible with more wireless cameras.
content: a voice controlled Stereo, A timer, a dictionary, Calculator, News, Weather, intercom can check on my mother, talk to my wife from office to home, leave messages, Like it going to buy another. only downfall I wish it was compatible with more wireless cameras.

author: Roy Eastham
title: Amazon Echo and Fire should go independent!
content: Come on, Google! Grow up and let Amazon make it's own version of YouTube since you don't have the maturity to give full use on the Amazon Echo Show! Maybe Amazon Prime Video should negotiate on a YouTube type streaming service and Amazon create an Echo and Fire HD that aren't affiliated with you at all! Silk browser pretty nice...Amazon...please, split away from Google completely!

author: Brian K. Dutton
title: POOR VIDEO RECEPTIOM
content: I purchased in July and  the SHOW has intermittent and continuing video reception problems. It is sitting right beside the 5ghz modem and still has lines and blinking screen. I cannot seem to get a hold of Amazon to try a fix or return for replacement. VERY FRUSTRATED!

author: Roger Wagner
title: Works well for "dropping in" on Mom.
content:
PLUS - Great product.  Set up a hotspot and Show to be able to "drop in" on my 88 year old mom.

MINUS -  Not a Show issue, but problem occurs when the hotspot gets unplugged during cleaning and needs to be turned on again, Mom has trouble getting this accomplished.  Not sure how it works but my Show says "Mom 's Home; recently active", but can't connect "Mom is unavailable."
- Drives me crazy that I can't get the DATE to show on the home screen.
- Also replaced original Echo (dropped and broken) with the Show, and can't figure out how to delete the Echo from the Alexa app.

author: Frankie D
title: Great device and with Prime Music at 3
content: Great device and with Prime Music at 3.99 per month it is a great deal.  The screen adds allot.  Tks.

author: GJ Karluk
title: Adds a new dimension to the Echo experience!
content: I have plenty of other Echo devices (9 to be exact) and they all work very well, but having the Echo Show really changed things up for me. I was not used to the visual component of the experience, alarms and reminders that sound and also display on the screen!

author: Diane
title: Really fun but useful too!
content: Love it love it.  Have it in my family room and  set up to change my furnace thermostat, look at my front door camera and play any of my Prime photo albums that I tell it to!  Love that it can sync with my Echo Dot and play music "everywhere" simultaneously, and I can see the lyrics.  Still learning all the skills, and even though at this point it seems like a "toy" I've found some really good skills that are productive (like telling me what the traffic is for my commute).  I agree it's a little thick, but it's not like I'm moving it around.  Can't wait to get my Echo Buttons to play games!

author: Brian Richardson
title: Not worth the price over the original.
content: We are really trying to like it, but we just can’t. I’m not even taking off pints for the whole YouTube thing. Word recognition, ability to search on the internet, reliability of functions are all sub-par. If I could return it, I would. Only gets two stars because we find the video calls with grandma and grandma are convenient. Truth is, we can do the same with a laptop.

author: S Seymour
title: Listens to your conversations more than what you tell it to do
content: I love the on screen features, including news stories, song lyrics and facetime. But this machine will pause and listen in on conversations more than it listens to instructions. If a new voice comes into the room, it will stop playing music to listen and I have to tell it to play. Very annoying! At times when I say "Alexa off", Alexa will pause to listen but continue playing music. I have to repeat myself sometimes three times to get it to shut off.

author: Galaxy S9 User
title: DO NOT BUY. Without YouTube it's not worth the cost.
content: One of the main reasons I purchased Echo Show was to watch YouTube videos. After it was removed because of Amazon's and Google fued the display has become useless. Amazon has tried to replace video searches with Bing which has been a joke. It can't find the majority of my searches. DON'T BUY THIS DEVICE IF YOU PLAN TO WATCH VIDEOS.  Amazon needs to put their differences aside and make the right choice for their consumers. Do the right thing Amazon and bring back Youtube.

author: kelli RN
title: Love It!!
content: I love my Echo Show! I use it for so much -an alarm, date reminders, control lights ,get weather forecasts, ask questions, reads me  books, listen to music and much more! Money well spent . More than 5 stars . Easy to interact with and program for all sorts of skills

author: Stryker
title: See it after you say it
content: While the product itself is awesome and can control smart home things. Via blue tooth, you can use your phone to make calls, but only to others with an Echo of some sort. It can't open a web browser per se. It can only search for stuff. Also, I'm not able to connect to my Prime Music. It wants me to join another Amazon Music service. It does play videos also from Prime. Maybe I still haven't figured it all out? If you're a liberal, you'll love it. All the apps, etc are all left leaning. Have to search for conservative sites.

author: M. Chick
title: Beware!! If you are buying an Echo Show to utilize a security camera that says "Works with Alexa", It wont do 2 way audio!
content: I have to say that I am a very big amazon device supporter as I have several of the Alexa devices. I recently wanted to be able to see and hear what was going on with an outdoor security camera that I got the day after getting the echo show which was the only reason I got the show. The camera was a highly rated one with 2 way audio, etc. Description said "Works with Alexa" as many of the better security cameras do. After installing I find out that I can see the live video on the echo show but there is no 2 way audio. I couldn't believe this so I started a chat session with Amazon support and they sent me to 3 different "groups" and passed me to 7 different support people including the "Camera" group. No one could answer my question and was very hesitant to make any claims on way or the other. I believe that there is much mis leading information and claim made by not being specific that 2 way audio is not supported on the echo show. I was made aware that the amazon cloud cam may be able to do two way audio but I wanted an outdoor security camera, not an indoor camera that will let Amazon deliveries in the front door. All the claims from several security cameras including the companies purchased by Amazon are quick feature the 2 way audio while stating "Works with Alexa" It needs to say "Only half works with Alexa"!! Very disappointed with Amazon.

author: Christopher D. Dunn
title: Drop in feature is still in beta
content:
The drop in feature is still beta.... I am an early adopter.  I have an echo, a dot, and two shows.  The shows can "drop in" to each other without problem.  The shows can also drop in to the dot.  However, neither show can drop into the original echo.  In fact, when I want to drop into the echo from either show, I will instead be rerouted and drop in to the other show.  In addition, I have one show that is connected by Bluetooth to my receiver.  I always disconnect the Bluetooth when not in use.  However, when I when I want to drop in to that particular show, it will connect by Bluetooth to my receiver, my receiver will turn on involuntarily, and amazon unlimited music will play.
I have spent hours on the phone with customer service.  All echos are updated and been reset multiple times.  I have been told more than once that I will be contacted by a higher end customer service person that is familiar with all the ins and outs of the shows and the drop in feature and together, we will solve this problem.  That has not happened.  In this instance, Amazon has failed miserably.  The drop in feature should be a great one--- but in this instance, it is almost useless.

author: Vickie Jarvinen
title: Who needs a spouse when you have Alexa?
content: Echo Show is awesome. What more can I say? My 4th Alexa (2 given as gifts). Wish I could rename it Echo because it is a Echo Show BUT my Husky is named Echo.

author: Brian
title: Basically a music box....Google did it better
content:
Hope you like music, weather, and flash briefings because that's all this is. Without linking to this Amazon product or that Amazon service, you can't do much but play music off of Spotify or Pandora. Also, because of Amazon's crippling immature fear of competition, there is no longer YouTube support.
Don't bother asking this thing questions. Unless you word things with pinpoint precision, Alexa can't answer anything. Audio visual searches are appalling, and without a decent internet connection, this thing becomes an expensive paper weight.....you can't even turn off the screen.

author: Blue
title: no youtube = not worth it anymore
content:
*EDIT 10/1- to clarify my review, for those who don't know, Google has decided not to allow the echo to access youtube anymore, they say it violates their terms of service.  They did this out of the blue and without any warning to customers.  I personally think this was a jerk move, and that they did it because they have their own home assistant coming out on the market soon.

I loved this until it stopped working with youtube a few days ago.  That decreased it's functionality and usefulness by about 95%.  I feel like I was duped because I bought this under the assumption that it would play youtube videos.  I hope Google and Amazon can iron things out- if they start allowing youtube viewing again I will update my rating.

author: Tracie
title: Love Alexa products
content: Still learning how all the features work on the show but so far it's doing what I expected and then some. I have several other Alexa devices and the show is my favorite with having the larger screen and overall functionality. I'm not tech savvy so I'm learning as I go but I would definitely recommend this item.

author: lfve75
title: Happy with purchase but improvements to make features more reliable are definitely needed
content: For the most part I'm thrilled with my purchase but I took a star off due to the fact that the scheduled Do No Disturb feature does not work.
