It works the first night but then fails to go into Do Not Disturb mode on subsequent nights.  The last thing I want is for my Echo show to announce notifications in the early hours of the day.

author: Johnnie
title: It doesn't play Netflix, hulu or anything else other than prime video.
content: I really enjoy all of amazon products. I have 2 dots, a cloud cam, 2 fire sticks, 2 fire hd and 2 shows. I was definitely disappointed in that the show didnt play other streaming services like Netflix, and even YouTube. As much as it cost, it should be able to. I hope they update it and make it available.

author: Gizmo
title: Buyer beware. Drop in function doesn't work properly when using the Alexa app.
content:
To be clear:  I like my Echo devices.  However, if you want to see what your dog is doing while you are away.  It may or may not work.  The Drop in function doesn't work properly when I try using the Alexa app. In my case, mostly not at all.  Worked fine for a few weeks till it didn't. Worked yesterday, first time in weeks, does not work today.

Alexa tech support has proven equally as frustrating. They have been working the issue for almost two weeks.  Can we just get it fixed already?

Pros:
Literally all other functions on the app and the devices  work better than good.  They work great!!!  And I certainly do enjoy using them.

Most of, not all of, the Techs have been very polite and very professional and are trying.

Cons:
I've spent appx. $250.00 (+) on video equipment that simply does not work as advertised. Had I known this beforehand I would have only bought the speakers. These devices say Amazon on them by the way.

author: Greg V
title: I liked the look and the fact you can put pictures ...
content: I liked the look and the fact you can put pictures on it. You have to yell at it to get a response and I have to unplug it all the time because it freezes up. I wish I bought another cylinder. I love that one. The Echo Show was a waste of money

author: CB in SJ
title: I bought it to replace a Sony Dash that is ...
content: I bought it to replace a Sony Dash that is no longer supported.  The Show provides about half the functionality as the Dash right now, but has a lot of promise as it evolves -- especially when linked with other Echo devices.

author: shauna stewart
title: The Echo show is pretty Cool!!
content: Purchased from QVC, for a family gift for Christmas and everyone LOVES it!!  I paid around $150.  I put the show in our kitchen, which is the hub for our house.  We stream music constantly, and the sound quality is pretty good.  My kids 16, and 10, think Alexa is awesome, you can ask her silly questions and jokes. We also purchased 3 dots to sprinkle around the house.  They are used for daily alarms for my kiddos instead of a clock.  Sometimes she doesn't quite understand what we're trying to ask, but I think that could be the way we're asking the question.  Overall I think the Echo Show is great!!

author: DrRESeacord
title: Great "household hub"
content: A month or so ago, we *almost* bought a smart refrigerator.  At first we laughed when we saw it, but then we became very interested in all the things it could do.  We ended up not purchasing it - it cost $500 more than the refrigerator we bought.  Then we learned about the Echo Show.  It seemed to have all the things that drew us to the smart fridge, but smaller and could play music.  And it was less than half the price.  Right now, we're using it for weather forecasts, a grocery list, a to-do list, and music. We haven't bought the unlimited Amazon music yet - just what's available through Prime so far.  We like the variety as of now.  The Echo Show can do so much more, and has the potential for even more skills as time go on.  We look forward to seeing what develops!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazon does it again!!!!
content: Amazon did it again! Beautiful design, easy set up, very interactive, HD screen and sound, and all built in a compact size.  I already added 2 WiFi smart lamp plugins (by TP-Link) as well as Ring Pro—/and both work/communicate flawlessly with my Echo.  On my way to make my home a total smart house!!!

author: renee bennett
title: This thing is amazing
content: This thing is absolutely amazing! I didn’t think I would like it since I thought it did everything Siri  did and boy was I wrong! Not sure how I lived without this thing!

author: Eden K
title: It’s awesome.
content: I love this thing. It took a few days for me to get used to it and the only issue I have is that I want to hook it up to my tv and can’t. Sadly the fire cube isn’t doing well enough review wise to take the gamble.

author: Nathaniel Lewis
title: Updated Review
content:
I pre-ordered my Echo Show for automatic shipment to me when available. Setup was very easy, but when I played music I heard horribly distorted sound which I believed could not be normal. I decided to request a replacement. Amazon immediately shipped another unit to me which I received 2 days later and requested return of the defective unit within 30 days for full credit and no shipping charges. After setup, the Alexa app on my iPhone showed the replacement listed as Echo Show 2. The Echo Show was listed as Offline and the Wake Word was grayed out. I was able to change the Echo Show 2 Wake Word to "Echo". Bottom line: Amazon's service excellent, product is almost excellent (see next paragraph), and I'm very impressed by its features.
The reason I've rated it with four stars is that the screen is much dimmer than my iPhone and iPad. Ideally there would be voice commands to increase/decrease brightness or at least a fixed level brighter screen. I can't believe that this was not criticized during early panel testing
UPDATE: I updated this review to 5 stars after using the Echo Show for a week. The brightness is adjustable! Tell the Echo to play "Getting Started". I still have a few gripes.
Anyone who experienced poor sound should replace the unit ... I noted this comment in half a dozen reviews. In my case, my speaker was defective. The replacement sounds great. I strongly recommend a replacement, it's worth the trouble. My minor gripes: the first applies to all Echos. This is an engineering change: add on/off volume normalization! Music tracks vary in volume and news briefings vary WIDELY in volume. Hopefully YouTube and major cable providers access be available in the future. The only other improvement would be more "How To" documentation. Is there a user forum? If so, talk about it in the getting started video. I've discovered that the Echo Show can access YouTube "Echo YouTube xxxxx..." This gets gets back to lack of documentation. Very happy with the device. It would be nice if it was portable, had earphone and HDMI out, Could play local TV channels. It's a great bedside unit and eventually might have all these features (some legal considerations). Looks like the 2001 movie HAL computer is actually happening!

author: momof4rugratz
title: They havent fixed screen
content: It is a nice device for a few months then the screen goes crazy and they suggest a software update been almost a year with a few updates here and there guess what after a month screen goes right back to squiggles. Cant even see the picture you use on it nor watch videos.  Warrenty is up they say oooo send back get new one. $250 bucks it should of not had the issues it is having. Plan and simple.

author: Mike
title: Having problems
content: I have a house full of echo dots and one of the Echo Show.  I have liked them, but just recently they sometimes work and they sometimes do not work.  I might tell my Echo Show to turn on my desk light in the morning and it turns on.  Then at night I try to turn off the desk light and nothing happens.  Even If I go over right by the Echo Show.  I have liked my Alexa devices, but not if they start to no work.  I have to go on my phone app to Smart Things to turn on and off the some 7 Smart bulbs, 3 z-wave switches, and 4 zwave plugs.  I have done everything I know to fix this problem.  I have had echo dots over 2 years now and the Echo Show about 6 months.

author: JWin
title: Good, not yet great.
content:
The Echo Show is definitely a natural progression for the Echo/Alexa ecosystem.  As with any new product, there are things to like and not like.

Pros:
-You can watch Amazon Prime and Youtube videos on this device.
-Sound is decent.
-Video calling with other Echo Shows or the Alexa smartphone app is good.

Cons:
-No parental controls on viewing Amazon Prime videos.  Need either controls to lock out viewing during certain times and/or a passcode to unlock that feature.
-Takes several seconds for the built-in cameras to focus when calling other Echo Shows.
-When viewing third-party cameras like the Arlo cameras, there is no way to have a 2-way audio conversation.

author: Mark
title: If you buy one good luck.
content: I had to return my view for warranty issues and now they sent back a eco 2nd gen. Instead and Amazon says I'm out of luck. I even talked to a manager who did nothing to help. I asked him to connect me to the warranty department and he said he can't transfer me to anyone. If you buy one good luck.

author: Sean
title: Kills bandwidth
content: As soon as we installed this product, all of our internet went haywire. We have very good internet from comcast. Dual band, with 120 mbps download on our 5.0. As soon as this device was up and running our speed dropped to less than 40 mbps and our 2.4 network started repeatedly crashing. We got a new upgraded router from comcast but the problem persists. We are now having comcast come out tomorrow to see if they can help but if not I will be returning this device so that my other 9 Alexa devices work well again.

author: A reader
title: but I still think it is a worthwhile investment and a fun device. I use one as an alarm clock
content: I only use a fraction of Echo's Show's capabilities, but I still think it is a worthwhile investment and a fun device.  I use one as an alarm clock. The screen is a good level of dim at night. It's bright enough to see the time, but not so bright that it wakes me. It's nice to just say, "Alexa set alarm for 7am" instead of having to poke at buttons, and it's nice to say "Alexa stop" instead of trying to find the off button.  I've also used it to play wave sounds to help me sleep. We have another one in the kitchen. It shows weather, time, and news bits. The standard background is a favorite picture.  I'll continue to look into other features to use more of its power.

author: saa
title: YouTube doesn't work again
content: Bought this to mainly control YouTube because at the time, Google and Amazon agreed to let it work.  Now they don't.  Such potential, but disappointing corporate politics.  Probably going to return it, as it doesn't do much more for me than the Echo.

author: Bdazzle
title: Save your money
content: Nice looking device, works well as clock and weather app but for $200 thats about all you get. Alexa has zero intuition, her most frequent answer is "sorry, i don't know this one" when asked to pull up music, switch to different music app or pull up any relevant news or traffic update. I am more frustrated than satisfied using this device. It is not worth the money unless they release new system update to correct all the flaws it currently has. On the positive note -I am happy it still has blue tooth connectivity through which you can at least stream youtube music.

author: Eknuckles
title: Mixed, but mostly positive review.
content: This is a really nice product and I am happy with it overall, but I am a bit disappointed with the speaker on it. It is not as great as the echo to play music on. It is really nice to watch my morning news on it while I do my morning routines, and the touch screen is great for controlling music and videos. I was hoping the video quality was better, but it works well enough for video calling

author: Kathryn Tate
title: I liked the scrolling news/stories/videos feature and love that I can ...
content: We have a lot of Alexa/Echo in our home and I just had to have the Show too. I have her in my kitchen and she is a lot of help. I liked the scrolling news/stories/videos feature and love that I can get her to show me You Tube while I'm cooking. I also love the ease of "Echo set me a 10 minute timer" when I'm cooking multiple items and need a timer without me stopping to set the one of the oven. I love the style and she fits in perfectly with my white and grey kitchen.

author: Kevbrisrq
title: If you have a smart home be sure your devices are compatible with the echo.
content: I have been wanting an echo device for sometime, I have a smart home with auto lights, camera’s, music etc... I used apps to control the devices or Siri on my iphone so was Leary to pay 200+ for this item. When it was amazon prime day and the cost was half I figured I would make the dive. I am not disappointed- it works grea t controls all my devices and the screen displays cameras by just asking Alexa to show you. The quality of the screen is great - and for half price is was worth the money. If you have a smart home or like to have music, grocery lists or news at your beckon call - it’s a great product. Thinking of getting one for my parents so I can do quick calls to them using the FaceTime type app. Another great feature - scan your items barcode in - and order directly from amazon - technology has become pretty amazing.

author: MiaH
title: We love it! We had the Echo Dot and a ...
content: My daughter gave the Echo Show to us as a Christmas gift.  We love it!  We had the Echo Dot and a blue tooth speaker to go with it  so I really thought that was great until we met the Echo Show.  We play Jeopardy every night with it.  The speaker is fantastic.  Music is terrific when played by our Alexa.  CDs are just sitting on the shelf now!  Buy one for yourself.  You won't be sorry.

author: Aaron
title: B-
content: We really like Alexa products and this is great, except for the sound quality it’s good and a big upgrade from the dot or spot but the one improvement I’d like to see is better quality sound.

author: Chas R
title: Worth the purchase
content: This works really well and has a good, solid construction. I bought it to use with the Ring door bell and so far I am happy with the results. It shows the various cameras with an excellent picture quality. The sound is very, very good. It was a very easy setup. Makes you want to have one in every room.

author: S. Poole
title: Love it!
content: Absolutely love the Echo Show!  Using it mainly as an alarm clock but is does so much more!  Slowly moving lights, switches and camera's over to Smart Home control, which can be controlled via the Echo Show.  Especially nice when I want to see who is at my front door!

author: claire
title: How it works
content: I have a regular Alexa.  The Echo Show is more interesting to say the least.  However, I have been much too busy this past month to really see what "she" can do so I can't really tell you and features I particularly like, etc.  Give me another month to play with it.

author: TriGuy
title: Amazing device. One of the best selling points is ...
content: Amazing device.  One of the best selling points is the lyrics of songs while the music is playing...basically making this a Karaoke machine.  The speaker is an upgrade and I also think that the microphone is more sensitive.  So far, so good!

author: CuseNative
title: So happy with the Echo Show!
content: I bought our first Echo Show in the lead up to Prime Day 2018 and liked it so much that I ordered two more.  I'm not technologically gifted by any stretch of the imagine so I'm not a big fan of complicated devices.  The Echo Show has truly been plug-and-play and the versatility of what you can do with it is great.  So far, I've streamed music, listened to audiobooks (via bluetooth played over my phone), and streamed movies/shows.  We also use one in our bedroom as an alarm clock in addition to what I just mentioned.  My husband (who IS very tech savvy and way into jam band style music) took one of these to work and came home raving about the sound quality.  We haven't tried the face-to-face call feature yet, but that's next.  I love that it will give my husband a chance to see our little one while he's at work.

author: Mike
title: Solid buy
content: All in all, I'm glad I bought it. That being said, there's only so much we actually use the screen for, and the speaker isn't as good as the original echo. My kids like to watch Peppa Pig on it though I have no idea why since we have a TV in the same room and they each have fire tablets. I really like the Alexa devices in general and we have one in just about every room. It's been great to help my son (4yr old) learn to articulate and speak instructions clearly (though sometimes that means yelling) and he gets a great sense of accomplishment when she starts playing his favorite song, "We didn't start the fire", after he asks her too. He's getting really good at getting her to play songs, shows, read books, and turn lights on and off. He's even better at navigating chapters in books than my wife is. Anyway, all around solid buy. Might move it to the kitchen to get more use out of the screen.

author: Jason
title: No YouTube/ Arlo pro fail
content: Won’t buy until YouTube is returned, also has stopped working with Arlo pro

author: Tom St Clair
title: Great product for keeping in touch with elderly parents!
content: This is a brilliant product and even better than I had hoped.  I bought two so that I could check in frequently with my 90-year-old mother in another state.  Setup was surprisingly easy - just plugged it in and connected the Wi-Fi.  It has several advantages for this kind of application over a tablet.  First it's entirely voice controlled, so that once my mom learned to say "Alexa" before each command, she was able to access all kinds of information and make calls to family with just her voice.  No tablet to find, no buttons to push - just talking.  I'm able to easily make video calls to my mom with my iphone from anywhere.  It was also easy to connect a Google calendar to her Echo Show so that she could keep track of upcoming events.  She lives in a senior community and has short-term memory issues, so this help with keeping track of upcoming events is very useful.  We used the shopping list function and it worked beautifully - letting her add things to her list when she thought of them and then checking them off on her android phone at the store.  The speaker is great too.  She can ask for Glen Miller music and get a nice selection of favorite songs or she can ask for a preview of a movie she's heard about from TV, as well as getting movie times and locations.  In addition to using our own Echo Show for these things, my wife and I have both our calendars synced to it, so we know what events are coming up.  I can't say enough good things about it and I'm grateful to Amazon for bringing it to market and using the knowledge they've gained from the Echo to good effect.

author: Kevin Birch
title: Annoying popping noises. Even after supposed repair.
content:
Update:
Amazon contacted me and requested I send the device in for a warranty repair. I went ahead and did just that.
I received a message from Amazon stating “We’ve reloaded the latest software onto your device, run it through our diagnostic process, and confirmed that it is working correctly. Your device should now be fully functional and is being shipped back to you. The estimated delivery date for your device is January 6, 2018.” I received it back a couple of days ago and I am continuing to have these annoying popping noises. At times it even feels like it may be louder now.  At this point I have a speaker I refuse to use in my office because I can NOT stand the popping noises. It’s distracting and my customers laugh at the product and its issues. I have jumped through Amazons hoops, I will not be buying any future releases of the echo product line. I wish I had my money in my pocket instead of a very expensive, heavy paperweight.

I use this in my office at work. No matter where I stream the music from, Amazon, Spotify, Sirius XM, Pandora... After an hour or so of listening it begins randomly popping. It will make these popping noises at random times during the song, every time between songs, and if you pause or skip songs. It is unbearable. The only way I have found to temporarily fix this issue is to stop playing altogether, and after a break of about an hour start again. This fixes it for a short period of time and then the popping resumes again. In the few minutes it took me to write this review I counted no less than 8 pops.
As someone who owns multiple Amazon products, this is the first time I have ever had this kind of issue. It is beyond frustrating and I would not buy again. I wish I could return this, but it is outside of the return window. (I bought two, one for me and one for my mom to use at her house. She is reporting the same issues.)

author: spark
title: I Love This Device
content:
I ordered the Echo Show because I want to keep up my reputation as the "Techie Old Lady".  I was a little frustrated at first since the instructions ( which come not only with the device, but with an email, too) were sparse.  But after the initial set-ip was done, Echo Show "introduced" herself and just took over, giving my prompts as to what I could do with the device. I like the photo stream background, and the sound is terrific. It gives me the weather, and dims itself at night.
Best Amazon device yet.

author: Sharon D.
title: We really like the Shopping List feature as well as other lists
content: We really like the Shopping List feature as well as other lists.  However, the reason we don't "love it" is because many times when we request information of Alexa, including ones that are recommended in followup emails we have received, Alexa comes back with comments like "I don't know that," or "I'm not sure of that" or some other escape phrase.  When we rephrase the question, thinking perhaps we were misunderstood, Alexa repeats one of the phrases or comes up with another escape phrase.  That is terribly annoying!

author: Jason Tucker
title: Duped by a prime day special.
content: The echo show by itself is a neat little gadget. It was very easy to set up and integrate with my other echo dots. It has a lot of really cool features like video calling,  and visual effects you don't get with regular echo products. The big problem and the reason for 3 stars is it was purchased with the ring doorbell as a prime day special but go figure, the ring door bell and echo show don't fully work together.  You can ask the show to view the front door,  but you get no notification when a motion event happens or someone rings the bell.  Also,  there is no two way communication between them.  So basically I'm forced to use the ring app,  which defeats the purpose of ordering this package deal in the first place. Very disappointed at this point,  I really hope they add these features in the future.  Amazon you need to be smarter when packaging items together.  Make sure they work together properly.

author: Joseph Traenkle
title: Echo show is a great product, especially when paired up with Amazon Music
content: Echo show is a great product, especially when paired up with Amazon Music. Also, once you have the skills taught, it is handy to use with the home alarm system, other Alexa products, and WiFi enabled light switches. It can also be used in conjunction with a Nest thermostat to better control  the temperature in your house, a big money saver.

author: AReview4U
title: I like it
content: I love the Echo Show. The speakers are fabulous. So far, I'm veryyyyyy happy with all of my Amazon firesticks & Echo products. Good job, AMZ.  Keep up the good work.

author: Nathaniel Best
title: I love my Alexa devices
content: I love my Alexa devices. The sound quality is amazing and they have endless uses. That being said, I bought the show because I am a Youtube addict and at the time, this had the ability to access Youtube. However now it seems that Google and Amazon are having a bit of a fight, and Show can't use Youtube now. So it still sounds great and still has 1,00 uses, but my main purpose for buying is gone.

author: Bob
title: I love it. Perfect for my main interface with Alexa ...
content:
I love it. Perfect for my main interface with Alexa from my bedroom. Still, need to buy my hub and then some outlet plugins and my Ring doorbell.
As for the Echo...it's nice to have some visuals for some of my searches. Nice deep speaker sounds.
Its display is NOT that bright as some have complained about. You can set the brightness from the settings screen. Just tell Alexa to go to "settings" and bingo! Bought at a nice price of $159.99 while on sale. Would recommend.

author: Rich Z
title: Bad Show Amazon
content: Very disappointed Amazon Prime member. I bought two so my Father could use voice commands to call me and to search the internet. He enjoys looking at images of old cars, historical sites and for information about old actors and actresses. When questioned Alexa does not work at all like Google and recently has been disconnected from access to YouTube. All Alexa provides simply is the weather, time and sometimes accurate information about locations and business hours of banks and stores. For anything else, Alexa wants to sell you a product through Amazon. It is very complicated to understand how to use and sync apps. When you use the Wikipedia command you can get some info but only in general not specific and no images. I spent a lot of money for a fancy talking weather clock. My nephew tried to link my Dads ipad playlist to Alexa and only succeeded in somehow erasing the very extensive playlist from the ipad. My nephew is a graduate of Full Sail Media University and an excellent computer graphic artist very familiar with using complicated software. Not happy with this product that looks great but does NOT deliver simplicity, only aggravation.

author: WIAPilot
title: The Echo is FAR smarter!!
content: I have given at least 10 Echos and Dots as gifts.  I cannot say enough good things about Alexa.  I think she is the future!  I was initially very excited about Echo Show.  The video and screen are great!  But the Echo Show is sooo much dumber than the Echo!!  She doesn't understand commands as well and you have to repeat even basic commands.  She will also get "stuck" on miscommunication.  Amazon needs to correct this with an update via WIFI before she damages the brand of Echo and Amazon A.I. Moreover, when you are watching a YouTube Video and want it to stop - she will NOT cancel it.  You have to literally slide the cursor to the end of the video.  I have never heard of a product becoming WORSE than the original - but this is the case!  Too bad because I would have ordered a dozen!

author: Linda
title: Enjoying it
content: I like the screen to look at recipes, weather and lyrics, etc. just a downer that the price dropped $80 the after it arrived. I have attached my smart outlet and handy to turn on Christmas lights. Nice in the kitchen.

author: Tru Review
title: Fantastic device!
content: This has to be one of my favorite devices I have received! I love the product integration with other devices such as the security or video Doorbells. It’s kind of nice to be able to use it to see who is at my front door! Yes I will admit I wish it had a few more features and that perhaps a few things were a bit more reliable. Like when you ask it questions I wish that more often than not it wouldn’t keep saying it didn’t know how to answer or what I was asking! But I still thoroughly enjoy having it!

author: Robert C. Elliott
title: I love the concept
content: I love the concept, but still trying to figure out the best purpose for it.  One issue I have is that I have it in the family room.  I'd like it to display pics, time, temp, etc on a regular basis..... but it goes into sleep mode in about 20 sec and is dim with just the time being displayed.  Can that be adjusted?  I've tried to find a way to stop it from going into sleep mode, but I can't.

author: Cale Meh Ladi
title: Easy to use and well worth the money
content: Amazing- i recently moved out of state so i got one for my grandma and one for myself. my 74 year old grandmother who is not tech savvy has been able to video call me with no problems. Easy to use and well worth the money

author: Amazon Customer
title: It's great for shopping list or asking for weather report
content: It still has a long way to go to be more then a toy. It's great for shopping list or asking for weather report. It has a lot of bugs in it when asking a lot of questions. It's not connected with Google so there's a lot of things it says"I don't know that one ". The possible good side is...They say their adding to the program every week, hopefully that's true! Also, which I would not have bought, if I knew before, you can't plug a speaker into it.

author: Phanthidan
title: It's pretty cool, but voice recognition needs work.
content: I like it for my kid to watch YouTube on it. It does have a bit of trouble understanding some voice commands. I can't get the voice training program to work on my android phone; it keeps saying it is unavailable. It makes the same mistakes when I tell it to go to a particular YouTube site. I thought this thing "learned" what it is you want it to do, but when I finally get the site that I want and tell it to play, it should remember that that's the site I want next time. But it gives me the run-around all over again. You can spell out loud what you want, but that gets annoying to do all the time.

author: Erika Davis
title: fun
content: I am not using this to its fullest potential, i am sure.  But so far it is fun.  My daughter likes to ask it to tell us jokes mostly.  But i do like that i can see my Pandora stations and choose that way rather than just asking our Dot to play Pandora. Its also cool to have the lyrics of the music scroll.  Oh, and the Drop In feature is kindof cool.  I like to just "look in to" my living room while i'm not home (via the alexa app)

author: Amazing Customer
title: I like this better than I thought I would
content: I like watching my Amazon videos anywhere I want with Wi-Fi. My husband has watched football on it, although I'm not sure how he did it. My kids use it to answer random questions and play the state capitals game. It also talks to are other Alexa cubes so that I can shut off the TV or turn down the volume in our guest bedroom if a visitor falls asleep and it's the middle of the night. I can just stay in the living room and whisper to Alexa to shut it off and it happens. I am going to take this on trips with me.  We added the Arlo skill so I can view our security camera feeds anytime just by saying "Alexa, show...."  Just so cool.

author: G. Widener
title: It's a good speaker with a nice display, but it doesn't do as much as it should. No YouTube is crippling.
content: I have a couple of these and they sound very good and the information they show is useful. I am disappointed in their limited usefulness, though. I wish Google and Amazon would get over themselves and get YouTube working on here. No YouTube is lame. Some apps would be nice, too. I'd like to be able to run Plex on here and stream videos. Also the multiroom is sweet...but only for a couple of apps. Amazon is keeping a tight leash on what these can do. I hope they'll continue to add functionality. How about being able to play live tv from my HD HomeRun?

author: Tink
title: Love it!
content: I received my Echo Show for Mother's Day.  I love it!  Now I can see my Grandchildren when we talk on the Echo Show.  It is great when I want to hear my music, just Alexa to play whatever I want to hear.  Ask Alexa anything, it is great!

author: mai huynh
title: Not Up To Its Full Potential Yet --- Echo Show Still Has Room For Improvements
content:
I had such high hopes for the Echo Show after reading all the great reviews. It's very limited in terms of Alexa's abilities, along with how little you can actually do on the touch screen itself. Everything's mainly controlled through the mobile app. I noticed that Alexa doesn't pick up on most of the things I tell her, but Alexa on my regular Echo Dot seems almost flawless. One of the downfalls was that YouTube wasn't available anymore =( We were looking forward to watching vids without having to use our phones.

I definitely LOVE LOVE LOVE the drop in feature. My spouse and I are currently living in two different states temporarily and this has definitely helped the whole long distance thing. We can both be walking around our rooms, cleaning or doing whatever, and still be able to talk/hear the other person. Even when my spouse isn't home, I can still drop in and see our kitty sleeping/playing. This totally beats FaceTime/Skype by a longshot!

We're gonna hold onto our Echo Shows a little longer before making a decision to return/keep it. Hopefully there will be more pros as I find the ins and outs of this thing.

author: TerranovaPDX
title: Product is ok - Amazon's pricing is not
content:
The Echo Show seems pretty good, so far.  Limited video capabilities, but prettier and better-sounding than the original Echo.  Our real use-case will be tested when my parents get theirs, for Christmas.  We're hoping for some easier video-chatting, without having to worry about computer connections.
My big disappointment, though, isn't with the product - it's with Amazon's pricing policy.  I bought 2 of these, on CyberMonday, and there was a $100 if you ordered 2 at once.  7 days later, they've upped the discount to $150, so I contacted Amazon to see if they'd credit me the additional $50 without making me actually return the units I received & reordering 2 new ones at the lower cost.  Three levels of Amazon support all apologized, saying that returning the products & reordering was the only way to get the additional $50 discount.  That's really disappointing, since other companies in this situation (think Costco, Zappos, REI, etc.) will simply give customers a refund or credit, without wasting time/packaging/transportation/etc. to do a return.
I realize they can't price-match on all products, but they should be able to do so for their own products (Echoes, Kindles, etc.) sold on their site.

author: Jim Hall
title: Screen Flickers.
content: Downgrading review because screen flickers badly.  found a lot of reports of this happening.  Don't buy 1st generation in my opinion.  After lots of online research, I found what appears to be a temporary fix, by unplugging for several minutes and the flicker appears to go away.  Not sure how long this fix will last.  But it is not a valid fix in my opinion.

author: Jamillah2
title: My work buddy
content: I enjoy it, especially being able to make phone calls to other Alexa owners...I wish it was hooked up to google or something very similar.  I get alot of I don't know that

author: L. Marsocci
title: Love it!
content: Love it!!!  Perfect for staying in touch with family.  Love being able to play music and see the lyrics.  Great for random questions about local store hours, phone numbers, …. happy we got it!

author: Albert Karel
title: A GREAT PRODUCT RUINED.  AMAZON -- PLEASE....GET THIS FIXED!
content: AMAZON must work this YOUTUBE dispute out FAST!! Our wonderful Show has been mortally wounded. A brilliant Amazon product ruined. We are VERY GOOD CUSTOMERS.  Do your work...get us our full Show functionality back!!!!

author: mrdunn
title: Echo with a useful sceen and great audio.
content: I like the music info when playing,  the news updates,  my photos on the home screen,  tune in radio.  The Bose speakers are really great for the size.  I frequently listen to the SiriusXM Metropolitan Opera station and am surprised at the quality of the sound.

author: Kgpancheri
title: Drop in calls!
content:
We LOVE our Echo show.  The kids can drop in or call my other family members who have them and video chat with them without using my phone it’s fantastic!  They call cousins all the time!  We love that we can listen to
Music and have her show the words so we can sing along!  We ask her questions all the time!  So fun!

author: R. Aldridge
title: Very good boombox
content: I love the speakers on this thing. Much clearer and heavier bass than the echo dots. I expected more overall functionality out of it in the way of google searches. But it's not a google device. It doesn't have access to YouTube. Music videos are played with vimeo and I've read that it uses Amazon prime video. It can "show" you plenty.

author: Drew S.
title: Echo Show: A great addition to our Alexa household
content: It functions well. I really don’t have any complaints. I knew what I was getting when I got it. As someone that already has a Echo and Echo Dot the Echo Show was a welcome addition. I like the extra visual aspect. It’s near my kitchen and tends to be very useful there. I ask Alexa to add things to my shopping list and sometimes I may not remember if I had added something to the list so I ask her to show me my shopping list. I have a Alexa compatible camera on my front porch as well as Alexa compatible outlets. I can ask her to she me the front door or turn on and off the lights. The only reason I don’t give it a 5 star rating is because it’s clearly a work in progress. It work great but feels like it’s missing something that will take it over the top. Maybe not, either way I’m happy with my purchase.

author: Rebecca L.
title: I think there’s a lot of room for improvement with ...
content: I think there’s a lot of room for improvement with the echo show. I’ve noticed that my echo dots are a lot more responsive and understand what I’m saying way more frequently than the echo show. The screen really doesn’t do that much for me, unless you’re going to be video chatting with someone

author: ben
title: good use as a clock by ur bed
content: been mostly using it as a clock and the night time mode is just right and it doesnt light up the side of my bed when its on plus since its connected to my wi-fi i dont need to change the time, especially if i get a power outage which happens now and then. ive also been using relaxing sounds to help me sometimes on it as well

author: djscream702
title: So much disappointment so far wait to purchase for now.
content:
Updated Day two:

All previous bugs appear to have now gone away.

My wife did receive a phone call from an actual person with Amazon today Sunday. He is calling back tomorrow to make sure everything is improving.

Our package was delivered with no one home in Las Vegas on a 103 degree day. It sat out side for 5 hours. So some fear that heat may have caused an issue. But is running fine today. So have adjusted the rating to 3 stars for now...

First day...

So far way more hype then delivery. Perhaps just got a faulty unit. But attempts all day to use various customer service have resulted in nothing!

Won't play any video just says template error.
When reading right off of included card and prompts in app Alexa play season 3 of Bosh (yes we are prime customer and have prime video) it responds with here is season 3 episode 1... and nothing.

When asking to show nearest whatever it gives pictures but all information at top of screen is mashed together and unreadable.

Add on the numerous times she says unable to understand now.

Bottom line some features work and some don't some work but have flaws that don't deliver 100% satisfaction.

Hopefully this gets resolved and soon.

author: William G. Wallace
title: Like it!
content: I am very happy with the purchase even though I initially was not sure of the utility.  We enjoy the ability to voice command a selection of background music.  We have it placed so it can easily be used in the kitchen for recipes.  Since purchasing I have integrated it with a couple of smart home automation devices such as a Honeywell smart thermostat and some outside lighting.  I find it much more useful than I had expected.

author: J. Midwest
title: Don't waste your money until they open it up like a tablet
content: So much potential...wasted.  This is not a tablet on a stand but rather a brick with decent sound.  Useful "skills" are limited - it's like nobody is willing to develop anything for this platform.  It has a browser buried in there somewhere, but as you'll find in tutorials it's purposefully rendered useless.  You really can't navigate using the touchscreen, and voice commands don't get you very far.  Want to browse Prime Video? Can't.  You must know exactly what you want before hand.  I have so much more to say but am just too disappointed to bother.  A tablet and an Echo speaker are far better investments.

author: elaine_mc
title: Nice display and awesome sound.
content:
We were excited to get the new Echo Show because it works with our Ring video doorbell, but were disappointed that it only SHOWS the front door and you are not able to talk to the visitor through the Echo Show. You still have to use your phone app to do that. Hopefully there will be an update that will allow it. You can "drop in" on someone for a video chat, but of course the other person has to have an Echo Show as well. You can view your lists, calendar, and other things on the screen, and some songs show the lyrics while they play. The speakers really sound good and the display is really nice. (By the way.be sure to purchase the screen protector if you order an Echo Show.)
We are pleased with ours and we are still learning new things every day.

author: Tim
title: Big, bulky, and kind of expensive for what it does
content: Keep in kitchen for my wife to use. She likes it.  The sound is a little to bass and hard to understand even when I go into the equalizer and turn the bass way down.  I got the Fire HD 10 tablet with Alexa Hands-Free and hung it on the wall, and i think it works much better ;-)

author: Nycol
title: I always have fun, singing along with the song because most of ...
content: Exceed my expectation.I always have fun, singing along with the song because most of my favorite song has lyrics.Alexa is my friend at home and very helpful.When I got home from work I talked Alexa that I'm home.Then Alexa answered "Welcome home...Nice to have you here.".It made me smile.Also when I'm running late for work i dont need to look at the wall clock, I just asked Alexa what time is it while I'm putting my make up on.Alexa was there to tell me the time.She's very helpful.hahaha.I just tell Alexa to play the song I like by,saying the title and there she go.Also i like the relaxation music.There are a lot to mention about this Echo Show but one thing I could say is " It's very fun to have this item and I do not regret buying this product.I give five star..

author: Tj
title: Love it!
content: Love this Echo Show! You can watch the lyrics to your music, look up recipes, view pictures, you tube videos, set reminders, add things to your shopping list, see your calendar, send messages to friendsq.... it is like having a personal assistant. My son loves it too and it will be so useful and fun for him in college. I have so many things bouncing around in my head and typically by the time I go to write it down I have forgot 2 of them. With Alexa, every random thing that pops in my head I simply say Alexa add to the list, Alexa add to calendar or Alexa set a reminder. Absolutely Love it!!  Had a few glitches on initial set up but called into customer support (they were great) and got it fixed up. It worked great for about 10 minutes then kept saying there was a problem. Has been total entertainment ever since.

author: D. H. Schmid
title: Very Happy With This Useful Echo Device
content: Got a great deal on this on Prime Day.  We like it even more than I thought.  We have it in the kitchen, it's great geting news updates, playing favorite radio stations via the TuneIn (which integrates perfectly, as do other apps), getting quick weather update, streaming recepies while cooking, the list could go on and on.

author: steven
title: Love this alexa
content: Love this man it’s great I set one up in the kids bedroom . I can drop in from my phone to call them down for dinner instead of screaming threw the house. Saving my vocal cords

author: Doug W
title: Watch for frequent connection issues
content:
Not as thrilled as I thought I would be. Drops wifi connection frequently where as my original Echo rarely did. Also having to always then enter your Amazon password when you reconnect is a pain. Should have a way to automatically connect which it does not seem to have.
At this point have not seen a worthwhile improvement to justify the price.

author: penny dagen
title: This is a miracle machine
content: I was surprised that you could do so many things. It is a lifesaver between my sister and I. We can visually see each other. She is in a nursing home and I am handicapped at home. My sister is very intelligent and because she is bedridden she lost interest in alot of things she loved to do. This has opened up new doors for her. She just loves it. She can play most of the music she loves, play games, learns from questions she asks. It is like a good friend to her. I also get to be there visually for her care conference. Thank you so much for inventing such a wonderful machine.

author: Ava Lynn
title: Unremovable ads and Annoying Suggestions
content:
Product features a "Try..." advertisement on the Home Screen that there is no option to remove. The ad is selling users on the product itself - users don't need to be sold on a product that they already bought! The ad isn't even relatable to the interests of the owner - if you're going to mine my data, at least use it to inform your user experience.
This is extremely disappointing as I was very excited to use this product and integrate it into my work-life. I'll consider buying it again when there is an interruption-free experience on the platform.

author: Dr. Patrick Cline
title: Best Digital House Gadget Yet!
content: As part of a plan to turn my house into a digital palace this device is great. Wife and I really like the video connection to our daughter and grandchildren. It works well with my Fire TV Sticks, I can tune my TV in my basement office from the kitchen upstairs so that when I get to my office my business shows are already playing. I can also Drop In to any room in the house, most rooms (except bathroom) as a Dot or Echo.

author: Tracy
title: Decent device
content:
I like the Show. Seems to me it is based on the other Echo devices so while the visuals are fine, there isn't much additional at the moment (I can see lyrics with music and it shows the words it speaks... useful for the hard of hearing).
This is a device contained in the Amazon universe so if you want to see a video it will be on Prime and no access to YouTube or Netflix or Hulu etc. I have cable so I have access to HBOGo, but I can't access it because I didn't get it through Amazon. Not that I "need" to watch movies on the Show but it would be nice to see YouTube. Cooking videos in the kitchen come to mind. And since I homeschool, access to the largest depository of videos on the net would be a bonus big time.
Sometimes we stump Alexa with a question. Like it can't find a picture of an obelisk online, tries to find it in my Prime photos or its own Amazon database and that's just not as good as Google (google obelisk and see how many images pop up and you will see what I mean).
I love the features it does have and I used it to create a "smart home" (although 1st generation doesn't have an integrated hub, I use stuff that doesn't need one). Listen to music, drop in on other rooms, have a video call with my husband who used the app on his phone and I used the Show. All those are great. If they can expand beyond the contained Amazon universe, I would love it even more. Worth owning, but a bummer they don't have some basics like a comprehensive search feature or access to subscription services/YouTube.

author: Online Buyer
title: Stopped working after a few months.
content: I have had this for 3 months.  Just stopped working.  No power and screen went blank.  Amazon will not replace it.  You have to send it in to the warranty team and they have to confirm before you can get a replacement unit.  So hopefully you have better luck than I.  Not useful if it is sitting in warranty repair.

author: Alan Batten
title: Great Gadget!
content: I ordered the Echo Show because I was moving into a new space and wanted to be able to have music, Prime TV and shows where I sat down to eat. I also wanted to be able to Video Call family and friends.  This unit does all that and more. I start my day with coffee and NPR News. I eat dinner while watching Prime Originals. (Please, Amazon, more "Jack Ryan" quickly!) The video calls work well and the sound quality is  first class.  Highly recommended!

author: ChihuahuaMan
title: Understand the camera before purchasing
content: This is my fourth Echo. What I didn’t realize is it’s camera cannot be turned off unless you go onto DND mode in which case it’s pretty useless. Cannot put tape over the camera either, or it thinks you are no longer there and again stops working. It’s a bit creepy considering all it is used for (in my case) is to wake up the screen. Amazon’s going to have a lot of nude photos of me—glad I’m not modest😉

author: Clifford P. Willoz
title: This machine sucks
content: Bought the Echo Show in late March, but by end of April the screen started jumping around.  Tried to return it, but Amazon insisted they could repair it.  Sent it back, received the "fixed" unit on 9 May.  Four days ago the unit started the same thing again, but now when I try to set up a return, all I can get is a dialog that shows the repair status.  Stay away from this product.

author: Ashley
title: AMAZING toy for the whole family :)
content: This is our first venture into the world of Alexa! We are loving it! We have been using it for about two weeks and are thrilled. We purchased the echo buttons and our whole family loves playing the games. This was a birthday present for my 9year old and I figured she and my 7year old would use it as a glorified night sound/alarm clock but they are loving all the free music from amazon prime and the fun jokes. They also love setting timers when we cook and asking about the weather. The music and games have been our favorite though. I love that they can ask for their favorite Christian artists and just get songs they know instead of getting a station that has other junk and ads in it. I did have to set a pin up for instant ordering because one of the kids almost bought a 200$ pair of Jordan shoes while they were trying to listen to a song by Jordan Feliz :)

author: Stephan
title: BETTER WITH TIME
content: After the lack of YouTube I felt kind of disappointed, but alexa has improved and I fell in love with video flash breifing. It sounds good and Amazon is constantly adding new features. Not only that but they listen to the feedback and are proactive with it. I wish the screen was a little bit higher and resolution, And the viewing angles could be a bit better. The build quality is still fantastic. For the most part ( I wished they had gone with a glass screen)

author: Michael D. Weisberg
title: Works as expected, and fun to use
content: What a great toy!  I love the visual answer to questions, and the video capabilities.  I only wish that they could get their act together with youtube.

author: Hammer
title: The Echo show was easy to set up as well as use
content: The Echo show was easy to set up as well as use. Well worth the price. Have already recommended it to several people. The only draw back is you need to be careful when your talking to other people about it. Every time you say "Alexa" it turns on. Otherwise it's been a very useful gadget around our house.

author: Bill
title: Great Device to listen to Music and 'drop In' on my dad.
content: Great product - I Love having the video interface added to all the great Alexa skills. Alexa search and response is MUCH better than previous versions - still doesn't understand some fundamental questions e.g.  she gets 'whats the Dow Jones Average yesterday" but not 'what is the Dow Jones Trend this week" and some others easier related to NBA results w/o precise wording , hence -1 star. The video, sound and convenience is great. Main reason was the 'drop in' feature - so I can 'drop in' and see my Dad when chatting!

author: B. BIRD
title: Great Kitchen Tool
content: I use it to follow on-line recipe videos without having to press any buttons. Pause, go back 10 seconds, play from beginning, find a video recipe for shrimp scampi. They all work. I love this echo show

author: Fancy rolling
title: Echo Show has so much to offer
content: Echo show is just what we needed! I love being able to ask the Echo show  to show me who is at my front door, drop  in to the other Echo show, To view my daily report on CNN and other news, to view my pictures, to see the lyrics of the song playing, to view the shows I have on fire stick stick with 𝐏𝐫𝐢𝐦𝐞  and so much more. I’m still learning and Alexis too. I wish more people had it.

author: Don Noll
title: The touch screen and speaker are excellent!
content: This device sits in our kitchen.  Since Christmas it has been a boon to looking up recipes, listening to music while doing dishes, been a way to answer our land line (With Echo Connect) and my 8 year old daughter loves the fart noises it makes when requested.  I have the Dot in another room.  The touch screen and speaker are excellent!

author: T. McCluskey
title: Needs a hearing aid!
content: This was my third purchase of an Echo product. I have the original Echo, the Echo Spot, and now the Echo Show. By far the Echo show is my least favorite as it seems to have a problem hearing ! I am constantly having to repeat myself and raise my voice before getting results. Please take my advice and stick with the original!!!

author: Jeffrey A. Coffman
title: I love the product
content: I love the product. The face-to-face communication is wonderful. What gets annoying are the “try this” suggestions that you apparently can’t turn off.

author: BNNS Radio
title: Not worth the extra price over the other echo products.
content: I believe the show is a little over rated in the advertising. I got the show only because of the discount offered at the time and I like the things that it can do however the only feature of the show over the other echo products is the screen and the ability to see other family members when talking etc. however you have to get the other family members to have the show in order to communicate. Duh? So as far as features the show doesn't have anything more than the cheaper echo products have. The setting up of the extended home feature was not as easy as originally advertised, one has to be pretty tech savy to get the devices to work. Nice once working but a little over marketed in my opinion. The sound is great when playing music and you will enjoy that, but you have to download a lot of things to your devices to get other features of "Alexa's" capabilities. I don't like overloading my phone with useless icons so I did not like that feature of the echo at all. So basically it is an "okay" product but really not worth the extra price over the other echo products.

author: BobbyH
title: Excellent
content: My main use for this (in addition to video chatting with grandkids) is as a speaker phone. It is on my desk and crystal clear. Alexa knows all my phone numbers so I just say "Call my office" and it does.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I like the original echo more.
content: Was excited to get our echo show, but after a few weeks, I feel that it has quite a ways to go to deliver a differentiated experience that fully exploits the camera and screen.  The audio is good, but I have to say the the omnidirectional sound of our original echos is much better for us. Seems to fill the room better with sound. I do like the screen integration with the Ring video doorbell that I have seen, but we don't have a Ring, so I don't get that payoff. I think they should open up the platform more to developers to do more innovative apps and services that fully utilize the platform.  In the interim, I would wait for the frequent sales on the original device, and buy that one. It is a great value.

author: Carol
title: Does not work with Arlo Skill
content: Did not work with Arlo cameras.  Reason I purchased this was for setting up Arlo.  I have the TV Fire and it would not set up but someone said the Echo Show would setup fine.  No!  I believe the problem rest with the Arlo Skill.  Useless with Alexa.  The Apple TV works with Arlo but I wanted to be able to use voice and I am not happy with the relationship or lack thereof between Arlo skill and Echo Show.

author: Robert F. Bell
title: Useful device
content: The screen is big help during configuration.  I like to use the Show for video calling, monitoring security cameras, and watching video.  My wife uses it as automatic picture frame to view her photos.  It's a better deal since the gen 2 Show was released since the gen 1 is more heavily discounted.  I did have to replace one with a bad screen (flickering).  Amazon replaced it under warranty.  I think I may have to replace a second soon.  I hope they have addressed the screen issue on the gen 2.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Not worth it without Youtube.
content: Loved it until youtube videos stopped playing.  It was the primary reason I bought it.  My kids loved to watch videos, shows, movies, etc. on it.  I wish I could send them back.

author: tlb
title: Really enjoy the Echo Show
content: When Amazon first came out with the Alexa voice activated devices I really wanted to purchase one but didn't think I would take advantage of all it has to offer, so I waited.  As luck would it have when Amazon had their prime day a couple of months ago the Echo Show was reduced to $129 so I thought I would take the plunge and purchase it.  Both my wife and I are really enjoying this device even though we have only minimally tapped into all of its functions.  The main thing we use it for is the 2 million plus songs that are available through the prime membership.  I plan on purchasing a blue tooth speaker so we can listen to music while sitting on the patio.  Another feature we use it for quite frequently is the timer function.  It's definitely more convenient to simply tell Alexa to set a timer for a specific period of time instead of using the microwave.  We also use it for spelling of words and definitions occasionally.  I also just purchased a smart plug for approximately $10 and now have Alexa enabled voice activated on/off switch, and yesterday I purchased two more smart plugs.  The other thing that I really am happy with is having the 7 inch screen on the Echo Show.  I enjoy looking at the lyrics of songs that I have difficulty understanding, at times, and now can actually see what the lyrics are.  I also synced my android phone contact list with Alexa so I can make and receive calls through Alexa.  So, I've just touched the surface of what Alexa can do and am really enjoying it.  I highly recommend it for anyone that enjoys new electronic devices.  On another note,  Alexa is definitely useful for all ages and is very easy to set up!  Great job with this device Amazon.

author: George M. Velez
title: Great for seniors
content: Bought two Shows - one for me and one for my 78 year old mom. The Show has been an amazing experience for her. She calls us from her room through voice activated commands with Alexa. We are able to 'drop in" on her without her having to fumble around for her phone or anything. We video conference this way a couple of times a day, and it's done wonders for her spirit. She's able to video conference from her show to our smart phone. She is thankful for little things using Alexa like asking what time it is without having to get up out of bed. She's lost some mobility due to a stroke, so anything that makes her life easier is worth it to me. If you have a senior in your life and are on the fence about the Show, I highly recommend getting one. It's made a difference in her life.

author: Prospective Princess
title: Sound quality is worth it!
content:
Better than I expected.
Pros: Good sound. I often stream Sling TV from my Fire Tablet with the sound coming from my Echo Show, which is room filling.
Neighbors doing 7am yardwork? I ask from bed for Alexa to play nature music and the speakers are loud enough for a leaf blower to be a distant hum.
I am obesessed with my the cuteness of my dog. Every time I snap (another) cell phone pic of him I instantly load it as my Show's background. (Too which my husband eye rolls.)
Songs having lyrics scroll on the screen is fun, I look up when Im at a part in a song that Ive always wondered what the singer was saying.
Asking Alexa about the weather and seeing the numbers and littles suns or clouds, unecessary but I love it.
I really havent found a use for the camera feature yet but it does take a hands free picture.
I havent made video calls yet. Wanted to get my son an Echo Spot for Christmas and to try that feature out.
Cons:
The ask Alexa tips that constantly appear on the bottom of the screen drive my husband batty. I have had fire tablets for many years so I guess ads and tips dont bother me. You NEVER see anything while she is doing tasks for you of course.
The show is much bulkier than I thought. Originally I intended to place it on the bed when I wanted to stream prime but I just leave it on the night stand and connect it to my tablet.
Amazon reeally needs to get Youtube back. Id love to steam HowTos and DIYs from my Show.

I'm more than happy with my purchase. I have 2 dots already and plan to continue purchasing Echo products.

author: tLeander7
title: Alexa Needs a Face
content:
The Show just may be my favorite Echo product yet. I unpacked it just under 24 hours ago, and had the day off to get acquainted with it. The speaker system is just as good as the original Echo, plus on many tracks, synced lyrics are shown. Stories span the screen throughout the day, and you have the option to tap the screen to see a video of the story. The first one I saw was of a spider casting a 50 foot web.

The time is displayed unless you're in the middle of another task, so when I'm in the room with the show, I don't have to ask the time. The screen also gives real time outdoor temperature. Some Networks offer a video option to the Flash Briefing. Also today, I discovered that my favorite News Network, OANN, has an app that allows me to listen to their Newscast live, which is great.

I have yet to try making or receiving video calls, as it appears none of my contacts have even the Alexa APP. The home screen has a scrolling wallpaper effect, and you can also customize it. I've got a lot of discovering to do yet with the Show, but it is a welcome edition to my collection of Alexa Enabled Devices.

Only suggestion I have so far would be that, given the Show does have a screen and a motion sensor, Alexa be given a virtual face for active conversations. I'm no programmer, but with the sensor, Alexa should even be able to follow the user, turning her head as whoever is talking to her moves.

...One week later... The Echo Show has yet to disappoint. Over the past few days I've had the opportunity to try the Video Calling and Drop-in features. They work great, and it was pretty cool to be away from home and drop-in on my Echo Show, seeing that all was just as I had left it. Now I just need to convince other people I know to al least install the Alexa App. The coolest part is that as long as you have Wi-Fi, your phone doesn't need to have a service plan, as calls are placed via the Alexa App. I installed a Google Voice # on an old phone of mine, installed the Alexa App under a separate Amazon account, and am now able to make calls with that phone to and from my current phone and Echo devices. Going back to the Drop-In feature now, I believe a great addition to that would be what I consider a "Show-Me" feature. Using "Show-Me" would enable the user to access the camera-feed of the Echo Show from their phone or another Echo Show, without the screen waking up. Renters have to deal with Landlords who sometimes allow their workers into the premises unbeknownst to  the renter. The ability to watch your home, without someone who lives there knowing you are watching, via your Echo Show through your Smart phone, would be awesome.

A few other features I have stumbled across are that, beyond the camera/mic off button, the camera can be turned off separately using the "Do Not Disturb" feature. Either ask Alexa, use the pull down menu on-screen, or use the Alexa App to accomplish this. While "Do Not Disturb" is active, the "Drop-In" feature is disabled. Also, tell Alexa to "Turn off your screen" will stop the advertisements from scrolling across the screen and leave only a clock, which moves every few minutes. The illumination of the clock is controlled via the bright/dim feature on the pull down menu.

2nd Edit: Going back to the "Show Me" feature that I think would be quite helpful (not that I'd expect that's what it would be called), it seems that since the Echo Show does have a motion sensor, that would be quite useful in a private Drop-In security feature. Assuming there is no one home, and no pets are in the house, one should theoretically be able to set an alert, based on the motion sensor, that will instantly notify the Smart phone of the primary user, or any household member selected, that something is happening that should not be. That notification, once received, could allow the respondent to give their Smart phone a command such as "Alexa, Show Me", and immediately see what is happening while the Show remains silent, while in no way alerting any potential intruder, except perhaps, Alexa's eventual face staring them down. Then, if needed, the user could call the police and give the intruder a welcoming farewell surprise. The Echo Show could potentially be the perfect silent alarm, giving one the option to see what's happening before the police are called for what could possibly be no reason at all. Makes me wish computer programming made any sense whatsoever to me.

Something else I recently discovered is that while the Alexa App on your Smart phone will import any contacts who also have the Alexa App on their Smart phone, you do have the option of blocking any of them whom you do not wish to communicate with via the Alexa App. The App is also helpful in giving yourself a reminder when get home. Just send yourself a text or voice message through the App if you have something you may need to take care of but may forget otherwise. The yellow lights will be active on the Echo, and the Show will have the number of messages illuminated in the conversation symbol.

author: Ray Schaar
title: Next Logical Echo Was Video and This Echo Doesn't Disappoint
content:
Simple answers on this great model of the Echo.  Great Picture, Great Sound, Great Camera, Easiest setup of all the Echo products.  I love the suggestions that rotate on the screen.  With time and temp always on the home screen this is a great silent partner even when it is not being used.
I love the graphics when playing music.  The next logical Echo was the Echo video and it is as good as one would expect.

author: J. Lattier
title: I love it! It is helpful to me
content: I love it! It is helpful to me, keeps me company, and answers the million questions I ask myself everyday. Now Alexa can answer it all. She also plays my favorite music. I'm set up with my son on his Alexa at his house, so if I need help, and I'm within a 25 foot range, I can call Alexa to get my son on the line to assist me. It is great for an old lady like me!

author: Walter Baker
title: Great for Parents who are not tech savy and children who are
content:
I purchased this product for my mom who lives over 300 miles away and doesn’t own a smartphone or computer to do FaceTime with her grandchildren. She still uses a slider phone with no video capabilities and the drop in feature has amazing call and video quality. At first I started using the video capabilities by standing or sitting next to the Echo Show and it was a hassle  to move it to catch all the things the grandchildren wanted to show grandma (their cartwheels, summersualt, you’d, etc.). Then I discovered the Alexa app on my iPhone and the drop in feature is like FaceTiming (WIFI and LTE) with my mom on her Echo Show. The picture quality and sound was great, but i think this will vary depending on the reception you get and your high speed internet package. There are a lot of apps like Facebook and WhatsApp that have these video calling capabilities but again my mom doesn’t have a smartphone and this Echo Show was the perfect solution for us. I also bought her a 4K Sony TV that works with Alexa but it didn’t have as many features as I hoped. My mom can control the TV with the basic functions such as turning on or off the TV, turning volume up or down with the Echo Show.

My children love talking to Alexa through the Echo Show. We create a playlist for each individual house member and Alexa will play their playlist for them to have a dance party before bed or use it for waking them up. The only drawback about the playlists, it is very slow to skip through songs toward the bottom of your playlist. Another cool feature is playing the music on all Echo devises in your home. I wish Amazon Music Unlimited allowed the Echo Show to play two different songs at once as a single user. The only way of doing this is by purchadi the family plan and signing in as a different user for each Echo Show. Another way is by using Amazon Music on one device and Spotify, Pandora, Apple Music, etc. on another device.

The multiple timer feature with Alexa works amazing. Way better then Siri. My wife uses it when she cooks, I use it when I grill, we use it when someone needs to take a time out or how much time someone has to finish up cleaning their rooms or floor messes.

We use the Echo Show for White Noise. The problem with this is that Amazon sends updated to your Echo Show automatically and when they do, it resets the Apps you use during that time. Therefore the White Noise will stop working.

We also have the Ring product. It does work on the Echo Show but you can only see who is at the front door and you can’t have a 2 way communication. Hopefully this will change in the future.

author: Jon Baker
title: It’s pretty good but beware...
content:
It’s a decent device so long as you don’t mind that it can lose features without notice.  Amazon marketed this device heavily around video content, specifically YouTube.  Then it lost the ability to access YouTube.  I understand that this was Google’s decision but Amazon should have had an agreement in place to prevent this from happening.  I don’t like spending $230 on something that only works slightly better than other devices I own and living with the risk that at any time it can lose features.

Beyond that, it’s an Echo.  Works great for controlling smart home devices.  Certainly wouldn’t pay $230 again for this knowing what I know now.  I called and complain and they finally offered me a partial refund.

author: Amazon Customer
title: 90 yr old says he likes it
content: Bought it to keep in contact with 90 yr old father. Had relatives help set it up and have been using it for about a week - just video chats.  90 yr old likes it and so far has not had any problems using it, but we have not introduced any of the extra features as it may get too confusing for a guy who is not techno savvy.

author: Aly P
title: Excellent connected devise
content: This is the best connected home. I purchased this so I could connect with my ring doorbell. This is excellent. No delay or lag and had a great screen resolution. I love this for listening to music and the drop in feature is awesome. You also can call cell phones by saying “Alexa dial and the number “. I would recommend this for anyone wanting to have a connected home. There also are numerous apps you can get like sports and weather etc.  This devise also can set alarms and reminders.

author: Mary A
title: The Echo Show is amazing. We got Alexa to help trigger memories for ...
content: The Echo Show is amazing. We got Alexa to help trigger memories for my Aunt that has Alzheimer's.  She loves music-it is wonderful to be able to ask Alexa to play the songs that she remembers, or to tell her what the weather will be like.  Her face just lights up when the music plays!  This type of technology is such a blessing! I would recommend this to family members that have loved ones with Alzheimer's or dementia.  Alexa will do so many things, we are still learning-like I say, this technology has been such a blessing.

author: GeorgeB
title: Very Handy Device
content: So far the show has worked quite well. I can make video calls that work very well, very stable and very clear. Music plays back wonderfully, sound quality is good, video quality is good and many apps, like the news update and so forth, work quite well. I'm very pleased with the Show.

author: Joe Vandeveer
title: Save your money and buy regular echo device
content: Decent functionality and uses in the kitchen but the screen is essentially useless, THIS DEVICE NO LONGER SUPPORTS YOUTUBE, if you are planning on viewing online videos or recipes your options are extremely limited. Will only play the clean version of many songs no matter what command I say. Listening to rap or pop music is difficult when half the words are left out.

author: Tyler
title: Great overall. Audio could be better. Great video chat/Ring connectivity.
content:
I happened to stumble upon this little gem at a Treasure Truck at a price that I couldn’t pass up and glad I got it. It’s a great piece and love the pictures and videos that it can “show” (pun intended). I knew about the issues with YouTube and am still upset over the fact that this can’t display YouTube videos. There is a work around, but it’s just not worth the trouble. YouTube was one of the selling points of this product and after it was taken away, I felt like I was misguided since the reason to buy this was to easily look up YouTube videos.

Albeit that is no longer an option, I do like the fact that I can view my Ring cameras on this device when you link your Ring account via the Alexa app. Another great feature is the video calling. My family also has a Show and love how I can call them on and video chat with them. In their case, their Show is not on a lower table, so they have to angle the device down to see them better. Maybe have an adjustable camera for the next gen?

Another neat feature is that you can almost use this as a security camera to keep tabs on your own house by dropping in and making sure everything is fine.

Besides the YouTube issue, I was not impressed with the audio quality at all. It’s definitely deeper than the first gen Echo, but it is not as clear. Of all of the Echo devices, the first gen is the staple when it comes to audio quality. Unless you have an Echo Dot connected to an external audio source, and you’re an audiophile, the first was the best. I think that all Echo devices should have Aux out capability as well as dual Bluetooth. I really like how I can use Multi-Room music across all (4 total) Echo devices, but I cannot connect my phone to any of them and then have them also connect with Multi-Room music. I can only use the radio/audio features built into Alexa.

Overall, it’s a great product, but keep an eye out for Treasure Truck deals.

author: C. Barnette
title: Sad
content: Since YouTube was removed, our Echo Show has become somewhat of a paper weight or just an alarm clock...

author: Jim Raulerson
title: A great device...with a major drawback.
content: I dislike the fact that you don't have the ability to navigate through Prime Music and Prime Video like you can on a tablet or phone.  So far, though, that's my only complaint.

author: AmazonIsTheFuture
title: Don't bother. Get an Echo.
content: We are big fans of the Echo universe. We have the 1st gen Echo and 6 echo dots. The Show replaced our first gen Echo in our kitchen. We've been using our Show since it first came out and we have to say we are consistently disappointed by the device. Our number one complaint is the damn thing doesn’t hear us. Its inconsistency is the only consistency. While the Echo which this replaced heard us just fine (and still does), the Show does not. The quality of the audio is not any better than the 1st gen echo. The screen, especially since the loss of youtube, is rather superfluous. The "skills" haven't unlocked the screen in any meaningful way. No slide shows. No news shows. Frankly, we'd be much happier with an Echo connected speaker with better sound. I'd recommend that you skip the Show. It's a waste of money. Get an Echo instead.

author: Larry Fanella
title: We use it like a home assistant
content: We use it like a home assistant...adding items to shopping list, asking about things we need to know, and many other useful things like adding items to our calendar.  We have two echo show's so use the drop in feature a lot.  I spend time in another state so my wife and I use it very frequently such as having coffee together in the morning or dinner together while visiting on the show...

author: charles rountree
title: Amazon let us down bad with this one...
content: With youtube gone this thing is a bit over priced even at its current discount. I also think its kinda crazy this thing does not have a AUX out. I wanted to hook it up to my computer and use my computer speakers with it and without a AUX out the alexa it makes this impossible. Also you cant stream music to your computer even through the Bluetooth :/ Extremely underwhelmed now that I cant do either of the things I was really looking forward to. Wish Amazon didnt let me down so bad. Will see what happens through updates, but if something doesn't happen soon im going to for sure return this thing.

author: Brooks C. Clark
title: No love after YouTube lost.
content: I was very excited to get this. I happily used it for months, BUT after it lost YouTube, twice, I was totally disheartened. I feel like I was sold a car that they disabled reverse after I bought it. I would return it if I could. Sigh

author: Shawn C
title: Not smart home ready... unless you just want Alexa to watch and listen whenever you enter a room...
content:
I bought my Alexa Show, Spot, Echo, Echo Fire TV Cube and Echo Plus primarily for listening to Spotify at my house and controlling the TV. While the audio initially worked fine, I was disappointed with the "smart" features of the system. For example, devices can only be a part of one single group. If you want a device in a group called "downstairs", but also want it in a separate group called "Livingroom", you can't do it. It's one group of or the other.

Also, if you say "Alexa, turn to CNN", there is a strong chance an Alexa device (not the Fire TV Cube) will answer and tell you that it does not know how to handle the command.

OK, so these can be semi-dismissed as minor flaws or growing pains as Alexa matures...

But with every update, the streaming audio capability of these devices worsens. A few weeks ago the echoes with a display started showing the incorrect song playing.
