And with the latest update, the devices are simply going silent in the middle of songs. To get audio again, you either have to skip the current song or pause then play it to hear any audio. It's honestly rendered the units useless to the point I've taken them out of groups and rely solely on my Sonos speakers.

Support has been non-existent except to deny there is an issue while simultaneously saying there will be an update. You can talk to two people in a row and they will tell you completely different things.

I spent several hundred dollars on these devices and I am honestly ready to drop them off at Goodwill. If you are buying these devices to listen to music in your home, they are absolutely worthless. You cannot even listen to a single song without manually pausing/re-starting every 20-30 seconds.

author: J. Stutzman
title: FaceTime to an entirely new level.
content: Great product, video conferencing is smooth and clear.  Love the lyrics when asking to play music genre. Some responses from Alexa are still lacking depth but that will continue to improve over the years. Now video call granny!

author: Grizzzly
title: some items are great, others, ehh
content: Great idea, but alexa has a lot of upgrades to get done. It is loud on pandora, you can watch movie trailers on it, and it is touch screen. I can not remember off hand exactly what questions, but she does the "hmm I am not sure" or similar far too often. it would be fun if she had more of a personality... weird to say about a computer, but you get what I am saying!

author: Dragoncat
title: Nice addition to the Echo family
content: I have a few Echo Dots and a regular Echo (original).  This addition to the kitchen is just what I needed to round out my place.  The visuals are great and the audio range while cooking makes it an all-purpose device for food preparation.

author: Anita G. Boone
title: Echo Show Is The Gadget of 2018!!
content: This thing is amazing!  She'll give you the weather in the area.  Have her play music and she gives you the lyrics.  24/7 she posts things at the bottom of the screen you can ask her.  24/7 she shows you headlines.  Each day you can ask for a birthday round-up and she'll give you stars' birthdays.  You can ask her anything and most of the time she'll pop the answer on her screen for you to read along with her reading aloud.  I just can't say enough good things about her.  She's FABULOUS!!

author: Elizabeth's Grandpa
title: Recommended
content: Easy to set up and use for a senior citizen with somewhat limited IT skill. Video calls allows us to see our first grandchild living 1000+ miles away.  Video and sound quality very good.  I'm using it to play music as an easy option to radio.

author: DeltaTech
title: Not worth the price. an Echo with an Android or Fire Tablet  has more functionality for way less money.
content:
As of 08/16/2018 The Echo Show seems like a product that is still in early Beta.
I really wanted to love the Echo Show, the software for the Echo Show needs a lot more development and is lacking basic functionality.(DEV TEAM-This is just constructive criticism)
I've been doing everything Alexa does(except for Smart home Automation) on my Windows PC for the past 12 years with Microsoft Speech Recognition  and WSR Macros along with VBS scripts to make the computer respond with voice...
There are things I have found useful,
Pros
1. control smart home devices via voice,
2.playing music (the sound quality is just ok for the price)(Only while connected to the internet---------)
3.Timers.
The Cons are numerous though
 Cons
1.Always online- no offline functionality what so ever
2.Finding useful skills has been impossible for me.
3.The screen is not used often enough to justify having one,it needs a skill to find and browse skills to be developed.....
3.It needs a usable web browser to be developed or unlock the one already hidden in the settings.
4. Alexa isn't an A.I., if it is,then it seems to be an extremely soft A.I.
5.  needs more customization settings-I.E. ability to choose or block news sources which show on the home screen.
6. Alexa  misunderstands often
7.Barge-In  needs improvement
8. has no Anaphora Resolution, needs developed
 I got a second Show for my Kitchen so I could view recipes while cooking only to find that every skill I tried had way too many flaws to be useful.
 I still have to use my phone,Laptop or tablet to view recipes.
 I do have the ability and knowledge to code skills, I won't since Alexa is cloud based and uses an API.
 I plan on installing OpenHAB and using raspberry-pi with the internals out of the two echo shows to build a better device for my own use which would make a web server or cloud service optional for Home Automation,
 The biggest reason is because it will ALWAYS work on my Intranet if the Internet is disconnected or down and will still play Music/Movies/T.v. that I have already bought over the past 20 years from my Home Plex server.
 I did get a call from Amazon Support which was more of a waste of time than helpful.
I think The Echo Show has too much wasted potential and will never live up to the potential I know it has built in.
I do appreciate that Amazon has not stuck us with Ads on the Echo Show.
I will update periodically and am hoping for the development of better software and useful Skills.

author: Pattidoll
title: Very convenient
content: I would like it to have a ring or some kind of buzz when somebody drops in. It doesn't announce itself well enough and I feel it to be. A little creepy that someone can drop in unannounced.

author: Tiffany
title: dont like it
content: bought at Christmas and just now opened it about 2-3weeks ago.. most of the time I have to unplug it or factory reset it bc when you say Alexa, the little blue line pops up indicated you talking but doesn't do or say anything, so I have to do a factory reset or unplug it and then it works. I feel like simple things that should be easy to answer or find, she always says "sorry I dont know that one" or it brings up something you weren't even talking about. the otherday my fiancé and I were talking, no words even close to the word alexa got said but it still popped up the little blue line indicating that it was listening to you talk...

author: Sumita Ghosh
title: Great Product. Nice screen.
content:
We have numerous Alexa products and this was our first with a screen. Great product, nice sized screen. Use it in conjunction with our other smart products (ring doorbell, smarthings hub) and they work well together.  The sound is also great and love that the words to the song shows up on the screen.
The one draw back I have is the sound recognition isn't as great. We replaced our first generation Echo with this Show and it doesn't pick up our commands across the room as well as the Echo. Do find that we have to talk a little louder or get a little closer for it to recognize us.  Otherwise works great.

author: Irene Dodson
title: defective product
content: It worked fine for a couple of months - now the screen has lines on the display which are distracting - it hasn't been touched since I bought it so this is a defect with the product.

author: margaux
title: First impression of Show
content:
I received the Show as a Christmas gift.  I already had an Echo Dot and recently bought the Sonos One.  I used the Dot to listen to a Flash Briefing at bedtime, and to run my bedroom lamp off a small WeMo plug (and my lamp became my bedroom fan during the summer).
The Show was easy to set up, the Dot moved into the kitchen, and now can play "Music Everywhere".  The screen is small, but on my bedside table, I was able find Doctor Who episodes and watch a bit right before bedtime.  I also found some yoga videos on Amazon Prime which I shall find useful.

Why doesn't the Show have 5 stars?  Not enough video skills.  Here's a wish list:
I would like to enable the skill for say, CNN or MSNBC (or even better, Jake Tapper or Rachel Maddow), have it show me a group of recent clips, and I can say "Show me Clip # 3", to watch like video podcasts.  The CNN headlines available for Flash Briefing were pretty useless.
I'm surprised Amazon hasn't enabled a good selection of themes and background slide-shows, or encouraged third-parties to develop the same.  This time of year, I'd love a Tropical Island slide-show :)
There are excellent sources for music video besides Youtube.  VuHaus and NPR Music have wonderful selections.  What about an NPR Tiny Desk skill?
If I stop watching a Prime Video, it would be nice to come back the next night and say "Alexa, resume Doctor Who" and pick up where I left off.

Based on the other Amazon Echo products, I expect the Show to be far more useful a year from now.

author: Jessica's Gone Viral
title: Exactly what we needed
content: It took a little while to figure out how to “drop in” call the other echos we have in the house but once we did it has worked beautifully.  We have 6 Echo Shows setup around the house so that we can check on my ailing mother no matter where we are in the house.  We also linked the Show to an Amazon Cloud Cam to use as a “buddy monitor” for my brother with autism. Such a great system.

author: OutdoorAdventurer
title: Needs Better Support, Verbal Commands, and Access to Internet - Disaapointed So Far
content:
I called Amazon to ask questions about the product. For example, how to stop a movie from playing (it only pauses) and was given an answer that is not correct. It doesn't play YouTube, you can't browse the web, seemed like a good idea for things like recipes in the kitchen...but it wont do that either so I called Amazon for help understanding it. Other than showing the weather outside and playing amazon prime videos, the agent was unable to provide a reason to buy the product.

This seems like a product built for a kitchen. It would be nice if you could browse the internet for recipes, or save them. Likewise maybe create a shopping list and print it. Watch movies on Netflix or Hulu, but it does none of those things.

Amazon, I would really like to speak with an experienced agent who can tell me why to hang on to this thing.I love the Echo....got two of those, this Show, however, needs better guidance for users (and little better training on the reps who are answering the calls).

author: Carol J. Beck
title: We absolutely love it and highly recommend it
content:
We received the Echo Show as a gift from our daughter.  We absolutely love it and highly recommend it.  The best part is that when we talk with our daughter we can now see her.  The screen is clear and bright.  The sound is great.

We are constantly discovering New ways to use the Echo.  Alexa answers numerous questions, finds our phones and provides weather updates.  Love the link to prime that enables my music to be played.

It's quick, easy and fun!

author: A. Gift For You
title: I would like to return this product but the website does not ...
content: Amazon has removed Youtube from Echo Show. This is unfair to me as a consume since I purchased the Show to be able to see youtube videos. I would like to return this product but the website does not allow me to do so now.

author: Vicky
title: This is amazing.
content: Love it. It heard me talking on the phone and started a movie! I didn’t realize I could watch movies on it. It’s perfect to have in the kitchen so you can ask it for recipes, just give it an ingredient or two and it will list recipes. I want one in every room

author: Robert
title: Save your money
content: Doesnt do much and does not support you tube. Meaning the only videos you can watch are through Amazon Prime.

author: Charles L. Curtis
title: I think regift it to someone who has more fun with the technology for the sake of technology
content: This device does a small number of things well.  It will tell you the temperature and time; play a limited selection of news stories from Reuters; play some music selections by name, category or artist.  It's a very narrow skill set.  Today it lost the WiFi connection and I have not been able to reconnect.  In my mind, it's now moved from the "labor-saving" category to the "labor-wasting" category.  I think regift it to someone who has more fun with the technology for the sake of technology.  UPDATE:  Moments after writing this review a nice man named Tim called me from Amazon and walked me through the way to reconnect with my WiFi.  There's a pulldown menu on the screen I had overlooked.  With that info panel it was an easy job to reconnect.  Thanks, Tim!!

author: Scott Greczkowski
title: Getting better all the time.
content: Not perfect but still fun to use.  There is so much I want this thing to do that it does not do currently... but it keeps getting better all the time and no other device comes close.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Great, but needs a major information upgrade to keep ...
content: Great, but needs a major information upgrade to keep me off of using Google on my phone instead, to find general facts

author: T. Uhler
title: I love it but wish the screen is bigger
content: I love it but wish the screen is bigger.I like that still has some learning to do and it gets a little frustrating when she can't understand what you're asking hopefully as a I evolved if I get better but since I ordered my first Alexa over a year ago it really doesn't seem to have changed. I do find Siri is able to come up with answers a little better. But my heart belongs to Alexa

author: eliane
title: It does work with ring doorbell!
content:
Now it works with the ring doorbell! I had to come back here and write a new review.  After 6 months that I have purchased the echo show.
They finally fixed the issue I was having.  I am Now able to talk, hear and be heard from my ring device.
________(below was my previous review)______
They say it works with ring doorbell pro, but it does not.
People who are standing outside your door can hear you talking, but you can not hear them talking.
..super mad_ this was the only reason why I purchased this product.  Fix it amazon!

author: Rodney McKay
title: Was great, but now...
content:
• No longer works with YouTube, which is how I previously used it much of the time.
• The screen on mine started flickering badly, and getting it replaced under warranty was a major headache.

I think a new Amazon Fire tablet that supports hands-free Alexa might be a much better option than the Echo Show.

author: Nikki_New
title: Flickering screen
content:
I bought this 07/2018... I love my echo show but the screen has started flickering. Seems a bit premature. Now I can’t figure out how to return/exchange this for a new one and I don’t see a phone number for Amazon customer service. There are also a lot of things I ask Alexa and she says, “Hmmm... I don’t know that?” She’s not at all like Siri, which is what I thought when I bought it.

***UPDATE*** 2/9/19
I was able to contact customer service. I sent my device in for repair and it was returned to me with a scratch on the screen (see pictures).

***UPDATE*** 2/14/19
Customer service sent me a replacement device for the scratched screen. Unbeknownst to me, it was refurbished and it started turning itself off and restarting. This process is very cumbersome. I complained to customer service about them sending me a refurbishment when I bought a new device and this one is screwed up too. I really like having the freedom my Echo Show gives me but if they can’t get it right this time, I’m going to get a refund.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Screen flickers and the options are limited.
content: I enjoy the Amazon and Alexa products for what they can do w music, my home security system and functionality. So when I bought my wife the Show I had high hopes for what we would use it for. You can't watch YouTube video or any other type of video if it's not part of Amazon and their Prime. The screen started to have half of it glitch/flicker which requires us to restart it and of course once it started doing that it was to late to return. Just thought it would be more universal w using other options but maybe later down the road it will get an update to allow those options.

author: Dan Anders
title: Great display
content: I love the Echo Show. You always see the song you are playing. It also plays music videos and movie trailers. When you ask for the weather, she gives you a video showing temperature, forecast including a 10 day forecast. Great for the desk or office.

author: Scott M
title: Bring back YouTube and I'll give you a 5th Star!
content: Loved the Echo Show until a few days ago (would have been 5 stars) when YouTube quit working with it.  The big perk to this unit was the ability to watch videos in the kitchen when cooking and other times but now it is useless for that.  Video Drop In works great from my phone to check on my daughter though!

author: corey
title: It's as useful as you make it!
content:
So far we're really enjoying the Echo Show. Initially we kind of struggled to find practical uses for it but after a few days it became evident that with a little effort you can do alot.

Security cameras - if your cameras support RTSP then you can use Monocle skill to set up all your non-alexa enabled camera easily. "Alexa, show me the front door" and I'm looking at the front door. Now this skill is still beta I believe so about once a week or two it won't work as the service is down for a short period, but given that accessing the feeds this way is far faster than opening any phone based apps, I'd call it a win. My wife recently had twins so that makes this feature even more useful since we get alot of solicitors who love to annoy homeowners in the area.

Drop in - each of my kids have a Dot, a Echo in the bedroom, a dot in the guest room, and a dot in the basement. So using drop in is really handy to tell someone somewhere in the house something.

Announce - you can broadcast a message to all other exho devices in the house with this simple command. This is great for gathering the family for dinner time.

Random news stories - the device scrolls different news stories across the screen throughout the day along with the command to hear more about this particular story, such as "Try 'Alexa, what's the whale story' ". If you want to hear the story about a new pod of whales that the headline above mentioned.

Camera - This has been alot of fun to be honest. With a variety of stickers you can take selfies with different art superimposed such as a mustache or silly hat.

Custom Skills - With Amazon's "Skill Blueprint" feature it has not become ridiculously easy to built your own custom Skills. I created one based on the house guests blue print where you list off different things a guest may want to locate or ask how to do along with the answers and boom, now visitors know where to find TP, plungers, silverware, plates, bowels, fire extinguisher, remote controls, bathrooms, change inputs on the TV, turn the theater on and off, password for the WiFi...and so on.

author: Allen W. Parker
title: love the experience with both voice and display
content: love the experience with both voice and display.  Use mainly for music and info but also control Lutron lighting and Honeywell HVAC.  Keep the skills coming.

author: cindylou Cavanaugh
title: Best product ever
content: I love my amazon echo. I have a 91 year old mother In law that lives by herself because she still wants her independence. Well she doesn’t like the computer because it’s hard for her to use. Fumbling with remotes and mouses is not what she wants to do. I got the echo show for her and showed her how to use it and she loves it. She listens to music and watches movies. Calls her children using the video call. And so many other things. Thank you amazon so much. I can now keep tabs on her.

author: Song
title: Great overall, needs more accessibility for speech impediments
content: I love that closed captions are available for my deaf husband, and the sound is great as well as her functionality. I give this a 4 Star because Alexa has a hard time understanding my husband because he does have a bit of a speaking accent being deaf and she doesn’t have a way to learn different voices.

author: Pampered 24
title: Not the best quality
content: This is the second time we have to contact Amazon in less than 6 months because the Echo starts freezing.  They say it is a software issue and that is it.  They won't replace it.  Only repair, and then it happens again in a few months.

author: HiThere
title: This thing is Awesome!
content: I've had the Dots for a while and finally decided to try the Show out. I'm so glad I did. I keep this in the kitchen and I love how you can pull up recipes, or movies, or whatever you want. Probably my favorite thing about it is being able to see the timer counting down without asking, "Alexa, how much time on my timer?" I'm sure you know what I mean. I see they have a new version of the Show out now so looks like I'll be buying one of those as an early Christmas present. Hope this was helpful!

author: Francesca Hernandez
title: Alexa is my handy assistant.
content: I love this! Put Alexa in my kitchen, she gives me recipe ideas, sets my kitchen timer, plays the daily news, text and call my contacts for me and plays Jeopardy when I am bored.

author: Texaskid
title: Echo Show device
content: First few days very happy with device but as day worn on getting more and more frustrated with its inability to access calendar.  I have had several communications with support via phone and email and they assure me they are looking into the problem and promise response by 2/22.  Seems that after an update to Alexa app it sometimes can access calendar but later in the day says "I'm having trouble accessing your calendar".  Using iCloud calendar and using the "specific" comments listed for Alexa on asking for calendar information.  Unit does well with turning on lights, accessing my  TV via Harmony App changes channels, turns TV/Cable box  on/off but calendar too difficult a task for it.

author: Emily and Jared
title: Neat Concept
content: It is a neat concept and will probably become more useful over time.  Right now, the link between the Show and my Ring doorbell is very slow and it does not work with many of my cameras I have around my home.  So would I recommend it?  Yes, but only if you have patience while compatibility is worked on.

author: Mupuman
title: Echo Show Rocks!
content: Love it, purchased an Echo also. I hav been adding smart home devices to my house and just ask Alexa to turn on and off my lights, lock my door, etc. I am an Apple Fan Boy and I choose Amazon over Homekit, sad to have to say. I love Amazon. I am a little disappointed that I spent over $1000 on Arlo HD pro camera's because they claim to be Alexa ready and they rarely work with the Alexa show. This is a NetGear problem but I thought those who are interested in Arlo may want to know, especially before dropping the money I did.

author: Mark
title: and a middle initial so in order to call him I literally have to say something like "Call Charles G
content: Works well, however contact management is extremely cumbersome. My father's contact has the long version of his first name, and a middle initial so in order to call him I literally have to say something like "Call Charles G. Johnson" instead of "Call Dad". I wish Alexa could support nick names for contacts to make it easier / more natural to call people we know. Honestly, there are people that show up in my contacts that I will NEVER call using Alexa. That is a worthless feature to me. However, using nick names is a big deal. The drop in feature works really well but my wife won't allow us to have it turned on because she thinks its creepy. I think if there is a better way to tell if somebody is watching / dropped in that would be nice. Also, it would be nice if the privacy setting allowed to block drop ins ONLY but allow calls to come through. That way you could leave drop in enabled and only disable it at certain times. Also it would be nice if you could set 'office hours' for drop in. Like only allow drop in during certain times of the day or allow drop in when in 'vacation mode' so you can check in on your house while you're away.

author: cm123
title: Good for streaming content from prime
content:
NO YOUTUBE! The system is OK, but overrated. For a video screen, it's extremely limited on what it will play.. NO Youtube!! Kills the main point. Secondly, it's difficult to find any way to play your own video content. Many content providers are NOT SUPPORTED.  Setup is tricky, options & functionality is limited.
It's handy for a clock, briefings, weather, shopping lists. Good for streaming content from prime, IF you know exactly what you're looking for.  Again, it's awkward to use & limited. The intelligence has a long way to go, but it's a step in the right direction. Needs more work & video options!

author: Amy K.
title: Where has this been all my life???
content: I use this to replace my old alarm clock, and it's a fantastic improvement.  It did take a few days before my alarm sound preference actually worked, which I think is a common complaint, but it's working now like a charm.  I have it set to turn off and on the Kasa bulb in my lamp, and of course it starts my morning routine with weather, commute info, and news.  But best of all....when it's time to sleep, I can tell it to shut down the display.  No more alarm clock lights shining in my middle aged eyes!  The display comes on in the morning with my alarm.  Love the Show!

author: J. Kim
title: No Youtube vids.
content: No Youtube.  If I didn't get big discount I would return it.

author: JonZ
title: Great As A Home Video Intercom
content: Has worked great as a video intercom throughout my home. I have a Nucleus intercom system, but have found that the picture and especially the sound quality are much better on the show when calling to another room. The Nucleus has always had sound quality issues and the picture quality is always hit or miss and usually ends up freezing within seconds of being into a conversation. That doesn’t happen on the Echo Show. Also bekng able to use Alexa for any questions or managing any of my other smart devices is a plus....being able to ask it to show me my Ring Doorbell and any one of my Arlo Cameras is FANTASTIC!  We also have become accustomed to listening to Pandora through it while we are cooking.  Just an all around good device...and I’m looking forward to trying out the 2nd gen very soon.  If I could recommend anything for an addition to make it better, it would have to be an inclusion of night vision for when you are video calling someone that is in a room that has poor lighting.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The commercials make it look awesome, easy to use
content: Bought this with 2 echo dots. The commercials make it look awesome,  easy to use, plug and play, No no and no. I use this device to ask the temp or the time. That is a terrible return on investment. Does not come with any helpful instructions. To learn how to use it you have to watch hours of you tube videos. Ohhh, you cant use you tube with this devise. JUNK. One more time, JUNK. Not from someone that wont back it up. My name is Ryan Ossege. My number is 513.  582.  3017.  I wouldnt give this crappy review without backing it up. Call me. I will tell you all about it. Persian gulf vet, husband, father, business owner.

author: shane zimmermann
title: It is nice to have a screen with an Alexa product
content:
Its okay. Basically a stationary version if Siri. It is nice to have a screen with an Alexa product, but at the time of this review, Youtube won’t function with it. This makes it severely limited. I have Amazon Prime video, but not a ton of content on there. Its nice being able to watch my Amazon stuff on the Echo Show, but I can’t watch Netflix or Youtube. Also, it can’t work without a corded connection to a power outlet, so for music I still use my Bose speaker in the other part of the house.

Its really nice for video calling family/friends, but they have to have an Echo Show as well. There’s a lot of features and things they keep adding to this device though, so I might get more out of it as time goes on.

I’ll end on a positive: the Amazon music feature is really cool. For $3 a month, you have unlimited music with the Amazon Music option. Any song any time. You only get this access on the Echo show, but that’s so cheap. It makes for a fun way to let everyone play around with the music for a party by just yelling “Alexa, play ____!”

Highly recommeded for peoplemwho’d rather say “Alexa, tell me the weather forecast” than check an app on their phone. The music feature is cool. And if you’ve invested a lot in Prime Video already, this will make a lot of sense for you.  If you already play on your phone a lot, and don’t know anyone with an Echo Show, then I’d hold off.

author: Mary
title: Alexa is fun!
content: I gave this product a 3 only because I am still learning all it has to offer.  I love the fact that I can tell Alexa to call my family (that has the same product) and we can chat.  I love that I can get the weather and set a timer so easily.  My husband has been recovery from a fall and is in rehab and sometimes I will just ask Alexa questions or turn on radio to see me company and it is easy.

author: Lance
title: A few upgrading ideas for Amazon and the Echo Show.
content:
Great improvement over the original echo which I have owned since released.  Instead of placing another review which many people have done already let me post some good ideas for software upgrades.  At the bottom of the screen where Alexa places the usual color bar that used to be the colored rings on the original.  A software upgrade would be nice where if you have a missed message instead of the right hand corner icon make the line at the bottom of the screen blink green like the top ring does on the original.  For a missed call maybe another color on the bottom and a third color for missed call and message.  Another possible upgrade would be for anyone having more than 2, or even for more than 2 with friends and family the ability to have a party type call where the screen would then have half size or quarter size pictures instead of the full screen for a party or 3 way call. Also for anyone having the Alexa show and echo when a call is made to the show a ring audible to the original echo in case you are in a different room.  The messages now go to both, no reason the ring shouldn't, just some ideas.. A slide shutter for the camera might be nice instead of shutting the camera or blocking it with something so you can keep drop in enabled on the show.  It's new and I know it will evolve.
Great unit.

author: 50poof
title: Personalize your screen saver
content: I like have the screen to look at for videos and music lyrics.  The movie clips and news takes it to a whole new level of just asking questions to Alexa. The skills it can perform in addition to screen savers makes it fun to try.

author: Eric B Hendricks
title: I so wanted to love this! I loved my other Echo devices but ...
content: I so wanted to love this!  I loved my other Echo devices but this one is clearly not ready for prime time .  Choppy bluetooth, frequent short lockup, hanging apps - I am so disappointed.

author: MS77
title: Work in progress, hoping it gets better
content:
Needs more integrations and it needs to work better.  For example, I cannot seem to find a simple command for Echo to tell me what my Honeywell thermostat is set to,  I can change it up and down, it just won't report the current setting.  Also I have Shows in multiple homes, need a better way to delineate which devices go with which location.  For example, when in location "1" and I want to change the temperature, it should default to the thermostat co=located with the Show device I am speaking to.  Then it could require more specific instructions if I want to change the thermostat in the other location.

Also, integration with Ring cameras is sporadic at best.  Sometime it shows them, sometimes it doesn't, even when the Ring App itself is able to show them.

In addition, I would expect to be able to have more customization available for the Home Screen such as showing the current date along with weather conditions and forecast.  It is a "Show".

It's a lot of money to spend for an alarm clock and shopping list manager.

author: Toni McGovern
title: Poor Ring Doorbell and WD My Cloud experience; otherwise Great!
content: Mostly this device is excellent but there are 2 specific reasons I bought it and those 2 things are less than excellent.  1) To view my Ring doorbell.  I haven't gotten it to work properly yet. and 2) to play music off my WD MyCloud.  I have the older cloud version and it is not compatible.

author: Lucylynn1202
title: Echo show review
content:
So far so good. I love the constant streaming for things you can ask it and things to try. I've only had it a few days so I'll see how it goes.
Also it has a very nice screen. Haven't tried the speaker to capacity yet but it's decent. The alarms could be louder.

author: William R. Hunter
title: Limited distance from Router.
content: Fun calling up music but was able to stump it on some oldies. Alexa has a bad attitude and acts snotty like an ex wife. Needs more range from Router as the signal dies easily. Needs bigger speakers. Also limited on “ wake” option phrase. Would rather custom program a “ wake” word. We like it. Cannot wait for an improved version.

author: Krystal
title: Love it for pairing with devices and voice control to ...
content: Kind of a mixed review. Love it for pairing with devices and voice control to change to the next song, volume, and song selection without having to stop what you are doing. I tried to get a measurement conversion and it didn’t understand. If you say Alexa and pause or stutter she can’t help you. If there is background noise from kids it can’t differentiate who to listen to even if you stand in front of it. Have tried to add items to shopping list because writing it down on a random paper isn’t working. Reviewed my list and only 4 items were recognizable. Alexa doesn’t understand you for many things I asked questions while cooking or cleaning and in would always tell me “I don’t understand” or “I can’t find that for you” tried using it to order off amazon per the videos and instruction guides it never turned up what I asked would have to stop use my phone app to order. The screen only shows like 10 items for what you are looking for on amazon. For the price not worth it until they get down voice recognition better. Setting reminders and timers

author: Deb
title: Not as expected
content: The home screen doesn’t let you choose what you want showing, mine has options on what to ask Alexa on the bottom and I don’t think it can be turned off. Also video call is only for people that have the show too, huge disappointment. Thank goodness I didn’t pay full price! Not worth the price!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love it
content: I have two and I love them.  I also have two Echo shows and an Echo dot.  I have a lot of my house set up with smart home products and I can't imagine living without it now.  I'm thinking about buying the one for the car eventually.

author: Margaret P
title: Just OK
content: It’s just ok. Nothing special- and since it’s not battery operated, portability is lost as it has to have a plug. Got this on sale Amazon - would not pay too much for this.

author: Janoux
title: Learning to love it.
content: Taking it slow and not trying to do complex things at the beginning. The functionality is amazing. I'm really happy I waited until Echo Show became available; the screen makes all the difference in rounding out the experience. Hoping for a future version where I can pick the name it recognizes.

author: Shanwhit
title: Alexa is always trying to connect.
content: I like the screen. Its nice to see recipes and news reports. I like the speakers and the area coverage with the Show. But Alexa will just blurt things out at random times, this happens a lot with the Show. It also happens with the Echo Dot. But the most frustrating thing with the Show is it constantly goes offline. I have not had this issue with any of my Dots.

author: Movielighter
title: Great Automation !
content: Present for my Wife- Already had the Echo, wanted to add a little more. Seeing the waether, connecting from the app on our phones and talking to the kiddos and dog while at work are a plus. Connected with the Etekcity wall outlets, for the Christmas Tree and a table lamp. Really enjoying it and all of the options we have.

author: Texas Artist
title: Bought 2 and they are the Bomb!
content:
I love this device. We bought 2 as I have a 2 story house and one of us is upstair in the computer filming studio working most evenings and I am down stairs after dinner usually working on my computer while listening to an audio book. We have it set up as a video phono and when Jon calls me to ask a question, my audible book pauses and the Show lets me verbally answer him. I can see his face while we talk which I love. Years ago Disney had a special pavilion of future predicted devices and video phones was one of them. This is so much better because I do not want to be on video most of the time with other people and have never been a fan of skype. I think we are using this like our own voice activated  walkie talkie with a picture and it will let me leave a voice message without having to do it from my Iphone.  I have 3 other echo devices in the house and this is my favorite.
We will probably discover more stuff to use it for but if that is all it did I would be very happy.

author: Ron Wedel
title: This most stupid smart device I have
content:
This thing is stupid, does not do anything on it's own with out downloadeding skills continuously and then it seams like it forgets that it has the skill and you have to start over.

Just buy the google one..

It does display the time really well.

author: The fonefreak :)
title: echo SHOW is hott.. and a whole lot MO!
content:
This device is LEAPS 🐸 and BOUNDS 🐬over the echo dot 'hockey puck' or the Alexa tower and for these reasons :
1. It HAS A SCREEN people!! A GORGEOUS screen.. i mean WHY have a virtual assistant that you can only yap at??
2. INCREDIBLE SOUND 🔊 from it's two front firing speakers 🔊, deep bass with rich highs and perfect midrange.
3. Totally modern, modular, classy design.. i recommend the WHITE color. STYLE CITY 😎
4. SUPERB engineering.. built to last, i mean this baby is HEFTY, but in a good way.
5. They even thought of putting a rubber pad on the bottom to prevent it slipping off  your table, nightstand, etc.
6. The ' drop in' feature is probably a great idea for ppl who have ppl that have one also so you can video chat, i myself will never use it and being paranoid as i am, I put a piece of tape over it's camera. 😱😵
7. You CAN change the query command if you don't feature saying "Alexa" every time, which is intuitive.. especially if you maybe have an EX wife with that name, lol 😂.
8. Amazon claims they will always be adding new features and updates to the device and i feel they WILL cuz of course they strive to keep customers happy but also they wanna move these units like hotcakes!

So, this is MY input on the ECHO SHOW and i hope it might help you decide easier.
Why talk to a tinny sounding hockey puck when you can have a handsome mini TV / virtual friend in your house? 😉
Thanks for reading 😎
the phonephreak...

author: Ralph R.
title: Disappointed
content: First, the good.  The screen resolution is great and the sound is even better.  The sound quality is a HUGE improvement over my Echo Spot even with the speaker I bought to go with it.  BUT, it does not pick up my voice as well as my two Echo Spots.  Sometimes I have to tell it to stop and then start over several times with my instructions.  My biggest complaint is that after watching several videos it locks up.  If I unplug it and plug it back in it doesn't freeze up again for a while...but then I have to do it again.  It is as if it has a cache that gets full and has to be cleared.  Also, I thought I could get Netflix on it but apparently not...or maybe I just don't know how to get to it.  Another aggravation is for video series with several seasons (for example Frasier) it won't automatically pick up from the last video I watched.  Every time I have to tell it which season.  I've gone back to using my iPad to watch videos.  Maybe this is why Amazon cut the price so much.

author: Brian P.
title: Wor thy addition to my Echo, bummed about no YouTube....
content: As with most of the Amazon home products I felt this would be a great addition to my original Echo. I like the room to room drop-in feature and being able to make voice and video calls (so far flawless)...So my Show was and still is a welcome addition except for the lack of YouTube access....hopefully this will be resolved in the short term future.

author: Darryl Elder
title: Echo Show is superb
content:
Upon having the show for just a couple of weeks, I really like it. I bought two, so that I could put one at my mom's house as she has early onset Alzheimer's. It's nice to be able to 'Drop In' on her to check on her, even though there is always someone around. Video quality is pretty nice but I'm sure it depends on your up/down speeds.
Hopefully they will add a way to monitor your home with the cameras without using 'Drop In' but rather somehow clandestinely, so that it doesn't beep to alert someone that your watching, this way you could check on baby/dog sitters without them knowing.
The interface is intuitive, and it's nice to play games like 'Jeopardy' and now be able to see the clues, etc. on the screen.
The design is a little rushed it seems, as it would have been nice to be able to move the camera or even wall mount the unit, which would be awkward given the shape of the back the way it is now.
I have every Echo device that was made except for the 'Tap' and really like them.
Kudos to Amazon.

author: Ted Cichocki
title: Terrible Device - No support for Streaming Services, iPhone FaceTime, or Home Screen Customization
content:
Terrible Device - No support for Streaming Services, iPhone FaceTime, or Home Screen Customization...lack luster customization all around.

- No support for YouTube, Netflix, Hulu, or other streaming services except for Amazon Prime.
- No support for iCloud Photos, uploading multiple photos for background display, except for Amazon Prime Photo Library.
- No support to FaceTime anyone from your iPhone unless they have the Alexa App, or an Echo Show themselves.
- No support to customize Home screen scrolling updates.  I don't want to know about Paris Hilton getting married.  Show me stocks, weekly forecast, etc.
- No support to have the Routine setting remember custom voice commands like, "Show me the price of Facebook stock", can only select from predetermined pick-list of actions."

Ideally I would love for this device to scroll the following when idle - date, weekly forecast, daily calendar, and stock tickers.  If I tell it to facetime "XXX" I would love for it to sync to my phone and perform that action with the Echo Show's built in camera.  The only positive thing I can say about this device is that it can sync of with Spotify or Pandora.  Overall the device seems to better serve a kitchen or living room, not a home office.  It's strong suit is playing music on command.  Otherwise it's no different than the iPhone's Siri.

author: Paul Shuckhart
title: Love it!
content: Love it!! I brought the Echo Spot first but after awhile the screen was just too small for the living room, so I moved that one in the bedroom, perfect size for there. I brought this one for the living room and love the screen size and everything you can do with it. I've owned Alexa ever sense she first came out, I have so much stuff hooked up to her now I couldn't image life without her.

author: Kevin Walton
title: Turns Itself Off While Playing Videos
content: My Echo Show will turn itself off while playing videos unless I wave my hand in front of the camera every 3 minutes. Seriously, who thought this was a good design choice?! From what I can tell there's no way to disable this "auto turn-off" feature and it's completely ruined my ability to watch videos on the Echo Show.

author: Mackie McBride
title: Echo showless needs a lot of work...
content: Where can i start.... This Echo device is extremely limited to just basic functions. Touchscreen features are limited to a degree that you almost forget that it's a touchscreen. Amazon music features on this particular device suck needs a lot of work, like the ability to go back to a previous list instead of speaking to the device.  If there is any noise in the background that renders the Echo show def, you have to be up close for voice features to work. Third party camera apps works for home security but that's about it. Amazon has a lot of work ahead to make this device appealing, especially after losing YouTube feature. I was expecting more out of a device at this price range. I love my amazon devices but this one leaves you wishing it was more to it then this.....

author: Milan Thakkar
title: Product is Amazing
content: I really like this product. I don't like that it was $10 cheaper AFTER prime day and they would not credit the difference x the 6 units that I ordered. Sometimes big companies do not use common sense. It must be working because they are a trillion dollar company now. I had to return all 6 of these so I can reorder for $10 each less . $60 is $60. Why not ! I had a chance to play with it and it is here to stay so get used to it like the internet. Voice is the future. I'm glad to be a part of it early on. I even signed up to be a skill developer and have an AWS account. Amazing Amazing Amazing product !

author: Amber
title: This thing is so cool! I didn’t think it was necessary
content: This thing is so cool! I didn’t think it was necessary. We got one as a gift and I thought “what will we do with it?”. It’s awesome though! We love using it for music, timers, reminders, news updates. I keep mine in the kitchen. It also links to security cameras! So cool!

author: Val
title: which is a good deal, ti is definately not worth the 229 ...
content: Do not understand all the excitement over these alexa devices or the google ones either.  It rarely gets what I say correct, does not control the Dish receiver.  Yes I set it up correctly, using the alexa app on my phone.  We got this for 129,  which is a good deal, ti is definately not worth the 229 price though.  Maybe in another month it will get better, or either I have one that is just deaf and dumb.  Really can not recommend this item at the current time

author: Erick Bertram
title: Fun product
content: This is awesome like the drop in feature.... Like the Start my day feature as well.... it's nice to watch videos while at the breakfast bar...

author: Rick A
title: I have come to love it even more than my original Echo
content: At first, I did not think the Show would be worth it, but after owning one for a few months, I have come to love it even more than my original Echo. I use it to easily video chat with my daughter on a regular basis and watch TV shows while cooking in the kitchen. Also, the constant updates on the screen encourage me to take advantage of asking Alexa about things far more often than I used to with the Echo.

author: SPL
title: Skip the Spot and get the Show!
content: LOVE IT! We have several dots around the house and we initialy had the Spot for our main area but it did't quite get the job done. We switched to the Show and everything is great. All devices connect and picture and sound quality are very good. Glad we upgraded to this device.

author: Upstate
title: Great for Elderly Parents that Can't Use Touchpad Screens (like an iPad or Smartphone)
content:
Great for elderly parents!

My elderly parent is not used to portable land line phones (and was forgetting to hang up the line), so the Show works really well. No numbers to dial. She talks to the machine and it does what she tells it to do.

She initially didn't want video calling, but she loves seeing the caller!! Seems to view it as a talking TV!

It's also really great to check on how she looks that day. I can see the room she is calling from and whether things are in order or whether an aide needs to fix something.

The set-up however was very difficult. I live outside the US, have a foreign SIM card, and the Show app was not available where I live. Also, my mom does not have a US smartphone. Had to hire a techie to set up the machines where she lives and then I carried mine back on the plane. On the other hand, I plugged it in (it's dual voltage) and have had no problems after the initial set-up.

author: J. Edgar
title: Very entertaining, I miss YouTube though
content:
I love our Echo Show, we hooked it up to the Echo Connect so now we can even use it in emergency to dial 911 or any other phone number.
The sound is crystal clear, better than the Echo Dot.

What I like the most is the quality of the video chat, we have several Echo Spots in the house and it's a lot of fun to drop in on other family members, the sound quality is crystal clear and the video quality is outstanding!!
About dropping in, you can add Echo Spots or Echo Shows to your "household" in settings or you can choose from your contacts BUT the other person would have to give permission first, so no need to be worried that someone unexpected might drop in on you. Also, there is a sound when someone drops in on you and it will take about 10-15 seconds for the other person to be able to see you which gives you time to make yourself presentable. ;)

We put the Echo Show in our kitchen which is very entertaining. You can ask it for recipes, play music, add stuff to your shopping list, video chat with family members or watch a movie. I truly miss YouTube though and I really wish Amazon will be able to work it out with Google.

author: Dan Ahler
title: Echo Show will change elder monitoring forever.
content:
The Alexa show has enabled my siblings in different states to play a role in caregiving for my elderly mother. Since all it takes is the app and ability to drop in, we have schedules for monitoring that she takes the pills (that are delivered via a locked and timed pill dispenser) on time. It also allows remote visitors to talk to her face to face rather than limited to a telephone call.

Eventually I would anticipate the ability to cast this to a larger TV screen so that mom will be able to see far away family members as though they were in the room with her.

Every person in a nursing home with family that is in town or far away will want one to help increase the amount of time we can spend with a loved one.

author: H. Calhoun
title: Software fails during setup - hope you have a better experience.
content: I don't know why, but the setup process stalls at a point where your not given any option but to accept Amazon Music Services 30 day trial. Just stays on the screen no matter what you do. Seems like the software is broken. You'd expect a product from such an otherwise competent company would not have this problem right out of the box. Shame, seemed like a nice idea.

author: Chasity Breymeier
title: Shoddy Quality and Warranty policy
content: After less than 2 months, the screen started flickering. Since product was “over 30 days old”, customer service demanded that the product be returned for repair vs replacement. Disappointed in product quality and product warranty.

author: wendy.B1
title: They LOVE them they sing Karaoke with ECHO and laugh at ...
content:
I bought two units, they were gifts and I have had both friend and family call and tell me what they are doing with the Echo Show. They LOVE them
they sing Karaoke with ECHO and laugh at themselves and games. AMAZING GIFT!!!
I am jealous that I didn't  get one for myself.

author: Wayne W.
title: Easy to setup and the centerpiece of my connected home.
content: We’ve had the original Echo for quite some time and just recently added the Show.  It was simple to setup and more inviting to use with the visual interface.  The Echo is being used as the primary interface for my connected home system which is currently only controlling lights and switches.  I look forward to expanding on that capability.  We also use it for maintaining lists, as a music player, general information, and entertainment.  I haven’t used the Show to shuffle through our favorite  photographs but will start that soon.

author: J Dog
title: Average product with a high price tag
content:
Do you like talking to a machine that doesn't know anything? Well, this product is good for you then. I ask it plenty of questions and Alexa doesn't know that. Asking it factual questions is hit or miss.
Great at ordering Amazon things, but for the price its just hands free and Blah..but still has issues with that.
You could be having a conversation and say something and you know who tries to interrupt. My experience is 3 out of 5. Definitely needs to work Alexa out for better automation. Its a great ride at the beginning, but then becomes annoying when you have to buy everything to keep her going, like Music unlimited and whatever else you want her to do.
Great screen and customizable and sound is great, but lacks base for the sound guru's.

Best part of Alexa is telling her to sound like a sheep. Who comes up with this stuff.
Simon says "This Rant is Over" and then you will hear Alexa repeat.

Simon says "Goodbye"

author: Slermj
title: Adapter cable/cord is black and doesn’t match the white body of the echo show I ordered.
content: Just received yesterday and unwrapped today.  Super excellent packaging.  Shows a great deal of thought and creativity went into packaging.  Shows class and quality.  Haven’t hooked up yet so can’t give true evaluation until later.  Product appearance looks well made and of high quality.  My only real complaint is that I ordered it in white to match a new kitchen being remodeled.  The echo show body is white and looks great but the adapter and power cord are black.  This will stand out and be obtrusive in my new white kitchen.  This should have been peered with a white adapter/cable.  At the same time that I ordered the show I ordered an echo plus in white.  The echo plus looks great and matches the white adapter and cable supplied with the unit.  I compared the white adapter cable/cord with the black adapter cable/cord and except for the color they look identical and are both rated at 21 W.  I may need to return the echo show if I can’t receive a matching white adapter cable/cord.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Ho Hum Device
content:
I have purchased many Alexa enabled devices.  They are all ho hum.  This one is no exception.  Alexa is just not smart enough, and is too Amazon specific.  Ask Alexa common knowledge and she can give the wrong information.  Not just about things, I think she is wrong on, but on simple a geographic quiz.

Things that need to improve about Alexa:
1.) She/It needs to be better at finding information that the general internet can find.  If I can figure it out with Google, Duck Duck Go, or Bing.  She/It should be able to do it well.
2.) She/It needs to understand exceptions to the rules.  If I say that I want to have an Alarm at 5:30 every weekday, but not on the first of the year, good luck figuring that out.
3.) She/It needs to accept keyboard input from bluetooth enabled keyboards.
4.) Don't forget about mouse support.

Along with the confusions of Alexa.  There is the utter confusion about the Amazon Alexa App used to configure it.  How many ways do I have to configure the thing to keep purchases, even free purchases, from happening without my password.  Also, why on a screen enabled device do I need to go to a different app to do security.

On the plus side though, at least it finally has a web browser working since Amazon had that spat with YouTube/Google, they decided to make the system more functional.

Since this is a Linux system, I should have access to the terminal please.  I want my compiler and to run Docker and such while it sucks power otherwise idle.

Oh, and the screen turns on whenever doing voice input.  I'd much rather have "Alexa, turn screen on."  By doing that, I could actually keep the brightness down.

Sound quality is grand, but don't think Amazon is making this device for you.  They are making it to keep you in their ecosystem.

author: J. Watts
title: Very handy! Screen is a definite plus in terms of overall usability/usefulness
content: We had an original Echo in the kitchen and replaced it with the Echo Show when the price dropped to $100.  We love the new Show.  Yes the audio isn't quite at rich is the original Echo, but it's good enough for the kitchen environment.  The screen is a fantastic addition.  It's easy to see timers/alarms on the screen without having to ask.  The picture/slide show is nice.  Also, the constant little reminders of ways to interact with Alexa on the screen subtly helps train you in terms of it's possible uses.  Overall a great value!  Only real issue I have with it is that the vertical view angle is non-adjustable.  It really needs to be on a high counter (shown is ledge over sink); on a regular end table might be too low for comfortable viewing.

author: momof3crazies
title: Love the screen
content: We really enjoy our Echo Show 1st generation.  It does everything that we wanted it to.  It will show you the lyrics to songs as they are playing.  The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because Alexa doesn't always know the answer to all the questions we ask.  We are planning a trip soon so it would be nice if she could give us some fun things to do in the area when we go but she can't.  But overall a fun nice thing to have around.  We use it daily for streaming music.

author: LiquidSteam
title: Limitations..... but still kinda cool.
content:
This is not a review on the ALEXA system...just the Show. The sound is as good as the ECHO 2 and way better than the Spot and the Dot. The microphone it uses to pick up your voice commands is not good. At times I have to really raise my voice even in a quiet room. Now I am comparing that to the ECHO 2 and Spot which obviously have better 360 microphones. The camera is ok not great but not bad quality picture. The thing I'll warn you about is the camera has a slight upward angle so if you are planning on placing it on a high dresser or elevated shelf be aware that it will be looking at the ceiling and not straight. It's good in a bedroom as a "drop in" doesn't show your bed.... but if you want to video chat you'll need to keep it on a lower shelf and probably be standing or very close up to it.  Not really a negative but just a heads up for those in the market.

 Besides the poor quality microphone the only other complaint is the inability to use this as a realistic clock. The number display is small. I wish there was a setting to make the clock the ENTIRE face of the show at scheduled times like between 8pm-7am. The rest of the day it can scroll the headlines ect... but at night I would like a larger number clock function

author: Jennifer
title: My family loves it!
content: Never thought I’d love it as much as I do. I won it in a raffle, wasn’t really planning on buying one. We use Alexa all day long. I have Amazon music so I love the lyrics displayed. My kids love daily trivia and all the games they can play with Alexa. I still have to program Alexa with more of my preferences... but so far we just love it. I’m going to buy my parents one now.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Cool concept - however there are some tweaks that need ...
content: Cool concept - however there are some tweaks that need to be made. The timeout feature needs to be updated for certain apps. We use this in conjunction to our nest cams to keep an eye on our 5mo old and also our dogs. Would love to have the show be able to stay on as long as we like versus timing out after 30 minutes.

author: MG
title: This machine is a lot of fun!
content: This machine is a lot of fun!  It makes manageing my calendar easier, tracks my shopping list just by me yelling from the kitchen, plays music and reads books, tells corny jokes which is fun, plays movies, finds me new recipes, can tell random short stories, etc.  It's been less than a week and I already love it.  I'm still learning how to phrase certain requests so I don't get the dreaded I don't know that one response.  Only improvements would be weather radar and better general search answers; I asked it how many wind turbines were in a certain state and just received generic data on wind turbines.  When I search online, I can get an exact answer to a question like that.  Set up was very easy, adding skills is also easy.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good sound for the bedroom
content:
Good sound for what the product is.
 It’s a great music player and o’clock for the bedroom just a little too large or small nightstand.

 I prefer this over the echo spot Because  after a few configurations you can get the screen to time out and go dark so it’s not lit up all night long.

- something they need allow the echo spot to do.

author: Erica Buteau
title: Alexa is fun, Echo Screen trouble
content: I love this overall but in less than five months there’s been trouble with the display - lots of flickering on the screen.

author: Neil A.
title: I like the far field microphones so it picks up your ...
content:
I like the far field microphones so it picks up your voice fairly well.
Don’t like how you can’t make the clock bigger. My parents are unable to see the time from far away because the clock is so small. If there was an option to make the clock larger when in stand by it would be better and worth the 5 stars.

author: Daniel J. Roses
title: Limited benefits, many caveats
content:
I've had the echo show since day 1 and I think it is time to leave a review.

TL;DR

Buy it if:
-You want to frequently video call family
-Are cost conscious and subscribe to Prime Music

Do not buy if:
-You got some more money to spend and don't mind spending
-Won't Video Call
-You care deeply about user experience and music quality
-Are deep in the Apple ecosystem

As I obviously cannot return this anymore, I will be selling the two I bought on eBay. There are just no reasons to own this over other options. I know this may not be a popular opinion, but for those of us willing to pay more for a much better experience, owning an Apple HomePod has really show me how much I hate my Echo. Obviously the sound quality is far greater on the HomePod, but it should given the price difference. However, the kicker is the voice recognition. I use Echo mostly to turn my lights and equipment on and off. The Echo RARELY understand me the first time, no matter how quiet the room is and how clearly I speak. It will NOT hear you if there is any decent amount of background noise. It is FRUSTRATING and kills the usability. I can literally WHISPER with HomePod playing music full blast and it hears me no problem. To me, this is everything.

The screen, while novel is useful in only very limited situations. I will say, if you plan on video calling family, it is a no brainer to own one, especially at $150. Outside of that, and maybe the cute weather animations you can call up, I never use the screen. I was super excited when this device came out and replaced 2 standard Echos on day one. I just have not seen anything much of value come out since then.

The software is extremely lacking. Setting up devices and managing smart home functions frankly sucks. With the R&D budget Amazon has, it is quite embarrassing what they have designed here. The nail in the coffin is the lack of integration with YouTube and Apple Music, which is a killer for me. I do not want Prime Music and will never sign up for it, so I cannot listen to my music on this thing.

Additional note 1, processing user requests happens on the cloud. While not terribly slow, there is a noticeable lag when compared to a device like the HomePod which has an onboard processor.

Additional note 2, because processing is not done on the device, privacy and security are not as tight as many users might want. For further reading, google Apple's stance on user privacy, their insistence on maintaining it and why they do processing on board.

Pros-
-Has a screen, looking at weather and setting up a video call are easy and helpful
-Current Price. At $230 MSRP, it is overpriced for what it can do, at the current promo price of $150, worth it over a regular Echo

Cons-
-MICROPHONES ARE AWFUL - There might be 7 of them, but they were definitely made in China. I can be in a silent room and speak to Echo loudly and clearly and rarely does it understand me the first time, or the second..... absolutely frustrating. If there is any background noise or you ever watch TV, don't even bother
-Lack of useful apps for the screen. There just not much to use it for
-Lack of connectivity. Does not work with Apple Music or YouTube, 'nuff said
-Sound Quality. Just does not do a good enough job on music for me to use it, ever.
-Sluggish to react

author: Xproduct
title: Screen has lines and flickers
content:
Update 12/20/18
After writing my original review I was contacted by amazon within minutes. They attempted to resolve my issue over the phone and when that didn’t work had me send it in. Well, the “new” one flickers too. Not sure if it’s a new device, a refurbished one or the same one I had before but it’s the same problem. Screen flickers and completely ruins the experience. Maybe they fixed this in version 2 but for the original I’m not impressed. Avoid at all costs not worth it.
- - -
Maybe I could forgive the fact that echo frequently doesn’t know the answer to my question or that the interface is too hard to browse the movies I own verbally but what’s unforgivable is the screen is already starting to go out after very light use. Things I like are being able to see my multiple timers at once, the fact that it’s touch screen and that the speaker is powerful. However without the screen what’s the point of paying this much. Just get a different device.

author: James D. Trommatter
title: Great sound
content: Great sound much clearer then echo dot.

author: Vinay
title: Good product but still need improvement
content: I have lots of amazon products, this one is best in all of them but still sometime it does not understand what i am trying to say. i have to speak slow speed :(

author: Chase
title: so maybe it's better than I think
content: This is so nifty to have on my bedside.  I'm using it as a glorified alarm clock.  The only catch is that for any internet search or video searches, you have to be VERY clear with Alexa what you want her to do.  Otherwise, she'll search through the wrong menu or engine.  So if you want Youtube videos instead of another video streaming service, you need to articulate that she needs to search Youtube.  I'm still learning how to navigate this, so maybe it's better than I think.

author: Lu Johnson
title: USED TO BE BRILLIANT... but without YouTube, not worth as much.
content:
Well, it used to b 5 stars... and still could be. But for this bitchy-bitch slap fight between Amazon and Google over YouTube.

I have purchased 5 of these. And they've all become somewhat useless now. You see, suddenly back in September 2017, YouTube quit working on Echo Show!
Google said Amazon's rendition of YouTube on Echo Show violated it's (Google's)TOS. But that's not the whole story.
Thanks, Google.

Looks like Amazon started this rift, though, by pulling Google Chromecast from it's shelves back in 2015.
So Google blocked YouTube from Amazon's Echo Show.
So Amazon blocked YouTube on it's Fire TV product.

And we all lose.

Update January 2019.: Finally, in the last couple of months, Amazon updated the Echo Show with access to their Silk browser or Firefox. This allows access to YouTube!!  Also access to other websites which if very handy!!

Thanks, Amazon!

author: Sha7759
title: We love ours!
content:
I studied reviews and debated about buying the Show for many months. We have an Echo Dot in every room of our house, including the kids’ rooms, as well as a Fire TV. Alexa feels like part of the family. I got most of our Dots on sale or through warehouse deals, so we hardly paid more than $35 for any of them. The price tag of the Show, combined with the mixed reviews, had me hesitant to buy. I also really wanted the Show to replace the digital photo frame I had in my kitchen, and many reviews seemed to suggest it failed in that task.

The week before Prime Day 2018, I saw that the Show had a great sale price. Even better, I found one through a warehouse deal for $95! AND we had points on our Amazon Visa that covered even more of the cost. I got my Show for barely more than I paid for a Dot!

My family and I love it!!! The image on the screen is much clearer than I expected. My daughter loves having a movie playing while she does her chores in the kitchen. So far, Alexa understands our commands just as well as on our Dots. The sound clarity is fine for us on movies and music. An audiophile might find it lacking, but the average listener like us would be happy. The volume is also much louder than the Dots, which we appreciate.

I’m thrilled that the Show has replaced my digital photo frame quite nicely. It even feels like an upgrade there!  I was already a user of Amazon photos ... that is a key component here. On Photos from my computer, I created an album called Screensaver. I put about 300 favorite photos in there. In the Show’s settings, I chose this album as the background source, and set the Show to rotate through these. It chooses a new one every 10 minutes or so. The photo is somewhat in shadow in the background, but clear enough to see. Overplayed are the time, the temp, and the “things to try” sentence. I wish the last one wasn’t there but I can deal with it. When I want the Show to become a true digital photo frame, I ask Alexa to show my screensaver album. It gives the option to shuffle the photos and to play on a loop. The photos display bright and clear (moreso than my previous frame), changing every few seconds. The time/temp/try text disappears. I love that vertical images aren’t cut off to fit the landscape frame. The full vertical image displays with a self-background. The photo loop plays until I tell it to stop or give a new command. I’ve had it running for hours. With Amazon photos, it’s a breeze to add or remove images in the album. I can even ask Alexa to show vacation photos, or photos of my dogs, or photos from a specific year or of a specific person.

I want another Show for my office! I don’t know that I can justify the full $200+ price tag, but if I find another great warehouse deal or save up enough visa points, I’ll jump on it.

author: L. Bell
title: Disappointed!!!
content: I purchased the Echo Show because Ring Door Bell can be used through Alexa, but Alexa only shows you who is at the door, you can not communicate with the person through Alexa.  The sound is tinny, and not at all enjoyable to listen to.  I basically have a new clock.  Amazon, if the problem is not the speaker, please provide an equalizer, because currently asking Alexa to adjust treble and base is very hit or miss.

author: Lowell Raby
title: Support of Information
content: This product was sold with very little instruction.  The only way to gather knowledge of how it works or how to use it must be purchased.  This is my concern due to the fact that it has a lot of potential but for the average person does not have the technical support.  The technical support requires addition purchase.

author: PhatHD
title: A must for a productive, fun,  person or family.
content:
WOW WOW WOW. Unlimited potential to make my day easier, more enjoyable, productive,  and fun. Powered by Intel, and sound by Dolby is a perfect match.
There is also many accessories to make it even better.

author: matt s.
title: Its okay. Few downsides though
content: Wish there was a way to ensure that the camera was software blocked to ensure that it could not be used by anyone that may gain access to it. It does add some functionality that was missing with the original Echo I like that you can see the timers without having to ask for them

author: Allison
title: It's ok
content: I wish I could have it show my photos automatically.. I have the background set to do that but it doesn't shuffle well and the photos are not as clear as asking to show my photos.. any time I turn on or off a light or turn on the coffee pot .. it stops shuffling from my photos .. video chat or drop in is very clear .. wish it was easier to show my own recipes.. but it is a neat toy

author: T
title: Best Amazon Product I’ve Ever Purchased
content: I love our Show! Alexa tells me the weather, the traffic report, gives me information when I ask, helps my daughter with her homework, and plays music and videos. The drop-in feature alone is worth the price. When my daughter is alone in the house, I can drop in on her and chat face-to-face. She texts me when she leaves the school bus, and I drop in so I am “home” when she comes in the door, even though I am at work. That relives her anxiety about coming into an empty house (except for the dogs).  This device is wonderful for anyone who has kids who might be alone, or older parents who might need some supervision when you are not there. The drop in feature sends a sound so the party knows you are dropping in, and you don’t get to actually see the room for ten seconds, giving the other party a chance to decline the drop in (So no stealthy spying with this device).

author: PAC
title: Highly recommend
content: Love my Echo.  The picture is clear. Being able to make a call and see the person on the other end of the call is great. Plus being able to connect it to my home security system and to be alerted to view the cameras is has worked out so well.  I highly recommend the Show.

author: wolfman5
title: A great product!
content: This is really a great item. We paired it to our other Echo device which allows us to have multiroom functionality. The screen has great definition so what we see is a great viewing area. We use this every day.

author: SharonAZ
title: I love it!
content: I love it!!!  I really love being able to see a screen and to see specific items on this gadget versus the regular Echo where you cannot. My favorite feature is how it usually shows lyrics as songs are playing!!!

author: Bullwinkle30
title: Loved it until the screen started going out ...
content: Good sound, use it as a daily alarm clock and got in a "2fer" package on Prime Day 2018. But 2 days ago the screen started pulsing with static-type lines across. I've unplugged and re-set but intermittently persists. Now I have to figure out how to return and get a replacement (and my order list indicates that this is eligible for replacement through June 19, 2019 so seems to have a one year replacement ... just a hassle). The white one I use in the kitchen isn't having the same screen problems and I do love it (especially the "drop in" function that lets me check in on my dogs during the day).

author: Rebecca Pemberton
title: Better than expected results in our home.  We were skeptical. It is great.
content:
MY significant other is 100% deaf, so the SHOW ME features of text on screen, capioning on videos, the weather report both audio and print makes this an amazingly wonderful product to have in our kitchen . He is not left out because of the SHOW ME screen - and I love being able to watch cooking videos and ask for any music play list imaginable.  The songs even have the lyrics on screen. I am so impressed.

If you say -- ALEXA - Take my picture -- it does.  And, then it stores them and shows them to you if you say -- Alexa, show me my pictures.

author: KSumners
title: Great for those with Alzheimer's
content:
I agree with Ed, the top commenter. My mother has early onset Alzheimer's and I think it's worth it's price alone based on how easy it is to check in on her. It has become harder and harder for her to work a phone. I've been trying to get my siblings to get one so they can do the same. The drop in feature is so wonderful.

My only issue with this unit is that I desperately want an interactive calendar. She will show you your upcoming events on Google calendar but I want an entire MONTH view because I detest short term planning lol. You'd think I'd at least be able to see a month view, but nooope.

Other than that, I enjoy this system- but my main needs are connecting to my mom,  news, music and calendar events. It all depends on your needs.

author: Tazmanian Devil
title: Don’t recommend this Show version.  Maybe later versions, but not version 1.
content: Something about the sound does work well.  I have to yell at her to get her to hear me.  The volume goes from 4 to 3 and the drop seems more like from 4 to-1.  What should be between 4 and 3 would be perfect but now, it’s too high at 4 and whispering at 3.  The screen is much smaller than I thought.  I think my phone screen is higger.  It’s pretty useless for most anything you want to use it for.  I use it for Ring doorbell but I have to have it right next to me to see who is at the door.  That means I cant use it to follow recipes in the kitchen without moving it.  Can’t have two to do both because that puts them in the same vicinity and they both answer when I yell and one always gets confused like when I had the Echo in the area. If I move it back and forth it is always in the wrong place for where I am when I need it.  One of life’s frustrations.

author: Saintsfan
title: Bluetooth does not work on the everywhere speaker group.
content:
Does not connect to Bluetooth speaker via the Alexa app. Must go in manually. Then, it disconnects from Bluetooth when your play your music group. my everywhere music group has 5 echo dots and two echo shows. Bluetooth works fine with the dot 3.

My echo support call did not resolve the issue.

Very disappointing.

I love just about everything else

author: JJohnson
title: Wonderful addition to the home
content: Our Evho Show is always present in the kitchen. Answering questions from the grandkids, displaying reminders from our schedule and providing updates on our Amazon orders. Alexia also controls the kitchen and living room lights, the thermostat and providing a link to each of the Echo Dots in each room. You really should add the Echo Show and find how many times you turn to Alexia for information.

author: Jose G Arias
title: Not as responsive as Google's Assistance. However works great as an alarm clock/music player.
content: Most easy commands that work on Google's Assistance does not work on Alexa. For example, set an alarm from this day of the week till this day of the week. Works great as an alarm clock.

author: Cheryl
title: Issues after short time
content: I love my echo show!  Especially adding things to lists ( groceries etc). But after a few months the screen started to screw up and the speakers started popping.  I have had to return it ( which customer service was excellent).  Right now it’s in for repair?????  I guess I have to wait and see.  I guess I thought they would send me a new one since it’s warranty issue.  And I would return this defective one once I received the new one. 🤷🏼‍♀️

author: Veepka
title: I love the idea of it and it works well BUT ...
