content: I love the idea of it and it works well BUT no youtube and let's face it 80% of videos on line are youtube so you are left with very little to watch. I received it as a present but I would not purchase this myself until Amazon has reached some kind of agreement so they can use youtube.

author: Linda M Condon
title: Echo Show
content:
I reviewed Echo Show 1st Generation as a Christmas gift. I never in my wildest dreams realize just how much can be down with Alexa!
 So far we have only one lamp connected by a Smart Plug.
 I am completely in love with it!
 I am anxious to learn more as time goes on!
 I highly recommend it!

author: Carla K.
title: You're not alone
content: I'm pretty sure I don't even use a fragment of its capabilities but so far it's already proven itself to be even more useful than sliced bread. Every day there's a new skill we find to toy around with. I'm almost relieved that when my kids grow up and move out, I'll still have someone to talk to.

author: David "HT" Kramer
title: I was very excited that amazon introduced this product as ...
content: I was very excited that amazon introduced this product as it has a huge potential as a true "Cloud Interactive" device that would be both Voice and Video capable. The issue is that the device began to have video distortion within 14 days of purchase. concerned about device quality a bit

author: Alex
title: The screen just started to flicker like it's damaged...
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player I've brought it this year on Prime Day and had it plugged into my kitchen to play music when I occasionally cook. The item was barely used and now the screen just flickers crazily. The quality control definitely needs some improvement! I don't know are there any improvement on the second generation, but if you're thinking about the first generation of echo show definitely stay away!  :(

author: James D. Holloway
title: Love my New Echo Show
content: This Echo Show surprises me everyday and the new skills that keep getting added and the "Drop In" feature is EXCELLENT for calling to the echo dot and using it as an intercom or sending a message to a friend or phone call to a friend.  The quality of the screen is great!!!  I like the news flashes and weather it displays on the screen as well as new skills messages and how to use them.  The box and packaging protected the Echo Show and was in perfect shape.

author: Wanita M. Lindsey
title: A constant source of music, weather in your area, recipies, movie reccommendations and many, many more subject.
content: I like the Echo Show, very much. It actually shows you the variety of questions you can ask of it. I received the Echo Speaker, first, and found it to be very helpful in acquiring information, but wasn't entirely sure of what I could request of it. The "Echo Show" has a constant stream, across the screen, of the variety of subjects it has information about.

author: C. Okamuro
title: Worth a look when discounted....
content:
It's safe to say that I've bought in to the Alexa ecosystem (2 Taps, 5 Echos, and 7 Echo Dots, and several Fire Sticks/Fire TV).  Most of those acquisitions were made on previous Prime days or during refurb sales, because the cost of the better devices can be off putting when outfitting your entire home.  While I've had a passing interest in the Show since it came out, I really wasn't motivated to buy it at MSRP.  I broke down and picked up an Echo Show, heavily discounted, on Prime Day.

This is probably the time to let you know what kind of Alexa user I am..  I'd rate myself about a 7/10 in general usage.  I have various skills tied into Alexa (home automation, various music services, etc.), but I'm not the best user of Amazon's services.  I ask for the daily news briefing, the traffic, and the weather forecast.  I add items to lists, set alarms, timers, reminders, events, etc.  However, I do not order anything, utilize daily deals, ask for jokes, or anything else really.

As a hardware device, the Show appears to be pretty solid.  I would not describe it as particularly attractive, but that's subjective.  The sound quality is roughly on par with a regular Echo, which is to say ok, but not excellent.  The touchscreen is responsive and well-lit.  On the negative side, the viewing angle is not particularly wide.  Unlike a tablet or smartphone, this type of device is going to be fairly static in its placement, so the relatively narrow viewing angle is not ideal.  The voice recognition and microphone pickup range do not appear to be diminished from a regular Echo.  I wasn't sure if the audio pickup was going to become more directional, but informal testing indicates that it's not very directional... off-axis recognition is pretty good.

As far as the interface of the device, I wasn't sure what to expect.  I hoped that it wasn't just a combo of an Echo and the Alexa app that's on my phone (essentially merging them on one device).  Fortunately, this is not the case.  The screen continually rolls headlines and command suggestions, while displaying a clock.  This display brightness is tied to the ambient light.  Since my Show is in my kitchen, the most useful benefit is being able to see my various cooking timers. The display also shows search results, music cover art, photos, etc.

If you're primary use case for the device is video calling, it does the task well.  The main question would be if the value proposition of the device is high enough to make it a good alternative to an Echo with a tablet or smartphone.  The lack of portability and high cost (when not discounted) are considerable cons - I would say it would be 2 or 3 stars at the normal retail price.  However, at the heavily discounted Prime Day price, it's a good alternative to a regular Echo.

author: jkepling
title: Expensive Clock with Alexa capabilitiy
content: Wife purchased as a gift last week. Just noticed You Tube no longer available. Disappointed to say the least. Own multiple echo devices and this appears to be no more than an expensive addition to my Echo and Echo Dot collection. It does allow me to view what it won't Show though.

author: pravin manerker
title: Best echo from the product line
content:
those who have used echo dot and familiar with the setting phase of echo dot would understand what I call breeze of setting up echo show.
This device is fantastic and opens to whole new AI world.
Some of the features I like,
1. Can use echo show as Home camera when away. From app one can drop in to the device.
2. Telling to stop playing music after some time.
3. YouTube! Yeah YouTube has been viewed on mobile phones for most of time but larger screen personal device is cool. Advantage is searching via voice.
4. Video call is boon for elderly parents.
5. Prime photos can be overlapped while playing music or flash briefing.

author: SaintsGirl
title: Functional for home automation not much else, don't really use the screen.
content:
It  is really not too exciting vs the dot.  I will not be using it as a face time chat function and I get frustrated with Alexa's lack on knowledge to answer simple questions.  The screen is not really that necessary as you can't connect with different online pages.

Alexa is a functional piece for home automation which is basically what I use it for and listening to music which I link to my Bose sound bar.

author: Dave's Tech
title: Almost perfect
content: I have had my echo show for about a month now, and I like it. But to be honest, I do not love it. I was disappointed with YouTube not being available. After reading many reviews, apparently it wasn't there, then it was there, and now, its not there again. I am holding out hopes that whatever the problem is, it will get resolved. The sound quality is absolutely amazing, I thought the regular echo was great, the show blows it out of the water. There are so many benefits to the show above all other echo products. Being able to see movie trailers, Amazon Prime videos, calendars, shopping lists, are all great. The video calling, and the drop in feature is also great! I really like that I can drop in on my show while I am at work, to check on the dogs, or my teenagers when they are there alone.  I am happy with my purchase, and I am hopefull additional features will be added soon.

author: George P. F.
title: Great way to connect with someone who is not at all tech savvy.
content:
I bought several to connect with my mom and grandparents who live in another state. It's technology that allows us a chance to chat face-to-face and is easy enough for them to use. They're loving the speaker quality and new access to music streaming services, weather and news updates, and jeopardy as well. It turns out that kids like it, too, so I'll probably send one to my niece and nephew sometime soon.

It isn't hard to set up, but I wouldn't recommend shipping this directly to someone who isn't at least a little bit comfortable with current technology.

author: Chris
title: Echo Show is a great visual compliment but I'm getting inundated with the Echo/Alexa universe of products
content: I just picked up the Echo Show because it went on sale and I like it so far. I already have a few Echos, Echo Dots and the Tap so I'm familiar with the Echo/Alexa ecosystem. This is a nice compliment to my other Echo devices, it currently it sits in my kitchen. The touchscreen works great and I like the visual display of the commands. I'm not sure I would have picked this up at full price but for $150 I would say it's worth it. I'm running out of rooms in my home for Echos now.

author: Suzanne C.
title: I loved my Alexa echo so much
content: I loved my Alexa echo so much, that I decided to try the show. So glad I did!! Now I can see my calendar, read recipes from the screen, drop in on my daughter for face time, watch movies/tv and so much more. Love, love, love.  I will be purchasing another, along with cameras and accessories for the house. Eventually, every room in the house will have an echo or show (except bathroom, of course).

author: mimalynn
title: Fabulous Kitchen Helper!
content: I  didn't set up my Show right away because I thought it would be time consuming and I just didn't have time.  I was wrong, it is practically seamless.  Once I set it up, I was hooked.  I have it in my kitchen, and since I cook/bake a lot it is the perfect place.  I can watch a movie while I'm chopping veggies, catch up on the latest news while I knead dough or ask for recipes or conversions without using my hands!  It is nice before work in the morning, I can ask what my commute is like so I know if I can have that second cup of coffee or not but the best feature of all is that I can video chat with the grandchildren and that is priceless!

author: Mekkmekk
title: Save your money
content: Had this item for about 2 months now and the screen flickers! Sucks that YouTube is not available for use with this product. Did a factory reset and it did not help!

author: AmazonCustomer
title: I great buy
content: I was not certain that I was going to like this product, but I purchased it anyway.  Now I love it and wish that I had one in every room.  I am still learning different things that it can do.  This is absolutely one of those things that one wonders how they ever got along without it!

author: M.Perry
title: SCREEN GLITCHING AFTER 6 MONTHS!
content:
UPDATED:
Increasing to 4 stars!
Amazon customer service contacted me the same day I left this review.  They tried to troubleshoot it and decided it was a hardware issue.  I will be sending it back for a replacement.
If they send me a new one I will increase to 5 stars.
Great customer service!

I received this as a gift and after only 6 months the screen is glitching.  It does this all the time.  I can't view my calendar or any lists because the lines jump around.  I don't believe this normal, but I don't know who to contact.

author: Anna Quinn
title: Very nice!
content: We had the old Echo and received this one as a gift.  Very slick, neat to have FaceTime access to my son and his wife who are having our first grandchild!  Also, handy to see words on the screen (you can see the words to a song while it's playing...handy for those who like to sing along!)  We took the old Echo to the lakehouse as we like the old one as well.

author: edward t rowland
title: It is a “in touch” machine !
content: I pretty much like the echo show. It allows dropping in on my family and talking face to face. Really nice. Besides the instant information, the music, the reminders.....I could go on and on. Lots of uses I am discovering every day. Love it!

author: Josiah
title: It works well
content:
Update: have had for less than a year now. The screen has a burnt image of the home screen shadow on it that you can see when doing other activities to it. She can’t differentiate between a song title or genre very well.
It works for what I got it for. The audio speakers are decent and can be heard a good space away. The responsiveness to voice alert is a little weak. I will sometimes have to speak louder than normal for it to wake up. I have used it to connect to my ring doorbell as well as wifi cameras I have at home; it took a bit for the cameras. It easily makes calls to other people, however it doesn't alert you to incoming calls from non-alexa devices. Would like to see that as an improve. The video quality in vid-calls is decent. I would recommend this others.

author: Amy Farmer
title: Better than a regular old Echo device
content: Added this to our smart home set up - use it to watch videos and catch up on the news in the kitchen. Usually while the coffee is brewing because I don’t like to talk much before coffee so it’s just “Alexa: flash briefing” lol. Also use it to view my Ring doorbell activity.

author: Maria Cruz
title: What a fun little assistant!
content: Wow I'm so glad I got this specially in you have some disabilities like I do I'm listening to music like I want to checking my weather bf stepping out of my door so from now on Alexa will be my assistant can't wait to add some other stuff and make my apt smart !

author: MAGAMEZ01
title: Great Purchase
content: I am very happy with my purchase. First of all, I found it on sale, brand new device.I am still trying to figure out all that this device can do for me. What I do know, it works great. My daughter started using it on her own. Great purchase and highly recommend this Echo Show!!

author: DRER
title: Awesome
content: Love it!  We have other echoes and love those so I bought this on prime day!  No regrets.  Love that I can connect to my Ring and see the front door.  Yhe kids like seeing the lyrics to songs and sing along. .

author: Catalina
title: Her Skills Are Getting Better
content: I actually purchased this item to connect with my outdoor Ring cameras. The Echo Show is a great tool, especially while I'm in the kitchen cooking. Unfortunally, there is a bit of a lag between the doorbell ringing and actually seeing who is at the front door.

author: Djames
title: Not a fan of the show. At. All.
content:
I love the echo family...I have a dot or an original echo in just about every room (even the bathrooms). I use echoes to control all of my lights, TVs, thermostats, etc. However, the show is just not a device that seems ready to me.

So where do I begin? Well, I will just list some of the issues:

Visual privacy, drop in is optional, but not welcome
Speaker isn't good, the dots have better speakers
Even at max, volume is still too low
No 360 sound, you have to be in front of the device to often hear the response
Bland/lifeless visuals, not a great touch interface
Design is not very attractive - it's really bulky for what it is and if it were beige, it would easily be straight out of 1983

This show is getting returned.

author: Maged Habib
title: Worked Great First Month All Downhill From There
content: I bought this item during prime day.  Excited to get it and start using it right away.  Worked great out of the box but after a month the screen started to flicker. Called customer service they had me unplug and plug back in...great idea! tried that already...did i again.  Once they realized it wasn't work i sent it in for repair got it back with message that all issues were resolved....great!  Nope but wait a few weeks later screen starts flickering again...called customer service advice...you guest it unplug and plug in again...genius! i should have thought of that myself....now it's a waiting game to see when it will start flickering again and when it does we will work on a  "solution", meaning i'm probably stuck with a nice $200 dollar paper weight.  Needless to say this will be the last Alexa / echo product i buy...Live and learn i guess.

author: Jeff J.
title: Flickering screen after a couple months ... and replaced by Amazon
content: Screen on purchased unit started flickering like mad after a few months after purchase. Attempts to fix over the phone with customer support were unsuccessful. Returned and replaced with new unit. Hopefully this one will not develop same problem.

author: GIOVANNI
title: Very disappointed with my third echo and first show
content: Very disappointed with my third echo and first show. First if music is playing medium to loud, Alexa cannot hear you so you either have to scream at the top of your lungs or walk over to manually decrease the volume. Huge Fail since supposedly the speaker is better than the original echo. Second YouTube is no longer available to use and makes this not as useful. I really tried to like it but it needs a serious update.

author: Amber L
title: Product is Defective..at least for me
content: Love the Echo Show..when it has no issues. Alexa is great and the Echo Show is an awesome kitchen island/counter accessory in our home. However, my Echo Show screen started experiencing lines and a jumping picture out of nowhere right after the short 30 day refund period lapsed, of course. I called echo customer service who had me send it back in for them to fix. This fix only lasted a month, and the lines on the screen are back. Tried to call for a refund and was denied. However, a manager today was able to approve a replacement be sent. Will give more stars if the replacement works great, or reduce to one star if the replacement also has issues in the near future.

author: johnj2803
title: Great tool but lacking some services.
content: This is a great tool in the kitchen. It shows you recipes and some video news. If only it was able to show YouTube videos like before as simple as saying it to do so it would be the best. The short videos are lacking. Content where news is more videos than audio would be great. Maybe they are improving on that. I pretty much watch YouTube a lot so if they had that it would be nice. I cannot play Netflix or Hulu directly on it.

author: PorscheOscar
title: Terrible, not up to FaceTime standard
content: I decided to skip buying another iPad for FaceTiming and instead I purchased three of these Echo Show devices to help with my father's care. He has terminal cancer, is in a wheelchair and has mental cognitive decline and can't work a modern device like this anymore. One of my new Amazon Echo Show devices is at my office and two are at my father's home: one next to his bed the other next to his recliner in the living room. There are doctors, nursess and health aides that come to my father's home almost every day that I need speak to. First of all, for calling anyone with an Echo Show you need a smartphone on BOTH ends with fairly new operating systems (Android 5.0 and Apple iOS 10 or higher). THE DEVICE WILL NOT WORK FOR VIDEO OR VOICE CALLS IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A SMARTPHONE. Amazon make no mention of this in the "simple to set up and use" section of theEcho Show listing on Amazon. Since my father lives out of state  I had to run out and buy a smartphone at Walmart before I flew back to be able to set up his two Echo Shows. That was a whole new expense I was not counting on. After activating the new smartphone and linking it to the new Echo Show devices I enabled the crucial "Drop In" feature on all the Echo Show devices on both my phone and the new smartphone I set up for my father. I thought about simply adding all three to my account but my parents have their own contacts that might want to use the drop in feature as well so I'd have to add all those contacts to my own contacts and then individually approve each contact and ignore the calls when they came in on my Echo devices...too complicated, their Echo devices should stand alone on their own. Finally, I mounted each Echo Show on a speaker stand to make it easier to move around. So back at my office I will ask Alexa to drop in on my father in the bedroom. (I changed the name of each Echo Show to Bedroom and Living Room). Except Alexa NEVER drops in to the bedroom. It's supposed to sense what device people in the other device are near, but it never does. I might have the doctor, nurse and my mother in the bedroom with my father and Alexa will NEVER drop in to that room, instead it will drop into the living room Echo Show even though there is no one in the living room. There is absolutely no way whatsoever for me to simply select which Echo Show I want to Drop In on from my device's touch screen in the "recent activity" window. So I have to repeatedly ask Alexa to drop in and it will randomly pick the correct device. After about 40 tries (literally) it will drop in on the correct device. Numerous calls to Amazon device support left them baffled. It was not until my fourth call, several hours on the phone, and lots or stress  that it was escalated to software people. It's absurd that you have to go through all this to make their device competive with Apple. Jeff Bezos this is unacceptable.

author: Ashley
title: Works well,  but it's kind of creepy
content: This works well,  but it's kind of creepy.  This is the only Alexa device that randomly asks "Do you want me to play____" or "Did you mean to look up ___" or "I'm sorry, I can't find _____".  This usually happens when I am in my living room watching movies or something and it never shows up on the app that I asked her anything....kind of creepy, if you ask me.  At least I covered the camera.

author: Janet
title: Echo Show
content:
I  do not have a smart phone therefore I cannot use it for what the gift giver intended which was to be able to phone internationally with each other.
I do not WANT a smart phone but never the less I am enjoying the device because of the different things I can do with it. However, for what I do with it it is not worth the price.

author: RC
title: Love my Echo devices especially my show.
content: Loving the show. Was a great addition to my Echo enabled house. Use it in the kitchen so I can use it for recipes and such. Next Echo device I’m thinking about getting will be the cube.

author: Dave the Train Man
title: Poor "How-to" impedes wonderful potential tool.
content: The Echo Show is much like the original Echo at its start.  If Amazon has thought through all the kinds of things the Show could do, then the literature with it is woefully inadequate.  When acquiring a new technology, I want a detailed "how to" for implementation.  The Alexa app is of very little use, some of which due to the poor index format and some due to the very high level content itself.  The "instructions" with the unit are of no use at all.  The on-screen instructions are not well packaged, and don't have ability to ask questions or go back to re-check.  I can see a huge potential for the Show.  I suspect that it - and I - will learn as we go and eventually have a fun and powerful tool.,

author: Valorie Dougherty
title: Worth the purchase
content: This item is awesome...many games, able to work with smart lightbulbs, love the room to room chat - the away from home options (turn on lights etc..), watching Amazon Prime in the kitchen, and does a lot of other neat stuff. However, still not as knowledge and in-depth in answers as the Google home.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Less functional than the DOT
content: For some reason the Show doesn't pick up my voice/dictation as well as the Dot. It's always getting words wrong that the Dot picks up fine. If they are using the same servers and dictation software, I'm not sure why there would be a difference, but there is. Most of the time I will ask the Show to play music and the light will come on indicating that it's listening, but the Show does not respond and the light times out and nothing happens. The speakers sound good for the size, but overall I'm disapointed mostly because it has proven to be much less useful than the Dot  which I have located in the same room. I'm using different wake commands, so I know that one is not interfering with the response of the other. The screen is cool, but there isn't much UI/UX to do anything with. Since the dictation is always wrong I would like to be able to type seachers for music or youtube. Thinking about returning it, but I've always been a fan of Amazon so hopfully an update will fix the bugs and all will be right again.

author: B. Culpepper
title: Great Device!
content: We love our show! We have it in our kitchen. It is great to be able to watch movies from amazon while cooking. We can also video chat. Sometimes the video quality takes a minute to become clear but I’m not sure if that is the device or our internet. The kids like to talk to Alexa and have her show them things. I also like the option to put your own pictures as the background.

author: crafty beaver
title: Love it!
content:
This item is a life saver. My husband has Altzheimer's, and has forgotten how to answer his cell phone. I bought a wi fi camera that allowed me to view him and speak to him, but it was disorienting, since he heard my voice, but didn't know where it was coming from.

The Echo Show allows me to pop into the room and talk naturally with him. It allows me to run short errands, while knowing that he is safe.

Love it!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: love it until...
content: I would give a 5 star for my echo show, but a few times no matter what I asked, Alexa would just say "Something went wrong" over and over and over and over...the next day it was fine. I'm glad I bought it when it was on sale! $200+ would've been too much.

author: Family
title: Wonderful
content: Great! This is an amaxing device that enhances the Amazon Echo experience by using video. It is an Echo with video! The speakers are fabulous! I can watch Youtube and Amazin videos. I like the suggestions which helps to get to know the device. I bought two. I live in a townhouse and now I can view the downstairs area from my upstairs bedroom. I gave it four stars because I would like to be able to turn off the tips and view only my famiky photo slide show. I would also like the option to turn off the screen when not in use or during bedtime. The screen does dim after no activity but not enough to be completly dark. The time clock continues to illuminate but why should it when all I have to do is ask Alex what time is it. It needs some work but I sm so glad to have this device. I moved the Echo to snother room. The echo show does it all and with video!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Suggested updates
content:
Overall I have to say we love our 1st generation Echo Show and will be purchasing the 2nd generation one when we return to our winter home.  Four out of five of our house guests were so impressed with it when they visited they ended up ordering one for themselves and called us on it as soon as they got back home and hooked it up. Even our friends in England where at the time it hand not yet been introduced.
A couple of suggestions for future updates however.  We as well as our friends have all found it annoying that the screen continues to display recent callers. Some of those video calls took place a while ago. It sure would be nice if you could attache a time stamp to the recent callers notification to help you determine if you missed a call or not.
The second suggestion is minor but it would make more sense if Alexa asked you "did you SAY (callers name)" rather than "did you MEAN".  Alexa repeats the names exactly as you said so the clarification of SAY versus MEAN takes on an entirely more effective way to clarify.
Just my two cents worth. Keep up the good work.

author: SavingTimeinFL
title: works better and more versatile
content: On my second unit that is being boxed up and sent back. Lines in the screen even at home screen. Got to stream Arlo Pro camera for baby monitor. This fails due to stream cutting out after some amount of time. Purchased and using amazons cloud camera for this function now, no issues with stream timing out, only with Echo Show having lines in the display. Returning and getting Fire HD8 Tablet and stand to replace, cheaper then the show, works better and more versatile.

author: Jeff
title: Can't play YouTube
content: Not being able to play YouTube makes this nearly worthless in my view.  Yes you can still make video calls but who does that?  Somehow Google has blocked YouTube from playing on this device which takes away about 95% of the reason for having this.

author: LR
title: Doesn't live up to it's potential
content:
I've had my echo show for over a year. It's good for the time and temperature, although sometimes the report from "Accuweather" is wildly inaccurate. For over a week this summer, it kept saying it was 10-12 degrees higher than the Weather Channel temps. One morning it showed 71 deg. at 2:30 am, the WC showed 58 deg. I went outside and it was nowhere close to 71. Usually it is 1 - 2 degrees different from the WC, but acceptable.

Recently, Amazon fixed some things about the Show that weren't broke, the screen font size and the screensaver images . Now, it is a constant visual annoyance!

The original default screensaver images were good, photos of nature, candy, fruit, etc. They were pleasant and inoffensive. Recently, Amazon changed the default screensaver and it's an epic fail. The images look like clip art put together by a child in a paint program. They're also including photos of people and places I could care less about with  their featured stories. Bring back the original, or make it an option. You can upload photos to use as screensaver, but who has the time (hours) for that.

Equally bad is their recent reduction in the size of the screen font, making it less "accessible" for some folks. We used to be able to see the temperature displayed below the time from across the room. Now it is HALF the size of the original and too tiny to see unless you are standing next to it. The Show would be better served by allowing users to customize their screen fonts and sizes. You can make things larger by tapping on the screen or asking Alexa to do it.... stupid solutions. Hello, the Show isn't a handheld tablet or smartphone. I don't want to walk across the room to tap on it or ask Alexa to do something that was good before they messed it up.

Alexa's streaming news, well sort of. The stories are usually a couple of days old, featuring science, oddities, human interest, and not much to write home about. Fortunately, Alexa avoids politics and anything salacious or gruesome. They are family friendly. Alexa's jokes and her original songs are also family friendly. What annoys me are the daily "Three things to know" and "Birthday Roundup", who cares.

Calling features and drop-ins - I like them. I only know a couple of people with the Show, but it is nice to have a visual conversation. We allow drop-ins, but you can turn it off. The camera is good, but I usually have it covered with a sticker unless I'm expecting a call....I should buy a new robe on Amazon.  I use Alexa to look up business addresses near me. Occasionally I use it to make phone calls, but only when I don't mind that it sounds like you are using a speaker phone.

Check traffic  - this skill is an Epic Fail. You have to go into the Alexa app and enter the to and from addresses. I tried this for my daily commute. It always gave me the same amount of time, whether traffic was good or bad. Worse, it gave me road designations that I've never heard of or seen on any map. I tried to delete the to and from addresses, but it wouldn't let me. Bizarre! It required addresses. I finally swapped my real addresses with stupid ones, eg. Google Headquarters in California to the Bailing Wire Museum in Texas.

Questions - Alexa doesn't know a lot of things. Sometimes you can ask her to check Wikipedia. Sometimes her answers are weird or wrong. I asked her the number of calories in Almond Roca. Her answer was 755 per serving! Wow, maybe for a sumo wrestler, but Google pretty much agrees it is 200 calories for one serving, 3 pieces. Don't believe everything you hear from Alexa.

Timers and alarms - quite useful. There are number of options in the Alexa app. You can also set recurring alarms.

Not useful! if you have more than one Amazon device, you can't set an alarm or timer for one in a different room. You have to "walk" into the other room and set the timer or alarm there.

Now the bad - music alarms. Aargh! I tried to make them work. You can set a music genre, but you will eventually get some pieces you don't like. Who wants to wake up to a song you don't like. You can set a playlist, with very specific wording. I said, "set an alarm to my playlist Bob", Alexa couldn't find it. I spent a half hour on the phone with an Amazon rep to figure out that I had to say, "set an alarm to my Bob playlist". I suggested Amazon make the words playlist and Bob (or the name of your list) in interchangeable order. I don't know if they fixed it. I've stopped using music alarms. Yes, you can use a playlist (of songs you do like),  but the alarm skill can't shuffle it. It will wake you up to the first song on the list, .....every time.

Videos - You can watch your Amazon prime videos here, but wouldn't you really rather watch them on a big screen?

Music - the speakers are decent and you can access your playlists on several platforms. Some songs will show the lyrics. I was surprised by lyrics I had misheard in the past.

Skills - be sure to read the reviews before adding them.

Lists - a pain. I created a list with numbers in a specific order. The list repeated them back in a different sequence. I tried to delete the useless list, but it is a convoluted process. You can delete items from the list, but not the list. You have to Archive it, then delete it from there. It took me a half hour of Googling to figure it out.

alexa.amazon.com - I use this online for settings, history, etc. Seriously, this needs a makeover, by someone with an HCI background. Can we say alpha order, or make things more intuitive. Why is the background black?

author: L W.
title: Nice to have
content:
Nice upgrade from the Dot.

Even got my security cameras working it.

When you play music is show the lyrics.

And can play movies.

Hopefully the price will come down even more.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Initial review of the Echo Show.
content: In general, meets all expectations, however, the angle is not optimal for little kids when using video calls. It is necessary to tilt it forward for smaller children. Also sometimes it doesn't pick up requests from across the room. It was necessary to speak louder. It would also be nice to have a battery pack to allow placement of the Echo Show in different areas around the house.

author: John D.
title: Limitations
content:
It's ok, but expected more from Amazon.
Somewhat small screen and no "out" line availability.
Was shipped as a 2nd Generation but figured that was just a clerical error.

author: Pet Lover
title: Not Something I would Purchase for Myself
content:
My husband bought the Echo Show to put in the kitchen. We have a smart home, tones of technologies. We are very tech savvy people. The Echo Show is a huge disappointment, basically a waste of money, and we do not like this product at all.

Here's a few Pros and Cons.

1) Limited Skills App, majority of these skills app are useless to us. It doesn't have a lot of the TV apps like HBO GO or basic ABC app etc. If Echo Show has an Android App store then it's not that bad. Unfortunately, it has these Skills App that limits what you can do with this device.

2) Limited TV Provider, if you do not have Dish, Fios, Frontier, Optic HUB or FireTV then you can only view Prime Video, which sometimes require you to pay extra for certain shows or videos. Prime video is worse than Netflix, more older movies or lack of. Unfortunately, we have HBO, Apple TV, and none of the other providers listed above. This is useless to us.

3) You cannot upload your own music like you can on iTune. Limit you to Amazon Unlimited Music, Spotify, Pandora, iHeartRadio, Tunein, Deezer and a couple of more which requires additional subscription fee. You do have the option to stream music from your bluetooth devices and use Echo Show as another bluetooth speaker, wasting battery life on your other devices. Don't even bother downloading the Amazon Music App if you already have other pre-built music app on your devices. Echo Show streams from Amazon Music the same way it does from your pre-built app. We already have wireless surround sound system and expensive bluetooth speakers that has better sounds than Echo Show.

4) You can listen to live radio and SiriusXm.

5) It cannot play youtube videos.

Of course, there are more cons and pros if I continue listing it out, this review will never end. Overall, If you are looking for a device to serve as an intercom, a bluetooth speaker, a camera, alarm clock or connect to some of your smart home device that is compatible than it is good enough for you. If the Skills app don't have most of your smart home technology apps and you are not a Prime Member (No Prime Video or Amazon Unlimited Music, Showtime), then this device isn't worth buying. If you think it's worth to pay $200+ for a device that requires more subscription fee then go for it.

Just a note, if you are using Echo Show as a camera, you cannot adjust the angle. We don't use it for anything, except for the kids to ask questions. Even very tech savvy young kids find this device limited.

author: karena klock
title: Wonderful!
content: The Echo Show is so much fun. I never used my other devices but now that I can watch a news brief or cooking show it makes all the difference in how I use it. I appreciate the helpful hits that scroll across the screen. A great, fun and useful product.

author: N Long
title: Easy set up -- fun to use
content: I received this as a gift. I already owned an echo dot but this has sort of taken its place for everyday use. I really don't have any negative issues with it. I also liked how easy it was to set up for use. I had a hard time getting my echo dot spun up -- a friend finally helped me out.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I love this device
content: I love this device.  I am still navigating thru the capabilities and still love it.  My husband asked Alexa "Who's the Man"?, and she replied You the Man....priceless.  She has a sense of humor for sure!

author: Karen Reeves
title: Love telling Alexa what to do - LOL
content: I really like the Echo Show. I already had the Alexa and now also have the Fire TV Cube - once you know how to ask for what you want - it is a lot of fun. Music sounds great - speakers and sound are surprisingly good. Alexa and I play games - I'm getting better at Jeopardy. We talk Klingon and replicate "Tea, Earl Gray" for Star Trek Next Generation fans!

author: Andrea
title: This is better than previous Alexa versions
content: This is better than previous Alexa versions. I am mostly excited that this one has a better hearing and I don’t have to yell 10 times! The speaker is also a lot clearer and louder. The screen is awesome! I have my Alexa show in the kitchen and it provides news so I can glance over when doing the dishes, I can also follow recipes when cooking! I wish it would work with YouTube again... (make a deal w YouTube amazon) very happy with this purchase.

author: Laird A. Popkin
title: Wonderful device !
content: Wonderful to have a display on Alexa, so it can show supporting information. Interestingly, it is still primarily a speech/audio device, with the screen playing a secondary role, playing Amazon video, showing answers to questions, lyrics to songs, upcoming appointments, etc. It's a great device to have on your desk while working, to remind you of appointments and so on.

author: LARRY
title: Bought this because it said after a Google search that ...
content: Bought this because it said after a Google search that it brought youtube back, when I received it I guess youtube took its capability back away?? Going to return now..

author: Morning star
title: Mom can hear us
content: I bought this for my 87 year old mother who is severely hard of hearing and in the early stages of dementia. Love love love it. It’s still little confusing for her but she’s getting it that she only has to talk to it. Also just being able to drop in and see what she’s doing or a quick hello. And she can hear us.  I’ve gotten her amplified phones etc and nothing has worked as well as this. And customer service with any problems with echo is awesome. Can’t say enough love it

author: Old Soul
title: ECHO SHOW - SHOW STOPPER
content:
I love my new Echo Show, and now I wish I had purchased 2 of them. Just received it today. If you have an Echo, you really need this Show. Just to start - you see the time and weather ALL of the time. The sound is amazing. I listened to one song and the music filled my living room. My husband who is def not an easy sell, fell in love. I asked to see the trailer for a movie, and it was incredible. The sound, the picture was like watching and hearing on one of the best TV's.

I purchased it during prime days, and the price was so incredible, I really should have purchased 2, or even more. I would use this instead of alarm clocks - I could set them up as a way to talk to my husband when he is in the garage working.

You need this.  You will fall in love.  And the look and feel of it is astonishing.  It looks like a very expensive piece of equipment that you will be proud of displaying. I purchased the white one, but am so sorry that I didn't purchase another black one for my kitchen.

author: Michael Hayes
title: Not being able to watch youtube videos on this device makes it pretty useless. Might as well just get an echo ...
content: I thought that youtube videos could be watched on this device.  It wasn't until I purchased it that there is a dispute between Amazon and google.  Not being able to watch youtube videos on this device makes it pretty useless.  Might as well just get an echo dot.

author: Charles F. Martek
title: Echo show is great in some respects but falls short in others.
content: I really like the Echo Show. I think the touch screen adds a lot to the device and is well worth the extra $50 price tag. It integrated very easily with my smart home devices and works great with them. Controlling your music through the Echo is also a delight. I took one star off due to the number of times Alexa has said "I don't know that" Siri wins hands down in the information category. For example, I asked Alexa how long it takes to drive from Fort Myers Florida to Key West Florida. She doesn't know. No problem for Siri though. In fact every time I asked Siri a question that Alexa didn't know, Siri was able to come up with the information. Hopefully Alexa's knowledge acquisition will improve in the future.

author: GTD
title: Nice addition to Echo devices  Ideal for kitchen
content:
My wife and I love the Echo Show.  Like that it displays the weather.  Wife loves the fact that she can ask for a recipe and the recipe is displayed and in many cases also includes a video on the preparation of the recipe.  Many reviewers are dinging it for dropping Youtube and I guess that capability would be nice, but there are recipes in other places than Youtube.
We like the device so much we bought our daughter one for Christmas.
have to be careful with the drop in feature to protect privacy.

author: Darby G
title: Echo Show is the best thing I ever bought!!!!
content: Echo Show is the best thing I ever bought. Everyone in my family is getting one for Christmas. The sound quality is excellent. News and items of interest scroll across the  screen when Alexa is not responding to one of my many requests. It's so much fun to ask and receive. Alexa is my genie in a box that shows and tells what I want to know.

author: dstevens
title: Great addition to my Alexa family of products.
content: Great addition to my Alexa family. The video and audio is great quality. A smaller footprint would be nice, but it sits solidly on my kitchen counter. ❤️❤️❤️ Recommend if you’re looking to add a video component to your smart Alexa home.

author: viable
title: Not too bad.
content: Could allow other features like streaming Netflix and Vudu instead of just Prime.  Also the constant advertising is a bit annoying, but overall, the device works well for the price I paid.  A tablet would make an adequate substitute, however.

author: Anthony Hord
title: BOSS
content:
Every thing about is fantastic, the UI, the screen, the shape, the size, the power cord is well hidden, and she basically does everything you would expect from a Echo Device but now with a screen!

One thing I really enjoy is how quick and responsive the skype calling is!

One thing I can't figure out is for the Echo Show to tell me the weather in Degrees Fahrenheit?! It's stuck!

author: Kate
title: I AM IN LOVE WITH ALEXA
content: This is the product that you don't know you need, but once you have it you will not know how you lived without it. Ever morning, I start my day with, "Alexa, what's my flash briefing?" and am then updated with news from People Magazine, Fox News, Reuters, and the weather forecast. I use Alexa to play music, to set my cooking timers, look up recipes,  to find my LOST PHONE (this is wonderful!!!) and on and on. I AM IN LOVE! This is the best Christmas present I ever got my husband!! :)

author: Larry
title: So far so good
content: Just got it but so far, it's great! Love the packaging and the screen is so clear. My daughter also loves using it for funny jokes or take selfies. The sound is excellent and no delay

author: remcentre
title: Where’s the video?
content: Works just like the echoes that don’t have a screen. Alexa is great and does the same good stuff. But there’s not much video content it shows or it’s not intuitive how to ask for it. Shows what’s playing when music is on. Will display the words that Alexa says. But I thought there’d be more of a video flash briefing or video to subscribe to. Maybe I just need a tutorial.

author: Blind Traveler
title: Great, fut not for the Ring Video Doorbell!
content: I bought this unit to use with our Ring Doorbell, BUT it does not work with the Ring Doorbell.  However I love having it in my kitchen.  It allows me to look at my lists, remove items from lists.  I can view recipes on the screen and use it as a photo gallery..  But if you make it work with the Ring video doorbell I would have given it five stars!  AND it is an available skill in the skill store, but why??? Please make it work??

author: Julie
title: I love the the Echo Show
content: I love the the Echo Show!  It's so much fun and has so many capabilities I have yet to have figured out but I'm working on it.  Only problem is that now I have to buy one for my son so that I can 'drop in' on him anytime I want :)

author: Christian Rockford
title: Has Potential
content: Don't like that it has no web browser or YouTube function though it is capable. Only feature I like is you can Ask Alexa to turn off display at night. The $5 off a Alexa order was a flop and customer service was no help. Getting a Homepod.

author: G. Julia Vandyke
title: Love My Echo Show !!!!!!
content: I love that you can see the words to the songs, the least liked thing about it is the words take to long to appear on the screen as it scrolls upwards.I also love setting timers and putting items on my shopping list.

author: Dan
title: Alexa with a Screen Does Not Skimp On Audio
content:
Screen is great and audio is excellent.

The menu structure, app vs no app and setup seems very complicated for what’s really there. The app on my iPhone to manage the system is buggy at best. I really wish Amazon invested more in the GUI side of the Alexa platform for the end users.

author: Mr. Peter L. Stark
title: Seems Kind of Limited
content: I'm not sure that I totally understand it yet, but it seems limited as to where you can go and what you can watch. It seems to be all about Amazon and very little else.

author: Judy
title: ... of all the Echoes the echo show is my favorite. You can display your own pictures on the ...
content: At of all the Echoes the echo show is my favorite.  You can display your own pictures on the background does everything the other echoes do. you can make phone calls has the weather and the time on it . The best.!!

author: Diva Alert
title: Such a wonderful new toy
content: This device is so delightful to the eyes and ears.  It gave me lots of joy. I promptly unplugged my old echo. We had a pretty good relationship, but the Echo Show puts my picture on the screen. It was love at first sight.

author: MP
title: This is Great
content: Love the Echo Show. Yes, I would like more.....but, Amazon is on the fast track and they will get Echo Show there. Give it time. I want to see areas of our home from my Nest Camera’s....it works. I want to get the news or see CMN, it works. Love the wake up alarm features and every day I push and learn a little more of what my Echo can do. It is over the top!

author: Charles Lin
title: Good device, clear screen, software issues.
content:
Its good but I have a few complaints:
1. My dad speaks with a slight accent. Compared to google home, Echo is much less accurate when trying to understand english spoken with an accent
2. Should have more language support
3. Calling should have the ability to specify which device to call. I have devices in multiple locations and would help if I can specify which device to call or drop in.

author: Stormleadr
title: Majorly disappointed  with Product and AMAZON
content: I have a friend  who's  company  tests  Alexa  products for  Amazon.  I looked at getting Echo Plus  for  zigbee support  of  My home automation.  My friend  advised me  Newer  edition was coming out  and to check into this,  the echo show,  I called  Amazon  spoke to Rep  and asked if supported Zigbee  stated he didn't  know  but would  check  puit me on hold and then came back and states yes  supports  Home automation and zigbee.  I then  waited to went on sale in July  Normally $229  each  were $129  each.  I bought  three  and  ONLY setup 2  because  I couldn't figure  How  to activate  Zigbee  so  opened a second one thinking maybe something wrong with first one  still no zigbee??  Began  exhaustive  search  online  for  info  and how to NOTHING about  Zigbee on these units  only  on  the older prior  the  Echo Plus.  I called  Amazon  and  asked Rep........  about Zigbee  they stated  NO zigbee  in this Version????  Why did  first  rep say yes  I based my buying it  based on his  obvious  wrong specs  on this item.  I took care  of  patient of mine  ( I'm a physician)  he works  locally for  amazon  he recommended I reach out to amazon and explain my issue they would most likely help.  I have  called twice  and  even asked for  higher level tech support  but all I get  is some low level  customer service  reps  who  just keep saying  use  Upgrade  with  unknown  value  Credit  for  your  item  and 30%  off  So  I was dubbed  by  first  rep  and  Now  feel like I will be dubbed  by trade  in where  I will lose money and  have to spend  alot more to get what I initially thought I was getting the first time.  For  being a Member  of  Amazon  since 2001  ( although I remember prior to this  buying books off here when all they handled were books)  and  Prime member for last few years.  I am Not happy  at all  with  amazon and or  the handling of this considering my loyalty  and spending  1000's  yearly on amazon.  I may just have to consider going to Google's  product or some other avenue  of  Home automation  which can handle Zigbee.

author: Matt Keeling
title: Extremely impressed, but lacks apps. (Update) Things are not so great anymore.
content: The echo is great to have around. However, the lack of apps is kind of a bummer. I wish apps like Netflix, HULU, Sling, Vudu, ESPN, etc were an option. I would recommend people buy this if they want to know information on just about anything, want to control smart items in the house, listen to music, and improve home organization with list and calendars. Until more apps are added I will rate this 4 stars.(((Update))) The screen has started to fail and lines are appearing on the screen. This just started about a month ago after just a few months of owning this product.

author: Debra C Summers
title: That if you don't have a usable mobile phone(that can receive a text)Alexa is unusable
content: We live in a mountainous area and because of this, our cell phones do not work here at home.  I was forced to get a landline to have a phone usable here in the house.  The service is through my wifi and tv provider.  Because I can not receive a text through this phone, I can't set up Alexa to take the place of a smartphone. So I can 't use Alexa as she was intended to be used.  My daughter, who lives across the country gave this to us as a Christmas gift and I am sad that we can't use her to chat as my daughter had hoped.  A lot of money spent for nothing.

author: heather m. laporte
title: The screen and audio is pretty good. The cost for what it is offering ...
content: No night camera. No wide angle camera. Therefore it has limited ability to be used unless it's during the day, a light is on, or your standing over the top of it at a wierd angle. Furthermore, it does not support multi person calling.  The screen and audio is pretty good. The cost for what it is offering is over priced considering the technology for the before mentioned limitations are inexpensive and available from the same company that Amazon ripped off it's idea. Lastly, it's support service has no idea about this product. If there is an issue and you call for help, the majority of the time they openly admit they don't know this product. I would say this product is a generation away from being exceptional, however that's assuming that the people in product development have a clue about these major limitations which should have been resolved before this one even being produced. Time will tell if Amazon can get it's act together on this line but as of right now I'm not optimistic

author: Alfredo A. Gomez
title: I have Alexa a good 15 feet from my recliner
content:
I found that 95% of the time Alexa was able to answer my questions. The microphones have exceptional range.
I have Alexa a good 15 feet from my recliner, and I don't even have to raise my tone of voice.
The quality of sound is superb specially in the music. Alexa goes to Amazon Prime Music and plays any song that I request. I'm very happy with my Alexa.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Limited features
content:
Because Amazon and Google can't get their act together and work together, the Echo Show has very limited features because it can't do anything Google related (e.g. Google search or watch YouTube).

It's all a bunch of pride between the decision makers of two large companies.

Definitely not worth the $230.

I bought it for $130 during the Prime Day sale. If not for the Video Drop-in feature, I'd return it for sure.

author: Christine M. Knott
title: Peace of Mind
content: I bought one for me and one for my Mother who lives 400 miles from me.  She is 93 and I worry (worried) about her all the time.  My brother set up the Show on her kitchen table.  Now I am able to drop in and have morning coffee with her and find I am popping in several times a day to chat.  She really enjoys it, gets tickled when it’s now so easy to show me something.  It’s an amazing tool and really takes a lot of stress off my family because I can make sure she takes her pills, etc.  She can listen to her old songs, watch shows, just a plethora of wonderful things.

author: Judy
title: Music and movies
content: I am not a music person.  For the first time ever, I am enthusiastic about listening to all kinds of music.  I also asked for my favorite movie of all time and started watching within a few moments.  So long iTunes.

author: Retired and Loving It
title: Easy peasy
content: This was really plug and play.  It found the WiFi and when I attached the Amazon cloud can it grabbed the complicated pass code.  No hassle ever to get a good screen shot of my front door. I like the screen size too.

author: Warren Resen
title: Just an expensive extra toy
content: Still haven't figured out how to use it or why I have to buy so many extra appliances so I don't have to get up to turn off my butt to turn electrical appliances on or off or adjust my thermostat, etc.  These are things I can easily do by getting my butt off the couch and walking a few steps. It duplicates most functions I can control with other devices.  But what it does is let me do is buy more things from Amazon and pay for additional services.  it's like having a bank robber in the house.

author: Tirso Cruise
title: and that was great except alexa is very limited
content:
Same as echo but with video.  I wish it does more with the video or apps you can use or customize.  I bought the TCL Xess last year, and that was great except alexa is very limited.  I wish this was the same as the Xess but it's not.  As a standalone, it's perfect for the kitchen, but I wish the screen is bigger like Xess or at least have option to send screen to your TV.  I can't watch shows or movies with this tiny screen and it's not like a tablet you can hold.  Still 5 stars due the great sound and finally "computer" as wake word.  I did bought 2 and one for my Mom and she loves it.
I hove the Xess, show and dot on my kitchen.  Maybe I'll move this from my kitchen to my bedroom kinda like a super smart alarm clock because is too small for me in the kitchen.

author: A. Gift For You
title: Works in Germany. If you can have a friend ship it.
content: AMAZON would not ship this to an APO. The Show comes with 110-240 adapter, so there is no need for a converter. Setup was a breeze, and after changing the zip code for the weather to the zip code of my village, I have local weather reports. I have not found a function that does not work just because I live outside the States.

author: Irritated Military Veteran
title: Great product!!!
content:
Really enjoy this.  Has great sound and the lyrics are a cool feature.  Plan is to connect it to the Ring doorbell.

We have 4 dots and an echo also.  This is the favorite in the house so far.

Sometimes I wish it had YouTube but other times I am glad it does not.

author: Matt
title: major reason we purchased was to have my kids talk to their grand mother but only works with a smart phone, so you missing a who
content: Have to ask the same question 3 or 4 times before it answer. major reason we purchased was to have my kids talk to their grand mother but only works with a smart phone, so you missing a who;e market of seniors who don't want Smart phone they want buttons

author: Alison Elicier
title: It’s fairly easy to use
content: It’s fairly easy to use.  But would prefer if it could access other popular social media accounts - Facebook, Instagram and Pinterest.  One of the primary reasons I purchased was to be able to pull my favorite recipes.  I’m not currently able to do that.

author: Bruce S.
title: Alexa could use a "brain" upgrade
content: Crisp picture.  Using as a baby monitor with Wayze camera.  Simple set up.  Alexa does not compare with Siri or Google.  If your looking for "smart" don't look here.  Works great with Amazon platform, but outside that world.......D-

author: ToujoursMoi
title: Echo Show 1st Generation
content: I bought the 2nd Generation around the holidays. I liked it so well that I wanted a Spot for my bedroom, but they didn't go on sale again. My sister has 1st Generation and I think it was just fine for what I wanted it for. It is! And the price is a lot less!

author: Issachar L.
title: Now I see Alexa, but I wish she listen better.
content:
This is the second Alexa device I got, the first one is Echo 2nd generation, which I love so much. So I am taking another step to enjoy Amazon services by getting Echo Show. My Echo is black but I choose white for Echo Show which I think more eyes catching on my desk, while black Echo got a sturdy look.

Having visual on Echo device surely improve the experience and it's so much more fun, specially if you have Prime Video service. If you listen to music most of the time, Echo Show shows currently title, even lyrics, which I think is really nice.

The only complain I got is Echo Show's mic performed slightly poor than Echo, I need to speak louder so Alexa could catch me correctly.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Voice command sucks.
content:
It works but doesn't understand a lot and it gets frustrating saying a command 15 times before it works. Doesn't help that theres no way to do anything without voice command.  The games don't work well and exit randomly.
Maybe I just got a lemon, but I'm not wasting more money to find out

author: cantonusa
title: Works As Advertised
content: While the Gen 2 Echo Show has some pluses over this Gen 1 version I have been very happy with it.  It has worked flawlessly and has been a useful and fun addition, both for the information and the entertainment that it can provide.  I enjoy it so much that I bought a second one for my daughter's family.  Now I can do video phone calls with my grandsons, which adds to the fun of visiting with them when we can't be together.  Could I live without the Echo Show?  Of course, but I'm glad I don't have to.  Very happy with this purchase.

author: Lorie Vanderpool
title: Please don't buy this......a huge headache.
content: Undoubtedly the worse product to purchase. I have had two of these since July 14th and had another one to go out today.  Was told that they are having numerous problems and there is no solution....do not purchase

author: Amazon Customer
title: I can see/talk to my :baby" while away on one of my my work related trips.
content: I LOVE MY ECHO SHOW !  I travel a lot for work & am able to check in on my baby (dog) while I'm away.  My baby is NOT happy that I'm not there, BUT when he hears "Alexa" he jumps up on the couch where we can view each other.  I LOVE this feature BEST about the Echo Show.  There are HUNDREDS of reasons more, of why I love it, but NOTHING tops being able to talk/see my baby when I'm away !

author: Richard klinger
title: Love my echo
content: I have it next to my chair I watch tv from. I ask it a lot of questions. Like I would do with Google. It can answer many of my questions. It turns on lights for me, gives me weather info, and it is learning new things to do daily.

author: Howard Beale
title: 4800 miles like next door!
content: We live in Florida; the grandkids are in Europe.  Both we and our son bought Shows simultaneously a year ago.  After years of messing with Skype and Facetime with sometimes frustrating results, this is a godsend.  No setup after the initial programming!  Just, "Alexa, call the kids" and our son's kitchen appears.  Occasionally the call drops or pixelates because of a weak connection, but most of the time the results are better than all of the previous options.  We have three non-video Echos and this does what they do as well and integrates with them to serve as the best room to room intercom we've ever had.  One minor quibble: the audio sensitivity of our Show seems to be a bit less than that of the audio-only Echos; a request of "Alexa, set a timer for an hour" may result in the timer going off in the bedroom 30' away rather than the Show 10' away but that is facing away from the person requesting it.

author: Amazon rocks...
title: What's really the purpose?
content:
I am an early adopter. So ordered it. But just don't see the value when my Echo Dot works perfect for fraction of the price.
Alexa is great, but struggling to see the value proposition of Echo Show.

author: IntuitiveMuse
title: It's About the Visuals!
content: Amazon Echo Show has exceeded our expectations!  It's not only  gorgeous, the ability to view videos, graphics is superb. And, there's so much more to explore with Alexa everyday, as she offers up a variety of news, content, recipes to explore!

author: stanley pacheco
title: great product if i could give it 10 stars i ...
content: great product if i could give it 10 stars i would first it started with a little hiccup the first echo show wasn't  working right the right speaker wasn't working n the left 1 was pop not to say it was amazons fault because we all seen the video of how some ups drivers treat there packages so i call amazon 2 get a return label n to get a replacement so they take my info n transfer me 2 a supervisor n let me tell u i've deal with alot of customer service in my life but amazon customer service is the best i ever experience not only did she help me but had my replacement sent to me the next day by 11;45am thats less than 24 hours later n it was a sunday now 4 the echo showlove the show screen size is perfect the sound is great i had a dot n it wasn't loud enough so i got a 20 watt bluetooth speaker well with the show i don't need it anymore its as loud as the speaker or a bit louder amazon hit a homerun with this 4or somebody like me this a god sent n the reason why is because i'm a quadriplegic paralyzed 4rom the neck down the show gives  me a bit of freedom i've been looking 4or a device like this 4or years i've seen some in the market they r called ecu environment control units n depending what u want 2 control they start at $1400 i even got a quote 4or one that controls everything n the quote was $20,689 i don't know if the  amazon team where thinking of the disable but never the less thank u u guys r awesome i can't wait 2 see what the future holds 4or amazon n alexa i see alexa can pretty much control anything i look forward 2 trying some of the alexa add on in the future when i can save some money because the add on i would need 2 control my environment will pile on n be expensive 2 get all at once a little at a time THANK U AMAZON U GUYS ROCK

author: Critmyself
title: If you own echo products, a must addition
content: I love this product so far.  Screen quality is very good.  Sound quality is very good.  If you enjoy echo products then you will like this.  Video chatting is great and more convenient than on my phone.  I have one in my kitchen and one in my bedroom which I use as my alarm clock and more.  Thinking of getting one more for my office at work.  I also own an echo dot which for the price it is a great product as well.

author: BDR
title: A Great Addition to the Alexa Family
content: Absolutely love video interacting with my 88 year old Mother, and she has no difficulty mastering the simple interface. Thanks Amazon!

author: billb
title: Not so bad
content: Decent speaker, great at first. Now, 8 months later, it does not work as well. Screen is a little fuzzy at times. Still in all not a bad device.

author: Vikas Kohli
title: Fabulous device, our first Echo.
content: This is our first Echo. I'm bad at reading instructions so I started setting up basis prompts. Took maybe 2 minutes with no additional effort. The device did take time to load as it was downloading an update. Alexa started introducing the device and features. Here are skills that we use daily, timers: such ease, no need to poke around on your phone. YouTube trailers:Alexa shows a notification as soon as a new trailer comes out and immediately plays it if prompted. Music requires a little effort and needs clear enunciation when band or song names are similar to another.

author: Mary SanDomenico
title: Sound quality is very good although there is no option to change bass or ...
content: Sound quality is very good although there is no option to change bass or treble  The other down side is that there is always a message on screen suggesting things to ask Alexa. This is annoying especially since I want to display photos. Make it look cheap. Also so disappointed I cannot get utube  not sure if I will keep it. Not much different then echo or tap

author: Frequent Amazon Shopper
title: YOUTUBE is no longer supported which is the reason I thought these will be cool gifts, now I just stuck my family with ...
content:
July 16th 2018 update after 7 months of owning this cube of junk. It’s an overpriced speaker.
I was really hoping for improvements with the show but it’s the most frustrating piece of technology I have ever owned  takes great effort to setup and remember exact commands to use it if it decides to work at all. I’d be rich if I got a quarter everyone she say hmm I don’t know that or ignores me completely.

Bought 3 of these for Christmas Presents, YOUTUBE is no longer supported which is the reason I thought these will be cool gifts, now I just stuck my family with a useless amazon device, Amazon should be ashamed of their deceptive promotion of the show.

after getting over the initial disappointment of not having YOUTUBE, I have a love/hate relationship with my Echo.  I have a complete automated home with TPlink and sometimes I can turn on my plugs/lights using voice commands and sometimes not.  I am ending up using the Kasa application on my phone more and more because I am tired of yelling at my Amazon Show and repeating myself several times

Some of the features are nice such as setting up a key word that turns on multiple devices - I just say Alexa-Good Morning and my TV, lights come on and I get my traffic and weather report.

The recipe feature is nice - able to scroll up or down with just a word.
The kids enjoy watching Sponge Bob at the kitchen counter while we are cooking.

Since I purchased several for family members - we can talk over the Show, this is a nice feature - kind of like SKYPE and once setup is easy to use, also the drop in feature is great to drop in on the kids to tell them things like come down stairs for dinner or brush your teeth and go to bed now, and with the automated plugs - I can also turn off their TV's and lights.

Annoying things like it's inability to search the web for information to respond to questions, and the lack of flexibility to understand questions.  You have to ask questions in a certain way if you want an answer and sometimes I get frustrated trying to remember skill phrases - because if you don't ask just right - you will end up repeating over and over again to get a response.

All in all I find that I end up yelling at Alex several time before I get the results that I ask for. Kind of frustrating

^-15-2018 Update
This thing still sucks - it is not getting better at all - never does what I ask it to do - it says it turns lights off - but doesn't and I have to repeat myself 3-4 times before it responds. Drop in feature is awful if you have multiple devices, I say drop in on family room and it drops in on the kitchen, if it can even find the drop in at all - most of the times it says it doesn't know that contact,  Adding things to the shopping list or appointments are the same experience, you have to repeat yourself 3-4 times before it will work - I used to keep up with the new commands and features and actually try them - it's really hard to remember the correct commands to open apps/features so I give up - I also will ask it a question like what actor won the most awards and it tells me what a boat is - still don't recommend buying this thing unless you like repeating yourself over and over, having it not do what you ask

author: Faith
title: Love ALL my Echo devices!
content:
I recently ordered two Echo Shows (one black and one white) via Best Buy after my daughter and her family came for a short visit. They received their preordered Echo Show just before they left to come for their visit so they brought it with them. I liked it...so after they left I ordered two Echo Show's and got the $100 discount. The only reason I ordered via Best Buy was because I was able to get 12 months free financing on my purchase. My Echo family has grown...currently I have two Echo's, two Echo Dot's, one Echo Tap and now two Echo Show's...LOVE them all! Yesterday I requested an invitation to be able to purchase the Echo Look. I ordered a little 8" turntable via Amazon so I can swivel my nightstand Echo Show and liked it so much I'm having a second one delivered today for my other Echo Show!

EDIT: I forgot to mention how I use my Echo’s... Local Weather, weather from areas where my family members live. Music, Videos, Audio Books etc... Amazon Music Unlimited, My Amazon Music, Pandora Radio, Tunein, iHeart Radio. My Calendar Events, Voice/Test msgs, Amazon Notifications, News Briefings, LiveWatch security system via Alarm . com, Philips Hue Lights, RING doorbell, Honeywell Total Connect for changing my thermostat settings, reading audio books via Audible, recently added “Drop In” with family members using Echo Show...and the list goes on!

author: Wolfgang
title: Great and smart product.
content: Delivered 28th of June as Amazon promised (Amazon always hold their deliverytime). Easy to set up. Great sound. High quality. Have 2.4GHz and 5GHz. Love that it has a touchscreen. Nice to watch YouTube on.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very disappointing as clearly amazon dumbed down this device for what ever reason
content: I will probably return this. Got it yesterday and thought the youtube issue was resolved. Turns out its not, so no you tube on this device. Also, i didnt realize you couldnt use a browser on this (similar to a tablet). There is no way to look up something specific. Very disappointing as clearly amazon dumbed down this device for what ever reason. Basically its a $180 clock radio with weather. It could be so much more.

author: Jeff F
title: Echo show at this point is just an ok device ...
content:
Echo show at this point is just an ok device for me. I did not know that YOU TUBE was no longer supported on this device due to some conflict with You Tube/ Google and Amazon. I may or may not return the item for this very reason because You Tube was going to be one of our major uses for the Echo Show.

Update 6/19:  I gave it a few nights and have decided it needed to go back. I thought maybe I could live with You Tube being supported anymore which I was willing to do. The thing that broke the back was the constant news blurbs/facts and "try This" which covers the screen.
I have down graded it to two stars. If You Tube is added back on and an option to turn of the never ending text on the home screen then maybe I will try again.

author: nickiBF
title: Awesome buy!
content: Love it!!!! And loved the flexible payment option! I didn’t need it, but I used it and it was awesome to feel like it wasn’t a large purchase. My daughter and I both love to use the “show” part of the product. She reads lyrics from her favorite songs and sings along (she 8) and I love the fact that I can see her face when I’m traveling even easier than FaceTime

author: Marcelo Guerrero
title: Great for tech freaks
content: This thing is great if you have a lot of smart home items, such as security cameras, smart thermostats, smart lights, can also be synced up to other amazon echos to play music through your whole house. It is also capable of making calls and video chat with other echo shows. The speakers on this thing are great and it’s got a good range because of the multiple microphones to hear your voice even over vacuum cleaning noise or being at the other end of a room. That being said I wouldn’t recommend this if you’re just going to ask questions and not use it for any other function. I’d suggest you’d go a cheaper route Like the echo spot or echo dot.

author: Amazon Customer
title: "COULD" be great, just isn't.. Maybe later
content:
"COULD" be great just isn't

This is a product that is completely designed off hypothetical features. When you see the commercials and people request to see the front door - They show the front door video application loading in a few seconds and in reality it's like 45 seconds on almost all functions that require video. Just doesn't work nearly as smooth as it's marketed. At best it's really used just as an Echo Dot, asking questions and getting answers but now when can see dialogue on the screen.

Oh, and not being able to watch Netflix or Hulu on this just add insult to injury. Today, it's not even close to worth $220.00. Wait till its on sale, or until its updated significantly

author: Michael J
title: Awesome device with my Ring Pro Doorbelll
content:
Based on the reviews it seems that having the hard wired PRO and a good 5G router is needed to be happy with the Show...it takes about 5 seconds to show the live image from the front door after Alexa confirms the request...image is clear and no buffering issues....Very easy to get this up and running...

Little disappointed that there is no speaker output (I have my Echo dot sharing a connection with my PC hooked up to a mini T-class amp with some polk audio book shelf speakers and a powered sub.  The Show does sound pretty good though)...

author: J scavone
title: Defective and no suppoort!!
content: My Echo show became defective within 2 months of use, sent it back for repair or replace. I received the same item back with nothing more than an update. Now a month later its doing the same thing and out of warranty because it had a so called previous repair? Buy a google device.

author: Lizzie G
title: Great fun. Only one thing I dont like
content: I love my Alexa. My schedule comes up on her everyday. She knows the weather, can play my music, audio books, and games. The only thing is that she is not like a google device. You won't get answers to your questions unless you program a skill in her. Programing skills are easy but if you wlask a question about that skill you have to ask alexa to ask "that skill" and then your question. Other than that I think she is great. She also raps, sings, tells jokes, riddles, and will answer personal questions about her self.

author: Marc E
title: A nice leap from the original Echo
content: Better sound, a bright and easy to use display and no stuttering when watching movies or video. It's really everything I liked about the original Echo plus helpful visualization. Highly recommended.

author: 2down1togo
title: Video Chat is very good!
content:
The video chat is very clear worked perfectly.
The volume is low, and it will occasionally start talking on its own.
It won’t show all my prime options.

author: ANDREW
title: HAL 2017
content: Will it Open the pod bay door?  Not yet, but having the original echo this is the logical next step.  What I like about Show are the likely apps to come.  A scrolling twitter feed by my bedside would be nice.  Scrolling stock quotes.  Weather maps.  Traffic maps.  Alexa's face (creepy but you know you want it.).  Aquarium screen saver.  All kinds of cool apps likely to come.

author: Christina
