title: Priceless to talk to my Grandmother!
content: I love my alexa show, I actually bought three of them.  One for my mom, one for my grandmother, and one for me.  They all live far from me and this is such a great way to connect! I drop in on my grandmother because she gets a little confused at how to answer a phone, and it works so perfectly!  You have to set up the device for drop in and indicate your contacts who have permission to do this, so my mom and I have our devices turned off for that feature so noone can drop into us.  But it is priceless for my grandmother, it is gray at first and I always make sure to say something like Grandma, are you there? I'm just calling to say hi.. and then she has some time before the screen clears up. We'll have a great video conversation and I feel so much more connected to her after seeing her on the screen! My alexa show tells me when she is active, so it really makes it so easy.  My mom and I watch tv together or I use it as video chat for her to see the grandkids, I like how it is a standalone device that just sits there on the table and I can talk and see her while doing other things.

author: Glenn Mumper
title: Screen Flicker
content:
I have only had this product 2 months and already the screen is flickering.  UPDATE:  Unit was repaired but the same symptoms are there.  If it isn't going to work then that is money wasted.
don't buy.

author: Nikknac
title: MUST HAVE!
content:
We bought two of these and have one for upstairs and one for downstairs. If you have an echo or an echo dot and want to upgrade you will LOVE this echo show! I have one in my kitchen and one in my bedroom upstairs. I love listening to music with the lyrics. We have connected it to our front door using ring and our air conditioners. It is nice to turn the ac up or down when you are on the opposite side of the house or even in bed. I think the people that are disappointed with this product are unrealistic in what they expected. For the price, I think this thing is amazing. I mean it is the first of its kind. I am excited already for them to come out with updates and new releases. I even play some of the games it has, like deal or no deal when I am in the kitchen cooking. I also use it for my morning news update. It really is great. THE ONLY DOWNSIDE: Sometimes the alexa upstairs hears me when I am trying to talk to the alexa downstairs and then music will start playing upstairs and I have to go upstairs to turn that one off. Not that big of a deal though. I even took this with me to watch a movie while I was taking a relaxing bath... Alexa play me a funny movie! I use Alexa so much my son's first word was Alexa! I wish I was kidding! :)

EDIT: I almost forgot to mention one of the greatest things about this product.. ALEXA, add jelly to my grocery list. This feature is so nice. I will never forget things at the store again!

author: SF
title: It streams audio quickly and smoothly, even on 2mb internet speeds.
content: I have never been one for talking to inanimate objects. However, the echo show, a gift, has been surprisingly useful. I use it to connect to radio streams via Tune-in, listen to audible audio books, and have it set to remind me of things I too often forget. Very handy. It connects faster than I can using the computer, and the streaming seems somehow smoother - no buffering, etc. Perhaps because all the extra info and advertising on the webpages is not downloaded, only the stream. My wife loves to have it show the family photos stored on Amazon prime.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Echo Show is Awesome!!
content: Wow, I absolutely love this! My Cousin got the original Alexa from me as a gift because I didn't think I needed something like this in my apartment. Was I wrong! This thing does it all...even the littlest of things. Great for turning on lights (with the Smart Plugs), listening to music and the news, accessing my Calendar, getting detailed info and basically having a Full-Time Audio Assistant in my house! Totally worth the amazing sales price I got it for too!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: best echo by far
content: buy this one if could afford it, best echo by far. better sound quality, watch movie on bed.get the weather on screen.  I got this on prime day, best purchase I made this year!

author: Aaron
title: Not sure what to say. Wow.
content: I am not sure what to say here. We have an Echo. We have 4 Echo Dots. I got a bit of heat from my family when I pre-ordered a sixth one. But this one, the "show" is a mind blower. We are a tech-centric, smart home device loving group, and this thing is still awesome to us. If I list everything I have found it can do at this point I would run out of room. If you are not a smart home type, there will still be more things you can do - see that you will be able to count. The sound quality is deep and immerses the entire room. Will likely buy more.

author: Carter D
title: love this - but still dislike Alexa's bias
content: love this - but  still dislike Alexa's bias.  When I ask for certain things - she will not "understand". Really tired of fighting to get news, music personalized to a conservative taste.

author: Hippichikki
title: Big POS!!!
content:
After using this for half a year,I have many complaints.
First,it constantly cuts off while playing music,as if you said her name. When we cough or just say any random thing she is in the mood to pick up,the music goes mute again like you are talking to her.
Second,she consistently tells me,"hmmm,I don't know that one"..This is really getting old to me!!.
Third,she is not very helpful.  I constantly have to go elsewhere for the information I am looking for.
Fourth,when I use her to stream Spotify,she plays only the same 3 bands on my list and then starts over. She never just plays through the list like she is supposed to,and if I have her shuffle music,she will only shuffle 2 bands over and over again.
My huge positive with my Amazon Echo Show is that even when she shouldn't be,she IS TOTALLY listening. I like that though,because it makes me feel safe as I know if anything happens here,she is recording it all.
Hope this helps!!

author: ShuMO
title: Amazon owns your deskspace -
content: The unit functions okay for the most part. Basic Alexa features but there is a 'TRY blah blah' that can't be disabled.  Users from all over have asked Amazon to make it disableable but been ignored.  I wouldn't buy this again at this time.  V2 of the unit (called Gen 2 I think) also has the problem per the demo screens being shown.  More annoying the a presidential alert.

author: Dianna Romero
title: Best helper ever!
content:
I love asking Alexa questions and asking her to play certain music. I also love having the exact time by my bedside and having Alexa set alarms for me. I don’t even have to get up to turn off the alarm. I love being able to dictate my shopping list to Alexa and then having it on my phone when I get to the store. I am still learning what Alexa can do for me so
I’m sure I will discover
Even more things that I like

author: Kevin T
title: It helps us get a full night of sleep!
content: We are enjoying our Echo Show in the bedroom because we can go to bed with relaxing music or ask Alexa to "Play ocean sounds" and she will play an audio file that just helps us wind down and go quickly to sleep and keep us sleeping soundly all night. In the morning, it's great to ask Alexa to play our "Flash Briefing" (fully customizable) to get us a start on our day.  We are quite enjoying our purchase.

author: Michael A. Ginesi
title: Fine when it actually works... Lots of bugs
content:
When it works it is ok.... But it does not always work. We ask Alexa to play certain music and it goes blank... It keeps putting questions up on screen like ,' try " Alexa, how old are you"
Might interest a 6 year old but to an adult it is ridiculous...
I will use my CD player more than this

author: Nelson Munoz
title: Poor performance
content: I own two of this products. One of them works without any problems. The second one I have a screen flickering issue. My device was sent in for repair and it came back and I still have the same issue. I have contacted amazon numerous times about getting a new unit or my money back. They said they will send me a new unit but “they’re having a problem on their end” that prevent them from sending me out a new unit. This is not the way to treat loyal customers and prime members. I still don’t have my device replaced.

author: David Shear
title: The drop in feature is great for video calls
content: The Show is still a little buggy, but overall the product is solid. I use the Show in my kitchen. I mainly use the screen for recipes and to have video chats with my family. Alexa works in the same way that you would find in the echo or dot. The sound quality is good but not great. Take time to load your pictures into Amazon and then set the Show to display the pictures on a slide show in the background. We have 300 pictures that slowly rotate in the kitchen. I purchased this Show for my parents. They are now “dropping in” to our Show for video chats with their grandkids.

author: Josh
title: No YouTube! Buy a different Alexa device
content: Great for playing music, asking questions, etc. The lack of Youtube makes me regret the purchase. Without Youtube you should not by the Show. Just by a different Alexa device.

author: pomogeezer
title: Get C. J. Anderson’s guide before plugin.
content: After being underwhelmed by the Echo Dot experience (which we quickly disconnected and packed away as a lost cause), we have found the Echo Show to be worthy of the titanic effort required to set it up.  The sound engineering of the Echo Show, alone, justifies the frustrating complexity of the set up process (which, for us, would have been impossible without C. J. Andersen’s guide). Don’t even plug this marvel in before reading the first chapters of Anderson’s e-book.

author: Christy H
title: Started off great
content: My husband bought this for me as a Valentine's Day present.  We loved it, I use it in the kitchen almost daily. Several weeks ago the screen start to get a blurry/ snowy effect.  We've put in multiple trouble tickets with absolutely no response.  Amazon and their products are normally better than this.  Sad to say the product quality is poor, but the lack of response is unacceptable. We won't be buying one for my father like we had planned.

author: Amazon Customer
title: You will luv this
content: These are awesome. I bought 4 so my grandkids can FaceTime me, each other and great grandpa. We are all closer since using this. The kids just say Alexa call GIGI. I love getting all their calls. We use drop in feature for great grandpa as technology is not his favorite to figure out.

author: Cheryl H.
title: What to do with product.
content: Beautiful picture.  Still setting up and learning.  There were no clear instructions sent with product and the Amazon store were of no help.  I was told to look it up on UTube.  Have not had time yet.  I like the bright clock.

author: Margaret A. Parker
title: Love the Echo Show
content: I love the Echo Show, I have had it for two weeks as of this review and have been enjoying it daily. Love that I can see my brother when we talk, because he lives in another state and we do not see each other very often.  Also that I can listen to news or music while working in the home. Needless to say I love it.

author: frank
title: No YouTube?
content: I'd give it 5 stars if it had youtube. Otherwise it's a very nice addition to the family. Hopefully they'll offer it soon. Or come up with a reasonable replacement for YouTube videos.

author: Jonathan S.
title: Dont hesitate the extra bucks are worrh it.
content: The little screen can do a huge difference in the interacfion you may have with Alexa, the fact thst you can watch movies, see the lyrics of the songs or even whenTelling you a joke or story see the path is absolutley cool!i I love it.... my mom is disable and it help her to get things done, things that could take her a major effort, like calling me or texting me...i even use her as a reminder when the dryer or asher would be finksh. To call my lyft or uber driver, star him, tip him. I can order food, see closes retaurant, watch movies, find nearest cinema and what they  are airing. I can check my expedia flights and confirm with the airline. Rent a car, check the weather or add stuff to my cart as soon as I ran out of them for not forgeting to buy on amazom fresh! I aslo sync my entire home! alexa rocks!

author: RONALD
title: Things to try annoying !!!!
content: Disable things to try. Just dumb.

author: Brian M.
title: A Great New Echo Product!
content: Have always been a fan of the original Echo and Echo Dot and now I'm a huge fan of the Echo Show! It sounds great and adding video to the Echo was the next logical step. Being able to use video as well has allowed us to use ours as a baby monitor, to check the doors camera feed and so much more. I have 2 so far and I plan on buying at least one more. One is in my office and my wife will use the drop in feature to check in when I'm working late or I will see if she needs anything instead of shouting up and down the steps. Overall I'm really happy and can't wait to see the improvements and additional hardware that get integrated with the Echo Show!

author: M. Andersen
title: Many things I would change but it's a decent unit.
content: Maybe there's a learning curve but right out of the box I'm not terribly impressed. I had hoped that it would interface with my Apple apps much more easily so things like calendar and contacts would come across but it seems to be an uphill battle getting my other devices to communicate with it. It does have decent voice recognition but so does Siri. I also wish that you could change the voice from female to male. I guess I've got a lot to learn to get real worth out of it.

author: LAURA VANHOOK
title: User friendly
content:
I am having fun with this. It’s super user friendly and performs like a charm as promised.
I’m off to find a compatible speaker to link another room of the house for music throughout.

author: pcladie
title: Alexa, Start the Show!! I likey a lot...
content: I enjoy dropping in on my family. The sound is great and watching a movie on my desk is super cool because it frees up my laptop for actual work. What I don’t like is the angle it’s made on. I have to prop it up in the rear otherwise people only see my ceiling when video chatting. Also the drop in feature is strange. People have access to your home without you being in the room! Be sure to turn that feature off!

author: Wayne Simpson
title: Cool fun technology
content: wow, this is really neat.  I had pre-ordered this before I bought my Echo Dot.  Only had the Dot a few weeks before receiving my Echo Show.  This is technology that's fun to use.  I like it better every day.  I'm looking forward to friends getting an Echo Show so we can video chat and "drop In".

author: Linda M
title: GREAT CHRISTMAS PRESENT DON"T HESITATE
content:
I too bought 2, one for me and 1 for my 92 year old mother who lives in Florida with my sister  (I am in NY).  Best present I have ever given her.(her words) Being 92 and with failing eyesight she is VERY limited in her ability to use any electronics.  I set hers up so she can just tell Alexa to call me.  I can drop in on her and she doesn't need to do anything. I also set up her own play list. She loves gospel and Elvis and Conway Twitty among a few.  She just tells Alexa to play Betty's play list and she is on cloud 9.  She can listen to audible books and  I can watch Amazon videos.

Now I have to convince my daughter to let me buy my granddaughter one so she can call Mimi, when she can talk (she is 10 months).

Also on my Alexa app on my phone I can use it to drop on mom too. When I visited my granddaughter, my mom was able to see her great granddaughter.

author: RY
title: Great for some specific circumstances--comments on international use included
content:
To be clear, a decent tablet is a much more versatile device and a better value for most people. However, for some specific circumstances, like mine, the Echo Show is great. I have a 75-year old mother who lives in Asia and I have tried to get her to use Skype and similar apps for years, with no success. I bought her a laptop and an iPad--the laptop was too complicated (font too small, double mouse clicks needed too difficult for consistent results, etc.) and she didn't keep the iPad charged. Even when I tried to keep the iPad permanently plugged in, she didn't like the touch screen. Elderly people sometimes don't interact effectively with touch screens, which can be unresponsive to their touches, possibly due to skin moisture content.  Given these past issues, I was really excited when the Echo Show with the drop-in feature was announced and bought a pair immediately. I just set up one of them for her and, to my great relief, she really likes it!

It is on my account and I enabled "drop in", so that I can check in on her in the morning and evening.  My mother knows when to expect me and doesn't find the drop-in intrusive or creepy.  The sound is pretty clear and the video does not lag much, if at all, probably because she does have good wifi (10-30mpbs, depending on the time of day). She likes that she doesn't have to immediately drop what she is doing to answer my calls, like she would with a phone call. I have set it up so that she can call me by voice control, in case she falls and can't get up--I am in the US but I can call for local help, if necessary.  She enjoys listening to music on it and using the timers and alarms. These are really limited uses and a poor value, compared to a tablet, but I really don't care about any of that. This is the first device that has worked well for my mother and being able to see her daily is priceless to me.

a few random comments:
--The Echo Show works fine internationally, on the right type of wifi. I couldn't get it to work properly on a cellular wifi hotspot, in either the US or Asia.
--The power adapter is dual-voltage.
--My mother speaks English. My primary interest is the drop-in feature that doesn't require any understanding of English, though.
--Alexa is pretty resilient with foreign accents. Alexa understands most of my mother's commands. I have explained that she can make mistakes without hurting anything and can just repeat her request.  This has been less intimidating than a laptop that freezes up with mistakes.
--I have not been able to set up the weather for a foreign country yet, but my mother likes hearing what my weather is like.  Anyone have success setting up weather in a different country?
--Her test calls to the app on my iPhone have not been completely reliable (with 2 failed attempts out of 10 test calls), but that is still better than having no other option. Of course, her cell phone and land line are more reliable, but this is still a good back up, especially if she can't get reach her physical phones. I think it helps if I refresh the Alexa app on my phone, so I close and open the app daily.
--I disabled purchases on it, just to be safe.
--Even with the TV on pretty loud, Alexa still recognizes when she is called. Compared to Siri on my iPad Pro and iPhone 7 plus, Alexa on the Echo Show is much more responsive.

I would give the Echo Show 5 stars based on how much it has helped my specific circumstances, but it's far from perfect and needs more development to be useful to a wider range of people.  4 stars overall.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great
content: Love my alexa enabled devices! Have never had any issues. I have echo, echo spot, echo show and the new camera.  Love them all!

author: RALI
title: Cool Gadget
content: Works great if your separated from you're loved ones or need to video conference w your team .. other than that its limited.  Maybe future development will include ability to look at videos; recipes, instructions, news, live tv, etc...

author: usmc1371
title: No YouTube
content: Due to Amazon's greediness YouTube is blocked on the Show.  There aren't alot of other useful ways to use the screen so I would recommend saving your money and just getting a normal Echo.

author: Donnie Light
title: Love the screen content!
content:
I really like this device. We have 3 Alexa devices in our house, and we use them all, everyday. I love the idea of the screen. We can now see lists, music videos, and the screen gives us prompts for new things that Alexa can do.
My ONLY minor complaint is that the sound seems a bit more muffled than our other devices. The sound is not as crisp and clear. I have looked for ways to adjust sound settings, but have not found any. It seems there is too much bass in Alexa's voice. It's a minor complaint, and the only reason this is not getting the 5-star review.

author: Ev
title: Great Show
content: Alexa! I love Alexa. The Show is another great product. I can see my lists without being on my laptop. Alexa is constantly suggesting content to see or hear. It very helpfully shows you a joke that Alexa is telling.

author: PittsGirl
title: Does most things just right.
content: I've enjoyed using Echo Show for music, video, recipes, drop in, etc. It's easy to order, understand, and switch accounts. The reason for 4 and not 5 stars... I was told that having multiple Echo devices would be fine, "the closest one to me would reply when prompted." Simply not true. Echo Show is nearly 75% effective at taking over another Echo device in my house. I have 4 so that is seriously annoying.

author: Ary R. Mize
title: Much Hype, Little Substance
content:
What I like the most:  The potential
What I like the least:  Much of its core functionality is severely limited since Youtube, Netflix and amazon can’t play nice.  I had high hopes.  I wish I’d placed my money elsewhere.

6 Month Update:  I originally gave this 2 stars.  Downgrading to 1 after 6 months of ownership.  The device is useless.  I never ever use it, and it’s sitting on my office desk, where it should be handy.  The Amazon squabble with Google continues to limit the YouTube capability that would make this device worth having.  My family continues to get good use out of the Echo II and the Echo Tap and the Echo puck.  I’ve had VERY few hiccups with Amazon over their existence.....this happens to be a grand disappointment.  If you MUST have a device of this nature, buy the Kindle 10 with the Dock.  Much more useful.  I will be shocked if they continue to make the Show now that the HD10 Dock option is available.

Came back for update (08/25/2018):  Device still sucks.  Having to Return device because speaker is popping.

author: Nick
title: not good for communication, with the loss of youtube, its pure junk cant hear each other talk
content:
I Purchased two of these, the thought/concept is amazing and has many applications in the home, Sadly this product is junk, amazon gives no warranty outside of the 30 day, you might as well go after something Samsung makes vs trying to go further with this one.
I use these for in house communications, and occasionally call in from my phone, all of which no one can hear each other due to microphone issues on these devices. we will not discuss how much bandwidth these devices are using, almost no compression, so you mobile carrier will thank you for hitting the data limit... hope you have unlimited data.

author: Bill Tracia
title: Screen Problems
content: I have had this for about a year and a half, the screen keeps jumping and static like and old tv set

author: Jeannette P. Fuller
title: For Elders need cell phone to activate Echo Show
content: Just discovered the “drop in feature”. It’s great for our 91 year old grandmother who has dementia and wouldn’t be able to answer a call. We got this as an early Xmas present.  However, it turned out to more difficult to set up then we thought it would be BECAUSE the 91 year old doesn’t have a cell phone and you need the Alexa app on a phone in order to synchronize and install contacts.  We used an old iPhone, changed SIM card from ATT to t-mobile. T-mobile has a pay as you go plan and since all will be on Wi-Fi and phone only used to set up Echo show it was cheapest option. $50 to activate and $10 credit on pay as you use. No other charges will be incurred. It’s wonderful for seniors but a cell phone is needed with its own number to activate Show.

author: Comfort
title: Deep voice, this may make Echo hard for you to use.
content:
I sometimes had trouble with my last echo picking up on my voice, it’s fairly deep.
The Echo Show is far worse there are times I almost need to yell to get it to activate or stand right in front of it. Please resolve this issue with an update or a patch.

author: Ellen
title: I received this as a gift and I love it. It's so easy to video call my ...
content: I received this as a gift and I love it.  It's so easy to video call my kids.  It's very convenient when I am writing my lists.  Everything is in one place and I can view them.  Plus when I ask for a recipe, it is on the screen.

author: Darryl
title: Not as helpful as thought it would be
content: My wife wanted an Echo with the screen so I got her this.  Not impressed at all.  Doesn't seem to access to that much info.  I've used the Google unit at my daughters and it is much better.  It also doesn't have very good voice recognition.  Ask for "adult alternative" and got "90's alternative".  Not very happy with it, especially for the price.

author: Rabid Reader
title: Pretty good but kind of creepy
content:
Semi useful- sometime she just starts talking or starts to play a song based on what she thinks you said.. and we were not talking to her!
I must confess, I do like to say “good morning” Alexa and have her give me a daily tid bit of info.
 She is great at playing music from amazon and pandora.

author: Jeadak
title: This Echo Show is a fabulous piece of equipment that can do so much.
content: I love my Echo Show. I actually beat my expectations. This is a wonderful piece of entertainment and does so much. I love the fact that it automatically connected with my Echo Dot. I wish it came with a few extras, such as the wall outlets to turn on lights. That will be my next goal, to expand what this unit can do.

author: Nekosdad
title: $725.00 and we can't get Alexa to turn the lights white.
content: We have 4 of these devices in our home (echo show, Echo 2nd gen, Dot, Plus) and 19 "smart lights" since December 2017, That's a LOT of $ we've spent on for something that's stressed our lives out.  We are so over it, we can't even get the blasted lights to turn white using Alexa/Echo! This thing is the most stressful thing I have ever wasted my money on, the last thing we need in the morning is to fight with Alexa with green, blue or red or any other color  except WHITE while trying to get ready for work.  Only thing good about these speakers is the sound quality and Amazon Music,

author: Just browsing
title: Great for the music lover
content: Great for the music lover. Needs multitask capability and better screen resolution along with output connection. Bluetooth not available on all devices I wanted to connect to. Bought a Bluetooth transmitter/receiver to connect to home stereo and lost a lot of signal strength verses hard connections with our Dot. Overall good product. Some but not all music have lyrics on screen while playing.

author: Mark B.
title: Scam Equipment
content: What a scam, doesn't work with Facetime video, only with another person with the Echo equipment.  Only grabs some of your contacts, so you can't call your other contacts unless you know their phone numbers.  Only works with 1 Nest account, I have 3 so it only sees one set of cams.

author: Sandy Cerv
title: Feeling Duped ;-(
content: Amazon...I have the Echo and 2 Dots & love them; my only reason for purchasing 2 of these from the get go was for the YouTube functionality. Now it doesn't have that. What are you doing about that? My honest opinion is that you should offer a refund or partial refund at the very least. This should have never made it to sale day before all the promised features and issues were ironed out.  Note- The 2nd one was a gift for my quadriplegic brother who was thrilled with the ability to go on YouTube and actually maneuver around the content himself. So this setback really stinks for him and he's just frustrated with it now.

author: enthusiastic hobbiest
title: No live view on my Ring 1 Video Door Bell
content: I have echo's and love them.  I got the show specifically to use with my Ring Door Bell only to find out that the first gen Ring Video Doorbell is not fully integrated and I can only view the camera when the bell is activated (no live view) which was a disappointment.  I also seem to need to repeat myself more with the show than with the echo.  I can't give it a 5 until it's more responsive.

author: Jacobs H Jordan
title: Show won't work with cloudcam with latest software update without work-around
content:
UPDATE: After speaking to an amazon customer service rep, figured out that I had to enable alexa notifications in my device options in the alexa app. After that cloudcam started working properly, but I would get notifications every time the camera captured motion on all of my echo devices - even though I had all camera notifications turned off - which was a bit annoying. However, turning notifications back off allowed cloudcam to continue to function. So I've upgraded my review since my wife absolutely loves every other feature and this very important feature is now working as it should.

If you are experiencing issues with cloud cam and echo show go to alexa app > settings > {accounts} Notifications > {Skills} Amazon Cloud Cam > Alexa Notifications

Try toggling on alexa notifications and see if you can get echo show to display your cloudcam. This worked for me - although no one could explain why notifications were required for displaying cloudcam on my echoshow when it would display on my other alexa enabled devices just fine (Fire TV, etc) and on the cloud cam app. But the problem is at least solved for me. See original problem below:

Bought this device for my wife for Christmas and while most features work as advertised it DOES NOT WORK WITH CLOUDCAM. We have two cloud cams and both are set up and functioning well and we can view them on our mobile devices and our linked Fire TV, BUT the echo show wouldn't show them out-of-box (it found cameras but wouldn't display). So we upgraded to v. 597464020, the newest software update and Alexa says "this software version does not support cloud cam" it's the LATEST SOFTWARE VERSION!

author: JILLAINA
title: Better than I imagined!
content: This product is even better than I imagined. I love the timer setting, it reminds me to put the clothes in the dryer if i ask it to, and i love shopping list feature.  My family enjoys the games too! It’s made my life a little more easy! Alexa is my personal assistant. :)

author: CM
title: The Amazon cloud was not an easy set up
content: Purchased this to add additional camera security to our home. Still searching for the right compatible camera.  The Amazon cloud was not an easy set up.  However, The Show is an easy set.  We purchased two.  One for our bedroom and the other in the kitchen.  The show has a great sound and really good picture quality.  Love the easy access to use in the kitchen for recipes, set alarms and timers, help with homework, and to end or start debate topics.  Great product added to our household.

author: Jon B Kimbrell
title: Love the Echo Show!
content: Not sure of everything this can do, but so far we all love it!

author: Shashib
title: great for kids homework help
content:
We used it to keep in touch with family while traveling. There is no app to open or laptop to start. You just use the Alexa app to drop in. Our Echo show is conveniently placed in the kitchen so we can chat as if we were all around the dinner table even if we were a continent away.

Plays music, answers questions, great for kids homework help. Makes calls. You can watch video (hope the issue of YouTube between Google and Amazon gets resolved) I haven't used the security camera monitoring feature but use other smart home features.

It's worth the money.

author: Warsteiner
title: I really like the Show
content: I really like the Show. I got it for Christmas to replace my Echo Dot that I was using for an Alarm clock. The device is clearly still in its infancy and needs some more functionality added to it. I realize it is not supposed to be a full tablet but at least some form of touch control would be nice. Also it would be great if they put more visual apps on it. Right now the only video that actually uses the screen is Amazon Prim Video.

author: ed808
title: Why didnt i get this a long time ago.
content: I love it! Plays great music, movies, and so much more. I does lag when u want to see your arlo security cameras thou. So far so good. Wish it had a longer cord.

author: theHatter
title: Not great. Wouldn't buy again.
content:
I don't use this for video chat, so I can't attest to the success of that feature. I use it basically the same way as my regular Echo, but sometimes I stream videos on it.
The video capability, for some reason, doesn't seem to offer as many choices from Amazon Video as you would find on your TV or laptop. It looks like Amazon narrows your selection to only a few results.
It works well for streaming radio and music, but terrible for podcasts and audiobooks because of the pause feature. I'm a mother of two young children and I frequently have to pause what I'm listening to in order to tend to something. But the pause on the Echo Show only lasts about 10 to 15 seconds before the device  cancels and returns to the home screen. It's tolerable for audiobooks because Audible saves your spot, but for podcasts you have to start the ENTIRE thing from the beginning. And because they want to force you to use the voice commands instead of the touch screen you have to say "Alexa fast forward, Alexa fast forward, Alexa fast forward" hundreds of times to get to where you were. It's maddening; the ordinary Echo doesn't do this.

author: NDL
title: could be improved
content: I like the screen and the constant information displayed.  What I do not like is the screen flickered for several months despite doing everything I could think of, resetting, moving etc and then, inexplicably, it righted itself, so that's good but who knows how long that will last. Additionally, this device just does not seem to "hear" and understand commands reliably.  I often need to get quite loud and repeat myself multiple times, that's a bit frustrating.  Honestly, i do not really notice any sound quality improvement over my Echo, 2nd generation that I have downstairs.  Finally, the Echo Show occasionally will blurt out random stuff and I assure you, no one said "Alexa".  That is just creepy.

author: patv500
title: Makes listening to music like karoke
content: We are really enjoying this.  When we listen to music the words are on the screen, really cool.  We play Jeopardy and can read the questions, just like the show.  And it adjusts our Nest via voice.

author: Duke
title: No Show without YouTube
content: Bought this back on preorder in June and was excited when it arrived. It was Great being able to watch YouTube videos.  That's the main feature that drove me to buy it.  But September 26 came and NO MORE YouTube!!!!!  It's nothing special anymore.  Should have kept my echo dot!  Cuz that's all this is now is an echo  for Show.  They knew it was coming hence the sales.

author: J.D.
title: A good device. May be more useful in the future.
content: Pretty good product. But not offering so much that is new or useful yet. Don't get me wrong I love the Alexa cloud service and have dots and the original echo in my home too. I hope they keep updating because at this point I don't find myself really drawn to using the show over the other products. The video features are not that appealing and I don't think I will be using the video calling as other tools are better and don't require others to have this set up in their home or phone. So it's a nice toy at this point but not a game changer. If it becomes a smart home hub in the future I might be singing a different tune at that point. If you are looking for an initial alexa device and are willing to spend the money, I would go with this because the extra features and the speakers are quite good in this device. If you have echos or dots and are on the fence, you won't be missing too much by holding off in my opinion.

author: BibleGirl
title: I love it, and want to buy another one
content: I love using this device. I like that I'm able to contact my nephew's Amazon Echo. I just ask Alexa to call Anthony's Echo. I'm getting him the Echo Show for Christmas so we can have a face to face conversation. I watch Amazon movies, look at YouTube, watch recipes videos with the AllRecipes skill, check the weather, traffic, listen to Spotify, TuneIn, Pandora, Amazon Music & listen to books. I love the Bible App which has different reading plans that keeps track of my plan. I review the skills and add new ones everyday.

author: Amazon Customer
title: but it did not perform like I thought it would
content: I bought it to go with my security camera system, but it did not perform like I thought it would. It doesn't alert us when someone is at the door. Also, I can't talk to the person at the door through the echo show, only through my cell phone.

author: earlyadopter
title: LOVE IT!!! Great device to help the family stay connected <3
content: I will start by saying that I got this as a gift and have previously own an Echo and a Dot; these are great devices as well, but I really enjoy the ability to make video calls and see my loved ones on the screen so for me it is totally worth the extra money. The other basic features are improved as well, for example if you ask for the weather you get a visual with the information per day on the screen, the daily flash briefing now includes video, when you play music you get to see the lyrics. The new features such as YouTube and Amazon Video are pretty cool too. This device is in its early days, Amazon has invented a new category, don't buy this if you expect it to be a tablet that talks or to have "apps", this is still a devices intended to be use with your voice and offers visuals as a complement. Still some stuff needs to get better such as recipes, but from my previous experience with Amazon products, they improve fast, I choose to take advantage of the $100 off promotion and give it a shot!

author: Patricia A. Pounders
title: Fun !
content: It's cool ! Alexa has a hard time sometimes finding my radio station I like, but she'll get eventually. Love it, it's fun. My son has one too so we can talk to each other from our homes . Seeing each other too ! Technology! Love it

author: Snowshoe
title: Great addition to Echo family
content:
Love this. It is a great addition to my Echo lineup. The screen is a nice addition. I can watch videos while cooking! It is fun to see what Alexa suggests to hear or view.
As with all the echo family, this is a quick and easy setup. The quality of the picture is really good and Alexa responds well to most inquires.

author: Christopher G. Lassiter
title: Could be great - But struggles to get there.
content: The Show is a beautiful device with so much potential but it is quite dumb a lot of the time.  One of the biggest reasons I bought the Show was for youtube and Google has removed it from the device.  This may get worked out in time but it is very disappointing.  The video conferencing is awesome.  Camera quality is excellent.  The music service is $4/month and will play any song you want.  There are so many great features of this device but the lack of youtube hurts it and the voice command interface is cumbersome in many cases.  It can be updated so looking forward to the future updates.

author: Loves Line Dancing
title: I Love The Echo Show
content: I have a regular echo dot. But this is great. With the screen you can follow the words with songs. When you do the “question of the day”you can read on screen rather than trying to remember the question and answers. Seeing on screen everything is great. I have Ring doorbell. I can say “Alexa show me the front door”. Bingo, there I can see who is at the front door.  Course Ring does that too. But I have learned so many things this can do. You can link your calendar to it.  “Alexa, show me my calendar”.  And its on the screen. I havent tried watching any type movies etc. but I believe you can do that too.  Just received a few weeks ago, so still learning how fun this is. I’m not a cook, but understand you can read recipes etc.  its so much fun having the screen. Ive had no problems.  You can link your lights etc to it. Ive only set up living room lights

author: Iggy
title: ... old would be able to watch videos and have fun with it
content: all the youtube reviews show that it can play youtube and apparently it doesn't anymore which was one of my main reasons for purchasing so that my 2 year old would be able to watch videos and have fun with it. as an alarm clock which is why i purchased it . its ok if you like waking up to sound or a couple of pre-stored voice recordings which get annoying after a week. haven't found a way to wake up to music yet. if either of these things change i would rate higher but right now its just an expensive alarm clock

author: Seaotter
title: Great Closeout Value
content:
I resisted getting a show because of the high price and limited ability. But when I heard that the Gen1 Show's software had been updated to the Gen2's standard, and saw the the warehouse price was $99, it seemed like a great time to take the plunge.
The unit I received came in what appeared to be the original packing. It even came with the protective plastic film covers on it. I chose the "acceptable quality" selection, but I have not been able to find any sign of wear  or usage whatsoever. It certainly appears to be brand new.
Set up was simple, as usual, but after I got it set up I could not find a browser. I had to go back to settings to find out that it needed an update. Not a big deal, but I don't know if someone unfamiliar with Echo products would have known to do that. After a 15 minute update process the Show functioned perfectly. I was able to get my Hulu account set up on it, and my Pandora, Tune In, and other accounts from my other Echoes transferred seamlessly. Having used the Show Mode on my HD8 tablet quite a bit it didn't take long to figure things out.
A couple of oberservations:
- YouTube does work now, but it is not really integrated into the whole Echo universe. You can't do everything hands free. Having said that, it does work well. I would not have purchased a Show without the ability to use YouTube.
-having a browser is really nice. It functions just like any other browser. I was disappointed, but not surprised, when Crackle and some other steaming video services did not work, but with YouTube, Hulu, and Prime Video I don't think I will ever be without something to watch. The ability to look things up with the browser is great, and I am really glad that they included it.
- I have heard a lot of comments about how the Gen2 show sounds much better than the Gen1. If that's true, then the Gen2 must sound incredible, because the Gen1 sounds really good to me, as good  if not better than my Gen2 Echo.
- the 7 inch screen is fine. Of course I watch a lot of movies on my Fire Tab7, so I might not be a good judge. But the Show screen looked fine to me. I watched two movies on it in a row without any issues.
-the calling features are the same as on my tablet in show mode, which means they work well. I have bèen video chatting with my family via FB Messenger, and I am interested in seeing if it works better with the echos. I will update my review after getting more experience with it.
I know that this review is of limited interest, as the gen1 Shows are about gone. But if you have been on the fence about buying a Show, right now they are a great value at $99. So buy one. While you still can!

author: Pradeep Chunchu
title: Good but needs improvements
content: It’s a good product but needs a lot of improvements. These are the issues I’ve had: have to repeat many times to get the right searches, plays the wrong playlists/songs, very annoying to add/remove from playlist (have to say every single item on the list). The list goes on and on. I haven’t used it much for automation but plan on trying that out when I have the right products installed.

author: Skip Hunter
title: Smarter than a smart phone.  Literally so simple a 3 year old can use it.
content: Buy a pair -- real life changing video conversation which can be initiated by a three year old.  The other features are nice, but this voice controlled device is so much less complicated to use than a smart phone.

author: Jolie
title: Could be good, but...
content: Disappointed that this device Is not able to access youtube as of Dec 2017. I wasn’t aware of that when I purchased it. I’ve had problems with my device. The voice stops working throughout the day. I can see it trying to respond to me, because the window it opens contains the info I asked about, but it’s like the device gets stuck in the process. It stops working, and the blue bar just flashes. I keep having to unplug and restart the device. Once I do that, it starts working again. So irritating. This device could really be a great device if Google and Amazon would act like grownups...

author: John Leonard
title: i have 2 i use them for my arlo cameras ...
content: i have 2 i use them for my arlo cameras and my ring doorbell. you can also make video phone calls and use all the apps for alexa. having a video screen takes alexa to the next level.

author: Heather VanOpdorp
title: LOVE our Echo
content: We received this as a Christmas present and we love it! Our entire family uses the Echo Show everyday, for a variety of reasons, from weather to fun facts to jokes. In a multi-story house, you can talk to each other through the old Alexo Echo Dot and the Echo show. For the size of the speakers, the sound system is fantastic, and I use it to listen all through the house. HIGHLY recommend!

author: annie
title: best idea ever!!!
content: My daughter bought my husband and I the echo show so we could go on and speak to our grandkids. I listen to the radio on it while getting ready for  work. my husbands's works perfectly, I have had some problems with mine but amazon-Amber has helped problem solve.  The BEST use of this has been to speak with my mother. My mother speaks with her grandchildren and great-granchildren several times a week. She can see and hear them, they can hear and see her. The little ones can call her by themselves. Its easier that trying to hook up a computer, bigger than face time on a phone. The echo show can easily be moved from room to room as needed. As computer acess isn't needed, my mother has been able to listen to the radio, watch the oldie but goodie movies. We bought our son one so the whole family is now connected.  Thanks Amazon!

author: Matt S
title: I loved the Echo Show, when it worked.
content: I purchased the Echo Show and immediately fell in love with it. The device has a large database and offers a wide variety of music. It serves as a great alarm clock, and it will even wake you up to music! I would have given this device 5 stars; however, two months in, my device started to have problems. It began to make this weird audio *pop*. In the beginning, this inconvenience was unnoticeable, but, as time went on, the sound started to become unbearable. As of today, the device only serves as an alarm clock. Playing music is like nails against a chalkboard. Hopefully, the Google Home doesn’t have these problems.

author: Sheri Lee
title: Great product so many features...
content: I really like the show. Personalized the home image to one of my own pictures. I especially like the ability to call from room to room. I also like to "drop in on friends far away."(video calls to other Echo's and Smartphones). I originally planned to put the Echo Show in my home office but it is in the family room so I use it to settle family debates, video call friends and family and listen to the radio and music from my smartphone. It is linked to my Philips Hue lights so I can turn lights off/on through. It is part of my Echo family which includes the original Echo and Echo Dot, the Echo Show plus future plans to purchase the Echo Spot. I

author: Weedarkone
title: We have two other Amazon Shows that connect fine. This one--refuses to do so
content: Bought this to connect to my Amazon Cloud Cam. We have two other Amazon Shows that connect fine. This one--refuses to do so. It just refuses to see the camera. Same account--no rationale. Stupid.

author: Xhua
title: Initial thoughts
content:
Preordered 2 when they were announced. Overall it's a nice product. Much better speaker than the dot and nice and responsive touch screen. It's thicker than I thought it would be so fitting them on a small end table or night stand may create issues if you have other stuff like we do. For most people it's probably not worth the cost of around 3-4 echo dots. The dot does pretty much everything the show does (I had 6 dots) just no screen so while it's nice not really a need right now. The issue is unless friends and family also have the echo show you can't really use the video "drop in" feature that was a main featured selling point. Pains of being an early adopter I guess. I think with a few software tweaks it could and will be a lot more useful. Things like ringing your phone when you don't have the echo app open when someone calls from an echo device would be much more useful since I don't have echo app open usually. Also it would be great to be able to hang the device or having a removable camera so you can place it without having to move the whole unit around would allow you to use it as a baby monitor. Right now I don't know how you can as the camera is naturally positioned slightly upward due to the device being slightly tilted back when sitting on a flat surface. Anyways I'm sure it will get better but w/o that killer app/feature I would imagine that the dot which can do like 99% of the things that the show can for 1/4 the price is what most people will buy.

Lastly Amazon if you're reading please don't forget about Alexa like Apple did with Siri (that's hard for me to admit being a huge Apple guy). Don't rely too much on 3rd party apps as she needs to continuously improve so she doesn't end up being useless.

author: Dr DT
title: Not quite ready for syncing calendars.
content: The calendar sync with Outlook was the main reason we bought one. Unfortunately it was unable to sync in either direction with Outlook on my iPhone 7+.  The issue was escalated to the development team but have not received any update in a week so I returned the unit.  Maybe later when the sync issue is resolved I'll repurchase another one.

author: Joseph P.
title: Its smaller than I thought
content: Its a lot smaller than I expected.  (all of the pictures make it look nearly Ipad size to me and it is really more like alarm clock size.)  You have to install apps to get skills, to show specific things.  If I want to see a recipe I have to ask a recipe app to show me a recipe and if there is no recipe then you get nothing.  I wish I could just google with it.  I like being able to see the calendar and the events of the day.  I like being able to drop in on the camera at home and the teleconferencing works pretty well.  I bought it to work with arlo cameras though and was very disappointed at the speed of integration with arlo, it takes much longer to get arlo pictures of the front door than it does too walk and open the front door

author: Surgeonhawkeye
title: Loving it
content:
I got my ES 2 weeks ago.
It is bigger and heavier than other Echoes, and a little big for your bedroom table, but still it is there.
It is pretty esay to configurate, took me less than five minutes .
The sound is actually pretty good, nice quality speakers.It has few videos you can actually watch, and it is small to watch a movie, but good for quick news.
The calendar is good, also the weather report.
Has no aux output like the previus ones, only bt conection.

author: Skye Karmun
title: I bought it to be a hub for my smart home. It controls my Phillips Hue stuff great
content:
People told me i invited a spy from the government into my home when i bought this. I tell them they have a spy in their cell phone case.
I bought it to be a hub for my smart home. It controls my Phillips Hue stuff great. I havent been able to get it to connect with much else. It cant find my Nest thermostat and doesnt seem to have any funtionality with my new Sony tv.
Alexa is handy to have around. I use her to set timers and search the web all the time. You can tell her to add stuff to a  shopping list and it is also added to the Alexa app on your phone, which is great. Im still learning what it can do.
I think the Show is worth the purchase. A dot would have probably been sufficient for what i use this for, though.

author: Susan D.
title: Best Home device out of all of them.
content: I love this device!  I've had the Google Home (all versions) and this by far exceeded my expectations.  Although I had won this at a conference, it's a great deal for the price.  While it's not in use, it shows current events as a slideshow.  I use the amazon music (free edition) and have play lists I've created on my desktop computer.  To play them is easy.  Just say 'Alexa, play my rock playlist on shuffle' and it plays all your favorite songs.  I prime shop a lot and this device gives me order updates when I want.  All while I'm cooking dinner!  I definitely recommend.

author: Greatescape
title: Not up to par yet!
content:
This item needs major firmware upgrade...Whoever wrote this version must have just got out of programming school...The functionality of the Show is nowhere as robust as the Spot...1. Can't get the slideshow to work (and neighter could 3 techs at Amazon). 2. Can't disable the display night mode (so screen goes almost black with very dim digital clock on totally black background for about 12 hours at night). 3. After display night mode goes off all you have is a totally black screen with a nicely lit digital time showing - and it will stay like that all day long unless you manually change it to a picture but that won't stay on screen but a few minutes and then back to black screen) - if it were not for the little time display showing all day, my tv TURNED OFF looks as good!. 4. Can't change the clock style. Alexa works fine however and the one thing that I really wanted and will keep me from sending this back is the fact that it will show all of my Arlo cameras throughout the house perfectly...All contact with Amazon say they are referring these problems to their development team to seek resolution so until these issues are addressed properly, the rating stays the same...Just in  case you are wondering if I have a habit of giving bad reviews, this is the first time I have ever given a bad review for any AMAZON branded product and I average 160 order from Amazon every 6 months and been a customer since 2003.The Echo Spot, which I have ordered 2 since getting the Show, is so much more functional than the Show and much better looking...nice clock backgrounds and the backgrounds will rotate and show current weather in your town, and reminers you have set...just cannot believe the Show, as a supposedly upscale product, lacks at least a decent looking all-time on screen. Perhaps some of you have found a way to get around some or all of these problems but I have not nor have the techs at Amazon that I have talked to.
I will gladly upgrade this review if and when it is deemed necessary as I am a VERY loyal Amazon customer and would not know what to do if something ever happened to them...

author: Julia Ann
title: Did not last.
content: My echo is not yet a year old and it has lines running through the screen. I emailed Amazon about it and they never responded back.

author: L. Dill
title: Didn't realize how useful this was until I'd owned it, and now have multiple Alexa devices around the home.
content: This was a gift that I would not have normally bought for myself, but after a couple weeks, my wife and I have enjoyed it so much, and found it so useful that we have since purchased two additional Alexa devices so that we can have access to Amazon services at multiple locations around the house. Admittedly, I use it mostly for music streaming, and news and weather updates, but since I work from home I use it for hours at a time. I really enjoy streaming music channels without advertisement and voice interruptions that I would normally deal with from the radio. I am also impressed with how readily Alexa recognizes my and my wife's voices. This is the smoothest voice recognition device that I've ever worked with, having given up on several others in the recent past. My wife uses it for music streaming, but also for word definitions and data look-ups while she is doing research and paperwork. ... In short, this is one of those devices that I didn't realize how useful it was till I owned one and had put it to use.

author: Garry Christensen
title: Great echo with a video screen
content: This is our second echo show.  We have a home in Mexico and one in the USA.  Now when one of us is in the other home we can easily stay in touch and see each other.  We can also drop in on the houses when we aren’t there to check on them.  We use it to turn on and off the lights and security systems in both homes.  We also have echo dots in various rooms.  We love all this technology!  We ask her many questions and she plays music for us.

author: Kenneth Young
title: See just about anything!
content: I have 3 Echo dots and an Echo plus so I kinda knew what to expect with getting another Echo device. The Echo Show on the other hand is pretty cool. It not only tells you the answer to whatever your asking but it also shows you. Weather it’s you morning briefing, the weather, a video, or even a movie preview. It’s far more interesting than I think people give it credit for!

author: dad of 4
title: Way better than expected.
content: I wasn’t sure if I needed this. I own several echos and dots throughout my house. It went on sale and I wanted to try it. To my surprise I love it. I can use it as a digital picture frame, it shows lyrics to the song playing and has a bunch of other features and the speaker is pretty good. Way better than a dot and close to an echo.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazon lost the leading edge.
content:
I had expected more features that utilise the screen. I am especially dissapointed that the video call feature does not work worldwide and not across marketplaces.
I got the devices for just 148$, but I still returned all 3 of them.

author: phorton58
title: Very good - potential to be great with software updates.
content:
Has the potential to be great!  Pretty good right now.

Voice by itself can only do so much, a picture is worth a thousand words.  The combination will likely be the best mid term solution until VR / AR comes along.

Industrial design is not going to impress, and certainly not anything like Apple quality - but it gets the job done and with future updates I expect this to be a long term winner.

author: Cicely
title: My Kitchen companion
content: I am obsessed with the echo's but Echo Show is my favorite! I can pull up recipes as I'm cooking. I can watch videos or listen to music while I wait for my meal, and I can take calls/texts while cooking. I love this thing! ❤️

author: Nick Pupp
title: What an amazingly impressive echo device
content: Absolutely love this device! I've had the echo dots for a while but it's so nice to have the show. Not only is it a beautiful device to catch a visitor's eyes, but it's an enhanced experience each and every time you ask Alexa something. To have the visual aspect accompany the already impressive voice assistant, the echo show is easily the "next best thing". The sound quality is that of a typical sound tower and produces crisp overall sound and a decent amount of bass even. It's nice to not have to hook it up to a Bluetooth speaker to be able to enjoy music.

author: DJW
title: It's the Model T of A.I.
content: Had this for a few months now. I'd hoped that the "APs" that it promised would be coming along a lot faster and better than they have. I get the idea that having a window to "artificial intelligence" could be a nice home feature (works for Iron Man), but this is more like buying the first Model T in the neighborhood; cool tech with a lot of maturity needed before it fulfills its promise. Amazon should have taken their time before tying their name to most of the "skills" out there, they don't really work very well, are often just frustrating to deal with. One thing that Apple always did well was to be careful about who they let share their name, something Amazon should consider. They need to vet their skills list rather than take the blame when they don't work well which is what's happening. Amazon really needs to spin this whole AI off to another platform or risk falling behind their other "super server" competitors.  An "Alexa" home site of it's own, outside the Amazon home shopping network is where to start. I would still rather have the Model T over a horse, but that's not the issue Amazon, there are going to be a lot more options than the Model T soon. If you fail to "capital-"ize on the A.I. revolution, you will have missed the 4th (and final?) phase of the industrial revolution.

author: Chuck
title: If you want one of these things, wait till they get all the bugs worked out
content:
I know it is new, but I don't see the point of having this. It doesn't really add features (other than the "look at the new toy I have") It actually works worse than the original echo.
Example: Listening to a playlist on Spotify. In the past I could say "next song" and it skips. The Echo show has no idea what to do with that command.
or
It constantly scrolls thru news feeds on the screen. One of the items interested me, but all I could do is ask Alexa for top stories, then use the touch screen so it could have issues displaying the article. I had to use a laptop if I wanted to know more.
or
I have one on my bedside table. The screen is bright, and I know there is a command to make it go black. When I say "Alex screen off," it asks for which device I want, and I have it named "Master Show". It says it can't find that device.

If you want one of these, look hard at if you are good with a regular echo. The cost is more than an echo, but the speakers are worse.

author: Blanca
title: the best toy i have ever bought
content: the best toy i have ever bought, i see and talk to my long distance parents on my echo, i look tru my ring doorbell cam and backyard cam whenever i want to, and i am addicted to the news on my device plus i raise the heat on my thermostat by asking alexa. its a toy a great toy. blanca

author: Amazon Customer
title: Extreemly disapointed in Amazon Show
content:
I just got the show tonight, I was hoping for a mounted version fo my Fire 7 tablet with additional features. Nope! nothing of the sort. You will still need a tablet to make the show work because you do not have full menu settings even with the touchscreen. I think you are better served with a fire tablet that this thing. Want to use this a photos frame? only with prime photo, but you cannot manage any of the photos on the show. Want to watch Amazon video well only if you know exactly what you want, there are no menus. Want to shop with Amazon sure if you know exactly what you want you can put it in your cart. By the way, if you want the cool UK accent no shopping for you. want to open a web browser? Nope. Want to load any apps like Netflix? nope, you can load some tv provider options with the Alexa app and your tablet.

save your money and sanity just get a tablet.

author: Nick Rutgers
title: THIS THING IS AWSOME!!
content: I originally had the echo’s and they were cool but didn’t take full advantage of them(to be honest they got used for a couple months and set aside) I got the echo show for Christmas and now all the echos are plugged in around the house. I absolutely LOVE THIS THING! It does everything. The drop in is cool I just need my siblings to get either the show or dot so our kids can drop in and talk to each other. (You have to personally allow drop in for each contact so you don’t have to worry about people just dropping it. Kinda like locking your front door) I set my alarm when we go to bed by just telling Alexa to do it, next project is to slowly start switching the light switches throughout the house to Alexa ones..amazon needs to get on the ball with packs of 5 or 10 for this!!! I enabled my local news as a skill so now I see a quick 5 minute video of what I need to know. My 5 year old daughter now can say “alexa call daddy” and we are face to face wherever I’m at! It’s worth the money. I wanna get the echo spot next for bed side nightstand. “Alexa wake me up to pandora radio at 6am” Spotify, xm radio., iHeartRadio whatever you want. I’m learning new stuff to make Alexa do everyday. Best gift ever!

author: cdburns123
title: SO Glad we have two
content: Working out of town, this was great to have.  Get to see and talk to the kids and wife with all the added Alexa benefits.  Use for cooking, music, weather, news...etc.  Great device.

author: Shan A. Greer
title: No You Tube = No Joy
content:
5-star Device until Youtube was pulled.  1-Star now.  Amazon is being ridiculous here.  They will not sell Google Devices on their store and they recently started pulling Nest Devices off.  When I shop, I expect a store to provide a full set of options.  My grocery stores carry other brands than their own, that is what I expect from Amazon.  Start selling Google devices and let your products speak for themself.  Don't increase your sales by limited the competition.  That is how monopolies are formed and the DOJ comes knocking.

Work with Google to get Youtube back and start selling Google products.

author: Don C.
title: Nice hardware but software is lacking
content:
The device itself is pretty nice.  Nice bright screen, and audio quality is better than I expected.  This has a lot of potential, but I find the current software implementation to be very lacking.  You can't talk naturally to it unless what you want to do is in the small set of commands it understands.

For example, "alexa show me a calendar for june" ought to show me a calendar on the screen.  Hardly an unreasonable request,  but it doesn't know how to do that without installing a 3rd party "skill" and then I have to remember to say some unintuitive or tongue twisting prefix phrase first ("ask foo bar to show me ...").  I should be able to create custom phrases as aliases for these cumbersome phrases.

I'm especially disappointed with the Ring doorbell and camera integration, particularly as Amazon now owns Ring.  The Ring "skill" should be a shining example of what Alexa can do; instead it's an example of a "skill" that's rated by almost everyone as 1 star for its inability to do much of anything. You'd expect a skill that connects to an electronic doorbell to notify you when someone rings the bell or motion is detected.  Alexa's Ring skill does neither.  You can view a live feed and nothing else.

The Google calendar integration is also lame.  It will show events, but not tasks.  Why?  There's a bunch of third party task skills, but none of them integrate with Google tasks and require you to use their own task system.  Meh.

Another irritation is that you can't customize the main screen. other than choosing the background.  Why can't I see the next few entries in my calendar on the main screen?  You see what Amazon wants you to see, and nothing else.  I could write my own skill of course, but at the moment Alexa won't show you anything without you asking for it.

I'm keeping this because the software can be improved, and hopefully it will be.  This could turn out to be a very useful device, if Amazon brings the software up to par with the hardware.

author: King
title: Great technology for the elderly
content: I bought two on Prime day with the hope that my 83 year old Mom would find some use in it. I was amazed how simple it was for her to use! Definitely benefits older folks with the big screen. We now video call regularly and she is very accustomed to asking Alexa cooking questions, schedule g reminders, and anything else she can think of. Exceeded all of my expectations!

author: Rick
title: Wait till this product improves.
content: I know this product just came out but, I dont think now is the time to buy it. Wait until Amazon improves its capability. It has a touchscreen but no internet browsing feature. No youtube. It requires constant touchscreen interaction. You cannot place the unit out of arms reach and expect it to navigate with just voice commands. This applies to almost everything. For example,if you ask to see a video that Amazon doesnt control, it will take you to a website that Amazon approves of (other than Youtube) and you will be presented with an ad before you can see the video. We are all used to this, but the button that allows you to skip the ad if your not interested after 5 seconds must be manually pushed or the entire ad will play, and sometimes the video will not start after the ad. As I said, because of this constant need for touchscreen input, it must be within arms reach to complete even the simplest request. On a phone, if you make a voice request to Siri or Google, you will be taken to the web and shown relevant pages to complete your inquiry. Not with this unit,since there is no web browser you get what Amazon determines you want or nothing at all. Also, some results are ad driven, pointing toward things to purchase. The product is just ok at the time of this review. If it was more like the Fire Tablet I would definitely recommend it and give it 5 stars.

author: Richard Roberts
title: Random shout outs without provocation
content: I starts talking without provocation, 3:00AM outburst scare the hell out me ..... also the screen saver asks for me to ask Alexa a question , I ask and then Alexa says “ I don’t understand that request!”

author: Jesse Lara
title: Best of the Echo family, but they're all great!
content: So far, this device is so awesome! The screen plays video in super HD quality. It not only has all capabilities of the echo family, but it can also double as a Bluetooth pairing speaker! With Echo getting new skills and updating every so often, this is already a great device set to only get better from here. Got this as a gift for Christmas, and I couldn't be happier.

author: Maryland Reader
title: Absolutely Awesome
content: This is without a doubt the most amazing little gadget I have. I already own the first generation of "Alexa" and Echo Dot....so when this came out, was a no brainier for me. I love everything about it...video calls, music, movies, shopping, recipes; etc. The list goes on and on. The sound is outstanding. I have watched movie trailers, shopped. Used video calls, and to think this is right on my kitchen counter and works amazingly. Was so easy to set up too. Can't wait to see the updates and the different things she may do it the future....thank you Amazon for creating such wonderful devises for the home...I will "stay tuned" for the future of Alexa....will most likely buy these for my children for Christmas too....absolutely love it...

author: Roger F.
title: Awesome!
content:
Bought it on sale and - I am very happy!  Turns my coffee on in the morning without getting out of bed!
So, I have a hot cup waiting for me to start my day.
Plays my music playlist by just saying example Alexa play my modern rock playlist.

author: Amazon Customer
title: So disappointed in this product.
content: So disappointed in this product. 1st one start pixelating in 45 days. I was sent a new one....new one is now 6 months old and it to is pixelating....

author: PJ
title: Will not be getting an immediate replacement.
content: Quit working two weeks after purchase. Amazon requires I ship this one back to be tested before they will ship me a replacement. I am not pleased with this process. Was under the impression they would send a replacement and I would use that shipping box to ship back the non functioning echo show. Disappointed.

author: S D
title: This is the second Show I’ve bought, they’re that good!
content: I bought my first Show for my nightstand to use in place of a clock. Then I started listening to music on it and then started reading news on it. My wife started looking up recipes on it and “stole” it for her kitchen. She loved it! It really is all its advertised to be and will add a level of convenience to your life that you won’t want give up...

author: Goldviper
title: What a great unit.
content: I ordered the 2 pack.  Sent one to NH and I have one in AZ.  Lots of fun for the family.  Have already used a recipe.

author: MS in SC
title: This COULD be a great device but there is one HUGE flaw
content:
This COULD be a great device but there is one HUGE flaw. You can adjust all settings to avoid trending topics, upcoming events, etc. But there is no way to turn off "suggestions" such as "Try..."!  I don't get it. I already bought it, why bug me about trying what I don't want to try.

Try again Amazon.  Fix this.

Still trying to decide whether to return this or not.

author: Pen enthusiast
title: Buy it
content:
Amazon has created something amazing. I have two dots and now the show. Works flawlessly. Gives me news briefings, music, answers to questions, video, security views of the house both inside and out. A lot more as well.

The entire echo line is a work of genius.

author: Wilson
title: it sits on my kitchen island but would be nice if there was a battery to move the show ...
content:
I wrote about how the Echo Show wouldn’t connect with other Echo devices and play music with the rest of the Echo devices I own. Recently the shows updated to allow this. Amazon saw my first review and sent that it’s a device that can integrate with other Echo’s. Neat.

Portability isn’t that big a deal, it sits on my kitchen island but would be nice if there was a battery to move the show around the house.

author: Dallas
title: Command word can change Alexa answer.
content:
Like that the screen has information scrolling through even when you are not asking for anything.
Speakers only face one direction. I replaced my Echo with the Show on a center island so the sound isn't as uniform as before.
Would be nice to have a list of commands Alexa responds to for accessing info - Do I use-  what is? or show me? or get? or play?. These are things you need to figure out as you try to find answers to your search/question.

author: Fiesty
title: Third time is the Charm
content: I have the echo dot, amazon echo and the echo show.  I love the echo show.  unlike the dot and the echo, I do not have to yell at the echo show.  Alexa hears me just fine, from across the room or while my music is playing.  unlike the dot and the echo, the edcho show plays  my music without a hitch.  not once has alexa given me, "there's no music in your libriary."  and for a person who loves music but is hard of hearing, seeing the lyrics of a song is so helpful. My only complaint with the eco show is that when you are playing music and you ask her to, say, "show me my timer(s)."  unlike with the others, she doesn't pause the music.  she talks while the music is still playing.  rather irritating.  hopefully amazon will come out with an update to correct this.

author: G F Long
title: I love my Echos and this one has a screen
content: I love my Echos and this one has a screen.  I use mine all the time and still barely scratch the surface of it's capabilities which are continually being expanded.  Friends always play with it when they come by.  I know at least two subsequently bought their own after using mine... they ordered while still at my place.

author: Kari
title: Nice sound, helpful.
content: I like it. We all enjoy listening to the music with it. The sound is loud and pretty impressive really.  My only real complaint is that I very much wanted to watch YouTube videos on it and you no longer can. I feel like I was hoodwinked because it was available when I bought it. The drop in feature is really cool.  At first I thought it was creepy but you only let certain people drop in, like my wife and I drop in on each other and all they see is a blurry screen at first so if you need to throw a shirt on or something you can. Or you can reject it. It feels sort of futuristic and I sort of want another one for upstairs so we can drop in on each other within the same house.  The only thing keeping me from getting another one is having to pay $4 more dollars a month for the music. It adds up.

author: Florida Buyer
title: Fun new gadget!
content: One of the best purchases I've made.  I love being able to ask Alexa things and getting answers.  Some things she just can't understand, but you can try to word it differently or look it up another way.  I'm still on a learning curve, but ultimately, I am very happy with my Echo Show.

author: John L. Weed
title: Fundamentally flawed device
content: There's very few positive things that can be said about this device. My guess this is the reason Amazon has discontinued production. Very few things it can do and huge list of what it cannot do. I am very disappointed in my purchase and no longer in the return window except for the fact I purchased with American Express card so they can deal Amazon lack of response to a flawed piece of equipment.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It's great for keeping tabs on an older adult.
content: I use the Echo Show for communicating with my husband, who has dementia and mobility problems, who is in an assisted living facility.  I have an Echo Show at home for me (which wouldn't be necessary because I can also connect to his Echo Show with my iPhone), but I love using the Echo Show at my home for this because it doesn't need me to hold it, and I can pick up the cat or dog to show him, and he really enjoys that.  I'm a grandma of 12, and I was able to set it up myself and found it to be quite easy to do.  I love the Echo Show, and so does my husband.  He is'n't able to play or tune the radio to the broadcasts he enjoys or play the music he likes, and I can do that for him from home through my Echo Show.  I just ask Alexa to play, for example, big band music on his Echo Show, and it plays on his Echo Show at the assisted living facility.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazon Flicker Show
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player Here is what my new echo show looks like.  Amazon says they are still looking for a fix and returning it wouldn’t be a good option because chances are the next one will do the same thing.  Adding video.

author: Bruce sullivan
title: Doesn’t really seem like the solution to getting a new unit justified the ...
