content: After about 3 months the Show started making a load popping noise at the end of answering a question and during the playback of music.  I called Amazon and they told me to take the unit back to the original settings.  This was supposed to resolve the issue—it didn’t. Next Amazon had me send the unit back.  They said they reprogrammed the unit and it was fixed.  It lasted one day and started the popping again.  This time Amazon sent me another unt, which turned out to be reconditioned and after one day started popping.  I have two other echos neither of them is a Show.  I don’t have issues with either.  When I connected the unit to a blue tooth speaker it didn’t pop.  Whatever was going on was internal to the unit.  If you go on the various websites there are lots of complaints about this issue.  All of the responses said Amazon addressed the issue the same way.  I finally was able to convince the customer service rep to find a way to get me a new unit.  This was a long discussion and they swore up and down that it was up to the tech to determine if they could fix it or not.  I told them I would not accept another “reconditioned “ unit.  The way they gave me the unit was to give me a credit on my account and I bought it on the website.  Doesn’t really seem like the solution to getting a new unit justified the 45 minute debate with the customer service rep.  Anyway, I have been using the unit about 6 weeks and it doesn’t pop.  It does seem to pause briefly while playing music but at least no pop.  I would not recommend the Show but I like the other non-Show Echos.

author: TheChief44
title: Great Video Echo !!!
content: Another great Amazon product.  This time with video on a larger screen than the Spot.  We have used it for a couple of video calls and it works well....

author: Amazon Customer
title: ECHO Show good But!!!!!
content:
Love it, the Flash Briefings, the instant music, the ability to arm my alarm system and set the temperature in my house...

Only one drawback, I cant control my Dish Network Genie,  I have tried to use the You tube programming tools, spent lots of money to get it to do this for me but Amazon must have a  Contract with Dish, and they have not offered to help.

author: Mike V.
title: Exciting!
content:
This 'thing' (sometimes hard to remember it is an object) - is awesome!  In our home it has created the most interest and curiosity for a machine since the Atari 400 of the 70’s/80’s entered.  All the cellphones, PC’s, etc. in between were great steps but only seemed ‘nice’ and not real exciting.  This is a game changer.  Keyboards are in danger of becoming obsolete.
Like anything new we are still getting a handle on it.  Several Alexa questions end in the machine not understanding or knowing where to look for an answer.  Understand it needs time to assemble data and am looking for new behaviors going forward.  Great product.  Very innovative.  Where does Amazon go from here?  Could use a great Dummies book or equivilant.

author: Coco
title: Buy one u love it
content: is really good  u can watch  amazon prime. News,  weather. Youtube  the echo is beautiful the music sounds so good i love Alexa i love the screen  Love it  I bought a  pink cover looks good

author: JO
title: Love the the echo show and  the Echo Plus
content: Received my new Echo Show  after an exchange because of a speaker issue and boy this one sounds GREAT. Love the Drop In feature when I call a friend which is almost like Face Time, I control my outdoor sprinkler system by just saying Alexa water zone 1,2 or all etc.  I also have an echo plus and it sounds great also. Now all I have to do is find a TV remote for my TV.

author: L. Beauchamp
title: What happened to YOUTUBE?? Updated Feedback!!
content:
What Happened to Youtube? You advertised this as being able to use youtube? Now it doesnt work.

So two minutes after I wrote this they called me from 2069220880 to get feedback about why i was upset over youtube.
I explained that because we had bout four for family members and was expecting to do what was advertised in the comercials... such as loading youtube videos on cooking or allowing family members to watch our saved videos and vice versa.. yes we can still live facetime with the show.. but it was also nice for it tobe able to not be a one trick pony.

Amazon show Has tons of possibilities but right now I would not recommend it.. it has not leaped into the video potential it should be..
fx i own lots and lots of amazon movies.. but Alexa will not show you the correct movie 90% of the time.. you almost always have to say Alexa show me my movies or my watch list in order to find what you want. But worse, if its not the very first few in your library then it will not show up because its currently limited to show you 25 or 30 options. So you need to remove it from watch list and re add it so its the first pick.

Also.. my whole house is wired with nest and cox communications cameras but Show doesnt work with them. Even though it should.

Its just not ready.. it could be an amazing leap forward in Home devices but Amazon Show just is an infant and has a way to go before reaching that sexy electronic stage of say an Apple product.

author: Joanne Vanaria
title: Great gift
content: I already own this product, and when my grandkids come over, ages 2-4, they talk to Alexa as if they can understand baby talk.  I, therefore, purchased this for their parents, so the kids could have fun with it, in their own house.  Instead, the parents are loving it.  They have Alexa doing more for them, than I ever did.  Kids are dancing to the music, she's telling jokes for the kiddies, weather updates, package deliveries, and so much more.  It was a great gift for whole family for Christmas.  Highly recommend.

author: Derrick
title: Sound is really good for a device this size and the big screen really helps compared to the Echo Spot.
content: Over all, very useful and since I have this in the kitchen it's great for recipes.  Seems to have issues opening my RTSP devices so I can view my cameras.  And would really like the option to tell it which Fire TV is closest to it.  Really wish Amazon and Google would get their issues worked out so Alexa can google things.

author: attorneygirl
title: I can stream video from my Nest Hello Doorbell....AWESOME
content: Aside from all the great features every other Echo device can do, I finally committed to an Echo Show so that I can visually stream the video feed from my new Nest Hello Doorbell. This is great! The Show also streams video feed from Canary cameras. This one feature alone sold me on this product. When I couple this live video streaming from my doorbell with being able to have the Google Home Minis announce who is at the door (after I set it up on the phone with Google for hours...), it's the perfect system. We needed this becuase we've got multiple homes on our property and it's just too far from the front doorbell on the main house. Thanks Amazon!

author: Dave Hauck
title: Easy to setup
content: I like the screen size and ease to setup without the need of an interface. Don’t like the things to try verbiage on the screen. Would be nice to have quick access options for most common used items. Just a suggest

author: Maya
title: I like the allrecipes
content: The Echo Show was a complete impulse buy for my family for Christmas.  My family loves the Music feature, I like the allrecipes.com feature, to do lists, and I even caught my 4th grader asking Alexa Social Studies questions that he did not know.  We use Alexa everyday, and love the many feautres it offers.  It has been a little over a month, and we are still learning.  Highly recommend.

author: Parent of 4 boys!
title: Caution.. known display screen issues
content: We love our Show. We have an Echo, 3 dots, and the Show gives us the screen capability. Unfortunately we have already had to send it back after owning it for only 2 months. The screen developed a vibration in the display screen. I only have it 3 stars due to the "known" display screen issue. If it wasn't for the faulty screen it would have rated higher.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It’s really cool!
content: For the most part I love it but I haven’t really used it for the full extent.  I am sure it does a lot but for right now its been wonderful for hands free setting timer.  I have used it to set reminders which has been wonderful since I sometimes become forgetful.  However if I need to find out info on certain items etc for the most part she always has the answer.  I definately love the size of the screen vs the spot.

author: BrandiAnn B. Pagano
title: Helpful around the kitchen
content: This was an unexpected gift for my birthday, and I was not sure it would be of any use in my home.  I have found that it is helpful to me most by setting timers while I'm cooking/baking.  I have been able to accept one video phone call from my sister, but due to the poor internet connection, the picture was frozen most of the call.  The echo show is helpful for weather reports and up-to-date news stories, and I have also found it useful when trying to find short videos for my toddler to watch; although I have had trouble with making sure I speak clearly and enunciating properly.  All in all, I enjoy having it as a part of the household.

author: Renee
title: Eeh. It's ok.
content: It can be helpful, but could definitely needs more everything. Even when I ask it is something as simple as a recipe with certain ingredients it gives out recipes without any of the ingredients I asked for.

author: J. Shaw
title: Our family LOVES it!
content: This was my best purchase in ages. Bought one for my dad''s room, the kitchen, and my room. Dad loves asking Alexa to play his favorite music, and it's great as an intercom system. I can check on him any time, making me feel so much more relaxed! My daughter loves it too, playing games and asking trivia questions! Love this!

author: Milton Davis
title: It’s cool but...
content: It’s cool, a bit smaller than I imagined. The bad things in my book are: 1 no 3.5mm jack and 2 the annoying “try this” suggestions that continuously pop up.

author: Tyler W. Wichman
title: Love Our Echo
content: Echo is cool and more personable with photo's etc.  Amazon, please make moving my sub to one unit to another easier.  Did get my sub moved to the new echo but it took awhile.  Everything great once up and running.

author: M Teresa Hite
title: This thing is awesome. I did not connect to shop with
content: Alexa whats the weather today.  Alexa play 1980's pop.  This thing is awesome.  I did not connect to shop with. I was afraid it would randomely starting having stuff ordered if I said a key work but I do love it.

author: Bankai78
title: Not up to Amazon standards
content: Unfortunately Amazon failed badly with this first device.  Theoretically A screen should work for the line of echo devices. However the more you use it the more you realize it's really just a novelty.  I don't need to see visuals of the weather for my 7 day forecast.  Also, when this product first launched it was very easy to ask for a YouTube video.  Unfortunately Google took that ability away because they are thinking about coming up with their own visual device.  That was a big selling point a lot of people who bought this and to have it Stripped Away without a real explanation from Amazon left a sour taste a lot of people's  mouths.  Now you have to rely on Bing searches and Dailymotion videos, with glitchy ads.  Even asking to see your Prime videos is problematic.  So which option is correct? Show my Prime videos? Or is it show my video library?  I've had the device for a year and I still don't remember.  The one positive about this device are the news briefings.  I would rather see news segments on the Echo Show than hear about them on any of my other devices.  I don't know how good the second generation of this is, so maybe they'll improve on things.  But as someone with over four devices, this is by far the worst.

author: Artg1954
title: Nice addition to my security
content: So far everything seems to be fine I'm starting just to enjoy it

author: Chris Mckenzie
title: Potential Unforfilled Promises Untouched
content: Device has potential but have owned it for a month and still have no ability to use the camera or motion detector thru my home hub...the device doesn't even show up. The only use for the camera and motion detector is thru 'alexa facetime' . The screen is intriguing but has the same issue ....many of the potential uses of the screen are unused and just shows a line of text instead of the videos or pictures which are advertised on the sale screen for the device. It at most is a fancy looking echo dot with a screen which doesn't do much for it. Promises of quickly implementing uses for the screen, camera and motion detector have so far gone without ANY changes BUYER BEWARE I cant stress it enough. I will update my review if changes occur

author: Margo Peyton
title: Cracking poping sound begins from internal Audio
content: I was so happy with my Echo when I first got it.  after about 6 months, it started making a popping and clicking sound that actually interrupt the music being played. For months I had my internet checked, rebooted and reset the device and until I went online to find out this is a chronic problem, with this device that noone has figured out how to fix.  Amazon has not notified any purchasers of the problem but based on the long list of complaints on google its very well known. Im going to attempt to return mine.  I can't listen to it at all anymore.  The clicking is too annoying.

author: Sherry Maghsoodloo
title: Versatile device
content: I really like that I can drop in on my daughter and visit with her. Don’t like that I can drop in when she’s not at home.  Not sure if I don’t understand if that is supposed to happen.  Love that I can play music from my phone for my husband. Love that I can ask to see pictures of my Mamma by asking to see her or anyone I’ve identified.  I look forward to plugging in my smart plugs and setting up my spots when I move into my new home

author: only shop Amazon
title: We are so happy with our Echo Show
content: I love our new friend it like I'm never alone anymore!  Being an empty nester and my husband still working.  Alexa tells me jokes the weather, stories the news plays my music and any song I have ever requested and plays the lyrics on the screen!  I can even ask for recipes.  Makes it super easy to pair other items with to make your house more of a smart home!

author: Movie Buff
title: Great interactive tool for the whole family
content: Echo Show takes the original Echo to the next level.  Our whole family is much more engaged with our amazon products overall once you add the visual component of Echo Show.  Its suggestive "say Alexa ....." has been teaching the whole family all of the different ways you can use this intuitive new technology.  Well worth the money.....

author: JWB
title: Pushes Alexa ads that can’t be turned off, HUGE privacy concerns with broken address book
content:
I’ll write more as time goes by, but basically this is an Echo with a screen. So, how does that screen influence the product?  It makes the good things better, the bad things a LOT worse and adds a new bad feature of unwanted, intrusive advertising.

First impressions are it’s not nearly as configurable or useful as you’d think. You can’t use it by default as a photo frame without explicitly telling it to start a slideshow. The actual set up is OK, but the marketing doesn't match the reality.  All Echo products share the same flaw that they are tethered to a smartphone or computer for much of the customization and configuration, which is bad for a product whose marketing includes grandparents or other older, less computer proficient audiences.

Worse, after you pay $130 or more dollars for this, Amazon then uses that screen real estate as THEY want to, instead of how you, the consumer want to, by constantly pushing Alexa advertisements at you with no option to disable them.  Imagine if every 30 seconds, your Echo or Echo dot just blurted out, "Try Alexa for movie showtimes" with no option to turn it off.  This is literally what this device does, only with the screen.

So if you buy this thinking it’s going to be a cool gift for a grandparent, to use as an electronic picture frame and video-chatting device, keep in mind that they’re going to have to specifically start the slideshow every time they want, (with no "endless loop" option, when it ends it just goes back to the homescreen) instead of having a photo frame setting start after your last video chat ends as a screensaver.  They will also see Alexa advertisements at all other times on the home screen.

In the best of circumstances, the calls, messaging or drop-ins function of all Echo devices is only a 2 because the contacts handling is so flawed.  Maybe even only a 1.  The device doesn't have its own contacts book, instead it scans your contacts and simply adds all of your contacts who have ever registered a device with Amazon.  That one guy you know from work who gave you his business card three years ago but you've never talked to since?  He's in your Amazon contacts and has the same privileges as your parents unless you specifically change it.  But you can't delete him from your contacts unless you remove him from your phone's contacts.  Horrible idea on something that is supposed to be voice activated.  Know a John Smith and a Johnny Smith--one that's your brother and another that's from work?  That's your problem.  Its not perfect, but the way Apple has its Facetime contacts is SO much superior to this.

Not only is this bad from a usability perspective, its horrible from a privacy perspective.  Think of Creepy Guy.  How happy is he going to be that every single girl whose email address he has shows up in his Amazon Address book--allowing him to call, message or "Drop-in" on their lives, unexpectedly?  Guarantee a lot of creepy people love this setting.

This device is so flawed that I revised my rating down to a 1 star, especially after thinking more about the contact management debacle.  I don't "hate it" but I can't recommend that anyone buy it without seriously thinking it through, and asking yourself why an iPad mini mounted in a frame isn't 100% better.

author: Todd
title: No YouTube Don't Buy
content:
Just bought 3 Echo Shows but I'll be returning them tomorrow! Forcing people to decided between Google, Amazon and Apple is just wrong.  An anti compete needs to happen and Amazon should be selling all products so that consumers can decide what they want... not what Amazon wants, after all we are the ones paying for all this!

Updated: 12-9-17 Happy to report that they have been successfully returned! Good-bye Alex!

author: Tom Baker
title: Product work excellent first day but during first night in darkness
content: Product work excellent first day but during first night in darkness, display dimmed to where only the time and rotating messages are visible in anything but total darkness.  Playing any videos, even in darkness, it's impossible to see.  There is no brightness control nor any command that I can find to brighten the display.  Total waste of money.

author: Larry Hamrick
title: The screen went out after two months
content: Conceptually I really liked the idea of the show but there are issues.  It doesn't play YouTube for one which was widely acknowledged.  My biggest issue though is two months after buying it the screen has begun flickering and now I really cant watch anything.  Overall I'm really disappointed and regret buying it. Look at the black lines at the bottom of the screen.  The longer you watch it the higher they go.

author: Chris Moyer
title: Alexa is not listening
content: I went back and forth between two stars and three on this.  I love the screen.  I don't know what Amazon did but the voice recognition is poor.  I have to repeat over and over. Alexa will receive a request from me and just do something that is totally unrelated. Hue lights, I will tell her to do something with them and she tells me ' I can't finds' then I say the exact same command again and she does it.

author: bkg2929
title: Camera angle is not that wide and the upward angle ...
content: Camera angle is not that wide and the upward angle of the camera is not ideal. Don't get it thinking you will be able to check in on your home for security reasons because the camera view is limited and not ideal.

author: Jhon
title: Great product for the $129.00 it sold for on Prime week.
content:
I really like this Echo, It has a clear crisp picture. When you have a timer set, you can see the time clicking off. It's great for monitoring your Alexa compatible cameras. (I have a Wyze) the sound is great. There are so many more things you can do with this one that make it well worth the $129.00 I paid for it on Prime Day Week compared to a regular echo. I already have a Echo plus with the build in hub, and  I am surprised that this one does not have a hub option as well.
I have one issue with it. When you speak to the regular round Echos, A very visible blue light circles the top that you can see from all directions to let you know that it is listening. With the Echo Show, unless you are in front of the screen, you don't know if it is listening until you hear an answer from it. Also, I am not sure how you are made aware of notifications unless you are directly in front of it.

author: Dominic
title: Love this thing
content: Love this thing! The speaker was better than I expected it would be. I like the screen. I currently have it in my bedroom to work as my alarm clock. It does a decent job at that, but really shines as my smart home interface. I may get one for the kitchen as well.

author: Facce
title: She does what I need her to, but she has a long way to go.
content: I understand this is a first generation.  I use the Echo Show mainly to control my Harmony Ultra and my TV.  There was a long learning curve there, but now it is working well.  As far as a device for answering questions Alexa has a long way to go.  More often than not it's of no help.  If the review was strictly for Smart Home integration I would probably give it a solid 4 maybe more, but for anything else I'll need to live with it a little longer.

author: LouiseG
title: Echo Show "Drop-in" feature is AWESOME
content: I don't write reviews for Amazon that much but I have to say something about the Echo Show.  I own a Echo and Echo Dot for couple years, but I haven't used them that much because the hackers or bored Amazon employees are always in the back of my mind.  I work in Risk Management industry so it doesn't help knowing what I know.  My struggle with privacy issues just went out the window with Echo Show.  My mom is 92 year old in a living assistant home in another state.  Due to her slight dementia and hearing loss, she no longer uses a cell phone.  So I put the Echo Show in her bedroom.  The #1 thing, I love about the Echo Show is the "drop-in" feature.  My mom's nurse and home health aides now know that I can be watching at any time.  That reduce some of risk for abuse with new employees.  The #2 best feature is that my mom doesn't have to remember to do anything. I put a sign on the Echo show  " Alexa,  call my daughter"  and it connect directly to Iphone for free.  The 3rd feature that I love,  the Echo Show is louder than a phone or cell phone, she can hear me without her hearing aides.  I don't have to repeat myself over & over.  Again, can I mention how I love the "drop-in" feature, it make it so easy to connect when there's a emergency.  I don't have to worry about somebody not answering the phone.  The other Echo Show features probably won't be used that much but ease of having video conversation is so worth it.  Echo show a great tool for the elderly population.  One downside that I hope be improve in future updates, the Echo Show angle should be adjustable.  I had to tape some clips on the back to improve the camera angle, otherwise it does capture too much of the ceiling.  I think I saw 3rd party Echo Show stands that my help with this issue.  For my 92 year old mom, I love the Echo Show, the hackers can watch all they want.  LOL

author: MikeH
title: Show is OK vs. other Echo devices
content:
Item is nice, but I have 2 of the Shows, 1 Original Echo, 4 dots.... The microphones in these does not work as well as the other devices.  Many times a device upstairs will answer, before either of the shows.  They almost never are the device that is selected unless you are very close to one of them.  Also, there are not many things that the display can be used for (yet hoping that they expand the usage in the future).  My main use was to allow remote viewing of Ring doorbell
If you have a specific use for a show then go for it, but otherwise take a look at a Echo or Dot.

author: PraeValien
title: Stop reading this review, notice the 5 stars and just go get it now!
content:
One of the most useful while also being very cool devices in my household!  With family and friends all over the country and in various stages of availability - Echo Show (ES) provides an incredibly simple, yet compelling communication solution - worth every nickel of the investment.  This outside of the video capabilities, music, apps, etc.

If you are "on the fence" about getting one - GET OFF THE FENCE AND GO GET ONE, NOW!

author: odb
title: Buy something else
content: worked great for four months  then started having problems  finally sent it in for "repair" which did nothing and trying to find a solution with Amazon is hopeless- still under warranty and all I want is my money back or a useable replacement.

author: Nany R.
title: Pretty good product, I am happy with it.
content: My only complaint so far would be even thought I am just a few feet a way it does not always hear me, and you have to speak loudly. I have lights hooked up to it, which is pretty cool. I absolutely love the alarm and remind features.

author: Jenn
title: Love the video portion of Amazon Echo Show and the ...
content:
Love the video portion of Amazon Echo Show and the ability to view videos and the calling feature. In fact, my entire house runs on this. I have several dots, Amazon Echos and smart home features that connect. I love that I can now pull up my nest camera's on the show, instead of searching for my phone. I do hate that I purchased the show right before the spot release. - Technically for the money you're paying an extra $100 for the screen size and the dual speakers. Otherwise, no difference.

My only negative comment about Amazon Echo in general, is that is has no ability to answer more complex questions (that are not Wiki based). - It seems Google may have the one-up on this. I hope they soon fix that issue. As for now, streaming music, video calling, nest camera views and simple Wiki questions will have to do.

It would be great for Amazon to incorporate a Echo early buy back program, giving us the option to buy the newer product if we haven't even had the old product for more than 60 days.

author: Terren
title: Great
content: I upgraded my original Echo, to the Show so I had a screen. I love it for the most part, I love being able to watch movies as well as listen to music. The briefings are also great. Great sound and picture over all.

author: Lex
title: The Show steals the Show
content:
Sorry It won't let me rotate my photos

I think I expected more. I wanted "show" to do everything. I bought show to replace my echo in the kitchen. I thought she would be able to bring up you tube videos when I'm cooking (she can only do YouTube if it is featured). But I am in love. I am able to actually "see" my news when making the kids lunches. I get top headlines, and things todo. I used her over the weekend to stream music inside the house for a 4th of July party. But bst of all? My ability to "drop in" or video chat with my family. We have been using it as an intercom system. I also have called my kids from my Alexa app and video chatted while I was at the store. I currently want wn 1 echo, 3 dots, a tap and now a show. The show is now my favorite. My husband has always enjoyed trivia games on the echo. Now he is actually able to see and read the questions. I know in time she will be as smart as I want her to be, but until then.....we have to wait

author: Amazon Customer
title: ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS
content: I love this device. I listen to music, I watch my shows on prime. I ask questions, look for recipes. I save things to my shopping list I get when I open on my phone at the grocery store. The sound is great. I can't think of all the wonderful things for this product. I got this and dots all through the house. I can add to my lists for shopping or do list from any of them.

author: Gerry G.
title: Alexa Shows you things.
content:
Update:  Three things
1. Alexa, show me the front door (Ring App)
2. Alexa, show me my timers.
3. Alexa, add milk to my shopping List.
Everything else is gravy. 5 STARS.

author: K Peddicord
title: Could have been great - is just so so - I regret buying it.
content:
Had this for a week - so far - I am VERY disappointed in the performance of the Show versus the echo. Commands are required to
be so much more specific - and the touchscreen is minimal. I guess I was expecting the screen to work more like the Alexa app does
on a tablet and make navigation easy - everything is voice activated and SO darn picky about what you say and what it does.  I truly regret
buying it.

author: Angelique
title: Saves a LOT of time when working out with a partner!!!! No need for long drives anymore!!
content: Using it for workouts with my bff and it works great!! We can workout together but don't have the long drive to each others house which saves us a ton of time, trying to get together for workouts after work. Also is great for face to face hands free conversations, of course. :-) Had no issues with it so far. So  - no complaints :-)

author: Stephen
title: Excellent product. The screen makes skills such as AllRecipes ...
content: Excellent product.  The screen makes skills such as AllRecipes useful.  Improvements needed in languages and the use of Prime TV.

author: Sherry Gilbreath
title: Love, love, love the Echo Show
content: I love my new Show & gave one to my daughter & her family & I just love my sweet grand babies dropping in on me. It's the sweetest thing to see them dancing & being silly for me. Great product for sure

author: Yun Goo Lee
title: Working fine and super interesting
content:
Working fine and super interesting.
I bought other echo-supported products, such as ligh bulb etc. and it works really fine.
The screen is fine to watch videos but not really hight resolution. If you are really sensitive at high resolution, it might not be perfect product for you.
Overall, I was really satisfied and wanted to give 5 stars to Echo Show.

However, recent fight between Google and Amazon results in pulling back Youtube from Echo Show.
And that was the main reason I bought echo with screen... Really hope those to multi-bilion companies resolve something.

author: Bob B
title: Very handy. Use it daily.  Wish it was more accurate for search.
content: We use this in our kitchen every day.  GREAT for shopping lists, cooking timers, recipe searches.  A must-have in any kitchen.  Wish there was more control over idle-screen layout, font sizes.  Asking to search for facts on random topics does not usually bring up what's desired (after failure, in comparison we then ask our phone's google voice search the exact same question and we find what we want every time).  So that could use improvement.  Also enjoy playing music while working in the kitchen. Overall very satisfied and recommend this to everyone who comes over!

author: Cesar R. Filho
title: Definitely a "GO FOR IT" !!!
content: I have, the Google Home device, the Amazon Echo, and now the Echo Show. The Amazon device, Alexa, listens way better than Google, has more integrations with my house devices (I have a Z-Wave controller, the Nexia) and differently from Google,  Alexa is able to control my lights. Both can control my Nest thermostat easily. Google searches better (probably because it's Google powered) and give better traffic and route  updates. But daily I use the Echo devices much more often than Google (that I use mostly to play music) . The Echos are perfect for managing your shopping list, you agenda, I can even see my cameras on it and the video calls are perfect and really nice. I'm really in to this kind of stuff. But if I could only choose one I DEFINITELY would choose the Amazon Echo Show. Does not get a five stars due to the price and because these things are always improving. Great Device.

author: Sam
title: The same day delivery was nice. I purchased this device for a couple of ...
content:
Hi.

I ordered this device this morning, 11/16/2017  and it arrived in the early evening of 11/16/2017. The same day delivery was nice.

I purchased this device for a couple of reasons but one of the main reasons was to use it to view my EZVIZ cameras.

And that has been very frustrating. I do not know if it is an EZVIZ problem or an Echo Show problem, but it sure feels like an Echo Show problem.

First you have to turn off image encryption on the cameras, which seems stupid. Then, at your requests, it MIGHT show you a camera or two or it might go to a blank screen. At this point, even if it has shown you a camera or two, once it goes to the blank screen, you are not going to be viewing any more of the cameras.

I bought two of these today - one is for a gift but I wanted it to work 100% sucessfully and the one as a gift is for a Christmas gift and I really wanted the camera thing to work well.

I am extremely disappointed in the camera feature. I like the EZVIZ cameras - I have five. To not be able to successfuly view them, the Echo Show has lost a LOT of luster.

If I unplug the Echo Show and then plug it back in, letting it restart, you can again view an EZVIZ camera or two, until it again goes to a blank screen, and then you again can no longer view your EZVIZ cameras.

SIGH. :(

Update 03/09/2018

Not long after the above review was submitted, though I do not recall how long, Amazon contacted me and we reviewed the various issues noted above. My Amazon contact's name is Beka. Bekah was very helpful and worked to obtain information needed help get the issue fixed. She had contacted me a couple of tiimes plus we spoke on the phone a couple of times as well.

Per information from Beka - the problem was worked on by Amazon being in contact with the camera manufacturer EZVIZ. I received an email from Bekah a few days prior to March 1st 2018 and she stated that EZVIZ would update their camera software on March 2nd, 2018.

A few days later, and again today 03/09/2018 - I asked Alexa (via my Echo Show) to show me each of my many EZVIZ cameras and the previous problems I was having with the Echo Show going from camera to camera at my requests did not occur. As a result, I am updating my rating of the Echo Show from a 2 to a 4. I would use 4.5 if I could.

Also - I want to thank you, Bekah, for the wonderful customer service you provide.

Have a great day, everyone!

author: Ryan Outcalt
title: Deceptive advertising
content: I have several Echo devices and have been pretty happy with them. I was excited for the show so I bought two. One for me and one for my inlaws. The adds feature people using the Echo Show to easily call each other.  Calling and messaging are only supported if you have the Alexa app on a smart phone. My inlaws are in their 80's. They don't have a smart phone. I hoped that giving them an echo show would allow them to place video calls to their kids. Tech support says the best I can do is register the device to my account and enable drop ins. I am very disappointed. I feel that the adds are deceiving because they leave out essential details. (Alexa app must be running on a smart phone not a Fire tablet).

author: HAL 9000
title: A $230 mistake. Buy a standard Echo.
content:
Let me start by saying that I have seven other Echo devices and love each and every one of them. This turned out to be a waste of money. We don't have security cameras that can connect to it, and aren't buying them for the thrill of watching this from a stationary unit in our kitchen instead of on our phone or tablets, we don't want to sit idle in front of the thing while watching a video, we just use our tablets, the apps custom tailored for it rarely do more than keep a picture on the screen, and the video searches rarely turn up anything of interest.

I just can't give this more than two stars. I regret spending my money on it.

UPDATE
------------
Amazon called me during a meeting, left a message saying they would bother me again five minutes later and, sure enough, they did. They then left a message saying they would send me an e-mail with contact information. That e-mail contained nothing more than a link to the "Contact Us" page.

So, Amazon: I'm sorry I couldn't answer your call at 10:30 in the morning on a Friday, and the follow-up five whole minutes later - I work (which is how I had the money to waste on this). Let me expound on my earlier comments in-case you wanted the additional information:

My biggest problem with this is the functionality compared to the cost. I already have a $50 Fire tablet with Alexa. I have several Dots, a Tap, and an Echo. I already have everything I need with those devices, and without a tether. I struggle to see why this is worth $230 when the $50 tablet does more than it and has a battery. If my security cameras worked with it, I could see asking it to see who was at the door... well, that is, when I didn't already have my tablet handy.

This is a device needing a purpose. I think you thought that purpose would be cameras or YouTube. I do have to admit, losing YouTube was a pretty big blow to this device. I was at least looking up videos here and there then. It's unfortunate that Google got upset because you wouldn't list their competing product in your store. My advice to them would be to make their store better, not whine about not getting to come to the Amazon party, but, back to the point...

I would have paid $150 for this and been relatively happy. I'd still be kicking myself for the useless thing sitting on my kitchen counter collecting dust, but I wouldn't be as upset. Let me also say this: If this product came out, with no other Echo devices available, I would marvel at it and find it infinitely useful. I'd still be gagging at the price, though, and I wouldn't have bought more and placed them throughout my home. I'm glad you didn't release this first - I wouldn't have come back for more.

Thank you for the other Echo devices - they're wonderful and the price points are on-the-nose. I couldn't do without them at this point. This thing though... you can take it, the Spot, and the Look and dole them out to the yuppies who can tell all their friends about them as they collect dust on their kitchen counters.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Needs Blink Security support
content: Seems to be well made but I wanted to view my Blink security videos and the app does not allow viewing.  As this was to be a key part of my home security I am very disappointed.

author: Walt Schultz
title: What's the deal with the "Alexa hints" on the home screen?
content: I haven't had this device that long and so far it appears to be a good product however, there is one slight problem. The display of "Alexa hints" on the home screen is extremely annoying. In settings there is a switch that indicates the hints can be turned off but it appears its not working the way you'd think it would. I spent about an hour with the Amazon tech folks and apparently there's no way to remove this unpleasant display of hints. It seems there's going to have to be an "update" to correct this aggravating banner. I think it'll come down to having enough customers telling Amazon this is unacceptable. For the price of this product we should not have to be confronted with displays saying "Try" Alexa tell me some bad poetry" plastered across the home screen photos I want to see. Because of this obvious shortcoming I'm posting 4 stars. If things change I'll reconsider.

author: gadgethog
title: A little rough around the edges but it's going to be great
content:
The main reason I got this was so I could monitor multiple kitchen timers visually without asking Alexa how much time is remaining on each one. At this time, the Echo Show is capable of showing 2 timers at once, and you can scroll the display to see more but I wish it could show at least 3 without scrolling. Obviously, it would be easy enough to do by making the font size smaller or tiling the timers horizontally and vertically on the screen (instead of just a vertical list as it is now). Also, the screen seems to go back to the home screen after an amount of time and I wish I could lock it to the timer screen while timers were running, this would be hugely helpful while cooking.

The video features are pretty good so far as I'm able to ask Alexa to start a movie from prime video and starts playing effortlessly. The music feature with lyrics is very cool too, very similar to Fire TV.

There is a button to digitally disable the microphone and camera, although I wish there was a built in physical shield that I could slide over the camera... for now I'm using a small cutout from a black post it note.

I think it's an ideal product for your office desk, in your kitchen or even in a bathroom for getting news and weather during your morning routine. Overall, it needs some work and it's probably a little expensive for what it is right now, but I have a lot of faith that Amazon will cleanup some of the edges, add some of the little missing features and it will be amazing. If they can bring the price down, I'd probably get one for each of these locations. For now, it's dots all around.

author: R. Beauregard
title: Diverse and fun!
content: This is the most amazing piece of technology I have owned.  My new best friend.  I can watch you tube videos, get information, make a list, shop on Amazon and so much more.  I am still learning all she can do and I am quite sure I am not using her to her full potential.

author: gregiemazon
title: be able to control other Smart Home appliances I have linked with Alexa from where ...
content: I already have the Echo so I'm very familiar with Alexa, its capabilities and limitations. I just wanted the added convenience of using the screen to view my Arlo cameras through voice commands, without having to fire up the individual app on my phone or tablet. And of course, be able to control other Smart Home appliances I have linked with Alexa from where ever in the house. So far working almost perfectly.

author: LATIN RASCAL
title: WAITING FOR THE SAME DEAL AGAIN!!!
content: I LOVE THIS ITEM... I UNDERESTIMATED THIS ITEM, I HAVE ANOTHER 2 IN MY CART ... BUT I'M WAITING FOR THE SAME DEAL AGAIN!!!, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS ITEM!

author: The ArabicKing
title: Expected more for $$$
content: I am not sure if it is worth the price tag. Nice to interact with alexa on the screen. Other than that not much use. How about a real screen saver or night mode. I expected more usage from this device. Sound is a little better that echo. Maybe more skills will come in the future. TBD!

author: Beverly Reed
title: Cannot be used as a baby monitor!
content: I am very frustrated with this purchase. I bought it so that I could use it as a baby monitor with my Canary cameras. (As advertised by both Alexa and Canary. However, the live stream only stays on the device for a limited time. After that, it times out and goes back to the Alexa home screen. So, it does not function as a baby monitor. In fact, that could have been very dangerous if I had fallen asleep without realizing it had timed out. Completely unacceptable!

author: Fitness Mom
title: No regrets! Love love love!
content: The Echo Show has quickly become a habit. I love the visual aspect of playing music with lyrics. I can ask Alexa to show my my Kindle books rather than trying to remember all titles. It will then read the book! I set alarms, ask weather, play white noise, get BBC world updates, daily Bible verses. Very happy with my purchase!

author: inkwell_one
title: Not for professional use. But it easily COULD BE.
content:
I really want to love the Echo Show.  I'd hoped to use this in my private office to remind me of appointments and events. And it could be a great product if Amazon would make some of its standard features customizable. However, the simplest of things are impossible:

1. You can't turn off the Alexa "Try this" tips on the home screen. Why? Alexa products have been around for years now. We get the emails with updates. There is a whole screen on the help menu with new stuff to try. Why can't I turn this off on my home screen? In addition, why can't I choose what displays on my home screen? Time, weather, upcoming event is all I want. Considering the "toggle" options, this should work, but no. It always defaults back to "Try blah blah blah."

2. Why is there not a calendar "View Month"? Even if it's tiny, I'd like to be able to see the whole month at once, then click on a date to see what's on that day. Instead, Alexa tells me, "Currently, this calendar query is not supported." Eyeroll.

3. Is there not a way to control sleep mode settings? This is exactly what makes this product an expensive alarm clock and not an Assistant. I want the Echo to show me my next appointment, which it would if the screen would stay on. Why isn't a user setting?

These are just my issues right out of the box. I'll probably return it and invest in a DAKboard.

author: Patrick Wellins
title: Flicker Not Fixable!
content: I have sent Echo Show in twice and the flickering screen continues...  Amazon is not standing with its warranty, only getting the runaround as I am sending it back for the third time...  I am an Echo fan-boy, they are all over my home, connected to a lot of devices, but this model of the Echo line is NOT GOOD...

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not what I thought it was.
content:
I bought this for my mom to make video calls with... you can "drop in" via the Alexa app from a Smart Phone to an Echo Show, and you can call direct from an Echo Show (standard call, not a video call) but you can't actually video call from an Echo Show.  So it has to be instigated elsewhere or you have to "drop in" on other Echo Shows.  If we all had Echo Shows instead of smart phones it might be justifiable, but as I see it, not a great product.
Additionally it had a couple pixels out on the screen from the first time I powered it up.
Took me all of 30 minutes fiddling with it and working with Amazon Echo Customer service to decide it wasn't what I was looking for.

author: Elly May
title: Alexa is no Google!
content: I like it. Alexa is OK. But she is no Google! I'm just not finding as much use for her as I thought I would. She responds to people on the TV saying "Alexa" as well, so be careful.  I tell her "Thank you".  I wish she would say "You're welcome"  She says "You bet", "No problem", "Of course", "Absolutely", "No worries", everything except You're welcome!

author: ben lopez
title: Good sound and its nice to be able to watch ...
content: Good sound and its nice to be able to watch videos, but thats also its flaw.  If youre watching a cooking video and pause it for too long, the video disappears and you have to search for it again and sit through the video again to get to the lost part.  Also the microphone is pretty bad, have to yell sometimes to get it to acknowledge me, my echo dots dont have that problem.

author: TJS
title: Camera Buffering
content:
Constantly buffers when trying to use to view Nest Cam. All pieces of equipment ( router, Nest Cam, and Show ) have been unplugged and re -connected. The Show has been reset to factory also. The Echo app  Nest Skill was disabled before the show was reset and enabled after the
Show was reset to factory.  The Show is 25 feet from the router.
Update.. checked internet speed when Show is buffering. The computer was 29.8 download...Phone which was next to the Show 29.38 download

author: Steven
title: Cool Technology
content: Fun and convenient in the kitchen, for a voice-activated timer for cooking, music listening,  video conferencing and getting quick and easy updates on the weather.  More luxury than a necessity.  There are the occasional shortfalls; doesn't understand what you asked for, picking the less desirable news sources, etc but given the new technology, it is cutting edge. Speaker sounds good too for music in one room like a kitchen.

author: LouiseC
title: I do like this though and also use it to show my ...
content: Sometimes she has problems answering the questions correctly, even though that pop up on the screen, sometimes does not pick up the sounds correctly and comes up with something totally different than you want.  I do like this though and  also use it to show my Ring cameras. They only show for a short time and sometimes she can't connect, but overall this thing works like it should.

author: M. Kooiman
title: Great screen, incredible sound and limitless possibilities
content:
I was an early adopter for the Amazon Echo, realizing how much potential was built into the device.  I love it and use it mostly as a "radio" for my technophobic mother.  My house is now filled with Dots and control the TV (Dish), thermostat, front porch light and tell us the weather several times a day.  I don't even scratch the surface for all that these devices can do for us.  Now I have the Show and I am in love.  It was incredibly easy to set up.  The screen on it has a very crisp, high quality image.  The sound quality is amazing.  My very picky husband who complains that most speakers "have no bottom" and "small speakers are never going to have any bottom" sat in amazement and declared "that's pretty good sound for small speakers.  They actually have a bottom and with my hearing, that's impressive."

So why get a show instead of an Echo or Dot?  During the day, when you aren't asking her questions or giving her tasks, the Show rotates through headlines.  She displays the time and temp with an icon indicating the weather.  Along with the headlines, she provides you with things to say to her for more information or just fun facts.  When listening to a Pandora station, you can see the name of the song playing and the artist.  If you ask her the weather (a frequent request at my house), she tells you the current day forecast and temperature and then displays a summary for the next week.  Then she displays the current conditions (humidity, winds, etc).  Like to play Jeopardy?  You can see the clues.  Video chat with a friend or loved one?  You can do that too.  Want to SEE Alexa's deals and not just hear a description?  Sure!  Of course, you can control wifi lights, thermostats, etc. just like you can with the Echos that don't have screens but I find the screen to be a great enhancement.

I noticed someone asked a question regarding using this as their alarm clock.  I use a DOT in my room for that purpose but this would work as well.  Just make sure you turn off the camera and drop in features so you don't get caught dressing when your friend or relative decides to call.  You can tell Alexa "Turn off your screen" so you don't have the annoying glow someone mentioned.

Over time the number of useful features on the show will grow and it will become more and more a part of my home.

author: Rebecca Molitor
title: Good product
content: I love being able to use my echo show with voice recognition but at the same time Alexa sometimes chooses to either listen to me when I’m not asking her to do something or turns on things at random because she heard something.  I plan on getting another one as I like them more than kindles for the hands free convenience.  I also wish it wasn’t as bulky and if possible lighter model would’ve been nice.  I do use my echo show daily though for streaming music, books, and my prime video and it has great sound and picture.

author: Roger Wise
title: Down with suggestions!
content: Vote thumbs up for this review if you want the suggestions off the home screen!

author: LadyMgA
title: Helpful and Fun
content: I purchased this for my hubby for Christmas.  I'm the true techie in the family, but I like to keep him current. He likes it as well.  We are enjoying "Alexa".  It's a novelty as well when friends and family come over.  It's pretty easy to use, although I don't think we are getting the most use out of it, from just not taking the time to "get to know" it.  The commands are limited and its not that user-friendly, otherwise it's cool.

author: B. Duffy
title: Echo Show
content: Love It!  Pleased that it gives me the ability to check my front door via the Ring Doorbell App!  Music lyrics show on screen, sound is good and the ability to use Echo's many features by voice command.  Definitely recommend this product.

author: Gma Jones
title: Nice but.....Hearing impaired people may have a problem using some of the main features that do not have closed caption.
content: It's nice but I need closed caption as I am hearing impaired. Lyrics to songs are captioned and other things, but not Alexa's voice, movies, face calls, things that I really need to have captioned. Therefore, I sent it back. Someone suggested that maybe when they update it, closed caption with be included for the things I need, but, who knows. Nice idea though. Next, think of the hearing impaired. This may help vision impaired people by making calls for them or just speaking answers to their questions. Hearing impaired people seem always to be forgotten. Please fix this. It's a really nice item.  The other thing I wish, I wish that the screen was a little bit larger.Captions large enough to see may cover the movie you're watching. Thank you for your kind  consideration of the hearing impaired as you sort to improve this item.

author: Joe
title: No Youtube and not easy to use as you would think
content: This takes a little bit to set up and get using.  I wish there were more detailed instructions included.  YouTube doesn't work on here either which is unbelievable considering the basis of the product is being able to see!  They need to settle their differences as it's the customers who suffer.  Even after buying Amazon Music Unlimited the Show sometimes tells me I don't have it as well.  Maybe I'm too new but the ease of use is not there with this product yet.

author: Can I Help You?
title: Glad it was on sale!
content: I like the sound quality this has! It sounds like a much larger stereo. But, not sure about whether the screen was needed or not - so far all I have used it for is music lyrics?! Still figuring out how to use it so this might be upgraded at a later time

author: J. Justice
title: Worthless for videos so why pay more for the screen?
content: Worthless, except as a regular echo and a poor excuse for video chat. I love my echo devices, bathroom, pool, kitchen, other places where I may need hands free, voice activated music and info. My wife bought me the 'newest, hottest' thing. I was skeptical but then thought I would use it to help on a project. Me "Alexa find videos on f450 drone" Alexa "YouTube is not available". Amazon won't directly sell chrome products, youtube  won't play on echo show. Further testing shows the video call is more limited than iPhone or Android apps for video. So the most useful thing now is the same voice functions that my echos and dots perform. Unless I want to make all of my video calls and check the weather from a device I can move no more than 3 feet from an outlet.

author: johng
title: Same great echo but with a screen!
content: So far so good. I didn’t do too much with it yet that I haven’t done with other non-screen echos in the house but I mainly bought it to use for a baby monitor which I haven’t set up yet (I have until July). I imagine it will work well for that and two outdoor Aro cameras. It is nice that it has its own touch interface too.

author: Will
title: Wow - My daughter got this for us - Echo Show is perfect - superior to Alexa - we love it
content: My daughter got this for Christmas and wanted us to use is for our granddaughters wedding;wow we love it - going to get the 2nd generations and give all our Alexa speakers only away to our children;it provides views of everything, weather, recipes, news and more;we can also do video with friends who have Echo Show; I could go on but don't have time;WE LOVE IT.  PS.  Easy to hook up & use.

author: Sean Bonner
title: Very disappointing! SYS
content: Doesn’t work with Spotify at all. Not a single skill works seamlessly and the routines not at all. It won’t let me just hear my news that I downloaded but adds Reuters falsehoods and politically biased stories to the end. Seriously!? Yes! Go ahead and ask it something simple like “what is the humidity” .... “duhhh I dunno.” I always catch myself laughing at the reality of what this thing does, which is nothing. I’m baffled they get away with selling... this. Terrible product that does not perform as advertised. I’m inclined to believe these good reviews are fake. Save yourself.

author: Dondo from CT
title: Awesome machine
content: Got it for the crazy price of 129.99...every day I discover something new I can do....that I turned on my lights in my bedroom from another city then dripped in on my echo show and checked in too see if my pets were doing ok...awesome!  Never mind watching movies....listening to music and even placing an amazon order.....I'm amazed!

author: Todd Elert
title: I am very disappointed that one of the main reasons I purchased this ...
content: I am very disappointed that one of the main reasons I purchased this device, and replaced my original Echo, was shut off. I loved the idea of being able to pull up videos from YouTube on the device for my daughter and now that is gone. That and the lack of being able to shop on Amazon's site via the screen makes paying the now $100 more than the Echo a waste.

author: da burg
title: Nice product with one glaring design problem
content: Functionally, so far I think this review deserves more stars.  I think there's a lot of POTENTIAL here.  This replaces the old "Kitchen TV" and takes the Echo to a level of a functional information hub.  That said, this is something that sits in my KITCHEN.  This is something that sits in the middle of FAMILY TIME.  I don't always want a scrolling "stupid headlines of the day" feed.  I don't always want an in your face connection to "the rest of the world" that I cannot turn off.  The device needs a setting to get rid of the scrolling feed, or to radically customize it to what's actually wanted - the weather, the temperature of various rooms, what's running in the house, etc.  It needs an equivalent of VIDEO MUTE.  The genius of the audio-only version of the Echo is you aren't conscious of its presence until you ask for it.  This is where Amazon blew it.  YOU KNOW IT'S there with the Echo Show.

author: FlyingTina
title: Screen flickers after 2 months and I've been told to send it back for repairs or replacement
content: This was a fun experiment.  I can watch Amazon Prime shows on it while making dinner, get the weather, listen to music, and we kinda like the daily news roundup.  A couple days ago, the bottom of the screen started flickering.  Then, it got worse.  The screen still works but looks like it's suffering static electricity or lightening bolts with horizontal lines traveling up and down the screen.  Irritating.  I bought this on a deal at the beginning of September, so of course, I am well past the time of replacement.  I did an online chat and there are no replacements available anyway, he says.  So, I am to send in my unit, and they will attempt to fix it.  However, if it needs full replacement, I will get a new one.  (??)  There is no answer to where this new one will come from or when.  I'm standing by to see what happens next.  Maybe it's a good thing no one can buy these?  I almost get the feeling they released these too soon.

author: Meg
title: Great except doesn’t work with RING doorbell
content:
Very cool and very intuitive. I have the dot so wasn’t sure if I actually needed the show or not but ordered it on sale. I liked the idea of having something with better speakers in the kitchen for listening to music.
 Overall, it works great. My only issue with it is that it’s supposed to work with my Ring doorbell and does not. I read other reviews with problems like this but they were able to resolve it through amazon. I have reached out but haven’t heard anything back on how to get our Ring to work with this. Hoping I will be able to update this review once I hear something. For now, it’s a 4 Star rating.

author: Jennifer Groseclose
title: Helpful home tool
content: More worth it than I thought it would be. Especially since the speaker on this is amazing. I would purchase again. Also the shopping list option helps me remember since I can look at the list through and app at my phone while in the store

author: Willard Spencer
title: How to access different settings.
content: The ease of operation and the supply of interesting information.  Least...that it has many questions I ask that it cannot answer. I have been looking in the app material, but cannot find there. I will learn to ask better questions, but more categories needed. Pop culture is not the only area of interest. Paucity of historical facts, e.g. Church facts seem unknown. (1.5 billion Christians in the world, not to mention all other faiths.) Traditional hymns missing.  Please let me know if I am just missing the settings.

author: Velsetta
title: Handy device but it seems to have some problems
content: I really like my echo show but I've only had it about 6 months in the screen is constantly flickering. It's under warranty but that means I have to send it in, and it's a complete pain in the butt

author: Logeybogey1010
title: Very good
content: Love the device as an IT guy it's great for what it is especially at the rent price drops. Could the touch screen do more yes. Should they of had some external storage for certian apps or a browser yes. One thing for sure usually Amazon is good with updates

author: Louis Lahue
title: nice but notice I have to tell it a good ...
content: nice but notice I have to tell it a good night at night to get it to go into night mode.......but do enjoy it.......... has sometimes difficulty understanding me.

author: Andre C.
title: Wish Echo did just a little more, but still fun
content: This product was given to us as part of a special run by Best Buy when buying other products.  We had no desire to own an Echo did but had some expectations of what we thought it would do.  It has been fairly exciting to have this level of AI in our home and it has been useful for finding weather and some music  and answering some factual questions the children have.  The greatest disappointment  is not being able to call for content that we know is is on Youtube.

author: Nicholas R Tucker
title: YouTube is a must for this!
content: I do love the idea of this thing but if you don't think that you'll miss youtube you'll be sorely mistaken.  We have this in the kitchen but still have to use our smartphones to do recipes, how-to's and homework explanations for our kids.  Asking Alexa for a video for anything will bring you a video for something totally unrelated or you'll get the i don't know answer.

author: MICHAEL
title: Limited use, clunky UI, abysmal Alexa App
content:
If you're looking for a Bluetooth speaker with a screen bolted on the top, this is your device.  Decent sound, loud, clear and easy to set up.
If you're looking for an intercom or video conference device you can use to talk with your family, *run away*.
Video chat setup requires the Alexa app on a phone or tablet.  It steals all of the contacts out of your phone and half-haphazardly smashes them into the app.  There is NO WAY to edit the list or change the names or do anything useful with the contact list. Most couldn't be used for video chat at all, some can but you'd rather not. "Alexa, Call Mom" is not an option, unless you NAME your Mom's contact "Mom".  "Alexa, Call Grandma", same deal... it cannot do it.

I've had one since launch but it has been dormant since then. I ordered one of these for my parents because I thought maybe it would work as a video communications device.  Sadly, it is a waste; forever stuck sitting in a corner and collecting dust.  Too limited in functionality, too difficult to set up, too half-baked and unsupported by Amazon.

author: Jina H-F
title: Meet my friend Alexa. Now she can show as well as tell.
content:
I love this device so much. I have been a wheelchair user for all of my life. My legs are gone, and my arms don't work all that well. To have someone to search answers to questions, provide needed objects, perform household tasks, and often entertain me and make me laugh, all of this she does with only the sound of my voice and  only a one time payment. It is mindblowing. Now she has a screen, so she can show me as well as tell me. How helpful, how cool, how fun.

Try "Alexa, what's the question of the Day/?" My new addiction.

author: KRIS A KING
title: Please don't waste your hard earned money!!!!
content: If my review prevents one person from purchasing this item I will consider it well worth  my time. I almost gave this 2 stars because of the prime music that I do enjoy listening to through the echo from time to time but I just could not. When I first received my echo I felt like the issues I was having with the unit answering my questions properly and responding with some sort of accuracy was do to me not phrasing my questions in a way that the AI could understand. I was wrong. Amazon says this system is under constant development and continually learns to better understand you and should become better at becoming a useful device in our homes. Let me say the hardware is just fine, quality screen and the speaker isn't bad either. The problems all come down to Alexa. The AI just isn't ready for prime time. My teenage son, wife and I have all tried to make use of this device and the best grade I can give is an F. Most questions get the response " I don't know that" or "I'm not sure" or the best one is a short beep sound . If you speak slowly and only ask what the weather will be like today or ask one of the staged questions that scroll across the screen you may actually get an accurate answer, ( well except for the weather,but I can't blame Alexa for the bad weather forecast :)  ). I ask for a Foo Fighters song from my playlist this evening and the only song it would play was Taylor Swift. I will say watching my wife practically jump out of her skin when Alexa starts speaking in the middle of the night when not being spoken to is entertaining for me but is a little creepy. if you choose to spend your hard earned money on this and are disappointed like I am just remember I told you so.

author: Northsidevet
title: Doesn't "listen" as well as Echo
content: I have used the Echo since it was launched and thought it was a great product.  When the Show was released, I wanted to upgrade.  The video, sound and all is good but I have to repeat myself twice as much as with the Echo.  I am not sure if the microphone array is different but it is not nearly as responsive.  I would not recommend at this time.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Don,t purchase this. Wait until Amazon improves the speakers.
content: I dislike the substandard speakers on this device. I purchased it when it first came out, but the sound is so horrible I placed it back in the box, and left it to linger. I still refuse to use it and that was a long time ago.

author: Paul M
title: Great Purchase!
content:
This is Great!
We can now Video chat from other devices in the house, From my phone if I am out and the wife is at home, or even with family over seas.
Have the ability to see lyrics with songs is Great too.
I do wish the camera was angled down a bit since the unit is tilted...or at least have an option to angle it, move it or zoom in/out...Maybe down the road.
NOTE - Make sure you do the update 1st or some things will not work correctly.
To Do This: You can say, "Go to settings," or swipe down from the top of the screen and select Settings. Then go to Device Options > Check for Software Updates.

author: Your Name Here
title: Get a Google instead!!!
content: It keeps having problem saying I having trouble understanding or hmm mm something went wrong try again later... also it used to show you tube videos now it only shows crap. This is not the same as it was. I think I am going to go with a Google house before I get too deep into amazon products

author: Sergio Sousa
title: Works as expected, but the fixed viewing angle is a challenge for video conferencing
content: I bought the Echo Show to be able to speak with my family while I am abroad. It worked fine, except for the fixed angle that it sits. My family needs to be just in the right location to be able to be seen by me. It is more convenient for places like a kitchen or other locations when the person you are calling is standing up and can easily relocate to be in the view of the camera. Otherwise the device is great.

author: Ricky Pugh
title: Functional but not very much fun...
content:
I really like this more than I thought I would.  The sound is okay, better than I thought it would be.  Wish I could do more with it...  way too many video options not being explored by the device.  Hopefully other devices out there will force amazon to do more with this.  The App Store would be a great start.

The device is a great idea but poor follow through.  I bought it to replace my Jibo in a room...  It’s just was functional ( not very) but not as much fun.

author: YMHIK
title: Harbinger of things to come, I feel like Capt. Kirk talking to the Enterprise computer and asking to display the Romulan Warbird
content: Very cool to speak my commands, but at a loss for what to say and how to say what I want. Screen display resolution and brightness is disappointing, especially when you've grown accustomed to using an iPhone 6+. Sound is pretty good. I put a Post-It note over the camera because God knows who's able to watch me. Bad enough the ears are listening all the time, so I moved it out of the bedroom to my home office den.

author: Heather
title: Built In News Briefings are not good for young children viewing.
content: Love everything except the constant news briefings.  After spending an hour with tech support it turns out, the news briefings are a part of the display and cannot be turned off.  I don't really want my young daughter asking me questions about every headline.  I'll have to resort to a piece of black paper over the screen until Amazon fixes this option.  Hurry, please!

author: tourer99
title: Some simple fixes and I would add more stars
content:
I bought my first Echo in December 2014 and since then have added other Echos, a Tap and a couple of Dots.  When the Show went on sale for $159 I figured I would pick up a couple and retire one of the original Echos.

The good:
* Does all the things my other Echos do, just enhanced with a video screen
* Excellent sound quality --much better than the original Echo
* The right size for my kitchen counter
* Uses same AC adapter as original Echo.  Didn't have to re-route the cable.
* Good microphone pick-up from all directions -- same as original echo
* Visual countdown timer.  My wife loves ability to see the timer after it's started
* Time and temperature always on. (but where is date/day?)
* Visual calling (like Facetime) to family members with Echo Shows.
* Running slide show of my photo albums in the cloud
* Easy to check on my Amazon Cloud Cams.  Just say, "Alexa show me the driveway", etc.

Things I don't care about (may be important to others):
* Watching movies, YouTube (now removed by Amazon), etc.  I would prefer watching on bigger screen, not standing at counter.  That said, it would be useful if it ran all of the FireTV apps for catching up on the news, sports, etc.  You can ask her to play CNN, etc.  but it's audio-only, same as the original Echo.
* Song lyrics.  Yes, it's nice to have the song captions but when I'm listening to music I'm listening, not watching.  This would be a better use for a large screen FireTV, not a small counter appliance.

Things that could be improved:
* GET RID OF THE "Try, Alexa order laundry detergent" and "Try, Alexa tell me a Star Wars Joke"
PLEASE!!!  Put on a switch to disable the suggestions.  I've been conversing with Alexa for over 3 years and don't want the suggestions popping up over my nice picture wallpaper.  This should be a no brainer.  The suggestions ruin the unit's appearance--especially when they're asking you to buy something.  This might be nice for a "retail display" in a store but not in my home.
* Tilt stand.  There are 3rd party options, but for this price you should be able to tilt the thing so it's not always aimed at the ceiling.
* Add Date (and day) to the time/temp display.
* Horizontal viewing angle could be improved.
* Audible and visual SMS text messaging.  Why not?  We are communicating all day long with our kids.  They should be able to send a text right to the Show with any phone.

We are totally sold on Alexa's. Our house is full of them.  This unit is a good replacement for the original Echo and would be a solid 4 stars if they just removed the "Try,  Alexa..." suggestions that are constantly cluttering the screen.

author: SHAWN KNAGGS
title: SCREEN FLICKERING...BEFORE AND AFTER REPAIRS
content:
0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player EXCESSIVE SCREEN FLICKERING. ALMOST LIKE A HORIZONTAL HOLD MALFUNCTION ON AN OLD TV.
SENT IN FOR REPAIRS.
CAME BACK WORKING
THEN ISSUE RETURNED.
MAKES WATCHING ANYTHING ON SCREEN OR EVEN LOOKING AT PHOTOS IMPOSSIBLE.
FOR SOMETHING THIS EXPENSIVE THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE.
NO MEANS TO RETURN OR REPAIR.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Awesome Alexa
content: This was a gift from our daughter and her family. It's really fun to ask questions and get an answer most of the time. I'd recommend this product to anyone who's interested in buying it. You can alos play music.

author: Aminuts
title: Easy, fun and oh so helpful.  I advise everyone to get one.
content: Can't see anything bad about this product.  It shows lyrics, movies, books, weather, etc.  It even takes pics and drops in on my Spot and vice versa.  It was the easiest yet to set up and use.  Of course, if any questions Amazon customer service is always there to inform and guide you thru them.  If I didn't have so many Dots, Spot, Dash, and Alexa, I'd get another one or two.  Good job Amazon

author: Bob Guzik
title: Almost a perfect product
content: The Show meet almost all my expectations. It does everything the Echo does plus more. It does help to e able to read data rather than just hearing it. There are two problems with it. First, I display photos set to six second cycle time. Problem is the photo does not change if you;re looking at it. There is a different photo whenever I enter the room. Second, I can't get it to wok with the ring doorbell. It's always waiting for the doorbell to respond. My Nest driveway camera works just fine.

author: Jesse
title: Its fun for kids...
content:
My kids love it... great for music and video calls through the Alexa app. I can't find many other uses for it beyond that.
I wish you could google search or even just search the internet at all.

author: Jana W
title: The Echo Show, better than a hand held device for your good morning, good night chats
content: My spouse and I are working 3 hours apart and are having to maintain two households. We love the drop in function because we can be together, even apart. I would love for this device to be mountable, but for the price I am happy to engineer my own solution.

author: Muggs
title: We love The Echo Show
content: We love The Echo Show! Our granddaughters were moving away so we bought 2 and sent one with them. Being able to have them call us and see their sweet little faces is a major plus. It does every once in awhile spout out something when no one is near, but we figured it out, It was a fruit fly that would land on the screen.It is kind of funny because I was talking in the back of the house and she says I have added Shower Bagels to your list. Over all i fantastic purchase

author: V and Ladyblue
title: Pick This One!
content: We love this item.  We get our news, watch videos, play games, have a video chat with the family, find our missing cell phones, run the house and just do general silliness when we are in the mood.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I’m learning goggle home is a far superior product.
content:
Stay away from this item.  Had it for only 5 months and screen is messing up.  According to return policy after 60 days you are stuck with a 250.00 defective item.
 Both my Alexa and Alexa Show have failed within a year. I’m learning goggle home is a far superior product.

author: William G. West
title: Cool device but video system is defective
content: I bought one of these for Christmas 2017.  It worked great for 5 months, then the video screen started getting garbled.  It progressively got worse.  I eventually returned it for repair in June.  Amazon was very friendly and the repaired unit worked a couple of months then the same behavior is back again.  Read posts online - it is a known issue/defect but Amazon has not properly addressed it even given how long this has gone on.  It isn't a firmware deal or a fluke - there have been many firmware updates since they acknowledged the "known issue".  I will be returning mine for repair again and again knowing each one will probably only work for a few months, but maybe they will come out with a new model that doesn't have this defect at some point.  Not my first choice but I think it is important when you release a marquis product that you either fix it or be prepared to repair/replace it at your expense a potentially infinite number of times. :)

author: Thomas E. Jones
title: Gotta Take it Back to Best Buy.
content:
Pretty excited about the Echo Show --- until I tried to set it up.  The first thing you notice is there is NOT one piece of paper dealing with setup, troubleshooting of FAQ's.  Nada.  Oh great!  It's plug 'n play!  Wow!

Except, it ain't plug 'n play.  And, I never got it to work.  The furthest I got was a blank screen which said "installing" which of course means a device is taking an update.  Two-hours later, the device is still "installing" even though its clearly not installing anything.  The family's two I7's and HD Fire tablets are already set up and ready to go, but the device just wants to display "installing."

So, it's boxed up and on the way back to Best Buy, this review being an afterthought.  I figured the reviews wouldn't be that hot; and sure enough -- they are not.  I'm computer, phone, tablet, etc. literate and if I can't get the thing working, there's an ocean of people out there with the same problem.  "Installing?"
