Installing what, for how long and for what reason?  A simple update, or is it waiting for an unknown-to-me action, in which case "installing" would be an incorrect prompt.

I have no doubt that the device would work marvelously if it could be set up properly, and I have no doubt I could do that if I had written set up instructions and a troubleshooting guide.  But, the manufacturer unbelievably chose to sell a complicated electronic device without the first word of "how to" instructions.

I don't always review, but have written quite a few.  Don't think I've ever give ANY device a one-star rating, but this one is richly deserved, and affects my future decisions on whether to buy any other product with the same brand logo.

author: Lason
title: Works good but....
content: Works good but I really havent found a good use for the screen. I mainly bought it because it was on sale and I thought it would good with my Ring doorbell but the skill is pretty limited. I cant talk through the doorbell using this echo and I wish there was a way that it would activate when my doorbell goes off but no dice. I guess it would work better if I had family members that also had it.

author: J. Dagostino
title: Just like the Jetsons!!!
content:
I can't tell you how much we are enjoying our 3 Echo Shows.  My husband bought 2 of them for my birthday and we loved them so much we bought another one for the kitchen.  My grandchildren are visiting and I told "Alexa" to play a children's video and she played videos that the children loved.
I ask her what my schedule is for the day and she names off all of my appointments/events.  We put one in our bedroom, one in the office and one in the kitchen.  The grandchildren will drop in on us in the office and kitchen.  We "hang out" together, even after we are done speaking to one another.

author: Chris Pierce
title: 30 Days with the Echo Show
content:
She (Alexa) isn't as smart as Google, but she's fun to have around, and the Show model provides some useful features.

What I want?
"Alexa, show me the weather for the US. Show me the highest temperature in the US, today.  Show me the Tropics weather."

author: Robert B.
title: Great idea. Some documentation would have been nice and ...
content: Great idea. Some documentation would have been nice and save a lot of time. The Show also drops WIFI occasionally, even when the other devices in the house are ok, even farther away devices. Once I figured out all the ins and outs and it holds WIFI it is an amazing piece of hardware.

author: Ed Kessler
title: Not sure if I would buy it again?????
content: Doesn’t do quite what we expected. We hear “I don’t know that one” or “I am not sure” more than anything else from “Alexa”. This was a gift for my husband, not sure if I would buy again if given the choice. I am giving 4 stars as my husband does like the feature of asking for piano music while we eat a family dinner.

author: sueend
title: Will buy again!!
content: Really enjoy the Echo Show....Some times has problems understanding me but that is just a process!  Convenient and it is great when you ask for a phone number and it shows it...Don't have to remember it.  Love to see the lyrics of a song too! No more peanut butter an flour on my phone or ipad keyboard either as it shows me a recipe and doesn't time out.  I would buy again and would definitely recommend it! I do not have a dot or other echo but love the Show and may just get another!!

author: Bullet
title: nice box- lousy software
content: Extremely disappointed with the interface software.  Makes the whole thing worthless,  Can do nothing other than an extremely limited bunch of idiot commands spoon fed to you by Alexa.  This box has great potential but is so limited.  Please open this thing up to some decent android developers to provide a functional interface instead of the bunch of armatures that threw this together!!! Give direct access to a browser and Play Store.  My $39 fire tablet and a good bluetooth speaker (I have a Zeeq pillow) blows smoke rings around this $240 table weight.  STAY clear if you expecting anything more than a Echo that shows YouTube.

author: Go Blue Girl
title: What did we do before the Alexa Show?
content: We have this in our kitchen.  It’s the best addition ever. Alexa hears you perfectly, answers every question imaginable and asking her to play music is revolutionary. Amazon music (even without unlimited) is fantastic. You can also connect Spotify and many other music services and she will by voice command play that as well. The sound fills the kitchen / Family area beautifully and the picture is stunning.

author: George M. Hacker
title: Something everyone should own!!!!!
content: I really love the Echo Show.  I now own three that I use and I have also purchased one for my father.  As for the ease of use, my father just celebrated his 90th birthday and he enjoys the use his every day.  I have one on my nightstand, and two in my office.  I am going to purchase another one for our Kitchen.  They are absolutely helpful and give you a wealth of information at your voice command.  Also adding the benefit of viewing items is a great advantage over the echo and the echo dot, although we have several of these as well that allows me to utilize the for multi-room music and to communicate to and from any area of the house.

author: Tashia S
title: Alexa and the Show Show Shows Up Siri
content:
I love the Echo Show. I’m going off to live on campus for school in the fall and we got two of these to serve as an easy way to connect. Some people might not like the camera but that makes little sense. We carry devices with cameras all the time. The only difference here is that the item is stationary. My family and I also find the drop-in feature a comfort rather than an invasion of privacy. It’s definitely a source of relief to my parents that they can so easily pop in onme and visa versa.
I’d also like to thank Amazon for including their VoiceView screen reader on the device. The Show would be a lot less blind friendly, even with Alexa present, if they hadn’t included that.
We are an echo-loving household with two dots, three echos, and now two Shows. I wouldn’t be surprised if we got more in the future for ourselves or loved ones. Thanks, Amazon!

author: Melissa
title: Video Playback is beyond frustrating
content: Overall, the screen size, picture quality, and sound are actually quite nice. My problem is with the functionality of Alexa. The video Playback is rigged with inaccuracies and frustrations. For example, if you finish Amazon's "Pete the Cat" series and want to start it over (back to episode 1), it will forever lock on to that last episode of the season unless you go to the website or prime video app. I've also reached out because it's so frustrating that seasons of shows are "101" "102" etc. It makes it nearly impossible to ask Alexa to play that season unless you get the words exactly right. I have other Echo products and can navigate them well, but I find myself hating the Echo Show more than I can enjoy it. Bummer!

author: Noreen R. Viscioni
title: NOT COMPATIBLE WITH ALL FIRE TV :( :( :(
content:
I was so excited to get the Echo Show only to find out after several hours of time with customer service both online and over the phone that it was not compatible with the Fire TV that I have so I cannot access Netflix, Hulu, Etc....
Now I have to either buy a new Fire TV (even though mine works perfectly fine) or return the Echo Show.  Either way, I'm bummed.

author: TribalTech
title: Excellent and very useful device for the family!
content: This thing is amazing! It is so useful. We have it installed in our kitchen and it makes looking up recipes so convenient. Also getting quick measurements or conversions on things like cups to tablespoons etc becomes so convenient rather than have to pull up the phone or a computer. With kids it is useful to play music and/or music videos to keep them busy if we are busy cooking dinner etc. And then to start the day by making coffee and asking Alexa to play the news is a great feature. Another great feature is that it keeps flashing trending news bits on the front page that you can ask her to elaborate. Last but not the least i've got it synced with my Arlo Pro suveillance system and my ecboee and it works with both of those things amazingly well. Particularly when I ask her to show me whats at the front door or basement etc and it pulls up the surveillance live feed is awesome. Great device and our family loves it!

author: R and B
title: Echo Show, love the instant viewing of Prime videos!
content: We just got the 3rd gen Echo Dot and we love it.  We have several Alexa devices, two of the 1st gen Echo devices, one 1st gen Echo Show, one 2nd gen Echo Dot, 3 Fire TV devices, and now the 3rd gen Echo Dot.  We use them all multiple times throughout the day and can't remember what it was like before having them. The devices just keep getting better and better!  Watching Amazon Prime video just by voice command is awesome, everyone at our house loves it!

author: 6inthebay
title: We love this. So many amazing uses--especially for talking to ...
content: We love this. So many amazing uses--especially for talking to their dad at night. Also great to see song lyrics (except those sneaky cuss words). Fun device. We are slowly getting addicted to all those darn Alexa devices!

author: Jackie Austin
title: Amazon stands behind their product!
content: This is an updated review: Initially, we really loved this! In fact, we ordered 2 more.  Soon, youtube stopped being able to be played on them. Then about 3 months into their use, they started cutting out on the sound. Amazon reached out to me thru phone calls and emails. We tried various ways to fix the sound issues and when they didn't work, Amazon replaced them! Thank you, Amazon!

author: lady flora
title: Not super impressed and not a must have technological gadget.  Don't get it unless on sale!
content:
I got this when it was on sale for $179.99.  I chose the white.  I like it but I don't. The drawback (and I knew this going in) is it won't play You Tube. That is the major drawback for me.  Additionally I would like to watch Netflix on the device.  In retrospect I wish I had bought the Dot.  But hope springs eternal that You Tube and Netflix will be able to use on the Show.

I am becoming annoyed with the music Unlimited not being recognized and having to chat with customer service.

Some days Alexa drops and can't finish a simple ap like 20 Questions.

Fortunately you can disable the drop in mode.  That is too creepy for me.  I can see how some people might need this but for me that is not something I want.

I bought this because it is my hope that Google and Amazon can reach an agreement so that You Tube videos can stream.  If you want the ability to play You Tube or Netflix, forget it.  It isn't going to do that.  That is the main reason I gave it 3 stars.

Otherwise there are a lot of  skills available in the Alexa ap. Some are better than others.  The Alexa "Let's Talk" really needs work. Right now it is aimed towards a young and I mean young audience.  I am glad I got it on sale because it isn't worth full price to me personally..  Right now it is a novelty gadget and nothing more.  I can't speak about the smart home portion because I don't need it.  I don't buy products at Amazon at all.  If you do you may like this.  Right now it is a great PR tool for Amazon and its products.

If it had not been $50 off I would have sent it back.  I know this is the first generation and with time will hopefully improve.

author: Jan Marie
title: THOUGHT THIS WOULD BE BETTER - DISAPPOINTED
content: I thought Alexa would be more like my tablet that I can talk to and it bring up what I'm asking it.  So many times Alexa doesn't have a clue what I'm asking or gives me the wrong information.  The other day I told it "You Are Dumb" and the reply was "Send Feedback to the Alexa App".  She can answer basic questions but I have to say my good old Samsung Tablet I purchased several years ago is way better at getting the information I need when I need it.  Disappointed!

author: Wanda
title: Just ask Echo, she delivers.
content: OMG!  Talk about having a personal assistant, this is it.  You will never miss another appointment again with Echo, the reminders keep scrolling the day before then you tell Echo to delete it when done.  The sound quality is so much better than that very expensive radio.  Phone callers sound as though they are sitting right next to you in the room.  I started off with the Echo Dot and progressed from there.  I bought an Echo Show for my Granddaughter for Christmas.  The screen is what makes this product a stand out device.  I keep up to date and informed on anything I choose.

author: Kaley Ward
title: Awesome addition to our household!
content: Love our Echo Show! Alexa does so much! The speakers are great and the flex briefing keeps us up to date on current events and so many other customizable daily things like quotes, bible verses, today in history, etc. Pandora comes in handy at family gatherings to play music too.

author: Music lover
title: Great visual
content: Great for a bit of visual while getting update on news; Love the available on-screen lyrics while listening to music.  Who knew the songs I’ve been singing along with for years were with the wrong words?1?

author: Antonio  Brown
title: Alarm feature...
content: This morning is the second time since buying this thing that it doesn't shut off, the first time it happened at 4:30 IN THE MORNING I pushed it off my night stand out of frustration.  So ONCE AGAIN I tell Alexa to snooze... no problem.  When I tell Alexa to dismiss (turn off the alarm) NOTHING HAPPENS!!!! I repeated the same command 10-15 TIMES!!!!!!!!!! And each time looking at the light blue line THAT SHOWS IT'S LISTENING it doesn't.  4:30 IN THE MORNING is WAY TOO EARLY to have to deal with this crap.  All Alexa is good for is using the traffic and weather and possibly the video feature (that I don't use).  DON'T USE THE ALARM CLOCK!!!!!! Get another clock that you don't have to talk to because it will listen but DO NOTHING sometimes!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I've had it, I actually want to drop it from the tallest building I can find!

author: Kimberly Morris
title: Worked well, for about 3 months
content:
As a fan of the Alexa products, I was excited for the show.

Pros-easy to set up
-easy to link to calendar
-the right balance of voice sensitive
-beautiful display

Cons-not as intuitive as I would expect
-has trouble finding things on Prime video
-no YouTube access
-uses Bing as search engine

Biggest con, I have used it for about 3 months and the screen is starting to glitch. Started with lines across the bottom of the screen, now has lines flickering up through half of the display. Thought it might be interference from other appliances but problem persists when device is moved.

For the price I would expect to to work perfectly for beyond 3 months.

author: Gadgetguru
title: Is advertising and Alexa tips really an issue?
content:
I've read numerous reviews complaining about advertising and Alexa tips being constantly displayed on Echo Show. While you do not have the option to turn off Alexa tips, you can turn off the advertising on Echo Show's home screen (swipe down from top of Echo Show's screen>settings>home screen>home cards>notification switch off).

My home screen typically consists of either 2 or 3 pages. The first page shows the current time and weather forecast through an icon. The second screen shows my calendar appointments for the day. The third screen shows news events or things of interest. If I have nothing on my calendar for the day, that page will not be shown.

Are constant Alexa tips really a bad thing? In my opinion absolutely not! I have learned about so many things that Alexa can do for you from these tips. What good is a device if you are not using it to it's fullest potential? Also the font size of these tips is about 12pt which is not much bigger than the size of a standard line of an email when viewed on a computer. If you were more than 5-6 feet away from the screen at full brightness you would not be able to read the tips. That shouldn't be a problem for most people I would think.

The sound from the Show is every bit as good as the standard Echo. Maybe a little bit better. When listening to music it will display the lyrics for most (not all) songs. If you are listening to instrumentals or songs where the lyrics are not available the display will show the album cover, artist name and album title.

The Echo Show is a valuable asset to my home and I am considering purchasing Echo Spot's for my bedrooms.

author: Pamela
title: I bought I would like the large color screen but it's always so dark ...
content: I bought I would like the large color screen but it's always so dark and hard to see. This one also is always saying "Sorry, something went wrong" ....frustrating...I liked the Dot way better, I gave my Dot away, so I'll be ordering another one, esp now they are only $35

author: Foreman
title: It makes life easy
content: This thing is a must have for the home office. I really enjoy listening to music,news, weather. I have even linked it up with my security system and can see who is at the door. There is so much the echo show can do. I really enjoy it.

author: Joanne
title: Bravo Echo
content: I have the echo but got 2 show. 1 for my Daughter. Absolutely love it. Especially for the video chat.  Does have a flickering screen issue. Trying to get it resolved.

author: Londonlady
title: Buy one, as you will love it and what it can do.
content: Christmas Gift, so just learning about it. Have special light bulbs in my lamps, so can get Alexa to turn them on and off when needed. Love asking and getting recipes that I can actually see. Have Ring, so can actually see the person at front door,....so many things, and still learning. Pretty good for an 86 year old!

author: A. Harrison
title: My grandmother (101 years old) loves hers as her vision isnt great and she only needs to speak
content: We have now bought 3 of these. One for us and one each for my grandma and my husbands grandma. A little hard to get the second set up off of my account...while the others on my account went smoothly. My grandmother (101 years old) loves hers as her vision isnt great and she only needs to speak. She uses it daily to check weather, listen to music and ask random questions. The other grandmother hasnt had hers long so she is still getting used to it. The on screen calling has a slight delay which makes it hard for grandma to catch what's being said but that may be her wifi connection. Make sure you have amazon prime or amazon music if they like to listen to music.

author: Tom Pai
title: Without the support of YouTube, a key video feature ...
content: Without the support of YouTube, a key video feature is no longer available. Until this is resolved, I would avoid buying this product

author: Jeremy F.
title: Flickering screen after only 4 months.
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player I had such high hopes for this item working as advertised. So far as the typical Amazon echo functions, it works just fine. But when the screen is flickering so bad that you can’t see any of the video or the major functions that the Amazon echo show is meant for, especially only after four months of use I’m not optimistic about keeping this for much longer. I have contacted Amazon to which they continually send me into a loop of Technical Support with them trying to make me reset it without giving me the option of sending it back before disconnecting me and me having to start the entire thing all over again.

author: SiobhanMaire
title: Very tech, very useful!
content:
Love this! I love tech and this is perfect for my lifestyle.
I like having the custom Flash Briefing, I listen to it while having my coffee each morning. I do wish some of the flash briefing skills were available separately also.

author: Jean Socha
title: Buy Echo Show!!
content: So far we absolutely love our Echo Show. Getting information has never been easier!! Playing music, movies, turning on/off lights and appliances (with the hub, and smart bulbs/plugs) has been so convenient!! Marking my calendar, setting timers and alarms for cooking is wonderful! And dropping in to check on the house (and see my pets) has been stress relief!!

author: James Hayes
title: Another great product
content: We like ours.  We use mostly for lists and the fact we can now see the list makes it even better. I have ours showing my photos I have uploaded to Amazon, the screen is excellent.

author: Shelly Miller
title: Good for seeing your security camera.
content:
Love being able to see my camera on the screen. It’s nice when living alone to have the added safety. Much easier to get to than bringing it up on my iPhone ( nest camera).
As far as dislike:  not really a dislike. It’s just I had already bought the Echo which, except for the screen, does basically does the same thing. It’s a bit redundant.

author: NurseDevyn
title: Less then 4 mos old and burnt images on the screen!!
content: Unfortunately for the Show! I am very disappointed!  What Amazon hasn’t explained is when you leave your show on!! Images get burnt into the screen, I have owned my Show less then 5 months, the screen has already failed and has images or image lines,  it’s not made to be left on apparently and it’s ready features which I loved, have proven to be the Shows downfall..  Sorry Amazon but that was wasted money, now I have a very defective product on my hands!  I do not recommend the Echo Show for anyone.  Otherwise the rest of the Amazons features are great. Until they fix the screen problems we will avoid any video products in the future. The Show has great potential, I just don’t believe 1st or 2nd gens have really hit the nail on the head.  Product does have some nice and fun features but not enough to throw money away for your health, A warning should be clear that the product can not be left on 24/7 due to images being burnt in the screen.

author: Dolores
title: I received this as a gift and now I don’t ...
content: I received this as a gift and now I don’t know how lived without it! She keeps me notified of appointments as I have it connected with my iPhone. She is a fount of trivial information. And she helps me sleep at night; I always had trouble going to sleep and staying asleep. Now I simply ask Alexa to play calming music, meditation music or relaxing sounds and I’m asleep within 20-30 minutes.

author: Chalo6770
title: News with a View
content: Already owning two Echos I pretty much knew what I was getting with the Show. I wanted a visual alarm clock whereas with a standard echo I’d wake up in the middle of the night not knowing what time it was. Now I can. I also live the karaoke like feature of seeing lyrics along with the music that’s playing. My gripe is the same as all Echo owners. Alexa’s intelligence can be frustratingly limited at times.

author: RJChip
title: Not for me
content: Not what I expected. Basically a shopping vehicle for Amazon. Unit not very smart. That said, I am not that versed  in computer's  so those limitations may be my fault. Just couldn't justify the cost of the thing vs its usefulness top me

author: wsobchak
title: No YouTube or other good video news sources except for CNN.
content:
A very disappointing product that currently does not support YouTube videos or cbsn videos or NBC news videos.

Sounds good, but haphazard integration with Google products (including Google search) hampers its usability.

Wait for strong sales promotions to buy this product. The Amazon refusal to sell Google devices is hurting the consumers as the echo products do not integrate well with Google API, not because it can't be done, but because Amazon chooses not to do it.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Great Personal Assistant
content: I tend to be a gadget person and I couldn’t wait to get the Echo Show. It’s so many things in one. It’s an alarm clock, radio, TV, personal karaoke etc. I really like the recipes with videos. The only downside Alexa doesn’t always understand my Southern accent, lol.

author: Carol
title: Must have specific providers to use this
content: You MUST have Fios, Frontier, DISH, Fire TV to use video capability.  You cannot watch videos at all unless you have these. I tried to watch BBC news but even with it added it would not play. No Youtube either. This is pretty useless unless you have those. Also not as intuitive as my first echo this one seems dumb as more often than not it does not know answer.

author: FriscoFolks469
title: This is a fairly good product, from Amazon
content:
This is a fairly good product, from Amazon.  It has some very cool features, including functionality with Spotify and really cool timers and recipes.  There is significant room for improvement, though.  I can't believe there is no functionality with Apple Music.  I thought Amazon and Apple were plating nice, now.  I realize that Amazon would rather drive traffic to Amazon Music, but considering the flawless syncing with Spotify, that argument doesn't hold its ground.  Apple Music needs to be incorporated.  Additionally, the Ring video function (Amazon now owns Ring) is horrific.  It NEVER works with my Ring doorbell, despite engaging Tech Support.

Overall, this is a pretty cool "toy" with massive opportunities to improve.

author: Jan
title: Buy it, you will not regret it.
content:
I love this "Echo Show" and use it for so many things during the day and evening.  Entertainment, help around the house, answering all my questions, etc.etc.  It amazes me, and so easy to use.  I ask a question and get answers, I need a recipe and there it is, I do not write my shopping list, Alexa does it for me. In my kitchen it is magic for me, no need for getting out my recipe books anymore just follow the recipe on the screen.

Music, I cannot say enough about that, sheer pleasure!!.  The Tone of the music is so perfect,  The video so enjoyable, shows the Singer and words follow on the screen so you can sing along.  Gee, all I can say is Alexa You Are Magic.
So totally well worth every penny spent.  Amazon, this is a definite Keeper, You will never get this back from me:
(unless it quits working, and I know Amazon is so good to follow up on problems}

author: Alex Corbin
title: Faulty Screen in Both Original and Replacement
content:
Faulty Screen in Both Original and Replacement

Both the original one I ordered and the replacement for it both had faulty screens/digitizer issues. Would not order again. Hopefully the second gen model is an improvement.

author: Robt B. Porter
title: RED ALERT - YOUTUBE NO LONGER AVAILABLE ON SHOW
content: RED ALERT -- YOUTUBE NO LONGER AVAILABLE ON THE SHOW...this is my first Amazon review....The loss of YouTube is a Deal Breaker....It doesn't seem that this is going to get resolved......as others have said...it's very "useless" with out YouTube...too bad...Had so much potential!

author: Malcolm Granger
title: Awww, my Show is now almost 18 months old. What a good friend!
content:
Would love the new 2nd gen Echo Show and will perhaps trade-in for the new Show. My Show is a constant kitchen companion for nearly everything. Since there are like 17,000 reviews, I'll just add several notes. First, NO YOUTUBE! That was taken down months ago and I have never forgiven Amazon for this cry-baby feud with Google. Youtube was the bomb on the Show; now it's a clumsy workaround and not worth the effort.

I loved Youtube in the kitchen so much that I bought a competing 10inch Lenovo Smart Display. That is a whole other story and using the Lenovo just made me miss my Show even more. The Lenovo has a load of quirks like NO LYRICS (???) and cannot continues a playlist when you stop the device. Also, Google's own Google Play Music service is almost hidden from the Lenovo; it defaults to Spotify - sad. Just avoid the Lenovo.

Anyway, the Echo Show is still the best; lyrics work, Alexa is learning to be more personable, and the 50,000+ skills alone are amazing. Amazon Music is not bad actually, but alas no music videos.

Get the 2nd Gen Show! I know I will (eventually).

author: Trot Aceman
title: Amazon Prime Music + Stations + Multiple Room Groups = nothing but frustration!
content:
Because 8,000 reviews just isn't enough... here's one more, and I hope it helps someone.

Alexa is a great idea.  The Echo Show is also a great idea.  They stop being great ideas somewhere around when you realize you need the EXACT magic combination of words to get Alexa to do something that should be fairly simple like play an Amazon music station on a multi room group.  Oh, and by the way... about multi room groups...

Amazon tells us we can play music simultaneously on multiple devices.  We have three Echo Dots and an Echo Show, a multi room group called 'Everywhere' that includes all of those, and an Amazon Prime Music subscription.  I've gotten music to play on all of them, IF what I want to do is play an offbeat version of a single popular song.  As soon as I try to get the device(s) to play an album, or worse, a station I KNOW exists, it goes something like this:

"Alexa, play the station kids film favorites everywhere."
"I'm sorry, I can't find the station you requested."

"Alexa, play the amazon music station kids film favorites on the everywhere group."
"I could not find a station 'kids film favorites on the everywhere group' on Amazon Music."

"Alexa, play kids film favorites everywhere."
"I can't find the album 'kids film favorites."

"Alexa, play the amazon station kids film favorites everywhere."
"I could not find a station named 'kids film favorites everywhere' on Amazon Music."

"Alexa, play the amazon station kids film favorites on everywhere."
"Sorry, I could not find the station you requested."

And so on through every possible combination I can think of.  With no luck.

Then, just to give up in abject frustration:
"Alexa, play the Amazon music station kids film favorites"
"The station kids film favorites, from Amazon music."  (Playing on whatever device I'm next to).

So.  IF what you want to do is listen to the millions of songs Amazon advertises are included with a Prime Music subscription you paid for on devices that are supposed to be easily linked together, this does not work.  At all.  It leads to stressed parents and crying kids.

I'm sure there are any number of other things it does ok, but I have not found a lot that works in a simple fashion.  Maybe Amazon should stick to delivering orders quickly, or work a little harder at interpreting the voice commands better, because this just annoys us to the point where we're considering alternatives.

author: Amazon Customer
title: What a great gadget.
content:
I love my echo show. I have it in my bedroom . It is a great alarm clock. Hasn’t failed me yet.
It’s also great to ask questions to,and watch movies . If you’re thinking about getting one do it. I love mine.

author: Mike H
title: I like it but.......
content: So we purchased this for a few different reasons.  First, we wanted to be able to view the ring camera at the front door.  It does a great job of that.  We wanted to use it as a replacement alarm clock.  It does an OK job of this.  I would get 5 stars from me but every time Amazon updates the software on this thing, the clock gets smaller and smaller.  How difficult is it Amazon to make a face that has a LARGE clock?  Read the other reviews, this is by far the biggest downfall of this device.  If / when they fix this, I would rate it 5 stars.

author: kireviewer
title: wish it had bluetooth; video aspect not fully realized for Amazon
content:
This is nice, but I don't know if the video option is really worth it.  Without being able to do YouTube and other apps there isn't too much you can do with the video on this screen.  We mostly use it just like a non video Echo.

The sound quality is a step up from a normal Echo and much better than a Dot, but it isn't that great.  I really don't want to listen to music on it that much.

I wish it came with Bluetooth so I could stream to my home stereo.

author: sbi3
title: Alexa is a fun tool
content: Alexa is a fun tool. I listen to music a lot, ask her questions although she doesn’t always know the answer or understand what I’m asking but overall she is good company and well worth the money.

author: TR6vs911
title: Freakin stupid
content:
Whats the use of having this. They pulled youtube again 12/5/17 because of google owning it or is it google doesnt have a answer to the show having only home. Or could it be Amazon trying to make you pay for one of there services either way Ive had enough bought it at Target its going back I have no desire to play in anyone's wars!  It does function fine does screw up had to reset it once

update 11 Dec 17 I have this til 21 Feb 18 by Targets receipt so Il keep it til then. I found its true calling its heavy enough a door stop it will work awesome holding a door open and if I want to listen to CNN news I can use it when I want a good laugh. Its great lets see Ive had to reset it 3x now keep buying it people. Its a huge disappionment junk!

author: Michael Lusby
title: A Must Have Device !
content: This is such an incredible value I could not pass on it. Being able to request music, news, weather, etc by vocal command is such a delight. This is a must have device !

author: Amazonian
title: "Drop in" is great for elderly parents -- all over the world
content: My mother-in-law lives in Taipei, Taiwan, and we got her an Echo Show in her house (registered to my wife's name). Since my mother-in-law is 90-years-old, hard of hearing, non-tech-saavy and does not speak English, the "drop-in" feature is great for speaking face-to-face with her across the ocean. She doesn't even have to speak any commands or touch and operate any buttons! It is a God-sent for checking in on elderly parents. Highly recommended if you are in the same situation!!!

author: Schaun O'Brien
title: ... gadget that is available but so far I am disappointed. The screen should be more customizable than it ...
content: I bought this product because I must have every gadget that is available but so far I am disappointed .  The screen should be more customizable than it is.  The ability to get to videos should be simpler.  Echo Show commands should be separated from the store and easier to find.

author: Jen H
title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
content:
At first I wasn't sure I wanted the video screen. Then, on Prime Day, I thought maybe I did want one for my kitchen, but I didn't want to be impulsive. Then, they were on sale again and I pulled the trigger. The speakers are really good and put out good sound, however there is distortion at volume 10. Also, there is a HUGE jump in volume between 5 and 6. It kinda needs a volume 5.5. I feel like the Show can hear me from further away than my Dot can. It is so much fun.

My boyfriend, who absolutely hated Alexa when I got my Dot, liked the sound so much he wanted one for our master bathroom. So the day after I got my kitchen Show, I ordered him a bathroom Show. (Then I had to order the screen protector with the camera cover!)

I'm not ready to use this for calls yet, because I have concerns about Amazon infiltrating my contacts. But otherwise, I love it and this is my favorite Alexa product. Now that I have 3 devices in the house, I upgraded to the Unlimited Music family plan so we can play different music on different devices at the same time. With the family plan, you can have up to 6 family members and/or devices playing at the same time, so I included my daughter in the plan.

I set up a group with all the devices so I can tell Alexa to play whatever I want to listen to on the everywhere group and hear it no matter where I am in the house. It's also so convenient to be able to drop in on any other device and use it like an intercom system.

I am so glad I splurged on this. I love it and I use it every single day.

author: Andrea DeFeo
title: Drop in feature is scary
content: The drop in feature needs a bell or something to let the other person know you dropped in.  When I drop in on my sister I appear in her kitchen and now what?  She has a 3 story house and other than a low chime she has no idea I am there.  I found myself yelling like a crazy person trying to get someone’s attention.  I now use a megaphone to yell into her house until someone realizes I am up there.  They have dropped in on me when I was home alone and all I heard was talking downstairs.  It scared the crap out of me.  I thought someone was in my house.  Crazy feature.  I don’t want to disable it because on the plus side it allows her small kids to call me whenever they want to say hi.

author: missyO
title: LOVE it!
content: This was our first Alexa product and there was a bit of a learner curve but now we live it! She turns lights on/off/dim/bright/change comour - she tells us time, weather, traffic, mearby shops/restaurants, finds recipes, plays music, keeps shopping and to-do lists updated, plays prime video - all through voice commands! Sometimes she forgets how to pause videos which is strange and irritating, but for the most part we’ve been very happy with it.

author: P.R.A.
title: I like the idea but it seems to be missing some ...
content: I just purchased this a few days ago but have owned an Echo, Echo dot, spot, & tap.  I like the idea but it seems to be missing some pretty basic stuff.  First I wish I could just tap on the temperature on the home screen and see the forecast, or even be able to configure the home screen to always show it.  Second it would be nice to be able to configure relevant news (or other information) to show on the home screen instead of the constant 'things to try'.  In some ways I was hoping for more of a tablet experience with this.  It seems like there is a lot of potential for this with the screen, but is currently underutilized.

author: Dr. C
title: It’s great at doing exactly what you don’t want it to do.
content: I bought it primarily as a kitchen assistant.  The only problem is the screen always dims as I’m trying to read a recipe.  When I ask Alexa to turn the brightness up so I can actually read it, she returns to the recipe search, backing put of the recipe I’m trying to read and without even turning the display up.  It’s incredibly aggravating.

author: irene
title: I love the drop in ability
content:
bought for my 83 yr old dad. He LOVES it. Dances we can keep int touch. I love the drop in ability. He said. " it's like having a companion!"
liked it so much I bought myself one too :)

author: Rus
title: More convenient than Echo
content: I had Echo and then I got Echo Show as a gift. I like the touch screen, it’s just additional feature that is nice to have. News headlines, tips and recommendations on the screen, weather on the screen without having to ask for it. Cancel timer by swiping up on the screen without having to use voice command. Love it

author: Benjamin Robert Davis
title: Perfect
content: Love it. Awesome price as well!!

author: Paul Swanson
title: Alexa keeps telling me the birthdays of people I barely know online from social media.
content: We have it in the kitchen and it gives us recipes.  We are learning what Alexa can do.  I would really like to know how to stop Alexa from telling me all the birthdays she found on my phone or my computer or facebook or?  I would rather have it remind me of only the birthdays of people who are actually in my life.  How do you do that?

author: Frances M. Baynard
title: I am enjoying my new Echo Show and am constantly ...
content: I am enjoying my new Echo Show and am constantly thinking of new things to try.  I only wish I had purchased two for $100.00 more.

author: Voracious Reader
title: All kinds of surprises! all good...
content: Just discovered I could answer my home phone via this device - very handy! Of course, I love streaming music and music videos through it, too. Love it!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Love my echo show
content: Love my echo show! I can now see my grandkids when I call them. This is my 4th echo device and not disappointed at all! The sound is good picture is clear. Like being able to look see time and temperature. Just be sure to check out all the skills.

author: Desertdude
title: Great Device!
content: I love the show,  originally I didn’t think I would need a show since I have the  original echo, the dot, and the tap. But I bought one on sale and love it. I love the screen to show you what you’re listening too. I can also ask the echo show to show me my blink cameras and they appear on the screen. I would highly  recommend buying one.

author: Mary- Jude Neal
title: Not much here...get a Kindle Fire instead
content:
I was initially excited about this new Echo device but it really doesn't do much. Two stars are given for design: it's compact and skeek.

First of all, the screen is small. I cant imagine watching a movie on this screen unless I was holding the device in my hand or on my lap.

Also, and this is a biggie, ourside of a few Alexa Skills, the only thing this can show is Amazon movies. No Internet. This device does not display Internet content. Also, due to ongoing feud between Google/Amazon, YouTube videos cannot be accessed.

Imo a regular Kindle Fire is a far better option. I see why the Show has decreased in price so much these past few weeks. Maybe the next version will be capable of more but for now it's really limited.

author: sharon
title: Five Stars
content: It is so awesome, i love it, much more than i expected

author: LlaunaC
title: I thought it would be a nice screen in the kitchen instead of my tablet
content:
Received this as a Christmas gift. I thought it would be a nice screen in the kitchen instead of my tablet, but it does not interface with apps I already frequent. It's a fine product but it's not right for everyone.

Items that would make my rating increase would be:
Being able to link individual  accounts for skills to your individual profiles in Alexa/Echo (Spotify, Calendar, etc)
Easier search functionality in Amazon Video since my Echo does not like "play (show) season X, episode X" as a proper command
Apps for Paprika recipes book

author: Jerry Archuleta
title: Screen distortion just after warranty out.
content: Had my echo show for just a little over a year. So warranty out. And this happens.  No wasn't dropped. Bottom of screen distortion getting worse by the day!

author: Scottso
title: Great next step for Alexa!
content: Great, fun device.  The sound is very good, the picture is sharp, and it integrates well with Amazon Video and audio.  Basically, its Alexa with a screen.  As time goes on it promises to become even more useful.

author: Miss
title: Simple to use and helpful!
content:
So simple to use and very helpful! I ask Alexa for a lot of information and of course, to get my daily affirmation. LOL

Everyone should have one! Get it!

author: Charley Davis
title: A "friggin" mazing....LOVE LOVE LOVE. A must have in every smart home.
content: I absolutely love my show. She operates my entire house and I cannot imagine not having my Echo Show. When I say she operates my entire house I mean that by, she operates my wireless security system, I can activate the cameras inside and outside my home through the Alexa App that I installed on my phone that will remotely operate my Echo Show. All of my Echo dots that I have scattered throughout my home also hook up to my Echo Show and I can ask my Show to turn on a specific dot in a specific room or I can ask my dots to do things that only my Show can do. its very interesting how they all work and interact with one another. She also operates my wireless plugs that I have my lights and TV's hooked up to and I can either speak to my Show or my connected Dots to operate the plugs without even moving or through the Alexa App I can remotely turn lights or radios or TVs that are plugged into the wireless plugs on and off at my command. I can even watch movie trailers and Amazon shows and movies on my Echo Show. Oh and let me not forget...I have Dish TV and my Show will turn my channels for me if you have satellite with Dish TV. It is amazing.

author: Teachaway
title: I love the new Amazon Echo
content: Well, I love the new Amazon Echo.  I can see my shopping list displayed, and I can also see any alerts that come across the screen.  The tunes show the lyrics which I greatly appreciate.  The time and temperature is always there.  My daughter purchased the Amazon Tap for me a couple of years ago.  I carry that with me throughout the house to listen to music.  I was not at all disappointed with the new Echo Show.  I love it.

author: R. Chapman
title: Versatile machine
content: My wife and I like the "do not disturb" function. We really like the video and pictures taking capabilities. Also the phone call video function is really nice to have. My wife uses it to check weather, also for spelling words and answering questions. We love it.

author: S. L. Small
title: Great present for the ‘rents!
content: Got this as a gift.  My parents love this.  My dad has reduced eyesight, so telling it what to play instead of looking it up has really brightened his day.  And he can ask it questions about stuff.

author: Alison M Mills
title: Ticked Off
content: I need someone to help me correct an issue with this stinking product - which was purchased for my parents, and you stinking customer support is not set up to troubleshoot an issue that is not a device that is not owned by me.  The product is faulty, and I need to help my parents correct it.  You have no phone number to call.  It's still under warranty, but you don't make it easy to have an issue addressed.  It's got a glitchy screen, and needs to be fixed.  What do you do to fix it?

author: LV2H8ME
title: It was almost the greatest device I ever owned!
content:
Overall I like my Echo Show. I have had nine for over a year now.  But there are two simple things that could/should be added to the Show to make it Perfect!

1. Ethernet port- The wireless works very well, but some people, like myself, love a wired connection. Wired is always faster than wireless.

2. Audio port-The bluetooth works good most of the time. Sometimes it hiccups. I believe it is from interference from other electrical devices,there's a lot in my room ha. If Echo had a dedicated audio port 3.5mm or optical, i would really use my Echo for music alot more than i do now.  I also use my Echo to display my security cameras. It works awesome!

I was hoping the 2nd gen Echos would have these ports, but it doesnt seem like they do. #sadface

author: Will R
title: I like it
content: I got it on a good deal. I like it better than plain echo because It can show me things, and it basically works as a digital picture frame when I'm not talking to it.

author: MsHI2u
title: Love our Alexa
content: Love our Alexa. Since buying one for the office and one for home, my sisters have all bought one so our whole family is connected. :) So much fun for family get togethers. We play games and listen to music. And it helps us keep in touch so much easier.

author: T. Carr
title: Awesome product when it had all the capabilities advertised.
content:
Awesome product. Would have loved to be informed that they removed Youtube from the device though without having to wonder why it wasnt working. I Think a portion of the price should be refunded
for cuatomers who have bought the show for the ability to have Youtube on their devices.

author: giovanni arteaga
title: This device is defective
content: This divides have a hardware issue I have sent mine to get fix and after I got it back it started having the same problems i would recommend this product

author: Christine Case
title: Love this!
content: I love this product.  Recipes, video calling and lyrics, not to mention the amazing speaker!  I will be buying one for each of my kids for Christmas so we can all video call.

author: J H
title: Doesn’t work well with Nest cameras
content: I bought this especially to view my Nest cameras however it doesn’t always work.  I will make the request and Alexa will say “ok” but nothing appears.  Kind of frustrating.

author: OldDawg143
title: Well worth the money
content: It’s great.  Visual is great.  Grandkids watch movies on it.  You can see lyrics on songs.  Alexa puts all kinds of great ideas on for you.  I recommend this if you like useful gadgets.

author: Greg B.
title: Garbage, avoid.
content:
The suggestions cannot be turned off, turned off some things in settings that still didn't turn off.
Poorly crafted device, looks and feels like an unfinished product.

author: Andrew S
title: I like it
content: I like it over all. Playing music there doesn't seem to be as much bass as the echo speaker but the sound is still pretty good and can fill the room. The angle for the camera isn't Amazing but it entirely depends on what you set it on height wise. I do like that the screen stays on and shows you news and weather. I use it in conjunction with the nest cam and it works flawlessly. I probably don't even scratch the surface of what this thing can do. It's an Alexa speaker with a touch screen simple to use interface.

author: TK403
title: Limited uses, screen failing after only 4 months.
content:
I bought the Echo Show back in in July. I don't use it much, honestly. Sometimes I have it play music, but that's about it. It's neat when the lyrics are on the screen if you're close enough to want to watch it and sing along, but really the screen is too small to be useful for much else. Mostly just novelty.

Now, about 4 month later, the screen is failing (see video) and the device no longer responds to "Alexa" or anything else for that matter. She's just been sitting on the counter, mostly undisturbed for a few months; not close to any heat sources, not in the direct sunlight, not near any sort of water. No idea why this is failing already.

author: Christine
title: If you need answers, she's not sure...
content: Alexa knows absolutely nothing! I find it I constantly have to ask Alexa to Google information which she will not do. I have to tell Alexa to go to Google and then search for the information myself. It's pointless. while I do enjoy the video show and the fact that it connects with my phones and make calls, most of the people who I need to call Alexa cannot seem to dial into. Womp Womp. #return

author: Collette
title: ❤️ THis echo show is awesome we love it
content: ❤️ THis echo show is awesome we love it.  We have echo dot & echo plus also.  This one with its screen is truly the best!  All the features are great it gives on screen updates of what is happening all day long with words.  LOVE LOVE LOVE ❤️❤️❤️. The Alexa apps good morning beautiful & good night are so cool they have really complimentary verses to lift your spirits up in the morning & at night they say things that really make you happy & you sleep better for them.  Thank you amazon for lifting my spirits with my loved companion Alexa she keeps me busy throughout the day❤️❤️❤️

author: Annie M
title: Was initially really happy with the Echo Show
content: Was initially really happy with the Echo Show...currently very disappointed with the fact that You Tube videos are no longer available on the Echo Show.  Also not happy that the price was recently decreased...

author: Gonzalo Delrisco
title: Long way to go
content:
Big Expectations, after reading some of the reviews.
I have to admit that as usual the case and presentation of the product is impeccable; well packed and high quality material.
connection inter amazon products...a piece of cake except my zmodo cameras that I can't make them work. There is no much difference between the echo show and the rest of the Alexa devices except the display to show time, temperature and whatever pictures you upload in your account. You can create family vault pictures, albums etc.
Sound is great and there is no distortion. Definition of the display is very good.
I heard in the past it was possible to play you tube in the device, that would be a very nice feature as well if amazon premium videos were able to be played. I recommend to wait for the price drastically decreases from $240.00 or the features of the device increases up to a much higher level.

author: dan martin
title: Today’s technology is truly amazing! 😍
content: I like the Echo Show - Black; it finds almost everything that I wanted to do. What I like least is the speaker on it is cracked or crackles like it’s broke like a speaker that are used to have years ago in a car that had a crack in it made weird noise when you turned it up about halfway. It can find almost everything that I wanted to do. What I like least is the broken speaker...😪.  I Remedied the problem by running my Alexis through my surroundsound system and use the speakers on my surroundsound system instead of the Alexa show.

author: Yas
title: I'm loving my non-stop Jazz music with Alexa!
content:
I had been eyeing this for a while; every since I purchased an Echo for my Mother's Xmas present. I purchased hers' on sale, due to the holiday promotions - GREAT incentive! Needless to say, the price of these babies (not the Echo-Dot) had me on the fence; that truly being the deciding factor. Well, when I saw Amazon had  this model discounted by $100, I broke the entire fence! I quickly let my fingers do the walking on my mobile app. I'm so happy I did, because I haven't stopped playing it since I burst open my box.
I only hope it continues to work properly, because my Mother's Echo had multiple problems, resulting in (2) exchanges.
So, I'm keeping my fingers crossed with this one-LOL!!!

author: Thomas O'Brien
title: Finish the Job Amazon  -  Where is the comprehensive setup help video?
content:
While the show has some cool features it is difficult to set things up. There should be a how too video but nothing other than some promo videos. Finish the  customer support Amazon.  Sending me to the app...which is already confusing is NOT the solution.  If you really want people to use for ecommerce...well create a video.  For example I bought one for a friend of the family...he is 99 but still very active.  How do I set up the video phone for both of us...Guess what...Go to the Video App..does not help.

Get that done and I'll write another review.  Oh and the sound is not as vibrant or as loud as my standard echo...
Tom O’Brien

author: John Carter
title: Great sound and features!
content: So far I’m very pleased with my Echo Show.  The problem is, there’s so much it can do that I haven’t been able to explore the extent of its abilities! I got the special price as part of the Prime Day promotion...and you just can’t beat what you get for the price.  Very pleased with the sound. The video screen is sharp. Sometimes it takes a few tries to get Alexa to perform a command...but as I get to know the system better, I’m hoping that will improve.  One drawback in the music...I’ve noticed a lot of the songs from years past, are re-recordings by the original artist...but not the original recording itself.  Example: Secret Agent Man by Johnny Rivers...a “live”version is used, not the original version.  If I’m going to pay for Prime Music...I’d like to hear the original version of songs...not later recordings.  Or at least give me a choice of what I want to hear.  Otherwise, I am very pleased with my Echo Show.  So pleased in fact, that I bought a second one!

author: Michael Welte
title: Screen Constantly Flickers (happened on the old one and the replacement)
content: I enjoy the echo show for what it offers....IF the screen worked which it doesn't. It constantly flickers as you can see in the video. Also this isn't the first one I've had, it's the 2nd, I returned the first one with the same issue. I called Amazon again and their response was "we can replace it" which would just cause the same problem all over again. Was really hopeful on these devices, but looks like it's time to give Google home a try.

author: B Sandy
title: Great device but needs more "show".
content:
I purchased my Show mainly to be used as a clock radio. In this aspect, it has met my expectations with some exceptions. Now one can use echo devices to set alarms using your own selected music or music from one of many streaming services. It's also great to be able to fall asleep to music using the command to set a sleep timer to any number of minutes (or hours) you desire. The sound quality is very good. If you set the screen to "do not disturb" it gets dark enough so that it will not interfere with your sleep. However if you say a command while in do not disturb, the screen will light up. There should be a way to disable this.

The device is lacking is in its limited ability to customize its screens. The home screen does not show your next set alarm setting. Since I often need to change my alarm, this can be an annoyance. You either need to ask alexa to show you your alarms or go to the do not disturb mode to view your alarm. The home screen also only shows the first event on your calender, which will remain showing even after the event is completed and is inconsistent as to when it displays the following day's event. There is also a "Good morning" screen that displays the time when you wake up but surprisingly does not show the current temperature. Again, I need to ask alexa to tell me the temperature.

Hopefully, Amazon will address these issues in a future update. Meanwhile, I am keeping my Alexa Show.

author: Felix
title: Awesome
content: I waited for the perfect time to buy the echo show, when the price dropped.  If I would have know it was going to make a difference in my daily routine I would have purchased it when I first wanted to.  Alexa app is awesome.  Alexa understands you clearly not like the other folks.  The sound and video out of this system is superb.  The home apps for all the lights, cameras, etc work well with Alexa.

author: Theresa A. Sielski
title: Echo Show a disappointment.
content: Same ease of use for music and questions.  I like being able to see the words to songs as they are played.  Looking recipes is nice.  Sound not as rich as original Echo.  Tried hooking up Alexa to my cellular phone so I could chat with my father.  We bought him an Echo Show when we purchased ours.  So far the app has only successfully accessed my personal files and contact list.  The app takes me around in circles and prompts me to call customer service to make it work.  Customer services has me going around in circles removing app and reloading it.  So far the reason I bought not only one, but two Echo Show and four Echo Spot devices and I have yet to successfully connect my phone or any of these devices to each other.

author: Steven
title: Not as good as I thought it would be
content:
This Echo Show was a gift and it had many problems.

First of all the speaker sounded pretty bad.  I can hear the vibrations in the speaker when playing on volume 5.  I never had any sound problems  like this with other Echo or Echo Dots that I previously purchased.  Its possible the speaker is defective but it was difficult to find that kind of support on the Amazon website.

I could barely get it to play a video. I was able to get a video list from youtube.com, as per instructions, but the video titles were not readable.  When I asked the echo to play a number selection it did nothing.  I tried several times but had to give up.  I finally did get a movie trailer, not on youtube, to work so I know its not a Wi-Fi issue playing videos.

So I tried to get it to play news videos and asked it to play my video news briefing.  That request would bring up Pandora and play my last music channel.  That happened a few times before I gave up.

Truly disappointing from the experience I had with all of my other Echo's.

On a positive note I was able to upload a picture to the background screen without problem.

author: Gary Gagliardi
title: As Revolutionary as Original Echo!
content:
For a first generation device with no competition in sight, this product is a conceptual breakthrough. Five years from now, this will the way in which most computer interactions will take place. I expect five years from now, this will be the television that we use, only we will "touch" the screen with a video pointer of some kind.

Solves a lot of problems with audio-only communication. For example, want to hear deals of the day? No, you want to see them and scroll through. The order by number. Every wanted to know the lyrics to the song. Look at the screen.

Can only imagine this getting better and better, but we have to compare this all the alternative ways currently available. Is this a lot better than audio tools like original echo and all the new competitors? Yes, absolutely. Is this better than doing similar things on my tablet or computer? Yes, it is hands free. Screen is big enough to see and stands up in its own. Speaker is decent.

Is there stuff to criticize? Yes, doesn't seem to have Bluetooth.

author: Disneylover
title: Enjoying the Echo Experience
content:
It’s a fairly useful addition to our Alexa family. I was hoping we would use the “show” feature a bit more but for the price it is nice and I am sure as we continue to learn all the things the unit can do beyond playing music and answering a few basic questions we will enjoy it.

One feature I do love is the do not disturb feature you can turn on at night to dim the unit. Brilliant!

author: Badger Guy
title: Amazon Echo Show does not work consistently with the Arlo Pro 2 camera system. Beware if you need that feature.
content: I purchased the Echo Show to link it to the Arlo Pro 2 Security camera system from Netgear. I can rarely get it to connect and it often locks up the Echo Show. I am using a Netgear Alexa capable wireless router so it should work and have tried resetting the apps. There are lots of reviews about this problem but no solutions. The message people receive is "waiting for Arlo" or something similar and then the Echo show locks up. Both Amazon and Netgear should immediately stop advertising that these cameras work with the Amazon Show and Amazon Spot unless they fix this major problem. The other Alexa features of the Amazon Show seem to work alright but I would not buy this device if you expect it to work with the Arlo security devices.

author: old_john
title: Echo Dot with a Screen - Camera support is weak!
content:
I bought the Show for the video aspects; Drop In seems okay but audio is delayed and garbled sometimes; not much success in connecting to our existing Hikvision cameras around the outside of our home. They worked one day but not the next; seems like this feature is still being "crowd tested". Alexa needs a better skill for managing video & security cameras.
I don't like that all my contacts are now stored in Alexa - there must be some way to edit or disable the contacts I do not want to reach through Alexa-phone.

Let the Buyer beware!

author: Hacksaw
title: Excellent but could have been better.
content:
I have two of these Echo shows the microphone quality is great and picture is good way better than the nucleus intercom. It's awesome being able to see what Alexa is talking about instead of just hearing it. Now for the problems there's no physical shutter to block the camera only a button to turn it on and off and the button also turns off the microphone so it's both on or both off not one or the other. There is not separate volumes for when Alexis speaks to you and the music playback so expect to be adjusting the volume often so you can hear what Alexa is saying if you're like me you listen to music at a low volume especially at night time when sleeping when I wake up in the morning I like to ask her the briefing or the weather but the volume down low from the music so I have to stop her turn the volume up and then start over then when I go to play music the music is blasting loud. This should be a simple fix considering there are separate volumes for the alarm. Another problem no IR lights which means no night vision so if you doing a video or just checking in on a room you have to turn the lights on. Also while in a video call Alexa will do only pretty much hang up or end call she won't turn the lights on or off or do anything else that's a problem no IR light can't see in the dark and can't turn the lights on while in a call. No ethernet port no USB port no SD card slot only one hole for the power cord enough said about that. Also does not work with things that claims it does says it works with ring video doorbell it does barely you cannot answer the doorbell only ask Alexa to see the front door no two-way conversation nucleus intercom does this quite well I was very disappointed that this does not. Nucleus cameras sure you can pull them up but you see them for a second then buffering then you see it for another second then buffering and not even the good type of buffering where you can see an image and it's frozen the screen just goes black and says buffering so trying to make out anything on them is pretty hard unless you have a photographic memory. But still a very good purchase just make sure when you get one to tell Amazon every problem you see in every problem you have so they fix it cuz if no one speaks up nothing gets fixed. Separate volumes FIX IT!!!!

Update sep 19 2017
Dropped another star because if you have let's say three of these and you tell it to call one of the devices it rings them all so no one knows who the cause for or who the calls coming from because the matter which device calls which device it says home calling not the name of the device that you name it. Call Amazon about this their response was to use the drop-in feature I replied if I had kids and wanted to make sure they weren't killing each other in some room other than the one I'm in great but we're all adults here and I don't want somebody dropping in on me in my bedroom with a camera at any time unexpectedly. Come on Amazon use common sense and stop with the one step forward 30 steps back crap.

author: Jan
title: Echo Show is Great
content: Love this item and setup was easy.  However, the only complaint I have is that the camera does not follow you as you move about the room. You must have cell phone, amazon account, and gmail account to use if you are going to communicate with someone via video for initial setup.  Just FYI.

author: GhostriderGale
title: Great for using recipes on the show for cooking different meals
content: It works as I expected, read many reviews before buying so there was no surprises I wasn’t expecting. I certainly like the speakers much better then the speakers in the dots. The dots need those speakers too

author: Mike W.
title: Defective Devices and Bad Customer Service
content:
I received this as a gift and was pretty happy with it from the start. After a few months, the screen started flickering and I had to exchange it for another refurbished device. This replacement now has the SAME issue. It is quite an inconvenience to experience this twice and have to be without the device for the time it takes to ship as well as have to deal with the customer service each time. My whole family purchased these so they could see their grandchild and now we can't even do that since my Show spends most of it's time in the mail.

After chatting with customer service, they will only offer me another refurbished - and likey defective - product OR they will offer me a refund at a whopping 50% of the value! I couldn't be more unsatisfied with both product and customer service. I realize they no longer sell this terrible generation, but definitely would not recommend purchasing it anywhere else.

author: Donna Allman
title: Potential uses are exciting.
content: We are enjoying it, but it's hard to learn to use all its features. Not sure whether some is ready for prime time or not. So I still don't know whether I wil be able to use it as a substitute for TV remote, for example. Also haven't learned to sync wel with a fairly close by echo.

author: Beth P
title: I love it!
content: I love it! I can see my security cameras, FaceTime with my kids, control the lighting and temp with Alexa. The speaker could use a little up grade but overall I’m very happy with it!

author: Andrew
title: Unfortunate screen issue ruined the experience.
content: Worked well for a bit, until the screen issue started. Amazon claimed that they would have a software fix within the week but it has been a few weeks and still no fix. They say it isn’t a hardware issue, but the screen is unusable at the moment. Disappointed with the lack of help with the issue to be sure.

author: wirble
title: Does not show video alert from cloud cam automatically
content: I bought it because I also have the Amazon Clod Cam. I was hoping the videos alet would show on the screen automatically. It does not. You have to say show me.  I rather buy the Wyzemecam for 20 versus the cloud cam of this is the case. Amazon...if you are listening, you meed to make this the option to beat out thecompetition cameras.

author: Slovak34
title: At some point, Amazon decided to mess with the ...
content: At some point, Amazon decided to mess with the most interesting feature - the news feed. Rather than getting headlines on important and breaking news stories, I’m given the option of seeing a celebrity video, “World Update” (with no further explanation) or trending fashion.

author: capnpik
title: Great addition to our Echo/Alexia house.
content: We love our Echo Show, use it most every day. We have it mounted in the kitchen and it has been a welcome addition. If you have an Echo and get along with Alexia you will like it. People either get it with using Alexia and love it or they don't get it. It works great for us with no complaints. Just the normal arguments with Alexia :)

author: Ken Linkish
title: Like the screen, speaker is a little better than the dot but it doesn’t work as well as the dot
content: The voice recognition doesn’t work as well as the echo dot. If you have multiple reminders and don’t “dismiss” a reminder before the next one appears the following reminders will not be on time. I bought this for the better speakers and I’m not that impressed. I do like having the screen but wish it worked better.

author: JEANNINE
title: really disappointed.
content: For about $200.00 it should go on the internet, but it doesn't.!. really disappointed.

author: J. Cammarata
title: Disappointed with Amazon's support on this product
content: Worked for a few weeks and then had static lines all over the bottom half of the screen. Called Amazon customer support who had me ship it back for repair. Any it back to me without a power cord, even though I sent it to them with it. Then I prefer a new power cord and it looked fine, for two weeks. Now it is even worse than the first time.

author: Lou Spinnazola
title: A Welcome Addition to My Home
content: This is my first venture into getting Alexa into my home.  I was waiting for Amazon to run a special price, and when it happened, I snapped it up.  At this point, getting to know the specific voice commands that will make Alexa more useful has been my focus.  I immediately took to the interface with TuneIn Radio.  That was a big selling point for me.  I'm disappointed that YouTube no longer works with this device.  If you're listening, Amazon...  The next skill I'd like to see is to have Alexa recognize and play my personal music at home provided by my DLNA music server.  I will slowly begin to add smart lighting and cameras.  The 'Drop In' capability is very cool.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good device,  not smart like siri though
content:
The speaker on the echo plus is far more superior than on the show. Alexa is not very bright yet. Often times when we ask her a simple question,  her answer is something along the lines of 'Hmmmm, I don't know the answer to that'.  Hopefully in time,  Alexa will become more intelligent. On the other hand,  she is very convenient to have in the common area for listening to music,  dropping in on friends,  family,  getting weather,  news watching short videos,...  It's nice that she displays lyrics for songs when available.
The one thing that disappoints me about amazon Alexa in general is that you have to upgrade and pay for prime music for each device you own otherwise you are quite limited to what you can listen to. I don't think that's fair. 5 devices in one house and I have to upgrade each device?  If I'm wrong, someone please correct me. But each time I try to listen to music she tells me I need to upgrade.

author: Percy
title: DO NOT BUY Bad Engineering
content:
this product in not ready for market, needs more engineering, current state is junk.
I recommend DO NOT BUY You will waste your time getting it to work, I gave up after 2 days and returned it.

author: Suzanne D.
title: Love it so far
content: Love it so far, but the music selections are so specific they can appear limited. The custom algorithm keeps bringing you back to your favorite songs so much so that you get tired of hearing them. I hope that I do not learn to hate my favorite tunes.

author: Nite
title: it is useful. My main use case was kids (who are ...
content:
Echo Show is a decent device. I definitely feel this is version 1 - and the hardware will be updated in coming years. The screen size seems a bit smaller, and could be larger. But despite that, it is useful. My main use case was kids (who are too young to have cell phone) could watch YouTube video about travel, drawing or other things they are curious about. That use case worked ok for 3 days - before the current spat between Google and Amazon. You can no longer watch YouTube videos on Echo Show either through a native app or through their website.

The reason for 1 star - send a message to both Google (YouTube) and Amazon to grow up!!! I love both products. Don't make me chose between one or the other!

If the spat between the companies is not resolved, I would be returning my device as a protest. It's a nice to have, not a must have - so I can easily live without it.

author: Linh T. Nguyen
title: I loved it! I knew that it was still new ...
content: Initially, I loved it!  I knew that it was still new but it did a lot of awesome things.  Then, we lost youtube and that stinks.  We used youtube a lot.  We hope it comes back and also maybe some netflix.

author: Ckf1962
title: Another great gadget for your home!
content: My favorite gadget!  Personalized to my liking!  The screen started going out and it was still under warranty.  I contacted Amazon and they repaired it and sent it back. I am noticing an orange line at the bottom of my screen every once in a while may have to send back again. It should have been replaced with a new one. All I can say is get you one if you like being able to watch videos, look up recipes, make phone calls (live), send a text without texting watch a bear hunt ask questions and get an answer or just stream music or your favorite book.  May get my mother one once I know I will have no more problems with this one.

author: Ghargis
title: Echo Show needs tweeking
content: Dont have smart home devices added yet. Display screen does not always follow the do not disturb hours. Use the Show as an alarm. Sometimes screen stays on after alarm turned off even though I have the alarm set during the do not disturb time frame. Not really clear how to turn off display screen without using my voice and since I wake up much earlier than my husband I don’t want to disturb him by speaking Alexa command so almost always turn off the unit completely.  Even when asking the show suggested skills I find the it not being able to show or pull the information requested even though it was a suggested skill.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love the drop in feature!
content: I love it! This was a gift from my daughter so we could drop in and talk to their family! I love the screen resolution! It's a fun device and we easily added it into our network of other Echo devices in our household. While working in the kitchen, I can get the news while and visit children and grandchildren at the same time! It's a great gift for families who live at a distance.

author: john pointer
title: Wasn't sure at first
content: When I first received this as a Christmas gift, I asked myself, now what the heck am I going to do with this thing? After about a day or so I learned about " Skills ". I found out how to prompt Alexa to give me news briefings and other useful tasks. When I found out she could stream my XM Serius programs I was ecstatic . Now I start my day with my New York Times briefing, the weather, stock report and start listening to Howard Stern show. You know, I wasn't sure at first but Alexa is now my girl ! PS, also have Echo Dot that I love too.

author: Jessica Andersen
title: Great upgrade from the original echo
content: We have had an original echo in our kitchen and when the show was on sale for Prime Day I wanted to try it. I have loved the upgrade to the show. I enjoy playing music and having the lyrics pop up on the screen. I like being able to have my photos play on the screen. We use it a lot for timers while cooking and I like being able to just see the timer on the screen instead of having to ask how much time is left. I'm sure we haven't figured out the best way to use it for everything it can do, but I definitely think it was worth it.

author: Dru
title: Amazon is way ahead of Apple
content: Great Amazon product. I have the Dot and now I have the Show. I have this on my nightstand by my bed. I like the alarm clock on it. I was so glad when Sirius XM came to Alexa. Love to be able to listen to my Sirius XM on the Show and the Dot. Amazon you did it again!!! Great job!!!!

author: Paula H.
title: Really like it but it needs more video apps
content: I really like my Echo Show and use it every day.  The amount of video/screen apps for it are really limited though.  Most Alexa skills are still voice only.  It's hard to search through the Alexa skills to find video ones since they are all mixed in with the audio-only skills.  When they release more Echo Show skills, I could see myself getting another device for another room.

author: Shauna
title: Quick and easy set up right out of the box.
content: Quick and easy set up.  I am learning along with Alexa as this is my first Echo device.  I like what it does that I am already thinking of expanding add-on devices through out the house. (Oh and she will not answer to Siri as I have found out.)

author: IAN
title: Don't buy unless you want a desk weight, are paying cash, and willing to wait for seamless integration and features.
content: It would be better if:  I could play music through the speakers on Echo Show's Dolby speakers using Plex or Twonky Media server to play my music--the speakers are a waste (for now) considering this isn't a possibility.  You can use the built in speakers only to play Amazon music:  You cannot use this device to play you tube videos, for screen mirroring (even through home network or Bluetooth).  I do not like that I need to pair devices using Bluetooth to access the speakers and have a "ugly display" showing "Bluetooth connection" with the Bluetooth symbol.
