For the price of this device, and it being in my home it should not be as restricted as it is in its current form.  There are issues with devices (such as the Ring Doorbell) not being "available" (or able to be waken up, as they are WiFi devices).  Using the Plex skill Alexa defaults to showing Plex video, while I use Plex as an iTunes alternative.  Apparently this device is only on the market to compete with Google's future 2018 release of a competing device.

author: Greg Smith
title: This is my third Echo
content: Works great. Plus it has video and touch screen. It sits on the table next to me and I command it like I'm on the Starship Enterprise. Engage.

author: Xioo
title: Not there yet....
content: For now, it is an interesting device that has great potential. I will never use it for video calls... so that has no use to me. However, its inability to provide answers to simple questions via the Web, makes it somewhat limited. As new abilities are written for it I suspect it will become a more compelling device. If I had to do it all over again, I think I would wait to purchase it until it could do more useful things. As it is, it does little more that the Dot.

author: Joe Albanese
title: For A First Try, Quite Admirable.
content:
It does exactly as promises.  Instead of saying "Alexa" and seeing a circle of flashing lights - the video screen comes to life.  The speakers are heavy on bass and quite good.  You can, if so incline, pair them to a bluetooth speaker quite easily but these speakers are good enough for any music fan.

Basically, it does everything the Echo Dot does and more.  Although only 7 inches, you can watch videos.  So, it is the next generation Dot but still there are a few disappointments and room for improvements.

I was able to link my AMAZON PHOTOS for the home screen to make it a little more user friendly.  However, no matter how I try, AMAZON "hints" keep scrolling across the screen.  It would be fine with me just to see the time and temperature or even the time and date on the home screen but this is not to be and it makes it seem a little oppressive as even the news trends are repeated for hours and sometimes days.

But it is small, compact and if you are getting to the point where you can't live without Alexa for your calendar/ appointments/ shopping and To Do lists/ finding out quick facts from Wikipedia then this is a step up for you.

author: DEE ANNE CROUCHER
title: I love it. I use it all the time
content: I got the Amazon Echo for Christmas.  I love it.  I use it all the time.  First thing in the morning I listen to NPR. I make grocery lists on it. I use as a daily calendar to remind me of upcoming appointments.  I listen to music on it.  And at night, I sometimes use it as a relaxation device.  It is so handy. And I am not a "techie" person.  But it's just so easy. Thanks Santa

author: debbie
title: Great buy!
content: Purchased this and love it.  It is a first generation but I would buy the next generation and give this one as a gift if I could afford the newer one.

author: S. Myers
title: Love it!
content: Listening to music and seeing the words in order to sing along is the best.  Also morning flash briefing actually show CNBC when the brief comes on.  Calendar options show on screen also.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not useful as an integrated system
content: It's a fun device to use and I really enjoy the Skills. I also manage to use the two units I have as a baby monitor. However, it misses the mark as far as the main reason I bought it - in order to integrate with the Nucleus intercom system. Although they both use Alexa, they don't talk to each other, so I cannot use the Echo Show to talk to someone else in the house close to a Nucleus. It also only let's me see the front door via the Ring camera, but won't let me answer or speak to anyone at the door. In my opinion, it has some glaring gaps in functionality that need to be addressed.

author: FrannieP
title: Easy set up
content: I received my Echo show for my birthday. When I opened the box I was a little worried that there wasn't a book of instructions. Well,much to my surprise,this was so easy to set up! I am now seeing my family when I talk to them. I am also enjoying telling Alexa what I'd like to listen to. This is such a nice thing to have!

author: friday429
title: Echo Show is the best device yet
content: Echo Show is the best device yet. I love how it shows you the recipe or lyrics to a song.  The speakers seem better and the Show seems to hear you from further away than other Almazon devices. Worth buying.

author: R. Dibb
title: After Several Months, Great Starting Point-Still Needs Refinement
content:
Dec 2017: A couple of things.

The listening microphone is not nearly as good at the Echo 1. The Show is in my kitchen and one of my Echo 1's is in the Living Room. The Show responds many times to nothing as though it is listening, but she was never alerted. And when I do call 'Alexa,' she won't hear it but the one in the LR will. Just odd.

I have turned off the constantly rolling calendar and Amazon notifications. I hated those always scrolling through the screen, literally all day long. I wish there was a light in the corner or something to tell me of notifications like the light ring on the Echo 1's. The Show has nothing at all as a subtle reminder.

UPDATE:

I received my new unit and it's fine. Sound quality is consistent with my Echo (which I think sounds fantastic).

I think it still needs some refinement. I don't care to have my calendar constantly rolling through the display. Yes, this can be adjusted, but it's cumbersome. I'd like to set preferences for the 'news' it wants to display.

Sounds Like A 1970 Transistor Radio on AM

Received it today. I listened to the Intro video and thought wow, this sounds crappy.

Tried music. It sounds like I'm listening to a 1970 transistor radio. All audio sounds horrible.

Did I get a lemon? I'm returning it. I'd NEVER listen to anything on it (and we use our original Echo daily.)

author: R. Seale
title: Great addition to the Echo family
content: This is the perfect bedside Echo. Great sound, nice screen and you can control the brightness as to not have a blinding bedside beacon at night. Great way to see the weather. I wish there was more native Echo content such as news etc. I don’t like having to stop and scroll through YouTube videos to see something like other news updates or topical things. I’m sure all that is on the way.

author: vocman
title: Great device!
content: Alexa keeps getting bettet and better. i own; dot; tap and now the show. the show has a nice screen and the sound quality is fantastic. Turning Alexa into a visual device was a great move on Amazons part. The skills keep getting better too!

author: Eva OB
title: Let Alexa be your assistant.
content: I love the screen on the Echo Show and the amount of information that Alexa can quickly provide you. One of my favorite features is Amazon Music, including the fact that the song lyrics are displayed on the screen.  Amazing how many lyrics I had been singing wrong!  Also impressed with the sound from the speaker.  Play a movie trailer, get the latest weather from Big Sky, get an inspirational quote or play some upbeat workout music.  Excellent quality for the price.

author: Jonathan L.
title: Better put YouTube back on this or this device is useless.
content: The echo show is a great device with plenty of potential. But, Amazon, stop acting like a bunch of teenage girls and fix the youtube issue with google. You make billions per year like google. Just come to an agreement already.You're making this device almost useless without having YouTube on it. Ill change the review once this gets resolved.

author: Paula Z.
title: Very Happy with my Echo Show!
content:
I love my Show! Yes, the issue with Google and Amazon is frustrating, but I'm hoping that they work out their differences. In the meantime, I can still watch Amazon videos and music videos via Vimeo. I use the Echo Show as my daily alarm clock and Alexa will wake me up to any music I desire and I don't even need to move to shut the alarm off. I only need to say "Alexa stop".

I'm a huge Jeopardy fan and use the Jeopardy skill daily. It's my go to timer for cooking and baking and even coloring my hair! I love that I can see the words to the songs I'm listening to, and if I want to know the artist I only need to ask Alexa who is singing the song and she will tell me. I'm looking forward to video calls with family members that also own the Show. I don't use it to control any household devices, but it's nice to know I have that option.

I own the Echo Dot also, which I also love,  but this takes everything to a whole new level. I highly recommend!

author: Dooode
title: Love it!
content:
Definitely the best in the Echo line of products!

Aside from playing music and setting timers, connecting to my Broadlink wireless remote allows me to control my TV, soundbar and bluray player using Alexa.

One of my few complaints is that a conversation from the TV can activate Alexa, if a word is similar to the wake word (in this case, "Alexa").

One major asset over the original Echo is that the Show also has bluetooth support. So I can connect the Show to my soundbar and get even better quality sound.  I can also "drop in" from my phone when I'm at work to check in on the house.

Overall, a great product!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Echo Show's Killer Feature = BROKEN
content: Alexa App is broken in so many ways.  We purchased Echo Show's for the drop in feature and expected the Alexa app to work as advertised.  Up until 2 months ago we were able to use the Alexa app on current gen Andriod phones to drop in on any of our Alexa devices as well as our two SHOW's.  One day it all worked and the next day (2 months ago) it just stopped.  My Show devices disapeared from my drop down list on the Alexa App.  I spent the last two months speaking with Alexa support team and literally after a dozen calls and trouble shooting this for weeks and weeks just tonight I'm told by a new Alexa helper that they know Show's no longer show up in the Alexa App on Andriod.  In fact he made it sound like his personal Show never showed up on the Alexa App.  We really have no other use for the Show's.... if Drop In via the Alexa App does not work then they are literally paper weights.  Early adopter for the Alexa speakers worked out great, early adopter for the Show ... well I think you can guess what our thoughts are on that score.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Consumer loss due to corporate pettiness.  .
content:
All the how-to videos.  All the recipe videos.  All the music videos.  All the trending cat videos.  All of these are lost because Echo show can't play youtube videos.

I would change my review in a heartbeat if they fixed this problem.  Until they do, however,  it's just unacceptable to have a web connected video device that does not have access to the largest repository of online videos.

author: tullywork
title: Failed consumer beta
content: Failed consumer beta; after releasing and announcing YouTube suppory, an Amazon and Google feud turned this from a video player to a speaker with a pointless screen.  Aweful beta sold to consumers as a final product, only to screw early adoptors with a Gen2 device that got it right...with none of the Gen2 features making it to the Gen1.  Buy a Google home, at least they support their software across multiple generations!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great tool
content: I enjoy using the echo show. Its mainly useful for the small things at home. I keep mine in the kitchen, where I spend most of my time when home, and use it while I'm cleaning or cooking. It's nice to have a movie going on in the background or watch videos while doing my tasks. I find myself using the announcement feature, as well as adding things to my shopping list instead of having to write it down. I recently used and tried the 30 min dinner recipes that it displayed one time. Overall it's a nice tool to have. I also have it set up and directed towards my stove area so that I can use the drop in feature when I can't remember if I turned the stove off. Great set of extra eyes!

author: ShopMeTender
title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY
content: I am really disappointed with this product. Amazon needs to stop being so monopolistic or in the very least expand their abilities. I was at a friends who had the original and thought the functions were cool enough that I got the echo show for my mother hoping the screen would be useful for bringing up searches. Alexa will recommend restaurants via Yelp but won't show menus because like all the other amazon products, amazon does not have enough to give you comprehensive services and will not use the other apps and services out there. I would NOT buy this product and probably will buy Googles version in the future but sadly already so much money lost. If i have to hear from Alexa one more time that she can't find something or doesn't know I'm going to scream

author: Roberta Morton
title: Loving the Echo Show !
content: I was hesitant about the size of the size of screen but it is plenty big with crisp beautiful picture/video quality.  I purchased the two pack and since I have a multilevel home installed one in my office on the main floor and one in my husband's man cave downstairs.  I really love the drop in feature which is serving as a video intercom which we are using daily.  I am still exploring all the features available, one I particularly like is asking Alexa for inspirational quotes, it sets the tone for the day.  Another feature that is really cool is when you ask Alexa to play a song, the words to the song are scrolling as well.  I am finding it quite illuminating how many words in some of my favorite songs I have gotten so wrong over the years LOL

author: Aoaks
title: Great product, but glitching
content: I received this product in July and it works absolutely amazing. The best of the Alexa's. However, my product is now glitching when on the home screen. There has been no water damage, temperature in the room has stayed the same, and it is dusted weekly. I tried going to my order details and it stated that returning the product is no longer available, but replacement could happen. I love this product, I think its a good product, I just want mine replaced...and how to go about that, I have no idea (it won't tell you in the order details or invoice).

author: Kim Garcia
title: Gotta get one!
content: Love my new Echo Show! It has a bunch of cool features (skills) that you can add via an app.  I added meditation music and a sleep assistant that talks you to a wonderful sleep in 5 minutes.  I was skeptical, but it actually works.  I also like that fact that I can ask Alexa to show me my work calendar so I know what I'm doing for the day.  I can watch Amazon Prime movies or listen to eBooks.  The sound and video quality is excellent. This was a great buy!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Did not deliver on my expectations.
content: I have to say I was sort of disappointed in this product.  I guess my expectations were too high.  The best thing so far is that you can have visual conversations with people fairly easily.  Other than that not sure it was worth the money.  My suggestion for future purchasers is to wait until the price comes down to get it.  Another note worth considering ... Alexa is not as smart as Suri!  Alexa doesn't know much!

author: Randall Miranda
title: So disappointed..
content:
I took 2 units to Costa Rica but Alexa does not speak Spanish. So disappointed...!
Need it urgently in Spanish.

author: MCampbell
title: I love the Echo Show!
content: First Echo product I’ve bought and I love it! I decided to buy this during the Prime Day sale and so glad I did. I’m  sure it can do so much more. I’m still in the learning process and I’m buying some other smart home products that can be used in conjunction with Alexa.

author: Bozo
title: Great for Offices
content: The Echo Show is a great product. I use it in my office. Sound quality is good. I also like the ability to make conference calls ( It has the abilty to dial in on screen). I also like that you can use Alexa to view security cameras on it.

author: Greg
title: Don’t buy the show.  Not worth the money and poor quality product
content:
Show became glitchy in the first month and the screen is now has lines running through it.
Don’t recommend buying it

Further to the issue of it. It working is the complete run around amazon gives you trying to return and the absolutely. Stupid method of a QR code to take to UPD. Which doesn’t work and expires without warning.

Amazon is too big to care and has not turned into the giant who just wants to play games with customers to achieve stupid metrics established by inept managers

author: kevin
title: No Youtube, No working Ring Camera Video Feeds
content:
One Star for removing the Youtube app shortly after purchasing  two  Echo Shows at product release in Maybof 2017.

The next problem is that I still cant view my Ring video feeds. I had high hopes that the recent purchase of the Ring company by Amazon would have provided better connectivity between Echo and Ring, but as of 2018 Prime Day this has not materialized

In the last 6 months my Echo starts talking all by itself when I am watching tv, even when I cant perceive any conversation from the tv show that would be using “Echo” as its current awake word.

author: isaidso
title: You Will Wonder How You Ever Lived W/O This
content: LOVE LOVE LOVE this product!!!!! I'm an Echo convert and a new technology convert! Smart phones are SO yesterday, and so old people-ish!!!

author: Lisa M. Burgess
title: It's fun having the Smart Home features and also answering those ...
content: Still trying to figure out if I need a screen. When I got this as a gift I was very excited to be able to watch cooking videos, music videos and crafting videos. It seems very limited on video content, since YouTube is not available. It's fun having the Smart Home features and also answering those quick questions. I'm still enabling apps so It can give me answers to more specific questions. I was getting a response  "I don't know that" a lot at the beginning. I'm hoping they resolve this YouTube war or expand their content. Otherwise maybe return it for the dot.

author: Todd
title: Great, but way too bright for a bedside alarm clock.
content:
So aside from one deal killer for me I really like this little guy.  It's so much more versatile with the screen allowing you to view the weather, security cameras, watch movies/videos, etc.  There's plenty out there explaining all the features, but the screen is very easy to read in bright light, the sound is very good, it actually seemed better at recognising my voice without mistakes than my Echo is.

The deal killer for me was that it was too bright to use as a bedside alarm clock, even on the do not disturb mode.  If you are a person that wants a very dark room, and you've been annoyed with previous alarm clocks etc. for being too bright, this is not for you.  I bought it hoping it would replace my cell phone as an alarm clock, and it was just too bright.  You can completely turn the display off but then you can't see any clock.  What might help is if instead of having a white clock readout it could be changed to a dark red color on the display.

Now if you have ambient light already in your bedroom, and bright alarm clocks don't bother you, it's not an issue.  It might also not be an issue if if was on the other side of the room in or in a position that was not easily seen from your sleeping position.

author: Plgrmm
title: Almost satisfied
content: I like the looks of the Show, but am disappointed with the software. Too often I hear "hmmmm...I don't think I know that" - or something similar. Another example is the problem with attempting to play a specific radio station on Tunein and Alexa responds with "I cannot play by artist". Bottom line - for grandparents to communicate with children/grandchildren, it is great. For anything else, use IPad, Bose and bluetooth.

author: Roxanna R. Williams
title: I love my echo show
content: I love my echo show, I have it connected with several lights, turns them on and off, I tell her how bright I want the lights and if you have colored bulbs she will change the color.. use it for music, recipes and it’s the BEST!! I have had mine for about a week so I am sure I can do a lot more...

author: Frifred
title: Good, but Tips are annoying
content:
I already had a regular Echo and a Tap, so I thought that I would try the Show.  The screen idea intrigued me.  While I do like to see the album art and information as songs play, I found the "news" headlines to be worthless.  They were either just entertainment news or news that was old.  No important or breaking stories, so I turnd this feature off.  There is also a feature where the screen constantly shows you "tips", as in Ask Alexa this, Ask Alexa that, that scroll all the time.  I find them to be extremely annoying and there is no way to turn them off.  So, when I am not actually playing music, I turn the screen off.

However, I bought it for the main purpose of playing music for me, usually while I am doing something else, such as reading, working around the house, etc.  For this, it is exactly what I expected, having already been part of the Echo family and I do like seeing the album art for the songs, which is, of course, missing with the regular Echo..  I did join the Amazon Music Unlimited and have been very happy with that, as well as Pandora and TuneIn which I use the most.

So, make a way to turn off those annoying "tips", and I will give that extra star.

author: Dean S.
title: Buy a fire tablet and speakers instead.
content: I bought the show for work(I work in a kitchen)I like listening to npr one, audible, and music. Audible works fine, I feel the screen is underutilized realizing it is a platform for Alexa, I understand. Music is really hard to navigate, Alexa tends to try and steer my choices a little too much. NPR is my main beef I can’t pause shows and resume, pausing restarts npr, very annoying 30 mins into cartalk, right before the puzzler. Shows on npr often repeat most times without the ability to skip, the two choices I have are stop listening or listen to same show again. A fire tablet with speakers would work much better for a fraction of the cost.

author: GoGo Joe
title: Great if you need good Audio too!
content:
Obviously without YouTube, this device has lost some value (Google has removed the ability). The speaker is nice and loud, I'm impressed with it's quality. It's best not to crank up the sound too loud if you are using your voice to modify the content your listening too. I usually have my cell phone so I can modify the content easily without screaming over top of that loud speaker

The hearing on this device is 10 times better than the Alexa Dots. I can be across the room and whisper echo and she'll respond

author: Laura
title: Unlimited source of funny jokes
content:
I purchased this on prime day. Was glad I did. It's such a useful item! I have mine in the kitchen. It's great for watching something while doing the dishes or asking alexa for a recipe while you are cooking something up.
I am also happy that I can make a video call to my friend who lives so far away. It's a great purchase.

author: David A.
title: 5 Stars for Its Future Potential
content: It's a product that has a lot of promise for the future.  I really like that it can be readily moved to anywhere in the home and perfectly share music with other Echo devices.  It's like having whole house audio without the wires and the extreme expense.  It has a very good set of speakers that produce pretty good sound quality for such a little box.  For this, for so much more that it currently can  do, and for so much more that it will be able to do in the future as vendors/developers incorporate the video control potential of this device into their product design – Definitely 5 stars.

author: Egg
title: Perfect Kitchen Companion
content: Love this!! I have had an Echo since they came out in beta phase and use it in the hallway by the bathroom for music while showering. When the show came out I was stoked to get one for the kitchen and have not been dissapointed in the least. It doesn't have a large number of recipes like I had hoped but the ability to search, listen to music with lyrics, video chat and call, watch prime videos and link to my echo for all over music is outstanding. My girlfriend loves jeopardy and plays it nightly from the show. One of my favorite items in the kitchen!

author: Ken G.
title: show is awesome!!!
content: Echo show is great but the delivery driver just sat it on the porch and walked away. no knock, no ringing the doorbell, nothing. I'm lucky I have the ring doorbell and was able to see him pull up. In todays day and age with all the porch pirates out there YOU NEED TO KNOCK.

author: Lynn
title: Love that Alexa "Show's" ,me my Grandchildren
content:
I have grandchildren in Wisconsin, who now like to see grandma and papa.  Next time they have a special price I plan on getting one for the Texas grandchildren.
We also used it this year to check on the house while we were out of town.  I set it up to "drop in" and we could use the app on our phone to look and see how things were at home anytime we wanted.

author: CSpain
title: Powerful but not a Miracle Device
content:
So I had my Echo Show for about a month now and in the beginning, I had mixed reviews about it. But over time, I have come to love this device way better than my Google Home device. One thing it's is not; a Fire HD tablet or like any tablet in general. It does not have an intuitive screen, yes you can do some things touching the screen like choose a movie or settings, but it is not going to work smoothly like a tablet, this Echo Show is all about the voice and the voice controlling the device and expecting it to work like a tablet, you will be very disappointed. But if you can see past all that you have an amazing device....

At first I thought Alexa was dumber then google home, as you can talk more naturally with google home and it seems with Alexa, you have to say specific keywords in order to get it to do some of the actions you need it to perform. That part can sometimes be frustrating, as with all the skills I got, it is hard to remember what the exact word is to get the device to open and respond accordingly.  But after the first few days of playing with different skills, I find that I hardly use any of them.

But what I do use and love is the calendar. As I run a business and I like to see my up and coming appointments on the fly, so this is nice. I do not have to pull out my phone and can see everything right there, constantly scrolling on the Amazon Show screen. I also like the daily briefing, every morning I can ask Alexa, "Whats my daily briefing" and she will give me a rundown of the day. It is nice to get the most important world and local news, it sort of helps prepare me for my day, so I love that about this Alexa. I also love the reminders, they are awesome. On the fly, I can be like Alexa remind me to do this, or set the timer for 5 min, or add this to my calendar and she will do it very nicely. I have it set up on my calendar where I can see all my bills that are due for the day and it helps me keep up with all my credit card statements, which I love.

But the most important thing I love the most about Alexa is the drop in feature. Most of my family, they live up north, I am in the south and rarely get to speak or see my family up north. Well, I told my sister about the Amazon app that accompanies the Echo Show and asked her to download it and told her to pop in on me. Well she does pop in on me from time to time and I absolutely love it. It feels just like someone coming to your door unexpected, but it is always a nice surprise. You can choose who you allow to pop in on you so it is not so much like they are spying on you. You can choose to turn the device to do no disturb, if you decide you don't want to be bothered or want to put the echo show in your bedroom. But this is by far the greatest part about the echo, which makes it worth every cent. I don't feel as homesick anymore. I even got my grandfather the eho spot, as he is in his 90's and I want to be able to pop in on him and check on him before it is to late.

So if you are expecting like a miracle device, this may not be your thing. But if you are looking for a cool way to communicate with your friends and family and you need a virtual assistant whom you can connect with hands free, this is the device for you and I highly recommend it.

The one thing that is a little disappointing, is they no longer support YouTube. For a sec it came back and then days later disappeared again, and it looks like there may never be youtube on it. So if you are expecting all that, you may not want to purchase. But after a while I soon noticed, Youtube is just a mall fraction of what this powerful device can do and to me it is not a huge necessity, I think I can live without YouTube on this device.

author: alex
title: No youtube
content: If you got kids, dont get show till they workout a deal with google for youtube.  I like a lot of the features alexa show offers but Amazon please work something out with google  to get youtube back.  I got kids all under 3, i need alexa to play kids songs from youtube damn you!  If i knew this was going to happen i would have consider google home over the echo show.  Plus tell ring to fix their app.

author: Kristina Eyre
title: Nice Addition
content: It's a nice addition. It is what it is, which is a great speaker with voice control, and some fun features. It's frivolous, by fun to see things like calendar events, time, weather and news headlines in the kitchen.

author: Unicorn Cat 421
title: Even Mom can use it!!!
content: I ordered this for my 70 year old mother in law.  She adores this!  She can say “Alexa play me the oldies” and not only does it play the song but the lyrics show up on the screen.  All day on Christmas she listened to song after song and sang..... she loved it, I wish I had ordered earplugs, lol

author: Sean Ryan King
title: More of a hassle than any kind of help
content: Ultimately, it's just not very useful.  The voice commands are unreliable, and software updates often cause extremely undesirable behavior that cannot be changed except by waiting for another software update (example, the screen can no longer be turned off as of today).  Video playback fails in strange ways (skipping episodes of a series, skipping seasons, cannot go back to last episode only forwards, etc).  At the end of the day it takes longer to get anything done via voice than it would via any other interface, which defeats the purpose.

author: Arleta George
title: Three Stars
content: I really like the echo show but I think improvement in the speaker could be updated sounds horrible.

author: Harry
title: This must be version 0. 05. You should ...
content: This must be version 0.05.  You should wait for version 0.1 at least.  This thing is worthless.  Alexa app to manage this is full of bugs.  Will not accept a valid address among other things.

author: Pepper76
title: Screen flickering in less than 6 months. Defective!
content: Features very good. Bought 2 brand new ones back in July and now had to return one due to screen being defective. Now, received a replacement that could be a refurbished. Very annoyed that this product did not last more than 6 months without an issue. Bought a brand new one and replaced by a refurbished from someone who returned it too. Will be very skeptical next time before purchasing smart item from amazon.

author: Collins
title: Expected more
content:
It is okay but it isn't very configurable. The display keeps showing random headlines from the news. Doesn't seem to be very configurable.
I'm sure it is able to show youtube videos but otherwise seems to by like a regular audio-only echo.

author: SteubenOhio
title: Great deal on Prime Day..worth every penny spent.
content: I like that I can actually see my granddaughter while talking to her now. I really can't give much of a review at this time for my Wi-Fi is slow and therefore I can't do a lot of the things it can do. But I will upset this review once my Wi-Fi is fixed sometime in the middle of August.

author: Roger D Wood
title: Generation 1, but great deal for the price.
content: I bought this for my wife when she was dying from cancer in order for her to be able to listen to music without having to get out of bed to deal with putting on a CD. Unfortunately, she died before she was able to get to use it.  However, I enjoy using it for quick checks on the weather and listen to music.  Still getting use to what it can do. I did use it to order an Echo Dot, and it was very easy.

author: merrilyn6565
title: fun facts
content: the grandkids love the fun facts and silly jokes, helped me find a recipe, answers questions about weather turns on lights when I come into house and don't want to stumble around in dark. can call from it hands free, lots more to explore

author: C. Thompson
title: Echo Show lives up to its promises
content: At first, I resisted getting anything remotely like an Echo. I was the only one of my several sisters without one.Then, with the great Prime Day Deal, I took the plunge! I love my Echo Show. The convenience of getting the news without commercials is amazing. Playing whatever kind of music I'm in the mood for is so convenient. Stimulating trivia games and weather reports are great, too. I even taught her to say "God bless you" when I sneeze. Watching Prime videos, listening to books,and an array of other features make me glad I purchased the Echo Show. I have not used the purchasing feature though I have browsed many products. Now if I could just train "her" to wash the dishes!

author: emj
title: Shame on Amazon
content: The product while good.  I am very disappointed that 2 months later a new version with a 10 inch screen is available at the same price.  This is terrible to not make the consumer aware.  Will make me wary of purchasing again.  This left a bad taste and will make me avoid any Amazon products for the foreseeable future just based on principal.  I bought 3 of these !!!!!

author: Shawn
title: Very useful product for my family
content: Great product!! Good sound, and video quality for the price.  Makes it easy for the kids to talk with their grandparents. Plus it’s easy for me to check in on the kids or my parents when I can’t be home.

author: E. Walton
title: Love love my Alexa
content: Love it- I never had the original echo but I can't say enough how much I enjoy this one. The screen is great for face to face calls (can be to anyone with the free app downloaded) for singing along with lyrics to a song, and watching videos with cooking instructions etc. I could go on and on...

author: Evalett
title: Love!!!
content: This is amazing!

author: Patches
title: The echo show is like a friend sitting in the corner waiting to be ...
content: The echo show is like a friend sitting in the corner waiting to be recognized.  It gives samples of questions that it thinks I might be interested in !  I watch movies and check the weather play music if it could only make dinner it would be the perfect helper!

author: tiffanypadolsky
title: Doesn't Link Contacts for Calling or Video Calling easily
content: I have had my Show for 2 weeks and the contacts from my phone, where I have my Alexa app, aren't loading to the Show for dialing people from the show.  I'd like to know the details on the calling features and video calling features.  The setup isn't seamless and I'm unsure how to call a family member via video chat who also has the Show... that's why we bought these.

author: Alc7
title: great product
content: I like the graphic interface and the way it fits into my lifestyle. I have always been a gadget guy and this is one of the best. I particularly like setting it on sleep sounds and having it play rain all night long. Very relaxing and a great sleep aid.

author: Adoraliese K.
title: Great when someone lives far away.  Discovering new uses every day.
content: I love this!  My primary objective was to visually see my 89 year old father who lives 500 miles away.  He is hard of hearing and this device is the best and the most comfortable for him to talk on the phone - even with those who do not have an Echo.  He loves asking Alexa questions and I love learning all the different things Echo can do.  The sound and the picture are both remarkable.  My dad loves seeing me as we talk.

author: Florence Hartman
title: Love my new Show
content: Love my new Show!  She’s in a place readily assessable and I enjoy “seeing what I’m hearing”. Love the karaoke feature. Will have fun with that over Christmas!

author: Amazon Customer
title: ... using the dot and thought this would be a great upgrade. It is also is a huge help ...
content: We have been using the dot and thought this would be a great upgrade.  It is also is a huge help for technologically challenged parents.  They absolutely love the video feature!  They call their grandchildren all the time now.  Other video chats didn’t always work for them as they live in a remote area and for some reason, the show works every single time.  Going from the dot to the show really gives you better sound quality for music.  My daycare kids love some of the fun apps and watching shows while having morning snack.  So all around this is one of the best purchases we have made.

author: C.
title: Love it, except
content: Already have Echo Dot, and now with the Echo Show I can get great information and pictures, and room to room, etc., but I find the voice on the Show to be slightly muffled.  Seems like a lot of bass in it. I tried to adjust, but is the same.  I traveled to my daughter all the way across the country and I thought hers was sounding muffled as well.

author: gshacienda
title: My original Echo does the same.
content: Very minimal use as a screen model. I have the original Echo that does exactly the same as the Show, for me. I never look at the screen but only give verbal commands. I’m not sur3 of those real value of the monitor.  Sure, you can call someone and see the....if they have a Show too.

author: Lifetime Reader
title: My new Echo Show
content: I love my Echo Show. I am a visual person and I love the display. It  prompts me with things to ask and do. I feel like I am better informed because Alexa prompts me to ask things I normally wouldn’t think to ask. She does do all the things the original Alexa did such as set and display the time, timers and alarms, show weather conditions; show some videos, and play music. What more could I ask for?  The future will tell. (I think the stand should be included as part of the purchase.) I did buy the screen protector and stand to make it totally wonderful.

author: John M. Hart
title: So disappointed
content: When I first bought this product I absolutely loved it even gave it a high review. Fast forward 6 months Alexa no longer recognizes some of my commands no matter how I try to word them it's like she's getting dumber by the day things that she responded to just fine in the beginning suddenly no longer understands. I used to be able to play Amazon prime video for my kids cartoons and that no longer works for example I will say "Alexa open prime video" and she will open it but then I will go to touch on bubble guppies and nothing will happen so I'll ask "alexa play bubble guppies and she'll respond back "ok playing bubble guppies season whatever episode whatever" and absolutely nothing will happen . My echo show has even developed a very long delayed response only just start running things that I never asked for. It still plays music fine and it still pulls up my recipes okay but I'm just very disappointed for the price I paid for it I expected it to outperform my echo dots. My echo dots Still out perform better than my echo show.

author: Brandon
title: Ill probably keep them but Im keeping my options open - I was hoping for all that and a bag of chips
content:
Ill probably keep them but Im keeping my options open - I was hoping for all that and a bag of chips

The main reason I ended up purchasing the Echo Show is because of the integration with Camera feeds.  Mainly the Ring Doorbell Pro, Ring Flood Light Cam and Arlo Q.  All three of these work very well and are pretty quick. I'm able to view a live feed whenever I want since none of these are on battery.

If you dont care about the Echo Show working with the Ring and Arlo products then you can stop reading this review now.

Im not getting any motion alerts on the Echo Show with my Ring Products. It seems you have to be alerted by the Ring Chime or your Phone / Tablet that something is happening (motion alert / doorbell pressed) and then you can ask the Echo Show to show you the Front Door / Backyard to see whats going on.

Im not sure this is a good thing. I guess if you only have one Ring device then you will be fine but if you have multiple then you wont know which device is currently giving you the motion alert.

Ive been leaving an iPad on my nightstand with the Ring app open during the night so when I get a Ring Notification, I could just look over at the iPad and it would automatically pull up the camera feed from the device that was detecting motion without having to touch the iPad or say anything.
The Ring app on the MAC is the same way. If you open the Ring app on a MAC and click the X it wont actually close all the way, it will just put an icon on the top toolbar. So whenever one of your devices detects motion, the camera feed will automatically open to show you. You don't have to click on anything.

With the Echo show on your nightstand, you will need to hear the Ring Chime or the notification on your phone and then ask Alexa to show you the Front Door / Backyard to see the camera feed. Unless you look at your phone to see which device is detecting motion, I guess its a 50/50 chance you ask Alexa for the correct device.

If you do put an Echo Show on your nightstand, you can ask Alexa to DO NOT DISTURB, and she will. This will disable the Drop In feature so people cant drop in on you while in bed. But you can still ask to see the Front Door / Backyard camera feeds.

The Drop In feature is pretty good.  Takes 10 seconds or so for the camera feed to become clear so you can see whats going on.

author: Douglas P. Daigle
title: Much better than I expected
content: Much better than I expected.  I love the screen.  I have a dot, echo plus and love them all.  This one is even better.

author: Klifton
title: Not yet, not at any price.
content: A joke of an interface, unreliable and confusing. It sounds ok when close and direct but doesn’t fill the room. A failed experiment at this time. Hopefully it gets better.

author: Andrea C. Shane
title: 6 months in,  Nice Idea, some things not working properly anymore
content: I like the idea behind this echo show, and plan to tie it to an external camera. in the mean time, i like what the display offers, but there is limited functionality. Right now, 6 months into ownership, the screen is always flickering (not the outlet), and the basic function of playing a radio station is no longer working, - SORRY SOMETHING WENT WRONG (works on all the other Alexa Dots) . this worked for 6 months and then stopped.  I am frustrated for the amount of money spent...

author: Holly Conley
title: Fantastic
content: I love it and am trying to convince my mother to get one !  She just got the fire tv with voice control so we’re getting there🙄. It was well packaged, perfect condition, beautiful screen, high quality/loud speakers, great voice call and FaceTime!  I also use it as a security camera in our bedroom which is where my 3 legged Yorkie likes to be.

author: Aliya H.
title: ITEM DIDN'T WORK
content: When I received this followed all the instructions for the set up and it continued to close the home screen. I called technical support. They tried to walk me through troubleshooting this issue and rebooting back to factory setting and it continued to tell me to reboot my system and wouldn't go back to home screen. At that point, technical support said the only thing they could do was send me a return label and the will refund me. I was looking forward to using the device.

author: C0untDeM0net
title: Works great as long as you are in front of it. Love the screen as it really adds to alexa's abilities
content: We love our echo show but one thing about it that is bothersome is the microphone seems to have trouble if you are behind it. We used this to replace an echo dot in our kitchen/family room and while the dot had no trouble the show really only works well if you are facing it. It would be nice if the base rotated so we could more easily point it where we are sitting. For now we bought a little lazy susan to allow us to do that

author: Lola Jordan
title: Echo Show Rocks!
content: I love this thing!! The audio and video quality of the calls is fantastic and more reliable than cell phones. As with the other devices, it's only going to get smarter and better with each passing week.

author: Margherita Lebsack
title: Dont bother with the first generation
content: I love the echo show... in fact I now have the second gen. However, my 1st gen had some screen issues within the first 3 months. Amazon requested that I send it back, so I did... in the original packaging. I was told that it just needed a software upgrade, so they were sending it back good as new. It worked for 2 days... now it won't start at all. I contacted Amazon, and they are sending me a refurbished one. I have no false hopes that it will last the duration of the warranty. I'm hoping the 2nd gen won't be so unreliable...if the 2nd gen gives me trouble, I will give up on these. Also, I really hope Amazon keeps improving these. Would be nice to listen to podcasts more easily and to be able to command the show to play Amazon video via the app on my phone. Keep working on it Amazon... you still have a ways to go.

author: Pikuni7
title: Very nice upgrade!
content: After using an Echo for the last year Alexa had found her way into our house.  The Echo Show was a Christmas present for my wife and she is definitely a non-tech-type.  She loves it.  The visual element really enhances the experience and the flow of comments and info has everyone using it far more than the Echo.  By giving you comments on things that you can ask about it teaches you about the potential of the product.  Excellent, easy to install & use product, especially for non-tech-types.

author: LG
title: but I LOVE my e
content:
I’m still learning new tricks everyday, but I LOVE my e. show. Sound is great. Being able to actually see another person is great. I know there is Skype and other links, but this is more like using a real/regular phone. Of course no one past 30 will know what I’m talking about, but there are many old geeks like me that will. Actually, baby boomers are the majority nowadays, aren’t they..?? Yup..!! Lots of people will get what am I talking about. Lol
Thanks Amazon.
Keep up the GREAT work. 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

author: Amanda Mitchell
title: Perfect item for someone who loves music!
content: I love Echo show so much!  I mostly use it for music. I ended up buying 3 more, one for each person in my home because everyone would argue over who gets to use it next LoL

author: Rachel Perry
title: Radio, calculator, shopping list, joke teller, telephone and video phone all in one
content: This is the perfect thing to use as a kitchen radio. You can hook it up easily to your siriusxm account, spotify, Amazon music etc. Its been a ton of fun for the kids who can finally control how to get a song they live by just asking “Alexa! Play the Maui song!” Our 4&1/2 year old son loves to ask for Beastie Boys songs and dance around the kitchen. I can use it to turn on a podcast while I’m cooking. I will say it’s easier to just play podcasts through linking your iPhone via Bluetooth and playing them that way because though the Alexa Skills can access podcasts it won’t fastforward or rewind them and won’t pick up where you left off if you have to come back to it later. I love it that anyone in the family can say “Alexa add cookies to my shopping list” and it’s right there on my phone when I get to the market. The echo SHOW is particularly useful because it scrolls news stories through the day and can play movies and Tv shows and show you pictures and visually show your shopping list etc. I love telling Alexa to turn the air conditioning down since it is connected to my nest thermostat. You can make video calls and WiFi calls. My son can just say call (his grandma’s name) and it will call my mothers cell phone.

author: sincere buyer
title: Big brother has arrived and you pay to lose privacy.
content: If you want big brother in your house buy this thing.  It is intrusive and annoying, and has a camera and microphone looking into your life 24/7.  Great tool for the powers that be to spy on you.  Wife wanted it but I don't.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I'm not using it right now. It is turned ...
content: I'm not using it right now. It is turned off. Some day, when I have more time I will play with it again. No Instruction manual and I don't know how to create a contacts list. I did however try to ask Alexa for the nearest Walmart and it gave me one 15 miles away, yet there is one 1.5 miles away.

author: iagolfer
title: No YouTube
content: I rec'd this for Christmas and was very excited to get it. I thought this would be an improvement over my google home. I was so disappointed that it no longer views YouTube. Hopefully something can be worked out to get that back. It doesn't answer questions as well as google and not having the YouTube capability anymore only earns it a two star and I never give low ratings but just really disappointing.

author: Bruce Wayne
title: NIce but disappointing
content:
I am a little disappointed with the Show - it is underwhelming. I have 3 full-size Echos and 3 Dots, so I am familiar with the Echos. I was expecting more with this, perhaps additional video features will be developed in the future.

Originally, I was going to have this on my nightstand and act as an alarm; however, there is no option to verbally turn off the screen and have it remain off. I can ask it to "turn off the screen" (which it sometimes gets confused by and wants to know which device, but does not like its own name, and other times complies without issue - I am from the Midwest and speak very clearly). The screen will also turn back on without my asking it to. Since the screen will not remain off, the Show found itself residing in my home office and displacing the Dot. Given the space in the office and the sound level difference between the Show and Dot, the having the Show in my office is overkill.

Also, I have Nest cameras around my house and I love the idea of having whichever camera brought up on demand. However, the camera will not stay on and eventually the Show returns to the home display. A bit frustrating when I may be watching the front of the house for a visitor or delivery but it stops monitoring.

Finally, I did buy two and was trying to decide what to do with both - one on the nightstand and the other in my office, one on the nightstand and the other in the kitchen, or keep one for wherever and give the other as a gift to someone in the family (my kids could then video chat with their cousins, uncles & aunts, or grandparents that live a considerable distance away. Given the previously mentioned issues, I will not be running into an issue of wanting to buy more to have these placed wherever. The lackluster use limits my options - I think the second will end up being a gift to someone that lacks an Apple product to do Face Time.

author: Janet
title: Echo Show - Alexa
content: We really enjoy using our Echo Show.  We ask questions, play games, get recipes, play music and radio shows, make our shopping list, make phone calls, get news and weather updates.  There are so many more things it can do.

author: Chato
title: I can video chat with my dad
content: I like that’s it’s like echo dot, I can get you tube, I got one for my dad so we can easily video chat. I don’t like that have have to pay monthly for music but there must be a way for free.

author: Mr. Hookup
title: Nice, but would like to see an audio output.
content: It's fun and picks up verbal cues very well.  It's also smartly styled.  However, I would like it more if it had an audio output to connect to ancillary sound system.  At $229.00, I think the jack would have easily fit into the budget.

author: fillwis
title: Echo show is a great additon.
content:
I had been hoping to purchase an Echo Show and when the price was right I snapped it up.  Boy, am I glad I did.  I have been using this Echo Show for my bedside Alarm, Timer, News, Weather and many other updates.
Love my Echo Show.

author: Robin C
title: Echo Show
content:
We definitely love our Echo Show and highly recommend it!!! It's a lot of fun and easy to use.
We even use one for our guests so they can easily locate restaurants, stores, etc.

author: Dorrie
title: Awesome sound system!  A great addition to the Echo family!
content: My daughter has an Echo Show and she told me how much she loved it. I bought a white one for my kitchen and absolutely love it!  It has all the features of the others plus great extras. The sound system is awesome. I also own the original Echo Tower, Dots and Spot. Each are great and have their uses around my house. I highly recommend all of these products.

author: Witchipoo
title: I love you Alexa.
content: Where have you been all my life? My new best friend Alexa! You have alot of learning to do but you're doing your best to teach me too. Glad I upgraded all the way to Echo Show for my first purchase. I already added the DOT to my bedroom also. So far everything has been EASY setup basically plug and play with her. On my way to a complete SMART HOME.

author: Ginger M.
title: Works great. Love always being able to get the weather ...
content:
Bought this to go along with my Echo to control my TV  and add to my security system and Ring doorbell.  Works great.
Love always being able to get the weather & traffic in my area before leaving the house.  Also good when I'm cooking and forget a recipe,
 the temps or how long to cook a roast, etc.

author: StevenSS
title: **UPDATED**  Picture quality - not so good!
content:
After I wrote my original review (below), I started playing around with some settings, some I did not know existed.  I was able to improve the image quality of the display.  I've been wanting to return to this review and give Amazon credit and change my rating.  Although I'm sure it's pointless now, I see there is a second generation released.

One of the benefits of the Echo Show, was the benefit to have your photos (a) as a backdrop or (b) a slide show.  This is one of the primary reasons I wanted the Show.  I have sworn by Amazon products since day one, I have been a Beta tester for some.  However, the quality of the display is just not up to Amazon's standards.  Highly disappointed!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Music is on every day playing her favorite artists.
content: I gave this to my wife for Christmas...she is not a technology person...but she loves this. Music is on every day playing her favorite artists...she sets timers, looks up receipes...We were having health treatments about an hour away and she figured out how to check travel time by asking Alexa...working out much better than I expected. Who knows what she will figure out next.

author: Family-Man
title: Another Step Forward
content: We are heavily in the Amazon ecosystem. Amazon Prime, two Echo Dots,an Echo, and an Echo Tap. And we've now added the Echo Show.  We tied in some automation using TP-Link products and the Logitech Harmony Hub. It takes some patience to get everything working.The Echo Show is a big step forward. It's so nice to see results on the screen when you ask questions. If you like your Amazon Echo or Echo Dot...get this.

author: lynne davidson
title: Love video chat feature
content: Love it, bought my mother the 2nd generation ( she is 86 and lives in UK) and now we can have free Video chats whenever she wants to. Shrinks the miles for us. I also like watching YouTube videos on the

author: Amberlicious
title: Love My Echo
content: I loooooove my echo! I paired it with several smart outlets, so I now have a sorta-smart home and waste less time googling recipes, walking across the house to turn a light on or off, and can turn on my sous vide from my office.

author: MrRat
title: Nothing wrong with it, just nothing to get excited about.
content: I have found that my screen usage doesn't justify the extra cost.  I love my Echo Dots, which are scattered around my house, and this works just was well.  Just not $100 better.

author: disappointed 1
title: Product does not show Blink video, nor youtube. ...
content: Product does not show Blink video, nor youtube. What is purpose of a screen when the functions are limited. Save your money and just buy a dot or regular Echo.

author: Karen C
title: Only downfall is that you can only change the name ...
content: Only downfall is that you can only change the name to 1 of 4 different names.  we have 4 echo products in our home... Hope to see this change in the near future.

author: MJ
title: A must have for alexa users
content: Such a great upgrade to the old alexa. Better responsiveness, changable backrounds screen to display your schedule. and the video calling is amazing.

author: Robert B. Hamilton
title: Love it.  Thanks Amazon!
content: I love Alexa.  I'm all in.  100%.  I've got 14 Echo's of one sort or another.  But have to say the Show is the best of the bunch.  We picked up a pair for $149 each on Superbowl Sunday.  So far I haven't done the video chat thing - not sure I would like that feature even though it seems to be what Amazon had in mind when they invented the Show.  But I like seeing the lyrics of songs scroll by.  I like the way the Show links to my Nest cameras.  The audio quality seems on par with existing Echo's.  What's not to love?  That said, if you don't have a Nest camera or Ring doorbell I'd probably skip this model and get a less expensive Echo.

author: Mr Keith Lazarus
title: Lots of potential but lacking
content:
The technology is great but I find the video offerings to be lacking.  I would love, for example, to be able to view my Google Photos on this device but that doesn't work (Amazon Prime Photos does, though).  I don't believe Youtube is supported either.

This was my fourth Echo that I purchased and I love the technology.  That being said, I don't have any patience for supporting Amazon getting involved in  a sparring contest with Google.  I don't care about your issues - just sort them and let me access my Google-hosted data with the Amazon device.

author: AmazonCustomerUSA
title: Ordered on March 12, 2018
content: So we have had this a long while now and we paid full price back then at $229.99 and honestly at first it was great until you realize you couldn't use it with youtube and it only worked with amazon prime and it wouldn't work with netflix or anything else. Then it wasn't really worth it anymore. I let my prime service run out and the echo Show was pretty much useless so to be honest with you I wait now before I buy to see how things go in the market and if the prices lowers or a cheaper version comes out. I'm a prime member again and wish they let us use youtube or netflix with the echo show..

author: Sparky
title: Almost perfect but lacking some very important features
content: So far so good, purchased mainly so I can see who is at my doors, with my Ring Video Doorbells, disappointed that you cannot talk or zoom in. Also must have feature for the alarm clock, no battery backup if the power goes off you will have no alarm. Also no longer can you access YouTube.

author: Edbikenski
title: Only Ehco product I have that will not auto connect to wi-fi!
content: I have two Ehco's and an Echo Dot and purchased  the Show.  It was a mistake.  The show will not reconnect automatically when there is a power outage or a disruption in power.  All the other Echos will reconnect without an issue.  So stay away from this model and maybe the Gen 2 has resolved this issue.  Not worth the extra investment.

author: ryan blanchard
title: Device broke before the device was paid in full
content:
Purchased the device with the payment option Amazon was running on the echo devices and well my screen broke before I even paid the last payment. Unfortionitly for me I was outside my refund, so a refund was out the window.  They did offer to replace the item but you're going to be without your device for about a week or more because you have to pack it up and drop it off at ups.

Device 1 out of 5
Amazon 5 out of 5

Bottom line there is some manufacturing issues that hopefully have been caught by now, this thing sits on a shelf there should be no reason anything breaks

author: Chris C
title: Has great potential with the right upgrades.
content:
So before the Echo Show, I've never own any Amazon voice command devices.  I will say I was impressed with Alexa.
The sound quality on Echo Show is crisp and clear.  I usually have music playing from my bedroom in the morning when I woke up and can hear it well from the bathroom about 15 feet away.  The volume bar is interesting, in my opinion, I feel like the 9 to 10 option is more like 5 to 10.  There's a dramatic increase in sound.

Video quality is essentially on par with that of my laptop with high definition.  The 7inch touch screen makes wonders of this device.  You can adjust the brightness as well and can work as a night light for moments you don't feel like turning on your bedroom light to move around.

WiFi connectivity is pretty solid and I usually have multiple devices connected to Alexa.  I can control her while I'm downstairs and still have a strong signal.

Voice Command, so this is where it gets a bit tricky.  For the most part, Alexa does a good job when I ask her to set my alarm to a specific time or what the weather or any silly questions when I'm bored.  However, for some reason she has the hardest time with music when I ask her to play a certain song from different music programs.  I usually talk to her in a steady normal pace and sometimes she still gets it wrong.

Overall, Alexa has good potential.  The apps that follow with Alexa could be much better as sometimes they do not work or they're quite useless.  Unfortunately, with the dispute between Youtube and Amazon, it no longer plays Youtube access videos on Amazon and that's certainly a downside to me.

author: Eric Allen
title: Screen is garbage!!!!!!!
content: The screen glitches and distorts constantly!! Apparently if it is more than a few months old Amazon does not take it back or offer a repair. By far worst product from amazon.

author: Serenity63
title: Buggy
content: Buggy start because it only acknowledges 'correct' commands, rather than several options. "cancel" should be the same as "stop" but it's not. Also,  phone calls should take precedence in the audio system, as it does in an android linked car. But instead, the background app is still playing over the phone call. try to cancel the app, and it hangs up the phone.

author: ChrisBlec
title: It's great, except for the homescreen.
content:
Echo Show is a nice little device.

I'd give it 5 stars if it weren't for the incredibly intrusive and annoying homescreen. Yes, it's so bad that it's worth removing 2 stars over it.

What's wrong with the homescreen? Well, you literally cannot turn off the newsfeed that scrolls across the bottom. Yes, you can go into settings and turn off certain types of news, but you can never get rid of the "Tips" from Amazon.

The Echo Show currently has a prominent place in my living room. However, I will not allow Amazon to advertise its services to my houeguests. If the homescreen doesn't offer an option without newsfeed in the next 2 weeks, then I'll need to return the 2 Shows that I bought.

author: SodiumAnnie
title: Helpful and fun
content: This was a gift to us. Didn't even think we needed one. But it has been fun to figure out and helpful for the little bits of information needed throughout the day. It's easy to sync to devices as desired. I live that I can connect it to my Spotify music. Nice addition to our little collection of techie things!

author: Dave Lennox
title: GREAT kitchen tool
content: It's kinda hard to rate something that's the first in its category, but here's how I've used/enjoyed the Echo Show. GREAT for setting timers if you're into cooking and actually care about not burning/drying out your food. GREAT for a calculator as you just call out the math and she calculates it for you. I've had fun playing Jeopardy!, and yes, you have to type it with an exclamation point! I've used it to suggest recipes, which it then shows you the ingredients and instructions and my family LOVED the mahi-mahi which I made, which means "strong-strong" in Hawaiian. I use it to play music by just telling it to play jazz, alternative rock, whatever. I have never actually ordered anything on it (sorry Amazon Echo people). While I could watch videos on it but haven't, it's great to have a screen to immediately see what's playing on the radio, how much left on your timer, and obviously cooking instructions that you don't have to write down.

author: Amore
title: Speaker sounds horrible
content: Google gives me more info. Disappointed on the sound quality on the speaker. Sounds gets worse when the volume is turned up when listening to music. The echo dot for it to be so small, the quality sounds amazing. Echo dot allows me to connect to other bluetooth devices but this one keeps giving me error messages. Gave it 3 stars for the video concept.

author: D. Smith
title: Unlimited Music streaming only on 1 device :(
content: Excellent idea, poor execution. So we are a family of 5 who absolutely loves Amazon. Since the launch of echo "Alexa" products we have been on board. We use many features daily to navigate through our hectic schedule. I have come to one fault that you may not be aware ove. When you stream from a stationary device such as an echo show, tap, dot, etc, you will not be able to stream music from another echo device or mobile device. I feel that a stationary proprietary device like the echos should not be held against your unlimited music device. I understand that Amazon does have a family plan, however, feel a little upset that a stationary device such as the echo products only allows for one user at a time. Unfortunately, I have 3 echo products that I can not fully enjoy :(

author: Phillip Jones
title: Great product. It is very useful having the screen ...
content: Great product.  It is very useful having the screen on there.  Use it to view my ring doorbell when I'm in my office to see if I need to go answer or can just keep working.  Would be great to have the ability to talk to the ring door bell.  Also nice for finding a recipe and having it show up on the screen

author: Bryant
title: Good start...One major issue - The cord color.
content: The unit is okay.  We are enjoying it in the kitchen, especially in the mornings.  Have a very white and grey kitchen so we bought the white until and we are very shocked that most of the front is white and the CORD IS BLACK.  It is such an eye sore in the kitchen on the marble countertops.  Too bad such a small thing is overlooked.  I researched online and cannot even find one to buy.  Please make one :)

author: Diana
title: it was definitely worth it and I am happy with my purchase
content: I bought this for the prime day special price, it was definitely worth it and I am happy with my purchase. If I had paid 100 dollars more for its listed price, I wouldn't be as happy because there is a lack of features that make the Show a bit hard to handle, such as for prime video, one is unable to browse through all selections, they only display the top 20 movies on prime or so. If you know what movie you want to see you can ask Alexa and she will oblige but it just feels like there is little you can do to manage the Echo Show from its own interface. Also Alexa find it hard to understand "go home" sometimes so I have resorted to saying "exit skill" which works sometimes.

author: little davie
title: It's outstanding
content: I'm surprised, It will do about anything. Sing songs, play movies, complex math. and answer questions. The sound is fairly good and the picture is outstanding. I would like it to be battery powered, but it's not. Ask it to play happy birthday (your name) and it play the cutest happy birthday song to you.

author: Melanie Sirof
title: OK when it worked
content: Looks like I have the screen flicker like so many others. The device was useful, but quality issues have rendered it useless. Now, I have to wait for a return label. Then find a box to mail it back, so they can maybe send me a new one.

author: Candace
title: Convenience - I love it!
content: I love the way I was able to connect it to my home security. I just wish it was compatible with my LG smart TV.

author: K-9
title: Nice upgrade
content: I like this Echo, I have several other devices but this one has nice sound plus the alarm clock and it responds to voice and displays stuff on screen.  I had the regular echo and this is much nicer.

author: Lifejoker
title: Good as regular echo but needs more specific skills to be more than an echo with a digital picture frame
content: I like my echo devices i have multiple echos and echo dots. added an echo show to my setup. i basically control my lights, my music, my home cinema with them. So the echo show does the job. the speakers in the echo show still dont match my Sonos systems and are not better than the regular echo. the screen for now is pretty useless aside from being a glorified picture frame since you cant customize the home screen to any great extent and there are not many echo show enhanced skills. its nice to see whats playing when you run music through the echo, but since i mostly run the music through sonos dosent have much use. The screen itself seems nicely built, so i am waiting for skills to use it and most importantly for that home screen to be fully customisable including removing the tips and temperature and being able to have a full weather forecast for example. Nice device still inbeta if you ask me

author: A. Pena
title: It's worth the money, no issues so far, screen is actually very useful.
content: I thought it would mostly a gimmick, but I really like the show.  Just as good as the other Echoes, but the screen is very useful for weather quick glances, movie previews for planning a night out, and playing songs with all the lyrics on the screen.  Is it necessary, no, but it increases functionality and my kids are begging for their own to do Karaoke.  Love it.  Sounds great for a little box too.  Would buy again.

author: Sage B
title: It’s the best of Alexa, worth the upgrade
content: I already had two echo and two dots so I didn’t need a show. Bought during prime day the price was too good, so I picked one up. Within a day I ordered another. The dots are retiring, and the shows are amazing. They are essentially the same with a screen. It’s nice to ask for videos for kitchen needs and music, prime shows etc. the sound is superior imo even to the echo which is great on its own. The mice hear me from across the house, so I actually needed less coverage. There is much more to learn, I am very pleased.

author: Arthur
title: Quality is amazing!
content: This is way ahead of our time. There is so much it can do. The quality is impressive and the sound is amazing! Good for a whole floor.

author: E. Tom Jorgenson
title: Everything Except the Base is Inspired
content: I really like everything about it except the case. The case was created to mount in only one position and it has an awkward shape for any other use. I wanted to put it on the top of my treadmill in the media slot, but it won't fit there. Too bad, it would have been the perfect way to entertain myself while walking the treadmill. Other features are really nice.

author: Andrew Demcak
title: Almost, Not Quite
content: I really wanted to love this. I really did. Having met and fallen in love with Alexa last October when I got my first Echo Dot, I was expecting the same radical change to my household. One of the main reasons this didn't happen is: with the Dot you have freedom to roam around and interact with Alexa, with Show you have to stand in front of it to justify the screen. I'm so used to hearing information spoken aloud to me from Alexa that adding an image to it seems unnecessary. It's a nice product. It does all the things the Dot does plus more, but it's disappointingly less useful. I wanted it in the dinning room, but it wasn't as useful as the Dot. Bedroom was out because even when the screen is off it emits light and any movement triggers it to turn back on. I settled on the kitchen counter where it sits next to my kitchen utensils and the stove. At least here I can ask to watch a video of how to bone a chicken and do the activity at the same time. So far it's working well there and I'm hoping for updates and improvements to make Show more a part of my household.

author: Fred Schuellerman
title: Amazon Customer Service Sucks!!!??
content:
Bought this for my elderly mother so we could better stay in touch as she lives in PA and we live in ID. 3 months after she received it it now flashes white lines across the screen. Hasn't worked for 3 or 4 weeks now. That entire time we have been trying to get Amazon to replace this for her with absolutely zero progress. She is 82 years old and 2500 miles away, tech support is not an option for her, she can barely use her cell phone. You really screwed this one up Amazon. Next upgrade we will go with the new Google portals.
Signed, very disgusted with Amazon customer service!!!

author: Thomas Jackson
title: Don't waste your money!
content:
Don't waste your money.  I own an echo gen 1, and echo gen 2 and a dot. They all do a far better job of voice recognition that the Echo Show.  In fact, it is so bad that it is virtually useless.  Also, the speaker is incredibly bass heavy....so much so that it is hard to understand voices.  I've worked to adjust the bass and punch the mids and treble, but it still sounds awful.  Finally, the screen just doesn't add much.  I can't see if from across the room, it rarely activates in any meaningful way, and when it doesn't, it is more of a distraction than a help.(Using FaceTime is so much more practical
than using the Show.) I'm surprised Amazon didn't make this a little more useful than it is.  Perhaps in the future, but for now, it is a waste of time and money.

author: J. Watkins
title: Disappointed, not very useful.
content: This is not as useful as I thought it would be, I am disappointed. I have been hoping for a firmware update to add functionality but they released a new model, so I don't think an update is coming.

author: Shqipe
title: Love the karaoke style lyrics when playing songs and the ...
content: Love the karaoke style lyrics when playing songs and the sound quality is great. The product scanning feature is cool too. Nice addition to my echo dot and echo look. Would be nice if the screen were a little bigger but I am sure that will come eventually in a future version.

author: With love by Ash
title: Lazy programming and poor design is keeping this line from being awesome.
content:
I love all 5 of my Echos (mostly) but there are a few gotchas that just kill the experience. My biggest complaint is the lack of continuity in the platform for each model. For instance, you cannot setup the WIFI on the Echo Show from the app... but all the non-visual models use the app exclusively. The app is sluggish and buggy with UI failures that scream LAZY PROGRAMMING. Then of course, there is the point on the Show where you MUST ENTER YOUR PASSWORD to "prove" you are who you say you are. ABSURD AMAZON. I have huge, cryptic passwords that are stored in a password manager and cached in the Amazon applications I use...  to demand the user TYPE this on the visual keyboard is stupid. There are better ways to verify this IN THE APP.

The continuity issues are due to lazy programming and poor design. Do better Amazon. Alexa is cool and *IF* done right, the Echo line can be as cool as it should be by now. You can do better. STOP BEING LAZY.

author: wayne j. s.
title: Works fine most of the time.
content:
Bought as a gift to replace original Echo but the Show seems to loose internet connection which the original never did.  This unit is set up in the same area as the original Echo.  Also ccassionaly cuts out for a short period of time.
  I do like the video features and will continue to learn its new features.

author: AliciaR
title: This is a great little dohicky
content: This is a great little dohicky! My kids have fun playing songs on it and watching some shows.  The only thing I dislike is you can access YouTube.

author: Juan Garcia
title: Good unit overall
content:
I bought 6 of these things. I have a pretty big house and some sort of Alexa device in all my rooms.

First- This thing sounds noticeably better then the standard echo. I ended up buying "Amazon Music unlimited" because I like the ability to play specific songs and to my surprise, there is a phone app that lets you use it on your mobile.

I also really like the drop in feature. I used it so far to communicate from one room to another. If you have a 2 story house, you will quickly appreciate this feature.

There are some weird app things that I wish were different. Example- I have a ring doorbell and the Show will not notify you someone is at the door. You have to either listen for the doorbell or have your phone with you to see the alert. Once you get the alert, you have to then dial in. Another werid thing is that if you want to see your front door bell and there is nothing there; it will say "your doorbell is asleep, please wait 30 seconds and try again". Wished they would just let you see loading and not have to repeat the command in 30 seconds.

Also would be nice if the display would show Nest temps on standby. I have 2 nests and still have to use my phone to see the temp.

Still giving it 4 stars since my only issues with this unit are software based and Im certain Amazon will update these units quickly. The hardware is great and so far I am happy.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Worst purchase ever
content: I had this amazon show for a month and a half and the screen started glitching. I sent it in per amazon request exactly as it came. In the original box with instructions and power cord. When it was returned to me it was not in the original box and had no instructions and NO power cord. Better yet it had a dent in the top. The flat out refused to replace it with anything but a refurbished one and I refused since I had bought this one new less then 2 months prior. Since then it has been a complete nightmare dealing with customer service.
