I finally got my first few installment payments back(I purchased this in installments, once which was due while they were repairing it) and they still cannot manage to cancel the remaining payments due. I have never felt with such clueless and less helpful and uninformed people in my life. Every time I dealt with someone I got a different answer and was assured everything would be fine. I was also told twice they would put a $10 gift certificate on my account for my troubles which i still do not have!

author: #1 Amazon Customer
title: Speaker makes popping noise
content:
0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player The speaker started making a popping noise about a month ago, so it is no longer good for listening to music either. It's a fun topic of conversation, but the screen isn't very useful in our daily lives.

Edit 4/9/2018 - An Amazon customer service rep contacted me due to this review, which I really appreciated. After multiple phone calls and being transferred around, I got to a rep who said "this is a hardware issue. I'll send you a shipping label to return it for repair." Great, I said. But I told him I needed them to be sure to note that the popping noise starts after 30 minutes of speaker use. I even wrote it on the return label. I went to UPS, paid $5 for them to package it, and waited. 10 days later, the device is returned to me with a message that "We’ve reloaded the latest software onto your device, run it through our diagnostic process, and confirmed that it is working correctly. Your device should now be fully functional and is being shipped back to you."

Guess what? It is not fixed. Exact same problem. I have downgraded my review to one star.

author: John M Holly
title: Extremely poor quality cell cellular phone to Show unless your phone ...
content:
Negatives:
Extremely poor quality cell cellular phone to Show unless your phone is connected to WiFi and not cellular data. Basically worthless with cellular.

Classic BAIT AND SWITCH by Amazon.  Music choices are extremely limited even if you have Amazon Prime account. This is 100% the opposite of what Amazon advertises.  I ended up having to add the music monthly along with the yearly Prime to play current top 40 songs.

Unable to play you tube videos. Very bad decision by Amazon

Positives:
Show to Show video is excellent even when one is connected to dial up. This is why I gave it a three star. Otherwise a one star.

author: 4Kids2Dogs
title: Best Echo device yet!
content: I didn't realize just how much we would love the Echo Show - but we do! It's great to have a small screen to watch short videos or read news stories, and the scrolling alerts are a nice way to keep up to date on what's happening. The kids love the song lyrics that play along with the music. We have pretty much every Echo device available in our house at this point, and this one is definitely the family favorite.

author: Melissa Torres
title: Love my Echo Show
content: Love my Echo Show. I can listen to Pandora, stream movies (Amazon Prime Member), find new recipes, have Alexa turn on and off my lights in my living room (you'll need the hub to do this though), check on my kids and and actually see them, see what upcoming movies are at movie theaters, and LIVE video chat with my bro-in-law on his echo show in another state (through drop in). It's a pretty cool gadget.  This will definitely will be a FAMILY CHRISTMAS GIFT that keeps on giving.

author: Bill W
title: Alexa is great.
content: We have two of these and some dots.  They are used daily. Playing music and setting an alarm is an important feature. Alexa can do other things such as simple math operations. An internet connection with wi-fi is required. Alexa also interfaces with our z-wave devices. The down side is that Alexa is always listening.  Be careful what you say around her.  The TV and radio sometimes gets a response from her.

author: D. Goldsmith
title: Good device at the reduced price, but needs an EQ for the sound
content: Good form factor for Alexa, solid device...I just expected better sound quality. The sound is flat, muffled and "bassy" on the kitchen counter. With the visual touch interface, this device could really make use of an equalizer to dial in the sound. As it is currently, the original Echo has a more rounded sound quality, even if it lacks bass.

author: John Granillo
title: I bought the Amazon Echo and liked it. I saw the new Echo Show and ...
content: I bought the Amazon Echo and liked it. I saw the new Echo Show and how it works with the Arlo camera and I thought it would be a great security feature in my newly constructed home. I tried to be diligent and read the reviews and features, etc. I ordered the Arlo camera and base station package thinking I had ordered the camera with intercom. Wrong! I ordered the regular camera and not the Pro. I thought ok, my error. I returned the camera, and ordered the Arlo Pro camera to replace it, checking first that the base station would work with the Arlo Pro. Great! Now I can hook up my new Alexa Show and use the Arlo camera just like in the ads! Wrong again. After spending two days with both Netgear (Arlo) and Amazon tech support Arlo finally tracked down the problem. The Echo show will not receive any motion alerts from the camera, and will not transmit your voice to the camera. That can be done using only the Arlo app on your cell phone. If you think you can use the Echo show as an intercom with the camera, like I was foolish enough to believe, you will be wrong. So why use the Echo Show????? I never saw any information telling me of the limitations using the Echo Show. Sure saw a lot of ads touting how great it is to use the Echo Show with the Arlo camera! Misleading? Do your research, you be the judge!

author: John Go
title: Amazing!
content: Arrived on time. I really love this product. Easy to install and use. Update, I have had this product for three months now and I absolutely in love with it! The only down side is without the internet this device is useless. You can’t do anything without internet, you can’t even set the alarm without the internet.

author: PCP1219
title: echo vs show
content: seems like the echo under me much better that show. I like the screen, but this Alexa has a much lower IQ than her older sister Alexa echo.sound is as good as echo .

author: Roger B. Atkins
title: Another tech toy
content:
If you were particularly interested in the Calling & Messaging features, but you don't have a smart phone with a service plan in effect, you may want to consider the regular Echo, as opposed to the Echo Show, at least for the time being.

The following is based partly on experience and partly on Amazon technical support. Echo Show is not a voice activated substitute for VoIP programs like Skype. You will not be able to set up and use some Echo Show features, including calling and messaging, unless you have a smart phone with a smart phone service plan. Flip phones, phones without text messaging, and smart phones without service plans, will not facilitate the process of setting up and using some features, such as calling and messaging. The smart phone must have a recent version of the operating system. I received conflicting information as to version requirements, but Android version 6.0 is supposed to work according to Amazon tech support. The set up process requires entering a phone number to which a text message will be sent containing a verification code which must be retrieved and entered into the Alexa app on the smart phone. The PC and Kindle Fire versions of the app do not support the set up process for calling and messaging.

According to Amazon tech support, the smart phone must be in operation when making or receiving calls or messages. You can only call or send messages to people from your smart phone contacts list who have a suitable Amazon Echo product and who have already completed the set up for calling and messaging, which means they would have to have a smart phone and a service plan. Why use Echo Show instead of calling by phone or by using a VoIP program such as Skype? The only advantage the Echo Show may have is voice activation, completely hands free, which may not be worth the price of admission for flip phone users.

I have not yet discovered a substantive feature of the Echo Show (except those requiring a smart phone) that I did not already have through my regular Echo, Fire TV, and/or Amazon Music. Also, the Echo Show screen can become annoying and distracting, not to mention the energy waste, so I turned off the screen when not in use (most of the time).

Echo Show is still a fun toy, but it could/should have been more.

author: Michael A. Liguori
title: Echo Excellent
content: We placed this in our kitchen and it is ideal if you want a quick question answered or just to play music while cooking. The set  up was incredibly easy. If you wish to search for a recipe, Alexa locates several. We really enjoy the Echo.

author: Maureen Fink
title: Figuring out what I can do
content: Was easy to set up. I'm still figuring out what all I can do on it. I think it will be helpful once I figure more of itout

author: Henry Faley
title: Totally fun addition to our home..
content: We quickly found all sorts of things to do with Alexa.  She gives us the weather in the morning, the news during the day and helps with our shopping lists.  She is great as a timer and is set up to display our Ring doorbell camera.  We were so happy with it, we ordered another for a my wife's sister in another state. She says it's the best gift she's ever received.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Doesn't work
content:
Update - After working with Amazon tech support, I returned the Echo Show and bought a new one. This one doesn't even work as well as the first one! Will have to send this one back too. But won't be buying another one.

Good for getting forecast, but many other questions go unanswered, even if we ask a question that Echo Show prints on screen. When it says 'try this:' and we do, Alexa often doesn't answer. The light stays blue for a minute or so, like it is trying to find an answer. Alexa often says "I'm still learning. I will get back to you when I have the answer." With all the hype about Alexa, I expected it to work better.

author: asmurray5
title: The Echo Show is an excellent automated companion
content: The Echo Show is an excellent automated companion, and it integrates with a lot of wi-fi enabled products. I would definitely recommend the Amazon Echo Show.

author: Brad Smidt
title: Worth the extra cost and great for your "home hub"
content:
Love that i can face time with the family via my phone app while on the road.  We also created a "show" album in amazon prime photos and the show will cycle through those photos on the home screen.  Also like the viewable timers, weather, etc

Dont like that you cant remove the "Alexa tips" from the home screen so you'll always see things like "Alexa show movies with Matt Damon" etc

author: Amazon Customer
title: Echo Show is the best echo
content:
We have three other echo devices, and this is our favorite - it provides a running display of what is coming up on our calendar and makes visual suggestions of what else we can try on Echo.

We have it in the kitchen so we can see any timer we have running and check out the stock report. It's become our communication hub for our family. The quality of the speaker makes listening to music that much better.

author: Melissa Richardson
title: Does what it advertises - perhaps not exactly what you expect.
content:
The Alexa show is pretty nice. It looks pretty when it sits on your table, gives you the time, temp, random news or interest stories which are sometimes interesting. The main thing I use it for is music, which of course you can do without the screen, but you can play amazon prime movies which is nice when I just want something on while we eat a quick lunch. I'm sure there are other aspects of the device I haven't found yet that are also very useful.

However. I think this is almost like a partially-completed product. Many of the "skills" (what they call apps) are not optimized to take advantage of the screen. However, this is a software issue that could be addressed as time goes on and more people own the Show versions of alexa. Also (and this is entirely my fault for lack of research) I was expecting a little more integration with regular internet. You can't even play YouTube videos. I get that they are different companies but hopefully in the future they can work out a deal. If you could get Neflix or Hulu on here as well as YouTube, then you'd really have a product that was worth something.

If these sort of software integration things were my only concern, I would give four stars, as it's possible it could be corrected in the future without me purchasing anything else. I took one more star off because I think Amazon really missed an opportunity to put at least one usb charge port on this thing. Another lapse in integration, but this one can't be solved by a software update.

If you're on the fence about the Alexa show, maybe just wait a while. If you love Prime movies (although it doesn't remember where you stopped watching; or even what you were watching, you have to go through the whole thing every time) then maybe it's worth it. I got it on Prime Day sale. I wouldn't want to pay full price for what feels like a beta test run for this product.

author: Chaz Boudoir
title: Love the retro look and feel
content: I have really come to like the 1st Generation over the 2nd Generation Echo Show. I tried both and returned the 2nd Gen because I didn't really see it as much of an improvement. Yes, the 1st has a smaller screen but honestly, if you want something bigger, that is what a Fire HD 10 is for or better yet, your TV. I use it for music playing, seeing the lyrics and who is playing. It looks quite nice on the kitchen counter with the white retro appeal. Yeah, I'm keeping her. :)

author: Pat f
title: Our 1st echo
content: We love our Echo Show. This must be one tough little unit since it was packed in a great big box with nothing around it and bounced around in there the entire time while it was on its way here. And it still works.

author: John Mallow
title: Echo No-Show: No YouTube, no Hulu, no Netflix
content:
So, got this as a Christmas gift, and it doesn't seem to do anything but answer stupid and/or amusing questions. It can't play Hulu, Netflix or YouTube so it's basically a video box for Amazon properties. Mine is sitting on the counter in the kitchen as a glorified alarm clock that occasionally displays a headline that I care about. You (and I) are better off propping our iPads (or other tablets) up and watching whatever we want without restrictions. I'll give it a point for having a decent speaker for something this size but not worth $200+.

****UPDATE 1/4/2018****
Not even an hour after posting this review yesterday an Amazon CS representative called me. He was curious as to what my chief complaints were, which I reiterated from my review above. I know a service rep can't magically make the missing features appear, but Amazon's prompt addressing of my review is a good sign that they are possibly working to remedy these issues. I just wish that the family member who bought this as a gift for me had read the reviews. I'd much rather have $200 in gift cards or something else that I could actually use.

****UPDATE 1/5/2018****
As much as I would love to have faith in Amazon to get some more features and capabilities added to the Echo Show, I have decided to part ways. I'm really not interested in having a $229 alarm clock sitting on the kitchen counter until Amazon improves its functionality. I can't return it so I am putting it up for sale online. If you know someone who'd be interested in a basically brand-new Echo Show and lives in Western North Carolina, check out my Craigslist posting. https://asheville.craigslist.org/ele/d/amazon-echo-show-brand-new/6449167504.html

author: T ruiz
title: We both absolutely love it. Mom can’t use a cell phone to ...
content: I bought the amazon show for my elderly mother who lives In an assisted living in another state.  We both absolutely love it.  Mom can’t use a cell phone to FaceTime so this has been so great for us.  She says it’s the best gift ever and she would not take a million dollars for her Alexa!  She also loves how it plays all her favorite music!  Thanks for a great product amazon

author: Charlie J.
title: Phone video is good but I ask it to play song and it ...
content: Phone video is good but I ask it to play song and it just plays a sample and without you tube it went down hill I bought three for family Christmas presents basically I can do same with my phone made a mistake purchasing maybe they will get better

author: Kindle Customer
title: Fun Echo product
content: Easy to use, Answers all my questions,Hands free, What's not to like , It may not be perfect but it is  a sign of the times to come, can be connected to smart home items, I enjoy it totallly,, Keeps your home connected

author: S. Isom
title: I thought I was upgrading, but it’s a big step down from my regular echo.
content:
I thought I was upgrading, but it’s a big step down from my regular echo.  First the microphone is far worse than my old first generation echo. Voice commands that used to work great with my old device, now routinely fail and drive me crazy!  I now have to walk to within a few inches of the device to have any chance of being understood, and it still misunderstands about a third of the time. I have three other echoes and none of them behave so poorly. Not even close.
My guess is Amazon rushed this to release before it was ready. Again. Maybe Amazon will fix this some day, but right now it is a very expensive paperweight.

author: Brazilian in the US
title: Amazon Needs to Work with Google!
content: Very limited usability without YouTube! I can't blame Google for this one, since Amazon stopped selling Google products. Please work together with Google, Amazon!

author: Chris
title: An excellent product for the Echo aficionado. Not for the fussy.
content:
This is a device for those that used the original echo and enjoy it. This is not for excessively picky people who get mad at a device because another corporate entity pulled their license. It's also not for those that are closed minded about technology.
I personally love that it shows the shopping list when I add items to it. I love that it shows the lyrics to songs that I stream from Amazon Music.
I love that I can get limited recipes on it to. I do wish it would be more customizable in that category.
I would love more control of the font especially, to be honest, mostly for the clock when my glasses are off.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Have an Echo, and a Dot, Needed a Show next will be a Spot
content:
I am a gadget guy through and through.  I love my iPad Pro, but nothing gets me more excited than new additions to the Echo line.  I have an echo, which my daughters kidnapped and keep in their room and I have a dot, and I absolutely love them both.  I was on the verge of getting the spot, when I saw a price reduction on the show.  I had wanted preorder it but was not in a position to when it came out.  Take all of the auditory recreation & educational opportunities you get from the original echo and add the Visual element, the result is a fantastic piece of technology.  It is more portable than it seems.  It has too many abilities and functions to list.

Get one, take the time to truly learn how to use it and stay up to date on new skills as they become available.  It is entirely cloud based, there is no limit to the skills, games, programs etc... that you can add.  It truly is a one of a kind device.

I’ve researched and tried google home and related devices, and got to try out Apples new release just yesterday, they are years behind being worthy of comparison.

The show is the best of them all

author: GA GN
title: Jury still out on the added screen
content:
I bought the original Echo the day it came out.  I always said if it had a screen it could be so much more---I'm still waiting for the more part after having the Show for a few days.  Like the original Echo when it first came out, it took a while and some updates to reach potential.  This Show still needs those updates.  First thing to note is that it's not very customizable.  You're very limited with the settings.  You can change the background pics and a couple of the scrolling options, but that's about it.  I was expecting more of a tablet experience, but now as I'm typing this it is more like my Fire tablet where you don't have the same ability to customize like you would a standard Android Tablet.  I'm just very disappointed in the limitations.  I was hoping that you could change the screen to show like a weather station, etc.  Just more options.  As others have stated, there is a constant message that gives you suggests to "Try" on the screen.  You can hide this, in a way, by turning off the scrolling and just keeping it on your calendar, which we use Google calendar linked to the Alexa app.  I don't mind the "Try" scrolling right now because sometimes it's good to see what other things it can do.  But I could see wanting to turn this feature off at some point....but you can't.....right now.  Maybe an update will cure that.
The next pet peeve was just how to get around and use the thing.  Thankfully, CNET has a good write up on their web page on how to use some of the main features and set up your Echo Show, other Echos and the Alexa app on how to use the camera remotely.  There was little to no guidance on these features and you really have to explore the thing.  I had to figure out on my own to try "Alexa, go to the settings screen" to get to settings.  For a while I was trying "Alexa, go to settings" and she responded, "Hm, I don't know the answer to the question I heard" quite a few times.
I want to say that it seems she can't hear as clearly as my original Echo.  Others have mentioned that many times, the light turns blue and....nothing...literally no response, which is odd because she usually tells you she couldn't hear you or doesn't understand.  But it's literally nothing with me standing right in front of her...er...it..  :)
Lastly, so far, the camera.  This thing is an odd shape to begin with because they didn't put chintzy speakers in it.  But since they put the face at an angle, the camera also faces upward.  So using this on a side table about waist high, when you drop in, you see mostly ceiling.  You can't see anything below about the 3.5-  4 ft level.  So if you are dropping in on your grandkids, well, you won't be able to see them.  I would only see the forehead of my 7 year old son, who is slightly tall for his age.  They should have kept the camera angle at least straight ahead and level and not the same angle as the face.  Now if I want to use it to drop in while I'm out of the house, I have to stack a few kids books under the back end of it to make the camera face straight ahead so I can see kids, pets, state of the house, etc...This seems to me like the developers only thought that people would be standing right in front of it, faces 2 ft away, standing and staring at the camera for this to really work as a "drop in" feature...that or they have a preference of staring at ceilings.
So....those are my initial thoughts.  I gave it a 3 which means "I like it" which may seem contrary to what I put above, but I bought this knowing there would be updates to help it's functionality.  The 3 is based on my past experience with the original Echo and that Echo growing into our daily usage.  I expect the same for this...except for the camera issue, the fix for that might be some kind of mount that makes it face forward.

author: HFL
title: Really cool gadget, be nice if could view video from Blink XT
content: Very handy to have around.  Ordered the wall mount to keep it off of the counter.  Slideshow feature is pretty cool.  Would be nice if it were easier to know what these things do rather than have to stumble across things, or have to do searches on what Echo can do.  It's annoying that documentation is so sparse and forces the end user to spend time researching all the things it does, or can do.  I purchased a Blink home security system thinking I would be able to view the images on this, no, it will not do that.  Maybe, since Amazon purchased Blink that will change.

author: Robin H. Darby
title: This item is fun and useful at the same time.  Just know that the USPS needs to follow thru with their delivers as promised.
content: We have really used this a lot and are enjoying it.  We keep it in our kitchen, which is the center of our house.  We can ask it anything and I really love the screen which shows the words of the songs playing at the time.  We have our pictures downloaded and they scrolling at all times.  One thing I would like Amazon to know tho.  THIS A NOTE FOR AMAZON:  Our Echo was scheduled to arrive on a Tuesday and we received an e-mail stating this.  But when it did not come Tuesday or Wednesday, we got in touch with the USPS, since that is who was responsible to deliver it.  The person (USPS) we spoke to got right on it and had the regular delivery person to turn around and deliver it since it was on her deliver that day (and may have been there the day before).  I just think if Amazon is going to rely on the USPS, they should know the deliver is not always being followed thru with the delivery promised date.

author: Cherie
title: No YouTube support because Google and Amazon have a disagreement
content:
Everything is awesome down to the speakers... Except for no YouTube support because Google and Amazon have a disagreement.

This was half the reason why I bought this product so it's a bit of a turndown... Really hoping they can resolve it in the future, but for now, you should just know that you won't be able to use YouTube if you purchase this.

I don't plan to return it just because it still supports Spotify and the hardware is very decent for the price I got it at. Love the speakers. But buying an alarm clock/music player was not my plan. PLEASE WORK TO RESOLVE DISAGREEMENTS WITH GOOGLE AND SUPPORT YOUTUBE AGAIN.

author: Vida
title: The cell phone just got a competitor.
content: I no longer have to fumble around with my cell phone to see my to-do lists. I just ask, "Computer, show my shopping list" or "Home list" or "Writing list," whatever list I've created, and it's there in large type I can see across the room. I can also ask it to check my email and the most recent unread emails appear and the first few lines read. That quickly gets me up to speed on electronic correspondence and then the news. Dailly Flash-Briefings on five things to know with pictures. Though I never used to be a fan of audiobooks, now I'm hooked after hearing a free one on the Show. Maybe seeing the book's cover made a difference. The Show will also read the nonaudio books in your Amazon books library. But I don't use this feature because I'm not a fan of Alexa's voice. I'm planning to use it to help during writing. Things I usually google like synonyms, antonym, meanings, spellings. I also like that any reminders I create flash across the screen along with some headlines. I'm still learning what else a visual person like me can do with it and so far I'm impressed. I just wish Amazon would add more voice options, including male voices like my Google mini. But the Echo Show is definitely a tremendous step up from my Echo voice-only speaker which I rarely used. I haven't used the video call feature yet and the cell phone has to be close to the Show to text, which is irritating and defeats the purpose of brief texting. Also, Echo sends a voice recording along with the text message. This is disconcerting to me. In any case, overall the Echo Show is a useful, even practical device, and I'm generally pleased with it.

author: ABF
title: Not Impressed
content: Being a computer teacher, I really wanted to try an Echo Show and wanted to love it.  But, considering it cannot even do a simple web search via voice, it was very disappointing.  Yes, I can hook it up to my home smart products, but without simple web searching, its helpfulness to me is lacking.  I also love to bake, but the only recipes it will find is in AllRecipes.  If I ask for a recipe by Martha Stewart, Alexa does not know how to help me.  Amazon also needs to quit the feud with Google and get with the program.  Bing?  Seriously, who uses Bing in today's world?

author: C. Parker
title: Great sound and unexpectedly NOT something that will play VIDEOS.
content: I hate leaving 3 stars, does anyone actually read these?  Anyway. I am VERY impressed with the sound quality of the show. NOT happy with no contract with Youtube. When you ask for it to play a video it goes to an unusable link to Youtube. Really. Dumb. Have Not watch a single moving video at all, not sure if it can even do this. Anyway, this is about as good as a dot for usability. For the size for the unit it has great sound and no need for a soundbar. Paid $120

author: Tocky
title: Alexa couldn't tell me how to pour a proper glass of guinness
content: I'm still trying to get used to using it but so far it has been awesome. The only drawback is that alexa can't tell me how to properly pour a glass of guinness

author: Bruce Lelievre
title: Nice!
content:
This is my fancy bedside alarm clock. In screen saver mode, the clock and temperature are large enough where I don't need my glasses to see the time. In power saver mode, the clock is even larger. Considering this could double as an expensive night light,  it was nice to discover the command, "Alexa, turn off the screen." As expected, the sound quality of the Echo Show is far superior then the Echo Dot. Initially, the voice recognition is far better then the Echo Dot. I don't need to yell at my Echo Show to activate it. Activation by touch screen was a bonus. I hope no rating updates will follow my initial updates as was needed with the First Generation Echo Dot.
Update 11/10/2018
My Echo Show is still working great.

author: IRate
title: One of The Best Products out There, Except for One Thing
content: The Echo Show is one of the best products out there, except there's one thing. You can't search up any YouTube videos anymore on it! However, Amazon's unlimited music is able to let me listen to the best titles out there. I don't use the calling much on it, as I don't need a use for it. It also helps me catch up on the latest news!

author: Alice Moery Keeler
title: this is amazing. The setup is super easy
content: I am a Google person.... that is an understatement. I was intrigued by this ability to make phone calls. I'm blown away, this is amazing. The setup is super easy. The sound is amazing. It's super easy to play music on it.

author: Trish G
title: The Echo Show...all  I'd hoped  it would be.
content:
I am very pleased with my new Echo Show.  I put off purchasing this item because I already have an Echo that I use all the time and couldn't justify splurging for another.  But when they ran a special I just couldn't stop myself.  The screen is such a nice addition and I love having the lyrics scroll across the screen when I'm playing music.  I'm sure I'll be taking advantage of all the things I can do with this Echo Show and am so happy with this purchase.  And I don't know how she does it but Alexa just knows me so well and always seems to recommend the best playlists. :)

I have the perfect setup for me with a reasonably priced tilt stand and 7" clear tabletop Lazy Susan.  It's a very sturdy setup and I'm not worried about knocking it over.  The unit swivels and tilts exactly the way I want for less than twenty dollars.

In addition to my device, I also purchased (on Amazon) an awesome screen protector that includes a button to cover the cam when I'm not using it and a nice silicone sleeve to help me keep my device free from dust, fingerprints, and scratches.

I just love Amazon and everything Alexa!

author: cyclegirl
title: I absolutely love this littel gadget
content: I absolutely love this littel gadget. As a prime member, this is so perfect and useful. I love the music selection (better than my Google home mini) and the sound quality is perfect! Great value too! I will be buying my father the smaller one so we can video chat!

author: franbene
title: Excellent product and price
content: At first I was kind of skeptical about the Echo products. I’v bought one echo dot to try and it was a real surprised. I then decided to try the Echo show and believe me, it has been one of those things thar really amazed me. You’ll love what this thing does

author: Mary
title: Awesome!
content: I use this all the time. Music, reminders, timers, lists......Awesome!

author: HAJ in NC
title: Possibilities, but overpriced and poor sound quality
content:
The echo show is an interesting device with lots of possibilities, I think.  The screen is bright and clear, even from a distance of 15 feet. I like this feature a lot. I can see the screen from anywhere in my kitchen.

The sound from the Show is really bad. Retail price on the show is north of $200. For $150, I can get a Sonos Play:1  that puts the sound quality of the Show to shame. I’m certain that I will never choose to listen to music on this device.

Getting started with the device would be a lot easier, I think, if Show-specific skills were easily findable either in the Alexa app or on the Show device itself.

 At the retail price, this device is too expensive. I bought at a time when the device was substantially discounted. At the discounted price of approximately $125, the Show is a worthy  addition to my Echo family.

author: Danky
title: My new kitchen companion
content: Bought this on a whim a while ago and I have to say, Alexa is a great little helper in the kitchen. So much so that I just ordered 3 dots to go around the house. It does a lot obviously, but my favorite feature is definitely being able to have multiple timers going at once.

author: Ben Studer
title: Flash back (in not a good way) to the 80's
content:
It's taken me quite since time to write this review because I don't use this every day, buy my son does.

Stress anyone what have issues were the screen flickers, fades, scrolls, and gets staticky? It's like watching over the air tv in the boonies when I was a kid in the early 80's except we can't stand in the corner with the antenna on a foot to fix it.

It sounds good, still fits everything else like my other two. Maybe just one out of three is bad?

author: R. Bennett...aka...arbee
title: and something called smart life waiting for you in the weeds
content:
Just Alexa works as advertised however, this not something for a senior citizen unless you are very skilled with the technology and don't plan to hook up your lights any time soon....they don't tell you about the other hurdles with dealing with your smartphone, and something called smart life waiting for you in the weeds....good luck!!  SMART?...not so much.......have your grandson nearby.
UPDATE:  An Amazon tech named Tim called me and we are working through my situation.  Tim is very courteous and helpful and we will get this done!!  Never have I experienced such amazing and professional customer service.....Amazon rocks!!!!

author: Phyllis Jean
title: Almost there...
content: I love this product but I need more phone features!  I want call waiting, ability to dial passwords and to make conference calls - all the abilities I have with my regular phone line.  I do have the Echo Connect as well.  I am hoping there are firmware updates in the future to address the extra capabilities that will set this apart in the smart speaker space!  With that being said, the sound quality is amazing for both calls and videos/music.

author: Scott K
title: I really dislike "Things to Try"
content:
Nice device, good concept.  I also have an Echo Spot and the screen on this is much nicer and quite large for what it is.  You can do a lot with Echo, and the list of things to do grows every single month.  It seems like a very solid device, though time will tell.

I deducted two stars because of the useless "Things to Try feature" that cannot be shut off.  It is barely masked advertising that spoils an otherwise decent device.  There is no way to shut it off.  On the Spot, it can be hidden by selecting to only rotate the home cards once.  On the Show, that is not the case.  This is a common complaint with Echo devices that have screens.  I mean I could set up the device to rotate my own photos, but what's the point when there is some big blob of text going across the bottom of every photo?

If they insist on keeping this, they should allow the option to remove it for a bit of extra $$, like they do with removing ads from Kindles.  I'd pay.  I bet that others would as well.

If I'd paid full price for this, it would already be in the box, headed back to Amazon.  Because I got it for $100 off, I will probably end up keeping it and continue hoping (against hope, no doubt) that they eventually allow the ability to remove this very annoying "feature".

Update 12/15/2018 - I didn't realize that I'd already reviewed this and came here to do review it.  I haven't changed my mind about any of the above.  The only thing to add is this thing has a difficult time understanding what's said, particularly when there is ANY noise at all in the room.  If the tv is on, forget about it.  To get it to do anything, I have to mute the tv first.  At many times, it seems mostly deaf.  I'm expecting Amazon to release the Amazon Echo Hearing Aid For Echo Show.  They'll probably only charge $49.99 for it.

author: Tomek
title: Sounds great!
content:
Can't believe it took me this long to finally get one. Great for the kitchen in regards to music, recipes, and just overall fun.
The sound is great!

author: geri 74
title: great volume
content: We love this. I can look up recipes, watch a movie on Amazon Prime, listen to silly jokes and so much more. I love the calender feature. We've only had this for one day and looking forward to learning more things to do.

author: Kimberly
title: Happy with the purchase.
content: Love having this on my desk. Nice size screen, personal photos screen saver, time and temp always displayed, shows lyrics while music plays, good sound. Wish Alexa had better (Google) answers available to her.

author: kal
title: Screen broke down after 1-2 month use
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player This product really is not reliable.  we didnt even us it much and screen started having issues just for being plugged in for about a month or so.  Then it gradually became really really bad.

author: Rachel_mom
title: Nice when it’s not in the shop!
content: I received the show as a Christmas gift. I wasn’t sure I’d like it or really use it but we quickly found a few great uses for it. It’s definitely not a must have but it’s nice to have. The reason for only 3 stars is that for the second time in the six months we’ve had it we’ve had to send it back for issues with a screen. It’s only nice to have if we have it. Hope this time they have a real fix!

author: DanaLeigh
title: EXCEEEDED MY WILDEST EXPECTATIONS FOR MY ELDERLY PARENTS...AND MYSELF!!!!
content:
People. Seriously. What can't this thing do??? I bought two, one for myself and one for my late 80s parents. I know, I know...a lot of folks get all worked up over the set up in two households, two accounts. Not me. They are both registered to me, my amazon account, my unlimited streaming music. I just named one my first name and named the other one 'Parents'.  It was easy as pie!

So here's where the fun begins!! My parents have ZERO technological skills. NONE! The very first day, Daddy sat down and said, "Alexa, drop in on Dana" My screen started beeping and there was Daddy!

Yall! This was amazing! Do you realize if he had fallen, and couldn't get up, he could have called out "Alexa, call Dana" and I would have instant contact??

This is AMAZING AND WHAT EVERY OLDER PERSON NEEDS ALONG WITH SOMEONE ON THE OTHER END WHO CARES AND WANTS THEM TO BE HAPPY AND SAFE!

The following day, I get a phone call on the telephone and Daddy says,"HONEY! We asked Alexa to play Elvis and she played us one song and it quit. Then we asked her to play a SELECTION and she's been playing Elvis all afternoon!!  Look at that! My Daddy figured that out all by himself!

Over Elvis singing 'I'm so lonesome I could cry" I hear my Mama holler out, "I LOVE THIS MORE THAN ANYTHING ELSE I'VE EVER GOTTEN!!!"

 I asked Daddy to stop the music, and say "Alexa CALL ...then my first and last name" It picked up on my cell contacts since I uploaded the alexa app and my phone began ringing. THERE WAS DADDY ON A VIDEO CALL ON MY PHONE!!

 I took him around outside and showed the new roof, the dogs playing, how great their antique bed looked in my guest room. Daddy said, "This is as good as being at your house!".

Then I had my Mama do the same. She was shocked! They do not have smart phones so they had never done a video chat before. Mama told me they were having SO MUCH FUN! This means so much to me. They're 87 and 88 and recently moved to independent living. Knowing they could call out to Alexa to call me if they had fallen MEANS THE WORLD TO ME.

If you are thinking of getting this for an elderly loved one, DO IT. DO IT!!

It turned out to be way simpler and easier than we realized. I"m not worried about this being on my amazon account. They don't know they can order anything. But if they figured it out, I'd be buying it for them anything so I don't care. This thing should be in every house of elderly folks especially if someone lives alone! Just make a cheat sheet so they can remember what to say!  GREAT JOB amazon!

author: Mia S
title: It's great but I'm not a big fan of Echo everything
content: It's great but I'm not a big fan of Echo everything. Still, it's nice in our kitchen and it was a gift for my husband who loves it. We don't like that we cannot take off "the Alexa" on screen tips. We would rather be able to see our pictures without Alexa suggesting things to ask her.

author: Henry Halladay
title: Great Alexa enhancement
content: The Echo Show is a great enhancement to Alexa showing background images, time and temperature. With Amazon Connect video calls show the images for cell phone calls. Sound is adequate. Current weather to weekly forecast works great. I have 3 Echo Shows now.

author: Dennis Mabrey
title: Good for somethings... fails at others.
content:
It can be useful for smarthome devices and asking it questions on Wikipedia.  It also can be helpful to tell it to set a reminder or a calendar event.

I also often use it to tell it to play music on my Amazon account.  Some of the skills that you can associate with it are quite useful.  It can also tell me when one of my Amazon packages is coming in.

However... Alexa can fail pretty easily.  Also the show's screen is often not really used for anything other than just displaying background pics.  It can play Amazon video but it isn't really a big enough screen to enjoy it on.

author: Angie
title: What is not to love?
content:
We have had this about 4 months and love it.
Easy setup, could not jave been easier. Love it for recipes, video chatting etc. this is in my kitchen and we use it everyday.
We also have 2 dots, one upstairs in the man cave and one in our bedroom. We use those as intercoms with the drop in feature.
I use the show to see my Ring video doorbell and Ring spotlight cam. Great video quality and sound. I have smart home so Alexa shuts off my lights, turns things on when we are not home etc. we had a thermostat installed also and works great to control that. I have no issues, love the emails that tell all the new things alexa does. If you read the directions you should not have an issue with the show or dots.  Thinking sbout the spot for my bedroom and move the other dot to my office. Alexa, make my life easier... DONE.

author: Bill
title: Love it.
content: This thing is awesome.  We use it for an alrm clock, but it does so much more.  News. weather, music.  The sound is good for it's size, as in the screen.  The only thing I don't like is that the only was to use an external speaker is with Bluetooth, and if you do, it cuts off the internal speaker.  You cannot use both at the same time.  I got this on Prime day, so it was $100 off.

author: Artz
title: Service Areas
content:
Love the product but as a prime member I am not able to reap all of the benefits because of living outside of the USA.
They are plenty movies and music that I am not able to watch.

Fix please

author: HWR2
title: Echo Show was so easy to set up it's ridiculous
content: Echo Show was so easy to set up it's ridiculous. What a great product. To me it is the best of all of the Echo devices. Love the sound as well. You can do so much more on Show than you can on the Dot. Video calls, the Camera takes pictures, the videos you can watch, the news video feeds. All seamless. The music sounds great as well, better than the other Echo devices. I can't say enough good things about it!!!

author: RFiandaca
title: Love this little thing!  Didn't know what I was missing being old school
content: I'm not a techie or gadget person at all as my partner wanted this which I thought was going to be a waste of space.  Have to say I've ended up using it more than her...  I love it!  My mindset was you can look up stuff on your laptop or we have bluetooth speakers for music why the redundancy?  Because, this is extremely convenient and fun to simply say, Alexa is going to rain?  Play such and such or ask it a quick question about something that pops into your mind at the moment, without having to stop and open your laptop.  It's fun to speak to it as if there's another person in the room.  The display will continuously update current affairs so glancing keeps you updated.  The screen is very clear and the device has a nice shape.  Loving my new experience.

author: Giant Doofus
title: Video features are nice, but audio/mic disappointing
content:
I own an Echo Show, an original Echo, and several Echo Dots. I bought the Echo Show primarily for the video calling / drop in feature, and this feature does work very well. There are a few issues with the device though.

1. No more YouTube. This was another big selling point for me buying the device, but now that it's been gone for a few months with no signs of returning, the value of the Show seems to be permanently diminished.

2. Sound quality. The sound quality was supposed to be better than the original Echo, but my opinion is that it is slightly worse. This may be because the original Echo's speaker was omnidirectional and the Show's is not, but as you move away from directly in front of the speaker, the sound quality is not as good.

3. Microphone. The original Echo also has a 360 degree microphone array, so it hears you equally well from all directions. The Show seems to miss commands much more frequently than the original Echo did, especially when I am off to the side.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Other than this happy with the Show
content:
Cannot connect with Arlo Pro despite Arlo saying it is linked. This was a prime reason for purchasing this. Instructions basically are lacking re linking and could not find any trouble shooting or tech support.

Other than this happy with the Show.

author: donna coleman
title: no headline
content: A friend ordered this for me, so I evidently didn't make clear what my needs were.  I had anticipated using this for a line dance class.  It seemed it would be so easy to just ask Alexa for a particular song, then dance to it.  However, the fact that this needs to be plugged into a wall was not good for my situation.  Also, this building (a senior community) has walls that make the sound on this and other electronics sometimes  fuzzy.  And, I had asked repeatedly if there would be a monthly cost.  I was repeatedly told "no."  (I can assume that everyone I asked believed that everyone already has an account with Amazon.)  So for these reasons, I am sending it back.

author: Jennywren
title: Not impressed - poor quality vs my echo
content: They sent wrong color (white) and the speakers goes in an out, poor quality compared to echo

author: Mike
title: As an owner of 8 Echo devices, I have to recommend you stay away from the Echo Show.
content:
As an owner of 2 Echo's, 3 Dot's, an Echo Tap, an Echo Wand, and an Echo Show - I have to recommend that you stay away from the Echo Show. Go with one of the other many models.

I don't say the above lightly - I love my other echo's and have driven over a dozen other people to jump on the Alexa bandwagon! The Echo's have been a significant value-add for my family. The Show just falls short for me in a few very very key areas. I've had my echo show since release. I preordered 2 of them, one for me and one for family to conduct video calls.  If we could return our Echo Show's, we would.

Issues:
First, as others have pointed out - YouTube is no longer supported but to us, that feature was kind of hokey anyway. Getting it to find the right video was often a chore - but that's due to my chief complaint - Voice recognition.

Voice recognition on my show is crap. It just is. I don't know what the problem is, but I can say "Turn on Fireplace" directly in front of the show, 2 feet away, and it doesn't recognize what I say. I ask it to play a song, and it responds with "What pandora station would you like me to add?" Of course, I didn't say anything remotely resembling Pandora. These are commands we regularly do, and have done, with the other echo's. The Show just gets it wrong.

Granted, it's voice recognition issues don't happen all the time, but it's so frequently an issue that it's incredibly frustrating and no longer a "help" to use my Alexa. It's definitely the Show too, as my other echo's recognize us without issue. In fact, we replaced one of the original Echo's with the Show, so it's in the same place in the room. For additional context, we have a very automated home - we use voice for lights all the time, and some devices (like the fireplace) as well. We listen to music almost constantly with 3 small kids.

The second chief complains isn't Show specific, but impacts all Echo devices - Calling & Messaging. I have a phonebook full of contacts, 95% of them I never talk to, but have for work, or an old colleague, or a family member I just don't talk to frequently. I have escalation lists for my job, which means some very senior contacts from my very large company. I can't filter any of these out on my Echo's, and with one small mess up can call any of them from any of our echo devices. I only have 1 person I want to call, but I can't restrict who is in the devices contacts. 4 year old is mistakenly heard for calling our CTO? Yup, it's going to give him a call at his house on his family's echo saying I'm calling. How did anyone agree this was a good idea?! To add insult to injury, I can't remove the contacts unless I call customer service!

That said, my kids and my niece/nephew love it when we video call. They all get around the Show and they like playing games with each other and just having a good time (age range is 2-6).

Another complaint which is rather minor is the lack of ability to press a button for the Echo to recognize your command. It's available on every other unit, except the show. You can only trigger the Show with a voice command. It's minor, but it is an annoyance.

I really wanted to like the show. Perhaps it's just my unit that has the voice recognition issue - I hope that is the case. The contact management aspect is crippling the feature and usability though.  Every time I try to drop in or place a call, I have to be super careful with who it calls. I shouldn't have to worry about that! I should be able to only add those who I actually want to call or talk to.

So, what do I have to say that is good about the Echo Show? Nothing specific to the Show unfortunately. All my praise is applicable to the entire Echo lineup. I use it for shopping lists, to-do lists, weather updates, news, music, home automation, dropping in around the house (an internal intercom), and for some of the local store hours / information - though the last feature only works on a few "mainstream" stores / establishments. Some of the skills are pretty good, but I mostly use it for it's core functionality.

That about wraps up my long overdue review of the Echo Show. I hope you've found this helpful. If you have, please click the Helpful button below the review - It's anonymous!

author: Robert W Pirigyi Jr
title: SCREEN FLICKER (UNREADABLE)
content:
After 6 months of having 2 Echo Shows,  the screen on BOTH are flickering to the point that the time is unreadable. Also when asking it anything there is a flicker in the screen as seen in the video.  I have tried unplugging, resetting and moving them to another location in the house and the same happens. I am in the process of sending them back for an exchange with hopes that the new ones do not do the same.

UPDATE : 12/3/2018

One out of the 2 Echo Shows that I had to send in is now having the SAME issue with the flickering screen. This is such an issue with these that it's almost a scam.  Amazon did send me a return label and back to the shop, it went. We will see what I get this time. Last time they said I would get replacements. THAT didn't happen. I got the same ones back and they said they "updated the firmware" . Well.....updating the firmware doesn't work. I don't have high hope in getting this one back and it working past 1 month.

author: Zjwillie
title: zjwillie@gmail.com
content:
Honestly I would expect more. Basic echo is just as good. Screen is essentially useless. Cool it shows the timer for a few minutes but then goes back to spamming you with things you don't want to ask you, why not show the timer in the corner all the time. Ask it about calendar shows only today which you have to use touch screen to scroll - can't show you the week or month to review. Lists only shows 4 things of you shopping list rather than fit to screen. I mean, it feels like they just didn't bother.

Edit: Amazon reached out to me, they are working on all of the above. Changed to 4 stars.

author: BenjaminX
title: Doesn't Yet Live Up to the Hype
content: We have six Amazon Echo devices and this is the seventh.  So far, it's a disappointment.  I immediately wanted to take advantage of the screen, so I asked for a weather map -- nothing (it just showed a chart of the weather).  I asked for a local map showing mexican restaurants in the area -- couldn't do it.  I asked for the hours of my local bank, expecting a clean chart of the business hours -- nope; instead, I got a link to their website.  Ok, not terribly helpful.  So far, it is not as useful as the 1st Gen Echo it replaced.  Also, the 1stGen Echo had 360 degree sound coming out of it, which was great on the open kitchen counter.  The Show's speaker only points in one direction and the sound is no where near as immersive as with the round 1st Gen Echo.  Overall, disappointing.  Maybe it will get better when we start using its video calling features -- of course, for that, we have to wait for someone we know to get an Echo Show or Echo Spot.

author: Neil
title: Was good, for a while
content:
I enjoy the Echo Show although I don't use it nearly enough right now. It is a nice desk clock and is fun to play some games on.
I bought this just over 2 months ago and now the screen is flickering. I contacted Amazon about this and there is apparently an issue with screen flickering. That would have been nice to know. Now I have to ship this back to them and wait to find out whether it will be repaired or a replacement will be sent. Of course, I got this just before the second generation came out, so I screwed myself there.
There is not as much a need for this Echo as others, so unless you KNOW you will use it then I say avoid it until they can correct these issues.

author: C M Kelly
title: Amazon left out a key Alexa scheduling feature - Sunset & Sunrise with time offsets
content:
The products (echo, show, echo plus etc.) are all well made and I wouldn't hesitate to purchase again; with that said they left out a key feature for the Alexa routine and scheduling app.  The ability to have things happen at sunset or sunrise with a plus or minus time offset.  It is clear they did not do a proper UX Design flow using people who were already home automation people that would be switching over.  This feature is in every piece of software I have investigated and is a basic part of home automation.  Amazon Alexa team please add the key feature!

Amazon contacted me is forwarding this feature to the dev team!  Great work Review Team!

author: nurse_judith
title: Love the Echo Show!...
content: I effortlessly got the Echo Show up and running without any technical savvy.  The Show holds a prominent place in my kitchen.  It answers my questions and even makes me laugh.  Alexa voice and I have an already in place Amazon Alexa in my living room.  The screen is large and I’m learning to do something new everyday with my Show...  I can’t wait to see where my Show will take me into the future.  Echo Show gets smarter and smarter!...

author: Rider
title: great sound (Bose quality
content: Simple design, great sound (Bose quality, imo), fun to see the lyrics from songs on the display.  The only opportunity I experience missing is offering to show time-only by scale.  “Alexa, show time only, [1-10].”  Fill the dispay with time that is easy to read at distance at 10-largest font that fits.  Other options such as show me date and time only, etc.  Basically, more voice control of display on this Show product.

author: CompTIA certified
title: Not There Yet
content:
If it could link to a computer and READ/PLAY from an established music library, I'd give it 5 stars.

Ratings drop from 4 to 3.  Can't even find a lyric from amazon's library on a song....that is actually part of the title.  "Alexa, play 'The Who' with the lyrics "See Me, Feel Me...Listening to You."

Alexa didn't listen.

At least an episode from Star Trek: Enterprise wakes it up.  "Computer, load Zindi database."......"I don't understand."

author: J. A. Rose
title: one month after purchasing it the screen started acting up ...
content: one month after purchasing it the screen started acting up so i contacted amazon to return it. they would not return it or give me a replacement. i had to send it in for repair so after a week of being without it i receive it back without the power cord. i contact amazon and get transferred multiple times and noone can figure out what to do. feces product and feces service. do not buy!

author: Rick R.
title: Things started out fine, but after a short while the Echo Show ...
content: The Echo Show arrived and was not too hard to get going.  Things started out fine, but after a short while the Echo Show was losing it's wifi connection now and then.  I changed locations and then added a wifi extender which helped a lot, but it still does not seem to maintain the connection all the time.  It also seems to have trouble controlling the tv with the Harmony Hub app.  Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. Overall, we like the concept.  Wish it worked more consistently.

author: Barbara Marks
title: understand the product more.
content: Its nice, but I wished I had understood that it would help if others (friends and family) had one too. It does a lot of things, which I haven't gotten into yet. You can make calls but being able to see who you are talking to they too have to have a Echo Show.  I am sure when they go down in price, more people will get them. The prime music is great.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Hey amazon... what can it do?
content: Why are you fighting with google??? Bring me some YouTube, or send out DETAILED information that depicts all actions that the device is capable of. I want to know more without feeling stupid and having to... GOOGLE it!

author: Kat Hills
title: I do like the feature that lets you see song lyrics
content: It does everything that my Echo Dot does, but with a screen display.  I do like the feature that lets you see song lyrics.  It's easier to play games like Jeopardy when you can see the questions written out on the screen.  I plan on looking into getting a security camera to use with it and that is primarily why I purchased it.  Otherwise, I don't see much advantage over other Echo devices.

author: Kkatydid
title: ... the echos and somehow the echo show isn't as smart as the others
content: I have all the echos and somehow the echo show isn't as smart as the others. I have to repeat my questions several times. Most of the time it just thinks, then goes out. or says mmm, I don't know.

author: Sharon Baskin
title: ENDLESS POSSIBILITIES
content: LOVE THE ECHO SHOW!  USING THE DROPBOX TO FACETIME IS BEYOND WONDERFUL!  SO MANY OPTIONS, I USE IT AS A TIMER FOR ALL MY BAKING....IT TELLS ME WHEN MY PACKAGE ARRIVE, THERE ARE ENDLESS POSSIBILITIES!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love! Use for baby monitors
content: I love these! Bought with main purpose for baby monitors and it’s amazing!! Also super fun for kitchen dancing music with the tiny tot. I was worried I’d be upset about the amount of money after I got it but I definitely think it was worth it.

author: Meshsales
title: Disappointed!!! Echo needs to work with ring for notifications
content:
I would give the echo 5 stars !!but
Really unhappy!
I purchased the echo show for the sole purpose for ring

Amazon and ring need to add notifications software for the ring !!

Really dumb you need to ask Alexa see front door
I have the show in my kitchen and would love to get alerts when someone comes in the driveway or ring the door bell !!
If they don’t send out a update In 30 days I’m going to be returning it !

author: Ocelot Preservation Society
title: Other options are better
content: Not worth the money compared to other options and losing YouTube makes this far less appealing. I bought it as a pre-order after loving my original Echo and subsequent Dots but find it more frustrating to use than helpful. Go with a HD 10 tablet and bluetooth speaker if you really want the screen. I see this as being worth a slight premium over the Echo, but nothing else.

author: John R. Sternickle
title: Wait to Buy Until They Fix YouTube
content: YouTube no longer works! Amazon needs to fix this. People should wait until this small video screen has video to display. No YouTube, no more sales. If you really still want to buy it. WAIT, the price will keep dropping. Especially if Amazon doesn't fix this problem.

author: Will Paradis
title: It is very buggy
content: It works, barely. Already had to reset device within 3 days of having it hooked up because it repeatedly would crash and stop responding. The update that supposedly would allow YouTube videos does not work. It also would go offline regularly which requires it to be unplugged then plugged back in for it reconnect. These issues need to be addressed. This is also my 5th echo, I think if it didn't have these problems it would be a perfect addition to my home and I would buy more to replace 2 of my dots with.

author: J. Thornton
title: Need Help
content: Received the Show as a gift. Also have an Echo Plus. The Show doesn’t seem as command sensitive as the Plus Also, we have not been able to figure out how to enable the Show to display FaceTime calls. Both iPhones we have have and do this properly. Would give it a higher rating if there were better instructions and we could get it to do what it’s supposed to.

author: Rhonda Koch
title: Everyone Should Have One!
content: OMG! I love this thing!! I got it as a gift from my sister. I already had an Echo Dot, which I love as well!  The "Show" is like a whole new level of cool! We just went thru Hurricane Irma and I was saying the two things I missed the most was AC and Alexa. Everyone should have one of these!!

author: rehoguy
title: Needs Option to Turn Off "Things to Try."
content: "Things to Try" is not necessary; clutters the screen; and is unwanted advertising in the middle of our kitchen counter.  Will not buy the new (and presumably with even larger advertising) Echo Show 2 until this is resolved.  Or, at least give customers the option to purchase without advertising, like the Fire.  Such a shame to spoil what is otherwise a fine and enjoyable product.  But this is, in our house, fatal.

author: Irene C.
title: I love the Echo Show
content: I love the Echo Show. I started out with the Echo Dot. Then I bought the Echo because it has built-in speakers. Now I own the Echo Show and would never go back to the previous models, The Echo Show speakers are so much better. When I ask for a recipe it shows the ingredients and directions on the screen. Listening to a song you can ask for lyrics and sing along. It shows the time, temperature all day. Alexa keeps showing helpful information to ask her. When I set the timer while cooking, it shows the countdown on the screen. ECHO SHOW IS THE GREATEST HELPER AND A PERFECT COMPANION FOR US SENIOR CITIZENS

author: Ali Avey
title: It's fun, but not necessary
content: I do like this.  When its playing Prime music stations it scrolls the song's words.  Cool.  However, it is google connected and it censors any alternative videos and any right-leaning news you might search for.  It cannot be programmed to search with FireFox, where ALL internet postings are retrieved.  Alexa is cute, i use it for shopping lists and recipes, and ordering on Amazon.

author: Steven Barall
title: It can play any radio station you want, all you have to do is ask.  That's it.  No additional setup.
content:
Now, I bought it at an Amazon store a short walk from my home.  I wanted it mainly to use a a clock radio.  I had to make sure I could easily use the Echo Show to listen to local radio stations and also some not so local ones and that is what I told the staff at the store.  The first person I spoke to at the Amazon store had thought I could use the Show to listen to radio but didn't know how to make that happen.  To her credit she asked for help and the second person was sure I could listen to local radio stations but told me that I had to use the Alexa app and somehow configure it to play the radio and that maybe I had to make a list of stations and those would be the ones I could listen to.  I went ahead and bought the Echo Show thinking that it would be a pain in the butt but I would figure it out and live with it.

To my surprise, upon setting up the Echo Show I just went ahead and asked Alexa to play WFAN radio and it did automatically.  And it played all the stations I asked it to play.  I didn't have to use any apps or configure anything!  So the answer to my question is;  Well sir all of that has already been figured out for you.  All you have to do is ask and you will get any station you want.  That's it.  Just ask.  Nothing else.

I think that no one under the age of forty has ever listened to the radio and that's why I they couldn't help me.  The thing is there are a lot of people closer to my age who buy devices like this.  Maybe Amazon can train their employees a little better.  That all said, I love this thing.

author: Jan Smith
title: I really like this a lot but I had thought it would ...
content: I really like this a lot but I had thought it would sync with my sonos speakers - thought I had read that online and it does NOT!  I bought it for another room to be able to play my music in 4 rooms.  Doesn't sync with the speakers but I love the rest of it!

author: MTB Man
title: This doesn’t last
content: Needed to be fixed within two months because the video screen started flickering, can’t get an update on repair status.  Says it hasn’t been received but ups receipt says it has been at the repair site for 4 days.

author: Emily C
title: It's already been said, but LOVE this thing.
content:
Oh the life-changing magic of Alexa. Did I think I needed it? No. Did I buy it first for my tech-obsessed dad and immediately have envy? YEP. I love this thing. I'm sure everything has already been said, but I'll leave one pro tip here: if you have a toddler who responds better to external timers than mom/dad telling him it's time to move on to the next thing, Alexa is for you! He now asks for a five minute timer before bed and (so far) doesn't have a fit when the timer goes off. I like the structure of it.

We also use the white noise skills on our dot in the bedrooms and kid bedrooms, which are lovely and have an extensive library.

Also love being able to drop in on my parents, but have conveniently turned off drop-ins for us with a perplexed look of confusion every time they ask why they can't drop in on our kitchen.

I also think it's handy to know the weather and my commute on my way out the door in the morning.

author: Bobbie
title: I just love my Echo Show
content: I just love my Echo Show!! It has become my companion and organizer. I love the new updates and the fact I can watch videos on the device. Works well with all the other echo devices too.

author: Daniel Margotta
title: Perfection
content:
We absolutely LOVE out Echo Show. From the moment we received the well packaged box, to the quick, easy, initial setup; to the every functionality and usefulness of the Show, it has been everything I had hoped for.

I read earlier reviews before buying mine, and the earliest purchasers of the Show said that a lot was left wanting. However, after being out for nearly a year, now, the Show has grown into its own.

This AI Assistant, Alexa, is fantastic. From playing my favorite songs with a simple command, to looking up recipes and emailing the ingredient list to my phone, and ease of use for video drop ins, to the numerous Easter eggs hidden within; Show has been wonderful. I have it placed in my kitchen, so I get my daily update and weather forecast each morning before leaving for work. A reminder on the screen that I set helps me to remember my lunch before walking out the door. And the jokes and joviality of Alexa make it even more personal, and less robotic.

If you’re looking for the next step in home AI, look no further. It’s easily adapts to an even-growing number of Alexa capable devices, as well, making home security and functionality even easier.

Way to go, Amazon. Keep up the great work.

author: Joseph Souffrant
title: Speech Recognition is No Good
content: Not happy with the voice recognition. I have 8 echo dots and they all recognize my commands 10 times better than the echo shows. What’s going on with that amazon? Alexa, turn on Joseph’s lights. I’m sorry, I do not recognize turn on Monique’s bike. Whaaaaa?

author: Lisa T.
title: I am ready to purchase another!
content: I am happy to clean my kitchen now!  I love to stream music, it is so fun seeing the Artist name pop up.  I also view recipes!  I love to watch prime videos.  downfall, if you stop a show and come back to it the next day it doesn't save where you left off.  (Now maybe I just don't know how to do it.  We are still figuring out Video Calling.  We have a standard Alexa, Tap an an choe

author: Rangermenace
title: Echo show
content: I bought this off QVC and I'm ok with it. Sad it lost YouTube and Alexa is kind of stupid but the video is a pulse. I like watching my morning briefing and using it with Ring which needs improvements. They can take this a long and well see how well they support it.

author: Beverly Barnhart
title: Love the timer shows remaining time on the screen
content: Loving seeing the lyrics, especially to new music!  Love the timer shows remaining time on the screen.  Enjoying the Echo Show!

author: Benegesserit
title: Love the big touchscreen.  Love Alexa.
content: I love that I can order Amazon stuff on the fly with Alexa.  She shows me stuff on her nice big touchscreen and I can buy it instantly.  I am so so spoiled.  The sound is not as good as my original Echo though.

author: Amazon CustomerJeffHVT
title: No way to shut-off 'Try' suggestions
content: Would be a very useful product, if there was a way to turn off the 'Try' banner, which ruins my home screen photos,

author: L
title: Meh.
content: Little more than a $200 alarm clock.

author: Joseph T. Reeser
title: Alexa is by far superior to Google home
content: I have Alexa and Google home.  I got Google home because it seemed that the google app on the phone seemed smarter than Alexa,  Alexa is by far superior to Google home.  If you are playing music Google home cant hear you unless you scream at it.  Alexa listens, plays more music from more sources, and seems to be getting smarter all the time.  the Echo show and my Ring Floodlight is integrated and works great.  The drop in feature and overall quality is just better.  I liked the Echo show enough to get a 2nd one.

author: Merv
title: We love the shows screen
content:
We love the shows screen.  Its nice to see the info you just asked Alexa.  I like the visual countdown timer for when I am cooking.  We also like the shopping list shows the last five items you added. We already have tried the video phone with another show. It works just as good as Apple's Facetime.  There are so many things why we love our echo Show.
Now for our one complaint, no privacy shutter for the camera.  We some times come to our kitchen in our underwear.  We have place a little flap over it and remove it for video calls.

author: G Family
title: Mostly useless, no you tube
content: Don't buy, they need more time to improve software.  No you tube. Mostly useless.

author: Clow
title: I love the Echo Show
content: The sound quality is great.  The screen is large and bright.  I love that I can view recipes, picture, and videos.  The drop in feature is great for checking in on my family.  My kids are young and can easily call me with the echo command.  They love to see me and speak with me on the Show.  We have 3 types of Echo products. All of them are excellent, but the Show is my favorite.

author: Amanda Couture
title: Love this product!
content: I have this set up in my kitchen and it’s been great! I can listen to music or play movies while I’m cooking something. I really have enjoyed the Echo Show. I have both the Spot and Show now and they work together seamlessly.

author: Jennifer
title: Great for connecting with far away family!!
content:
It took me almost 4 months to figure out how to drop in on my dad (who does not have a smart phone to verify his cell phone number). But when setting up my device, I noticed how the iPhone and iPad Alexa apps don’t sync, are standalone. So I used my phone to verify his phone number, and tonight all is finally right with the Universe.

I just wish we had purchased this technology last year, when my mother was still alive. She would’ve loved!! the Show’s abilities; and I believe she would’ve heard better than she did using the phone.

I’m in love, with this device (despite its Big Brother flaws).

author: Debbie Duffy
title: I love my Echo show
content: I love my Echo show!!!! I can watch videos, movies, look for recipes, ask Alexa questions and get answers immediately rather than have to search in Google. It’s an amazing product!

author: 916Funkster
title: Echo Show is great!
content: I have a Dot in a portable speaker, and a Echo in my office...bought this Show on sale when the new one was announced for the kitchen...works great for displaying my recipes, and finding new recipes! I use it to play a news summary while I eat breakfast, and when company's over it's great for background music and showing vacation pics/videos! I'll probably upgrade to the new Show with the bigger screen eventually, but until I get some extra $$ or it goes on sale this will have to do...

author: BReal14
title: We love this thing
content:
We love this thing.  It sounds 100x better than our Dot and is at least twice as loud with more bass too.  We put the dot in the bedroom and keep the show in the kitchen.  The new 'drop in' feature is really cool - allows us to have a home intercom now so no more screaming up the staircase.

Best feature is lyric text streaming and the 'streaming video' for news, etc.  Turns music listening into karaoke.  Overall, very happy with this device.

author: iam
title: Stay away
content: Never hated a product as much as this one. Voice recognition is s***. I end up yelling obscenities daily because it can't seem to figure out simple requests like "pull up comedies on prime". It essentially was a $200 timer for cooking since that seems to be the only thing that works well. Never again.

author: JmZ
title: Nice quality drop in video calling
content:
Got this for my other half and she was very happy with it because the clear video quality when dropping in on the kids is much better than our older system. The kids love it too as they keep requesting music videos and if anything they cannot spell, they will ask. Overall a pretty good assistant with view.
The negative part is that the screen only stays on until it tell it to turn off when it should have an auto sleep mode like every other electronic device nowadays. Also there is a lag in the connection for video calling when you initiate the call but after it clears up and de-pixelates.

author: Dee
title: Great addition to my kitchen!
content: I purchased this for my new kitchen to make cooking or time spent in the kitchen more enjoyable. I absolutely use this device daily to find recipes, play music create shopping lists,  make calls or even watch prime videos while preparing dinner. I’m glam I selected this as appose to echo spot in he kitchen. My only negative comment. They should have a white cord with the white device.

author: LifeJunkieRaj
title: Huge potential, but lacking in some major areas including software and hardware issues.
content:
As far as it's Echo functionality, it is amazing. That being said I don't feel they utilize the screen to its max capability. You can't play your Prime videos or Netflix or Hulu videos on that I know of. You can't use other video calling apps like Skype or Google Hangout. This makes the Show only relevant if all your friends and family have an Echo Show.

Though it's not as big a problem but they don't  have a jack/port to connect bigger speakers which I feel is an oversight.

Though I have several versions of the Echo and love their functionality and features I believe they don't meet their full potential because they can't integrate with Google or any of its features. If Google Google decides to upgrade, enhance and/or come with several versions of the Google Home that are counterparts to the Echo Dot, Tab, Spot, Home etc. then Google will make Alexa obsolete because Google and its wide range of free and very useful and practical features and apps such as Hangouts, Earth, Translation, Maps, Streetview (and many others),  with the most basic but important function which is Google Search being sometning makes Amazon's Echo (all versions but especially the Show) much less functional than it could be. For example Google owns YouTube and if you could watch YouTube videos on the Show that would make it amazing.
