But not even being able search things through Google Search on an Echo device or have those results shown on the Echo Show screen make it a very limited device that doesn't tap into its huge possible potential and it will eventually be made obsolete by Google's own home AI devices.

Lastly the camera shouldn't be so fixed and stationary. For video calls this can be very inconvenient since the screen and camera are at fixed height and in a fixed position. Also glare can be a problem when you can't till the screen to the perfect position to avoid glare from various light sources.

All-in-all I love the concept and all the things all the Echo devices can perform. I love Amazon allows its new features and apps to be open source and that anyone can create a new ability or app for Echo devices. I love how well the show integrates into shopping with Amazon through your account. There are several amazing features and abilities I absolutely love about the Echo Show and other versions of the Amazon Echo. I just hate to think that these devices are hampered by not being able.to tap into Google and I worry that the Echo could lose sales and eventually complete market share to an home AI like the Google Home which literally owns all the proprietary rights to all the Google Apps, websites and abilities that it can integrate into its own AI that will make their devices all the things that Echo devices just can't be due to trademarks, patents, copyrights etc. I'll keep supporting the Echo as long as Alexa is around and the same goes for the Echo Show. But there is definitely room for improvement.

author: Amazon Customer
title: blending audio and video
content: It is nice to have a audio and video presentation.  Very useful in the kitchen finding and using new recipes.  Handy to send hands free messages while hands are busy cooking.  Love the reminder and timer features.  Nice to be able to get news updates as I prepare breakfast.  It does take time to learn specific commands.  I highly recommend it.

author: Jennifer Nilsen
title: Our new favorite!
content: We purchased this Echo Show during the "Prime Days" special and could not love it more!!!  It's our new favorite!!!  We didn't realize just how handy having a screen accompany the already-super-useful Alexa would be!!

author: Celo
title: The Echo Show itself is good. But there's a huge delay when wanting to ...
content: The Echo Show itself is good. But there's a huge delay when wanting to view my Ring 2 Doorbell or my Arlo camera from Echo Show. I already check wifi settings on all devices and they all have strong signal..also once YouTube stoped being supported..usage of echo show was down by 50%...so currently is it worth the money?? Really depends on you.. since I already have echo dots around the house it almost makes it not worth recommending.

author: LDK
title: Do not buy the Echo Show
content: Ordered the Echo Show, had issues with the device Screen, Amazon charged me over $46 for a restocking fee on a non-working device.

author: Cheryl Smith
title: No Youtube
content: This would be great with Youtube.com.  Why can't I access it.  When it was ordered, youtube was supposed to be back, but even with the software update it is not available.  Sounds like I may have to replace my Fire with a chromecast as well.

author: Betty VS
title: Love these! My 2 year old grandson loves calling ...
content: Purchased 2 of these, one for my son and one for myself. They arrived on time and are as stated by seller. Love these!  My 2 year old grandson loves calling me on it and even hugged their's he was so excited Alexa showed him pictures of babies. I don't consider myself very tech savvy,  but I can use this with no problem! Love that it is hands free,  works great for having Alexa look things up for when I am working in my soap kitchen or crafting and my hands are busy! I purchased a sturdy case with  a handle to easily carry from room to room when I need to.

author: Peter Galamaga
title: Great - with one glaring flaw
content:
This is awesome overall.
However - buyer beware. If you do not own a smart phone (and anyone you gift this to does not own a smart phone) you CAN NOT set up video calling.
To me, this is absurd. Why doe I need a smart phone to make this connect to another Show device?
I went around and around with tech support on this.
In the end, it had many features that are fantastic - but those of us who refuse to become smart phone zombies are SOL.

author: OCAngel
title: Now that YouTube is Disabled There’s No Reason to Buy This.
content: Very disappointed with my Show now that YouTube has been taken off. I was enjoying watching videos on YouTube, but now it looks as though I’ve bought a very expensive photo frame that once a day reads me my news. Without videos there’s not enough features to justify buying the Show. Until they have come to peace with google and reinstate YouTube, and then start adding more features/skills I would say “don’t waste your money”.

author: Edward Palmer
title: Horrible audio.
content: The speakers are small, tinny and have no push. Your cellphone literally has better sound then this device. The rest of the features are archaic and not very well described. I couldn't get it to connect to Pandora or spotify. When I used my cellphone to drive the Echo as a Bluetooth speaker, I couldn't turn the volume up past 40-50% before the speakers began to rattle and distort the song. The worst part was buying it from the Treasure Truck, because now Amazon won't let me return it and we've only had it operational for a week.

author: Me
title: I’d love to give it 5 stars
content: I’d love to give it 5 stars, but it’s random talking and limited wake words irritate me.  Also, dropping are difficult if you have more than one unit in the house.  Who knows where the call will go!

author: Joel M.
title: Where;s the You Tube Dudes?
content: Without You Tube this is kind of hobbled. It does work ok though.

author: Allison Sprague
title: We love the features of watching videos
content: We love the features of watching videos.. grandkids love it. I can see what is in my 🛒 shopping cart and what I have bought in the past without getting my phone out.I can order quickly just by talking or making a list. I like looking at my daily calendar to see appointments. Hands free is so important! Having a device in different rooms makes it nice. We like different music different games.Its great hooking up plugs so we can tell Alexa to turn lights or different appliances off. I wish it had a longer cord without having to use extension cords.

author: Eidnic
title: Didn't know I needed this and now I wouldn't be without it!
content: I love, love, love my Echo Show! It was my first Alexa product and now I am completely addicted to smart plugs. I have so many lights and fans etc that now work with Alexa!  Amazing! I watch my 5 year old grandson land he loves to ask it to play music. We now dance every mornings. Now I'm getting more exercise too! Its just so fun!

author: Tom Waggoner
title: This was the best gift of the Christmas season for our family
content: This was the best gift of the Christmas season for our family.  It's like having your own personal assistant.  She can show you the trailers for all the movies playing near you,  tell you where the nearest Italian Restaurant is and best of all plays all your favorite music too.  She also controls your lights, fans, and the thermostat.  We love it and would definitely recommend it to anyone without hesitation.

author: Maureen Bowes
title: communication and music
content: I can see my Granddaughter who lives across the US from me. And easily. Once it's set up all say is the contact person you have installed. its's so easy. you  can ask her to play a generation of music.

author: T.C. Platte
title: Great device, still trying to figure out how to ...
content: Great device, still trying to figure out how to have it to control other devices in my home for more functional automation.

author: Jefe
title: Fun for everyone
content:
My three year old doesn’t completely understand why Alexa can’t answer all questions, like when is bedtime.  My wife and I enjoy the music and answers to trivia questions but mostly my daughter has conversations  with Alexa.
There are some issues with the show staying connected to the internet even when other devices are working fine.

author: mima
title: Nifty gadget!
content:
I like the fact that the messages are visual now as well as audible.

I am puzzled because it will light up and make the "notification" sound but when I ask Alexa to read my notifications, she tells me that there are no new notifications.  This has happened at least once a day for over a week now.

author: Ignatz Wubbles
title: A definite "Alexa" improvement!
content: The Echo Show seems to be exceeding my expectations on a daily basis. Having a screen, although a bit on the small size, makes a big difference. The sound, while pretty good on the Alexa is by far better on the View. Been putting it through the paces the last few days without a problem. Seems to be a solid well built unit and I am very happy with it!

author: UPtechGUY
title: Very handy device with great sound quality!
content:
Great speaker! I used the whole home audio across my Alexa devices and replaced Sonos with them. We all enjoy them.

I like using the video drop in feature from my cell phone to chat with my kids when out of town. It is fun to surprise them as the feature does not require they do anything on the Echo Show side of the call.  Best part is they can see me too via the Alexa app.

Last week I also had the Thursday night football game on this device. Very Cool!

author: leah Cooper
title: A few quirks but overall good!!.
content: I do really like it although sometimes when i drop in on my house (check on my dog) on the show the call will abruptly cut off. Sometimes the picture also is all black as well. But other than that I really enjoy having it. The speakers are good enough that I do not need to connect any additional speakers. Also sometimes when I have the music going it has trouble understanding me when I ask it to turn down.

author: James G. Magnano
title: The other feature of this that was useful was the video calling
content: This is basically an echo dot with a screen, and costs 3x-4x more.  The only reason to buy it was for Youtube, which Amazon got rid of when they decided to try to control the market by suddenly refusing to sell Google products, but somehow expecting to KEEP free access to Youtube.  The other feature of this that was useful was the video calling.  Does it work?  Is it any good?  I couldn't tell you, because in order to test it you need someone else with an Echo Show, and nobody is buying them because it doesn't have access to YouTube.  Amazon pulled out their rifles, took careful aim at Google, then whipped the rifle around and shot themselves right in the face.  Useless item.  Buy a Dot, or an standard Echo, or just buy a Google Home.

author: L.A. Lawson
title: A great investment.
content: Echo Show lives up to its name. It shows you everything you want to see that it is capable of showing. The picture quality is above average and the sound is impeccable. I love the fact that it reads my books to me. It is a good sized product that deserves pride of place. It is like having a personal companion and I truly do believe it should be marketed as a valuable help in the quest towards alleviating loneliness simply because once plugged in, it is always responsive to anything you ask; be it the news, weather, defining words, reminding you of things to do, playing favourite songs, podcasts or dropping in on another Echo owning friend anywhere in the world for a face to face chat. Echo Show is an awesome investment.

author: Amy P
title: This device is AMAZING!
content: We received this as a gift. It was not even something I would have put on my wish list. This Echo Show has been amazing in my new kitchen! I use it to listen to news, smooth jazz, and even to look up recipes while cooking. Also, my 35 year old mentally challenged daughter loves the lyrics feature for music so much that I purchased one for her room. Now she has so much information at the command of her voice. It will replace the ocean sounds from her sound machine and will even turn off using "sleep timer".  I cannot praise this device enough.

author: Rodrigo
title: Did not work as well as the previous versions
content:
I'm a big supporter of Amazon Echo since its early days but the Echo Show simply does not work as well as my old Echo.

It does not hear me as well (placed on the exact same spot) and I lost the count of how many times I said "Alexa", the blue light shows up and then it shuts down without waiting for the command.

I have 5 Amazon Echo at home. (3 dots, 1 Echo and 1 Echo show) and the Echo show is by far the worst, the most expensive and the one I'd be ready to return if I could.

author: 21 Days
title: LOVE THIS THING!
content: We already had four Echoes in the house and my husband had no clue why I had to have a Show for the kitchen. I LOVE THIS THING! I can drop in on my kitchen from my phone and video call with the family with the best quality I've had on any platform. I watch videos on it, use it constantly for music, the shopping list (paired with Any.do is my preference) shows up and is editable right on the screen, timers count down visually, lyrics for songs play so we can sing along and annoy the children, the weather shows a nice graphic of the extended forecast, and finally I can pull up a recipe and see it as I'm cooking. Echo Show is AWESOME! The drop in feature on all Echoes is so useful and having that video option in the family area just takes it over the top.

author: amazonfan
title: Worth the cost!
content: Love it! It plays music, gives you traffic info, weather info and answers questions about different topics.  It's great.

author: paulandpaula
title: AI needs a ton of advancement yet for our family
content: great display for the weather but darn Alexa is stupid in so many ways.  Basic questions and basic music selections cannot be understood and have to be repeated many many times in different ways to get her to every play a song from our library

author: Idaho Living
title: Can't read books from it - or if you can I can't figure out how
content: Great product.  The one thing I bought it for, however, it doesn't do. I was hoping I could bring up my books on it so I could download cookbooks and have them at my fingertips while cooking without having to have a large book laid out on the counter.  We have a couple of echo's in other rooms so have to make sure we don't talk to them overly loud or all of the echos come online.

author: Joyce A
title: so much fun
content:
This is so much fun to use.  I have talked to my Grandkids down in Florida and gotten to see them when I did, love this.
As I am disabled it help me turn lights on and off when I need them to and gives me news info when ever I ask for it as well as listening to my favorite praise music whenever I want to.  Could not be happier with this thanks to my son who bought it for me and set it all up with my other son in Florida made my life so much better!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Problems communicating
content: While it is great for playing music, it is no better than the Echo or Dot; set up with Fire Phone and Kindle's for communicating is a compatibility problem. One which tech support was not aware of! In order to maximise use would have to buy a new phone and/or other than Kindle tablet, dumber than a box of rocks!

author: MW-Linh
title: LOVE IT! Works beautifully as a picture frame
content:
I mainly bought this as a picture frame and Alexa was a bonus.

If you store your photos on prime, this is for you! It shuffles through my photos that I have forgotten about in random order which I love! It doesn't display duplicate photos.
My Suggestions:
1) Have an option to shuffle through the background pics faster on the home screen.
2) Have a timer for when the pictures displays automatically, instead of me saying "Alexa, show me my photos"

Almost perfect for me.

author: Jerry K
title: Stylish With Top Quality Sound and Video
content: Great addition to the Echo family of products.  Looks great on my desk in my home office and after integrating it with the Echo Connect it makes a excellent speaker phone in addition to all the other Echo features.

author: C2008
title: DO NOT use as baby monitor.
content: This has been advertised that you can use it as a baby monitor, but I have been using it for the last 2 months as a baby monitor, in the middle of the night it leaves the babies cameras. Sometimes when you ask it to find a room it says that it isn't able to. Then on my app I pull it up and it works fine. This is very inconvenient as I need to be able to hear the baby at night. I had very high hops for this as amazon has amazing products but truly it has let me down. At this point with the camera and the show I have to much money in to try and trade it for anything else. Just very disappointed.

author: SEM
title: Bought this on Prime Day saving $100 and very pleased. It has a great picture and the sound ...
content: Bought this on Prime Day saving $100 and very pleased. It has a great picture and the sound is good. I have it connected with my other echo's for playing music, I have video called a friend and connected it with Blink and Amazon camera's - all working fine on a DSL internet connection. Very simple setup with my existing Amazon account. Will check back later with an updated review.

author: Tony Philip
title: Had high hopes. Still think we can get there eventually.
content: Bluetooth only supports amazon supported Bluetooth speakers.  This means I can not connect to my stereo like I can with the dot. Why would you remove that functionality?  This device costs way more then a dot. I would have rather bought another dot then this show that does less then the dot. You would think with a screen you could do cool things like look through your lists/cart to see what you have there and maybe even have a purchase button. Since it does have a touch screen. Maybe all of this is coming but that just means this product wasn't ready for “Prime” time. Maybe wait until they fix these issues before you invest in a crippled dot with a a screen.

author: Steve
title: Disappointing Alexa video calling
content: Love Alexa.  Actually love the calling feature(dropin) of the base echo.  But very disappointed in video calling capabilities of the show.  I find it very difficult to understand how to add friends and family to this feature.  I actually bought one for my mom and one for us to be able to video call with her as she is not tech savvy and should be simple... but getting someone on the phone at Amazon to actually help with issues, particularly tech issues is a big FAIL of Amazon.  Online help is good, but the ones where you need a personal touch NOT.  Seems like a great idea, that needs work  I really wanted this to work and work as easy as Echo....just isn't for video calling.

author: Neilah Desiree
title: Organizer
content: Really good investment. It's like my personal assistant, plus.  I would recommend for everyone. I'm listening to audio books, getting reminders everyday. And, we are staying more "informed" with latest trends. Saves time.

author: Chris Crews
title: Echo Show is great!
content: I just installed the Echo Show. My grandchildren and myself love it so far. Extremely easy to use and a great product!

author: J. Lim
title: Terrific device!
content:
I bought 2 today -- mostly for the drop-in capability to check-in on my elderly father.  I've not set it up for my father but in the short time I played with it today, I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it was to setup (compared with the previous Alexa generations), it's ability to easily make phone calls, play music, answer questions, and even show videos as well.

My mother loved seeing the lyrics for the songs.

I only wished it took a smaller footprint.  I can't wait to give it to my father.

author: JP
title: One of the better Echo devices.
content:
Great speaker.
Understands commands well.
Displaying of current weather saves having to ask.
I like that it displays lyrics when playing music from Amazon Music.
Touchscreen works well, makes configuring options easy.

author: Ricky McKenzie
title: it's a large speaker with a useless screen. It's not like we are going to ...
content:
Without Youtube, it's a large speaker with a useless screen.  It's not like we are going to watch a movie on the device.  It does not have a video out, so you can not even plug it into a larger screen to watch Amazon movies.

It had a purpose with Youtube.  The kids loved watching nursery rhymes and singing along.

Hopefully this well get resolved soon.

author: AA09
title: Elevating the Alexa experience to the next level!
content:
The packaging was beautiful and then there she was!! We have 2 dots and an echo plus already. Now we have the show and we love it. An echo for each room!

You can also say "Alexa, turn off the screen" and it will go black. This is good for sleeping.

author: Ashley
title: Easy to Use and Set Up, great addition to our apartment
content:
We really love our Echo Show - we received ours as a gift, and are very happy with it. It was somewhat trying to set up at first (Alexa wouldn't do voice training, at all), but we've got the hang of it now. We've started to purchase other SmartHome accessories for it as well (some WeMo Switches, which have worked wonderfully for our living room light and our TV), and pairing those accessories with Alexa were easy enough for us to figure out. I don't consider myself hugely technologically inclined, to give you an idea of my experience level with tech.

I think our favorite feature is being able to drop in on our Echo, and to pair a camera with it to monitor our puppy at home.

The negatives: Ours arrived with a dent in the corner. My fiance wanted to send it back, but I persuaded him to just keep it, as long as it didn't affect the technology itself. So far, I don't think it's affected anything about the performance of the Echo show.

We live in an apartment that is approximately 850 sq ft. Alexa cannot hear us from everywhere in the apartment. We have the Show set up in the living room, and can hear us in the kitchen and living room, but not from our bedroom (which is directly behind a wall where the Show is placed). We plan on getting a Dot for our bedroom.

It arrives packaged pretty nicely, and I would recommend it as a gift.

author: LD In Houston
title: Great product really awesome
content: I have been wanting to get one for some time now... and with the prime special there was no way I was going to let it pass up the great deal... so far so good we really like it and my little one loves that I can call her anytime... I would like for it to have a Spanish option and YouTube

author: Jay Paul
title: Detailed VIDEO Review  [In-Depth]
content:
0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player This is the Echo Show
amazons newest Alexa device
 and if you’re familiar with the Alexa hardware line like the original Echo, the smaller dot, or what seems like an endless line of integrated hardware products that work with Alexa System OS  this device for some might seem like the next logical step for amazon to take but for others it might come as quite a departure from Amazon’s original echo.  let’s take a detailed look and consider the Echo Show, Amazon’s newest device and see if Alexa has a primetime hit with its newest show.

The first thing you will observe about the Echo Show is its shape
 It’s a noticeable departure especially from the original Amazon Echo
With 4 inches of width added to the echo show to accommodate for the additional touch screen its
nearly 2 inches shorter than the Echo while the depth of both devise stayed the same.
The echo show also boast an intel Atom X-5 Processor
Dual 2 inch speakers (which are impressive when comparing them to the original or most portable speakers)
Bluetooth
dual band Wi-Fi support
 and an array of 8 microphones that will be able to detect your voice from across the room

Now the real question is with all this tech what can the Echo Show actually do?
Well for one if you’re familiar with Alexa and how she works, the echo show keeps all the functionality of having a digital assistant but add another layer of immersiveness, functionality and aesthetics to Alexa’s growing list of skills.
For example, of you’re into cooking like my wife or a noobie like myself Alexa can help at all skills levels. For my skill level I used the Echo Show as my timer to keep track of my pizza’s so they don’t burn.  My wife’s kitchen use differs because she can look up recipes from a number of apps hands free, and even can watch instructional videos or look at ingredients lists on the fly.

The Echo Show also has the capability to connect to a number of smart devices to create a more immersive experience in your home. Weather this system works seamlessness is up to the actual devices themselves but in my case, it works well for me…. Most of the time.
Currently I have 2 Ring Security Cameras and a Ecobee smart thermostat hooked up to my Echo Show. The neat thing is once I connect my smart devices I could control the temperature by asking Alexa to turn the thermostat up or down to my desired degree using my set voice commands. This also works for my security cameras which I can view by asking alexa to show me my front door camera, and if I do have someone at my door I can connect using Alexa and communicate through there. One thing I did have to do before anything worked was download my devices Alexa skills and connect my smart devices by logging in but once that’s done its as simple as using the right voice command.
Another feature I loved is Alexa’s ability to play music from a number of streaming services, I happen to use pandora myself. When I do ask Alexa to play a song like a tribe called quest she will get the lyrics and display them on screen so you can try to sing like I do if you want.
Or you can use the Show to catch up on certain cable news shows like CNN. There are several skills that can be enabled that will let you watch clips or listen to the latest podcasts. Or use your voice to control your Amazon fire Tv.
All this requires that you have a Fire Stick hooked up to the same network as your echo show. Now you be able to tell your Echo show to look up for example action movies. The Echo Show will actually display your results on your tv allowing your several options for you to choose from.
It’s also easy to sync your calendar to the Echo Show which will give it the ability display all your important events on screen for you as a reminder, or you can schedule your own alarms. You can even Schule an uber ride with your voice for quick pick up and amazon promises to keep adding more functionality to the echo show.
I also loved the ability to drop in on another Alexa Device. I use this functionality to use the Alexa systems as my personal intercom for my house and you are able to limit who has the ability to drop in on your Alexa devices. In my case I limited it to my household only so I don’t have anyone randomly calling me.
There is a lot to love about the Echo Show but there seems to also be some growing pains that amazon can overcome. For one I would like to see more screen functionality. The Echo show has a relativity large screen but for the most part the only way you can interact with it is with your voice. It would be nice to be able to scroll through headlines on your home screen though this isn’t something that would dissuade me form purchasing the Echo Show it would be a great for some more screen functionality
Also, Amazon need to add major app to their skills to really feel like you’re getting the most of your echo show. For now the video is limited to YouTube and Amazon Prime and even then…… some of the videos cannot be viewed easily on the device. Hopefully this will change soon as it would be nice to be able to catch up on some of my episodes on Hulu while I cook dinner.
My last grievance is that in the next models of the echo show I hope that amazons talented design team is able to condense the device down into a more aesthetically appeasing unit. The overall look and design of the Echo Show are a little bulky and boxy and it would be nice to see a Echo Show that looks as sleek and sexy as its predecessor but also remain true to amazons visions and keep its functionality of a generously sized screen.
All in all I would recommend the Echo Show to any who believes in the Alexa system architecture and wants to have a product like no other on the market. If you’re an early adopter and a patient one you’ll find the Echo show a great piece of hardware. There are obviously some functions that amazon needs to add to make this device feel fully functional. But for now, the Added touch screen is able add an immersive layer of functionality. And for that I have to congratulate amazon for coming out with a product in my mind that in more than a gimmick

author: Sergio Muterperl
title: Amazon please make up for this!!
content: It looks like we are all really upset about the youtube feature being disabled. That is definitely what pushed me to buying the Amazon Show. Hopefully Amazon will start issuing some sort of refund or package to those who were expecting a product that does more. I planned on buying more Amazon Show devices after i tried the first one out. Now I do not plan on buying another show, nor any of the new Alexa enabled products you offer.

author: Jerry Alexander
title: The video screen is a great feature but sadly very limited content is able to ...
content: While it boasts of high number of mics which can recognize your voice even with ambient noice, I have found that it really doesn't pick up the wake word even from a short distance of a few feet. The video screen is a great feature but sadly very limited content is able to be accessed via Alexa. Most skills have language and location restrictions which clearly takes away the enthusiasm with which I bought the product. I am not very unhappy, but I am not happy either. Hope things will improve in the days to come.

author: im_it1234
title: Great Start with the Show would like some improvements
content: So far so good.  Owned a bunch of iterations of Echo's and the functionality of this one is generally the same (voice is the same, video/graphics interface is improving).  The video calling is cool, the fact that is shows a full weather forecast with graphics is neat.  We love playing Jeopardy on it as the questions appear just like on TV.  As with some of the other games there are graphics not just spoken word which we like.  What I would like to see is the ability to change the size and color of the clock in the night.  I want a red color and a larger font, hopefully they add this in the future.  Also I would not use this as a primary alarm clock in case your power goes out (I know the possibility is small but it happens).  We had a similar experience when the 1st Echos came out and I expect functionality to improve as time goes on.  Is it a must have?  Probably not but it is a neat gadget.  You can get 80% of the functionality with an echo do with less and a 1/3 of the price.  Do I regret the purchase?  Not at all.  They will continue to improve the functionality as time goes on.

author: Varun & Shilpa
title: Three Stars
content: The screen has gone bad after a couple of months. it has lines...

author: Jesse R.
title: Integration for products marketed as supported falls way short
content:
The Philips Hue integration is garbage. It's the main reason I have this thing. It doesn't even natively support it without downloading a "skill" as they are called. Similar to browser plugins it seems. The way it imports the devices from Hue and through to homekit is garbage. A lot of what you have created and working will not just work. If you try to organize them in any way in the Alexa app, the next time you have to discover scenes or devices will wipe out all the organization work you attempted to try and get the default import to do what you need it to.

I left a similar review for the skill in the Alexa app. Don't put it on the box and market its support and then leave it to some half measured plugin to accomplish.

There also doesn't seem to be any way to simply play your Spotify (also marketed as supported) library, which is beyond belief to me. You can play playlists, but would have to manually remember to add everything to a playlist that matches your library exactly.

Cool device, but a major function of it is supposed to be its integration to other devices, which seems lackluster to me.

author: Bill S
title: Finally a video phone that is an appliance - truly plug and play!
content:
My wife has been using Skype for years to talk to her parents daily, with constant technical issues.  Since her father is 88, it's a lot to ask the man to uninstall/reinstall/reconfigure Skype, but he does.  When I saw these on sale, I jumped on them.  My wife was resistant to "learn a new technology", but I told her these just work - like the video phones I saw at the New York World's Fair in 1964 - 54 years ago!

Yesterday it set up quickly and worked fine, with no issues.  My wife told her co-worker today and she went out and bought 3 - one for herself and her husband, and one for each set of parents.  It just works, like a telephone - imagine that.

author: jubella2
title: Don't bother
content: Works great as a speaker for playing music. That's about it. Constantly misunderstands questions and is overall a disappointment.

author: Jason Crump
title: I want to really like the Echo Show
content:
I want to really like the Echo Show.  The display is great but there is very little video content.  The lack of Youtube is a giant fail and Amazon needs to get their act together and start playing fair with Google.  Youtube was a giant reason that I wanted the show and without it, it is basically a clock radio.

PS.  Why can't the timers stay on the screen while they are running?  Having to request it to show the timers every 30-40 seconds or so is a big pain. We should be able to glance over and see how much time is left.  The timers should be included on the home screen as a "card".

I love home automation and i love alexa but i expect more from this product.

author: Andrew Kidd
title: Love it
content: purchased this before Amazon day when it was like $125.  What an amazing value.  I plan on purchasing more if it ever goes on sale again.  I watch movies, check my security cameras, listen to music and play with the different features from time to time.  Really enjoy this.

author: Amazon Customer
title: We love it and use it daily
content: We've had the Echo and dots for  a long time now and thought this one would be just one more, but we were wrong! Ilove watching videos, our photos, the lyrics to songs and somuchmore! We love it and use it daily, I highly recommend it.

author: Michael E.
title: Product failed 6 weeks out of warranty - pathetic customer support
content:
I bought an Amazon Echo Show on November 22 of 2017.  Over time it started to develop vertical lines across the display.  At first it was mostly during image transitions, when scenes changed.  Now it has vertical lines on every image all the time.  I contacted customer support, and because the device is only 6 weeks out of warranty, they offered me a pathetic 15% off should I purchase a new one.  The support rep was very argumentative.  I complained and got so-called supervisor who offered me a $50 dollar credit should I purchase a new one - the device is listed at $229.99.
I note that there are hundreds of complaints of lines across the screens of 1st generation Echo Shows, and Amazon now has a 2nd generation version.  I have been a customer of Amazon for 20 years and have spent a lot of money with them.  The support for a device 6 weeks out of warranty is pathetic.  The service of their help support, all from heavily accented individuals is argumentative and pathetic.  I asked the supposed supervisor, Anastacia M - she wouldn't give me her whole name - to connect me with someone who could assist me,  She said that there was nobody else.  I asked her to have someone to contact me who could resolve the issue. She said she would pass it on.  6 weeks out of warranty on a defective device where the problem showed up gradually - during the warranty period and that is supposedly the best that Amazon can do on their own product.

author: Kathy Summers
title: Best investmate for long distant family member ever!
content: I absolutely love my Show.  I purchased one for my daughter and sister.  I bought spots for my grandson and brother and now wish I had gotten them each shows.  It’s brought our whole family closer because even though we live in different states, we can  visit anytime, attend special occasions, and just drop in to say good morning.  ❤️ I enjoy having coffee with my sister as she gets ready for work.  My grandchildren have called just to show me the art work they did that day.  And, recently I joined a family gathering for Thanksgiving that I wasn’t well enough to travel to. That was a gift.

author: Aloha A.
title: Absolutely love it.
content: The Echo show is wonderful. I love being able to see the lyrics to songs I don't know and shopping for deals. The sound is amazing also. Highly recommend this product.

author: jkAddison
title: Trending Topics are USELESS
content: I like the Echo Show except for one feature - the home screen trending topics.  Amazon daily shows trending topics that it thinks is important and much of it is junk.  I am currently watching news regarding mangos, a girl setting the record for 4 leaf clover hunting, a birthday roundup for the day, and news about a walking dead mobile app.  All stuff I don't care about.  Come on Amazon, let us configure the trending topics so I get news that makes a difference to me, whether it be financial, sports, tech related, politics, or stuff that each of us individually cares about.  The constant stream of useless information really makes the "idle"  mode almost useless.

author: Sean Gross
title: Amazon, I see you,
content:
What do I see, amazon hit a home run with this device. I can chat with mom who is half a country away over the net, and it's so easy for a retiree to call me with the "Alexa, drop in " feature. Do you have a Nest thermostat, cool, it can control it. The speakers on this box are phenomenal, I don't need to use the blue tooth option to connect another set of speakers. I would say, this is the best amazon connected device yet ( IOT for you IT nerds ) . You can control a Firestick with your Echo Show.

If Amazon and Google could come to terms so one could watch YouTube, this would a be a end all device.

author: lunasquid
title: Mostly love this thing
content: Mostly love this thing.  Nice to have words to songs as they play and the ability to group Alexa devices.  The only problem I have with it is that it keeps dropping off my wifi and I have to reset to factory settings to get it to link up again.  Frustrating, and hopefully I won't have to keep doing it over and over.  Looks great, sounds great in my kitchen.  Just loud enough for a smaller room.

author: Robert
title: Disappointing, (1st  generation) especially at price I paid
content:
My expectations fore the Echo Show, 1st generation were high, and I was disappointed, especially at the price I paid.  The device was, frankly, not described well.  The screen is small and hard to see, it is very bulky, kind of like a very old tv, huge, but with a very small screen.

The resolution is horrible, pictures are blurry etc.

Probably should have sent it back, but I didn't and now I am stuck with it.  The Google similar device is much more impressive, with a much bigger screen.

2nd Generation might be great, but the 1st generation isn't worth the money at any price.  You'll be just as well off buying the Echo dot for $24.` I gave it too stars because it does work as promised, it is just "Show' part is inadequate.

You will be disappointed in the 1st generation Echo Show.

author: Sarah Ashe-Duenas
title: Easy to use so helpful!!
content: This is a great device we use it all the time, son can call his dad at night if he wants to with ease, I check status of my orders and can place new ones just by speaking we all love this!!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great technology..
content: The echo show has so many different of features that I enjoy playing around with. I love the fact that you can actually tap into your camera and view your home as well as just speak and it brings up recipes, it brings up music with lyrics, the sound is awesome. The only thing that I didn't really like is this that I had to buy the music package from Amazon in order for her to identify most of the music and the camera take a minute for you to see what's on the other end, but they can see you first.

author: greg
title: Not worth it
content: I honestly thought I could speak to people via video messaging using Facebook messenger.

author: Victoria Hall
title: not that great
content: I have the pucks and the taller alexa that has nice bass. when playing music. I was impulsive to buy this... Should have saved my money cause its on sale now- not to sure i would even buy it cheaper.

author: Moe214
title: Worth the upgrade
content: I replaced a 1st gen Echo with this Show and I think it was a great replacement. The sound, response and functionality have been great.

author: Jason F
title: Awesome for kitchen with Music Unlimited
content:
Bought one for our kitchen because (surprisingly) none of our appliances have a clock.  We didn't really want a wall clock because there is no wall space where it would look good, and the Echo Show looks pretty good for a countertop clock.

We didn't expect it would be so useful -- it's actually a perfect companion for the kitchen.  Everyone in the family has used it to check the weather, watch videos, start timers, pull up recipes, and most importantly, with single device music unlimited, play any song on command.

The voice commands work extremely well even though the device is 2 feet from the kitchen sink.  And we've never had a problem pulling up desired songs or play lists for a wide variety of music from pop to indie, old and new.

My main complaint is that when starting a timer, it only displays the timer for a few seconds then it goes away until the timer goes off.  I would rather keep the timer in the bottom-right corner of the home screen, so you can see it any time rather than have to request to re-display the timer.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The best Alexa device for kitchen use.
content: Love the echo show, great using in the kitchen with Allrecipes and news skills as well as home automation. Speakers are actually pretty good and sound decent when playing, assuming this is where the bulky size of the device comes from. With the screen, I do wish it had search capability like the Google home, but I find it does most everything I need it to for now.

author: getty
title: listening to music in the room while on the computer
content: What I like about this product is , I can listen to old albums anytime. Those old songs of the 60's and 70's and 80's is what I listen to...And foreign singers are my fave...like Dana Winner and Dusty Springfield

author: kleervu
title: I like it a lot . . .
content: Very pleased with this new version of Echo thus far.  Set-up was a breeze, and it automatically transferred my Pandora stations, etc.  I'm still exploring all it can do, but I use it mostly for music and I like the on-screen pictures of artists, etc., plus lyrics on many of the songs that come through Amazon's music service.  I find the sound to be a little more treble and less bass than I would like, but it's a minor concern.  I've watched a few YouTube videos on it, checked out weather and also sports scores, set some timers and reminders, etc.  An amazing gadget that I will continue to learn about in the weeks ahead, but I'm very glad to have it already.

author: Red's Dad
title: Like it
content: A gift from my son.  Have had it 3 weeks, and still learning.  So much it can do, so little I know - yet.  I do have spotify app and like the music.  The novelty of asking questions - has worn off.  As time goes along - I'll understand more.  It was the best ever gift!

author: Shauna
title: This is great for almost any room and any family member!
content: I love the Echo Show.  It's great for the kitchen for looking up and viewing recipes and timers.  It's great to watch quick news videos and it will play your favorites from Amazon Music.  We use ours mainly in the kitchen.  You can start your day with a view of your calendar and end the day catching up with emails, videos, video calls and so much more.  I wish I could trade my other echo in for another of these.

author: Dave  D
title: Echo Show Screen Glitching
content: Echo Show Screen Glitching. Evidently there is an issue with these and the screen displaying lines thru it and or double text. At first it seemed to go away at lower display brightness settings but it came back.

author: Brad Quevreaux
title: Impressive.... 🤔
content: I'm extremely happy with this little guy. It is awesome to have on your kitchen counter. We also have an echo plus, and love it as well. About the sound quality of the show... First let me say, I am an avid audio enthusiast, it is my passion and occupation. I have heard (and own) many small "bluetooth" speakers. I can say this device puts out better sound than I expected. It gets its, nearly 20 watts of power from a Texas Instruments TPA3118 class D power amplifier; as with all class D amps, the louder you play it, it begins to sound harsh. However, at low to mid volume, it really is amazing. I definitely recommend the Echo Show.

author: amandamae
title: Awesome!
content: I think the white one is ugly got the black one blends in the kitchen with other appliances. It's sharp as a tack can't wait to get one for my boyfriends mom for Christmas . I'm so happy with it going to be listening to music and watching videos while doing the dishes now and cooking. Will update if any problems but super happy I purchased . Reasonable price

author: Nikki
title: Absolutely love it, but there is plenty of room for ...
content: Absolutely love it, but there is plenty of room for improvement.  Only real issues we are having with any of our Echo products is that the drop in function does not work. We have them in every room and cannot drop in on any.  I contacted customer/Tech service and they supposedly are working on the issue, but haven't heard back for a couple of weeks...really a bummer because that was one of the selling points for me; using as an intercom.  I am hoping there is resolution soon.  I really like the product but it is not what I was sold on...

author: Daniel E. Sadaka
title: Weak Fire TV integration.  No YouTube
content:
I like the touch screen setup and the video that you *can* get on the screen.  However,  there is still a ways to go before this product can make me happy.

1) Weak integration with Fire TV
- I can find a video but can't seem to play it without the remote
- I can't play music on the Fire TV.  It will load Spotify but won't start playing my request.  Hokey
2) Can't play YouTube videos anywhere
3) Can't change location via voice commands.  When I set it up I was in a different town.  Actually, I shouldn't even have to tell it right?  Why can't it detect it's location?

author: Michael S. ONeill
title: Amazon & Google WORK OUT A PEACE TREATY!!!
content: If Amazon's & Google's power struggle had not eliminated accessing YouTube, I would have rated this 5 stars. I am still learning how to get the fullest use of The Show. I have 2 first gen Dots & 1 first gen Echo. The Show easily replaces all of them in functionality and quality. I purchased one for my brother & sister in hopes of video conferencing with them. So far that hasn't happened... Could I live without this pricey toy? Sure I could, but since I got them for about half price during Prime Days - WHY NOT??? If you can afford & justify them to yourself, I highly recommend them.

author: Heather
title: Love it!
content:
I love the Echo Show!

- It sounds great.
- It can find so much information.
- It shows lyrics to a lot of songs.
- There's just too many awesome things to list.

Con's:

- Has to be plugged in at all times. Would be Nice if it could be Battery Powered in addition to being plugged in.

- Has to be connected to WiFi to work. Would be nice to be able to use it where I don't have access to wifi like Siri (iPhone) can.

- I don't like that my information and everything I do on it (video chats, my voice, etc.) are all saved forever. That creeps me out cause it's a security issue. Definitely think that they should not store anything about me.

author: D.D.L.Santos
title: Some good and some needs improvement
content: I like the voice command,  timer,  song requests and little fun question and joke bits.  I dislike it doesn't make it easy to call out.  Especially with regular or repeatedly made ones to the same name. Im having issues with setting more than one reminder.  Would also like to be able to set a child profile that my child can use to call grandparents or request songs or stories that are age appropriate.

author: Dry Tortugas
title: Doesnt Play Any Videos - Junk - Sending it Back.
content: DOESNT PLAY ANY VIDEOS - only plays amazon prime, no youtube, no other videos.  The screen is near worthless. Junk. Amazon didnt win this war. Google won. Sending it back.

author: PhotogDog
title: The Echo Show Is The Best Ever and I Do Enjoy Having Them Around
content:
OKAY Folks, "Get Ready, Get-Set and Go Get One or Two... Or More!" "I will Be Getting this As Gifts For ALL My Family!!"

Basically everything went well, a little bit of trouble with learning proper voice commands and Alexa responding to me at first, "It Takes Time" for her to get to know us as well as we learning all there is to know about Alexa, LOL..."Have Patience will pay off. I did purchase 2 units, one for me and one for my "Love Nuggets" and received a great $100.00 cash discount at point of purchase. I also enrolled in the Family Amazon Unlimited Music Plan and paid $149.00 for one year in advance ($12.42 a month vice $14.99 per month Prime) for this plan and received another great savings. I will be working my way through the many uses, lighting controls, Nest Heating and Cooling Thermostat controls, Cameras, door locks, etc.- etc. to take full advantage of the Echo system as it expands with function, gadgets and services. The screen is a bit small but very sharp and easy to see from a distance, speakers are very good but hope one day to be able to control the Base & Treble to personal taste! I do bet Amazon will be developing a larger screen and a more expanded system later on as the demand increases across the board. In working out the bugs and swinging through MY Learning curves, the awesome Amazon Echo Customer Care/Support Dept with a direct line (877-375-9365) to reach a real person has been worth this Venture! I highly recommend this product, not only as a leading edge Gadget that is fun, but also it is informative and has a real life functionality! that is helpful, even for my age at 74... but at a slower pace, I do get it Kids!!

I believe honestly that this investment has been worthwhile and fun at the same time!!  I will up-date this review when I expand the Echo presence in our home and with all our family, stand by folks...

Thank you Amazon and the Echo Support Dept.for your 5 Star Support

V/R

Kent M. Whitney

author: Maximum Verbosity
title: She is a great Smart Home manager and I love the drop-in feature
content:
So far she does everything I ask her to do as far as running my smart home. Turns lights on/off, turns the thermostat up/down and reports the temp in the living room. I love the drop in feature, it's perfect for when our dog is at home alone and I know he's lonely (which thankfully isn't very often) and to talk to my kids when I'm at work and they're off school. She also works great with our Blink cameras - we have one on our front porch and I can easily see who's at the front door without having to open it or even get up, which is especially nice at night or when salespeople come by.

She can also do the basic stuff (weather, temp outside, play music, videos, etc) but she doesn't seem to understand as many questions as our Google Assistant. I do like Alexas repertoire of her own songs though, I actually play "It's raining in the cloud" a lot-lol!

I'm glad we chose this on Prime Day, I don't think I could have afforded it otherwise. I love being cozy in bed and seeing the bathroom and hallway light on AGAIN (kids never learn) and instead of having to get up to turn them off for the 15th time that hour, I just ask Alexa to do it and it's done! I paired her with our Blink cameras, Sengled light bulbs and Nest thermostat and all work great. I'm getting ready to hook her up to the Amazon Cloud camera and TP-Link outdoor camera to monitor both the front and back of our home.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I'm really not pleased with the sound
content: I bought 2 Echo show systems. I'm really not pleased with the sound. It's very, very muffled.  I've tried both the units to make sure it wasn't just a malfunction with just one.  It's both of them so I've concluded that the "Powerful, room-filling speakers with Dolby processing for crisp vocals and extended bass response" were removed and replaced with defective speakers.  In addition, Alexa doesn't know the answer to many questions including what she can do.  I'm continually referred to the Help section of the guide.  I asked for a list of people who sang a particular song (Google gave me 4 artitsts).  Alexa didn't give me a choice.  She said Mel Torme and then began playing the song.  I asked for a list, not to play the song. I understand that I'll need to pose my questions in a certain way but I don't think it's going to get better.  It doesn't matter anyway since the sound is so bad.  Considering returning items.

author: AllenDoug
title: Works as advertised with a few minor hiccups.
content: So far it is doing what has been expected except that the background screensaver cannot be adjusted for how much time between pictures. At this time I don’t have anyone I can call that also has a show to try video chat not do I have cameras to try out.

author: Alex Bowman
title: Video capability makes Alexa even more useful!
content:
Best features:
Drop-in - let's you communicate with other Echos in your home.
Multi-room Music - lets you play your music on all or select Echos throughout your home.
These features work with Echo, Echo Dot, and, of course, Echo Show.

author: TB
title: And she it makes her feel better to be able to “ Drop In” see I’m ...
content:
4th one we have purchased Office, Kitchen, Bedroom, and one in my room at a cancer treatment facility 11 hours away from home. The last thing I was planning on using one for.
My wife can’t stay here for the 3 months + I’ll be here.

 And she insisted I place one on my bedside table at home. As well as bedside here.

We locked access to only each other. And she it makes her feel better to be able to “ Drop In” see I’m ok and sleeping, with out waking me up with a FaceTime/ Skype- call.

Some nights she leaves it dropped in all night and goes to sleep. I’m going on the 5th week here and it is still working perfectly.
However, I doubt it was intended such long hours of daily use. But I’ve seen no issues so far.

So no complaints. I think our oldest echo show is around 2 years old. Never had any issues.

author: Amy
title: Great product please advance the product to the next level
content: Love the screen and alexa, the issues is the giant transformer and if it could be made flat so it could be mounted on the wall that would make it 5 stars...

author: drjim
title: I LOVE the Echo Show!
content: I had a couple of Echos already, but purchased the Echo Show for my library.  It has been an absolutely amazing device.  I use it often to help me with my spelling when writing.  The characters coming up on the screen is a very attractive feature.  The calling feature is so attractive that I decided to purchase these for each of my sisters, who live far away.  I call them almost every day, as I previously did so with my cell.  I use it with my Nest thermostats to turn up and down the temperature.  I control my Dyson fan and air purifier over and over all day long.  I look for movies, and review the trailers on the device whenever we head to the movies.  I get news releases on it all day long.  I use a background picture of my family on the device, so it is as having a photo sitting there on my desk.  I occasionally will listen to music over the Echo Show, but do this more on my other Echos, as I am often on the phone in my library.  I use it all day, every day.  It is very futuristic, and incredibly useful.  I recommend the Echo Show VERY highly.

author: M.E.
title: Why the need for a smart phone and an application on the smartphone?
content: the hardware is excellent but the setup leaves a lot to be desired.  Why have a cell phone application tied to this product?  I purchased so my mother could video the family but found this more difficult to set up simply for her and I have yet to find the setup that would allow my brother to share the video.  I would really love this device if setup were clear and flexible.... something that could and should be done without the necessity of a smart phone.

author: Dan2176
title: Bad microphone
content: Low rating based on already having an Echo which works excellent.  The Show does not.  It's microphone must be unidirectional and even when in the same room unit cannot hear us most of the time.  Our echo in the other room detects our voices better than the Show and the Show is only about 10 feet away.  We find we have to yell at it most of the time and is so frustrating it detracts from the other nice features that the Show has.

author: Munson
title: We loved our Echo until just recently it started making a ...
content:
We loved our Echo until just recently it started making a popping noise. Usually at the end of each song and now during some songs. So sad because we use it all the time. Sure didn’t last long!
What can we do at this point?

author: Darrell K. Pedersn
title: Great technical TOY
content: Great technical TOY, If I am not on the Computer and need to know something I am not sure about, "Alexa" knows all the answer's.  However when I asked her whether she liked "Putin" or not and her answer was "I am not sure of that" - which makes her much smarter, than a lot of my friends!!.

author: Robert R.
title: Brought my pictures out of the cloud and onto my coffee table
content:
This product coupled with Amazon Prime Photos brought my pictures out of the cold storage of a hard drive, and back to the coffee table where people can actually see them!

I don't use the "Alexa" feature much, but it does work well for automation and if you have a camera system such as the Arlo series of cameras.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Use it every day.  Annoying screen details.
content: Every morning I ask it about the weather.  We don't use the screen as much as you think we would, normally just audio so could have gotten away with just a dot.  The annoying thing is though when it does show you a fun fact or picture of something trending on the screen and you ask about it it 70% of the time it has no idea what your asking about.  I mean if you show me a picture of something and I ask you about it, or request more details it is really annoying to get a standard I don't know that,  At the bottom of the screen it flashes a sentence, but unless you are paying close attention and can read the exact sentence back it offers you either an I don't know response or info that only vaguely relates to the screen in question.  Either make the key word sentence bigger so you can read it, or stay on longer so you can exactly quote it,  or finally how about being able to return to previous screen,  Perhaps this is one of the reasons we seldom look at the screen.

author: okiemunchkin
title: Such a handy gadget!
content: I love the idea of the screen so you can see what Echo is telling you. I can set timers, watch video, get recipes, add to my calendar, see what's on my calendar, etc. There are new skills being added daily. I'd really like to see the weather radar added.

author: Happytobeme
title: I purchased this for my mom and has been horrible experience. Alexa quits responding and have to continually ...
content: I purchased this for my mom and has been horrible experience. Alexa quits responding and have to continually reset. This is so ridiculous. I ordered 2 more for gifts plus two other Alexa items. We so looked forward to Alexa but spend more time resetting than anything.  Total waste of money.  I am about to pack it up and send it back.  This is not the only Echo item I purchased with this issue.

author: SB
title: Love it, but no two way audio
content: I really like the Show. It adds a nice visual aid to my home automation. The sound is better than Echo. I really bought them (2) for displaying Nest Cams on demand without using my phone. Would get easily 5 stars but the video skill is missing one important feature - no two way audio.

author: Ryan
title: Great evolution of the Echo, but the Spot is probably more practical.
content: The screen is starting to have a line that almost looks like feedback. I realize that it really doesn’t  turn off screenwise. Not sure if this is something I can change in the settings, but it seems odd thata timeout for screen would be decault.

author: Jerry
title: Mostly good, description missing critical requirement
content:
We already have the Echo, Tap and Dot, so this was the next step.  The show does everything that its predecessors do, so I won't go through the audio features.  After figuring out how to setup contacts using the Alexa App on my smart phone,  I've been able to use my phone to make video calls to my family from wherever I happen to be.  I was on a business trip in Brazil for a couple weeks this month and used the App to call home regularly without problems.

The Alexa App lets you choose which camera to use.  The default is the camera facing you, but by touching your picture on the screen you can switch between cameras.  I was able to show my family sites from Brazil while talking to them.  I've noticed that my kids like to get in on the call when I use video.  When I make a regular phone call it's usually just my wife that I talk to.  Hopefully it isn't just the newness of the Show that has them participating.

My wife says the audio cuts out sometimes when I call from work, both here in the US as well as Brazil.  However, the problem hasn't occurred when calling from hotels, so I think it is related to my work network.

We bought a Show 2-pack and shared the savings with my wife's parents.  The one snag we've run into, which can be a big snag, is that in order to set up contacts for Alexa-to-Alexa communications, both parties have to have smart phones (or cellular service on a tablet); this is how Amazon links accounts.  One of my wife's parents has a smart phone, but the Android OS was only 4.4 (the other parent has a flip phone).  For contacts, the Alexa App only works with Android OS 5.0 and above, and iPhone 9.0 and above.  I called Amazon and confirmed that this is why we could not set up contacts on their end.  Fortunately their son lives with them and has a compatible smart phone so we were able to setup contacts.  Since the main incentive for many existing echo/tap/dot users to get the show is for video calls, Amazon needs to include this critical information in the main description for the product.  Many people, especially elderly, don't replace their cell phones every two years so that they have recent OS phones (if they have them at all).  Hopefully Amazon comes up with another way to link accounts in the future so that the cell phone requirement can be eliminated.

author: Rich
title: Alexa update broke my house *UPDATE*
content:
This is really a review about the home automation software that the Show interfaces with.
I have a Show, Dot, Echo and Cube in my home, I have completely bought into the Alexa home.
The problem is Amazon forces "updates" that break things that used to work. I get home tonight and the app has changed. My lights randomly respond to commands. All of them worked fine before the update and they and they work fine with my SmartHome app.
If Amazon is serious about being at the center of my home, they MUST test releases and allow customers to control updates or revert.
I am extremely upset. I have some lights that I can't even get to except through the app and now it doesn't work.

UPDATE:
Amazon customer support quickly responded and fixed the issue. My house is  all working again thanks to incredible customer support. I am back to loving my ALEXA again but like any good relationship, I want to improve my partner ;-)

Why not 5 stars? Here is why -
 1. Please get someone that actually cooks working in the development team and set up default configurations i.e. kitchen, living room....
 2. When I look up a recipe, keep it on the screen. It is EXTRA annoying to have "helpful hints"  (see 6 below) pop up when I am trying to read a recipe.
 3. In the kitchen I want to watch the timers, so please keep them on the display so I can see how much time is left.
 4. Make timers available on all devices, i.e. if I start a timer in the kitchen, I want to know how much time is left from the living room.
 5. Related to 3...Sometimes a timer setting is picked up by one of my other devices and then I can't get access to it from the kitchen.
 6. Stop running the nuisance "hints"
 7. Add a command to Routines to turn off music
 8. Do not claim that a Fire cube is like another ALEXA when I can't add it to my "everywhere" music group. Double penalty here due to advertising it an "all in one entertainment experience" when it doesn't stream with other ALEXA devices.
9. Bonus points if Fire devices would play "everywhere group " music through my TV audio. Oddly enough, I have chosen to attach my best speakers to my TV. I suspect I am not alone here.
10. Even though my Cube won't join the "everywhere group", it pauses whatever programming is on the TV when I send a command to any ALEXA device in my house. For example, even though I can't listen to the same music as the rest of the house, my family room TV gets interrupted when someone sets a timer in the kitchen...then I can't access the timer from the family room!

Like I wrote above, I am very committed to the whole Amazon Home Automation environment. It has greatly simplified my life and is usually reliable and convenient. I will continue to add more devices to my home as time and my budget permit.

author: Bond007
title: Garbage Quality Product from Amazon
content: Within 6-8 months of use, the screen of both of my echo show have gone bad. Echo Spot is working fine, so it seems like the quality of LCD is poor on Echo Show.

author: Miguel
title: Awesome device, love the screen but i do have ...
content: Awesome device, love the screen but i do have a few complains, amazon has not fully utilized the screen, i understand that in the future, developers will be able too, so as of now its underutilized. Also youtube does not run natively on the device, but if you run a browser you could, but it defeats the purpose of using your voice to search videos. once it has more developers adding more features it will be all the better.

author: S. Northup
title: Subscription nightmare! I wouldn't reccomend this to anyone.
content: I bought this product hoping that Alexa would be pretty well developed and far enough along, therefore expecting her to be responsive. This $100 piece of crap doesnt even know how to respond to a question that amazon themselves told me to ask her. (Echo buttons manual, see Step 3.) The device has potential given it has a big screen, decent sound but for 200 bucks, I would never reccomend it. Even for the $100 I spent, I feel like I got shorted. Oh and lastly, the device is pretty useless without a prime membership. I linked my personal account to it and the thing was literally a decorated bluetooth speaker. I went on the family account (this one) and got it to work minimal. Oh, and even with our prime membership, you have to have a music pass or something that's an extra 3.99 a month, leaving this item a subscription nightmare, and a overpriced, decorated bluetooth speaker in my eyes. I would give it zero stars if I could.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Almost Great....while it lasted.
content:
My wife and I use this device regularly. We use it for the calendar feature, the grocery list feature, the recipes (ours is in the kitchen) and the news. But the biggest reason we purchased it was to communicate visually with our elderly parents. Therein lies the problem. Being older ourselves our parents are quite old (80's and 90's). My parents hardly know what a cell phone is much less a smart phone. The Show has no way to create a contact list without a smartphone. HUGE design flaw. It should be an easy fix and I have seen others complain about the same issue. So far no response from Amazon other than "we're looking at it." I should probably detract 2 stars, but I'll be generous and leave it at only 1.

UPDATE: 8-10-18: Fun while it lasted. Within two months it developed black flickering lines across the bottom of the screen. Tried to replace it-apparently they no longer make the black ones-That was short lived!! I have no interest in white given the tendency for white plastic to yellow with age and show dirt. I am now "Showless." The only reason I don't mark it a "one star" is I did manage to get a refund.

author: LINDA S BIERMANN
title: Easy set up
content: Echo Show is great. Love the music videos capability to see and talk to family and friends. Easy set up and was on sale!  Love it. Try it.

author: Diana Heil
title: We love it!
content: It's so much fun, but there are times we have to go ahead and use our computers for things we want to know, Alexa doesn't know as much as she should yet.

author: Amazon Customer
title: We love our echo show and continue to be amazed by ...
content:
We love our echo show and continue to be amazed by it's capabilities.  I bought this so I could monitor my grandbaby from my daughter's living room while I baby sat. I was looking for a larger screen than traditional monitors and have been pleased by this unit. A big plus for my ageing eyes.  I love that I could use this to see and communicate with him as he grows from my home eventually when I can afford another unit to pair to this.  The baby loves going up to devise and seeing his "dada" from work and talking to him. Alexa quickly finds his favorite tunes on Spotify so he can dance. Quality of sound good. Price high! I've waited til I found it at about 150 on Amazon and bennifited from prime free shipping
. Don't understand why you need to buy a book to learn all it's functionality. It was a plus to buy a spin base found a good one for under 20 dollars on Amazon. Curious what future units will offer.

author: Michael S. Turner
title: Great Item for my Kitchen
content: I was leary about getting one but I am glad I did.  Alexa is great for playing music or movies while I am in the kitchen. I thought it would be a negative that it doesn't connect to Youtube but I don't need it to.  Alexa has answered all questions I have to include recipes, measurements  T spoon in to table spoon etc.  I also like how I can get a flash news brief on the top stories of the day.  Highly recommend it to anyone.

author: nawang d.
title: It's ok
content:
Yes I finally got it. And it looks awesome. The screens adds a special touch to alexa.

Edit* hmm I changed my mind. It was below my expectations. I was hoping the experience to be open like being able to do anything but there
are restrictions and there isin t many skills to make full use of it. I am not saying this is a bad product just not for me.

author: John Nelson
title: Great if you have older relatives living alone.
content:
At age 95 my mom doesn't do much with computers but she does still live alone.  If she forgot to hang up the phone after someone called, I'd have to drive over which added 20+ minutes where, if there was a problem, help wasn't on the way.  I have drop-in enabled on the echo show and its placed in a central area of the living room (I have a few other echo spot's placed at her house too).  When the phone is off the hook, I just do a drop in from the echo show on my desk at work or at home (this has happened more than once) and tell her the phone is off the hook.

I don't think it was designed to be a watch dog, but it works great as one (I have an echo spot pointing at the inside of the entrance as well as a ring doorbell device outside the door to help too).

It allows me to check on her instantly (which is very handy)

author: Amazon Customer
title: Needs more Video Content. Start using screen Amazon!
content: Nice device and nice to have a screen but really disappointed with the lack of video content. I mean the device has a screen why not use it. I would love to see HULU or Netflix or sometime of tv app that you can watch. I thought I would love it more but I really am not that impressed. If Amazon doesn't start getting more applications to utilize the screen I think this is a pointless device. I love amazon and have a ton of devices but wish I liked this more. Also I wish when you asked to show albums by an artist you could see the track in the album. All it does is starts playing the whole album not list tracks so you can't view or choose to individually play.

author: art
title: Fantastic for the kitchen!
content: It's really great for watching shows, listening to NPR, setting timers, listening to music, and allowing the NSA to gather even more information about me and my loved ones. We love it!

author: Sissy
title: 5 Stars!!
content:
I have had the Echo Show for a few months now and I have really enjoyed it.  I love asking it for the weather.  It great if you like to audio books because it turns you Kindle books into an audio book that it read to you. If you have Amazon Prime you can watch 'tv' on it (granted it small) but is convenient.  I like also how I can listen to my local radio station that has online playing...so it becomes a radio for me too.
Love it!

author: ViziNO!
title: Had TWO that failed miserably.  Buy the Dot instead.
content: Terrible device.  Have an Echo Dot that's AWESOME.  Echo Show was a major disappointment.  It would say that it was connected to my WiFi, but always had an orange band showing it not connected and wouldn't work.  Tried all the troubleshooting (disconnect power to router and Show; reconnect) to no avail.  Returned it and got another.  Same thing.  Amazon customer service couldn't figure it out.  My ISP didn't show any issues when they pulled a 24 hour report.  I'm not a luddite by any stretch of the imagination, so that's not a factor either.  Oh; and the handful of times it did work briefly, it fouled out over Sirius/XM.  I'd ask for a channel (like I do with my Dot) and it went into a shame spiral, eventually showing orange band.  TERRIBLE DEVICE.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Screen is cool but can’t use it for much
content: I love my Echos, but the Echo show adds little to the party. It can do all the awesome things your standard Echo does, but I find little reason for the screen. There is a time display, it makes Jeapordy a bit cooler by displaying the questions on the screen in classic jeapordy format, and it can do a few other neat things like that. I do recommend you research for yourself because I’d hate to undersell it but that’s my experience. Unfortunately, it does not play YouTube, which alone would make it 5-star for me. I love watching my favorite podcasts and looking up Tasty recipes on YouTube, and thought this would be the perfect device for my kitchen so I could enjoy those things while not in front of a television or computer. Of course now I know, Amazon and Google are at odds, so unfortunately for consumers the screen on the Echo Show has very little useful utility, speaking for myself at least.

author: T. S. Marsh
title: Surprisingly useful
content: I love having this on my desk. Security cameras, drop in, writing skills that let me see my teams status and them being voice controlled... all excellent. Im probably going to pick up a few more both for around the house and as gifts.

author: Amy H
title: White option, but comes with a black powercord?
content: I like the option for white, but it’s bizarre that it comes with a black cord. I have a white kitchen, so now I have this stands-out-like-a-sore-thumb black power cord. For aesthetic purposes, I was happier with my year-old white Echo (not Show) because it came with a white powercord. This seems like a major design flaw in the “white” option. I strongly urge Amazon to change out the powercord to white.

author: Kazumichi Inagawa
title: Great product by Amazon as always
content:
Great product by Amazon as always! I linked all my smart home device including light switches etc to Alexa and the whole system work as a charm! I have Wink to control all my light switches so I basically tapped Alexa to communicate with Wink instead. The two platform works together extremely well and go hand in hand together.

For anyone considering setting up a smart home interface in your home, having the Alexa smart home system and pairing it with Wink or Samsung Smartthings is essential to building a functional smart home logistic. There are a lot of smart home devices that are not supported by both system and having Alexa as a central bridge to pool everything in is extremely nice.

author: Sophia
title: The software isn’t there yet
content:
Unfortunately, Amazon Echo was a huge disappointment for us. She doesn’t know answers to anything except “what is the weather?” When we ask her “alexa, what do you do?” She tells us to look in the Help and Feedback section. You can’t even look up a recipe and have it stay in queue if you navigate to adjust your music.

The music function is really awesome. If we say “play songs by [artist]” she plays music only by that particular artist.

Working in a software company, I may just have had a high expectation for AI capabilities and Amazon. There are so many possibilities with this technology, Amazon echo just isn’t there and I wouldn’t spend the money at this point.

author: angelwishes
title: Things I enjoy about the Show
content:
Things I enjoy about the Show:
1. Able to see my calendar, shopping checklist, and albums, composers.  There are times when Alexa shows us the words of the song.  Not sure how I can ask that in command?

She seems so much smarter.

Hard to give commands when the T.V. is on.  She seems to pick up the T.V. sound and ignores our command.

Would like the screen shut off when I ask Alexa to shut off screen.

author: Sean
title: Another reliable Alexa product but falls short in features for the price in my opinion
