content: I have a lot of Alexa devices and will probably have more. The Show seems over priced compared to say the Fire TV cube both in looks and features.  Might be more valuable to me if we did more video calling at home but even at that a smart phone would probably be perfered at least by me and it's more portable. The Show is still a decent Alexa device if you want something to control smart devices or have a fancy alarm clock. Wish there was an option to make the clock numbers larger and outdoor temp constantly displayed instead of headlines that can't even fit the first sentence on the display. This was not a very well thought out product in my opinion.

author: Raymond Harris
title: They're on top of it they seem to care
content: Just received a phone call from a tech support Personnel about my review. I know now how to overcome the obstacle. I am very happy with the technical support the guy was super cool. Thank you

author: Jinxabit
title: I love the screen and being able to video chat
content: I love the screen and being able to video chat! My only complaint is that it doesn’t sync with my dot.  They don’t talk or recognize each other and I don’t know why.  On its own, the show is awesome, as is the dot. I love them both. The music is clear, and I enjoy ‘chatting’ with Alexa to see what’s new and entertaining. It’s great to catch the news, sports or weather and the kids check the weather all the time!

author: bryocephus
title: Too much fluff for me.
content: I was not impressed. My fire 8 on show mode works just as well on my nightstand connected to my bose speakers. I really wanted to like this item. A swing and miss for me.

author: BP
title: Excellent promise but terrible microphone performance compared to other Echo devices
content:
A lot of promise, and a great integration or two (for instance, showing video from Ring doorbell) but many are half baked (can't talk to the person at the door for some reason). Sound is pretty decent for music.

That said, the microphone and its ability to pick up commands is absolutely terrible, especially compared to other Echo products (I have a dot and 1st generation Echo, both which pick up commands infinitely better. Have to repeat things, it seems not to hear, can't hear through a noisy room, etc.

Video playing is just okay. The video chat works fine. But the fact that the microphone is so lousy makes it more frustrating than useful.

author: Pbonner
title: Absolutely love it
content: I have it in the kitchen to use for music while l cook.  I love that I can search for recipes easily to see while cooking and does not blink off to log in like I have to do with an ipad.  My favorite feature is the Drop In.  I bought my mother one, brought it to Canada, hooked it up for her and loaded my Amazon account to it.  We can now drop in to each others to say high and chat with each other.  My husband has one in his Man Cave loaded with his account and if he is not answering his phone, I just drop in to wake his butt up and answer me darn it!!! LOL  He may not like it as much as I do (evil grin).  This Christmas I will be getting another one for my daughter so we can drop in and chat with my grandson and family.  I think it is a must have.  (:

author: bill
title: Love this thing!
content: We have our Echo Show set up in our kitchen and it has become the hub for our family.  It tells us just about anything we need to know from the weather, traffic, recipes, news, and just about anything else you can think of.  But, this also SHOWS you on a beautiful screen what You would like to know.  Ask it the weather and it shows you the forecast for the coming week.  We also have it controlling our home lighting (with added hub and comparable light switches) and also controls our home security system and HVAC system.  Very helpful product.

author: Cindy E
title: Not terribly easy to get working and the help is limited.
content: This is not as user friendly as needed for a non-technical person to set up.  The camera seems to have a mind of it's own, changing settings at will.  Additionally, the Echo has granted me access to other friends Amazon Alexa accounts which I should not have!  I can change their settings and add to their shopping lists!

author: M. Mansfield
title: Screen problems ruin experience.  AVOID and wait for redesign
content: Purchased July 2018. Nice but unreliable screen. Screen flicker started after a few weeks  of ownership. Worked with customer service following reset protocols. Finally returned for repair. Sent repaired (replaced?) unit which has worked fine until yesterday. Screen lines and flicker are back. This makes for a pretty disappointing experience. Not up to the Echo design and reliability standards expected. WAIT for next version.

author: Bryan Lowe
title: Getting there, but it isn't yet
content: It's ok.  I bought it to see recipes in the kitchen, but that feature is painfully limited.  Sounds good.  Looks cool.  Doesn't yet live up to its promise yet, though I think it will.

author: Christen
title: There are some things I really like about it
content: We were given the Echo show as a Christmas gift. There are some things I really like about it. The timers are great! I make healthy family meals everynight and I can just ask Alexa to set timers without interupting my cooking to press buttons. My kids 5,4, and 3 have also learned to ask Alexa to set a 10 min timer when it comes to sharing a toy. Playing music is nice and we also like playing games like Jeopardy when making dinner. The kids love jokes and songs by Alexa. The shopping list feature is also a favorite because with the app myself and my hubby can always see if we need something when we are out an about. We had a pet that needed meds for two weeks 2x per day so to have ongoing reminders was really nice. We have plans to purchas a spot for the bedroom and an outdoor camera. That way when the dogs bark at night I can ask Alexa to show the backyard camera hopefully saving some peace of mind that it is just the wind.

author: coffeenut
title: I love this!
content: I love this!!  It was a gift from my sister and I liked it so much I bought my sons each one for Christmas.  I love that we can talk and see each other.  Echo is like my personal secretary.  I would recommend it highly.

author: carthub
title: Please remove "try" suggestions from home screen.
content: I would happily give the echo show a rating of 4 or possibly even 5 if there were a way to remove the annoying "try" suggestions on the home screen.

author: L. Mars
title: Cool Addition to My Tech Tools
content:
Received as a gift, and I am enjoying. Like the ability to have my books read to me.

There are a lot of apps, which is great. However, I find it cumbersome to recall the specific set of instructions required to launch each app. I'm confident that Amazon will continue to refine and improve the device.

I would love to have the ability to watch Prime Video from the Show.

author: Peche1
title: Amazon's in the lead
content: The Echo show is so much fun! I wasn't sure about a screen being necessary, as using your voice was the whole idea behind the echo, and I believe that is what has made it so popular. However, after having the 'show' for a couple of weeks now, it's totally sold me. It resides in my kitchen (which seems to be the most logical place) and has become so helpful. From setting timers ( you can watch them count down on the screen) to looking up recipes (Alexa will read them to you while displaying on the screen), to playing music (title and artist are displayed). The screen is clear and has good color. I've been updating my house with smart devices, and the 'show' controls them along with my other echoes and dots. Lights, thermostat, cameras. I really like that I can just ask Alexa to show me one of the camera views, and there it is on the screen. No running to get my phone or iPad to use the device app. The drop in feature is helpful and fun too. I bought my parents a 'show', and they love that feature! lol. It allows you to activate one of your contact's 'show' screen (drop in) and video chat. (it will warn the person you are contacting, that you are 'dropping in'). The only down part for me is that I wish Amazon would have used more premium speakers. Not a deal breaker. I just use my Bose Bluetooth speaker. I'm still discovering more about it, but it has already been so useful. This is definitely the wave of the future, and Amazon is light years ahead.

author: Alan
title: Love!!!
content: I can not say enough about this product, this has become my favorite thing in my house. I go to sleep every night to thunderstorms, see my kids in the Nest camera, and it has great speakers!!!

author: Woody
title: Less than useless. Does not work with Amazon CloudCam.
content: Less than useless Does not work with Amazon CloudCam. I purchased this from Best Buy to allow me to monitor my two Cloud Cams from my kitchen. I am VERY tech savvy and have numerous Alexa devices but have been unable to get it to work. I tried installing and enabling the Amazon CloudCam Skill, made sure there were no new updates for the Show (the Show automatically updated when I first plugged it in). The final straw was when the tech support rep told me you can’t use the Show with the CloudCam—and then was unable to connect me with someone who could actually solve the problem. Useless is no help; less than useless actually makes more work. The Echo Show is less than useless.

author: Linda T Skinner
title: Great way to Stay in Touch with a Family & Friends
content: The visual adds a whole new dimension to Alexa. To be able to see who you are talking to and see information and articles that you request Alexa to find. Love it.

author: Patricia Ann Murphy
title: We love Alexa
content: Wow.  Alexa is amazing.  We got the Show for the kitchen and for upstairs to be able to see our security camera if need be. It’s in the master bath.. nice to be able to watch a movie while in the tub.

author: leslie
title: Doesnt really do much
content: I thought it would do a lot more than it does & also give more info. So far no really impresses with it. It does play music great but but also has problem with that to when you want to play top hits of the artist .

author: Ms. B
title: Love it!
content: Love it!! Great display and sound.  I have an Echo and 3 Dots...will be replacing a dot with another show soon. We have them all over the house connected to lights and will add cameras soon.  Don't know how I lived without Alexa.

author: wizzard
title: No u tube. ??
content: This should be 5 stars as the product is innovative, fun and entertains. One Huge problem is the lack of u tube. Once the hype of making video phone calls ends this products life cycle will certainly be cut short. Come on executives no more fighting. This product would help u tube popularity and generate equipment sales for amazon. This is corporate stupidness.

author: Wayne
title: Annoying Suggestions Returning Both
content:
I bought 2 Echo Shows during the Prime Day sale. I like the concept but due to the annoying barrage of 'Alexa Suggestions' I'll be returning both.
Per Amazon support 'at this time' there is no option to turn them off. Why take a chance of getting stuck with the rolling billboards?

author: Charles Gray
title: Echo Show response compared to Google Home response
content: Replaced my google home with the Amazon Echo Show. There are pros and cons about the Echo Show. One of the pros is I can video chat with friends that have Echo Show, Echo Spot, or even the Alex app on there phone. But one of the major cons for me is the command response of the Echo Show compared to google home. The response from google home was much better than the Echo Show. For the most part, I could say a command only once with google home and it executed the command, I find with Echo Show I have to repeat the command a couple of time before any response. Just based on the response to my voice command, I would chose google home over the Echo Show. And I even programmed my Echo Show to recognize my voice.

author: B. Anger
title: The audio quality was terrible put next to an Echo Gen 2
content: The audio quality was terrible put next to an Echo Gen 2.  Also, the Alexa programming was not nearly as responsive as her competitor.

author: Asilvaesq
title: Great Echo with a Minor Gripe
content: I like the Echo Show a lot.  The sound quality is good, we use it a lot for music in our kitchen/dining room.  Although not a reason I bought it, we really like the digital photo frame feature.  The sound and video quality are good when I "drop in".  My minor gripe is the angle of the camera, it points up at the ceiling.  I typically prop something under the back so I can level out the camera.  I think a nice feature in the future would be adjustable screw feet in the back to set the camera where you want it.  I really like the Echo Show and would recommend it.

author: Paul Hunter
title: Cool Product
content: Love my Echo show.  I have it in the bedroom and use it to set reminders, turn on/off lights, and to view my security cameras when they pick up detection.  It still has a way to go in being able to answer questions correctly, but overall, it's a cool product to have.  The only issues that I have had is when Alexa commercials come on the television and the Echo Show picks up the keyword.  lol

author: Chris York
title: Completely UNDERWHELMING. Save your money!
content:
I have given this flashy piece of tech garbage over a year of my patience. It is not only the worst-performing Echo (I own 3 Echos, 4 Echo Dots, and a Echo Spot alongside this Show), but the terrible OS and User Interface handicap this thing’s potential.
Specifically, the microphones on the Show are far less accurate or responsive, and I find myself almost always repeating myself multiple times (Alexa is hard to even trigger at a close distance).
Bezos made a pathetic mistake by shoving out Google, as this Show is no longer YouTube-enabled, foreseeable until these CEO children stop bickering over more and more control/monopolized sheep.
Also, there is no way to simply “load” an app (like Prime Video) and use the touchscreen for navigation/control like a smartphone/tablet, making it quite pointless and unusable, especially without the secondary use of an iPhone/iPad to find what you’d like to stream EXACTLY as titled by request of Alexa (who’s typically way off, and starts automatically playing nonsense).
The speakers are just fair, and easily surpassed by a cheap Bluetooth speaker for music.
I had desired to use this as my YouTube box for streaming random videos, but that’s kaput, as any non-Prime video request results in a terribly-rendered Bing Video search result. I find the ONLY thing I consistently or reliably use this countertop-wasting-box for is to watch Routers TV, the absolute best and simply-consolidated news stream compilation each day (Download the iOS/Android app now for your new fix, it’s IDEAL!).
Pandora and/or Spotify music streaming is inconsistent, especially when paired in a Echo whole-home group, which is the very reason I bought all these Echo’s. The music will 1) refuse to play on some speakers, randomly/inconsistently, 2) Stop playing after one song or after another random duration, 3) refuse to resume playing, and most aggravatingly 4) Play something completely different from said request. I realize some of these grievances are not unique to the Show, but as I said before, it’s the worst-performing and thus least-utilized/realiable Echo out there. Save your money, this box is not worth wasting your time simply for a terrible version of the Echo with a small screen.
***************UPDATE*****************
Now 4000% more useful! Changing my rating. As of 10 Oct 2018, with the new OS update, YOUTUBE IS BACK! Amazon finally introduced the Silk & Firefox browsers, allowing this to be basically a hardwired tablet! Finally, an always-on, kitchen-based, communal “tablet” for browsing the Wide-World Web, namely streaming YouTube, the end-all-be-all video source. The usefulness of this subpar Echo has increased tenfold with the ability to use a browser and login to YouTube!

author: Carol Cevolani
title: A fun assistant
content:
Very fun.  She sings and raps if you want her too.  She is not an "information" center, rather an assistant.  Sets timers, make lists, etc.
I have not connected it to smart home equipment yet.  Love having a selection for music but very expensive monthly.  Wish it could answer questions (like Google).

author: SMJP
title: Works as expected
content:
So far has work as expected.  Bought a 2nd one for my son so we can video calls, everything appears to work well.. Needs improvement with looking for recipes from Allrecipes.  Does not search well from the skill.
Also use it as timer, to play music, question of the day, etc.  Really could care less about YouTube not being available on this devise.

author: Amazon Customer
title: One Star
content: My echo shows a double screen all the time, it is sooooo frustrating!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not A Good Product
content:
Update to original review.
My show is now 5 months old and no longer works fully.  I would not invest in this product.
I have emailed Amazon twice with no responses in return.  I would give this product zero stars.

Original review.
I have never left a review before on Amazon.  I am giving the Echo Show 2 stars because it's a great sleep machine and provides some good ambiance sounds.  It is also a great alarm clock.

However, it is not worth the $230.00 I paid for this at an Amazon store in the mall.  Echo Show is not very user friendly.  Alexa does not know a lot.  In order to get information you want you have to open all these skills and most of them are like basic apps that were developed years ago.

Overall Alexa is fun to listen to music and very basic things.  The Echo Show provides the basic smallest amount of information when asked.  I am amazed that Amazon would release a product so simple and not ready to be fully utilized to its potential by consumers.  I have a feel Google will blow the Echo Show away when their version comes out.
I was foolish enough to purchase 2 of these; one Show for me and one as a gift.

author: txeggplant
title: Great for Kitchens, Small Living Rooms ... Good Sound
content:
I was really pleasantly surprised by this. I expected the screen to be smaller and I didn't really think about how it stood up (It's a wedge ... a nice sturdy wedge). Originally, I intended it to go in my bedroom, as a replacement for my Spot. It was a little too big for that. So, I moved it into my kitchen.

I love being able to stream shows while I'm cooking. I love that I can see recipes as I'm cooking.

The sound on it is really good ... lots of bass. If you have Prime Music, it will show the lyrics as well. I don't need help singing though *wink*

I was so impressed with it, we bought another on Prime Day for the living room. I don't have a television in there (because I feel like people should be there to visit, not to watch tv and wipe Cheetos fingers on my couches), but I thought it would be nice to have a Show in there. This way, we can stream shows and it's not obtrusive.

The one thing that I'll mention and this is just my experience is that the more expensive the Echo gadget, the softer you need to talk to it. With my parent's Dot, I literally scream at it across the room and it picks up. My Spot, I have have to be a bit closer and not scream. The Show doesn't seem to pick up across the room and seems to respond better if I just use my inside voice with it, close to it. It could be where I have all my devices but it happens enough I thought I'd mention it :)

author: Amazon Customer
title: Echo with Alexa 5 Stars
content: Love my Echo Show and my Echo (2nd Generation) - Smart speaker with Alexa - Heather Gray Fabric.  The sound on the Echo Show is great and the screen images are clear.  Still learning all the things about it.  My Echo (2nd Generation) - Smart speaker with Alexa - Heather Gray Fabric has great sound.  I use it to fall asleep at night with "sleep" sounds. My favorite is Thunderstorms. I like that you can tell Alexa what you want to hear and set a timer for shut off.

author: Shelley
title: Handy smart device
content: I like that it is voice controlled but can also be turned off.  I like the touch screen also.  I'm going to be purchasing a security camera and lighting that are Alexa compatible to go with this device.  I like the skills that you can get on it.  My children enjoy playing the Sponge Bob and Song Quiz.  You can't pick random songs to be played unless you have a premium account with Spotify or Pandora or Amazon Prime Music.  The sound quality is pretty good for playing movies and music.

author: John
title: Take your time!
content: I love this remember take your time when setting up and speak normal.  Your Alexa needs time to recognize your voice, when you are loud, accent, sick, or you speak low.  I purchased this for my parents.  It's helped them in so many ways, reminding them to take pills, exercise, to call me drop in...I have one as well and I can see them and actually see how well they are doing.  They can read there subscription name to Alexa and she will tell them what that pill is use for...so they take the right pill.  They can now set their calendar up using Alexa and clearly see day to day events.  I still call to remind them, but I get a big kick when my mother tells me she knows...sounds like me when I was a kid.  They can listen to their music from the past at anytime.  They love the jokes and they love giving commands to Alexa to turn on or off their lights. (need to buy the special bulbs which you install and pair up with Alexa).  My parents are both over 75 yrs old and they were hesitate, but quickly picked it up.  My dad had problems saying Alexa because of his stroke.  So, I changed it to Echo and now Echo has no problem recognizing him. (you have four choice to choose from, computer, Echo, Alexa, ?) Also, I was fortunate enough to buy these when they were on sale for hundred dollars off.  Got them at B & Beyond you have up to a year if you are not satisfied with your Echo.

author: Elaine
title: Alexa in a Screen.
content: Really like the screen with all the pictures.  Use it in the kitchen for new recipes and for listening to music.  Anxious to learn more & more about all it does as time goes on.  The screen protector is a must to purchase with it!

author: CPG RZ Review
title: Screen flickers and glitches out at random moments
content: Out of no where my screen started freaking out and it keeps happening randomly throughout the day. it's annoying to look at and reduces the functionality. extremely disappointed.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Screen gets distorted and static on half of it.
content: Screen has issues. Starts to get distorted and static on half of it.

author: Lana Lee
title: Easy to set-up, immediately responsive to verbal directions and questions. Good resolution on the screen. FUN!
content: Still learning about the capabilities of the Echo Show, and have purchased a few books for my Kindle about how to best utilize this device to get the best results with it.  I initially purchased a Kasa Smart Wi-Fi Plug Mini - Controller, but have not been successful at getting it to pair up with the Echo Show so far. I was kind of happy I didn't waste more money in buying several more as I originally started to do but removed them from my order at the last minute!  So far, I'm pleased with the Echo Show (other than the pairing issue with the controller outlet form TP-Link.  It's a nice way to access Alexa.  I have already frequently used it as a way to play music playlists and the sound quality is surprisingly good!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best device ever/ not to happy about the way I got treated when they upgraded
content:
This is everything you want an alexa device to be. Youtube is horrible unless you know exactly what you want to look up. Mine is in the kitchen. It's great for cooking, listening to music, getting the news and everything else you would use your phone for in the kitchen but completely hands free. It does have a problem picking up your voice if you have the volume on 10 while listening to music but the device gets loud so it's understandable. I had a little problem with mine out of the box and tech support was amazing. Fixed the problem within minutes and noted it so if the problem happens again it will be able to return out of the warranty. Best buy ever

Update: my show is a gen 1 a few months into owning it my volume button went out.
Not a big deal I called amazon and was told that I need to send it in then they will decide how long it will take and if they can fix it. I ask if they can just send a new one since I reported this issue right out of the box the first time and was told that no. Because they dont have any because they no longer make them. I was issued a refund.......super disappointed. Now I have to fork out an additional 100 bucks to get a new model that does the same thing mine already did. Sucks

author: Clei
title: Not all that great.  Google on my android is way more responsive!
content: It's not what I expected. I thought I could ask it to find a recipe and it would for example. It seems it doesn't do internet searches. Google works much better. I like it for music play that seems to be the only thing it's good for. I tried to order with it & get a discount and that didn't work either. I don't care about videos or games. I wanted a kitchen gadget personally. I don't know anyone else who has one so the video phone part hasn't been tested that might be neat but I can do that with my phone too.

author: Amazon Customer
title: No battery. No tablet-like functionality.
content: Got this on sale for $149. Couldn't resist at that price. Two *major* improvements this would benefit from: Make the screen operate a lot more like the Kindle Fire, and Add a Battery. It lacks the versatility of tablets, and it lacks the portability of Bluetooth speakers. Moving room-to-room means boot up. If I could do it again; I would buy a Kindle Fire with Alexa, and a Bluetooth speaker. Together, they'd be about the same as the sale price. No way I'd pay $229... It definitely functions as described, but their ad needs to emphasize that in spite of it's weight - there's no battery. (Which seemed a reasonable assumption at the time of purchase)

author: Christopher A. Hammer
title: Alexa: unfulfilled Promise!
content: The Show can be handy in the bedroom for controlling lights.  BUT there are MAJOR disappointments:  (1) I paid extra to NOT have advertising but I can’t seem to turn off the non-stop flow of useless « news » and « information » about skills and capabilities that are of no value to me.  I especially don’t want to be told about the personal life of celebrities and sports figures.  I am not interested in spectator sporting events.  And I don’t choose to be told about all the unwanted things I could have if I joined Prime; I am just not interested.  (2) I do want the Echo Show to broadcast a continuous video feed from my Nest Hello video doorbell.  But I must ask for this display and then it shuts off after an Amazon-predetermined time.  To get what I want, I had to buy a security monitor, a Google mini and a Google chromecast dongle.  Too bad that Amazon has decided to pre-empt the useful with their display of annoying and useless on-screen babble.  (3) Alexa is programmed with useless information.  If I asked something stupid like Kim Kardasian’s birthday, I would instantly get an answer but I don’t care about such mind-numbing trivia.  But if I asked Alex a question like »who was the king of England when the Mona Lisa was painted? » all I get is irrelevant non-sense or an admission that she doesn’t know.  For now Alexa is good for little more than turning on and off the lights.  No, I don’t want Alexa to tell me a joke as her AI is a joke.

author: Chris S.
title: Jumps high, falls short
content: Product works great.  Music sounds amazing. But here is the problem. You cannot stream any kind of videos except amazon video.  If it would stream Netflix, YouTube, Vudu, and Hulu, it would be amazing beyond amazing. But sadly it is barely useful.  And if you want to tell Alexa to play a video or movie that isn’t a normal title, good luck. Might as well just buy a tablet and use that instead.

author: Mr. Dale L. Tucker
title: Outstanding!
content: I'm very happy I've upgraded from the Echo Dot to the Echo Show! The sound is remarkable, the ease of use and the expansive capabilities of this device is very gratifying!  The only issue I'm having is calling device to device... I easily hear the party I'm calling but consistently, the other party struggles in hearing my voice.  Tech support was stumped and even sent me another Echo Show. Still an issue but otherwise, an amazing upgrade! Highly recommend!

author: Matthew David Smothers
title: Lack of Apps and Youtube make this purchase unjustifiable.
content: Without support for Youtube, unable to use apps from the app store, no dedicated browser, and searching the web limited to voice commands only, I was very unimpressed with the available options on the echo show. With that being said, the design was pleasing to look at and the UI was clean and simple to use. I returned my anemic show and plan to get a Fire 10 tablet with a stand and bluetooth speaker as what I believe will be a far superior experience. While the microphone on the 10 may not be as good as the show, I am sure the other features and better display will make up for it.

author: KimberlyBH
title: Show stopper!  Love
content: Amazon show is great!  Love being able to dial in love.  Screen is blurred until a person comes into view and talks.  So not an immediate spy situation.  Better sound.  With amazon prime music you get the lyrics to the song which is awesome.  I can “drop in” on my children’s echos in their room.  No more ignoring me!  I’m in love with this product

author: nattimom
title: LOVE the screen for recipes in the kitchen!
content: Got this as a Christmas gift and Alexa has quickly become our "go to" for just about anything!  The music is awesome - especially love all the options and choices.  So long to the CD's because this does it all!  I also like being able to ask for a recipe, and have all the options appears along with ratings.  Choose which number I want and voila!  There are all the ingredients and instructions!  I use to have to drag the laptop to the counter but Alexa has quickly become my personal assistant!  Such a fun toy!  Kinda like Rosie on the Jetsons!

author: Derek C.
title: ECHO Show Shows!
content: Such a cool product...also doubles as my Bluetooth speaker for my computer. Everywhere speaker option is awesome!!!

author: Chris S.
title: Alexa Show is amazing. My wife hated that I bought it
content: Alexa Show is amazing. My wife hated that I bought it, thought we didn't need it and after a day she fell in love with Alexa too lol. It is so convenient for setting timers, listening to music, playing music for the dog while im not home, connecting to bluetooth speakers for parties, playing movies. I love it!

author: Bowser B
title: Just like a tablet with 95% of its apps removed and inability to unplug from the wall
content:
Received as a gift.  If you live with only Amazon services, this might be OK.  Otherwise, it is comparable to a small iPad, but without Netflix, YouTube, a web browser, portability, email, iTunes, and so many other features and apps that are widely available for tablets and phone.  Controls only a limited selection of "smart home" devices (not my thermostats, security system, or switches).  Must be plugged into AC to work.  As it is, this is a fun toy for kids or those easily amused--for a couple hours.  All in all, the list of things this can't do, compared to a basic tablet, is many times longer than what it can.

Before I set it up, I thought it might also be a good gift, so I bought one at a local Target store.  Big mistake.  Now I'm going to have 30 days of questions like, "How can I play my iTunes?" "Where is Netflix?" "No You Tube?" "How can I get my email?"  Sadly, the answer to all these things is going to be "Use your iPad."

author: Joy
title: Didn't think I would want one ...
content: I received the Echo Show as a gift and didn't even take it out of the box for several weeks.  Don't know now why I waited.  The ability to sync my calendar and to do lists with my phone is a huge benefit.  No more leaving notes on the counter for my husband to read.  He is not technology savy but has no trouble asking Alexa what's on his to do list or what time his favorite football team is playing.

author: Anna
title: I’ve had mine for a year. Love it.
content: Bought one for my parents since I love mine so much. We now can call each other & send voice messages without pushing a button on our phone. I love these! The “drop in” option is amazing when you are away from home & want to check up on your house(or pets).

author: K. Biegler
title: Worked at first
content:
Worked fine at first ... Now it's response to requests it played before without any issue is suddenly unreliable and inaccurate at best.
Will repeat request accurately so it hears it correctly then does nothing at all or shuts off or plays something else. Theses are skills that aren't new or complex. When it was working it was fine but now it's worthless.

author: tom wright
title: The response is super fast and accurate and the voice recognition is spot ...
content: This is the coolest purchase that i've made in a long time! The possibilities are endless with the Echo show. It has replaced my alarm clock, sound sleep machine, internet searches for restaurants and goods. The response is super fast and accurate and the voice recognition is spot on. Have never had to repeat a question or gotten a no response. I learn new uses every day for the Echo show, what a time saver!

author: Chicago Mom
title: Great device - but four months later and it's on the fritz!
content: My family and I love the Echo Show - we bought it in January. However, here it is now April and we are having issues. The screen is flickering constantly - it first started only in the morning when it would first start up, now it is happening throughout the day.  There is supposedly a warranty on this device but Amazon makes it so difficult to figure out who to contact. After only a few months, this really shouldn't be happening.  I'm disappointed that we now have to deal with this, otherwise the device is great.

author: RC
title: We love Alexia
content: We task Alexia to do a Varity of things. From keeping a calendar to  adding things for the shopping list. And just useful information. The "show" is a new addition to the already one Echo and two dots family. The Echo show can show us our Ring cameras, show us a recipe and show us the lyrics to a sound that is playing, amongst other things.

author: Jeremy D.
title: Perfect for everyday use
content: We love it! we use just about every skill we can think of on it. It's out alarm clock in the morning, we have it set to tell us the weather and traffic information so we can plan our mornings accordingly all while listening to the radio on it. You can watch amazon movies and tv shows on it. If you have another Echo devise in another room it acts as an intercom for room to room conversation so that you're not yelling across the house. We also have several things within our house that we can control through Alexa (A/C, door locks, lights) What we like best is that we can check in on our friends and facetime chat through it as well. If you don't have one of these yet do yourself a favor and get one you'll thank me later.

author: LaDamia King-Ray
title: Alexa can't hear me..
content: A friend of mine got the Echo for her birthday and she absolutely loves it. We were playing around with it, asking Alexa all types of nonsense questions. At one point we sat the echo in the middle of the room and surprisingly it responded to the wake up from across the room.. I decided to get myself an Echo Show thinking I can talk to it from across the room... I was in the doorway of my room, about 12ft away and said hey Alexa.. Nothing.. tried again.. nothing.. I'm not trying to be screaming at the top of my lungs at 5am to see what the weather is like.. So I wasn't so happy.. I just got it yesterday and so far that's the only problem I've encountered so far.

author: Jerry Schenk
title: Sadly disappointing functionality
content: I like the quality of the picture. The sound quality is not as good as the Echo. The apps are fairly useless. The ring doorbell has no interaction with the person at the door. The daily brief is just words with no story pictures. Basicly it should have more Kindle capabilities.

author: jonjo
title: Would purchase again.
content:
Regardless of big brother watching me, I still like Alexa.  I connected an Arlo for security, play the daily question, listen to amazon music (sound quality good without speakers), have compatible light bulbs & other items. Would buy again.
Easy to setup and many u tube videos for help.  Weekly emails and Alexa screen suggestions  to enhance Alexa use.

author: Sully
title: works great for us
content: We use it as a baby monitor with an Amazon cloud cam in the nursery, works great for us.  Alexa doesn't always understand us or can't do what we ask but it is getting better with updates.

author: TJ C
title: Love Alexa - this one might need a hearing aid
content: We love the Echo product line - have the original, several dots and now the Show.  The only complaint we have about the show is that the microphones that she uses to listen seem to be less sensitive than the other models... we have to speak above a normal voice to have her hear us... this was not the case with the Echo we had in the exact same place as the new Show...  That said - its great to be able to read as she speaks and see music lyrics.... "no more excuse me while I kiss this guy" mistakes :)

author: Linette
title: Love  my Show
content: I use this Echo for everything. Right now it is playing my smooth jazz station from Pandora. The sound is wonderful. Also when I ask it to turn on my closet light, with smart bulb, I don’t have to stand directly in front of it to hear my voice. What more can I say? It is wonderful.

author: Polymorphorism
title: Disappointing. Not worth the money.
content: The promise of a display implied the display could be used interactively, but aside from displaying back the text that Alexa is reading, and playing Amazon Prime videos, there's practically no use for this device to have a screen. Maybe they can add functionality in the future. If not, it's an expensive Dot that takes up a lot of room (relatively speaking).

author: Roman Cecilia
title: Your Echo with a screen that is great.
content: Amazon, this is simply AMAZING!!!  I love my Echo device but this is so much great.  Beautiful to look at because of the screen.  The sound quality is great and it really a pleasure to use.  Than You so much for this product. I just opened this mourning and set it up.  (So easy)  Thank You again.

author: Tigger Lily
title: So Glad I Went with The Show
content: Absolutely love it. I'm a visual person and it's great for presenting the information. My favorite part though is the drop in. I can drop in from my phone when my kids are home without me and say "Hey! Turn of that tv and get started on that homework!"

author: flagolfer
title: Alexa doesn’t understand me on my new Echo Show
content: I like the display and the speaker produces very good sound. I am disappointed that Alexa doesn’t underztand my voice as well as she does on my Dot. Maybe because the Show is in a larger space. I am glad I had $100 off whem I bought it, otherwise I might not be as hzppy with it!. Maybe she will learn my voice & respond better.

author: rand
title: Lousy tech support
content:
I love Amazon. They do a great job of designing and selling a product
HOWEVER their tech support is an epic fail. If u simply need someone to read a script to help you connect to your wifi no problem but anything that is "out of the ordinary forget it.
I have had an issue with 3 echo devices for 3 plus weeks. I have spent countless hours on the phone always starting over. The one thing they do do well if apologize. After that it will bring tears to your eyes.

author: mountainbiking23
title: Screen flickers and sub par warranty service policy
content:
One star between lack of features, lack of quality and lack of service.

For such an expensive device, it is lacking features. Lacking sound quality. No YouTube support or anything (apparently it was taken away) groups and multi room listening doesn’t really work well, not as robust as you might like.

Then there is the quality.
Screen flickers occasionally, reboot seems to solve it for a bit then it happens again. Tech-support can solve it and suggested replacement.

 Here’s the kicker. With just these issues that have listed it would probably be at three maybe four star review, especially considering it’s a newer items. But when I went to get it replaced, they want me to send it in to get repaired. This is supposed to be a smart home device, Where I am controlling things in my home with it, and without it my home controls are no longer working. Since their device is not bein where I am controlling things my home with it, and without it my home controls are no longer working. Since their device is not designed well, I have to go without smart home control in the mean time because they sold a sub par product. This is supposed to be a $200 plus item, doesn’t seem to be worth that price.

They have an express replacement option where they send you one first but they want to charge you for it.

author: Jack Brown
title: Love it!  Great style and look.
content: I like it!  It works great.  At times it has a hard time understanding me.  Nice skills, connects to my thermostat and security cameras.  Love pulling up the cameras on this device.  If the price drops again, I will purchase another one.

author: gwen
title: I LOVE it! Says good morning
content: I LOVE it! Says good morning, gives me the latest weather & news! Tells me a joke, comforts me with the sounds & pictures of the beach or a fireplace! Even compliments me!  Plays any music I ask her for! Just love that it's instant !! She gives several recipe options when I ask how to cook something. Gives me reminders for appointments & special dates. I've only scratched the surface with things to do with her! She asks me a lot if I want to order Pizza ? lol  This would really be ideal for someone who is limited in mobility or an elderly person.

author: Shelly
title: Game changer
content: This is what you call a Game changer! Best gadget since the tablet era. I wanted something that could serve as my sound system in the kitchen and this thing surpasses my expectations. Sound is booming. Plays music AND movies on demand. I dont use the personal assistant or shopping features much. Really only use it for entertainment so far. Screen wakes up when i enter the room, which i thought was a slick feature. Oh, and the lyrics and song info show up on the screen when playing music! Updated: still love it. Found out i could add pics to the background. It also flashes my schedule, any packages im expecting, as well as breaking news on the screen. News highlights also show the alexa command to see any related youtube videos. More to come...

author: Bill B Shopper
title: Enjoying it.
content: So far so good.  Neat to have a visual version of alexa's responses. Nice to see the lyrics of music you are listening to.  Flash briefings have good videos.  Speaker is much better than a dot but not the highest quality

author: Patrick H
title: Difficult to troubleshoot!!
content:
I have one of each of the echo devices and this one by far is the least reliable.  It’s impossible to get it to go to set up mode and it’s hard to change the Wi-Fi that it’s connected to. The Wi-Fi  settings don’t show up in the Alexa app and I have sent email request for support and haven’t got a response.
 Very disappointed.

author: The Technological Consumer
title: My Elaborate Alarm Clock
content: Alright, I have had the Echo Show for about 3 months now and I love it.  And more for than just the basic Amazon voice commands functionality.  I mainly use the Show as a super elaborate alarm clock.  It wakes me up every day with a news and weather report for my area.  Another one of my favorite features is the video functionality linking for my smart home.  It links to both my Nest and Ring cameras.  Using simple voice commands I can get the video feed from any of my cameras within a few seconds.  Nice to check to see how much snow has accumulated on the vehicles in the winter.  Other voice features:  Drop in conferencing to my Echo dot.  Voice command music play lists.  White noise machine.  Verbal commands for my Wemo outlets.  I am very satisfied with the Show but wish it had the Youtube functionality.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Quality
content: The screen started flickering within one month.  After discussing with Amazon and troubleshooting for an hour sent back to amazon for repair.  They repaired and returned same unit and within another month the screen started flickering again.  Now warranty is up so no option for another repair.  Unit did not last 6 months and not worth the aggravation.  Update,....Amazon Customer Service was very good and will be sending a replacement.  Changed to 4 star

author: DM
title: Perfect for elderly - great way to check on family members
content: Bought this for my 87 year old mother, couldn’t be more pleased with it! I registered it to my amazon acct and placed it at her assisted living hooked up to their wi-fi. She doesn’t need a phone or amazon acct to use it. It’s so easy she was using it within minutes, and it was super easy to enable drop in for my sisters. They just downloaded the Alexa app on their phones and I enabled their access. Now they can “drop in” on her any time! My mom has already figured out how to make a call! She loves seeing us everyday, she could never figure out an iPhone of FaceTime or Skype but she can use this.

author: Randal K Brown
title: Not that easy to set up.
content: I bought the Alexa Show to replace my Google Home device that I had in my kitchen. I’m very pleased with the sound quality but it’s not as easy as they lead you to believe in getting your smart home all set up. The only thing that I have been some what successful with is the Ring system. I can get my Ring Stick Cams to work but not the Video Door Bell. I have also tried to connect MyQ Chamberlain garage door opener with no success and my Honeywell Total Connect thermostat and no success. I want to do the lights but I’m very hesitant because I do not want to spend a bunch of money with the chance of it not working.

author: CoffeeBean
title: Best product ever!
content: Thank you, Amazon! I use this to check in on Mom, who has Alzheimer’s. While we still use our phones, she struggles with FaceTime and hitting the right buttons. This product is effortless for her and gives a clear, sharp picture for both of us. I have the echo spot and absolutely love it. I am definitely recommending this to all my friends who also provide elder care. This absolutely perfect!

author: Shemeka G.
title: I feel like I wasted my money
content: If I knew the YouTube or watching also any video outside of Amazon would be resticted I would have save my money. The thought behind this purchase was to use it in my sewing room for videos. All the sewing blogs I know are on YouTube. I already have a Echo so this is a waste for me.

author: Ojayzie
title: Liked it so much, I gave some out as gifts!
content: I loved watching random youtube videos, but it seems GOOGLE has pulled that capability.  At least I can still enjoy "dropping in" on my folks for a video chat and making other video calls to friends who have downloaded the alexa apps on their smartphones. Also I enjoy WATCHING most of my news briefings instead of just hearing them. The show doesnt hear as well as my regular Alexa device sometimes, but as long as  it doesnt get as bad as talking to an automated telephone prompter, we're good.

author: rog
title: Best place to place your Amazon Echo device???? The trash
content: I would rate this product -5stars and product support -10 stars. The “worst” product I have ever owned. Makes me suspect of other products Amazon sells. The quality of this product is only matched by their substandard customer service department. They want me to send this in a second time within 4 months of purchase for diagnostic services before getting a replacement. The supervisor’s name is Christina....very rude.

author: Judy
title: This unit flickers
content:
We returned this once because it flickers and they sent it back and said it was fine after they did all diagnostic testing.
It still flickers. Very annoying. They did not replace the adapter which...who knows?...could that be the problem? They specifically asked us not to return the adapter.  We have moved it around the house to various locations and it still flickers...not always...but enough that it is annoying and needs to be unplugged for several hours and sometimes still flickers and other times it is ok for a while...then...flickers again!! Anyway. ...not happy and this was not a cheap item.

author: Charles
title: ... products primarily for the Arlo integration will be extremely disappointed, expect "the camera is not responding" or "waiting ...
content: anyone who bought the show or spot or fire products primarily for the Arlo integration will be extremely disappointed, expect "the camera is not responding" or "waiting for netgear" most of the time. this has been like this for a year now and all you hear from netgear is "engineering is aware of this issue" but nothing is ever fixed and amazon just flat ignores you. amazon touts this integration but it works like complete garbage so buyer beware. this is a known issue effecting hundreds of users. if you want Arlo camera integration that works, go with google home. I'm likely to switch myself. their integration apparently works much better.

author: JHDW
title: Every time you reboot your Wi-Fi you have to unplug it
content: What I dislike about the echo show is that if your Wi-Fi is turned off in comes back on you always have to unplug it and plug it back in to get Wi-Fi connection

author: Sharon J Golden
title: I am pleased with the Echo Show
content: I am pleased with the Echo Show, from the sound of the music and the words to the tunes to the news and weather. The color on the screen for my photos could be better.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not a great product by amazon, unfortunately
content:
The main reasons we bought the echo was for music, video chatting, and prime TV during breakfast time.

Music quality isnt that great, but gets the job done. Video calling is good when it works. Regualr phone calling is awful bc alexa does not respond to commands.

This goes for the TV and video watching too. She freezes, doesnt respond. One of the worst amazon purchases ever. Lets hope the gen 2 has all these kinks worked out.

Haven't called Corp yet in regards to these issues. To be continued....

author: Derick
title: Echo Show: A Kitchen Accessory
content: I love having this in my kitchen. It is a mutlipurpose tool that can actually replace things like timers, cook books, and evn my radio.  It helps keep me organized, reminds me of those special events and Alexa gives me helpful hints and recipes in a hurry. It took me a little to learn how to ask for help, but once you get the hang of it, it's GREAT!

author: David S.
title: Vastly improved sound quality over the Dot
content: Much, much better sound quality than the Dot, but the speaker still cracks during certain songs. Otherwise have been very pleased with the device. The only other shortcomings are related to Alexa, but I suspect those will be addressed over time as they continue to improve the service.

author: Alex
title: Disappointed with the "drop in" experience
content:
Bought it for the "drop in" functionality, so that my parents can virtually drop by to see their grandkids (from Canada!). Functionally the feature works as advertised, but the physical design of the device is NOT with little people (kids) in mind, since when it is placed on a flat surface the camera is directed upwards into the ceiling hence for 2-3 year old to be seen with the camera they have to get up on a chair, or the device has to be placed on the floor - neither is acceptable. Also, if you tilt the device for the camera to point down then the screen is in a suboptimal viewing position - also an awkward experience to speak to the person who is dialled in. One easy way to fix this is to design the device with an adjustable camera angle.

I was so looking forwards to a solution for my parents to drop in...  Hence I'm equally disappointed... Once Amazon fixes this I'll bring the rating back to 5 star, since otherwise the device is awesome. Also, once this is fixed I'll buy 4 more for my siblings, drandma and both sides of the parents.

author: Lisa at Home
title: The gift that will get used every day. Invest in yourself or someone else with this technology.
content: Gift that was very well received and gets used daily. My son loved this. He actually thought I bought everyone an Echo Show. An Echo for everyone else, but the show for him because he owns 2 businesses. Now he has orders programmed in freeing up more time for family. A huge hit!

author: Michael Vela
title: Very useful.
content: I was very hesitant to buy a product like this. I don’t like being spied upon and I've always viewed these things as nothing more than government listening devices. However, I got a good deal because Amazon has moved on to the 2nd generation of Echo Shows and this one is old news. I actually really like it. I use it a lot more than I thought I would and I really like the on screen score updates from my favorite teams. I would recommend his product,

author: Trunq22
title: Fun
content: The Echo Show really changes the how Alexa can help.  I have this on the counter top in my Kitchen which is great for looking things up, watching a movie while cooking, finding a recipe, a to-do list for the kids.  Seeing the Weather as well as hearing it.  When turning lights on/off, you can see the option to Dim if needed.  Its kind of a game changer.  I can even see my front door Ring camera (even though my door is pretty close and in plain site.  The fact that i can also chat with my kids at home when I'm away is pretty sweet.  I was able to buy this at Best Buy for only  $99.  Well Worth it.  I should have bought two!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Remove ALL protective shipping stickers!
content:
So I’ve had to update my earlier review. I had given a poor review and rating stating how disappointing the sound was. To help others avoid humble pie, there is a clear sticker applied over the speaker area that I had missed peeling off with the other protective stickers. Remove this! It destroys the sound quality.
Otherwise the device works well enough. The lyrics scrolling while playing music is fun, just don’t find myself using the screen as much as I thought I would. Usually just end up telling it to turn off each night.

author: Nor'easter
title: The Best purchase I have made this year!
content: I promise this Echo Show will change you life in a very positive way! Alexa (voice of Echo) is always ready to answer questions that you have, turn on your smart devices such as the Nest Thermostats (sold separately)and monitor the children’s room with a compatible camera (sold separately). One of the nicest features is how the outlook calendar can be synced so you can review your meetings by simply requesting it! The device itself is made to last and the speakers in this unit are very impressive with crisp clear sounds when you play your music. The Echo show does so much and the features keep being added! I love how simple it was to connect to the internet via your home router. The Show also has a monitor to view news highlights or to show your photo album. I have owned this for a little over four weeks and I’m still finding new cool features that the Echo show can do. It’s truly amazing!

author: swags
title: Echo Show
content: I am enjoying my Echo Show. I keep it on the kitchen counter. I was surprised at how much information it located of mine. My photos, my digital books, my music, everything related to Google and Amazon were all right there. It is nice to get updated weather reports, as well as many radio stations. I enjoy asking for and receiving various music selections.  This has relpaced the radio in the kitchen. When I walk by, it lights up and shows my pictures and calendar for the day. Cool.

author: luvbub
title: Very happy with my Echo Show
content: I love having a screen associated with my Alexa. I’m not even sure why, it just feels like it makes the device more complete. I have connected my Alexa to my front and back food Ring devices, so it’s been nice to see who’s at the back door just by asking Alexa. I’ve also used the Echo Show to see recipes, which is helpful rather than just hearing a recipe read out to me from my other Alexa, which didn’t have a screen. Overall, just very satisfied with my new Echo Show.

author: MTC
title: NO MORE VIDEO FROM YOUTUBE
content: I loved the Show so I just purchased two more and find out that Google has pulled YouTube from the Amazon Echo Show. This has just reduced the Show to nothing more than a dot with a screen where you can READ what Alexa says but she can no longer "SHOW" anything. No wonder they are offering $100 off. They know that the Show is not worth more than $49.99 if it can't "show" any videos. Sad. ***Update 9/28/2017: My 3 Shows are now worth less than 1 star.  Aside from not being able to watch news videos, recipe videos, or any YouTube video at all, now it seems that Phillips Hue lights are no longer working correctly with Alexa. What's next? I have 3 of these and if the issue is not resolved 2 will be returned (still within return period). The 3rd will just be taking up space. I AM LOOKING INTO GOOGLE HOME which I imagine can answer the thousands of questions that Alexa can't look up and will most likely be coming out with a screen device soon.

author: McGlohn
title: I loved it so much I got my mom one as ...
content: I loved it so much I got my mom one as well! I got her the original Alexa a few years back, but this one is so much nicer! We video chat all the time and she loves the recipe lookup. Not to mention watching your favorite shows right while you cook! Love it

author: Audrey Picciano
title: Great product. Love it
content: No problems .Love my echo show.  I think everyone one should have. My son and myself have one ,and when we call each other I can see everyone and talk to all . I  just told my daughter in San Antonio  she is going to buy Echo Show.  We all also have echo 2nd. Generation I  placed in all room love them all

author: Pat M
title: Extremely Useful
content: I have set up my 'show' in the kitchen and I use it every day. I set timers, check my calendar, look up recipes, turn various lights on and off, and play music quite often. There are lots of things to do with Alexa that I'm still learning. I enjoy having this version of Alexa.

author: Oliver
title: Drop in and watching videos is awesome!
content:
I love this thing! It's in the kitchen, and for the first time, I can watch Frasier while cooking without straining my ears because I can't hear my tablet. And I don't have to fumble around with bluetooth speaker, or touch the screen with my dirty hands.
My other favorite thing: Drop in! I have dropped in on my house from work a few times, and my daughter gets super excited every time she sees me.  She comes running up to the counter, climbs on her stepladder, and tells me about her day.

author: EC
title: integral part of the house
content: I bought this device for the first floor, thinking that it might be a useful tool for checking the weather, traffic, etc. It quickly became an integral part of the house. Just the other night, I played several rounds of 20 questions with Alexa, with Alexa guessing what I had in mind 80% of the time. Alexa Show is a much better product than the echo. I'm very satisfied with this purchase and know what I will be getting people this Christmas.

author: Vince Berry
title: I love the usefulness of the show.
content: I already had the Echo. The Echo show with the added screen is fantastic. I love the extra info and entertainment I can get this way. Very cool. I may now get the spot for the bedrooms. Great job Amazon!!!!  Keep it up.

author: T. Tech
title: After 7 months of use, the screen went bad and unit had to be sent back for warranty repair.
content:
Getting my repaired unit back in a couple of days.  New software supposedly loaded.  We'll see how it goes after I get it back.

Update 11/25/18:  Problem is back after receiving the unit back after "repair".  Amazon wants me to send the unit back again.  What a PITA.  I do no believe there is currently a fix for this.  Will never purchase an Echo product again.

author: Wattage
title: Great for use in the Kitchen
content: Very handy in the Kitchen. Can now ask Alexa for a recipe  and be able to reference it on the Echo show's screen as I go along. Perfect for the Kitchen.

author: TheGreatWhite
title: Personal Secretary for the Everyday Person
content: I received one of these as a Christmas gift in 2017 so I have had it for about 4 months now. It has revolutionized my mornings, alarms, reminders, schedule, and music. It is so easy for me to get my news while making breakfast and not having to have my TV on full volume to hear or constantly be looking up from what I am doing. I can have this sitting on the counter and take quick glimpse to see what is relevant from a selection of news sources that I pick. No more changing channels or constantly searching the internet for the stories i want from multiple news sources because I have already selected them on my Echo. I do not have to worry about setting alarms because I can just tell Alexa to do it and I know its loud enough because the volume is up all the way for alarms but not for everything. I can give her reminders and ask her the traffic situation so I am never late to events or to switch over my laundry. My life feels more organized because now I have my own personal secretary reminding me what I need to do and I no longer need to go through my phone and input it into a calendar which is a hassle. Also when it comes to music it is 24/7 ready to go. No more leaving my phone plugged in next to speaker where I cannot conveniently use it or dealing with connecting to Bluetooth speakers. This is an all in one package. As a bonus you can now call all your friends that have an Alexa and talk to them or video chat if you want which is way more convenient than paying for a landline.

author: Amazon Customer
title: And that is a good thing! We have slowly moved into the world ...
content:
Alexa has taken over the house.  And that is a good thing!  We have slowly moved into the world of a smart house. And it's been fun.
We tried the other system and it just did not work well for us.  The Alexa devices are simple to work with and the skills are easy to install.

author: PSai
title: No Youtube makes the device no worth
content:
I bought it since i had great use of it for songs/ recipies on Youtube as it consists of bollywood songs and indian cuisine.
Right now its just a dummy sitting at the corner, without youtube its use cases decreases 80 percent and only use ocassionally for 20 percent scenarios, like looking on arlo cameras, or playing pandora as there are very few bollywood songs there.
So not much excited

author: Matthew Feibusch
title: Cool idea, bought it as a modern Sony dash ...
content:
Cool idea, bought it as a modern Sony dash replacement.  Works great as a simple connected alarm clock and to control smart home devices.  However at this time it really doesn't make use of the touch screen. Most skills are still audio only with some text output.  Some skills have visual output... to the Alexa app, instead of the device screen.  Also the loss of YouTube really hurts the functionality, especially in the kitchen where you would want to use it to bring up video recipes etc.

Overall, great potential, but currently at the price a cheap tablet just does everything better. Something like a fire 10 gives you the Alexa functionality plus access to anything with apps.

author: Ian F
title: Echo show = Huge hit for the household
content: I replaced one of my standard echos with this.  It blows the others away.  Graphics, videos, the sound.  It is a huge hit in the house.  We keep it in the kitchen.  My wife calls up recipes on it.  They appear on the screen to use while cooking.  There are also tons of food network videos as well.  It shows the news and sports in video fashion.  Super easy set up.

author: Robert J. Carlson
title: Needed Help to setup-Cumbersome Contact Admin
content: After discussions with Development/Support, I managed to get correctly oriented to the point that I got the Show to Show video going, got the Show to Android Alexa connection going and got the Show to Iphone Alexa going.  Part of the problem was incorrect Household members setup on the Amazon Account.  Once that got corrected, the Show to telephone connection started working.  Still having problems with Contacts" in Alexa, have no idea where it pulls contacts from in either a device or application sense.  The Alexa Contacts don't seem to have any logic of which ones were chosen:  they cannot be deleted, edited, or new ones added.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not Quite There Yet
content: This product is great if you have a lot of compatible devices for your home or order a lot of repeat items from Amazon.  But unless your content getting scores or traffic updates from the internet, you may be a little disappointed with its capabilities.  I have to admit..  I DID NOT research this product before I bought it (unusual for me) and simply relied on the advertising.  That was a mistake.  I got a chance to borrow a Google Home unit to compare it to and after much frustration with Alexa - I returned both my Echo Shows for a Google home unit.  Until Alexa can actually search and process internet results - like the Google Product (and the soon to be released Apple) - its usefulness is limited and not for me.

author: Kevin R. Seeker
title: Not Perfect, But Pretty Good
content: Video function does not seem to perform as well as audio. It often brings up a “top pick” that does not make any sense...top pick according to who? Video also has tons of commercials because it is using Bing, not YouTube.

author: Janet Brown
title: so much better
content: so much better than just the echo. I can get updated on news or have music, a tv show or movie playing on it, while I'm working. its the perfect size for my desk and very sleek looking

author: onederin
title: An exercise in frustration!
content: I'm a huge Amazon fan and have several dots, an echo and two echo shows now. However, this device is not ready for primetime. It's not intuitive, and the software is slow and annoying. Case in point, many people will use this on their night table, don't bother, it's way too bright. Want to turn the screen off? You'll spend 10 minutes trying to find exactly the right words to do it! In fact around 50 percent of the time this thing can't figure out the most basic commands.

author: Chuck C.
title: Love these product
content: I love Alexa on Echo so it was a great sell that I could also see what was going on the screen.  An added bonus is I can tell it to show me what is going on at the front door and it will turn on the live view of my "Ring" doorbell.  Great product.

author: Ty Healy
title: Worked great at first, then the screen started acting up.
content:
At first worked like it was supposed to.  The software was limited.  I was hoping I would be able to pull up the weather radar, sports ticker, YouTube cooking videos, and other things a tablet/smartphone can do.

About 3 months later the screen started flickering and makes it almost unusable.  If I could get this replaced I would gladly go to 4 stars, software update 5 stars.

author: Joan R. Owen
title: Great Great
content: Am amazed at the things you can ask Alexa and she has the answer,am so proud of it.

author: MD
title: Amazon Promise - What's the latest Dave Limp?
content:
This product was 5 stars, but after losing YouTube 2 weeks in, it has to move to 3 stars.  The most frustrating part is not knowing if/when Amazon will fix the YouTube issue with Google after Dave Limp admitted Amazon customers are the ones being hurt here, and that Amazon is "committed to fixing it".

Amazon - Where are we at with working towards resolution?  As a loyal and long-time Amazon customer, it's no fun being caught in the cross-fire of a turf war.

“It was a surprise to us,” Limp said, following an event in which Amazon introduced a series of new devices, including new iterations of the Echo. “We don’t love it, on behalf of customers. We think a lot of customers were using YouTube on the Echo Show and liked it. What I’ve said to Google is: just tell us where we weren’t compliant with the API and we’ll send a team down to Mountain View tomorrow. I’ll send one tonight! And we’ll get the product back in line. They just haven’t told us what’s wrong with it. We’re committed to fixing it.”

Google named what needed to be addressed to resolve it. Time to play nice and get us back the full featured product we loved.

Thanks,
MD

author: Amazon Customer
title: Does not support youtube
content: It's really cool but it doesn't support youtube. Really Amazon? The sole intent on purchasing this was to watch recipe videos while I cook. Now I have to settle for less variety of recipes with your content video platform. Please get with the program.

author: Damion1701
title: No netflix
content: I love this device. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because it does not support Netflix. It will play Amazon prime video but it will not stream Netflix. If this changes in the future I will change my review to 5 stars.

author: Yvette
title: Android video chat
content: While cooking get to video chat with my husband while he's driving get home. Get caught up with latest new feeds from CNN. We have ADT security system which I'm hoping in the near future can live stream the cameras on the ECHO Show. Otherwise very happy with the product. Have the all recipes skill on it as have used it a few times. Overall very much enjoyed the Echo Show in the kitchen.

author: R. Hood
title: Entertaining, but still needs some work in practicalities
content:
I purchased two of these so I could have one on each end of the house (master bedroom and my office).  Primarily, I wanted to be able to use a video intercom between the rooms.  For this purpose, it works pretty well, although it is a bit slow to resolve the video feed into something recognizable.

The built-in audio is very good, and falls on the higher end of the scale between the Dot and the (original) Echo.  Not surprising or unexpected, since it wasn't designed to have "room-filling" audio like the (original) Echo.

The single-device aspects of its practicality are very good, with the ability to display a decent range of information.  However, having more than one of these devices limits its usefulness in practical terms, because you cannot separate information on a per-device basis.  For example, I configured my Office Show to display my business calendar, but the Master Bedroom Show also displays these calendar events, where it really isn't practical.  From what I can tell, you cannot configure devices independently (by setting up multiple profiles on the same account), so be aware of this if you want to purchase multiple devices and have multiple people use them.

author: Jeannee Stevens
title: NO YOU TUBE - Google doesn't support You Tube.
content: what good is my Amazon Echo Show if it doesn't show videos? I purchased it for that purpose - and now, Google doesn't support You Tube videos. I don't want this just for showing the words to the song. I wanted the videos - isn't THAT the purpose for the screen? I am not happy about this change and hope it is remedied soon.

author: Sarah N Austin
title: Cool...BUT bug problems must be fixed
content:
I would love to recommend this, IF amazon can fix the bugs.  Until then, I cannot recommend this to friends or family.

Pros:
-Great video display & sound
-Ability to talk to relatives far away
-Easy to use
-Simple set up
-Fun features, news, weather, lists, music
-Durable and easy to clean
-Sleek, attractive
Cons:
-YouTube is no longer available on the product.  This is a big reason I dropped this from 5 stars to 3, along with other technical bug issues.  I watched a lot of youtube videos to help me cook, to entertain and teach my child, to watch music videos, etc.  I didn't realize how much I used that feature until it was gone.
-Unexplained bugs.  Videos often cut off in the middle of playing.  Alexa features topics to ask her about, but when you ask about them, they only work half the time.  I have had several issues with the "facetime" application of it freezing the picture, but you can still hear the voice.
-She often doesn't understand requests after repeating clearly several times, even simple requests we make daily.
-Amazon customer service has been little help.  If I email, they request a phone conversation, which usually goes no where.  I have had two calls, both with a thick accent that made the call last twice as long as it should have due to the fact I had to have the rep repeat every sentence at least twice.  After an hour on the phone, nothing got resolved and I hung up completely frustrated that we both could barely understand each other.
-I purchased this with a relative to use the facetime feature and my relative has all of the above issues as well, so it's not just my show unfortunately.

author: Jason
title: It's basically a direct feed for Amazon advertising.
content:
I've had two Alexa Shows since the day they came out, and today I finally admitted that I hate them enough to unplug them and chalk this off as a learning experience about predatory corporate practices.

At its default setting, the Show is basically a direct channel for Amazon to advertise to you. And after you've turned off all the "content" settings, and even after you've turned on "Do Not Disturb," Amazon will still push "suggestions" to you constantly, 24/7.

These suggestions at first appear ridiculous, and aimed at first time users, but you can't ever turn them off. Why? Because interspersed among those pointless suggestions are advertisements (e.g, "Try asking Alexa to show you our latest Prime TV show!")

If this had been marketed honestly, it would have warned people that it comes with "Special Offers" that you can't turn off. That alone would have kept me away. But they didn't, which makes it even worse.

As an Amazon customer since the 90s, I no longer recognize the company it is today. I'm done with it.

author: Will arnold
title: Works best in a quiet room
content: It works when it hears you but sometime it appears distracted and is not listening to you, but if you shout loud enough the other devices in other rooms will respond to you. SOMEDAYS  it hear everything even tv COMMERCIALS that calls it name or any name that sound almost like Alexa. The info is good and I do like the ability to snap a picture and see what is happening at the door with the ring doorbell.

author: Andy Bryan
title: Karaoke Trainer
content: Love the large display and very clear video. Getting some great practice for my next karaoke attempt thanks to the lyrics displayed during songs. The speakers are very good but wish it had bluetooth so I could listen to audio while I wonder around the house doing chores,  luckily my Echo Dot handles that task.

author: WiK
title: Still needs improvements.
content: Will not play video from my plex server.  Will not play video from a lot of things.  Will not communicate two/way to ring doorbells.  Only allows you to view video which is the main reason I wanted it for.  It does have great sound for music.  Google solution I feel is still a better way to go.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Fun Chatting with Alexa
content: I've had an Alexa Dot for some time but I'm really enjoying the Alexa Show. It's great to have a visual whether it's a song or the weather. Played Jeapordy, but I'm not good at it. You do learn trivia and no one's watching! Love that recipes are visible and movies are available. Haven't had it long enough to try everything.

author: George R. Lee
title: Best technology ever!
content: I have no dislikes, it's gr8 to connect with family that live in different states and other parts of Maryland. I plan to make my home a smart home to connect all my devices to it!

author: David Navone
title: Very easy to set up
content: Arrived in one day. Very easy to set up.. (It basically sets up itself, just add your WiFi Network password). Excellent product. We use it all day long.

author: Bookmage
title: makes popping noise
content:
(We use Alexa around the house)

After a half of a year the show started making popping noises when listening to audiobooks every 10 seconds, and between segments in any audio.  This is probably the biggest issue.  But another huge flaw is that when listening to podcasts it will replay 5 seconds of a segment between sections of segments.
These two issues make it less than ideal.

Other negatives: besides a lot of  Alexa issues.  This device has a  very limited touch interface.  The touchscreen can be helpful, but it almost always needs to be a mix between the touchscreen and talking to Alexa to get something done.  It would be soooooo much better if a few basic amazon apps were able to be used on the device.  An example.  Let's say you are listening to anything, and you want to change your selection, it almost always makes you use a voice command.  Though if you use a voice command to show you options it than you can select through the touchscreen.  Very intermixed and not intuitive.

The other Huge negative is that there is a very limited option to show most of the time.  SO if you were thinking that you would be able to have just a clock and pictures rotating... expect limited options and awkward unhelpful recommended content constantly.

The pro's,  sound is clear and the device does show the lyrics and song that is playing.

author: angela
title: Love it!
content: I love that I do not have to stop and keep reopening my phone tonlook at recipes. It is just right there for you.  As my coffee is being made in the morning I hear the headlines and prep for day!

author: Woodlin D Warrior
title: The Show is great
content: Great box to play music and videos and receive calls on with FaceTime. I also love the feature called drop in where you turn the camera directly and speak and see people in your rooms / house. Great way to keep an eye on kids and animal while your away.

author: Nancy cav
title: Best invention! Everyone needs one!
content: Love love LOVE having the show!
