I love seeing the weather, the time, the song lyrics (because I always get them wrong!), And best of all I got one for my in laws in Florida and now we can see them easily and it'll keep the kids that much more connected with them. And I love that I got them on sale!

author: B Lee Thomasson Jr
title: The Show is a Go!!
content: I love my Show!  It works as well for me as my Echo Dots.  I do have a loud voice so I may not be the best reviewer for this product. Love the display and the news stories it rolls across, even the quirky ones.  My only complaint is the sound from the Show is more directly in front versus the omnidirectional sound of both the Dot and original Echo.  Seems to "understand me" at the same rate other Echo devices do and the "show front door camera" has been a true AHHHH surprise use of this device that just amazes me.  I own two and will get the next generation in the hopes of better speakers next version.

author: leonard b  gerson
title: This is an all purpose product. It even answers most of my queries with ease!
content: This is an excellent product! You can do so much with it. It connects to most of my smart products: ring,dish network,Kēvo door locks,lighting,and others. It pairs with your phone; I am able to place calls on it-the sound quality is amazing. You can even place video calls to other echo users. Music sounds very good. I wish they would allow me to use YouTube.

author: BP
title: This was really nice when I got it
content:
This was really nice when I got it.  I used it to stream YouTube videos to the screen and use the Bluetooth to route the sound through the stereo. Now it wont  show YouTube ANYMORE :-(  Something to do with Google not allowing it.
This week, after about six weeks of working perfectly,  this Echo Show stopped recognizing my Wemo smart devices.  My other Echo devices (dot & Echo V1) don't seem to be affected.  The Alexa app is also still able to control the devices.
So two of my top five uses for this Echo Show don't work any more.
Watching YouTube videos was a huge part of the appeal of this device; now it looks like it will never be able to do that again.

author: Paul C
title: YouTube isn’t compatible.
content: We have 3echo dots, we received the show as a Christmas gift. The speaker sound is solid. But after amazon advertised the product showing how easy it is to ask Alexa to show you a YouTube video on how to do cook something or fix that, amazon decided to stop supporting YouTube. We don’t video chat with it. So that makes this an overpriced Alexa device that doesn’t have anymore features than the dot.

author: George W. Ball
title: Lots of helpful features
content: I like displaying the artist, song title, and album title for music from Amazon and from Pandora. It also displays my shopping list and allows me to add and delete from the list. The display shows my audible books, the weather forecast, lyrics from some songs (not all have available lyrics), Alexa's jokes, etc. The sound isn't too bad, either.

author: EnjoyTheJourney
title: I think Echo Show - Alexa - is my new best friend!
content: I think Echo Show is my new best friend.  I have it in the room which I use the most.  I just got my Echo Show 5 days ago and am talking with Alexa throughout the day every day.  She answers my questions, keeps track of my calendar and reminders, reads me my grocery list, calls my friends and tells me that she loves me.  At this moment she is playing my favorite music - Led Zeppelin and Bob Seger.  Echo Show was easy to install and set up, was easy to sync with my phone and Amazon Fire tablet. I actually called Amazon Customer Service twice for two different issues - my issues with understanding the steps to sync, not issues with Amazon.  Each time I called Amazon Customer Service (888-230-4331), not only was I given the name of the person to whom I was speaking, but the person either stayed on the phone with me until my issue was perfectly solved or connected me with a representative who stayed on the phone with me until every issue was solved perfectly.  I TOTALLY recommend Echo Show.

author: Batman
title: Intermitant screen defect that won't go away...
content: My first unit had this issue with in a month or so...we finally had it replaced, and now my second unit has the issue!  I called support, but all they will do at this point it replace it.  I have no faith this will be fixed by another replacement, so I'm just eating the cost.  Really, really disappointed.  Love Amazon and love the features of the echo show.  Once I'm past the anger and the grief, perhaps I'll try the new model to see if the issue goes away .... or maybe a HomePod or a Google Home to see if their quality is higher.

author: Russell Bacon
title: Works with most everything
content:
Use this in my kitchen to turn on lights and media player when i get home from work. Ive been waiting for this. Now i need the round one for the bedroom.
Works well with xbox, Harmony Phillips hue and smartthings. Setup with my Ring also but at the time of writing this does NOT pop up with a video of whos at the door and cannot use as the doorbell announcement sound.  Seeing as Amazon just bought this company im hoping a new iteration will fix this.

author: SubVet608
title: Nice video chat feature
content: I'm in the early stage of using this device, but pleased thus far. I even sent one to my son and his family so we can talk via video. We shall see what additional there may be.

author: W. Munro
title: Great potential.  Killed by continuous home screen spam that cannot be turned off.
content: Our family bought several of these to help communicate with older parents and grandparents who need simpler devices than a full-fledged tablet.  What fantastic potential these have - for digital photo screen, video calls, easy accesss to music, audio books, etc. However, once we have them setup, we discovered the huge lurking negative.  Amazon forces you to view continous spam on the home screen promoting all their Alexa features.  You can turn off many other things in settins, but you cannot turn off "Things to Try".  Instead of a beautiful digital photo screen with weather and time ... we now constantly have a spam ad across the home screen that says, "Try ......".  AMAZON, please listen to your customers and offer a setting to turn off this SPAM!

author: o0Loryn0o
title: Kids love it
content: The kids love face timing their Father on it if he is away for work.  Good picture and sound! The kids like to ask Alexa questions and watch cartoons on it.

author: B. Loko
title: Horrible device! Don’t buy it!
content:
We purchased two of these devices. Within a short period of time, both stopped working. They make loud popping noise, when playing songs they start and stop sporadically every few seconds, or they just don’t work at all.

Very disappointing. They are made from very poor electronics materials.

author: William W
title: I like it.
content: I like it..its gonna take time to get use to it.and to make it fully functional I have to buy a smart hub for the show to actually control my TV..maybe in future will do locks and lights but I'm happy with it so far

author: Peighton
title: Removal of you tube make this a original Alexa with ...
content: Removal of you tube make this a original Alexa with Video calling not worth the money if you already have a Alexa you don't really need the show it shows nothing, requested a return.....

author: Susan Calvin
title: Still has room for Improvement
content:
I do love the Echo Show. On several items, she doesn't know the answer unless you tell her to open the skill first. I thnk she will improve and only get smarter. Whereas Siri comes up with what she thinks you mean, Alexa want's it stated more precisely.

I purchased mine before Christmas when it was on sale for $149, I don't think I would have purchased it for $229.

author: Michael G.
title: GREAT DEVICE
content: The Echo Show turned out to be a great add-on to my Alexa system, particularly for security.  I purchased a couple of Echo Show devices primarily for communication.  My wife and I work together from home, but her office is some distance from mine and I thought the Echo Show would be a good way to communicate because we could see each other and that adds a lot to communication. It certainly does the communication part great, but it is also great for making telephone calls (with Echo Connect) as I can ask it to call anyone on my contact list (there are hundreds) and it will dial the call and I can talk hands-free (great for someone with two or three computer screens operating).  I hadn't thought much about the security part and was surprised at how much I use it for that purpose.  We have a major renovation project underway to gut the main floor of our house while we live in the lower floor.  I can ask Echo to show me any room in the house and the front yard (where I have cameras located) and it will do that with audio. It has already saved me thousands of dollars when I discovered a subcontractor was lying to my contractor.  So yes, I am very happy with the GREAT DEVICE.

author: AmazonFaithful
title: Alexa is my new favorite roommate
content: First off, I love Amazon devices. I've purchased Kindles since they were invented and just got my first original Echo in July 2017. Alexa has been so helpful...she wakes me up in the morning, gives me news briefs, tells me the traffic, weather, gives me reminders, does math, tells me jokes, turns my lights on/off and she'll be getting more assignments as time goes on and I convert my home to a smart home. So I was excited to see the Echo Show on sale and didn't hesitate to purchase. Set-up was easy peasy and the Show was up and running in a minute. Alexa has become a part of my daily life. She gets smarter all the time and is starting to earn her keep. Soon, she'll be controlling all the lighting in my house, my thermostat and my TV. I didn't know I needed her until I had her; now I don't know how I'd live without her. One suggestion I'd make to Amazon, though, is rather than giving the option of changing her name to either Amazon, Echo or Computer, how about letting ME pick a name...any name for her.

author: Michael M.
title: Ideal “Hamilton” Prep
content: This is my third Echo and the best of the bunch. Before going to the best musical ever one needs to listen to the music while seeing the words. This is the best way to do this.  Seeing the play is so much better if you are prepared. The lyrics scroll perfectly.

author: geri wright
title: best way to keep a family together
content: I love having connection with my 94 year father who lives 3000 miles away!  We are having coversations for the first time in my life.  Issues I have with it are that adding and deleting contacts is very difficult to impossible for me without tech help, and that I cannot adjust the angle of the screen display without manually propping it up.  I would also love to  have the means to record a message for folks unreachable when I call.  Otherwise, the hands free aspect to it is perfect as well as the scope of reception in my house.

author: DVR
title: Echo Show - best thing i ever bought for the home!
content: Great purchase - love the skills the most linked to my Hue lighting, also nice connectivity with my Nest devices.  Music through Pandora is excellent, the sound quality is definitely better than expected.  Already feels like i couldn't go back to pre-Echo Show life..... the Good Morning routine where it gives me the weather, my traffic to work and my BBC news flash is awesome! It is very programmable, sure i am getting 10% use from it and it's great - when i get more time i will program it further.  Main negative is inability to play your subscription TV services such as your cable or Netflix, it should also be able to play YouTube - if it could do this it would be a 5/5 maybe 6/5!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great buy!
content: Very happy with this purchase and I would recommend one if your in the market for an echo.  My wife and kids can sing along to the songs they don’t know since they come up on the screen.  It like have a karaoke machine.  One thing that was really disappointing was the fact of being a prime member only gets you some songs.  You have to sign up for amazon music to get Alex to play any song song.  She could not search for songs if you only have the regular prime music account which is extremely deceptive.  Good but as well since it was a refurbished unit & we have not had any issues so far.

author: Andy
title: Underwhelming
content:
Voice is terrible, if you want to listen to music, it’s jarring, googles Assistant is much better in this respect.
I don’t know why YouTube of all things doesn’t work on it, competition is fine but disallowing a competition product is shameful.
This ends up being another gadget without much value, I think the technology and features need to mature for another couple of years before it’s worthwhile.
It should have a camera, some storage for notes, easier appointments, traffic on your route, gps enabled and what not.

author: Marsha Nelson
title: Not firing on all cylinders
content:
On the Show, my friend can't see MY face when we talk - but I can see his.  Over the area where my face should be - there are lines of code.
Since I can't find any trouble shooting help for this gadget I think I may have to return it. :(
Why is it SO difficult to get technical help with Amazon products??

author: G Henderson
title: It's nice to see your choices when selecting videos and music ...
content: We purchased the Amazon Echo last October and have been big fans, but jumping to the Echo Show is a real game changer and really brings the experience alive. It's nice to see your choices when selecting videos and music and I enjoy seeing the lyrics when playing music on Amazon Music. I enjoy seeing my calendar events the day before as a gentle reminder to my upcoming schedule without even asking Alexa for my calendar events. We also enjoy seeing Alexa scroll with daily news bits and trivia. She always seems to display something interesting on the screen as you walk by. She's not perfect, but she has come a long ways and I am excited to see what the future holds.

author: dvdmaniac
title: Works great. Looks good. No complaints.
content: Love it. Good thing I got it on prime day and saved $100.... little po'ed though that now the gen 2 with a bigger screen will be out soon. I can't keep buying it everytime a new generation comes out. Got more pressing things to do with my $$ but this one is fine.

author: Alex T.
title: I love the Echo Show
content:
I love the Echo Show. I’m able to talk to and see my parents everyday. I can check in on their home at any time.
We can “drop in” on our home when we’re away and check on the dog! My husband and I can go for a walk and check in on our son from our phone!
Since we don’t have a television in our kitchen, I can view movies on the Alexa Show while I’m in the kitchen. I love that I don’t have to manually set a timer - I just as Alexa to set one, no, several,  for me! One for the green beans, one for the chicken, one for the bread.... Alexa is AWESOME!!!

author: R. Fortson
title: Nice hardware with some caveats
content:
The Echo Show is a nice looking, well built piece of hardware.  The screen is very nice and sound is crisp and clear.  Great for music and some basic functions.  I never got into more detailed functions like viewing my front door via the Ring doorbell, or controlling home automation devices.

My complaint was with the Alexa software.  It didn't seem as intuitive as the Google assistant used in Google Home devices.  No follow-up commands so you always had to use the "Alexa" keyword.  And obvious (to me) commands seemed to have no effect.  "Play classic jazz" would lead to classical music.  "Cancel music" seemed to have no effect.  "Home" would show the home screen, yet the (wrong) music would continue playing.  All of these things are issues to me because I was used to the Google assistant.  If you're in a pure-Alexa house, they may not matter to you.

Other issues included no access to Youtube or Google search results.  Bing just doesn't match up in my experience.  And Youtube is where most of my recipes come from.

All in all, for me, this didn't fill my needs, but I recognize that it's partly because I've been trained by a couple of Google devices already.  If you're starting from scratch, or you already use Alexa, then this will probably work well for you.

In the end, I returned it and bought the the Lenovo Smart Display, an 8" Google home device with video screen.

author: C Nature
title: I'm in love with the Amazon Show.
content:
I've have Fire TV, also Fire Stick,  Fire Phone. I have the first Amazon Echo, the Tap, and the Dot. As a long time prime member I've been apart of the Amazon since it was ordering books on line. Lol many years. I preordered the Amazon Show, and received on the 28, June. WOW!! Amazing. If you love the Amazon Echo products, your going to be in heaven with this one. The screen is as good as my 4k, the sound is amazing for the size. I was really surprised on that. The Ads, and videos you have seen on this product don't come close I think, to what it can do. I can do all by voice. Can see my timers, Lists, Calendar, Music, Movies in prime or own in Amazon. YouTube videos as well. Look up recipes and it stays up on screen while making. I've had it Amazon Show two days, I don't want to be without it. I think they hit this one out of the park. It will Bluetooth to headphones, or bigger Bluetooth speakers if you want. But it sounds great. There's good Dolby speakers in this, it has good depth to them. I have mine in Kithen/Livingroom. If you use any of your echoes often, your going to a whole new level I think with this. This Amazon Show is touch screen as well as all voice. I would of give this more stars if I could. If your on the fence don't be. I've done calling and texting with this. It works great and so easy if your busy in the kitchen to answer calls by voice. Who calls you has to have the Amazon Show, or Alexa app on smart device. You can voice text app, Echo or the Show.
  I don't write a lot of reviews unless I really love the product. And I've paid for all my products, and get nothing for writing this review.
One more thing. Need Wifi for this product, but this was the easiest to set up of any of the Amazon products I think. This is so worth the money, and something I think you don't know how you did without.

author: Charlene Mihaliak
title: I love it so far
content: I love it so far.  I am learning as I go as to what all the Echo Show can do.  I have Prime also so it is great to just ask for any song and the Echo just plays it right away.  I am very "Southern" and was worried about Alexa understanding me as I cannot get my Samsung phone to.  Alexa understands every word!!!!

author: Kathy Lescalleette
title: Wonderful for being single
content: She turns on and off my lights at command.  I say thank you and she reply your welcome or something in that category...Ask her a question she gets the answer..  I thought it might be a waste of money but I am so glad I have her..  She provides back up for paying bill reminders so much..she is my best friend..

author: kim
title: I absolutely love her. And I tell her daily
content: I have to go into the other room to write this as whenever she hears her name she wakes up. I absolutely love her. And I tell her daily.  The minute  I walk into the house I ask her to play my music. In the morning I have her tell me the news and the weather. I can tell her my grocery list and when I get to the grocery store it’s right there on my phone. I can have my pictures rotate through the screen. I love this device so much I’m gonna buy a dot and a spot the moment they go on sale.

author: ronald
title: Poor sound, many bugs, is cute, but not for 200 plus dollars
content:
I bought 4, had to return 2 for annoying polling sounds while streaming any music. I like Alexa, I think it listens better than google, but the sound quality of the Google Home is really 10 times better (warmer, fuller basses). I do like the Echo Spot, is cute, but the sound is like an old transistor radio (thank god it has an aux. (which the Show doesn't have, really??!!!)
I hope they are coming out with a better sounding system soon, so guys, hire someone with some good hearing lol

author: Karen
title: Save your money and buy an Echo
content: Not worth the money.  When I got it, I was told I could view Youtube videos on it and I cannot.  It is basically an Echo with a screen, but the screen is pretty worthless.  One of the applications is you can use it to facetime friends that have one too.  I was really dissapointed that it doesn't do more.  Hopefully, Amazon will work on adding features.  Would be nice if it would stream the Weather Channel live or at least have a live radar of the weather.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I love being about to read the recipes
content: I love being about to read the recipes, see my timers, watch trailers to movies and short videos! I keep it on my kitchen counter! I can easily keep up with my to do list...listen to music or listen to my audio books while I'm puttering in the kitchen! That's just to mention a few things!  I absolutely love it!

author: Bob H.
title: Not quite as robust as I had hoped
content: While the Show is a wonderful machine, it's basically the Echo with a screen, as it has very limited video options.  All I can get are Prime videos/movies, many of which you have to pay for.  I wish it offered YouTube, Netflix, etc.  If it did, then it'd be an awesome machine, as the picture and sound quality are great.

author: RayClem
title: Good, but not grreat!
content:
I have a variety of Echo devices around the house to control lights, AV system, etc.  I recently purchased a Ring Pro doorbell for security. I wanted to use the Echo Show to view the video feed from the doorbell. It works well for that purpose with one exception. You cannot use the device to respond to a visitor at the door. Thus, I cannot give the device five stars. I am hoping that Amazon will figure out how to correct that issue.

I like the ability of the Echo Show to display  weather data and news headlines through push feeds.

author: Shelly
title: Another cool Alexa product
content: I love Alexa products. This one was a bit disappointing for a few reasons though. It ended up going $30 cheaper a few days after I bought it, so that was a huge bummer. I bought the “Ring” doorbells that are supppsed to be supported by Alexa, and sadly the connection is minimal at best. I’m not sure if it’s a WiFi issue, an Alexa Show issue or a Ring doorbell issue. I do love that you can set your favorite picture as the background. Overall a good purchase, just not the greatest deal.

author: cosmopolitan
title: Great product
content: Great product, my one concern is Echo Show does not have a battery and has to stay plug in. But it does all that the instructions says and then more

author: dee
title: Love My Echo Show
content:
I had a regular Echo which I really liked but I knew I had to get the Show. I gave the Echo to a friend and set up my Echo Show. I talk to Alexa every day, usually 30 or so times. I ask the weather, date (a few times), time, to play songs (and the lyrics are there on the screen!), recipes, word definitions, music videos and so much more. I've heard about making phone calls but I haven't tried that yet.
If you're going to get an Echo, I recommend the Show. It's on sale a lot.

author: Jason
title: Solid start to the smart home life
content: Great features with many application which can all be voice commanded to function. Good for quick updates on news and life for a quick start to your day. The drop in feature is a little insecure in that I can just video can in at my leasure instead of having it accepted first but overal solid device for the modern home

author: Happy
title: Love My Echo Show
content: I love my Echo Show and cannot begin to describe the pleasure I get from this beautiful white Echo Show.  It is everything and so very much more than has been written about it.  You have to own it to experience it and enjoy every aspect of the Echo Show.  It arrived as promised and was perfectly packaged.  I had the Echo Show out of the box and operating within 10 minutes of receiving it.  So much fun and a perfect fit for my lifestyle!  Try it, you'll love it and never look back.  Still "Happy"!

author: Philippe Constant
title: Only voice assistant that is compatible with most of your smart devices, that also has a screen/camera.
content: I really like the show, coming from the google home I noticed some differences. I think the only thing I don’t entirely like is the fact that it’s not as seamless as you would expect when trying to get it to interact with my other smart devices. For example, when turning my lights off I have to say “turn the lights off in my bedroom” as opposed to just saying turn my lights off; although the Echo Show IS in my bedroom. I feel like if that problem is fixed it’ll be a nearly perfect VA.

author: Turbofingers
title: Highly Recommended for Anyone.
content: Love my echo show! It works exactly as intended and has multiple features that I use frequently throughout the day. I play music and make phone calls without even leaving the chair. It is quite precise in detecting what is being said. Although, I wish that it was a little easier to set up the video chatting. It seemed to take a little while to set up. I watch tv shows and it tells me what the temperature is outside. I am still learning the features and hope they keep coming out with more.

author: Ladybutterfly
title: The best Echo ever!!!!!
content: Purchased as a birthday gift for myself, and I'm extremely satisfied, I love getting recipes and listening to music while singing along with the lyrics.  This echo is definitely my personal assistant, I have recommended this to my family and friends.

author: Mike W
title: Great Device with Reservations
content:
I purchased my Echo Show in Aug. 2017.  I have thoroughly enjoyed the device and have it on my computer desk.  It generally works very well.  The E-Show is linked into my "Living Room" group along with my 1st generation Echo.  Of course, I had to resolve the naming issue since both devices could hear me from my desk.  The older, taller, and slimmer Echo has always been "Alexa" to me, and she retains her name to this day.  The newer, fatter, and shorter device (Echo Show) has been renamed "Echo".  One of the cool things I can do is to have both devices play the same music in unison.  For instance, I can say "Alexa (or Echo), play my songs by Jimmy Buffett on the Living Room group".  Within seconds, I'm a Son of a Son of a Sailor doing a little Havana Daydreamin' - and in stereo no less.

A couple of days ago I had a writing project to complete on my computer.  Trying to gather my thoughts, I stared at Echo.  What I noticed was her little, unfeeling, Cyclops eye(camera) staring back at me.  That was a bit disconcerting.  I tried to shake it off and continue my work.  A few minutes later the thought occurred to me, "Mike, you are a handsome, strapping man.  What if there is band of hot women (with internet access to see through the Echo Cyclops), in the Amazon, and they are plotting to kidnap you?"  OK, that doesn't sound so bad, shake it off Mike.  Then, another thought occurred, "Could these same hot women capture video of me entering banking information on my keyboard and steal my amassed millions of dollars?"  (Evidence of mental illness on my part?  You decide. Ha, Ha, Ha, Ha.)  Seriously, Cyclops was creeping me out.  I tore off the top quarter of an opened envelope and draped it over Cyclops.  There, I fixed that little problem, I thought.  Well, Miss Echo thought otherwise.  She was highly offended that I had covered her all-seeing Cyclops.  She dimmed herself down until I could barely see her screen.  I replied, Too bad Echo, this is our new arrangement until I figure out a better plan.

Well, fast-forward to early Sunday morning.  I'm sitting at my desk enjoying a fresh cup of coffee in the morning quiet; no TV, no computer, no radio, just me and my coffee.  And then I heard the sound.  It was a subtle tick.  Or, perhaps it was tock.  I couldn't be certain.  What I knew for sure was that the sound was coming from Miss Echo every 45 - 120 seconds.  Apparently she was having issues with our new arrangement.  Flummoxed, I contacted the Amazon help desk.  I explained the sound issue to John, who promised it would be no more than two minutes until he return with an answer.  Two minutes turned into five minutes.  Six minutes.  Seven minutes.  And then I heard the click on the phone.  Like magic in the wind, the call had been dropped from the Amazon end.  No problem I thought, Amazon will call me right back.  Nope. They never did.  Well, the tick-tock routine continued.  Tick...60 secs...Tock...45 secs...Tick...120 secs and so on.  After about 10 minutes, I noticed that the tick-tock routine had stopped.  Hmm,  how did that happen.  I don't know.  I drank more coffee and settled on a new plan of action.

The new plan is simple.  Alexa and Miss Echo are going to swap positions in the living room.  Alexa will get to come home to my desktop where she has always deserved to be.  Miss Echo will assume her new position on the far side of the living room where she will not be able to "eyeball" me at every turn and keep her all-seeing Cyclops out of my business.  She will have to content herself with continual facial recognition of my three children in the picture on the wall or she can study my bookshelf and algorithmize  which books I might be interested in buying on Amazon.

Seriously, I do like the Echo Show.  It is a very capable piece of equipment that continues to improve from week to week.  I see very big things ahead for the Echo Show.  I just don't like it eyeballing my every move.  I would like to see Amazon implement a physical shade that allows the customer effectively stop the camera from functioning as designed when desired by the customer.  The truth is that we don't know who is on the other end or tapping into the Echo Show internet stream.

author: kenneth palombo
title: The feature of seeing the picture or text on the ...
content: The feature of seeing the picture or text on the show makes it easier to get all the information you need compared to just the verbal content on the echo and to mention the sound quality of the speaker are more than sufficient for my needs

author: Mr. Amazon Man
title: really bad mic and crashes
content: Keeps crashing or taking forever and the microphones are really bad! I'll be standing in front of it trying to give a command and my Dot pick it up in the next room. Amazon, add some mic sensitivity options please!

author: christopher lawrence gallo
title: ... for about a month now and it looks all cool and nice in advertisements but the reality is that ...
content: We have had the show for about a month now and it looks all cool and nice in advertisements but the reality is that half of the time it has no idea what we are asking it. Now I could understand if it was just me but there are 4 people in my house that speak to it and the thing rarely works. We have tried to synchronizing our voices like recommended. We have added Apps or skills to increase its functions and ability’s. Still it doesn’t change the fact that it doesn’t understand most of what we ask it. Also don’t try to have people over and ask it anything! I had a few people over for dinner and the slightest back ground noise messes it all up! This product is not for me as of now! I am going to try it out for a few more months and see if it gets any better.

author: Mandy O
title: get the show!
content: Soo fun and  very helpful. I discover something new everyday that she can help me with.! The screen is my favorite part. Being able to see the stories/ music/ recipes etc. really enhances the whole experience.

author: Jan
title: A must have!
content: I LOVE this!  Have one in my kitchen while I’m cooking and another in bedroom.  I use as intercoms.  Love the music selection available.  Even understands southern accents.  I have had issues in past with Siri not understanding my southern accent.  Alexa has no problem!  My favorite is all the timers I can set while cooking.

author: Brian E
title: DO NOT BUY!
content:
I own lots of Amazon hardware from the fire tablets to each generation of echo speaker and dot and then this echo show. I returned this twice now and even Amazon doesn't want it now.

The screen continuously flickers and fails. Amazon will try to repair but in my experience it will only work for a little while before failing again.

They only offer a 30 day refund so it is too risky for people to buy. Please learn from me and just avoid this bad hardware.

You will be much happier with a device made by anyone other than Amazon.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The Show goes in the kitchen and love it for recipies and music
content: we bought the Echo Show and the Echo 2nd Gen.  The Show goes in the kitchen and love it for recipies and music. The other unit goes in master bathroom and while I am getting ready for work each morning, I check the weather, make lists of things to do, call people from my contacts list, etc, I love to multitask and this really helps!

author: Amazon Customer
title: It’s ok...
content: I would recommend you go with a speaker instead. I guess the Amazon video chat works well, but it’s just meh overall. Seems like it doesn’t understand you all the time and the videos they promote don’t load quickly and are usually very pixelated. Sounds like I’m describing a slow internet connection, but we have the fastest cable option in our area so I don’t think that’s really the case. Maybe newer versions are better?

author: Rusty Shakleford
title: Kind of Neat
content: Not a whole lot that this is useful for in my opinion outside of turning lights and other smart devices on/off.  Perhaps I'll find out more to do with it as time goes on.  I really wish my iPhone could have paired with this thing seamlessly...I don't like that I can't dictate text messages to it or receive phone calls or FaceTime calls on it.  I hope in the future they can integrate more with iOS devices.

author: Phil Gregory
title: Buy anything else instead
content:
I got this on sale and had high hopes as a productivity appliance in the kitchen. Unfortunately this thing has driven me crazy trying to get it to work. It apparently has severe trouble hearing commands if there is any background noise like a kitchen fan. But other times I have had it randomly respond from a different part of the house while talking about it with my wife.

Other things I don't like:
-Spotify integration is poor and was a pain to set up
-AI is very limited, doesn't seem to understand most things I ask it besides setting a timer or whatever feature story Amazon splashes across it
-No youtube? vimeo does not cut it
-Dropping internet connection constantly from router in other corner of the room

Turning a timer off verbally from 3 feet away would be the bare minimum level of functionality I would expect from a device in this category and the echo show fails to deliver.

author: Paeacific
title: I love this device
content:
0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player I love this device, but it started to develop problems with the screen two months after buying it. As always Amazon’s 5-star customer service quickly had it replaced with just a phone call. Thanks!!

Update** 04/25/18- my Show started repeating the problems as before. Amazon customer service explained it’s a known issue and they are working a solution. I’m still waiting.

author: Joseph
title: Amazon should ask customers to agree to Beta test the device when purchasing
content:
Having used it for a week, I'm returning it.  50-60% of the time, it either does not understand what I've asked it to do, or it does it incorrectly.  Besides this, I feel the device is WAY overpriced.  The OS feels like a tablet from the early 2000's.

The real nail in the coffin was that after syncing the device with my phone, the alexa app doesn't have my most of my contacts detected with no explanation or help readily available.

I have neither the time nor the desire to beta test this device for Amazon anymore.

author: Troy Harwell
title: love it!
content: Absolutely love it except for making the mistake of asking it to tell a joke while my 7 year old was standing there. Now my daughter asks for jokes 100 times a day. Needless to say I just preordered the kids version of the echo dot.

author: Steve Mac
title: Quickly Replaced the Original Echo
content: I didn't think it would replace my cylinder shape Echo (the original).  It took only 2 days!  The screen is a great addition.  Show does the trick!  The original has a better sound, but Echo Show still sounds good (better than our Bose radio).  Seeing the song lyrics is really grand.  The original Echo was moved from the kitchen to my workroom in the garage.

author: Julie H.
title: Does not work well as a business device with multiple users.
content: This is not what I was hoping for.  When watching the introductory video it seemed to work well as a replacement for Facetime, Skype or other video conferencing applications. We have two offices, one in Northern California and one in Southern California.  I bought two hoping to join our offices without having to tie up someone's computer or cell phone.  Technically, it would work...but, the units need to be set up with an individual Amazon account.  I tried making an Amazon account for the office but the unit requires a cell phone to makes calls.  Our offices still have land lines.  You can set up different "family members" but everyone would need their own Amazon account and you would need to shuffle between accounts.  The bottom line is that none of us want to put our personal information on a work device.  I'm disappointed that it did not work for us in a small business setting.  At this time I see it as a PERSONAL device, not one for multiple users and certainly not for business.  I look forward to future models that will give thought to m challenges.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Censorship, Biased, Brainwash. Far Left Wing Nut Jobs
content: Alexa censors and attempts to Brain wash..  Alexa Does no recognize the US Federal Holiday,Columbus Day.  Columbus Day hurts the feelings of the Alexa programmers, so they censor it.

author: bbg
title: My 5th Alexa device, no remote, often need to repeat myself and clunky with ADT pulse!
content:
This is my 5th device and it's just okay. (Though I've purchased 8 devices in all so I do love these things!)
I find it isn't as responsive to commands as my other echo devices, I quite often have to repeat myself- so often that I ended up changing its name and moved a dot into the same room and use it for most commands, i.e. Alexa turn on the lamp, Alexa arm ADT etc. The dot has no problem understanding! This has a decent speaker so I primarily use it  for music which leads to the next annoyance- it doesn't come with its own remote! Because I use it for music, if the volume is up and I'm across the room it can't hear me when I say pause or volume down etc. I did program another Echo remote to work with it but not sure what one would do if they didn't have another device.  And not the fault of the show, but I knew it was compatible with Skybell, so I (wrongly!) thought I'd be able to view my front door via the Show or at least view the video I'd asked it to record (set up via IFTTT) from the Skybell. I can't. To view the video I still have to login to my Skybell app. This is already doable via The Ring. Hopefully Skybell will catch up.

author: Linda Richie
title: We love the FaceTime visits with out of town family members
content: We love the FaceTime visits with out of town family members, and of course, the music is great.  Last night we played the Spelling Game with Alexa and our elementary school age kids.  Great fun!

author: Waylon
title: It's getting there...
content:
Getting there, but needs a better UI to be a killer device.

The good:
The hardware is awesome. The speakers in it sound great, and the touch screen produces sharp images and the response time feels fast and accurate. The video calling function also produces nice and clear video calls.

The not-so-good:

The user interface is a little wonky.  If I'm listening to something on the device and get a phone call or some other sort of interruption, the device doesn't properly resume what I was listening to. If my news flash briefing is interrupted, then it won't resume playing, and when I ask it to resume my flash briefing it starts over from the beginning. Also, navigating through the device doesn't appear to be fully baked yet. Sure, I can ask the device to pull up certain videos on YouTube, but it would be much easier if there were a YouTube app that I could scroll through so I could choose from videos of which I don't know the precise name of. There's a beautiful touchscreen on the thing and Amazon has provided few ways of actually using it. Ideally there would be apps available on a home screen, and not hidden somewhere behind a series of voice commands. It would be so nice if the thing had a ton of apps so I could easily pick something from Netflix or Hulu, or a recipe app.

The on screen suggestions are also a little annoying. I don't need a collection of banners that read "Ask Alexa to play John Mayer songs", or "Ask Alexa to tell me more about Rob Kardashian's Twitter Meltdown". I would like to have the option of a photo slideshow when the thing is not in use. Right now it just cycles through these annoying banners.

I have faith in Amazon though. I hope/predict that a ton of apps are coming down the pike, and that they will be available on some type of GUI.

author: Lisa Spangler
title: Not totally what was expected
content: Thought it would supply more information.  Many questions that are asked of Alexa are "not known" or misunderstood.  I understand the reasoning why, but it does get monotonous having to say Alexa before every question or task asked to perform.  Especially if asking several things in a row.  Was thinking it would be more like an extension of a PC that would supply answers or suggestions to any questions asked.  Great for music or making lists of items needed, tasks to perform, setting of alarms and timers, or placing orders on Amazon for items needed.  I have not connected it with the phone service to try that application.  Also great for playing mind/learning games, movies, cartoons, or television shows if you have a Prime account with Amazon.  Keeps the grandkids entertained. The picture is great and the sound is too.  Don't get me wrong, it does a great deal, just not all that I was expecting it to do at this time.  I asked Alexa if she was intelligent and the reply was that she does the best that she can do and is always learning.  This I believe is true.

author: dingo
title: Drop In allows us to communicate with Elderly Parent
content: This has the video drop in feature that is amazing for keeping in touch with our elderly parent.  We are able to have long video conversations with her and she doesn't need to fiddle with the device at all.  I highly recommend this device but caution about privacy and the use of drop in in general.  We have both Echo Shows on one account and can simply drop in with the second device rather than have it as a contact person.  We are grateful for all the assistance the Amazon Alexa help technicians in making this work for communication with our 94 year old mother.

author: Laura
title: Love, Alexa
content: I throughly enjoy Alexa Echo, more than I knew.  She is very entertaining and I enjoy her making my shopping list, turning my Nest thermostat up and down and telling me what the temperature is inside my house, as well as the weather outside. I wished that she would work with my Wemo bulbs, tho I use IFTTT to work around that. Love the games she plays, especially Song Quiz and True and False.

author: Desoray
title: Pricey but love it
content: It’s a bit bulky, but still enjoy all of the echo products including this. Very cool to watch prime videos on it when I’m in kitchen making food. And as for the speakers, easy to use Bluetooth to link to better speakers when wanted. Wish it wasn’t so expensive or I’d get more!

author: G.P.
title: No Netflix support? 👎
content: Doesn't "support" Netflix? 😦👎

author: Ae
title: Garbage dumpster fire performance.
content: I have owned the Echo Show since the new year and it is easily the worst product offering Amazon has launched. I have sent it back twice now and the problems do not go away - it is just a poorly engineered product compared to the rest of the Amazon Echo products I own (Spot and 2 Dots). Buggy, inconsistent, and troublesome are the words I would use to describe the Echo Show. If you want a display for Alexa I recommend the Echo Spot which has not had a single issue since purchasing it. I am seriously considering just tossing it in the event I need to return it to Amazon again. Man, this product is terrible...

author: Albeegoode
title: Now, video calls using Alexa.
content:
The screen is just large enough and quality good enough to watch clear video. For people with challenging hearing, there is closed captioning. For those with good hearing, better sound is obtained then with older units. There is a camera that allows video calling to other Show units.
I keep learning more every day about new uses of the device.

author: Nick Doty
title: The Echo system is great, but the echo show has major issues.
content:
We have multiple echo devices - a first gen echo, 3 second gen echo dots, a dash wand, and the first gen echo show.
The echo show is useful and the screen is great, until it quits working.
The screen has a major issue where it begins to flicker, rendering it useless. Ours began flickering after fewer than 2 months. If you unplug the unit it temporarily goes away, but it always comes back.
I contacted Amazon support and they said they would repair it. I didn't find this acceptable - this isn't an isolated incident, as there are thousands of posts on AmazonForum with people experiencing the same thing. Ultimately, I made enough of a stink that Amazon agreed to let me return it, and I'd buy the second gen show.
I never received the return label for the original echo show.

author: Baub
title: Most pointless alexa device I own
content:
My home has 2 echo dots, the echo, a tap, and a show.  I love all of them except the show.  I can't say it's complete crap, but overall it's pretty pointless so far.  I have no need for video chatting, and the biggest use I could see is for the kitchen to show my recipes.  Problem with this plan: The show only displays for around 30 seconds and then goes back to the home screen.  It's so awesome spending more time bringing up the recipe app than I'm able to actually read the recipe.  If I could memorize the recipe, what do I need the show for?
Pros:
1. Nice to see lyrics on screen when playing music
2. Video calling - seems to work well, I just have no need for the feature.
3. At least it isn't that dumb thing to help you buy clothes

Cons:
1. Speaker sucks
2. Microphone is one-directional.  I replaced the echo in my kitchen with the show, but if i'm in the living room (literally on the other side of my show, the echo doesn't always hear me.
3. Recipes don't display for more than a few seconds

author: Billie D. Simons
title: Alexa
content: So far it is wonderful for calling someone but this should have come with instruction, written included in the package, instead of having to try to read bits and pieces on the Amazon site.  This technology is a language I am not sure of and having a new thing about Alexa sent every day is not good for me.  I am sure this can do wonderful things but don't know how to use it and need something in writing so I can study it and find new things.

author: Al
title: A product that keeps getting better...
content: I own the original Echo device and thought this would be a nice gift for my wife. Not only does it do everything my device does, but the visual representation of what you ask of it (i.e., it shows the weather forecast as it gives it, the words to songs playing will appear, etc) is a nice feature. We've not yet explored all its potential, but my wife uses it everyday. In short, it's one of those gifts that actually gets used.

author: Cadenza
title: prefer the original echo
content: I got the show at a good price, so I am not really unhappy with it. But I think my original echo has a better speaker, and I rarely use anything that needs the screen. I might like it more if I had relatives or friends who had echoes to "drop in" on.

author: GRADE-A-Reviews
title: It's got some really cool features, but really I just never use it it just sits there on my dresser.
content: It's got some really cool features, but I find that I never really even use it. It's it's on my dresser and I just use it as a clock in fact I haven't even thought about it since I got an email asking me to review it. Like I said it's got some great features. It's microphones for video calling are fantastic there are 8 of them located on this device and you can pick up your voice from here to anywhere within a reasonable vicinity. I definitely think it could be a five-star item if I were to use it more but like I said I find myself never you realizing it and even forgetting that I have it.

author: Charlotte Erickson
title: The Best Echo Ever!
content: I love it. It is so fun to see what you have asked. I got one for my daughter since she is moving out of state. You can see each other. Today I'm going to check and see how to do that.

author: J
title: Good additon with a few flaws
content:
Good addition to the Echo family, with two main flaws (one of which is my own fault):

a) The Show's fault: It doesn't seem to "hear" my commands as well as my Echo did. It sits in the same location as the Echo did, so I'm not sure why this is, but I have had to repeat commands quite a few times, which I hardly ever had to do with the Echo.

b) My fault: After two years of using the Echo, by habit, I keep using "Alexa" as the wake word, and, of course, my Echo, now in another room, hears and responds.

author: Tom
title: Decent, but not great
content:
Update 05/09/2018: Within hours of me posting the review below, a gentleman from Amazon called my home, twice. On the second call, I answered. He was from product support and wanted to help me isolate the issue. After some discussion about what I’d done to try to resolve the popping, he said the my Show was still under warranty and he would send me a replacement. I received the replacement two days later. I have been using the new unit for nearly a month and it does not suffer from the popping issue, so perhaps the original unit just suffered a defect.

I am raising my rating to three stars. Why not five stars? In my opinion, it’s just not that much better than a plain Echo. Sure, it has a screen, but aside from looking at my Cloud Cam feeds every once in a while, the screen is of no use to me. But the lack of value add for the screen isn’t the reason I do not give it five stars.

I take away one star for the low quality audio. It’s not as bad as an Echo Dot, but not as good as a full size Echo. With the size and shape of this Show’s cabinet, they could have done much better with the acoustics. Call me when you come out with a Bose or Klipsch version. They could work wonders with this much cabinet volume.

I took away the second star because they insist on using approximately the bottom 25% of the vertical screen real estate to show irritating “Things to try with Alexa” hints. You cannot turn these things off. They are there regardless of what skill you are using. The only way to hide them is to set the device to Do Not Disturb mode. Here’s a tip I’d love to see pop up one day... “Alexa, turn off things to try.”

==== Original review from 04/13/2018 ====
I own six Echo devices, one full size Echo, one Echo Show and four Echo dots. The primary thing I use them for is to listen to music, either from my Amazon library or from an internet radio app like TuneIn or IHeartRadio. I bought this Show to use in my home office because I wanted the additional ability to view the Amazon CloudCam video from my front porch so I could be alerted and get my frequent amazon deliveries before someone swiped them.

At first I was pleased with the Show, despite the fact that the audio wasn’t as good as what I previously had using a Dot and an old set of computer speakers. However, at some point it began making an irritating popping sound. It sounds like a vinyl LP with a big scratch is being played. The only difference is it doesn’t happen at regular intervals. It occurs between tracks when I play them from my library as well as randomly while playing internet radios stations. I still use the full size Echo and the Dots in other areas of my home and none of them have this problem.

I work 10 hours or more from home every day and listen to music the whole time. For the internet radio, I can make the popping stop for a little while by telling Alexa to stop playing music, giving it a few minutes and starting again, but after a few minutes it is back. I find myself shouting at Alexa to just STOP!!!!!

For this reason, I cannot recommend the Show. I am not the only one to experience this. Search in the questions and reviews, you’ll find others. Until Amazon resolves this, I would recommend you avoid the Show.

author: Mary
title: Wonderful!
content: Fun toy.  Very responsive, even understands my accent.  Much better voice recognition than Siri.

author: Tony M. Johnson
title: Poor sound quality
content: The sound is distorted at volume 5 or above.  I contacted customer service, but even a full reset and optimization did not help. I checked my wi-fi band width and it was well above the minimum.  The test for blocked ports passed.  I am disappointed with the sound on music and movies.

author: NormaJean
title: Best Thing Since Sliced Bread!
content: I received my Echo Show as a Christmas gift and don’t know how I ever got along without it. I mostly use it with TP Links to turn on lights and appliances. I will add security devices as I can afford them but for now I can use the smartphone app and Echo Show as a camera focused at the front door of my home when I’m away. I get weather reports, keep shopping lists, reminders and timers for everything. Not having to punch in a timer when I’m busy in the kitchen is a plus. Alexa also helps with recipes. The Show has a great speaker so I’ve given up my Bose Bluetooth. Alexa will play anything from my Amazon MP3 purchases but I also have the option of an affordable monthly Amazon music subscription....but I have so many Amazon purchases, I haven’t needed that yet. If you’re contemplating an Echo purchase, definitely spring for the Show. The monitor gives me so many additional suggestions throughout the day...functional, newsworthy and fun.....that you won’t get with the canister Echo.

author: Jeff
title: Better then the echo dot.
content: it has the tools of the echo, but also with a screen to actually show what you are asking for.  Plus you can watch amazon movies on it.  Lastly you can do in system video conferencing.  this is great.

author: D. Squires
title: Nice but needs more development.
content: I would give the device a 4 or 5 star rating if you had more control over the “home page”.  The consent showing of Alexa hints is extremely annoying.  I spent many hours doing research on getting rid of them but there isn’t a reliable way.  Should be an option.

author: SHERMING WOODS
title: IT works well for me every day
content: I like when I ask the Echo show to do something it does it I also use it to put me to sleep at nights I listen to the sound of the ocean.

author: Zach
title: Echo is the best assistant out there
content:
So i bought a google home for every room in my house. Bathroom. Basement.  Living room etc ect.

I ended up getting this echo because i had a $100 off coupon. I figured why not.

Even if you take the screen away the echo is so much better.  For instance if i tell it to turn the ac up on my nest. It says Ok and its done.

My google will lower my tv and tell me what it is doing. Very annoying.

I will be replacing most of those google homes with the echo show.

My only drawbacks and hence not a 5 star:
I wish they would link and play music together.  Like a whole house audio system. My google did that.

I wish they would turn on  my Smart Tv.

I love that this works with my Sleepnumber bed and it also shows me my nest doorbell amd other cameras.

I also use it in the kitchen for recipes when cooking.

They do need to get YouTube on there.

Basically amazon created one amazing assistant.  Definitely good buy!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not as smart as my echo, but I am enjoying the screen.
content: I feel like this is Alexa's dumb little sister.  She's having a harder, slower time learning.  She's really picky about how we ask her for things.  More so than the echo.  I do, however, love the lyrics all the time and the screen for everything from recipes to news.  The screen has been very fun.

author: Amazon Customer
title: What a Show!
content: We already had an echo and when the show went on sale before Prime day it was a no brainer. We use our echo mostly for music so I couldn't wait to hear the show. We were not disappointed. The sound is phenomenal and for most of the songs the lyrics scroll by. You can also watch video clips, news and even movies from Prime Video. And of course its all assisted by Alexa, the best AI out there. Oh yea, you can video chat with someone who also has one.

author: LUV2SHOP
title: Great Product!
content: We received Echo Show as a surprise gift from our daughter. Great product. We’ve got our lights  and our security in-sink. Getting the latest weather and other facts, as well as talking face-to-face with family & friends is fun.

author: Carolyn Grau
title: Same as other units.
content: It works the same as the smaller units.  I bought it because I thought, from what I read that it would hook up to my Ring doorbell.  It will show me the front door but I cannot talk through it.  I was going to have a knee replacement and thought this would be great because my phone takes a while to get it to connect before I can talk.  Other then that it does the same as the other Echo units.

author: DavidAH58
title: Use it in the kitchen
content: I have been impressed with the ease of installation of the Echo Spots I've put around and this Echo Show. I love having it in the kitchen for the entertainment purposes (music, videos) but even more functionally, you can use to set a timer, get conversions for measures, even find simple recipes. In addition to being functional, I'm also impressed with the quality of the audio and video.

author: Kelly Martin
title: Screen not that helpful!
content: It’s ok. It just doesn’t do that much. And now with YouTube being pulled, it’s even worse. I would’ve returned it if I knew it was going. Too late now. The difference between the show and my other echoes is obviously the screen. But it’s just not that big of an advantage.

author: Kraal
title: easy to set up
content: only used a few times so far.  Seems fairly easy to use , but sometimes have to repeat request. After 6 months or more will have better idea.

author: Molly
title: Great gift for parents
content:
We have one in our house and love it! We use the screen mostly for video calling.

Great gift for parents and grandparents!!!

author: Dave K
title: Great Alexa product
content: We had an original Echo and I finally got the show. it took a bit of research to figure out how to link a folder of pictures on it. But everything else has been great. It looks and sounds good. Controls all our alexa stuff.

author: Kurt Baker
title: This is a great product.
content: This is a great product....lol...I use it when I'm out and I want to see my FOUR Beagles...I wish the camera would twist, turn or tilt...Maybe the next Echo Show 2?

author: Andrew King
title: Great when it worked - now an expensive paper weight
content: We are Alexa junkies. We have two of the kids dots,  six of the regular dots, plus the Alex tower. This however, was by far our favorite. We put it in the kitchen and it regularly set timers and reminders for us, as well as functioned as our kitchen. Hub. Unfortunately,it Quit one year to the day I received as a gift. Yesterday, Christmas.  The display just turned black and now it won’t turn on at all.  An expensive paper weight ;( Really disappointing!

author: Tanya
title: Echo Show
content: I bought one for myself and 2 others for each of my parents (divorced).  They are happy with theirs and I am very happy with mine.  Mine sits on my desk and I use it all the time.  For music, for alarms, for information etc.  I haven't tried to order anything through it from Amazon yet.  It is paired with my calendar & Amazon.  I get notifications of packages being delivered etc. I have my Echo Show paired with my Echo Dot and my Echo.  They are in different rooms.  Works great when listening to music as I clean.  The reason I bought it for my parents is so that we can see each other when we talk.  My parents both live in FL.  I gave them each one for Christmas.  Since I live in Washington State I don't get to see them as often as I would like.  This gives us a wonderful opportunity to chat and see each other.  My dad has thanked me several times they love the gift of their Show.  My mother still needs a little help with hers.

author: DBHouston
title: Enormous Potential but Needs More Work
content:
It's clear that voice activated and directed appliances are in our future. Echo Show demonstrates how this technology is useful for many tasks, such as defining terms, asking for facts, dialing hands-free, getting daily briefings, playing media, etc.  Today's Echo Show is limited by the defined questions (called skills) it can respond to, so about a third of the simple questions and most of the highly detailed questions will stump the Alexa.

Still, I'm keeping it for now (had it two weeks), for the things it can do.  I hope it gets smarter over time.  The best web services grow by user contributed content, so I hope Alexa will learn from it's subscribers and vendor partners.

author: Desdet
title: Works fantastic for video calls between us
content: Purchased the two pack for our distant daughter and ourselves. Works fantastic for video calls between us. We also enjoy the video flash briefings and the ability to watch specific items on You Tube. It controls all of our lights on the main floor and our television as well. In my opinion the speakers sound better on the Show than on the Echo. Only wish it was battery accessable as well. Overall a great product.

author: M Frees
title: Amazon knowingly sells defective products
content: Product is malfunctioning, apparently it's a known issue for the product, and they sold it to us defective anyway. Google "Echo Show Screen Flicker" and see for yourself. Several fixes recommended by Amazon have been tried, including unplugging for various amounts of time, resets, etc. I've turned off the adaptive brightness, set the brightness to less than 40%.  Running the most up to date firmware. Skip it folks. It's gonna break.

author: Debbie
title: Family Must
content: I loved my Echo 2nd generation, when this came up during prime days I could not resist. My only regret is my didn’t buy 2. This takes Alexa to a whole new level. Music, weather, ordering,news, deliveries,smart home,audio books,games-homework for kids,reading and learning games only adds to the fun.group games are available too for great family entertainment. Sound is awesome. Something can be said about the Alexia devices. Walk into a dark room-and by voice using smart plugs light up the whole room. smart home accessories are very easy to set up. 100% success on all that I have purchased. I haven’t tried watching prime shows.......but yep-that’s there too.

author: T. K.
title: Just part of the total Smart Home Echo package.
content:
At the suggestion of a friend, I decided to try the Alexa Echo lifestyle.  At first, I could not imagine what I would use it for.  Why the heck would I need to ask Alexa to do anything for me???  Well, I bought the Echo Show along with an Echo and and Echo Dot.  I was immediately hooked!  I began with smart plugs, then some smart bulbs.  Then I bought an Echo Plus, the one with the hub.  After figuring it all out, I ended up returning the Echo Plus and I bought 3 more Echo Dots.  With two of the Dots, I bought MOKCAO POWER+ Cordless Speaker with Battery Base for Amazon Echo Dot 2nd Generation (https://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B0749K9C1T/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o07_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1)'  I found that this speaker with a Dot gave me as good or better sound than having a full Echo or an Echo Plus.  The bonus is that each of them is portable so I can take it anywhere and treat it as a bluetooth speaker.  The 3rd Dot is now hard wired to my 7.1 Suround system in my gameroom and the 4th wired to my Bose Wave Radio in my garage.  So, as you can guess, I'm all in with Alexa.  The Dots are great if you can hook the up with a speaker as i have done with two or a stereo system as I have with the other two.  The Echo Show is the one we have in our morning room, the room we spend 90% of our time.  The reason is that it has very good sound quality all by itself and the screen is great for seeing lirics of songs.  But it best for linking your photos up to Amazon Photos and playing all of your photos like a digital picture frame.
I plan to use this same review for all of the Echo products I am now enjoying, Echo Show, Echo, and 4 Echo Dots.  Even my wife is asking Alexa to play her music and that is a complete positive testament.  Oh, did I mention that I set up an "everywhere" music group so I can now have music playing throughout the house.  I can also ask Alesa to turn on the Livingroom Lights, Deck Lights, Bar Lights, Gameroom Lights, Office Light, Bedroom Light

author: Noah Newsome
title: Recent UI update made a mediocre product terrible
content:
I was very interested in getting an Echo Show mostly for YouTube.  At the time of purchase YT had been re-added to the Show's capability, but was quickly removed again, I was able to use it the first day, but not any other day after that.  I ended up keeping it as an expensive (even though I got a good deal on it) alarm/clock replacement.

I use this product infrequently for anything other than a convenient way to set timers or reminders, which it is bad at since it won't let you set a reminder for anything over 24 hours away, so it is basically useless other than for short reminders like for cooking or laundry.  Alarms are limited since you also can't set alarms over 24 hours away except for repeating alarms which you can't set to skip so on holidays you have to remember to cancel the alarm then, after the holiday has passed, re-set your alarm.

This device sits on my dresser across my room from my bed where I can see the clock and the outside temperature, one of its only useful features.  It would constantly scroll through suggested actions, like news articles, jokes, or other random things it can do for you.  Which was fine except you cannot customize this content at all so it constantly suggests the birthday roundup, which is something I have less than 0 interest in (meaning not only do I not want to hear it, if for some reason it did play it would actively make me annoyed), but of course I can't customize the content on my own device because that would be too useful.  It had a large portion of the screen dedicated to the clock/temp in the upper left with an alarm indicator in the top right with headlines and other suggestions in the lower left.  Well, so much for any usable features on this device.  They pushed out a UI update recently which shrunk the clock/temp text to an unreadably small text in the top left (this might be readable on a bed stand a foot from your head, but not from across a room), and pushed the advertisements (let's call them what they are) into taking up about 80% of the screen right in the middle.  Bear in mind there is little to no customization of this device, minus the ability to set a wallpaper... oh right, they also, as the ads scroll, now put up different images for the advertisements in the background which scroll by and are incredibly distracting on a display screen.  There is no way to revert or disable any of this functionality.  It's like buying a kindle with advertisements for the full kindle price without any of the features, YAY!  Or maybe more appropriate, buying a Kindle and, after owning it for awhile, them turning it into one with advertisements.

Other than that it is a basic Alexa.  Moderately useful with all the downsides of an active listening AI, it hears its name randomly for no reason, it doesn't listen to you when there is any background noise, and it is tied into your Amazon account so it can buy things you don't want or subscribe you to services you didn't ask for.  This is not an exaggeration.  I asked it to play a song that is free for Prime users, it heard some completely unrelated song that was only part of Amazon Music and said it could sign me up for that, I said "no way", it said Ok I've signed you up.  I then had to log onto my Amazon account and cancel the membership.  So good times there.

Basically, if you want Alexa get a normal Echo device, the show is basically useless and they've only made it worse as time has gone on.  I guess if you watch a lot of Prime stuff and don't mind watching it on a 4" screen because you're in the kitchen or the bathroom or something maybe it could be useful...

author: Deborah Conrad
title: Incredible!!!!
content:
Incredible device! It is absolutely wonderful.! I gave it to my husband for his birthday, and wonder: what did we do before Alexa?
So unbelievably incredible.  It has made me obsolete.

author: Martin W. Divirgilio
title: like a call will come in and i want to ...
content: I have Alexa generation 1 and a Dot, Sometimes they get confused with each other, like a call will come in and i want to answer it on echo show which is near me for the video, but instead Alexa 1 will pick it up and i wont get video. Or I will ask the echo show something and alexa 1 will pick it up when i only want the echoshow to hear it. Or, when I have moved, I will ask Alexa 1 something but echoshow will mention it did not hear me or did not understand. That's another thing, although the voice technology was around in the 70's and seemed to work as a sort of unintended racial predjudicer I looked forward to seeing the technology shame and change those to whom the hipped taught us were equal but we learned lied  when we looked in the world saw clear differences objectively- one of which was speech. I was born in 1964 and believed Steinem,MLK , and Toclas I guess they lied. But otherwise, its good.

author: Dan C.
title: The best Echo so far.
content: This really brings the Alexa  and smaller Echo all together. Makes it a lot more, More what everything. Wish it herd me a little better and that it had Google, Wikipedia. Maybe it does and I just can't find it yet. It would be nice to have 3 of these in my home. If you are in bed and want more heat just say Echo turn up thermostat. You do need a smart Thermostat.

author: CAROLE W.
title: Plays great quality prime movies ..
content: the sound quality is very good and the fact that you can play prime movies on it, is an excellent feature. Havn't tried the talk to face feature, cause i no noone qho has the app..lol

author: MamaSama
title: Best of the bunch so far!
content: I love the size of the screen. I love all that it does. - I still have an issue with the brightness control of the screen and changing it. I hate having to turn on the light, go to settings and do all that.  Make the control voice-enabled, just like the volume control!  ( It'd make me love you more!) - Other than that, the sound quality, perhaps because of the larger size of the speaker, is far better than spot or dot. It was worth the wait to get one.

author: 801shirts
title: Perfect companion to my other Echo's
content:
Got my 1st Echo while it was in Beta, it took a while for my wife to like the Echo (she was frustrated it didn't understand her commands, didn't do what she wanted, thought it was very limited, etc). But after a week she learned how to use it, and here we are almost 3 years later and we have 10 Alexa's in our house and she can't live without it.

Here are some common ways I use Echo Show:
Alexa, show me the driveway/front-door camera (I live on a popular street)
Alexa, play <word> on YouTube
Alexa, play <movie title>

Here are some common ways I use Echo (any of my Echo's):
Alexa, turn on/off the bedroom/hallway lights
Alexa, turn on/off the projector
Alexa, play popular music (while I'm in the shower, my phone/tablet aren't loud enough for me to hear over water)

My goal this year is to use Alexa to control my Media Center (Alexa play this movie, resume this show, etc). It's possible with Plex, but I use Kodi and it's a very complex setup :/

Since Echo was the first it's in class, and has the most apps, I'm looking forward to seeing what developers come up with in the coming days/weeks with the Echo Show!

author: Buck
title: This makes 3 , that I have . Sm Med lg .
content:
This one has GREAT sound + the screen.
Fun , easy to use ,for basics , but you got to know some stuff to use it’s full range of neat options . Did treasure truck . $115.00

author: Jerseygirl22
title: Innovative - Fun - Love Seeing song lyrics
content: We really love our Echo Show.  This was for my husband’s birthday and then we received another one in white for Christmas!  The set up was really fast and easy.  We had a Echo Dot initially having two in a home is not overdoing it.  I love having the lyrics for songs and placement in the kitchen area - makes cooking & clean up a breeze.  We also make visual calls to our family up North.  I would recommend to everyone.  The plug is neat but i have to try the set up again - i wasn’t successful.

author: Brian K. Beresford
title: Subpar 7" screen & no real worthy content to watch on it without YouTube.
content: I like the idea but no YouTube. Really???  Without it the screen feature is pretty much useless even with Prime movies or videos available. Who wants watch  full movie on the 7" screen. And the LCD screen could've been better quality it off axis viewing is horrible and resolution for 2018 is subpar at that. Might as well just have a Echo classic. I guess it's only saving grace is video calling and drop in feature for my 82 year old mom that isn't too tech savvy. But, honestly at a minimum settle your squable with Google and bring back YouTube capabilities at least.

author: Miss Kay
title: Another great Echo
content:
I love the Echo products from Amazon.  We use them constantly in my house.  We purchased the show recently and our whole family loves it.

All the features of your original Echo and your Dot but with a screen that gives you top stories, song lyrics and can even play movies, etc.  Amazing.

author: JAB
title: Abysmal voice recognition!
content:
I haven't had my show for very long but, so far, I agree that the voice recognition is TERRIBLE compared to my Echo.  When you ask it to play video, it asks if I want to create a station on Pandora, performs a web search for garbage that I wouldn't search for, etc.  For example, when asked to play "daniel tiger's neighborhood" for a child, it first asked if I wanted to add a station for Dan Fogelberg to my Pandora.  A second attempt saw it returned bing search results for kylie jenner.  A third attempt started to play Jack Reacher.  Over a dozen additional attempts returned similar results. None of them actually pulled up Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood from Amazon Video (This was supposedly one of the main selling points).
I'll be testing whether performance is this poor with recipes this weekend.

author: Chris Rice
title: You need connections!
content: I got this for a gift after giving a similar one to my brother in law last year. I have used it every day and haven't begun to tap its potential. The best gift was " being with" my twin sister as we opened presents this year. We need to work on coordinating times for a call because the "ring" is hard to hear if you are not right in the same room.  I wish I had had this when my elderly father was living alone. It would have been handy to check up on him with a quick call instead of just depending on a phone call. I LOVE it!

author: jkaz
title: the quickest return decision of all time
content:
I bought this for the most part to use with my nest cams. I was aware of the 30 minute time out for viewing that did not bug me. But if you have nest hello and the doorbell rings it DOES NOT pop up on the Show. So what good is it? For me it was an easy decision. I can do more with a $99 android tablet. This was the last straw for me with amazon devices.

The good (and the only reason it didnt get 1 star) was that it is really fast and responsive which was nice. But I just found no use for it.

author: G. M.
title: So far so good, except.......
content: I have not had it long enough to write a good review, but the one thing that REALLY bothers me is that when I need traffic information, you can only get it on the same address, as in just one. You cannot put in frequently visited addresses and get traffic information as needed. I think that’s awful and really needs to be addressed.

author: S. Miller
title: A picture is worth a thousand words ....
content: I received my Echo Show as a gift from my daughter who bought one for herself as well. We both are enjoying it. Love being able to chat while in the kitchen and seeing one another. It's also great being able to see her latest purchases and getting a fashion show. I moved my other device upstairs. This purchase is for my niece ... price was right and will be seeing her in about 2 or 3 weeks and I just know she will enjoy as much as we do.  Creating our own network ... lol. We ordered one for another family member.

author: Keoni
title: Yea its an Echo and works like the others.
content: Net my expectations for an Echo. I was replacing a first gen Echo that unexpectedly to a dive so I was expecting to get at least that out of this device. Extra features, sure; FaceTime calling yup: display personal photos for as a digital frame, check! I. Sure there are more but as long as it did what my previous device did, I'm good. Just wish the original lasted longer than 2-3 years before DOA.

author: banks6618
title: Bravo!
content: I absolutely love my new Echo shows. Totally worth the price. I bought 2 and received $100 off. I purchased a white one and a black one. Unfortunately the white one had small damage on front bottom right corner (pic attached) hence only 4 stars. Not sure how this happened as the box was sealed and not damaged, probably in factory.
