It bothers me but too much trouble to return and not really a big deal. On a more positive note they are really nice quality and perform better than expected. Good job Amazon!

author: Ian
title: Screen went bad
content: I ordered this when Amazon was having their deals in the summer. It didn’t last very long the screen started to mess up and flicker. There was not a lot of customizing you could do with it. I bought it to use with my Ring door bell. You had to ask Alexa to turn it on each time instead of it popping up automatically. My advice wait for the next generation.

author: Catherine Abaya
title: I can easily communicate with her when I’m away
content: My mom has dementia and cannot use a regular Ipad for FaceTime. Having this in her room, I can easily communicate with her when I’m away.

author: mech527
title: Used to be good................
content: As a long time Amazon customer I agree with the rest of the customers regarding the loss of Youtube. Even with the recent drop in price it still is not worth it. Unless Amazon can work something out with Google to bring back Youtube just save your money. I hope Amazon will take in account the number of valuable and loyal customers and fix this problem. Amazon Prime video is just not enough to buy this Alexa with a screen. I mean really who's gonna sit and watch a 30 min. show let alone a 2 hour movie on this size screen. Youtube was the perfect addition to this device, and now it's gone. AMAZON SHOULD DO THE RIGHT THING AND REFUND US SOME $$$$$. It's like buying a car just to find out 4 months later that you have to return the stereo. It was just on "loan" to you without your knowledge. What a slap in the face....

author: Eddie B
title: Youtube no longer works with this product.
content: Very upset that youtube no longer plays - that was one of the selling points. I feel cheated. Other than that, I like the product.

author: Magz
title: Has a ways to go to be a really good assistant
content: So so. I wonder if google might be better. It is hardly able to search the internet to get an answer to basic questions. Long way to go before it can be truly an asset to a household.

author: Glad to help!
title: Great, could be better with Utube.
content: This is great. I would have given it 5 stars but Amazon and Utube lost their relationship and it really needs them. I bought 2 bu would only buy one if I knew of the loss of Utube.

author: S. Dumke
title: Echo Show is great!
content: I'm really happy with our Echo Show. It's a good size and its great to be able to talk to our adult children and grandchildren. It is a huge improvement, especially with the grandkids. The expressions and laughter, to actually see that is priceless! I have also watched a few movies on Amazon Prime video and listen to music on it. The set up was extremely easy as well. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the fact that it has to remain plugged in and it doesn't follow us like I see the Facebook portal does. I'm sure those things will come eventually. But I am very happy to have it now!

author: Flew
title: Awesome
content: I waited and purchased on sale but I really like it I have several smart speakers but what I like most is the integration of my Ring video door bell pro it works amazing

author: mke53233
title: Get it
content: I’ve had for a few months.  I love it, and so does my wife.  Very convenient for some inconvenient lights in our house (Wemo switch purchased separately).  Love the timer, music, shopping list, weather, and traffic functions.  We use multiple times per day.  It saves a few seconds here and there, but is so convenient.

author: Kris Johnson
title: Alexa fan for life!!
content: Everyone in my family LOVES this thing. I have never seen my family spend so much time in the kitchen!! We loved it so much we bought a second one...The sound is very good and it is so easy to use!

author: JESSE STUHR
title: What's the point?
content:
Update:  picked up my 3 year old Nexus 6p and said "ok Google play me some workout music on YouTube" guess what? My ancient device already does more than this thing.  Never had to touch my phone. Why is this a product again?

Got this as a gift from my mom for Christmas. Finally set it up and there's no YouTube. What the hell is the point of having a screen and you can't even play the most popular music and videos? Completely useless pile. I'll use my tablet or my phone and get everything I need. I'm really hoping she can send this thing back otherwise it's a total waste of money. Stick with Google people.

author: Pete
title: Video call and loud wake up alarm great for hard of hearing elderly
content:
Best thing about Echo Show so far is finding out Mom was alive.  Worst thing was power came unplugged and disconnected video call while showing her our kitchen remodel, (it was easy to call back).  Mom had not answered her phone or email for 3 days. Turns our her laptop had crashed and her hearing had deteriorated and she couldn't hear her cell phone ring, (she forgets to check for missed calls). Yesterday was the first time I had ever placed a call with any Echo device.  I simple said call Mom and to my surprise she answered. Huge relief. I think it helps that Echo Show is stationary and that we placed it next to where she spends a lot of time. Obviously Mom struggles with her hearing. A few months ago when it became clear she was sleeping through her alarm I set her up with an Echo to help wake her in the morning, (in the free app you download to your phone you can control the volume level (Loudest for Mom) of the wake up alarm).  Total life saver. Immediately she stopped missing her morning book club not to mention her doctor appointments. Feeling good about myself over the holidays I figured why not get her a Echo Show.  On a roll during the set-up I got her signed up with Audible so she could listen to Trevor Noah's Born a Crime and I guess I enabled something about phone calls off her contacts list.  Then I flew home and, like I said,  soon she mysteriously dropped out of touch. Getting worried I asked Alexa to "call Mom". I had never used an Echo to make a "phone" call. Evidently when it rang it was completely natural for her to tap the green answer button and accept the call.  Nice for both of us to be able to see each other as the visual communicates so much about a person so quickly.  Mom looked great!

What else is cool is about Echo Show? Its nice to see the time and temperature at a glance and it's fun to see lyrics to songs it turns out you never knew in the first place.  Other cool Echo features...  NPR Flash News, easy answers to cooking questions, lists and how to spell hard words. Ordering new stuff and of course Amazon music and the fun of calling up favorite songs from memory.  Can't wait to see what new features they come up with for Mom.

author: K. Lance Vail
title: Always informed.
content: Have the grand baby’s pictures loaded, always know what the weather and news has going on. Didn’t know what I did before I purchased it.

author: Cissy Dietrich
title: Great product
content: I absolutely love the echo show! After reading the reviews from good to bad, I was a little apprehensive in purchasing the show. I am very happy I that I did. I have my echo show set up in my bedroom on my night stand. I love the fact I can lay in bed and tell Alexa to play a movie on amazon prime or play a song from prime music. I also love the fact that my ring doorbell and arlo cameras are compatible with Alexa. I can simply say Alexa “show me living room” and then it pulls up camera in living room. I also love the fact that all of my smart plugs are also compatible with Alexa. I love being able to say turn on lamp while laying in bed. I also recently found a cool feature where you can set a routine, like say Alexa start my day, Alexa tells me the weather and turns on my lamp. It can be customized to whatever you like. I can use the show as my alarm too. You can also put a personal photo on the screen of your choosing. So many features and I’m sure many more I have not figured out just yet. All in all I love it!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Sound from a Little Box
content: Great sound from a little box. The screen is small, but clear and I can watch Prime videos. I would recommend this to anyone who found the original Echo tinny and to soft to hear. The Echo Show also picks up my voice, even when it is playing music.

author: Michael Dodge
title: I like most of the features this has to offer
content: I like most of the features this has to offer, I am disappointed when asking it questions google does a much better getting answers.  I don't think its search ability is as good as it could be.

author: Jacob H. Slaughter
title: The voice controls are good. The inability to play me a damned youtube ...
content: The voice controls are good. The inability to play me a damned youtube video or list simple recipes upon request is offensive to my expectations of a device that I really just wanted to help walk me through recipes in the kitchen.

author: jamieÃÂ gould
title: Best echo ever!
content: My family enjoys the show so much!  If you are considering an echo this is the one to buy!  I have very slow internet ( i live in the country) and it still works perfectly!  I love how the lyrics to the songs played will show on screen. The sound from this system is really good. We use this unit daily. I also own an echo dot and the regular echo, we love being able to use drop in from room to room!

author: Long Islander
title: Very disappointed. Does not support YouTube.
content:
I bought a pair of these, one for my den and the other for my bedroom. The biggest motivation was that I could watch YouTube without having to bring it up in my TV. Well, with Amazon and Google at odds over Google products being sold on a Amazon, they withdrew YouTube. Now, I have two boat anchors that can do no more then Siri on my iPad, or Cortana on my Windows Tablet. If I could, I would return both Echo Shows. The only thing that I currently use them for is to turn the room lights on and off and to monitor my Nest thermostats.

Don’t waste your money.

author: BuBu
title: Not smarter than Alexa
content:
Last week I bought the Echo Show. I’ve had an Alexa for years, since they first came out.
Amazon Echo might be an enhanced Alexa with visuals and better speakers. Unfortunately, Echo is not a smarter Alexa. Eventually, they both use the same app on your phone.
I downloaded an app to count the time I spend brushing my teeth. The command is “Alexa, ask Toothbrush brushing to begin brushing.” Needless to say, after writing this, such command will be the only onevI know. So, I’ve never had a dialogue with this machine or from her sister. It’s been more of a conversation between an inept master and a confused slave. Until the master gives up, which makes Echo nothing more than a glorified desktop clock.
Most of the apps, or skills, are for meditation. I’ve enabled various meditation skills, but my confused slave tends to deliver Amazon music instead.
Listening to the news can take an hour, depending on the number of skills enabled. Often happens that news are a week old. There are lots of -in my view- junk skills and very few that could be helpful.
I was looking forward to making calls. Contact download is an all or nothing. Since I can’t download all my contacts (for Hipaa reasons) this is not a feature I could use. Both, Alexa and Echo can dial numbers dictated to them.
So far, I’ve been unable to make ring doorbell work with Echo. I haven’t tried this with Alexa. Nevertheless, I have been able to watch prime videos, listen to Amazon music and use other Amazon features with no problems.
I would like Alexa and hr sister to be more intuitive. I’ve been waiting for years for this to happen. I doubt she’ll ever change. She was not designed to be an artificial assistant in every way possible. She was designed to deliver Amazon products; and Echo does this much better than Alexa.

author: BC
title: Great in Kitchen
content: Great in the kitchen.  I love to cook and it is fun to look up recipes.  Also great for listening to music and watching shows on Amazon Prime Video while I cook.  I subsequently bought an Echo Dot with the ihome clock docking station for the bedroom.  I created a group so I can play music on both of them at the same time.  I plan to add more speakers in the future.

author: Gwen
title: I own 2 dots and I love them. When I got the Show
content: I own 2 dots and I love them.  When I got the Show, I expected it to be better but instead found it buggy.  My commands worked only 30% of the time whereas my echo dot responds correctly most of the time.  Also, this is not handsfree  as I expecteed when I went recipes and videos.  And the ads are very annoying.

author: jason
title: If you have a parent you want to keep an eye on ! This is for you !!!!
content: You will not regret this purchase I couldn’t be more happy !!!!!!!! What are you waiting for buy one or two. I’ll be getting another ! And on amazon prime day it was a steal!!!! I’m totally serious I have an elderly parent this has revolutionized our lives , to see the smile on mom’s face as she can see and hear me is priceless!!! Again what are you waiting for buy this echo show now!

author: Hank
title: Stupidly always shows "Things to Try" on the home screen
content: Giving the Echo Show a two star rating till Amazon adds the ability to remove the "Things to Try" text from the home screen.  I never read the text and it only distracts from my viewing of the background image.

author: Khurram Samani
title: Mind of its own
content: While some features are useful like controlling lights, alarms, timers, etc. This device activates randomly. I can be sitting on the couch reading from my tablet, this device randomly starts saying the news headline or say " I don't know how to help with that".

author: Stan Cook
title: I love it, BUT
content: I love it but every night the brightness dims all the way down even though the ambient light switch is off.  Every night it just dims all the way down for no reason.  Other than that, it is great.  Just hard to see it at night.

author: Portia
title: Many pros but read my update before buying!
content:
I read some of the other reviews and I guess it all comes down to what you are looking for. I have an Amazon Echo in the bedroom and the Show in the kitchen. I find it is everything it is advertised to be, and more. The setup is so easy I have watched 2 tech-noobs successfully do it in minutes. (These people constantly ask me things like "how do I find settings on my phone?").

The customer service is just amazing. You call the help number given in the app and in a couple of minutes, you have a live person on the phone who goes the extra mile to get the right answer. I called a few times to get answers on some how-to things, like "can Alexa handle double-authentication on wifi - answer is yes). The rep double-checked with one of their wifi experts before giving me the answer. I also had a problem with the message notification bubble not appearing on my screen. Turns out I had to remove the middle initial from my registration name. I was surprised she figured that out so quickly.

The screen is sharp and clear and I can easily read everything without my reading glasses. The prime music/video and youtube integrations are excellent and be sure to take a look at using the tunein application which offers some interesting podcasts and news. I like how, when I set a timer, it keeps going off until I dismiss it. I do wish you could personalize how many times Alexa gives you a reminder in case you are out of the room. Right now she tells you twice but the reminder is also displayed on the screen for a while.

I am finding new cool things that Alexa can do everyday and I have no doubt that future updates will add more. If you are looking for a device that is compatible with Chromecast, this isn't for you. But if you are looking for a personal assistant that can make your life easier and add a bit humor (through easter eggs), I highly recommend it.

UPDATE:
Now that Youtube no longer works with the Show, it has lost a good part of it's functionality that made it worth the cost. Moreover, those of us who bought it after reading the advertised statement that Youtube was included, feel rather ripped off. It's like buying a car with cool hubcaps and driving it a while, then the dealer takes the hubcaps back. You paid for them, but you don't get them. It still has a lot of pros, but I am lowering my rating for this.

author: Audacious_Ariel
title: Worth the price!
content: Alexa still has a lot of learning to do (coming from a Siri phone user....) but hopefully Amazon will catch up quickly - although the web searches are minimal information and its harder to remember the exact words to use in order to utilize Alexa, the touch screen is worth it - video calls and audio calls with other friends and family is a breeze and the speed is great (much better than free Skype), and looking up things and having pictures and videos (movie trailers, animals/plants/science look up for the kids, etc.) makes it worth the price. We have welcomed Alexa into our home and hope she continues to develop so she can become an honorary member of our family in the future.

author: edy enriquez
title: I still don't like the drop in feature where anyone with an Echo ...
content:
Definitely an upgrade to the Echo Dot and the Echo!  The Screen adds a whole new level of experience.  I still don't like the drop in feature where anyone with an Echo Show can drop in on me unannounced... but I hear we can disable that.

Need to find more ways to use my ECHO SHOW but otherwise it is a good addition to the kitchen.

author: SUZAN BACH
title: doesn't always connect
content:
I bought this product in hopes that I could get everything it said out of it, so spending the money was a no brainer.
HOWEVER 9  OF TEN TIMES  I TURN IT ON, IT SAYS IT CAN'T CONNECT.  I get so frustrated! I really want to send it back.

author: Edward Buehler
title: Prime Video does not display correctly, Amazon Support doing nothing to correct the problem
content:
Had very high hopes for this product as I have a number of the Echo Dots and love them. Problems I ran into the device which caused me to open a ticket with Amazon are as follows:
1. Prime Video will only display the first 40 items in my watch list (I have over 100), though every other device displays correctly.
2. Calendar is constantly a day behind. Right now I am looking at items from yesterday when I have at least 2 appointments for today. When asked Echo will verbally give me the correct information.
Amazon tech support is disorganized and its left hand does not know what its right hand is doing. I spent one hour being shuttled from department to department before anyone would stop long enough to actually listen to the problem. When I finally got someone from support on the phone the person was obviously not familiar with the product and I ended up doing more of the troubleshooting then she did. Note - the ticket was opened on 11/28 as of today 12/21 I have no resolution and Amazon support has not contacted me with any updates with the exception of the nasty-gram that I sent them on 12/7 demanding an update.

Bottom line, I bought this so my GF could be able to watch Prime Video without having to drag out her laptop but if I can't access my Watch List properly that defeats the purpose of the device. Can't access Netflix through the device so that makes it doubly useless. Will probably keep the device for the sole purpose of listening to music - the speakers are rather nice.

author: Erin Sellars
title: Unit was defective; Amazon's attempts to repair the unit failed; only recourse was to return & pay restocking fee
content: Our Echo Show worked fine for a short time. It then started shutting down and rebooting on its own fairly frequently. We sent it in for repair and received a "repaired" unit that turned on once, shutdown on its own a short time later, and never worked again (in a different house from where we experienced the problems initially). After following up with Amazon again, the best they could do by this point was to allow us to return the unit and to incur a significant restocking fee. We own several Echo and other Amazon products and have enjoyed them. However, we're very disappointed in our experience with this product and the support team in this case.

author: marvin newman
title: The Show is fantastic, the only thing that it is missing is being able to view Youtube on it!
content:
I like the fact that you can connect in a video conversation and I can drop in on family and also use it as an intercom and make telephone calls without dialing on the phone. I just wish that  the Amazon Show was able to connect with Youtube as it did when it first came out. Since it came out it was discontinued due to some ongoing feud between Google and Amazon which I think is stupid as it would benefit both parties for this to be straightened out.

 I have just read that amazon will be selling chromecast on their site and I hope that this opens up a way for Youtube to be shared on the amazon show as it was advertised. I am a Prime member and I think I am being shortchanged because of this. If you can view Youtube over the internet, I think it should be the same on the Amazon show.  The only one that benefits from this stupidity is Roku as you can view both, Youtube and Amazon prime movies on it.

author: Michael Floyd
title: Works well and is a great help with daily activities and personal assistance
content: Works well and is a great help with daily activities and personal assistance. The only thing I would dislike is the poor quality speaker within the echo show. It cannot go really loud without the speaker muffling sound. Also ,you can't play songs really loud either; the bass is horrendous. It can get to a nice volume without messing up, but if you are the type who likes everything (music, alarms, etc.) really loud, you need to buy a compatible speaker with it.

author: Stefanie Rachis
title: I love listening to music
content: I love listening to music, being able to buy what I need by using my voice and finding recipes when cooking. My favorite feature is being able to drop in on my family and chat with them and see them.

author: The Guy from Illinois
title: Not as good as anticipated
content: This was initially a great product even though it has the stupid "try this" scroll which one can't remove. After 3 months the screen has begun to flicker which is apparently an issue with this product. Fortunately, you can now buy an upgraded model.

author: Eric
title: Very disappointed
content: While I am a usual fan of amazon they really missed out on this product. It is not user friendly trying to watch prime video. Alexa sometimes plays the Command you say and other times you give the exact same command and she won't. Also, no Netflix support is a huge complaint. I really expect better from an amazon product. My screen also glitches out sometimes.  Very irritating to use.

author: Kate Zingsheim
title: Video Chat with Grandparents
content:
We bought this device for my 86 year old grandparents, because we haven't found an easy way to video chat them from afar. We've tried Google Hangouts, Skype, etc. and all are just too complicated for them to figure out. This device has proven so easy that my grandparents have been able to use it regularly and we NEVER have issues hearing or seeing them. The Echo Show has allowed my grandparents to see their great grandchildren, which is such a blessing as we live in different states. Because of their age, it's so important to me that my kids get to see them and recognize them, this has really been a gift.

We basically bought this as a glorified video chat device, but turns out my Grandmother loves talking to Alexa! She told me she has been saying goodnight to Alexa, and "Alexa is so polite, she tells me to have a good night!" - this is so funny to me and I love it. She also lets the device give her news that she's interested. If my Grandmother can use this, it should be user friendly enough for anyone!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very nice. The only dissapointment is that it doesn't play ...
content: Very nice. The only dissapointment is that it doesn't play Youtube Videos on demand. They need to make it a little more smarter but over great to have in the kitchen to watch  videos and listen to music.

author: Chef Daryl
title: Excellent sounds great graphics and performs a better than expected.
content: This is one of the best pieces of technology that I have ever owned. I find that the graphics are exceptional while watching and videos and news clips. In addition I find that this works better than any alarm clock that I have ever owned. While reading other reviews complaining of there being too much light while trying to sleep I see that this is untrue and you can also adjust the illuminations to suit your needs. While playing some of my favorite music the Echo Show actually displays the words of the song and displays the album cover of the music that I am currently playing. I cannot possibly describe all the features that this has in also find that I am learning something new about the Show every single day. I am seriously thinking about purchasing two more to add to other rooms in the house. If you want, a great unit such is the show I highly recommend the Show for your household.

author: Rob Crawford
title: Glitchy
content: Unreliable, Glitchy suitable for return but missed my window of opportunity as I was told it has a learning process ... Still waiting for Alexa to wake up to learn

author: Marisa Stidam
title: Worth the money.
content: This is the best money I’ve spent. Just being able to tell Alexa to add groceries to my list, is a lifesaver. Another fun thing, is the drop in feature. My children wouldn’t agree, but I find it hilarious!

author: Aries
title: It's neat but a waste of money and they should honestly just offer refunds ...
content:
Broke within the first year of purchasing.

Calling customer service only sort of helps, my screen is broken and they want me to jump through hoops to make this thing work again. Even though the screen is flicking and I can't see the setting on it. It's a very common problem. Lots of people complaining about the same issue on different websites.

It's neat but a waste of money and they should honestly just offer refunds or exchanges since everyone is having this issue.

author: dpr1961
title: So far so good
content: Wish it had YouTube but sound really good. I am still worried Uncle Sam is looking in on me. Can beat Amazon Day price. Wouldn’t buy at regular price, too high.

author: Dan Beauchamp
title: i have every amazon echo and love them all
content: i have every amazon echo and love them all, so i bought 2 of them. my daughter loved them .Now that it cant play youtube videos its basically a brick. Also now they lowered the price so feel extremely ripped off.

author: L.A. Mama
title: Alexa is so fun with a her info and skills
content:
There are so many reviews of this thing I don't this will be read but I think it is worth saying that this thing is life changing for me. As someone who absolutely loves MUSIC (but kids and animals keep me from listening a lot) I get to play it and read lyrics in the kitchen, bathroom or wherever I can hide away with it. I've been paying for Amazon music unlimited so now I'm getting my $$ worth. Alexa is so fun with a her info and skills. I just disabled the drop in feature right away. If I want my kid can watch all our Prime videos - but who wants to share this thing?! I got a great deal on a open box returned one, but I'd pay full price. Love the white as I am a nerd for things matching the kitchen subway tile post remodel.

ALSO - I used Alexa to call family when I was moving IKEA furniture by myself (like an idiot) and this chest basically fell on me (I am 35, not elderly just dumb). If it weren't for Alexa not sure how long I'd have been stuck so there you are you just never know!!

author: AmZ Customer
title: Excellent Central Hub for the House
content:
The Echo Show is fabulous! I love how everything is handsfree.
Frequent Use: The alarm sounds are not jarring, and while still lying in bed gradually waking up I can read thru scrolling headlines and if anything catches my interest then Alexa reads it out to me. Also, I get morning news briefing(s), weather, and listen to music. The sound system is great, I love how my favorite group Acoustic Alchemy sounds on this device. Overall, a very pleasant way to start the day.

author: Amazon Customer
title: 2 units going defective after 2 months.  Amazon support is worthless.  Wasted money.
content: I bought 2 of these to use as an intercom.  It works ok for that.  But, the screens of both units are going bad.  They have jagged horizontal lines tearing across the screen.  If I power down and restart, the lines go away for a few hours, but come back.  Buyers be forewarned, Amazon support will ask for the serial number of the unit.  But, the serial number isn't printed anywhere on the unit.  The Amazon support people expect you to keep the original box for the life of the unit.  If I had to keep all the amazon boxes for everything I buy, I'd have to rent a small warehouse.  This experience is causing me to think I'll buy less from amazon and more from other vendors.  Amazon's support chat was a complete waste of time and cause of frustration.  The woman on phone call support was pleasant and tried to be helpful, but she kept saying the device wasn't registered to my Amazon account and she couldn't help me.  I have only 1 amazon account and it wouldn't be registered any other place.  I'm not happy with my decision to buy Echo Show devices.  After these Echo Shows die in a few months, I think I'll switch to Nucleus devices.  They function better as intercoms.

author: JPJ Photography & Media
title: Very Happy With The Echo Show
content:
We own six other Echo devices and have been happy with them all. The Echo show is no different! I held off on purchasing it when it came out because I just didn't want to pay that much for it. The priced dropped just before the new model was released (I didn't catch that!) and I snagged one for the kitchen area. Although it isn't the newest model, we haven't been disappointed.

The screen is large and bright, and looks great. We use it to catch news, podcasts, view recipes and listen to music while in the kitchen each day. It also controls seven Alexa-capable WiFi plugs we have throughout the house which is great when you need to turn the lights on/off and you're in the middle of something.

I have to admit we've become  an Amazon/Echo household. In spite of the fears of having audio/video devices always on and listening for commands, I'm not too worried about SkyNet taking over. We started out with a couple of Amazon Firesticks for our TVs, then got a couple of Fire HD tablets one Christmas, then bought the larger Echo device we still use in the basement family room, along with an Echo Spot in my home office, and Echo dots in each room. When the new Alexa came out we got one and use it in the den for music and controlling plugs and it sounds grate. I've even registered to the Echo car version when it comes out! It's made it a lot easier being able to remotely control lights, fans and some extension cords as well.

Bezos and team, keep up the good work, but don't let Alexia become self-aware. Unless I can order a Terminator from Amazon to protect us!

author: kc
title: One Star
content: they removed You Tube from Alexa Show and the price has  increased, Alexa doesn't know a lot. and she is always in your wallet asking for subscriptions. Hate the commercial pauses while watching a video or clip... sad. want my money back asap.

author: Barbara
title: Fun and Amazing
content: Love it!!! It is amazing. I am having so much fun with it. I am a visual person and this really helps with my calendar coming up periodically reminding me of events. It keeps me current with news events. I also enjoy seeing my family photos rotate on the screen. Great purchase on prime day!!!  Thanks Amazon!!! Prime day is one of my favorite days of the year!!!

author: Ronald W Berger
title: With some additional capabilities it will be 5 stars.
content:
Updating my review to 4 stars.  Originally it was not clear how to adjust settings on the screen, that was my main issue, with the latest update from Amazon it provided the details I was missing on how to manage the screen.  I kept looking for these as well as the initial command to sleep did not appear to work, it does now.

Have now used this to replace my alarm clock and move my original echo out of the bedroom into the living room.

5 stars will come when I can change the visual settings on the clock as well as select more random pictures than what is uploaded.

Much happier than when it first arrived, if you want an echo with display it is worth it for the additional price.

When the ECHO first came out I jumped on it and am glad I did.  Mostly I use it for music, news, alarms, weather, and the occasional fact related question (most the time Alexa doesn't have an answer).

I did the same for TAP and TAP follows me around the house when I am working outside, again mostly music but having Alexa nearby is helpful.

Show, I think could be very good but some things I still haven't figured out:

1.  No easy way to figure out the timeout on the display.
2.  Limited home screen choices, great I can add pictures but it would be even better if I could configure a few things to display what is important to me.
3.  Backlight - want to use it to replace my alarm clock but the backlight has a lot of bleed and can't dim it (at least have not found a way to control the backlight)

Haven't tried calling and looking forward to that when a few in the family get one.  The fact is, it will likely be very good but needs some better management capabilities in the Alexa app and through voice commands.

author: Charles Berry
title: Performs
content: Enjoy the use of this product especially for music.  We use it indoors and out poolside. Great for entering calendar events and to do lists.

author: Felipe R.
title: Great!, but There's Always Room For Improvement
content:
4⭐️
- Wish there was an option to turn off the updates in the screen.

-Really wish this would work as a digital frame so I could download photos and create a slideshow.

5⭐️
UPDATE !!! ... I received a call from Amazon customer service just hours after I posted this review to inform me that Echo Show does have a slideshow feature.  I was told that I need to download my photos in PRIME photos first and upload an album.

VERY IMPRESSED !!! Thanks Amazon !!!

author: Bytet
title: A super fun echo device but after several months it's broken.
content: Very sad. Device has developed a serious issue which customer service has said they know about but after several weeks it's no better. Blue bar at bottom of screen has spread across half the screen in a flashing disruptive display. Gets better if I power down but by the next morning it's back. I have it on a window sill so maybe being in direct sunlight and the heat makes it my fault it's now a disappointment but as its not even totally paid for (one more monthly payment to go) I can no longer recommended.

author: hstt
title: I Like it
content: I hope Amazon reads these!! :) I really like the Echo Show, I always tend to forget my Echo devices are around, So I don't really use them as much as I would like.. Unfortunately the main reason I bought this it's not so great.... I bought this to use with some Wyze cameras I put up around my house (main concerns my child's nursery and the front door) I loved that I could ask Alexa to show me those cameras and it would pop up on the screen.... However it takes so long for it to load. I could live with the nursery taking a minute to load but when it's the front door I need it to be quick when someone is knocking or else what's the point?  I am not sure if that's more on the side of the cameras...the Echo or both but if they could get together and figure that out it would be fantastic! Thanks!!!! :)

author: Kevin berry
title: Not great yet
content: the show is nice. don't like the fact you can never turn it off so cant really use in the bedroom.  hard to remember to turn screen off would be better if it would go into a sleep mode.  also the mics on this aren't as good as the dot or echo  we have all in our home put this in the kitchen and took the dot out  and it just doesn't have the mic range.  they still need to work on this product !!

author: Randy Homoelle
title: Trouble responding to request
content: Though I love the concept of the product, I find it difficult to get a response from Alexa when I send a request. Often times she spins and Spins yet never makes a response. I have had trouble with the dots periodically, however the show seems to always have a challenge responding to requests. I almost find it useless.

author: Rochelle S.
title: Fantastic Start Amazon!
content: I like that this unit is easy to use.  (I don't like the fact that it can't read my mind...yet).  I think this is a fantastic start to something great.  I am looking forward to future integration/partnering with Netflix and other streaming applications.  Alexa has kept me entertained, which is saying a lot.  To the developers - more games please!  Other than that - I enjoy the Echo Show, and like what Amazon has started.

author: Ed Rempalski
title: Thank You Amazon!  and my 95yr Mom Thanks you! (If she could).
content:
I know that many media folks have stated that the "Drop-in" feature of the Echos is "creepy" and can see their point.  Here's a different perspective.  Mom is now almost 95 and she has short term memory dementia, she's in great spirits but I really can't teach her anything technical, like dialing a phone or even pressing a memory dial button.  She lives near my sister and is 2 hours away so visiting is always a bit of a project.

I thought I'd try setting a Show next to her rocking chair.  I can now "Drop-in" on her every day and share some face time with her, visit with her grand daughter, see the dog whom she LOVES, and just make her smile.  The beauty is that there is no interaction needed on her end, the Caregivers and my Mom love this setup.  The fact that I can use my phone from anywhere and actually see and talk to Mom, and show her things  is hugely entertaining and comforting for Mom, and everyone in the family.

So I say with extreme gratitude, Thank You Amazon for creating an amazingly personally helpful tool for the elderly.

Personally I am enjoying all of the other great features of an Alexa with a screen, using her with my Arlo Cameras, etc. It truly is quite an amazing platform!  In my office I added a small Pioneer bookshelf stereo, I can be listening to Spotify, Pandora etc and say "Alexa, connect Bluetooth", the Pioneer stereo is Bluetooth enabled, it can be OFF and with that single voice command, the Show will wake up the Pioneer, and begin playing the sound over its speakers with no other intervention from me!  This is magical stuff!

The only bug I have at the moment, "Alexa, turn off the screen", the screen turns off, then immediately turns back on.  Tell her again and the screen stays off, pretty consistent bug.  Edit- Seems fixed now!

1/06/2018 Still enjoying my Echo Shows very much, I don't expect this to replace a tablet, it does many things very well, besides being indispensable with visiting Mom.  Currently there is one in the Kitchen and it is used by the family to play lots of music, having the screen is really nice to be able to see what's playing etc.  We are trying Amazon Music and so far it's pretty sweet as well, "Alexa show me all albums from Keith Urban", up comes pictures of all of his 12 or so album covers, touch one and play the album.  Alexa, "Connect Bluetooth" and the Show connects to a Bluetooth receiver I have on our whole house stereo.  Alexa "Turn on the Stereo", Alexa controls the Logitech Harmony remote to power up the stereo and now we are hearing music everywhere, nice.

We've also added some Ring cameras and doorbell, "Alexa, show me the front door", now I'm looking out front.

Oh, and our doggie monitor/treat shooter, Furbo, "Alexa, ask Furbo to toss a treat" is our dog "Cookie" 's favorite skill!

Bottom line, this is a very powerful system, don't get me wrong we love our Apple products (Phones, iPads, and Macs)  but I prefer this Amazon ecosystem for my home music, automation, and general questions etc. as it's a fairly open system that plays well with 3rd parties when compared to the likes of Apple.

I would never have imagined all that is possible with these units!

author: Debbie
title: Really awesome for Seniors!
content:
We already have an Echo and an Echo dot, which have both become a part of our family. We use them all the time and loved them so I was really excited to get the Show. I primarily purchased it for my Dad who has Parkinson's and it has been working out great! He can ask Alexa to show him videos on YouTube, play books from Audible and get the weather, news etc. all without having to use his hands. He has been really frustrated trying to use remote controls, keyboards, tablets and the like with shaky hands and this has solved a lot of problems. He does have a shaky voice and Alexa is able to understand him. I really think this is a revolutionary product for people like my parents (my mom has Alzhiemer's.) They can easily read what is on the screen (it gives tips) and say those things. My Dad and I played Jeopardy on it last night and it was hilarious. I am very much looking forward to seeing how this device can enrich the life of our senior population. I showed it to my Dad's speech therapist and she thought it was genius and is already sharing it with her patients who have movement disorders.

I am hoping to get a similar device for my brother so my Dad can call him and have video chats whenever he wants. I do wish Alexa would just let you call anyone and not just people with the Echo app but it's not that big of a deal for us personally. Also, if it would work with Fire tv that would be awesome too since my parents are not so good withe remotes and buttons. Overall, though, it's really great and we are enjoying it. I put pictures of my kids and niece on there for my Dad to look at as well.

author: DH
title: ... a web camera to the Show - it isn't good enough. The video delay from the web camera ...
content:
If using it for a live feed from a web camera to the Show - it isn't good enough. The video delay from the web camera (Logi Circle) to the Echo Snow was 10 seconds - way too long. When I used the app that came with the camera, the video delay was only 2 seconds. For this to be an effective live feed display unit, the delay needs to be greatly reduced to around 2 seconds if not shorter. On a positive side, the video quality was quite good.

Worked with Amazon support for about 90 minutes but the delay was never reduced. Both the camera and the Show were on the same wireless network.

Looked cool, good idea, not ready yet.

author: Bob
title: Great improvement
content: All in all the echo show does what’s advertised. And I looks good while doing it. I find some difficulty searching you tube and would love to be able to just push things to the screen like you can do with Apple TV and chrome cast. A little more explanation of what all this can do would be great. I upgraded from an original echo first gen so this is quite an improvement

author: Vincent C.
title: Reaction is fast voice recognition is great even across the room
content: Reaction is fast voice recognition is great even across the room. However why too many "skills"  for my family to learn how to operate the alexia. Especially prime music and video. I am still learning

author: Robin M
title: good with music and has ring doorbell integration! love it.
content:
I purchased this with the prime sale price of 129 (with tax and recycle fee was nearer 150), I was going to get the alexa hub but saw this with a LCD monitor are couldn't pass up. The main reason for my purchase was for music playback from prime music. The sound is way better than my echo dot and fills my room with good level of sound and with good frequency response. It shows the lyrics of most songs and/or picture of the artist or the album cover which I really like.
I am very happy with the purchase and I have not even used the video conference feature or have a movie playing from prime.
One other nice thing I like is its integration with my ring video door bell - really nice! Wish it automatically show the door when there was motion or a ring...
So far I am happy that I got it over the hub.

author: M
title: Years in, amazon still hasn’t optimized the damn thing
content:
Received this as a gift.  The video screen is slightly nice for viewing lyrics, but beyond that i find it unnecessary.

The plus to the echo show is that the sound quality is decent and it offers an easy way to play music on demand.

But there are many dissapointments with amazon alexa products in general.  The voice recognition is mediocre.  The intelligence level of alexa (eg amazons searching algorithms and alexa programming) are mediocre to poor, and sometimes comically bad.  And the library of music available from the Prime subscription is very hit or miss.  They will have tons of songs by one artist, and then be missing various well known songs.  You have to pay extra for the full amazon music library.  WTF amazon?  Id rather just get spotify, which is better.

If i had to do it over again, id get the google equivalent for its superior voice recognition and overall value.

author: Jaimae L.
title: Staying Connected Takes Another Step Further!
content:
The Echo Show is great.  I had a couple of the Echo devices previously and really liked them so decided to try the Echo Show.  The addition of the screen really takes Alexa to the next level.  The best feature of the Show is the video calling and texting.  We've started using this quite a bit.  The camera video quality is excellent.  I actually bought a Show for my parents and all 3 of my grown children.  If we can't stay connected this way, then we have no excuses!

My next step is to hook up the Echo Show to an outdoor video system for the house along with a couple of Smart Home devices.

author: Lauren E. Reese
title: A cloud-based digital picture frame that happens to have Alexa built in. When it works.
content:
UPDATE: I've already had to replace this under warranty once because of screen flickering problems, and I was too lazy to set up the photo album thing all over again, so now it doesn't even do that for me (but to be fair it would if I'd spend the time). Now the replacement is having more ambiguous issues where it occasionally turns off and won't come back on all day, even after being unplugged which makes me less than motivated to set up this one as I want since it'll probably have to go back too. If Amazon wants to upgrade me to a gen 2 echo show then this one will earn itself a couple of stars back just as a disposable placeholder device.

I'm overall satisfied with my purchase as I bought my show during a deep discount sale and got an additional 25% off with some coupons (Amazon move and another for my 1st Gen echo keeling over unexplainedly shortly out of warranty).
My favorite feature is that the Show acts as a digital picture frame and automatically adds photos I add to a prime photos album. Digital picture frames with similar functionality exist, but they're even more expensive than a Show and without Alexa built in.
I have my Show in the kitchen and use it regularly for timers and controlling the TV in the living room (open floor plan) and listening to audiobooks or music. The jeopardy skill is fabulous on the Show.

That said, I'm pretty disappointed that there aren't more skills by now designed specifically for the Show and I'm sad there's no option for Netflix or Hulu, on prime videos which can be lacking.

In summary: don't buy it at full price. Even now so long after launch, there's not much content to really utilize the screen. But if you have any desire for a 7" digital picture frame, totally scoop one up during the next sale. I'm planning on getting them for all the grandparents when Christmas rolls around again.

author: R. M
title: Great Product!
content: Huge fan of Amazon products and this does not disappoint. Easy to setup, easy to use and works with all your other Amazon products. New features are constantly being added. I highly recommend!

author: Gary J
title: Echo
content: I find it works quite well and am enjoying using it more everyday as I explore the things it can do. The one thing I found to be difficult was during the setup and connecting to my wireless network there was no way to obtain the mac address for the wireless adapter in the unit. As I use mac address filtering as part of my wireless security this information is needed. Normally the mac address for the adapter is printed on the device, printed on the box it comes in, or by displaying the settings from the device itself but this is not the case with the Echo Show.

author: Gayle S. Ocheltree
title: Alexa is an asset to my life
content:
My first computer was a Texas Instruments computer, we saved our info on audio tapes, we bought it at Toys R US. I've gone through so many tech refinements in my life, good and innovative growth for sure but I'm so tired of being accountable to technology. I want to use it but not be constantly socially and marketing accountable. I enjoy writing on paper, it's just a different way of thinking from my tech notes, I use both.

Which brings me to one of the most fantastic tech additions to my home and to my life. I changed the name from Alexa to "Computer" My Alexa was responding to commercials on my television. I use far less paper, music throughout my home, I have a DOT in my bedroom.  I get to say things into the AIR and with ease my "TO DO" list, my "GROCERY" list, my "NUTRITION" list, recipes in the kitchen "voice scroll". Not annoying it is totally fun. When the cleaning lady comes I say, "Computer, How do you say "clean the laundry room please" in Spanish?" Fantastic, its stated it out loud. It shows the English sentence and I would like it to also show the Spanish sentence as well. I'm doing Zoomba and talking to Alexa," calculate all logged carbs, fat, protein, fiber and calories on nutrition list for the day."
I'm trying to figure out how to put Alexa on my 55-inch Samsung smart TV. I am spending hours looking at Lego's with my grandkids via the DROP-IN function. Flash briefing in the morning, weather, word for the day, amazing. I don't want to BEND OVER to use technology . .  THIS PUT Technology IN THE AIR for me!

author: imollyq
title: So far , so good
content: It does not support YouTube without a complicated hack, but the hack does work. I do like it for cooking infor and the screen is nice for sing along when it plays a song I like. well worth it for the discounted price $100, but not for full price.

author: Carlos Wildhorse
title: ... the us — the idea was to make it easy for them to reach me whether I’m in the ...
content: I have several echos — I work In South Korea whereas my kids and family are in the us — the idea was to make it easy for them to reach me whether I’m in the bedroom, kitchen Or at the office — But instead they all ring at once.  And when I want to talk to a specific family member — who has their own device, it’s impossible because they’re minors and they all show up as their mothet’s account.  Whatever naming system they use it’s too limited by tying the account to the one email address.  I love the functionality of the echo — just wish the services were a little more sophisticated.  I really don’t like being limited by a a small Number Of wakeup commands, making it hard to have echos for different people in near proximity.

author: A. Jordan
title: Improved relations with my Mother!
content:
My dad passed two years ago. I was getting married, and although I was a professional who could easily afford an apartment on my own, I had to leave my mother alone so I can have my own life, without having to worry about her. For over a year and a half, we’ve been talking on the phone literally daily, just to make sure she’s ok and not too lonely. The phone can only do so much though, and we’ve had our share of fights, especially over finances.

My mother is technologically illiterate, even for a 68 year old. A apple iPhone or iPad, wouldn’t work. An amazon fire tablet, too complicated to use, or have it be charged. About the only technological she knew was how to turn on the tv, change channels, etc. and also turn on or off her cell phone ( read: dumb phone )

My mother lives about two hours away driving. It was at a point where every 3rd or so weekend, I was guilted for not coming to see her. This was getting out of hand.

By getting the show and being able to see her face, and vice versa, it has definitely improved our relationship, as well as helping the relationship between her and my wife. She now has no problem not seeing us physically for more than every 6 weeks! She loves that she can just call with her voice. It’s simple and easy.

We set it up so that we can drop in on her ( she’s not the type to be naked ), but she can’t drop in on us, and it has worked extremely well.

This is great!

Obviously we got the two pack.

author: Konahead
title: The echo show has alot of great features and the call feature is a big hit ...
content: The echo show has alot of great features and the call feature is a big hit with my grand children.  Two issues i hope amazon will address soon.  First is the tips that show up all the time on the screen.  I have my photo's on the screen when at rest so acts like a electronic pic frame.  The Tips are in the way and need to have a option to turn them off.  Second the speaker is not at good as the orginal echo this replaced.  If I am asking alexa to do things and facing the rear of the screen she doesn't always hear or understand me.  She responds better when you are facing the screen so the 360 degree speaker is not as strong as before.  Overall really like it.

author: GeraldRobi
title: Love the visual.
content: Still getting used to it... haven't figured out everything it does, but i ordered the Dummies book to help out.  It's great having stuff on the screen instead of having to ask for it all the time.

author: EnewEd
title: Great Addition to our Household !
content: This has been great so far! The drop in feature works well. However it would be better if it had a verbal alert that someone was dropping in, and a way to hang-up when done. The reminder & to do features work well with the screen. Overall I am very pleased with my Echo Show.

author: Boris Chang
title: Flickering screen with horizontal lines after two months.
content: I’ve noticed others with the same problem.  The screen flickers and has horizontal black lines jumping around.  This is unaccepatable quality control. I did reboot it and it doesn’t fix a defective display.

author: ImNoWeatherman
title: Potential, but lacking functionality
content: Functionality is extremely limited. Still no YouTube. Paired with ring doorbell, doesn't activate when the doorbell is pressed and can't communicate with the doorbell through the echo show (as echo show advertises). If you are planning to put this in your kitchen to follow recipes, buy it. Otherwise, I would suggest waiting until they fix the quirks and bugs in the functionality.

author: GP
title: Alexa is alive and well.
content:
It is a delightful device.  As a Prime member I have access to all types of music and videos.
My only real complaint is no comprehensive manual to give you inside info such as how to connect bluetooth to another device.  A list of comparable devices would be helpful too.  Otherwise delighted with all.

author: Bonita C.
title: ... bringing up the view so I have not been pleased with the Echo Show thus far
content: Purchase the Echo Show so we could see our cameras in our driveway and almost 99% of the time is has a problem bringing up the view so I have not been pleased with the Echo Show thus far, we have some of the other products example Alexa and Alexa Pod that we have been pleased with but the Echo Show not so much.....especially considering the price......just saying.

author: Melissa Banford
title: Lines through screen after 3 months.
content: I’ve never written a review before but I feel compelled after purchasing the Echo Show 1st generation.  I had a few other Echo devises including the Echo Plus and Echo Dot.  I’ve been move over a lot of my house to smart technology including lights, outlets and the like.  I don’t have a TV in my room.  Just this Echo Show.  It’s nice to have the screen savers with music to sleep.  I like being able to watch a show sometimes Although the prime feature is lacking quite a bit and it’s often hard for my Echo Show to find what I want to watch.  Sometimes I feel I have to “trick” it into finding the correct season of a show by asking to “show me” episodes of the Americans and then I can skip to the correct season.  There’s no way to search for show or movies even though I have Amazon Prime.  And all this was still worth it till the screen started flickering and running lines through it.  I’m past the return date and there doesn’t seem much I can do.  I’ve only had it for 3 or 4 months.  The Echo Show 2nd gen was released the next day after I bought this.  I think that would of been a much safer choice.  Maybe I’ll try again in the future with another model.  Thanks for trying though!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Enjoyable
content: I think I will really like this as I go along but a learning curve (for me anyway). Love the first command I gave it "Play Perry Como songs" and it played songs from various albums all morning! Lots of "I don't know." answers but I will get better at asking hopefully! Love that the time and temperature shows all the time as we are freezing here and I like keeping track of the temp at a glance. Curiously, just time and temp but then a cloud icon showed up surprisingly so am curious about that addition without knowing why. But overall enjoying it and think as I get better at asking it will be better at answering. A fun thing nevertheless. Many family members received one so am looking forward to seeing how the family connection works as we are scattered all over several states.

author: David Osler
title: We love the echo it Is taking the following us around ...
content: We love the echo it Is taking the following us around the house Even fight over to daily basis Life changing device And the show is the best of a lot It's great for playing music Unfortunately I can be as dumb as a five-year-old Everybody's Needs one It Can't do everything And Amazon if you're reading this Improve the bloody weather app Add centigrade With Fahrenheit Add wind chill and Make it look good

author: Carla
title: Totally worthless
content: This was the biggest mistake, purchase, I have ever made. I .got a set of these with the hope that I would be able to talk to and see my grandkids every day. This will not do that. The machine I have does not answer the simplest questions. It comes on at all hours of the night and starts talking, and scares me a lot! NOT FUNY. The settings change out of no where. The alarm never works. I have missed appointments. I would set the clock a couple times for times to go off during the day to test it out. Didnt go off. I set it for the morning appointments and after missing one I set two clocks, the other one was not from amazon. The echo I will ask for it to play a song and it doesnt even come close to playing what I ask for. I have a playlist that is "MY list" and it never gets it. So i go online and get my songs to play then when they are playing I ask for it to turn them either down or up and it will not answer me. I will scream out ECHO and nothing. So I have to do it manually. This is just not worth the effort and frustration. Now out of nowhere, the  time size has changed on the screen. That was the last reason I even left it out.... I do not sleep well at night at all, and need a clock that I can see at night. It did at least have the time correct and it was about an inch or so high so I could see it without my glasses. Now all of a sudden the time has shrunk to half the size and has dimmed so I can not even see it. My other mistake was not returning it when I could have. I kept thinking that it would get better and it was just a glitch and it would work itself out but nope. Instead it has gotten worse. This was not cheap and if I had not had the option to have six months to pay for it then I could not have gotten it. I just wish I had that money back now,

author: Roland
title: Maybe will get better over time
content: The potential is definitely there, but currently getting held back by buggy and feature lacking software. Basic image search barely works, and basic listening skills a significantly sub par from either of the Echos. Requires frequent reboots to keep stable. Amazon - get this right!!!

author: Just Lil' Ol' Me
title: Buggy, poor quality screen, terrible video playback stability.  It needs more time in the oven.  Expensive for what you get.
content:
Of all my Echo's (I have 7 of them), this is the worst of the bunch.

It is buggy as hell.  It locks up a lot.  Stability when watching video's is terrible.  And if you ask it questions or something while watching a video, it ends up dumping you back to the front page more often then it returns you to the video.  Very annoying.  I thought it was going to be perfect for the kitchen, but I was wrong.  I would return it but I'm outside the return window.

UPDATE: I can't change the score for the product.  It is what it is.  But what I can do is say as always for me, Amazon Support came through and took care of me, and I didn't even ask them :)

FIVE STARS for Amazon support.

Now, if you are after a large screen device that supports Alexa hands free, get the Kindle Fire 10.1 W/Alexa Hands Free.  Not only do you get an Alexa Device with a HUGE screen that does everything the show does and more (like YouTube via Web Browser :)), you get a full blown tablet to boot AND, BONUS!!!!! It's $100 cheaper!

At $100, the Kindle Fire W/Alexa Hands free is a winner.  it's not perfect, but works SO SO much better and it's wicked fast compared to the Show.

author: Amazon Josh
title: Terrible connectivity issues
content: I already owned the original Echo since it's initial release date and had great luck with it, in fact I moved it to my bedroom and it still works good.  This new Echo Show is terrible compared to it.  It loses connectivity constantly.  Not happy at all with it.  I'd return it if I could, but it's been over 30 days.

author: Rick Gustavus
title: Doesn't Akways Listen
content:
I have item sitting on the kitchen counter.
Thought it would be good to make grocery list etc...
Alexa does not understand commands and it is frustrating to constantly repeat myself.
Have same problem with an echo spot in the living room.

author: A. B. Green
title: It works
content:
It works I assume as it's supposed to, but it's most annoying stupid flash briefings or what ever they are can't be shut off, and I don't care about 90% of what it shows, it changes and draws my attention away from what ever I'm doing, very very annoying.

You have to use the touch screen for menus that is a pain since it's on a shelf and I have to stand to use it.

I hope it will get better as time goes by.

author: William E. Donnelly
title: Echo Show
content: This is the second Echo Show, 1st one was returned... I wish I could return this one ... sometimes it works OK but most of the time it doesn't sync with my Google Calendar and is not much better than a clock

author: Dave is my name
title: Requires a smartphone to video chat - How many 90 year olds have smartphones, Amazon?
content:
I'm giving this one star out of protest and will explain why:

The Echo Show is the PERFECT device for seniors. We purchased this for my 89 year old grandma so my kids could have video chats with their great grandma. BUT, to make/receive video calls (or any sort of call) on the Show, you need to have a smartphone. How many 90 year olds do you know who have a smartphone? If she had a smartphone, we wouldn't need to buy this for her! If they don't have a smartphone, you have to struggle through a bunch of steps to create a fake phone number attached to someone else's smartphone. It can be done, but it's a huge hassle and totally inconsistent with the Show's "easy to use" marketing. There is no reason why Amazon can't address this problem. The Show is basically a tablet. Tablets can use programs like Skype or Duo or Hangouts to do video chats without a smartphone. But the Show has this ridiculous barrier for those who don't have smartphones (who also happen to disproportionately be older people--people for whom the Show is supposed to be ideal). I will gladly change this review to 5 stars if Amazon fixes this major problem.

author: Granny2000
title: Love it!
content: I purchased four Echo Shows: one for my parents, one for my in-laws, one for my son in the military, and one for me. They work great, and our elderly parents (in their 80s) are enjoying much more than video visits! They enjoy asking Alexa questions, playing music, watching videos, having her flip a coin, seeing our photographs. My mother is not well, and it's super helpful to be able to have an "in person" visit. The only hiccup was getting my dad to remember her name! A side benefit is that my dad speaks more clearly since he began using Alexa, and he loves singing along with the music she plays. My in-laws dance once in a while instead of watching TV.

author: JGreer
title: I love this Echo Show
content: I love this Echo Show. I have the Echo tower in my kitchen and decided to add the show in my bedroom. I love how it shows the time and I can check my calendar each morning. I also love the ability to show my photos. I can even sit it in my lap and watch movies before bed time. I can manually delete items from my shopping list, without having to go into my app, so that's neat.  I don't like the you tube function. It's not user friendly. Overall, I love the Echo Show.

author: DB
title: Fantastic
content: Bought this for my wife. We have the Echo, two Echo Dots and the Tap. This is installed  in the kitchen.  It does all the other function of the other devices but the screen works great for looking at cooking steps. You tube etc., Makes a nice screen saver background. It dims at night It,s best use is the ability to talk to someone having the same device and being able to see them. We havn't tried this yet.  Overall it,s a great addition to our system or as a stand alone unit. The size is perfect, about seven inches square.

author: Peter
title: Better than you think
content: Amazing. We use it to control the TV, catch the weather, discover odds and ends, and video chat. From listening to music or rain sounds to catching what's showing at the local cinema, we think this is great! Echo is getting better and better all the time!

author: GotTurbo
title: Should have waited.
content: Product is mediocre at best. The software leaves a lot to be desired. I specifically have to ask mine 3 times to shut off the screen before it actually stays off. Should have waited a year till they actually have a decent product.

author: mikado48
title: Falls Short of the Possibilities
content:
We pre-ordered the Show, so we have had this as long as possible by now.  We have some other echo deicws and do really like those. The main drawback to the Show - for now - is that it doesn't come close to realizing the potential of its screen. Yes, the video drop-in is nice, but that requires someone else to have a Show. My plan, though, was to have this in the kitchen where I could pull up recipes, websites, videos, etc. In the very early days, there was a hack that allowed me to get to a browser and go from there, but that has since been plugged. We also used to be able to pull up videos, like the ads promised, on all sorts of topics via YouTube. Google apparently made Amazon stop that now as well. So we presently get clickbait news headlines and are able to play music with Amazon Unlimited Music - none of which needs a screen to project anything, it's just audio. Thus, as of right now, this is a glorified Echo or
Dot - not worth it. The possibilities seems to be a bit off, so if you want to order this, lower your expectations and hope that Amazon upgrades the software on this rather than requiring purchase of a new model.

*********************
After writing this review, I received a note from Amazon saying they do now have YouTube content available. That appears to be the case, but only temporarily since YouTube content will no longer be available after 1/1/18. I also meant to add that we don't seem to have access to Amazon Prime Video content, which is more baffling. So I stand by original review.

author: Drew V
title: Make the cord match the unit!
content:
Why is the power adapter cord black!! :(
I have a white echo and it came with a white cord. I want a white cord. I also want the front plating and speaker grill to be white. Black electronics and cords stand out like a sore thumb in my space. The white model should be all white including the power cord. Other than this I am happy so far with the item.

author: M Johnson
title: One Major Flaw
content:
**UPDATE** Rachel (From Amazon) did get this to work, but I have to use my daughter's cell phone to register my Mom's Echo Show. Which makes it awkward when your Mom wants to call you and has to say, "Alexa, call Daddy" LOL

While I'm writing this, I'm on the phone with Amazon customer service, trying to get Echo Show to work for my 86-year old mother. Apparently, if you don't own a smartphone (which many elderly people do not), you're kinda screwed.  This is truly a flaw that seems pretty basic, and excludes a huge portion of Amazon's potential customer base.  Hopefully, this will be changed, soon.

author: Dakota6
title: Awesome little Echo Show
content: Awesome Edition would be nice if you could do more a little difficult to understand why you can't play YouTube on it

author: Gramps
title: Am having a lot of fun with this new “toy”
content: Am having a lot of fun with this new “toy”. My daughter also bought one and surprised us with a drop in showing us her and the Grandkids. I am still learning a lot about Alexa and will continue to play. My wife hates talking to computers and will not talk even to Siri (she is a Mac person). But today Fedx delivered a package (they just put it on the porch and drive off) and we got the notifications on our watches that someone was at the front door. My wife is warming to Alexa. The ad that Alexa is constantly learning looking forward to the future.

author: Arturo S.
title: I love love love the SHOW
content: I purchased this on prime day for 79.99 and I regret not buying more!!! I love my Amazon Echo Show. I can even view my ring doorbell and ring spotlight cam on this device, it’s asesome! Friends never believe I got such a great deal. Amazon Warehouse Deals are the best!!

author: Philip Draco
title: Really buggy Amazon Video Integration.  Ok at other things.
content: Really buggy.  Keeps forgetting videos in my video library that I just watched.  Consistently shows irrelevant video search results, or repeatedly returns an error like "something went wrong".  No way to manually browse or select videos from the builtin UI or the Amazon Videos app.  "drop-in" voice prompts broke at least twice in the past year, trying to search contacts instead of devices.  Other things work ok.

author: Julie1978
title: Cool yet somewhat disappointing at same time..
content:
I got this as a gift for Christmas. There are already two Amazon echos in our house which we are overall pleased with (4 stars). As for this show, I really would give it 3.5 stars and this is why:

Pros: nice to have a screen, LOVE to see song lyrics, like your linked photos so easily to be viewed (even though the ones you take up and down on phone are considerably smaller), like that you can access prime video content, have read that you can use it for show to show video chat but personally haven't had the opportunity, has a good looking/interesting home screen

Cons: gets confused, says "something has gone wrong" regularly, not overly user friendly interface to search/select content in prime video, I repeat my commands a lot more often than to its echo counterparts, the games you can play on it (even with the buttons) are just so so, the voice clarity (for others to hear me) when using it to make calls is poor, the fact that the lowest subscription of music unlimited doesn't apply to the device and it's regularly difficult to understand its voice (pronunciation/inflection)

I hope Amazon is working to improve it...

author: Barbara C. McLaughlin
title: Love it!
content: Being "technologically challenged", wasn't sure how we'd feel about the Echo and Alexa when our daughter got it for us as a Christmas present.  I'm sure that we haven't used everything that the Echo provides but we love setting reminders for appointments, playing music and videos and video chats with grandchildren.  I experiment with it every day to find new things to explore.

author: N. Dao
title: Echo Show review
content: I have 5 Echo Dots, 1 Echo, and 1 Echo Show.  I have not found anything useful from the Echo Show that I cannot get from the Echo Dot.  Audio is mediocre, limited on what you can get on the small screen of the Echo Show.  Presently I found the Echo Show impractical.  Do not recommend this product.

author: RDB
title: New device and pretty good but needs some time
content:
I bought this as a radio for my kitchen (be sure to get a screen skin because there is grease in a  kitchen) and it is pretty good for that use.  The software needs lots of help.  For example making a slide show behind music takes several commands and if they are done in the wrong order it is a mess.  The home screen constantly shows "Try this..." ads and I really don't want to see that -- but is there a way to turn it off? Seems not.

But all in all I am happy with the purchase.

author: Michael M
title: NO LONGER Better than expected BIG DOWNGRADE WITH LOSS OF MUSIC UPLOADS
content:
I have 2 Echo Shows (so far) and they are turning out to be much better than I was expecting. Some of my favorite features are:

-Using Drop In for room to room video intercom calls is excellent and I plan to expand my system to more rooms for this feature alone.

-The family loves having lyrics displayed when they play music

-The viewing angle works well for desk and countertop viewing and the units are solid enough to stay put when you are pressing the touchscreen. A stationary device is a huge improvement over struggling to hold and use a tablet in the kitchen or at your desk.

-The touchscreen and voice complement each other better than I expected. Voice commands put you directly on the screen you want without tapping through layers of menus and the touchscreen makes it easy to select something that would be awkward to articulate as a verbal command.

-Viewing security cameras is an awesome feature and is another reason I will be buying more of these.

-I was also surprised how handy it is to have Alexa show me a numbered list of YouTube videos or my music playlists and then select one by telling her to "play number x"

Looking forward to getting some more of these!

Update 1/15/18 Reducing the rating because I can no longer upload songs that are not available from streaming services. This has greatly diminished the value of my Echos. I am considering a move to another platform that can play all of the music that is important to me.

author: Jule West
title: Not perfect, but getting there!
content:
I haven't had my show very long or used it a lot, but I love it! I use it to set timers when cooking because my stove is being finicky and not wanting to work most of the time. I also use it to check for different recipes, listen to music and my all time favorite.... telling everyone it is time for dinner. My son gets a real kick out of that!

I know a lot of people are expecting more out of their shows then it is possible to at the moment, but remember the original echo didn't have what it has now when it first came out. I see that Amazon is adding new stuff all the time and soon I am sure it will have all that we want very soon.... maybe even things we haven't thought of!

I do wish it was a bit more user friendly. I still haven't figured out how to video chat with my cousin in North Carolina who also has one, and when I tried to call my son's dot it went to video chat immediately, last I looked, dots don't have video screens!

Another thing that needs to be addressed is when my husband tried to have the one in our bedroom play thunderstorm sounds to help him go to sleep, it tried to get him to buy an app instead of playing the skill I had enabled that was free. So now he is a bit worried to use it again. That needs to be fixed.

I do have to say that all in all I am very happy with my Echo Show!

author: Sharon
title: The most useless piece of "technology" ever created
content: Echo Show is the most useless piece of technology I have ever wasted my money on. Unfortunately by the time I had an opportunity to set it up, my return window had closed. Seriously this is a piece of junk that doesn't understand simple questions anyone asks of it beyond the unwanted prompts that automatically appear on the screen. On top of that, when asked to elaborate even on those useless bits of information, Alexa consistently fails and mindlessly repeats over and over the original soundbite. The only thing it seems to do is play music, but even that it cannot find most musicians or songs you request. Do not make the same mistake I did. Save your money for something (anything!) else!!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: The Dot worked great and is what induced me to get the Show
content: I had a Dot before buying the Show.  The Dot worked great and is what induced  me to get the Show.  Very handy to have something that can set timers, make grocery lists, control my thermostat, etc.  The problem with the Show is it does not hear anywhere near as well as the dot.  My Dot now sits in my back room, the show in my main living area.  Often the Dot hears me when the Show does not when i give commands standing  in my main living area, or the Show just does not hear me at all.  I've tried moving it around a little and am convinced it is not its position, but rather an inferior microphone.  Not sure if it is a deficient product in general or isolated issue relative only to mine.

author: DTM
title: ... would be helpful for her and enable us to easily voice chat
content:
Purchased for my 77 year old mother hoping it would be helpful for her and enable us to easily voice chat.. Overall as advertised and useful for me, but she found it difficult and WAY to much change.

My only complaint is that setting up video calling latterly requires a smart phone with access to your contacts. My mother has the Amazon Fire tablet which she also does not use, but that is not sufficient.
