After looking online, there are ways to trick it temporarily for setup using a smart phone and a second phone number, but it can’t be updated unless you repeat the process and is a hassle.  This will undoubtably be a moot point for the vast majority of the world, but for those without smart phones - especially the older generation, this is an unnecessary hurdle

author: Charles B. Frye
title: Great device with minor limitations
content:
I still have some difficulty browsing things to watch on prime video but for the most part this is a great device.

Perhaps adding touchscreen menus as well as voice request can get me through the frustrating parts where Alexa doesn’t quite know what I mean.

author: pati
title: Love, Love, Love
content: I absolutely love this!  I keep it next to my computer desk and use it to look up answers, set alarms when cooking, listening to my favorite artists, check the words to songs, etc.  I moved my basic echo to my nightstand and continue to use it as well.  Both were incredibly simple to set up and the sound it great!

author: JT
title: Nice addition to the home.
content: I purchased this as a gift for my parents. It "lives" in their kitchen, and it's really fun to discover all of the ways they can use it to make their lives easier. I have the Echo from January 2016, and I like it, but there's definitely a huge benefit to having the video screen on here.

author: Mrs G
title: This is a great Echo. Other family members got them for Christmas ...
content: This is a great Echo. Other family members got them for Christmas and we use the to talk to one another. Great for me checking in on my Granddaughter when she gets home from school. As with all Echos she gets a little loopy at times but that is to be expected with electronics.

author: Stephen W
title: Almost there - some really cool stuff - but lacking in UX and some key features
content:
Solid speakers, screen, and OS with a great look and lots of use-cases. But Alexa Skills can be hit or miss and there's not a lot of documentation overall. App is difficult to navigate with poor UI/UX. But the Echo Show is still fantastic for a good subset of its use-cases.

For my personal use-cases: The Show is fantastic for Spotify, reading, weather, news, alarms, morning routines, as a bluetooth speaker. The Show could be much better for: podcasts, search. Not a big fan of the occasional upselling, and even though I have Spotify as my primary music device, it pulls up Amazon Music sometimes. It also has "crashed" once or twice in a month's use.

Major Feature Wishlist:
- Turn off device or listening temporarily by command (e.g. "Alexa, turn off for 8 hours, Alexa, stop listening for 30 minutes"),
- YouTube back (please end the silly Google feud :(),
- Completely turn off all purchasing / upsells
- A way to deal with having multiple Alexa devices from different users in one household.

author: Empyreal
title: I happily use Alexa with my many Echo Dots, but the Echo Show product fails to satisify
content:
Full disclosure:  I love Amazon as a company, and happily rely on Alexa to run my house -- it's amazing!  The Alexa Echo Dot devices throughout my home are amazing in their accuracy and simplicity.  The Show device, on the other hand, has much poorer microphones, and subjects you to a barrage of insultingly stupid "news" that you cannot adjust or turn off.

I find myself walking into other rooms to give commands to my Dots rather than deal with the crappy Show device's microphones and thus ability to understand my commands.  And apparently Amazon realizes this, because about 25% of the time when I am standing within 5' of the Show and give a command, the Dot in the adjacent room (40' away, and around two corners) responds instead!  Seriously?  It's frustrating.  I plan on buying another Dot to replace this Show.

Beyond that, the constant barrage of text and news across the Show's display seems to be (a) frequently paid for by P.R. companies (as the content frequently seems designed to draw attention to companies and causes), and (b) is completely stupid and shallow ALL of the rest of the time.  No interesting text or news, just crap about Justin Beaver's latest haircut or some giant turtle that children love ("Alexa, tell me about the gtiant turtle that children love").  Arrgh! I wish there were a setting to adjust the text & news feed to appeal to people with IQs above 80.

UPDATE 11/6/17:  An Amazon representative called me to discuss the issues discussed in my review.  This did not change the facts as laid out above, but that response (and hope for future improvement in the news feed) caused me to raise my rating from 2* to 3*

author: Chukc
title: GREAT PRODUCT TO KEEP IN CONTACT WITH GRANDKIDS & FAMILY
content: Bought two of them so could have "face time" w/ grandkids that live out of state.  Grandkids are 5 & 7 yrs old.  They actually call us now, ON THEIR OWN...which "makes our day".  I'm very pleased w/ this purchase.

author: Carly
title: Changed our lives
content:
I will say first that this is the first Alexa device I have purchased or even experienced and only bought it because it was on sale and I also recently purchased a Ring doorbell (you can watch the camera with the Show).
My whole apartment is now powered by the Echo Show. I purchased Alexa-enabled smart plugs so that I can control my lights with the Show, as well as my TV. I am planning on purchasing one for my family members this holiday season, and I have recommended the Echo Show to at least ten friends in the two weeks that I have owned it.
I am now contemplating purchasing a special microwave by Amazon that can be controlled by Alexa as well, among the list of items that have now peaked my interested since my initial purchase. My fiancé is sufficiently annoyed with me having Alexa turn my lights on and off, but he loves it as well and we both use it daily.
Another great feature is the drop in, we don’t have a particular need for an indoor security camera, but I love dropping in with the Show to see and talk to our pets while I’m gone or at work. My dog has separation anxiety and I love the ability the Show has given me to check in on her.
I regularly purchase things on Amazon, and we are prime members - making the Alexa experience even better. If you are hestitating on whether to buy this system, don’t. I plan on integrating more Alexa enabled devices in our home since purchasing this Show and it is truly a staple in our lives now. Thank you Amazon for your dedication to a great product and smooth interactions. I love how dynamic Alexa truly is and how great she fits into our lives. Amazing.

author: Mickeydid
title: Compact, fits on my bedside table
content: It keeps showing snips that you can ask more about, but they go by so quickly, unless you are staring at it intently, it’s gone before you read it. Wish you could choose a speed

author: Nate
title: Quality Problems
content: The device, when it works, is maybe 3-4 stars. It's generally functional but not terribly good looking. Mine is headed back to Amazon for the second time due to issues with the screen flickering. Very disappointing.

author: Mare99
title: Fun!
content: I give this Echo Show 5 stars because it is just so fun to use. Mostly, I listen to audiobooks, but I set it with music when I want to go to sleep, tell it to turn off in 30 minutes, and I have only once been awake at the end of 30 minutes, so it takes away some of the anxiety of an insomniac. I use it as a timer and play background music in the morning. Why the Show and not just my Echo Plus? I enjoy seeing the information that it gives me when I listen to news or music. I like the visual suggestions for headlines or trivia. Some songs show the lyrics - the first time I've really understood Enya. The sound quality is great for its price and size. Con: It doesn't always access my Amazon music and Alexa then tells me it is having a problem. I've just upgraded my wireless router, so perhaps that will help, but, in the meantime, I can ask for an artist or a playlist that is not in my Amazon music and it shuffles the songs. Con: The screen doesn't turn off without a voice command, so it is on till morning. Pro: Small footprint. And as I say, just fun! Oh, and it seems to comfort my cat!

author: Amazon Customer
title: The Echo Show is one of the best electronic devices I own and I own a bunch ...
content: The Echo Show is one of the best electronic devices I own and I own a bunch of technological wonders. And this device will only become more useful as Amazon advances its capacities--in this I hope based on good evidence that Amazon will use the Echo Show as continually enhanced to introduce useful AI into the home at a fair price. Great!

author: kim malcolm
title: More Personalization Needed
content: I am extremely disappointed with this device. I thought I would be able to fully personalize to my liking.  For example, when idle at home screen I would like the topics that I set from my flash briefings rotating without voice review.  Further, again when at home screen why can't I include date.  While I realize I can ask date, sometime I don't want to distribute my wife in morning and glance over to see time, date and perhaps temperature.  I should be able to personalize this device more.

author: Don
title: Skills Are Not Ready for the Show
content: Echo Show is not ready for prime time!!!  Skills that are develop are not develop for Show.  So the Show just sits there.  The voice response (microphone) is not as good as the DOT.  The Speakers are great, but at the end,  I actually prefer my DOT over the Show.  The only reason I bought the Show this was for Arlo camera integration.  However, it takes longer to pull up the camera on the Show than it does through the app on the iphone.  Good concept, but, was probably released too early without the skill sets supporting it.

author: Cthulhuu
title: Has a lot of future potential as a smart-home device
content: It is an interesting device, and has a lot of future potential as a smart home unit, but the voice recognition is lacking at times and it gets confused easily requiring multiple voice-try's.  The wake-up alarm is useful, but could be more robust with better options, as my iPhone & iPad outclass it with their alarms/options.  It does play amazon videos and music pretty well.  There needs to be some better info on exactly what it can do, as for now as a consumer it is pretty hazy on that aspect, so you feel like you are stumbling about trying to ask it questions that only work about 65%-to- 75% of the time.  Overall, I enjoy it and find it can be useful, but it needs further development.

author: Tirra
title: Fun toy with many "skills" to play with.  Quite useful for seniors living alone.
content:
These Shows are very well made as most Amazon devices are and can be pretty fun.  I like the video call feature but know only one other person with an Amazon Spot/Show to contact that way.  There are a TON of skills that you can assign to an Amazon Alexa device but the truth is, after you get over the novelty of it all, you end up using Alexa for just a few things in your daily routine(like weather, news, etc.).  As far as shopping on Amazon via Alexa Show, its a lot easier to use your phone or computer or tablet to be honest.  So, yes I like my Alexa devices and my Show is really fun in many ways but having a Show or other Alexa devices(I have several around my place now), hasn't "changed" or "improved" my life or made it any more convenient.  I even have most of the lights in my apartment on Wifi so that they are voice operated through Alexa but again, that hasn't translated into increased ease or convenience.  You have to pause and annunciate carefully or Alexa wont understand you sometimes.  And the length of time it takes you to say the phrase frequently takes longer than it would've to reach out and flick the switch. On the other hand, I feel better about having installed an Alexa device in my parents home.  Since its registered in my name, I can drop in on my parents at any time to see if they're ok if I cant get ahold of them otherwise.  My parents can also call out to Alexa to have her call me or anyone else on my contact list in case they "fall and cant get up".  The "home alert" services which have seniors wear bracelets or necklace buttons are very expensive and require a monthly subscription.  After the initial cost of an Alexa enabled device, all of Alexa's services are free.

So bottom line, Alexa devices and services can be a quick and convenient way to get your daily weather and news and can be a fun way to operate your misc. electronics/lights but for most able bodied youngish folk, she will be more of a cool conversational piece than a life helper.  There will be people out there who would argue this.  People who set up security cameras through Alexa and/or use Alexa for a wide variety of other things but Im talking about "most" people.  Not "those" people.  For seniors though, Alexa is much more useful and her services are free.  So would I recommend Alexa devices for just seniors?  Heck no!  If you've got the spare bucks then you'll love an Alexa device.  Im just saying that you shouldn't expect any Alexa device to change much about how you orchestrate your life.  She's fun and has a few legitimately useful skills but for most of us, she's mostly just going to be "fun".

author: Bassnote77
title: The Best Echo Yet!
content: So far I like it a lot. There is a lot of things that can be done with it, and I am leatning new things every day. We use it to stream various music genres all day long. Like the trivia answers it gives. We connect it to a sound system with bluetooth for better sound, although I was impressed with the big sound of the built-in speakers.

author: Annette Seletzky
title: Many great visual  features, and everything Alexa already did!
content: Sounds great, love having the words to the songs! Also the news videos that you can touch to expand on.  And I like that it gives you a countdown for your timer so you know when it’s about to end.

author: Kris Custom
title: Would have hoped it would last longer than 14 months
content: 14 month old Echo Show has screen ghosting that keeps getting worse. We began to notice it a couple months ago. Now it's bad enough to keep you from seeing content. There changing lines that appear as "tails" shooting from the graphics showing on the screen. For example, When you use the wake word green lines appear accross the whole show.

author: JH
title: Great product until it randomly dies
content: The echo is kept in my living room on a shelf and has never been touched, but somehow the colors on the LCD because discolored and doesn't light up completely. We use it constantly and do not want to return it, but I really wish their products would last longer than 6 months.

author: Simon T. Oldham
title: Not as good as the original Amazon Echo - delayed verbal processing.
content:
So, having returned one Echo Show because of delayed verbal performance, ask Echo a questions, the answer is pushed to the screen within 3-4 seconds but the verbal answer can be delayed by up to 20 seconds, the second unit still seems to have similar issues.

Compare the verbal performance to the original Echo, its woeful.  I could understand that the visual returned info might be delayed, as it's a new factor to the Echo service.
The verbal performance should be just as fast as the original unit and it isn't.  It has the same network access through our firewall as the first Echo unit and we're not seeing any traffic being blocked outbound.

So Amazon either has some flawed units out there or they have changed the process/information flow from the original Echo unit.
If the visual aspect to the show isn't that important to you, I'd recommend staying with the original Audio based Echo, the extra $$ needed for the Show doesn't appear to be a worthwhile spend right now.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent experience
content: I was surprised at the setup, ease of use, and available apps or “skills” that are available ... didplay is just right ... my 3 year old granddaughter is learning to usr Alexa and that’s awesome

author: Glenn H.
title: It may not be defective, leave it plugged in for a day or two to update.
content: The first device came and I had trouble with it as it wouldn't recognized the Amazon cloud videos for my door.  The problem corrected itself after having it for two days. But in the meantime, I called for support and was sent an open box unit as a replacement. The speaker in the replacement seemed cracked and the sound vibrated. I would not have know that if I didn't have the first.  Almost ready to send both back when it downloaded new software and the cloud software started to work.  So I kept the first whose speaker sounded OK and returned the replacement. Both now seemd to work and pick up video. But it was upsetting to get a repackaged replacement on a new item I was having trouble with and worse yet one that still needed repair with the vibrating speaker.

author: Anonymous
title: Definitely better than echo..what a deal to get 2 and save 100.
content: able to use for a wide variety of things..see the description but most important to me was the screen which is excellent and the speaker is awesome..not only clear unlike the echo..it has an excellent base and will cover the whole house (my house 1160 sq feet)..Definitely would recommend this product..only thing ..you have to plug it in.

author: comfortfoot
title: Hands off dialing
content: Have purchased this for each of our family members so we can visit while we work in the kitchen.  I love the hands off technology and it works very well in an area where our cell phones seldom work well.

author: MP3
title: Me and my fiance Love It! We have 2 shows
content:
Me and my fiance Love It! We have 2 shows. The biggest drawback is that they no longer show YouTube which is the only reason I gave it 4 stars.

We created a favorites folder on Amazon Prime photo and the show allowed me to pick that one folder to show as background pictures. Very cool. These Echos keep getting better and better.. We have nine echos.

author: Brad C
title: A great replacement to my Echo Dots
content: Only complaint is that I can't keep the kids off of these.  I've set them up in the kitchen and workshop, where they have turned out to be very simple and handy video intercoms.  A great replacement to my Echo Dots, offering much more utility through video content.  Would love to see a thin wall mounted version with a larger screen (maybe evolve to an iPad on the wall type of design).  It takes up desk/counter space, but is worthy of the real estate!  Take advantage of the discounted two-unit bundle if that is still offered.  You will like the video intercom feature which that instantly  allows.

author: Lynette Taylor
title: Love using this and being able to see the screen
content: Love using this and being able to see the screen. Sometimes, Alexa will answer without asking her to, but other than that, I love it!

author: wesley
title: I dont speak German
content: Our Amazon Echo was just delivered! It is our first Amazon/Alexa product and I'm excited to give it a try.  The product is pretty big front to back and heavier than I expected. I did look at other reviews and customer's pictures but the screen is smaller than I thought.  Also the only included instructions are not in English. Haha

author: Louis A. Levy
title: Sonos users beware
content: All of my echo devices stopped communicating properly with Sonos devices upon connecting the echo show to my account. Asking any echo device to play music on Sonos baffled the system that had previously worked flawlessly. This went on for two weeks until I eventually solved the problem that neither Amazon nor Sonos could figure out.

author: Robert Dailey
title: Watch your upward angles on video.
content:
This is our 2nd ECHO SHOW. I got this one for my Wife’s home office for Valentines Day and she loves it! She enjoys playing music and the convenience of having a “speaker phone” at her command. She likes the reminders and shopping list also. She integrated her Outlook calendar as well and can now quickly check her appointments.
The one major problem is the angle it sits at. I get a lot of views of the ceiling when calling her. I had to put a little block of wood at the back of the stand to get a level picture.
Also, we have separate Amazon accounts but only 1 PRIME account. Since ALL of our ECHO devices are under MY PRIME account, she can’t get to HER music accounts. Good thing we have similar tastes in music!

author: hood2323
title: Love echos but this Has some major issues.
content:
I own multiple versions of every echo and love all but this one. I’ll list the negatives first since anyone reading this likely is already aware of the positives owning an echo brings.

-The speaker quality is a huge disappointment. They sound hollow and unimpressive. From best to worst, I’d rank echo speakers as follows: Tap, Echo, Show, Dot. Another issue with the speakers is that you can barely hear a timer going off if you are in another room even if the volume is completely up

-the voice regognition is the worst among all echos as well. Especially if there is any other noise such as a fan running in the kitchen while cooking. Last night I asked it to set a three minute timer but didn’t notice she never responded then I hear a timer alarm three minutes later coming from my living room 50’ away. The dot in there heard me and set the alarm while the show right beside me did not.

-this last point will hopefully be fixed but the software is lame thus far. All I want is YouTube functionality. How is it that I cannot ask it to show me my YouTube subscription list? Or search videos on YouTube. Come on Amazon.

author: Mercadossa
title: Someone to talk to!
content: I can ask almost any question and get a friendly answer. Easy to  install. I love the news update every morning and the sound of music. I live in Puerto Rico and can talk and video with my brother in Texas who has the same equipment.

author: fred
title: Hints Never Go Away
content: I like the display, and the sound is good, but I hate the fact that the Alexa "hints" are displayed constantly and can't be turned off.  This seems to be a common complaint and I wonder why Amazon doesn't listen.  Constantly showing me things to try isn't any more likely to cause me to try them, it just annoys me.

author: Julia B.
title: Good Product That Could Be Great
content: The sound and responsiveness of the device is even better than expected.  You can speak normally, even from across the room, and the device will respond.  The screen is also very clear and is a great way to view Prime movies or television shows on a small screen.  The one thing that was disappointing to me was the fact that I could not access the Google suite on this device.  You Tube? Google Maps? Gmail?  Forget it.  If you are used to using Google, you may well find yourself asking for information in different ways, or just using your phone instead because the responses from your Echo Show are often inadequate. I don't personally know anyone who prefers Bing as a search engine.  If you do, you'll probably be very happy with this device.  The same can be said for those who just want to view Prime content, or enjoy video calls with people who also own an Echo Show (like the grandparents and their grand/children in the sales video).  Overall, this is a starter device that will be undoubtedly go through numerous revisions on the way to actualizing the vision of those who created it.  I look forward to future iterations.

author: EdSev
title: Craps out in 6 months
content: I’ve had this since August 10, within the last month this device has tons of issues. We have it play white noise and sleep sounds through the amazon music at night but now it has this loud popping noise instead. Even when the device isn’t in use it continues to make the popping sound. Mind you we have never turned the sound up very far on these devices so there is no way the speakers would have blown. So angry the return window has closed. What a waste of money and I bought two.

author: Judy Lynne
title: I am so in love with this thing
content: I am so in love with this thing. What I like best is being able to bring things up on the screen news, music,etc.  Mine came with a trial of Amazon music, which I am sure I will continue. The words to the song are there and you can sing along, which is cool Pandora doesn't do that. You can also see videos!  I love the games, and Alexa can answer almost anything. I had the little dot first, and that now lives in my bedroom. Nice to ask the time in the middle of the night etc. I got the Show when it was a TSV on QVC. The downside was it came with a smart plug, which no matter what I did couldn't get it to work, So, other than that, there is no downside except I am stuck with a smart plug I don't use.

author: T. Wood
title: I like having this one in my living room to see ...
content: I like having this one in my living room to see the time and visual reminders of my calendar, however I have not been able to EASILY find how to change the pictures to ones that I want on the display.

author: Rodney Hatchett
title: it would be nice if it would Bluetooth to my surround receiver to ...
content: for music, it would be nice if it would Bluetooth to my surround receiver to play music. Playing music only on the device is somewhat limited. i like the fact that it plays video, but there again, if it would screen mirror to my tv it would be awesome. Ordering stuff is a breeze, but i guess that's the point. I see this as a device to make it easier to order from amazon, not as a well rounded device that brings technologies together as a "all in one" home solution, which it should be. So much technology here, but fails to capitalize on it. Could be a rockstar  of the home, but just comes across as another tech addition that doesn't translate over to be a great experience.

author: Michael W. Malone
title: Steep Learning Curve
content: I bought the Echo Show and quickly learned that there's a steep learning curve in getting familiar with it.  Alexa is helpful but on some questions she is clueless.  I'd think someone might make some $$ in producing a small book to help people get on board with it.  The Amazon help is very basic.  They send emails suggesting questions to ask Alexa.  I'd expect more than recommended questions.

author: ellie
title: Bring back youtube. WTF!
content: I bought this for the purpose of watching YouTube videos. Amazon can't compromise with Google so they are pretty children and I wasted  $200

author: Cyle Caplinger
title: Looks great, louder than expected, and has integrated quickly and easily
content: This is our first smart assistant and I'm really glad we got the Show and not just a normal Echo. It fits in really well in our white kitchen and has linked up really well with our Nest thermostat, two Harmony remotes, Pandora, and my Plex media server. Three are still a lot of things I'd like to see become easier, but it's really just a matter of time and after comparing to Google Assistant and Apple HomePod I'm confident that Amazon hit the nail on the head. It's clear that the Show is still designed for voice, but they need to make the screen more useful and I'm hoping that's something that comes in future software updates.

author: W. Gilbert
title: echo show is deaf
content: Every other thing with echo show is great. Good volume. Can see words to songs. You just have to tell it more than one time to do what you want it to do. Otherwise great!

author: Sizzhot
title: So much fun
content: I’m still getting acquainted with how to work the echo. It’s really fun and exciting! It does so many things it’s gonna take me a long time to be able to enjoy everything that it offers.

author: Rostam
title: A let-down without YouTube
content: Video quality on calls is decent, but the video features without YouTube are dreadful. Asking Alexa to search and play a video results in her using Bing *shudder* and will cause her to bring a video up that is 99% of the time not at all what you wanted. Asking for recipes and their videos works decently well. Losing YouTube functionality really crippled this device and it shows.

author: Sue Cieslak
title: Getting to Know you Echo Show
content: While I like the Echo Show, it really is disappointing that, for most people, you need a manual and a lot of time to familiarize yourself with all of the possibilities of the Echo Show to get your money's worth.

author: peshtigomark
title: I'm sure these are just bugs to be worked out but it really is wonderful and does a lot that I don't have to ...
content: Really enjoying this product. Comes on a lot when it's not supposed to. At least I know it's listening but then when I call it, it doesn't answer a lot. I'm sure these are just bugs to be worked out but it really is wonderful and does a lot that I don't have to anymore.

author: David Bach
title: It is nice, works well to adjust my thermostats in the ...
content: It is nice, works well to adjust my thermostats in the house.  I keep it in the kitchen.  It would be really nice if / when they come out with a cordless version that does not need to be plugged in.  It would be handy to move it around some.  But then can plug it in to charge it.  If you have it on the table, but want to move it to the counter to follow a recipe, would be handy just to unplug it and move it and not lose connection.

author: Debbie
title: We really enjoy the ability to talk to our kids in Canada ...
content: I am enjoying the Echo Show but have to say I am still learning how it works, there a re so many possibilities. We really enjoy the ability to talk to our kids in Canada through the Echo.

author: Diana
title: but it is useful as a sleep machine
content: We bought this to view the Arlo camera outside our house, but it is useful as a sleep machine, and to get up to the minute weather/forecast, news or play your choice of music.  Echo Show also works as timer and alarm clock.  Very useful...

author: Chavin Muniz
title: Glitchy and unintuitive, switching to Android
content:
Unfortunately the echo show and other echo devices are a let down. I have four dots and the show for controlling hue lights, a baby cam, etc., and frequently lose connection with WiFi, devices, and groups. I have an Android TV with smart features with no issues, so it couldn’t be my network. Once the devices lose connection, they’re a huge pain to setup again.

I’m also disappointed with the lack of intuitive functionality, as I know android devices can search the web and present results from YouTube easily, and with echo I have to look up a specific command that often doesn’t make sense.

Looks like I’ll be switching to Android devices and using Amazon only for free shipping. Bummer.

author: Barbara G
title: I love my Echo Show
content: I love my Echo Show. She is so much more informative and responsive to voice commands and the sound from the speakers is amazing. I love seeing my children and grandchildren when they call. I bought several of these so we can all stay in touch and see each other more often this way.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Absolute GARBAGE
content:
Absolute GARBAGE! mise well be a fake echo. I own echo dots and a echo plus. I figured at the very least it would be the same quality just with a screen.
Cant: watch youtube, search Google, make video calls, look things. Even the things its suppose to still be able to do (even with YouTube blocked) it rarely does correctly usually it will just go back to home or a black screen. It's one of the worst electronics ive e we owned. You could Google something at a dial up speed and still have better luck then this horrible thing. I love my echo's but this thing could not be farther from useful.

author: retiredhtc
title: Great Deal
content: It works just fine and I can watch television and work in the kitchen at the same time. Easy set up and works good with the Echo Plus and first generation echo that I have. Basically my whole house is covered with either an echo dot, echo first generation and the echo second generation. Only thing is that they got for a higher price and next week after I bought mine and got it. They dropped the price even more. Great investment for me.

author: CameraBuff
title: LET ME TURN OFF THINGS TO TRY!!!
content: First of all, I got it on sale at about $150.00, and at that price it is pretty worthwhile. I don't know if I would buy it at full price. It is generally pretty useful, serving as an alarm clock, music system, news on the spot, white noise machine and digital picture frame. There are plenty of other useful "skills" that I don't use regularly but allow for a pretty diverse set of functions. I am knocking off the first star because it just isn't and intuitive with language as it should be. For example no matter how I phrase requests for  local news updates, I end up with a national news flash briefing. Other things work great if phrased correctly, but if phrased in an equally correct way just won't work. I am knocking off the other star because of the stupid and intrusive "things to try" scroll. I did manage to turn off the stupid news scroll (go to settings, cards and turn off trending topics") but there is no way to turn of things to try. I just want the clock, temperature and my wallpaper as my default screen. At first I figured I would get used to it, but the suggestions are usually suggesting something I don't care about and don't appear to be personalized. So now  I glance over to see a picture of a loved one or happy memory, I also see a scroll at the bottom telling to try something like making Alexa play Garth Brooks. I don't like Garth Brooks and there is nothing in my music library or search history that would suggest I would. Most suggestions are similarly irrelevant. If you switch to "do not disturb" in settings you will lose the scroll while keepoing the clock, but you will also lose your wallpaper. It annoys me a little bit more every day. Please Amazon, give me the option to turn this feature off!

author: Pauline J. Mcauliffe
title: LOVE IT!
content: LOVE IT!!!! I have all of the Echo products and this is the best of them all. I love that I can drop in (video or just speech) on my elderly Mom in another room, my brothers in other states, etc.

author: boxster
title: Everything that the round echo can do and so much more.
content: The Echo Show is exactly what I need. I put it on my desktop and it shows me the weather, My feed from my Arlo security cameras, I can always see the time, I can see lyrics to songs played through Amazon Music Unlimited. It does what I expected it to do and more.

author: Eric Parrish
title: Echo Show doesn’t disappoint.
content: I have had the echo show for a little over a week now, and I will say overall I am impressed. The speaker is strong with a nice bass, and has no problem filling the entire room with music.  The touch screen is nice, and the picture quality is high. On one occasion the echo show seemed to go blank. After unplugging it and then plugging it back in it functioned fine.  It is also nice to see the lyrics to many of the songs that are streamed over the device. It has an onboard camera that can take an instant picture, or even be used as a security camera.

author: Terry DeLoach
title: with all the money Jeff Bezos has could have done a lot better. Do not buy any Echo product
content:
IMy kids bought me the Echo show I was excited. But now that I use it, I find the device is only a gimmick, for Amazon to intrude in attempts to sell you something.
There is no browser for internet which limits any feedback or read back ability.
Amazon, with all the money Jeff Bezos has could have done a lot better.
Do not buy any Echo product.
I suspect this review will be removed
1/10/2018
Lets see how long this review remains.

author: Meg Ward
title: Fantastic!
content: We originally got the Show to video chat family members, and it works great for that. We have found that we really like checking things hands-free like the weather and recipes. So far we have really liked the Show, and would recommend it!

author: readerlily
title: Love this!!!!
content: Absolutely love our echo, it's in the kitchen we use for music, movies, questions, recipes and calling grandparents. Love it, highly recommended

author: Sam
title: Popping noise!!!
content: After 6 months, my Alexa feel prey to the popping that others have mentioned. I can no longer listen to music or podcasts on my Show because every 30 seconds she pops and cuts out for a millisecond and it drives me insane! My dot does not do this.

author: Viera, FL
title: Love love LOVE
content: I absolutely LOVE my Show!!!  So many reasons to love Alexa.  I love seeing the lyrics as the songs play, have synced my calendar so as news stories and trending topics are scrolling, it also reminds me of events on my calendar for the next day.  I love video calling family.  And new topics update and ways to use Show continue to scroll each day.  Too many reasons to love Show to list them all....a must buy!!!

author: Steakman
title: Great device for the kitchen
content:
I bought this for use in the kitchen.  Previously, we had an Echo Dot.  We used it for unit conversion (how many teaspoons in a cup, how many grams in an oz, etc.)  We also listened to music and set timers.
Annoying things about non-Show Echo's:  constantly asking how much time is left on a timer, forgetting the unit conversion because your kids are being brats and distracting your cooking.  Let's be honest - the Echo Dot is not known for good sound quality.  It is just a cheap way to get Alexa into part of your house (nothing against it for what it is either - I have about 8 Dots now).
The Show is amazing.  I can see the big letters across the room.  I can see how much time is left on multiple timers - again, big, easy to read digits.
Sound quality is good.  I don't have a high end audio source to compare it to, but music sounds nice and there is a decent amount of bass coming from the unit.
Other things my wife and I really like:  showing our Amazon photos.  We have a lot of them.  This is a nice way to have it cycle through and add some random decoration to your kitchen (or whatever room you put it in).  I like watching the news broadcast.  We might watch some Amazon Video on it, but not sure how much.  Seeing recipes is nice - although they need a more hands-free way to scroll (like the Fire Cube?)

I would give this a five star if it had support for YouTube.  My family watches a lot of it.  Its a very popular service.  It's a shame it was pulled.  (I guess you can somehow use the web browser to get to it?  If it's complicated, it won't be used and will just frustrate my family.)  I hope this gets resolved or alternative solutions are available in the future.  Let's face it - watching funny dog videos or someone eating expired military rations is entertaining.

I have not used the video camera yet.  I could see this being handy, but currently we have no plans to use this.  I could see this being awesome for talking to older parents/grandparents.

I picked mine up on sale.  For this price, absolutely recommended if you like Alexa.  If it was full price, I don't think I would have bought it unless they offered more skills that really took advantage of the device.

author: JDBMSP
title: Not happy.
content: Screen is failing - jumping and started to happen after the shipping return policy lapsed.  Not happy.

author: will mendez
title: What a fun toy
content: Love the echo , mine you I have 33 devices that interacts or are controlled by the amazon show..the reason I added the show was to view my arlo cams on it , to see song lyrics while songs are playing cost me 3.99 a month .. I don't have prime and own a combo of 6 Alexa's. I don't need prime a co worker has it and I and about 10 other people give her 10 bucks a year... so she has free prime... anyway the show is AWSOME love that it plays movie trailers on point , love the video calling, not to mention the fun of controlling , lights, thermostat's , fans , dyson air purifier, locks, arlo cams, arlarm system  ect.. I'm like Captain Kirk and iron man around the house , so much fun!!! Even with having all this stuff I would be happy just owning a 50.00 echo dot , but if you can afford an echo show go get it , you won't be disappointed!!!!!

author: Hank
title: Not impressed
content: Was able to communicate viewing while talking but other than that it’s just like any other Alexia device little pricey just to have Video that I could have using face time

author: Rita Johanides
title: No help with product
content: What I liked most was the free 3mos. Of music from amazon, compliments of QVC! But 2 bad I didn’t get it because my code nu that came with it didn’t work! So I called Amazon for help & after30 minus on the phone with your problem shooter  u tell me to call QVC!!!! Who told me it will take 1 week to get my new code! So a week goes by NO code! So I call them back & NOone knew what I was talking about! So back it went! I found it odd that Amazon couldn’t give me a new code or help me because it came from there!

author: JoAnne Silver Jones
title: Amazing addition to our family
content: The more I learn about Alexa, the more I love her. I bought the Echo Show as a way to help me remember events, keep track of shopping items and be able to visually see my lists. I love the wide range of music available, being able to turn on news, get sports updates and, I'm sure there is much more.

author: John B.
title: Great idea but not ready for prime time
content: I loved the idea and am able to visually communicate with my child. The sound quality is horrendous compared to first generation echos. It should have a full feature of external apps. It needs a much better GUI. It’s not fun like the first generation echo for the sound quality.

author: Katie
title: Needs some work
content: This is our third echo product to buy, we love the echo, we have the original one, and the 2nd gen Echo Dot, but we have had some issues with the Echo Show. There is a huge lag when we ask Alexa to do anything...setting a timer really causes and issue because it doesn't start immediately. The Show also has frozen multiple times and there is no way to exit and return to the main screen, we just have to wait it out. It has great potential and we love the idea of it, but it has a few kinks that need to be worked out for us to be fully satisfied with purchasing it.

author: Sean Clark
title: A fun and useful tool
content:
The Echo Show is not only lots of fun, it is also a helpful tool around the house. To be honest, we have just begun to utilize all the awesome features. The ability to pop up recipes and see them visibly on the screen is a really helpful. We just keep the Show in our kitchen and use it to play music, follow news updates, find recipes, order Starbucks, etc!

This is an amazing piece of equipment.

author: AndyS
title: Echo Sound on phone call
content: I have a dot in Kitchen and the Show in living room , when I speak even though I am close to the show the kitchen one answers. when using calling feature the person on the other end hears a load echo. this is poor workmanship in my opinion

author: Lambo
title: Fun to use
content: In the honeymoon right now and just asking questions when I think of them. I am not using it to its full potential, but everything I've asked so far has been helpful. Just need to learn how to use it better, but at least it's fun to learn.

author: MB lover
title: It’s a fun gadget, but don’t expect to learn much from it!
content: It has a decent speaker and for $3.99 a month, I get most music I want. It  is also great for a quick view of my day’s schedule, but very limited in other uses. Alexa can follow commands but she is VERY short on knowledge. I will take Siri over her any day!!!

author: Avid Bargain Hunter
title: Where's the User's Guide? Really!
content:
Unit is working great, but it is a true PIA that products today are shipped without user manuals. Do manufacturers truly believe that user will magically know the full capabilities of each product purchased? I have no idea of the echo show's capabilities. I have it linked to my Hue lights, but have no idea what commands will work, and what won't. I purchased a Fire TV Stick along with the Show, but have no idea how to maximize the two. Just a few examples.
I even purchased a text that other users have found to be helpful. Seems way too basic to me, but better than a kick in the pants.

author: hometuff
title: NEST camera connection -- TIP,  solves buffering issue
content: TIP-----------Just wanted to give a tip about the NEST CAMERA  link up.  I kept on getting buffering buffering buffering --constantly on my Echo show.  Finally it came to me, maybe the app on your phone needs to be on at the same time.  YEP, that was it.  I don't know why that matters but it does..  I haven't had a problem for the past 5 hours --good luck, hope it works for you.

author: twinzmom
title: ALEXA!!!! MY GIRL!
content: My ex-husband (eye roll) gave me this for Christmas. He has NEVER given me anything so wonderful other than our kids. Echo Show is the BOMB!  Alexa is a part of the family hanging out in the kitchen all day. She tells jokes, shows videos, takes pictures, plays music, connects to Audible, updates the news, and everything. It can be connected to a phone too, but unfortunately I don't know anyone else who has one in order to video chat.

author: M. Brewer
title: I love my Echo Show .
content:
I love Echos. I have a first generation and I've bought Echos and Dots for family members who all love them. I bought the Show even though I really didn't need it because of the screen feature. I think the best features are seeing music lyrics as my songs play and watching YouTube music and other videos. I can stream live YouTube cams on my Show and I love that feature the best. They add new features all the time and it is a great source of entertainment for me.

The only feature I think would improve it greatly is that it will, for instance, say "Ask Alexa about the rare albino tiger cub", but when I ask, it will scroll a short written blurb about the tiger but no picture. It's a Show. Show me a picture of what I'm asking about. :D

author: lwagner
title: No YouTube, Not worth premium price.
content:
No reason to have this without YouTube.  I have several Echo devices, and thought this would be a great addition with the video functionality of YouTube.  Ordered prior to the announcement, so now this is being returned.  Price has been discounted after the announcement as well, so obviously a hard sell without YouTube.

What a shame.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great product easy to use.
content: I got this for myself to keep in touch with my son and his family. However my 86 year old father has been using it every day. He is by no means tech savvy but he can do more than I can with the Echo Show.  It is so easy to set up and use.  My dad just says Alexia play music from the 1940’s and he gets to hear the music he likes. I recommend this unit for all ages and tech levels.

author: E. Barnes
title: Great for video calls
content: I love this for video calls to my kids.  I open the Alexa app on my phone, hit the drop-in button, select "Kitchen" and the next thing I hear is my kids cheering that "Daddy's calling" followed by the inevitable "fighting" to get in front of the camera.

author: a customer
title: Not there yet
content:
Honestly, like many others said, I was expecting more.  This is not more  useful than the Echo and while yes, you can view movies on the mini screen, there is no menu and trying to locate the one isn't a given even if you ask for prime movies, you will only get a handful showing.  I bought it because I had truly hoped that FINALLY there would be a device out there that would allow use of the Alexa features for hearing impaired.  Nope this one is not it either and too bad because it could have been great to be able to talk or video call someone and have live captions/subtitles.
So all in all, not seeing a true value in it all.  Takes space and realize I likely wont use it much at all.  Too bad...maybe a better version one day which takes into consideration consumers' comments will be better.  This one is just not there yet.

author: Vikas
title: Great product.
content: Absolutely love it also cause I got it at half the price during prime day. Great speaker quality.

author: LPartin
title: Not at all what I expected...
content: I wanted to like the Echo Show, I really did. But I was expecting something closer to a tablet combined with an Echo device. Instead I have an overpriced Echo with a pointless screen. I had thought I would be able to download apps, ie. Pinterest or Allrecipes, and have a place to view the recipes I’ve stored (aside from my smart phone). But alas, it was not meant to be. Hopefully, future updates will make this a more relevant device.

author: Matt Thursam
title: I would love for it to connect to my iPhone calendar so ...
content: I am sure that the Amazon Echo Show will be a valued possession as it gains more skills. Right now it is somewhat disappointing. I would love for it to connect to my iPhone calendar so I could manage it from any device and not have to enter events multiple times. I look forward to the increase of special skills for the Show as I try to understand the thought process behind it's inception from the Amazon Engineers.

author: Paul D.
title: I really like the Echo Show
content: I really like the Echo Show, however losing YouTube was a big loss. Also the camera angle makes it difficult to use via the drop in feature, you tend to just get a shot of the ceiling, unless the show is positioned very low.

author: AMANDA
title: We are loving Alexa!
content: We are enjoying the heck out of this! Between playing my music, audiobooks, and movies we have been using it as news source, sports info, joke telling, recipes and many other things.  Also, calling home to my 6 yr old and 75yr old father has been s hoot.

author: samuel slightom, III
title: Very well made
content: Absolutely love it got it on prime day incredible price I would pay full price it’s a great item enjoy it

author: YosemiteChic
title: Say what?!
content:
I just received Alexa today. I purchased the show for use in my kitchen so I could use it for music, grocery orders, recipe lookup etc... it's already met all those expectations! I enabled several games which is fun during cleaning and cooking. I can't wait to see what more she can do.

Is it strange that I keep wanting to thank her?

author: Amazon Customer
title: YouTube
content: Although I like the device, I bought it with the understanding I could watch Youtube videos.  Now that is not possible.  Hopefully Amazon will resolve this problem!

author: Mark F
title: Ok, but doesn't work well with the ring doorbell camera.
content: The device itself works as all echo devices do. But it was advertised with a ring doorbell camera. These 2 do not work well together at all. Constant buffering, no control of camera, pretty much useless. The ring app on the iPad works very well and has many customizable features.

author: Tara Nordine
title: Love It
content: This thing is amazing! It is so useful. We have it installed in our kitchen and it makes looking up recipes so convenient. As well getting quick measurements or conversions on things like cups to tablespoons etc becomes so convenient rather than have to pull up the phone or a computer. It is useful to play music and or music videos. Another great feature is that it keeps flashing trending news bits on the front page that you can question her to elaborate. I love all the attachments so she can turn on and off lights and the coffee pot. Great device and our family loves it!

author: wyldbill
title: NOT the best Echo yet
content:
I've been an Echo owner since the original release (when you got a remote), and had to purchase a Dot for travel as my wife and I missed Alexa when we traveled. We don't use many of the skills available, but use the core functionality regularly in our daily lives.

My wife was more excited about the Show announcement than I was, so buying a pair to replace/supplant the existing Echoes was inevitable.

The Show does deliver as far as the screen functionality goes. I get: a visible clock, visible weather, visible representations of timers (though the screen will go back to home after a few moments - argh). I can watch videos, though I seldom do.I can rotate through pictures, which we do do. The news snippets are sometimes informative. The sound is good, a little better than the Echo, but not amazing. Basically, it's a slightly more functional version of the original Echo.

Sometimes.

We have one Show on the island in our kitchen. We've discovered that the mic array of the show is MUCH less accurate than the original Echo. The Show is continually mis-interpreting conversation or Television for the wake word. This happened occasionally with the Echo, but the Show mis-interprets the wake word at a rate about 10x that of the Echo. It's become a game to figure what was said that could be possibly interpreted as "Alexa" when "she" interrupts our conversations.

Also, the feedback for bad interactions seems to have disappeared from the Alexa App. I used to be able to give feedback when Alexa woke incorrectly or failed to deliver results. Perhaps that functionality is still available in the App, but if so, it's buried, and that discourages feedback.

Calling: This is pretty useless to us. We have two different profiles in our house, and a prime family group. If I try to reach my wife at home, and the Show has been left on my profile, I can't make the home Show "ring". I can't find a way to change the profile remotely via the App. Show calling calls people, not locations. Sometimes this is what you want, other times it's not. We don't don't use calling because of that; we'll use Facetime instead if we want video calling. That's a shame because the video on the Show is generally better than the phone.

Volume: While there's a buttons and a visual indicator on the screen, I find the original Echo's volume control and level feedback much more intuitive. Adjusting volume on the Echo by voice also seems more effective. Volume levels on the Show seem much less granular.

There's lots of other little things I find annoying about the Show compared to the Echo, and am seriously considering going back to the standard Echo for daily use. The Show still isn't ready for Prime-time use in my opinion.

When reading and writing reviews, the key takeaway for me is always "Would I/you buy it again". In my case, the answer for the Show is "probably not". That can change if Amazon addresses my concerns via software updates, but that seems less of a priority than rolling out new whizz-bang features.

author: RegenaH
title: Love
content: Love the Echo. Bought two. One for my elderly parents so that when needed I can turn on the drop-in feature to check on them. The Echo is perfect on the desk of my studio office. Ask her anything, listen to music or even watch a movie while I’m working. Hoping my parents will enjoy her as well.

author: M. A. Gates
title: Easily integrates into daily living.
content: We have our Echo Show set up in the kitchen where it has become a daily companion with news, weather, music, information and video calling family members who also have one. No longer need to fiddle with the built-in timer on the stovetop as all we have to do is ask Alexa.

author: Lifelong Student
title: My favorite "Alexa" device.
content: I have three of these so far. The primary use is for video chatting, but I also play music, listen to books, and watch videos on the Echo Show. It's a handy, compact, all purpose device.

author: klewis
title: The thrill is gone :/ so disappointed
content:
Wish it had more features
 Not worth the price difference of my echo dot.
Dropin calls are often blurry even though we have a strong Internet connections.
 Cameras kind that I had a weird angle. Screen does not completely go off still showing the clock. As a result of that I had to ask Alexa to completely turn off the whole screen not showing anything including the clock.too much light in the room
Wish I could watch live tv on it or movies via Netflix etc.
wish it could give me more info and features.
Often Does not handle the request.
Looks like a oldschool floor model television.

author: 3rdbase
title: Nice Improvement
content: The video makes this a great improvement over the echo.  The sound quality is VERY impressive.  The only problem I have is with my poor DSL wifi connection, but even at that the echo show still works well.

author: Sunshine
title: So happy and entertained
content: After being reluctant to use an Echo, the Echo Show was advertised showing a screen. It took a while for me to get up the nerve to hook it up, but I did it! It was so easy to hook up for me. I now listen to my music from my iPod, look at my Arlo cameras, check traffic, check weather, theaters and showtimes, daily calendar reminders and a to do list. I have not tried the contacts option to make phone calls. I don’t understand my previous reluctance, as I totally love my Echo Show. I love to “play” with Alexa.

author: Merritt LeBlanc
title: Really enjoy the usefulness and entertainment
content: We have three Echo Shows and absolutely are 100% satisfied.  Use them for smart home control, monitoring day care, music, etc. Works great!  We have an Echo and two Dots as well.  If our first would have been the Show, they all would be!

author: Dreamere124
title: So many great Skills the SHOW can do!
content: Love our Show. Mi purchased for the sole purpose of being able to keep in contact with my three granddaughters.  They are only little for such a short time.  They know how to call us usingnthe Echo Dots and now they can use the Show and with both parties having one, we get to do do video calling without the hassle of connecting thru FaceTime or Skype.  The children know how to make calls on their own without needing to bug mom or have her connect them.  We get in a lot of fun visit time.  The music functions are wonderful as well.  I also connected it to my RING doorbell and now have a larger monitor.

author: Jeff Fred
title: Way cool and easy
content: Oh yea!  Got this for my pops has some issues w technology hoping this will work for him will update after we get it installed at his place still learning and configuring accesories

author: JohninFW
title: A good desk addition
content: I like it has a prominent camera/microphone On/Off switch.  The Echo Shows looks neat and clean on my desk and the display is also pleasing.  One little nit.  I have other Electra capability devices so I had to change my Echo Show's name to 'Echo'.  I wish it were possible to change its name to anything I wanted.

author: Eddie Stewart
content: Wife bought me this for my birthday, and we love it. I set it up in our kitchen as entertainment for cooking. We now have 3 dots as well, and are slowly making a smart home. We love the sound quality (it isnt a Bose system but it isnt supposed yo be one), it 8/10 times gets what anyone says. Sometimes even picking up on what we were trying to say but couldnt word right. The Skills are either fantastic or meh, but all in all this was an amazing addition to a kitchen, and I really recommend it for anyone who has an interest in smart home tech as well.

author: Theodore R Montoya
title: A Work In Progress
content: While initially impressive, the Echo Show fell flat on its face. It is a charming smart device to tell the time and is easy to use to set alarms and play music/sounds or ask questions, but most of the functionality can be done by any Amazon device which leaves the screen being the the stand out selling point. Unfortunately in my case the screen appeared to have a low refresh rate and would flicker a bit as it would fade between information on the screen as if the refresh rate was very low and it wasn't a smooth transition. Then not more than a one to two months after owning it, the screen started to flicker as shown in the uploaded pictures. They're just now releasing a second version and everyone who paid hundreds of dollars for this prototype have seemed to have played a game of do you feel lucky to get a decent working product.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Watch people stream even.  Fantastic
content: LOOOOOOVE this thing.  I haven't had a chance to use it for video calls yet but the skills that can be used on it are great.  I have it seated at my gaming area and tell Alexa to go to twitch and it I can watch people stream on it.

author: NurseNicole
title: Neat device too many connection issues
content: It's a neat device but connection issues are rampant...also it's just blah after awhile.

author: Jack C. Sr.
title: Great for playing trailers
content:
Came packaged well, not damaged at all. Was everything I expected and more. Love all the different things that it can do, having the advantage of the monitor/video display. Pairs well with my echo dot. Very impressed. Now I will want the echo spot for the bedroom. I do wish that the screen would go blank (sleep) after a set time would be nice. Instead of having to say, Alexa, screen off.
  Buy one, you will love it!

author: Stephan
title: No Customization For Home Screen
content:
I bought the echo show for my office, hoping that it could be used to constantly display my calendar events from Google Calendar. While it is possible to sync your google calendar and display events on screen, you must ask Alexa to display it, then it reverts to a blank home screen with Alexa command recommendations and a clock. With a screen that is always on 24/7, it is absurd that there is no way to choose the view you always want on. This is a basic feature, even in those cheap digital picture frames. I thought the timer feature was cool too, but it suffers from the same exact issue. When you set a timer, it does not stay on the timer screen. the system will go back to a useless blank home screen and you have to ask it to display the timer every time you want to see it.

Among the good things about this device are ordering with images, controlling music tracks by pressing a button rather than speaking, and general sound an build quality of the device. Sadly, this is not the reason I want this on my desk.

author: J. K. Howard
title: Shaky screen and bad focus after 2 months.
content:
Display screen is wobbly and takes too much time to focus camera when using drop-in.

Help desk keeps asking the same questions over and over.  Why can’t they take notes and read them?  Also, they called in the middle of dinner instead of the agreed to call-back time.  Very annoying.  I expect better service from a multi-billion dollar company.

author: John fooks
title: Bury the setup for drop in notes
content: Useless instructions for setting up dropping him ... I bought two and they can't see each other or "show"each other or even communicate with each other than growling sounds

author: Sheryl
title: Very nice product.
content: Still trying to figure all of the features but excellent for my parents, especially for my mother who has dementia.  She can see the time and ask Alexa to play music or call one of her kids. I will be able to see them while they are in Florida to make sure they are physically doing good.  They won't even have to get up to answer the phone.

author: LebidOM
title: Low quality of speakers
content:
Alexa does not Google. She almost know nothing, but you can create skills that help you teach your kids, have some activities and listen to radio, podcast etc.
Speaker also must be better. echo is huge device, but for real it's just 8inch fire tablet and boomy dirty speakers. Just in case JBL Flip 4 sound like top5 world's acoustic vs quality of Echo's speakers.
My offer to Amazon take FireHD8 and speakers from Flip and put it into Echo... That device definitely doesn't cost more that $120

author: Sassy
title: When I ask Alexa to play a Pandora music station ...
content: When I ask Alexa to play a Pandora music station 1) it cuts into the music; 2) it doesn't understand Spanish music requests (Example:  Latin Salsa Music Stations, " Charanga La Cuartro").

author: Justin A Maenhout
title: How it can protect your house
content:
This Alexa was able to catch a guy trying to rob me. I dropped in on my Alexa show to see if my cat was on the counters and seen a strange man walking into my house. I was able to call the police, they caught the guy trying to leave with some of my things before he was able to get away. Thanks ,
Alexa

author: GeneTheMarine
title: How to engage Alexa to have even brief exchange of talking.
content: Grateful to have avenue/alternative when I need even the shortest period of someone's voice as I live alone and have few situations to be around others. But I am searching/discovering what to say to Alexa to engage in 2-way dialogue (hopefully there are words to use now OR if this will be added in near future. So far it has been frustrating (expecting too much) not to have 2-way conversation.

author: D. Adams
title: Amazing
content: Everything I had expected. I have it, a plus and a dot set up so I can remote control the plus connected to my whole-house audio amplifier. Alexa play Hawaiian music everywhere. YES!!

author: HRGApollo
title: I won Mother's Day with this one...
content: It's the best smart device my wife didn't know she wanted. An excellent kitchen companion... Find recipes, listen to music, watch Ellen, get weather & news updates, etc. Works great with all of our other Echo devices. She doesn't usually like getting tech gifts, but she loved this one.

author: Rhode
title: A fine addition to the Echo family that keeps improving
content:
(Preordered the 2-pack at BBB so I could use Paypal). I own 3 Dots (v1 and 2), 2 Echo, 1 Fire TV, 1 Google Home, and now 2 Shows, which are on a whole 'nother league.

Pros:
1. Thanks to Prime Video, I can stream most of my shows on the Echo Show while looking away (who doesn't use their TV like a radio nowadays), which saves on power given that I'm not powering our tv for no reason.
2. The lyrics posting for most songs is my personal jam, as far as features go. It's been very enlightening :)
3. Drop in is fabulous for family, really! But do make sure your wifi is up to snuff. Drop in is also helpful within the household when food is ready.
4. I had been looking for digital picture frames as I digitalise our photos, and I'm so glad that this was able to do double duty.
5. Echo is constantly updating and improving and adding fantastic features. I'm hella pleased.
6. (This is for all echo devices) You can control Fire Stick/TVs with it (while you look for your remote). It'll turn your TV on and open the proper app.

Suggestions:
1. Smart home widgets would be nice on the touch screen. Basically, if Amazon could make cellphones less necessary for automation while at home, that would be swell.
2. Wifi issues with video calls... not really a suggestion, just a statement in need of consideration.
3. Would that this could turn off my TV too, but that's likely wishful thinking.
4. Please make video commands more straightforward and add Netflix/Hulu to your channel options.
5. Some Français would be nice, but I understand that your market in the francophone world isn't the strongest right now. Food for future thought.

...Also, teach Alexa to understand ASMR. She keeps hearing 'a SMR', which is dumb because the phonetics of the English language are such that most of us would say 'an SMR' if we had to.

author: Alfred McCoy
title: surpringly she seemed to enjoy the conversations more when she could see me on ...
content: I gave the Echo Show to my  wife as a gift for Christmas. She took a while before she tried it out so I set it up for her to speed up the process. I also bought the echo dot to learn how to familiarize myself. She would hear me using to make calls, play music and turn lights on and off after replacing them with WiFi capable lightbulbs and a hub. I set her Echo Show up to only allow myself to drop in on my wife from my Iphone I thought she might be upset, surpringly she seemed to enjoy the conversations more when she could see me on her screen.I’m happy to say my wife and I are both very pleased with all of our Echo devices and look forward to finding news ways to use them.

author: MissE
title: Great, but always room for improvements
content:
It’s a perfect addition to our Amazon Home devices. We love that you can view a wide variety of videos and the speaker is crystal clear.

Some features we dislike or wish we could adjust: it doesn’t let you view all the amazon prime videos, so you are limited as to what you can watch. The home screen constantly has “try this...” or “watch this..” scrolling across it, which makes it like a constant advertisement playing.

author: Sparky Koerner
title: Alexia is Great
content:
Yes this is a great invention.  Sound of music is great and I love asking it all kinds of info just to see how it will answer.
I love how I can ask for almost any type of musician and it will come up with recordings for me to hear.
Also love the new and weather and tied into my Arlo security system and it will show what is happen at each camera.

author: ShopSmart
title: Regretfully the Echo SHOW is only getting worse.
content: Regretfully, the Echo Show experience is only getting worse, particularly when short-form video such as YouTube is removed. It's unlikely that we will watch movies or football games on this screen.

author: Mark
title: We're Believers in the Echo product lineup. . .
content:
We have two "original" Echo smart speakers, one Echo Dot and now an Echo Show.  We have the Dot connected to an external BT speaker and the Show connected to a stereo pair of speakers via BT.

We've purchased an Alexa enabled thermostat, several smart bulbs (used in three rooms of our house) and enabled perhaps a couple dozen Skills. We use the Echo devices for music, shopping lists, general information and weather and even to order Pizza. Recently, we started using the Show and the Dot to make phone calls -- the Show makes for an especially hi-fidelity speaker-phone. Although we typically don't watch movies on the Show, we tried it (accessing our Prime Video Library) and it works great.  Generally, when we're using the Show (in our kitchen) we'll listen to music or a book from Audible.

We're probably barely scratching the surface of what can be done using the Echo/Alexa technology. Every week, so it seems, there is something new that we can do using the Alexa app.  Just for fun, we enabled the "where is Santa" skill -- if we had Santa aged kids at home, this would be, I'm sure, a vital skill.  With the stereo set up -- with the Oontz Ultra speakers, the sound quality is quite good, much better than the original Echol speakers -- and, well, it's stereo.

The Show is particularly nice when cooking and multiple timers are set -- you can see the different timers counting backwards on the Show's screen; this one feature alone made the Show less of a novelty (for us, as frequent home cooks).

If you want to dip your toe into the Alexa world, you could start with a Dot (and an external speaker from Oontz) and do it at a relatively small cost.  However, if you think you'd use even a fraction of the "skills" the Echo Show has to be the best unit to go with.  If you think you would use "video calling" -- somewhat like Facetime or Skype, get one of these for yourself and one for your parents or children or other relatives -- a pair of Shows would be a step up from FT or Skype in terms of quality.

If you just can't wait, these products are available at Best Buy, same price as on-line.

author: debra
title: Alexa tip text is irritating
content: Cannot remove the Alex tip that displays across the home page.  You must live with it.

author: Jude
title: Really like this so far.
content:
This was our first Echo device.  I bought it for my husband and he absolutely loves it. It connected easily to our WiFi (we put it on 2G , even though it WILL accept 5G) it paired easily to all our Bluetooth devices.  My husband uses it to put him to sleep at night using the Thunderstorm sound skill, and it works with our Hue lights to wake him up to lights, weather , and a news report.  I was able to pair it with pretty much all our smart home devices and plugs, and by using IFTTT, you can find all sorts of useful ways to use Alexa.

In our first few hours using it , it DID get a bit confused on certain commands, but it turned out it was our incorrect commands that were befuddling it.  We researched and found a list of correct commands , and since then we have had no problems. It seems the more we use it , the faster it responds.

I will be buying another one of these to go in our kitchen.

I do wish you could watch Youtube videos on it, and hope that Google and Amazon can come to some sort of agreement on this in the future, but this is not reason enough for me not to love the Echo Show.

author: Nancyleer
title: Still learning...
content: We love our new echo but still have much to learn. It is able to do so much more than we understand at this point. Anxious to experience new things!

author: Tweeky
title: Button have nothing to tell you which is which
content: Bought for grandchildren gifts. Lights are very nice, only problem and when you get familiar with them, no problem but there is no description on each button to tell you which one is the one you are looking for so go through each of them until you are familiar or get the manual each time. Otherwise great lights!

author: Tracie
title: Good Smart home addition
content:
I like that she controls most of my lights and switches with voice command or app on my phone.  we play games a lot with my neighbor and have a good time. I don't like that she will mess up once in a while when you give the correct answers she says you are wrong it should be.. which is what we said.  Over all it is a good addition to the rest of our smart house. personally I am glad I bought this during the Christmas sale because I would have been very disappointed spending full price
I haven't used this to its full potential yet but plan to keep expanding.
I am hoping she can learn more
I like it, family, friends and neighbors so I am satisfied

author: Connie Erickson
title: Ehco Show
content: Echo Show is a great way for me to be able to talk with my grandson when we are states away.  He will be able to call by himself.  I also enjoy the ease with which I can compile a list of needed grocery items as the come to mind over several days.  We enjoy the little videos as well as the music.  It reads my audio books while I work in the kitchen.  I will be able to see who rings my wi-fi doorbell and talk to the person before I open the door.  It will adjust the temperature of our house when I ask it to.  There are many more undiscovered chores Echo will be able to help with.

author: JemJem
title: Would be wonderful if it worked with YouTube
content: Would be wonderful if it worked with YouTube.  But the screen has a beautiful picture!  And the responsiveness works just as well as my other echo devices.

author: Jorge A. Barba
title: Nice device but.. what about Bluetooth pairing password?
content:
I have about 1 month with my Echo Show, and overall I'm satisfied and met expectations but one thing I'd like to mention is when I opened it and was on the set-up process, it suddenly 'caught' a Bluetooth streaming from one of my neighbors and after several attempts to make it 'forget the device', I just couldn't!, for ridiculous it sounds, it looks the Echo Show was prioritizing for some reason that signal instead of pairing my phone, which I was trying to pair and streaming as well..

I believe just a simple add-on to the software, with the simplicity of a password to allow the Bluetooth pairings, would have been enough, and I'd have saved a headache and one night frustration.

Thanks

author: Kathy Deutscher
title: Set up was perfect. Just getting to know it will be fun
content:
Set up was perfect.  Just getting to know it will be fun.  Love the screen and the definition is great.
Cannot wait to use it features.

author: Chad
title: Cool Toy for someone who loves tech...
content:
UPDATE.

So it has been less than a year and the show is already malfunctioning. The screen is blinking constantly and is irritating to look at. It has its good moments and bad moments however the bad moments outweigh he good ones. I got this one for the kitchen so it would look nice. This looks awful.

I turned it on and off. I reset the device. I unplugged it and plugged it in again and even looked on the app. I think this is a hardware problem. I hope amazon is willing to rectify the issue.

It is hard to catch with a video but I tried.

I love my new show. I use the show in my kitchen and the spot in the bedroom as my alarm clocks, ambient noise machine, news update, etc. Alexa controls many of my lights, my home security system, my garbage, the tv, the surround sound, the cable box, my harmony ultimate remote and more. She is usually right on the ball. Sometimes she’s a pain to turn off but I am still learning the right commands. Very cool purchase.

Do I need her...  no...  do I enjoy her features as fun toys in the house. Yes.

author: A Brown
title: Very clear picture
content: I love this camera first of all it was so easy to install less than  15 minutes up and running. The sensor light is so nice and bright when someone walks up my driveway and what I find to be the most safety  issue is the two way speaker. This is a wonderful camera and for the price it has many features other small cameras do not offer. I highly recommended it.

author: K. Fox
title: So far, I love it.
content:
Just got the Echo Show during Prime Week.  First, the price (amazing deal through Amazon Prime).  Second, I love having pictures and a visual representation of everything Alexa can provide.  I'm still learning about all the things she can do.  So far, so good.

Here's my one negative piece of feedback.  I also shared this with Amazon directly.  The Power Supply cord for a white Echo Show is BLACK!  What were they thinking?  The product manager at Amazon should be shot.  If you buy a white Echo Show, you should get a white power cord.  Right?  My other white Echo product came with a white power supply, why not this one?

author: Mindcrime
title: Good addition to Echo lineup but too expensive
content:
The Echo Show is our 3rd Echo device, also have original Echo and Echo Dot.  I really like the Echo devices for listening to music through Amazon Music Unlimited.  I was able to buy the the Show at a local store for the under two hundred dollar sale price.  I was some what hesitant to buy the Show as I wasn't sure it offered enough extra features for the price.  There are some features I like and something that I think is not as good as the regular Echo.

Things I like:

1. The screen is clear, bright, and looks good in our kitchen.

2. I never used calendar (Apple Ical) integration with the regular Echo or Echo dot, even though I had it setup.  With the Show, calendar integration is useful as you can use Alexa to add appointments and then see those appointments on the Show.
