We share a family calendar and having the appointments on the screen is a nice feature.  The home screen rotates different notices and headlines and will show daily appointments or you can scroll through multiple days.

3.  Weather is nice to see on screen rather than trying to listen to the forecast over speaker on the regular Echo's.  Asking for weather shows todays forecast and the 5 day forecast.  The home screen also shows current weather and temp, a nice feature when getting ready to head out.

4. Pictures- I can use my own picture on the background or load pictures from Amazon photo.  A nice feature as it basically becomes a digital picture frame.

5.  While I don't use the video conference feature yet, I don't know anyone else who has a Show, it would be very useful to connect to my parents with out them having to use Skype or FaceTime.

What I don't like

1. I don't think the sound on the Show is as good as the regular Echo.  The sound is fine but just not as powerful or deep as the regular Echo.

2.  The price is high to me compared to the Echo.  With the new Echo being under hundred dollars, the Show is too much more money just for the screen features.  With sound being less than the Echo, if you are using Echo's for mostly music, I would stay with the lower priced 2nd Gen Echo.  Amazon needs to get the price of the Show down to about $175 in my opinion.  If not, then Amazon needs to improve the speakers in the next generation Show.

While I like the Show and what it offers, the price is prohibitive to make this a must have.  I know a lot of people are upset about the YouTube removal from the Show, but I have no interest in using YouTube on the show as I listen to music through Amazon Music and I can watch YouTube on TV, iPad, Computer, Phone etc.  Not necessary, for me, to have YouTube on the Echo.  Maybe Google and Amazon will work through their issues and put it back on before long.

author: Al Mars
title: Great in the kitchen
content: Definitely enjoying the benefits of the Show. I placed it in the kitchen so it can and has been used for many recipes and baking tips! The video tutorials are great. And also the ability to ask Alexa to show specific pictures is great such as "Alexa, show me pictures of ..... from my pictures". I do miss the fuller sound of the Echo that it replaced, but the living room Echo isn't too far away since we often use our Amazon Music through the devices.  The voice recognition doesn't seem to be as good as the Echo either, but still pretty good, just have to slow down when speaking.  I will definitely be adding more Shows as they go on sale. My wife is finally excited about using an Alexa device!

author: Frankie
title: Great bedroom entertainment
content: I like the way my wife loves to dance to the music.Have it connected to a sound bar that I hid under the bed.Also nice to have her extend morning snuggle by just asking.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It is amazing! Plays music from pandora and amazon music
content:
It is amazing! Plays music from pandora and amazon music!! Awesome sound also. The most significant feature is how you ask Alexa for a recipe and they come up on screen so that you can view and Alexa stays with you until you finish recipe. She even goes through steps with you if you want her to.

I am planning on purchasing a second one!!!

author: S. Wittstruck
title: Screen Flickers After 2 Months
content:
Had my Echo Show for about 2 months. Seeing the flicker on my Echo Show -- turning off adaptive brightness and setting the display level to lowest setting seems to help a little -- but I can't see the screen well.

Seems to be a common problem: https://www.amazonforum.com/forums/devices/echo-alexa/473732-echo-show-screen-flicker

Running latest software version: 620525820.

UPDATE: Started the return for repair process on OCT. 31 -- it is NOV. 13 and I have yet to hear ANYTHING from Amazon. Plan on getting a Google Home Hub and selling this Echo Show whenever the repair gets sorted out.

author: Eachai
title: Has potential.  Little guidance on correct commands.
content: Show is ok when it understands the command.  Little to no instructions make it time consuming and frustrating to use.  Example, want it watch the Showtime (subscribed through Prime) series “Chi” but when I say watch The Chi (tried both pronunciations - chai and chee)it either gives several wrong shows or if you say play the show Chi, it brings up music.  Never understands watch Showtime show Chi only responds that it can’t play Showtime, even though it had played it before.  Very frustrating.  Doesn’t play Youtube.  Good for video chatting with family members who have one.  Wish I had a complete guide on what it can do and the correct way to ask.  Otherwise functions as Echo and Dot.

author: Steve Rivera
title: It's ok
content: You have to be really specific when you talk to it.  It's annoying that it doesn't do YouTube that well or Google.  I'd prefer if it did.  You have to pay for amazons unlimited music or else you get stuck with the same songs

author: Shshmd
title: Much potential but not quite there yet.
content: The Echo show has much potential, especially for elderly and technophobic individuals. The drop in feature which could be intrusive, is actually a useful feature for caregivers and families who can drop in and check on their loved one. Voice commands are also much easier for elderly. The Alexa artificial intelligence, is however, not as well developed as Google. As a result it still does not understand many questions. You can request songs to be played on youtube but is has difficulty finding anything that has a "non English title", nor is there a search feature once in youtube that would permit a manual search. You don't have control of any of the apps available. No batteries means that you have to plug in and wait for it to reload every time you decide to change locations and therefore not practically mobile. I have not used its smart home features and can not comment on their usefulness. For those who have their smart phones and tablets and are reasonably tech savvy, Echo show really does not offer any practical benefits. It is just another cool toy :) I, however, do see a market for using Echo show for the elderly and their caregivers.

author: S. Tescione
title: Love this version of Alexa
content: I use my Show every day, for everything from music to traffic reports, news briefings, weather reports, games, and as my main timer and clock. I do a lot of complicated recipes so I can set the timer when I cook and play music at the same time, or play one of the games. Love it. Often I am on the phone with my brother at the other side of the country when a timer goes off. He thinks it's hilarious when I tell Alexa to stop or when I ask it for information pertaining to one of our discussions. For me, Alexa is a harbinger of things to come. I have two robots, a Braava and a Roomba. I haven't linked them yet, but I'll get around to it. Imagine the home of the future, where the most mundane of all house hold chores gets done for you, either by pre-scheduling on a device or by telling that device what to do. Alexa is a segway to that. It won't be very long before you load clothes or dishes into a machine and then tell the machine the settings you want it to use and it does it. Your entire household will someday be controlled by devices like this.

author: Jack
title: Alexa is part of our family
content: Having echos and echo dots, the show is a great addition to the line up.  It takes Alexa to a whole new level.  I use it on a regular basis to call my sons while they're getting ready for school in the morning.  They love being able to use it to call me whenever they need something.

author: Zonia Young
title: Prime Day FAIL, but still an Echo Fan
content:
Purchased 2 of these on Prime Day, and had to spend $20 more because the two-pack bundle would not check out.... it would disappear from my cart. Individually they were $100 off each, but if you bought in the black and white bundle they were $220 off. I didn’t want them to sell out so I had to buy them individually because of the “Prime Day Crash”... and I missed out on my extra $20 savings.

Other than my big disappointment with amazon prime day, these are the 5th and 6th echo’s I’ve bought for my home (I’ve bought 7 total - 1 being a gift for my dad). I have a 5bed 3bath house and between the 3 dots, 1 tower, and now my 2 shows, my house runs smoothly with Alexa working all my lights in the house, door locks, garage, my TVs, my indoor and outdoor cameras, the theater.... including playing lullaby’s for my children at night until they fall asleep, and cracking jokes with them “Alexa tell me a joke”, Alexa has become my bonafide house manager/mom-assistant.

Now if she could just feed my kids, I’d be one ecstatic Customer.

Thank you for all you do, Alexa. I’m a working Mom of 6 year old Twin girls and a 2 year old boy.... when I’m running out of my house at 7am with 6 bags on my shoulder and I shout “Alexa turn off all lights”, and you turn off every single light upstairs and downstairs so I don’t have to take the extra 5+ minutes it takes to do it.... a lifesaver. Keeps me at work on time.

You are the best co-pilot for this busy Mom! Can’t wait to see what the Echo Show can do for me!

author: Cynthia H.
title: So far, so good but...
content: I haven't had a chance to use it much but, I have to admit, I've noticed Echo Show doesn't answer some questions as accurately as Google Assist products do.  I'll ask both the same test questions and Google Assist will give me a better, and even correct, answer.

author: DL
title: I like my echo show
content: The echo show sits on my desk so that I can query it and use it as a music source during the day.  The speakers are quite nice for a small device, and the ability to ask it "alexa questions" makes it a very nice tool.  Originally purchased for the kitchen, once I set it up, it never left the study!  I don't use the video screen for much, but for those times when a video is part of an answer, it is nice to have.  I've always enjoyed my relationship with Alexa, but the echo show takes it up a notch.

author: Mike
title: Great product
content:
Already owned the dot wanted to get the echo show to video message family when away.  So far works well.  Yes all parties need an Amazon account, speakers are better then the dot and having the touch screen is great.  Video quality is great and once you set up the accounts it is easy to video call.  All in all a great product so far.  Happy with purchase.

Pro:  ease of use, video call is great, images and video flash great.

Con: need some more skills would love to be able to play youtube clips

author: RayD
title: Echo is good fun for the entire family.
content: Not much I can say that hasn't already been said.  It's a very cool device with a voice accuracy of about 85%.  Some repeating is necessary now and then within my house but the mistakes are usually pretty funny.  I do like that you can connect to University AI personalities where you can have a conversation with the echo.  This was kinda fun talking about football and my favorite teams.  She was full of interesting stats, but you could tell she was cheating by looking stuff up, but the conversation was still interesting.  We've come a long way with this type of technology.  Echo is good fun for the entire family.

author: Michael St James
title: Echo Show is GREAT for video calling.
content:
I pre-ordered two of these a couple of months ago, and have had them on deck for about a week now, one in my son's home in PHX and one in my home in Utah.I bought them primarily home automation, and for the video calling and messaging functions. After a couple of calls between the two units, I can say that I'm satisfied that my reason for buying has been justified. Call quality was excellent; no breakup (pixelation) such as Skype calls are afflicted with, decent video resolution, no voice/video sync issues, no lag. Works better than I expected for this function. A minor niggle under CONS. A secondary reason I wanted the SHOW is for viewing my five Arlo cams on demand. This also works well enough, though the skill could use a little tuning. I'm sure that will happen. The only issue with it is that there is some delay while "Connecting to Netgear", which can't be blamed on the Echo. Same thing happens when checking cams from my phone, or even from my DT which is in the same room as the Arlo hub (with both hardwired via Ethernet.) Also a Netgear issue is that it sometimes takes more than one try to connect to a camera. Netgear should probably try to fix this issue, it's longstanding. But I digress. The skill COULD display multiple cameras at once, as you see on the phone app and the web app. But it doesn't. Maybe someday. My major beef (revision 2017.07.29) is that my home automation control has become randomly flaky, unreliable, particularly with Wemo devices. I Could blame Wemo, since their app maybe the worst of all time, but all Wemo devices are currently working fine with the Wemo app and another lighter-weight 3rd party app. Something has changed within the last 24 hours. I've iupdated all apps, device firmware, re-booted both router and cable modem, and re-discovered devices within the Alexa app...they all discover, but respond randomly or not at all. This complaint isn't specific to the Show device; I have to original Echos (tall) and three Dots as well. Same problem with all, but I thought I would throw this in because, for home automation, and for the time being, the Alexa/Echo ecosystem for use with a heavily Wemo'd home is useless. I will revise again later, if Amazon gets it fixed.
Other pros and cons, subject to revision after the device SW and skills mature:

PROS:
YouTube
Lyrics onscreen when playing from Prime Music
Photo slideshow from your Prime Photos as a homescreen background, if you want
Speakers are very decent for voice and quite decent for music (also a CON; see below.)
Can display calendar appointments on demand (Google Calendar used.)
Drop-In feature works well for room-to-room intercom.
Seems to reconnect & become usable more quickly than tall Echos and Dots when unplugged & moved.
Solidly built, pleasing aesthetic (I bought black.)
Bright screen, touch sensitivity a little low for me...an adjustment in settings would be nice.

CONS:
Speakers (also a Pro; see above.) The speakers are very directional, covering the 180 degree arc in front of the SHOW well, but sound quality drops dramatically as soon as the listener moves to the side or rear of the unit. This primarily affects music quality. If it's up against a wall or in a corner, should be fine, but we keep ours on the kitchen counter which is open to great room, and behind the device music is thin, flat, watery. To be expected, I guess, with speakers oriented toward a screen viewer. We've been spoiled by the sound from the tall Echos. One located in the center of the great room provides excellent coverage throughout that area and the kitchen as well, with no directional blind spots. Definitely our choice for music. Stick with the tall Echo for great streamed or BT music. We rarely use our Bose BT or the Big Jambox we've had for years anymore...Echo tall is that good. As good as Bose/Big Jambox? No, not quite, but very close. Besides, if you want to use your favorite BT music speaker paired with the SHOW, you certainly can.
Home screen: Inability to have granular control over what's displayed on HOME screen. I HATE that SHOW rotates through a bunch of unwanted and unneeded suggestions on what to ask Alexa, overprinted onto my chosen BG images (photo slideshow.) LET US TURN THAT OFF! I called Amazon CS, and the guy was great, spent about 30 minutes with me, but neither of us could turn it off. Minor niggle...the screen darkened during a lengthy video call as part of SHOW's screensaver logic, and I couldn't get it to brighten again without rebooting after the call. Amazon should definitely write into the OS so that the screen NEVER darkens when a video call is in process. How hard can that be? Also, I read that the inactivity screen darkening is supposed to see new activity around the device and brighten again on approach; it's flaky, unreliable at present. Needs a tune-up.

ALL IN ALL, I'm UNhappy with the purchase, but here's a REALLY, REALLY BIG THING for Amazon, and one that would send the sales of ALL Echo devices through the roof, and probably kill the Google Home to boot: Being able to listen to a music stream on all or selected multiple devices throughout the house. Goggle Home can do this. Right now we have two tall Echos, three Dots, and one Show. If Amazon would enable synced music streaming, I would have a device in every room, and as a side benefit to Amazon, I might subscribe to Prime Unlimited Music instead of just using the free Prime Music.

I'm sure I'll have updates after a few more weeks of use. BTW, I've had two SW updates not including the initial one on first boot, so I know they're working on stuff.

author: Gregory
title: Would recommend
content:
If you're going for that Smart Home style or just looking to have a helping hand in the kitchen or a small display in your room, the Echo Show in my opinion is great for that.
Setup is easy, when you first plug it in everything is setup using the touch screen (easier then using the app). If you don't have your phone on you can also ask Alexa to show the settings and configure the Show just like you would with the app.
I personally have mine in the kitchen so that I can listen to music but also use the screen to watch movies/tv shows and have Alexa bring up recipes for me. Or just have her display my orders, to-dos, weather etc.
When I first got mine it wouldn't work with other echos for multi-room music until I updated it. Which you can do by asking your Show to bring up the settings and have it update from there. Also I couldn't find this option in the phone app, only on the Show it self.
I personally am super happy with my purchase and it works great and as advertise.

author: G. Nassif
title: No video playback, buyers beware.
content: Can't play videos.  This is horrible!  My kids are going to go nuts.  I am going nuts.  Amazon and Google, work out your differences.

author: Rob
title: Great product! Build quality is excellent and screen has ...
content:
Great product! Build quality is excellent and screen has decent resolution.
Great to see cards on screen, adds to value of information. Recipes are easier to follow and fun knowing what the lyrics are in songs. Shopping lists are great on screen and Alexa can add or delete items! GREAT kitchen appliance.
Enjoying the camera most. My Arlo and Ring Cams can display their live views and currently audio can be heard on the Show. I am confident we will see two way audio as with the original Echo (Original owner since day 1) I have witnessed excellent improvements and new features constantly being added to these devices!
Highly recommend if you want voice control with a visual interface.

author: Joe Noble
title: Echo Show for our family
content: We decided to update our original Echo which we couldn't find a use for it. The Echo Show immediately proved it's worth. We can watch movies, show my calendar and communicate with family and friends. We were so impressed with it we bought each of our twin sons an Echo Show for their birthdays. Now my wife uses it at least daily and I can't resist using whenever I'm near it.

author: Rehomore
title: Very Cool
content: There are some negative reviews here, and a number of the professional reviewers found various faults with the Show, from its "dated" look, to its somewhat scary intrusive nature.  To me, it's a slick and handy device, and an ingenious look into the future.  Though the touch screen is not very sensitive, the Show is best used as a voice command device in any event.  The screen resolution and sound are both quite good in my view, though I use Alexa to control my Sonos speakers, which  some people somewhat unfairly tried to compare its sound too.  Come on.  As far as the microphones go, I'm kind of amazed at how far I can be from the kitchen counter where I keep the Show, and still have Alexa respond by (most of the time) turning on and off the requested lights.  It seems that the kitchen is probably the most logical place to keep this for many people, so you can do, see, and hear almost anything while working there.  And doesn't it seem that the kitchen usually turns out to be the most frequent gathering place during get togethers?  I mean the food and the wine are there, so why no Alexa?  It's a good conservation piece during parties, since many guests are unlikely to have seen this thing up close.  There are probably valid privacy concerns, and if so, you can easily disable the camera and the somewhat creepy drop in feature.  Still, in this day and age, we have to be willing to accept some degree of intrusion into our lives if we choose to be connected at all.  A personal choice of course.  Overall, this is a very cool, elaborate device that is a lot of fun.

author: Tori
title: ... a sale at the time and thought I would like I better since it is a viewable product
content: I bought this because there was a sale at the time and thought I would like I better since it is a viewable product.  I do like this product however I wish you can go the webpage where Alexa was getting its information.  I also would like the games to have a video of the games enstead of just words because it basically becomes just like the other devices without the video.  I do like that you can go to YouTube and view videos but was not as successful using vevo on YouTube \.

author: Jamie Newman
title: Maybe wait on this
content: Bought in December and screen started showing lines and flashing in February. After awhile it shows same stuff over. Sometime Alexa acts like your saying her name and shows stuff on the screen you didn’t ask. It was ok at first after awhile a little boring for the price and the screen glitching is a red flag. Have to send it back to amazon for repair. Update: ok so I received my repaired (I think) back and they shipped it back without the a/c power supply...so I don’t know if it’s fixex because I can’t turn it on. I call amazon. They tell me all they can do is give me credit to purchase the charger from a 3rd party seller...hmm ok. Bring you tube back and all is forgiven!

author: FALOME
title: ECHO ON, BOSE OFF
content: BOSE OFF - this is the greatest from Amazon yet.  What a picture and performance.  I took my Bluetooth speaker off within minutes.  Zoom in was also the mot valuable Alexa instruction I needed, and she told me that for the video.  The speakers are great.  Alexa Pause, Alexa Resume.  Wahoooooo.

author: Lilybay
title: Home Companion
content: I am amazed at the AI, I think it needs to learn quicker and maybe be a little more knowledgeable. But, it works well with other house technology and entertaines the kids.

author: KelliePicklerFan
title: Has a short life!
content: My echo show one month past the warranty and now when playing music skips every few seconds! EXTREMELY irritating!!! NOT worth the money!!! Useless to me now since I use it for background music for the dogs when I am away and to listen to music when I'm here! Guess I will be using my Google home mini for now on. The Show is garbage to me now! Should have lasted for more than just past warranty!

author: Jeremy West
title: Kuna front door camera will not show!
content: Show is neat, I wish it would work with my Kuna camera light. I can control the light with Show, but can't view my camera on it. Makes no sense, especially when it works with other brands. This is the primary reason I purchased, and it doesn't work.

author: L. Morgan
title: Love the Echo Show
content: We now have these all over the house.  I can add to my shopping list no matter where I am in the house.  We use it as an intercom system.  I play music or watch Prime movies and television shows while preparing dinner.  It's my alarm clock, my cat toy, my music player, etc.  Love the Echo Show.  However, they now have a generation 2 out.  I may have to take my Gen 1 model to my office and get a Gen 2 for my kitchen.

author: Proudnavywife
title: I love this product
content: I love this product. Currently she sits in the dining room on a small table. Even when she is playing music and I am in the kitchen she can still hear me and responds accordingly. She is also compatible with my Hyundai blue link so I can ask her to start the car, lock the doors, etc... I am about to purchase another for my parents so we may video chat with one another.

author: Kcole
title: the most useful function has been playing music and weather/news updates
content: Chose the echo show over standard "alexa".  Not sure it was worth the additional $$.  Placed echo show in kitchen to pull up new recipes and thought this would be helpful.  Wrong!  I pulled up a recipe but after about 15 seconds the screen adjust back to the home screen.  Haven't found a way to recall screen or adjust settings to keep the topic on screen.  Not helpful.  I only purchased this unit about 2 weeks ago and my overall impressions may improve.  So far, the most useful function has been playing music and weather/news updates.  All of which are available with standard alexa.  I had hoped to use echo show for face time calling parents/family.  This feature only works when the other person has the amazon app downloaded on their smart device.  Again, not entirely helpful.  Some may enjoy streaming hulu, netflix etc on the echo show but a smart tv already provides those features. The instructions in the box include steps to connect to wifi.  If you need further instructions, on anything, ask your echo screen because that's your only option.

author: DeniseFox
title: I love Amazon, Alexa and the idea of the Echo ...
content:
I love Amazon, Alexa and the idea of the Echo Show.  The Echo Show is the buggiest Echo product I own (and I own them all.)

Example:  the screen will not clear my message about package delivery.  This cuts my screen size by 1/3.  I've tried to clear it, yet it persists.  The Alexa App won't let me turn off Amazon package notifications.  Even when I turn the screen off, the message remains.  When I play a movie, it remains.  Anyway, you get the picture.  You might want to wait until the bugs are worked out.

Update 8/31/18 - Amazon has indeed worked out these bugs and the Show is working swimmingly now.  As a result, I will update my rating from a 3 to a 4 star.  I appreciate Amazon following these reviews for QA - very smart of them and makes me feel good about their products.

author: papagreg
title: Glitchy - many flickering lines across the screen.
content: The concept is good, but the product is bad.  It worked fine for a week or two, then the flickering lines started. Called Amazon tech, said unplug for a few minutes and then turn it back on.  Did that and it worked fine for a few hours, then same thing all over again.  I moved it from room to room with no improvement.  Finally sent it back for repair or replacement.  Still out for repairs.  Hopefully, the problem will be corrected.  We really like it in the kitchen.  BTW, I use several Echo devices in the house with no other problems.

author: Adam
title: We like it, but there aren't a lot of functions ...
content: We have many echo dots in our home, but just one Echo show in the kitchen. We like it, but there aren't a lot of functions that utilize the screen as I would like there to be. This doesn't mean that it will stay that way, Amazon just needs a few updates and more time to perfect it. We love that in the kitchen our timers can be visible instead of asking the dot all of the time how much time is left on the timers. The sound quality is decent for the device that it is, doesn't make you feel like you're at a concert hall, but then again we are standing in our kitchen. It has potential!

author: BarbW
title: Not perfect yet
content: Still trying to figure out how to watch youtube videos.  Also, Alexa told me about a recall of the goldfish crackers, but not the dates that were recalled

author: Master of none
title: Where have you been my whole life?
content: This is our third Echo. Got the tall one (don't remember the name) the Dot and now the Show. Freakin' love this thing! I hope someday Google and Amazon can play together nicely and have YouTube again on the Show. It would make this thing rock even MORE!

author: Blackwidoe
title: Priced too high for its uses
content: Really don't use it much, mostly for playing music.  Amazon videos are hard to search through and Hulu and Netflix are my go to which it doesn't support.

author: msme
title: Love it!
content: I bought the Echo for my husband on his November Birthday! He loved it so much I ended up buying the Show for Christmas. I got it on sale!  Out of the Echo, Dot, and Show, the Show is the best but it is also the most expensive.  We keep it in our kitchen.  The sound is good and I like having the touch screen.  Great for recipes, playing music, checking the weather, help converting measurements and asking random questions.  I should be a tester for this product because I have sold 3 so far and on my fourth.  Their is one downfall you cannot play YouTube, you can thank Google for that.  But I heard Amazon is launching their own video service.  If you can afford it, this is the way to go!

author: Ramster
title: Great for grandparents
content:
I have one in office, one in kitchen, and one for each grandma. Video in general is great, but the drop in feature is what shines. Grandma's are technically not so savvy, so I've set them up in each of their homes allowing us to drop in on them, but not vice versa. That means when the little ones want grandma they get grandma... but grandma won't get us unless we want her to.

If you don't follow what I'm saying, there's setup in Alexa app for each device owner that identifies if the calls/drop ins you are receiving get auto-answered or if you have to accept the call. When we call grandma it automatically picks up and we are immediately looking at their living room or office. When they call we can pick up or refuse the call giving our household some measure of privacy control. Is that imbalance, year, but it works. Hopefully nobody's walking around naked when we call the grandparents. That would be traumatizing for me and the kids.

author: WM-AB
title: Echo Show
content: These are just fun to have!  We received ours within for a couple days of ordering.  It was packaged securely to prevent damage during shipping, we have fun using this from watching cooking videos, listening to top Christmas songs, learning useless facts and all sorts of other things.  The new one came out and this particular one wasn’t available on Amazon on Black Friday so we purchased another one for our mother through Best Buy.

author: SandyW.
title: I Love This Technology but....
content: Once I take the time to learn all that the Echo Show can do, I'm sure I will be hooked. Right now I use it to make video calls, listen to music and watch videos and movies that I love. I have Echos and Dots in every room that I use for Smart Home functions. Just be careful about enabling Drop In outside your home. One of my siblings "dropped in," didn't say a word until AFTER my telephone conversation. A person can be too connected.

author: Mr Ken
title: Beautiful, Expensive, Functional
content: Wonderful device, however if it were not for the $149 price tag, I probably would not have purchased it. It’s a well designed device and looks great. It’s a big advertisement for “ Just ask Alexa ...”. Seriously, can we adjust what it’s displayed?  Also needs a power button so I don’t have to unplug every time I want to turn off device. And yes, there are times if like to turn it off.  I like the display when asking questions or seeing words to a song when playing.

author: Marvin C
title: Unbelievable what this can do
content: I use this product to listen to music and the news that I want to hear when I want to hear it. I had the Amazon Dot but this is much better as it has pictures, connects with my calendar and can make phone calls.

author: rick
title: Love the fact I can video chat with my family ...
content: Love the fact I can video chat with my family in Oklahoma. Just say the magic word, "Alexa" and she's all business with the answer to most questions that are asked.

author: Forsaken747
title: Needs improvement.
content:
The features are limited. Taking away youtube was a huge decrease in value/function if you ask me. If you are ok with technology you can setup systems for your family and video calls from across country are great!

Cons:
- You can have family photos as the back ground but they are dimmed due to the floating text and I cannot seem to find options to adjust that.
- you cannot use the touch screen to adjust the show settings in anyway. This must all be done via app remotely
- if you ask about Technology, It seems Amazon has partnered up with some companies to give B.S. opinions. The GTX 1050TI is not the best graphics card available! (of my soap box)

Pros:
- Having the Show connected to you Gmail account lets you see upcoming events in your calendar on display.
- Once figured out, calling or dropping in on other Show/Alexa devices is fun. Family lives in California and I live in Okinawa Japan and everything runs smoothly. All I do is say "alexa call mom" and it does its thing.
- Sounds great. Music is loud and has base/depth.

All and all I feel it has potential but this has been out for some time now and nothing has changed. If anything, they have removed some features. Get on top of this Amazon! and I will charge my rating.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Alexa keeps my bedridden sister company all night long.
content: I brought this for my bed ridden disabled sister.  She loves it.  Alexa keeps her company all night long.  She plays music, keeps her up to date on the news, and answers the front door bell.  I couldn't be happier.

author: YB Hoel
title: A couple of Epic Fails
content:
This is not something I would have purchased for myself, but was received as a gift.  Functionally, it does not do much more than the original Echo.  It would be more useful if I subscribed to the various Amazon services, Music, Photos.  As it stands, it is a good music player.

Here is Epic Fail #1, Alexa will not play Spotify to a multiroom group via voice command.  Spotify app on my phone will allow me to choose a multiroom group to play to.  Lack of voice command seems to defeat the convenience factor.  That glitch needs to be fixed.

Epic Fail #2.  The White Echo Show comes with a BLACK CORD.  A black cord against light walls in the kitchen is an eyesore.  Worse?  Customer service doesn’t know the white Show ships with a black cord. I actually exchanged black Show for white Show to get a white cord at the suggestion of Amazon customer service representative. Ugh!

Amazon can easily remedy both these issues and I expect they will.  Until then just three stats from me, and hooray that this was a gift.

author: Spaghettisaurusrex
title: Cool but not that cool, needs a lot of work
content:
We already had 4 echos, 1 echo Plus and 3 echos 2nd gen in our apartment. We also have 7 Phillips hue bulbs, a nest thermostat, nest security system with camera and 3 smart WiFi plugs.

I will honestly say that there is little to no menu systems in the echo show which was super disappointing, you can’t flip through it and change things whatsoever it all has to be done on the app, which is a mediocre app at best. I was hoping for streaming options on the show besides amazon video or just better options like Netflix or Hulu YouTube etc, maybe cooking channel for me and my girlfriend to watch while cooking? Idk, there’s not even really clear instructions for what it can do just what you can ask it.

The bottom line for me is that we already have 4 echos in a small apartment that play music fine and control devices fine, not always great which needs work, but now we have this new device with a screen that does most of the same but has a ultra limited screen that has tons of potential but little actual use, the device doesn’t even cover the hub that the echo plus has. :/

Amazon, without YouTube support this thing sucks, I’ll be honest, I’m returning mine, I don’t want browser based support for my products, I want REAL support, get it together, and stop asking me to subscribe to amazon music, it sucks, Spotify is way better.

author: L. Gangle
title: Awesome!
content: I bought the Echo Show on Prime Day 2018 after waffling back & forth between the Show & the Spot.  So glad I decided on the Show!  Yes, there are some things it doesn't do(connect to YouTube for instance), but overall I LOVE it.  The screen size is great, speakers provide good, clear sound.  I know there is a lot more it is capable of, but I will work on learning all of that.  Definitely happy with my purchase and recommend Echo Show!

author: Professional Shopper
title: NOT AS EXPECTED
content: Disappointed that this device does not have an internal battery.  When the device is unplugged, it kills the battery.  Which means that you cannot take the device from room-to-room.  Also, the cable does not have a USB connector.  The cable must be completely disconnected/connected from the outlet in the wall.  The lack of portability of the device, requires that you purchase additional devices (for other rooms in your home) to fully appreciate the capabilities of the Echo.

author: K. Smith
title: Horrible!
content: I am not happy with my Echo Show I tried to return it but was 2 days too late, I wouldn’t purchase this item stick with the Echo , it talks out of the blue, it restarts itself

author: Robert
title: Where is the speaker button when dropping in on an Echo Show?
content: Would have gave it a 5th star except for this huge oversight.  When using the Drop in feature on any other device your cell phone app has a speaker button.  When you drop in on the Echo Show the speaker button goes away and you get a button to disable video.  One might argue the only device you need a speaker button for is the show because it is the only device you need to communicate with while looking at your smart phone.  So now I have a video communication device that can only see my ear while using my smartphone.  Huge oversight guys!

author: Geoffrey
title: Lots of potential, but fix the setup
content:
I'll do a pros and cons:

Cons first: when compared to the pairing system of the echo and echo dot, this thing doesn't work anywhere near as well for pairing. You can't pair with your mobile, which makes it somewhat painful if you have a wifi pw that happens to be a 26 character hexadecimal. Add in that the firmware update failed 3 times, due to a "slow connection". Probably Amazon's firmware servers were slow, as I tested my bandwidth at 50mbps down sustained. As far as use: screen is a bit small for something you have setting down.

That's it for the cons. Like I said, setup was painful.

Pros: The sound quality is astonishing (it had better be for the price). The screen quality and touch response is quite good. The tip displays are great and very useful. The skills are expanding more, so that's rather nice. Of course, one of the major reasons I got it was for Ring integration. It works well, though I'm disappointed that sometimes I have to issue the command twice... Once to wake the camera, then again to show it. Why can't it just issue the wake command to the doorbell, then wait? Probably Ring's fault on that... Wait, this is the pros section.

I've found this to be an ideal nightstand device.

author: Robert Smith
title: This device can no longer play YouTube videos.
content: I purchased the Amazon Echo Show for one reason, to play YouTube videos while in my kitchen. I am very upset that Google no longer allows the access for this. Amazon needs to correct this issue immediately. I will update this review to five stars when the issue is resolved. Without YouTube video access, my Amazon Echo Show is worthless to me. I really loved the Amazon Echo Show, and Amazon is my favorite company on this entire earth. But sadly, this device is totally worthless to me without the access to play YouTube videos.

author: JAMES W WIEDMAN
title: Good for Early Adopters
content:
The Echo Show has great potential, but has quite a way to go. I like to see some of the results I ask for (three-day weather forecasts, lyrics to songs) and it is nice to have Amazon videos available. The killer app for me (the one that got me to buy it) is the videos to go along with recipes. I am a challenged cook, and seeing step-by-step instructions is nice: BUT, the screen times out too quickly, and I have to start at the beginning of the recipe once I get back in (infuriating!). There is also no way to tell which recipes have video until I get into specific recipes to see, which is tedious.

Most frustrating, the Echo Show doesn't support key services that would make it most useful. Skype and YouTube are essential for a video device, and the lack of those two significantly reduces the value of the Echo Show.

My general complaint about Alexa is that it does a terrible job recognizing classical music titles. When I want to listen to classical music, I either have to build a playlist in Amazon Music with the music I want (time consuming) or switch to my Google Home Mini (which is much smarter about classical music).

author: dsmith
title: love it so far
content: just got it and I like it already, plays the words to songs as it plays I can read a recipe when I am cooking it and unlike my tablet it doesn't shut off works with all my smart home devices, I am sure there are things I haven't explored but happy with it

author: Phillip Carroll
title: the show should have been a 5 star, But ...
content: the show should have been a 5 star, But got it to connect my netvue cam s  the instructions were ok But everytime I got to connect got an error of can not connect ..  the problem was the softwear or OS  you need to upgrade alexa  to newest version  and then  the key reboot everything  and then everything will enable

author: larrydonn
title: Great Device!
content: When I saw this Show I thought there must be a mistake or something. Then I re-read the listing and immediately bought it. After I set it up, which was extremely easy, and the right size for my taste, I couldn't believe the quality and features available with my Prime account, so I immediately bought a second one. With my Prime account they have so much to offer. I Love the on screen Lyrics at 67 I feel eighteen again after my two strokes I don't have to remember I can see the words so I can sing along(LOL). If someone is looking for a great device they should definitely buy a Gen 1 or Gen 2 Show Generation 2 are the only ones you will find unless you look hard). The capabilities are simply FANTASTIC!  The screens are clear and bright and the sound is incredibly bright and strong with great bass and if you want to customize the screen and sound you have brightness and equalizer controls. Although I haven't experienced the 10" screen on the Gen 2 Show, It can't be less than what you get on the great 7" screen on the Gen 1. So Go and get the future right now! I LOVE IT and the Gen 3 Echo Dot is a great compliment if you are on a budget, I have it too.

author: Prime user
title: Echo Show not reliable.
content: After the first few months of purchase, my show started to act up with problems. Half The screen display had lines across it.  I would turn it off and back on after 10 minutes. Itwould be ok for a few weeks and then start the problem again. Most recent problem is the screen will freeze up in the middle of asking a question.  I have found the Echo Show to be very disappointing in performance and reliability.  It constantly answers to the TV in the other room but never to me. I have to say “Alexa” first to get its attention and most of the time it answers with “I don’t know”, “I don’t understand” or my favorite is “I’ll have to look that up” and then I get nothing.  I tried and tried again to do the voice training but it never has positive results.  If I place a call through it, the other party won’t answer because they think it’s a Spam call. I can figure out how to chance the caller ID to my number and not the 800 number it uses.  Just recently I returned it after 8 months of frustration. It was still under warranty. I’ll see if the replacement unit is any better. Otherwise, it makes a great “paper weight” or a good time and weather announcer.

author: Jason urban
title: Not very happy.
content: Very disappointed in this. Have had for about 4-5 months and for the last 2 months the screen scrambles and bounces. Have sent several emails about this and absolutely nothing. I have 4 echo dots, echo spot, and echo premium, fire tablet and a toshiba fire tv. Love alxa stuff till this. Very sad this is doing this especially just made my last payment on it. Not please. Do your research.

author: jaxsqach
title: Camera phone??
content: If think what makes this great is the new drop in feature...can check in my dog or kids anytime I want....and the kids can call me without need of a cell phone or home phone...it still needs a few updates like a screen timeout but overall its worth the purchase....thought about buying one for my wife's mom so they can face time and she can check on the baby while she's at work

author: tb10818
title: Took away ability to play my own music
content: I loved my echo devices up until amazon decided to remove the upload your own music feature on Amazon music.  I have a bunch of music that cannot be streamed and was basically the only music I listened to. Now I have a very expensive cooking timer... I'd recommend the Google home devices over echos. All the same features and I you can upload your own library.

author: Traumadoc
title: Three Stars
content: Needs a lot of work . Has potential.

author: Michael Jost
title: Great features
content: Love this thing.. Best toy I've bought myself in awhile.. So far I have a smart plug connected running my Ac.  And the wifi light bulbs.  Baseball scores, weather are  cool but the music is the best feature.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Easy to set up with the exception that I already ...
content: Easy to set up with the exception that I already have another Echo and linked them together. Even though the older one is registered with my Prime unlimited music, when I tried to play a song on this new one, it said I had to have the Prime unlimited music plan to play it.  I went into the other room where the older one is and told Alexa to play a song, and it played on both devices.  It is just hat I cannot start a son on the new one. Would appreciate knowing if there is something I can do to have the new Echo Show start the songs.

author: Susan Rodgers
title: LOVE ALL THE FEATURES!
content: I absolutely love my Echo Show.  We already had an Echo and a few dots in our house.  Being able to see the shopping list on the screen and the 8 day forecast is great.  I also love the lyrics to songs while they are playing.  We also video call with our kids that live out of town.  I’ve setup my pictures to use as backgrounds that change the picture every 10 minutes and love that feature as well.  I could go on and on.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I recommend the cheaper Amazon dot
content: The Amazon Echo show does not understand when you talk clearly to it. I recommend the cheaper Amazon dot. It seems that my Amazon dot understands me more when I am talking to the device. The screen is broken on the bottom and the device only plays certain videos. I don't recommend the product for the price. You are better off getting the amazon dot.

author: don lavoie
title: IT'S JUNK DONT BUY..ONE STAR NOT LOWER RATE
content: HAD IT LESS THAN 2 MONTHS AND NO POWER TO DEVISE. AMAZON SEND TWO WEEKS WOULD SEND ANOTHER POWER CABLE. IT MUST BE COMING FROM BOAT FROM CHINA. THE ECHO HAS BEEN MOVED ANY PLACE. JUST STILL IN THE SAME LOCATION. SO THE CABLE SHOULDNT HAVE FAILED. I DONT EVEN KNOW IF IT IS. BUT IF A $123 FAILED IN LESS THAN 60 DAYS IS A POS..DONT BUY THIS....I HAVE A JUNK ONE ABOUT TO HEAVE IN THE TRASH PICK UP. DID AMAZON TELL YOU THEY ONLY GUARANTEE 30 DAYS.  MY LASTED 6 WEEKS. $123 BLOWN. IF YOU TRY TO RETURN THEY SAY THEY WILL SEND ANOTHER POWER CABLE. IVE BEEN WAITING FOR WEEKS FOR THE GHOST CABLE. THERE IS A REASON THAT THERE IS A NEW ONE OUT AND AMAZON ONLY WILL HONOR 30 DAYS OF FUNCTION!!

author: David G.
title: I do not like how I am unable to zoom or pan when ...
content: I'm not that "wowed" by it so to speak. I do not like how I am unable to zoom or pan when I use this with the security camera. Also, we had a huge issue with the software connecting to the cameras. Since this is a newly launched program, I expected gliches to occur. Will keep since no major issues this far.

author: Adam
title: WAIT FOR 2ND GENERATION - LOTS OF BUGS, SLOW, POOR SPEECH RECOGNITION AND ACCURACY COMPARED TO OTHER ECHOS
content: Bought two and sent them both back.  I have used the Echo and Echo Dot.  Compared to those, this unit is MUCH SLOWER and does not pick up voice recognition as well.  The video feature needs a lot of perfecting.  Not many of the "SKILLS" are applicable.  Came across several bugs, like accuracy, speed, freezing screens, and horrible video touch screen interface.  Save your money and wait for the second generation to come out.  This one stinks.

author: Lori Roxanne Andor
title: Not happy shuts down and has to be reset
content: This was a family Christmas present. We love it. But, 2 weeks after we noticed it shut down so hubby called and got it reset. Now almost 2 weeks after that it did it again, my hubby doesn’t want to give up on it so 1 more time he has rest it. Might have to go back if does it again.

author: James F. Woodward
title: Very Limited usefulness
content: Was expecting more, expected a Fire Tablet on a stand, the Echo Show is very limited to only Amazon Videos no access to apps except for a limited few for music apps.

author: Lauren G.
title: Mehhhhhhhhhhhh
content: I like my Alexa tower better. The Echo Show has so much potential but sadly I’m not impressed at all. It doesn’t understand as much and won’t show you basic things online. It makes everything much harder. My other Alexa has WAY better sound.

author: Carpenter60
title: at first thought nice little gadget but a little expensive for playing music ...
content:
I,m a remodeling contractor and have watched the Alexa craze start in the kitchens of homes over the past couple years, at first thought nice little gadget but a little expensive for playing music or answering a few questions? (180.00 for a music tower) I shop Amazon weekly and noticed the new generation Echo Show on sale for (Prime week $129.00) and with my prime account free shipping, NEXT DAY! I read specs. on the unit and knew I could make use of this device. I made the purchase and am very happy with it. I check weather daily, check top stories in the news, I ask questions that come to mind when i'm bored, I ask for recepies, I play music alllll the time, I watch trailers for prime movies,this Echo Show does it all, i'm not a huge techy but I do all rite , it took me 10 minutes to set up and be running. I have had it 3 days and already purchased a 2nd one for the bed room and that took all of about 5 minutes to set up. I have read dozens of revues and it seams the I phone Apple folks seam to be the harshest critics, I am an PC. guy and an Android Phone user and I have to say this is probably the coolest addition to my home and i'm in a lot of homes
 ( Remodeling Contractor as said earlier)  i'm now running 2 Echos and streaming prime and on tablet all at the same time and NOT an issue, some folks made coments about buffering or hesitation on there Echo,,, they mite have to step up there internet connection or upgrade from dial up HAHA!! anyway.. I plan on upgrading with lighting and a couple cameras and probable a thermostat to run off my Echo Show. Also like an other person who wrote a review I have a mother in a retirement home that is cell phone challenged an livs 1400 miles away and i'm planning on installing one in her room soo I can video call and check in with her, all she would have to do is Say (Alexa Answer Call). Soo for me a remodeling contractor who is in many homes and see a lot of trends come and go I think we could most all agree this technology is here to stay and all the little quirks will be worked out as Alexa gets smarter as time goes by.. She seams to be getting my traits in just a few days.. I would recommend this unit to any of my friends or clients.. Thanks Carpenter60.

author: Ashley Riley
title: With my husband being gone on (sometimes long) work trips I wanted a way to easily see around our house without needing my phone
content:
I purchased two Echo Shows for the main purpose of using them with my new Nest outdoor cameras. With my husband being gone on (sometimes long) work trips I wanted a way to easily see around our house without needing my phone. The Echo Show works superbly in that regard. The video quality is fantastic and it allows me to rest easy at night knowing I have such easy access to my cameras. I love many of the features, including the easy and useful interaction with Alexa. When I have my hands tied up with the baby or doing other tasks that take up a majority of my attention, it's great to have her there to play music, ask questions, and delegate tasks.

I only have one complaint about the Echo Show, which I saw in many, many other reviews while doing my research before purchasing, which is that it cannot play YouTube videos. I understand competitive markets and not wanting to directly promote the use of a competitor's product. But honestly, this would hands-down be a 5 star product if it had that capability. I hope in the future that Amazon will allow for this to be a skill on the Echo Show after seeing the public demand for it.

author: Jason Gill
title: Works great until you get the infamous screen flicker
content: Lots of people are experiencing an annoying screen flicker after the first several weeks of use. According to the forums, Amazon is aware of the issue but still does not have a solution. To get support, you'll need to send the device in for repairs before they will offer a replacement.

author: DOC
title: Crappy Warranty Support !!
content: I've had this Echo Show for just under 1 month. It replace an Echo Dot. The "Show" is actually a cool gadget, however mine has developed a problem with the display where the bottom 3/8 -1/2 inch continuously flickers and there is a black line separating the viewable upper portion from the flickering section. I spent 45 min on the phone with customer service and Echo support doing reboot and factory resets with no change or improvement. So now instead of Amazon sending a replacement, they want this device sent back for repair...If the service center can't fix the issue they'll replace it. Still that means I'll be without the device for at least a week (probably longer) I am disappointed that Amazon can't / won't just send a replacement.

author: Joe
title: Waste of time
content: No YouTube, Netflix, Hulu, or other main streaming video service capability, half the music I ask for isn’t available unless I go with Prime Music Unlimited (even for some songs that are 40-50 yrs old and some that are open source- like children’s songs). Alexa can’t understand some of my family members when they make requests and you have to ask Alexa just the right question isn’t he right way to get what you are looking for. Maybe in a few years this will be with your time but I hate this. My elderly mother who uses it like a radio she can talk to enjoys it enough for us to keep it but I wish I could talk her into something more functional. There are so few video functions for this I don’t even know why there is a screen. For what my family uses this thing for an echo dot or something would have been better. Very disappointing.

author: techfan
title: Didn't think I would like it initially
content:
I had an Amazon Echo and a Google Home before this. My most recent was a Google Home. The Google Home had too many issues and was not consistent. Also, my Hue lights would not work consistently so, after using the Google Home for a month, I decided to go back to Amazon Echo.
Initially, when I first heard they released the product, I figured they were “reaching” in terms of a product rollout. Then I started to see the reviews on Youtube and started getting interested and my thought of Amazon “reaching” was starting to go away.

The Amazon Show is more useful than I thought. Having the screen is a great thing if you like to see things visually. For example, when you want to see how much time is left on the timer, what is on your grocery list, a scrolling feed of top news stories or the weather and time. In terms of watching videos and such, the screen is about the same size as the Iphone 7 Plus or Galaxy S8+.

Overall, comparing it to the Echo, I think the $50 extra for the display is worth the money. While I do not use the video screen all the time, its useful to have when you want to see something visually.

author: Alex
title: Overall great product
content: The Show is an amazing tool for the home. From setting timers, to displaying recipes, and even getting updated on recent news, the Show can help you get a little more accomplished by acting as your personal assistant. The drop-in function is amazing, and has great image and audio quality. I use it daily to check in with the family and to just check on the Home. The ability to control other smart devices is a very useful feature, by the way of acquiring “skills” in the Alexa app, but the list of available skills is still growing, and there is no real easy way of seeing which skills are available, say if a family member wants to use it. Skills are activated by very precise wording, which can make it a pain if you don’t use it as often.

author: J. Hamby
title: Great for use in Kitchen!
content: There are so many great sites for any recipes for cooking just about any dish and Alexa is a great help. It's like having my own cooking instructor in my kitchen showing me how to do it. Echo Show is one of my smartest buy for this year and I am looking forward to all the innovations of the future. I love having Amazon!!

author: Jackyl764
title: easy to set up
content: I got this for my wife for Christmas, as with all Amazon Echo products, easy to set up, and a pleasure to have in our home. We're converting all of our lights to Wi-Fi bulbs, what a nice feature, no more walking into a dark house.

author: Fawzi
title: The best Echo you can have!!!
content:
I can't say enough of how great this product is. All what Alexa can offer , plus more of visual flavour to your voice controlled commands and assistance. Everyone in the family was able to easily enjoy and use.
Expect lots of "wows"

The only problem I had was the lack of sowing lyrics to my Amazon music played. I tried to fix it with amazon support team with no luck. I'm sure this is fixable, but I found the support team a bit unaware fully of how to fix it.

Otherwise, it worth it.

author: J. Dorman
title: The Best Parts of Echo Get Better!
content: I love Echo... it's such a part of our family my kids are constantly calling out "Alexa" even when we are away from home. This leads to the embarrassing "Echo moment" when you realize she isn't there. Echo show is best described by others I'm sure but all I can say is: Wow! All the old features I won't rehash but with Echo Show my news flash briefing in the morning is now like a little TV newscast just for me. I would like to see a few more regions added for local news but most states have a larger participating news station that will do for now. People said before this came out that the screen would be too small to enjoy watching Amazon Video or any videos for that matter. Actually the screen is much larger than I thought and the convenience is NOT having additional space wasted by having a large screen in the kitchen. I only hope cooking apps and channels are added so that when Echo is in the kitchen she acts like a visual cooking instructor that you can pause and cook along with. Until then watching "Jacque and Julia Cooking at Home" on our Echo will do just fine!

author: jason
title: Some issues
content:
Seems like the Echo show has a problem recognizing words, more often than not it performs wrong or not at all.
Should of stayed with Echo Dot, performs way better.

author: Lenslady1
title: excellent addition to my kitchen
content: ‭The Echo was a gift and what surprise!  Ask her anything and be tickled.  Got the Echo Show a few weeks later,  excellent addition to my kitchen. Music weather and recipes just to start!  Video phone calls with family who live cross country!!

author: mpwayne
title: Junk - Retracting
content:
SOLVED! -- I figured it out (I hope).  Apparently, you can place the Alexa devices too close together. My Show is working fine now that I moved the Echo to my basement office.  They were about 25 feet apart with no walls between. The Dot is in the bedroom with two walls and about 40 feet away from the Show. The Kindle Fire is still being difficult, however. I've already replaced the charger cord and the plug itself. Followed the directions several times about what to do if Kindles won't charge. Didn't help.
ORIGINAL POST- It was GREAT at first. Five months later, no sound. Not happy. Don't waste your money. Between the Show and my HD Fire 10 (takes days to charge), I'm done with Amazon electronics.

author: Joyce Scholefield
title: Fun for me
content:
I have one in the living room so I can drop in on the animals. My dog just ignores me. One of my cats (the not too smart one) runs into the room when I drop in and looks at me. The other two cats are in cahoots with the dog and hope by ignoring me I will go away.
I also set up a show in the kitchen so I can drop I on the man while I am at work or away. I think he is taking the dogs side. But most important, I am having a real good time.

author: KevinB.
title: Billboard for amazon suggestions 👎👎
content: So far this is nothing more than a billboard in your living room for things Amazon want you to see or buy....  and zero ability to watch YouTube. I really wanted this to be cool, but you cant even stop the endless display of suggestions that are on your screen pretty much continuously......

author: Seth
title: If you like the echo
content: If you like the echo, you'll love the show! We had an echo and I hardly used it. Got my wife a show for christmas, figured it would be good for in the kitchen, and it's much more inviting to use. It streams suggestions about news stories and other things to ask Alexa.

author: njack26
title: It is perfect, my daughter lives in another state and my ...
content: I bought one for my daughter and one for my mother.  It is perfect, my daughter lives in another state and my mother, who has trouble with skype or facetime, is able to use this to video call my daughter and talk with her and her great grandson.  Believe me she LOVES it....  I hear she even uses it to listen to songs sometimes...

author: MarkAllisonMc
title: Alexa app automatically picks who in in you contact list
content: Awesome Sound awesome drop-in feature for use with elder care. One feature that is not good is you can’t select your contacts.  It automatically adds people who you have in your address book who happen to have an Alexa device.  For example I have contacts from work in my phone who I would never want to call personally on my Alexa device nor would I want them calling me.  But they are in my Alexa address like list and I can’t remove them manually.  The system should let you add them manually not just put them in if they have registered their phone number with amazon.  Very annoying.  I would be a Five Star otherwise.

author: P. Elliott
title: Visionary
content:
Works just as well as the normal Echo tower, and sounds great.  Even some of the Flash Briefing providers are now adding video to their narrative (e.g. Kiro 7).

We have one in the kitchen and one in the bedroom.  I've set the "do not disturb" mode on a schedule on the bedroom one, so that it always dims when we're going to bed with no little headlines, and brightens up in the morning, with little snippets of things to ask.  I would say that although it does dim appropriately, the do not disturb mode could be one step dimmer.

One suggestion I have, is that the home screen shows the current time and weather, but also needs to show the date.  No doubt an update will fix that soon.

author: Aardvark
title: A Good Device with Potential
content: I received this device as a Christmas gift from my employer who is hoping I would spend some time developing a skill for it that my firm can use (I am a software developer).  It is a well built device and the audio is superb.  However, I have found there to be dearth of video based applications for it.  I usually watch the morning "Five Things To Know" video from CNN and I also have the Ring doorbell skill installed that allows me to monitor my sisters Ring doorbell (I do not have one myself).  Other than that, there is no longer any YouTube support and there is no access to most social media site like Facebook (Twitter is available as an audio skill and I have used it with my Echo Dot's).  As this device has only been on the market 7 months, I imagine that has not been enough time for a skill base to develop specifically designed for the Echo Show.

author: Anonymous
title: screen started glitching
content: After having the product for about a month and a half, the screen started flickering.  There are also lines that appear on the bottom of the screen that appear and flicker or bands that will appear in the middle of the screen.  This device has been sitting in the same spot since I received it.  The whole point in having the echo show was for the display, but if the display becomes an eyesore, then what's the point?  I should've just stuck with my echo dot.

author: Tim and Cai
title: So so
content: I like it I just wish it had an outpoot jack of any kind so I could use a speaker or headphones.

author: FRAYDA LEVIN
title: Still a Novelty
content: We really can't find much to do with the Echo.  It is more like a fun novelty.  I am sure over time it will be as essential as computers and phones.  But right now, we only play ask questions.  Half the time Echo does not "know". The other times, we realize it would have been quicker to just search on a device.  But again, I am sure over time it will have many practical uses.

author: scout
title: Amazing!!
content: Haven’t had the Echo very long, but it is amazing! Weather, music, questions, etc, etc. and all ya do is ask. I like the Exho Show with the screen. Can watch movie, see music artists and lyrics. Blowing my mind how far technology has come along. Also, makes me feel like I have a roommate..

author: Amazon Customer
title: Frustrated by Try Alexa suggestions on screen
content:
The Echo Show has a clear, crisp screen great screen. Shows video and webpages easily. Improved speaker as well.
Major problem for me is that you can not remove the constant "Try "Alexa" suggestions on the screen. I would prefer to control the screen messages of the unit I purchased myself.

author: Ursula Campbell
title: 5 stars!
content: I purchased this for my mom for Christmas and she loves it! My mom is in her mid-60s and it is so easy for her to just tell Alexa to play a song, or let her know what the weather is like, etc. She video calls me and it is the greatest thing in the world to her.

author: Stephen Weiss
title: Impressive Device, BUT no YouTube !!
content:
0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player I purchased this device primarily to listen to music streamed from YouTube: a sort of ‘table radio’, an all-in-one replacement for the separate device (Fire 8 HD) and speakers that I currently use. YouTube is a great source for background music, having easy to find, extended-play (10+ hours or streaming ‘live’) music available. I was very disappointed with regards to the Echo SHOW’s inability to directly access YouTube; can be done, but very cumbersome and difficult to navigate to the desired selections.
My PROs:
• Attractive, all-in-one compact design; device’s ‘Retro-Modern’ styling deserves a spot in the Design section of NYC’s “Museum of Modern Art”
• Initial set-up extremely easy
• Voice recognition is very good, even in a noisy environment with background music playing.
My CONs:
• Voice-only control can be very frustrating for complex inputs/requests
• Lack of external keyboard connection ability
• Answers are very short and lacking in detail
• Alexa’s AI needs more development (see my comments, below).
My WANTs:
• YouTube . . . Please !
• Keyboard connect ability as a secondary input (via ‘Bluetooth’ or USB)
• Audio output (low level, stereo) jack for connecting a powered external speaker system for better sound quality.
As noted above, I also have some reservations with respect to the ‘answers’ provided by Alexa. I personally (others my feel differently) that ‘answers’ are just too short, incomplete, and sometime WRONG (or at least, misleading). A prime example is my question regarding Gold:
Question: “How much does one cubic centimeter of Gold weigh?”
Answer: “There is 0.043 pounds of Gold in 1 milliliter.” While this answer could be correct UNDER CERTAIN CIRCUMSTANCES, I consider it to be WRONG (IMHA)! This Q/A is an indication of AIexa’s inability to properly interpret the question ‘in context’ with common practice, and also to totally disregard the need for ‘qualification’. Alexa should realize that “Gold”, being a precious metal, traditionally uses the TROY weight system, NOT the standard AVOIRDUPOIS system. Thus, the best ‘correct’ answer is 0.0517… Troy Pounds (or, better yet, 19.32 . . grams, which is the weight of one cubic centimeter of Gold (equal in grams to the Specific Gravity). Also, weight-per-volume needs to be qualified as to temperature (and, for gases, pressure). In addition, although “milliliter’ and ‘cubic centimeter’ are equal ‘volumes’, the use of ‘milliliter’ is a bit ‘off-track’ since ‘milliliter’ is normally used in reference to ‘liquids’ not ‘solids’.
In summary, the Echo Show may serve the needs of many purchasers, but I found it to not meet my expectations or requirements. Alexa, and Artificial Intelligence in general, is fairly new and will continue to evolve. At some point I may ‘revisit’ this device, but for now: bye-bye Alexa.
*************
Accidentally omitted mention of using a small Bluetooth keyboard with my Fire 8 HD tablet / powered speaker mention in the above review; the keyboard makes input a lot more convenient and faster.

author: Speed
title: Like it more than expected
content: I looked at this for a long time. The initial reviews seemed a little lackluster, and the price ($229) is quite high. I wasn't sure what the screen could really add to Alexa for that price. When it dropped to $150 for the holidays, I bought one. So, if you already have an Echo, I think you will have reasonable expectations. Does the screen add a lot? Not really. But it is nice. The screen will rotate through your calendar, the temperature, and links to some interesting stories and videos. If you ask for the weather, it will display the full week. You also get the real feel tempurature. If you set a timer, it will rotate through that too. I think this works really well in the kitchen, but I have multiple Echos and I don't see a reason to replace the others with an Echo Show. So if you know what an Echo does, you should like the Show. Just don't expect it to be something else. It doesn't currently support YouTube, but I can't really see myself using that a lot.

author: N. Rosenthal
title: Meh...
content:
This was my 4th echo device, 1st echo show  it seemed to have huge potential, and I really wanted to like it, but soon found out it is quite limited. A bit disappointing, but not the end of the world, I used it like I use my other, screenless echos.... For a little under 2 month, when the screen started flickering, mostly on the bottom of the screen but not just. A quick look in some forums made me understand it is pointless asking for a replacement, as some people had 2-3 devices replaced, only to start flickering again shortly after. Amazon are not providing any serious answers, and this has been going on for quite some time apparently.
Long story short, I moved it to the hallway, and been using it as a very expensive... and bulky voice activated light switch for my hue lights. So like the headline suggests... Meh.

author: Crystal
title: It is easy to use
content: It is easy to use.  I hadn't realized that it was so locked to Amazon only.  It was not worth the price to me.  I cannot do so many things with it that I would like to do.  I wish it just had a standard android OS on it so that you could use apps and such.

author: Bottm4UBoy
title: I love Amazon Echo Show, which is one of my best purchases on Amazon
content:
I love my Amazon Alexa Show.  Echo Show brings me  everything I  love about Alexa, and now she can show me it all as well on a beautiful, bright, colorful screen.  I can watch videos, flash briefings,  see music lyrics, security cameras, photos, weather forecasts, to-do and shopping lists, browse and listen to Audible audiobooks,  and all of this is hands free.  All I have to do is ask Alexa.  I use her to find out how to spell words, make hands free video calls,
and instantly connects to other Echo devices around your home so I can tell Alexa to turn off and on my lights.
Alexa plays my songs,  and she streams over my in home Wi-Fi.  The speakers are exellent quaility  Dolby processing for crisp vocals and extended bass response .  I am even able to adjust the treble, mid, and bass levels with my  voice.
I have not connected any cameras yet, but may try that soon since that is possible,.  With eight microphones, beamforming technology, and noise cancellation, Echo Show hears me  from any direction—even while my music is playing which I love.  There are numerous skills and I one of my favorites is that i have here connected with my XM Radio account so I can listen to my XM Radio through Alexa.  I love this item and I highly recommend.  It is one of my most favorite purchases on Amazon.

author: Pat G.
title: Love it
content: We have an Echo, a Dot and a Tap so I guess we need to get a life but I love this one.  This was gift  from our son and I was not at all sure about it  but I am now hooked.  Really love the screen.  The Facetime option  is great.  The speakers are really good and we now  exclusively use the Show for music inside now.  I also like that I can see my shopping list without opening the Alexa app and having timers  on the screen is also nice.

author: Fistandaltiis
title: Amazon Support for the Alexa not up to par on this device
content: At 1st I wanted to give this device 5 stars. After having for slightly over a week, I've run into a problem with the Alexa SiriusXM skill. I have an account with full access on Sirius that includes full computer/device access. I've add the this option to Alexa and Alexa tells me it's linked. I ask her to play something like 80's on 8 and she tells me my subscription doesn't cover that. So I ask her just to play ch8. Then she tells me "something is wrong" but she won't say what. I've spent a good deal of time with Sirius making sure it's not their issue. I've spend just as much time with Alexa support on Tuesday. I was told it was being sent to the development team, and that I would be contacted back within 24 to 48 hours. Now 36 house later, still no contact as I was promised by the person helping me Tuesday. I've never had problems with any of my previous Amazon devices, but this one is a challenge. I feel that I upgraded my Sirius subscription for nothing as I can't use it on Alexa as I had expected. Also please note, I have the original Echo and an Echo Dot and they can't play Sirius either.

author: Jay M.
title: A good start
content: We share an Amazon account so it’s hard to split our two Alexa Shows by room/person, and a little awkward to program and use some features. As it gets more useful and user-friendly it should be a great product.

author: bill
title: great to video chat and get close to family and ...
content: The show is unreal, does so many diff, thing to many to mention.. great to video chat and get close to family and friends, Easy to set up too took less than 5 to 10 minutes. I bought 4 for family and friends. BUY IT.

author: Kenneth C Corson
title: Bad video screen SAVE Your Money
content: I own an Echo & Echo Dot & have had no issues. The Show on the other hand started having screen issues at about to 60 day mark, I called about this issue & the person I talked to said they had no known issues ( I read online after that this is a known issue). So they sent me a return label, I returned the item for repair, it came back within the week, now it started acting up again.  Save your money, DONT BUY this

author: Joseph Ferraro
title: Limited capabilities and in desperate need of some updates, before it sinks into obsolescence.
content:
We use the Echo Show in our kitchen. We like the availability of a screen at the breakfast table, for our 3 year old. She’s very much into movies - and ones that we enjoy, too. So, it’s a benefit in our house. We also use it to cast music throughout the house using Groups of other Echo devices around the house. In some ways, the Show is fun, but very limited.

It’ll play music you’ve connected to your account - like Pandora. And, it’ll play albums from Amazon Music. It can play a radio station, like your local NPR station, and gives a fairly decent weather forecast. But, that’s. about. it.

You’d think they’d have built in Fire TV features to a touchscreen video player. But, no. No access to download Netflix or Hulu, or any apps at all for that matter. Even an SD slot in the back would’ve made a ton of sense. But, again, no. It’s basically an Amazon only devise. With a few, very few, exceptions.

It’s command recognition is beginning to feel antiquated as well. I know, for a technology that’s so new, I’d assume it has better capabilities. It barely knows how to play/pause what your watching or listening to.

Alexa knows how to pause a video, I’ll give them that. But, it doesn’t know how to continue playing. “Alexa, pause,” works fine. To continue playing, with the video or music paused on the screen, one would assume “Alexa, Play,” would be the right command. Instead, that command forces the software to start playing some random playlist.

Without a major update soon, I can smell the obsolencense of this device a mile away. And, that’s too bad. I’m sure it’s due to be replaced very soon, and it will end up in the trash like a lot of other tech junk these days. A BIG update is the only saving grace of the Show.

I’d steer clear if I were considering this device now. And, go with a tiny monitor you can mount on a wall with an Amazon Fire plugged it. This way you can enjoy many more features and capabilities.

author: Oki North
