title: Like Mary Poppins...Practically Perfect!
content: I have the Echo Show in my kitchen and use it for EVERYTHING! It does great with multiple timers, showing how to do something special with videos, doing measurement conversions, performing temperature conversions, pulling up my recipes, keeping my shopping lists (I have 5 different list going at once). There are no downsides to this product with one exception, the sound does not meet the same standards as my old Echo. My old echo was much louder and clearer. This Show seems to be much quieter, in addition, there does not seem to be the crispness in sound that my old Echo had. If the sound were the same quality as my old Echo I would definately rate this 5 Stars.

author: Jerry K.
title: No YouTube. Not worth it.
content: Without YouTube it is just not worth the cost. Will be returning.

author: Dalton
title: Best Echo yet....
content:
I am so disappointed in myself for taking so long to buy the Echo Show. It has proven itself to worth every dime spent. From watching my news briefing, to videos and photo playback.

Most importantly, I can drop in on my two year old during the day to see how he is doing while I am at work. He is more attached to it that any of my other echoes in the house and understandably so.

I love the idea that it shows everything onscreen. I sure as heck makes karaoke simply during family time. The sleek design sure fits in perfectly in my home.

author: David Thornton
title: Needs video skills update and web browser but still a great device!
content: This is a good device. It needs some better skills for video. When I connect my fire TV I cannot play the Directv Now recordings over it which sucks and I cannot play live TV from Directv Now on it. It has a screen for a reason but seems some of the video apps are a bit hard to get to or missing. Using it for Audible books and podcasts is wonderful. It just needs some upgrades for video. You can play prime but that only works a little for me because I use my AT&T phone to connect to the internet and data is free for Directv Now but not for Prime Video.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazon Echo show screen flickering issues
content: The product is really nice when it works..started screen flickering within two months of purchase .. It was sent in and repaired .. two months later it is doing the same thing .. Pos!! It has something to do with the brightness  or adaptive screen setting , I change those and it goes away for a bit

author: AT
title: I do like seeing the words to songs
content: Only reason I purchased was to be able to watch Youtube and then that was removed due to legal issues.  I do like seeing the words to songs, etc. The sound not as good as with the original, but it is certainly adequate.

author: victoria
title: Cool gadget
content: My husband just made our home a smart home. I thought He would Get it for the music but now I can just ask Alexa to turn on tv, turn on lights, etc.  We plan on using it for more skills as we learn them.  Has fun games.  Just bought my family an echo too.

author: Jan
title: Full of wonderful discoveries
content: I'm still discovering the many features of the Echo Show, and of Alexa - Most of my music choices are enjoyed, but am disappointed she does not know Edward Grieg's "Lyric Pieces" which is a wonderful multi-faceted combination of marches and other Nordic music.  'Have not asked for stories listed, just news.  I still work 3/4 of the time and don't have time to experiment with the Eco so much.  Am retiring soon and will have more time.  Am looking forward to  that - it's a wonderful product!

author: Amazon Customer
title: It's nice to see the lyrics of some of the songs ...
content: Just purchased it, so I am still checking out the capabilities.  It's nice to see the lyrics of some of the songs I ask it to play and it is awesome to check the local forecast without having to wait for a weatherman on the TV or radio.  (I haven't found an app that shows weather radar for my local area yet though.)  The sound when playing music isn't as good as the Echo Plus, but it isn't bad either.  Biggest complaint is the instructions on initial setup are severely lacking.  Still, happy so far with the purchase.

author: Gina
title: Not as cool and benificial as I thought it would be. Might return it.
content:
Not liking this very much at all. I never owned a echo or anything like this. I got a deal on it for $159. I thought I would use it more. Because YouTube isn’t part of it anymore (and I knew that before buying it )but figured there would be other videos to watch. I do a lot of DIY projects. This doesn’t bring up anything I ask it. I’ll ask Alexa please show me cocoa butter Lotion, chapstick,or body wash recipes,whatever I plan on making and so forth but it will bring up baking recipes for cookies or other things instead. I can get everything on my iPhone so I really don’t even need this for that. I figured it be easier instead of getting my phone all gross while making my products.
I used it a few times to call my sister because she has one too. I also used it for the drop in for when I’m away to check on my house and my cats. Though the noise it makes scares them. while my sister was taking care of my house while I was a way last week, when I called her on it, she said my voice was distorted and it was making a weird high pitch sound. I couldn’t hear it on my end though. So maybe something is wrong with it?  Since I’m not getting much use out of it as I thought I would, I may end up returning it. It’s expensive to just sit on my table or counter collecting dust. The commercials made it look really neat and useful. Also, everything else extra for it like the outlets to turn lights on and the cameras are pretty expensive. I don’t know if I’ll ever be able to afford to buy them in the future. I guess I should’ve done more research before purchasing. I got it on Inpulse bc the price was cheaper and the sale wasn’t gonna last much longer that day, plus I was able to set up a payment plan which made it much more affordable. I’ll have to think about it some more to see if I really want to keep it. As of now, it’s pretty useless. The camera part to check in on my house, I can do with my tablet and a free app. So that will cost me nothing.

author: Gun Sam Kim
title: Does way more stuff than you think it should
content: It's quite an amazing product.  Just when I think the original Echo totally met my needs, Amazon has this new product for sale on Prime Day.  I didn't see any Prime Day Amazon dogs, though.  It blew me away so much that I had to get a second one.  It has words to songs. I can watch Star Trek TOS on this. My wife loves it!  The only thing we haven't figured out is how to do video chat between our two units. I can call one but the other one can't initiate.  We'll work through this novel feature as well.  Everything else is a wonderful adventure of discovery.

author: Rick J. Harron
title: Exceeded my expectations!
content:
When I purchased the Echo Show, I had low expectations as to it's use.  The main reason I wanted it was to see who was at the door for my Ring Door Bell, when some one rang the door bell.  Based on the reviews I read, I realized I could not talk through Echo to someone at the door, but I could only see who was at the door.  For me that was enough.  The Echo Show accomplished that need and it does it with minimal delay.
After playing with Echo Show,  I realized there is so much more to this device that I really liked.  I like being able to play Amazon Music and request any song and genre I want.  I enabled Sirius XM and now I can play all Sirius channels as if I had a Sirius radio (you do have to have a printed list of the channels and request the specific channel you want to play).  I like being able to look up and use recipes on All Recipes.com.  It is really great how it steps thru the recipe while I am cooking.  Love being able to listen to my Audible books on the device.  I appreciate being able to get weather and traffic conditions on the fly.  The timer is very useful in the kitchen.  Every day I am enabling new things that the Echo Show can do.  For the price I paid for this device, I think it is fantastic and I am considering buying another one for my bedroom in place of my alarm clock.  I am surprised Apple had not come up with something like this sooner.

author: Jason Hart
title: Good product, but is missing one key feature and lacks support
content:
I've only have this product for about two weeks so I'm still trying to discover all of its capabilities.  Currently I am using it in my office and it is making a good assistant.  The best part of the show is that it is combining the Alexa App features, the Echo, and my google calendar into one device.  I don't use video calling at this time so I can't write about those features and I don't use any apps at this time.

I think Amazon missed one important feature that could really be useful to the disabled community.  There should be a feature that allows the user to touch which app, such as Spotify or Pandora, without having to use voice commands.  This feature would also be useful for playing Amazon Music or Videos; there are people who cannot speak and adding this feature would allow for them to use this device.  If this is a feature that is already on the Show I haven't found it yet.

author: M. Lopez
title: Great Device adds functionality to the Alexa lineup
content:
Very Nice unit. Sounds better than I originally thought. using it in my bedroom as clock radio alarm replacement. But it does so much more.
It has exceeded my expectation. As a purchaser of the Dot , Echo, and Echo plus this one fits nicely in between all of them.  the screen is nice.  I do want to mention I got it during the Christmas special don't know if I would have purchased it at full price.

author: Cisco
title: Don't bother if you like your clock to show todays date.
content:
Don't bother if you like your clock to show todays date.  Spent over 80 minutes between being transferred to over 5 customer service representative, and not one could figure it out.  Then after two hours....Sorry that option is not available.

Ring doorbell skill, takes forever to respond making it pointless, as the person is already gone by the time anything is shown on the screen.

Save your money.  I wish I did not buy it

author: Monique Long
title: I have so much love for the Echo products
content: I have so much love for the Echo products. As an Apple lover, they just waited too late to get into the home automation game. We have an echo in every room of our home (except the bathrooms.) We are only purchasing smart home products that are Alexa certified. We are getting more and lazier by the second!! I know she can order food, but if only Alexa could cook...

author: T Lepton
title: Please fix the All-Or-Nothing contact list for Alexa.  You can search on ways to get around it but should not have to.
content:
I like the show.  Along with two dots we have intercoms. It still has the problem of all or nothing with the contacts list.  I cannot put in just family for drop in communication and I am not giving it my phone's full contact list of hundreds, mostly business people that I do not want to have drop in access.  AMAZON PLEASE FIX THIS !!!  Ask anyone.
Otherwise all is well and I like the device.  I would like it better if it was not all or nothing on the phone contacts.

author: John Gallagher
title: Great addition to home automation.
content: Works very well with other items in the Wink 2 home automation system. I like that I can use to view Ring doorbell and Canary home cameras. Nice to ask Alexa to turn on lights or for status of devices and locks.

author: Scott S.
title: Aretha is fantastic!!!
content: I like everything about it!!! I’ve got 3 if them, 1 for us at home and 1 for Stephanies parents & 1 for my parents. Fantastic for the video phone calls. One thing that disappoints me is that I have some premium music apps that I cannot use through any of the Alexa devices. Haven’t watched videos as advertised but perhaps someday. Looking forward to adding to our smart home, 7 Alexa devices in the home, many smart outlets and switches beginning to add for outside with landscape lighting and holiday displays

author: Mary Hnylka
title: 2nd one
content: This is our second one - the first one didn't even last a year.  Went thru 3 exchanges - and the other 3 were refurbished ones.  They didn't work right.  Was told by Amazon to buy one and they would reimburse me, which they did.  This one works fine, will see how long this one will last -  We do like it

author: Kinetech Solutions
title: Can't get to YouTube Videos which is a huge waste of the screen.
content: Alexa is brilliant and having a screen attached to it is awesome. Amazon Music shows the lyrics when you play songs. HUGE DOWNSIDE THOUGH... Apparently Amazon is fighting with Google so you can't get to YouTube Videos which is a severe disappointment.

author: Elissa Spicer
title: Didn’t know I needed one, and now I’m expanding!
content:
My in-laws got this for us as a Christmas gift. Being an Apple family, we hadn’t really even heard much or researched the Echo line at all. So, I will say that we opened the box with zero expectations and weren’t disappointed with the lack of YouTube, since we didn’t find out that was originally included until a few days later. Not knowing that it was supposed to be a feature, we didn’t feel as let down as some other reviewers.

The Show was really easy to setup, and we had it online within minutes. The hardest part, which wasn’t even that hard, was navigating the Alexa app for iPhone and trying to find where all of the settings were to get the device tuned in how we wanted (for example, allowing our household to drop in but not anyone else). A few times, the app did not want to save my address for things like updating traffic and weather, but I just kept trying and eventually it stayed in there. Not really a problem with the Show itself, but can be annoying as you try to get ready to try out all of the features.

Staying home with a 4 year old means that I’m usually always doing SOMETHING, and most of that with my hands full. The ability to just talk to Alexa and add items to my shopping list while cooking lunch and dinner is amazing. Turning up music on a quality speaker, skipping songs, or even changing the station with a few words is great. Watching videos on a clear screen that is surprisingly great quality while meal prepping has been my favorite. Especially after my husband and son took over the living room TV with their Christmas gaming console, I can still watch my Prime Videos in the kitchen while I’m getting things done. Now, I will say that I had the ability to ask Siri for things before, but half the time my phone is across the room or in the bedroom on the charger. Having a dedicated screen and speaker on the kitchen counter while my hands have chicken juices on them means I actually USE the voice feature all the time now.

In the near future, we plan to add smart products like LED light strips, WiFi enabled lightbulbs, security cameras, and maybe even the Harmony remote. I’m pretty excited about the possibilities of integrating so much, especially as we consider adding another baby to the family.

Things we love-
Great quality sound that doesn’t distort as the volume gets louder
Great video quality for the screen size
Ease of use
Easy to set up
Tons of skills to set up and explore

Things that could be improved-
Chargeable battery to take to another room easily
Camera angle adjustment for small kids using the video call feature
Design that allows easy mounting to a wall if low on space
Easier trigger words for skills, or an easier way to change what Alexa defaults to when we use certain phrases would be great. For example, I use Our Groceries, but if I just tell Alexa to add something to the list, it defaults to the native shopping list. The ability to change that would be perfect!

author: Joe W.
title: Waste of money
content: It seems like it has the absolute dumbest version of Alexa, it can't answer simple questions and ever since this last update it refuses to turn off it's screen no matter what I say to it.

author: Pru Red
title: Glitches and does not work well!
content: My dad likes Amazon devices and he bought this for me as a gift, and I thought that I would really enjoy it. Whenever I asked it to play music or if it was talking and I asked her something during that time it would not respond. I would have to go and pause the music in order for her to respond. And after a few months of using it, the screen starts to glitch, lines appearing all over the screen and I would have to constantly restart. The idea of the product is good but the actual product is not.

author: Chris
title: At first she worked fine, however after a week she wouldn't answer when ...
content:
At first she worked fine, however after a week she wouldn't answer when I called her name. Also she would take time to render what I had said.
I was thinking about get one for my daughter, but I not sure about 🤔🤔 and is the second one I ordered,  very disappoint. Need to be fixed or something because now has like a moving screen ☹ I feel like a waist almost $500 between the two of them.

author: Najmur Rahman
title: Mic quality not so good.
content:
Its not able to listen to the voice unleas i am real close to it. I also have a google home which works even if i am in the other room.
Other than that it works as describer by Amazon.

author: kp129
title: Buyer Beware
content: You can select a background but why?  There are constant banners on the screen of "Try this" with Alexa, plus larger banners of misc.  No way to shut them off, it is going back.

author: Hugh M
title: Echo show has better sound. Although I feel like the software should ...
content: Compare to the original echo, Echo show has better sound. Although I feel like the software should be much improved. Wish there is a setting to turn off the screen at certain hours or just turn off after some inactive time. I place it by my bed and I am a light sleeper, Even at the dimmest setting, it is still too bright at night.

author: Phil
title: Simple detail misfire.  Too bright at night.
content: The screen is pretty good, but at night even if adjusted to night mode and brightness turned all of the way down it emits too much light.  We do like to sleep in a dark room, but the alarm clocks we have don't light up the room like the echo show does.  Looking for film I can put over the screen to darken it.

author: A. J. Pope
title: Best Beginning Echo!
content: I love how easy this device makes it for me to stay connected with my family. I can be cooking in the kitchen and talk to my mother as she's cooking in her kitchen. It picks up voices from across the room and delivers clear and Crisp audio every time. One example of how well this picks up audio, my brother actually went into the other room and some through a closed door and I could still hear him! I actually prefer to call on it in over my cell phone. Video quality can fluctuate with connection, but overall, I am so pleased with this. As a side note, you actually can call any phone number using the echo show, but only Alexa app users can get a video call. I even use it to call my mother on her regular cell phone. I enjoy the other features, and find it easy to use with playing content from Amazon, namely audio books, movies, music, etc. The sound quality is very good in my opinion, the closest I may ever come to owning a bose. Jk, not quite that good, and Maybe others will correct me, but I find it has good sound. Also, if definitely fills a room. I cannot believe I have lived so long without this in my life! Also, I own a Dot, and can honestly say that the pickup on sound is not nearly as good, and the sound quality is acceptable. I use my dot to set alarms at night and remind myself of things. I am glad to own  both, but I definitely use the show and neglect the dot :)

author: M. Johnson
title: Not up to par!
content: I own many other Echo products and was very disappointed with the show. The speakers sounded muddy, it constantly responded "Sorry, something went wrong", and actually made my other echos glitchy. It was disappointing also that YouTube is no longer supported.  I have returned it after 4 days of trying to work the bugs out.

author: Shauna  G.
title: My mom lives in Canada and is not text savvy ...
content: My mom lives in Canada and is not text savvy and I am which poses a problem. I can drop in on her I can see her whenever i wish. she can show me all of the stuff that she picks up at the store I can send her pictures of my life and see that she's OK in person… Priceless...  Amazon please make the Canada to US echo shows a little easier to set up though .

author: Sunnie and Richard Hanes
title: Great for home monitoring, and video chatting!
content: We are a fully integrated Alexa smart home!  this was just another great addition to the line up!  I love that I can "drop in" and view my living room (where the device is set up) from anywhere using the Alexa app!  Another great bonus is being able to "call" my parents who also have one, and video chat!  Picture quality is great!  I can even view my security cameras on it!  Love it!

author: Brenda
title: Awesome devive
content: I have found so many  Uses for this device it is amazing The best thing I have found so far is I can never forget My Shopping List I add to Alexa and it automatically puts it on my phone In the kitchen this is my new can't live without device for setting timers adding to the shopping list and for playing music while I am cooking I have pulled up recipes the uses are limitless in the

author: Brian
title: Bad screen but worst customer service experience
content:
0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player I've been generally very happy with my Amazon experience, but I must say this echo show has been a serious pain in the rear. Purchased in June I believe and then in August it started having this flickering horizontal line that drove me nuts. I connected with support they said we have to send it in and there's nothing else that can be done. I send it in, and after them having it a week they started calling me back. When I was able to talk and they called we chatted and came to find out they called to see how it was. I told them I haven't received it yet. The agent then said he was calling to see when he could call me again to check in on it. "So you're calling me to see if you can call me?" I was pretty irritated with them, he couldn't tell me what was wrong with it but told me when I could expect it back.

When I did receive it, it was better for awhile. In reading the notes it said they reloaded the firmware and it was all good. 1) why didn't they ask me to do that? 2) It's not all good, now a month later, it's doing it again but even worst. I attached a still pic and small movie of effect it's having now.

If I could return it I would, but I'm outside of the window now. Very unhappy so minimally I hope I can give pause to someone on the fence that minimally you get a couple year protection plan via squaretrade or something because I have 0 faith in this lasting a full year.

Update: Amazon tech support reached out to me not long after this review was posted (nice they're sensitive to their reviews). Will try and reach out to them when they open (9a Pacific) and see if we can go through the long repair process again. Uploaded a video to show the screen issues again, last one wasn't the best example I recorded.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good but needs some updates!
content:
I bought this when it first came out and finally got around to writing a review. If you are in a long distance relationship, this can work wonderfully. However, it does have some limitations.

1. It's bulky.
2. It always needs to be plugged in.

These first two are important if you like moving it around from room to room.

3. There is no feature that allows you to turn the microphone off-- and the microphone only. Sometimes (during video chats), I don't want to turn the camera off, but I have to press the dual microphone camera button. Why is it that there's a video off button on the screen and not a microphone off button? Phones have this feature, come-on now Amazon.

Here are things I really like about it:
1. Amazing screen size and quality. I like to watch flash briefings every morning as an alternative to watching the news.

2. The speakers rock. I love how I can listen to my audiobooks and Spotify music as loud as I want. I usually have it on high while I move around the house.

3. How I can connect it to my home security system and smart plugs.

author: Sherry
title: My Alexa is a fast friend
content: I really love my show I have it in my sock shop it is useful in so many ways I ask it for definitions of things it plays my music it reads my books it keeps me sane it lets me see who’s at my front door when I’m in my shop it’s an amazing partner like a friend of mine said you get to love them so much you don’t want to disappoint you or Alexa it’s funny I know

author: akonti
title: Not A Good Amazon Service As Manufacturer
content:
My Eco Show Alexa started having issue with the screen at about 6 months after we purchased it: the screen is flickering on the top part of the screen, which disturbs the entire picture.
First it seemed that it may be a glitch due to the wi-fi connectivity that will go away. It was on and off then, but now the screen is shimmering constantly. I heard that this is a known issue with the first generation of Show devices. I called Amazon but the don't take the device for refund or exchange - it's been 1 month over their 6 months refund policy.
If there is a manufacture issue with the first generation products, should not the vendor at least make an exchange? The item in not cheap ($229+tax) just to get stuck with a malfunctioning/deficient product. I have 4 Alexa devices at home but now I am thinking about switching to other brands with a better customer support. At this point, there are plenty out there... Very disappointing!

author: Gijoe
title: Some good...some bad.....Verdict is out
content: I most enjoy having the display that enables me to read along as Alexa shares information and how helpful the visual display is as I use recipes while cooking.  I am also impressed that I have been able to contact a live person to address issues of concern.  I did not get resolution of my issue, which was a request to assist with enabling the smart device “eco plugs”, and in fact got disconnected from the representative.  I am very disappointed that ALL of my contacts are not available on the Alexa network...only those that have downloaded the Alexa app appear on my device, and these are the only persons I can call from the Echo Show device.  I do not find sound quality nearly as good as the original tall tower Alexa device.

author: Andy A
title: Amazon has already obsoleted its own product...
content:
While this could have been a nifty addition to the echo family as a hybrid echo/fire device, Amazon has -- at least from this consumer's point of view -- already (a) shot this product in the head (by yanking the ability to play youtube [or any other] videos) and (b) obsoleted this by the much cheaper Fire HD tablets in "show mode".

Yet, it could still play well if Amazon would/could re-allow youtube (and maybe add apps for other common video services like netflix, hulu, etc.).  Also, could the AI/UI be enahanced to do things like "Alexa, play season 3 of "Game of Thrones" or "Alexa, show me the episode list of "Futurama"?  And why can't I (re)configure my Show from within the Show itself?  (And don't get me started on the quirks that pop up if there's been a network interruption...)

As it stands now, I only use my Show as a alarm clock.  It could do so much more.

author: chief
title: It was almost to easy to set up
content: This was the first Echo device I bought. It was almost to easy to set up.  I use it for the music, appointments, timer, alarm clock, weather reports, phone calls and just generally fun stuff.  I'm still learning all the things it can do.  I've have since bought a Echo Dot and a Echo Spot.  They compliment each other.  I believe these devices would be absolutely perfect for people who are bedridden, in nursing homes or with limited mobility.  Just the simple act of answering questions can be a real blessing.

author: Robert  Page
title: Funny how my phone and a nice speaker can do ...
content: I have the Echo and the Echo Show.  My spouse chides me for buying both.  Bought it thinking You Tube would be available and its not. Alexa rarely responds and will not respond if music is playing.  Its all very clunky and non-intuitive.  I do not see a future in these devices and I was a hopeful consumer. It essentially displays the time and my schedule and plays music .  Funny how my phone and a nice speaker can do that too.  My phone sits next to the device most of the time.

author: Kathleen Hill
title: not impressed
content: set to wrong city, cant change it, I wonder if i got a refurbished model without being told.  Doesn't listen or reply well, doesn't perform nearly as well as ad indicates.. do not waste time or money...

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good, but not for all
content: I purchased a couple (gave one to my non-technical mom). I like to use it for my morning news. The tower echo has the best sound on all. It is cool how you can start a show you are watching on the FireTv and it picks back up where you left off. This has certain applications and is not for all. Also, I could not in good mind get one for certain rooms (bedroom, bathroom, etc.) knowing there is a camera. If I did, I would place tape over them. I have my one on my desk in my home not facing my screen. I would recommend this for large homes or extended families that stay in touch often.

author: Craig M.
title: Google is very disappointing on the removal of YouTube on Echo.
content: I was really liking the Echo show, but until others have it, the video calling is not something I really use. Its nice to have a screen, but can do without. Now a great feature was being able to watch You tube on the echo. But recently Google has removed that capability to do so. I know these guys are competing with one another but we the consumers deserve better, they need to come together and make it a better experience. If I could return my echo right now I would, I'm very disappointed with this feature being removed. Youtube is played on all kinds of devices what the H.... is the difference on the echo. Google very disappointed in your childish behavior.

author: SimpleJimmy
title: One heck of a clock
content: The scheduled Do Not Disturb feature doesn't work, and Alexa can't correctly answer simple requests for authors of a particular title (i tried Stranger in a Strange Land and Dune and it wasn't even close). Other than those couple things, she makes for a better clock and weather forecaster than any of her siblings.

author: Steven
title: Love the screen & design
content:
I use this in my kitchen nook and love it. I really like the screen. If I request the wrong song I don't have to wait halfway through to figure it out. The name and lyrics are right there. Angular design makes it disappear so doesn't feel like mini television.

Plenty loud too. Don't even need to turn it up to 11.

author: Fairy_Dust
title: Echo Show
content: We purchased 2 of these originals and liked them so much we bought two more newer models for the rest of our home. They help me keep track of my cooking timers, appointments, can wake me up at a set time daily, use it as a sound machine at night, see who is outside at my front door due to it’s connected to my ring door bell and so much more. I’ve heard complaints, but for what my family was in need of it served its purpose. I like I can listen to music in any room I’m in or call my family from it. Haven’t tried out the video calls yet after all this time. I would love to see updates one day where I can watch cooking videos,etc.

author: thoughtwing
title: A billboard in front of one's nose.  Where will it lead?
content:
I purchased three over the holidays.  On the surface, the device has potential.  The big, big problem is this.  The home screen is constantly flashing inane messages and suggestions into my visual field.  Ever notice those side monitors which flash at you when paying for your gas at the mini-markets.  That's what this is, multiplied times ten.  Every seven seconds, you'll be seeing something like this showing prominently on your screen:

Try "Play the cat language video"
Try "How does my day look"
Three Things to Know
Try "Alexa tell me a Star Trek joke"
Try "Alexa play the amazing people video"
Try "Alexa play happy music"
Florida Man punches overperforming ATM
Try "Add walk dog to my to do list"
Saudi Arabia Hosts World Chess Competition
Try "Alexa play popular songs from 1999"
Pinball No Longer Old-School
Try "Alexa, play music for cleaning."
Late Balkan Mystic Predicts Major Events for 2018
Try "Alexa, tell me a riddle."
Born on This Day:  A Birthday Roundup

It's never ending.  You can't turn it off.  You can't simply have a blank background field.  Hopefully this will change with future software updates.  For now, when I'm near it, after I check the weather, I turn the display off,  Seriously, it prevents headaches, and lowers the risk of unanticipated seizures.

For now, two I gave away, one I kept, hoping for the best.  What could they have been thinking?

author: Gabrielle R.
title: It has a way to go...
content:
This will be an ongoing review

Cons

No Netflix
No Hulu
No YouTube
No Facebook video chat
No Skype
No internet browser

Pros

Amazon Video
Nice Alarm clock
Can ask it random questions
Great Speaker
Can make lists

It certainly has a long way to go, but I am hopefully for what updates and future models will bring.

author: Frances D
title: Needs an off switch for only camera that does not also turn off the microphone.
content: There is only one thing I hate about my new Echo Show.  There is no way to turn off the camera without turning off the  microphone.  I can't imagine there are not a lot of people like me who want to carry the Echo into the bedroom and bathroom and listen to music while taking a bath or shower or changing clothes. Not to mention bedtime fun for couples. Who wants a camera to be working under those circumstances?  Well, maybe a few people, but probably not most of us. This is a serious deficit in my book.I read that if you throw a towel over it, it gets confused.  Throwing a kleenex, which is translucent, seemed to work, but I haven't had it long enough to find out if that occasionally causes problems.

author: prestotruck
title: Don’t buy until hardware is upgraded.
content: Terrible screen failure only about 1 month in. Amazon customer service not very helpful... I think we all know how to turn it off and back on again to see if that fixes it....

author: Gailsey
title: Don't be in a hurry.
content:
Have not used it a lot but I intend to setup and group multiple Echo's, Echo Spots, and accessories with the Show.  As soon as I get this done I will edit my review.

Talking with Support is  a lot better than trying to understand the online instructions.

author: Tim,  Seattle WA
title: Highly recommend this as it is far more useful than I ...
content: Life changing!  Highly recommend this as it is far more useful than I anticipated.  I expected to use it mainly for weather forecasts and the convenience of  general questions.  Exceeds usefulness expectations:  play music by genre or artist, order food or any item you need, set timers, let's you know when your Amazon package is at your door, pulls up your Amazon orders, movie trailers, listen to podcasts, pull up a recipe, video calls,  schedule reminders  eg. "Alexa remind me to make a doctors appointment tomorrow at 3:00PM"  Fantastic product. Cant imagine living without it.

author: Kindle Customer
title: It is great!! Worth every penny speakers give really great ...
content: It is great!! Worth every penny speakers give  really great sound when you play your music.. amazing easy to use. Wonderful addition to the home

author: Michael Quitoriano
title: YouTube is no longer an option!!!
content: You can no longer watch YouTube videos!!! What the heck!!?? That's why I bought this!!! I want my money back, I'm very upset!!

author: sad dad
title: Video calls are the greatest!
content: Very nice device!  I purchased Echo Shoe becasue I have a leaning disabled son who lives in a home away form me.  I do not get to see him more than once every 6 weeks or so.  He would not be able to use a smartphone or a tablet.  So, the Echo show allows me to  make a video call and all he has do do is nothing (becasue I can use drop in) or just hit the green button.  It is easy for him to make a call just by saying, "Alexa call dad"  He has also learned to ask Alexa to play music.  The other features are not appropriate for him but the ability to make video calls is worth the money.  If I had a wish list it would include making the screen more moveable.  My son has not yet gotten used to the idea that he must be in a good position for me to see him.  The angle is not good while he is sitting by his desk.  If the screen could at least be moved up or down manually, that would make all the difference.

author: Johnathan Hale
title: Doesn't pick up your voice ad good as the Echo Dot
content: Doesn't pick up your voice ad good as the Echo Dot. Have raise  your voice sometimes for it to hear you.  A bit glitchy too.  Also tech support is in India a big waste of time trying to troubleshoot.

author: DI
title: No more things to try, please...
content: Things to try needs to be an option only. I don’t want to see them. Having it on all the time takes away from the view. I have Amazon Photos set as a background, and things to try shouldn’t be displayed along with them. Aside from that, great sound compared to the other Amazon echoes and such.

author: Mark P.
title: Good initial effort. It has the potential to be really good!
content:
I've been pleased with this purchase. It's nice to get the weather and traffic updates every morning. We control lights through our Philips Hue. We've used the Alexa app to make video calls. Music of course. The sound is acceptable. Certainly, our very old but high end stereo system is better, but this is convenient for use while in the kitchen, where it is located. Finding times for movies and where they are playing locally is more convenient than using the phone or PC. Other such simple queries are equally convenient.

However, making more complex queries through Alexa are the reason for 4 stars instead of 5. It's not as reliable a source of information as a Google search on our phone or computer. Amazon needs to keep working on Alexa so it can respond more accurately to natural speech requests. Looking forward to improvements in that area over time.

Finally, most Alexa skills seem to be, of course, designed to work with Echo devices without a screen. There needs to be more skills developed to take advantage of the screen. For example, I am unaware of a good map skill that works in the same way as Google maps or even Apple maps does on a phone or tablet. Seems like a natural. Again, hoping to see improvements to this platform in the future.

author: Ambie Marie
title: Sleek, useful!
content: I love this! I actually got this free from Best Buy with some appliance purchases and I love that I did. My only complaint is I can not get rid of the "Try this with Alexa" phrases and I googled it and it seems there is no way to get rid of it. Other than that, my whole family loves it!

author: Shelley G
title: A must for every household!
content: I love my Amazon Show! I think everyone should have one. I use it every day and it’s a must if you have elderly parents. Enable the “drop in” feature and you’re able to talk to them quicker than making a call and show them anything. I bought one for each of my best friends for Christmas so we can always stay in touch.  They love it!

author: Ithaca Chasma
title: Not Quite Ready For "Prime" Time
content:
Having owned an original Echo from the beta testing period, I pre-ordered ordered two of the devices with great anticipation.  The Echo Show is easier to set up than the original, which is important, because there is very little documentation contained in the nicely designed packaging.  Amazon has successfully marketed this innovative product, and it does what it is supposed to, and does it well.  Consequently, there is little need to evaluate the features that were advertised.  Instead, I will report on some of what is problematic, in my opinion.

Despite the 7" display, the Echo Show is primarily an audio device.  The screen is tiny compared with anything but a cell phone, and therefore watching a program beyond a few minutes is a bit of a chore.  The speakers are stereo, yet they somehow sound less full than the mono speakers on the original Echo.  I contacted Amazon to ask how to adjust the band equalizer, and the tech rep told me there was none.  Only volume control is possible, at present.  In that regard, the Show is an unfinished product and hopefully some kind of tone control will be forthcoming soon.

The Drop-In feature also seems unfinished to me.  There does not appear to be a method for deleting contacts, which means people on your lists may be able to monitor conversations without much notice.  In my judgement, this represents a serious privacy issue, so be aware that after the initial (and subtle) tones, you may not know that someone is drop-in listening to your Show unit from afar.

As a purchasing platform for Amazon, the Show is well-developed, as buying products is (perhaps too) easy.  I imagine that Amazon will be refunding many thousands of of items ordered by accident or by unauthorized customers.

I think that Amazon owes its customers a bit of an apology for releasing a product that is not quite ready for prime (pun very much intended) time.  The Show needs a better screen, real audio controls, improved (or some) documentation and a lower price to live up to the hype.

Amazon is one of the world's foremost pioneers in technology products.  In my judgement, it has the resources to do better and I expect that it will.

author: Frank D
title: "I'm sorry I can't answer that"
content: The speaker is excellent and the graphics are good. However, there are a lot of limits as to what it can answer and do.

author: Santi
title: Not multilingual
content: Alexa gives up to date information and I enjoy receiving my news glad brief. And her daily interesting facts and jokes. I feel more informed. My only concern is that she is limited in languages. She doesn’t understand any other language but English, had I known this I would not have bought one. If I want to listen to music that is not English she has a hard time understanding what I want. I think Alexa would benefit in being multi lingual. :)

author: C. Hodrick
title: Great addition
content: I purchased this after a trade in for my echo.  I love it!  It has a great sound and I love that it puts the words on the screen.  It integrates with my auto devices very well!

author: Joseph G.
title: Neat product. I beleive that the product will quickly ...
content: Neat product. I beleive that the product will quickly gain steam as App developers will bring new applications that utilze the screen.  I am a bit surprised that the screen is not a full touch capable.  Video's look great

author: Ramon Ramos
title: The device response very slow to the command. Echo ...
content: The device response very slow to the command.  Echo dot response quickly.  Echo show seems to think very slow and most of the time just hang.  I wonder if the mic is so weak.

author: Rita
title: … My son and his family introduced me to their Echo Dot and I became more interested as I saw how easy it was to use
content: At one point I thought this was a device that I had no use for, and would never purchase.  Boy was I wrong...…  My son and his family introduced me to their Echo Dot and I became more interested as I saw how easy it was to use.  I decided at age 62 not to let technology frighten me into thinking that I could never learn to really use it.....  Now I am video chatting with my grandson every day, playing music upon request, watching prime movies where I want to (kitchen, bathroom, back porch, etc), checking the weather forecast, watching news reports, getting new recipes, and looking to purchase a security camera that works with Echo!  My, was I ever wrong in waiting on buying the Echo Show!  I love it!

author: valerie e.
title: very frustrating
content: the voice commands work occasionally, but unreliable. The sound to Amazon prime works randomly, the ability to find how to make corrections is cumbersome and time consuming . Not worth it, I will wait for a better product to come out

author: Stan in KS
title: Makes Life Easier
content: These units with built-in screens make thing easier.  Adding and editing shopping lists.  Tracking shipments, watching movie trailers, video calls to family and just playing music. Works well with home automation products.  Best feature is to be able to turn on motion sensitive security cameras quickly without finding my phone or iPad.  Great product

author: carolina
title: The big reason we why we are so disappointed is it was not recognized our Philips Hue Gen
content: This did not live up to our expectations. The big reason we why we are so disappointed is it was not recognized our Philips Hue Gen. 1 (hockey puck). I tried downloading the skill and still didn't work. However, when I spoke with technical support, they told me NO need to download skill, the echo should be able to recognize smart devices. Unfortunately, it did not! Also, customer service took almost 1.5 hours troubleshooting and still did not work. Yes, we made sure the echo and hue bridge were on the same network. The tech rep for Amazon blamed it on Hue bridge as not functional. However, the Philips Hue works just find with other devices. Thus, we returned it!

author: Thomas
title: Love it.
content: I've got 2 of them and we use them endlessly. Pretty good sound quality. I love dropping in on family members its awesome! Sometimes there is a lag but I think that's due to the internet connection. Also, these go on sale like every other month, just FYI.

author: Patrica D Scott
title: 60 days later
content: Well 60 days later from my review.. I worked with the technican, updated software.. problem came back.. I shipped it out the service department said they updated the software.. It worked well and now  GUESS WHAT!!!!! The screen is jumping all over the place.. This is the first worse purchase I've made with Amazon.  Everything I've purchased has worked well or it was returned and now I have this Echo Show that's really driving me insane... If it was an option I believe at this point I would opt out for a refund.. Did I say I was disappointed...

author: MrsLeyva
title: This was a great investment. I purchased this to go with our ...
content: This was a great investment. I purchased this to go with our RING doorbell. You can say, "Alexa, show me my front door" and it will show you a live shot of your camera. Beyond that, it shows song lyrics when you are listening to music, and plays youtube and other videos on the web. You can load skills for screensavers that play music with pictures. I have a Christmas one going now. It will be nice when family is over on Christmas Eve. You can change what information it shows on the home screen from the time to news or weather. My kids like the random news bits that come up. It has really nice sound, too. My husband was surprised that it sounded so good (and loud!)

author: BT
title: Flickering screen
content:
This is my second unit within the first six months. The first unit began developing an intermittent flickering screen (see the video), and after going through the troubleshooting with Amazon support they exchanged it. I've had the new unit for a few weeks now and it too is now beginning to flicker. It's not constant, but it does get worse as time goes on. Once again, another 30+ minute call with Amazon in order to get them to replace the replacement. My concern is that I'll hit the end of my one year warranty and then it will be "too bad, so sad, sorry we can't help you" and I'll have a nice, pretty $100 paperweight on my table.

At least my Google Home is working fine.

author: Eric Caligiuri
title: Not impressed
content: I cannot get the Bluetooth to work properly on this device. I have an original echo, and it still works great. However, it seems like the Amazon echo devices have been steadily going downhill ever since.  If I didn’t already have so many echo /amazon devices (over 10), I would switch to the Google products.  Anyone buying smart devices new, I think your money is much better spent on the Google products.

author: Construction Dude
title: Nice, but some major security holes
content:
Really the nicest of the Amazon Alexa devices, but huge security holes, especially on the display where it places all kinds of info: my calendar appointments especially. All guests visiting can simply stand and read any of these devices in the house. Imagine the chaos if this was in a law office, a politicians office, even a doctor/dentist, social worker, the list goes on. It breaches client confidentiality.

Customizing the screen is it's worst feature. I am scared to turn on the calling feature also as apparently all my echo devices will ring no matter who phones me. A major breach of security. There seems to be no way to allow only certain callers in your phones contact list to be permitted... it's all or none! And anyone in the house can easily answer a call as who knows who the call is for? This seems to be true for all Alexa devices. Maybe someone that is actually daring to try the calling features can amplify on this.

author: Meisia
title: And this version of echo (show) is the best so far
content: I have an accent since English is my second language. Sometimes a bit chalenging for me to say all of those command. But other than that, im very please to have ALEXA around. And this version of echo (show) is the best so far. I can watch my morning briefing while sipping my coffee.

author: KMB76
title: I almost wonder if it wouldn't be better to get the Kindle Fire and use it as ...
content:
Still evaluating...
I almost wonder if it wouldn't be better to get the Kindle Fire and use it as your viewable smart home device? I guess the Echo Show has the advantage of a great speaker but its capabilities are much more limited than I anticipated. I can always buy a pretty good Bluetooth speaker.

author: Kyle
title: Generally a pretty cool addition to the Alexa group of products
content: Generally a pretty cool addition to the Alexa group of products.  I definitely wouldn't spend full price to get one, though.  Watch for a deal and buy it then.

author: Sourdough Baker
title: Great for elderly
content: The Echo Show has been very helpful to my parents. I love that I can call anytime to check on them and they don’t need to remember anything about using a computer or tablet. The improved app for iPad is great for communicating with the Echo.

author: John Hall
title: My Echo has been great
content: I have enjoyed my Echo, it does more than I ever expected.  The learning curve on its capabilities has been a little slow for me... it there a Alexa for Dummy's? :) JH

author: Bill Huston
title: Must have
content: I love this new toy!  She does all that Echo does and more.  Recommend to everyone~

author: Amazon Customer
title: Non working Amazon Show
content:
I have so enjoyed my Echo Show.  It’s not even been a year and the speaker sounds terrible!  It pops all the time and it’s very annoying and truly not worth turning on.
What can you do for me about this purchase?  I have ordered so much Amazon Alexa merchandise from you guys but this is bad.

author: Judy Tomlin
title: Absolutely love it!
content: Absolutely love it!!! I love all of this line...Alexa, Echo dot and now the Echo Show and of course Echo look! I recommend all of them. =) Now I just wish the stuff to make your home a smart home was cheaper or sold in bundles to have this technology.

author: Robbert Patrison
title: The best Echo, but is it worth the $50 premium?
content:
The short answer is: yes, this is worth the premium of the regular Echo. Here's why in detail:

1) The bright touch screen makes the human-machine communication easier than with an audio-only black box (correction: black cylinder). A quick glance at the Echo Show yields a picture of the artist, lyrics, album art, the weather, or wikipedia info. That picture is worth more than a thousand words. That is obviously exaggerated: the true extra value of the screen is probably a dozen words spoken by Alexa's synthetic voice. Still, that is better.

2) The main advantage of the screen is to enhance the existing Echo experience. The new capabilities of the touch screen are also pretty cool. Saying "Alexa play youtube Stephen Colbert" is faster than grabbing a smartphone out of the pocket, followed by some frantic fingering. Echo show is great for short interactions such as news events. It's also possible to watch Amazon prime video, but such longer engagements on a small screen are not the sweet spot. This is Echo Show, not Echo TV.

3) It is my impression that the sound quality is a bit better than the conventional Echo. The new Echo Show has 2 front facing speakers that project true stereo sound. The original Echo is mono.

4) The Echo Show screen adds colorful eye candy to the kitchen counter. Music is shows wit album art. A nice touch is that the screen dims dark when nobody is in sight. It immediately wakes up as soon as some movement is in its field of view.

5) The video call capability is great for setting up a connection with elderly parents. Echo Show is easier to operate than a smartphone and the camera is always in the right upright position. I was pleasantly surprised that it is possible to call the Echo dot in my daughter's room, even though it is on the same account. The system is very easy to setup and convenient to use.

After all these positive points, I have to mention one weaker issue of the Echo Show. The original Echo is an industrial design masterpiece: an iconic cylinder made from excellent materials. It will end up in art musea next to iconic Apple and Braun designs. The teardown at iFixit shows that this beauty runs more than skin-deep, with elegant engineering of the inner components. The Echo Show is not at that level. It is not even close with its utilitarian square design and cheaper looking plastic. It looks like any $30 clock radio at first glance. That is a missed opportunity, because the Show will have to be placed in a prominent place in kitchens or the living room.

Overall, the Echo Show is a good functional improvement over the orginal Echo. It is a product that is ahead of any competition, while still at a reasonable price point. Kudos for Amazon in pulling this off so well. Echo is a device that Apple should have brought to market, but wasn't able to without Steve Jobs. Jeff Bezos turns out to be a worthy successor of Steve's spirit.

author: G. Jean
title: Family gadget
content: I love Alexa. Had the original, which my son took. Upgraded to Show and love it even more. Drop in is great for family calls and discussions, especially since not everyone needs a Show to connect, just the Alexa app. Great family gift or addition and perfect for parents who are not online but live alone. Gives us a little peace in that regard

author: Alura
title: My new little buddy!
content: I love this thing! I keep it in my kitchen, every morning I watch the news, get a weather and traffic report and a fun fact for the day as part of my programmed routine. My family and I have sat around and been entertained by this for hours - playing jeopardy, heads up, hearing jokes, playing choose-your-own-adnevture games and do much more. We also purchased dots for the bedrooms and the drop in/announcement feature has been so convienient. I also use it to find recipes, even watch shows while I’m cooking or doing bills, whatever. It has really nice speakers and I like that the lyrics are displayed on screen.

author: Robert Daniel
title: Bought for mother with dementia
content:
I bought this to help stay connected with my mother who is dealing with a slow decline through dementia.  I wish there was a specific mode or some options that would be for this type of customer. I have a google calendar linked to show her specifics that are happening on certain days, kids’ birthdays, etc. But on days with more than one event, rather than the home screen scrolling through each event of the particular day, it shows the first event and then will say ( plus 2 other events).  There is no way she will ever know how to check for the “other 2 events”. I teach her and she forgets within a minute.

I also wish there was a scrolling reminder option where you could type certain messages and they would display as well: “Remember to leave Alexa ON ALL OF THE TIME” or “Remember: You must say ‘ALEXA’ first in order for her to listen to your command”.  Or even things like: “Your son has someone coming to fix your roof next week”.  This repetitive communication is essential and will help these older, suffering adults maintain their dignity and be able to live on their own in their own home for a much longer period of time.

The idea of this is amazing. If a software designer would focus a bit through this lense I present I know this would be the next cool “Apple” product.  Think in terms of allowing a grown child to effectively communicate and stay connected with an aging parent while saving them some of the exhausting time it can take.  My mom loves to help and be a part but telling her she is supposed to make her famous pecan pie for Thanksgiving, and not green bean casserole, and having to tell her truly over 50 Times is degrading.

This is a great start- it seems like a terrific product with great potential.

author: Amazon Customer
title: and I really enjoy it. I tend to be an electronics junkie
content: I've had my Echo Show for about 2 weeks now, and I really enjoy it. I tend to be an electronics junkie, and when I heard a new Echo was coming out, I had to have it! The sound quality is good and the video screen is a welcome addition. Much as I like it, however, we still haven't hooked up any smart devices that use video nor do we have relatives with an Echo Show to make video calls. This is an excellent product, but I would say that if you intend to use it mostly for music and other move conventional uses, the Show isn't really necessary. There a number of suggested videos that are fun to watch, but an upgrade wasn't really necessary for me. However, my wife has already made plans for me to hook up a front door camera and other things. So I am sure we will get full use out of the new Echo eventually.

author: NJB
title: Meh
content: This is a pretty mediocre product.  The screen doesn’t offer much additional functionality, and Alexa doesn’t seem to know much of anything that we ask her.  When attempting to use it for ordering products on amazon, it’s a waste of time.. better off just using your phone or computer!  Not horrible product, but not worth the extra cash for an Alexa with a pointless screen..

author: donkc1
title: When will YouTube work again?
content: When will Amazon and Google get over their differences,  so the customer can use YouTube on it again??  That's a huge feature that doesn't work thru no fault of the customer.

author: Crimes&Misdemeanors
title: The worse Amazon device for 3 simple reasons.
content:
Words cannot express how disappointed I am. However, I'll use them anyway. Let me explain my disappointments:

1. No Netflix: I own two Kindle tablets. I sorta assumed that the echo show was going to be able to do at least what my Kindle does. However, it doesn't even do that. I was shocked when my Echo Show told me it could not SHOW me Netflix. While I am an avid prime user, my wife loves to watch Grey's Anatomy while she cooks and does the dishes. When I cook and do the dishes, I tend to watch Sopranos and Dick Van Dyke (on prime), but since my wife is mainly a Netflix user, this is a point of contention. AGAIN, let me stress, one should assume that the more expensive Show can AT LEAST do what my cheap kindle cand do.

2. No Youtube: I love watching random videos, concerts, cooking instruction, and everything in between. Moreover, I mainly do this on my CHEAP KINDLE TABLET, so AGAIN I assumed The Echo Show would SHOW me Youtube. It does not.

3. Viewing angle: The viewing angle is not that great, especially since compared to my CHEAP KINDLE TABLET. The screen also bleeds some light.

I could get over #3 if Amazon fixed the Netflix and Youtube issue. I own two echo dots an echo plus, so I was super excited to purchase this. I am astounded that Amazon would release this without having Netflix and Youtube, not to mention Hulu. Amazon, if you're reading this, please tell us if and when these apps come available. In the meantime, I'm shipping this back.

author: jg1930
title: Beware of glitching!!!
content:
Great device, features are awesome, the interaction is fantastic. Home automation works perfect if you link up your accounts correctly. My only issue is out of (4) Echo Shows (2) of them have been sent off for repair because of the screen glitching!! These are less than 3 months old and already having issues!

First repairs were sent off and they “updated the firmware” when I got the device back nothing worked, I had to update to the newest firmware for it to work again. Then (2) weeks later the glitch starts up again!

I love the show but I’m getting really frustrated with the glitching.

author: Augustine K.
title: It quite pleasantly surprised me!
content: It was able to do what it says it can do. Still has ways to go in learning but then again that's what it says too. What I so far haven't liked is that if I pause long enough in the middle of a prime video movie, I cannot just come back to start where I left off. I haven't yet found the command to resume that worked.

author: Evan S
title: Poor Quality, Screen Flickering
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player I've had this product turned on for less than 1 month and the screen is already flickering for no apparent reason.  Never been dropped or hit, never left the desk.

author: Gregory Hines
title: Very Smart
content: As in most "Smart" Items, it takes a "Smart" person to get the full impact.  Not the case with me I have minimal needs so it works well for me.

author: Sarah Cottrill
title: Doesnt work
content:
Tried asking for recipes. It says here they are screen flicks and goes to home screen. Wont show recipes. So 5 seconds into having it. It dont work right. One of the main features I was looking forward too
Side note. Bigger and heavier then I thought it would be.
So far everything else is working with it.

author: Linda Leo
title: Good, but not perfect
content: Like this product - the only thing stopping me from giving 5 stars is 1) the lack of support for YouTube, but understand what is going on there.  2) Another minus is the lack of jack to hook up my speakers.  Although I could do that through BlueTooth, my speakers aren't compatible (yet) and frankly sound is better when connected directly.  Otherwise, enjoying the visual aspect - only had first gen dots and Echo before.  It is a little clunky on the bedstand, but really like the additional features that a screen affords.

author: DOMINICK PUCCI
title: Low microphone.
content: For some reason when using the show for calling or drop in tge person on the end of the show can hardly be heard on other decices.  I think something is wrong with the microphones.

author: Lilbit729
title: Echo Show - Black
content: I love this Echo and was lucky enough to get it while it was on sale.  Since I wrote this review I have been having trouble with the video.  The picture on this device seems unstable and sometimes flickers as though the picture is about to go out.  I called customer service and was told that I would have to send my Echo Show in and let them work on it to see if they can fix it.  Meanwhile I am without my show for about 5 to 7 days.  Some customer service.  I love my Show so I will have trouble being without it.  But the flickering is getting worst and is happening more often so I guess I will have to bite the bullet and send it in.

author: MCRace
title: A Very Nice Addition to the Kitchen
content: I really enjoy having the Show in the kitchen. From music (often including the lyrics) to recipes and cooking info. It was a little "creepy" at first as it has a sensor that detects when you are nearby and changes the lighting on the screen. But we are used to it by now. And every night on the way in from work we play Jeopardy!

author: Lord Adam Spencer
title: Flickering screen all the time
content: The screen flickers all the time , very troubling and annoying. The is not mention of warranty on amazon site, or where to get this repaired.

author: Tahoe Johnny
title: PERFECT for elderly wanting to video call with kids!
content:
All I wanted was a way for my 82 year old mother to video conference call.  She has dementia so it had to be simple.  This worked better than expected!  Anyone with a smart phone can communicate with this Show.  Install Alex app and call the owner's cell phone number.  It is so simple to use for an elderly person.  It sits on the shelf and displays photos.  When a call comes in, two icons light up. ACCEPT and DECLINE.  If she hits ACCEPT, everything comes tthrough very clearly.  Keep in mind, video uses bandwidth so I would advice 10MPs minimum.., My mother had 6-7MPs and sometimes it freezes, but usually pretty good stream.
We do not use this for anything else so for the Video Conference feature alone, I give it 5 stars.

author: JB
title: A very cool tool that shows the potential of the rapidly approaching smart home.
content:
Other than the feeling like you could be watched and listened to at any and all times (unless you want to see a bright red light indicating you are "definately not currently being watched or listened to"), this this is way cool.

Bottom line, if it catches on, it will make dropping in to others with the device as easy as saying "Alexa, drop in to Charlie ..." and suddenly he may be standing there in his underwear or something.

author: Dan LaCross
title: ... as a Christmas present and my wife and I like it. She usually uses it for music during ...
content: We got it as a Christmas present and my wife and I like it.  She usually uses it for music during the day.  I used it to check my schedules and get the daily mass readings.  I plan to connect it to my Sirius XM as well.  But I am sure that we don't use it to it's fullest potential.  I would really like to have been able to use it with YouTube but apparently it isn't available.  It's actually pretty handy.

author: Nancy M
title: Echo Show adds New functionality to Alexa
content: A great product. Nice size screen and add so much additional flexibility and functions over the other Alexa products. Sound quality is also excellent. Some skills could use some more development but with any new product I am sure this will take place. Like the calendar function and ability to see your schedule on the screen. I use the Arlos camera system that are Echo Show ready but the current skill is very limited but hope on time improvement will be made.

author: Richard Cox
title: Should've purchased ALL Shows a long time ago!
content: So far so good. It's pretty much like owning an Alexa device BUT you get a screen. Comes in so handy for music lyrics, YOUR photos, whether reports, and now I just added two cameras so I can watch my little one sleep when I get up earlier or go to bed later. Wish all my Alexa devices were Shows!!

author: n8ur9irl
title: Mine had a connection problem.
content: Wanted to use it for home security cameras but they are not reliable enough. Kept disconnecting. Echo kept losing its connection also. I have 5 other echo products and they are fine so not sure what's wrong with it.

author: Test Shoot
title: worked for awhile, then the screen went crazy
content: Don't you like that highly technical description :)  What started happening was the screen would flash or blink, whatever you want to call it.  It would get horizontal lines like it's driver was failing, meaning the electronics that drive the screen.  It also appears to have some background vertical rolling.  Amazon sent me a replacement and I returned the defective one.

author: TonyaNorway
title: Smartest device in my SmartHome
content:
I live in Norway so SmartHome products are not so easy to come by so on my travels I tend to pick up items from around the world and hope they work when I get back home.
Well no problem with Amazon products, original Echo & Show from California, Dots from the UK, 4K Fire TV from Germany, Dash Wand from Sweden, all working just fine thank you.

Of course not all the skills work such as Uber, Amazon Shopping Basket for groceries, etc, but all the main skills are up & running.
The new show is a constant source of wonderment for anyone who sees it.
Even when I'm not interacting with it, she is showing the weather, time, great background pictures, news stories and various tips on what to ask her.
I think the best feature of the Show (and all the Echo series) is that fact that the Alexa platform is constantly evolving so she is literally getting smarter as each day goes by.

In a typical day, I'll ask her for my news briefing which is customized just for me (no sports, thanks!), be informed of the local weather, play some of my favourite tracks from Spotify, arm my Arlo security cameras and answer a myriad of questions I may have about almost anything under the sun.

The phrase "Digital Assistant" is used quite a lot to describe Alexa products but it's so much more than that.
Just the way I can take my phone out of my pocket and check my shopping list that compiled for me from either voice memos or by the Wand saves me so much time, I literally save a small fortune by not using sticky notes all over the place :-)

I put a Dot in my Prius Prime and connected it via my phone's WiFi hotspot and audio out to the aux in and I have a voice activated computer to rival any car on the market, the sound quality is just great.

But back to the Echo Show - if you are wondering whether you should pull the trigger and buy one the smart answer is YES!
It'll probably be the most useful purchase you make this year.
I'm looking forward to when I can ask Alexa to show me the video feeds from my security system or drop in to other Show users for a video chat.
All of which are working just fine in the US but not yet rolled out in Europe.
But it's only a matter of time . . . .

UPDATE JULY 2018: Now the videochat drop-in function works here in Europe and so does the videofeed from my Ring 2 doorbell system!

ALEXA: Turn the lights off, lock the doors and play David Bowie from Spotify . . . . . . . . OK!

author: Charlie's Mommie
title: I Love 💕 Echo!
content: I was pleasantly surprised at all the Echo Show can do.  It is so much fun to sing along with your favorite song, prompted by the words scrolling on the display screen. Formulating questions to access Alexa’s information requires a specific pattern  which at times is hit and miss.

author: teenie
title: good for video watching
content:
I purchased this to have in my small bedroom. I love that this can stream the videos from here. I found this works good most of the time.

I have trouble with trying to stream The Flintstones, and I have all of the seasons of them. I have a kitten that loves that show and need her to be occupied while I need to sleep. I do not have trouble with any other shows that I watch on this.

I have used this as an alarm and it works pretty good. I have also used the timer on this when I have gone it to lay down, and dinner is in the oven.

It is handy to see what the time is and asking for the temps is nice just before climbing out of bed (helps me know what to wear to work).

I have mine on a power strip and turn it off when I leave for the day ( I have almost everything on a power strip and use the toggle switch to turn them off when not using). This does not take up much room and is handy for my small space.

One feature that they took away is you tube, and that was nice when it did work, not a deal breaker for me. I am not sure how long this will work, but for now it is nice. The drop in feature I am having trouble with, and wish that it worked, to check up on my house when I am gone.  I got that to work once and then not again. That is the one thing I wish that I could get to work, and for me and that reason only I would not purchase again.

author: Botanical SA
title: We like the way it powers down when it starts getting ...
content: It's been a handy addition to our lifestyle (we're old..., 83 yrs & 69 yrs).  We like the way it powers down when it starts getting dark in the room for night-time sleeping.  The little informational items that come across the screen go away, the clock enlarges itself to easily see at night, and everything comes back up in the mornings.

author: Slick
title: Don't hesitate to purchase it!
content: I was a bit sceptical when I ordered this however, it surprised me in a big way.  Very easy to setup, responds to commands very well, never needed to repeat myself (so far) and interfaces to my Arlo and FIre Stick nicely. I love it and getting weather, news or just about anything you would look for on a computer is a snap.  I would not hesitate to get another one or recommend this to a family member.

author: Raphael Hsieh
title: Spotty video calls keep cutting in and out
content:
I bought two of these, one for myself, and one for my elderly parents.
When I call them the video keeps cutting in and out and is very laggy. The worst part is that the voice (which I would expect to be agnostic of video quality) cuts in and out along with the video. We are hardly able to keep a conversation going. I ended up just calling them on their land line which is much easier.

I had high expecations for this, but overall I'm not impressed. I hope that Amazon improves this in the future.

author: Nicolas M.
title: Speaker has started to crackle!
content: I did love this product until yesterday when I came home and it sounds like the speaker has blown. There is a defined crackle when Alexa speaks and/or a plays a song thru the device. I'm not sure what Amazon will do about this but I'm hoping there is some type of warranty.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Great upgrade from the Alexa
content: We had two Alexa speaker units and we loved music and many of the other skills. This unit adds video to the mix, you also get the lyrics with music. What really is great is things like recipes and the fact that you can navigate a recipe without hands. I also like that the Show gives you headlines and recommendations on things to ask.

author: Tom Long
title: The camera angle is bad
content: For all Echo-y functions, this is great. The speaker is quite nice for listening to background music. The one thing that really miffs me is the camera angle. During video calls you either tilt the Show forward or the person on the other end enjoys their choice of a view of the ceiling fan or up your nostrils. How hard would it be to face the camera forward instead of up? C'mon Amazon.

author: Frank III
title: The sad part is that Amazon doesn't leverage the screen much
content: This device is really disappointing and I bought two of them. I have 6+ Alexa devices and this one is the most expensive and no more functional than an inexpensive echo. The sad part is that Amazon doesn't leverage the screen much. The Show unit just flips random pop culture and news story leads all day and tries to convince you to ask Alexa about them. There is no way to curate the news items. On my Android phone I can choose what I get alerts about - on the Show, Amazon chooses the stories and most of the items are sort of inane. In a world where personalization is 20 years old it would seem to be table stakes to be able to choose alerts from a publication that you subscribe to and a category of RSS feeds like U.S Politics or Automotive - to tailor it to my interests instead of Amazon's. Also the fact you need another device like a computer or cell phone with the Alexa app to add and manage skills - especially when the Show has a 7" screen - is silly. You can customize everything about an iPad mini on the same size screen. Amazon - improve the software or this device is a goner.

author: Esmeralda
title: Family friendly
content:
Yes, it is awesome. We have synchronized with our calendars and it works just as expected. There are two main advantages: 1. it is hands free; 2. it retrieves most of the relevant information, faster than unlocking your smart phone to see the weather or your calendar. Just say, Alexa ...
Love the drop In option because I can connect  from iPhone or Android. I would love to test it with the smaller Eco devices in other parts of the house.

author: Irene
title: I'm 58 yrs young and I love all my Echo devices
content: I'm 58 yrs young and I love all my Echo devices!  I have show in my kitchen, the tower in my bedroom and a dot in my home office.  Best prices I found were on Amazon Prime and I had my devices (as always) within the 2-day time promised.  Thanks!  I'm planning on learning a little more about the products out there that are compatible and making my home a "smart one". :-)

author: Kberb
title: In with the Echo Show and out with my previous device
content: I received my Echo Show as a gift, and I absolutely love it. I’ve used it for weather, recipes, music and videos. We had a Google Home device and it always answered “I haven’t learned that yet”. The Echo show was ready to go right off the bat and we put it to great use. I highly recommend it!

author: Monkeyshines
title: Amazon scores again. Great device. Very helpful for those with disabilities.
content:
It's very entertaining. One you understand how to phrase a command or question. It's perfect.

I'm disabled so it helps me out with lights. I can listen to radio, watch Amazon Prime movies.

It keeps your mind sharp with apps. Helps with words you are unsure about spelling. The same with complicated math I no longer have the brain power to manage.

I can call who ever is on my phone list, hands free. That is superior for someone who has difficulty using their hands.

It's an easy set up. I've had mine for about three months. I'm still learning so much about it.

You can ask to listen to full albums if you have Amazon Prime music. It shows everything available. You can say scroll and it will go to the next set of selections.

You can tell the Show which one by name or tell it the number that is listed under your selection. It's that easy.
