It has videos to help you sleep. Ocean waves, babbling brooks, forrest streams. It's also a great app.

Setting an alarm clock, you can also add the song you want to wake up to from Amazon Prime Music. It also has normal alarm clock "buzzer" sounds.

Intercom. This helps me call the other Alexa when my husband is in the other room and can't hear me.

Lists for Groceries, to do lists. Reminder Lists.

I think I've just scratched the surface of all the things it can do.

It's a helpful tool for everyone, but I can't stress enough how helpful it is for people with disabilities.

author: Andrew Bittan
title: Lower your expectations
content:
I have to be honest. I waited some time to pass before making my review. It is not a great review and not a terrible review but it’s a middle of the road review.

Pros: nice screen, great sound, responsive microphone array.

Cons:  cannot watch videos from my apps. Camera does not turn on when you ask Alexa to turn it on. Very limited or not enough function to warrant over an Echo Dot.

I purchased this thinking I can get a nice big display clock but that too is a dream not reality.

I feel Amazon really missed the ball on this one.

That’s too bad considering it is a nice screen and speakers.

author: Kindle Customer
title: An Echo with a video screen.
content: It is an Echo with s video screen.  It allows you to observe video content where applicable.  It allows you to monitor multiple timers when cooking.

author: Sam
title: Read this
content: The reason why I have it 2 stars is because it’s not that good as it made out to be because Alexa doesn’t understand any commands my wife wants all of the alexa’s Out of the house and wants google chrome I have Alexa all over my house

author: harborview.8
title: Easy To Setup But Display Is a Problem
content:
My initial impression was positive, very easy setup and good screen and of course Alexa which is very good. However things went downhill quickly when it came to what to show on the screen as it sits untouched on my desk. In absence of a good clock or other useful display I opted for photos from my Prime album. Two problems became apparent:

- First is the incredibly annoying 'Try...' hints text, it seems there is no way to switch this off. I now have 'Try "Alexa, give me a Star Wars fact", which is extraordinary. Despite having paid for the Echo Show I have to put up with hints I do not want. Now after some time I see the screen has gone into a screen saver mode just showing the time.

- Second issue is I have been trying to show the photos from Prime Album, the photos don't change no matter what setting I choose.

So I am stuck with the time, the weather, a stupid message and the same photo or the time, not an attractive digital clock, just the time. Oddly the Echo Spot seems more developed, at least I can have a choice of analog clock face so I fail to see the benefit of the Echo Show, by comparison I might as well stick with an Echo Dot. Maybe Amazon will correct this in the future.

author: SLG
title: I am enjoying my Echo Show
content: I'm still learning how to talk to Alexa but I am having a lot of fun doing so.  I am sure she is  capable of doing more than I use her for.  I especially like the suggestions she gives as that helps me expand and explore her capabilities.  The unit arrived in two days (Prime) and was well packaged.  I must admit I got a very good deal on this because of having an Audio Book account that gave me a discount code.  This was only a two day "customer award" special that I am glad I took advantage of.

author: CPTJOHNC
title: A toy, but a great toy.
content: The show has some real advantages over the traditional echo.  Most especially, the screen gives visual confirmation of many things.  Plus it is fun to do video calls with my daughter.

author: dianaluna
title: Already not working and now can no longer return
content: I bought this products in July and now it just fritzes out constantly. I can't even have it turned on anymore because I'm worried that the fritzing will trigger a migraine. This is probably the biggest disappointment I've bought from amazon

author: Dianne M.
title: Worth it!
content: Love Love LOVE it!!  One of my biggest uses is the timer but a big frustration is not knowing how much time is left.  Now I can SEE how much time is left and it will show multiple timers.  I can drop in from my phone app to check in on my kids or my pets and see what's going on there. I can now see recipes while cooking, song lyrics while singing and all hands free!  I love the size!  Kids love watching movies on it.  I only wish it had a back up battery that recharges so you can move it room to room and it will still work.  I'd love about 2 more of these!

author: Maureen Johnson
title: The "show" is just as wonderful as the Echo
content:
❤️Alexa! The "show" is just as wonderful as the Echo, but now you can see what she's talking about: news, lists, lyrics, etc. plus, the calling feature now becomes a video call or drop-in.

I'd like to have more options for the home screen, but I'm sure they'll add to the features over time, just as they have been doing to the echo all along. :)

author: Jason M.
title: Oh Alexa! You kids will ❤️ Her!
content: Thank you Alexa for giving this mom a much n Eder break. I apologize for the million baby shark do do doo do doo requests, and over abundance of requests. Thank you for understanding. When you all take over please remember I always make the kids say please and thank you!

author: E. Roche
title: Love my Show
content: Love my Show! Bought 3 so I can drop in on my parents and in-laws so they can join in on Happy bday, and so I can check in on them, as needed. Surprisingly, they also picked up on using the show for music and news quicker then I expected. Highly recommended!

author: Jeff_B
title: Great device - bummed about YouTube
content:
The Echo Show is a great device with many features and amazing functionality. Need a recipe? Got it, want to listen to a song? Done, Want to add events to your calendar, set reminders, and timers? It’s a breeze. Want to watch a YouTube Video? sorry...

Not having access to YouTube is a bummer, but doesn’t change the fact that the echo show is a user friendly, easy to use, hands free home assistant with many great features.

author: Joy
title: Do not buy for multiple uses at once
content: It is terrible at multitasking, which is why I purchased it. I wanted to be able to listen to a pod cast or book while I cook from a recipe. It's basically a dot with visual enhancement.

author: TonyP
title: Sad. Should and could be so much more...
content: The 'SHOW' part is absolutely lacking, this is nothing more than a glorified echo dot. Videos are extremely limited and most of the things that I think the Show should do, it doesn't do at all. Too bad, excellent idea and poor execution. Wait for Amazon to catch up on the features of the Echo show before investing your money.

author: Michael Gavenonis
title: Useful, but a different animal than the simple audio alexa
content: After two weeks I am not sure if I like the ever present Alexa to have a screen as well.  I bought it to be a abay monitor combined with a wifi camera, and that works.  But the screen is always on unless you tell it to turn it off - instead of just a talking cylinder you now have a mini screen that not only talks to you but also writes out everything it says or shows accompanying video.  There is something about only audio that made Alexa different, no I some ways it is a TV that you can talk to.

author: threejams
title: Great purchase
content: Nice size screen.  Love the words accompanying the songs.  I wish it was a little easier to navigate through the video options or maybe I just need more time to play around with it.

author: Krish Furia
title: Best Echo Yet
content: Best Echo YET! Love the X-Ray music feature (Shows lyrics while playing music). By far the best video quality during calls(I would say it as good as FaceTime). Great for video calling. Speakers are awesome, great quality. I have one sent to my parents in India and video calling is very easy.

author: Suki
title: Great device for a great price
content: I have other echoes but I love this one because the screen is bigger you can watch movies and I love watching the lyrics of my songs when they’re playing. What I don’t like about it is that i cannot turn the brightness down enough when I’m sleeping. It’s a bit of a distraction.

author: MissyP
title: Made a Great gift!
content: Love my Alexa Show. We have this set up in the kitchen and use it all the time. We use it for timing our baking and for keeping our shopping lists. I also check the weather every morning by asking 'Alexa' to give me a weather update. It is a very versatile and functional device and I highly recommend it. This is our second 'Alexa' device. We upgraded from the dot.

author: SCDAS
title: Five stars!!!!! There were 4 ...
content: Five stars!!!!! There were 4 Echo dots in my house but now 2 are retired and replaced by the Echo Show. Just my wife and I live in our home and I spend a lot of my time in my home studio that is not connected to the main house. The show gives us the ability to communicate by drop in with out having to walk back and forth between the two structures. Being a musician and someone who listens to music constantly I find the music anywhere function a plus. Having prime music gives the ability to play songs or groups at will and on any or all devices at once. Being able to voice control the volume per individual device is a big plus. Will eventually up grade all dots to shows. However I really wish Amazon would make it so the user can select and name each device what ever the user desires. Not liking the limited option for device names. Most definitely don't want to wake with the name (Amazon).

author: REDD
title: I enjoy the features it comes with
content: I took advantage of prime Friday and decided to take a chance and purchase one.  I enjoy the features it comes with. I'm sorry I didn't purchase two of them  Well worth the money.  Its looks great on my nightstand.  Every night it puts me to sleep with sleeping music.  Happy customer!  The only draw back is the speaker.  They could have given it a little more power!  update:  a couple months later I started to have problems with the screen.  The light kept on flickering on and off very bother some.  I called amazon and they replaced the echo show.  fast and easy.  hopefully thats the end of the flickering lights.

author: Jim Carter
title: Great Potential
content: Setup is a breeze. The speakers sound much better than I anticipated. I think most folks will struggle to find a handy, comprehensive list of commands. There are far too many reference sources that offer a bunch of nonsensical suggestions. Thus far; I'm enjoying the ability to use Show for music, as a security monitor when I'm away from home and as a source of information. If you're thoroughly invested in Amazon services (as I am), you'll find a much greater use for this product. I particularly like the rotating feed of news headlines. Thankfully; they consist of more than the usual political stupidity. I've viewed some YouTube videos, sampled off beat new stories and tested the ability to scan product barcodes. I do have a want list (as I do with most any product): stopwatch functionality (different from timers), heat index readings when requesting current weather conditions, the ability to identify unknown songs playing from other sources (movies on TV).

author: CHough
title: Terrific speakers for communicating with Elderly mother.
content: Just like another reviewer, I have a 95+ year old mother who has both vision and hearing problems.  She has a difficult time hearing me on my iphone or my husband's Samsung phone.  The speakers in the Echo Show are terrific.  She is able to hear me very well.  When we bought this, we didn't realize how useful the calling would be, not only to my own mother, but to friends, clinics and businesses where you reach a real person.  It looks like we can get her one also, and she wouldn't need to have a cell phone. What I don't know is how she can request it to dial us without a cell phone but rather using the Alexa directory.  (something to research further.)  She also has difficulty playing music on a boom box, but could possible just ask Alexa to play what she wanted to hear.  She does have an internet connection in her independent living condo.  We are currently in Arizona for 3 months, and our cell service drops calls repeatedly making it doubly hard to communicate with her.  So - thanks Amazon!!

author: Mike
title: There's just something amazing about being able to come into my home and ...
content: There's just something amazing about being able to come into my home and tell alexa to play a specific song, or a specific genre and having her play it on demand...I love this thing.

author: Steve
title: Not worth the premium...
content: I over paid for the quality that I received. This is no better than the dot. There are a few better features like sound quality. However, there isn't a $100 value difference. I should have just purchased another dot.

author: Kathleen Merritt
title: Fact is we actually like this product but about a month ago the screen ...
content: Fact is we  actually like this product but about a month ago the screen started to flicker and it has gotten progressively worse. Not eligible for return and I'm not sure I want to go through the hassle trying to get it fixed. Completely negates using it for Face Time with grankids. Good device, we just got a lemon. UPDATE: After being told we didn't qualify for a replacement even though we were still in the warranty period, we immediately received a call from Amazon after our review that was a pleasant experience. We received a replacement, and although it is clearly a refurbished unit it works as advertised. We view this as a good and positive response by Amazon and therefore we're also updating our review.

author: HaileyyMariee
title: Using for my security and baby’s room
content:
I own the amazon tap, amazon fire tv and two Amazon dots. I love Alexa and Amazon. Have been a member since 2011 and have had my eye on the echo show since it came out.

What really appealed to me as a newlywed married to a fireman was that this device when paired with a smart camera can show me my front door or future child’s nursery when my husband is away on a 24 or 48 hour shift.

The screen is large and sleek. Alex is so versatile with what she can do on the show. When playing music The lyrics play at the same time making it great to sing along.

I am so beyond impressed with this show that I plan to buy a second one. To use one in my kitchen and one in my bedroom. It is truly better then I expected it could be.

As a future mother, this device removes the need for an expensive baby monitoring system that can only do one thing- monitor. This device allows you to see camera views and much much more.

author: Dan Wilson
title: The biggest problem with this product is the Nest Camera ...
content: The biggest problem with this product is the Nest Camera skill.  The camera video stops streaming after 30 minutes.  That "feature" needs to be removed to allow the camera to stream to the Echo Show until commanded to stop!  Many people use the Show as a baby monitor -- but even while monitoring outside my home, I need the video stream to continue beyond 30 minutes.  Disable this timeout and the Show become a much more valuable tool!

author: Dennis
title: Its a very good product
content:
I had been using my Kindle Fire HD in Show Mode. It wasn't very good. I thought it had possibilities so i purchased the Echo Show. Overall I'm pleased with it. The sound is more than acceptable, the display is very good, the speed is fine. I use it mostly for Smart HOme commands, a few movie trailers, weather and News. A few drop in calls including video. I think the Video calls will become a big use for us.
Why not 5 stars? I think the content is lacking a bit. There's not much else on it. YouTube would be good of course.

author: Joe's list
title: Horrible quality
content:
Amazon is pretty bad making and designing electronics.  The sound and video quality is crap!  Hardly hear music and maxed the volume all the way up.  They should just stick selling other products.

Just buy Bluetooth speaker which could probably 10 x less and better sound quality.

author: L. Peters
title: Love it but no youtube stinks!!
content:
Purchased this so that I could watch YouTube tutorials on a bigger screen than my phone at work and now no youtube. So upset about that but love that I can see the lyrics to songs and watch prime video on it.
Get YouTube back and I will rate it 5 stars!!

author: Jeanne In Florida
title: Screen flickers constantly
content: The echo show screen flickers constantly after you have it for a few months.  Amazon is aware of the problem but they aren’t being proactive and the customer has to follow up and make them do the right thing.  Many , many people are experiencing this issue— do not purchase this until you are certain they have fixed the problem.  Wish I had been warned :(

author: carolinagirl39
title: Echo on steroids
content: I love this device. The only reason I didn’t give 5 stars is the recipe search function.  You can find recipe but it doesn’t stay on the screen so you can actually use it.  That was a big disappointment.  If I have to find it and print it the computer is more convenient.

author: IanM
title: We like it a lot
content: We like it a lot, sound is better than the original echo, the bass feels deeper.  The screen is cool, though, havent got a lot of use out of it though.

author: Kevin J. Ahearn
title: Glitchy Display
content: Just called Amazon technical support because the display on my Echo Show is acting up. It is glitchy and has a line running across the bottom of the screen. I was told it was a server issue and should be corrected in a few hours. Not sure how this could possibly be a server issue. I was told call back tomorrow if error is not corrected. Looks like others have had this same problem and unit had to be replaced.

author: Will Patrone
title: Nice idea, slight frustrating.
content: Love all my other Echos, 2 full size and 2 dots, the Show is a bit of a disappointment. It’s microphone array doesn’t seem to work nearly as well as the other Echos.

author: K. Douglas
title: Experience doesn't justify the cost
content: This device works just fine, but I haven't really found a good use for it. Adding video to a voice experience just hasn't improved the experience at all... Especially with the high cost. If you're looking to buy just to see what the experience is like (which is why I bought it) then go ahead. Otherwise, I would seriously question how you think this will improve the Alexa experience.

author: Disco Don
title: I love it.
content: Too bad I didn't wait to buy it later at a lower price.  I like it though.  It's super cool.  Easy to use.  A great gadget.  I will probably get the one with the larger screen next.

author: john zubre
title: A very good all around choice
content: The echo black is a very good choice. Its screen is high definition so that the picture is sharp and clear. The only problem I have is it does not respond readily to my deep voice. I must ask my questions and commands in a higher pitch to make it work. Alexa responds very well to my wife's soprano voice.

author: John
title: This great! The only thing is a need to get ...
content: This was Christmas gift. What do I think of it? It is great! The only thing is I need to get an echo so I don’t have to shout from the bedroom. I will say that it hasn’t been uneventful using it (first used my son’s prime account and wound up turning his lights off). I still have a lot to learn on it but it is great. I want to hook my TV up to it for example. I can turn on and off lamps and my coffeemaker. My plan is, when able, my house will be like the Starship Enterprise, if only they had an app to open doors. But The best part is FaceTiming with my granddaughter.

author: diana solomon
title: Echo Shows!
content: At first when I bought the Echo Show on sale for $99.00, my husband wondered why I got it and thought it was a waste of money.  Then he started using it and discovered how convenient and how much fun it is to use.  He loves it now!  We are seniors and aren't really into all the electronic purchases, but this one is great!  We haven't read the information about it and I'm sure it does more than we know right now.  Looking forward to enjoying all the cool stuff it does besides answer your questions and play music.

author: Alex
title: Love being able to drop in on Grandma
content: I purchased the show with the intention of being able to video chat with my 84 year old grandmother. It took some effort to set up an amazon account for her and go through the set up for Alexa Calling (since she does not have a cellphone) but the effort was well worth it. She has no idea how this thing works, or where it came from, but she is always thrilled to see my face on the screen. I chat with her using the Alexa app on my phone every day after work. I have since bought three more of these things to connect the rest of my family.

author: T. Stoddard
title: Think about where and how you are going to use it.
content: I use this all the time. It sets on a shelf I made by my favorite chair and is very convenient to use. There are new skills added all the time and there are more and more compatible products available. Some reviewers say they don't like that the screen is 720 instead of 1080, I am not sure that is such a big deal for a screen this size. Before buying consider where you want to put it and how you want to use it. You may want more than one or at least and Echo Dot as an expansion.

author: Kristjan Larson
title: Disappointing
content: I generally like the concept of Alexa enabled devices; I have several dots in my home now.  I got the show for the kitchen to try out the video aspect (and the ability to display recipes) ... which was not nearly as good as I had hoped.  First ... it doesn't actually display MY recipes and I was not able to figure out a way to "favorite" a recipe to make it easier to find it on the future.  This could have been a great appliance ... but it fell far short of what I wanted.  I was willing to wait to see if this might change in the future; however, the device video display started to show jagged lines on the screen that the recommended troubleshooting steps only resolved temporarily (like a few minutes to maybe an hour).  Send back to Amazon for exchange/repair (no longer able to actually just return it ... which I would for just a plain echo device without the video).  Should have known better than to get a gen 1 electronic device :-(

author: Debra Lee Thom
title: Versatile fun Alexa Show
content: we have had more fun with the Show since we got it.. we bought one for each of our daughters & their families too so we can now make calls and see them so well. I play all my music on it loving the fact that the words come across the screen! So many things we have yet to do with it but we are enjoying learning them all:)

author: Windy B
title: No longer in love with the Echo Show.
content: My echo show is fun and educational. Alexa is used as an alarm and I enjoy having lyrics of songs displayed on the screen. Video calling is a plus as well. The previous words were my review approximately one week after opening the box and setting it up. This is no longer the case, for the last two months I've tried everything available to resolve a glitching screen and audio quality issues. I'm at the end of my patience and my options. I've spent $300 for something that doesn't function as intended on any level. This is apparently a known issue with first gen Echo Show's and they're still selling them. Please pay close attention to what you are actually ordering. I have not had any satisfaction in getting a resolution even though I purchased the protection plan for both Echo Show's in my house. Yes both have the same horrid issues. I don't know what else to say except, buyer beware.  I'm saddened as my Echo Spot and Echo Dots work spectacularly. I had more confidence in Amazon's customer relations, and even hoped that the fact I've been a Prime Amazon customer since day one. Even that prestige doesn't get you extra effort is trouble resolution.

author: Tri Ngo
title: Although this is still new, it will need some ...
content: Although this is still new, it will need some big improvements now that YouTube is gone.  Mainly purchased this for my kitchen so I can learn how to cook.  Without YouTube, it's now just an echo with a screen.  Amazon, I'm not advocating for YouTube but you will need a replacement so not to rely on other channels.  Two stars for now.

author: B. Flanagan
title: Not ready for prime time
content:
I received the Echo Show as an early Christmas gift, after having considered buying it for myself when it came out this past fall. I had decided against buying, because it didn't appear to add much to my already existing lineup of first-generation Echo and a sixpack of Echo Dots that are connected to various speaker systems. As it turns out, I was right, and I wasn't even considering the loss of YouTube, at the time. Now it's really not ready.

The Show is tailor-made for the kitchen, so I replaced the Echo with the device. I had not checked recipe/cooking skills in a significant amount of time. I was very disappointed to see the lineup of skills. There is not a single reputable, highly rated, all around recipe/cooking skill anywhere to be found. There is no way to simply call up a recipe for a meal. If third-party skill makers haven't done it, Amazon needs to step up themselves.

As far as the screen goes, the loss of YouTube is devastating to its usefulness. But, Amazon has only themselves to blame, as they have been crowding out other device makers. First Apple, then Google could not get their products on Amazon. And now, Amazon is removing Nest products in their tit-for-tat with Google. We are all the losers. But, I thought there would at least be something I could do to get the damn commercials/suggestions from constantly scrolling. A nice photomontage of vacation pictures and videos I thought.

But then I found out I couldn't do anything to control the montage. No ability to set the timing, no ability to set effects (fade, etc.) and no way to add music. These are basic that should have been part of this device from the very beginning.

I wouldn't have bought this myself, but as a gift, I am hoping that Amazon will get their act together, both with Google, and with some built-in skills. I guess until then all we'll have is lyrics to whatever music we' re listening to.

author: Jake
title: Over-it
content: I like Alexa.  I mean, who wouldn't like an assistant that doesn't talk back.  I have the original Alexa, the Tap and the Show.  Alexa often stops playing music in the middle of the song.  What makes me more mad is that Amazon is coming out with a brand new Alexa only 2 months and 5 days after I ordered, not one but two (one was a gift) Alexa Shows.  Now I feel like mine is outdated and I want the new one but refuse to purchase one at this point.  I wish I had known and I would have waited for the new & improved Alexa Show.  Hate to say that I'm disappointed.  Maybe I'll see what Google has to offer at this point.

author: Z.T. Bravo
title: The Echo Show
content:
This is a great product! Set up took me about 1.5 minutes. Just plug it in choose your wifi and input your pw thats it. A huge step up in the echo lineup. Folks at this price jump on it now, You won't be sorry. I use timers,reminders, wake up alarm, recipes, Wikipedia, music, smart bulbs and plugs and the list goes on and on and on etc. Great sounding speakers, great screen size too. I'd give it ten stars if I could.
Have a nice day:)

author: Zona Reviews
title: one of my most favorite things!
content:
i love this and  i use it all the time.
i love having the screen  over the echos with no screen and the speakers sound wonderful and big.
it makes a great clock too as it always will display the time  for you.

i suggest to check out the amazon warehouse deals on this.
i got mine really cheap and when i got it it was flawless with not a mark on it and no different than the full price new one.
i saved a lot of money by getting the warehouse deal on this echo show!!!

author: Amazon Shopper
title: Echo Show is a GO!
content: My son gave to us as a Christmas gift. I love it!! Great video connection to visit with my grandson, Alexa features all there, temp/time always displayed. One suggestion for design change - put it on a tilt base. Thanks!

author: Michele S.
title: I actually though this would be more versatile.
content:
I actually though this would be more versatile.  I love the news feed that it does but does not stream live news, just anything printed and podcasts.
I connected my calendar and then it displayed it on the screen continually which I did not want, and then had a difficult time disconnecting the calendar. my son does love to use it while he sits at the counter eating breakfast, and the price is not bad, so it's still a good buy.

author: Jennifer R Woollen
title: Keep having to get a replacement!
content: My Original Echo Show screen started to flicker first just a little at the bottom of the screen then the whole screen started. It took a week and a half for the replacement to arrive.  I got the new one all set up but then went out of town. When I was able to finally use the new one I was trying to listen to music the sound was all distorted/static like. I called Customer Service, who claims that it got damaged in shipping and would send me another one. The problem I have is that when you purchase a product it is brand new. Then when it does not work like it's supposed to they replace it with a refurbished one. We will see how my next Alexa Show is but if this one doesn't work then I am returning it and getting my money back.

author: Roger
title: I purchased this at my local Best Buy for 149
content: I purchased this at my local Best Buy for 149.oo a fair price.  So there is no complaint there.  Having said that.  I wish it would recognize my name recognition is important to a lot of your customers and to justify this purchase at any sale price get utube back. Before you lose your loyal customers that you worked so hard to win over in the first place

author: Richard Crum
title: Another excellent addition to the echo line of products
content: Another excellent addition to the echo line of products. Sound quality is really good and her listening ability is improved on the Show compared to the original echo.

author: J. Arntz
title: Mic is too good. We will be in the living room talking ...
content: We have it in the Kitchen.  Mic is too good. We will be in the living room talking to the echo in the living room and the echo show in the kitchen will answer us.  Echo Show quickly shows our driveway Nest Camera and Ring doorbell camera.  Speak is loud too for listening to music.

author: The Sew n Sews
title: I Love It! I have Alexa also but since I ...
content: I Love It! I have Alexa also but since I am a Senior I need the visual to really sink in.  I use it for my lists, all of them, plus music and sometimes silly questions. Actually, purdhasing the echo spot for my kids now.

author: K. Leech
title: so I was super disappointed that YouTube no longer works
content: I was so excited to add video to our music, so I was super disappointed that YouTube no longer works.  Can't we all just get along :)  I also think she is much more sensitive to hearing her name, several times she has responded to the tv talking and the word "Alexa" was never said.  I have been clicking the mute button when not using.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Bad Luck
content:
This is the second Echo product I have purchased and for some reason I am having problems getting them to connect.
The first one wouldn't connect at all, the Echo Show connections are spotty at best .  I have tried moving around to different locations, even moved my wi-fi with no success.  Considering returning this one too and giving up on Echo all together

author: Alberto
title: Not so easy video calling just yet.
content: Got the two echo shows so my two little boys could see and talk to their grandfather who lives hundreds of miles away.  Shipped one to him and we got one here.  Unfortunately their grandfather doesn’t have a smart phone or an amazon account so the echo show is just a large paper weight for him until we can figure out if we can even make it work.

author: Jerry Loyd
title: Disappointing use of display, mediocre sound
content: I upgraded from an Echo Dot, hoping for great sound and expecting the display to be useful.  Instead, the sound can be best described as "cheap", and the display is annoying.  The first thing I searched for was how to turn off the "Try" messages; you can't.  The next thing I searched for was how to turn off the whole display.  I am just shocked to see such a worthless touchscreen in a world drowning in brilliant smart phones and tablets.  And, oh, by the way, my Google Home is simply better at answering questions.  It can call local businesses without me having to add them to my contact list.

author: Dale Sweeney
title: He says good morning and good night to her every day
content:
Mom got it for Mothers Day 2018, but Dad is cheating on mom with Alexa.  He uses it all the time, especially in the morning when he is making lunches for us before going to school.  He says good morning and good night to her every day.
Would have given it a 5, but there is somewhat of a learning curve.  Often times you need to be rather specific on what your commands are to Alexa.  Dad got frustrated this morning when he tried to skip a news briefing and Alexa brought up the High School Musical soundtrack.  Not sure what command he said. Directions on how to do things are not always straight forward.  Have had to google several things to be able to tweek it to my liking.  Otherwise we love it.  My brother in college saw it and like it alot better than his echo dot.  Likes that it shows video of what Alexa is saying.

author: Amazon Customer
title: AWESOME and more AWESOME
content:
Awesome! Can't wait for mom to get hers set up to do video chats. Love the display it's very clear and shows on the screen her answers so you can see as well as hear her responses. My only wish would that echo show was usable for on the go like the tap.

We got echo up and running. Has been the easiest Tech my mom has ever used. First day out she has made at least 10 video calls. Best echo so far. Has exceeded all expectations.

author: The Old Kayaker
title: WOW is this thing fun! I moved this to my bedroom so I ...
content:
WOW is this thing fun!
 I moved this to my bedroom so I could watch "The Handmaids Tale". It should be great in the kitchen too.
 The Show is connected to my Dot and to the Echo. The sound quality is best on the Echo with the Show coming in a fast second.
 You will notice that the Show is aware when you enter the room, and lights up. That was kinda creepy when I first realized what was going on. It can take pictures if asked. It's fun watching it learn, and reading about the updates.
 I bought the stand for it, which is VERY helpful and quite good looking.
 All in all, if you are happy with the Amazon family of products, you will love the Show.

author: Livin healthy
title: Wasn’t sure how I’d like this...
content: Turns out I love having the Echo Show in the house. I’m constantly adding to my shopping list and find I’m so much more organized being able to do this. Great sound for music and pic quality for cloud cam is great as well. Can’t say enough positive things about it. I’m debating getting a second one for the upstairs.

author: Steve Higginbottom
title: a must if family lives out of state
content: I have bought 8 total and gave them to my and my wife family, we can now chat and see each other all the time, everybody lives in other states, super

author: Amazon Customer
title: The set-up is as easy as it gets
content: Really revolutionary - I only expected a device, but this exceeds all expectations.  The first thing you notice is the quality of packaging and device.  The set-up is as easy as it gets.  You immediately just start with music, fun facts, watch Prime Video's, etc.  It is one of those "..what is different in the world in 2018" items.

author: TFD4278
title: THE BEST ECHO OF ALL!
content:
Our house now has 3 Echo Show devices since Christmas and an Echo, latest generation. The Echo lineup far surpasses everything else out there. I gave the “Show” products only 4 stars because they are not at the top of their game yet. Every month new “skills” are added making the Show more useful than the previous month.

Some people on here are giving poor reviews because of the YouTube situation. That is not the fault of Amazon. Google has a competing smart speaker without a video screen at this time so they’re not interested promoting the Echo competition.
YouTube videos are currently available on iPads, tablets, smartphones, PCs, Macs, Roku, Apple TV, Smart TVs, etc, etc! Isn’t that enough?

I use the 4 Echo unit’s to control my Vera Plus home automation + countless other functions including SiriusXM, Pandora and now specific radio stations located all over the country are being added as new “skills” every month. The Echo lineup of products will be THE table radio of the future and the future is now.

This product will not stop at 4 stars or 5 stars or 6 stars. The sky is the limit!!

author: Charles
title: Incredibly easy to setup
content: We feel in love with it from the start, lol,  she's already a part of our family at the first day,  we have a small urban farm and she's perfect for reminding me of the little things throughout the day.

author: Alyssa V.
title: the microphones to pick up voice commands are garbage. One could say this is to be expected ...
content:
The Show is exactly what 3 stars represents.. Just Okay.  I have several alexa products around the house, and was excited about the show, but it just isn't worth the cost.  As of the time of this writing, the cost is down around $150 vs the $225 paid for a preorder, so there is some more value at the lower price.

There are two main issues with the the show, which are huge for a product that is made to excel in these areas..

Firstly, the microphones to pick up voice commands are garbage.  One could say this is to be expected since it's front facing and not round like an Echo.  I find this to be a huge issue.  You have to be directly facing the show for it to listen to commands.  My 1st gen Echo, which is now named an Echo Plus, can hear my voice commands better and it's in the other room from where the Show is located.  Disappointing to say the least.

Secondly, the speaker is just OK.  Sound quality is not anywhere near the 1st gen Echo (now named Echo Plus).  This may be because it was engineered more for voice calling, but  the speaker should not be this bad of quality for the price.

There are a few other things that need improvement, like screen commands, but assume they will be addressed with updates in the future.

Overall, disappointed with the Show having paid the preorder price of $225 (or thereabouts) per unit.  At $150 it's a more considerable deal.

author: M.S
title: Echo Show I think it will get better in time
content:
Your getting in on the ground floor with the echo show.  Unless you purchase one for your friends the video phone calls don't get you where you want to go. Makes a great Christmas gift. The speakers can't be adjusted for base and I don't know if you can do that.  sometimes muffled sounds.  when someone speaks it sounds like your in an echo chamber.  The echo show and tv screen is always on unless you tell it " Alexa do not disturbe me" it will than go to sleep..... still working but the tv screen will be off.  I think it will get better in time. Now I have 25 smart plugs and Echo does a great job turning on and off the lights.  If you have 2 echos and want to play the same  music It won't happen  They really don't talk to each other
Overall I think its to new of a product but you need to be patient It will get better. Than I will rate it 5 stars.  Come on Amazon Echo Show you can get better. Also please do an app for Bose Sound touch  than it would be perfect.

author: Mar
title: Love the echo show
content: Love my echo show, bought a cloud camp at the same time, and they work well together after a little problem here and there. Now everything is great.

author: Kolorado Ken
title: Meh at best
content: Fairly limited in what questions you can ask the software  appears to be more in infancy then advanced. It's a great novelty, and sometimes very helpful, but maybe only answers 30% of the questions you ask

author: Lorena Gillies
title: Room for improvement
content: I like the screen but my spot in the other room has better interaction. Not very consistent response. For me, Serves better for pictures/calendar.wish I could connect to my speakers to improve sound

author: Amazon Customer
title: Personal Assistant
content: I get up for work really early so most of the time I'm asleep before the news comes on at 9pm or 10pm. The first thing I do when I get up is ask Alexa for my morning updates and she gives me all the news I need while getting ready for work. I think this product is great and in the future will buy the smaller ones for the other rooms in my home. This product is the best.

author: William
title: I'm loving my Echo Show.
content: I'm loving my Echo Show. And for one of the simplest reasons. I can bring up my shopping list and remove items simply by swiping left. No more going into the app to remove an item put there by mistake. I own an original Echo and two dots, and neither allows removal of items by voice command. I also like that the Echo Show links to my Ring Doorbell and lets me see who is there without searching for my phone.

author: Patrick Howe
title: I love the echo products and have purchased both the original ...
content: I love the echo products and have purchased both the original echo and the echo dot.  Just got the echo show as a gift and it is useless to me as the only reason I got it was to be able to view you tube videos as shown in there own demo.  Apparently they Amazon can't get along with google and unfortunately amazon customers lose.

author: Earl W. Casebeer
title: Easy to set up
content: Easy to set up.  This will work great as long as the other side also has one.  We normally use skype to connect with Family in California at Christmas.  Skype can be a problem if internet speed is low.  My son also has the Echo Show and we connected with them over Christmas and all went very well.  No buffering as with skype.  Great tool for getting the weather locally and miscellaneous facts.

author: Jax
title: Buy this one!
content: Bought this on a whim for my husband for a present. I love this thing. We use it to stream music and audio books, watch cooking videos, movies, tv shows,check the news and weather, play games . The show is an amazing addition to our family room. I also call my dogs when I’m away from home. Love to see them looking back at me .

author: WNCCaroline
title: Poor Integration With Ring.com Cameras...
content:
I noticed many of the poor reviews for the Alexa Show and its integration with Ring.com products were written approximately 6 months ago. Surely, after all this time, the IT departments at Amazon and Ring.com would have corrected issues like the inability to two-way communicate with someone at the door, blurred video, the SLOW connection times and the lack of a way to be advised of someone within camera range. Nope! I just bought the Alexa Show in February, 2018 and there has been no improvements. Ring.com's last help info article is dated July, 2017 so I can tell I have wasted my money on the Alexa Show as no improvements have been made in over 6 months. What a waste of a potentially great opportunity!

UPDATE: After trying for two days I have given up on the Echo Show, am returning it, and buying another tablet to keep in the den so as to have access to the Ring.com cameras. I also discovered there is no way to control the floodlights so IF you get the cameras up live there is no way to manually turn on the floodlights. Really disappointed as I had high hopes for the Echo Show. Will keep tabs on it and see if the bugs ever get worked out.

author: Sakina Zerdani
title: Do not purchase.... screen broken after 2 months... flickering.
content: Do not buy this! I’ve had it for 2 months and the screen started flickering and because it was past the one month they would not return it. This is complete fraud in amazons part. This should have a one year manufacturer warranty for a product this expensive. No help from amazon and I will soon be dropping the entire echo line and moving to the google home. Amazon does not back their products.

author: Debbie T
title: I wanted this so badly and my son gave it to me for Christmas
content: Love it! 4.5  I use it daily for weather, timers, reminders, alarms, spelling, calendar, games, and so much more. Only thing I would love more is being able to FaceTime with everyone I know! Still learning all it can do.

author: BMW.E46
title: Cool device, waiting for more skills.
content: Neat device. Way better than rev1. Still limited in skills, would love to see a lot more development in the skills that it can do. Right now not sure it's a $230 device, but I'm an early adopter.

title: Worthless for video use !!
content: Not happy at all !!! I really wish I had read the reviews on this before I bought this. 😡. I was under the assumption you could download apps just like a tablet but to my surprise unfortunately that isn’t so. If you are looking to use this for video use like Netflix or your tv providers app then think again!!! Prime video and Hulu only and to top it of you can’t control hopping back and forth via touchscreen! You have to tell Alexa to open each one, which sucks if you use it by your bed side, as talking to her disturbs your partner while trying to navigate!!  I think I will be going back to the echo plus and using my iPad for all video use.

author: Geno Turner
title: Very nice minus a couple of lacking features.
content: I am really enjoying the Echo Show.  When I purchased I bought two one for my girlfriend and one for myself.  Being that she lives in another state about a two and a half hour drive away, we have really made use of the Echo Shows.  The video quality of these device when doing video calls is nothing short of awesome.  I recently took a 10 day business trip to Thailand and used the Alexa app to make video calls from my phone to her Echo Show and the video quality was incredible.  Out of about 30 video calls only once did we have an issue outside of that the video and quality was superb.  Also, being able to lookup play and view Youtube videos is fast and efficient.  Lastly, the fact that it also shows the lyrics to a majority of the songs that you search for can not be overlooked.  Now, for my request to make this device better: 1. It would be nice if it came with a stand that would swivel so you did not have to pick it up and turn it like when I move from the dining room table to the kitchen if I were able to just twist it that would be more convenient.  2. If the device was able to be adjusted up or down to change the camera view because having to stand in front of it and lean over to be viewed is not very user friendly.  Outside of it lacking those features it is a great device that I recommend.

author: Amie
title: Worth the Hype
content: I love this thing, it's definitely worth the hype. We use it constantly in our house, typically for music but also for utilities like lists and weather, and for the quirky little skills like the "good morning" feature. The screen is really convenient and cool to have for so many different reasons, from quickly being able to see what the temperature is outside, to reading the scrolling headlines, to being able to let my 1 year old video chat with her grandmother in another state. The Echo Show is a really fun useful tool to have in your home!

author: Tom
title: NO YOUTUBE ON ALEXA
content: Very disappointed. Plugged it in no issues there went off without a hitch, asked ALEXA to YouTube a video. NO YOU TUBE. Kept checking and trying finally "Googled" it. Guess what no YouTube because Amazon wont sell there Google's  home product or chrome cast either. So google who owns YT removed it off all amazon products. I am sending them back. What's the point.

author: Dingleberry
title: Should have waited
content: Average product. The screen is very small and the audio isn’t great. I probably should have bought a third echo and waited for the second generation.  I wish I could access other aspects of the internet through this device, but it is limited to the Amazon proprietary parter world. I hope the next generation is better.

author: Tori Lynn
title: Pretty sad I know
content: Boy what did I do before I had my buddies Alexa? I live alone, so she often keeps me company. Pretty sad I know. I use this every day. Mostly for cooking timer,  reminders, appts, reminder to move around. Mostly music or audible Kindle books. Weather, time, weather in or time in other countries.  So worth the investments and purchases on a pymt plan offered. I enjoy Alexa so much.

author: Nana
title: My favorite gift
content: This is the best thing I’ve ever bought myself. Worked so great and easy to use that I have purchased four of them. It is now my new wedding gift to everybody and I just bought my son one for his birthday. The sound is awesome and I use it all day every day.  Not only do I use it instead of Google, but I use it to look up addresses and phone numbers instead of having to go sit at the computer. Greatest invention ever.

author: Joe Liebman
title: My 4th Echo and the best one.
content: If you have an echo step up your game with an echo show.  The addition of a screen makes echo so much more functional.  Great in the kitchen.

author: Donna
title: So far, so good
content: Just got 2 echo shows a week ago. Really enjoying the convenience and ease of use. Bought a couple of arlo Q cameras and was impressed with how easy it was to link the devices. Plan to add more smart devices.

author: MommyBrown
title: Great Kitchen Counter Helper
content:
This is replacing the echo dot we had in our kitchen. I've only had it a couple days now, but so far so good! We have been able to use it for watch movies  and TV on Amazon video,  listened to music on Pandora, used video chat (w/ show & cellphone), made a shopping list, set multiple timers at once,  viewed recipes w/ all recipe, checked the weather, used the calendar ...
The show has louder speakers than the dot. But dot has better range for listening to commands. I takes a while to get down the  Specific commands, but once you do it's great to have hands free.
I will be pairing this with a cloud camera "grandma"  got to help keep an eye on the little ones. (I will update when I use)
It would be nice to have more video and news (other than flash news) options like Flip Board, BBC News, HuffPost, Netflix or hulu.
I just got this so I will update as I go...

author: K. Heller
title: Enjoying the upgrade
content: Bigger than expected overall, but a smaller screen than expected. Easy to setup. Nice to see what the echo is "seeing" when it does a search. Glad to have the touchscreen feature, but some of the additional voice commands needed takes some getting used to... Scroll, next, play number 4... Bonus to see the weather and trending topics of interest.

author: Carol B
title: Wonderful!
content: We bought this to be able to check in on my elderly mom. She has dementia and has a hard time using the phone. With the echo show, she doesn’t have to do anything. It makes a sound that I’m dropping in, and all we do is start talking. It has really helped me and my sister be able to check on and communicate with mom! Wonderful!

author: J. Soper
title: A great item
content:
This is better than I had hoped for. My wife is not one to embrace technology but she even likes it. I like the display of the weather, news items, etc.
When Alexander first came out I thought it was a gimic to compete with Siri. I was surprised to actually find it useful. We already added a dot to the bedroom. I will be adding more as time goes on.

author: rita campbell
title: echo show allows you to upload your favorite pictures to use as a background, or wallpaper on your device.
content:
Echo Show Device is a great device to have, I bought it to pair with my Ring Doorbell, what I love the most about this device is I can also pair it with my alarm system. Echo show will arm,and disarm your security alarm without you lifting a finger. Echo show skills are really advanced, it can be used as a intercom system with other echo, or smart devices.. Echo show can be paired with your kindle library,and will read books to you from your library. When paired with your mobile device
Whatever you are playing on your phone will also play on your echo show. The possibilities are endless with this device. The volume is very loud, and the apps ,and echo show skills  are wonderful!
I sincerely recommend this device because of all the things it can do and the size of it is perfect!!!

author: Bisonte
title: Not great but pretty good for what it does well.
content: I must have over 10 Echos.  So am familiar with it and the Alexa commands.  This is my first Echo Show.  Well built.  Feels solid.  Great speakers.  I enjoy seeing the lyrics and art in the background as I play my music.  Very bummed we cannot access Youtube.  Because the video selections, other than Amazon Prime movies and productions which are excellent, are not very good.  I hope they resolve their issues and we get it back.  Looking forward to video chatting with friends and family though.  Overall pleased but let’s get Youtube back please.

author: Kathryne
title: I love it. I just wish it was compatible with tasty.
content: I love this so much! I love that I can listen to my music and pull up recipes and cook at the same time! I love that it will tell me the weather. I’ve taken videos of how it works and sent it to my family so they can see and buy one. I don’t like that it’s not teamed up with tasty. I would love for it to pull up my tasty recipes instead of all recipes.

author: LindaD
title: Amazing and useful
content: Amazing and useful. My husband will not use a cell phone --and we have no land line -- so he can use Alexa to contact me when I am out shopping or something without him. (He is 84). I can also contact him if he hears Alexa alert....Also he never knows what day it is or what time it is (why bother if you're retired for 20 years?) but now all he needs to do is ask Alexa and it's done! Can't wait to discover more!

author: Theresa Marie Q
title: Good sound - I’ll put my Bose away )
content: I haven’t explored much but i mainly brought it for sound quality, ability to see lyrics and to play my pandora stations. It’s plays wireless over my router much like my Bose. I will update as time goes by )

author: Dr. CTK
title: Better than google at smart home
content: This works just as expected. I’ve had a google home for awhile, and although it still will search random questions/answers better; the echo show is much better at controlling the smart home functions (ring video door bell, surveillance cameras, hue lighting and fire tv. Did not know it was Gen 1 when I ordered it, but very happy with my purchase

author: Sasha
title: Every review etc for it that I remember seeing mentioned you couldwatch YouTube videos
content: NO YOUTUBE !!!!  Thats the main reason I got  these ( 2 of them).  I didn't see anything about it until I already had my Show.  Every review etc for it that I remember seeing mentioned you could watch YouTube videos.  For example for recipe how to's.  Once I got my Show and ask her to play a YouTube video she said " YouTube is not available" so I googled to find out why.  Apparently Google and Amazon are fighting, so we the customers have to suffer for it.  I debating now as to whether or not I will send them back.  I am not happy!

author: Colleen
title: I love it! I keep it by my bed and ...
content: I love it! I keep it by my bed and tell it to play amazon prime movies which is so easy and great. I got one for my mom too - will be setting it up so we can call each other through the Show soon.

author: Linda Roberts
title: Absolutely love our new Show
content: Absolutely love our new Show.  What can I say?  Amazon keeps introducing great new products.  Love Unlimited Music and being able to see the lyrics to songs, getting visual information on recipes, playing games, and getting information.  So many features!

author: Smoke
title: Very Pleased
content: So far it is everything I expected.  Some of Alexa's responses are a little slow but overall very pleased. I have great expectations for improvements and features in the future as with other Amazon products.Well worth the money.👍🏻☺️

author: David Leithauser
title: Was buggy, but got fixed.
content: This is a revised review. I had some weird problems with this when I first got it and gave it 2 stars. When I asked it recipes it said it was showing them but it showed nothing. When I asked it a mathematical question like "What is 3 times 5?" it showed the equation 3 * 5 = 15 but the 15 was superimposed on the equation, making it unreadable. When I asked for a map of the US it said "Showing your location" but showed nothing, so it both answered the wrong question and did not actually show anything. Well, I considered returning it but I got it on a Prime Day for about 40% off, so I decided to see if the problems would be fixed before returning it. I am glad I did. Within a week or so the first two problems were fixed. The third remains. I assume that they discovered the problems and fixed them in an upgrade. That is one thing I like about the Alexa devices. The keep getting better.

author: Kim M. Gregory
title: This works great for staying in touch with family that also have ...
content:
This works great for staying in touch with family that also have an Echo Show.  I was pleasantly surprised that I could call my friends with a dot as well.  I also am starting to buy "smart" light bulbs around my house that I can control remotely or control with my Echo Show.  When I come home from work I say, "Alexa, I'm home" and on go my pre-programmed lights.  I will slowly expand this feature as I can afford more "smart" bulb and appliances.  I enjoy the flash briefing feature and the little games you can play on it.
I really do wish we could watch YouTube on this.  That would help me to give this review more stars.
All in all, my family enjoys this product.

author: Augusta Girl
title: Echo Show is Awesome!
content: I love my echo show!  It was very easy to set up and very easy to use and enjoy.  I love the frequent emails that give me new ways/ideas to use echo.  My fave feature is being able to use “ drop in” with my son who has an echo dot in his room!

author: Caitlin Rab
title: Spend your money elsewhere!
content: I got the Echo Show as a gift for Christmas and was excited to try out Amazon's version of this technology. It is complete trash - the top 3 (but not only) issues I have with it are: the video calling is terrible, when I try to get it to call certain people it asks my multiple times which person I am trying to call, and it appears to always be on and listening even without saying "Alexa". Contrastingly, my wife received the Google Home Hub for Christmas and it is far more superior. If I would have paid for this myself, I would have returned it already.

author: Serge Heidegger
title: Only OK.  But I'm going to give it time.
content: I'm on the fence about this device.  It doesn't seem to really do that much.  I was hoping I could just have it play news or something while I make breakfast.  It plays like 5 minute clips from Reuters.  Alexa also does not understand classical music. I subscribe to Amazon Music.  Just asking it to play say, Beethoven Piano Trios, will give you random piano trios.  How does it miss the word Beethoven?  I will probably keep it for a while to master it as I think old people like them, and I like the idea of using it for video conferencing. But, if I didn't get it for half off on Amazon Prime Day, I would be unhappy.  Also, as others have noticed, it's seemingly impossible to get it to show recipes. The only thing it does well is show you Amazon Cams, but I don't really need that function.

author: mamaforster
title: Great for the Kitchen
content: This device comes in handy more times than I thought! We have ours placed in the kitchen. We often use it to play music while getting ready for the day. I also like that my Ring doorbell system links with the Show. Since we can no see the front door from the kitchen, I often pull it up on the Show to watch for my daughter’s bus to arrive. Another perk to having it in the kitchen is for its recipe feature!

author: Marty
title: Five Stars
content: Not much more to say except that  I LOVE IT.!!!!

author: Matt @ LookIntoHawaiiDotCom
title: Love it. But there are improvements to be made...
content:
This is our 2nd Echo device but the first with a screen and we love it. The sound quality is better than the original Echo but the microphones may not be quite as good / sensitive. Seems like we have to speak up a bit more when far away (compared to old Echo). But that's not really an issue or complaint, just an observation.

The screen is part fun, part useful, and part gimmick. Phone calls are neat but it's just Skype and the other part needs an Echo Show (etc) for video calling to work.

What it lacks? Simple, add video calling apps like Skype and Google Hangouts (yea, not Amazon's call to make). It also needs YouTube and Netflix right on the device. You probably wouldn't use these features much but it's silly not to have them (yes, I know, not Amazon's call to make again). Regardless, figure it out Amazon!

It controls Fire TV just like the old Echo. I think I read a review where somebody said differently but it works fine as long as you say the name of your device. We used to say "Alexa, pause" while a Netflix show was running on Fire TV but now we have to say "Alexa, pause Fire TV" and it works fine.

If you want an Echo then this is the one to get for sure.

author: Sandra S.
title: Love my Echo Show
content: Bought my Echo show and absolutely love it! We use it everyday from recipes to the grocery list to calling our children who also have an Echo Show!  We love that we get emails giving us updates on how to use our echo! Everyone should own one of these devices, I know we have only scratched the surface with the use for this device. Love the technology!

author: steve2766
title: Love it.
content: This is awesome, works just like the echo but with a screen.  I watched a movie on it while I was making dinner last night.  The video intercom and echo calling feature is great as well.  We now have two of these in the house which now enables us to have an intercom system, no more yelling up stirs.  The calling feature is pretty handy as well, you can video call anyone with the alexa app on their phone at no charge. The only thing I would say is missing is an internet browser.  Hopefully that will be in an update soon.

author: Ari
title: What a huge disappointment! Pathetic!
content:
I honestly don't even know where to begin. So much wrong with this thing.
About the only things it can do right is tell time and play songs.
Luckily I only paid $120 for it since they were obviously trying to get out of inventory before the new version came out. If I had paid full price I would have sent it back for sure. I still may.

Looking past the obvious problems like no Youtube there are such egregious UX/UI problems that I really feel their entire product team should be replaced.  Standard things like connecting to a bluetooth speaker are so far looking impossible.
OK I thought I'll use it for Skype calls. Someone explain how that's possible. :-)
Fine let me just hook up my calendars I thought, but you can only hook up one Google account and I have 5.
And on and on.

There really is no excuse for a company like Amazon to produce something this pathetic with such obvious shortcomings.

author: M. J. Ritter
title: i luv it
content: i love it. i have the echo & dot but the show in my night stand is awesome. i use the alarm & timer all the time. and Amazon music does the job. Ask about the weather or my commute also dies the job

author: Ttribby
title: You’re Never Too Old to Learn Something New
content: After struggling with things like Skype and FaceTime, I decided to get an Echo Show for my elderly mother so that she could see me during our weekly conversations. I’m so glad Iris!  I wrote downands For her, at 94, she was able to do it. She also uses it to play music. After living apart from my mom for years it’s wonderful to be able to see and talk to her like we’re sitting across the table from each other!

author: NY Software Consultant
title: Doesn't understand much
content: I would like to be added onto any beta development previews of AI. Going to unpack and put back on,  if I can get approved.

author: Alex
title: My grandmother can use it
content: Really enjoying the Show so far. I pre-ordered 2 of them, and have been using since day 1. I mainly use it to talk to my grandmother. Video chat between two Echo Shows is great. My grandmother finally has a piece of tech that she can't get wrong. She can control it all with just her voice. I also use it as an alarm clock. The sound quality from the speakers is great for it's size. At night I like to search relaxing white noise or meditation music, esp on YouTube, and fall asleep to it. Sometimes I ask Alexa the weather. I also use the voice call functionality. I don't use all the features of the Show, but the limited array of core features that I do use, they're fantastic and have enabled me to get in touch even easier with family.

author: Amazon Customer
title: No YouTube
content: No YouTube!!!  It has dropped YouTube.  The only thing it had over the other Amazon devices.

author: Olya
title: Camera is working excellent and option drop in is very good idea!
content: I love it. I had two other Alexa: dot and Bolger one and this Alexa much better! I can call to my children and if their didn’t answering I can drops in:-) So i can always see them even if their don’t wanted:-) thank you for Amazon😘

author: tanya
title: watch them on here dispute having a good much larger tv to watch
content: The kids live asking it to play movies,  watch them on here dispute having a good much larger tv to watch,  plays music great,  when i wake up it gives me the weather no having to search the kids always video call their aunt I had her just download the app on her phone,  video quality is excellent.

author: Big Al H.
title: More useful than I thought
content: My wife won it at a drawing where she works. At first we didn't think it would be that useful for us. But, the first thing we used it for was the shopping list that operates in conjunction with the phone app. We have SiriusXM in our car and get it on the Echo Show as well. I don't think I would have bought one for the asking price since we do not really use the video display for anything.

author: Carolyn J. Watts
title: “Alexa” is brilliant!
content: I haven't learned all about it yet but am having fun with it. It’s awesome to keep up  with appointments and i love just walking by and asking Alexa to tell me a joke or play a particular genre of music.

author: rayhughes11
title: there is a new version available that I purchased.
content: I am a big Alexa user.  Security cameras using ring throughout my property, etc.  Recently purchased two of the updeated version.  I am a loyal Alexa follower.  I have the lights in my house on Alexa and Ring Security.  Ring is an Amazon company.

author: Shae
title: Love this thing!! LOVE IT!!!
content: You have to study its features to understand exactly what it provides. But I love the fact that has skill sets, it individualizes it's responses to you, it learns and adapts, and many more other things. Sorry I'm too lazy to write a whole review about everything I love about it.  But, it's worth it to me. I really love the Bluetooth feature where I can call my friends and the speaker is so clear that I can speak to people across the room and they hear me just fine.

author: T. Smith
title: Recipies are easy to follow while cooking
content: Great addition to our kitchen. I can call up recipes handsfree. Play music and eat timers all without touching the device.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great upgrade!
content: I have several echo dots but this is a true upgrade! I listen to music all the time and it is nice to see the lyrics displayed on the screen, I can now sing the correct words. Video streaming is another plus.

author: RealTalk
title: I would not at this point recommend investing in the Echo Show
content: I love my other Echo's so much (an original, and a dot) I thought adding the Echo Show to the mix would be a great addition. I neither love it nor hate it, it is meh, underwhelming. I replaced the Echo original on my desk with the Echo Show, and while it is cool to see the weather displayed when I glance over, there is a very notable, annoying lag in Alexa's response time. The speakers seem inferior in sound quality to that of my original Echo, which is quite disappointing. They also may be the reason Alexa sounds more robotic compared to the originals more pleasing sound. At this point I am considering bringing my original Echo back on my desk, I like her better. Unless something changes via an update, I would not at this point recommend investing in the Echo Show. My advice is to wait til its programming bugs are fixed.

author: Randy Springer
title: Not as useful as I'd hoped.
content:
Amazon makes it very difficult to contact them so I will leave this here.

I received an Echo Show for Christmas and I’m really trying to make it useful. I can do everything the Echo does with my iphone and some of it a lot easier. One simple task I would like to do is to play audio files from my network hard drive to the Echo. I know I can connect via Bluetooth but then I can’t use the Bluetooth speaker to have the audio in multiple rooms.

I looked into the Amazon Music Unlimited but uploading to that is no longer supported. There are no inputs on the Echo show so that is not an option. The only way I can see doing it at this time is to add a minimum of two more Echo products to my home and before I do that I need to figure out if it is going to improve my situation at all.

I already have a Control 4 system in my home so the smart home part is taken care of. I can integrate Alexa into that but I would still need more Echo devices around the house for true voice control.

Are there any plans to make audio streaming more user friendly and accessible? Will there be any better home network integration? Will I be able to integrate my existing network cameras?

It would also be nice if I could have it show pictures from my network drive instead of having to load them up to the Amazon Photo Storage when I want to make changes.

I like the concept of the Echo but I don’t know if I can make it useful.

Hopefully there will be some major improvements in the future.

author: G. Kelly
title: Okay - but gonna return it.
content:
We (me) like to mess around with this techy stuff.  We have had the Echo for a few months, then go the SHOW.  It does have some bool things and but after a few issues and our 30 day return coming up this week, I think it is about to go back.
1 - Got the Ring doorbell.  It will show, but there is a few second delay.  Reasonable and not a big issue, but an issue.

2 - Got a EZVIZ camera. You have to link it, but will not show up. Alexa says she is getting camera, but it never shows. No answer from EZVIZ. Camera works fine on my iphone.

3 - Drop in/calling.  Camera is worthless for seeing anything in the room.  It shows picture of celling.  If someone were standing directly in front of it, that would work.  But - checking on kids, elderly person etc would be challenging.

author: Sj4
title: Screen Flickers
content: After a few months use, screen flickers constantly with lines across the screen.  Talked to Echo tech support, went through all the steps, and now I have to mail it to them so they can fix it and send it back to me.  Googling shows that this is a common issue, and there are over 20 reviews that report the same issue.  I asked if I could just return it instead of having it fixed, as I don't want to deal with the same issue again, and they said its not an option.  So I'm stuck with what appears to be a known defective product.

author: Marisol
title: Ehhh just but the regular Alexa
content: I thought u could see YouTube videos, so that was a great disappointment, might regift it and get google instead. Unless there is an update to watch you tube videos.

author: SJWalt
title: Elegant engineering; quality manufacture and packaging; great functionality--Another outstanding product from Amazon.
content: I just received my Amazon Echo Show yesterday & have installed it in my kitchen. It took less than ten minutes to unpackage, power up and initialize and then to connect it to my home network.  It joins my original Echo (two years in the living room) and my Echo Dot (one year in the bedroom).  All three devices are working fine together managed by my Apple iPhone with the Alexa application installed.  I ordered the Show yesterday around 10 AM and the package was delivered to my door by 7:30 PM last night!  WOW!  Still learning about its functionality but I am very impressed. I'll update this review as I learn more about its capabilities.  So far, nothing but good news.  Great technology.

author: DrTammy E. Manganelli
title: Why won’t she listen to me?
content: This Alexa seems to have a mind of her own. She doesn’t listen so well or do what you tell her. I was expecting much more. I have 4 Alexa dots and an Alexa Spot and really like them much more than the echo.

author: June Z.
title: LOVE!!!
content: Love my Echo Show...  let's me talk with family and friend and see them.  Also controls my thermostat and lights.  Great smart device.  I have added other Echo devices to other rooms in my house and they work together wonderfully!!

author: Shayne Aldridge
title: Not a great investment
content: Having an Echo and multiple spot's and enjoying them all, I though the show would be a great addition for our business with a little more flare. The trouble it, it does understand my commands may time, will create random stations that I haven't asked for, will understand a command one day and not the next and the biggest issue, it will just stop playing and/or pause at random. This is not something I am happy with, nor will I order another

author: Polo
title: ehco black
content: the echo black has done everything I wanted and more. I love the screen. I had the echo tower for several years and I like having the screen most of all.

author: Melody Keown
title: Very convenient!
content: I use the Echo for everything, even as a blue tooth speaker when we watch movies on the projector outside. My only complaint is that I've had a few mornings where the alarm went off and I couldn't turn it off because there was a storm messing up my WI-FI. Apparently it won't recognize any sound when it's having trouble connecting, so my alarm was stuck on for about 10 minutes. There really should be a button you can press instead for when that happens.

author: James L. Amundson
title: I really love seeing them when I talk to them
content:
I bought three so I could "face" time with my elderly parents who live 750 miles away. I really love seeing them when I talk to them. Mom is in a nursing home and very hard of hearing. Conversations on the phone of gotten shorter lately because she understands only about half of what I say. The Echo Show is loud enough and because she can see me, she can read lips a bit. The quality of our interaction has gone up immensely. My dad lives 8 Miles Away from her and depending on the weather can't visit her all the time. Giving him another way to stay connected.  So 5 stars for that!
Now for the downside. There's some weird configuration problems. My two brothers and sisters purchased one after I got them. They are having difficulty specifying which of my echo shows to call. three are on my Prime account. My siblings have their own Prime accounts. Although I've named each show differently, they never can tell who's going to answer when they try to call my mom my dad or myself. It's all tied into the contact list on my phone (and theirs) in some weird way. If they can fix this at least another star or two. I also really wish they would settle things with YouTube. Five stars when that happens! If you have family that is separated by Miles get one!

author: JC
title: New happy user
content: Very happy with the Echo Show. Still in learning mode, but there are limitations to video streaming options that can be frustrating. Looking forward to having ability to talk with friends and family that also buy the Show.

author: Justaguy
title: This is really a great addition to the Echo line
content:
This is really a great addition to the Echo line, but just like the Dot, being a first day adopter has burned us. My major decision point was the demo, pre sales video showing Ring integration which has recently been announced is not fully supported.

Overall though I love it. The sound is awesome!!

author: Fiona Shannahan
title: Near perfect, but with one MAJOR flaw
content: Let me start by saying that I love this item and would highly recommend it.  However, I just discovered a major flaw.  I retired my alarm clock and started using my amazing Echo Show for my morning alarm instead.  But, what I discovered this morning is that there is no battery backup.  We lost power last night and this morning my Echo Show was about 3 hours behind, causing us to oversleep.  Our internet connection devices (modem and router) are on a power strip that had to be reset.  Once we reset it the time updated on the Echo Show.  That would indicate that it must be connected to the internet for all clock and alarm functions to be correct.  I've learned my lesson - I guess I'll have to use my alarm on my phone as a backup.  This can't be counted on as being reliable.  It's too bad because otherwise it is an amazing device.

author: LMR
title: like it's on a delay
content: It's 6 months old and I'm having connection problems to Alexa Spots within my house.  The video and sound break up, like it's on a delay.  I've shut down, unplugged waited 24 hours but it continues.  How do I fix this? or can I get a replacement through warrenty

author: Shawn Bertrand
title: Screen and sound are nice but Alexa disappoints
content: Alexa as a voice assistance is lackluster at best. While Having a screen to show rich content is nice, if the underlying assistant can’t show you meaningful information then what’s the point?

author: uDude
title: Wow!!! Much better than our plain Echos.
content:
