Honestly we are long term owners of Echo devices, yet we were very reticent to buy the echo show and now we are happy that we did.

The speakers are loud, more like the big Echo than the Dot.

The prompting on the screen for things to try is opening our eyes to new ways to use Alexa. You just don't have that without a screen.

We have elderly grandparents that have found the Echo Show (yes, we bought them one as well) easy to use for video calls.  They were flumuxed by the Apple iDevices we got them.

Like most, we pit it in our kitchen -- on the table for us.

Using recipes is much easier than on the tablet that goes dark all the time to save battery.

It is superior to our Kindle HD8s in show mode.  The camera is wider angle so we aren't having to croud together during calls, the camera does not smear and jitter, the mic on the Show is very good and they do a great job of canceling the noise they are making for you to speak.

Would I like a 8 or 10 inch screen, yes. Would I like Google to quit being monopolitive jerks and quit singling out the echo to block from you tube?  Yes. Google used to be a champion of consumer freedom, now that tHey are on top, they are hurting our choices.

We have a Google speaker, too, ane we are sticking with Amazon Echos because we don't like being bullied.

Seriously, off our rant on Google, we highly recommend the show.

If you are a DIYer like us, we've written Alexa home automation stuff for our homemade sensors, too.  It is a well done platform.

author: The BW
title: Not as large, but better than any other
content: The latest software update did require a factory reset. When I attempted to reload my background image, the app kept abending (abnormal ending for non-geeks). After some fooling around, I reduced the size of the image, and it loaded perfectly. I'm not complaining. I'm just sharing that you need to make sure the image does not exceed the allowed size of the Show's display capabilities.

author: Matthew and Elizabeth Silvey
title: It’s a have to get item. Just need WiFi
content: Love the echo show we purchased 2 for our home. We bought 2 more for our adult children. I highly recommend this. My 3 sisters, and mother in law all purchased one too. It’s great for phone videos. I resently moved away from my sisters and we video chat all the time. I clean and talk it’s great.

author: FitOne
title: Alexa is like a member of the family
content: I was unsure if this would be a good purchase for my wife.  We found that it is worth the money just for the music.  The speaker is surprisingly good and it taps right into our prime music account which has a pretty good selection of music.  I wish it would access our i-tunes account but it really isn't a big deal.

author: Devin C Spencer
title: Its a no SHOW
content: We have all the echo products minus the spot. The SHOW is the only one we are constantly having issues with. The LED display is flickering and doing a double vision thing. It sits in the kitchen so it gets used a ton for recipes and timers. Unfortunately, we now are unable to see how to scroll because of all the display "doubling".  We bought this in July and this started happening about a month ago.  Bad quality on what was a spendy purchase.

author: p
title: Software Update End of Echo Show
content:
After yesterday's software update nothing seems to work anymore.
- No wake-up alarm this morning
- No more controls of my Philips Hue lights
- No more YouTube (???)
- No more IHeartRadio

Roughly 400USD for two devices - where is the benefit??

author: Dr. H
title: Edited: Excellent customer support.
content: Wil not connect to Ring doorbell! After two days of customer support, the device is linked. It seems that you have to shut down and reboot all devices at same time and enter the EXACT linking account information. It also helps if you reboot your router. Make sure your Alexa app is also cleared and re installed. A lot of work but it rocks! Customer service conacted me and I didn't even request it. Beautiful. Thanks Steve!

author: William
title: how much I like the Echo show
content: I can’t say it enough, how much I like the Echo show. Ours is in the kitchen so I can listen to music, watch shows/movies with Amazon Prime or ask measurement questions while cooking, all without having to touch anything. My fiancé and I added games to it as well. I bought one for my parents for Christmas and liked it so much I bought myself one. I even video conferenced with my dad one day. The only draw backs are that the way we video conferenced it did not ask if you wanted to accept a call or anything like that, my dad just showed up on the screen.

author: Calito
title: No YouTube access.
content: Love the echo show,  but I can't give it a five star ratings until Google and Amazon resolve their issues, and allow access to YouTube.

author: Madonna Busenlehner
title: Alexa or a google hub?
content: Did not have WiFi for a year so Amazon show was not used. We have WiFi and are now using the Amazon show but the screen periodically blinks and has lines through it

author: Withoutrestraint
title: Annoying ads/tips are torture....
content: Constant bottom banner giving (unwanted) Alexa "tips".  PLUS, occasional large font "tips" on the screen.  For a person who doesn't like or need this constant barrage, it's torture.  Found a forum of like minded folk who complained about the inability to get rid of these and the non-responsiveness of Amazon to help.

author: Mr Jules
title: New update!! Just like any other Alexa but with one extremely irritating feature!
content:
So I had two Echo devices already but purchased this Echo Show for a number of reasons. I thought having pictures of my kids, extended family, and places that I've visited all displayed on the screen would be nice. Also I can make calls and it has an interactive clock that shows the weather too. Great!

However it has one extremely irritating 'feature'. You cannot turn off the 'Try this..." tips from the screen. I'm a 51 year old man and quite tech savvy. I don't want constant scrolling messages about "Try, Alexa, tell me a horse joke" or "Try, Alexa, how do I play music around my house' and so on. No break, just random stupid messages that ruin the photograph you want to display.

These devices so far have been great and you quickly get accustomed to what is useful to you. Playing music, listening to Audible, turning the house lights on/off, controlling my Sonos system but I'd avoid this one. It's now in my bedroom and frankly - I should have saved my money and purchased another Dot.

It gets worse! The latest software update has reduced the size of the nighttime clock dramatically. This makes it useless for anyone that like me wears glasses.

I know this version has been replaced with a new model with a bigger screen - possibly the reason, but I’m not buying another one.

This goes in the cupboard as I have other Echo devices but for my bedroom I’m back to a regular clock.

Thanks Amazon. Feeling let down.

author: mirm
title: The Echo works great and it's nice to have the screen
content: We held off purchasing an Echo but couldn't resist during Prime Days.  The Echo works great and it's nice to have the screen.  There is still a lot more we need to learn how to do.

author: ronny111
title: Dissappointment
content: After having it a few months I have to say it’s been major dissappointment. It is very difficult to search and play videos. Lack of battery backup makes it awkward to move around, like take on a patio. Speaker quality is very poor. News briefs are ridiculous, person reading news, something you would expect 20 yrs ago. Alexa’s command set is very limited.

author: Ted Coombs
title: Love this thing
content: This Echo Look is outstanding, I love being able to call my family members and see then while talking with them, it add tons to the conversations. Playing music and seeing the lyrics is cool as I can not always make out the words, but with the look displaying them as the song plays I get it all.

author: tengleha
title: Showtime!
content: We love our Echo Show.  We have recently adopted Alexa into our household with an Echo Dot that was given to me during a conference.  There was some concerns about privacy and all the issues but I wanted to try it out to help manage the numerous smart devices we have rather than managing each via their app.  Alexa has since been approved and we used the dot for a few things.  Then the Show went on sale for $129 and seemed like the perfect compliment.  We added the Show and haven't been disappointed since.  It sits on our kitchen bar so we can access it from multiple rooms.  Our boys will just come down and watch cartoons on it or play some Weird Al.  It also connects seamlessly with our Bose surround sound in the family room.  It now controls everything from the garage door to the temperature of the house.  It is very convenient to use and the drop in feature works great.  We have so many people now wanting to add a Show to their home, especially during parties where music is playing and they see the lyrics scrolling through.  I will likely add another Show for down in our basement (no need for more than 3 devices).  If you are looking to get a dot or something, I'd definitely consider the Show.

author: DavidE.
title: Good device - No adjustments for Bass and Treble
content: The Echo Show was only OK for me. The Alexa features worked as they are supposed to.  The speakers were pumping out too much bass for me when music was playing. Unfortunately, there is not a way to adjust bass and treble.  I've returned the Echo Show and have ordered an Echo Spot.

author: Patrick G Ledbetter j
title: Love the fact that I can use my Alexa Phone ...
content: Love the fact that I can use my Alexa Phone app to screen talk with my family. Love the visuals displays when you talk to Alexa.  When watching videos, I love the fact that the lyrics are on the screen to read along.

author: Jeffrey D.
title: Not at all as functional as advertised.
content: Big swing and miss here. Amazon did not at all take advantage of having a touch screen. Instead of being able to browse the echo's capability with the screen, you have to figure it all out with voice commands that are often misinterpreted or misunderstood. Why can't I browse the Amazon video catalog? Why do I have to ask for specific content like "movies in X genre"? Why isn't there an app I can select on the screen? The capability I'd there Amazon just decided to lock all useful functionality behind the voice commands. Regret my purchase.

author: Stephanie Anderson
title: Loved it until it stopped working!
content: I loved the Show, until the screen went, which was within 6 months.  Amazon refunded me completely and now I have the new generation Show, which I highly recommend!!!

author: Lake House Granny
title: Very nice and like them.
content: I have mine in the living room and bought several for family members.  I love watching my pictures filter by.  Love it for the music too. Need to get Youtube back.

author: Genevieve R. Thompson
title: ECHO SHOW MAKES LIFE SPECIAL
content: Love almost everything about the Echo Show so far......love dropping in on my children to see them and say hi......the only problem I find is that one can drop in very, very easily without the other person knowing that I'm there.  I feel as though I can invade their privacy.  Other than that I just love Echo show.  I'm sure we can work out this minor problem.  Echo show has everything a person would want.  I would be lost without my Alexa.  So far, I've given two Echo show to two of my children and one Echo to my friend.....and they love them.

author: PDR
title: Never a dull moment!
content: It will take me at least a year to find everything my Show does!  Just love it!

author: Ranger Dog
title: Screen is definitely plus and enhances the Alexa experience..
content: We've been super pleased so far with our two Echo Shows.  Alexa still needs a lot of work before she is conversant enough to understand all commands.  I also wish the device could identify different users, especially for calendars, phone calls, etc.  Otherwise, the screen really enhances the experience.

author: Dayle
title: Echo Shows link with my smart home electronics!
content: My echo show is great.  Do you like Karaoke?  Echo Show is pretty good with words of the songs I like to sing along with....thank goodness no one lives with me, as my singing is not to good,but it is fun to sing.  Echo show is fun as Alexa is learning to do so much more.  I have my echo dot in my bedroom, now...an excellent alarm clock and weather forecaster!  My echo show in in my kitchen area, and I love it!  Oh, Echo Shows link with smartphones, and many smart home electronic devices.

author: C. ONeill
title: You'll love it too!
content: Lots of things to do with Echo. Listen to my Amazon music. Listen to my Amazon books. Get the weather. Get information. Watch movies. Play trivia games. Control my Fire Stick. Make phone calls. All hands free!  And I just got it. I'm still learning about Echo. So far I love it and you will too!

author: saun1776
title: visual backup of music is wonderful for whole family.
content: Great sound.. speakers are even better than the echo which now sits in my bedroom. The  words on the screen are especially good for those of us who are a bit hearing impaired.My granddaughter , who is six and learning to read ,can now sing and read all the words to "Let it Go , I have heard it ad nauseum. The three year old grandson  practiced saying troll so Alexa would understand him. She understands him  better than I do.

author: triplesss
title: It is unexpectedly nice to SEE things I’m hearing....
content: I love the visual!  I have the first Echo, several Dots, and certainly didn’t need the Show.  But I love LOOKING at the weather forecast, for example.  The sound quality is excellent for my purposes—reading, alarms, news, podcasts.  Love it.

author: Michael Krautstrunk
title: Amazon can't build displays -- UPDATED
content:
UPDATE (10/10/2018):  I moved the Echo Show to a different location and it now works as good as new.  I'm guessing there was some sort of interference  either from another electrical device or from the outlet.  At any rate, problem solved without returning for repair.
ORIGINAL POST: The concept of this product is wonderful, and the actual use is as good, if not better, than the other 4 Echo products we own and all of the other Alexa-enabled devices we use.  The problem is that the display has begun to flicker after only 4 months of usage.  I've already had to return a Paperwhite because its display became unresponsive.  Work on this Amazon, or get a different display vendor.

author: ceb39
title: If you received this device as a gift thee is a good chance it was registered to the buyer
content:
Amazon needs to work on developing a set of instructions to set this device up, and how to use the app for it.  If you received this device as a gift thee is a good chance it was registered to the buyer.  You will have to contact Amazon to de-register it from the buyer, to who it was given to and then re-register it.  Now comes the fun of setting it up, and setting up any light you may want to control.

I think once this device is set up properly it will be a good device.

Note:  This device will control the new SMART HDTVs, which I believe are the new OLED ones.

author: chumley
title: better then apple pie
content: more then my best hopes.  i bought two , i am a senior  the pair enable me to feel secure allows me to see front door, included  allows me to see front room , the sound is great., the drop in call provide me the ability to make hands free calls. i chat with my granddaughter in college  face to face. i am learning new things every day

author: Jewels
title: Great Christmas Gift
content: I love it, easy to set up and easy to use. This was a gift for Christmas. Very enjoyable, just do much fun and informative. Probably would never have bought it but Alexa is great.

author: Scott Stevens
title: Echo Show is awesome
content: Love my Echo Show. Bought this for my daughter to help her with homework and talk to her grandparents. Information and answers  are only a question away.

author: CATCRAW
title: Great for aging parents
content: My friend was looking for a device to help her mother with reminders at the recommendation of staff at her assisted living facility.  We decided on the Alexa Show as it would be visible as well as verbal.  The calling and drop in feature was an added bonus.  We were so impressed with the video calls, that she purchased one for each of her siblings.  They can all call their mother and see her when unable to visit.  The grandkids call and it has worked out very well.  Her mother can easily make calls with just her voice.  What a great tool.  However, it took some time to figure out how to set up her mother's device as she does not have a cell phone.  Customer Service said no way to set it up without one.  After much thought I found a work around.  I was able to download an app on my iphone to get a second number - free - on my phone and use it to set up her mother's device.  The number is only assigned to the show and never rings on my phone.  Worked perfectly.  Amazon, this is such a great device for aging parents and they don't all have cell phones, so either fix the setup or document a work around as I found and not just say it won't work.  My friend almost returned all of the devices she purchased when we hit this snag.  There are ways to make it work, train your Customer service team.

author: Tamanzi
title: Knocking it out of the park again with Echo Show...
content: Love the Echo Show. I like that I now have visual feedback on my kitchen counter for things like trending news stories, recipes and shopping list. But, it also works great as an electronic picture frame. AND, I can ask it to show my front and back door cameras at any time – although it would also be great to be able to communicate through the Echo with visitors too – perhaps that will be addressed in a future update – I hope. I really didn't think I would be impressed – but Amazon continues to hit it out of the park with the Echo line.

author: CapnCaveman
title: Almost perfect... almost.
content:
Update:

The longer I own this, the less I like it. I would have been better off buying a new Alexa-enabled Kindle Fire HD and a decent Bluetooth speaker, because it still doesn't support Netflix or Hulu and it now fails to show me my or Prime watchlist, saying that it's empty when it's not.  To top it all off, it won't even connect, via Bluetooth, to my new Kindle Fire HD. It still connects just fine to my old one, but not the new one?  It's bad enough that I should even have to consider connecting them because Amazon neglected to add support for other video streaming services, but now I can't even rig the system like I used to?  That's completely unacceptable and  I'm deducting another star for it!  I just wish that it was still within my return window so I could send it back.  It basically just takes up room on my kitchen counter while I use my Kindle and headphones these days.  At least an Echo Spot would have looked better in that role.

If you want any more details from a more optimistic (but still dissatisfied) me,  my old review is below:

The screen is identical to a Kindle, and the sound quaility is very good, but not as good as the Gen 1 Echo, IMO.  I love the ability to look things up and get visual feedback, as well as using the touchscreen for those times when voice control is either inconvenient or impossible.

This would be a 5 star review, if for only a few things:

First and foremost, it needs to support Netflix , Hulu, and YouTube, but it doesn't.  Even just one of those services would be a saving grace because, let's face it, man cannot live by Prime Video alone.  You can ask it to show you videos of [insert subject here],  and it will search on Vimeo, (which means you'll usually get music videos) but it doesn't have access to your account and playlists.

I also wish that it could adjust the screen brightness with a voice command, rather than using the touchscreen.  You can turn the screen completely off via voice, but mine seems to turn back on by itself within a few minutes anyway.  If a future update fixes these flaws, I'll change my review.

author: James Hinman
title: Not quite as easy as it sounds to set up home automation
content:
Ive had this Echo for about 5 months now and, so far, have only really used it for a calendar and couple games of connect 4. When you see other products that say, "works with Alexa," that doesn't necessarily mean you just plug it in.  A lot of devices require other devices.. and not all devices play well together.

An example.. Phillips Hue bulb "works with Alexa." But no.. this bulb does not. This bulb works with a Phillips hue bridge hub.. and that hub most likely works with Alexa. As is the case with "Wink Relay" switches. They all work with Alexa.. but they don't. The switches work with the Wink Hub.. which in turn may work with Alexa.

All these device manufacturers.. they share one commonality, and that is the urge for exclusivity. In all reality.. if you truly want an "all out" automated home, there is no way around purchasing individual "hubs" for each and every different brand of device. You will have a closet with hubs on top of hubs.. all required to communicate with Alexa. One workaround is learning how to flash firmware with modified coding. I, personally, turned both of my "Wink Relays" into "wall mounted Galaxy cell phones" with all the apps I need. Still though.. I rarely find myself standing infront of the walls playing candy crush on the light switches.

My point is that there are options.. and the 4 stars I rate this is not because of what it does, but rather the potential it holds. Alternatively.. you also have to ask yourself which aspects of the "home automation" is truly necessary and start the first. You cannot just go fill a shopping cart full of random "works with Alexa" devices, then go plug it all in. You will drive yourself crazy.

Do your homework.. and look into brands that offer a lot of what you want. Stick to few brands that offer vast selections of devices.. then get their hubs to make the stuff work. This isn't magic.. there's a science to it and the less confusing you make things for yourself, the better.

author: LaRee
title: Can't wait to get more things to control with it
content: Love it and it drives my husband nuts. Wish the skills were all enabled and you could turn off the ones you don't want instead if taking so much time to turn each one in. I have f7 n talking to it when I'm bored and my 2 1/2 year old likes that she can play Bed Jumpers and tell it what songs to play.

author: Aaron I. Anderson
title: The best, most handy Alexa I have.
content:
I have an echo dot, Kindle fire, and a few other l alexa enabled smart devices. The Show is by far the best one I own. I have my family calendar on it, my family pictures and all kinds of skills I use for work and handy stuff around the house. Ive had it for about three weeks and I use it several times a day at least. Setting a timer, reminders, listening to music, getting recipes, getting random info, playing games, looking at my nest cams and more.

The sound is actually pretty good for music, too. I was skeptical because the speakers arent that big but it fills our large kitchen with good sound.

I dont know what other reviews are talking about when they say that the microphone cant hear them because even when I'm upstairs and try talking to my Alexa Dot in my bedroom, my Show in my kitchen often picks it up. Its a great device and works superbly. No glitches so far.

author: Quality First
title: The WASTED HIGH PRICED ECHO FROM ...
content: Simply stated, it was and is a big disappointment as well as the tech department and warranty for said product.  When a product cannot perform; when your tech personnel is witness to the fact; when this occurs and some functions no longer work on the third day of use; and when no replacement for said product is offered under these circumstances, this product is a rip off and is no better than an over priced item sold in a toy department.  This echo can’t even successfully make more than one list.  After making a list, it may fail to recognize the list.  Alternatively,  it may also say your list is unavailable and to try again later.  After a few days you realize later equates to NEVER.  This was supposed to help a person with special needs.  It helps no one.  SHAME ON YOU AAMAZON!!!!!

author: Martha H.
title: YouTube no longer supported. False advertisement 😤
content: I changed my review since they no longer support YouTube.com which a reason why I bought it. Really messed up to advertise something it took away.

author: Connie
title: Not just a music player!
content: A surprise Christmas gift! I love this, it does so much more than I thought. From checking the weather to face-timing with my nieces. So far I haven't asked anything Alexa could not answer. I am sure it does much more than I have discovered, but so far we are enjoying it! From asking the Question of the Day and playing trivia to the weather and searches, it is fun. It displays different headlines and you can get a summary of news or find out "three weird things". It is not obnoxious looking and sits out on your table without looking bulky or out of place. The screen and sound are clear. You can link it to your phone and make calls and face-time. We are definitely not disappointed!!

author: SVWP
title: Like it but would prefer to see updates.
content: I have only used it a few weeks and I do like it but I wish I could ask it to connect to my iTunes and Amazon music without having to go to my phone and open the app. I know how lazy can you be but I like the ability to minimize steps.

author: Gt NO DUST
title: Great Product but Alexa is always listening and now looking!
content: Working better than I thought. But you expect the best from Amazon. Tells you the weather and just about everything else you want to know I enjoy the music but they have recipes and games and it goes on and on and on. The future holds the limits if any.

author: John Squillace
title: It’s Show Time!
content: I really hadn’t thought about purchasing the Echo Show at all until the recent Prime Day special. Now I wonder why I hadn’t gotten it earlier? If you’re going to take advantage of Alexa, it might as well be with Echo Show. With the constant new features, content and Alexa abilities this is the device you need. I did consider Echo Spot, but the screen just was too small.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Awesome
content: Had other Alexa enabled devices, but truly love having the screen so she can show it to me not just tell me.  Still learning all she can do but this was truly worth it, going to be giving to family for Xmas to stay better connected.

author: Joma
title: How do you make calls???
content: Nice quality.  Wish there were more instructions.  Easy access to music and headlines...standard Alexa stuff, but challenging to access the voice activated calls.  I’m a technological novice.  Maybe it is easier for someone with a greater handle on electronic devices.  Nice sound.

author: Neil B.
title: Awesome!
content: Awesome! Still learning all there is to it. Much better than google home. I would put one in every room if i could afford to. This thing has changed our life for the better already

author: Bobster
title: We love it!
content: This is a very convenient device.  I video call my son's family and control my A/C remotely and I even bought something with it on Prime Day.  My wife likes listening to her favorite music on it too.

author: R. Martin
title: Buy one next year
content:
Annoying screen clutter. Not as responsive to voice, esp in noisy environment. Very little to recommend the screen. Switched back to Echo normal in the kitchen and my wife uses this upstairs now. All in all, not worth the money.

The screen version is where the voice version was two years ago, at the very start of a long learning curve of usability and skill development that best takes advantage of an interactive video screen and microphone.

Buy one next year.

author: JR
title: Everything I am used to expect but......
content: I was blown away by the sound quality of the Echo Show. Had in in the Kitchen because my wife had been using it to search for recipes but it is now in the living room where my music sounds even better. I will buy her another one if I have to

author: Debbie Vaughan
title: I love it!
content:
I love it!!  I bought one for my son and his family.  Now I can talk to my grands all the time!!  It gives me useful information based on my interest.  When I play my favorites songs it shows me the words like a karaoke machine.  It test my brain with social games like name that tune, etc.  It is Bluetooth compatible but I wish it had an earphone plug on it.
I cannot say enough about this wonderful product!

author: J. Summers
title: Great device!
content: Love the Show! I cannot see the front of the house from where I watch TV. It is very nice to keep an eye things out there and when I get deliveries or if someone is coming to the door.  I also like being able to pull up recipes.

author: JoeBlack
title: Temperamental Device with sub par customer support
content: The device has potential but is not ready for prime time. If you are fortunate enough to have a device that works, don't make any changes to it or how you use it. Once you try to add skills, subscribe to a prime video channel or anything of the like, it's all down hill. I used the echo show for a month, and it was growing on me despite some of the quirks with Alexa. I subscribed to Full Screen and it worked for one day. After that, the show would no longer play any Amazon Prime videos. After spending an hour with Amazon support and talking to 3 people, none of which were truly paying attention to what I had to say, they tell me they will contact an engineer and get back to me in 2 days. Thankfully, I have a 45 day return policy to Best Buy, where I will be taking it and using my iPad Pro instead.

author: William R Naggy Jr
title: I actually was going to take it back all together but it's nice to ask her different things and get the answer
content: Well I'd have given her 5 stars but these ECO devices where far too deceiving I think .. I thought they played music free BUT they don't unless you subscribe to a $3.99 a month plan .. so what we do do is use another device and Bluetooth to her .. I actually was going to take it back all together but it's nice to ask her different things and get the answer .. so I guess we'll keep her .. but truly not all they said she was .. too many hidden things I think like having to join prime or pay a monthly fee for free music ( other than I Heart Radio )

author: carlos samaniego
title: On the fence
content: To tell you the truth not too sure about it yet. Been having problems communicating with it and occasionally it thinks I communicate it with it when I never even said a word. So I'm still on the fence with this new device

author: JR
title: I still think Alexa technology is very useful, but the Show does not add much
content:
The Echo Show has so much potential but is missing some key elements. I still think Alexa technology is very useful, but the Show does not add much. The issues as I see them are:
 - No YouTube. Seriously. It had YouTube at first which was great for checking out a quick video. Now, Google/Amazon must have had a dispute.
 - You can't do web searches, you can't install apps, you can't use the screen for controlling hue lights. The screen is there for 2 purposes: to buy from Amazon (which you can do through other devices, with descriptions) and canceling alarms quickly (only because the alarm system doesn't recognize "Alexa, I'm skip the other alarms today."
 - You can browse Prime Photos, but the UI is not intuevtie.
 - You can set it to do not disturb by voice, but you can't set it to turn off drop-ins.
 - Lack of video skills (most of which are flash briefings)
 - There's no multi-room streaming using Spotify.
 - It does not understand me. It gets it wrong about 50% of the time. It's far worse than the Echo.
 - You can watch prime video, but you can't cast that video to your TV or anything, so it's not a very impressive feature.

author: Jim Sands
title: Very useful Echo product
content: Love Echo products especially this one.  You can catch up on news without having to open a laptop or iPad.  You can also use this as a karaoke machine because it will display song lyrics.  Also great as a videophone and intercom.

author: Samantha H.
title: Lots of benefits- you just gotta play and learn.
content:
Bought one for me and my sister. We enjoy video chatting with the kids.
Nice when cooking to ask when your hands are dirty and you are multi tasking for it to start a timer.
My 4 year old son and 1 year old nephew like yelling Alexa... so sometimes this is annoying when your 4 year old keeps asking it to Play Spider Man movie or play “Bad Boys” theme song when you just want it to be quite.
Does a morning update of what you have scheduled for the day if you like your calendar.
Will display recipes from All Recipes (I think that’s what it’s called) and a few other places.
Does a whole lot more but takes time to really learn about all that it can do.

Cons:
When you say Alexa show me kids movies you are limited on what you can see. I wish you had an easier way to feel more Movie options and recipes.
She will respond to commercials and here lately she has been coming on randomly when everyone is in bed or when no one said anything close to “Alexa”. Which is pretty funny bc in Q&A someone asked if it detected ghost.... (which you should go read the Q&A for this bc it’s worth it)

In the end I like what all it offers I just wish I had more options and control when I ask it to search movies or recipes. Like a lot of other reviews YouTube would be nice.

author: Will
title: Best Amazon Product Yet!
content: What a great product! I purchased one for my parents and I love being able to communicate with them while I am in the kitchen cooking. So easy to drop in with them and have a quick chat during the busy week. Speakers are very loud and fill the entire kitchen and living room. Best echo product yet by far. Once you have a screen, it is hard to go back to not having one! Go out and buy one...you will love it!

author: TechGentry
title: Cool but a screen is not a game changer...
content:
Let me start by saying I received this as a gift from somebody who knew I already had an Echo Dot. When I first received it I was excited to set it up and use it but a thought lingered in my mind, "What does the Show do that my Dot doesn't already?"

Even after a month I still find myself asking this question. Don't get me wrong I love the show and I use it every day, it's audio is far superior to the Dot and it has a screen (So it must be cool right?). But aside from the audio quality and the new visual aspect, what core features are in the Show that aren't included with the Dot? The answer, virtually nothing.

Let's start with what I usually use the echo show for telling time, setting alarms/reminders, integration with smart home products, music, news.
None of those features are exclusive to the show and none require visuals. Now, of course, you can do more with the show like watch videos(Very limited selection), video chat, and I'd assume there are some "games" only for the show. But do those extra features make the show worth nearly 4-6 times(depending on sales) what the Dot is? In my opinion no and I would instead suggest going with the Dot and buying a couple extra smart home gadgets with the money you saved.

author: Allen
title: It’s good but needs better sound and microphones and touch sensitivity.
content: So I own all Apple products from the watch to AirPods. You name it I have bought the echo second gen and fell in love. It’s amazing. I got the show as a gift for my kitchen and i was really excited for a screen. It fell short of my expectations. I love that it shows my calendar and news and weather. I like that I can watch video. But the major let down for me was sound. The echo and my dot seem to have better sound. Sure it gets loud but it’s distorted. The display isn’t as touch responsive as I hoped. And it seems to have a much harder time hearing me. It gets what I said wrong a lot more than my dot or echo which is maybe once in a blue moon and the show gets it wrong like Siri.

author: P. Fracola
title: Too few reasons for a screen
content: Since Google introduced its own device Amazon is no longer authorized to play YouTube on its Echo Show.  As YT is the best and only truly free user content video site I wonder what use the screen is on the Show.  I returned mine when my nephew asked why he could no longer look at YT on my Show.  All of this said, I thought the Show worked very well and sounded great!  The thing is I only listen to radio stations on it.

author: muzman
title: Amazing interactive assistant
content: My daughter got one and wanted us to get one so we could chat with her and our new grandson.  WOW so much nicer than a phone or tablet ... the picture quality and sound are top quality.  Then I use the same option take advantage of the "drop in" feature from my phone to see inside my home when I am not there and talk to my golden retriever.  I have the morning headlines read to me by Alexa, ask about my morning commute, find out where my Amazon packages are, create shopping lists, reminders and so much more.  I love it and just recently added a Dot to another room and now have music playing in all rooms or just one room through Amazon music.  This is a great addition to your home and a way to stay up to date with today's technology.

author: M. Fry
title: Very Satisfied
content:
I was apprehensive to pull the purchase trigger on the Echo Show given the wide range of reviews... until the price dropped to $149.

Especially at this price point, the Show is a great addition to my Alexa family.  I have no issues with the Show hearing and understanding me like many of the 1 star reviews.  The sound quality is very good and the screen is crisp and vibrant.

author: BlkWidow616
title: Another Great Product!
content: I love Amazon's products! This is so cool to be able to see my parents and watch videos and see lyrics. It was definitely worth the money.

author: Prime Customer
title: Great product at a great price.
content:
The Amazon Echo Show is a great product at a great price, since I got it for $129, on sale. Having a nice size screen is really good for many reasons, I can even watch Amazon Prime movies on this thing. The only complaint I have is not against the product itself but against the ongoing fight that Amazon has with Google.
Unfortunately, due to this ongoing squabble the Amazon Echo Show will not do YouTube at this point in time.

author: J. brutovsky
title: Excellent New Product to replace the Bricked Sony Dash.
content: This is a very new product and I've only had it 2 days, but so far my experience has been great. It is replacing a Sony Dash that I was gifted in 2011. Seems odd to me that this product goes on sale 2 days before Sony bricked my Dash, but all well. So far the Echo show has been a hit. I normally have it on my nightstand, but last night I put it in the dining room during a dinner party and it was the hit of the party. Everyone kept asking the Echo questions and asking for jokes. (the jokes were the hit of the party). I must say that the voice recognition is excellent. This isn't tech from the early 2000's . I didn't have a single misunderstood word to the Echo. I got six years out of the Dash, and I hope to get many, many years of use out of the Echo. The instructions that come with the Echo are a joke. Pretty much say "Plug it in, connect to the internet, download the smart phone app, and start using the Echo" , and that's it. There is a learning curve, but I think that with the Echo's on screen hits and tips that it should be fairly easy to learn. The alarm clock sound are okay, but there are not many to choose from. I'm hoping that in the future that more alarm sound choices are added. The camera features seem to work very well. Picture quality is excellent.  The touch screen reacts to the light in the room auto dimming in low light, and the touch feature of the screen works very well. The ease of use of the "drop in" feature is very easy to use from the smart phone. Over time the calling features of this device should be excellent, but at this time it is hard to comment on the calling features as the unit has only been on sale for about 4 to 5 days and I don't know anyone else that has one yet. As far as I can tell, you can only call other people that have a Echo device (The Dot and up to the Show) , but not a cell or land line. I could be wrong about that , but again that goes to the lack of documentation that doesn't come in the box with the Echo Show. Many of the Echo Show's feature are tied into Amazon Prime (music and video come to mind right away) so it appears that you get much more use out of the built in features if you have a Prime account.  I haven't tried any of the home automated commands yet, because I don't have a Ring doorbell, Nest thermostat, or Hue lights (yet). Where the packaging is concerned, it was packaged very well, with no transit damage (as it should be) . The unit came out of the box wrapped in a protective film keeping the unit spotless until unwrapped by myself. same with the power plug and cord. The unit has an excellent finish and a hefty feel to it that scream quality. If there is a need in the future, I will update the review, but at this time I have to say "Great job Amazon !!"

author: David S. Young
title: Alexa, Echo-Show- POOR QUALITY
content: My Echo Show, after just 3 month’s, will no longer accept voice commands. Rendering it useless. This is simply insufficient quality! Don’t even think about purchasing this new age failure!

author: Hedwig Poon
title: Must say I was terribly disappointed with how the Google-Amazon dispute is going
content:
Must say I was terribly disappointed with how the Google-Amazon dispute is going.  I ordered two of these devices and before I received them, the Youtube skill go yanked.  Also, forcing two Amazon music accounts to have two clock radios is a bit much.

It's not bad but I was really hoping for a tablet-light.  Perhaps, it will improve in the future.

author: Alex S
title: love, love
content: love,love ,love it  so far,ive just been using it to play music ,since it features lyrics of every song,i usually sing and even dance with it.this is a good workout,as well to shed lbs or just to reminisce the good old days .i have not use other features ,except for cnn channel ,since i dont have said channel of my cable line up.i ordered another pack( 2 ) that i will send it to my loved ones.thanks amazon!

author: Cheryl Fensom
title: Definitely an Upgrade
content: I have the original Alexa, but I find the Echo much more interactive and fun. Love the video calls and the ability to watch movies. The sound is crisp and it also has more bass.

author: Derek  Matthies
title: Skip it and get a standard echo device.
content: It's an Alexa device with a screen, but the screen does not add any value.  It could be wonderful if you could customize news sources or if the device used the screen in any novel way, but it feels like Amazon does not care much for this device as I am not seeing any new features targeting the screen.  I would skip this if I were in the market.

author: Carolyn M Smyth
title: Meh
content: Alexa just isn't smart enough. She can't communicate with my phone in a meaningful way (I can't use the device to call anyone except other people who have an Echo) and she has a hard time understanding things I say or ask. For example, she gets confused if I say "play the band The Beatles" instead of "Play The Beatles" -- it's the little things like having to reword things in a way that she'll understand that irk me about this device.

author: Arlene
title: Fantastic Product
content: I have several different Alexa based products and this became my favorite almost immediately. You can do so much with it.  I love that it shows all the words to most songs that you ask her to play.  You can load your own pictures for background. I haven’t found a thing I dislike about it yet and I’ve had it since before Christmas.  I bought it when Amazon had a great sale on them but it’s worth every penny even at full price. It definitely surpassed all of my expectations.

author: Dnjriley
title: Nice but too dependant on wikopedia
content:
Great for many things but questions usually get answered through Wikipedia, therefore not too reliable information wise.
Love it for music and the "Easter eggs."
We haven't explored all of the settings yet, so we'll have to wait and see.

author: AGATES
title: Sound is very disappointing
content: I have recently purchased 6 echos, one plus, and two shows.  I am very disappointed in the shows and may look at returning.  The sound is awful and can’t be turned up much without having crackling noise as if the speakers are blown.  The rest of the features with Alexa are great, but are same as echo and echo plus.  Unfortunately because the sound is so awful I put the plus in the kitchen and the show in a small room downstairs which defeats the opportunity to shop or see recipes while cooking.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Need more video content
content: I like the features that translated from the echo and echo dot. The screen is very nice. I do have a little trouble making video calls. They work sometimes but not others. I thought there would be more video content and even TV available to the device. Perhaps there is but it’s not intuitive and Alexa can’t tell me when I aske.

author: Sandi Braudrick
title: Echo Show is a MUST HAVE
content: LOVE THIS!!!  Echo Show brings Echo (which I dearly love mine) to a whole new level.  I enjoy singing along with songs, but rarely get the words right and now they are shown (like a sing-along).  Actually seeing what movies are on locally is awesome, you can even watch trailers.  Amazon just keeps getting better, always getting new skills to try out.

author: Anita Baran
title: Buy the Echo Show - You don't even realize how much you want it.
content: My husband has a new girlfriend.  Her name is Alexa!!  I've used Echo Show previous to purchase for our home & loved it.  My husband was reluctant.  However, we're both having a blast:  besides the obvious music & weather checks, we're playing games & checking sports & news throughout the day.  When cell phones 1st came out, I thought "why would I need that?"  Now I'm lost without it.  Truthfully, we've had the same reaction to the Echo Show!!  Don't cheap out & get the lesser versions.  Buy the Echo Show!  You won't regret it!

author: Michael
title: Need mors live news or live broadcasts
content:
So far so good
Wish it did more live news rather than just flash news hopefully app

author: mary
title: Not at all what I expected, bottom line this ...
content: Not at all what I expected ,bottom line this item is a very expensive alarm clock doesn’t do all the things it supposed to do.I can get more information out of my iPhone that I can frok  this device.  Tried to hook up a lamp  with this  purchased the device I needed to be compatible with Alexa and it still didn’t work no support can’t contact customer service for any assistance I would return the device but it was past the return policy so I was unable to

author: Lawrence Rodriguez
title: Bad quality but even worst customer support
content: I have had this device for less than 4 months and it has had numerous problems.  When the device is actually in nice working condition, it might be worth the money, but it has spent more time with various problems such as a flickering screen, not responding to commands what so ever, and even trouble playing music, than it has actually been in good condition.  Not only to mention this, but I sent the device in shortly after I got it due to its first wave of problems as it was still under warranty and amazon support sent me back the same device, except they forgot to send my power cord making the device useless.  As soon as I obtained a new cord, the device still had the same problems.  Not worth the money.  Especially when there’s a brand new 2nd generation device that comes out and probably is a better investment.  As for Amazon chat support, it is still terrible.

author: MJ Sparks
title: Five Stars
content: love it! have one in every main room!

author: May Navarro
title: Account settings and use
content:
While I’m an Advid friend of Amazon I have an issue that can’t be resolved. I purchased 4 of these things for my kids and wife and for the love of Jesus cannot get my wife’s to work. Won’t take her account numbers won’t take her phone numbers can’t use it.. calls to amazon say her phone is associated with different accounts.

In the end amazon help center for me is non existent.. quality of care non existent.. concerns about customer satisfaction zero, accessibility zero, availability zero, online support zero, account support zero

Good for buying coffee but that’s just about that.

Be wary ever buying electronics or anything carrying the “amazon” logo cause you are totally I mean totally on your own!

author: Trisha H
title: Pretty Great
content: I like this thing but there are some things that could be more user friendly. Alexa doesn't understand a lot of what I'm talking about, and trying to get her to read headlines is a pain because you have to say EXACTLY what she says, in small print at the bottom of the headline. Also it's great she'll take your picture, but the unit is angled upwards so it can't get a good picture if you're sitting on the couch with family, or even standing in front of it. It's pretty great, but the tech isn't quite all there and streamline yet.

author: Thomas Wallner
title: It truly has potential and it is already useful as its is
content: It would have been 5 stars with the Alexa and other improvements I hope that will be made in the future. It truly has potential and it is already useful as its is. But how nice would it be if there was Airplay (in and out), TosLink out and maybe even speakerphone functionality. Don't get me wrong: the Echo Show does what Amazon says it does ... and it does it well. But give me Fire 10 HD tablet with the full functionality of the Show then I would take the tablet anytime. Bottomline: the Show is great but not so great that I would buy a second one.

author: Brittany and Chris Shaw
title: More to come
content:
So far so good. Quick delivery, easy payment option utilized, packaged beautifully, simple set up.  I will update after using it for a while. Read reviews for your buy, it’s not for everyone.

I did take lots of pictures upon opening it. These are a good reference for those who want to know how it comes packaged and what it comes with.

author: Dallanar
title: I want more
content: Love these things and use them all the time to monitor the cameras, have a conversation, find deals, or view who is at the door by using my Ring doorbell camera. I have 2 Echo Shows and a Echo Spot that work great together.

author: Amazon Customer
title: echo show works very nice
content: Really great echo show. Alexa listens way better than Siri on the iPhone. I also like the fact that I can do video calls through the alexa app. Hope there is a way to call home through the echo show and not having to be home with wi fi connected to my s8 phone.

author: LAURA J
title: Great product with a very annoying  feature.
content:
I like the echo show. It feels like an upgrade from the tower form of the echo. It has great sound. I can pair my iPhone. I love that I can see, as well as, hear the information provided. When the show is not in use I use it as a digital picture frame, rotating the images I uploaded. However,The echo show has one MAJOR flaw. The Bottom half of the screen has a constant message printed out with tips on how to use the echo. You are unable to make this message go away. So in the middle of your photo you have:
Try "Alexa, Play Tom Petty"  or Try "Alexa, play my messages" This constant display of hints is unnecessary and totally irrelevant to me. I don't need or want the hints!  At the very least, Amazon should give me the choice wether or not I want to display these hints.

author: Rachel
title: Can’ Live without it
content: Works as a regular echo/Alexa but it has the wonderful addition of a screen. There are news/ informative items shown all day. I like the fact that I can store things in it andit will show me. It was so easy to use.

author: Silverwolf341
title: Great for viewing amazon and videos also security cams.
content: Love the display screen it’s nice for seeing information. I also got the spot as well. You can do much more on these than the dot and orignal echo. It is nice to see the time and temp at any time. Good sound but not as good as the the echo and the new one for music. But can both be used in the same room. Each one needs a different wake command.

author: Aaron
title: Alexa talks
content: Echo Show is really cool, It's the same as the normal echo but with a screen. You can play music, shows, movies and ask so many questions. This provides a great comfort to calm my anxious dogs. I also tried out the video call option and had a chat with my brother. Haven't learned all of the things this Alexa can do yet but I am sure I will enjoy them. Would buy again and greatly recommend this.

author: Brian P.
title: Needs Touch icon in Touch Header to go to cams ( I have Amazon Cams)
content:
It would be great to add a camera icon in the drop down header. Quicker access, no speaking late st night. Icon should display multiview of cams on screen of live thumbnails that are selectable to each cam.
I’ve had cams for 20+ years, super quick access is key to multiview and in this case also silently  if your partner/spouse is sleeping  or it’s just late and you’d like to check on things.

author: Susan E. Howell
title: Do you understand me?
content:
I am glad I purchased on sale price. I am finding she doesn't under some basic demands. For instants, close book, or turn off audible.
Maybe it's just my voice. Other than her understanding what I am saying once she gets me it's pretty cool. Like the weather reports when ask also reading my books at night is great. I don't have to take my fire to bed anymore. I usually ended up with it under me.

author: WatermarkSD
title: The best Echo product yet
content:
Absolutely love it.  We have several other echo products throughout the house, but we just got an Echo Show for the kitchen.  I use the timer function with Alexa all the time, so it's great to finally be able to see the timers instead of asking for how much time is left.  It's so beautifully designed, with custom graphics for weather, as well as the ability to customize the background.

LOVE IT.

author: bernard
title: Four Stars
content: sometime Echo chow listen sometimes it talk to himself

author: V M Coniglio III
title: Amazon for the win
content: Purchased this on a whim, it works great and I like the fact that I can call up my Blink cams to see who is at my door or when my kid gets home.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Drop In feature opens the door to Grandkids!
content:
With the "Drop In" feature it's very simple for the grand children (ages 8 and 6) to call up Grandma and Pappy anytime they feel like it so we get a lot more interaction than we did when they would FaceTime us on their mom's phone.
The other element that my wife likes is that when she uses Echo Show for recipes the screen stays on unlike using her iPhone when it turns off every 10 seconds or so! Finally, my favorite feature, is you can call up a musician's albums and play the complete set of songs (assuming you have Amazon Prime?) just like the good old days of listening to music!

author: Slartybartfast
title: it can also sometimes be downright disobedient like when I tell it to turn the screen off ...
content:
Works okay but a little buggy still.  Seems to have more trouble with voice recognition than our dot, it can also sometimes be downright disobedient like when I tell it to turn the screen off at night there are times when it just pops back on.  Also, for some reason cannot ever locate my Prime Video library.  This might be me but I also haven't found a way to turn off "Suggestions" even though I tried everything I could think of.

Useful but I'm not getting as much out of it as I thought I would.

author: SD Brian
title: Malfunctioning screen
content:
After two days of use, the screen has stopped working.  Power cycling does not fix the problem.

For a product distinguishing itself based on addition of a touchscreen, a failing display is pretty damning.

author: Flameworker
title: Love my Alexa(s)
content: The Echo products just keep getting better and better, and Echo Show is the best so far.  Our family keeps the Show in our open concept kitchen which allows us easy listening and communication from the living room and dining room, too.  I'm an Allrecipes subscriber and really enjoy using the recipes on Echo Show that can be activated by voice or touchscreen.  Since we also have a dot and original Echo in different rooms, the drop in feature works great as an intercom.  The one thing I wish would improve on the Echo devices is the ability to answer general knowledge questions easily.  My Alexa allows my handicapped son to easily make phone calls connected to my Ooma device.

author: Ms.GO2
title: Giving it a little more time
content: Still early in our relationship, but so far I've had problems with Alexa recognizing other devices. I've had to be on the phone for hours with technical support. When I get more devices, i.e. security cameras, if I continue to have issues, I will return it all. However, I'm giving it a little more time because there is most diffidently a learning curve.

author: JMD3
title: Get the newer version
content: I want to start this review off by saying I am a huge fan of the echo Alexa devices and was very excited when I found an Echo Show refurbished at a decent price through Amazon warehouse. The first couple weeks of having it was great but I noticed that it kept shutting off. I read into it online and it says it does this periodically when it updates. I noticed that it started doing it more and more and more. Sometimes it would come up with a message ouh-oh something went wrong reboot. Overall it's okay but more times than not I come in and it has shut itself off so it doesn't really work the way I thought it was going to that's why I'm giving it three stars I was going to trade it in to upgrade to the new show but they're only offering very little. I've now owned the Echo Show for over a year and wish I had waited

author: DMorales
title: Not as simple as I would like...
content: Disappointing.. i love the idea behind the Echo Show however it's very frustrating having to enable every skill. Alexa apparently doesn't understand Spanish. Alexa does not understand most of what I am asking. I am not able to enable video because I have FIOS. This was given to me as a Christmas gift otherwise I would have returned it. Wish it was easier to figure out.

author: Michael Berry
title: Want a bedside alarm clock that can play Sirius?  This is it.
content: Want a clock radio that can play Sirius? This is it. I can lay in bed and play the Stern show by voice. It’s pretty awesome. Some complained it’s too bright at night but I don’t see that.  I would purchase again. Hit me with the hein!

author: Deb G
title: Echo show is so easy to use.
content: I have a couple of the echo dots and have enjoyed using them.  I have not mastered them by any means.  With the echo show you can read the lyrics and find you might not know all the words like you thought! I can watch movies from my prime account. It shows the forecast.  The show does everything my dot does only now I get to see it too.  I have only tapped the surface... can't wait to see what else it can do!

author: salt94
title: Amazon Show
content: Set up easily. screen not as responsive as I would like ( have to tap screen several times to function often). I try to tap screen to make objects bigger but can't seem to get timing just right without several 3 taps. works well with connect in answering phone. I think robocallers hang up because they think they got a computer on line. I like the visual of the product, it helps with the interaction

author: K. E. Russell
title: Echo Show
content: I am having such a great time with my Echo products.  It is so simple to set up and use. I bought this Echo Show to keep in touch with my kids who live in different states.  Love this product, so much fun. Thanks.

author: Fernando
title: No good
content: No good can get YouTube

author: Britney
title: My family loves it!
content: Echo Show is amazing! My family has enjoyed it very much. The daily reminders, weather update, synced calendar, lists, to do’s, timer, music, recipes, and generic questions my kids ask have been a staple since we got it. The sound is great! Overall very pleased with this product.

author: Vilynt
title: Echo show minus YouTube equals waste of $$.
content: If you don't have Prime video it is not worth buying, or giving as a gift.  Since the removal of YouTube off the device, I barely use it.  I am very pissed off at both Amazon and Google.  I don't know why a fire tablet at it's much lower price has more features than the show.  If the show could use apps, then I would be writing a 5 star review......

author: Larry Baker
title: Was cumbersome to set up and performance was at best marginal.
content: Did NOT work as intended. Was cumbersome to set up and performance was at best marginal. Returned

author: Phil N.
title: This is the best Amazon Echo you can get!
content:
0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player So if someone asks me what Amazon Echo to buy, I tell 'em this: Get the Echo Dot if you're just getting started, and the Echo Show if you're really serious. Yeah, you can get an OG Echo for less money, but the screen has so much potential. I LOVE using it as a digital picture frame for seeing pics of my family while I'm at home. And Alexa calling is a great way for my 7-year-old to get ahold of me without actually needing a phone.

I still want to see Skills actually take advantage of that screen, though, but that'll come with time.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Frustratingly limited and clunky.
content:
I was hoping to use in kitchen and bedroom as a way to watch apps I use on Fire TV. This, unfortunately, does not work with Netflix, Hulu and barely works with Amazon Video. Everything must be controlled through app which is clunky at best. Very limited controlling through touch screen, which seems like you'd a no brainier, but Amazon wants you to mainly control the Echo Show with your voice so phrasing correctly is key. Luckily I bought using Amazon Points and was going to buy an echo anyway so I thought I'd take the leap with the show.
To be fair, a lot of this could be fixed with software, so hopefully Amazon is paying attention to these negative reviews.

author: Andrew
title: Horrible design and Echo needs to be more intuitive
content: I was all invested in Amazon smart home devices until I bought this and decided to give Google a try.  The echo products are slightly more responsive than Google (i.e. they pick up softer voices from farther away) but they are not as intuitive.  The killer for me was simple stuff like listening to Spotify or trying to watch instructional videos.  YouTube is not available on Echo which doesn't sound horrible but turns out is crucial.  Also, it is so difficult to navigate through Spotify via voice commands.  Google Home has it down for now.

author: AvidReader
title: What did I ever do without Alexa???
content: Alexa is my new best friend!  She turns my light on and off, plays games, sets my alarm, plays music, gives me my calendar events for the day or week, keeps my to and shopping lists...and more!

author: J. Simeone
title: Love the show!
content: We love Alexa.........and the Show makes it even more fun for the kitchen.  Have done recipes and videos with this unit , along with kitchen timer and fun games; including Jeopardy!  How did we ever live without HER??!!!  Did I mention she controls all our lights in our home and made the Christmas Tree even brighter this year with more frequent use of the lights!  Am looking forward to updates in the future with the Alexa wand from Amazon being compatible too!  That there was a hint for Amazon!!! :)

author: Robert Stella
title: My Eco Show has been a great add-on to Alexa which I have owned for about ...
content: My Eco Show has been a great add-on to Alexa which I have owned for about a year.  Having access to time and weather is great along with a family photo background, placing it anywhere is easy.  The only downside is every once in a while she will play music or answer a question I never asked but this has only happened twice in the several months of use.  On my way out to the Phillies game last Saturday night and Alexa, through my Eco Show let me know that the game was canceled due to the weather and saved me an hour and a half drive to and from the stadium.

author: AbinoLynne
title: Loving It!
content: I am on the learning curve but enjoy what I have done so far.  Having an Echo, it was much easier to assimilate.  The screen/video portion is such a plus.  Don't be shy.  It's well worth it.

author: eDude
title: My kids can instantly talk to and see their grandma overseas!
content:
I bought one for our house and gave one to my mom overseas!  My kids can instantly talk to and see their grandma overseas!

I will buy a newer version as soon as it goes on sale!

author: Celeste
title: Good purchase, But check around for the best price
content: Great sound system and great picture. Awesome device over all. My only complaint was that I found it online at Macy’s for $100 cheaper than at Amazon. That shouldn’t be the case.

author: Kamal
title: Adds a visual capability that has to be seen to be believed (pun intended)
content:
I have a fairly automated smart home with lights, security, thermostats and front door locks controlled by units produced by a wide range of manufacturers. I have been controlling these with the original echo plus 2 Echo Dots for the last couple of years. Never felt the need to shell out the extra money for a Echo Show. I ended up purchasing the Eco Show on the latest Amazon prime day. It was a very pleasant surprise. If I had known the difference it would make, I would have purchased it at full price much earlier.
The ability to view the front door (nest cam), see shopping lists, watch music videos, see my calendar are just a few of the items that have won me over with this unit.
Do not let the price difference from the echo and Echo Dot prevent you from purchasing this unit. The visual capability it adds more than justifies its additional price.

author: Typical
title: Nice product - good sound
content:
I do like this device. It's great for music because of the powerful speaker system. One complaint I have is with the device and the other is with Alexa in general.

Device: the angle is only good if you put it on a counter, and that is only good for adults. I like to video chat with my kids when I travel, but unless we put it on the floor, I can't see them.

Alexa.. we'll, she gets a lot of stuff wrong and can't answer basic questions that Google can. Good for Amazon music though (which you pay PER DEVICE instead of house.. ridiculous).

author: SJ
title: I want to like it but...
content: I want to like this but it doesn’t always work right. Screen flickers a lot. Sometimes I ask it questions and the words come on the screen but no sound comes out. Great idea but the execution needs some work. When it does work right it’s very cool.

author: S. McDyer
title: Our best Echo addition yet.
content: Super easy setup. Great quality in the display and sound. We have a first gen Echo, and a Dot as well.

author: Dan
title: Echo
content: like being able to see recipes on the screen and getting sports updates also have it hooked up with my ring doorbell and can view my door from the sceen.

author: Richard A Reeves
title: Echo show has unlimited possibilities.
content: I use it view my front door, I use to listen to music, I use it ask questions,  I used it to turn some of my home lights to on and off, and I realize that I can use it for many more things.

author: V. D.
title: Limited home screen options
content: The echo show has all the benefits of the echo dot.  My biggest disappointment in giving it fewer stars was the limitations in customizing the home screen.  I was unable to simply show a large clock on the screen or have news headlines that I'd be interested in, and instead had a range of inexplicable messages .  Since one looks at the home screen 99% of the time, it would hope Amazon gives users more control of their home screen over time.

author: G. Meehan
title: Exc for ELDERLY in assisted living memory care nursing home old age community
content: I HIGHLY  recommend devices of this sort for elderly loved ones, whether in a facility or if they live at home. If your loved one cannot dial a phone anymore, he/she can tell Alexa to call you, or even to drop in on you if you choose to set it up for that.  Plus, you can call and video chat anytime.  If you want, you can also "drop in" on him/her anytime and chat or watch or listen in while the aides interact with her/him if he/she is in a facility or speak to the aides over the unit.  In the case of my mom, I left a unit connected at all times often with video and sound off at my end so she couldn't hear me  but I could always hear her,  and contact was just the touch of a button away, if she called out. On one occasion she fell and I had help there two minutes later. On another occasion she locked herself in the bathroom and again, I had help there in a couple minutes.  Sometimes I left the communication open, so we could just keep talking throughout the day, which was lovely for her.  On her last night conscious on the planet, I heard a commotion in her room and turned it on and there she was, staring at me, scared to death. The aides were there and spoke to me and told me what was up as they were calling 911. She said "I can't move" and I was able to talk to her and soothe her and tell her not to worry, I would be there by the time as the ambulance was, and would ride over with her... that this was just another glitch in her health another trip to the hospital, etc, etc.  The relief on her face was palpable as I spoke to her.  I have tears in my eyes as I write this, over a year later. I was able to get to her with the ambulance and ride over with her, and also able to call my sister who met us at the emergency room  We were both able to talk to her and soothe her some more before they gave her meds to put her to sleep... she didn't know it but her organs were failing and she was put her in a medical coma from which she never awoke. We would never have made it to the hospital on time without the Amazon echo. I would not have been able to talk to her and soothe her while she was freaking out in her room.  There are other devices that would serve the same purpose but I will always be a loyal Echo user as a result. There are rules about this type of equipment n facilities, and they vary from state to state, but I would never put a loved one in a facility that didn't allow it. Some facilities allow it even if not required to. In Florida and several other states, they are now required to allow it so don't let anyone tell you otherwise (of course that could change, there is a powerful lobby against cameras, etc).

author: Bill From RI
title: Not ONLY A GREAT Digital Assistant - Incredibly SMART SAFETY DEVICE, Too!
content:
Awesome! No second thoughts what-so-ever!

Here is GREAT IDEA, TOO! - My "friend" in her autumn years, has limited mobility (crutches), and lives alone. What an incredible device to use as one of "those" - "Alexa Call For Help or Call Bill - I've Fallen scenarios." Not even any monthly recurring costs you'd be paying for one of "those" 5St** Emergency devices with a fee.. This takes the place and reasonable to purchase.

Being another "eco system" person, Alexa's voice recognition seems to be GREAT! It may be matched to my voice or something - there are so FEW commands that "she" doesn't understand what I've asked. (Unlike the other "eco system" I've used in the past.)

Sound is _good_ on the "Shows" too - whereas the DOT devices obviously a little lesser quality.

I use Alexa for controlling lights, heat, TV, door-lock (it will NOT let it "open" my locks - (smart thinking!)) but allows me to lock if I went to bed and forgot.

(The privacy issue folks? If you _believe_ the stories, then put the cell-phone down. - Turn your computer off (mute mic/cam) too!)

They're on sale, AGAIN, I see today. Compared to the 'other two' digital devices as of today? (you know what those are)  In my opinion Alexa crossed the finish line and WON, while the others are crawling to the starting gate!) Grab a couple - I'm happy I did.

author: Shelly from Selma
title: Consider other similar devices -first!
content: We had the Echo Show for 4 months & rarely used. Don’t know why it stopped working last 3 weeks-too late fir a return. Was really looking forward to chatting with our grandkids

author: Akiko Ashley
title: The patient Echo Show
content: Echo Show is the perfect Echo with the screen and the speakers. It is an upgrade from the Echo's without a screen. I love my Show. Alexa is very patient with kids who try to ask her for everything on the Show. I can make video phone calls to other Show and Spot owners and it is crystal clear with no jumpy pauses. Great product.

author: chris from RI
title: Love it!  Needs IPhone Mirroring and YouTube and it would be 5 stars!
content:
I love the show.  I’ve had an Alexa since the first one and have 6 additional.  The show is great for the kitchen and for the lyrics to songs.  I’ve even watched a movie on it because I could.  The reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is that I think it should have more accessibility to TV and YouTube.  You should at least be able
To mirror your phone to it and watch YouTube or news on on it.

author: RichardP
title: Generally unimpressed.
content: I have multiple Echo Dot's around the house and decided to get the Show as so we could implement a Ring door bell. The quality of the screen is decent enough, but wife wanted to use it as a digital photo display. The home screen photo rotation always stops - go in change photo location and it will resume for awhile and then stop again. If you use the "slide show" feature this gets around it, but every time you talk to Echo that slide show stops and you need to ask her to start it again. Not an issue, just annoying. Delay to Ring is slow and sometimes nonresponsive - hard to say if it is Echo or not, but my gets it right away. Speaker sucks. Microphone doesn't seem to be as good as what is in even the first gen Echo Dot.

author: Ryan19
title: Absolute Trash.
content: Ordered this on amazon prime day... big mistake. truly a piece of garbage, no wonder they started selling them cheap and discontinued them. first of all when i first got it in the mail it legit wouldn't display my cloud clam on the screen, talk to a few morons in the service department who couldnt seem to figure out the issue, oh ya thats right alls i had to do was update the firmware, the usual suspect, and none of the geniuses i talked to ever mentioned that as an option, well since then things have only gotten worse, the screen legit starts acting up in the craziest way possible to the point where it cant be read, and i know im not the only one, have seen this happen to multiple people when ive been at their house. Not happy with this product what so ever and would want my cash back if it was an option.

author: Average Guy
title: The Echo Show is pretty nice but it must not have a big music ...
content:
The Echo Show is pretty nice but it must not have a big music library because it often repeats songs in a Particular genre as in easy listening music.
Also when asked to play instrumentals it also plays vocals so it does need to learn the difference,. I like that you can ask it anything but often you need to repeat the request for it to understand what you want and your choice of words are limited to what it understands. The camera angle faces up and should be lower because if you want to have a face to face telephone conversation you need to be close to it, not across the room.Overall it's a cool addition to the home.

author: jayson
title: Good tool but needs work .
content: I like it but.... the sound could been better the 1st gen sounded WAY... better.. i got it for the arlo cams and the ring door bells. hopefully amazon will tinker with it and make the sound more rich.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Not Google, but pretty spiffy
content: Needs a few tweaks as it is not quite intuitive enough.  Examples: a title of events for calendar better be short and sweet, in flash briefing, it keeps calling "coins" "co-ins" regarding Big Mac anniversary coins, also when searching for the meaning or examples of ' nightshade vegetables' it only sources Wikipedia where there are no examples. Next, the app should indicate the activity of the flash brief options as I have some medical ones w/o any daily briefs. Last, it would be wonderful if it displayed the day, date, and time when in idle.

author: DavidW
title: Love being able to integrated it with my Ring doorbell
content: Love being able to integrated it with my Ring doorbell, have it scroll through pictures I upload to my Amazon account, and have it play various types of music through Amazon prime.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best smart device on the market. Alexa changed our life
content: This is the best product. This helped to turn our house into a smart house. We got the cloud cams. And firetvs. We are going to continue to grow into everything. We love it so much. The cameras with the kids is the best.

author: Tyler
title: Best Alexa ever....
content: I cant tell you how much I love this product.. its soo much better than the Echo Dot.. the fact that I can just place it on my counter and pull up calls from my grandchildren, children and friends is great.. I truly love it and will be ordering more of them as holiday gifts for my children...

author: RocknRocknRon
title: You can name it something else besides Alexa!
content:
I like the video part of it.You can read the weather report or anything else it displays. When it is playing a song it shows you the words to each
song also-how Kool is that!
I am not impressed with the audio sound that it has it sound tone-ee to me maybe if you can adjust the bass and treble settings this would give it a 5 starr rating from me.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very poor quality and unbelievably poor service from Amazon
content: stay away.  Very poor quality and unbelievably poor service from Amazon.
