Defective unit replaced twice by Amazon then they charged $244.36 to my surprise despite my returning the defective unit. I had only paid around $300 for two echo show units to begin with.  No one can say why and no one has the tools to correct.  I have been passed around to a half dozen people and supervisors, each has a different story.  Received email confirmation that I was billed in error but apparently they cannot figure our how to refund.  Passed around to supervisors but they put mu on hold without checking back. Currently 56 minute hold.

author: clam
title: Wait for next generation....
content: Disappointing.  Not enough hints on how to use effectively.  Not all Echo features available yet.

author: Brian
title: Great device to have
content: Great device to use for just about anything like grocery lists, timers, gathering info from questions, current weather, sports updates, etc.

author: BigBaldGuy Reviews
title: The best Amazon gadget we have ever gotten and my technophobic mother loves it also!
content:
The Echo Show is probably the single best product I've ever found to allow my elderly technophobic mother to converse with my children and utilize internet connected services without having to use a mouse or touch screen. The video quality on the Echo Show is top notch and it has really brought about a significant improvement in the quality and quantity of interactions between my mother and my whole family.

The speakers in it are fantastic and it's regularly used for impromptu dance parties in the house. Overall, it's by far the best Amazon gadget we have ever gotten.

author: Storm
title: The video is clear and I love to drop in on family
content: Item as expected and described.  Awaiting new features.  The video is clear and I love to drop in on family.

author: Connie V
title: Best Echo device yet!
content: I love the Echo Show!! I have the dot and have been using that for the last 6 months,  but the Show is so much better.  The sound quality is amazing and the screen resolution is like watching a mini 4K tv.  I love being able to see my timers, events and list instead of having them read to me.  I purchased this on prime day, and it is worth every penny.  When the dot was given to me, I thought "this is a cute novelty,  but I'll probably never use it". Was I wrong!!  Echo is part of my daily routine,  and has made my life so much easier.

author: Jason S.
title: Nice option to get visual Amazon content
content:
I've had this for several months now.  Overall, I like it.  I enjoy seeing the 7-day weather forecast on the screen and being able to see the text of a lot of the stories it reads.  I read other people saying it has better sound qualities than other devices.  That's where I disagree.  I moved my Echo to another room and miss the sound quality it provided.  The show doesn't seem to do quite as well here... definitely sounds fuzzy when I'm listening to music at louder volumes where the Echo really shined.

Overall, I'm happy with the product.  I just wish the sound quality was a bit better.

author: John Rizzo
title: Great for information and entertainment
content: As you can see Echo Show is in kitchen. It far exceeds my expectation. There’s a wealth of information about any topic. If is customizable for sound and video. I also have Echo and Echo Dot. You can group them and have hole house music. Still not done exploring all it can do love it. Perfect for getting recipes so you can see them while you’re preparing to cook.

author: Marilyn Sanchez-Osorio
title: The Amazon Echo Show is a wonderful gadget. I use it a lot to play ...
content: The Amazon Echo Show is a wonderful gadget. I use it a lot to play music, find out about the weather, etc. It is really helpful and fun.

author: The Neisens
title: So disappointed
content:
I honestly expected this device to be more knowledgeable. I guess Google has spoiled us.

You have to be VERY specific with your commands.  For example, if I say, "Alexa, play Daniel Tiger" the device will only find purchase options. But if I say, "Alexa SHOW Daniel Tiger" the device brings up the 3 free episodes. And recently after a search for a movie trailer I then asked to show Daniel Tiger but the device "could not find a movie titled Daniel Tiger."
Just today my son and I came home from errands and I nearly had a heart attack when I heard voices in my home. Daniel Tiger was playing on the Echo but we hadn't watched it in a full 24 hrs.

Also, for a while, we could successfully call Dad from our device to his app on the nights he was away for work. Suddenly he can no longer hear us when we call.

I personally would not buy this again. It has been very disappointing.

author: Kimi Pyles
title: Love it!
content: Connected very easily, have throughly enjoy it!  And have only scratched the surface on what we can do with it.  Love making out my grocery lists on Alexa!

author: Scott A. Smith
title: Eureka!
content: I received the Echo Show as a gift.  I set it up and was very disappointed with the sound quality.  After using it for the past two weeks today I discovered that the speakers were covered with a plastic film that I only noticed due to a little blue tab on the right.  That's when I had that eureka moment!  Take that baby off!  What a difference!  Now enjoying holiday music!!

author: Alexander J. Wiedmann
title: Solid buy
content: She doesn’t QUITE do everything I was hoping. But I think my expectations were really high. I definitely don’t regret the purchase and still recommend it. And hopefully with updates/new Alexa skills it’ll be able to do the extra things that I was hoping for like sync better with my iPhone so I can pick up podcasts where I left off from one device to the other (as of now they don’t)

author: J. Miller
title: I really like the Echo Show
content: I really like the Echo Show.  There are things that I wish it did differently though.  I do not like the recommendations it cycles through on the home screen.  I would also like to to always show the timer.  I have mine in the kitchen and when I set timers I need to see them.  The way it is now, I might get lucky that it scrolls passed it, but usually I either have to scroll too it manually or ask Alexa how much time is left.  That's my reason for 4 instead of 5 stars.

author: vicki
title: Unable to view ALL utube videos
content: Very Very disappointed!!!  That I can no longer view videos on utube! That was the main reason I purchased the Echo show!!! For instructional videos, Recipes, music videos, news on utube! Etc etc! I would give this 5 stars if I was able to view utube videos!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Show’s One Fault
content: So impressed with this. I am very happy with all it does and I have been able to eliminate many devices out of the bedroom. However, the one thing that annoys me is being able to set up the music/radio for alarms. It will not work through the app and the device misses the instructions. It takes many attempts to get the correct station or genre of music. Otherwise, the Show has been a technological advanced product that I love.

author: Jon
title: Screen Defect
content: This is my forth echo purchased and while I have no issues with the voice features after about two months the screen began to randomly flicker. And all the touch features become useless. Very disappointed in this especially considering the high price for it.

author: Scurvydog Designs
title: add YouTube again
content: Great product but you need to learn to get along with YouTube because the videos are seriously lacking and the show kinda loses the point...music is good but cant watch videos...

author: Denver Bautista
title: Can't get enough!
content: I love it! I have The echo show, the regular echo, and the echo dot.  I also have the harmony, which is compatible with Alexa which enables her to control my tv and cable box (including changing the channel and going from one app like netflix to another).  She can control my hue lights in the bedroom, my fan, kitchen and living room lights as well. She is also able to access the camera on my ring doorbell, although I have to wait 30 seconds for her to wake it up.

author: Robert J. Thompson
title: Love it
content: It's one of the best tools we use in our kitchen.  You can ask it for recipes or any news item you may be looking for.  It's the best for chatting face to face with someone that also has this device.

author: Judi Haley
title: Great Product!!!!
content:
I absolutely love this one. Bought one for my niece and she is the same way. Always nice to have Alexa around the house.
It monitors my security cameras and can just tell it to show me a certain area and it does.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I think this is just the best thing. It's got a sharp little picture
content: I think this is just the best thing. It's got a sharp little picture, good sound and very  receptive microphones. It was easy to add the Kasa app "skill" so I can control smart outlets by voice. It is a lot of fun calling up various songs that I haven't heard in years. My next step is to learn how to do the video phone calls. I'm really impressed!

author: Amazon Customer
title: The video screen adds value
content: Does an Echo Show do anything fundamentally different or better than other echo devices? Probably not, but the screen is a great addition and it displays stuff and scrolls song lyrics (when available) and makes video calls to other echo video devices and cell phones with video capabilities, so it's a pretty neat addition for us. The Echo Spot is a smaller video enabled device, and while we enjoy having our Spot, it doesn't have nearly the display ability due to its much smaller size, but it will also make video calls to other echo video devices and cell phones with video capability.

author: Gary
title: Died unexpectedly, poor warranty.
content: Product died in less than 60 days. This is the equivalent of the PC "blue screen of death". I just spent 30 minutes on the phone with Amazon, unplugging and replugging, for them to tell me to mail it in. I requested they send me a replacement immediately and they told me "5 days after I send it in". Not satisfied.

author: Diane S.
title: Improve sound quality by connecting to a bluetooth speaker
content: Bought this to stream music and were unhappy with sound quality out of the box.  Did not realize when we bought it that bass/treble were not adjustable, and our first impulse was to return it.  However, we connected to a bluetooth speaker, which made a big difference. Keeping it!

author: cdhanimations
title: Less than a Year Old
content: So I bought one of these for myself and it worked pretty well for a couple months. After 3-4 months, the screen started flickering the whole time and lines started appearing and vibrating through the screen. Contacted Amazon, they let me ship it back and they would look at it and hopefully fix it or send me a different one. Just got my "new" one in the mail today the bottom of it is damaged.... haven't even plugged it in yet. Like seriously, for how expensive these are, you'd think I'd get one that isn't damaged.. Plus I'm out the $15 I spent on a screen protector for the first one and now I'm gonna have to buy another one for I guess this already damaged one. Not happy with Amazon products right now....

author: Amazon Customer
title: FANTASTIC
content: LOVE ALL THE OPTIONS I HAVE IN USING MY ECHO SHOW.  I LOVE THE FACT THAT I CAN FIND A RECIPE, CREATE A LIST OF ITEMS AND SET A TIMER.  CREATING A CHORE LIST FOR THE FAMILY IS SO HELPFUL.  LOVE IT!!

author: Dicey
title: Five Stars
content: The only thing I regret is not getting one sooner.

author: Scott B.
title: Works well with it's limited functions
content:
I expected more from this product. Seems to be limited in it's functions and very pricey.
I do enjoy what it can do now, but it becomes very boring very quickly - a pricey dust collector

author: Lawrence S. Burstein
title: Not ready for Prime time
content: I really wanted to love this, but so far it is an expensive toy. It is supposed to work with my Logitech Harmony remote, and sometimes t does, but others not so much. It doesn’t seem to be able to control my fire stick very well either.  The screen is nice, but not bright enough. The screen and displays a stream of things to ask Alexa, but that gets old quickly. You can access its camera from the internet, but I don’t have much need for that. Hopefully there will be more useful and reliable skills in the future, but right now I would stick with one of less expensive versions if you want to get a sense of what this technology is like

author: Amazon Customer
title: I really love Alexa, but I only give it 3 stars ...
content: I really love Alexa, but I only give it 3 stars because I hate that you have to download a bunch of items from the Alexa App to have her be more useful. Also, you have to say very specific commands to have her do things you want or need. It is much easier to type on my phone to google the questions I want which is disappointing. I wanted to be able to just be hands free working around the house and ask Alexa lots of questions and she says most of the time she does not know. If I google it I get an instant answer.

author: atldallas
title: Dementia patient use
content: Purchased for my mom who lives out of state and suffers with dementia.  She likes being able to see me when we talk.  I also have a medicine reminder programmed.  We thought she would use it for music but she forgets her name. Calls her “Girlfriend.”  We only have problems when she unplugs her internet connection and the Echo goes off line.  We’ll see what happens as the disease progresses.

author: Belle
title: pretty decent comparatively
content: It seems a little less intuitive then the regular Echo Plus. It's also a little harder for it to pick up what you're saying.  When combined with the other four we have in the household, having to speak loud enough for it to hear was cross activating other ones, so we had to rename this one.  Overall it works well, but does not seem as adept at doing things as the original Echo Plus.

author: Glen M. Green
title: Show not ready for prime time.
content: Used for two days. Most of the time it recognizes I have provided the wake up word “Alexa” but it just cycles without response. My other echos work great but not this Show. Can’t find a way to return or warranty as it is just 6 months old. Would like Amazon to advise fix or replacement. So looking forward to this item but it doesnt seem to be ready. I’ve seen many forum entries with folks having same issues.

author: Chase
title: I am hoping I got a lemon and this is not the norm
content:
Pros: You can see the lyrics the song that is playing
  Potential for video chat
  If you use the Amazon cloud for photos, you can display your pictures here
  See weather reports rather than just hearing them
  Could work as a small tv to watch amazon videos

Cons: Price vs Utility
  Microphone has issues
  Sound quality not as good as 1st gen Echo
  Video call quality was not very good (needed a lot of lighting)

I have 2 first gen Echo devices and the sound quality and microphone in those is far superior to what I received in my Echo Show. Alexa will either not hear you or not understand you when talking 2 feet away. Alexa will also respond to random sounds (toys, pots clanking, etc...) or words and it can be a little freaky. I have yet to experience these issues with the Echo devices.

I bought this to try for video calls with family but was disappointed with the video quality. The camera quality was pretty low for this to be one of the "attractions" of the device.

The sound quality when playing music is not that great, either. I find the sound from the 1st gen Echo to be much better. Note, I am not an audiophile - but the sound just seems kind of flat. Also, the sound levels are odd. Volume 3 and Volume 4 are almost identical and the same with 5 and 6.

Bottom line - I am very disappointed.
The microphone will not hear or understand you when talking to it while also responding to random clinks, clanks, and words from the kitchen. I never had this issue with the Echos. For example, I have an Echo upstairs that I can talk to from

author: Ni
title: Maybe I was expecting more...
content:
I've been updating my review and will continue to do so as I've noticed updates and get more hands on experience. After separating my expectations from the actual capabilities of this device I've come to the conclusion that the Show still had me wanting more despite it's capabilities.

 I currently own the original echo which is in my living room, 2nd gen Echo in my home gym, a spot in my bedroom 12/21/17, and a dot at work. I have lights, fans, a thermostat, security cameras, surround sound, fire sticks, fire tv box, fire tablets and TVs all connected to my Alexa devices. Of course I had to buy one with  a screen. I'm a big fan of Alexa, the products have become a routine part of my day. As soon as the Show was available to preorder I ordered one without any hesitation.

Initially I wanted to put my show on a 70 inch TV stand by my 60 inch TV where my original Echo was. I figured it wouldn't look bad because I could use it as a digital picture frame also. I don't have end tables and quickly came to the realization that viewing a 7 inch screen from 8 feet away wasn't going to work for me. My Show now sits on my kitchen counter. I figured I'd get more use out of it in my living room because most of my Alexa enabled devices are in there and generally I spend more time in my living room than the kitchen. A few people mentioned why don't you put it on your desk. I honestly don't spend much time in my study, if I am at my desk I'm already on my computer and wanted the Show where I would get the most use out of it.

This device was marketed as a hands free companion in the kitchen for things like recipes. My frustration is when I ask it to pull up a recipe it's inconsistent. Sometimes it wants to send the recipe to my phone, sometimes it wants me to swipe down on the screen to access the cooking directions and ingredients. Why can't I just say Alexa scroll down? Why do I have to touch the screen? Why does it have to send the recipe to my phone for me to view it when the Show already has a screen?

 As of now I've seen videos with CNN, Reuters, and Fox news during my flash briefings. There was a software update on 7/15/17 and now I've also seen CNBC videos. 7/19/17 I noticed today Bloomberg is now showing videos.

Personally I think 7 inches is too small to watch a movie from any fixed location unless it was maybe a foot or two from my face so take that in to consideration when determining where you might put one. *Update* Some of Prime's videos are widescreen meaning you only get to use about half of your already small 7 inch screen to watch them. I noticed this while trying to watch 13 Hours Soldiers of Benghazi while I was cooking. This is cellphone size small. *Update* 11/11/17 I noticed yesterday while cooking and watching a movie on Prime I was given an option to expand a wide screen video to full screen fixing my initial complaint. I'm not sure when there was a software update.

Navigating through prime videos can be a chore. You can't say the word movie, you have to say video.  When selecting options by number from the screen you have to be careful with what you say. I said something like play movie one thinking it would understand that the movie with a 1 on it would play. Instead it started playing a song. I had to say Alexa stop. And then go back through the voice navigation to Amazon Prime videos, then find my movie, then ask Alexa to play it.

The problem with Youtube it pulls the most popular video that is close to your description based off of key words. It doesn't go to exactly what you are asking it to pull up. Example Alexa show me Donald Trump's latest speech on you tube. It pulled a video from May 2nd which was 2 months ago. This is because the search uses keywords in this scenario Donald Trump and Speech. Then it pulls the most popular or viewed videos.

UPDATE 12/5/17 it was announced 2 hrs ago that Google is pulling the plug again on Youtube from the Echo Show and Fire TV devices. Apparently instead of working things out with Google, Amazon bypassed the block Google placed on Youtube. This is shady business Amazon! I dropped my score back down to 3 stars again because Youtube was a promised feature when I preordered my Echo show.

One thing I love about my dots and the original Alexa devices is that they are intuitive I don't have to use precise wording. My Show expects me to use precise wording to navigate and use quite a bit of features. I just left the kitchen trying to get it to go to the dim screen. I used multiple variations of turn off the screen which sometimes works.I kept getting the response sorry what device? After several attempts to get this command to work I gave up and walked out of the kitchen frustrated. Maybe it's still learning from me? *Update*  I am still having issues with it not always recognizing the turn off the screen command.I also find myself constantly having to ask the Show to turn the screen off. I don't know why it keeps turning on without me using any wake words. I heard it wake when my dogs went in to the kitchen this morning 7/19/17, yet I can walk past it all day long and it doesn't wake. Randomly I will hear my Show while I am in another room answering questions and acting on it's own with no one talking. I don't know why it does this.

The sound is hands down better than any other Alexa device. The show can put out some bass. For some reason when playing Prime movies any speech sounds a bit muffled and the sound output is significantly lower..

I placed an order with my Show and honestly it was fast and unlike my other Echos I could visually verify my order. I didn't have to pull my phone out, fumble with a keyboard, computer or tablet. I knew what I wanted said the name and probably in less than 30 seconds placed my order.

Being able to look at my lists calendar and reminders without having to pull my phone out is nice. I wish the calendar could show more than just one day at a time. Like my whole week or month. The show won't display your whole shopping list only 3 to 4 items on the screen at one time then you have to ask it to scroll down. *Update* As of 7/16/17 the Show displays 2 days on the calendar now and will scroll through events two at a time.

If you are a shopper like me that likes to browse recommendations your show will only give you a total of 12 recommendations which were no where near as accurate as my interests on my Amazon account usually are, actually they were way off. You can only view one product at a time. Basically the Show is only good for ordering when you know exactly what you want. It's not good with recommendations, and browsing items. You are limited to viewing items one at a time and then having to ask Alexa to scroll right or go right makes the process painfully slow.

 I guess the best way to explain the show. Most of what the Alexa devices were using your phone for can now be done on the show's touch screen. I still find myself listening to my Show more than looking at it, which kind of defeats the purpose of a screen. My biggest frustration with the Show is instead of operating Alexa from across the room with voice commands I find myself having to stand in front of it, or walk to it then hovering over it to navigate through the screens. I still find myself pulling my phone out of my pocket or reaching for a tablet to pull up information rather than getting up walking to the device and dealing with the frustratingly clunky voice navigation. Most of everything we use now a days is wireless, we aren't used to being restricted to a certain area to use a device. I haven't felt this way since the landline was the only way to make a call and there were no such things as cordless phones, cellphones, laptops, tablets, bluetooth, smartphones and other smart devices. This is probably why the device is more appealing for Older people, because they've spent more of their lives on devices that needed to be plugged in, like phones that had to be plugged in to phone jacks. I personally hate the idea of having to stand in front of my kitchen counter to make a video call, or running to the device to answer one.

When using the video chat feature the Show gives you a full screen view of yourself before the call is connected and a smaller window like Skype once the call is connected. With the angle of the camera and my Show sitting on the kitchen counter I had to take a few steps back, maybe 5 feet from the device so that my head would show up on the camera. As a note I am 6" 2. Standing 5 feet away to video chat from a device with a 7 inch screen isn't as nice as using a web cam on your computer or laptop with 15+ inches from a few feet away, or a 10 inch tablet from a few feet away.

This is how I use my Show I listen to music from it (any Echo or Alexa device can do this) I add items to my grocery list ( any echo or Alexa device can do this) I can view my shopping list without having to check my phone, any tablet with Alexa can do this, your fire TV and Fire stick can also. I set reminders (any Echo device can do this) Alexa tablets can not. The Show will show you 2 calendar days or the current day. However my phone is synced and always with me and shows me the same info. You can also view this information from any Alexa enabled tablet and all Alexa enabled fire TV and Fire TV boxes. Positioning your tablet vertically will show your more days. Any Echo device without a screen will read this information to you. I ask my Show questions some times, mainly sports scores, when my teams are playing again, maybe some calculations. (Any Echo or Alexa device can do this). I set timers (any Echo or Alexa device can do this). I control all my smart home devices (Any Echo or Alexa device can do this.) I occasionally will watch a Prime movie. (Alexa tablets, Fire TV and Fire stick can do this). I listen to my Flash Briefings (Any Echo or Alexa device can do this) The Show will Show you video clips on some of the news skills. It's not like watching the news. However the Show is the only Echo or Alexa device that can do this. The only thing that really sets this device apart from the other Echo or Alexa devices is the Amazon video chat feature, which is not an enjoyable experience for me and something I rarely use. I preordered the device before any reviews or definite answers were out expecting it to be like a hands free tablet that is plugged in to a wall and could have apps installed on it. If that is your expectation you are going to be sadly disappointed. The Fire 10 HD with hands free Alexa is everything I wish the Show would have been, had it been released first I would have bought the tablet and passed on the Show. My biggest disappointment with the Echo show is, it just doesn't have much to Show.

UPDATE 3/12/18 All Fire tablets can video call and call mobile phones. The Fire 10 can do it all hands free, which was the Echo Show's only real advantage.

Why you might consider buying the Fire 7 tablet with Alexa before buying the Echo Show

I bought the Fire 7 tablet with Alexa for $30.00 during Prime day, now $49.99 (Same price as a Dot!) Here are some noteworthy comparisons. The show is limited to being plugged in to a wall and although it can be easily moved it will require a little planning as to where you might put one. The Fire 7 is obviously portable and has none of these restrictions. Both have a 7-inch, 1024 x 600 touchscreen. The Show blows the Fire 7's speakers out of the water. However you can use bluetooth with the tablet and compensate for the lack of sound quality on your device. In order to use Alexa on the tablet you have to hold down the home key for a few seconds then without using the wake word Alexa or Echo speak your command. This is a nice feature because it won't wake my other Echo devices, it will also give those worried about the always listening peace of mind. Plus it's one less thing to have to say in your list of commands. I found my tablet very responsive to my commands and could do ALMOST everything my Dot and Original Echo can do EXCEPT you can not use the newly enabled voice call feature, which to me is no big deal. Apparently you can not set reminders on the Fire 7. All of my home smart devices can be controlled from my tablet by giving the same commands I use on my other Echo devices. You can not use the Show's video chat feature. Skype, Oovoo and a few other apps are options you can take advantage of. Chances are the people you'd want to video chat with already have these services which the Show can not use and not Amazon's video chat. As a side note you don't need a Echo Show to use Amazon's drop in service it can be done straight from the Alexa app. The Echo show when it displays cards and information the whole screen is filled, where as the Fire 7 you loose about 10% of the same image that is on the Show. However unlike the Show you can rotate your screen. For those that complained about the lack of HDMI output on the Show you can pick up a micro USB to HDMI adapter with the Fire 7 tablet and fix that complaint. For those that complained there was no way to cast to your TV with the Show and other Echo devices you can cast your Prime movies straight from your Fire 7 to your Firestick or Fire TV. *Update* As of 8/5/17 I've been able to use all of my Echo devices to control my Fire TV and Fire TV stick. You can access your tablet's apps via Alexa with the Fire 7, The Show has no apps. The fire 7 also syncs instantly with your other devices in Amazon's ecosystem. Unlike the Show you can watch Netflix, Hulu,  and other streaming services on the tablet. I find myself using my Fire7 significantly more than my Show. I don't have to be in the kitchen hovering over my counter and lets just face it even a limited Amazon tablet can do a lot more than an Echo device with a screen. Think of the Fire 7 as the budget friendly tap version of the show for $80.00 less than a tap and $180.00 less than a Show. If you are on the fence about shelling out $230.00 but want to experience the Echo screen hype this may be the way to go.

Why you may consider the Fire 10 HD with hands free Alexa
You can purchase the Fire 10 HD tablet with hands free Alexa for $80.00 less than a Show or $130 less when it is on sale. Unlike the Show you can watch Netflix even command Alexa to open Youtube, Netflix, Hulu, and, other streaming services on a 10" screen instead of just being limited to Prime videos on the 7" screen with the show. With it's portability and always listening mode unless you have to have Amazon's video chat services. Almost all of the advantages are with the Fire 10 HD. If you are worried about the battery dying on always listening on the tablet just leave it plugged in all day and set it where ever you'd keep an Echo show and pick it up when you want to carry it around. I personally like having my tablet on my coffee table something I can't do with my Show. I bought the fire 10 with hands free Alexa and I'm happier with the purchase now I have a 10" screen hands free Alexa I can use anywhere and can do a lot more with it. I've added a side by side comparison of the two in my pictures. In short the Fire 10 with hands free Alexa is everything I wanted the Show to be at a fraction of the cost. If you found this review helpful, please click on the this was helpful tab.

author: Bill & Deb
title: Wonder product. Highly recommend
content: Love the echo show, can keep I can video chat with the kids and grandkids. I have it in the kitchen, so when I run out of something I have Alexa to add it to my grocery list. I use it for everything. Was very easy to set up

author: Ktecuento
title: Not much fot the price
content: As many people I was excited with the arrival of the new Echo Show to my home but once we got it, is just another gadget with limitations and not much to offer if you don't have a cable or TV provider due the fact that for some legal rights or capabilities doesn't allow to play must anything you ask to "Show" regardless you have internet or wifi at home. so  hope this help to those who are looking for a another way t see anything on the Echo Show. Regards

author: Amazon Customer
title: Underwhelmed.
content: I have to say I had high expectations that Alexa would be my new best friend. We have had some good times, yes. One of my pleading strategies when nagging... Errrhm persuading my husband to buy Alexa for me was the fact that I wouldn't have to get my phone dirty when scrolling and cooking recipes. Now, I feel I was mislead. I get a large majority of my very tasty inspirations from all recipes. Alexa will only retrieve the same recipes she's already offered me and I've continuously rejected. Now I would have imagined with all the smarts over there at Amazon you all would have taught Alexa to shuffle up recipes as this was one of the main selling points. And shame on you Amazon for not recognizing that the best recipes come from allrecipes.com WTH Amazon? Get on the stick and fix this, I'm pretty sure that chick over at Google home can find me better recipes. I should have known she doesn't have great taste when she told me she picked the Eagles to win the SB. We didn't speak to each other until after the SB. I'm also from New England and Alexa doesn't get down with that thick accent🙄. I feel like the reason I wanted the "show" was for the recipe benefit and it is so underwhelming I rarely even use it for that. For the positives, this thing has a great speaker!!! I host Mariah Carey, Whitney Houston and Chris Stapleton sing offs weekly while meal prepping and for that I have found it's worth. My husband and dogs might disagree. I do enjoy that the lyrics play on the screen, you wouldn't believe the songs I had butchered before Alexa. She's a good source for news, if you can stomach to hear the turmoil happening in this beautiful country, but I digress. Overall it's a good product, I guess. But the fact she has such poor range and taste in recipes is a real turn off for something that was purchased for that reason. The echo tower has a great speaker as well, and a lot less expensive.

author: Paul Wagner
title: The screen makes a world of difference.
content:
As a user of two home automation systems (Alexa and Google Home) I'm able to speak to the pros and cons of both systems.

Neither are perfect. We have two Echo Shows at this point, and the voice recognition capabilities of the Amazon system seem better than Google Home.

That being said, there's nothing better than having a screen. Because of this, the Echo Show has become our go-to device.

My favorite feature? Being able to drop in to home while traveling or at work. This feature alone makes it worth the price.

Pros:
Beautiful screen (though OLED would be preferred, particularly if you have the Show in your bedroom)
Great sound quality
Simple to use

Cons:
Large
Occasionally not as intuitive as I'd prefer
Mobile app leaves a lot to be desired, particularly when trying to use it to drop in on your Echo Shows.

On the whole, a fantastic and useful device.

author: V. Pierce
title: Screen Flickers and Is Full of Lines
content: This was a nice addition to the echo line and we enjoyed it for about a year, but two months ago the screen started to have flickering lines rolling across it.  The screen is pretty much unusable now.  That pretty much negates the purpose of it.  A spot would have been just as effective without the significant extra costs.

author: Jessica S.
title: Best Thing Ever! Worth The Money!
content: Love Having Alexa In The House! Its So Handy To Have Around. So Easy To Order, Love The News & Able To Play Music Just By Asking “Alexa Play Classic Rock”. The List Is The Best! Anyone In The House Can Put Things On The List From Home Or Phone With The Alexa App-No More Forgotten Lists & Wasted Paper!

author: Missy
title: Love this!
content: We were already fans of the echo dot and love this even more...I was using the dot for kitchen timers very often and this one shows the timer on the screen.  When we listen to music, the lyrics are on the screen and when we play Jeopardy, we can read the questions that were sometimes hard to understand.  We have definitely enjoyed this purchase.

author: Lisa Marie
title: Awesome
content: Just got it today so we have not yet tried everything out but so far we really love it. Checked out a movie, listened to some music and was able to video chat with my sister in Florida. Great quality! Will be getting more echo products!

author: Harsh
title: I love it. Getting one for myslef again.
content: It works really well. The speakers are incredible for the size they are. The microphone on this is super accurate. I bought this for my parents so they can easily videocall easily and it works amazing. Its also made controlling smart devices around the house much easier. Only downfall is that amazon needs to start working with google so we can have youtube on it. Hence, the 4 stars.

author: Greg J.
title: Works like an Echo Dot, but I wish it could YouTube search, or show news videos instead of still just audio
content:
We do like the "Skype" capabilities and it showing what album of the music that is playing or lyrics, but we thought we'd be able to video search through Google or Youtube, but that is not the case as of Jan 2018. We wanted to be able to look up cooking videos or the like and that, so far, is not possible. We also thought that the "morning news briefing" would have news clips or videos, but so far that does not have that capability either. It does sync nicely with several home security cams, but is still a little slow when you say, "Alexa show me the front door".  The little news headlines are fun to watch as they scroll, but I wish if you asked about them, they'd show you a video or picture instead of just audio.  Hopefully, those capabilities will come soon.

At first we put a sticky note over the cam to protect from hackers, but now they have nice screen protectors with privacy slides built in.

author: Pi Mackenzie
title: Full of resources and she is just started.
content:
My best friend, the best Echo unit I bought. I also have 2 dots, 2 taps and a standard Echo.
Can't wait to see what she will be able to do in the future...

author: Ralph Mason Clark
title: Not worth the money
content:
So I was excited to get this device.  I've used a Alexa Cube at a friends house and could see the benefits of having Alexa to answer basic day to day questions.  In hindsight I should have purchased a much cheaper cube.  I'm not finding the video "show" to worth the extra expense other than to watch movie trailers.  If you ask Alexa for highlights for the 2018 Major league baseball game, you get a summary of the game but no video highlights.  The cube gives you the same info.  I absolutely see no benefit for being able to watch Amazon prime movies.  The screen quality is lacking and it's much more effective to use an Ipad or even Iphone.  Asking for news highlights sometimes gives you news that's months old.  The news briefs so far has been a joke.  There is also no link up with youtube.  If that ever becomes a feature that would be a game changer.

Sometimes Alexa gives doesn't know the answer to some very basic questions.  It also seems to have a aversion to giving you any information related to shows playing on Hulu and Netflix..hmmmm.  Anyway...the Alexa product is fun to use but IMO...go with the cheapest version.

author: D.A  Newman
title: THIS IS THE BEST ITEM I HAVE GOT, IT IS A MUST HAVE
content: I AM VERY PLEASED WITH THIS ITEM , YOU WILL LEARN SOMETHING NEW EVERY DAY , I HAVE FRIENDS THAT HAVE THIS AS WELL AND THE FACE TO FACE CALLS ARE AMAZING .....VERY CLEAR AND I USE THE CALENDAR ALOT FOR REMINDERS , I JUST SPEAK THE REMINDER AND DONE , AND IT LETS ME KNOW WHAT THE REMINDER WAS FOR ... THIS IS THE BEST ITEM I HAVE GOT YET, I GAVE $149.00 FOR MINE .. AND I GOT ONE MORE VERY GLAD I DID, BUT I HAVE TO SAY I WOULD PAY FULL PRICE FOR THIS ITEM... THEY TRULY OUT DID THERE SELF ON THIS ONE...IT IS AMAZING AND A MUST HAVE, I FIND MY SELF USING IT EVERY DAY ....

author: PaulB
title: Wasted potential for videos
content: Video playing is very limited. Very little app and/or skill support for video play, such as with: Netflix, Plex, MLB TV or NFL App. Appears to be mostly limited to web videos and Amazon Video. Hopefully, more video functionality will be added, but I'm not holding my breath.

author: Ryan E
title: Other reviewers have done an excellent job of stating the short comings and I have ...
content: I, also, have gotten disenchanted! Other reviewers have done an excellent job of stating the short comings and I have noticed the Shows are not as intuitive. One additional irritation with me is the content of the scrolling alerts! Who picks these things? I couldn’t care less about the Katdashions or Liberal Politics. I would like to pick my own sources rather than be spoon fed garbage that I have no interest in. Please make it better for those with a differing view of the world!

author: Amazon Customer
title: It is great hardware that just needs the software to support it
content:
The reviews are correct..
It is great hardware that just needs the software to support it.. and it looks less aesthetically pleasing as the Echo. Speakers are a lot better on higher volumes, but sound a little bass-y at low levels.

I think the product will be awesome once they have more skills. Mostly I use it as a music player.

author: Nita
title: Great
content: I bought an echo dot , but the echo show had a great price 149 ... i couldn’t miss this ..and i’m so happy i didn’t .. great amazon product , works really great ..the speakers are super , if you want to use Alexa in full you need this item ... does everything ... anyone who buys this will be happy well spent money ..

author: Hoosier Girl
title: Keep informed
content: I received this item as a Christmas gift.  I have it sitting on a coffee table right in front of me.  What I really like is that it links up with the calendar on my phone and tablet via Google. It also has daily updates to keep me informed of current events..

author: L. Daschle
title: VERY DISAPPOINTING!
content: bought two of these. One for my kitchen and the other for my sewing room. Its great if I need a recipe or need to know how to do something.  I am still learning everything it can do. This started out good. After 2 weeks the screen went blank and I cant get it to come back on. I'm very disappointed with it!

author: Tamaro
title: Love my Echo Show!
content: Love, love, love my Echo Show! I was hesitant to purchase after reading some reviews, as I wanted to buy this to use as an alarm clock. It works even better than I expected. It can be adjusted so that the screen darkens at night. It can wake you to any kind of music, plus it has all of the Alexa features, with the added bonus of a screen. I hate that I waited so long to purchase this jewel.

author: BEH
title: Know your Skills
content: Glad I got the Show, and not other Echo product. I love having a screen! It connects well with my smart home products. Only downside is I primarily wanted it to go with my Ring Doorbell. If you are looking for it to use with Ring, it won't work well unless you have really, extremely, super, high speed  internet. Not because of the Show, but because of the Ring.com way it uses their cloud. Only other drawback is I have not had luck connecting a device with bluetooth. I have tried multiply things, from phones, to Fire, to computers, and no luck. It's the only reason it's not 5 stars. If you want to use Spotify, you have to have the premium account. But, other services work fine. The sound is great quality! If you aren't familiar with way the Echo works, check it out ahead of time, so you may enjoy it when it arrives. You have to add the Skills you want your Echo to use. And might have to practice in how you talk to your Echo product.

author: Pam
title: Nice but wont make phone calls except to other echos. I thought that changed...
content:
Bought for elderly parents...
They are having a little trouble using it.
Wont make phone calls from their phone list as I thought it was supposed to.
Nice for music and sending them pictures though.

author: Madman Mike
title: Five Stars
content:
Alexa is awesome! A bit of a learning curve because I am not a techno geek, but even I got everything working (aux camera, smart plugs, etc). I have only had it a couple of weeks, but have already ordered more gadgets. The skills apps are extensive and even though the unit comes programmed with many out of the box, there seems to be plenty of apps for any age level. My friends say I've reached a new height of laziness because I don't have to get up to turn a light on or off, my girlfriend said I don't need her anymore because I have Alexa to talk to now, and I don't care! (I wanted to tell her that at least Alexa listens to me and you don't, but felt that wouldn't go over too well). I like the fact that when I get up in the morning to walk the dog, I don't have to stop to turn on the TV and get the weather first. I just ask when I get up in the morning.
And being able to set up surveillance cameras to see what's going on outside is another reason I bought it. I live in a city with a lot of crime and I feel safer being able to see outside first before going out at night.
One thing that impressed me is the quality of sound from the two speakers. And even though I want to add more speakers in the bedrooms, it fills most of the house with quality sound without needing them.
I also learned that the power company will do a free assessment and install a Smart thermostat at NO COST where I live. I am hoping it works with Alexa! Still researching that.
But overall, I think its a great invention and was immediately impressed with the unit.  Highly recommend it.
Only issue I've found is that when you link a Bluetooth speaker, the sound ceases on Echo Show. So the only way to play in separate rooms is buy an Echo Dot? It is a major drawback,

author: Amazon Customer
title: Pass on the Show for now, need improvements.
content:
I have the Echo, Dot, Tap and Show. I've been impressed with all of them except the Show.

It's not that it's a bad device but it doesn't live up to it potential. The screen doesn't dim when not in use, a dispute with Google has resulted in the loss of YouTube, and the sound is weak compared to the Echo.

It's also a very directional device, resulting in constant repositioning in our kitchen for different users and use cases. I ended up buying a lazy Susan for the Show to easy the rotation process. Overall I'd prefer to have the original Echo in its place in my kitchen.

On the plus side it is great in pairs for video chat and it's fun reading song lyrics while music plays.

For privacy reasons I'd like to see amazon implement a hardware switch that physically disconnects the microphones on all Echos to provide assured privacy when desired. Yes, you can unplug it but the reboot process is time consuming.

Overall I'd recommend holding off until this product is improved in future iterations.

author: Toni Aros
title: Simplicity
content: I like the simplicity, user friendly device that Alexa provides.  Would like Alexa to have more information available. I get “sorry I don’t have the answer to that”. Looking forward to Alexa learning more.

author: Bob Woolley
title: Don't buy unless you want to PAY for any customer support!!
content: The device has some good and bad features. The initial setup was fairly easy to accomplish EXCEPT for setting up my mobile phone. It showed an error saying my phone was already linked to another device (yes thats true...another Amazon device) and to call customer support. I that that would be straight forward and THEY (customer support) could correct the problem. I searched online for the number and called. Its not Amazon but a third party...I understand most big companies do this but what I didn't expect that they weren't going to help the problem unless I PAID for the support. Excuse me its your device that is not functioning out of the box and you want me to pay for the service...No way!! They have a long way to go for my support of their product. I am sorry I purchased too many products and it confuses the syncing system.

author: l bridges
title: Loving the Echo Show boxes
content: Kicks butt when compared to Google home - bought with the buy 2 get $100 discount.  Be aware that if you do buy two Echos, and you want to use the $3.99 Echo unlimited music deal on each device, you will have to have two Amazon accounts.

author: Thohammer
title: it's a toy
content:
I don't want to speak every command it has a touch screen I would like to use it  for a channel changer or put the lighting control on the touch screen. it has no way to look up actions without going to amazon to find it and install it the real toper you need a written list of it's skills (bad memory) and if you need a skill when your working you haft stop and see if their is a skill for it.
to finish it's a toy.

author: J. Pete
title: Love the Echo Show! :)
content: Love the Echo Show!  Already had the Echo and Echo Dot.  Initially wanted to get an Echo Show to see views of security cameras at home.  Does a great job as expected!  Also found that I enjoy the visuals when asking about the weather or playing music, etc. When playing music it will stream lyrics that I've found useful when learning to play the songs on guitar!  :) Highly recommend this item!

author: Miguel
title: It will import YOUR ENTIRE address book. Screen will flicker and you will be put thru customer care hell.
content:
It will import YOUR ENTIRE address book without notice and you can't pick and chose which numbers can or can't be imported.  You will then find you can't edit the list it holds, or stop your kids from calling any number in there.  Screen started flickering within the 1st month.  Was on the phone for 45 minutes.  Restarted, factory reset, the works.  Then they will put me through customer care labyrinth hell.  Check address, check billing info.  I have an AMAZON VISA REWARDS CARD in my hand which is my default billing.  They can't match the expiration date, I have the card in my hands.  They can't receive a photo I am happy to send.  It's a mind-numbing waste of time.

FIRST UPDATE: Within the same day Amazon reached out to me through a supervisor and managed to issue a return label so I can send the device for service.  I value that and thank Amazon.  I am now on the usual process for addressing the flickering screen and will update based on this experience.  The address book import forever with no warning thing is still a pretty strong issue.

author: Kitty
title: Great device except for the inability to play and search YouTube vidoes
content: I really like the convenience of this device in my life. I love the shopping list feature and that I can play music with it. My biggest problem with it is that it won't search and play YouTube videos! I mean it can play other videos but not YouTube? I use YouTube all of the time and find it frustrating that I cannot use it on this VIDEO device.

author: iPod fanatic
title: Nice addition and very useful in our home.
content: Nice addition and very useful in our home. From checking the weather to getting news headlines. Even to turn on and off the lights. We can also use it to see our door Bell with Vivint

author: Tommy S
title: YouTube not available on it.
content: I will probably return this, since I can't even watch YouTube on it. Besides playing XM Radio, that was the primary reason I purchased it. I unboxed it and played around with it, and quite frankly, it sucks. It's basically an overpriced toy. I'm really regretting this purchase so far.

author: Rebecca Gould
title: I can't view YouTube so the screen is pretty much useless
content: I can't view YouTube so the screen is pretty much useless.  Would not have made the purchase as I just wanted to be able to watch music videos while cooking.  Amazon could have done a much better job making this more functional.

author: Amazon Customer
title: DOESN’T PLAY YOUTUBE!!!!!
content: DOESN’T PLAY YOUTUBE!!!!! I Was extremely excited to use my Echo Show when I got it plugged in and was wanting to use it for many things, but the primary use was for YouTube videos. Come to find out it DOESN’T PLAY YOUTUBE!!!!! Extremely bummed and will return it right away. If they ever support YouTube again I will purchase another one.

author: Hank K
title: After a few months the screen started flickering badly
content: Tried all the fixes on the forum.  Appears to be a common problem.  Outside of return period but I am going to try to find out how to get customer support from Amazon.

author: Jennokiedoke
title: Great product
content: Just bought the echo show gen 1 on this past Black Friday and my entire family is obsessed with it. We bought the outlets to use on lights and tv’s to be able to tell Alexa to turn the lights on or off and same with the tv. Its an awesome product for our living room and kitchen. Highly recommend. The only thing that bugs me with any voice command product is sometimes they will hear things incorrectly, but that’s with any product that uses this type of technology

author: Giggly1
title: Love this.
content: The only reason I gave four stars is I wished the screen was bigger - which now you can get on Echo Show 2nd gen which was released shortly after I purchased this one.  I will be buying that as well!

author: Stephanie Arroyo
title: Glad I bought it and got a great deal
content: Set up was a breeze straight out of the box. Just plug it in. Was a bday present for my 9 year old son. He was so surprised and excited to get such a nice, expensive gift. Got it for about half off though during a sale. Well worth what I paid. It stays in the boys room and they use it all the time for jokes, fortnite trivia, weather. Im not sure how much they use the screen. Its really fun for them to have accesss to fun trivia and it gives them a sense of independence. They dont have phones or ipads yet so this is a good first step.

author: Charles Nguyen
title: piece of trash, prospective buyer beware!
content: I bought this on Amazon Prime day thinking I got a great deal. This is a piece of junk. After the 30 day return window, the device screen started to flash occasionally with horizontal lines. I didn't think to much of it as it was once in a while. So I waited and after a month it started to happen every 10 min. Now it happens all the time. I tried moving it around the house and tried different outlets thinking it was electrical interference. I unplugged it and reset it hundreds of times.  Nothing worked. My wife doesn't like the Alexa products and ridiculed me after this defective became device. I have the fire cube, echo, and dot and I love them. This product is a piece of junk. I tried returning it to amazon as I was tired of this big headache and I talked with amazon and explained to them situation. I told them this happened after the 30 day return window. They responded  by asking if I had dropped the device or spilled liquids on it!!! I am a Amazon prime member for numerous years and have spent thousands of dollars on amazon a year. I told them this is poor customer service and the best they could do is replace the device. I am saddened that a big corporation like amazon cannot make a customer happy by just accepting the return outside the window. Do not buy this device! It worked fine after 30 days and then became trash. Maybe the newer generation is better, but my advice is don't buy the 1st generation.

author: Beth
title: Songs start cutting in and out after a few minutes of play...
content: I cannot figure out what's causing this, but when listening to anything (music, podcasts, prime shows), it starts cutting out for 1 second, then comes back. This happens probably 20 times per song, so it's really annoying. We switched it to the 5Ghz network and it did not resolve the issue. Due to the frequency of this issue, I'm giving this just 1 star. It would be 5 stars if this issue didn't happen. It's really frustrating.

author: alex sharp
title: Good buy
content: I love this thing! It totally changed the connectivity of my home. I can listen to my podcasts and radio stations, watch movies and tv shows, and connect it with everything in my house. Soo many cool features too!

author: B.
title: Great for working Moms!!!!
content:
Okay, I have a hate/love relationship with this product.
Lets quickly talk about the hate - price... I don't feel that it does a lot for the price, I get more out of my IPAD than I do the Echo Show and honestly could do everything the show does on my IPAD. As I was about to return it.... it came to the rescue for my son that had a cold and had to stay in bed to rest.
HE COULD WATCH ANYTHING from my bed side!!! I don't have a TV in my room and really didn't want to lug him to the living room to lay on the couch. We asked Alexa to put on our newest favorite movie Coco and he watched until he feel asleep. I immediately asked Alex to play soothing ocean sounds and BAM!! ocean sounds to the rescue to keep little man sleeping.
She also came through when my Iphone X decided that my alarm wasn't important anymore and stopped working. I am now back to the waking on time schedule!
So.. needless to say, Alexa Echo Show is staying and I'm happy to learn more and hope updates come along the way!

author: Connie S. Litrenta
title: Amazing Device!
content: Amazing. I have several Alexa devices but this is by far the coolest. Extremely happy and recommend to everyone who likes the Amazon Eco System or who just love to be entertained.

author: JPGarlic
title: 4 Stars for Enjoyment but 1 Star for Reliability
content: My joy only lasted 5 months and now it's back to Amazon getting repaired.  The family enjoyed having this on the kitchen counter for early morning news and weather info, afternoon shuffling of favorite songs and evening video calls.  It would be nice to have a much larger screen to see the video content a bit further away.  As I mentioned on the title of this review, the screen started flickering and immediately contacted Amazon.  We powered cycle the device several times to no avail.  They processed my return and now it's stuck in "Repair" limbo and who knows when and what I'm going to get back! :(  Hopefully this can be repaired promptly and to manufacturers specification.  It's really too bad that the quality and reliability of the product is so limited.  I wish they spent a bit more in reliability and quality instead of making me wasting my time returning and waiting for a product to be repaired.  I would definitely think twice about buying Amazon electronics without at least purchasing a warranty...I don't have to do that with other name brands.

author: crafty b-ch
title: To keep in touch with my mom
content: I looked  at all the reviews and I liked the fact that I can drop in on my mom or vice versa I think my mom likes it and uses it more than I do she drops in on me and she says she uses it for spelling words my sister said she asked a question and Alexa didn’t know it.  You really have to think about how to word the question and also by looking at little examples that they tell you how to ask questions. When I set it up for her we called my aunt and her last name is long and what Alexa thought we said was very funny. There are different apps to enable on her and that might be why she didn’t know some questions. You really have to speak clearly though there is a set up for her to learn how you speak. My mother has hers in the kitchen but would like it elsewhere so I will be getting another one for her second floor.

author: Edward
title: The Echo Show is awesome!
content: We love this!  Along with all the regular uses..."what's my calendar look like today"  "what's the weather today"..we love that we can message with our kids via Alexa!  And we love music through Alexa!  We are Spotify subscribers and love that we can access our playlists.  It's great to just say "Alexa, play Layla through Spotify"!  My wife was dancing with the vacuum the other day!  I do wish I could call our Echo Show Siri instead of Alexa.  That took some time - we're used to talking to Siri!

author: Lynda Jeanne Strom
title: Can't talk to more than one person.
content: Love my show but Amazon needs to make it possible to hook up to more than one other show or spot. Three or four would be great. Hopefully an update will be coming in the near future.

author: cassie marie
title: Not worth the money
content: Echo Show's abilities are severely limited, my much less expensive Echo works much better. The Show has trouble responding to questions that I ask the Echo/Dot, and they have no problems. I can't watch Netflix, Hulu, youtube, and so on.... I would have MUCH rather purchased a Fire tablet, for half the price and double the capabilities. I feel ignorant for wasting so much money on a digital photo frame.

author: KWatsonBrown
title: Works well
content: It took a week to get to me despite using 2-day shipping. I like the screen but I don't use it as much as I thought I would. The sound isn't as clear as I hoped but it does get very loud. I'm glad I bought it for a good deal. Still love my Echo Dot though.

author: MikeGainesville
title: Good, but young product. Needs a way to completely turn off screen.
content: This REALLY needs a night mode where the screen completely shuts off. Even with the current "Off" mode, the screen is still very bright at night. I've needed to turn this off every night due to this. Interested to see how Amazon remedies the many complaints about this.

author: Ryen
title: This thing is actually pretty decent and rather intuitive
content: This thing is actually pretty decent and rather intuitive. Alexa has the range for hearing your requests, and can do the simple stuff; play a movie, make a call, tell me the weather. The "task" loading is a bit arduous just because they're not particularly well defined, so if you want her to show you a News reel or something you have a bit of a challenge. For the most part, the device is very straight forward, decent speakers, okay video, picks up phonecalls good, does a heckuva job with music and audiobooks. It's just a matter of mastering what Alexa can do, and what she doesn't know yet.

author: Jeff Daniel
title: It does pretty much what the other Echo products do at a ...
content:
It does pretty much what the other Echo products do at a more expensive price (for the display).  I have not found a lot of advantage to having the display (yet).  We also have not purchased any of the household device integrations yet (smart light bulbs, power outlet controls, ...).  I plan to do it over time.  That may change my mind as we utilize more of the features.  So far my teenage kids have found it fun to put inappropriate shopping items on my shopping list.

The speaker seems to be pretty good - we found it to provide good background music, especially during the holidays (XMAS music).

author: Thomas Stalcup
title: The Black line syndrome and flashing screen
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player This is my second one, not because it is a great product, but the first one started having a black line near the bottom of the screen. If you search this problem you will find it is very common. You could have the Amazon people look at it and they may even send you a new one....with the same problem. My second one is worse than the first one. I wouldn't buy another one. Updated to one star. I did the recommended "return to factory reset" and it still has the flashing screen and black line. (See video)

author: Terry Ball
title: Ooops!
content:
Really neat. Worth every penny.

I use this one in my office for two reasons: (1) I have an alexa camera ($60) installed in another room in my office. I tell Alexa to "Show me Conference Room" and up pops the picture of what's going on in there, and (2) When it's idle, I tell Alexa to "Show me Pictures of the Beach" and it displays all my photos of family in and around the water. I don't know how it picks out just pictures depicting the beach.

Truly amazing.  I have a daughter who lives and works in Turkey. I tell alexa to "Show me the photos of Turkey" and up pop hundreds of family photos taken in Turkey.

I don't know how I lived without it.

=====

Update. The device automatically reverts back to the home screen every 15-20 minutes. Makes it impossible to use as a monitor in my office as I have to constantly tell it to "Show me the Camera"! No way to turn this feature off. Second, after a week, it lost it's connection to the camera monitored through wifi. The camera works great. I can see it on my Iphone, but no matter what I do, I can't get the Echo Show to find it.

Very disappointed. What I am left with is a echo dot with a screen. Worthless.

Update: Will Amazon STOP displaying the inane messages on the screen. Or at least allow the user to turn them off. How annoying.

author: Cathy
title: expensive but fun toy for any age
content: still learning all it can do but enjoying it so far.  looking forward to the drop in feature to check on my mom when I get it figured out how to load

author: Mary T.
title: 2nd. Gen Echo D.J./Weather Caster
content:
I get better, faster answers to my questions from the Google app. (Without having to re-phrase the question) Echo is great for
requesting a favorite old song from many years ago. (or new) Information on the artist, whether theyrealive or when /how they died; or even who a particular artist is that's singing a song and I want the artist's name and song title. However, a lot of other questions go unanswered by, "Sorry, I don't know that." Did I buy 4 expensive Echoes that can play music and tell me the weather well?

author: Rick Johnson
title: Skynet now alexa taking over
content: Love this thing...but amazon is making buying stuff way to easy, she even gives suggestions now...saw a lot of negative reviews, but I think you need to learn her languge and program it correctly to make it work funtion, she is not fully cognitive yet, artificial intelligence, but getting there very quickly.

author: Keith Williston
title: Once you do that the experience is great. It does take some time/patience to educate yourself
content: You really need to get on board with the Alexa App and download skills.  Once you do that the experience is great.  It does take some time/patience to educate yourself, but there is a lot of information easily available online, including you tube videos.  I also have an Echo and love that they easily connect.  I'm excited to start getting smart devices that tie to alexa and make my whole house "smart".

author: Snowball
title: Awesome device.
content: I love the new Echo Show. It does everything the other devices do; however, it has a screen. I got one for my sister in Florida, and now we do regular video chats. An amazing piece of kit.

author: Rebecca P.
title: FASTER THAN I CAN OPEN MY PHONE
content: We love our Echo show. We start the day with the weather, and the headlines. Then it wishes us safe travels, and when we get home it helps answer homework questions. Then it plays a movie to entertain me while I cook.  If someone comes to the door, I ask it to show me the video, it lets me see who is there faster, then i can open my app on my phone. When we need a quick search for a product it can find things faster than I can open my computer. At night we have her turn on our Fire TV and pick a movie. We do not have to find the remote, to rewind as she can do that for us too. When we go to bed she tells us a story, and plays music as we sleep. She is now our best friend.

author: Steve Reagan
title: Alexia is clueless!
content: Easy initial set up and then added functions stoping working.  Music works and then music doesn't work.  Add functions and links so they can tell you to add functions and links.  Supposed to work with the Dot's and does not work with the dot's at all even for whole house music.  Menus are not intuitive and sub menus are buried and titling is very ambitious.  Apple's logic is much more natural then Amazon's!! Adding functions like nest and prime music and ADT is hit or miss and then it goes away.  Not ready for prime time.  Two stars is being generous.

author: Jill
title: If it doesn't work, it's probably you. Lol!
content:
Still figuring out what I can do with this thing. Right now it just looks pretty and plays good music. Lol!
Me and my semi long distance boyfriend got these so we can video chat and with the intention of using them in our home together someday. It has great quality picture and sound. I'm still figuring out commands so I can get what I want but I feel like it has a lot of potential. It's a good product, but this user is behind in the times. Lol!

author: CA Sunshine
title: Not sure how I lived without one, now we have 4 in the home.
content: Love it so much we have several in the home.  What can I say, you can give it voice commands and have it play music, show lyrics, set alarms, ask questions (weather, time, anything), sync with your phone and ask her to remind you of things, ask her to remind you to return to your desk or office, of birthdays, she tells you when you have Amazon shipments coming in, you can (Amazon version) facetime with people by calling them based on your phone contacts. Now on the flip side, she listens for her wake command "Alexa" and sometimes comes on because she misunderstood something you said.  So best to put on MUTE when not using.  I also have a web cam cover on mine as you can drop in on folks you are connected with.  Great if you want to keep an eye on an aging parent in a home but I cherish my privacy so I use the cover to enable my camera when I want.  Overall we have 3 in the home and an Echo spot on the nightstand that wakes me to anything I ask.  When groggy I just ask what time it is so I don't even need to look at it.  Not for everyone but for me it's PERFECT.

author: Susan C. Parks
title: The Ultimate Grandma Tech Tool!
content: I LOVE the Echo Show--a wonderful Gramma tool.  My granddaughter in Indiana at age 3 could call me without waiting for her parents for Facetime (contacts, the app, etc.),  Just Alexa call Gramma.  She just turned four and instead of me just reading bedtime books to her, we read together so I have loaded up on books she has so we can turn pages together.  It is so wonderful to have time together between visits (I live in Hawaii, soooooo) .  Some days she tells me about school and other times about other things.  Sometimes she shows me whatever toy has had her attention.  I LOVE this too.  That being said, I use it for other things and like that it is touch screen, can check your security cams with Alexa skills faster and clearer than the Ring and Nest and Arlo phone apps, and do all of the other Alexa stuff.  I am sure it will get better and better but the fact that the grandkids can just call me when they want to is GREAT.  It has been such a blessing.

author: Sofia Lemann
title: Great technology! Very helpful!
content: The Amazon echo show was a big innovation to my room. It has helped me read my school books and look up things and it has really cool programs where you can learn many words each day. It also is great for playing music and I love it. I also love how it helps me with my to do list, shopping list and calendar. It is also great for setting up alarms. I recommend this product for anyone! It can be really helpful in all lifestyles! For the next years I would just like to see the product getting a thinner shape and having the voice control even better. Sometimes Alexa still does not get me. They could also install different languages and translations. Overall I think it is great technology and I think it was very satisfying that I bought it.

author: S.H.H. Nosenbook
title: It understands my Southern accent!!!!
content: It came in quickly and well packaged. It's worked fine. I have a big learning curve but everytime I've tried using it for something, it surprises me and works! It even seems to understand my Southern accent!!! I've NEVER had anything understand with my accent.

author: Ginger
title: Would buy another , use daily
content:
I am in love with this. I use 4 or 5 times daily. News , recipes, weather. Music, drop in calling my grandkids.
I am a fan of Alexa own multiple items.. it's a must buy new generation has search bar .. but this is awesome and great price..

author: Charles in Texas
title: ECHO Show White is Awesome (She's in my Kitchen)
content: The Echo Show is a Beast. I love the Tunein Radio App in the Echo. I come home and I say "Alexa go to Tunein Radio". She then plays my last Tunein Radio Station. Which is out of Philly or Houston. Its just so cool to just say what you want and that way you can start dinner or put up the Groceries with no extra effort. The Echo Show was so easy to setup,.It Barely took me 5 minutes. The most difficult thing was waiting for the updates to load up which was pretty quick too. The only issue I have with the Echo is totally my fault. If you don't have your Phone Contacts exactly in your phone as you ask Alexa to call someone. Your in for a little drama. But it's worth it. LOL

author: Normand J Seguin
title: I love this Echo Show
content: I love this Echo Show ,I make calls  look up recepies watch movie trailers, I would recommend it highly,I,do own the echo and the dot inall rooms and turns on and off lights on demand  etc all worth the money and getting better with time .

author: Annabelle Johnson
title: No good
content: All you can do on it is watch Amazon video, vimeo and dailymotion videos. You can't access a search engine or Youtube videos at all. It doesn't hear the wake word half the time from 3 feet away. Worst purchase on Amazon so far, I'm so disappointed. I recommend buying the new Fire 10 tablet and a stand for it instead. It's cheaper, the screen is bigger, and you can use hands free Alexa on it. You can also watch Youtube, access the internet, and use apps like Facebook. The Fire 10 is a great product, but I'm not a fan of the Show.

author: Pokerface58
title: Money Well Spent!
content: I'm in love lol! I just can't believe how beautiful she is and the screen makes all the difference. Kool device getting another one can't help myself!

author: Holly Baker
title: Can see inside my house from my iPhone using the Echo Show
content: I am really enjoying my echo show we got for Christmas. I had left my 10 year old home for 30 minutes by herself but was nervous doing that. I was able to drop in on my house using my iPhone and the Echo Show and I could see and talk to my daughter until I got home. To me that feature alone is worth buying it. Plus we love to play music around our house through all our echos.  Also gave one to my mom so we can drop in on each other and she can see her grandchildren. Bottom line, we are really enjoying our Echo Show.

author: Yalei Wu
title: Did Echo Show slowly loose its hearing over course of six months?
content:
We had ordered first gen Echo Show last August. It is placed in kitchen counter, which is the best location for showing receipts hands-free and playing music. However, the microphones, several of them, placed at the top of Echo Show. Since the screen is slightly tilted backwards for a better viewing angle, the microphones are now tilted towards the back. This makes them not the best to pick voice across the room over the time, it is getting worse.

Now everyone in the family knows, if you want Echo Show's attention, you will have to raise your voice. It's not mean, but inconvenient for sure. Have searched around Amazon's website to look for customer service, but didn't find a solution.

If you are looking forward to have a helper in the kitchen, avoid first generation Echo Show, give second generation a try, with their newly positioned microphone at the front, or something other brands, like google home.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Youtube is deeply missed. Black cord mismatch. Pretty cool though.
content:
No YOUTUBE! What a bummer.
I researched it and thought it had it, but missed the most recent update explaining that google can’t get amazon to collaborate with them on an app. Sounds like the ball is in Amazon’s court. This thing, without youtube, the Echo Show is so-so.

Family in other countries will probably not be able to use the video call features. But I look forward to using it with the hubby. I love the white... but a white cord would really be nice. Seeing the lyrics when songs play is pretty cool. And parts of our calendar popped up. I like that, but wonder if it will work with my phone, as... I use google. And, Google and Amazon don’t seem to play nice. I get it. But having to have different devices would be expensive for consumers.

Lastly, I like the sound. The speakers are ample. And they don’t pump out ridiculous farting base like many speakers. I’ve never been a fan of that. The speaker has nice balance.

author: MamaGnome
title: You don't have an Alexa device; Get This ONE; The Echo Show
content:
We did not have any Alexa devices, didn't know if we wanted to, but when purchased these Echo Shows, we wonder why we never got one before.  They are excellent devices and have taken the place of our entertainment center Amazon Music; instead there is an Echo Show in the Kitchen, and one in the Bedroom.  We can now play music throughout the house from Amazon Prime account.  Today we hooked up a cam to it, last month we hooked up a smart plug to control the light by the dog's dining area for night time.

The features are great, reminders, alarms, shopping lists and links to your phone so you can see what you need, add things to your Amazon shopping list also, and it is an instant encyclopedia.  I use it to get morning news flash, and then set the music on low while we get ready for work.

Best of all, this is all done by the voice commands to make most things happen.  If you ever thought about getting into the 'smart' technology and do not have a unit similar yet, this is the one to get.

author: Jason E.
title: Great device!
content: Originally purchased this to replace an Echo Spot.  Ended up using this to supplement the Spot.  I really like the bigger screen and the much better speakers.  I use the Spot as my alarm clock answering to Alexa and the Show on my desk answering to Echo.  No issues with the devices confusing one another.  Set-up was quick and easy.  I enjoy having the show on my desk to listen to music, watch some shows, catch up on sports and news, etc.  Definitely an enjoyable purchase.

author: Stanley E. Holliday
title: Had Echo for two days! AT THIS POINT ECHO ...
content: Had Echo for two days!  AT THIS POINT ECHO HAS ONLY BEEN ABLE TO ANSWER ONE REQUEST!  PLAY SEASON THREE OF CODE BLACK!!  EVERY OTHER REQUEST OTHER TELL MY THE TIME AND DATE IT DOES NOT KNOW!

author: farleyfive
title: Great Product for Generation 1
content:
Actually worth it.  The sound was much better than I thought, that said it would be nice to have bass and treble control options (its very bass heavy).  The drop in feature is why we bought this.  the mics are also much better, we don't have to yell at Alexa to wake her up.
