Next gen I would like to see Bass/Treble options, additional wake up names, and Zoom Camera options to check in on our dogs.

author: Marky Mark
title: The best digital assistant so far
content: I was debating on getting Echo and Google home. Ended up getting the show version since i have an Ezviz cam setup that is compatible with the show. Alexa can do a lot via skill installed. Lights on with my TP Link bulbs and switches. Power on with Elekcity plugs. It's fun listening to music with it ad the lyrics when available will appear on the echo show screen. However i wish there was a bigger selection. At times the music i want is not available on prime or i have to purchase prime unlimited. Tv integration would be nice, like add a HDMI it out port on the ver. 2

author: Stormy
title: Disappointing
content: Really disappointing . Screen quality not very good, connection not good.  It is nice to ask things when you want to know it or have it play music.  It will change channels on tv if you are on dish, but won't show guide or turn it on or off.  Very limited use, so keep your remote.. I would not buy again.

author: Kitkat
title: Alexa does it all!
content: I love this!  It has a constant time and temperature reading.  It constantly gives you ideas to ask Alexa.  She’s easy to read.  Easy to talk to, and she wakes me up at 5:40am to music from the 80’s.  I still haven’t used  all of her abilities but I’ m looking forward to learning more.  She is awesome and worth every dollar.

author: Bonnie
title: It has been fun to learn new things using Echo Show
content: It has been fun to learn new things using Echo Show.  Asking for recipes with multiple matches.  Playing music, playing jeopardy and being introduced to many new subjects.  But sometimes she’ll start responding on her own and won’t know the answers to questions asked,  Touch screen works well and displays are good. Has been a god addition to the echo family in my home!

author: Debbie
title: After months of researching and deciding, on Prime day we bought 2 Echo Shows.
content: I am a huge fan of technology and Amazon.  Our mother lives in a group home and we thought the Echo Show would be the most awesome thing since email!!!!  I chatted with 3 different Amazon support reps and read as many reviews as I could.  No one ever mentioned you need a phone to use the Echo Show.  We wanted to give this to the home so all of the families would be able to enjoy video chats.  It is now 2 months after Prime Day and we are finally returning this Echo Show.  I chatted before and after with several reps making sure this would work the way we wanted.  First I connected it to my account and phone.  The problem there was every single one of my contacts were in the contacts of Mom's Echo.  I didn't want anyone having my personal and professional contacts so I was told I needed a different Amazon account for Mom's Echo.  OK, that done we still couldn't add any contacts, play full songs, or anything else.  Finally yesterday we called Amazon and spoke with Andy.  He was the first and only person to tell us that we needed to have a phone with no contacts in order to use it as we wanted.  I should of found this out the first or at very latest the second time I asked.  I was always very clear about what we wanted to do and it took all this time and frustration in order to find out we can't use it the way we wanted.  So no video chats with our Mom or anyone in the home.  Andy was very helpful and set it up for us to return one Echo Show and gave me $15 additional credit for all of our frustration and wasted time!!!  We love our Echo Show and purchased 2 more to go around the house.  I warn everyone before buying any of these devices make sure you have a phone to attach it to!!!!  My other reviews of our other devices are 99% awesome!!!!  Amazon I am so disappointed in the support I received, the credit given, and all of the frustration and wasted time.  I don't know if I will ever go back to being the 100% happy Amazon shopper and supporter.

author: Erica A.
title: I know, I know! No YouTube BUT....
content: I really do dig this little device! I know it’s more expensive than the rest of the amazon smart home devices & it doesn’t play YouTube any longer BUT... I really like having this around! I’m not nuts about the design( I think they could’ve gone a bit more futuristic or funky with the design like it’s little sis, the amazon dot. I believe it has better microphones for  listening & finds info easier than the (no screen device) echo does. I really do like that you can see & read what Alexa is saying on the screen & see the weather as she is giving it to you. The YouTube thing( I hope) is just a hiccup for a bit while they sort their differences out( between amazon & google) & it returns back to the amazon show. But for the time being... I’ll watch news, weather & play games on it till then. Some of the apps I believe slow the device down but since I’ve powered it down & back up its worked quicker since I’ve put the apps on it that slowed it down to begin with. I like it and recommend it. So.... COME ON AMAZON & GOOGLE... GET THOSE DIFFERENCES WORKED OUT SO WE CAN HAVE YOUTUBE BACK ON THE DEVICE! Or I’m afraid Google will ultimately win this battle with their future products especially since YouTube is such a big deal on these devices! Amazon needs to think about that hard before they keep this argument going! **My thoughts on the subject

author: T. J.
title: Wonderful!
content: Wasn't sure about getting this, but decided to try it.  I love it!  Don't even know what all it can do yet, but really enjoy it.  Hubby has my original Echo and he is getting used to that.  Like the reminder feature, the calendar and the grocery list.  Love being able to get weather, traffic and play music.  Highly recommend to anyone wanting to get organized and make life easier.

author: DW
title: Absolutely love them!
content:
We have 3 Shows in our house. My husband can’t work a computer and can’t type, so he loves being able to talk to Alexa to get information. I ordered lots of AudioBooks for him which he listens to every night. I even bought him a Sling so he can have Alexa outside with him while he works.

We also use them as intercoms, as you’re able to connect through each one to talk to another. And I got one for my daughter so she can video call here from her house (I even get to see and talk to her dog LOL).

Complete voice control over volume. And we got the Hue light bulbs so we control all our lights with voice. We get weather and news whenever we want and plenty of music. I’ve even figured out how to put my own music on them (from various sources).

My nephew comes over and loves the available games. I’m thinking of getting him one so he can call me through video. I even set it up so it turns our tv on and off, when necessary. Being able to view my calendar events is nice too.

Setting an alarm by voice command is so easy. I had a problem once on it showing ALL our AudioBooks and the developers went to work on the problem and got it fixed, so I’m very happy with their response to issues.

There is some basic setup necessary through the app. I’m computer savvy so I have no problems setting up tech items. Perhaps those who gave bad reviews have not fully set up the Echo to do all it is capable of doing, as I don’t get how you can give this item a bad review.

All in all, we adore our Shows, Sling, Hue Lights, etc. They’re constantly updating them. Keep the advances coming!! I’ll keep buying! 😊😊😊

author: mary e.
title: great speakers for sound,nice size screen
content: This product is definitely a winner,I love the fact that I can listen to music, get recipes,watch videos very quickly by just asking Alexa to get them for me. Nice size screen, great speakers. All and all everything I expected.I love the fact that if someone you know has one, you can video chat

author: lmontan
title: I got this for YouTube and is not longer working ...
content: I got this for YouTube and is not longer working with the services (I don't care the issues Amazon have with Google) it was advertise to work!! with YouTube.

author: RLM AZ
title: Doesn't dim enough at night!  Otherwise very nice.
content:
Nice unit, easy to see and read.  Like being able to see short videos regarding news and other stuff.  Not for watching movies on such a small screen - at least for me.  Easy setup.  However, I already had one of the first units that they made which made things very simple.

You can ask Alexa to turn off the screen at night if the light is too bright - but then the clock goes away - but the screen will go dark.

author: Carol11944
title: Don't need to be internet whiz to use.
content: I love the Echo Show.  I now own 2 one in kitchen one in living room.  Overall it is really easy to use.  Occasionally I have difficulty asking question correctly to get answer and I need  to re-pharse.  for answer or response. Having 2 makes it easier since I love being able to call family and having a video call. I also used at Christmas Eve dinner to let everyone know food was ready and they should come to kitchen now. I am not a expert at internet connections but I am able to figure out most things I want to use.  .The children and grand children were impressed that I could use as drop in from room to room.  Makes my life easier,

author: Sarah Thompson
title: Highly recommend, I actually want more!
content: Love it, love it! I got two of these, one for my house and the other for my parents. We video chat almost daily. I use the music and video features daily. We are already over the novelty of most of the games but I love having weather and news updates. Alexa doesn't always understand me but she's learning.

author: Vic Tchapari
title: Bad Speaker
content: I like it, perfect for me as a wake up Alarm, the big down side is the Speakers are very bad, I can't enjoy listing music on it, horrible, need improvement in understanding command, every time I said Master Bedroom ON, keep telling me about the weather, I did not ask the weather I ask to turn the Lights ON, But keep giving me the weather, Thanks

author: William S.
title: Anything and everything is important to know when you choose to purchase electronics such as these .
content: The Echo Show will be on my gift list from the first one that i ordered in February for  my sisters birthday till next year my goal  will be to make  the  Echo Show a gift 🎁 my entire family .This means a purchase for at least twenty of them . The  Echo that I received on Saturday afternoon is for my MOTHER for Mothers Day 2018 !Cheers.  The only thing I don't like is that it should be equipped with accessories . I'm praying that the unit itself will not be changed until  maybe 2020.????

author: Stormy
title: Very useful
content: I love this product but I'm upset that it has gone down in price so much already after owning only a few weeks.

author: Larry F.
title: Save your dollars— too many issues
content:
I want to like it— love my echo dots, but I cannot.

I purchased the show so that I can view who is at my door through my Ring doorbell.  All is set up, and was working.  Then when I need it, every time, Alexa thinks and thinks and then says,  hmm it’s seems that isn’t working right now.

Also, voice recognition is pathetic.  I can stand in front of my show and say “Alexa” and one of my other devices will respond from another room while the show sits there looking pretty, flashing it’s ads, never even recognizing I am in the house.

Save your money.

author: Joe
title: Echo Show works well
content:
The item does what it is supposed to do but would love to see a little more sophisticated model.
HD Screen
Adjustable angle
Way to move the inset image or perhaps a small 2" screen somewhere else on the unit so it does not interfere with the full image when video calling
Rechargeable battery so it could be moved to different areas for video and audio calls
LIttle sleeker and thinner design

author: FARmom2B
title: Love my Echo Show
content: Just set up my Echo Show and having a blast.  This is a great device and so easy to use.  It can answer any questions, tons of music and the trivia questions are fun.

author: Milagros Cuellar
title: Love ❤️ your show
content:
Nice on your night stand it’s very nice looking you could glance at the time or ask Alexa
It dims at night so brightens doesn’t annoy you you can listen to music 🎶 news watch prime movies 🎥 and videos on cooking etc yes I do love 💕 my echo show

author: Dan
title: great addition to the Alexa family
content: I've gotten hooked on Alexa and this version with the screen is great!  Great sound to boot!  The only questionable thing is the screen likes to be on all the time.  You can tell it to turn off but it eventually comes back on.  There doesn't seem to be a way to keep it off so probably not a good choice for a bedroom.  I'm still trying to figure out the algorithm.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Set up was super easy, but I really dislike this
content: Set up was super easy, but I really dislike this.  Really does nothing special.  Yes, I thought it would be nice to facetime while I'm cooking and things like that but my contacts won't synk.  Went through troubleshooting multiple times also.  SO if I say, Alexa call "Bill," she tells me there is no contact for Bill.  Looking further into this, it tells you that you can only connect to people who have an echo device and have the Amazon Alexa app.  I even purchased the Echo Connect that plugs into your land line thinking that would help, nope.  Do not purchase this unless the contacts you want to facetime with have the Alexa App on their smart phone and a registered account.  If you just want this for basic, "Alexa, what is the weather of the day," then just get the regular Echo or the Dot and save yourself a ton of money.

author: Rick
title: News Updates, Music and so much more.
content:
I got my Echo Show around Black Friday 2017. So far it has met my expectations. However I was unable to blutooth to a first generation Harmon-Kardon Onyx speaker.
As for smart home devices, it works great with my Philip Hue lights, Nest Thermostats and recently added Ring Doorbell and Ring Spotlight. Response to this added devices is quick and I like that my kids can ask Alexa to shows them the Ring Doorbell camera and see who is at the front door before they slide to the front door and open it without first checking.
Adding a whole home WIFI is highly recommended and I suggest eero 2nd Generation.

author: Frederick Lee Porter
title: Can I get this repaired or replaced?
content: The product started fading in and out, for over 2 months now... looks like possible refurbished.  My other family members have one with  o issues and has had theirs longer than I. I like that I can communicate with family long distance so I only want it fixed.

author: Elizabeth
title: Poor Customer Service and incompetent technical support
content: I purchased an Echo Show July 16th but I did not get to open the package till November 26 as a result of traveling.  When I attempted to activate the Echo Show, it did not work.  After contacting Amazon's technical support department, they suggested I send it back for a replacement.  After waiting an unreasonably amount of time, I received the same device without the wall adaptor.  I called amazon expecting them to send me at least the adaptor that came with the Echo Show but I was told that I would have to order one and they would gladly send me another one.  I was further told that for my inconvenience they would not charge me for the adaptor.  Well, how nice of them. they shouldn't charge me anyway,because it was their incompetence that caused me not to have an adaptor.  After speaking to several kind foreigners, I was transferred to customer service where I spoke to "Rally", a fellow American who was very condescending and refused to allow me to speak to his supervisor.  This is a tragedy any time a person makes a purchase and then is expected to have to buy their incompetent service and deal with inaptitude personnel.  The CEO of Amazon should be aware of how his customers are being dealt with.

author: Luis Nunes
title: Five Stars
content: Very Cool. Daughter just found that she can ask for movies...

author: NOLA 2100
title: Repair or replacement
content:
The Show worked great for a month or so. Alexa work fine , but the screen constantly jumps.
I can't find where to send it for warrenty work. Amazon makes finding who or where to send it, is like looking for a needle in a hay stack. Please tell me who and where to send this show to for repair or replacement.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I use it everyday
content: I keep mine in the kitchen and use it everytime I need a recipe. Or I watch hulu while i'm preparing food or watching/ listening to YouTube.  I can't ask something's like I can with Google but I can open Google and surf for answers.  I haven't used it to video chat because I don't know anyone who has one to chat with. I love it and want to buy another one

author: B. C. V.
title: So much potential; so much disappointment
content: I have all versions of Alexa, and this one is by far the most disappointing. I often have to ask the same question multiple times, and many times it does something completely wrong. With the loss of YouTube, it's even less appealing than before. It's disappointing that this version has hearing problems, because it should be totally awesome for showing recipes, shopping lists, etc. Instead it acts like a random response machine, often exposing me to wonderful historical people or facts about the world I'd never know otherwise, but also pissing me off in the process. I still love the echo and echo dot though. Those things rock!

author: Krystal
title: My favorite black box
content: This device is the best! I'm not a big fan of most of the echo devices until I found this. My complaints are very minimal. I'm not a fan of having to keep it plugged in as it gets moved from room to room. And thy lack of things like YouTube. Also the daily planner could be better. I was looking for something easier to set up thought out my day. Not so much a calendar feature. Still hands down awesome!

author: Ron Prusa
title: Have Many Fine Echo Products But I think the Show Was Rushed
content: I've had the Echo Show since it came out day one. It just doesn't sound as good as the Echo. Sound is pretty unidirectional and the bass sounds like it's coming out of a box. The Show could be slicker looking. Looks like a small projection TV. I own many Echo products and love them but I think this was a little rushed. Hopefully the video conferencing works good. Going to give one to my family in Chicago.

author: Ian
title: The Jetson Video phone is here!
content: I love the drop in video and calling on this, Jetsons eat your heart out. It works really well. The touch screen is great and the speakers awesome for such a small device. The small downside is that its pickup of my voice from the other side of the room is not quite as good as the original echo I had but to be honest I am probably going to plug my now spare echo dot in and let the near field magic do its work. Amazon improve the mic and you have a perfect product but I am really nit picking as I was spoilt by the Echo but that could not do the whole video thing, it also could not show me recipes on screen in the kitchen which is the 90% use case for this version for me.

author: E. Hoffman
title: It's not really great. The night mode is too dim
content: Bought this for use in the bedroom as an alarm clock.  It's not really great.  The night mode is too dim. I'd like the night mode to just show the time in a massive font.  The sound quality is great.

author: Geeky
title: Really like the Show except for one CRAZY thing
content: Really like the Show except for one CRAZY thing ... the "Try 'Alexa, blah blah blah ... '" suggestion alwys in view on the home screen. There is NO setting for this in either the app or Settings inside the show (swipe down). I found MANY users also very disappointed by this on the internet. NO turning everything off in the options and rotation to single will not get rid of it ... it's always there. AWESOME tool EXCEPT for that. Would be 5 stars ... but 3 now. Amazon, a simple option to disable this suggestion PLEASE!!!

author: michelle winston
title: New Tech in the house.
content: My sister bought me this Echo and I love it. Slowly but surely I'm getting use to asking Alexa questions. Eventually, I will use Alexa to place orders, that will be so cool.

author: C. Pomeleo
title: Meh
content:
In less than 50 days this thing started flashing and becoming unusable. Sad cuz it could be such a cool little machine. I have 5 Alexa Echo devices in my, and I was the most disappointed that this died so fast. Not enthusiastic about the return policy either. If it dies you have to send in to tech support so they can diagnose it.
I don’t like that. I’ve had it less than two months and it shouldn’t have died already.

author: Shawn H.
title: Great Addition to Alexa Home Group
content: Great addition to our Alexa family. Love the screen and sound. Like many others, I do wish we could remove the suggestive "Try...." Amazon Alexa text from screen. It is not needed and distracts from your home screen and slide shows.

author: Eric Z.
title: Waste of money
content: This thing sucks, won't connect to my arlo even though it says it will and the skill is rated 1 star. No YouTube, pretty much only Amazon prime videos. Buy a cheap laptop, a tablet, literally anything else and don't buy into this product. Makes a subpar $130 clock or great at watching movie trailers. Returning this thing and never looking back.

author: LukeyLu
title: OK for 1.  Awful with 2 or more devices.
content:
We took the bait and bought 2 Shows.  (I was confident that Amazon would produce a quality product).  Wrong.
Here is my experience:
1)  I spent over 2 hours with tech support trying to get my devices to accept calls from each other.  Setting aside the fact that English is not the first language of tech support plus the fact that they apparently have limited if any experience with the product, it was at times incredibly difficult and frustrating to understand what was being said.  I lost track of the number of times I had to say "I don't understand what you said".
2)  Each contact person I spoke with REQUIRES:  spelling my email address, slowly pronouncing my name, stating my account name,  repeating my house number, street address, city and state. I ended up doing this 4 times as I was 'shuttled' to someone who was a more advanced 'tech support' person.  Plus I had to repeat the entire reason I called to each person.  Hello?  Here is an idea:  "Share the caller's information with other employees as the call is passed up the support line."  Can't you use AWS to solve this problem?
3)  It turned out that the inability to call another Show device was the result of needing to link to a second account which would be connected to the 2nd Show device.  OK.  That worked.  (It took 1.5 hours to figure that one out)
4)  This begs the question "Do I need a separate account for each Show I purchase?  What if I want a 3rd in my kitchen?
5)  So, I call tech support ... again.  They inform me that I do not need another account for a 3rd Show but I do need to 'turn on' Drop-In.  If I do not have Drop-In turned on it will not work?  Huh?  Why is that?  They can not say.
6)  The summary of this situation is that as 'kewl' as the produce idea is, Amazon Show is not ready for real customer use.  (It probably works well if you want to purchase just 1; but given their enticing offer of $100 off if you buy 2, I must say "If that is your need, look elsewhere.")  They should have a)  trained their support staff on the product and it's features and b) beta tested multiple product use.  But, apparently Amazon uses it's customers as beta testers.

I am returning my devices.

author: David L Byrer
title: Hands down this is the top of cool things to have
content: Hands down this is the top of cool things to have.... when our great granddaughter drops in on us...it makes our day... everything is yours for the asking ... current weather, quality music with rich sound, interactive games that entertain our whole family connects to my Amazon Fire Tv....don't tell Amazon but if the price of this Gadget went up 10X and I had to replace it.... I would pay the price!

author: UrAvgUser
title: Calling feature needs improvement
content: I recently bought this mainly to talk to my parents via the drop in feature and voice/video calling. Unfortunately, the audio quality is poor and keeps breaking plus it’s hard for others hear my voice during calls due the low sound (as if I’m speaking from miles away). I was really hoping to like this device as I’m already well integrated into Alexa ecosystem, however not being able to use the calling feature reduced the value proposition of echo show significantly.

author: RedRebelChick
title: Easy setup, easy use and able to view variety of home security cameras!
content:
Impressive!
We already have the Spot, but it doesn't show Blink camera's, yet.......
I wanted something that will show me ALL my security cameras in one place, and I could just voice activate to show each one.
I finally found it!
This was on sale, and I jumped on it.

First off, I can now see my 2 outdoor Nest cams, 2 XD Blink Outdoor cams, a Logitech outdoor cam, and our Ring Doorbell.  All we have to do is tell it to 'show me xxxxx', and there it is!  The large screen is perfect to set on top of our entertainment center and view from 15 feet away.

With the Ring, when someone rings your doorbell or there is motion, it will not activate this device.  Ring hasn't perfected that yet.  You have limited settings for the cams, using this device, but you CAN view all of them.

Yes, they time out after 30 minutes.  This device isn't really made to be a security 24/7 monitor.  You would get burn in!

Using this device for other than viewing our cameras is an awesome addition to our living room.
If we need to add something to our Fresh order, just speak it. :)

BE AWARE:  If you put this close to your speakers for your local TV, the news people LOVE to say ALEXA for some reason.  Which will activate it.  We changed our activate word to Echo and there have been far less 'ghost' activations.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Screen flickers and shakes.
content: Like the concept but for as much as I paid for the device the screen sucks. Flickers and shakes. I bought 2 extras for family members and theirs does the same thing.

author: Proud Grandma
title: LOVE IT!
content: Love it, love it, love it.  Don't know how I survived without it.  Every couple of days I find something else it will do for me.  I have the original Echo and loved it but I love the show even more.

author: Yashakur
title: How fast Alexa executes the command.
content:
Great product, fast delivery, reliable!
Works MUCH BETTER than Google Home products when using IN NORWAY!
It works perfectly in Norway/Scandinavia btw!

author: ryan felt
title: ... this as a Christmas gift and it’s possibly the worst peice of garbage I’ve gotten
content: I received this as a Christmas gift and it’s possibly the worst peice of garbage I’ve gotten. It doesn’t do anything my iPhone can’t do, and what it can do is limited. The user interface is horrible, the video call function is pointless, since you can’t move the device with you anywhere. Having to use the app on my phone to update anything for the device instead of being able to do that on the device itself it redundant. I’m shocked this piece of crap was over 200$ Oh, I forgot another terrible problem with this thing, ads, why would I want ads floating across the screen, the user should have full control over what is displayed all this thing is, is an expensive marketing device

author: Kathleen
title: Very Disappointing!
content: The only thing this might be good for is recipe display in the kitchen! Very disappointed in the Echo Dot and Echo Show!  When I get up at 5:30am and ask for news, I get the news from the day before!  When I asked who is hosting SNL on 1/6, I get the host information for next weekend! W TF?  It is the 21st century of round the clock information availability, correct?  I also hate the fact that tou cannot go outside of the. "Amazon-Approved" world!  Extremely disappointing, so I will be re-selling my Amazon Dot for sure!

author: B. Burns
title: I want to like this product and maybe I just haven't taken advantage ...
content: I want to like this product and maybe I just haven't taken advantage of all of its uses, but I feel like I just bought a really expensive "click bait" machine. I hate the constant news teasers! If I could figure out how to get rid of the "click bait" messages then I might give it 4 stars.

author: Candice Jenrette
title: Love Alexa Devices!
content:
Love my Echo Show!  I also have the Dot. ...& the Fire Stick, ...& some smart home devices.  I love that they are all basically made for each other.  I use the Show with my Arlo Cameras also.  (& just a side note: the speakers/audio/sound on this device really impressed me! I was not expecting such good sound quality from the Echo Show, but it definitely packs some audio-power!)
I stay busy, & my hands are always busy so all the voice command options are great for me.  I'm constantly telling Alexa what to do, & she's constantly reminding me what I need to do!  lol  I would like (& could definitely use) more features involving Calendars & Reminders, ...I really wish the reminders had the option to set "monthly" recurring reminders! (not just daily/weekly) so that I wouldn't have to constantly manually add each & everyone of my monthly reminders by individual date!  ...and even more-so I wish the Reminders had the option to sync your Calendars & have it so Alexa will verbally remind you of whats on your calendar also!!!  I've just started using the shopping lists which are becoming very helpful also!  ....All in all, keep up the good work!  Thanks!

author: Linda Z
title: Love  the Echo Show
content: Just received this last week. Love it. Set up was easy and took under 20 minutes. There definitely is a learning curve and I have only scratched the surface on capabilities. The ability to ask for any song or album and have it played within seconds is great. Also the lyrics follow along on the screen. The speaker is good quality. So many helpful options.

author: W30W9
title: Absolutely love this! Crystal clear sound quality
content: Absolutely love this! Crystal clear sound quality, clear understanding of commands and wide range of questions to be answered by Alexa. I will be buying these as Christmas gifts this year. I love it so much I bought one for the upstairs and downstairs of my house. It even connects with my Ring doorbell and security cameras. Truly the finishing touch to a Smart Home.

author: BB
title: Great home automation device.
content: Love my show. Have it linked in with Cloud Cams and it works great. Also like watching video flash briefs, rotating photos, and lyrics to songs. Just wish it integrated audio with tbe Ring doorbell (it does video).

author: Amazon Customer
title: Useless, except for amazon marketing/purchases
content: Screen stopped working (heavy flicker; lines through sceen) within three months.  Also, video function is pretty useless for anything but amazon purchases, which the unit clearly prioritizes when you ask alexa anything (it shows products, not information)

author: Terry Mangum
title: Neat idea!
content: So far, so good.  Nice to have visual feedback for weather and other answers. Fun to see lyrics of songs that are playing. Just like the other Echo products, I'm sure it will take time to learn all the capabilities this device has to offer.

author: James W.
title: Screen Flickers- Repaired-Flickering again
content:
Likes:
Good Sound
Works well with WiFi outlets
Good Voice Recognition
Dislikes:
Screen Flickers- Even after sending in for Repair
The only reason I bought an Echo Show is for the screen.  The Echo actually has better sound quality (I have two of them).  The screen flickering is beyond annoying.  I sent it in for repairs and Amazon was amazing with this.  I want to report it again and can't seem to figure out how to file the complaint again and start the process again.  Maybe I only had one shot....  I'll keep trying.

author: Chris
title: It's fine, but I prefer Google Home
content: It's fine overall. I had Google Home devices before, but got this as a Christmas present so I figured I'd give it a shot. Overall I prefer the Google Home experience much better and will stick with it, it just feels much more natural.

author: annushka
title: Its ok.
content: I got the show because I was hoping it would have all the capabilities of an echo speaker and all the capabilities of a fire tablet. I was also hoping some of the Alexa skills would have additional content for the video screen. And i wanted to be able to watch movies on Netflix, Hulu, Vudu, etc... Because no matter what anybody says the screen is plenty big enough. You just need to have it no more than a couple yards away. Its good for video calls and its ok for Alexa skills and I can watch amazon prime movies but most of what I want to watch isn't on prime. If they get more video content it will be a lot more useful

author: David Worsham
title: One Star
content:
No YouTube because Amazon can't just play ball.  Paperweight

Fix YouTube before I consider purchasing again!

author: Sheheartsprime
title: Awesome gift
content: I bought 2 of these for Christmas, one for my parents and one for my sister and her family who just moved out of state. My sister and I got them set up ahead of time so when my parents came over on Christmas morning we were able to open presents "together".  My parents were so happy to be able to see their grand kids open their presents on our first Christmas without them.  I know there are other ways to video chat but I think this one my parents will actually be able to handle.  Super easy set up and was able to make the call to my sisters echo show on the first try.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Echo sure works very well easy to set up but trouble shooting not that easy.
content:
The echo show works great,I bought two one for my house and one for my parents home still haven’t been able to set up my parents to do video calls.
As crazy as this may sound they don’t have a smart phone So we couldn’t set up the echo show to do video and any Calling. I really thought that being on Wi-Fi  you can talk And do video calls from one Echo show To the other. I’ve asked Support if I set up both with my number if it will work And they got on the phone was very helpful but didn’t solve my issue. I would try surround myself and see if it works for the same number

author: Basschamp
title: The sound is so amazing, it is nothing like a phone call
content: The Echo Show has exceeded my expectations, especially with the video calling feature. My daughter and grand daughter live 1 1/2 hours away, making frequent visits difficult, especially during peak traffic times. I can simply  ask Alexa to do a video call to my daughter and within seconds we are chating while viewing CRYSTAL CLEAR videos of each other. It is so cute when my grand 19 month old grand baby tries to give snacks to Daisy, my dog,  through the screen. The sound is so amazing, it is nothing like a phone call. It sounds as though we are in the same room talking to one another. We all LOVE our SHOW!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Definitely worth the sale price!
content:
I was very hesitant to buy an Echo device as I live in a studio apartment and have no smart home items. I actually bought this for my boyfriend when it was on sale to cheer him up. He loves new technologies and the idea of AIs running our homes. This was supposed to be a present for him.

I now use Alexa more than he does. I was very surprised by how useful she is and I was blown away by all the different skills I can have her do. It's way more useful than I was lead to believe originally. We actually set her up with my account since I have prime.
I love that when I'm cleaning in my bathroom I can say "Alexa, play jungle noises", she can hear me, and that the speaker is loud enough to hear in the bathroom without it being to over whelming loud when I go back into the main room. Which always deterred me from listing to music/ambient noise while cleaning before. With the added benefit of me not having to stop what I'm doing if I change my mind and want to listen to something different.

I really like that your calendar events show up on the screen. It's been super helpful reminding my boyfriend when I work and when all our appointments are coming up. I also like that it shows different things you can try, and news story headlines that you can ask more about.

I've very happy with this device, my boyfriend still gets frustrated at times with Alexa. She doesn't recognize some commands and will do the wrong thing. When he tries to have her remind him of something he gives her all the info at once, which is usually when she messes up. I think if you keep the commands simple, it helps. It might take a tiny bit longer, but she'll do it correctly.

author: laurieb
title: Great little device.
content: I really bought this because I needed a decent radio, and since this has many more functions and was about 1/2 price at Amazon Prime days,  for 129.00 I am extremely happy.  I am just technologically challenged and need to learn how to use all functions.  It's great I can just say just about any song or album and Alexa pulls it up. Plus the option of watching Prime videos, movies, asking questions or whatever, I feel I got a real bargain,  Very happy.

author: log cabin 13
title: Very Useful
content: How great these are...we love our original one so much we bought this for another area of our home. So easy to setup.

author: JED L
title: Slow to respond, sometimes it never does.
content:
Was really looking foward to this addition of the Alexa products. I use my Amazon Echo to play music, check weather, etc. all the time. Set-up was easy just like the other devices. Everything I own is on the same Wi-Fi network, but the only thing I have trouble with is the Echo Show. Gaming on Xbox One: Great. Streaming videos on my Smart TV: no problem. Ipad and Ipod: no issues. Amazon Echo and Dot: run like Champs.
All I hear from the Echo Show (after a long pause) is: "I am having problems playing your music right now." " I am having trouble connecting right now." Or my personal favorite: "I don't understand." I don't understand why I bought it.
I have tried factory resets, etc to no avail. Right after it tells me it can't connect I walk to another room and the original Echo I bought (one of the first ever made) performs the request flawlessly. Very disappointing.

author: V. hodgdon
title: BECOMING DISSAPOINTED
content: let me say i love this thing and what it can do. It does need some work and expansion. I AM HOWEVER SUPER DISSAPOINTED I CANNT WATCH UTUBE ON IT ANYMORE. so much for cooking videos in the kitchen anymore that really sucks and is almost a deal breaker for me. had i known i would have sticked to my tablet and google.

author: Boo
title: Meh -- but we love our other Echo products
content: Purchased this at a local brick and mortar to work with our Ring Doorbell 2 after my husband's spinal surgery. Even he can get to the door faster than this thing responds to the command to show the door. Not happy with this item at all. Not at all.  The regular Echo speaker and Echo dot are much better products. Save your money.

author: Frank P.
title: Amazon vs. Google--the Echo Show You Tube War
content: In Dec 2017, (Just before Christmas) TechCrunch and other other Tech analysts reported that Amazon and Google had reached agreement to allow YouTube access on the Echo Show and that it was available.  I decided to buy a system for Christmas.  Oh Joy on Christmas Day!  Alexa was as dumbfounded on accessing YouTube as am I.  Should have bought an Echo Dot and saved my money.  Bitter Pill.  Its not about the device, its about the content.  Disappointed at best.  Never again--waste of money as this thing really doesnt support YouTube and others.

author: Walleyeman
title: Great For Video Calls
content: I guess by reading so many negative reviews my expectations were lowered. I am quite impressed with the show. It plays very well with my Nest thermostat and camera, and Hue and Wemo lights. I really like being able to read the lyrics of songs, words otherwise that are not discernible. When added to the group of echo devices, the lower fidelity of the show, compared to the echo devices, is not noticed as much. I love viewing my photos on the 7 inch screen. The ability to change the background to your own photo is nice. Watching Amazon movies with the show on my lap couldn't be better. Maybe if I had owned the show when the capability to watch YouTube was available, then taken away, I would be disappointed too. Maybe I wouldn't be as impressed if I had paid full price, but I purchased mine for considerable less on the deal of the day. All in all it is a very impressive unit and I highly recommend it, even at full price.

author: Kindle Deb
title: Our little help mate!
content: We love our Echo Show!  My husband plays Jeopardy, I set alarms while cooking, I can watch "DIY" videos while I'm doing it, and we now have two.  One of my favorite things is to have it take a picture of us, just by saying "take a picture". Also, it is our second little movie theater for the dining room.

author: Amazon Customer
title: You MUST have a smart phone for the Echo Show to work!
content: Overall I really like the Echo Show.  However, there is one thing that people purchasing this for an older person needs to know - both people  HAVE TO have a smart phone to set up the echo show!  Many people wrote in to say that it worked great for an elderly parent and I brought 2 to do video chat with a 80 year old friend.  EVERYONE stated that not having a smart phone would not be a issue.  However, you need the contact list in a smart phone in order to set up you can call.  The computer download will NOT let you enter contact information!  This was very disappointing to me, esp as this was not mentioned in any description of the Echo Show.  My friend has a older flip phone but not a smart phone.

author: smartshopper
title: Takes great photos & has fun photo booth feature
content: Love the screen size, easy to read when using recipes or singing lyrics while playing music. Sound is excellent. Didn't even realize that it could take photos or that it had a photo booth feature. Love that it sends my photos immediately to my cloud. Again, screen size is great for "drop ins" or photo slideshows. Waited to buy it until it went on sale. I read about the new one coming out with a larger screen, but for the price and my needs, this works just fine. If you've been wanting to purchase an ECHO SHOW, I'd say go for it, you won't be disappointed.

author: Betty Martin
title: I love the large screen
content: I love the large screen! The video feature is nice and clear. I am still learning how to use the features. I like that it can show me the weather forecasts as well as my daily calendar. It was easy to set up out of the box (I am not a tech person). Alexa apps are easy to download and install.

author: KUHOOPS
title: Sound Quality
content: Very disappointed with the sound quality, specifically the heavy bass and inability to adjust the tone settings.  The bass is quite high and very little treble.  Not ideal if you play much music on this.  Even talk radio is too muffled with bass.  Will there be an update available to adjust the tone settings?

author: photogrphr
title: THE RING and ECHO SHOW Can fix this, if they want to.
content: I love tech, so it is no wonder that I bought an Echo Show. I have LIFX light bulbs and the Ring doorbell and cameras. I got the Echo Show and set it up. I said "alexa, show me the front door" and the ring was on the screen and I saw the front door. "alexa, Quit" and the app closed. The trick to getting to put this in the kitchen was to get the approval of my wife. She is not as enamored with technology as i am. So I showed her the alexa show, and she said "so, what can it do?" I said "alexa show me the front door" and the ring doorbell image came on. This she liked. She likes being able to have the security of viewing who is at the front door. Both she and I thought that when someone would ring the bell the Ring Doorbell image that I get on my phone we also show up on the Echo Show. We were pretty disappointed that when the doorbell rang, and I ask alexa "show me the front door" it cannot and claims it cannot get on the ring system. I bet this is something that can be fixed by Ring Doorbell and Alexa Show, If they want this to work as I described. Maybe the Ring and Alexa Show aren't playing that well together. I don't know. But I know this, if the ring doorbell shows on echo show screen when someone rings the doorbell, this is going to be a BIG WINNER for both the Ring and Echo Show. The video I posted shows what it says when it does not do what you want. While the camera isn't responding to ECHO SHOW, it did respond to my iPhone.

author: Cathe Ashcraft
title: Hands free calling
content:
I love how my answers come with ‘pictures’ and songs with ‘words’ (I’ve been singing them wrong for years )
My granddaughter loves calling her mama,  (we’re still trying how to figure out Camera calls )
I’ve been giving away my echo dots and replacing them with the show

author: Dani Nics
title: Alexa has been welcomed in my home!
content: This is my 1st Alexa product and I’m absolutely loving it!! The sound is just awesome,  as I use it for an alarm clock as well. The ease of playing music, video chatting and making/taking phone calls is great. Worth every penny! Makes a great gift or if just wanting a little something for yourself.

author: Morgan Overstreet
title: I will admit the idea and the direction the future is heading is pretty outstanding. But it gets confused very often and ...
content: It’s all right. I will admit the idea and the direction the future is heading is pretty outstanding. But it gets confused very often and doesn’t understand me

author: cookie
title: Love it!
content:
I purchased this product before it came out.  Payed top dollar.  While waiting for delivery my children gave me Sonos with Alexa.  Loved it.  Received Echo Show and was going to return it but life got in the way and it was the past 30 days.  So I sent it to my cottage in Maine.  Got it hooked up and absolutely love it.  My neighbors love it too.  Not only does it play my favorite music, it shows recipes and movies.  I really like it for a quick recipe.  I asked for Oysters Rockefeller and it gives me 5-6 recipes with photos.  (Oysters are fabulous here in Maine).
  I am having a problem though.  I use to be able to ask Alexa to put something on shopping list and it went on my phone Alexa App under shopping list.  For some reason that feature stopped.  I cannot get it to work.  If anyone has a suggestion let me know.
I do love this product and will purchase one for my home in California.  The price had dropped.  Hope it does not become discontinued

author: Ashlei Shipp
title: Awesome
content: I love that this of course works with my other devices effortlessly. One think I don’t like is that there is no volume control like the other devices other than using your voice. I also don’t like that the prime video feature sucks. All I would really want to watch are music videos and there is a very small selection. Other than that it is great!

author: Rob, Michigan
title: A show stopper...
content: I have enjoyed the Echo Show so far. You can see your news flash, see other people with the echo device, it responds very well. The show was tons of skills that I haven't even touched the surface.  If you like technology you'll love this.

author: William Rule
title: More to Echo than it appears
content: The major problem is not knowing everything you can do with Echo.  It is a learning process and it grows.  Easy to set up with help from a grandson who is more technologically advanced that we are.  Then felt like dopes because it was easy.  Decent quality sound.  Being able to get radio stations from other areas is a plus.  I can find out what is going on in my hometown.  We are still experimenting with Echo to find out all we can do.  The periodic emails with suggestions are useful but a little incomplete. If you do not want to spend more for the add-ons of programming, etc. you don't need to and Echo is still solid.  I also like the ability to talk directly to relatives who have an Echo Dot by Echo and not phone by just requesting the connection.  Cool.

author: David J. Lackland
title: Worst of all the Echo devices
content:
Worst of all the Echo devices, refuses to do almost anything the other echos can find immediatly, cuts you off with a denial as you are asking the question?????,...dim unreadable screen, no output port of any kind???, ... can't hook up directly to intercom, external speakers, etc, (while all other echo devices, (even litttle "spot") has an output port?????)  avoid this and look to any other echo device,...this one is old or something,...just unresponsive and stupid.

It's a frustration machine

author: pdwrinkle
title: Nice for staying in touch
content: I bought one for myself and my grandson. We talk on it everyday. We did talk on the dot but I like that we can now see each other. I even watched my 2 little grandchildren open their Gifts Christmas morning.

author: D.S.
title: Great sound. Now it knows my name!
content: Came up to my expectations. Great sound and very responsive to voice. Just wish I could turn the brightness of the screen down as I have this in my bedroom and it lights up the whole room when I go to bed. I use it to play music most of the day and night.

author: Terry D.
title: Excellent product with almost perfect execution
content:
The Echo Show is really cool.  It offers a lot of cool features with a ton of promise.  As integrations continue to be established with products like security cameras, the value of this product will grow significantly.  The only drawback is that the microphones in the Show don't appear to work as consistently as the original Echo.  I find myself, on occasion, having to repeat myself several times before Alexa can understand me at a distance.  This never happens with the Echo.

Hopefully this is a software issue that can improve through a software update.  Other than that, this is a pretty sweet addition to the home automation suite.

author: Allyson
title: Love this Echo show
content: Love this Echo show. I’m a Mac girl so I’m used to using Siri. The white color is the way to go. Only thing is I wish I could pick the name of the device as my mother has one and when we talk over the Show her Echo hears my echo. We both love so much I also bought one for my sister

author: Kevin B.
title: Powerful.
content: We started with the dot. Then got the show. We were happy with the dot, and now nothing compares. The show is loud, and the screen is a nice to have. We love using ours to show us the ring doorbell when we are waiting for the pizza delivery person. If you’re on the fence, just get it. You won’t be disappointed.

author: Jeremy Bernard
title: You must have a smart phone.
content:
I got 2 echo shows, 1 for me, 1 for my parents. Wanted to be able to "drop in" and help my parents at a moment's notice. But without a smart phone to download the Alexa App, my parents can't upload any contacts. So they can't call the rest of my family or me over the echo.
I really bought this to connect with my parents. $300 for 2... I would have been better off spending $30 on a Dot, and getting my mom on a smart phone...

author: E. Heller
title: We absolutely love our Alexa Show
content: We absolutely love our Alexa Show.  If you have kids, here's all you need to hear:  Rather than answer the door, the kids just walk up to the Show and tell her, "Alexa show me the front door.."  They don't need to go to the door.  No one can tell they are home.  (Note:  You need an arlo camera system for this.)  They also love the karaoke style of presenting songs with lyrics.  Everything else is incidental.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love the Show
content:
Great speaker.  Easy to set up.  Good listening skills.  All the Alexa functionality.  Screen is pretty.  Would like to see more visual content.

Got on sale. Don’t know i would pay full price for it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Seriously flawed user input for the Display.
content:
It would be great if it gave more user control for what's displayed. I really don't need a constant reminder telling me what to try. C'mon Amazon, you can do better than this.
Update: Nick from Amazon review team gave me a call. Wanted to help me out because of my 2 star review. I was impressed with that. He did explain a few things most of which should be included in a small manual if they had one. By biggest peeve is the constant "Hints" of what to try by asking Alexa. I've been using Alexa for quite some time. Echo, Echo Dot, Echo Plus, so the constant hints are annoying. Nick did follow up and agreed they at this time can't be turned off. So, still 2 stars.
Update: Using my photo's as a background for the Display, it's supposed to change pictures every 10  minutes. (That's a default time that is not user changeable). Well, the 10 minutes is whenever it feels like it. Now we are down to 1 star.

author: Dawn Brophy
title: Kitchen Addition
content: We have an Alexa in our living room.  We were always yelling from kitchen for Alex to assist with cooking or to play music. Plenty of times our apple iPads leaned against whatever was in the counter while we read recipes. Now with the Echo Show. No more yelling - selecting music is a breeze and we are finding that we use it to time cooking more then the oven timer.  Just gave it to my husband for his birthday so we are still finding additional ways to use!!!

author: Ragamuffin
title: No YouTube? Big disappointment.
content: I purchased my Show on Prime Day. So far, it works great and does what it’s supposed to do. My biggest disappointment is that I can’t watch YouTube videos. I make jewelry, and it would be a big help if I could watch jewelry videos while I’m making something. That would make it much more useful, and I would definitely give it five stars if it had that capability.

author: Dacanivalwannab4
title: Very easy setup and the device works great
content: Very easy setup and the device works great. Alexa show seems to be hear me much better then our original Echo. It is nice to see our calendar for the day that shows up every morning. I am very happy with this product and am considering purchasing another one for my house.

author: Kindle client
title: Nice for price
content: I like the screen size. The sound is not that great,  and I didn't like that the screen showed black lines after only 25 days of use.  They're sending me a new one we'll see how it goes.

author: Brinks
title: Save your money, known defect will not be addressed by Amazon after 12 months.
content: Screen started to fail 6 months in, looks like a moving bar code. Found out it was a growing defect just after the warranty period ended, Amazon said I was SOL, bought it to video conference with friends, but they see this thing, and of course they will never buy one. No fix, no return. When I got it they said it was great, now it is 1st Generation, for a reason. Don’t do it.

author: Kristen Rae
title: BEST AMAZON PURCHASE!!!
content: My kids and I love Alexa and our Echo Show. I wish I would’ve bought 2 during that sale! My mom, who is technologically challenged, has even used it!! Which tells me just how user friendly it is. We’ve played games on it, listened to music, watched videos, movies and tv shows, purchases items, done web searches and, our favorite, asked her to tell us a joke!! The Echo Show is 100% worth buying!

author: Joe
title: Marginal! You
content:
Does not work with Flash News Briefing which I use daily.
Works great talking to our grand daughter.
Reuters news usually works
Bottom line, it works sometimes.

author: Ravenheired
title: Stopped working properly
content: Have had for less than 3 months and has stopped working properly. Wavy lines at bottom. Very disappointing

author: ISRAEL CABRERA
title: but I don't like it because she doesn't know most things
content: The item works well, as a basic clock, radio, weather informant, but I don't like it because she doesn't know most things, every time I ask a question she answers "I don't know about that one" and if there is a subject you are interested in, you would have to install the information, so what is she good for? I have to install all the information. Siri does a better job as far as I know

author: jennifer t.
title: Disappointed and sadly
content: Bought this specifically to watch YouTube videos (as advertised) and it has become the least used amazon product in our house-and we have many. Less capable than our echo and tap and dot and google Home at answering questions. Disappointed and sadly, can’t recommend.

author: Barb0325
title: marketed for seniors but they can't set it up!
content: I bought a pair of these so my 88 year old mother could video chat with her great granddaughter, so one is at her house which is 2,000 miles away from mine, where the second unit is located.  But mom doesn't have a smartphone, so even though I opened a gmail and amazon account for her, I couldn't set the units up because her cell phone doesn't accept texts.  She is obviously not tech savvy and won't even text let alone FaceTime, but I don't want her to miss out on pictures and video chats so I thought this would be ideal.  They don't tell you any of this in their online descriptions. But for those of us who are tech savvy and have Alexa capabilities it's a neat fun toy

author: TeeJaiP
title: So far so good
content: I'm sure I haven't scratched the surface of what this can do but I'm having fun with it! It's not as advanced as asking Google (sorry, but it's true, Alexa can't pull information like my..."Ok Google" device) but it's still a nice gadget.

author: Greg D
title: Integrates well with security cameras by Nest and Ring.
content: I really like the Echo show, it is the best of all of the Echo products and I have all of them including the fire tv cube which I enjoy as well as it functions similar to an echo show utilizing you tv. The echo show integrates well with my smart home, security system and two different types of camera systems (Nest and Ring). I will be purchasing another in the near future.

author: Jan
title: Excellent and fun
content: This is a nice addition to the “smart home.” I loved that I could watch a video while cooking. Since I suspect many people will put this in the kitchen, perhaps some sort of cover that is more washable could be designed. But, it is a great product. I love Alexa/Echo.

author: Brett
title: Echo show
content: Great device I use it everyday the only problem is it’s not very smart when it comes to settings when I tell Alexa to turn down the brightness or turn it up it will ask what device when obviously I want the echo show even after saying “turn down echo show brightness” it will just re ask what device I hope they fix this soon especially because I love adaptive brightness but when I turn my lights off it gets to dark. There are some other bugs but overall great device if you like to listen to music I highly recommend getting this sounds amazing.

author: Vbranham
title: Nice device
content: Love my echo show the only thing is that I would suggest is that since the device requires constant power that there be added USB charging ports on the side to charge other devices. Also when trying to video chat you need great lighting or else you will appear to be too dark and the other person will be unable to see you.

author: Paul
title: Great for the kitchen
content: Nice product with the screen.  You can use it for recipes,  timers, or just streaming music while working in the kitchen.  Also works great for smart home automation.  Have it controlling lights, switches, music, and the Nest thermostat.

author: Jeff Wulfekuhl
title: Not bad, just not great yet.
content:
First off, I really like my Show.  I use it as an alarm clock every day and it reads Audible books to me every night to help me get to sleep.  I have WEMO and HUE lights that it works with.  No issues on these.  She has issues sometimes waking up and hearing you the first time so you have to repeat yourself due to the screen having to come on I believe.  Currently YouTube is blocked from her as of the time of this review due to the crappy implementation of it.  Google is blocking it because Amazon is not following the proper API to implement YouTube on the Show.  I side with
Google on this because I would like to be able to log in and have my subscriptions and suggestions available and not the random videos it pops up.  She needs more apps that utilize the touch screen.  I'd like to be able to control my lights without having to talk at night and listen to her say "okay".  The screen is pretty nice and has good color.  I put my favorite photos on Amazon so I can use them as backgrounds.  I'd like to be able to turn everything off on the screen to use it as a photo frame when I'm not talking to her.  Not that I "talk" to her, just sayin.  Overall I see a lot of potential in the Show that Amazon is dragging their feet on and not implementing useful features.  I can't remember all the features enabled in her.  How about "Alexa, show icons"  so I can pick something out instead of having to use the app to see what's currently activated Amazon??  Would I buy it again?  I would for what I'm currently using it for.  I like that the screen goes black at night when "do not disturb" is set and I can just touch her to wake the screen or snooze the alarm.  I like that I can tell her to stop reading after x minutes so she doesn't keep reading all night long.  The weather app could be better but is still useful.  The calendar is kind of a let down because she can't actually show a calendar.  How hard is that Amazon?  Hopefully she gets there eventually.  I'd like to see official forums for people to discuss features and issues with support reading along too.

author: D money
title: Alexa show is a great addition to my home
content: I made this purchase right before the holidays to see if it would be a good gift for members of my family. After I got everything linked up to my show, I find that I use it all the time and love it. It has really good range for voice command you don’t have to be next to it for Alexa to respond and it can hear your voice despite how noisy it is in the room you are in

author: Ben S.
title: Helpful and Entertaining
content: This thing is great to have. From listening to Pandora to asking for the weather, it is very handy to have in my kitchen. It’s easy to control volume, it can be very loud, and the quality is pretty nice. I am one for technological advancement, and I am happy amazon created this Echo Show. The only downside I have found is that the Show cannot hear you that well if the volume is maxed, but I rarely have it that loud... Nonetheless, it is Highly Recommended.

author: Angela Braner
title: Love it!
content: We just bought a house in Florida so I'm missing my grandbabies!  This is the perfect way to stay in touch!  My 3 year old grandson can call me now anytime he wants to!!!  Love it for playing music too!

author: Hylnder64
title: Impressive
content: Having to learn a few things ...works well with Alexia as the focus word to open .. not so well with others ie Echo..like having my pics on screen.. haven’t figure how to  eliminate the scrolling .. but learning

author: harley angel
title: Li k
content:
I love the total functionality.  I have linked my blink cameras to the device.  I play music and pictures.
My calendar posts daily activities.  I ask Alexa for daily weather.

author: Nicole
title: Best present my husband has ever bought me!
content: I love this thing so much! My kids can set reading timers on her, I can listen to music as I cook, I use her for reminders and the best part of all is she duals as a baby monitor with the Wyze cameras!

author: L. K. Underwood
title: Perfect for Video Conferencing or Monitoring Elderly Parents - from Anywhere!
content: I use this to quickly drop in and video conference with my 85 year old mother while I am a work.  5 minutes a few times helps keep her engaged and gives me peace of mind.  It also helps answer the question "what's the weather like?" - Alexa doesn't worry about repeating herself!  An absolute godsend for elderly.  Also has the ability to network security cameras.

author: Tom and Erin
title: Pretty good
content: Good product overall. Would like to be able to download apps. Can't play videos as was implied in advertisements. I guess I was expecting this to be more tablet-like. Also, I don't appreciate the fact that you can't play a song or podcast across multiple echo devices without subscribing to Amazon's unlimited music. Again, good overall, but very limited in its utility.

author: James Moore
title: Breaking after 4 months
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player Screen is glitching/juttering just after 4 months of owning this item, probably will die before the years up. Not worth the money for an item that's already breaking!

author: amalcr
title: ECHO SHOW
content: I am ambivalent on ECHO SHOW.  Most of the time it works O.K., if you want the time, weather or a word spelled.  Most other off the wall questions it gives you "I don't know that" answer.  It will run movie trailers but if you want it to play music it refers you to Amazon's in-house music store.....read SIGN UP FOR A MONTHLY FEE here.  I like that it has flash memory so Amazon can update the software.....it's going to need a lot of updating down the road.  I'm not sure it is worth the $230 that it costs.  Amazon better get Echo Show's act together or it will be a dud.

author: Todd
title: extremely helpful
content: I use it as an alarm clock and for reminders from my calendar and the weather every morning so I remember everything that I have going on.  Very useful and definitely worth the money.  I have yet to make a video call from it but it's on my To Do List.

author: Carmelo
title: Echo Show steals the Show!
content:
I am really impressed with the Echo Show. The only problem I had during set-up was connecting it to my Philips Hue lights.  I could not get it to control individual lights upon initial set-up. I then decided to call customer support for Alexa and they were very helpful.  We were able to resolve the issue by going into the Alexa app and assigning my individual Hue lights to groups.  Once the groups were established with group names, I was then able to control them with Alexa.
The speakers on the Alexa Show sound great, but I prefer the ability to connect Show to my Bluetooth speaker and play the music I choose with the Show through this speaker.  I then get the album artwork and lyrics on the Show.
If you decide to purchase the Show, you will not be disappointed. It is nice asking Alexa for help with various things or questions and getting a visual with it as well.

author: csciguy
title: Sound is not as good as the original Echo.
content: My family and I own two original Echo's, three Echo dots and a Kindle Fire 10".  They are all used heavily.  I debated for a while if the advatages of this device outweigh just using the Kindle Fire's built in Alexa feature.  In the end I decided that it's superior sound and always on state would be worth the price compared to the Kindle Fire.  While the screen is very nice and responsive, the sound is below par with what I expected.  The original Echo has a much better sound.  This unit seems to have a much more limited accoustic range especially on the low end.

author: Libby Klein
title: Love the echo show.
content: Love the echo show. It’s super nice and  convenient and even just fun to play with. Love the video feature if your family has a show! Use it constantly. And great sound quality works amazing for music and an alarm lol.

author: JMB
title: Perfect!
content: This is now my favorite thing in the whole world.  My mother is 100 years old and when she wants to talk and see my brother in another state she just tells Alexa to call him.  Needless to say I purchased one for my brother as an early Christmas present and he too is very pleased.  We both have been showing off the unit to all our friends and family. The capabilities of the Echo Show are wonderful.  The voice is so clear that my mother who is hard of hearing is able to understand every word.  The Echo Show has all the wonderful abilities of the original Echo and the added benefits of the video screen.  Have even watch some videos on it and they come in very clear.  Love it!

author: Boilerplate
title: This is ideal for the kitchen, especially the smaller kitchen
content: When these first came out I really didn't think I'd need it.  During Christmas time it went on sale and I replaced the Echo on my kitchen counter with the Show.  It's easily the best part of the kitchen!  In fact, because of my small kitchen space the Echo had to be placed in the corner which muffled the Echo's sound somewhat.  The Show throws the sound directly through the front which for me was an improvement.  This does recipes and has a beautiful fish tank screensaver.  Also shows the whole week's weather forecast.  The white one really looks sharp.  Very good sound quality.  When they have a sale, snap it up.  You won't be sorry.

author: Verified Purchase
title: Black Power Cord, Not Good!
content: I like it.., really?! a BLACK power cord with a white Echo?!  Seriously, it is sitting on my white island with a black power cord draped to the outlet.  How freaking stupid id that?

author: Laura
title: Great device for home!!
content:
I love this thing! It’s perfect as an alarm because it’s super loud.

I love that I can call my mom in it anytime I like.

I love I can tell it to play music and the lyrics show so I can follow.

I gave it 4 stars because it’s certainly not perfect.

Overall, this is a great device for any home!!

author: Sherri L.
title: "Alexa" Show
content: Love it!! I am so excited about this one!  I can use this to video call family members, see recipes, add items to my shopping list, listen to music, etc.  I ordered mine in white and I just couldn't be happier.  Set up was easy and now all I have to do it pair her to the other echo's I have in my house.

author: Pam Davis
title: Great Echo Show
content: Really love it.  Spend a lot of time on it instead of my phone.  I am able to converse with family members (individual or groups).  It is so nice to be able to talk with and see family and friends and see them - it is like being there.  My grandkids love asking Alexa questions and taking photo-booth shots.  Highly recommend it.

author: M. C. Thornsberry
title: VERY LIMITED
content: I love virtually all of the Amazon Echo products but this unit is ridiculously limited and I have yet to find a reasonable use case for it. My initial purchase was to use this in the kitchen for recipes from youtube. It doesn't allow you access to the browser or a way to install apps. It is both expensive and virtually unusable. I hope they fix this. We should be able to install apps and use it to browse. This is a product that should not have happened.

author: Aerin
title: Fun toy but worthless for streaming camera feeds.
content: I do like the Show.  The screen is convenient and makes other echo tasks more convenient.  I am only giving it three stars because it is almost useless for the task I bought it for which was livestreaming camera feeds.  It takes so long for it to access and then buffer the feed that is truly useless for that purpose.  I can't think of many situations where saying "Alex show the front door,"  and have the image finally appear one to five minutes later would be useful at all.

author: George E Olds
title: it's great and I look forward to future enhancements utilizing apps ...
content: Yes, it's great and I look forward to future enhancements utilizing apps and new software interactions. I wish however that the camera was adjustable. I am forced to purchase a stand to adjust the viewing angle or prop an item in the rear of it since I currently have it positioned on higher ledge

author: Amazon Customer
title: I LOVE YOU ALEXA!
content: Love my Echo Show! This is the second one I purchased.  Each of my family members is begging me to give it to them. They don't understand why I need two . If it was up to me I'd have one in each room!

author: Big T
title: I Love this.. 😀
content: Great product. ☺️ I Love it. Especially the Ota firmware updates. Everything works as advertised. New features are just an update away.

author: Warren Mills
title: No regrets so far
content: I am happy with the Echo Show. It has some features that I particularly like. One being that when I ask for my shopping list it gives me everything instead of just the first five. It also shows me the list on the screen. I also like that to some of the songs from Amazon Music the Echo will display the words. As far as security, since I have a Ring doorbell I can say, "Alexa, show me my front door" and the Echo will connect to the Ring and I get a live picture of my front porch, great for deciding whether or not to answer the door. I'm sure I'll be finding other features as time goes on. I got this for $70 off the regular price, so if you need/want a new Echo I would recommend this one.

author: Kevin R. Dickerson
title: it is cool given the screen and you can watch amazon prime ...
content: it is cool given the screen and you can watch amazon prime t.v. shows on it and talk to other people on video 'If they have one" or the new echo spot.. which is a cheaper smaller version kind of like the echo dot.. both are great dot is cheaper... and sound quality is decent on the show .. the reason I would recommend is the ability to use the screen for timers and weather also if you want to watch amazon prime shows.. and talk to people face to face.. again though it only works for those who have one also I believe. it also plays the lyrics of music on the screen...  would be kinda cool to add a microphone to this for those karaoke enthusiasts! No downside for me but ...if you are happy with the echo and have no reason to see what I've described by having the screen then save your money and stick with what ya got!

author: Kristin
title: No YouTube or Netflix Access Ability. Otherwise, great!
content: We have only had the Echo Show for a day, but we played a lot with it last night. I like that we can speak to the Echo from any point in our kitchen, dining, and living rooms. Having items show on the screen is an added bonus. However, I am disappointed that the Echo Show cannot play YouTube or Netflix. I feel very restricted that way. I'm sure we will learn more ways to use the app in the upcoming days, but knowing of the restriction is quite saddening.

author: Brent Dooley
title: Not ready for prime time!
content:
So I love my 2 Amazon Alexas' and 1 amazon echo at home.  Purchased Amazon Echo for the office and it is unable to stream music when any of my devices at home are streaming.  It says you can have up to 4 devices.  Ok this is my fourth device.  Called customer service, got a very nice Indian service tech.  But none the less unable to fix it.  He acknowledges it should work.  Rebooted the device, went to setup in my amazon app and nothing so far.  Still on hold.  Even the rep acknowledged that this device is new and he doesn't know much about it.

Cmon Amazon I expect more from you then I do from Bill Gates!

author: Alice Thompson
title: I having the video calls so easy to do
content: Bought two.. one for my sister & nephew and one for myself. I having the video calls so easy to do! I also like being able to simply leave a message that they can play at their leisure. :)

author: Cathy M.
title: Unreliable
content: I’ve only had the unit for a month and the screen is going out (flickering). It’s still under warranty, so amazon is having me send it to a third party for repair, but still...I shouldn’t have to deal with this.

author: David
title: Aid to Handicapped Senior
content: This Echo Show combined with Arlo Pro wireless cameras, and WiFi enabled locks helps my friend that suffers from chronic nerve pain. Before he would miss a lot people that would knock on his front door. Now, he can easily see who is there and if desired, unlock the door and admit them into his home. Before he had to painfully walk all the way across the house to answer the door and it would take awhile, and usually when he got there they were already gone. It works FANTASTIC in this fashion. There are also 4 other Echo Dots and an Echo Plus in other rooms controlling everything from the sprinklers (Orbit BHyve) to the lights, TV, and thermostat - making his life just a little easier in his senior years. He has learned to control everything from his desk (where the Echo Show sits) while he does what he enjoys most, writing. Thank you for a great product.

author: Gordon Ewasiuk
title: Get one.  No, get two.
content:
I put this Echo Show in my garage and was just floored at the amazing sound it provides.  I had music going for hours and it was deep, rich, and sounded AWESOME.

Alexa is awesome and having a video display just adds more goodness.  Get one, you won't be disappointed.

Oh, and the ability to place video calls is pretty spectacular.

author: Richard
title: Almost, but not quite, worth 5 stars
content: Overall, the Echo Show works well, and the sound quality is very good. The ease of setup & use is also very good. I dinged it by 1 star because you can't turn off the annoying "Try saying, Alexa..." feature. I would really like to have a nice family photo, or something for the static background, and don't want anything on top of it. At the very least, if it's going to do suggestions, they should stop after the latest 5 or 10 "Trending videos, breaking news, etc. etc. Look at the Echo Show Blog, this is like one of the most hated things it does! Get rid of this, or at least make it to where I can opt out or something, and I'll give it 5 stars!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Shared Prime Accounts
content: This is the greatest thing since slice bread! One major issue. If you have a household Prime account that you share with you parents or other family members, all Echo Show devices will show all calendars and shopping list. I have spoken to Echo support on a few occasions and this is currently how it works. I really don't want my daughter's calendar coming up on my device and not a fan of her seeing my calendar and shopping list. Their solution is to get my own prime account for $100.

author: The consumer's voice
title: This is my 17th "Alexa family" device purchase.
content:
I didn't think I would like this as much as I do.  After reading early reviews, I held off on buying one until they had a considerable sale on them around the holidays.
