The microphones do a very nice job of picking up my voice, the sound is surprisingly good for a unit that only has twin 2" speakers and no passive bass radiator(s) or ports - I'd put it in the same class as the first generation Echo, sound-wise, but obviously more directional, given the speaker layout.  It's also in stereo, a feature lacking on most of the other Alexa devices (the Tap being the exception.)  Granted, Dots and second-generation Echos do allow for stereo out via the 3.5mm audio jack.

I was surprised that Amazon's new "flagship" model doesn't have an audio-out jack.  There's just one plug, and it's for power.

Screen is sharp, clear, and plenty bright.  It has a light sensor about halfway between the camera and the top left edge, hidden by the smoked plastic frame around the screen that will automatically dim the screen based on the level of light in the room.  It reminds me of the 80's Sony Trinitrons that had the "Lumisponder" feature or the self-dimming alarm clocks that do the same thing.  Pretty convenient.  Not all songs on Prime Music have lyrics, but a majority of the things I've played have album artwork that displays on the screen, and lyrics, when available, can be turned on and off.

I have to get back to the sound again - it sounds great, and I've never had a need to turn it up to 10 except for testing purposes.  I frequently crash out on the couch and stream Prime movies and TV shows next to me on a Fire HD 8 tablet, which impressed me with it's sound from such tiny speakers, but this thing has a lot more going for it, sound-wise.  It's like comparing the speakers on current LCD TVs to the dual 6x9" speakers that would come in the CRT "console TV" cabinets.  There's just more room inside this for the sound to resonate and deliver a much richer sound.

If you're used to the Echos (first and second gen, Dots as well,) you'll notice that the glowing ring is absent on these.  Instead, the blue "listening" mode is indicated by a small band on the bottom of the screen, and notifications like messages appear as a "speech bubble" icon on the top right with the number of unread ones on it.  You can ask it to play them with your voice, or tap the icon instead.  The microphone off button is replaced with a button that turns off the microphones and the camera, and a small red LED lights up between the light sensor and the camera.  Also missing is the "action button" found on the Show's siblings, this is the one that you can press instead of saying the wake word.  You've got volume up, down, and the one that turns off the mic/camera.  Device weighs a little more than the first generation Echo or the newer Echo Plus, but not by much, and naturally takes up a little bit more room on a table.

Another thing to note, if you subscribe to the Alexa email newsletter, you'll find that between trending stories that show up on the screen, the familiar [Try "Alexa, do this or that"] phrases cycle through on the screen.  It's normal resting screen will show the clock, but when it senses movement, the screen switches to playing screen-saver style pictures with the time, current weather, and the trending topics/tips for a few minutes.  You can follow the suggestion on-screen to vocally tell it to show the story, or just tap the screen to bring it up.

I hadn't planned on being this long-winded in this review, but I'm genuinely impressed with this device.  It would be great if it had an audio-out plug, and a battery like the Tap, but overall, I think this device has come a long way since being released.  The built-in camera really wasn't a selling point for me, but I could see it coming in handy if you do video calls.  I did test the camera, though (which you can turn on and off with your voice,) and it took a pretty clear picture.  Just not a feature that I personally will be using much, if at all.

One final note that I just remembered, setting the device up with your wifi is even more simple than others, I've never had to use the app - I take it to my neighbor's and all the available wifi spots show up directly on the screen itself, so you can just tap on the right one and enter the password directly on the device instead of using your phone/tablet/etc.

Bottom line:  Satisfied with the purchase.  Probably wouldn't pay full price, but when they're on sale for the regular price of the new "Echo Plus," it was a gamble that I'm glad I took.

author: cwb
title: I love it.
content: So fun to have. Finally catching up with the rest of the Echo / Alexa world. Sound controls could stand ability to adjust treble/bass.

author: MissyMae
title: my fave
content: We have several different types of "Alexas". But this one is my favorite! We keep it in the kitchen so that we can watch a movie if cooking alone. The touch screen makes everything asked of it much easier. Can eliminate things on my list by touching . Finding recipes is also easy as it will bring up a selection (with pictures) and I can scroll through by voice or touch.  Sound quality is excellent.

author: Michael Lukacs
title: "If it only had a brain"
content:
I was very impressed by the fireTV stick w Alexa , so ordered one of these hoping for a similar functionality but with a built in display and audio.
TOTAL LOSER! this product has all of the needed hardware (good audio) and connectivity to operate as I expected but it was designed and built  WITHOUT A BRAIN!
While the fireTV runs a variant of the Android OS and was made for easy download and installation of a nearly infinite number of android applications, the Echo Show has NO accessible operating system and can not load or run any apps other than a few simple "training tricks"  .
I could not even use it as a desk clock of my liking!
I returned it and bought a 7" HDMI digital display with audio and a Fire TV stick and plugged B into A to make a better device for 2/3 the money.

author: Helen Bruder
title: Love it, replaced my old alarm clock radio
content: So my alarm clock was starting to die and I had also been thinking about trying some smart home device like next or ring, so on Prime day I decided to give the Show a try. Set it up on my nightstand and started using in parallel to my clock.  Well right away I liked being able to ask for the weather and get reminders in the morning the only part I could find was how to get my favorite morning show Kidd Kraddick to play.  Well after my old clock died and after spending a little time in Alexa skills area I got it figured out there is an app for my local station. I know have a morning routine programs to set the heat, weather, and news, and then I can tell her to open the app. The only reason I'm not going 5 stars is I wish you could program routines to open apps.

author: Rodney W.
title: Glitching just after 12 months
content: So first off we love the device. We ordered it just when it was released.  We have used it daily and enjoy the features it has.  The downside we have had relates to it's longevity. Just after one year almost exactly the device began to flicker. Now it flickers constantly about the middle 40-50% of the screen.  Looks to be a video issue either with the display or driver. A consumer grade video product should last at least a couple if not more years when retailing over $200.

author: Bob in NC
title: Many Cool Features
content: This was a Christmas gift to us and we were also given an Echo Dot as a gift as well.  Since then we have added the Ring Doorbell Pro and 3 different LIFX lights to work with Amazon and really enjoy all the things.  With the Echo Show I can tell Alexa to show me the front door and a live feed of my front door will show, which is awesome.  In the bedroom I can tell Alexa it is Sexy Time and the lights dim and turn purple and light jazz music starts playing (yes got the eye roll from my wife for that one, but its still used, lol).  One thing I am concerned about is the listening aspect, not sure I buy that no one is.  We will NEVER use "Drop-In" other than for our household devices only, the thought of someone dropping in on us anytime and seeing or hearing us is quite disturbing, there should be something asking you for permission first and very glad that can be disabled for outside of the home use.  Those last couple of things are why I took off a star.  We also use the timers often for cooking and setting multiple timers.  Give it a try!

author: Jetti
title: Echo Show is a Clever and Well Designed Marketing tool
content: The Echo Show is a clever device. It has a lot of potential however it is like a locked cell phone. It works well with Amazon services, but its general utility as an Internet device is very limited. The picture on its screen is quite sharp and the sound quality is as good as most moderately priced table radios. The clock is a nice size, but would be better if it included more informaion such as day/date and local outside temperature. The timer functions are useful and the weather report display is good. Alexa's ability to provide information appears to be mostly limited to Wickipedia entries. It makes shopping on Amazon a little too easy which could lead to unintended consequences. It works quite well with Amazon Prime movie and music services, however if you are not a Prime member access to Internet based media is sharply limited. The video conferencing feature may be useful if you know someone else with an Echo Show otherwise not so much. It is primarily a marketing device which is Ok if you wish to confine your purchasing to Amazon's offerings. It also collects information on your questions and purchases which allows Amazon to target you with "deals" they feel you  may want. There is also the issue of having a very sensitive microphone  and video camera inside your home. You can supposedly disble them ... Personally I unplug it at night or when I am not using it. Also every question you ask Alexa is stored somewhere in the "Cloud". Again you can supposedly edit the conversations but there may always be a backup somewhere.  Everything that is done on the web ultimately becomes a part of some Google database somewhere. If you are happy living within the Amazon Universe it could be a useful device. It also appears to have a lot of games and other features that can be added. (In Echo ease these are refered to as "Skills".) An unlocked version that allowed unfettered access to the internet would be a more desireable product. Despite its technical sophistication it's limitation of access to alternate media and information sources greatly reduces its consumer value. By providing a captive audience and copious amounts of consumer data this device benifits Amazon far more than any of its customers.

author: P. gordon
title: Great during hurricane florence
content: I had my show in the library in my house just south of wilmington, nc.  When I was evacuated for over a week, I could use “drop in” feature to see if the power was still on...and, in fact, twice it wasn’t.  I could also see how dark it was outside and hear the rain and wind pounding on the windows.  It gave me some peace of mind that my windows were still intact and that the house hadn’t flooded.  Although the routes to return were mostly blocked, I could still talk to my house cleaner when she was able to come.  Maybe next time (and I hope there isn’t one), i’ll face it toward the window to better see, before I evacuate.

author: Dana
title: Love Alexa
content: I love Amazon Echo Show! Gone are the days of getting my ipad or computer filthy with food when you are cooking and trying to read through a recipe.  Alexa shows you the recipe and scrolls for you without you having to touch it.  She reads you the news, shows you lyrics on songs, and you can make calls with someone who also has the Echo.  I love the Echo Show.  The $229 price was spendy, I'd wait for a sale to get it.  What would make it better is if when making calls or texts the other person didn't have to have an Echo, ideally it would make calls and texts to a cellphone or land line.

author: Denise
title: Love my echo show I can do so much with ...
content: Love my echo show I can do so much with it play music video calls check the weather flights and times in different states and much much more .

author: A. DELOSSANTOS
title: Failing screen - intermittent flickering horizontal lines
content: Just a few months old and the screen or electronics driving screen is failing.  There are intermittent flickering horizontal lines most of the time and occasionally stops for a while.  This seems to be a common problem reading other reviews.  Maybe there was a bad batch of displays, electronics or electronic contacts in summer 2018.

author: Stanley S.
title: Awesome Product
content: This things does eveything except actually cook you breakfast , I love it talking to several family members and can see them at the same time also you can factime them from your IPHONE - AWESOME I love listening to all my music and it connects to my Pandora music files and play allsay and night none stop.  - I recommend everyone should have this in every home being my Mother is in another state I can see her now on the regular while talking thru Echo Show but over all I love it I also control my  thermostat for my home comfort and my ring door bell and my flood light motion cameras also my home security alarm sytemby simply asking Alexa to do so Awesome.  Stan Smith 1-7-2019

author: Matt
title: Waste of money over the echo generation 2
content: Waste of money over the echo generation 2.  You don’t really get anything more from a video chat on this device then you would on FaceTime or Skype and it does not cycle through your pictures when you put it on slideshow mode it sticks on the first photo and will not leave it no matter what you do I have even looked online to research articles and cannot find a solution.  I have also had problems with this device shutting down and I have not had these problems on any of the other echo devices.  Price difference is just not worth it

author: modern shopper
title: My echo show is malfunctioning
content: I'll look on Amazon for a solution to the problem, because of course Amazon readily backs its own products. My Show keeps saying, 'Something went wrong.' That's all it does.

author: Bruce Buckley
title: Echo wins today, but google has more answers to questions.
content: It is a great unit, very responsive to music requests. But still disappointed with the lack of understanding  questions. I also have Google and it is more responsive but echo face has a screen so you can see the words to songs, watch movies, CNN news, and visually follow recipes. You can't do that with Google, I can also control lights and thermostat with echo

author: Able Devildog
title: Can't get it to work with my Smartphone because of some glitch with the password and very poor support.
content:
Setting it up wasn't difficult except couldn't connect it to my Smart Phone so it is practically useless.  Won't accept my Amazon password. Amazon Tech Support says that the password I am using is correct and it works when I open Amazon on the Smartphone. Issue was referred to Amazon engineers who promised they would get back to me in two days. Never happened. I called back four days later and was told it would be at least six days before I would receive a return call. But one thing that was very annoying was that when I tried to log in, I had to prove I wasn't a robot and the test is a very difficult scribble that users have to decipher.

I bought it mainly to use it with my Ring doorbell but if it will not connect to my Smarrtphone, it is useless.

author: Sheila
title: A must have for the whole family.
content: I’m not a big gadget person. I recovered Echo Show for Christmas. I absolutely love it. My kids ask her all kinds of questions and get a big kick out of it. The music portion of it is amazing they danced and had so much fun. Weather and news is good and my little 7 year old called me via Alaxia and we video chatted. He just loved that he could see me and talk.  I give amazon a 5 star rating. You really out did yourself.

author: Jiho
title: Great, but please make Alexa app available to South ...
content:
Great, but please make Alexa app available to South Korea AppStore!!

I got this for my elderly parents who gets lazy answering their phones. Drop in is such a great feature and they don't have to operate anything to answer my "drop in." The problem is, I cannot get my sister to get the Alexa App because she's in South Korea and the iOS app is not available there. It's such a huge frustration (we don't care about language support, we just want to be able to download the app to use drop in!).

I know Amazon is very data driven, and you might say that this is a tiny portion of the users and might get pushed down to the backlog, but PLEASE, just write an email to the Alexa App team and get it available in South Korea AppStore. I know this is just a single tick away for the developer.

author: Richard A. Thornton
title: Echo is the best of the breed, Having said that AI still has a long way to go.
content:
Echo is the best of the breed, Having said that AI still has a long way to go.
Some of the gripes include:
• It gets old having to start every command with "Alexa,"
o Wishlist item:  AI team, please consider something like, "Alexa start listening for a series of commands"; e.g., Command 1, 2 3, etc. Then when finished, "Alexa stop listening for command series" or something to that effect.
• Also, the listening ability still has a long way to go. Perhaps a mic detached from the unit option should be considered?
• Just a thought, how about a real manual? Believe it or not, some of us can and do read. To date, I have as of yet read a theory of operation.
I am excited about the possibilities. Go AI team go.

author: Big Dawgs Fam
title: Alexa on steroids!
content:
UPDATE: NO YouTube support makes this almost useless, we streamed YouTube videos for the kids and it was great because we they didn't get to hold the device, now that YouTube doesn't work, it's really pointless.

Ring.com support is good, but would rather use my phone because I can't interact on this. So unfortunate...

=======

Okay, since getting this, we haven't turn on our Echo again, we love having this in the kitchen. Playing music, videos for the kids, seeing the time and temp clearly. It's great!

Sounds great when playing music, I do with the screen was slightly bigger, but for now, this is perfect!

author: Jason G.
title: Great Value
content: The screen is a great upgrade for Alexa devices - I wasn't interested when first pushed as a baby monitor... but you can ask to play music, videos, etc. The Spot is a must... and if you can benefit from the screen, this is a great one.

author: Andrea F
title: Not a reliable product...very disappointed
content: Ordered one mid-June.  In less than a week the audio didn't work; speaker only clicked.  Amazon was awesome as usual and sent a new one.  New one started having video issues within about a month.  I have to turn off for a few minutes and boot back up usually once a week to let it rest.  This generation just not a good product.

author: Mike
title: It doesn't seem to work as good as the other echo dot or echo plus that ...
content: It doesn't seem to work as good as the other echo dot or echo plus that we have.  It seems like you have to yell for it to work and usually it answers from a different room because you have to talk so load to get it to work.  I like the idea but until it works as good as the others I would wait.  My friend has it as well and he said he has the same issues.

author: Anthony F
title: OK, you got me, I'm an Echo fan ...
content: OK, you got me, I'm an Echo fan now...I have a Dot, now a Show and bought Show's for my Mom and Sis so we can video chat.  :-)

author: S. Sauter
title: Pretty darn cool to be connected!
content:
This is my first foray into Smart Home technology. I think it was the touch screen that sold me. I set one up on the kitchen counter and my kids listen to audio books while they eat breakfast. So far they are halfway through Ready Player One.
I’ve caught my son listening to some weird rap on Spotify and my daughter is always asking Alexa to tell her a joke. Thankfully Alexa keeps the jokes clean because I know she shares them with her 3rd grade class.
I just set up two of the new Amazon Cloud Cams. They were a piece of cake to set up, have great video, and linked seamlessly to the Echo Show. I finally feel like I’ve got a connected home.
My next step is to get some of those voice controlled lights and figure out how to link my thermostat. Then I will feel like Captain Picard while sitting on my couch - “Computer - lights and a cup of Earl Gray...”

author: GrindMyGears
title: It's a Really Big Spot!
content:
The Good: This is a great device in the Amazon family.  I've tried out most of the features and they work well.  This includes watching video, checking the weather, taking pictures, scanning barcodes, sending messages, calling other echo devices, and video conferencing.  I video conference with a Echo Spot and it worked fine.  No major lag.  Picture is super clear.  I also like the reminder feature, as it shows me all reminders and upcoming reminders.

The Bad: The design is a bit clunky.  It's like a weirdly shaped right triangle.  Also, one of the pixels was burned out on mine when I received it.  It's very small, but noticeable.  The list price is a little pricey in my opinion.  One last thing, and probably my biggest issue.  I had some preconception that this would be ipad or Fire like, in the sense that I could choose apps and open them.  No.  Not the case.  It is essentially a big spot.  This is fine, but no Netflix or Hulu so it's a bit disappointing.

The Final Word: It's a fun device to have in your kitchen and as part of your Amazon ecosystem.  Worth it if you can get it on sale or if you are really into all the Echo products.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love me my Echo Show
content: When I somehow had an Echo show up on my Prime, I was quite miffed, because I didn't remember ever putting into my cart. But when it came, I couldn't resist trying it. I immediately LOVED it. The day I set it up, the Show came out. So I sent it back and bought the Show. I love it too. The only thing I like the Echo for better is the slightly better sound quality. But here you get to see videos, news, etc. It's great.

author: Patty T.
title: It's Easier Than You Think
content: I needed to have my son in law explain how the Echo Show works and it was so much easier than I expected. I called Amazon with some questions but I don't think I had ask the right questions. I bought 3 Echo Shows at the Prime Day rate. My grandchildren are on video calls All the time now and they can also call me. Now I can video chat with All of my grandchildren and they enjoy this much more than talking on the phone. My 2 grandsons that live 2 hours apart have enjoyed this and that makes this Nana So Happy. BTW... Once these echo shows are set up Tell Alexa you want to do a VIDEO CALL with _____. That's all it needs because it picks out your names from your contacts. I love the Echo Show.

author: Andre Long-Hart
title: Perfect...
content: I love it so much!!! Great addition to all my other Echo products.!!!!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Try "Alexa, turn these suggestions off"?
content:
You can't get rid of the "Try ...". It seems like I had the system down to just giving me the time and weather on the screen, but now the "Try" is back telling me to do the things I already know that I can do. I was so happy when I found a way to turn off the constant headlines and change the background to a slowly changing slideshow of my photos, but I couldn't turn off the "try" thing. Then the "try" thing just went away and I was thrilled. Now the "try" is back and I'm really frustrated. Still no option to turn it off.

This would be a nice gift for people if it wouldn't drive them crazy.

It is a decent system, but somewhat more intrusive than the regular Echo. It gives you the sense that they're always watching, mostly because the system will react when you enter the room. Sort of creepy. Also, the flashing blue ring isn't as pretty as on the Echo; it's just part of the screen.

By denying me the ability to turn off the "Try" suggestion, I start to wonder if this is just some sort of electronic billboard in my kitchen. I don't need a billboard and you probably don't need one, either.

author: S.S.
title: Alexa has a hearing problem
content:
It's like having another kid in the house; I have to constantly repeat myself.

I can tell Alexa to do something clear as day, and according to the history, she hears something comeletely different.

The device is really cool, and I like the concept, which is why it gets two stars. However, it just doesn't work as intended.

I find myself irritated more often than not when I use this device.

author: Bitchtek
title: This thing is going back.
content: This POS is maddening. I mainly got it to play the sleep videos from Prime Video. Had it over a week and haven't been able to get it to play what I wanted even once. Tech support hung up on me.

author: nm835
title: Alexa who can talk and show - love it.
content:
Having a screen does add another dimension to the Alexa experience.
Particularly handy is seeing full week calendars and weekly weather reports  I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone who already loves Alexa.

author: Al
title: Amazing Device
content: Purchased the Echo Show during the Prime Day sale.  Just plugged it in and answer a few simple questions and was up and running in no time.  My wife and I are still amazed at what a great and entertaining device this is.  Best electronic device that I have purchased.  Highly recommend to anyone.

author: rrubiera
title: Almost great
content: When watching Prime Video it has dificulty understanding requests. It does not remember the show you were watching. If you want to go back to a show it goes back to season 1 episode 1 instead of where i left off.  For Everything else I really like the Show, it complements my Dot well.

author: BC
title: Bluetooth intermittent, breaks up.
content: Bluetooth intermittent, breaks up. Returned and the second one also would not work with bluetooth, linked ok , but signal drops off. My equipment is fine, works with all other Bluettoth devices. Works great if you don't want to use Bluetooth.

author: K Pomaville
title: The microphone is easily distracted by ambient noise
content:
2018 UPDATE!!
I've been living with this device on my nightstand since 2017.... great alarm clock but for the life of me I can't see any other use for it. Amazon needs to get internet videos back like you tube. What's more they need to make it with a mini stereo jack so you can plug it into your stereo! The Echo Show continues to be the worst performing device in the lineup. I own the 1st Alexa (great device) an Amazon Tap (love!!) two Amazon Dots 1st generations (awesome!) and the Amazon Show (Flop!!)
UPDATE: Without YouTube what's the point!! This thing gets worse every day!! not worth the $!! Use non video Echo Devices!!

While some features are made easier such as lists and voice messages...I've found that my 'Show' has a few short-comings.
1. Microphone 1 star; The microphone is easily distracted by ambient noise. Sometimes it takes 15 attempts to get the 'Show' to turn off its screen. it constantly claims not to hear.
2. Screen 3 stars: The screen is excellent for shopping lists and to do lists. BUT if you ask the 'Show' for movies you get a short assortment of  movies Amazon offers a large number of which are 'prime'!!
3. Calendar 0 Stars: If you run an apple phone the 'Show' requires you to turn on apple's double security to use it which makes your iPhone a nightmare to use! So forget Calendars its not compatible.
4. Nightlite 2 starts: The screen is very difficult to turn off and there is no manual switch for it. So unless you like a bright room to sleep in even on its lowest brightness setting you'll have to toss a towel over it.
5. Prime Movies 1 star: you cannot ask it to play Amazon Prime Movies because she'll just say she can't do that.
6. You tube 1 star: if you ask for 'tiny homes' it gives you a short list to choose from and if you come back later wanting to see other tiny house videos 'Show;' will bring you back to the exact line-up of videos; convincing 'Show' to go further is an exercise in patience...better just love re-watching the same videos!
The list goes on from here but you get the picture. A good idea but too many kinks

author: Lori J. Rosendahl
title: It is as advertised.
content: I like it!  I like that for most songs you can see the lyrics.  I would like a better way to let me know there are notifications.  Something more eye catching like the green ring on the Echo.

author: JORGE J GALVEZ
title: I like amazon and I would of love to give this ...
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player I like amazon and I would of love to give this device an "I love it" rating.  First of all, what good is a screen if you cannot watch Youtube? I for one use Youtube to find a how to show on cooking a good meal; Also, how cool it would be to play music videos. Many times "Alexa" does not recognize what I am saying and it gets annoying.  there is also a lack of video skill that should be on the Show,  many of the news it provides you with has no video only sound, makes you question why you wasted money on this device, when you could just use the regular echo. I would NOT buy this until more changes are made, i do not think is worth the 229 price tag it has, and I think this is why they have sales that dropped the price to 160.  Also if for some reason you want to watch a Prime video, well good luck! the interface sucks or none existent ! I really hope they fix this problems and get youtube in this.  And amazon!!!......  Bing? really? every time this search engines finds me a cooking video, it is not playable!  maybe is a way for Cortana to say Screw you Alexa!  or maybe is just the device.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Lack of YouTube now makes this much less useful and pretty much the same as my Echo
content: Lack of YouTube now makes this much less useful and pretty much the same as my Echo. Please get YouTube back on the platform Amazon!

author: Lori Dettloff
title: Met my expectations
content: This product adds to the whole Alexa experience.  I have used it for All Recipe app and loved having it walk me through directions without having to use my hands.  My grandson loves to look at the animals when we use the Animal Sounds skill.  I really wish that I had family you also had a show because it is so easy to video call people.  If there was one feature that I think would improve would be the selection process for movies.  The show can play videos from Amazon Prime video library, but you seem to have to know which movie you want.  I would like be provided a search function.  But all in all, I really love the product.  I had been eyeing it up since before its release so I had high expectations.  I was not disappointed.

author: Wayne Tutzauer
title: Go past the music
content:
Set up was easy and we were having fun with alexa immediately. I like the ability to request songs from Amazon prime spontaneously.

After linking to 2 smart light bulbs for voice control we moved onto sending the audio to a blue tooth amp and speakers in the next room.

author: Chad B.
title: Love love love.
content: Our other echo went out and we had to have another one. Decided to spend the extra money for the Echo Show. Well worth it. We already have cameras hooked up through the show and the screen makes the whole Alexa experience even better. Takes things to the next level. Really awesome.

author: Rosalina
title: Can't be beat
content: I love everything about it. I was a die hard Google home person and didn't want to anything about stuff out there. When my daughter said said she was moving 3000 miles away I knew I needed something to keep in touch with her and my grandchildren on the fly. Found the echo show and haven't looked back since. I just preordered the 2nd generation and I am beyond thrilled. We can keep in touch on the fly. Besides that the home control is amazing! There is no going back for me, this is now an Alexa house!

author: William A. Santini
title: Love the screen
content: We've only had the product a little while, but we already use it all the time.  The screen is very crisp and the music sounds great.  I'm hoping for more apps the use the screen like traffic maps and weather maps.  Great start!

author: Willow
title: I love it!
content: Have only had it for about a month so have not used all the features but using more all the time. I use it with smart outlets for the lamps (alexa turn on my lamp) , tell her my shopping list, look up recipes, have her play sleep sounds,  play games, iheart radio (alexa, play 80's music on iheart radio), wake me up with music or alarm, remind me to do things on time and call people while I am doing housework. I bought it for the kitchen, but like it on my nightstand..so will need to buy another for the kitchen now so I can read recipes while I am cooking- and not have to worry about scrolling with dirty hands...(alexa scroll down).

author: Jeff G
title: Show new firmware not well thought out, with regard to clock font size
content: Amazon recently updated the original Show with new firmware in concert with the release of the Show "2nd Gen".  As a result, the clock and alarm detail font size have been greatly reduced.  For most of the day, and all of the night, this device functions as a clock.  The original font sizing was perfect.  Now you can't read it from across the room.  My microwave oven's clock display is larger than the Show's.  All that screen space and a tiny clock display.  The first Amazon help person I chatted with said to change the font size through the accessibility settings.  Unfortunately, there are no font size settings. The second Amazon help that I chatted with said the new firmware was in "Beta" and insinuated that it wasn't stable. What kind of crazy nonsense is this?  Amazon rendered my functional device largely unusable, unless i'm actively using "Alexa".  Until this device can at least function like a readable clock, I cant recommend this device.  It was fine until "they made it better".

author: Lorelei
title: We put this in our kitchen. It has become ...
content: We put this in our kitchen.  It has become a karaoke dance party for our daughters.  MPR morning news for my husband and ways to remember for me.  I’m not sure we could live without the show now that we have it.

author: Mat Roll
title: Elephants in space Mixed review
content: I like and don’t like it, it’s weird... it has all the features of echo. I wish it had better camera options like tilting or being able to move the mini view of what the other person sees. Power cord also is to short. I have mine on a shelf easy view of my office when I talk with friend she or customers. I did notice it gets really warm after a long video call. One last think I was miss led from a review, you cannot connect all your echos to make one large sound system. Besides that it’s a decent tool needs more built in options, just feels like something is missing, but I prefer Apple FaceTime.

author: L. Parker
title: It was fun and worked great until yesterday
content: I bought an amazon show for myself for Christmas. It was fun and worked great until yesterday. Tried unplugging restarting and now it’s just a digital clock. It does nothing. It’s almost 7 months and old.  UPDATE: was able to to a soft reset and now even the wavy lines in the screen are gone. Hope this does the trick because I love this gadget and they aren’t cheap.

author: Windy Sheets
title: Such fun!
content: I have all of the Alexa toys now. The Echo Show is in the kitchen. I've watched a movie while cleaning. I've looked up recipes. Asked silly questions. Made calls. Dropped in on my other devices. Love the thing. I've only had problems trying to connect it to some of my existing groups and routines. To be fair, I haven't read up on how to accomplish this. These devices are so much fun!

author: M. Sabes
title: Nice display, but not sure it is useful for me.
content: Gotta say that maybe I am just not that much in need of what the Echo Show delivers.  A nice screen.  Like other Amazon Alexa devices, it answers questions well, but the video is something that for me adds too little.  When not otherwise busy, there are hints of what might be fun to ask, but they rotate quickly and unless you are focusing on the Show, pass by so fast that I do not have time to think of whether I am interested or not.  If I am not paying specific attention then if something catches my eye, it is gone before I can quite catch it.  If there is some way to back up, I do not know of it.

author: Michael J. McDermott
title: Whack af
content: Searching the internet is impossible with this thing the only reason i gave it 2 stars is because the video calling works very well but other than that this thing sucks! No netflix, no youtube, no Google obviously because they're beefin with each other

author: Greg
title: I haven't used this product to it's full potential but ...
content: I haven't used this product to it's full potential but, so far I'm very impressed. I own the Echo, Echo Dot and now the Show. Al spread out throughout my home. One would say "I'm impressed with the product.

author: Dave W
title: Get it on sale and it's a greater bargain!
content: I just love the added features on Echo Show...including finally being able to decipher what the groups were singing on some of those hits from the 60's and 70's.  Clear display, great background pictures, and the never ending Alexa always there at your beck and call.  Thanks to Amazon for lowering the price for an extended period of time and keeping the monthly payments feature to pay for their more pricey items.

author: OphirDude
title: An Echo, but it is very full featured
content:
Pros:
1) Sound quality: I am an Amazon Prime subscriber - this allows listening to music as well as creating limited playlists.  For the kitchen, the sound quality is acceptable.  I was surprised to see a song's lyrics pop up on the screen (an addictively fun feature).  Non-Amazon Prime/Prime Music subscribers will not care about the sound quality.
2) Although smaller than a Tablet, the screen is large enough that recipes can displayed; however, the speakers are directly below the screen and "stuff" such as flour can get into the holes.
3) You can play YouTube videos and the video quality is quite good.
4) The power cord is surprisingly long, a very smart feature.

Cons:
1) it is very pricy.  You'll have to decide on getting 4 Echo Dots (with change left over), 2 Echo Spots (with change left over) or 1 Echo Show.  I wanted to see what "Show" is like.  It is difficult for me to recommend "Show" due to the high price; however, I do like it.
2) While a large footprint is to be expected, it does take up quite a bit of space.

author: H Hunt
title: Very capable device
content: This is my second Show.  I like them very much.  I use mine for music and my Arlo security cameras.  I can connect and display my outdoor cameras by voice. They are exceptionally capable devices.  I highly recommend them.

author: Lori Spiegler
title: Great for cooking help!
content: It sounds pretty good, and it's responsive. I hooked it up with the rest of my Echoes In The House, streaming music across the rooms. I'm enjoying adding the visual to the already amazing product. Being able to cook hands-free from reading recipes is a bonus.

author: Brad P.
title: Screen burn-in and downgrade in audio
content:
Purchased the Echo Show on Prime day as a replacement in our kitchen for the First-gen echo.  After initial excitement and benefits, I am disappointed with the overall experience of the First-gen Show.  The good features are the visual cues and the video calling which was the purpose of the replacement.  Video calling works great with other Echo Show owners.

However, there are more negatives than positives.  The first disappointment was the audio quality.  Our echo is in a central location in our kitchen, so we enjoyed the 360 degree speakers of the first-gen echo.  The First-gen echo show has dual front speakers, so we only get audio in one direction.

After only 3 months, the screen started to deteriorate.  Ghost images and reflections would appear under bright text and start to degrade the experience.  Upon talking to customer service and resetting multiple times, the problem did not go away and I even noticed screen burn-in.  The time which is almost always displayed on the screen appeared on dark screens when not in use.

Amazon customer service did determine that the unit was defective and has processed a replacement.  I was disappointed that they would not allow me to pay to upgrade my device to the 2nd-generation model that was just released.  I fear that my replacement will suffer from the same issues as the original and was hoping to upgrade for a better screen and audio experience.

author: Val
title: Issues may turn me to “hey google”
content: It was working for the first couple of weeks and now it is having trouble understanding standing my commands.  I have to turn it off and turn it back on.  It won’t even turn off an alarm.  Won’t stop a drop in conversation.  Very disappointed on spending so much on her.  I have multiple dots and a echo in the household but if these issue persists I may have to look at google.

author: Daniel Baker
title: Bluetooth has been worthless.
content: I had a ECHO DOT and would use it for my alarm in my upstairs.  It would bluetooth over to an audio receiver with dobly 7.1.  I replaced the DOT with this SHOW in hopes that having a screen with the calendar to remind me of what I had to do that day.  Well this thing would not connect to blue tooth besides my phone for a month.  Then it was updated and it would connect but would lose the connection at which point I would have to move my furniture to unplug it and plug it back in because the wire is built into the bottom of it.  Then it was updated some more and that did make it to where I didnt have to unplug it 2 or 3 times a day and it was working better.  Here recently it updated again and now it cuts out really bad on the audio from Tunein and Pandora and I have to unplug the bluetooth audio receiver instead of the echo show.  So I guess thats an improvement?  But the whole it doesnt make sound at 5 am because Im not awake to unplug something to make it "go" still is very unhandy.....  This thing has been about worthless for my uses.

author: BonSue
title: It's a blast and also a comfort
content: How many times can you claim that one device can be both fun and useful? In this item, both statements are applicable. The "Drop In" feature allows me to check up on my elderly mother, who suffers from Alzheimer's disease and lives in an Assisted Living Facility. I can "drop in" unobserved, using the device like a Nanny cam, or I can chat with my mother. The other features allow me to play just about any songs/albums I can think of, or ask any question that may pop into my mind. As a writer, I can also ask for historic dates or facts, so I don't lose my train of thought as I write. The only flaw remains the ability to ask a question in a way that Alexa can understand and offer the correct response, but hopefully, this aspect of the Show's performance will continue to improve with updates.

author: Dale A Malone
title: Defective
content: After about a month of use, the screen started flickering.  Power cycling and resetting to factory settings does not fix. I checked online and learned this is a very common problem. Haven't returned it for repair or replacement yet, but I might just switch to a Google or other device.

author: Imagine
title: I love calling family and being able to shut it off ...
content:
I love calling family and being able to shut it off hands free when we're done!
In addition, it's great in my kitchen for recipes, videos while I cook, or listening to and watching some flash briefings.  Music of course is so much fun to choose a single song or a whole album or collection.  Our anticipation for Echo Show's ability to add more features is on!
I don't like that it goes to sleep while I look for ingredients in recipe mode...

author: Chellie
title: Great item if you do not own any other Alexa/Echo items
content: When I first received the Show it was great.  I also have the first generation echo dots and tower so I was not surprised with having to reword request to help the Show understand what information or display I wanted to see.  Now that the show no longer has access to YouTube it is kind of boring. I have three fire sticks and a kindle fire so we have plenty of access to all that is prime, which is now the main format for viewing anything on the Show.  If I only had the Echo Show it would still be a great tool to have for weather, time, music and flash news updates but these are the same services I get on the first generation items.  If I am going to try to watch a movie or program while at home it will not be on a 7 inch screen!  Over all function and screen clarity is good.

author: Triedit
title: ALEXA SHOW is real easy to use!
content: I have NO complaints. To start with it always has the correct time and temperature outdoors on the screen. You can play Prime Music and watch the Lyrics on the screen and just join in an Sing. It was real easy to setup my WeMo plugs so, Alexa can turn things on and off with your voice. You can add your contacts from your phone with just a couple clicks and make calls to them. Example: just say Alexa call Linda. If the contact has the Alexa App on their phone you can do video to video or just talk like your on the phone.

author: eMCee
title: Great for keeping family connected!
content: We use our Echo Show several times a week to have video-chats with the kids and our 1 YO grand-daughter.  Great for keeping in touch with family.  Wish they had these 15-20 years ago when I was travelling heavily overseas.

author: Linda
title: I love the Echo show
content:
I love the Echo show. It Meets my expectations.  It has a nice size,screen, and speakers are clear and crisp.  I bought for myself enjoy all of what it has to offer.  You can call a person a see them like face time.  It does all echo dot  does but much more.  If you have a prime membership. You can download your pictures and view on your device. It can even take your picture.  It is a wonderful addition added to my home. I have three echo dots as well. You will love to have information, music and pictures at your fingertips. Justing using your voice commands!
HAVE FUN WITH THIS DEVICE. You will enjoy with family, friends. I give it five STARS.

author: Photodan70
title: Sound is great, video is a bonus
content: I love it! The sound is way better then original Echos with the two speakers. I don't see why people knock this. The added feature of seeing your requests on screen are great. I bought a second one at sale price as soon as I played with the first one. I own two originals, a dot and use them all the time.

author: M. Reyes
title: ITS A SAVIOR!!
content: For years I tried to figure out how to make my mom answer the phone.  Bough her a cell phone, a smart watch and a big wall alarm clock to remind her to call me.  I've tried EVERYTHING!  I love the DROP IN feature of this brilliant box!!!!  Just don't allow others to drop in call for security reasons.  Other than that, I LOVE THIS!!!  My daughter enjoys talking to it and making it play her favorite music and videos!!  WIN WIN!!

author: JHaynes
title: Love it
content: Love it, it was a Christmas present and I enjoy it a lot!  I already have an Echo tower in the living room, so I put his one in the bedroom.

author: Cherie
title: Nothing to see here. Keep moving along. 👎🏽
content:
We got this Echo for $100 off on Prime Day and thank goodness for that! There’s very little reason to buy this device if you have another echo. If you don’t have Prime I wouldn’t at all. No YouTube, no Netflix, no video except Prime Video. The only reason to get this is for video and there’s very little video to watch!

To give you an idea of how useless this device is, you can’t even search Prime Video. If you open it you’re given 25 choices. No way to even see what else there is to watch. So you need to browse on another device then go to the Echo and if you’re lucky it will play it for you. Half the time it opens a song or something else instead. It shouldn’t be this hard.

You have HBO? Can’t watch that unless you subscribe WITH Amazon. Forcing you to use their services is money grubbing and very consumer UNfriendly. You have Twitch? It’s an Amazon service so certainly this must work right? Well, not very well. It takes several steps to get to channel you want to watch and it streams Very Poorly. LOTS of lags and Juttering. The Twitch skill is extremely basic (no chat, no following, subbing or anything else. It barely plays.) and a much better experience on a phone.

Nothing on the Show works Well. Most skills work, but with an asterisk. It demonstrates just how poor th Echo platform is in general. After hearing of how poorly Amazon treats and pays its workers especially on Prime day I’m leaning towards completely leaving Amazon. Everything they do works only if you pay for their services and to me that makes it a crap device. Not consumer friendly, poorly working, useless “skills.”

The idea is great, but I can’t imagine more poorly executed device.

author: Kerry
title: I really do love my Echo Show
content:
I really do love my Echo Show.
For me, the best feature is the calendar. I like that it flashes the days "events". Keeps everyone aware of all the practices and after school activities.
I also like being able to see the timers - I use it for cooking a lot.

author: consumeradvocate8
title: Speaker failed within 3 months. Can not plug in external speaker.
content: Amazons most expensive Alexa device  does NOT have a 3.5 audio out jack to allow you to use headphones or external speakers to get better sound. I can no longer turn the volume above 7 without getting distortion from the built in speakers.  I have some excellent speakers but can't use them with the Show because of this deliberate design to limit the Shows sound quality. I know I could use Bluetooth adapter for my speakers  but sound quality suffers and consumers  should not be required to have to use that option when the Shows speakers fail. Will not be buying anymore Amazon Alexa products that force me to listen to what they give me.

author: ac1957
title: This is a great companion for my Echo and Echo Dot
content: This is a great companion for my Echo and Echo Dot. Outstanding quality and sound. However, i thought it would do more. If you do not have 2 of these to use for video conferencing, or if you do not have any compatible security cameras, there is not much else you can do with this other than access your video library and prime movies.If it would fully access what FireTV has this would be a state of the art bedside companion. Hopefully the Echo Show will continue to evolve over time and add more Fire-TV features. Overall, this is a great addition to my home automation scheme. It's like having a really fancy alarm clock next to my bed. LOL. I love it.

author: emily bush
title: Out of the four purchased for my family, only two work properly
content: My mother gave me and my daughter one for Easter so we could see each other as we all live in different states. I then purchased one for my aunt and grandmother.  The one that was sent to my grandmother has had sound issues since it came out of the box.  The one that I received developed lines in the screen about a month after I received it.  I contacted Amazon who told me they would send a label and they would look at it and possibly replace it.  The label has never come and I am super frustrated.  So out of four, only two work properly.  I want to love it - I really do, but Amazon is making it hard.

author: LeapFrog
title: Our family had high hopes for the Echo Show, but we are disappointed in the current product.  It's going back.
content:
Our family really had high hopes for the Echo Show, but we are disappointed in the current product.

The good: Nice form factor, good audio (amazing, actually), screen is OK.

The bad: Our primary use case for the Show was as a "kitchen helper" - to search for, retrieve and display recipes.  Unfortunately, we neglected to read all of the comments for the reviews regarding the few available recipe skills before we ordered the Show - and no matter how nice the device looks it isn't useful if it can't do some of the basics, such as scroll up / down or left / right on a recipe's ingredients list or recipe instructions.  Sometimes when you ask the Show for a recipe it will read back the request and then the screen just goes blank and the audio quits.  On an Echo in the same room the same recipe gets read back without an issue.

Our secondary use case was to be able to "Show Front Door Camera" - all our security cameras run only on our LAN and have private IP addresses.  But the Show (and the Amazon Alexa / Lambda infrastructure) won't allow you to connect to cameras on your local area network!  Another FAIL.

Voice recognition is beyond useless when compared to our other Echo devices.  Even saying the suggested "Ask Alexa to ..." tips don't work reliably.  Either there is a design or hardware problem or the software badly needs an update.  And speaking of Tips, why can't you turn off the useless, repetitive "Ask Alexa to ..." tips on the Home Screen?  And  why isn't there any listing of skills specific to Show-enabled devices?

We'll return this one and wait for the next generation.

author: C. Rinn
title: Older Android Problems
content: I like the Echo Show and what it can do, but I cannot give it 5 stars. I had a lot of difficulty with the setup, and the help site did not address the issue. I tried calling a help line, was put on hold for about 15 minutes, and then a pleasant recorded voice came on and said goodbye. I finally solved the setup issue on my own, somewhat by luck. The issue I had was that I could not get the Show to make any calls. Every time I tried making a call, It told me I needed to register the Alexa app on my phone. After uninstalling and reinstalling three times with the registration process, I gave up on that. I have an older version android phone (approximately three years old). I discovered that the Alexa app does not work with older android operating systems. Nowhere in the setup instructions or product description does it say what the minimum operating system needs to be. Luckily, my wife has a newer iphone and by luck I was able to complete the setup from that.

author: Benny's Girl
title: Yes there is YOUTUBE!!!
content:
Love my new "Show," great addition to our Echo family home system. I dont understand all the negative reviews stating no Youtube. I actually had to go check mine to see if it was no longer accessable. On demand, Alexa took me right to it! I'm thinking people are basing their opinions just by others reviews. I for one love this device and have purchased a total of 4 so far as gifts(from QVC & AMAZON). The display is crisp, the sound is rich and its a quality build. I still use the original Echo tower. These devices only get better with age as they're constantly self updating.
If you're on the fence based on negative reviews, dont hesitate. If you purchase now you have until Jan 31 to return. What have you got to lose?
 Personally, I give it 5 stars and an additional two thumbs up.😊

*Update: ok so I go back to youtube just now and receive alert that its no longer availble. I have to trust that Amazon will play nice and do the right thing so this matter will be resolved soon.
Like I said, I have until Jan 31st to return all four so right now have nothing to lose. As for my fire tv sticks, guess I'll be revisiting those too! Knocked my stars down to three and and no thumbs....

author: Maria S.
title: Great product!
content: I use it to play music, videos, pictures, weather, random questions. I’m so in love with this product, I just wish I could of gotten two since my 19 year old always takes it to her room!!!!

author: Janie Wernert
title: It really works fine and I love the screen
content: I like everything about my echo show. I really like the timer and I use it all the time. I like when they notify my packages have arrived. I enjoy the music and the weather. So far I can’t find anything to dislike🤗

author: Richard Baker
title: Good sound quality from such a small system
content: Good sound quality from such a small system. Wish it was stereo.  Sometimes confuses my requests and gives me the wrong location or wrong station. I like the screen and the visual/written prompts.  I like having the time and temperature readily available and at a size I can't easily read. I'm amazed at the range of information quickly available. I'm sure I don't use all of it's possible features.

author: Lynn H.
title: Video Freezing When Using Drop In Video from Alexa App to Echo Show
content: Really like the Echo Show.  Love the drop in feature.  Great to be able to drop in to assist elderly relatives and check in with them.  Would like to see the Alexa App updated to be able to control Amazon Movies on the Echo Show.  Also having big problem with video freezing when connecting to the show from the Alexa app on Android phone.  OK for short time and then it freezes after awhile.  Since this makes the drop in feature almost worthless and this was the main reason I purchased the Echo Show it's definitely not creating a good user experience for me.

author: Jman911TTS
title: I love it
content: Awesome product, the ability to call up any cameras (Arlo, Nest & Ring) around the house is huge.  Speaker sounds much better than the previous Echo version as well and over all a must upgrade.  Nicely done Amazon!

author: Jimmy L.
title: Doesn’t seem to last very long
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player Just a couple of months in, this resides in the very same spot I hooked it up in, and now just randomly the unit seems to be failing. I had such great hopes

author: Chuck
title: Still learning
content:
It came well packed in a timely fashion. Easy initial set up. The phone "Alexa app" was a bit confusing at first. The phone integration concept still need some work, and I still do not understand if Amazon eves-drops and records conversations per there agreement or if that part is exempt from the policy.  A VoIP would be a nice interrogation instead of requiring a land line or cell-phone. And the contacts import is not user friendly or well thought out!  I would prefer to have a contact list on my cell phone and a different one on the Echo Show. I have to go through my contacts and delete many of them to avoid confusion! I called my mother using the device after figuring out the app on my cell phone. The voice quality on my end was good ( a bit rich in the base) but the connection on her end she describe as sounding like I am talking from across the room in which I was about three feet away from the device.
  It is a great music player using the Amazon music app.. only a few songs that were not available, and I tried hard to stump them.
The blocking of google and U tube is Unprofessional! I really don't mind the google so much but U tube has a bunch of DIY video's that I watch when I struggle with a project. And that is part of the basis for 3 stars. It would be nice to be able to work on learning coding from watching a U tube video instead of switching windows on my PC, or any of the other robotics / IT integration lessons.
The Acoustics leave a lot to be desired.. not the worst but I enjoy a more stereo environment when listening to music. Maybe offering Bluetooth satellite speakers in the bundle and keeping the Echo as a center channel would offer a far more satisfying music experience. It does have decent base tones for such a small devise, but the addition of a front firing sub-woofer would help also. At least as an option for those of us who enjoy the full dynamics of music.

The home automation features I will look into at a later date in time. They are a bit pricey for my budget. When the have a smart coffee maker is when I'll cave in and spend some money in that area.. LOL

author: Fred
title: Happy with my Show
content: I’ve greatly enjoyed the show since I received it. I have found it very useful in the kitchen providing recipes and the occasional show from my Prime account. The sound for music I have found to be very good, not as good as a good stereo system but more then good enough for everyday listening.

author: Gun_Will_Travel
title: Our home got a lot smarter
content:
Just bought our second one - we love these things! Spectacular value, especially if you get the Amazon sale price (roughly $100 off) which comes up every 6 months or so. I use it several times every day:  First, to play the top news stories while I get coffee. Then to play a song or two while I have breakfast. During the day I use it to "drop in" for a video chat (the quality is a lot better than Facetime or Kakao video) with my kids who are home during the summer. At dinner time we use it as a hands-free timer in the kitchen while cooking. We ask it for quick facts, to tell jokes, or to play a music video or movie from my Amazon library or Amazon Prime channel. I sometimes ask it to do quick math calculations. It's also a great digital photo frame.

And we haven't even started exploring the smart home options yet!

author: Fordie McAlpin
title: This is a wonderful product specially if you're keeping grocery list or appointment ...
content: This is a wonderful product specially if you're keeping grocery list or appointment or you just downright want to listen to music it is wonderful no matter what you ask of it it always seems to have an answer I was on three of them honest don't hesitate to buy this product

author: David H. Malin
title: I love this device
content: I love this device.  I bought it simple so that I can have an alarm clock with my Amazon Echo.....and during Prime day for the price you couldn't beat it.  But, I have Sonos and Big Ass Fan lights that I am able to control with this device.  It's perfect and getting better all the time.

author: DRONOZYTE
title: Great step into the futures but......no battery and no browser! Otherwise only FUN!
content:
Hello shoppers!

I got this as a gift and came here on prime day to get two more and found a great bundle of two. It is just a next step in technology for your home no matter what your age is.
I love to use it while I am studying and it makes my life very easy. Let say when I am doing questions and I come across something which I need to wiki, I just ask Alexa " wikipedia xxxxx" and it can visually show you the page or text or read it out etc.etc etc. This is just one thing Alexa can do and having a screen is just a needed feature in today's world.

NOTE: It shows text and not the websites. As of now you can not browse the internet with ECHO as you normally would on your smartphone or iPad etc.

I revised my rating to 4 stars based on the above fact and that this does not have a rechargeable battery and needs to be kept plugged in.

Helps keep you joyful and happy specially when you are by yourself. You can spend hours just asking and playing with Alexa with your voice learning thousands of things along the way.

Can control many smart devices if you have them in your house/apt but this is right where you should start and then buy additional items as you learn the capabilities of this device. Alexa is also improving day by day.

This deal is insane right now and I just wanted to write a quick review for those who are still thinking about this. GET IT before the sale goes away....you will not regret this one (Usually amazon has deals on black Friday and prime day on these).

Have fun shopping.

PS: apologies for any errors.

author: DKim
title: ... because of the touch screen and I am very happy with my purchase
content: I specifically chose this Alexa device because of the touch screen and I am very happy with my purchase. I mostly use it for recipes, the weather/ news, the shopping list and the drop in feature since my husband never answers his cell phone. I am purchasing electrical outlets that will integrate with Alexa so she can control lighting and fans for me. Be aware that Alexa will not work with the Fire Stick. You must have Fire TV to integrate. I am looking forward to additional skills that Alexa can perform from this device.

author: LDHarris
title: Reliable and versatile!
content:
Although I'm still exploring the capabilities of Alexia, the Echo Show hardware is solid, excellent quality and reliable.
I'm able to communicate via Echo Show with my daughter and son who live many hundreds of miles away.

author: M.Fritz
title: Usability.
content: I tried to replace my echo dots with it, but the microphone doesn't pick up my voice like the Other echo (with out a digital screen) does.

author: Michael T MIller
title: Great Alexa Device!
content: Great for music, I have it connected to my Sirius XM, on top of Amazon Music. Shows lyrics to most songs. Does everything else Alexa does, plus video capability via Prime Video! New second generation now out at $229, but I'm still very happy with this one!!

author: R. Braud
title: The screen flickers so you cant see it
content: This could be a great product.  I works just like the other Echo products but on the Echo Show (I have 2), the screens don't work properly.  They flicker and are unreadable.  If they could fix that it would be great product.

author: John
title: Love The Echo Show...
content: So far, so good. Setting this up was so simply and trouble free it was a no brainer. Has all the features the my Echo Dot had and more. I love the fact that this unit hears my voice much better than the Dot did and I have it sitting on my bedroom dresser. I set it up using the "do not disturb" feature at night and I am still able to use the alarm and I turn it off in the morning. I have this plugged into my battery backup so if we loose power, it will still be up and running. Since I just set this up last night, I haven't tried accessing YouTube etc but because it was setup from Amazon using my account info, I didn't have to enter any info other than the WIFI password. That saved me so much time and all my WIFI smart lights and smart plug work perfectly. My daughter has the other unit but hasn't set it up as yet and I purchased another one for her out of state friend so they can chat using the Show instead of facetime on the iPhone. Haven't tried the person to person calling feature yet but I'm sure that will work fine also. Over all, I'm very happy with this product. Thank you Amazon.

author: Brian
title: WOW! Echo Show is amazing!
content: WOW! The newest addition to the Echo family is amazing! Amazon does a fantastic job on ensuring the finished product and supporting software are truly ready for the public to use. We love being able to send and make calls and send and receive texts with the Show. The touch screen is a great addition. It is so convenient to use. Of course we have always enjoyed having Alexa as part of our family, since the original Echo was released. Congratulations Amazon on bringing another great product to market.

author: Tracy L. Ables
title: Continued Issues
content: I've sent back my Echo Show once already because the screen bounces and constantly has lines through it. I've done as product support recommended unplugging, repluggling, moving it away from any other electronics that might be interfering with it. IT IS STILL DOING IT EVEN AFTER SENDING IT IN FOR REPAIR. And now conveniently it doesn't look as if it is any longer supported.  $150 of useless technology. I'm saddened by this, all my other Amazon devices work beautiful :(  And now of course theirs a new edition of this one available.....feel like I was taken for :(

author: Dale Grasso
title: Support???
content: Product is now not working. I have tried to contact Amazon in the past and would at least try and exchange for a working model. In the beginning the Echo did connect with my Ring door bell, but a week later would not. Tried to get help with connecting but there's no one I have been able to find on amazon to assist? Now the screen seems to be going out and only shows a bunch of lines going up and down. I would appreciate a call on an email from amazon so I can see if this is fixable? Everything else I have  purchase in last couple of years has been great. This is the 1st time I'm asking for help please? Thank you

author: Bebes papa
title: But....
content:
It works like you expect it should. Which is very well. But, what Amazon does not tell you is how much data it uses. Ignoring data used in playing music etc. I found it was going through over a gb a day. We don’t have unlimited, so that’s a big deal. Not happy! Plus we didn’t do anything that would use a lot of data like watching videos etc. to late to return it. Dang...

A @zon what are you going to do? Better be something!

author: Larry B.
title: Security for my family and home!
content:
Excellent product, as I have Amazon Cloud Cams in my home which makes it easy to see what is going on at all times. Having the ability to interact with our Grand kids and other friends who also have a Echo Show is really great.
I am hoping that Amazon will soon develop a outside Cloud Cam Security Camera so I can attach several of them to the outsides of my home. If you have Alexa Dots in your home, then you need to purchase this Echo Show as well, as all of these different units  do work well together.

author: Nuke3479
title: Limited use since it cannot play YouTube videos
content: I agree with many others the only value for the show without being able to play YouTube videos is the video phone piece. I currently could not recommend this to anyone due to this issue.

author: Pamela
title: Great but then and redemption
content: Worked for awhile then the screen started flickering but Amazon stood behind product. shipped it off for repair.. back in a week working fine.

author: Michael H.
title: No try Alexa whatever
content: Turned on my Alexa Show this morning and no Alexa suggestion on the screen. I hope this is permanent and not a glitch.  Seriously I could care less what Jabba the Hut weighs and I already know how to say good morning in Spanish.  Great job Amazon. Best move yet. Bought mine at Best Buy so there will be no certified purchase tag.

author: oldhorseartist
title: AMAZON stands behind its products!
content: I absolutely love this thing. And I love AMAZON because my Echo Show went bonkers and all it took was a brief chat and Voila, a new one to replace it is on the way. I was floored when the screen started blurring and shaking and jumping and missing part of its data. Alexa still talked but I couldn't watch movies. SO HAPPY that Amazon is so easy to deal with and makes good on its products without any hassle at all.

author: Scott Nelson
title: Hefty and very well built with excellent audio and video quality.
content: I have echo dots and echos spread through rooms in my home but this is my absolute favorite.  The ability to stream prime video has this positioned right next to my easy chair.  Hefty and very well built with excellent audio and video quality.

author: JR
title: Love it! I have 2!
content: Love my show. Do calls with my parents on their show, video calls when I’m traveling with my wife that’s often better than FaceTime. I’ve watched movies from prime on it when cooking.  Love it!

author: AELee
title: Still not impressed with this. Skills are limited and ...
content: Still not impressed with this. Skills are limited and most of its information is pulled from Wiki. Thank goodness they have stopped the frequency of Alexa commercials, I was so tire of this thing answering every time the Alexa commercials aired

author: Kathy Davis
title: See the above.
content: I now have 3 Echo's and I use them all the time. What is disappointing about the Echo Show is that I am blind and when I ask for Alexa to tell me  her Amazon deals it obviously is in print and she doesn't state the deals verbally. The same is true for asking Alexa to read recipes. Truthfully, I am better off with the other Echo units I have instead of the Echo Show. I would hope that you can make necessary changes to the Show so that bisually impaired and blind owners can hear the information we need instead of having to call a sight person in to read the information on the screen. I subscribe to Amazon music and play lots of games with Alexa. I hope you can help as indicated above with the Echo Show.

author: Tim Hinson
title: Failed in less than 4 months
content: The screen started flickering with horizontal lines to the point of becoming unreadable. A reboot would fix it for a few hours, but would fail again by the end of the day. Rebooting was the only solution Amazon support had. Although still under warranty, there were no replacement models available because it was a 1st generation device. I could only get a gift card for the sale price I paid, so I could buy a replacement 2nd generation at full price. This effectively makes the warranty useless if you buy an Echo on sale. Lesson learned. Time to try a Google Home device.

author: cmrmuniz
title: Excellent buy.
content:
I love that it was easy to set up right out the box. The speaker is awesome.
Plan on getting another one for my bedroom and my son's bedroom juat waiting for the price to drop a little.

author: rhotbutte
title: Device works great, just wish Alexa did too.
content: OK, only 4 stars because Alexa isn't that smart for AI.  The rest of the device is really good.  We use it as an intercom to the basement and the detached shop.  Also using it to control thermostat and lights.  Amazon needs to really, really work on Alexa.  She's smarter than Siri, but way dumber than Google.  Have to admit that Alexa is improving, but slowly.  Still get way more "I don't know or I can't do that" than I think it should.  We put it in the kitchen to be able to look up recipes and have them displayed, but so far Alexa isn't able to do much of that.  We've had to reset the device several times because Alexa froze up and would not respond to inputs.

author: Diana Elwell
title: Perfect gift for grandma!
content:
My mother-in-law is in her late 80's and struggles with technology.  We wanted a way that she could easily Facetime with her grandchildren and great-grandchildren.  Echo Show is perfect!  We set it up by her chair and she doesn't have to do anything!  The kids can drop in via Facetime on their Alexa apps on their phones.  I also set her up with some simple skills and wrote down commands so she can listen to her favorite music.  My mother-in-law loves it!

She said she feels like she is finally part of the 21st century. :)

author: Melissa Blevins Bein
title: Screen flickers! No fix so far...
content: Nabbed the Echo Show a few months ago off the Treasure Truck. Within about a month the screen started flickering. I've tried all the suggestions in the "Help" forums to no avail. Amazon is only offering a partial refund if it is returned. I'd say with the other issues mentioned in the reviews, if you are seriously wanting a smart home hub with a screen, maybe Google Home is the answer. My friend loves his, so that might be my next purchase to replace the Show.

author: D Ryan
title: Not Perfect, But Easily Good Enough to Be Very Worthwhile

author: w.prunkard
title: Not much of a product!
content:
I’m considering returning mine. It’s currently 75 outside, and my screen on echo show says it’s 69. Tried changing some settings, unplugging and restarting and still no change. Rapidly becoming disappointed. Amazon, WHY can’t you FIX THIS?!?!?
Also, upon doing the upgrade, the screen no longer turns itself off, the on again when I walk into the room. Customer service tried, but they had no answer, other than " it myst be the update" that causes this. It's useful as a clock, with annoying little messages of things you "can suggest", but other than that, Alexa "doesn't know that one". YouTube videos are being banned according to what I have read, so forget that feature.
In my opinion, Amazon really dropped the ball on this device! Not worth the extra cash you will shell out just to have a screen that never turns off. If you go on vacation, it would be wise to UNPLUG this device, as it can get pretty warm.
Dropping my rating to one star until this issue is solved.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I like everything, learning more all the time
content: I like everything, learning more all the time! Was disappointed to see it on sale shortly after purchase, my friend had me order him one for $179 and I paid  $229. I really like to get reminders and play so many tunes, also the sound is super!

author: kas9103
title: Yeehaw
content:
I waited two days to set up Show to give myself a reward for working. I read the majority of the reviews already posted. I have no idea why there is even a one-star review.

Setup was a breeze. My Ring Pro screen pops up brilliantly. Nest cameras, too. Played Adele at the maximum volume and sang along with the lyrics Show trickled on the screen.

As far as those who boo hoo over the headlines Show displays, you can give her the voice command of DND. Problem solved. Then, just tell her to wake up.

I followed the simple instructions on how to change the generic photo on Show's home screen. Easy peasy.

Granted, I haven't made a video call yet. Waiting for my folks to get in the game and buy Show.

I'm not a lover of all things Amazon. I bought the newest Fire Tablet but returned it after a week. Show redeemed Amazon.

If yours isn't working, you either got a dud or you're not doing something right.

author: M
title: Pretty cool.  Buy the show instead of Echo.
content:
Read all of the review.

I purchased 2 dots and an echo during the x-mas special deals.  All the Alexa devices take time and patience.  Lots of patience to activate and figure out. I took a star away because it seems just about everything takes a “skill” to work.  Meaning Alexa needs to learn how to work said devices via a “skill.”  The software is not all that.  But what can you expect for 149 (show on sale).  I’ll tell you.

I picked up 3 shows to replace the above mentioned devices.  My family loves them.  Kids love the YouTube availability.  Thank you amazon for resolving issues with google.  That would have been a deal breaker if google wasn’t on board.

On with the review.  I can “drop in” and see what the kids are doing 2 bedrooms away.  You can visually see and communicate with another show or even an iPhone.  However,  one must use the Alexa app on the iPhone and the iPhone caller must activate the “drop in.”  I can see what’s going on outside via camera. Simply ask Alexa to “show me (insert name).”  And viola, I can see the dog via the outside (Alexa compatible) camera. No, it does not work with any camera.
