Just Alexa compatible cameras at about 50 bucks a pop.  I ask Alexa to play “round and round” by Ratt.  And BAM.  Ratt on YouTube. It’s too cool. The show answers questions, makes the grocery list, adds stuff to the calendar. And on and on.  We love it.

With that said.  Most things require set up before they work.  So have someone in the family that is technically inclined to today’s technology available.  If it wasn’t for the wife, the show might have shown itself out the window.  Thank God for wives, lol.

Ending:  the show is a dream once it’s “set up.”  The set up requires lots of...., again....patience. I don’t have it, lol.  However, after the day in setting up and pairing and skills.  The show is absolutely amazing.  Get one.  But wait for a sale.

author: V. Price
title: That having the Echo Show to show me what the next five days of weather will be like is awesome.
content: I love the echo show and all it has to offer. There is just one thing I wish you would consider improving. When I am listening to music at volume 5, which isn't loud, I have to physically press the volume down button then tell Alexa to turn the music off.

author: Dima
title: OK
content:
I’ve bought this device to make video calls with my grandma.

Pros:
Good video chat quality.
Nice design.

Cons:
There are no physical buttons to accept / decline call. (You can do a drop-in call, but still).
Also, device is heavier than I thought.
Contacts are imported from your phone and can't be removed, weird.
Not possible to adjust energy saving settings.
Screen customization is poor, I couldn't remove all "Alexa, what can you do?" lines from the screen.
Only English and German localizations.

author: matt
title: Doesn't perform as advertised.
content: worked great for a couple months, then they forced some update, and now none of my smart home stuff is responding. amazon customer support has been entirely incapable of resolving the issue. they call me about every 2 weeks to keep telling me how they still havent figured out how to resolve the issue. seeing that the device doesnt perform as advertised, I have no reason to keep it. this problem has effected all my other devices. was very excited about all this amazon tech, but in the end it was all just a major let down and waste of money. maybe one day they will get it working again.

author: Dominic
title: Screen Issue
content: Nice concept but the screen flickers with horizontal lines most of the time. Started months after purchase on my original Echo Show and few months after the refurbished replacement was sent. I just received my 3rd Echo Show (I was told it’s new) as a replacement so we’ll see what happens.

author: Jack A. Newcombe
title: Works well with cloud cams
content: I really lilked that the device shows whoever is at my front door when say "show front door".  I am using the RING doorbell with camera, echo show works great with it.  I also like that it shows my Google calendar when I ask for it.

author: Ashishkumar
title: Defective Screens/Device Two times in row
content:
I like Alexa devices in general, particular the echo dots are very much reliable. However, the echo show has always given me trouble - the screen randomly starts flickering or shows green screen while playing news feed. I had to sent the device back to amazon and they sent me a replacement device. Not sure if same device was sent back to me or different but the new device was even worse. It won't even complete "welcome to echo show" video while doing the initial setup.

At this point, I am ready to give another support call to amazon and spend another hour to troubleshoot and send it back again. What a waste of time and money. At this time, I wish they just give me credit to my account for the original purchase price.

author: My account
title: Need more work on video chat.
content: I love using my Echo Show for music, it sounds amazing! Unfortunately the video quality when video chatting isnt great, my husband and I video chat often and his video comes out very clear on my end but he says my image is very pixelated. I'm still learning to use it but so far so good.

author: Lance
title: No YouTube
content: Bought it for YouTube. Now there’s no YouTube. Fail.

author: Lynda J
title: Great room filling sound for listening to music!
content: I love my Echo Show but must admit I need to learn more about what it can do and how to get more uses for it. I mainly use it for music but once the gardening season is over and I spend more time inside I will explore other things it can do like connecting to other devices.

author: Chris DiCintio
title: No HDMI and NO 1/8 jack, good sound.
content:
Very good product, has been able to show You Tube videos, I think that was a problem in the past. If you don't know this play music in stereo, unlike the hockey pucks with the 1/8 inch jack in the back, they will play two speaker mono unless you pair that with the Echo Subwoofer, that has it's own host of problems. So what is good and what is bad, OK I will do my best, first, I wish and hope that I can get voice and all the Echo/show specific features on a larger TV or monitor, it really is not realistic to watch movies or TV on it, even looking on camera would be funner on a larger monitor, which leads me to report that there is no HDMI out, nor is there 1/8 stereo out. I have not been able to find the voice activated features and the ability to simply call out songs or request weather, see lryics on another Echo product and coordinating other technology is impossible, period......
I have spoken to the Samsung Rep. And I cannot get any Echo product to assist with even the simplest of tasks, as far as my TVs are concerned, I own 4 smart 4 k TVs. So what does Echo Show do good, if you have Amazon Prime, and Prime Music unlimited, you can call out nearly any song, even remastered, limited, old songs and Echo plays it, and the sound is very good. I am going to try the subwoofer with the show, which no doubt drive me crazy, if it can even be done. This first generation Show has forward firing speakers, Second generation has side firing speakers, you will see a difference if you are sitting in front of it, not worth double the price, second generation has a larger screen since the speaker grill is located on the side and not eating up valuable space on front. If you are trying to use this in an office to assist with business, all I can say is don't, some features are not present, that you will undoubtedly need, it is what it says it is an assistant that can play almost any song, can set timers, can control smart home, and you can set many but not all preferences. Someone asked me if is worth getting the second generation? I say you can do just fine with a bargain, rather than spend double and more, (I paid 99 Dollars VS 229 Dollars) get the First Gen and save for something else, it is a good performer and sound is surprisingly good.

author: Khaled Elajam
title: Not impressed with the sound quality. regular Echo is much crisper.
content: Tried it for a few days and was not impressed. I liked the sound of the original Echo much better. I returned this one.

author: Jalen's Mommy
title: If you subscribe to all of Amazon’s services, then this device is for you...
content: If you’re not an Amazon prime member who utilizes Amazon music and all of Amazon’s services, you won’t get to experience all that the Echo Show has to offer. Alexa isn’t as intuitive and resourceful as Siri when asked googlable information. She often doesn’t understand the question. She works great for asking the time and weather, using her as a calculator and to set timers. I wish you didn’t have to subscribe to so many other services to fully enjoy this device. I also wish the screen could be used to display a slideshow of photos.

author: Jes Flores
title: Amazing sound quality and very functional!
content:
Bought this on Prime Day for $100 off. Was thinking about getting another echo speaker for my kitchen because I love it so much but saw this and just 😍

Live listening to music or watching TV while I'm in the kitchen. The subscription is only 3.99 for unlikited music and video. I can see my nursery, video call my husband and so can my son if he misses his Daddy he justs asks Alexa to call him! Love seeing the weather and getting cooking tips and advice (comes in handy when I'm covered in juice from raw meat and am trying to remember something!) Sets reminders, alarms etc and shows me everything I need! I'm completely in love!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Letting my child question Alexa instead
content: Overall goal was to further smartisize my home with voice capabilities after linking other devices.  However, it will truly allow me to escape the 50 thousand or more questions my child will continue asking in the immediate future.  My only disappointment so far is that an improved 2nd generation device came out 2 months later before I even opened and setup this 1st one.

author: Paul P.
title: ‘Hunting the horny back toad’ ~ Who would’a thunk?
content: The Echo Show is the pinnacle in my collection (Army? 😃) of 8 different Echos.  It resides on the counter in the bathroom where I shower and prep for the day. In addition to ‘watching’ my daily flash news briefings, I especially love having Alexia play my ‘sing along in the shower’ playlist, knowing that each song will sound excellent as they are played thru the surprisingly rich sounding speakers.  Not loud enough? Or perhaps I’m not in the mood for a particular song?  No problem! I simply call out from the shower, asking Alexia to raise the volume or move to the ‘next song’.  One perk of listening to music on the Echo Show is that you can see the actual lyrics of a song!  “Hunting the horny back toad” and “... burning out his fuse up here alone” now confidently roll off my lips every morning that I listen to my Elton John playlist. 😎

author: K Lehn
title: Makes a Great Alarm Clock!
content:
I actually bought the Echo Show to replace my complicated alarm clock, which was a Bose Wave Radio with a older iPhone connected to it for a better alarm.  As an alarm it's really good.  It's really nice having a physical display so I can see the time, I don't need to ask the device what time is it.  I only watched one video, quality was better than I saw on the video reviews.

The reason the only 4 stars, well I use both Google Home and Echo products in my home, each have their purposes.  The sound quality on the Echo Show is disappointing.  For the size of the device, I was expecting richer base, but instead get this flat sounding music, using Amazon Prime Music service.  My Google Home (original model) sounds better, more rich base, music sounds full.  Good thing I didn't buy this to replace my sounds system.

Overall, for what I use it for, it's great, I would recommend the buying of it if your going to use it to replace your alarm clock.

author: C. Corrie
title: Next
content:
The must-have device  for any consumer who wants to talk to an inept phone tree, but cannot be bothered to call Comcast. This device is good for making calls, if by that you mean that the voice controls are "called in." This blurb under the text box here gives review guidlines so let's do this by the numbers:

"Do explain why you liked or disliked it:"

Alexa is Suri on about 5 fewer lead paint chips. This would not be so bad if there was a way to cut it off and start again quickly, unfortunately there are frequent times where you spend more time trying to get her to finish the wrong task she decided till you can try again, than it would to just about anything wipe off your hands, get to a computer, complete the NY Times Sunday Crossword. Then when you try again what of the mutitudes of things that might theoretically be the culpret, a fan, kid in the other room, music, Gremlins on holiday from tearing wings off airplanes. So based on such little useful information your solution is to try again after calling to the other room to quiet the kids, turn off the overhead fan, avoiding ladders and stepping on cracks and maybe.. maybe you might get a useful reply or you can truly begin to discover precisely why "the definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over and expecting a different result."

I kid you not one of the promotional materials said something like "Alexa show me eggs" or something like that and it comes back with nothing I had multiple people say the very line that was used as a example by Amazon's promotional materials all of us came back with nothing. Why they would have a command for "show me eggs". Oddly enough unlike "Show me eggs" which is as I said given as a example "Alexa show me my video library" does not seem to be a recognized command while being far more sensible... but again its not like it got the answer to the one that was listed but it seems sensible to ask a echo show but it instead gave me local listings for public libraries.

"Do compare to similar products or services and share how long you've used this product."

For calls it loses out to cell phones, landlines, skype, and carrier pigeons. It is odd for example that in the age of everyone having their own line and family cell plans they would go with the single account=single line approach. Conceptually it seems a bit regressive but if that's the niche they can bring back the "party line" with the 2.0 the 3.0 they can just re-brand that carrier pigeon and call it their "Alexa Drone." I think that one would be hailed as the best one to date because it knows 1 command really well "find your home". It may crap on you like the earlier models but at least it gets the task right.

You might not have expected a full on "Jeeves" like experience but you will be disappointed that your digital assistant is "Wooster" in the first act.

"Do identify specific attributes (e.g. comfort & fit of a shirt or the battery life of a camera) and whether they met your expectations."

The best thing about this Amazon product is the Amazon return policy. All product gripes aside their return process is pretty painless at least at the time of this writing.

"Don't include promotional content of any kind or reviews written in exchange for compensation."

Even if that hat tip to their return policy qualifies on some level as "promotion" I think they will let it slide, but rest assured dear reader I am not being paid for this review.

author: Susan
title: Love It!
content: I absolutely love this Echo Show.  It is so handy sitting on my kitchen counter.  I've read the reviews, and I see no issues with it whatsoever.  There are complaints about the screen being too bright...just swipe down the screen and adjust the brightness!  I'm old, and it was easy to set up.  It reminds me every day of my schedule, it reminds me to take my pills, it keeps my shopping list, it answers all sorts of questions, and it's pretty just sitting there with the time, date, and weather.  I haven't used it yet to connect to others, but I can see this as a real 'plus' to contact out-of-town friends and relatives.  If you want to know how to do something ("Alexa, how do I make phone calls?") just ask the Echo Show.  When I ask a question, 'she' answers...unlike my husband!

author: Ben
title: 8-Month Usage Review
content:
I’ve had my Show for 8 months now. I have the echo plus and 3 dots. I love Alexa, but am disappointed in the quality of the Show. The screen - in particular. It started displaying white lines at 4 months and has progressively gotten worse. Now, where the time is displayed shows major signs of burn-in. While having video and images are nice, it’s not enough to justify the cost. (Even if it is $30 more than the echo plus).  It looks cheap and a bit trashy now and have considered just swapping it out with one of my others since it currently resides in the place everyone seems to gather.

It is not necessarily a bad product, just be prepared for it not to look as good several months after buying it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very limited music and video playback
content: Bought this for my wife for Christmas. Incredibly disappointed in the product for a handful of reasons - the main one being video playback is very limited (to Amazon Prime Video only), so attempting to play music videos is futile. I thought being an Amazon Prime member would entitle us to, at least, a music selection, but to get that service is another $7.99 a month.  The Echo's comprehension is also very limited - simple commands such as, "Alexa, play current Top 40 music" will have you listening to Christmas music , or prompt a response of, "Would you like to purchase around the world in 80 days?"  I could go on with a few more frustrations, but simply, I would recommend against purchasing this device unless you're OK with very limited music and video selections - if you are thinking about purchasing the Echo, go with the Dot. It's inexpensive and just as limited as the Show.

author: RLeo
title: Could do more.
content: Wish it had weather radar. Also be able to increase the size of the time displays. Do away with news on display.

author: Jesse Kline
title: The future of social media
content:
Streaming videos on demand, Video calls, plus everything an echo can do!
Love the skill, "alexa, take a picture"
Even will take a four grid shot that uploads to your amazon prime photos were then you can share to social media.  Just hoping they make it easier by making a 'share' option and the pic will go straight from the echo show to your social media of choice.  Then, and only then with this be epic.

author: R.H.N.
title: Nice Idea - Limited Capabilites
content: I had mixed feelings about returning this product, I really liked the display, I was put off by the limitations of what Alexa could do. So I replaced it with a DOT for $29.95 to see if at a later date I can justify the cost to upgrade.

author: S. B. Kim
title: You have no control
content: I was going to use this thing as an internet clock mostly and as an Alexa device.  You can't change the appearance of the clock at all. I wanted it larger, so it is easier to see.  You used to be able to make it a little larger by putting it in Do Not disturb mode, but they took that way recently. The echo functions are fine, the display not so much.  Don't waste your money.

author: Jw
title: You will have fun. Good luck.
content: My granddaughter ( age7) is much better at using it than I.  I sometimes brake out laughing when talking to Alexa (who is very picky about her name).  Overall I like it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Broken screen
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player The screen on this is pointless, starting glitching out before we eve paid in full.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not good enough Amazon
content: Doesn't deliver on the promise of youtube videos which is a significant drawback. Just moved to Europe and Amazon Videos are no longer available, which is significantly dragging down the real value of this product. Amazon customer service is inefficient and incompetent dealing with issues related to echo show. Amazon wants to become Earth's most customer-centric company but it apparently doesn't include Europe, which makes them fall far short of this ambitious objective. Not good enough Amazon!

author: MarkLondon
title: Picture quality on phone calls to other echo show recipients is very clear and I enjoy it very much
content:
Echo show 6 out of 10 times doesn’t understand me when I ask a question. I have 5 echos around the house and they understand me when I talk.  Picture quality on phone calls to other echo show recipients is very clear and I enjoy it very much! I wish there was some kind of limiter on the levels when I listen to different news casts to keep them at the same level as the previous or the following one. I have to keep asking Alexa to turn it down or up.

Cheers, Mark

author: rufus1198
title: I love so many things about having Alexa in the house
content: I love so many things about having Alexa in the house. When I think of something for the store, I can just say add it to the list, I can set alarms, reminders, etc. I enjoy utilizing my playlists throughout the day and the video chatting with others. I can also access Alexa on my phone when I am out and about. There are a few downfalls as Alexa is limited to Amazon. All in all, I am glad I purchased.

author: riley
title: Wasn't all impressed
content: Wasn't all I had hoped it would be. The microphones don't pick up your voice nearly as easy as they make it sound. I find myself having to scream to get it to hear me from not even 10-15ft away. I guess I just had really high hopes for this. It is nice to have for music and recipes.

author: Matthew
title: I was a smart device skeptic and have been holding off on allowing ...
content: I bought the Echo Show as a Christmas gift for my wife. I was a smart device skeptic and have been holding off on allowing such a device in the house for awhile but this thing is incredible. We found that the show is at its best in the kitchen where you can play music, get recipes, set timers, reminders and hands free video chat. We have it connected to an Arlo security camera for outdoor monitoring but can use the Drop-in feature to check in on the house through the Shows built-in camera to see what's going on inside the house when we're away. The show becomes even better with Music Unlimited for only $4 a month. Now we can listen to 10s of millions of songs which inlcude all of the newest releases, create playlists/soundtracks and/or ask Alexa to play her own playlist like "90s HipHop Barbecue" and she rarely disappoints. She recognizes my kids voices and asks for parental approval before confirming their request and the kids love her. Alexa, what was the largest dinosaur? Alexa, play the Ninja Turtles song. Alexa, where is Santa now? It's pretty incredible how the kids are using her and much of the use is educational and informative. Anyways 5 stars, no doubt about it.

author: Dr. Paul G. Schneider
title: Perfection
content: I love it.  I have two of them in my house to work as intercoms and they are much better that the regular Echo.  Also using them with your phone when you are out of the house works great.  In fact, I'm thinking of buying at least one more for the house.  I only wish I could have one in my office, but the wireless network at work won't allow me to have one.

author: E.Ceron
title: great product
content: Gave 4 stars only because in the 11th month some software problem showed in the screen. Thanks to my son who is a computer savy, he spoke to customer service to explain the problem and lucky for me i was a month w away from the expiration of the warranty.  They try fixing it but since the repair did not work, they replace my Echo.

author: craftygirl1961
title: Still needs some improving. Better than expected.
content:
I bought this during the Prime Day deals week at $129. To be honest, if I had paid the regular price of $229, I would have been disappointed and sent it back.
The sound quality is great as is the screen view. I enjoy listening to music while fixing meals in the kitchen. It's great to be able to change songs just by voice.
Video quality is very good and I can watch my Amazon Prime videos with ease. I do NOT like that I can access my Netflix, Britbox and Hulu accounts as well, at least not as far as I've found so far.
I would love to be able to use apps instead of just Alexa Skills. I use the Paprika app for my recipes and it can't be used on the Echo Show. I also don't like having to link an account to use the other recipe apps I am interested in using. It's a pain and a bit intrusive.
I truly wish that Google and Amazon would get together about YouTube. It would be great to be able to view the videos on the Echo Show.
I'm still learning what I can and cannot do by voice. I do use the app on my iPad for the settings as it's easier than the settings on the Echo Show.
Like others, I find the constant stream of try this and try that annoying. I'm hoping Amazon will realize it's an irritation.
The screen does power down and dim when the room is darkened so I may consider moving it from my computer room to my bedroom to use for an alarm and sleep sounds.
My granddaughter was enchanted with the Moshi Sleep skill so I will be using it when she spends the night with me.
I also like using the Flash Briefing Skills. It's pretty handy when I get up in the morning. I especially like the History Flash briefing. I'm kind of a history nerd.

author: Melody Sivri
title: and when playing music it truly has a wonderful speaker! I cannot wait to start integrating my ...
content: I bought one for myself and for my mom to communicate while cleaning and cooking in the kitchen and it's so lovely! I truly adore it, and when playing music it truly has a wonderful speaker! I cannot wait to start integrating my future purchases with my Alexa products!

author: teemcvee
title: Significant Upgrade
content: The Show is a significant upgrade over the Echo. Advantages include displaying song & artists during music play and time remaining on timer.  Also like headlines, time & temp display without a request.  Only downside is integration with Arlo cameras to show people arriving at our door.  Just don't have the right command yet, but will get it to work soon.

author: AR23
title: I bought one for my mother since she doesn’t use ...
content: I bought one for my mother since she doesn’t use a lot of technology and she loves it. She can video chat and listen to music she likes. My dad likes the music and prime movies he can watch on it.

author: James L. Malone
title: The music is my favorite part. Sound quality is very good
content: The Echo Show is a hit. Alexa doesn't have all the answers but she's entertaining. The music is my favorite part. Sound quality is very good. I'm still discovering uses every day. Reminders, weather forecast, and recipes have proven very useful.

author: Vdubs
title: Terrible Tecnical Support
content:
The clock changed correctly to EST, but unfortunately on the home screen my alarm time set is showing an hour earlier than it is actually set for. The alarm does work correctly, but every time I look at my echo show I see the correct time and an alarm set for an hour earlier than it should be.
I have been on the phone with customer service for nearly 3 hours on this, with no resolution.

author: kauna
title: Seeing is believing
content: I love my echo show!  I like looking up recipes and seeing the instructions just like a cookbook.  I ask to see what’s playing in my local theater and I can watch the trailers for any of them!  I like singing along with songs that I can now SEE the words too.  There are just so many possibilities with a visual echo.

author: Nina
title: Wonderfully happy
content: Its great does everything it said it would, i have it in my bedroom. I figure out how to blacken the screen at night, so no problems sleeping, easy set up and interface was fun to opperate. Will buy another in the future.

author: E. C. Dawson
title: Alexa at her Best!
content:
OMG how did we survive without Alexa?
So simple to use, even this Senior Citizen enjoys it.
Having a display is actually very useful.  See your lists, slide items left to delete them.  See your timer countdown, etc
Also works as a picture display of the kids or a fun screensaver of burning fireplace or swimming aquarium fish.

author: Greta Hobbs
title: So happy I bought one!
content: I love this! When it was on one of their truck deals, I snatched one up! I keep it on my nightstand and just love everything I’m able to do with it! The sound quality will blow your mind! Great deep bass!

author: M. ggranville
title: I am sure with time they will add some new skills and features this thing will be amazing. Let me say the drop in feature is ...
content: It's not there yet but, I am sure with time they will add some new skills and features this thing will be amazing. Let me say the drop in feature is awesome! My husband can call while at work I can answer without having to search all over for my phone. We also bought 2 so I can drop in on upstairs or down without screaming up the stairs to each other.

author: Larisa Goldenberg
title: 22 century device !
content:
Not only it delivered as promised, such as being  Videophone, playing video and music and weather plus voice control to my smart house but so much more!
Now my grandson of 8yr old  does not even have to wait for his parent to call me , just says call babushka and Alexa delivers ! My 9 month old easily recognizes me on the screen and huge smile on his face ...
But everyday I dicover something g else new about that unit..
I was cooking on the kitchen so instead of turning my cable connected 19" tv there actually watched Matrix in Alexa then asked her to pause, went into the living room , turned on my fire stick asked for Matrix and to my surprise it is started from the point I stopped it on the kitchen!
Love love every Alexa in my house( all 4 of them) but especially Echo show ! fantastic!!
I think Everyone should have that at home- a must for grandparents! And must for parents with kids so they can "drop in" in every room to peek on the kids occasionally lol

author: Bubble Head
title: So far so good, I have used the Echo Show for basic ...
content: So far so good,  I have used the Echo Show for basic stuff.  I have Alexa connected to my home security system and voice commands are neat.  But, accessing the panel is faster.  I am currently investigating cameras that are compatible with Alexa and my home security system.  My goal is a fully integrated system using Alexa for both voice commands and accessing the cameras real-time.

author: Digital Dreamer
title: I'm in love
content:
Echo devices have become a huge mainstay in my house that I use on a daily basis and I knew this new technology was something I needed to have. Just as I expected I have used this on a daily bass since day one. While it hasn't replaced my other Echoes it has added a different function for me to use. It sits on my nightstand so when I can't sleep I'm able to just turn on videos and watch til I'm tired. The screen doesn't seem too bright and I hardly notice it when I'm trying to sleep.

 I also love the video calls that I'm able to make and I'm surprised at how well this worked. The video didn't lag and the voice was clear, the only issue I had was that I needed more light in order for anyone to see me, that is not a design flaw just my room is darker than I thought. Lol

The sound quality for movies and music is excellent and there's no distortion at all when you turn it loud. So far I haven't had any problems with videos lagging or anything. I did notice that when I try to play YouTube it does tell me that I have restrictions on and to turn them off in settings but I haven't found where that would be. I must be missing it somewhere but again that is my fault and not the device. I still have no problems watching the videos I want so I don't worry about it too much.

I honestly can't wait to see what will be added to this as time goes on. For me, this device is exactly what I expected and I'm very happy with this purchase.

author: Mark A Luker
title: screen flicker
content: Ordered the show and it worked great after a couple of months the screen began to flicker. I contacted Amazon and they quickly repaired the device. I got the repaired one back in Oct and on Christmas day the screen flicker is back and worse than ever. I will be contacting Amazon about replacement if possible but I would not order the 1st gen show again. I hope the new ones are better.

author: Steven G Arzuman
title: Echo show is an excellent improvement on the "Alexa" technology
content:
Echo show is an excellent improvement on the "Alexa" technology. I'm able to have my pictures from my iPhone 6s Plus slideshow on the screen. I'm able to watch movies or shows from Amazon Prime videos, YouTube videos and make video calls.
I find all these functions a wonderful addition to "Alexa".
Also, the on screen suggestions of other "Alexa" capabilities is truly helpful. I will always have an Echo.

author: Steph
title: Could not live without it!
content: How did I ever live without this before!!!!! It connects to all my smart devices and helps me wake up in the morning in much easier way than the annoying beeping alarm!! The skills available make life much more fun to navigate! Play any music just by asking for it, play any movie, get your calendar, call someone, drop in on the pets, get info quick and find out what is going on in the news!! So many possibilities!

author: Bill
title: How could you not Love this? !! Not Possible
content: Hmmm where to start .. I dont have all day but I do a lot to share about Alexa.. I bought several at Christmas time... first cause I love music and Alexa can play millions of tunes simply by asking .. seriously how cool is that? There is so much to say I dont know what to put in a brief review, so I will say the one main reason I bought some for Christmas gifts , I have 1 niece actually I have over a dozen .. but 1 who finally had a baby .. and my sister Mary lives out in Pine Valley  .. in the San Diego mountains and her daughter my niece who lives at the beach, and is the one who finally had a baby.. ok so I saw that Alexa can do video calls .. all I have to do is say Alexa call Lisa and she calls Lisa and I can see Lisa sitting there talking to me .. so I thought wow.. Mary needs this and Annie (my niece) so they can see the baby anytime they want .. all my sis Mary has to do is say .. Alexa call Annie and boom, Grandma Mary can see the new baby  and mommy too.. just by saying it .. didn't even have to pick up her phone, with a nice size video screen too .. that's just awesome .. So Mary and Annie got Alexa for Christmas and the Davis Family too. One funny thing is when I was telling my niece about her gift at Christmas I said you are going to have a new member in your family and they thought I got her a dog or cat ...I could see their relief as I introduced them to Alexa.  Oh Yeah one HUGE reason to have Alexa is emergencies.... seconds can save lives.. rather than finding your phone you could be telling Alexa to make the call. ....

author: Dr. J
title: This is a great device, however one aspect was disappointing
content: This is a great device, however one aspect was disappointing. I purchased the Ring Doorbell with it expecting the front door to show up on the display. I later find that can only work if you have Dish satellite service. We have AT&T. Both the devices, Ring and Echo Show work fine independently, just not together.

author: JL
title: Less than 2 months old & screen is dying
content:
I loved the Echo Show when I got it & I still want to love it. I use it as a bedside clock/device. It controls my bedroom light & fan, it is my alarm clock, it is my sleep noise machine, and it keeps me entertained while I get ready for work in the morning. That's why I'm so disappointed that the screen has started flickering and fritzing out after less than two months. I'm used to my computers/tablets/tvs/phones lasting 3+ years. $229 for 2 months? Yikes, no. I guess I'll be testing out the warranty.

Update: Sent it in for repair. My device was returned "fixed." A month later and the screen is flickering again. I wonder if it's too late to get my money back or if they'll just keep "fixing" it until it is out of warranty.

author: Krista O.
title: Doesn't Respons Most of the Time
content: I have several echo products,  but the Show is awful.  Actually responds less than 30% of the time.  Don't use as alarm clock as it is unlikely you can stop it. I finally put it in basement,  but might as well use it as a paper weight. I am a huge amazon fan, but this product is junk. Stick with the regular echo or the echo dot. Very disappointed.

author: De Best
title: Easy setup
content: Easier than any other Echo to use

author: William Cunningham
title: WOW
content: Wicked awesome - bought 3 - one for my 91-year-old mother in a retirement home and one for my brother's family 800 miles away in CT. The sound is so much better than my phone - that my mom can actually hear better when we talk. Having the drop-in feature means she doesn't have to do anything to talk to us using this technology. And the picture is so life-like, she has asked me to reach through the screen and take something out of her purse -- forgetting that I am 3 miles away in my office. Kudos to great design and execution!

author: Johnny Lippeatt
title: In today's world things like an Echo are a must.
content:
I put this in the kitchen after buying a Spot for the bedroom.  Sound that fills my kitchen I'm impressed.  My Echo Dot is connected to a Bose system in the living room, Echo Spot in the master bedroom having play Everywhere is great.  Connect with an August Lock, Phillips Hue Lights, Fire Stick, Cloud Cam, or a host of home automation products to customize your home.  Using it for calls is a breeze, Drop In on the next room or your parents across town/country, ask the hours of your local coffee shop or stores with traffic status to get there.

A truly life changing device.

author: Minniepearl1
title: Pretty cool to watch a preview of new season series ...
content: Just received this morning.  Set up and updates a breeze,  sound quality is superb.  Pretty cool to watch a preview of new season series of “Jack Ryan”.  Pretty cool not to have to go to TV and search, since I won’t watch the show until evening.  I also pulled up a recipe and liked the touch screen aspect for reviewing.  Also, a $100 off the original price made this an affordable gift for myself!  Looking forward to setting up for other uses!

author: WEE
title: The best version of Alexa yet.
content:
Positives

Easy and seamless to setup.
Stereo sound is bigger than expected, while still being very clear.
Screen is crystal clear and  the ability to touch (or  "show") adds a new dimension of applications.
Voice and video calling are both easy and convenient for communication in large houses.

Negatives

While the design is functional it lacks that refined modern feel of consumer electronics released by competitors.

Otherwise happy with purchase.

author: Jazz and Cocktails
title: Better quality sound than I expected
content:
This is our second Echo. The sound is good, I use our Dot with a Tivoli Audio radio, and this sounds comparable to that setup. The screen is somewhat useful, continually displaying time and temperature. It's a mixed blessing for recipes, as Alexa will find you a recipe for a dish but necessarily the one for which you search. We purchased ours at the sale price of $149, at $229 I might not have plumped for it. The lack of YouTube support is a big negative - I hope the giants can solve their differences.
For some reason, a multi-room setup (Group) required a firmware update that took two days to show up.
As an audiophile what I would like to see in this price range is an Alexa device with a quality DAC, so that I could run a cable into a good amp and speakers.

author: Ron Hutchcraft
title: so amazing! this is the future-
content:
Upon Set Up I Immediately Thought of Buying One
For My Dad Because He’s 75 Now And Lives Far From Me! I Especially Like the Drop In Feature!
The Screen Is Clear And Music is Loud! And I Can Watch Prime Videos From My Echo Show! Definitely
A Huge Fan!

author: K. E.
title: Thank you Amazon!!!! Echo Show far exceeds my expectations every day!!!
content: I thought Kindle was the next evolution. I was wrong, this is the most intuitive device Amazon has developed. You'll begin learning how to use it from the moment you unpackage the device. Have trouble with technology? No worries, as Echo Show will help you along and tell you how to ask what you're looking for. Prime Music, shopping, local weather, news, audio books, videos, etc. etc. etc. - Take the chance, you won't regret a minute you spend with this beauty.

author: Maria
title: I like the product
content: I like the product, it works great for me. I wish it knew more stuff. But I ordered one for me and one for my in laws who live in another state and the show came to their house registered to me. My cousin had a heck of a time trying to figure out how to reset it. It also does not come with an instructions more than 2 sentences. So trying to help elders with their echo show across the nation is hard. I'm not sure how to video call yet either.

author: Jeff lindstrom
title: often misunderstands also answers when not spoken to
content: This product would seem to be great but many times must repeat commands to turn on lights several times and often misunderstands.. worse yet often answers or talks in response to my talking and seems to be offline doing something at 2am like some auto updates and responds sorry something went wrong this needs to be a stand alone device for the money and work though my WiFi and not the internet

author: Agnus Hoffsteder
title: Very Happy with Purchase
content: I purchased the 1st generation Echo Show at a closeout price at Christmas .  We actually love it!  So far I have learned that it takes selfies and shows our front door from our Ring 2 doorbell.  The screen resolution and clarity of videos is excellent.  Still so new that I haven’t discovered all it is capable of doing.

author: J. V. Rieger
title: Awesome Product!!  Works Great!!!
content:
This item works great, we use it all the time to listen to music and communicate with my wife's parent.  I would buy this product again.  The sound is very good and fills the room it is in.

UPDATE
The Customer Service Review Team/Tech Support came through and is helping us with this product.  Although the troubleshooting steps were not successful it did rule out some things which helped determine it is a hardware problem.  Amazon is sending a new unit as soon as possible.  I will update this when we get the new unit and the problem is remedied.  I have upped this from one star to four stars, I like the product, just not the current one.  Thank you, Stephanie, at Amazon!

author: Amazon Customer
title: 5 Stars X 100
content: I gave this to my parents for Christmas and it is an awesome product. I use mine to call them every now and then and it comes in real handy. There are several capabilities that I have not been able to try out yet, but eventually I will get some add-ons for it such as a security camera that links to it. I now have a first gen Echo, Dot and this Show and it's great having this one since they can now connect to each other.

author: Riley
title: Great
content: Best addition to any house hold! We use this everyday and even the kids go crazy over it. My daughter has even watched a movie on this before. We got it half off and I was thrilled!

author: Kathala
title: Pretty Disappointed! Ok I Am Upset
content: I have been an unbelievably huge fan of the Echo since before they even existed. I went on the preorder list and waited almost a year to get in that first run and I have been hooked ever since. The Show came out and I was showing everybody the pics of it and just always talking about it. My mom bought me one for my birthday on Dec. 8th, 2018 and I was so excited . I went home and turned it on which now made for my 5th echo in my house and the music was so much louder and it had bass and was amazing. But within about A week all the sudden I  would ask it a question and it would be offline and the light went yellow and a different echo would answer down the hall showing me the signal was there. Then after a while it would light up when I said Alexa but then it would sit there and just have the blue light blinking like it was listening but it was locked up and unless I unplugged it it would stay like that.  one time i let it go for an hour just to see and it never came back.  So I will never say I won't use my echo or i will never buy another one but when I called to see about returning it I did not get the experience I have come to know with Amazon. The lady never could understand that It wasn't  a broken device.  It was a defect straight from the start. When I put it on my dresser it never moved again. No way I hurt it. Then she said I could send it back but I had to pay the shipping or something. To be honest she was extremely difficult to understand. So here I am with probably the most excited I have been when receiving an amazon product and its a total dud. But being thats its a present I don't have the funds to ship it back and go get a box and all that. Never would have imagined I would have to. But I have a dot 3rd generation I just bought a while back and that one is awesome!  Really wish this one had been to!

author: M. Ericson
title: Good quality
content: Great picture but smaller than I expected. Try "Alexa open fish tank" to get a beautiful video screen saver of a salt water fish tank with many types of fish. Can't wait until a friend gets a Show so I can try a video call on it.

author: Bheru Gandhi
title: We love the Echo show
content: We love the Echo show!  My sister has one as well so it is always fun to drop in on them and vice versa.  The intercom functionality is great as well.  It can play our prime videos so when we are in the kitchen cooking, it is fun to have an episode of a show or movie playing.  Is is a great product and so far we are enjoying it!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Awesome!
content:
This is an amazing device, made even better by the video feature. It's awesome to talk to someone who also has an Echo
Show and be able to see them as well.  The only downside is the occasional frustration when the Alexa doesn't understand a question/command. I'm hoping there's a learning curve for Alexa and it will become "smarter" over time.
Overall, it's awesome!

author: Joshua Wise
title: Alexa is good but still has some bugs
content: I didn't expect it to be so thick but also I was expecting the screen to be a little larger than it was but overall a pretty decent product.  Sometimes Alexa has issues listening and there are somethings that Alexa says to do this and then you ask her she doesn't seem to get it on the first time or sometimes at all.  Asking Alexa to open amazon movies or amazon music are not commands that Alexa seems to act on.  Still need to check out the video conferencing/calling function yet.  I like the tap into other Alexa products and then home automation you can do with it.

author: Tim Jaquez
title: Works great, reason not 5 star is it will not ...
content: Works great, reason not 5 star is it will not play music everywhere along with the echos I have.  It is awesome for my dogs to drop in on so they can see me and I can speak to them!!

author: J Puryear
title: The Amazon Show is great fun and easy to use
content: I  liked that the Show was easier to set up than the Echo I purchased 4 years ago.  Setup took less than 5 minutes! The larger screen is awesome and it is nice to have the words to the music playing so I can sing along.  Also having the time and temperature on the default screen is a nice plus!

author: Gail
title: Who needs CDs?
content: My Father's Day present from my daughter.  Love it---the variety of music, the sound quality, the convenience of quick answers....  Always thought people who used them were ridiculous.  Guess I am one of them now.

author: Larry R. Putt
title: Love it the Show hate the shipping quality.
content:
The Echo showed up with cosmetic damage to the left lower corner and it was obvious it was damaged at the Amazon warehouse.  I say this because the Echo box was also damaged while the shipping box was not damaged at all.  The damage was enough that I almost shipped it back.  Seeing that the functionality was okay I decided not to go through the hassle of sending it back.  We are talking a quarter size gouge though, something they should have caught.

As for the Show itself I love it.  Alexa is better than Siri and I love all the things that the Show can do.  Next sale I will get a Spot for the bedroom.

author: Tim
title: I need a few more
content:
I love my Echo Show!  I have one in my kitchen and one in our bedroom.  I love to being able to also see what is going on with my timers and  and other visuals.  I can't wait for Amazon to develop more things that take advantage of the screen.

I've been an early adopter of Amazon Echo and have the original echo and an army of Dots.  These things are fun.  My kids ask endless questions and listen to music all day.  My only gripe is only one Echo can stream Amazon music at a time.  Even if I pay for the premium music package.

author: JonFo
title: Absolutely Fantastic
content:
As the proud owner of an Echo and 3 Dots, I wondered if we really needed the Show. I couldn't be happier with the decision to order one. Sleek design and easy to set up made me happy right away. We decided to place it in the kitchen where the Echo was (moved Echo to master bedroom, moved that dot to office...). I love the display and the sound. I love the scrolling suggestions at the bottom as well. It's a little hard to remember all the commands for all that the Echo offers. Scrolling lyrics, very cool. It brings up my Nest camera's and Ring doorbell wonderfully. These are two things I was thinking may not work well but they do. Tried out the video Phone call, yep, it worked perfectly. Oh, the background images are beautiful and uploading pictures from prime photos was a breeze.
If you are a fan of the other Echo devices, you are going to love the Show.

author: For What It's Worth...
title: "Things to Try" phrases on home screen cards can't be turned off
content:
I was given the Echo Show as a gift.  I want to give it a 5, but there is one feature that drives me nuts, so it's getting a 3.  If you look at the first couple photos of the product you'll see near the bottom of the screen [Try, "Alexa, what's on my calendar" or Try, "Alexa, show lyrics"]  These tips to "Try" CANNOT be removed.  They rotate at whatever rate you choose and the settings, but they will never go away.  So if you think you will have this really cool piece of technology sitting on your kitchen counter with a beautiful photo of your kids, dog, lake view, etc....  Just picture Try "Alexa, play Teen Jeopardy!!" smack in the middle of that photo.  It's like having a constant commercial.  When emailing Amazon customer service about the issue (which having now Googled the issue can see it has been complained about since 2017) the response I received was:
I want to inform you that currently the "Things to Try" phrases on home screen cards can't be turned off. You can reduce how often they appear on your screen by turning off continuous card rotation or removing cards from the rotation.
I've taken it as an improvement factor and forwarded your comments as feedback to our Alexa development team. They will look into this and may come up with the best possible solutions in the nearest future. Please extend your patience and co-operation while we work on this.

That said, if that doesn't bother you, then it's a really fun device.

author: PilotSteven
title: Very nice video screen added to an already nice device.
content: I got several at one time for family members as an upgrade to the old Echos. Adding video has been nice for information like recipes and song lryics. The video chat is one of the better quality ones available right now.

author: DigitalAlien
title: Former Happy Customer
content:
(review based on the regular price of 229, at 129 I'd give this three stars)
Update- lowered to two stars due to loss of YouTube and lack of any new features since launch. While I was initially pretty happy with this, the fact th at Amazon is having a stupid grudge match with Google affects customers negatively. One of the best uses of the show was watching you tube. Buying this at launch has only taught me one thing: don't buy any Amazon products at launch. They will ultimately lose features and be way cheaper soon enough.

Original thoughts-
 I have had an echo dot for about a year now and love it. This is basically that with a screen so I assumed it would be even more awesome.... So far.. I was right! I've only had it since launch but my first impression is well... I'm very impressed. I bought two of these, one for me and one for my mom, so she could easily do video calls with the kids. I actually think the drop-in feature is pretty cool. There is so much more I wish I could do with this, like use it as a surveillance device (which may be possible? Likely if it isn't it will be in the future) I have lots of smart devices and being able to control them via Alexa is in general pretty cool.
One complaint I do have is when using this with my Arlo cameras, it is a bit slow to show them and sometimes they don't come up and I have to ask again. (This could also be an Arlo issue not Alexa, not sure)
Bottom line, this is a really cool device. I am sure you could nit-pick the crap out of some things, but really there isn't any other device that does what this does all-in-one so it does what it does better than anything else available.
(oh... I wish I could have Alexa ignore my 4 year old. LOL)

author: Laura Lee Lamer
title: Its been a load of fun and I am thinking about getting one for livingroom ...
content: It was a christmas gift that I never expected. I am learning how to talk with Alexa...how to say things in her language ;).. Its been a load of fun and I am thinking about getting one for livingroom and kitchen.

author: D. Conner
title: We use it all the time for video calls with ...
content: We use it all the time for video calls with our family, but no YouTube makes this way less usefull.  The answer is combine Google assistant and Amazon Echo that way development resources could be combined.  That would corner the market and give end users a common interface.

author: Love to Read
title: ... me at Christmas and I use it everyday and love it.
content: My Grandson purchased this as a gift for me at Christmas and I use it everyday and love it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Get a 1st generation echo for each room
content: Sound not so good. She doesn't hear us all the time, like generation 1 echo. Screen is neat concept, but really isn't worth it. Probably why they are on sale. Get a 1st generation echo. Sound is superb.. Get one for every room and play music everywhere. You'll be impressed

author: Brooke
title: Alexa o the next level
content: I was at a friend’s for the weekend and met the Amazon Echo Show and decided I needed one. I am not disappointed. Alexa will show me my cameras outside, does all the controls my Echo Dot did and more. I’m very happy with this product and am learning more about what Alexa can do.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great for none technical elderly-allows my in-laws to "facetime"
content: I purchased 2 Alexa Shows right after they came out for my sister-in-law (62 year old living in nursing home with limited use of hands and essentially bed bound) and mother-in-law (86 year old living in assisted living with no technical ability). In order for my in-laws to talk with each other it involved having the nurses bring a phone to my SILL, make the call and hold the phone while my SIL to speak to her mom. My MIL does not drive and lives 14 miles from her daughter, I live 2 hours from both. For my MIL-she had to call the nursing station and get someone to take the phone to my SIL.  I purchased each a cheap cell phone to get them a cell phone #. I keep the phones (they do not have to stay charged to work).  My SIL runs through the nursing home WiFI, my MIL runs through the assisted living WiFi. Having the Echos where they can "facetime" each other every night has made a tremendous difference in their lives.  My SIL can "call" me on my Alexa app. I have an account set up for my SIL to watch movies, request books (she can't hold the books) and to listen to music.  It has given her a lot more independence when she is in the bed and consequently reduced her anxiety level. I also have the ability to "drop-in" on her.  The nursing home has used "super" Velcro to attach the Echo to the wall by my SIL's bed so that it is at the correct angle.  I would highly recommend it for elderly who don't operate cell phones easily so that they can "face time" with family members through the app.

author: Operational Necessity
title: I don't use it much because I can't get it to do anything.
content: When I am talking to it - I'm usually telling it to stop doing what it's doing.  Do I want the news when I'm trying to go to bed - nope.  That's probably what I tell it to do most is turn the screen off as it's too bright.  Most things I ask it to do I get back "Hmmm, I don't know that one."  I guess I need to learn how to use it but I don't really have a use for it like I thought I would.  "Alexa, can you send music using wifi?"  "Sorry, I don't know that one."  Seems like an easy question.

author: KendraK
title: Love her!
content: Love her!  And, yes, every once in a while she does something weird, but don't we all? She's offered us "karaoke" entertainment more than a few times, gives me my morning weather and news, excellent timer capabilities...  One thing I would enhance is the "routine" functionality - let me have more flexibility in customizing that.

author: cww1950
title: The next logical step
content: It has all the conveniences of the Echo with the added feature of video calling to those who also own an Echo show.  Speakers seem to deliver better sound too.

author: Guy Stickney
title: Speaker rocks
content:
Ok the sound quality of the show is amazing. We sync it up with the echo and dots and the whole house is filled with music. Its also nice when a song comes on you can see the lyrics, and sing the correct words.
Alexa still has issue with certain words and it may take 3 or 4 tries to get what you want, but real happy so far

author: Lisa
title: Life made better..
content:
I bought this for my dad who is 83 years old. Got one for me and my son too. My brother has the app.  Daddy loves it! He lives about 3 hours from us and this enables him to "visit" us anytime he wants. He can talk face to face with his children, grandchildren and greatgradchildren without having to learn something new. He just tells Alexa what to do.  He smiles all the time and actually is "dropping in" when he rarely picked the phone up to call before. Another bonus..hes hard of hearing but has no problem with the echo show. He can hear and see us clear as a bell!
 I get something out of him having it too  (besides the joy of seeing him enjoy something so much!)...piece of mind as I can check in on him to make sure he is okay.
He's making use of other aspects of Alexa as well due to the on screen prompts. He loves playing "his" music. All he has to do is ask.
When I am able, I plan on getting everyone in the family one so Daddy can "visit" all of us anytime he wants.
Thank you for such a wonderful life enhancing product!

author: BAZ-man
title: Rotates too easily, volume steps are huge. Getting boring watching the slow flips. Haven't found much more than Echo
content:
Display rotates *extremely* easy, so touching the screen is chancy.
Bass is boomy/muddy, overall volume can get loud.
Low volume levels have large steps. 3 is more than enough in the kitchen. 2 you can barely hear, 1 is for sleeping, at night. 4 is quite loud. 5 I can hear outside !!! I haven't tried 9 :)

author: Joe Hysong
title: BEWARE Not Compatible with Youtube!
content: I received it as a Christmas Present I wish I would have read the reviews before opening!!! Beware No Youtube this product is good if you have cameras around your house to view what might be going on somewhere but as a tool to use to learn music or kitchen help it is worthless, NO YOUTUBE NO Good Rating Bring it back I will change review.

author: Michael Wengert
title: Almost perfect
content: This unit is awesome.  It does just about everything it is claimed and more.  I use it to monitor my elderly neighbor lady who is 94 and for whom I am responsible.  Only two things so far keep me from giving it a total (five stars) thumbs up.  First, due to disputes with Google... YouTube videos are no longer available on Echo Show.  Second, the narrator hangs up after less than a full chapter of any of my Kindle books and reverts back to the begining of the current chapter, making it almost useless for reading Kindle books.  If neither of these problems bother you, then I recommend the Show as being far beyond anything Google has to offer.

author: Rose-Hermance Rony
title: Great Addition to the Echo
content: I Love my Echo Show. I love the song lyrics part of it. In the classroom, I had karaoke day with the students and they love it. I use it in the morning to read my calendar, the weather and traffic info. I am a big fan of Amazon and their products. The only regret I have is not waiting for the second generation to have the big screen to watch some of my Prime TV shows. It just means that I need to save up to add one more product. I highly recommend the Echo Show.  I was among the first customers to own the Echo 1st generation trial and so far, any new product just makes the line better. This is a purchase you won't regret.

author: Venica Pompey
title: No YouTube!
content: I really haven’t used it much because I bought it to watch YouTube videos while cooking and did not realize amazon had lost its usability. I’m not really happy with that 😒

author: Anata Mc
title: Get Echo 1st Generation and let Alexa talk to you!
content:
I received the 1st Generation Echo as a gift! I was so excited to get it but afraid I didn’t know how to set it up! OMGoodness it basically sets it self up. I turned it on and the Echo told me what to do! Love asking Alexa questions! She doesn’t know everything but she knows a lot! She even tells me jokes!
I hope to get more accessories soon.

author: Gigi
title: I was disappointed that I can't play YouTube
content: I was disappointed that I can't play YouTube.  It was one of the reasons I brought it.i may send it back.  I can watch YouTube on my Echo TV stick don't need the show.

author: MStutz
title: Love this product! Very useful for family who’se elderly or disabled.
content: I love this product!! I like it for many personal reasons. One of the main reasons I purchased it was so I could check in on a disabled family member who often doesn’t answer her phone. I purchased one for each of us so I can video call or drop in on her to make sure she’s ok rather than having to drive there. This tool is allowing her to stay in her own home a little longer. This technology has been amazing for us. If she falls or has a problem and can’t get to her phone, she can use her voice to call us or call for help!

author: Liz
title: Love my Echo
content: I love my echo show! We moved from NC to NY and this is a great way for my mom and I to still see each other. My husband purchased one for me, and one for my mom for Mother's Day. My kids love talking to their Nonna and being able to see her. They also like asking Alexa questions and hearing her responses. It's also great for playing music while cleaning, checking the weather, and hearing the news. We are considering buying one for my father as well.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Why do I need this thing?
content: I honestly I have no idea why I need this thing. My kids gave it to me for Christmas, and I’ve been trying my best to use it (just to make them happy) for the last couple of days, but really I don’t want it.  It’s actually annoying. The screen keeps flashing all this useless information, (“ Serena Williams to play Roger Federer!!!!” ~ So what?!)  and I don’t know how to turn it off. It also keeps running stuff like, “Ask me a question”.  I don’t need to ask her a question. I can ask my phone or use my iPad for that. I don’t play music, I can’t watch tv on it, It’s just a bunch of crap I don’t care about. What does it do? I Guess I just don’t get it. My kids keep telling me, “ Mom, play around with it. You’ll get the hang of it.”  So, yesterday it told me a joke because I figured, “ ok. I’ll “play” with it.” Seriously? What a waste of time.

author: liz
title: The quality of the video chat is really good and works with my iPhone
content: Oh my goodness -- I can't say enough about this device.  My whole family LOVES the echo show.  The quality of the video chat is really good and works with my iPhone.  I love watching the news on it in the evenings and I also love that I can access shows from Amazon Prime.  I cook a lot so I love having it with my in the kitchen.  My kids always play music from it and I haven't found an answer yet that Alexa can't answer.  My daughter wanted to make brownies the other day, asked Alexa and up pops the top rated brownies on the internet with stars by them and all the instructions. I honestly didn't think I would like this as much as I do.

author: Amazon Customer
title: She's sorry, she doesn't know that.
content:
Like: audio quality, speaker volume control.
Dislike: Alexa can't find anythingn What's especially frustrating is she can't find music on my Amazon Prime account, even when I set up a playlist.

author: Andrew W. Fischer
title: Really love my Echo Show and all the functions it performs
content: Really love my Echo Show and all the functions it performs.  I got two with the $100 off and sent one to my adult children living together in Arizona!  A fun way to connect with them.  Would love to see picture sharing from the Amazon Prime Photo app that I use to store my pictures and hope that is being developed soon!  Have stopped watching the network news and can sit back, relax and have Alexia find the news that meets my schedule, without all the other noise from the media!!  Looking forward to seeing where this device takes us next as I think the options are limitless!!!

author: SC
title: Awesome
content:
Hoping that it will become comparable with Kuna and Wemo cameras in the future. Isn't working with my ADT cameras or thermostat 😥. Also hope eventually audio will work with Ring products also. My husband has vision problems and hope a larger screen might be offered in the future.
I love being able to view our ring floodlight camera with having to deal with my smart phone. Also like having my calendar for the day on the home screen.

author: FromThereToHere
title: works fine
content: works perfectly, but I WISH the "news" scroll items were not SO VERY VAPID. I don't know who Jason Moana is, and I don't care that he's drinking beer and whatever else he's doing. I can't figure out how to change the scroll to more ACTUAL news items. The only thing I can do is get a CNN audio feed, but that's NOT what I want.  How do I change/customize the scroll stories? So the 5 stars are for the electronics, but I would give the "news" feed 2 at most.

author: Kari
title: Awesome but could use a tweak or two
content: love it but bought a privacy thing for the camera so i don't feel like some one is watching me sleep lol. They should definitely add more sound / music options for the alarm settings. Having Alec Baldwin yell at me to wake up  is disturbing

author: Steven
title: Echo-- Even better with a screen!
content: I love it!  Here's why,  Its nice to see calendar events on the screen instead of having to ask for them, and the weather ends with a display of the week, nice.  Still waiting for radar weather maps though.  Playing my songs with lyrics is pretty good deal too, and I don't have to ask who the artist is, I can just glance over at the screen.  The best feature is the always-on screen with tidbits of news stories which reminds me that Alexa is right there for me.  When its just a black tube, sometimes you forget it's there and don't use it as much.  Alexa is the same quality, quickness, thoroughness, and can hear just as well (which is VERY good!) however, it does not have 360 degree speakers so sounds perfect from the front, but not as good from the back--not enough to cut it  a star, but was kinda of used to the echo sound from before.  I don't use the drop-in feature much, only to annoy my dog--but it works great.  I wonder if this could be programmed to be a security device in the future?

author: Jmr
title: Beware of random, unsolicited commercials when the device is not in use!!
content:
Purchased about 6 months ago. While we originally would have given this device 4 stars (it does not connect with our Arlo cameras, as promised, most of the time we attempt) our opinion changed this evening. All was quiet in our house as we were getting ready for bed. Randomly Alexa starts some sort of video music, which turns out to be a commercial for Esquire. We were not in YouTube, etc. The device was quiet and not in use!!

Amazon if you continue to play random, unsolicited commercials you will render this equipment useless and it will go straight to the trash can.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Never Use It--Just Sits on My Counter
content: My husband bought this thinking we could communicate with my mom who lives two states away. Only problem is--she didn't want it, and now our Alexa literally just sits on the kitchen counter collecting dust. I've maybe asked it what the weather will be today like twice; other than that, nothing. Also, one time we were playing a board game as a family, and Alexa just chimes in creepily and says something even though we didn't ask her anything. We were all freaked out.

author: Steve
title: Nice upgrade from non visual Alexas.
content: I have owned the non screen versions of Alexa for years, but having visual abilities changed everything. For instance when playing music it shows the lyrics while the song is playing. Another nice feature is its ability to connect to my Arlo camera system. I can simply say "alexa- show me back porch" and I get a live view of that camera. This is nice for when someone is at the front door, i can simply ask Alexa to show me the camera view and see who it is. Nice when wanting to avoid solicitors. I am still learning alot of new skills with this new video version of Alexa.

author: CoolBoomer
title: Huge Improvement, Nice Camera and Calling Features
content: It's a huge improvement over the Dot but the sound isn't quite as nice as the full size Echo, which I was hoping for. It is a lot of fun though, and the text display for some of the results you get when asking for info is great. They have really improved Alexa's info-fetching skills and we have her getting scores for all kinds of college and pro sports.  I have the Invoke with Cortana, and the Google Home, and they all have their shining moments but the Show's screen is the selling point here. It goes on sale from time to time if you watch....

author: Jennifer L Simons
title: Love it but needs more access to Netflix and online content
content:
Purchased this on QVC on their 5 easy pay terms for $48 a month with free shipping. Just got it yesterday and really impressed with the audio speaker volume since I’m hard of hearing. I have to ask Alexa to turn the volume down. The video quality is very good, looks as good as my expensive flat screen TV.
It has so many features, can connect by wi-fi or Bluetooth. The ap is a little confusing to use on my iPhone, but that’s probably just me. Have only been using iPhone for a few months and don’t find it as user friendly as the android phones and tablets I’ve used before.
I would have given 5 stars, but decided not to yet since I just got it. Also, you used to be able to watch Netflix on them but they’ve taken that away.
I use my tablet in the kitchen to look up recipes while cooking and the Show will only let you view allrecipes.com. This is a bummer also. Limits my use and still need my tablet in the kitchen to get on line recipes.

author: Teri
title: NEEDS UPDATE TO BETTER PERSONALISE THE HOME SCREEN
content: I bought this for the sole purpose of “visiting” with my new grandson. It does work well for that. But I HATE that I am unable to turn off the Ask Alexa line on the home screen. I don’t want to ask Alexa much more than the weather forecast. If I want to play, the app gives suggestions. I don’t care why dogs dream. I don’t need to know if Alexa speaks Klingon. Especially if the suggestion is blocking my grandson’s face. PLEASE give us the option of turning it off.

author: AmazonMan
title: but I am a bit disappointed in the fact that the unit does not provide ...
content:
I upgrade my original Alexa unit for this screen version.  The sound does provide a bit more bass...but I am a bit disappointed in the fact that the unit does not provide a "constant" screen visual of what you are listening to (e.g., news reports).  In fact, only a few broadcast systems or news reports offer any related visuals....and those that do are very limited in length before the screen turns off.  As a kitchen area device, I was hoping for a visual unit to coincide in full length with the verbal aspects of the Alexa/Echo platform.

One irritable note:  This unit has demonstrated (over time) that it fails to receive verbal commands when it is in playing mode.  I think this may have to do with the deeper bass associated with the speaker system.  It does not easily capture lower voice tone commands.  So, unless this item is positioned in the complete open (void of walls or household items) then voice commands will have to be repeated to carry out commands!  This was not an issue with the original Alexa/Echo units.

author: JBC
title: Lots of issues with first generation, hope the second is better!
content: I purchased back in June, 2018.  Device was great for a couple of months.  It then developed lines on the screen, reminded me of old tv's when you were trying to tune them in.  I got a replacement sent out.  It wouldn't turn on.  I got a new power adapter, replacement still didn't power on.  Contacted support again and got a replacement for the replacement, it was good... for about a month then it went off and wouldn't come back on.  Tested the adapter with a multimeter and it had the correct output voltage.  Contacted support who wanted to have me buy a new adapter that they would then refund me for, nope.  I was done with this model of Alexa Show's and not real certain how I feel about trying the new one out yet.  If I were you, this model might be cheaper now that the new one is released, but just spend the extra and hopefully they have worked out the kinks.  I am a huge fan of Alexa and own various Alexa devices as well so not just a hater:)

author: Pat Ryan
title: Echo Show is a Disappointment (at least for now)
content: "Upgraded" to the Show from the Echo. The original Echo had performed flawlessly and we had become quite accustomed to using Alexa for making lists, getting the weather, streaming music, operating the thermostat, etc...all the skills and more coming available all the time. The Show has been a big disappointment so far. Non responsive sometimes, very delayed response sometimes, overall just bad. We contacted customer service via the Alexa app who ran some diagnostics and determined we needed a new unit which arrived in two days as promised. New unit - zero improvement. All the same issues. And our wifi system checks out fine and all other smart devices work flawlessly. Some research indicates it may be an Amazon server issue that may be resolved over time. We are patient and we will see if that is in fact the case. For now its a big THUMBS DOWN.

author: JesseOklahoma
title: Works great I bought this Direct from amazon
content: Works great I bought this Direct from amazon, and I have got to tell you, This item Echo Show and Echo Plus is the best item I have ever had and I am kind of a tech geek. I am a disabled person, and it helps me turn light on and off, and schedule doctor appointments, using google voice phone, and get my medical rides to and from hospitals, plays music on cue from multiple web apps, and watch videos, as well as communicating to my Nurses aide my schedule and calendar of events. I wish there were programs that helped disabled people get these and smart lights. They are literally the best items since chocolate to assist the disabled and literally anybody else who need them. Although the echo show is not a hub once you set up the Echo plus hub with your lights you can use any amazon device to shut the lights off. Thank God, no more working my ass off to turn on or off lights. Thank you Amazon. I will save up enough money to buy more gift cards from Affirm.com to purchase 1 more of each and some lights for rest of the house. Jeff Bezos these are awesome items and because of your allowing me to get amazon prime at a lower cost due to disability I was finally able to buy these items on your prime day event. really helped when all you earn a month is $672 on SSDI thank you all again.

author: Peter Q
title: Clock font size change? Why of why?
content: Loved my Echo Show, however, this past week, the font size of the clock display has shrunk considerably.  Prior, at night I could wake up, glance at the display and easily read the time of night. Now, the font size has shrunk so that I need my glasses to tell the time. What happened recently?  I can’t change the font size.  Help!

author: smegma11
title: It works to display my camera's, but without YouTube, it's not worth what they are pricing it at.
content:
I love this thing. I had just ordered another Dot when I saw these and I was lucky enough to catch it in time to refuse it and get the $100 off special and order 2 of these. Mine didn't work right when I got it, I couldn't change the wake word with the app and even the Amazon rep didn't catch it until he read the directions on his scree. You change it on the Show screen, not the app. The other thing that was messing up was I was getting garbage on the screen instead of text. It would say stuff like <screen. "size= etc. It turned out it was quiet a few update behind and under setting there is an update switch to hit.
After that all is good. Looks like everyone is still learning. The only problem is the speakers are still as bad as the ones in the original Alexa. The mid-range of horrible and when the volume is over 6 they sound like garbage. The good thing is you can hook them up to a Bluetooth speaker and get better sound. It's hard to believe it's something that sounds so bad cost over $200.

Update: As most of the other newer reviews show, the Show has lost it's access to Google and of course YouTube. Since it's lost half it's use, I would start pricing it at $99

author: Roy T
title: Was great for about the first week but now never use ...
content: Was great for about the first week but now never use it!! It just sits there and listens to us which is more than my wife says I do so at least somebody listens to her huh?!!

author: carol kupcha
title: Easy to install
content: Easy to install. Easy to use. It is so handy for music, information, ordering, notification when packages are delivered, recipes, set alarms and reminders and  the list goes on. Love it so much we bought 2 of the Echo Dots to put in other rooms. No problems setting those up either.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I am glad that there are hints that show up on the ...
content: I really didn't know what to expect with this new Eco Show. I  plugged it in and the unit powed up. I am glad that there are hints that show up on the screen because I never had anything like this. I  began asking questions and it would answer them.
