I have been using it for a few recipes  and to find out the weather forcast lately. The space it takes up is not as bad as some people say. But >  suppose if you don't have to much counter space it could be a concern.  Overall. It is very interesting and could be helpfull.

author: Meg
title: I love this thing
content: I love this thing! I already had two of the echo and one dot first generation but this Show is so awesome. I'm still learning what all it can do. You can do face time calls from the show and watch movies and so much more. I purchased the echo connect and hooked my phone up to the devices. When I want to make a call or send a text I just tell Alexa to do it. I also connected all of the lights in my house and the thermostat. Now Alexa turns the lights on and off. One little word of advice: don't buy the Emerson thermostat. The Sensi app is terrible and won't connect to the internet for me and reading the reviews it seems to be a common problem with it. I'm waiting for a new thermostat to arrive.

author: Rick and Judy DeLano
title: Do not purchase “refurbished “ from Amazon.
content: Ordered this as a refurbished to use with security  ring/door system. It arrived today, and there was no sound. I worked with customer service, and still no sound. This was a good deal. But returning, I would have to cancel, return item, and then purchase this echo snow again. Alas, that meant instead of around $100, that it was over $200. Such a deal!!  I think that my other Alexa product did not want this Alexa in our home, so back she went. Plus the Ring system order.  Yep, too good of a deal, to be real!! Lesson learned

author: Matt C
title: A MUST HAVE FOR ANY HOME
content: I have a lot of smart home devices in my home. It works great with all of them. I like the ability to see who's at my front door with the ring doorbell. Only takes a few seconds to show up on screen. Works good with my Arlo cameras also, but it takes a few seconds longer to pull those up. Does everything my Echo Dots do but better. Speaker sounds great too. Much better than I thought it would be. They just updated these things so now you can have multi room audio!! That is a big plus. I've been waiting a long time for them to do this, and it works flawlessly. I have 3 Echo Shows and 5 Echo Dots and now I can hear my music in almost every room of my house, or just a few rooms if I choose. You can set up multi room audio and create rooms you want to listen to music in and the just tell Alexa to listen to "artist/song/playlist" downstairs/everywhere or whatever rooms you set up. Best thing to happen to all of the Echo lineup. Thank you Amazon for this update. Going to buy a couple more Echo Shows for other rooms of my house now. And the drop in feature is great too. No more yelling upstairs at my wife to bring something down with her. Just drop in and ask her now. Awesome products.

author: sued
title: Fun and functional
content: I just wanted it for the clock and to ask it to convert measurements for cooking but am having so much fun with it.  I use it exclusively for music and radio and looking up things I am not sure of.  I haven’t even gotten it hooked to phone and tv yet but can’t wait.  So easy to get working too.....didn’t even have to call my kids to help!

author: KC
title: has great sound!
content: I do like my echo show the only thing I don't like is the constant streaming at the bottom  of "Try Alexa" thing  and that we can't remove it!  I did communicate with a  rep and they said at this time there is no way to remove it. You put a nice picture on it and that things runs through it and ruins it!  I think we should have the option to remove!  so for that you get 4 stars!

author: Sarah Martinez
title: Dear Amazon: Your customer service has become dreadful!
content: Bought this from “Amazon warehouse”, and upon setup, it would not link to any of my video subscriptions. I contacted amazon customer service techs, and the rep kept me on the phone for over 76 minutes “troubleshooting”. He made me go through the same restart steps over and over again. He then contacted Hulu on a 3rd party call, insisting that my sub service must be restricted (despite the fact that I have 3 additional echo show devices in my home that play my Hulu perfectly) Hulu confirms my sub wasn’t an issue, and then the amazon rep suggested I return the device and allow their tech team to “service” the unit. (2 week wait on that) I literally just bought and received the device two days prior to this issue...but the rep insisted that my warranty expired over a year ago and he could not accept a return. What?! How did he not know after being on the phone with me for over 75 minutes and having all my order history in front of him, that this device was purchased just days before the call?? All of my amazon devices are less than 2 months old! Long story short, he finally came to the conclusion that amazon sold me this unit from their return center without it being serviced from defects that prompted previous owner to return. He advised that it’s basically a hit or miss with the warehouse, and sometimes the defective units slip through the cracks. After over an hour of my time and no viable solution, he then approves a return (which should have been done within the first 2 minutes of my phone call). I ask for an exchange for a working unit and he tells me that I must wait a week to be refunded and then reorder again. It was an epic customer service FAIL. Time is precious, and for most of us, time is money. The most logical approach to this situation would have been a simple exchange/return. Why should I have to wait for amazon to receive the confirmed defective device first? Did they suspect I would try to keep both devices, despite one being non functional? Ultimately, these Alexa devices cannot be used without amazons approval, so I really don’t understand their logic. Solid, reliable Customer service is more  important to me than even the price of the product I’m purchasing. I am spending thousands per year on amazon purchases and memberships and Alexa devices- at minimum, I would expect amazon to be capable of resolving issues like this without burdening me as the customer, and making me jump through hoops. Their overall customer service has become cold and not at all reliable. I no longer purchase from amazon with confidence, and am considering scaling back on memberships and purchasing all of my “convenience items” from them. It’s just not worth the hassle of losing hours of time and weeks for a refund/exchange- it’s simply dreadful.

author: Kelly S.
title: I love my little echo dot
content: Not as impressed as I thought I would be.  I love my little echo dot.  Pricey for the features.  And since it promotes amazon you think it would be a bit more affordable.  I would buy them for family and friends.

author: Ron
title: I would not suggest it to friends and family to buy!
content: Although it’s connected to the internet, but it will not search the net for the answering the questions! It would be better if it did more, the price is way to high for just a box with the screen that doesn’t do much! It  has already forgotten that we own it, because it’s so useless!

author: debera albertson
title: What's the point of having it when i have to always check my app? Seriously considering google.
content: Alexa is always good for a laugh. You ask her a question and half the time she will give you" I don't know that you will have to check the Alexa app" but however Google will tell us.  Amazon needs to up their game so they can at least be equal with Google. I can ask the same question and I will get the correct answer from Google, and the exclamation did most often I will have to check my app. What's the point of having you if I have to always check my app? Seriously considering google all the time

author: Bill Vincent
title: Our household loves Echo!
content:
Love, Love, Love it.
 It does so much. Love the timer that you can watch on the screen, set two timers with a specific name for ea one, like set a pizza timer, then set a 2nd one for another item. Echo set a timer for pizza, she will tell you  the pizza timer is done. Set a remember for Friday at Noon about my doctor app. Echo will tell you about your doctor app.
Love the time and temp on the face, always there!
Play songs and the words are on the screen! so great.
Bill

author: Phyllis Volkmar
title: Glad I purchased however.....
content:
The Wyze cameras are having a problem.  The skills app for the cameras continuously search or "wait".  Very seldom do they connect.  I have disabled the app and deleted the cameras a few times to no avail.  The Wyze cameras are the main reason I purchased Echo Show.  A second fault is no YouTube, however I can go to YouTube on the desktop.

After receiving the Echo Show, I now rely on it to listen to radio stations, music, check the weather, ask questions (sometimes silly ones), etc.  The speaker is amazing and much better than my desktop!

Would I purchase it again?  Yes!  I am hoping the Wyze camera skills app will improve soon.

author: 18xvanity
title: "The higher ups in technology are working on it... we'll let you know when it's fixed" ***Update - Returned product
content:
0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player At first, I was the biggest fan.  I ordered two; one for each of my homes so I could drop in to double check the Nest Cam movement notifications. So again, at first, the Echo Show was great.  The speaker is more along the lines of the quality of the original Echo- much different than the Echo Look and the Echo Dot. The screen was gorgeous. It was just novel and neat.... that was in January.

Fast forward to April... my screen starts flickering on one of the devices... I wait on that for a few days then am annoyed, so I make a help inquiry on the Alexa app and am told it's a software issue that has been resolved.  Great, that was April 20th.  We look good for a while.  I wish I had the records on that so I knew how long the "fix" lasted... because the flickering came back with a vengeance... on both devices.

So I make another help inquiry via the Alexa app on May 5th. I get an email response telling me to call customer service... which is the last thing I wanted to do.  So I put it off for weeks because I figured the answer would just annoy me... I waited until May 20th actually... and I wish I would have never called. When I told the representative the screen on both of my Show devices was flickering, their response was "It's an issue on our end. The higher ups in technology are working on it. We will let you know when it's fixed."  I just hung up the phone.... I got these devices on sale (which now they seem to be on sale all the time?), if I had paid full price, I would be even more annoyed.

If you're looking for an Echo device that's fine for listening to music but has a different form factor than the traditional Echo, go for it...  Even the drop is feature is fine; the camera works on the device even when the screen is flickering- which was great to check on the house at 1:30 am when there was an notification the garage door was opened and no one was at the house...  If you want a reliable device to actually show you an image... wait or order it and wait for the disappointment.

**July update... logged into Amazon to make a new complaint as I've been waiting 3 months for a fix.  Noticed that the item was eligible for return... So as of July 11th, 2018 my return has been processed and these neat annoyances will be out of my life until I am certain that there is no software issue... because taking the software release back to April would have clearly been too much work for Amazon.

author: Bill Riemers
title: Better than anything in Canada
content:
This is fun reviewing a product, I haven't actually used.  I purchased this as a gift for my mother in the US.  Overall, I have to say I'm very impressed.  This is much better than any echo product available in Canada.  But setting it up for her was a pain in the neck...

This is well beyond her abilities to set-up, as she doesn't even own a smart phone.  We had her try a smart phone, but she could not read the screen clearly enough to use it.  So instead I had this mailed to my sister that set it up for her.  Then she received it when visiting for Christmas.  Overall, it worked well at my sisters house.  The problem became later when she got home.  Because my sister had set up the echo with her phone, it thought she was still at my sisters house.  It seems there is no way for someone to remotely update the configuration, short of a VPN tunnel on their phone.  I next time I visit I will need to correct her settings, until then it is not working correctly when I call her, because it will ring my sister's house.

author: Ernesto
title: Two Stars
content: too manu bugs, unable to connect via calls and message with other echo show and echo dot contacts.

author: Austin
title: Love it
content: Alexa integration works very well

author: Steve Saxenmeyer
title: Warning - YouTube is again not supported. I bought ...
content: Warning - YouTube is again not supported.  I bought this for my son a month ago knowing it supported YouTube and he would be thrilled.  Gave it to him for Christmas and we set it up today.  “YouTube” is not supported it says when requested to open YouTube.  A quick google search revealed an ongoing disagreement with Amazon and Google.  It was the single most reason I bought this for him.  Will return.

author: Evangelos Pikoulas
title: Flickering picture not good!
content: The screen flickers every now and then. Very annoyingly distorting the image. Reset just helps for a few hours. Otherwise Alexa function works well.

author: SamuelRiveraPhotography
title: Our household loves the new addition to our amazon smart home family
content: Our household loves the new addition to our amazon smart home family, I gave it five stars because we love it but one thing Amazon could change is making it a little smarter. A more fluid conversation would be nice, like follow-up questions. I feel like I always have to say the wake word and reword my questions.

author: Rayla Freeman
title: echo show works good but cant really connect with friend and family due to contact app issues
content: So they work good if you can get them to connect with who you want, the weak point is the fact that you can only contact your friends or family if they show up in alexa app and my alexa app is filled with business contact and no way to remove from alexa app to make room for who i actually want in the app. Tried amazon customer service but no help except to rename my contacts..They need some serious rework of alexa app or google will eat their lunch.

author: kod55tun
title: Won't play music you already own
content: Amazon is trying to lock you in to their products, so if like me you have over 100 gigs of music that you've already purchased (but not from Amazon), you will either play it on some other device OR go around your elbow to defeat Alexa's "Amazon of the highway" programming. Thanks Amazon (that's sarcasm btw).

author: BC
title: Great accessory to video doorbell and other video accessories.
content: Super convenient with excellent speaker. We utilize for the kitchen. Great for recipes with ability to see video and hear audio. Easily pause with voice commands. Links extremely well with other smart home products. Very pleased.

author: Brad Bentley
title: Great Product
content:
This is my first Echo product and I like it quite well.  There are some things that would make it even more useful, but Amazon has done a good job so far with this product.  It recognizes my voice commands easily and responds right away.  Here's what I've used it for so far...
1) Shopping List - "Alexa, make a shopping list."  "Alexa, add milk to my shopping list."
2) To Do List - "Alexa, make me a to do list."  "Alexa, add clean car to my to do list."
3) Adding products in my Amazon Prime account to my shopping cart.
4) Playing music.
5) Reminders - "Alexa, remind me tomorrow at 10am to wash the car."
6) Calendar Events - "Alexa, make an appointment on Tuesday at 12pm.  Lunch with Kora."
7) Alarm Clock - "Alexa, set an alarm for 6:15am, Monday through Friday."  By the way, the screen will go dark after the lights are out and will dimly display the time just as an alarm clock would.
8) Timer - "Alexa, set a timer for 10 minutes."
9) Weather Forcast - "Alexa, what is the Forcast for today?"
10) Math - "Alexa, what is 127 plus 534 minus 12 plus 82 divided by 3 times 12 squared?"
11) Playing movies
12) Looking up a recipe.
13) Seeing who is at the front door via the Ring doorbell.

So... As you can see, just a few days into owning the Echo Show, it's already getting a fair amount of use.  I'm happy with it!

author: Jerry Tomic
title: Alexa has a lot of neat features!!!
content: Works great - from controlling my home functions to playing radio stations; it does alot.  My recent use is using it for video calls and telephone calls because it frees up my cell phone

author: Daniel
title: Echo Show - Black
content:
Definitely a cool product but I hope a few updates will make it better.

1. It would be nice to use at least a few features while not being connected to the Wi-Fi instead of nothing at all. Like the calender, timer, current reminders, making list, & setting an alarm if using it at the bed side. We don't always have it connected because it hogs the Wi-Fi even with 100mb.

2. Wish it had a optional built in calender instead of having to load a personal one. But having my personal gmail, it sends reminders to my phone.

I might be missing a few things but other than that we really enjoy it. The speaker sounds great, it runs smooth and some of the skills you can add are nice.

author: Personal Account db
title: Echo Show a Family Friend
content: I had low expectations because of Amazon "Haters" saying the screen would ruin the experience and simplicity of Echo.  Actually it brings some enhancements that allow the Echo to be even more useful.  I love the dropin feature with the built in camera.  I have it in the kitchen and can see my family and interact while I am at work.  Also, when a song is selected from Amazon music the lyrics are on the screen, and we do Karaoke!

author: QueenB
title: Scratching My Head
content:
So, the Echo Show has left me scratching my head.  I have only had it for a week but I am left wondering ... WHY?  Why is the Echo Show and what does it bring to the table?  It is not better than my Echo.

Where does the Echo Show fit into my home?  It does not support YouTube so placing it in the kitchen to watch how-to cooking videos is out.  I could replace my clock by my nightstand with the Echo Show but the speakers are not powerful enough to project into the bathroom while I shower.  The little bastard also does not pair well with my iPhone.  If I am listening to a podcast or Audible and get a text or email the subsequent notification *bing* stops the streaming.  Silence follows.  And it will not accept my phone number in SETUP so I cannot initiate or receive calls.

Now, I CAN listen to music and watch the lyrics slowly scroll on the screen.  Totally worth $279, right?

Nope!

Note also that there is an annoying flash announcement on the screen.  I have no idea why it drives me crazy but it does.
- A BOY DOES NOT GET SPECIAL SAUCE ON HIS BIG MAC.  Ask Alexa, "Alexa, tell me about the boy and his Big Mac.
- A KANGAROO DRIVES A CAR IN DOWNTOWN DETROIT.  Ask Alexa, "Alexa, tell me about the driving kangaroo."

Unfortunately you cannot customize the screen except for a background photo.  Otherwise, you see what Bezos wants you to see.

Do not get me wrong.  I love my Kindle and my Amazon Prime account and I could not live without Alexa.  I have setup a smart home via my SmartThings hub with several Echos and I am in heaven.  I just have no idea why anyone should spend $279 on an Echo Show.  And, hey, why was I so excited that I bought two?

But maybe I am just missing the point?  *scratches head*

author: AndrewW
title: Great for working out on the elliptical!
content: I wanted to give 5 stars but in general, I’d like to see more touch interface developed for this device. Like a similar interface to FireTV. The Show was hard to get used to but quickly pays off after learning how to get/find what you want. Example: if you do a search it uses Bing and shows you tabs of search results. Searching the entire web and you get flash card results...seems rudimentary at best. But behind those cards, I know there is a lot of opportunity for updates. I mounted this thing to my elliptical to make my work out experience a breeze so I could push less (iPad) and talk more to get shows and content. You can Bluetooth your iPhone and play podcasts over the speakers, it is great! So great, product release - but there’s room to grow.

author: Craig
title: I cant answer the phone with it like id like to
content: its kind of neat. I cant answer the phone with it like id like to. set up was prettyeasy

author: Phinikey Phil
title: It worked fine for one day
content:
It worked fine for one day, then locked up and would not respond to any command.  I spent 1hour with a customer service rep and .5 hrs with a tech specialist (only after I finally requested one).  The told me to send it in for repair.  I asked could they send me a new one once they received the current non-working one. They send no I had to send it back for repair.

That dampened the gift giving effect​.  Now I wait to see if they can fix it.

author: Clifton B Atkinson
title: Screen has issues.
content: As soon as the return period on this Show ran out, the screen started having issues.  The blue line from when you call Alexa first started bouncing around at the bottom of the screen, then it started disappearing.  Now it dances around the entire screen, making the screen useless for viewing videos or for dropping in.  I will try to see if Amazon will replace it but because the new model is now out I don't know if they will.  Besides I would rather have the new model.  Not sure if they would give me much of a trade in on my old one, as it don't work properly anymore.  Besides the defect with the screen during the warranty period, this product has been great.  Now to see if Amazon will trade it in at maximum value due to the fact that it's only issue is a problem that should be covered under its warranty.

author: daniel gaylord
title: Absolutely love it! I got this as a gift from ...
content:
Absolutely love it! I got this as a gift from my work without having much knowledge of what Echo is or why I would want one. Turns out to be one of my favorite devices that I own! My favorite features include:
- setting sleep timers: when listening to music at night, all you have to do is say "alexa, turn off my music in 45 minutes" or whatever amount of time. works flawlessly.
- listening to music: the speakers are amazing, and amazon music has an incredible selection
- looking up recipes: just ask alexa for a recipe that you'd like to make, and she brings up a great selection
- doing the dishes: when you're in the kitchen doing the dishes and want to switch the song, it's as easy as asking alexa to play the next song, or turn up/down the volume without getting your wet hands all over it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Screen jumps, not stable, and can’t seem to get technical support.
content: Just got this a few months ago, screen keeps on jumping and have to reset it all the time, asked for help and can’t even get a response.  Terribly disappointed with this.

author: Monalisa
title: It is GREAT to see the news cast and photos run
content: Love this .. Especially since now I have it connected with my Zmodo cameras ... I can tell it to show me a certain room and it does ( for instance it can show  my front porch if someone comes to door ) Also the tidbits that run across the screen are very helpful !

author: Michael
title: Doesn't work!  No Amazon tech support!
content:
It worked for 1 day!  It connects to my WiFi & shows update on the screen, so I know it can reach the internet, but Alexa says it can't connect.  I've spent a lot of time searching but always end up at Amazon's FAQ or troubleshooting guide which are worthless because they don't list my problem.  I love my other Alexa enabled devices but this just doesn't work.  I just wish I could find any real Amazon tech support.
Amazon please contact me, I just want to get it working & then update my review.

author: Per Martin
title: App Improvements
content: I like this device, but I crave app improvements.  1. Need a way to have it list all enabled skills.  Yes, I could use a web browser on my PC to check the skills, but why can't the ES display them?  That would make it a lot easier to remember the names of the skills and launch them.  2. Need a way to create my own launch words for skills that are too awkward to speak.  3. I really don't like the device grabbing my contact list from my cell phone and then using it as the device contact directory.  I would prefer to choose to whom I want to link.  I probably don't want my boss's contact info posted in the device and I really don't want to video conf with his home.  4. It would be nice to have a speed dial list of the preferred contacts, and choose which of these should have drop in ability. My primary example is that I use this device to video webex with my 97 year old father in law.  It works great as long as I initiate the call.  But since we are sharing my cell phone "contact list," it is too hard for him to avoid wrong calls.

author: John
title: Get it, and you will buy another.
content: We love our echo...as a tech guru... I was not going to buy the voice activated tech until it got really good. But my wife bought me one for my birthday and I absolutely couldn't live without it I love it. I like the fact that I can ask for music and get it and my kids can watch their movies that we have on Prime Amazon's a genius for connecting all of its products with this device seamlessly.

author: x21ironsides
title: Love the ability to just speak what I would like ...
content: My wife and I get a kick out of this thing.  Honestly there is a lot you can do with it and more things being added daily.  The voice activation is something I'm really impressed with.  Even with music playing if you say the command name the unit immediately picks up.  Love the ability to just speak what I would like and it comes up (news, fun facts, trivia, even harry potter games.)  Because it has apps that can talk with other iot devices around my house I chose this.  Makes it convenient when motion sensors go off to just ask the unit to show me the cameras and up they come.

author: Amazon Customer
title: like a juke box great to say sound level like level up or down works good
content:
it downloads my phone contacts and makes call on voice comand ..just mention  "alexa"  and it works on finding it for you.
it takes time I think for it to understand what you want as it takes time to search cause you have to re fraze alot till it picks up on what you want.

not like asking  GOOGLE the video calls work great .
We like the play from my music feature tell it a song or artist and it likes to shuffle that artist if you have more than 1..

author: Kindle Customer
title: the Echo Show shows photos which I really like. Now here's the problem
content:
Ads, ads, constant ads

Just a quick review.  I have a regular Echo that my son gave me.  It's not lovable, but it has some uses.  When he gave me the Echo Show, I was puzzled.  What can this new one do the other can't?  For one thing it gets confused w/ the other one and they both respond.  I changed the wake word.  That fixed that.

And, the Echo Show shows photos which I really like.

Now here's the problem.  Neither use anything past some really good programming.  AI?  I don't think so.  Neither could puzzle their way around a corner.

And! when you go to look at your photos on Echo Show THERE IS ALWAYS AN AD.  It's not occasional, it's always there and according to the FAQ you can't turn them off.  It destroys the value of being able to look at anything on the screen because their add is ALWAYS there on top of whatever you're looking at.

Hold off buying until they get rid of the ads.

author: Zen
title: Pretty good - could be improved though
content: I really like the video call and the drop in. The sound quality is decent enough and I like amazon music a lot. I don’t like that it can only do one thing at a time. It would be really nice to be talking and have a recipe on screen for example. What bummed me out a little though was I signed up for amazon music unlimited using my phone and didn’t realize that meant I could only manage my subscription from iTunes. Omg. So I couldn’t change my plan to the one that is less expensive and paid all at once for Prime because iTunes seems to bill monthly. So I cancelled it and have to wait for almost a month before I can go on to my amazon account and sign up from there.

author: A. Snyder
title: Screen flickers.
content: Horrible. Screen flickers. Returned for repair, and Amazon did not return AC cable, so now it does not work at all. (And I'm skeptical that the purported fix, reloading the latest software onto the device, will fix the screen flickering, even if I could test it out.)

author: Judie S.
title: Alexa still needs major programming
content:
The Alexa app still needs some major work in answering questions.  I asked "show me directions from Greenville, South Carolina to Charlotte, North Carolina" and  Alexa did not understand.  That is something Alexa should be able to do.  Also, I hoped to use my Echo Show to view Do-It-Yourself home improvement videos on YouTube, so I was greatly disappointed when YouTube was no longer supported.
The Echo Show is wonderful for listening to music on Pandora, streaming radio stations on Tune-In and video calling other people that have Alexa as well as pulling up recipes.  The speakers and screen resolution are excellent. However, at over $150, Echo Show needs to be able to do a lot more to make it worth the cost.

author: George Anthony Nunez
title: A nice addition to the echo family
content: I just got mine today and I've had many echo speakers over the last year, I think the Show is a better fit inmy kitchen than the speaker, I'll be using this a lot for cooking recipes!

author: Robin Girondo
title: Great for staying in touch with people in other states
content: Bought 2 of them, 1 for myself and gave 1 to my father for father's day who lives in a different state.  Great way to stay in touch and for him to talk to his grandchildren and great grandchildren.  Love it!

author: G. H.
title: Excellent device in my opinion.
content: Nice product. Good sound. Information at a drop of the hat. Music, prime movies. Weather. I only had one problem it wouldn’t respond to “Alexa”. I renamed her “echo”now she responds just fine. No problems.

author: Jason Swift
title: The feedback has been excellent. My folks are enjoying theirs in particular
content: Bought these as gifts.  The feedback has been excellent.  My folks are enjoying theirs in particular.  We look forward to the Echo Show developing more talents in the future.

author: Jessica Burke
title: It’s a good Alexa device
content: I like the screen however I wish there was more ability to manually use the screen via touch. The ability to customize the home screen better and what not. As far as Alexa is concerned it’s great. Just make sure u speak clearly and word what you want to say correctly.

author: Habanero
title: I Love The Future
content: I bought this for my kitchen.  Liked it so much I bought another for my master bath vanity.  Now I get a video flash briefing every day while I shave.  Living in The Future is so cool...

author: jenny
title: Echo show
content: We love this, still learning all it's features, the kids love asking Alexa for help with homework, youtube videos, and Alexa, guess the animal game, plus they think it's fun to call each other  from different rooms in the house, very "jetsons"! We (Mom and Dad) like the news and weather briefings, and playing jazz music, Christian music, or 50's music, depending on whether you're trying to relax, gain some energy, or missed church Sunday!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Great picture  / sound from overseas trip
content: Great display and similar to all the Amazon electronic devices this one is super easy to set up and use.  I used this this most recently for video calling while travelling internationally.  I was able to "drop in" and have clear picture and easy interaction with my kids.  It's so good that I was also able to talk the grand parents through a TV remote control issue as they held the remote to the screen I could talk them through which buttons to push.  Well done Amazon device team.

author: Gramma
title: They all found it easy to set up and use
content: Well, this was my surprise Christmas gift to some family members, and it's a big hit! They all found it easy to set up and use, the same as I did when I bought mine. We are all having such fun "dropping in" with each other, and the kids! Well, the kids are having a great time talking to Alexa! It's the major attraction in the household!

author: MDun
title: Contacts don’t come across completely and support doesn’t know how to fix.
content: Just got the product and the contacts don’t work. Only some come across.  They appear in the app but not on the product.  Spent time with three different support people and they have no idea what to do.  Tried what they could but they just don’t know.  Left me with no options.  Beware if you want to use this with your contacts.  Doesn’t work at least for me.  Have not  had a chance to try any thing else because of this problem.  Most likely will return due to support not even knowing what to do. Who knows what else could go wrong.

author: Thomas McIndoe Customer
title: Echo Show
content:
every device, I have bought from Amazon( Echo dot, Echo, Fire TV,Echo Spot, have all perform 5 Stars.This"Specific" Echo Show, however did give me problems so I had to return it to Amazon, for exchange.. The problems were that it did not recognize all of my smart home devices  it did initially, but after about 3 week did not). An observation some other reviewers have observed.
but amazon, true to their customers, Gave me a mailing ticket for free return and as well are sending me a replacement Echo Show, free of charge next day shipping. Hooray for amazon.

author: ACC
title: Amazon Exho Show Black
content: This is a Very High Quality piece of electronics. A must if you have kids, like music, cook, like YouTube etc. There is not much it cannot do.

author: JGIRL
title: Lovin’ it!
content: Lovin’ my Echo show! Absolutely love the drop-in feature. Now, I wouldn’t allow drop-Ins to be enabled with people I wouldn’t give my house key to. I love walking in the kitchen in the morning and saying, “Good Morning Alexa”! She gives me video of current news from my local news station, turns on my lights, and gives me a great morning message!

author: EasTexSteve
title: It's a dot with video capabilities.  Think of the possibilities!
content: This thing is cool.  I have two echo dots, and being able to add video to some things is a great enhancement.  The video phone calls are great.  The only complaints I have is that it sits with a slight tilt upwards, which means that you have to be sitting slightly above it for the camera to be centered on you.  And, you have to be within about three feet for the person on the other end to see any great detail of your face.  But, since it has somewhat of a wide view lens, you can "drop in" on it with your phone or another echo show and pretty much seen the entire room.  It also doesn't seem to respond to any other requests or commands if you are online talking or video conferencing someone.  I do like the fact that even if you have bluetoothed to another device for speaker output, it automatically switches back to it's own internal speakers for an incoming call.

author: azane
title: Bad screen again!
content: After only 3 months screen keeps flickering. Back again and less than 3 months since they replace last unit! It is just af bad as 1st, see video.

author: Alberto Flores
title: Good but not as good as the big brother
content:
I have both the Echo Show and the Spot now and I'm more impressed with the Show. The features are much nicer. After using the the Spot a few days here are my peeves with it.

1. the screen is not as responsive, when i click certain things it goes unresponsive and then goes back to the homescreen
2. the speaker quality is not a good
3. much smaller than i expected
4. Cannot trim photos correctly to fit into the screen

Here is what i liked
1. Microphone much more responsive
2. screen quality is good
3. wireless seems better
4. Price

I'm pretty sure Amazon will address the touch and picture issues. I regret not buying a few more Echo shows when the price dropped to 149 the other day. At that price it was a great deal.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I love it. Also love the "skills" - like when ...
content:
I mean... it does everything you want it to do! Can't be mad that it doesn't connect with my iTunes music because, obviously, competition! I love it. Also love the "skills" - like when I'm bored making coffee I'll say "Alexa, motivate me" and it'll read a great quote. Also, "Alexa, meditate" and it'll walk me through a quick 5 minute guided mediation. Love the alarm, love the fact that I have it synced with my smart lights so I can tell it to turn on/off any light (and change it's colors if you you have phillips hue smart lights).

The sound is pretty amazing considering the size & I love the music available for $3.99/mo get amazon music & you can play whatever you want, whenever! It's great!

author: Amanda
title: Love my Amazon Echo Show
content: Love my Amazon Echo Show! Love being able to chat with my friends, ask any questions I have, play games, start my car, play music, and so much more! Highly recommend the show! We also have a shot upstairs for convenience and love that as well!

author: John Kachanis
title: I liked how the echo show provides information to you instantly
content: I liked how the echo show provides information to you instantly.  I have prime but you still have to hit me up for more money to get the good songs. By that I mean the good old songs.  I am a senior and the songs that I like are ancient so why not give us old people a break.  Come on..... aren't you happy with my $100 dollars.  To be honest it is a task for seniors to jump on this high tech computer bandwagon.  I am very happy with the echo show and would recommend it to my friends.

author: P_Dub
title: It's okay.
content: I purchased 4 this past Prime Day, so I'm still getting familiar, but so far I am not impressed.  The only thing I've really been able to use it for is to find my keys and to play music, so I guess if you can justify spending $130-240 for something that does that then go for it.  I expect it to get better, but until then, 3.5 stars.

author: Elbert A Craig
title: I really like my Alexa Show
content: I really like my Alexa Show. I love the fact that you can talk to her on the fly and don't have to stop what you are doing to set a timer, play music, get the latest news....etc. There are still things that Alexa cannot due and is still confusing to me on setting up some of the apps but we are both learning. Was fairly easy to set up with WiFi connection. Happy that My sister got this for me fo a gift. I had 2 of the dots already for the bedrooms. Now I keep the Show in the kitchen and use it often.

author: Midge Borer
title: Amazon better step up it's game because there is a new ...
content: Amazon better step up it's game because there is a new sheriff in town and it's called Google. Alexa is not like Google AT all. You could ask Google ANYTHING and it will have an answer. Alexa can only answer things that you have  enabled the the skills app for. Waste of money, good for listening to music, calling people who have Amazon devices and it's good for smart switches.

author: Stephen Deutsch
title: Well Made and Great speakers.
content:
I love the Echo Show.  The speakers are a bit better than my Echo, and I like being able to use it to look up recipes and general information.
The Show is well made and has some weight to it. I am very satisfied.

author: Doris E. Marshall
title: Wouldn't want to be without it.
content: Love it!  I have Echo at my winter home, missed Alexa and all her features in my summer place, so got my Show.  Glad to have Alexa back.  Like the feature that shows lyrics of a lot of the song I request, of course use it for tunes, weather reports, as a timer, for general information.  Just a great helper all around.

author: Computer Savvy
title: This device is a must have...
content:
I enjoy every minute of it.
Having my family on a video call, play Pandora, get news, weather, set alarms and lot more. Voice recognition is better than Siri.

author: CatGrammy
title: Easy set up and operation !
content: I really  love this product. It is easy for me to understand, electronic devices are not always my friend LOL. I especially like the screen and the fact that it shows what you are hearing as well.. I am , however having some trouble combing this with my new Echo Connect. I know it is not the product, LOL, it's me, but I'll keep trying.. LOL I like the fact that my original Echo Dot will work out on my deck,  I can have my music with me all the time and anything else I want to know from my new best friend Alexa !!.. Thank You !!

author: Elizabeth
title: You have to set up smart programs on you phone, iPad or computer. But, all is immediately available.
content: I never wanted a box or speaker that would talk to me.  But, I did want a way to set up all my Smart Home items and my ADT Alarm, independent of my phone so others could access the systems. And, I wanted a screen as an option. Other products were $300 to $500... way too much. The Echo Show is perfect!  And, I have found the other items are addicting. Music, wheather, radio... And, you can’t beat the price! I do wish I could set a clock, wheather or news, instead of the continuous little tidbits of info.  Or, wish I could turn those off. Irritating.

author: SVUSA11
title: Alexa's Hidden Gem - Echo Show!!
content:
Hello Everyone!

I'm writing this review after using Alexa Echo Show for about a week. I think this product is highly under-rated based on over all functionality it offers. It can pretty much do everything that you expect Echo/Alexa to do for you. I think where this product gains significant advantage is 7 inch screen which turns into home entertainment or automation or security hub while not sacrificing sound quality.

What I like Most?
-  Ask Alexa to show me who is at the front door and it will connect to my nestcam.
-  Ask Alexa to provide me video news briefing and start playing CNN videos.
-  Ask Alexa to play YouTube :) (yes its back!! wo hoo) Only draw back is I cant ask Alexa yet to play my playlist on YouTube but hopefully it can be fixed in future updates.
-  Ask Alexa to play Amazon Video
- Ask Alexa to make video calls -- Pay Slide Show - Check Weather - Set thermostat - Turn off Lights, Play songs all with VISUAL Experience and Digital Dolby sound!!

so, my recommendation - Skip Regular Echo and BUY Echo Show. It offer significantly higher value in the package.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It's fun to listen to music and have the lyrics scroll ...
content: We're really enjoying the Echo Show. It's fun to listen to music and have the lyrics scroll by for a sing-a-long. We also use it for a running shopping list, door locks and porch lights; and enjoy the silly jokes and limericks.  It took a couple days to figure out how to set it up for our different family accounts, so that we could listen to each other's music, and the Amazon help line was completely baffled. However, I figured it out myself, mostly just by searching around on the site and trying out different things. Instructions could be much clearer for sharing accounts within a family household. You should persevere though, as it learns more and more it becomes more versatile and we keep figuring out other things to use it for.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best Echo yet
content: Has good sound, the screen is bright and easy to read. Just not enough of the functions use the screen effectively. Amazon has maintained a pattern of continuous improvement with the echo line. So I am sure as time passes it will use the screen more effectively.

author: Shane M.
title: Works great!
content: I own two dots, a tap and a show. I love the echo show. Sound quality is amazing compared to the dots. I use mine constantly to create shopping list, kitchen and laundry timer, and news updates. But most of all I have the all throughout the house and I play music throughout using the group settings

author: Majesty8
title: Very cool!
content:
Overall I am impressed with the Show.  I was initially eyeing on the Spot, but when the Show was selling at the same price as the Spot (plus a bigger screen), it was a no brainer which of the two to buy.
There’s so many features this device can do, but I’ve mostly been using the “drop in” feature to check in on my household, and I like it’s audio/visual clarity than my wireless cam.  Yes, I’ve read a lot of the pros/cons, but for the most part, I’m very happy with it that I actually bought a 2nd one for the kitchen, which I think will see more use.

UPDATE 12/18:

It’s been 6 months since I’ve bought the Show.  I know theres a lot more features it can do, but as an “average” user, I must say... VERY SATISFIED!  I have one in the kitchen and living room.  I typically use it to listen to music and I must say, as an audiophile, the speaker output is more than sufficient.  It belts out good, robust solid sound unlike smaller Bluetooth speakers.  I don’t know how well this works in modern homes with open cathedral rooms though, but I know I’ve had to ask Alexa to turn the music down on a few occasions!  Other than that, it’s very convenient asking Alexa what the sports scores are for out-of-market teams, setting timers during cooking, weather...etc.  I’ve actually ordered my 3rd Show that’s going to replace my alarm clock.  Definitely looking forward to using that!

CAMERA ISSUES FIXED.  When I got the Show, I had problems with the camera turning on after initial set up.  After much troubleshooting (even contacted Amazon support which they didn’t reply), I found the solution after scouring the net: after initial set up (when the device downloads new updates) and is at the normal home screen, shut the device off and turn it back on.

author: Gilberto Pereira Migliorin
title: Still lack some improvement, but overall works great!
content:
Nice, but still quite limited.
I would appreciate if I could use it as a front-end graphical interface to Amazon Music or Amazon Video, so that it does not completely rely on Voice Recognition, or on requesting stuff through the mobile phone.
For English names Alexa works great, however I simply cannot ask for any International singer/band since Alexa always tries to match it to English language.
A GUI would definetely help on this limitation.
AI needs a lot of improvement yet.
Sometimes Alexa do not even understand about a request related to a story that she "advertised" 30 seconds ago. If you do not ask for more information about "stories" right away, it is not likely to understand when asked for more information about it.
Podcasts reading would be great!
Better integration to Google devices would be also great!
Other than that, once I was able to adjust the equalizer, audio quality got quite reasonable.
For North American singers and bands, Amazon Music integration to Alexa works just great. The capability of shuffling songs from specific periods is also great. Ex: Alexa play 90s rock songs, etc
Ring integration works fine.
Drop in and video calls are great!

author: MacMarty
title: Could have been 5 stars!
content: If they would not limit the software in Canada, I would have given it 5 stars. It is annoying when you have to deal with Geo-restrictions and there is no good reason to separate it for English speaking countries.

author: JK
title: No Youtube and gets video call contacts from cell phone only
content:
I bought two Echo Show devices. And it says it can’t play video when I ask it to. It tries to load YouTube and it can’t. I read on the Internet that Google cut off access. Googles mantra used to be “do no evil” but this is a petty act that deprives users access to open user posted content. So the device is not of much value if it can’t play video when asked.

Also, it advertises the ability to video call. But I only found out that you need to setup a mobile number with your amazon account for it to get the contacts you can video dial. This doesn’t work for my parents with an older phone. And besides, why can’t you simply add the contacts you want to video dial directly into the Alexa app and optionally link with your phone contacts? Doesn’t make any sense. And is only discovered after you buy the device. Weird unadvertised quirk.

author: C. Ivie
title: The speech recognition sysftem is very impressive.
content: The connected speech recognition system is very impressive, it rarely misses a word. I have some privacy concerns so I disconnect it if I am discussing anything confidential  The quality is quite good as the image and sound.  I am still learning its features and deciding which ones I will be using.  All in all it's a very interesting device.

author: C. Francis
title: Great for Deployed Servicemembers
content: This is a great product. I am a Soldier and deploy overseas frequently. My kids love that I can use the "Drop In" feature to pop into the room and have a conversation with them at any time. One of the great things about this item is that I don't actually need one on my end. I can connect my cell phone to a Wi-Fi network, launch my Alexa app and then "Drop In" to see the family. I put one in my kitchen, living room and the kids' bedroom. Not only is it a versatile product, it's very reliable and of great quality.

author: florence davis
title: I am in love with my echo show
content: I am in love with my echo show! My grandchildren. Who are 3 and 1 live 1.5 hrs away so I don’t get to see them often, so this makes it easy to stay in touch and see them. Often my grandson will drop in just to say hi. I also like all the other features it has to offer.

author: Andreas R. - D.
title: It's Okay
content: It is basically an Echo like any other. But there are some cool things it can do with the screen. Unfortunately when it is not in use the screen just cycles through annoying crap.  Instead of all of that screen garbage I wish it would just go dark. Ideally you could set the screen preferences. I would like to see time, date, weather, temp, and next event on my calendar. That would make this 5 stars. I don't want to look over and see "NY shoe designer gets $5,000 for latest fashion line".  I could not care less!  After a software upgrade I will probably upgrade to 4 stars.  Get to work coding Amazon!

author: Kim
title: Love the new Echo Show!
content:
I have been happily anticipating the arrival of my new Echo Show. I currently own the original Echo and an Echo Dot and absolutely love them both.

The Echo Show arrived nicely packaged and my first impression is that it is a clean looking design and a bit smaller than I had pictured in my mind, but that is not necessarily a bad thing, as it looks great on my counter top. It is EXTREMELY easy to set up due to the touch screen. No need to consult the Alexa app. I only needed to know the name of my Wifi, wifi password and Amazon password. This was a truly simple process and the touch screen walks you through it. It needed to update before starting, which I found odd since it was literally released today, but it only took a few minutes and we were up and running. I guess this is just an example of how Amazon is constantly updating and improving these devices.

The home screen displays the time and I set it up to scroll through family pictures which I really enjoy. If you own a Kindle Fire, this has a similar pull down from the top menu to give access to your settings.

I began asking Alexa questions immediately. "Alexa, how old is Tom Brady?" I got a nice picture of the golden boy along with his age which is definitely a plus. The questions are answered aloud as well as with text on the screen. You can set up a Flash Briefing using the Alexa App on your phone to tell you the news whenever you ask. CNN provided a nice video with their news which was really cool, but NPR and Wall Street Journal just had audio. I was a bit disappointed that the majority of the skills I tried did not utilize the screen. I think that just like the original Echo, this will improve with time. These are skills (apps) so it is just a matter of the skill updating to adjust to the new technology. Amazon is also great at listening to feedback and adding more features all the time. Echo Show is able to list movie times and even show movie trailers on the screen. The picture quality is very good. I also ask sports questions and the team logo, scores and information are displayed on the screen along with the answer to my question. I'm a big college sports fan and I love asking when the next game is or the score of the last game. This is a great feature.

Now, what I use my Echo for the most...playing music. I am an Amazon Prime member so have access to the Prime music library. You can also use Pandora, Sirius, Spotify, Iheart radio and TuneIn. "Alexa, play Zach Brown Band."  I am amazed at the rich, full sound that fills the large kitchen/family and dining room in our open floor plan house. I am not an expert on speakers but the sound is definitely better than the original Echo which I still very much enjoy. The screen shows the lyrics so feel free to sing along!

One thing that I find myself saying over and over is "Alexa go home." This seems to be the easiest way to close a skill or video and return to your home screen. You can also scroll down from the top of the screen to get your settings bar and touch the home button.

YouTube is the bomb on this device. It is fully functional and will prove to be both entertaining and educational. I love this feature. "Alexa, show me a YouTube video on dog training." Boom! I have many choices available to me on the screen.  "Alexa, play number 2." Now, if I could only get Alexa to train my dog to stop putting her front paws up on the kitchen counter...I also tried the Ted Talks app and that provided audio only.

Echo Show reads Audible books very well, the same as the original Echo but with the better speakers. There is not much benefit to having a screen for this, but I listen to Audible a lot while working in the kitchen or making dinner.

I tested the Amazon video capabilities and was very pleased with its ability to provide that content. Since I have it on the kitchen counter, i don't plan to watch movies on the Echo Show, but certainly could if I wanted. I can unplug it and move it anywhere I would like and it quickly connects itself to Wifi once plugged in again.

I looked up a recipe on the AllRecipe skill and was pleased that it showed a picture of the dish and written ingredient list along with directions on the screen. This will be quite helpful. When I played music at the same time I was looking at the recipe, it would go back to the music lyric screen after a few minutes. I would have preferred it to stay on my recipe. I will need to explore this further. It could be user error. The Campbells recipe skill does not currently provide any content on the Echo screen but sends the recipe via email to another device. I would think this can/should be improved.

If you have a timer set, it is displayed on the screen. This also reverts back to the lyric screen if you are playing music, but I don't mind that as you can always ask, "Alexa, how much time is left?" and she will tell you. I just love her! The timer still goes off even with the music on.

I have had this less than 24 hours but am really enjoying it. It is more user friendly than the original Echo because it is continually providing help and information on the touch screen. Even if you are technically challenged, you should be able to use this.

All of the Echo devices are great for running smart home devices, but I don't currently use it for that, so can't really help you there.

You can also make video calls with this, which I have not yet tried. I'm usually walking around and doing other things while talking on the phone so probably won't use this feature much. It would be great if you had children or grandchildren you wanted to see when you were out of town.

In my opinion, the Echo Show is a helpful, innovative and fun gadget to own. It needs to improve a bit to fully utilize the display screen which I believe it will with time. If you currently do not have any Echo devices, then this is the one to get. If you are a bit uncomfortable with technology, then this would be a good device for you because Amazon provides so much support via the touch screen. If you already own the original Echo, you may or may not want to purchase this right now. I have not found it to be worlds better than my original Echo at this point. If you would use the video chat or are wanting a richer sound for music, then I recommend purchasing the Echo Show. I do enjoy now having an Echo in the kitchen/main part of the house and in the bedroom. I am hoping that, like the original Echo, the content will continue to improve with time, but I am very happy with my purchase of the Echo Show. I hope this helped you!

author: Steve
title: I will make this a five star review when You Tube support is restored (second updated review).
content:
Amazon and You Tube’s spat is hurting customers. The Echo Show is a shell of it’s former self without You Tube support. Please resolve your issues.

Update: You Tube is back. Revising my one star review to five stars.

Update 2: Back to one star since the childish spat between Google and Amazon -- that hurts consumers -- has remerged. YouTube has been yanked from the Echo Show again. This is flat out ridiculous.

author: birdy123
title: waste of money
content: I bought Echo plus since it was on sale and couldn't resist the discount.  But my old Echo has much better sound quality and I see why I can't get all those recipes, all gone with Utube

author: Brenda
title: Seeing our grandkids is priceless. Any one can use this it is simple.
content: I have read many of these reviews and I was unsure about this device. I have thoroughly enjoyed talking to my grandkids weekly on this device along with playing music and watching YouTube videos. There are things that you can ask of Alexa and she is unable to proved like google but mostly it is some variance of a factual type of question. So this is no concern to me as all the other benifits way out weigh these cons. I highly recommend this product it is easy to use and the video streaming is wonderful! My grand kids will even be able to say, Alexa call Pap Pap and Nana and it will dial us right up. We Currently see our little grands and when they come to town they know who we are, thank you Amazon.

author: DD
title: Not ready for prime time
content: Not ready for prime time.  Product does not work as advertised.  You can't stream across devices and you can't stream videos that aren't coming from Amazon.  Customer support says the video streaming is a known issue.  I haven't tested other features like calling family and friends.  I would stay away from this product until they work out the kinks.  Obviously this was not tested very well.

author: Myron D.
title: Like the Show
content:
When I got an Echo a couple of Summers ago, I thought it would be great if it had a small (one line - 6 character) read out for indicating time or time left on timer.  So, for me, the Echo Show, even though YouTube was a no go, was just what I wanted.  The set up was very easy, 3-4 minutes after plugging it in, it was ready to go.  (I usually have trouble with these kinds of things.)

Like over reviewers, I wish I could eliminate the annoying "Try Alexa..." running at the bottom of the screen.  It would also be nice if I could turn off the default 5 minute " "sleep mode" when listening to music.  (When listing to music/viewing lyrics, it should automatically turn off. As is, every 5 minutes I have to give a command to awaken the screen.)

My sense is the sound is not fully featured as on the original Echo.

author: John Pfetsch
title: Nice but no Google or Youtube Access Anymore.
content: It seems to work well.  Unfortunately a lot of the functionality is lost because, as many have mentioned, it does not work with google or Youtube any more.  This problem is caused by Google because they came up with their own devices an no longer allow access from other devices like these.  This even effected my smart TV.  Anyhow we purchased a few of these to communicate with our children and grandchildren so we'll see what happens when we hand them out.

author: Robert Robert
title: It's pretty good but Alexa really is inferior to other A.I.s
content:
It is really a very nice device - the sound is good and the screen is pretty vibrant. I bought it specifically for the drop in feature, and it didn't disappoint. I also like the fact that it links to your Spotify account. You can tell it to play a certain playlist you've created, and it will do it. It also allows you to shuffle songs.

However, Alexa simply is not a very good A.I. - it understands you just fine, for the most part, but it doesn't do a very good job at what it's designed to do. For example, I asked it who Captain America is. Instead of giving me the answer, it tells me to follow someone who provides that information. But that guy sucks so there is pretty much no way to get that information. I also asked it to tell a bedtime story, and it gave me some nonsense about having to sign up for a skill set or something. And other times, it simply doesn't know anything at all. The most common thing I hear is something along the lines of "hmm I'm not sure."

My only other experience with an A.I. is the one that starts with a G. And when you compare Alexa to that, it really stands out as an inferior system. The G one will be coming out with their own video version soon. Unless you are loyal to Amazon or have accounts linked to it, you'd be better off waiting for that device. It's rumored to be released around September 2018.

author: Madison Gunn
title: Is it worth it?? YES!!!
content:
So first off... the price we paid could not be beat!!!! So this thing is awesome! She keeps my grocery list, she plays my Spotify, she sets my timers... I love Alexa!!! The ONE thing that gets to me... I’m not a paranoid person, but obviously people say things to me like ‘you know the government can listen through stuff like that.’ I think it was on New Years Eve I spilled some wine on the carpet, I rush to get my cleaning supplies and ask alexa to set a three minute timer. She lights up to acknowledge she’s listening... but never STOPS listening and never sets the timer. We give her command after command and nothing... we unplugged her for the night. I’m sure it was just a glitch. Maybe it was my internet because I live in central Texas and it was snowing.. who knows... like I said I love my echo show!!! Will probably convert the new house with a nest and such. It was just a little freaky lol!!!

Buy it... if you’re wondering weather or not it’s worth it. It is... wait for them to be on sale. I picked mine up at Christmas time at Target for I believe $120. It was a Christmas sale. But was also going on, on amazon as well!!! But yea... totally worth it!!

author: Firf
title: Unrealized Potential.
content: Lots of unrealized potential.  Too few original / useful skills.  Even simple quick wins such as a weather radar, or quick icons to get to skills or run apps, are missing.  I would rate it as ‘ok’.

author: Jason Dragon
title: OMG, so cool.
content: I have been an echo user for over a year now but I never have the Echo Show until this week.  I don't know why I never got it but this product is very well made and the cost is unbelievably low with a touch screen and all the abilities that I can do.  I told it to play a movie and it was playing the Star Trek movie and very good quality right away much better than a laptop would at anywhere near this price.  Versus the original echo which is what I have the sound on this is about 60% as loud.  But the original Echo is so loud that there's no time that I have it at full volume so this one is still good enough for All Occasions.  I'm still not sure I want one with a camera in my bedroom but it's great for the kitchen.

author: Philip A
title: Great product, fun, had issues, but Amazon came through!
content: I took a chance with the show on Amazon prime day because it was $100 off and I really have enjoyed it on the other side of my kitchen. Lyrics for songs were unexpected but cool, touch interface, volume at the top of the device, good screen quality... Although I did have it freak out and get that digitized noise, but I think it was a software glitch. As I was on the phone with customer service it restarted again on its own without any intervention (I asked) and then it was fine, but Amazon still insisted on sending me a new one, so kudos to them. I wish I had known that a ten inch screen was coming out, but for price I'm happy. If you already have a suite of echo devices (I have original echo and a dot aside) this is a must have in my opinion. I mean, playing games with friends on this is so much more fun!

author: Jurispuris
title: Amazon Show, a great multimedia device that is still improving.
content: Giving it just four stars for now, there seems to be a problem with X-ray lyrics on the Show. Unlike on my phone or tablet I cannot get lyrics to display for song in my Amazon music library. Amazon is currently working on the problem and will let me know once they find the solution. Besides that the show is a great device and if the lyrics issue is fixed I will probably buy one or two more for different rooms in the house. The Show has great video replay and the speakers are excellent. Love being able to watch Amazon movies on my nightstand while I'm writing or getting ready for bed. One other feature the Show could use is a remote control, sometime while in the closet the Show can't hear my requests and a remote would help and not make me scream.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Ask Alexa Anything!
content: I'm still learning how to use Alexa but am already enjoying my instant news and weather. I'm in the process of getting" smart plugs" for lights and outside camera! I like that it grows with me and even helps in the process!

author: Pixeechant
title: Absolutely LOVE it!
content:
Of course I delayed in getting anything that could spy on your household. But I have an iPhone that has Siri and I also have a smart TV. I don’t do anything to worry about people spying anyway. But I decided to go ahead and get the Alexa Show – I am absolutely enthralled by it. My whole family is. It was easy to set up. It’s pretty easy to use the app – you can add so many skills to add to the usefulness of it. I wish I would’ve bought one sooner. It’s so nice to be able to lay in bed and have Alexa turn off my light, my fan and other stuff around the house- LOVE that the start bulbs can dim your lights or change color if you bought those kinds. I just remodeled and had all new dimming lights put in/ what a waste of money!

Hoping my kids will be brave enough to put one in their household so we can drop in on each other through Alexa.

One thing I didn’t know when I was buying smart switches, bulbs, plugs and other smart items – is that I bought them from seven different companies so I ended up having to download seven different apps and create accounts for each one to connect to Alexa! Just a word of warning do some research and look at reviews of which ones are best and stick with one or two brands. I wish I would’ve known that before hand. Anyway really love my Alexa show, I bought one that came with an echo. I can’t imagine having just an echo without a screen. Really enjoy having the screen to interact with.

author: frank p
title: Great product
content: Excellent product, easy to use.  Would buy again.  Have recommended it to friends.

author: Timothy
title: It is actually worth the upgrade.
content: I love the new video feature, and unexpectedly seeing my calendar appointments pop up. I asked for my calendar, and all my appointments for the day showed up for me to scroll through. Notifications of upcoming appointments pop up too. Sound is perfect. So if you love or like the Echo, you will love the video screen feature, so upgrade. I do not work for the CIA or Amazon. I like the white version. The lyrics could be a problem scrolling along with the song, I have to warn customers to not break into karaoke. Blah. Unexpectedly very happy.

author: Erin C
title: Can’t get rid of “Things to try”
content: Like everything except that you can not get rid of “things to try” on my home screen. Highly annoying, like Jeff Bezos.

author: Pamela B.
title: The show works great with all my smart devices except the ring pro
content:
The show works great with all my smart devices except the ring pro.  When you ask alexa to show the front door camera it will show the front door for just a few seconds and then goes into a buffering mode so you really can't see who's at your front door. I have good wifi readings and very good power readings.
I've gone through all the trouble shooting recommendations with no positive results.  The tech support that called me back could hardly speak english. great product that work's great with iphone and ipad but lacks a lot to be desired in working with the show.

author: Dean Capalbo
title: Quick and convenient
content: I was surprised at how much our family has taken to this after not expecting much. We play music all the time and the speakers are quite good. The kids ask it questions often and it is a convenient source of info

author: Cheryl L Nelson
title: Screen doesn't last long
content: Screen flickers, rolls and has lines across it after only about 2 months. I received a replacement for the first one, the 2nd one did the same thing after about 6 weeks.  The screen feature is why one buys this Echo over another, and it is very disappointing that it goes out so fast. Otherwise, loved it until screen became unwatchable.

author: Tony
title: A frustrating product that I would definitely not recommend at this time.
content:
What a frustrating device, far from ready for release to the public.

The Echo Spot sits on my kitchen counter, about 6 feet from my Kloss Model one FM radio which plays NPR all day. Probably once or twice a day the Spot wakes up and may start chattering gibberish as a result of hearing something resembling its wake word.

I have downloaded the alexa.app on my iPhone and I have also checked the settings on the device itself. It has my correct street address, city, state and zip code in both places. It knows I am an Amazon Prime member yet if I ask it for my location, Alexa tells me that I am 125 km away from my actual house! If I ask for the weather, it gives me outdoor temperatures that are typically 5-8 degrees warmer than actual, probably miles inland from my coastal location (and what the Accuweather website says!). Ask for movies playing at local cinemas? - she cannot do it. She cannot find any local theaters. Ask for local restaurants ? yes!! She can even give me the address and tell me one is 1.5 miles away.
Where is the nearest Whole Foods Market - yes, 1.7 miles away.  Where is the nearest CVS drug store (next door to Whole Foods!) - sorry, I don't know that. ....... Just total inconsistency.

So far, the best use I have found for my Echo Show is to ask it to play BBC Radio 4. It can do that almost as well as my Grace Digital Radio!

Until Amazon makes major improvements to Alexa's intelligence, I would definitely not recommend spending close to $200 on this gadget.

author: Graveyyy
title: Great product, but room for improvement.
content:
The Echo Show works great, but there are some areas for improvement.

Pros:
Sound Quality
Large Screen
Ability to display CloudCam streams
Access to Prime Videos (if you like watching on a 7" screen)
Very easy setup

Cons:
Ability to only display one camera feed at a time. The ability to split screen would be a great improvement.
Screen can be under-utilized
UI can be difficult to navigate.

All-in-all, the Show works exactly as described. There is some area to improve, but you will be happy if looking for an Alexa capable device with a monitor.

author: Beetlebeau
title: You're going to want two!
content: Received it as a gift, and while I thought it was a very nice gift, I really didn't think we'd use it that much.  By that evening, I thought I needed to buy two!!!  Love it!  Use it for so many things.  Have it sitting by the chair I sit in most often, and it's so helpful to be able to just tell Alexa to remind me of things whenever I think of them.  Listen to a lot of music now, whereas before all I did was watch television.  I really do want to get another one for my bedroom -- just unsure which model to buy at this point.  And she listens to me much better than my children ever did!

author: Uncle Q
title: because this sweet little device is nearly perfect for researching the wealth ...
content:
This is a 5 star product that has been rendered a 4 star product by some squabble between the parties associated with the Echo Show and YouTube.  The result is that the Echo Show has apparently been intentionally de-platformed by YouTube, and it therefore cannot, at the time of this review, be used to view any YouTube content.  This is a shame, because this sweet little device is nearly perfect for researching the wealth of cooking and other short topic videos on YouTube.  While it does have access to many other sources of video content - it just isn't a candidate for viewing movies if a larger screen is available.  The lack of YouTube is utterly perplexing, and frustrating.

That said -- the Echo Show is a marvelous bit of technology for entertainment, communication, automation, topical research, information about the weather, and traffic information among other things.  I use mine to control numerous smart lights, thermostat, and to safely peer out at the world through our Ring Doorbell Pro.  Using Tunein it becomes a crystal clear radio, and the Serius XM streaming app/talent allows it to play satellite radio.  The Alexa app allows it to make audio or video calls to those who have registered with the Alexa App and have one of the Alexa enable devices themselves.

The new drop-in capability allows the Echo Show to behave like a web/WIFI camera with two way audio, and it allows audio-only Alexa enabled devices to act like a full duplex intercom system.  To use the Echo Show as a camera in this way, simply enable the drop-in privilege for yourself on your own Echo Show, and then drop-in using the Alexa app from your Android or iOS compatible device.  The connection is announced at the Echo Show with some tones, and then a fuzzy picture slowly resolves into a full resolution video that displays what the Show's camera sees.  The video isn't recorded as it would be with some web-enabled cameras -  but it is a great way to check in on your house when you are away.  You can even talk to your pets and hear what is happening at their location.  Drop-in can be limited to only those devices designated as "within the household", or it can be extended or prohibited on a case by case bases for select contacts.  A number of senarios make the ability for unilateral initiation of a connection a valuable feature; if you can't think of any you probably shouldn't enable the feature.  Where the feature is enabled it should be expected that those who have been authorized to establish a connection will do so at any time allowed.  This feature can be schedule limited.

author: A. Manley
title: Most questions asked the response I get is 'I don't ...
content: Most questions asked the response I get is 'I don't know that'.  Difficult interfacing XM radio and getting the stations I want played.

author: Erik Williams
title: The screen is failing after 6 months
content: We bought 3 of these products, and 2 of them have had a problem with the screens starting to fail. They both get a dark thick line right through the middle of the screen. The first screen failed within a month of ordering it, the second screen started to fail within 6 months of ordering it.  Want to replace the failing units because it's should a have a 1 year warranty, but no where am I able to get a replacement for these items. It says to go to your ordered item page, but the option to get a replacement is no where to be found.

author: PHYLLIS
title: Need a ordinary calendar page and more knowledge
content: The echo could not answer some knowledge questions but my google home could.  Also it would be nice if the echo show could display a regular calendar page not a personal one.

author: Sherrie
title: Do Not Recommend!!!
content: Returned after 1 month for lines running through bottom of screen.  Was exchanged with refurbished unit, after I had just paid for new one!!  Now past week the screen is almost constantly covered with lines.  Do not recommend until can be updated or something.  Definitely not worth money paid!!

author: AndiMc
title: So cool!!
content: I love my Echo Show!  I love being able to display my shopping list or my calendar or watch a video, etc.  I haven't had a chance to use the drop in calling feature yet but I know I will enjoy that too!!  My only wish is that it had a better search engine for questions that are asked so we can get better results.  It seems like it should be able to use Google or Bing or something like that and come up with answers for most questions.  Luckily, if Amazon Echo develops that technology, they should be able to update it behind the scenes without us having to purchase a new device.  Overall I love all of my Echo's!!!

author: Tyler Struve
title: Overall I am happy with it
content: I was so excited to get this item I could hardly wait for it to arrive. Overall I am happy with it.  Especially the business account pricing.  For anyone not knowing about business pricing convert your account to a business account easily and see the money you can save.  This Echo Show is regular price 115.00 all the time.  Awesome!  I saved 125 or more dollars.  but disappointed a little in the quality of the mic and Alexa picking up the commands.  It replaced the original Alexa 1st edition (tall cylindar unit without a screen) which sounds and reacts to commands almost every single time rarely without a problem.  The unit does not allow connecting to a 5.0 ghz network band only 2.4.  The unit has disconnected by itself several times while the other 7 echo or alexa devices remained online.  On the positive side the brightness of the screen and the playback of Prime Videos or News Flash updates is incredible!
