The camera  when dropping in from your mobile device to check on your dogs or friend or family is TOP NOTCH and quality is 100%.  Overall I have decided to keep the unit hoping that a firmware update soon to come will address the wireless issue and speech detection.  I would recommend this to anyone.  Its a very nice addition to our smart home.

author: Waleed T.
title: YouTube is unforgivable loss!
content: Elegant design, fair speaker and good screen resolution. Will give it a straight 5 if YouTube comes back. Apart from that, works fairly well except that it sometimes doesn’t reposed to voice commands - I would say once every 20 times.

author: vpeeler
title: Works Great.  Well, Used to work great.
content:
This is great as a Echo for the kitchen.  Good sound and video for use in a kitchen.  Worth the money.  I can also work as a video monitor for the house.

It started with this screen flickering issue last week.  See Picture. Called support and had me reset the unit then unplug for 3 minutes, but in less than 1 min it started again.  They want me to order a Version 2 Show at my expense then they will call me with a refund.  Why not just send a replacement. Version 1 or 2 without me having to place an order at my expense. Plus the version 2 does not have a great rep in the reviews for that version.

author: Bob Z
title: Show me what ???
content:
Received as birthday gift on 12/9. Just a big Echo with a screen that has limited use. No YouTube = No Good.
Sorry Amazon. You were always #1 for me, but this ????

author: Stephanie
title: Do your research first
content: I was excited to get this and be updated with the times... I used this for 24 hours and every time I asked a question alexa didn't know... I'm sure if you worked with it more it would benefit the product. It was easy to upload your calendar, contacts, apps, etc. I mainly bought it for calling my parents out of town that have apple products, and use as a security system. I simply asked "Alexa add turkey to my shopping list.." three times in a row. And her response was I don't know what that is... I don't have time for that I could write it down on paper for all that trouble in a 3rd of the time. Good luck with your purchase!!!

author: DeeA
title: Alexa confused when deleting items off list.
content: I tried deleting items off list. It would not recognize the list by name. It recognizes the name of list when adding items but not when deleting.

author: Kevin J. Brandich
title: repeated screen flickering after a couple months of use. ...
content: repeated screen flickering after a couple months of use. on my second round or trying to get a resolution.

author: DJ
title: Love the Echo Show
content: Love the Echo Show.  I own 2, have bought 2 as gifts.  I especially like the fact I call use it for recipes when cooking, but mostly use it for music, random questions, and face timing....

author: Mihaela Dimitriu
title: I'm trying to like it but
content: I'm trying to like it but, most likely I will return it. Very unhappy with the sound. When it plays music the sound is muffled. It needs more of... many things. Wrong response to simple questions (i.e. military time, news, etc.). I do not recommend it.

author: Tracerbob
title: Not ready for primetime!
content: If I could leave a zero... It worked for a few weeks. Now it's slow, doesn't reapond, fails to connect to the network. In general it is garbage. The dots function flawlessly on the same network. This has to be rebooted multiple times and still fails to function. Sending it back for a refund.

author: Clark Parker
title: Very nice!
content:
Enjoy using the Show rather than the base Echo. Have used videos on it and enjoy the music lyrics coming up during playback. Really nice addition to my Smart home. I have 2, 1 upstairs and the other down and it's nice using the call feature to communicate.

Microphone is more sensitive than the one in my older main Echo. Which is wonderful and a benefit. Would buy again.

author: Sds3r1
title: Echo Fo-Show!
content: I love my echo show!  I have a newborn at home which means it is used primarily for hands-free assistance.  We use our echo to turn on and off lights in the house, call family members, play baby lullabies, set timers, add items to our shopping list, answer our Ring doorbell, watch cooking tutorials, look up questions on line, check news and weather and much, much more!

author: Jackie Avondoglio
title: It's fun to see words of songs but if it's a ...
content: It's a toy more than anything. Still learning more uses.  It's fun to see words of songs but if it's a fast song doesn't always keep up.  I can do most things with the old Alexa or dot.  If friends don't have the show you don't see them. I thought it would connect to FaceTime but it doesn't.  Will rate again when I've had it longer.

author: Steven M
title: This is the Best of All My Echoes - Perfect Bedside Alarm
content:
First, I want to explain a little about my history with Echo, which may help those of you who are trying to choose between the various Echo products.

When the Echo Show first came out, I was excited about the possibilities, but a screen didn't appeal to me as I was mostly focused on finding an easy way to play music throughout our house, and the original Echo speaker worked great for that. I originally chose the Echo because I want quality sound but I don't need anything that anyone would consider hi-fi, so I didn't want to invest in a more expensive ecosystem like Sonos or Bose (plus, at the time, Sonos didn't have a speaker with Alexa yet). I just wanted background music for the bedroom when getting ready, in the living room when hanging out, and in the kitchen when cooking and eating, so I invested in a Dot and a few Echoes (I have several of both the original Echo and the 2017 2nd generation Echo). I've been really happy with all of these speakers.

However, as I've invested more in the Echo ecosystem, I've also started to incorporate more smart home products, especially wifi outlet switches. While those don't benefit from a screen, I've become increasingly interested in getting a smart thermostat and wifi cameras as well. So, when the Show went on sale for $179.99 on Black Friday (plus just $5 more for a TP-Link Mini Smart Plug) at Best Buy, I went and picked one up (it was the first time I've ever bought an Echo device from any place other than Amazon, and it didn't affect set-up or anything at all).

Here's why I give this 5 stars:
+ The setup was the easiest of all the Echo products I own because you set it up using it's own screen instead of the app of the phone.
+ The screen is vivid and clear, perfect for watching videos in casual circumstances and for seeing song lyrics, which my wife enjoys.
+ The sound is much more crisp, clear, and full sounding than any of my other Echoes (my Dot is hooked up to a Klipsch 2.1 Promedia system, so it technically sounds better, but honestly, for 90% of my listening, I'd actually prefer the all-in-one Show). Before I got the Show, I was pairing 2 standard Echoes in my bedroom for a fuller sound, but I've found that the Show is enough for our bedroom (the Show isn't equal to the 2 paired Echoes, but it's good enough to stand alone). I actually think the sound for the type of music I listen to most (modern, acoustic, mellow folk and indie) is really quite good. The quality also stays much better than my other Echo speakers when played at higher volumes, too.
+ The user interface is pretty simple and intuitive
+ The screen adds a dimension that the other Echoes cannot (lyrics, display time and temperature, showing suggestions and ways to engage with it) that I have appreciated. I may grow tired of the suggestions, but the preferences will allow you to limit some of that. Also, simple things that I commonly do with my Echoes is just better with a screen (for example, some parts of my Flash Briefing now have video and weather forecasts are easier for me to digest when I see them [likewise when I ask about what's on my calendar]).

The only drawback I've found with the hardware itself is that it's not built onto a rotating platform or one that can change the angle at which the show sits. Third parties have made bases for the Show, but ones that do all of that aren't exactly cheap, and I haven't yet justified spending the extra money.

While I give the Show 5 stars, there are a few things I hope that Amazon and third parties will add to improve the overall experience:
- Add more video flash briefing content (especially content that was originally video, such as the Daily Show and late-night monologues).
- Create some sort of a night mode that keeps the screen off except when I want to see the time (perhaps a tap to bring the screen on as it does now, but then include a way to  easily turn the screen back off without saying, "Alexa, turn off the screen," such as another tap or simply have a setting for it to turn completely off again after 5-10 seconds. [***Update 12/8/17: This actually is a feature -- it just takes two steps: all you have to do is go to Settings -> Display and toggle off the Ambient Clock. Then, turn the Echo's Do Not Disturb Mode on. It will now default to having the screen off, and it will turn on for only a short time as you interact with it (which can be through touch, so you don't wake anyone up if you just want to see the time in the middle of the night). Now I think the Echo Show is the perfect bedside replacement for an alarm clock.***]
- Allow alarms to be set to play a music playlist instead of an alarm sound. [***Update 12/12/17: Thanks to a new update on 12/11/17, this is an option!***]
- More generally, and I'm not sure if this is possible because of the way Amazon is using Bluetooth to create multi-room audio groups, I'd like to see multi-room music become more flexible (speakers could belong to more than one group or groups could be nested together under a larger group). I'd also like to be able to 'move' music (such as a playlist I'm currently playing) from one group to another (like when I leave my bedroom to go down to the living room) without having to start the playlist over.

Overall, I highly recommend this Echo. I think it is by far the best of all my Echo devices (though they are all great, too!)

author: Just your average person
title: Decent in the kitchen, bad alarm clock
content:
Bought 2 of these, one for the kitchen, and one as an alarm clock (Yes I am aware that the dot is actually designed as the Alarm clock, but this has better speakers for the only Echo in the bedroom).  They don't sound quite as good as the regular old Beta version of the Echo it replaced.  But the screen makes several things nicer to do.  I want to disable all of the "Try Alexa this" messages on the front, because my kid tries them all.

Some of them I don't want her to try.  I wish I could have the Calendar scheduled to be up every morning at 7am as we hit the kitchen, so that I don't have to remember to check it on hectic days, it's already available.

As an alarm clock, I believe it is lacking. It has the 3 buttons on the top, and I had hoped one of them would of let me turn the alarm off.  They do not, the only way to stop the alarm is to swipe up on the screen, but if you accidentally tap the screen you turn it to snooze. The screen still has a lot of backlight at night, making it brighter than I want.  Trying to decide if I can live with it or not.

author: mutsgo
title: was flickering and sent it out, 1 month later back to flickering
content: i like the concept but the execution is terrible, I cannot get a good one i guess, i had sent it out for repair and amazon sent it back "fixed" via a software update well that didnt work, a few weeks later it started doingit all over again just flickering and tweaking video. probably gonna have to contact my credit card company and do a charge back for defective equipment.

author: Indian Giver
title: I love my Amazon show
content: I love my Amazon show. Its everything I thought it was and more. I put my grandchildrens picture on as background. I have been able to learn so many things about cooking, world events. I have seen many videos about cooking, I have seen previews about movies. On my home screen. It's worth the price just wish I could afford to by each of my children one.

author: F. D. Meyer
title: See and Show is Super Easy!
content: Fantastic addition to the Alexa product family. Use it to be able to Drop-In on 94 year old Mother, who lives apart from us. Being able to Drop-In anytime, and to be able to see and talk with her, and her us, is a fantastic attribute, which we use very frequently. Also great to Drop-In on grandkids across the country! Super product!

author: HaveSomeCommonSense
title: My Echo Show was old and out of date making it appear broken. Turns out it needed a software update.
content:
I just finally decided to break down and get the Echo Show as it was 100 dollars off and I have many other Amazon Dots and Echos. I can tell you this they must not be selling well because mine was not working very well when I first got it. It would not pull up recipes even though it would say here is what I found. It would try to show me videos using YouTube (this was exciting for a second as I know Amazon and Google are fighting so YouTube is not allowed on Amazon devices making me think the feud was over) but they would never come up. I then was thinking this Echo Show is very old and out of date so I did a factory reset trying to see if it would update or something to fix the problem but it didn’t. After 2 hours I was ready to return it. The wife and I needed to to get some groceries so we left for a bit. When we came back I asked the Echo Show to show me recipes again and it worked! I asked it to show me a video and it brought up Bing instead of YouTube. I knew it had done a software/firmware update and now it was good. Later I found it has an option to check for software updates in the device options.

Also there is a lot of people saying these are louder and sound better than the Echo. That may be true for the new shorter Echo but certainly is not true about the taller original Echo. In fact I believe my original Echos are louder. Either way the Show is very loud and sounds pretty good.

As far as calling people on phones using the Echo Show it is better than my original Echo in the fact that it seems to have either noise canceling or the speaker mic configuration setup is better and the caller doesn’t hear an echo of their voice.

author: Shiloah Poore
title: Nice System
content: This is a very convenient product. I have a handicapped father and this device is very helpful to him. I love the drop-in feature so that he can contact me if there is an emergency. Depending on where you place the device in your home depends on the level of accuracy. The video may come in stronger in one place than another. Overall, this is a great product and would highly recommend.

author: A. Express
title: Once again, Amazon customer service fails to impress.
content:
Was sent this unit as a replacement for a defective 1st Generation Echo.  Worked great for about 2 weeks.  Now it doesn't turn on at all. Completely DEAD.  I wanted so much to get this working, because my last experience with Amazon Customer Service was so horrible, I was dreading having to call them.
My call was as expected...  30 minutes just to get to someone who spoke English, then told that they had to re-register the dead unit to my account.  Then go through troubleshooting - "is it ok if I send a test signal to it?"  Ummm... it's dead, unplugged, packed in a box for return.  But ok.  You would think, that a 3 week old unit, which suddenly died - would be an easy replacement for Customer Service.
After 10 minutes of "troubleshooting" I get transferred to "Echo Technical Support".  UGH! I don't need technical support... Just to be clear, I own 10 Echo devices.  I'm fairly adept technically, and can often troubleshoot far more than technical support can.  And with the Echo Show - there's no "reset" button.  If it doesn't turn on, you're done.

author: Mike E Saunders
title: Screen flickers badly
content: Fine for about 2 months, then the screen began flickering badly. I understand that defects occur, but had to spend 20+ minutes on the phone trying software solutions for what was obviously a hardware defect before they would consider sending a replacement. Very frustrating. Had to do a factory reset, and now it’s completely unusable while I wait for a replacement.

author: C. Winkler
title: Great sound quality
content: I've got several Echo Dots, and the sound quality on the Show is much better. I was hoping to be able to access my recipe files (on Google Drive) through this, so that it would be good in the kitchen, but doesn't seem possible. I've enabled some recipe skills, but haven't tried them yet. Might try doing some recipe screen shots, and see if they can be brought up onto the Show through Photos

author: Vargr
title: Meh
content: I'm not super impressed with the show, especially for the price. It's no better than having a tablet and a stand. Someone reported the speaker was on par with the original echo, it's not, it is plenty loud though. Given you could create the same basic set-up with a $50 tablet and a $30 bluetooth speaker, I'm going with 3 stars. It's cool for an alarm clock than lets you read news headlines, or plays random documentaries on command, but not $130 cool, much less $220.

author: Melinda Yost
title: I like this device however
content:
I like this device however, I already pay for Netflix, Wi-Fi, my Cable, and I have amazon prime, while amazon prime will show videos; nothing else works (regarding video capablity) without the fire tv stick, dish network, frontier, or Optic Hub. I knew there wpuld be additional fees for things like netflix, Hulu, etc. but figured the capablity would be there to use it.
So I have to purchase a Fire TV stick for 39 dollars in order to watch Netflix or YouTube or see any videos. This is irritating because I only have one TV that isn't a smart TV (which meaning I can already watch Amazon Prime Videos, Netflix and YouTube everywhere in my house) and I really have now need for fire tv. I did read reviews and specs on the fire tv stick and at least there is not a monthly fee to use it...just for subscriptions like Netflix etc.
I am worried that  the fire stick remote and my show will both pick up at the same time because my echo show can pick up my voice from almost anywhere in the house. I purchased an echo dot for my son's room upstairs which is the most difficult place to hear from. Which means 2 will be on the same floor. Praying it doesn't create a hassle.
All in all without the fire stick the, you can still use drop-in feature and see lyrics to songs as well as use apps (some for which have video and/or graphics) but to search YouTube or watch Netflix etc you must have fire stick. Not happy about the extra expense at all. Feel like this feature could have been preloaded in the device.  Which is why I have a 3/5 stars. If I had a need for the Fire Stick I would have given 5/5.

author: Olongapo expiat
title: A great home item
content:
This has been so helpful.
I can say "show front camera" and up it comes on the screen.
I can change my thermostat setting" raise thermostat 2 deg's"
easy to use, easy to set up.

author: John D.
title: Great but looking forward to updates
content: So far im very happy with the show.  Being able to view my Arlo cameras. I haven't used the video chat after we first set it up. The video chat works well, but Facetime is more convenient.  It has replaced my alarm clock next to my bed and i like it except this is where i see some obvious oversights.  It needs to make the home screen more customizable!  I would love to make the font size of the clock larger to be easier to read without glasses, the ability to adjust brightness and although the notifications can be reduced, the cycling notifications do change the light and is annoying to see brightness changes while trying to sleep.

author: ChasedYeti
title: The sound quality is very good. It gives a nice rich sound for watching ...
content:
The setup process for the Echo Show was a little quirky -- more so than other Echo devices I've setup (I have an Echo, 6 Dots, and 2 Shows).  I had to restart it and connect to the network several times, but once setup, I've been impressed.  I have it in my home office and play movies from Amazon Prime Videos while working.  The sound quality is very good.  It gives a nice rich sound for watching movies.  Pausing a video will cause it to stop in just a few seconds.  It would be nice to persist on the pause screen longer (until dismissed).
I have played around with the calling capabilities a bit, but it is not a primary driver feature for me.
I ordered a couple of items on Amazon PrimeDay from the Echo Show and the process was super simple.  It gave me more confidence seeing the product I'm ordering rather than voice ordering from my Echo / Echo Dot (as I've done in the past).
Now that Echo has a display, I would love to see some apps available for home automation, like visual control for my Hue lights or an app for my Ecobee thermostat.  When Echo/Sonos integration is finally released, I'd definitely like a Show Sonos Music control app.
Finally, I'd like more control over the screensaver, like being able to turn off the "Try.." suggestions altogether, instead of just limiting the scope.  I'm an experienced Echo user and don't want to be persuaded to watch "Dora the Explorer".

author: Sican
title: Great!
content: I have had the Dot for quite a while and thoroughly enjoyed it (still do).  I bought the Echo Show and love it!!  The touch screen is very responsive with crisp colors.  I read reviews with complaints about the speaker, I feel it has a clear rich sound.  I like that the music lyrics are displayed.  I connected my Dot and Show to be able to play music simultaneously in the house.  (if you do this, you will need a male to male audio cable to connect an external speaker to the Dot, you won't be able to bluetooth it)  I like the fact I'm able to view the Daily Deal products on the Show.  I am finding new things to do with it every day.

author: Judy Yu
title: ... expectations but wish Alexa was smarter and I would like to pick what is displayed on my screen specifically ...
content: Meets my expectations but wish Alexa was smarter and I would like to pick what is displayed on my screen specifically my news . Overalll satisfied and very  easy to use and love video chat with family drop in is nice to have.....buy it

author: Ashley
title: Your always being watched.... Always
content: So the wife and I got this for ourselves and my parents, as well as a few cameras that sync with it and our phones. This gave her an overwhelming amount of power.... And a bit of creeping fear. My wife literally saw our son crying from work, then started a playlist of children songs from Echo. He's calm now. Another time, my brother was over, and the camera turned to him and she said hi. I'm always being watched..... Always. Apparently, my wife is Skynet.

author: Nursebeanpole
title: The Echo Show is your kitchem’s best gadget
content: My kitchen go to. I ask Alexa to set oven timers, for recipes, song lyrics, and for my news briefings. Alexa even plays my Prime videos.  And she is getting better all the time.

author: Marshall Gill
title: Takes a little time to get running well
content: I was very excited to get the Alexa show. I have an Alexa and a tap already, but I wanted the show. The first day I was very excited and couldn’t wait to get it set up. The other items setup very fast, but this was a little more difficult. I spent about a half an hour and then went to dinner. I thought I did everything correctly, but I needed a break. When I came back from dinner Alexa was working pretty well and was online on my network. I was very happy with my Alexa once it was working well.

author: Zoa
title: Glitches, Light Bulbs, & Freezing
content: Many of the features worked great at first but lately seem very glitchy. I have my entire house hooked up with hue lightbulbs. Before, when I asked Alexa to turn on/off the lights it was no issue. Now quite often it’ll say “ok” and no lights go on so I’ll have to ask again. Also, when we try to load skills like Jeopardy the echo show will quite often freeze mid game. It can be really frustrating to use this. Hopefully more updates are en route because it has lots of room for improvement now.

author: pastorivera
title: It is a Wonderful way to keep in touch with loved ones.
content: I LOVE it!! I bought one for my 84 year old mom and another one for me and since then we speak to each other daily and I can see her and it brings so much peace of mind. The rest of my family also love it because they can also see her when they call through their phones and Alexa App.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Tech/Peace of Mind for Helping Elderly
content:
My Mom needs more help these days due to memory loss but she is not at the point where she needs full time care. And besides knowing how to work her Kindle, she cannot figure out any other kind of technology nor does she want to (forget a smartphone or iPad).

Enter the Show!

Set up was easy and I enabled the drop in feature for the Show I bought her and myself. Tech averse relative? Problem solved!  I pop up on her screen and all she needs to do is talk to me — she doesn’t even need to say anything to accept the drop in.

So far, I’ve been able to make sure she was using the right prescription toothpaste (she brought it up to the camera), made sure she ate when she was slacking (talking over the phone wouldn’t have enabled me to see her chilling in bed so I was able to encourage her to get up and go) and solved a problem with her landline phone and answering machine (drop in was the only way I could get through to her).  Total peace of mind and it isn’t much different from me being there and popping my head in to check in.

It is also handy for playing her music and putting reminders for appointments up on the screen. She is a visual person and likes to see her appointments in writing. Further, the Show prevented my Mom from getting frustrated via me trying to describe things over the phone — she just shows me stuff and vice versa now. -)

I actually like using my iPhone’s Alexa App rather than my own Show for drop ins because I can walk around and show her other things. This will also be handy when I travel. Glad I have the Show though.

The less than stellar reviews may want more out of the Show but it has so far accomplished what I want and more. I think Amazon will also enable it to grow.

The 2 reasons for 4 out of 5 stars and not 5? (I’d love to give it 4.5 out of 5!)

1) I wish you could toggle the camera lens up and down — even manually. It is hard finding the perfect thing to place it on relative to the height you need.  A simple dial could save lots of headaches. Also, a zoom ability would be nice.

2) I’d love a bigger screen  — or at least have the option in screen sizes to choose from since others may like the screen size. I’m sure this is right around the corner!

One could use this with kid and dog sitters too. In my case, it has given me great peace of mind for a very special person in my life!

author: brooklou
title: Stone deaf
content: I have now had the echo show for several months now and although it does have a few good points I would not recommend anyone to purchase it because of one major flaw that I have experienced and that is it is stone deaf. I have mine set up within 6 feet of my recliner and I usually have to yell the wake word for it to respond. My echo plus is not any better. The irony is that the reconditioned echo dot I have 20 feet away in a separate room will always respond to the wake word while the show and echo plus just sit there, deaf and oblivious. Hopefully they made improvements to the 2nd generation echo show and echo plus but in the mean time I'm stuck with these two expensive paperweights! They both have great sound quality but the frustration of having to repeatedly use the wake word to get them to respond far outweighs this.

author: nycrob81
title: Not quite there yet.
content: Not quite there yet.  We really wanted to like Echo Show in our house of 6 (2 adults, 4 children).  Unfortunately, the device doesn't integrate with Google & Apple services, can't distinguish between child and adult voices, can't play anything from YouTube, or even search and display images ("Alexa, show us pictures of cute kittens").  Sound quality leaves much to be desired too.  I think it's a good first try from Amazon, but in our case, we didn't find it appealing for the above reasons.

author: Hollie Cusick
title: Echo Show is pretty awesome!
content: I am really enjoying my Echo Show. I use it for everything and it works beautifully. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that I thought the sound quality/volume would be better. Don't get me wrong, if you listen to your music at a normal, tolerable level - this is perfect for you. However, if you like your metal turned up to 11, you will definitely need an external speaker/blue tooth speaker to assist. \m/

author: MountainJim
title: Wife loves it.
content: How neat! Video crystal clear...amazing

author: Timothy L. Calhoun
title: Works well in well lite areas
content: Wish you Could customize the screen more with other items than just an image like a calander or something over all not bad but needs to be in well lite areas for video calls and sound could be a little better given how big this thing is

author: Jaime Jay
title: The Amazon Echo Show is Amazing
content: I love this device. I did a head to head comparison with Alexa and Siri and Alexa won out. There were only a couple items that were recognized by Siri better, but I also think that has to do with the fact that I've been using Siri for years. Setting up the system was pretty simple. I took it out of the box, connected it to my wifi and voila! That was it. Highly recommended!

author: SammyB
title: Awkward to handle
content:
I got the two pack deal, the sound sucks, when I ask to show my Prime watchlist it pops up whatever the latest movies are available on Prime.  The Dot does just as well or better.  I have a couple of days before I can send them back, they're going back.

-- They are heavy and awkward to handle,  What I really don't like is the wall wart plug is hardwired to the Show unlike the Dot where you can remove the power plug, I feel eventually this configuration could be pulled out due to a drop or develop a short due to bending as the Show gets moved around,

author: Amazon Customer
title: This is a great tool, especially in the kitchen for recipes
content: This is a great tool, especially in the kitchen for recipes, timers, etc.  Good for listening to music, videos.  My only disappointment is sometimes Alexa does not have answers. Perhaps it will get better over time.

author: elaine
title: If you have an Echo and love it, this is a must
content: If you have an Echo and love it, this is a must.  My family started off with the Dot and while it was ok, we didn't have much use for it.  Thats until we found out the Echo could be used as an intercom for the house.  We have 2 floors in our house and the yelling upstairs to let the kids know it was time for dinner, to get ready, etc was very annoying to listen too.  Echo solved this problem.  Now, the beauty of the View is that we can video conference/intercom upstairs whenever we need to talk to people on the 2nd floor.  Also, we have a 9yo and 7yo and with no landline and only cellphones in the house (that require fingerprint passwords), if there is a crisis that leaves the adults unresponsive, my two kids would have no way of communicating to the outside world.  Well, the Echo's we now own (5 in total, 2 views) solves this problem.  The kids can now call anyone on my phone list, specifically, both my wife and I, as well as the grandparents in an emergency.  Have not tried 911 yet, but I'm sure this would work as well.  Amazon basically runs our house now.

author: Toni S Claus
title: love it
content: My grandkids love to ask Alexa to play a song or tell a joke.  I always ask what time it is, lol.  I waited because I wanted the one with a screen.

author: Kristen Jean
title: Love love love Alexa
content: I love this product.  Alexa knows the answers to everything!  I am having a slight problem connecting her to my smart home devices but I’m sure I’ll figure it out.

author: johngriffin0928
title: Not impressed
content: Echo doesn’t hook up directly with iTunes, which is where my music is. You can’t call up recipes you want, only the weird choices Alexa wants to offer. Alexa also forces its own suggestions or substitutions on you in other areas, most of which are so far off base that it can be irritating to deal with. Right now, the Echo is of limited use. This is not a system that is helping me, but is trying to bend me It it’s own bad taste. I mostly use it as an alarm clock.

author: LB
title: Fail!!! out of warranty less than two ...
content: Fail !!!  out of warranty less than two months and it won't work, no repair or replacement option only I need to purchase a new device.  Not even consideration for the fact I purchased seven of these units.  Time to move on from Amazon if they can not support their own products.

author: rkprince
title: A Great Addition to my Alexa Family
content: I never thought I would want an Echo Show, but I love it!  It shows me my to-do lists, the weather, news, shopping lists, etc.  Having the visual is really an improvement over the original echo.  I had an issue at first connecting with my cloud cam, but Amazon tech support was wonderful!  I contacted them using the Alexa app and they were in touch in a timely manner and even called me back later to ensure that my problem was solved!  The Echo Show is a handy addition to my Alexa family.

author: CH
title: IGNORE MY PREVIOUS REVIEW
content:
I'm changing my review to reflect 2 things:
1. The poor quality of this device. After just a couple of months I had to send it back to Amazon for repair.  Alexa became non-responsive, the screen started jumping around, and sometimes If a song was playing it would stop and restart by itself.
2. The poor repair service.  It's been 2 weeks and there is no updated status posted online, so I called.  Apparently, it's "waiting to be shipped."  I have no ETA.  I'm sorry I purchased it.

TEN STARS
OMG, I LOVE this thing.  The sound is AMAZING and it carries throughout the house.  So, when I'm cooking and I feel like listening to Jazz I say, "Alexa, play some Jazz," and I hear some of the very best Jazz.  WOW!  The same with any other genre -- great music, great sound.
This is a great device, and the video component just makes Echo better.  It integrates beautifully with everything else.  It's plug and play, just select your WI FI provider.  I didn't have to do any other set up.
Thank you Amazon!!!

author: chrissy
title: Alexa is awesome
content: I am still learning all that it does.  But it is so nice to ask it question instead of googling on my phone or laptop for answers.  I love to ask it to play a certain song.  I needed a timer and Alexa can do that for you.  I needed a quick subtraction answer and she gave it instead of using a calculator.  I like it shows a clock and the current temperature.  I even put a photo on its display.  It even show whats happening today on the display.

author: Jerry
title: More than I expected
content: I was given the Show as a gift and did not install it for awhile because I was afraid of it!  I didn't think I'd be able to easily hook it up and get it working. While it took longer than I would have wanted because it could not establish a connection with my wifi, I did get it up and running. It does much more than I could imagine. The bad part, as with most modern technology, is that it probably does more than I even know but I don't even know the questions to ask!!!

author: Warrior808
title: Being there when you can’t !!!
content: This is a great device to monitor children or elders!!! I use this to keep tabs on my mom and play music from her young adult decades which bring bittersweet memories but memories for sure!!! A great device as long as you got internet service!!! The only drawback is you can’t adjust the angle of the screen, maybe the next generation.

author: Prime Beast
title: Video calls amd home automation outstanding !
content: Genius Product, we now have video conferencing all over the home.  Great to have a voice activated resource for researching facts, looking up businesses,  making phone calls, making video calls, home automation, features and uses go on and on.  Kind of cool you can watch prime movies on it also, and Dolby speakers are outstanding.  This is an honest verified purchase user review, no compensation, not an employee of Amazon, just love having voice activated solutions around the home !

author: J. Filippo
title: The sound is so much better than listening to Pandora on my TV or computer
content:
I am so thrilled with the Echo Show!  The sound is so much better than listening to Pandora on my TV or computer.  Rich sound makes
it worth the price.  I have one in the kitchen and one in my sewing room just to listen to my favorite Pandora stations.

author: anthony.f
title: Great addition to our home
content: The show has a lot of features that may make your life a lot easier and more productive but with the lost of the ability to go on YouTube readily,  I feel as though a lot of the entertainment value has been lost but overall a great product especially if you have a smart home or just as a entertainment unit

author: Michael A.
title: Great Home Assistant but Poor Hardware Quality
content:
I picked one of these up pretty soon after they came out. It worked awesome as a little always on display showing the weather and for getting the flash briefing before taking off to work. Main complaint though is the screen. About 3-5 months in, I started to notice the screen would be all glitched/garbled up. For example, if you woke up Alexa the blue bar on the bottom would smear all the way up to the top in a glitchy fashion. Sound and Alexa was working fine, just the screen was unusable.

At first, I thought it was a fluke. I'd see that as I was passing by and then 10 minutes later, the display would be back to normal. As time went on though, the fits became more frequent and would last longer. Towards the end, it would go for days at a time. If I unplugged the display, waited about 10-15 minutes and plugged it back in. It would go back to normal. After that it may be good for the rest of the day or it could go back to glitched up after an hour.

Finally called Amazon Customer Support and spend 20 minutes jumping though all of their hoops for them to determine it needed to be returned for repair. They sent an RMA label but with the new system, I couldn't just print the label off and drop it at a local UPS drop box. I had to drive across town to a UPS Store for them to scan the QR code for the shipping label to generate from that. Then on top of this, I dropped it off 2 weeks ago and haven't heard of anything back. Amazon received it almost a week ago and still haven't heard anything.

So in between the screen issue and the clunky return process (which I haven't received one back yet) I'm putting it at 3 stars. Great home assistant but between the poor hardware quality and the pain in the butt warranty process, I'm not impressed.

*Update*

So after returning the Show for warranty repairs, I didn't hear anything back for almost 4 weeks. I called into customer service and all of a sudden a $0.00 order for a Echo Show had randomly popped up in my order history. When I viewed the order though, it still said not shipped. I double checked my tracking number from when I sent mine back and they have had my show in their possession for 3 weeks before even starting to process. I then checked on when I should receive it and was told that Amazon is out of stock on Echo Shows! Downgrading from 3 to 2 starts now since if it does break or have an issue, you may have to wait weeks to months for the repair.

author: Art the Engineer
title: Echo Show Losing its Wow Factor
content:
Bought 2 Echo Shows in June 2017, buying into the hype. Would work with Ring Doorbell, cool YouTube videos, Skype, etc.
Doorbell function worked GREAT...for 2 weeks. Then nothing. When I researched, found Ring 1 was no longer supported.
Disappointment.  Promises of future  improvements. A few appeared along with the need to reset the device a couple of times. But hey, you can watch YouTube.
Sept 27, 2017: cat fight between Amazon and Google. Who are the victims? Of course, the customers. You clowns need to remember the electronics business is fickle. Customers vote with their wallets. Ask Radio Shack, Circuit City, and all the hw/sw manufacturers whose stock certificates are pretty pieces worthless paper. Give us value for our money or the next big thing will.

author: joyce a smith
title: Love my echo
content: I love it. I can see my son and daughter-in-law when they call me and  I call them they live in another state, it’s  like they are near, I’m still learning more about echo

author: Tw33ty517
title: The best echo device so far!!
content: The screen size is perfect not too big not too small. But.. When making calls to a friend's echo dog from my echo show he said he can barely hear me even though I have the volume to the max on my show.

author: Ryan_H_DC
title: It's ok, zero advantages to having a screen with this device though
content:
I got one as a gift, I have had a Echo since the beta of the first one and am a fan of the devices. Here are my issues with the device:
1. There is NO way to filter Alexa apps by ones designed for the show / it's HARD to find video apps.
2. Very lacking in video / display content. I get almost zero benefit from having the screen, only thing I use it for is Bloomberg news, which is from I can tell the only video news app on the device. (It's missing, CBS News, ABC News, Newsy, all the video streaming news that are on Roku devices and my Apple tablets.)  This is my biggest gripe, it's a device based around a screen and it's missing most of the apps designed for a device with a screen.
3. It does not sound that amazing, the cylinder echo sounds WAY better everywhere in the room even if you are sitting directly in front of the show.
4. Takes up more space than it should with it's slightly small sound
5. It's a super dust magnet, I have a lot of other black AV equipment and this thing gets dusty the second you stop wiping it down

Good things vs other Echos (again, I'm a fan of the advantages of having a Alexa device in general so these are the differences)
1. It shows the time
2. I literally can't think of another advantage, if they got some streaming video apps on it then I would be happy with it but I have had it since Christmas and it's the same stuff, I don't think they have come out with any new Echo Show apps since then

author: Robert L. Kirby
title: Works well and does what it claims
content: It is very good for playing music. Just tell it the name of the artist you want and you can start playing right away. Has nice accurate weather reports and news as well. It is nice for showing your photos. It is mostly done by voice control and fairly easy. You need to be patient at first until you learn Alexa's way.  I have the 7" model but I see today they now have a 10 inch model too.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Disappointing product
content:
So after 1 yr, i can get it to do the following:
Show me my security cameras.. sometimes, display music lyrics, It just tells me the weather... when i would instead like to see a radar image.. and thats about it. Can't get it to do much else.  Would recommend the echo dot!

author: Kelly Willis
title: Love it
content: I love the echo show...provides lyrics with songs, videos, movie trailers, video calls...my son was recently out of the country and wifi wasn't working for FaceTime so we tried the Alexa app and it worked great!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: It is amazing for a quick look up while I am working
content:
This is my second one. I have one in the kitchen and wanted another in my home office.
It is amazing for a quick look up while I am working. I live a very busy life and it helps keep me on track with work and personal appointments.
I will buy for holiday gifts for my whole family. The gift of organization and information at a voice command away.

author: L. Hirohata
title: Echo Show
content: The Echo Show is a very handy device! Have a doorbell camera connected currently and it is very nice to be able to see who is at the door before I open the door.  Planning to add other devices and another camera.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Overpaid 100 mad enough definitely not worth the extra 100.00 to get it right after it came out
content: Lots of extra steps to set up things like Spotify which I have membership but I keep having to go thru setup and adjust settings each time I use it. Picture isn’t as clear as I hoped and the sound is a bit muffled with the amazon recommended wall mount for The echo show. Also not happy for all the money I spent I’m on a payment plan of I believe 64ish dollars a month when I ordered it it was listed 249ish then not even a week later dropped down 100.00 but I’m paying full price it’s last time I hurry to order an amazon product right when it comes out

author: Paul C
title: I feel like I’ve not made much use of the screen nor camera.
content: I feel like I’ve not made much use of the screen nor camera...  I do like the lyrics, weather, and timer displays.  I just don’t know it was worth the extra money given the content I use.

author: Tiffany S. Wilson
title: We love it!!
content: I am enjoy my echo show, I have gifted 2 of them so far and we all enjoy it! I cannot wait for Alexa to be able to multi task like when I'm on a video call I can still tell her to turn on the tv or lights and so on. It would be nice if she also had call waiting! I know Alexa is always improving and I can't wait to see if she will ever be able to multitask!! I also have gifted the echo spot and we love it!!

author: Thomas Harkins
title: I very much like the ability to not only hear "Alexa
content: The Amazon Echo Show has more than met my expectations! The display is OUTSTANDING - it works well with the compatible front door camera that I recently installed. I very much like the ability to not only hear "Alexa," but at times read what she has to say. With the video screen of the "Show" I am able to see song lyrics, watch movie trailers, and much more - all by voice command.

author: Mary
title: One or two Echo’s?
content: While the product seems to be working just fine, we have not been able to determine if we need to keep our original Echo with it or move it to another room.  Possibly we lost them, but I could find no instructions except how to plug it in.

author: Todd
title: My first Alexa love her
content: My first Alexa units I love them. I can control everything thing without switching programs on my iPhone. It’ll play music on both units at the same time. I can also connect to other Bluetooth speakers to fill the house with music easily. The timer settings feature, never thought it be as helpful as it is, but  I love it now. Telling me the time and the weather. My wife loves the calling feature the Alexa microphones pickup much better than iPhone speaker phone. She can walk around the house hands free. Didn’t realize but Alexa can’t dial 911 unless you add echo connect. Then it gives you the ability to get help easily and quickly. Hooking up echo connect tomorrow. The drop in feature make it a fantastic intercom system to talk from upstairs to downstairs. This along with echo connect would be invaluable for the elderly. My father hated the pendants to hang around the neck. This would have been so great. The drop in feature along with extra security cameras. You can check on parents or infants or any loved one who’d give permission to be looked in this way so easily. The ability to seem like you’re  always home with smart home devices. Is so much better than the old light timers. The uses are basically unlimited and continue to grow on a daily bases. Would definitely recommend the echo show Alexa is incredibly helpful.

author: Scott Conwell
title: Spend some time learning the features and become a Power-User!
content: As promised, here are my thoughts after 6 months with the Echo Shows, and now several weeks with a couple of new Echo Spots, Echo Connect... and of course the odd Classic and Dot strewn about the house: these devices have made me empowered, enlightened, lazy, spoiled, and content beyond my expectations. They are more than a voice controlled juke box... They adjust my thermostat as I lie in bed and speak my desired temperature; they make my coffee as I take my morning shower; they play soft music and turn off my lights as I drift off at night, and turn the lights back on and wake me up each morning as my alarm clock; they have become the brains in my old landline phone, dialing the number as I speak it; they are my whole house intercom; they are my pet-cam and my nanny-cam; they are my laundry timer; I can "drop in" on my kitchen from my cell phone on my drive home from work for a video call. And no, I'm not worried they're listening or watching all the time (other than listening for the wake word). These devices definitely have impacted my lifestyle. They no longer support YouTube, but that's outweighed by all the other great stuff they can do. I definitely recommend the device and the culture that is Amazon Echo.

author: Robert Hornbeck
title: Can't get rid of "Try *$&%^ skill suggestion on home screen"  FAIL
content: Well, I really wanted this to work.  As I get older and crankier in my later years, I get frustrated when the developers don't create options the way I expect.  My biggest heartburn was the perpetually situated "Try Alexa how do you . . ." forced on us on the screen in the bottom half of it.  A big deal?  Certainly not, but I wanted a nice clean, peaceful screen that showed the time and weather, and perhaps ONLY that.  Not some change skill suggestion.  I verified via other geek sites that folks have been asking for this capability for over a year. . . and it still hasn't happened.  So, I am sending my unit back today.  This is such a simple thing, and I refuse to buy in to a product where the manufacture won't configure it the way WE want it.  Your mileage may vary . . .

author: Amazon Customer
title: Worth Buying!
content: The Echo Show is pretty awesome. I can't believe how much sound is packed into this device. We have it in the kitchen and the highest volume setting fills our entire downstairs area. The kids have a blast "quizzing" it during afternoon snacks or watching from our Prime library. It does NOT disappoint!

author: Yaz63
title: Echo Show is well worth it.
content: The Echo Show is amazing. We use it for several things. Music in our gazebo, answering our Ring doorbell, videos and other things. Best purchase we’ve made.

author: Mom of two
title: Too expensive for what you get. Get the cheaper Alexa.
content: Too expensive for what you get. Doesn’t know the answers to most of the things and reads of first line of wikepedi information and half the time doesn’t know how to retrieve information. Music playlist is dependent on what Amazon has. I feel we paid too much money for this. Nothing special. You are better off buying the cheaper Alexa. Waste of money.

author: Gabriel Cerda
title: Works Great for a first model
content: Works Great for a first model. Would like to see the ability to load apps off amazon (Google market) to work with Echo Show. (netflicks/google maps/Foscam/Pintrest/). And wish the next model would come with a detachable power cord or a wireless power source, so that you can freely move the item around.

author: Chad
title: On big issue really hurts this product
content: The Echo show does a lot of things that are super useful.  Showing timers on the screen while cooking is really nice and many of the apps use the screen well to enhance their experiences.  However it feels like the dumbest "smart" product ever.  Headlines will scroll across the screen and below it will display "Say Alexa, what is the story about..."  Reading these verbatim will never get the story about the headline, and a very frustrating game ensues to find the right command to hear what the story I was interested in hearing about actually was.  I know a couple other people who own an Echo Show and they have this issue as well.  If Amazon fixed this issue the Show could easily become a 5 star product.

author: Rick Kolster
title: THIS IS A PIECE OF JUNK! If I could give it less than One star, I would.
content:
Got the Echo Show to compliment my Echo system.  Within a month the screen had wavy lines and interference going through the screen rendering it useless.  I requested a new one, I was directed to return it to repair it.  Sent it back.  took 3-4 weeks to get back to me and it still has the same issues.  They were minor at the beginning but now.  The device has the screen flicker and turns on and off intermittently.  Now it struggles to stay connected to the internet.  All other devices are connected and working fine.

BAD BUYING DECISION!  I tried to contact Amazon to get the issue resolved only now no way to contact them since they already did one repair.  MAD MAD MAD!

author: Jrugg16
title: Just Horrible! Sending back to Amazon.
content:
I wanted so bad for this to work. I wish I read other review on the Alexa apps for different skills because EVERYONE is having the same issues with the Echo connecting to cameras.

I got this to use as a baby monitor for the Arlo Baby Camera. It’s so inconsistent! It’s connects roughy 1 out of 10 times. On the Arlo app it works great 100% of the time. Even pulling up my Ring door bell it connects about half the time when asking the Echo so show who is at the front door.

Iv spent days in my modem trying different settings for channel, 2.4/5ghz, changing camera names etc. Nothing worked. Not even when each device was in the same room next to eachother.

I can’t believe Amazon put this out just read others reviews here and also on the Alexa app. Also Amazon and Google apparently are on opposite ends of the world and Amazon Echo will not allow you to play YouTube videos anymore. Unreal.

I just printed out a return lable and this is going back to Amazon for a refund. I hope one day they can get this unit up to par.

author: Jeff Hiles
title: Clock Display Suddenly Too Small!
content:
I’m mad. Amazon ruined my echo show yesterday. I had replaced my bedroom clock with it. The time displayed large enough that I could read it from anywhere in the room. But yesterday, the time display shrank to where I can’t read when I wake in the morning and look over at it. My Echo Spot has a bigger time display than this. The spot also has lots of options for how you want the clock to look. This doesn’t. Please let users adjust the size of the clock!
UPDATE: Someone from Amazon called me after I posted the above with one star. She asked me a few questions about what I would like to see. She said she would give my feedback to the developers. A couple weeks later the text on the time display went back to a more readable size. So I have increased my rating.

author: MchalffeyA
title: The sound is fantastic!!!
content: This thing is so cool. I originally only even bought this so I could search recipes while I was cooking. Which by the way is super fun!! But the best part of this time so far is the sound!! This sounds better than all my Bluetooth speakers I have and I already used Amazon music so it works out perfectly!! I was also able to link my Google calendar also do now it sets reminders for me! Really cool. Another feature I didn't know about was it basically had a more button so if someone accidently says Alexa it won't go off.

author: ChrisC
title: Could be better
content:
Getting there but still the software needs work.
Gotta add skills to make any of the devices do what you like.  Many of the apps and addons seem sketchy.

Would like an easy way to stream from one device to another or play music throughout all devices.

Be nice if you could direct device to a fire TV

author: desert shopper
title: No video
content: Why have a screen if you can’t show videos that correspond with your question? Also, Alexa doesn’t know why Harvey Weinstein was fired, so you can’t count on her to keep you current.  Most stories they project are incredibly trivial and yet repeat for hours or days on end.  Lots of room for improvement.

author: C. Cortez
title: Was great...
content: Had this for a little over 5 months and it worked great, but now its starting the make this crackling noise from the speakers when playing music.  It sounds absolutely terrible.  It looks nice though and is handy with reminders and such, but the speaker is a big let down.

author: Jason
title: It's a big Meh...
content: Sound quality goes down pretty quickly. Had it for two months now, have only turned it up about 3/4 of the way to max and speakers started sounding like they were blown. Doesn't always play what you tell "her" to or what "she" recommends, video wise, the first or even second time. sometimes doesn't turn on the lights when you tell "her" to the first, second or even the third. After third or fourth time i just use the Phillips hue app.  Not very knowledgeable when compared to ok Google. More like a 2 1/2 star

author: Thomas. Sundich
title: Sounds great too. On
content: It,is,what it is and than some. Sounds great too. On,y thing I dont like the camera being seen by anyone working for amazon  I asked echo show to show me camera and didn’t know what I was saying but knows how to turn camera on and off but can’t dhiw u what’s recording hmm

author: Grill-baby
title: Great device, want one for me.
content: Truth be told, I love the device. Bought it for my son to replace his broken alarm clock and the kid loves it. He’s very technical and so it has all the features and more to keep him intrigued. I like being able to video call him from my phone. Thinking about buying one for my parents to stay in touch with them. The one feature, that I’m not as excited about are the parental controls. You can understand my pause when my child has access to Amazon Prime Account and can watch videos. I’ve set up ratings controls and ‘I think/hope’ blocked purchases from the device. My shock was with the blocks, I found video games in my shopping cart. I truly wish icould deactivate the video and cart options as my smart son likes technology. Separately, I’m jealous and want my own echo show.

author: EPCDOCTOR
title: The best version of Alexa is the Show
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player This is hands down the best Alexa ever. The screen makes a huge difference when using Alexa and visually how it displays what is relevant to what you asked for..

author: Jeremy Lesley
title: Patience and look for updates to firmware
content: So far it’s wirking good although the Arlo use can be a bit slow but does work got this for home automation and is doing great looking forward to seeing more integration use on my part going to add smart plugs already have lights and cameras and works good so far works good with different music accounts and pictures does have slide show though it says it doesn’t also supports Bluetooth even though it says it doesn’t I’m learning how to use only had a few hours and almost everything took very little set up time 5 stars got this for prime day for $140 excellent buy definitely get one thinking of getting another for the bedroom

author: MisterEman
title: I like the concept
content: I like the concept, so far I've only had a couple of issues. It has turned on by itself two times. And on several occasions it would not respond to my voice command even after training. In my opinion overall it is a very good device. I would say 90% of the time it works flawlessly .The downside it has a lot of learning to do in order to work without glitches.

author: Bosco G
title: You’ll love it!
content:
I love this thing!  I’m old school. My first programming class was on a VAX machine with punch cards. I really appreciate the work involved in creating Alexa. When I talk to Alexa my thoughts are overwhelmed with possibilities for Alexa’s future.  The music feature is wonderful and the clock is superb!  I like the screen and the little clouds with sunshine for the weather report.
You can’t go wrong with this purchase!  You will love it!

author: WhipReynolds
title: My wife also like the features of being able to watch movie trailers
content: My wife and I are enjoying Alexa installed in our new Echo show, this is our first Alexa experience. My wife also like the features of being able to watch movie trailers, playing music, asking some difficult questions, and reading all the flash cards all day. We have not yet connected the Alexa capable security camera I purchased, but I am sure it will exceed my expectations. My wife uses Alexa Echo Show as a companion all day, asking her questions that she normally would have asked me. Before I would have told her to Google it, now I tell her to ask Alexa..... What a GREAT product, and I can't wait until Amazon makes this device even more capable. One thing that would be great would be - telling Alexa your name and having Alexa address me and my wife by name. When that feature comes - if we need to purchase a new Alexa device we will be happy to purchase and add it to our home. Please keep making Alexa smarter Amazon, and I am sure you will, that's a given statement.

author: Pam
title: Does not work well with Arlo cameras
content: This is a fun toy - but we didn't really buy it to be a toy. Two things convinced us to buy it. First is the "intercom" feature, which works great to communicate with our 90 year old Mom in her apartment on our lower level. The second, however, is to be able to see what is on our Arlo cameras. Occasionally, one of the 4 will briefly work. Most of the time, it will not show anything or will only do so for a few seconds before stopping. Still, it works great on the other smart home products and gives good information. It is easier for Mom to ask it (hers is an Echo Dot) for weather, scores, schedules, etc, than to look it up online or send me a text.

author: DJG
title: Visuals Make The Echo Experience Richer
content: Love the device. We have been using Echos and Dots since they were launched, but the Show really brings the whole experience up a notch. It's great having such a vibrant screen, and the ability to watch videos and see photos really makes it a lot of fun to use. I've brought up cooking videos in the kitchen, loaded our photos, played with the camera feature and such. A tremendous benefit is being able to set a timer and see how much time is left on it. We were very disappointed, however, to learn that we could not access YouTube videos, since that was the primary reason we bought it. Very much hoping that Amazon works something out with YouTube to make what is now a fun device truly one that's indispensable.

author: JLD
title: Easy & convenient
content: I love my echo devices, this one is cool because it shows you things on the screen. Although I use it most for music and really don't stand there looking at the screen much. I was disappointed that it went on sale 30$ cheaper 2 weeks after I bought it and Amazon refused to do a price adjustment.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Nice upgrade to alarm clock plus potential
content: Quality build,  nice touch screen,  good speakers,  good set of functions. I like the "flash briefings" in the morning because you can stack 5-10 briefings from different sources and execute all with a single command. Wish they had flash briefings 1, 2, 3 so I could choose news briefs, sports briefs,  etc.  I underutilize the Show now since no control of security, lights, coffee pots, etc.  Repeating alarms are limited and need Alexa app to set, but single alarm is great.

author: Terry Kringle
title: Great if you want to see what is playing and/or have photos being displayed.
content: I received the Echo Show for my birthday. I originally purchase the Echo for my wife’s birthday and liked it so much bought the dot for my birthday pairing it with a Bluetooth speaker. Because the Echo Show went on sale and I liked the idea of seeing what was playing I asked for it for my birthday. I also liked the idea of it having its own speakers. I enjoy it very much and listen to it probably at least once a day. If you want to see what is playing and have photos being shown it is well worth having otherwise I would just purchase the Echo.

author: T. D. Wood
title: It is what it is
content: I like this upgrade.  You get the screen that allows you to watch movies if you have prime or have bought the movie.  Other than that, she works just like Alexa only with a screen.  You could Karaoke with her if you like.  But let's face it, its Alexa with a screen.  If you don't care about the bells and whistle of seeing things like you would on a tablet, the tower is just fine.  But I'm a techie girl, so I love it.

author: Paul Dupuie
title: Echo show is best for deaf people.  She talk in caption!
content: It's surprise me royalty that echo show talked to me in captions!  I'm deaf and it helped me and my wife very much.  She don't have to repeat everything what amazon was saying anymore.  I even watched a movie with close caption also.  It is a must for all hard of hearing and deaf people out there!

author: michael
title: ... on her own and playing music on her own like someone's giving her a command
content: So far we've had a couple of problems with Alexa as far as her starting on her own and playing music on her own like someone's giving her a command. Also there's a lot of apps to download for her without downloading the apps it's like Alexa doesn't know how to answer questions without those apps...  I just think it's crazy it's a computer and you have to download apps in order for her to be knowledgeable on questions that you have for her and it's not already programmed into her database!!!

author: Jamazon
title: Great price !
content: Works great.  I work from home and it's on my desk.  I use it all the time.  The screen is super clear.  Since i bought it I have been finding new things it does almost daily.  The regular price is a bit much but at $130 it's definitely worth it.  Got one for Mom too.  She likes it also.

author: E J Dennis
title: Love it...but.
content: Yes we enjoy the Show in our home, with the exception of an audio jack for private listening..would not have purchased if we had known this. How you could design such a wonderful product and omit this function?

author: MerriSu
title: FUN
content: Having fun learning what she will and won't do. I was led to believe that I could connect to my Netflix but apparently I cannot do that yet. Otherwise i am pleased.

author: T. Graham
title: I love my echo show!
content: What can I say, it's another really well made Alexa device.  The speaker is adequate for its size and the video screen is really good quality.  Also, I recently got a Ring spotlight battery and I can view that camera from my Echo show using voice commands which is really cool especially when I'm in the kitchen and my hands aren't free.  I got it right after they dropped the price below $200 and I'm very glad I did.  I get to watch my news clips in the morning while I make coffee, check my appointments for the day, make reminders for myself and create a shopping list all using my voice.  It's almost like having a personal secretary.  Also, the video calls have been very good so far with no lag and I can even video chat with a mobile phone if they have Alexa installed.

author: ava76
title: Excellent for Phone calls and Youtube Video.
content: Very Nice Echo device. I can watch Youtube video by voice. If it had Plex video would be excellent. I own Amazon Echo 1st generation with Echo Dot 1st generation. Plus 2 lights and 3 plug all connected to my Echo devices. Amazon Echo and Echo Show has good sound when play music or video now.  Keep up the good work. I notice alot companies following your lead. My Amazon phone was ahead of its time on 3D graphics hopefully the people will catch up to your future ideals. Commodore 64 was way ahead of its time and took people 20 years later to figure that out.

author: Amazon customer
title: Echo Show Totally Alexa-Enabled and Much More!
content: Even though I cannot access YouTube videos, it still can access videos from other locations which is great when learning how to cook something.  Does everything a normal Alexa-enabled device can plus seeing things, such as the words to a song that is playing.  Does so much more and worth every penny.

author: Wade Ridgeway
title: has potential
content:
Keep the firmware coming.
We have six of these that we have either in the house. or have given as gifts to family members.
The retail of 229.00 is a joke . As an early adopter I paid $160.00 for my first one but they have fallen to $80.00 in AWH Deals.
The Sound is OK, about on pair with the Echo.
The biggest loss was the loss of YouTube.
It was great for videos in the kitchen when you are cooking.
It is now terrible for video.
The most useful aspect of the Show is the drop-in feature where you can remotely check on the house, integrate with cameras, talk to family and use as an intercom throughout the house,
its current price of about a hundred buck is pretty appropriate of its true value.
If amazon integrates more features through firmware updates, it's rating could imporve and make it a powerhouse.

author: M. Robinette
title: Helpful, Fun and always something new to discover.
content: This was a gift and something I would not have thought to buy for myself. It is a handy item to have. Was easy to set up and use. Although it has many fun and informative features my favorite is the timer. When cooking I can set timers for each item without having to push buttons or stop what I'm doing. We've had fun asking Alexa questions and getting our weather report while doing other things. Another very cool feature is being able to make phone calls. Recently my cell phone kept dropping a call I needed to make. Told Alexa to make the call and it stayed connected. Plus it is just nice to speak the number and make the call while you are hands free to go on doing other things. I'm sure as we learn more of what Alexa is capable of we will find many other fun and useful ways to use this item.

author: Ramon Martinez
title: The show, showing Arlo
content: I got it mainly for my 10 Arlo cameras. It's about 25 second to 1 minute delay before it previews my camera on the echo show. Maybe that will improve with software later on. It only allows you to view one cam at a time and there is no speaker or mic option for Arlo cams. Alexa is not that smart like Google or even Sire from Apple. The speakers sound  okay as for music.  I'm hoping with updates that this device get better and more options. I have the Arlo pro cams and it does work. ( Limited )

author: B. Murphy
title: We were thinking of buying maybe a total of 6-8 units if people liked them. We also have the Google competitor
content:
Bought one unit for our home, with the intention to see if maybe we would use them in more rooms and also some executive office at work.  We were thinking of buying maybe a total of 6-8 units if people liked them.
We also have the Google competitor, which we don't like.  Poor music selection, also the device can't really hear voice commands when it's playing something, it has been relegated to the garage and hardly ever used.
Amazon was the clear winner with it's far field voice recognition.  Youtube access really made this unit worthwhile...without youtube, not so much.  So now we have no intention of buying any more Echo Show's, and we will cancel our order for seven of the Echo shows.  Even if they do get Youtube back, now we have seen it can be pulled away at any time due to marketing and content disputes...Now I'm wondering how long Echo products will support any 3rd party...Maybe Netgear Arlo support will go away soon too, then we definitely won't buy any more Echo products.

author: Cliente Kindle
title: Eliminates the need to identify which one of the 15 smart home apps I need to use...
content: I am using it extensively to control my smart home devices including Lutron, Guardian air purifiers, ring, lutron, scout alarm, netvue cameras, harmony hub, smartthings, nest, Kasa, iLinkte, etc.  It truly integrates all components for a smart home. Only issue is sometimes it won't understand me probably because of my accent. Sound is great, would love to have HDMI out to play videos on non-smart devices.

author: jamie
title: Echo Show and what you should know
content: This would have gotten 5 stars however there is a major flaw with the Echo show. It works great for some things; however if you are sharing a household account ie Prime you will also be sharing all your contacts, calendars and whatever information you have on each others Echo Show. If I want to call someone; it calls someone from my daughter-in-laws contacts. Not good at all and after contacting Amazon Tech service their only solution to delete your household account and pay for separate accounts.  This is a bug; a major bug. Deregistering it does not work, nor does resetting to factory settings so don't waste your time trying that. The Tech people have been helpful but can't fix it nor could they offer a discount on separating the Prime accounts.

author: Alan Gamboa
title: Once you know how to phrase commands/questions the echo family of products is an invaluable tool for the home.
content: As a prime member I was able to get the original echo on pre-release and have used it everyday - it's part of my family's everyday life now. Setting timers, alarms, adjusting the thermostat, weather conditions, cooking measurement conversions, shopping lists, there probably more that I have not listed.  The screen on the show adds a new dimension on interactivity. It just adds more functionality that is very useful.  When cooking you can see multiple timers (easier than hearing them), it interfaces seamlessly with our Arlo wireless cameras so you can see what's happening outside, Have yet to video conference on it, need to wait until our friends get the Echo Show. I do own a Google Home Mini, and it seems to answer general question better than the Echo, but I suspect that will change over time. However; I do find it easier the say "Alexa" vs "OK Google" or "Hey Google", it just feels less awkward saying "Alexa"

author: Hector Miramontes Jr
title: Works great
content: This device I like except that it doesn't show the date on the main screen. Gosh, I have a 20 dollar device that shows outside and inside temperature, date, and time. Other than that I am happy with my purchase. I was able to customize the screen so that it shows my pictures. Works like any other echo device except that now you can see things on the screen. I like the drop in feature and being able to make calls . Overall a pretty good deal..

author: Repro63
title: Pay a premium for little content and practical use of the screen.
content: I love the Echo Show, however, it is a lot of money for the little function the screen offers. Don't get me wrong, I love using Amazon Echo's for all sorts of things, however, the screen as nice as as it is, offers very little function. You can see the weather and watch videos from YouTube. The screen is small for videos. The daily "Briefing" is also great offering some video. Other than that, this is a premium to pay fo every little practical use. I hope Amazon expands the use of the screen. The Echo Dot is still the best bang for the buck.

author: Michael Dalton
title: How can you live without this?
content: I am totally spoiled to this. The quality is awesome. How do you get along without this product? As far as I am concerned, this product is the head of the class for personal assistance....I would buy another.....I have two other echos in other rooms.....

author: AuthorElizabethYork
title: Worst Alexa is the more expensive one.
content:
I have one of each version of the Alexa electronics. The dot is awesome, the spot is even better, but this one - the show is horrible.

First, I am trying to understand why you would pay so much for a mini tv. The screen that is the same size as a Kindle has the ability for you to watch apps - the same thing you can do on a Kindle for less money.

Then there is the unreliability. I tried to put it in my daughter's room and have it as an alarm since it's louder than her clock, only this thing is sluggish, delayed, and acts like someone stumbling to get up after a night of drinking. She definitely doesn't understand the concept of time.

Alexa stop! I yell this more times than I care to admit. Why? Because she doesn't listen. Like an onery child you have to repeat the words like a broken record before it sinks in.  We know she hears us as she quiets down and waits for us to say it, but also like that drunken morning, complying seems to be something only the sober Google Home items can do.

If I could return mine I would in a heart beat, but that would require Amazon admiting something is wrong. You see, tech support can only help if she's acting up when you call, but my petulant device acts up when she wants to. A devil in disguise, she wears her halo bright when you complain about the wrong she does, but when tech is no longer listening she does whatever the hell she wants.

author: Jeffrey
title: Great addition to any smart home!
content: Love my new Echo Show! I cant believe I finally got one! Echo in every room off my apartment! It's great to see and hear! I wish our had a built in HUB for smart devices! That would have been a big plus for the price!

author: Julie Lowry
title: Perfect for My 84 year old Mom
content: This was purchased for my 84 year old Mother for Christmas. She LOVES it and has told all of her friends all about it. BTW...she is NOT able to move around well and must always use her walker. With the Echo Show she can just talk to it and not have to get up and down to touch anything. She LOVES listening to the music, checking on the weather report, listening to the jokes and she always tells Alexa what time to wake her up. The wonderful benefit for my siblings is we can "drop in" and see her to check if everything is ok if we are unable to get her on the phone. We have it positioned in a spot where we can see the living room area and also her doorway to her bedroom. I am SO very happy my daughter told me about the Echo Show. She is the one who thought this would be fabulous for Grandma! She was RIGHT. If anyone has a parent they would like to be able to "drop in" and see....the Echo Show is the absolute perfect gift and they in turn gain so much pleasure out of owning it!

author: Alan Weinstock
title: Great Hardware But More Work is Needed on the Software
content: I like the hardware but I think the Software needs some more work & improvements.
