For example, trying to call a particular echo device from my Android App causes ALL Echos on the account to ring. It would also be nice if I could control the size and placement of my local video image while in a video call.

author: Robin G Martin
title: Great Idea but spotty performance
content: The concept is good.  But the performance is a little spotty.  I am using the Echo Show for an elderly person and I am using an iPhone and my success rate is about 50%.  Did find out that it performs better on a WiFi versus using my phone provider.  I am hoping the performance improves.

author: Nanciejeanne
title: So far, we like this! [updated]
content:
I got 3 of these when they first came out (there was a promo discount when you bought 2.) My family lives in different parts of the state and we thought it would be nice to interact with them through this AND have the other echo skills (like music, weather, etc.) I have all the echo devices so far except the "echo look" (regular echo, tap, and dot.) Each has its own benefits such as size, sound, portability, etc. The screen is awesome though.

I am not sure however if each echo in a different house will need their own amazon account. It is all my immediate family (husband works out of town most weekdays, kids in college, and home.) If they use their own account, they won't have access to the prime stuff since we all share my prime account. But if they all are registered to MY account, how do I call the other one? So far we have only set up one and are unsure what to do with the other two. I may call support to see how this is done and will update my review when I find out. We would also like to use it to check in on our house and cats when we are away, but we don't know how to "answer" it if we aren't there. Maybe we can call our phone answering machine and accept the show call with that voice! ha ha!! That seems like a weird workaround. I don't know if there is an automatic setting to answer a call from another show. That seems nice for checking in on an empty house or for someone ill or something. Of course, you would have to pre-approve calls from certain others, but it seems it should be capable of doing that. Since you can connect to other cameras (they show a baby's room in their video) then you should be able to connect to other Echo Shows without a voice acceptance. There is the IFFT app or "mybuddy" where someone who wants to alert others with just a voice, but that isn't video yet to my knowledge.

It works just like an echo using your voice, but also has a touchscreen. I didn't really review here all of the alexa features as that has been covered (a lot!) on the regular echo pages, My review is more about the differences. It scrolls news items and tips on the home screen, but you can turn that off if you ask for "display off" where it only displays a white on black digital clock. Well, sometimes it works...other times it asks "which device" and doesn't understand. I am sure this will be tweaked as the devices rolls out. It is pretty new. The size of the screen is listed as 7" diagonally, but those those like me, (who can't clearly visualize that hypotenuse measurement!) the screen itself is about 6 inches wide by 3.5 inches tall.

We have indeed checked weather, asked questions, ordered products, and watched youtube videos on it. We aren't good at searching through youtube yet, but it does give you some suggestions based on your command. I am not sure how much we will use the feature for movies or something since it is so small, it would be nice to ask THIS to control your amazon fire stick or something on your tv or to cast your show. But so far, it doesn't do that.

It looks like a black trapezoidal box, and the viewing angle is set. I suppose you could stick a pen or something under it to angle it differently, but again, that is more of a hack than a feature. It doesn't look wall mountable, but more of a counter/shelf thing. I am sure there will be 3rd party wall mounts for this which makes sense for a kitchen or something. The sound is pretty good from such a small footprint. To me, the original big echo has the best sound, but this is a close second. Also, when it is loud (like level 10) this seemed to hear us better to stop than the echo (where you sometimes have to yell to get alexa  on the regular echo to hear you over the music!)

I don't always like to be an early adopter of things since version 2 of things is usually better somehow, and I am stuck with 1. But I really liked the idea of this and figured they could just update the software, not the entire device (like they have with tap now being able to turn on with just voice.) I hope they keep reading our suggestions and will consider the ideas of many of the folks who bought these.

There really needs to be a forum for this product clickable from the echo device product pages! The only ones I found are on the "kindle forum" part of amazon (https://www.amazon.com/forum/kindle?_encoding=UTF8&cdForum=Fx1D7SY3BVSESG&cdThread=Tx20BQ8KTGP9S3Z)  ALL the forums/customer discussions are so hard to find now, that people resort to asking questions on the product pages, and no one wants to scroll through hundreds of questions to find something. If there were a dedicated forum, we could ask questions, find hacks and apps, etc.

update: I chatted with customer service to see how to set up different ones of these on the same account, but in different locations. Apparently, it "drops in" in people using the device NAME, not phone number or anything. So I just named them for my family members and successfully connected with them with audio and video. I even dropped in on my cat who was home alone (I probably interrupted her secret alone cat rituals! ha ha!) I sort of like the ability to drop in on my house anytime from another device. There is also an alexa calling feature using phone number of contacts. You can use the Echo Show, Dot, and regular echo with that (only the show will have video, of course.) The main difference I see between the two is "drop in" automatically connects and calling announces a caller and you have to answer or ignore. You have a few seconds of blurry time on the camera to turn off the video for drop in if you want. Info for "drop in" is here:https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=hp_left_v4_sib?ie=UTF8&nodeId=202153130

For calling, you can also push the video off icon if you are home dancing naked or something. :D  There are also do not disturb settings so you don't have to worry about someone dropping in on you when you don't want them to! If you are nervous about the camera being there at all, you can always get one of those sticker sliding webcam covers and keep control it like that. Info for calling instead of dropping in is here: https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=hp_left_v4_sib?ie=UTF8&nodeId=202136190

author: jm
title: Don't waste your money.
content:
Horrible product.  No way is it worth the money.  I bought it to see videos.  No video capability from youtube.  Lots of glitches with Alexa.  This is going back to Amazon today.

BUYER BEWARE!

author: FranklyMe
title: Time and temp and Music....
content: I already have several Echo Dots and I love them.  Radio WMBI from TuneIn, Alarm, Spelling, general FYI, timer, but what I like about the Echo Show is the time and temp feature.  I could play a movie but haven't.  I'M still learning and there are always more features like the new music balance and lowering the bass.

author: DIANE M BAKKER
title: Easy to set up
content: Easy to set up. Plug it in then make some selections for your preferences such as language, temp C or F etc. I am getting more familiar with it and will be adding my calendar and appointments.

author: StillaYankee
title: Show me......everything!  Love it!
content:
Love my show!  Got it hooked up with my Hue lights in the kitchen, family room, ceiling fans as well as my Harmony remote this year was able to turn my Christmas tree & outside lights on with a regular schedule OR just by saying ‘Alexa, turn on...’.  Even works with my GE oven, turning it on & off or changing cooking modes & temps.  Love having it show my shopping list while I’m cooking or show my appointments while I’m doing other things.  Pretty cool to watch a movie trailer while busy in the kitchen.
The bass is a little on the boomy side but at least it’s got more ‘depth; than the Echo Dot.

author: Amazon Customer
title: no more youtube
content: Best feature has been removed.  no longer plays you tube content.  This was the reason i bought the show.  Amazon should start issueing refunds

author: jkshopomaniac
title: Echo Show
content: It's nice to have a visual to go with the Echo.  However, it is confusing at times....some simple commands are not understood by 'Alexa.'  Sometimes her responses are too brief or totally vague.  The Echo Show is attractive and compact, it does not take up a lot of room.

author: Jennifer M.
title: We love our Echo Show
content: We love our Echo Show!  I bought  it as a household Christmas present.  The words to songs show up when playing music.  Looking up a recipe and having it right there without having to print it has come in pretty handy.  My 8 year old likes to ask it to take pictures.  We've even hooked it up to our doorbell.  I bought 2....one for us and one as a gift.

author: Jason Wentzel
title: Accents may take a while to pick up with voice recognition.
content: I really like the ease of use, the only issue that I have noticed is the voice recognition software. I’m sure it works great if you’re from San Francisco and have no accent but it seems to have difficulty determining a southern drawl.

author: Paige M Gasker
title: Best Echo yet - great to have the display as ...
content: Would be 5 star if the cost wasn't so high.  Best Echo yet - great to have the display as well as the audio.  Alexa suggests commands on the display screen and this is a great way to learn how to talk to Alexa so that she understands what you want.  As developers/Google improve Alexa the Show is going to get even better.  Show music sounds much better than Dot sounds and can get much louder. Shopping on Amazon Prime is much better because you can see what you are thinking about ordering and look at specs and reviews.  Highly recommended if you can handle the price tag.

author: Nathan Harris
title: but the screen is nice to have
content: I hesitated to buy this since I already have Echos all over my home, but the screen is nice to have.  I especially like it for use with my Google Calendar, seeing all my alarms set and which songs go with each alarm, and using apps for cooking.

author: CME22
title: Would NOT recommend. For the price paid
content: Would NOT recommend. For the price paid, this should not malfunction 2 months after purchase (and after return eligibility - how convenient). Screen has lines going through it, and pixelates most of the time. A family member purchased one as well (from a brick and mortar) and same thing happened/happens to hers.  WHAT GARBAGE!!!

author: Elsie Campbell
title: I LOVE IT!
content: I LOVE IT!  I just love playing with this and finding out all the things it can do.  It's just amazing and it's fun.  New things to do with Alexa come up all the time.  I cant imagine how I managed without this.

author: A. Crews
title: Love my new "toy"
content: So easy to use. Still a learning curve with commands. (Mostly mine) Fun starting the  day with an interesting  good morning fact from Alexa and every night my husband and I have Jeopardy fun . We use the Show to turn on lights, see photos, and play music, and just a little shopping.

author: Y2jimmyk
title: Could not wait to get it out of the box!
content: I love this!such a great product and awesome addition to my Alexa home take over! Great picture and so much fun! Very easy setup and I bought the remote which was a great feature to add! A must have for any and all Alexa fans!

author: Amazon Customer
title: It had good reviews so i opted for the show
content: I originally wanted to purchase just a standard echo, but then did alittle  research on the echo show. It had good reviews so i opted for the show. Over all it's been pretty good. Still learning what all it can do. Not overly impressed with the speakers. I've listened the standard echo and it would appear that the speakers in the standard echo sound better. I would recommend the show in general. Not sure if additional speakers can be added.

author: cabbs
title: Screen is okay, Needs more Video Integration
content: We have an echo, echo dot, and echo show at our house. We love our echo and echo dot and the Show does everything the echo and echo dot does with a screen... but I don't know what extra value the screen adds. It's hard to get the right thing to show up on the screen, whether that's music videos, keeping it turned on or off, even prime video content. The video integration seems poor - we'd rather opt for a fire tablet with Alexa. The screen is also a problem at times. I want it to stay off so I can use it like a traditional echo most of the time because it's in our living room and I don't want my young daughter to stare at a screen every time she passes through there, but it'll automatically turn on when someone walks by. I like the Show in concept, but didn't like the execution of it. Maybe Gen 2 made better improvements.

author: texas mom
title: Screen has horizontal lines through it and flickers all the time
content: A few months after plugging it in, and having barely used it, the several horizontal lines appeared across the screen and started flickering constantly. I restarted it but the lines and flickering won't go away. Some days, it's worse than other days. Regardless, it's annoying and I'm not happy about paying as much as I did for a product that is defective.

author: refchar
title: Fun for kids, might be defective though
content: My kids love this device and can play for hours withit. But I can't get it to show me recipes or anything else other than prime videos or song lyrics.

author: Jason H.
title: Pass until they get youtube and netflix
content:
This thing should be really cool.  It's not but it could be.

It has less function now than the day I bought it since Google pulled it's YouTube support of this device.

If they can get their poop in a group and they get Netflix on board and Google back this will be an awesome gizmo

As of this writing it's a cool but pretty much useless gimmick.

author: J. Coppett
title: Brings Echo to a whole new level!
content: I really love this Echo Show!  I love all of the previous ones but now I can “drop in” on my husband as I’m at work and he’s at home alone, this adds a whole different way I use it!  I hate leaving him alone.  But it seems to brighten his day when I drop in and he can see and chat with me on the app on my phone!  He enjoys seeing the lyrics come across the screen, too!  I love it!

author: Debra P. Mastrobattisto
title: Great item to buy!
content: We have ours in the kitchen and think it's great. We listen to the news in the morning or music when having our coffee. We have played games and had Alexa tell us jokes which crack us up. I would recommend buying one to anyone who thinks they might be interested in it.

author: PositiveSerendipity
title: I love my Alexa
content: This thing is AWESOME!!  Alexa is so much fun!  She has made my home very smart and has made life so much easier for me.  I love adding things to my shopping list as I remember them and it synchs to the app on my phone so there is no more forgetting my written list at home.  The screen is beautiful and clear; works great with my Ring Pro to show me who is at my door.  I keep her in my kitchen so I can view recipes with the sound of my voice and play music from my pandora account.  She will even adjust the volume on command.  I am waiting for friends and family to get one too so we can use the drop in feature.  I am still learning all of her skills, but so far, this old fart is catching on quick to this new technology.

title: Love, but something to think of...
content: Love the show. Love all amazon echo products. I have camera covers over my computer laptop camera, so I did the same thing with the show (instead of a post it note). Just think of it as a computer. You’d cover the camera. However, that doesn’t diminish the 5 star rating. It’s soooooo worth it!

author: Lisa
title: Alexa - in a more useful package than Echo or Dot.
content: Just Love It!  At first - purchased to use to drop in on my pet but sooo enjoyed the features included by virtue of the screen (on the spot visual of lists, events, etc) and the helpful tips that pop up) that I purchased a separate camera to spy on my pets so that I can position the Show permanently for my use.  While I'm not sure why this also seems to be better at recognizing my commands than my Echo.

author: TedP
title: Communications Tech Alert.
content: I purchased this, not because I need an always-on digital home secretary, but to have a stable, always-on video phone call set up for talking to my aging parents. They can no longer work with computers or tablets or even a smartphone. Or, really, even the old phone on the wall. This would get five stars for that ability, once I got it set up. But, even with my 30 years of professional data-communications experience and digital video conferencing management, it took me two long phone calls with their techs (who were excellent) to get it to do what I wanted. Buyers should know that the Echo communications technology is not at all what is to be expected today (in a world of Internet-based video and audio calling, such as Skype and FaceTime). To be precise, the communications do not use a unique Amazon Echo ID (as do, Skype and FaceTime and Google) allowing any two devices or apps on the Internet to communicate. Nope. You must use a telephone number, and that number must be on a cellphone, and actually, on a smartphone that runs this app. Their ads and help files etc., make it sound like the app is a neat and optional feature, allowing you to call from your smartphone. Yes, that works great. But if you just have a brand new iPod Touch, which has all the smarts of an iPhone but no cellular radios (it is NOT a phone), then it downloads and runs the Alex app just fine, but has no communication ability—just plain missing in the app. The same iPod Touch can FaceTime just fine. See the idea? FaceTime and Skype use IP over the Internet and go to specific and unique IDs set up in the servers. I see no decent reason that Amazon doesn’t do this. Instead, this beautiful box (and it is a joy and beauty to own) requires you to have a smartphone pretty much for each device. There is a way to set up more than one of these and use just one account. The techs showed me how. But that meant my parents’ Echo Show was four hours away from me and using my iPhone’s contacts (there is no way to make separate Echo contacts!!!), and it was just a matter of time before they (or their home caregiver) would inadvertently call one of my contacts instead of me. So, we decided to buy them an iPhone. I just set that up last weekend. It is great. The family can now put photos on that new iPhone and their Echo will run a slideshow of those photos all day long. Just say “Show my photos.” I think I would have given this four stars, friends, even with all these issues, except that  Amazon has done a seriously weak job with the user interfaces on the device and on the app. For smartphone users, who we all are to be using one of these, things are just not as intuitive as they should be. Some things are done on the app and some on the Show and a few key things are only done on your web browser logged into your Amazon account. I needed those tech calls to learn that. I am pretty sure all that will get better over time. Will they ever do communications with unique IDs? I wonder. I suspect they like getting their hooks into our smartphones. Oh, well.

author: LuEtte
title: Still trying to figure everything out! But what I ...
content: Still trying to figure everything out!  But what I have learned works well.  It is hard for us 74 year olds to catch on.  If it weren't for the grand kids, I'd have to send it back.

author: ABBSllc
title: Not as good as the hype
content: We have had a horrible time with this product not staying connected with the internet and just not responding in general even after being asked multiple times. Was hoping to return it but getting a hold of Amazon to discuss that kind of a return after the 30-day window is very difficult.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazing
content: I absolutely love this! it works so well. I can listen to music, watch a movie, find out answers to questions. I can add to my shopping list or just order individual items from amazon. I can customize it so my kids cant order without my approval. I love that I can "drop in" anytime with friends or family or on my kids when im not home! I would recommend this product 100%.

author: jeffrey metzger
title: Impressive sound
content: Got it for a good price on prime day. Didn't care too much about the screen, rather I wanted a better sounding speaker. This thing sounds great and fills the room! Couldn't be happier!

author: EMcG
title: Love it - bought at Amazon Books store
content: I have 2 that I bought at the Amazon book store at the mall nearby. One white and one black.  I love mine and love my dot! Mom got the other one as a gift and so far so good! No problems other then sometimes Alexa likes to argue and say she didn't hear you LOL. She's a HUGE help, especially if you need to call someone (from any echo device) and can't find your phone.

author: J. Fuller
title: Video Chats Are Great
content: I like the ability to do live video chats with the Echo Show. Also the Echo Show displays suggestions for commands that Alexa will respond to. This is very helpful.

author: Sharon Lee
title: Okay
content: Still needs a lot of work. I feel like she understands less than my echo dot. Maybe the mic is shoddy. Pro is that the sound quality is pretty good, and it has touch screen for when I get frustrated when she can't understand.

author: Toni
title: GREAT PIC and SOUND!!!!  You should get one!
content: This is so fun and it has amazing sound!  I use it every day.  I have found recipes, music, movies and more.  I have Amazon Prime so that has helped a bunch as well.  Do it!  Its fun, great picture and sound!!!!!!!!

author: drew
title: Five Stars
content: Great sound! Easy to use. Good quality speakers, touch screen and intuitive. Need one in every room

author: Andrea Murray
title: Echo Show is like having my own private secretary ... & more!!
content: I'm just a busy Mama trying to survive in a fast-paced world & Alexa keeps me on track ...effortlessly. I don't know how I ever got along without an Echo Show or Alexa! If you're like me, by the time you put you're ready to put your shopping list together, you can't recall half of what you were running out of. Used to have to stop what I was doing to write it down on my shopping list, but not anymore! No matter where I am (there's an Alexa app for your phone!), all I have to say is "Alexa add...". My kids can add things too (be prepared for surprises on your list). If I need to remember to call someone at a certain time, not only does Alexa remind me, she dials the number for me & I don't have to do anything but ask. She shows me my calendar, date, time, weather, even traffic details & keeps me updated with the daily news. OH...& the sound quality from the speakers is amazing!! It's better than my Bose, which was more expensive. I can ask Alexa to play anything from ambient sounds to music & she'll even read my Kindle books to me. She's also a voice-activated camera & a mini-TV!! Want to call up a recipe or a cooking video, she'll do that too. Amazon has a deal right now ... 3 Echo Dots (non-visual Echo) for $75, which is a relative bargain! You'd be hard pressed to find quality speakers like these for $25 each, let alone a personal assistant in 3 rooms! I'm getting an Echo Show for my son & daughter-in-law who just had a baby ... it works as a baby monitor with your phone, or you can pick up Alexa compatible cameras for around $40! You can set timers for tasks when you know you're going to get "too involved", or for cooking & I almost forgot...this makes a fantastic alarm clock! You can wake up to any sound you like & forget hitting the snooze button because Alexa does that for you too! Crappy speakers on your laptop or phone? Bluetooth 'em to Echo. Don't want to yell from one end of the house to the other? Intercom. Voice activated calculator...state capitals... translator...random facts...she's a talking Wikipedia. Want to brush up on another language? Change the settings on Alexa to another language. For a $129, this girl pays for herself & then some & I haven't even tried the smart home apps yet.

author: CAMILLE BONANNO
title: not responding all the time,  was told alternate info about benefits
content: we received this as a gift,which we had requested.  Feel we were mislead by Amazon, was told we would be able to view certain tv shows on it, now found out you need to have Prime to do it.. Are on a limited budget, so prime is not an option right now. Plus, this does not always respond to commands.  Found if you have the volume up too high, Alexa does not hear you to stop playing.  A few times we have had to shut it off to end something.

author: Saydrick Kirksy
title: The device it self is awesome, However I was extremely disappointed to find out ...
content: The device it self is awesome, However I was extremely disappointed to find out YouTube doesn’t work on the device anymore. Furthermore it would be awesome if we could utilize the monitor for Netflix and other video streaming applications

author: Carol P.
title: I love Echo Show and all the Alexa lines
content: I love Echo Show and all the Alexa lines!  It is so much fun to ask her questions in the morning, look at my photos, find out about the weather for the day or to see all the items on my calendar for that day.

author: betsy brian
title: Unhappy
content:
It doesn't do much more then a echo dot. There is a screen that streams nothing. A video call is poor audio reception. A call has terrible audio.

For the price I feel ripped off. Which is something I have never said about an Amazon product.

author: M Johnson
title: SCREEN ISSUES AFTER 5 MONTHS
content: Worked great for 5 months and now there are lines across the screen that interfere with viewing. I did not drop it or anything, it was just sitting on my desk for 5 months and now the screen flickers and has several flickering lines running across it. Hope the upgraded one is better. For how much this costs I wanted it to last more than 5 months. :(

author: Erica R
title: The timers are fantastic in the kitchen and I love being able to ...
content: I am obsessed with Alexa.  She comes in handy as I walk around and realize I need to add something to the shopping list.  The timers are fantastic in the kitchen and I love being able to play music while I cook.  I also love hearing my morning briefing before I even climb out of bed.  The only thing I hated? When 8 college kids also became obsessed wither her and kept changing commands!  Also, hopefully we can rename her to the name of our choosing!

author: Cassie
title: It has an awesome sound for how small they are
content: I bought this for my boyfriend for his birthday, it now sits in our kitchen and we use it everyday. We don't use the drop in function as much as we probably should but are constantly listening to music. It has an awesome sound for how small they are. I love that it has a screen and shows lyrics to songs. I would recommend to anyone looking for a device like this.

author: Skilla
title: The best Echo but at a premium price.
content:
I have an Echo Tap, three Echo Dots, and two Echo Shows so far. The Echo Shows are by far the best way into the Alexa interface. Having the visual feedback is just perfect for “dropping in”, looking at recipes, seeing the weather, reviewing shopping and to do list, watching lyrics to your favorite songs, etc.

Pros
• Echo interface is great if you commit to it and the Show is the best Echo.
• Great speaker.
• Visual interface is so much better than just audio especially when “dropping in”.
• Great mic response.

Cons
• No audio jack in or out.
• Pretty ugly overall.
• Bulky even relative to the screen size.
• Set at a permanent angle that might not be ideal depending on where you use it.
• Very expensive relative to other Echo options.

Conclusion: If you have the money to spend this is the best way to bring Alexa into your home.

author: Wendy C. Bonzo
title: Very cool
content: I love our new Echo Show.  I have it sitting on my kitchen bar, right where I stand while cooking.  The sound is great, I love the screen, and I love that "she" has suggestions on the screen what to try or what's trending.

author: Charles J. Bischof
title: More useful than I expected.
content: I purchased the Echo Show during Prime Day at the urging of my daughter-in-law. We purchased mainly for video calls with our grandchildren. However, we've found it to be very useful for creating shopping lists, searching the internet, interfacing with our Arlo security system, and controlling smart switches in our home.

author: Kelly Chu
title: The whole family loves it!
content: I received this as a gift from my husband for my birthday. We had the Alexa Echo, which was nice, but I really like having the visual display that the Show offers. The weather is available at a quick glance, and love the news briefings -- it's almost like watching television. The rest of the family enjoys it, too. There's a feature called "drop-in" that's almost like FaceTime where I can call and talk to the kids from the Alexa app. We moved the Echo upstairs, and I heard there is a way to call from one to the other (room to room) which I would like to figure out how to do. I highly recommend it!

author: CMC
title: First Echo Show wouldn't connect to WiFi, but second is great
content:
I bought an Echo Show at the Amazon Pop-up store in my local mall when it was on sale for $150 so I could keep an eye on my pets using the drop-in feature while I was away on a long road trip. Unfortunately when I plugged it in and started it up I couldn't connect it to WiFi. Why? The on-screen keyboard would not show up. There was a blank text field for my WiFi password but no way to enter it. I tried everything including restarting multiple times but I was still stuck on the very first screen with no way to proceed.

I thought maybe a firmware update would resolve my issues, so I set up an unsecured WiFi network on my router so the Echo Show could connect to it without requiring password input. After connecting to that network the next screen asks you for your Amazon account and password, which I again could not enter because there was no way to get the on-screen keyboard to appear. But I pressed the disable video button and let it sit for about an hour or so at which point it started downloading and installing a firmware update.

Unfortunately when restarting to install the firmware update it hung about a third of the way thru the process. After waiting many hours for the update to finish with no luck I tried unplugging the device but every time it started back up it would get stuck about a third of the way thru the update process.

At my wit's end at this point, I took my effectively bricked device back in to the pop-up store and quickly and easily exchanged it for a new one. The new one works well.

I mention the issues I had with my first device mainly for the benefit of anyone else who runs into similar issues. I spent hours searching for help with the problems I had but found nothing, so I'm assuming it's not a common issue. Hopefully this review can help someone else avoid spending hours trying to debug the same things I did

author: Patty Flickinger
title: I liked the fact it shows you things now like words ...
content:
I liked the fact it shows you things now like words to lyrics or the news or weather ...but dislike a few things ..the way it only sits at one direction ...like when I'm talking to someone ..it's basically showing them the ceiling unless I'm directly above it ..and my Alexa echo sat in the window sill of kitchen to living room .picked up everything ..I am having issues with the show ..not picking up things from the back side.  :(
Also bought it and a security camera for outside ..(the nest) camera ..says they are compatible but I can't get them to hook up :(

author: Amazon Customer
title: Why no choice of clock display?
content:
I received this as a Christmas gift. It replaced a Dot as a bedside unit.
Of course, it does everything the Dot did and sound quality is MUCH better. I like having the photo slideshow from my Amazon Photos and I occasionally follow the lyrics on Amazon Music.
But I was very surprised that there is no choice of clock face. You get a digital time display, choice of 12 or 24 hour display and, as far as I can find, that's it (except for size in Accessibility). I would like to be able to change that display.
The other irritation is the "Try ..." subtitle. That should be able to be suppressed.
Overall, appreciated gift but I wouldn't spend the money to replace it. A Dot does the job for a lot less money.

author: Elbertai Company LLC
title: Sure did die really quickly
content: This product died - completely too soon.  It won't even turn on.  For the last week, the screen has been flickering.  Now, nothing!  I have the cheapest version which is much older and it is going strong.  Very sad I cannot return or replace.  Would not recommend.  It was cute for a little over a month.  Now, just a dead piece of electronic.

author: Mark
title: This is the one to buy if you want Alexa
content: I already had an Echo, and a Dot, and just got the Show because my son wanted it.  I really didn't think the video screen was a big deal.  But, I have to admit, the screen really adds to the whole concept of Alexa.  It pops up with events on your calendar, your local weather, news, and lots more.  My son and I who live over 700 miles apart already made a video call using the Show and it's much better than using Facetime.  The $100 off deal for buying 2 is would swayed me to buy it now and I really think it's a significant improvement over the other Amazon Alexa devices.  I would recommend it as the one to buy if you want an Amazon Alexa device.

author: Vegas702
title: BAD UNIT. Have several of these in my home and all are great except for this one
content: I tried to find a place to write the seller rather than posting it on a review however I need some help. I have several shows, spots and dots on my account and I love all of them. I purchased this white unit and have it at my office. It worked fine for the first month or so however now it has a large bar running through the middle of the screen that flashes runs dark. I believe the pixels might be going out in this area. I don't know how to return the unit or ask for some type of replacement unit. Can the seller please help?

author: Matt
title: I love this device
content: I love this device.  Bought it for my wife to put next to the bed, but immediately stole it and put it at my desk in my office.  This does everything that Echo does, but gives you so many more options with the HD screen.  I have it networked to my Arlo cameras, and like to pull up the baby in his nursery by voice, so that i can keep an eye on him while he sleeps.  I have it controlling all of our smart home lights, thermostats and will be expanding to door sensors shortly.  Our house is 100% Apple HomeKIt driven, but I prefer Alexa over Siri, and have integrated the two seamlessly.  It plays music with lyrics, calls me an Uber when I need one to go to the airport, and handles my calendar for me in a visible fashion.  All day long it scrolls pictures, and pulls up top news stories that i may want to read.  All in all, it is by far the best Echo product, and I am still learning new ways to use it.  The most frustrating part is trying to keep track of all the cool things that this is capable of.

author: Pablo
title: Before what ever updates they did it worked perfect. Non of my
content:
UPDATE MARCH 2018!
Alexa no longer recognize my 5 year old to play music.
Before what ever updates they did it worked perfect.
Non of my: two Echo Shows, Echo Dot, Eco Spot, Echo First and Secon gen work with him.
Simple question, Alexa play the polar express soundtrack... used to work, NO MORE!

author: PZ Maybee
title: adds a whole new dimension to the Alexa experience
content: Could not be happier. I have a couple of Dots and this Show.  wow! the screen is a great size and works amazing.  adds a whole new dimension to the Alexa experience.  got the wall mount too along with the screen protector since this is in the kitchen and I dont want any schmutz build up on it.

author: Drinks07.
title: Show and Dot turn on TV when linked to Fire TV stick or newer 4K diamond. No need to for new Cube
content: The screen quality on this is very clear. The speakers are very good and since they added the equalizer feature to the Alexa devices this sounds even better. I like that I can set the background pictures. I love that when you ask for recipes they show on screen and you can scroll without touching the screen. Everything about this device is great. One of the best features that I have discovered with this as well as my Echo Dot is that if you link it to your Fire TV stick or the 4K one is that it will turn on my my TV. I walk into the room and say "Alexa open Hulu, or Playstation Vue"  and it powers on my television as well. No need to upgrade to Fire TV Cube for that feature.

author: C. Chandler
title: Alexa is a wild experience. Tell her thank you ...
content: Alexa is a wild experience. Tell her thank you and she has a response for that. This replaced a Sony product no longer being supported.

author: R. Newton
title: Best Info On-Demand Device Available
content: Absolutely love this device.  The scrolling headlines and Alexa suggestions are awesome.  The Echo Support Team was fantastic as well helping getting it linked to my Blink cameras.  Wish it would have been sent with most recent version of software, but that was easily remedied and not really something to be too critical about.

author: John Galt
title: Great Sound, very useful
content: I was late to the Echo party. Really enjoying this purchase. It is amazing how many uses you find once you get started!

author: cheryl allenbrand
title: We are very disappointed. If you just want it to play music ...
content:
It's very difficult to understand even if you are close to it.  It has wavy lines on it as if there is a power issue and we have looked into anything
that might be causing it to no avail.  We are very disappointed.  If you just want it to play music and don't care about the quality it might work
for you. That's too  much money to spend on an inferior product and it is too late to return it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: An exciting addition to the Echo family
content:
Cons:
A bit expensive
Unpolished in many use cases. For example, UI to Amazon Music needs to improve, no ability to cast songs from a mobile phone to the Show, etc.
Lacks integration with more established apps. For example, currently only supports AllRecipes, which we don't use. Would love Paprika integration

Pros:
Music is a killer app/use case
Fits naturally into our lives
Drop-in is a bit gimmicky but fun feature
Improving every day

Overall:
An exciting addition to the Echo family. Lots of potential and can't wait for Amazon & developers to fully realize the capabilities of a smart assistant + screen in the home.

author: rimalaw
title: LOVE LOVE LOVE ME The Echo Show!!!!!
content:
I’ve had this all of 5 hours and had to work during a lot of that time. So I only gave it maybe 1.5 hours of attention, and in the video I attached you can see how easy and quickly you can use this baby!! I have just been able to do the following on command, “Hey Alexa ...:”
1-tell me the weather
2-Hear and see what’s in my calendar
3-read my Audible book
4-read my Kindle book
5-listen to the news stories
6-watch a few min of a movie on my Amazon Prime. (The whole movie was playing, but had to work.)  What’s nice is you can say the name of a movie, and it finds it much faster than using remote on your tv.
7-play photos from my library.
8-play music from my Pandora
9- make phone calls and video calls
10-do a drop in from my phone Alexa App or other Echo to my Show. Great for people who are not quick, children, pets, the elderly or disabled. You can pop in and talk or watch them kind of like FaceTime, but it automatically answers.  (Yes this can be enabled or disabled in case it makes you fearful of big brother and spying. But realize that our phones and computers can easily spy on us as well).
11- Look at nice ambient scenes like fireplace, waterfall beach etc. just say “hey Alexa, open fireplace.” Will give you choices of live ambient themes.
12- order Amazon items or place in cart.
13-raise and lower volume, as well as rewind/forward music, books, movies etc.
14- you can set an alarm/timer for any song you want!! Change it every day to suit your fancy!

Well, except for YouTube right now (since Amazon and Google are in a war), you can do so much and the list is enormous!!
This weekend I will connect her to my Ring Chimes and Floodlight camera. You can use her for so much home automation too.

But I love how you can make calls so easily, and listen to music and books so conveniently. Don’t forget to go to the settings to add your calendar email, music choices, and other apps or devices. You can use the buttons on top of the Show for volume, as well as touch screen to tap things you want if you don’t feel like speaking. You can touch the mute button to the left to disable people hearing you or the Drop in feature from working.  I swear, except for the price (makes sense to buy the 2 deal getting 150 off and split it with someone) than to pay full price. I got mine from Offer  Up or Let.  Go as someone didn’t know the beauty of this baby!! Now I need more and the Spot is next in my gotta get gotta get now wish list.  Watch my video and see some of what she can do. And please let me know if you found my review helpful. Thanks and good luck with your Echo Show!

author: Penni Lo'
title: GLAD I WAITED
content: I was skeptical at 1st and that's why I never order the previous models. But being the gadget geek that I am I LOVE that I waited for the Echo Show. The only problem that I see is that you can't stop the suggestions from scrolling. Thanks for adding Fire Fox to my Fire Tv box. Does anyone know if it can be added to the Echo Show to be able to access my YouTube?

author: Tyler
title: Sadly garbage...
content: I am on my third echo show. This is my 5th amazon device and I have loved everyone but this thing is way overpriced for what it can accomplish not to mention the screen is garbage. The first screen started to jitter the month the warranty ran out and then the second one they sent me was worse out of the box. The third one I have now has a big dent in the corner of it (there was no damage to the shipping box) and while a this time the screen is doing fine the software is having all kinds of problems. Wont set my background picture, tells me my internet is running to slow for updates (150+mbs) and only plays one playlist not matter what I ask. I love amazon products and really hope I somehow got 3 lemons. But as far as what this thing is suppose to do I'd just buy 3 fire HD 8s for the same price.

author: Ed OB
title: A Bit Beta
content: Looks nice.  Sound is good, but I was expecting more use of the screen.  For example, I thought I would be able to see weather maps when I ask about the weather.  But all it gives is very basic textual information.

author: RafMan
title: Better than expected but not 5star
content:
Have been echo user since its launch, when everyone hated on it that its just bluetooth speaker.  Its been great especially since it was only 99 dollars for the initial users.  I have been on fence with the show.. truely didnt understand its need/purpose.  BUT I love gadgets and it was on sale so figured why note.  Its def better than just regular echo, the screen is nice touch to make the echo more productive BUT i feel like the screen isnt being use to its full potential is why i give it 4 stars.  It works great for like weather, gives you forecast.  but no maps??  when i ask for traffic just tell me how many minutes why not pull up map and show traffic like google does?  It works nicely with my ring bell and camera, wish it would automatically answer door when someone rings.

AMAZON:  Please add maps to give directions, get youtube back or offer an alternative there are other streaming sites, auto answer option for ring doorbell, put full amazon app on it to make shopping easier,

author: Amazon Customer
title: Cant' answer simple questions
content: Could not answer most of my questions. I have nothing for it to control so it's a waste of time and money. It couldn't even tell me the grades of beef or cuts of beef. Couldn't give the basketball rankings, etc. Needs help on it's ability to answer questions. Every time it failed, my phone could give me an answer.

author: techsavvykat
title: Great tool for checking in on remote family.
content: This is a fabulous product.  I use it to "drop in" on my elderly mother throughout the day and put a bunch of photos into prime photo so they play for her.  Also, added a calendar to her google account and reminders scroll on the screen for upcoming doctor visits and so forth.  Great tool!

author: Nico!
title: I've had for a little over a year now the speaker is bad.
content:
I really love this device, it's made so many things at home more convenient. I bought it new in December of 2017 and in the last month, the speaker started crackling & skipping. This happens when connected to bluetooth, it happens when I just ask Alexa questions & she responds, it happens when Alexa is programmed to do certain things at certain times. I've reset it and the problem persists. I have searched through help and found nothing useful on this site; even the section for repairs & returns provides 3rd party products, and none listed Alexa/Echo as options so I'm at a dead end. I was able to find via Google many customers who stated sending an email in the Alexa app resulted in a replacement device, but I submitted one a week ago and haven't even received a confirmation email, much less a response.

While I've wanted to upgrade to the newer model, and have planned to (with this one going to another room for less frequent use) I'm not sure I will now if I can't even be guaranteed a whole year of use without breaking down.

author: J. Beshears
title: Can be used as a home security style camera.
content:
One of the best purchases I've made. I own 2 Dots,Echo,dash wand, firestick with alexa and 2 Echo shows. I gave my family Dots for Christmas because they are so great. After owning nearly every echo device short of the look camera I can say that this is probably my favorite.

I love  the Dots because of the cost, and form factor, I connected mine to a external speaker for the increased volume when playing music. You won't have that problem with the Show. The sounds is worlds better than the Dots and reasonably better quality and volume compared to the normal Echo.

A problem that I had with the Echo was the microphones seemed to not pick up as well as the Dots. I figure this is the dot design is newer and so the microphone setup was likely revised. This very minor problem is also much better on the Echo show.

What amazon did was take the best features of the Dots (the Microphones) the best features of the Echo(the speakers) and made them better and added a screen and camera.

The camera works extremely well, the video calling works great from show to show or to the mobile app.

********* I've found this trick***********************

You can set up all your private echos dots, Echo, and shows to allow drop in. This acts as an intercom system...... WHAT I FOUND is if I'm at work and I want to drop in on either of my echo shows I can see whats going on at my house... just like a security wifi camera. I can drop in on the Dog, etc. Its a great peace of mind to know I can drop in on the shows video camera from my phone anytime, anywhere.

The shows are worth their weight in gold if you ask me.

I'm sure more show specific apps are on the way, and I hope many more visual skills come to the already robust voice assistant.

What I'd like is the ability to ask Echo show for movies and have her send it to the fire stick on network.. (come on amazon, that shouldn't be that hard.)

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love It!
content:
Love this product and how Amazon continues to grow this business and offers all different areas.

Works great and the voice recognition is getting better and better. Make sure to do the training it will help recognize your voice.

author: Steven C.
title: Customer service changing there plan....not cool!!
content: The show work fine for a few months. The the screen started rolling and moving around. Called customer service first time told me they would replace it. You know send it back they will send a new one, they will call me in 2-3 days to set it you. No call by day 5. So called them, now they want me to send it in and they would repair it. Not what they said the first time and not like the repair part. Guess I’m calling them back again

author: Breeze
title: The Show is The Echo Show
content: I just love my Echo Show as much as all my other three Echo devices, I have. Ehco Dot, Ehco, and Ehco Spot. Echco  Show is friendly to use and great calling  friends who have Ehco Show with a Ehco Connect for home phones. Very good size screen for seeing your friends to. Just a great device for your home or office, all around.

author: Shawn Alexander
title: displays camera footage super slow. Should be much thinner Needs to be ...
content:
It's to expensive for what it is,
It is slow. Connects slow, displays camera footage super slow.
Should be much thinner
Needs to be able to hang on a wall.
Needs a bigger screen. Especially knowing 5he cost of screens being so cheap.
Maybe if it had a Ethernet connection to be faster and an aux to connect to the stereo would be nice.

There is a long ways to go with this product.
It could be leaps and bounds better with the current available tech. To pricey for what it is. Doesn't currently flow with life at this time.
Good try but missed the board let alone the bullseye.

So much potential lost.

I'll do what I need done another way.

author: Luna
title: Optimistic that future updates will bring improvement
content: I like echo products so I thought the show was an obvious upgrade. On that front, the show is definitely that. However, the developers have missed some opportunities. At the bare minimum this device needs apps (not skills, maybe in addition to skills?) and a web browser even if that seems redundant due to everyone having a browser on their smart phone. Overlap is not necessarily a bad thing (as we've seen with the shows video calling feature) especially when it can be used in unique ways with Alexa. It just needs to do more or be a whole lot cheaper. I'm thinking give it the features of a fire tablet PLUS the echo features. This would make the cost less unreasonable.

author: mrcisco
title: This really is cool device. You have to take a little time ...
content: This really is cool device. You have to take a little time to understand how it works and what it can do for you, but if you do... it is really enjoyable. I especially like the call feature. Being able to play music or watch a movie. Send a message with your voice. Upload your family pictures to amazon photos and you can have the pictures as your background on the screen. So far, haven't found anything I dislike it.

author: Linda Phillips
title: This was a great addition. I like having the visuals and the ...
content: We currently have the Echo and a couple of Echo Dots in our home.  This was a great addition.  I like having the visuals and the references that are displayed are interesting. There were no issues with installation.

author: weatherlover1
title: Really like it so far
content:
First off people need to understand this is not a voice activated tablet. This is the echo with a screen. I so far like it a lot. I have had the echo since it first came out and have added a few dots to my collection as well. The show is my favorite of the bunch.

Sound- The sound quality is better than the original echo. When turned up it's very loud and I can hear music from it well into the next room and even upstairs. Is it as good as some of the top Bluetooth speakers out there no but its a step up from the echo and I am happy with it. The sound when using it for calls is good very clear.

The Screen- When I first got my echo my first thought was why does this not have a screen? So when I saw the Show I was very excited. I love being able to look at it to see what song is playing or sing along to a song I don't know the words tpp(though its prime music only not your own library which kind of stinks).

Video Calling- This feature was one that I was also excited about. I bought one for myself and one for my parents. We have been using Skype for years but it seems to be getting buggier and more annoying. The show does it well. Good video and sound easy to use perfect for what we use it for. It does stink a little that the camera can not be rotated at all the camera is at a high angle and a little annoying but it's not a huge deal to me.

Everything Else- I am disappointed in what skills work with the show at the moment I am sure more will be coming but it would have been nice to have a few ready to go. One obvious one would be a weather radar how nice would it be to say Alexa show me the weather radar. There is a lot of opportunities here and it would be nice to see some fast acting on that front.

Slightly Annoying- Ugh Amazon stop giving me suggestions to try on EVERY screen. I get maybe having it for a day or two but there needs to be a setting to turn that off pronto!  Thankfully you can turn off the trending news and your calendar and also only have it scroll through them once but I would rather my calendar items be seen all the time not try this or try that. Also more controls over notifications. Yes, you can turn notification off on the device but it would be nice to have skill notifications for each device as well. Also, it would be nice if I do want the news and calendar items to continuously rotate to have some setting for how long it pauses between pages.

Really Annoying- This is more the whole echo line. Come on Amazon it's time to allow all devices to play music at the same time or pick two or more. I don't understand why you have not done this but its time I really hope its on the short to do list!

Overall I think this is a good device and has the potential to be a great device. I know it will get better and better with time just like the echo did.

author: missyandru
title: Multi purpose media
content: Love this product in my kitchen which is a central location for the family. You can do a lot with the show. We were able to do a mini karaoke night because it displays words for songs that play.

author: Chatty Girl Lisa
title: I like it.
content: It works as expected if you have the updated software version downloaded on the equipment. I am a little scared of it and think that you should turn it off if not using it as I think it is listening to you even if its sitting dormant. I do like how it shows you what you asks as well as tells you. I haven't used it to make phone calls but plan on doing that in the future. I love how it plays music by any artist you just say the name and it shuffles songs by that artist.

author: Bobq
title: Automatically come on when ring pro bell detects motion.
content: I rated it a 4 star because it still needs improvement loading and should work automatically with ring. When someone is at front door it should come on to show who is at door with a switch to turn on and off this option. That would make this a 5 star.

author: AsianATO
title: if it worked globally like I assumed
content: Yes... echo works well but in South Korea some of the functions are limited. Weather, directions, location of stuff nearby... etc. look forward to using these services once back stateside.. that’s the only reason for a 4 star rating.. if it worked globally like I assumed, it would have been an easy 5 stars

author: MNWildGirlEllen
title: 13 year old lazy boy approved lol
content: My son got this for Christmas and he loves it. He uses it as an alarm and to get a daily bus stop weather report. He got a smart plug also so now he doesn't even have to sit up to turn his lamp off. He just tells Alexa to do it. He recently found out he can control the Dish Network box with it too. He hasn't taken the time to figure out all it can do but so far he gives it a thumbs up.

author: LouCutrone
title: Meh, Not much to get excited about
content: What exactly does this do that my echo dot cannot?  Extremely  limited video content and no access to YouTube, Netflix or Hulu, live news, etc. Sound is pretty good but that's really about it. The newer version coming out in October is supposed to allow live TV through a Hulu subscription and has a bigger screen, that might be better. This version is pretty useless and I plan on sending it back while there is still time,

author: Kevin
title: We love Alexa!
content:
Saw this in an Amazon brick and mortar store. Prior to that I thought it was just a toy. I bought it onsale for $149 but still has great value at $229. This is one of the best tech devices I have ever purchased. I do so much with Echo Show - News, weather, home automation, Sirius XM, prime movies, recipes, traffic, shopping lists, reminders, video calling, encyclopedia. You will find uses right out of the box. Me and my wife have back and forth conversations with Alexa - our new best friend ;-).  Alexa is very intuitive. You can speak to her in plain sentences.

The one thing I have found Alexa doesnt seem to know about is financial market data. I hope they add that soon.

author: Suzie Q
title: Great video ques for those who are visual people
content: We love it! We already had two Echo devices and decided to upgrade during the Prime sales event. The video screen is great for visual cues of lists and reminders. We liked it so much we bought a second unit. The only thing we don't like is the video phone feature. It's a nice idea, but we read that the video is enabled as soon as the call comes in. That could prove embarrassing, so we disabled that feature entirely.Echo Show - Black

author: KPete
title: WASTE OF MONEY
content: I HAVE REALLY ENJOYED AMAZON PRODUCTS AND REALLY SHOULD HAVE LISTENED TO THE REVIEWS ON THIS ONE.  MY MOST RECENT IS THE SPOT WHICH I LOVE SO I ASSUMED I WOULD REALLY ENJOY THE SHOW SINCE IT HAS A  BIGGER SCREEN. I WAS COMPLETELY WRONG. UNFORTUNATELY, I HAVE RAN OUT OF MY TIME FRAME FOR RETURN SO I WILL HAVE TO TAKE A HIT AND SELL IT. IT IS USELESS AND I GET MUCH MORE WITH JUST MY DOTS AND THE SPOT.

author: rjhhhhytfjfy
title: No YOUTUBE very disappointed.
content: I like the device but after you guys do not have YOUTUBE and I use that in my daily life a lot I might return this unit back to BEST BUY. Sorry Amazon.I wish GOOGLE AND AMAZON  work together to make consumer life easy.

author: Deb
title: ... I can do with it but so far I love it. The main reason I got this was ...
content: I'm still learning what I can do with it but so far I love it. The main reason I got this was to be able to connect with my elderly mom in the evenings. She lives 2 hours away and she says it's like spending the evenings with us. She is 92 years young. (I bought 2 Echo Shows, 1 for her and 1 for me) It was fairly simple to set up. The only thing that I have problems with is hanging up the call with the phone app. I can't seen to find where to do that. I also read where you can interface the Echo Show with the Ring video door bell. That will be my next project.

author: John J Pearce
title: The Smart Home has arrived.
content: Superb product. I easily set it up in the kitchen for my grand-daughter to watch TV and play music while washing dishes. I'm using it for recipes, timers, and controlling lighting.

author: orion kinkaid
title: Meh... and the screen fails over time...
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player I bought this in November of 2017 and gave it to my wife on Christmas day. The video screen is now failing. You cant do as much on this device as we hoped for, streaming videos from only Amazon prime and youtube is limiting. Why not other apps like Netflix, Hulu, etc. The search engine is crap. I would recommend not buying this. Unless you just really need a cool looking music player that is great for setting timers.

author: Thomas Wilt
title: Good quality screen
content:
Really like this device for the kitchen. Use for timers, recipes and news. Voice pickup quality is not as good as Echo 3rd gen or Echo Plus 2nd gen.

Really wish there was a way to have the screen auto turn off and the pickup was better.

author: Christine Burger
title: I love my Echo Show
content:
I love my Echo Show, my sister lives in Illinois and I live in Georgia. We chat almost everyday, it’s so cool we feel like we’re in same room just having chat. We cook dinner, clean house walk around like we’re together. This has made our relationship closer.
We also have another one in our basement, can check on kids anytime.
Best thing could ever have! Going to buy one for our mother for mother’s day.

author: Lantana Al
title: No AUX output
content: Very nicely built and great idea... unfortunately minus two stars because no AUX output. I would have loved to use this to replace my much cheaper Echo Dot... but I want that Echo to be connected to a set of speakers via a wired connection.

author: Mamber
title: Great to have images as well
content: I like the way photos can be added and I love seeing which track is being played when I use the Show to play Spotify. While the price is considerably more than the Echo Dot, I purchased my Show at a special price which made it worthwhile. I doubt I would have paid the full price, but as it stands I am pleased with my purchase.

author: E. McNamara
title: Immediately indispensable, and lots of fun too!
content: It took only a few hours for me to fall in love with Echo Show.  It is one of those gadgets that become instantly indispensable.  I do the flash briefing every morning so that I know what is going on in the world, and then the weather comes on for my specific area too.  The screen has incredible sharpness, and it was very easy to set up. I love that when I play music by just saying "Alexa, play blues (or rock, classical, whatever) I get a great assortment of music from Amazon prime library, and if the phone rings I can simply say "Alexa, volume down" and do not have to go over to it.  The alarm is great, much better than waking up to a screeching alarm found on almost every clock.  It is awesome.

author: Dennis T.
title: Overall I love the concept and features of this product
content:
Overall I love the concept and features of this product, but have to give it one star because it doesn’t have a basic EQ built in.
Everything sounds muffled and somewhat unintelligible, some content worse than others.
Alexa herself I sometimes struggle to understand.
No music yet sounds bright and clear.
I bought two units and both behave the same.
I see online that it used to have a “hidden” EQ but was told by tech support that this was removed!!
Please put it back so I can enjoy this product without struggling to hear audio

author: memobug
title: Just broken without YouTube!
content:
The video capability of the show is pretty limited without YouTube support. If you happen to have two, you can access video under Drop In for a mini-teleconference. If you have a Ring doorbell you can look and listen, but not actually speak. It does support Amazon Video, but applications that utilize the Show's touchscreen are few and far between.

If you ask Echo show a question it will display the text for the Wikipedia entry it's speaking. Pretty worthless, as it should be displaying the picture.

The Jeopardy! App shows the clue in a game format. Weather displays the forecast a few days out.

Even when YouTube was working it was pretty lame. You'd get the top 10 results for your voice search and have no real browsing and navigational control.

Without YouTube, it's a 2. With YouTube as it was implemented, maybe a 3/5.

author: Mark Pierce
title: Excellent for a College dorm room
content: I got 2 Echo Shows back in June 2017 to have one for my family  and for my son who just left  to college across the country. I have preface this by stating that we are big Alexa users... With that said, the Echo Show is PERFECT for a son or daughter going to college.. You pop it on their desk and its an alarm clock, internet fetcher, Amazon movie player, music player  and best of all video chat.. No need to power on a laptop with Skype, just tell Alexa to call Mom and Dad and it will do the rest..  We are using it now and it is wonderful to keep in touch with your college freshman and enjoying the experiences he has and help him determine what are colors vs lights to throw in a dorm washer!

author: anista
title: Show vs Echo...
content: Meh.... I have the original ALEXA. Love it. If I didn't have it, I would love this, but the show doesn't offer much more. Ask her to find a place to eat near me and the choices she provides aren't that close to me. Also, the feature to show words on the songs doesn't work for all songs. I'd say it works about 10 percent of the time. Asking her to play "Christmas Music" she plays one or 2 songs and shuts off. She also doesn't understand/hear as well. I I will stick with the first version.  I will be returning my Show.

author: Mattadamsdietmanager
title: Love it
content: Love it already! Echo show is better than I could have imagined. The set up was easy, quick and fast. I downloaded the app to my iPhone easily. I love it for my workouts in my home gym

author: Laura K.
title: and one works fine, but the second started powering off intermittently and ...
content: This device failed within 5 months of purchase. I bought two, and one works fine, but the second started powering off intermittently and then went black. Good luck trying to exercise the warranty. First they want to trouble-shoot by phone. Then they want you to try a new power adapter which you are required to order yourself after they provide a specific credit. The new adapter did not help, so then they send a label but you need to find your own external shipping carton. I ended up having to return ship the dead device over the holidays. Ho ho ho. By the time I received an email confirming they had tested the device and found it to be defective, we had been without the device for about a full month. Finally received a replacement device and crossing fingers that it lasts. Would never order this particular Alexa device again, given the experience. My friends who ordered the smaller, simpler Alexa devices have had no problems.

author: Bettikins
title: A whole new level of Echo
content: I love the original echo, but this Echo Show takes my experience to a whole new level.  It is AWESOME!  What I really love is the constant stream of single line news headlines and/or suggestions for asking her something.  I have seen so many things on that screen that I would have missed otherwise.  I used to have a Sony Dash and this looks almost the same, but it adds so many other features that I finally let go of my Dash (not to mention that Sony "bricked" it and made it useless on just about the same day the Echo Show came out...coincidence?  I don't think so).  Anyway, it is totally awesome, especially in the kitchen.  LOVE IT!

author: DJ, FL
title: Great Upgrade to Echo!
content: Nice upgrade to the Echo, love the photo and video conference features. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is because it doesn’t have the audio output jack for connecting external speakers. However, the sound system on the show is of very good quality. I just like to play my music louder.

author: Nancy39
title: Love everything but the sound
content: I love so many of the new capabilities, the screen, easy access to apps, etc.  I haven't even had a chance to explore it all. But I'm very disappointed at the sound quality. My old Amazon Echo had far superior sound quality. The new one sound somewhat muffled and no crispness to the sound.

author: Kristen K.
title: Not worth it
content: Our Alexa show is not working properly. Only a few months after receiving it, it is glitching and not responding correctly. Cannot return because the “window” has closed.

author: Rose M Collazo
title: I can go to Home when I want to go back to where I was before I asked for something.
content:
So far I like it.  Especially the dropping in on my great grand children  👶 it gives me good info when I need it.
Glad at 79 To be alive in this age of Technology

author: Rover100
title: Great addition to the Echo Family
content:
Yes, I just hope now that newer devices are coming out that software updates, etc. for the Show don't stop as well.  That would be very disappointing and not live up to my expectations from Amazon.
It is capable of more and more each week.  Just imagine in a year what the devices will be able to handle.

author: DJ
title: Nice. Get one if it's on sell.
content:
So far so good. I really like the features so far and I have no real complaints yet. The screen display is surprising. I expected it to be more pixelated.
It responds very well.

author: BklynRayder
title: Great upgrade!! Worth the buy!!
content: I am very happy with this purchase as I already had an Echo and wanted this one because of the screen and it didn't disappoint! I love using some of th e game skills, like card games, because now you can see the cards; same with playing other games like Jeopardy! Also, my 3year old granddaughter loves to tell Alexa to play her favorite cartoons from Prime catalogue. Most are there except she gets upset when she asks for movies that are in theatres but Alexa defaults to playing the trailers, so that keeps her happy too. Love that you can look at your books and photos. Basically, a lot to the cool skills make more sense with the visual aspect so you will not be disappointed.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Limited knowledge
content:
Good company for someone. Doesn't know that much, she only gives you 1 sentence answers and the biggest drawback is Amazon's feud with Google. No YouTube. Could be a great device but it needs all the internet on it and some more detail if asked for.
We asked her if George Clooney had children, she said no. Go on Google and it tells about his twin children. This is a very basic ? to ask. If she is wrong here then what else.
She needs some tweeking or will be on the discount racks.

author: Dean K.
title: The best Echo device currently available.
content: My third Echo device. These devices are amazing. Great build quality. Very good sound. Useful home automation hub when paired with smart plugs and bulbs. There's very little these devices can't do to make your life easier.

author: Bob B.
title: Really like the Echo Show and we use it quite a ...
content: Really like the Echo Show and we use it quite a bit in the kitchen. We love the ability to set different timers for cooking and ask Alexa to show us all our timers. We also watch our daily flash briefings and love that we can tell Alexa to show us our internal or external Nest Cameras. That's an awesome feature. The one thing that we don't like is that it no longer supports YouTube.  This was one of the selling features of the Echo Show and one of the main reasons why we bought it. Very disappointed that Amazon and Google cannot come to agreement on the ability to support each other's services.

author: abc3702
title: This is going to be great..
content:
This is going to be great....but they've got a long way to go.  Just having it for a week to test out made me want so much more.  The possibilities!  But they are just way too early in development for it to be anything other than an exercise in frustration at this point.

If Amazon wants some ideas on how to make the most of it, and what should be next....gimme a call.  I can't wait for this thing to actually be what it can be:
- no reason it can't double as a security device.  Goodbye Canary.....seems like that would be a breeze to adapt.
- need to access Prime video content and 'my lis't from the device (duh!).  the search feature is terrible.
- connect it to my xfinity account and let me watch whatever i want on demand.  i'd never touch my remote again and i'd have one in every room.
- drop in feature is great, but until you announce who it is that's dropping in, and make it so I can choose to accept the drop in or not, it's not a feature that's going to catch on.
- bigger screen and better search functionality.  I'm afraid google is going to get there way before you do.  So much potential.

author: ScorchedEarth
title: Save your money - Wait for the next generation
content: Not fully integrated with your Amazon services. Example, if you ask to see your video library it only shows you the first 10 or so items - can't see your complete catalogue of videos. True is same for other features. If you're watching a video you can go tot he next episode, but not the previous one.  Can't see the channels you subscribe to through Amazon and lots of other issues. Just use it now as an expensive clock and weather station.

author: RGBCMYKER
title: It's the best Echo but not sure it's worth it
content:
It's okay.

Pros:
• It's the best Echo (for the price, however, not sure it's worth it)
• The on-screen feedback is nice
• The speaker sound quality is solid

Cons:
• It's pricey for what it does
• The front-facing camera quality leaves much to be desired
• The fact it has nearly zero touch controls and counter-intuitive
• The Amazon ecosystem sucks and simply isn't user-friendly (Amazon music, photos, etc)
• Can't use it like a security camera

Tips for a future version:
• Add a better camera
• Put a LED bezel around the screen that turns on when you have call so that your face always well-lit
• Make it easier to add photos to Amazon Photo and/or the device itself for family and group sharing
• Allow access to the Echo Show as if it were a home security camera
• The fact that my Amazon Music subscription is locked to one device and not, at the very least, transferable from one echo to the next is stupid

author: Zeddicus 2018
title: Fantastic Holiday gift, and a great new way to enjoy Echo!
content:
Great addition to the Echo Family.

I hesitated buying this, but now that I have it I'm very impressed.The You-Tube thing is easy -- I don't blame Amazon for You-Tube being pulled from Amazon products, that's not Amazon's fault... And I knew going in You-Tube wasn't available. Otherwise, I love the sound, the video screen, the look and features, I put it right on my desk beneath my monitor and can hear it playing music clearly even in my kitchen! It was easy to setup, just connect it to your wifi- network from the on-screen promps, and you're good to go. It has a number of features I may or may not use, but that's my choice and I love that I have the option to pick and choose! Such a great deal for such a cool/functional piece of tech. If I had to knock it for something, maybe it's not the best looking device out-there (not the screen or speaker they look fantastic) I mean the total shape. But otherwise, it's wonderful and I'm really glad I was treated to it as an early Christmas Present! Oh, and I love that it has CNN, and that I can watch movies / tv shows via my prime membership -- I'll be using those features a lot.

author: Lew Mills
title: Annoying screen on all the time? With stupid question ideas?
content:
No, I don't really need another screen full of distractions on my desk—with at-the-ready clickbait. I expect to see, "Try, 'Alexa, why do people hate Justin Bieber?'" (I'll save you the trouble: She's not sure.) Yes, you can power down the unit by holding the mic button for a long time. But then when you want to use it, it has to reboot. I just want the screen to go black. Or maybe give me just the clock.

I'm still struggling with other things that Alexa just doesn't seem to do. I can't seem to get it to "call" another unit without the second unit being connected to a cell phone number and Alexa app. (It seems to require an Amazon account too, to be registered.) That seems problematic, because I still want to talk to people who don't care to have a smartphone—like my aging parent. Maybe they'll get some better settings options over time. But for the meantime: Try, "Alexa, why do people put up with you?" (She has no idea…)

author: RJC3
title: LOVE IT...LOVE IT...LOVE IT...
content: I have 3 Echo Show (Black) and they are the best things I purchased in a long time. In conjunction with my Amazon security cameras I can view inside and outside of the house. When someone is at the front gate I can see and communicate with them from the comfort of my family Room, kitchen or bedroom. The music sound will laity is great as well and watching video, news footage, etc. I plan to get a few more for the theater room, living room and my home office.

author: S. Osburn
title: We've only started to learn how to use this - but love it so far!
content: We love being able to ask Alexa to play some music while we eat dinner, change the volume, and ask her questions about a song when we are on the other side of the room.  We have a lot to learn to create playlists, set up tasks, and other things, but so far, this has been a good experience for us.

author: iceg
title: I love the Echo Show
content: I love the Echo Show.  I bought 2 and sent one to my daughter who lives in another state. It makes it so easy to video chat. Even my grandkids can call me and I can see them sing and dance.  Love the jeopardy, the 5 day onscreen weather forecast. Just love everything about it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The good and the not so good
content:
The good: Voice recognition is very good.The video quality is very good. The build quality is excellent. The speakers are good.
The not so good: I had half-way expected it, but was still disappointed that local music cannot be played. You have to store the music in the Amazon cloud - for a fee. I mean, the unit costs $229 dollars, so it is not a give-away. I will probably wait to see if third-party apps may provide this before deciding finally between Google and Amazon and equip the whole house.

author: l. armstrong
title: To make your house a smart home, start here.
content: It takes awhile to develop a relationship.  There's a lot Alexia doesn't know, but will learn. It has meny features to offer, Sirius satellite radio and the ability to turn your house into a smart home. The best buy is when it goes on sale

author: Mildred
title: Love my Alexa
