content: I love it!!!  I've only began to explore everything that it can do.  I like asking Alexa to play songs and the weather, time and the joke of the day.  The music sounds great on my Bose speaker.  Can't wait to see all it can do.  Having fun.

author: Eric
title: Advertisements and suggestions you can't turn off
content:
I was excited to get this, I already have a few other Echo devices.  On the screen, ALL THE TIME is a "try this" suggestion to try different features.  There is no way to turn it off, and it's always there.

Forcing ads for other Echo features is dumb enough, and not giving the option to turn those suggestions off is ridiculous.  I'm more than likely going to return it.  I'll find something that doesn't force ads into my kitchen.

author: LC
title: Somewhat disappointing
content: The Echo Show is ok, however the constant suggestions about what to ask Alexa are sooooo annoying and there is no way to eliminate it. Also, I thought I could have the weather for an area displayed continuously,  but I have to talk to Alexa, which I don't want to do in the middle of the night. Had I payed full price it would have been returned. There are other features that are nice, but I may never use them.

author: clopitre
title: They are helpful and useful. I can listen to music on one individual ...
content: I have multiple Echo's thru out the house (total 5).  I have only 1 Echo Show which is in our kitchen. I also have placed multiple Echo's in my parents and in-law's homes.  They are helpful and useful.  I can listen to music on one individual unit or thru out the house simultaneously, made my own intercom system thru out with my multiple echo's, get updates as well as drop in on my parents & in-laws. My in-laws are like little kids playing with a toy.  They are amazed at all it can do.  You get really used to having it around once you get one.  The sound quality is very good considering its a not a huge device.  It packs a nice thump to it.  It has more bass than the regular Echo in my opinion.  A wonderful addition to your home.  I haven't used it to order anything yet but it is easy to do so (I played with it but didn't submit the order.)  With the screen you can video chat with another Echo Show, the Alexa app on a smartphone.  You can also see the content asked for (recipes, timer, weather, etc.).  You can also see the lyrics to songs playing.  You can watch movies/shows from your Prime account.  I even have watched NFL Thursday Night Football.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Update11/14/18-Disappointed, lacks the basics like Netflix
content:
Disappointed, the basics like Netflix, Hulu and You Tube are not available. Come on Amazon, get on the ball and give us an update to allow at least these streaming services, if had would give 5 stars.
Update11/14/2018, now have youtube and hulu

author: Carol Campbell
title: No youtube
content: This review would be 5 stars if it had YouTube back...but it gets a two because it’s absolutely absurd it’s not an option.

author: Barbara
title: Just what I wanted!
content: I love my Echo Show.  Bought it for my bedroom.  Can use it as an alarm clock, play restful music to fall asleep by, or play my favorite songs while getting dressed.  Like the big screen.  Wish the volume was a little louder, but all in all I got exactly what I wanted.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I just received mine as a present but love it so far
content: I just received mine as a present but love it so far. I’ve used the timer when baking, pulled up recipes,listened to music, and watched movies while cooking. It does everything I could ask and love how easy I can put an event into my calendar.

author: thebestsusan
title: It's fun to call people on
content: It's fun to call people on, the few that seem to have it also. It's pretty stupid for asking questions. I thought it would reach into the Internet for answers, but it doesn't really. It has never answered any question I've put to it (other than the weather) with any answer but suggestions how to look it up on my computer.

author: Samantha
title: still no youtube
content:
0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player Update 12/22/2018 - I have not had this very long and it’s already malfunctioning. Very disappointed! I guess since I got a bad product I will now have to also waste my time packing it up and returning it then waiting for a new unit. It did not take long at all on Google to see that this is a common problem with the Shows, on some pages Amazon even responded stating that they know about the problem. I really did want to love these but it is starting to look like I made a mistake not going with the Google products instead. Between the issue below with the Show not having any video of value video capabilities and now it being defective it’s hard to support this product any longer.

I can't give 5 stars until there is some type of video playing platform that can be utilized on this. It's an overpriced dot without that. Get YouTube back on it and it would definitely deserve 5 stars.

author: Scott Burgess
title: due to amazon and google's intractable territorial disputes, you ...
content:
due to amazon and google's intractable territorial disputes, you can not view youtube on any amazon device , protect your consumer rights by  not buying from either until they start putting the customer first !

Second day edit : four stars for  Amazons customer friendly return policy which allowed me to return 2 Echos shows and 2 kindle fire tablets and accessories, and Amazon allowed transparency about their own products deficiency due to silly corporate bickering in this product review.

author: Amazon Cali
title: A must have...for every household.
content: Love it. I use it by my bed as an alarm clock and to turn off the lights when I get comfortable. Plus, I watch music videos, movies, drop in on friends, listen to audio books with it. My cats like it when I bring up a screen saver with fish swimming. Fun to watch. I also have on in the kitchen to look up recipes, get weather, traffic, news...so many things it can do. Amazon is always coming up with new skills. You should get one or two today.

author: Jenn
title: Scam
content: Apparently from a glitch I ordered a second gen but it was actually this one. Zero help from customer service and probably my last echo device

author: Basant Singh Khalsa
content: Disappointment 😢. Will not control my hue lights anymore. Got to ability to make calls but it only shows people with an echo and to make other calls you have to say the whole phone number, can not add contacts. Why cant i just add an alarm just plain and simple from my phone, got to wAste more time trying to get it set how you want. It could and should able to do more. Like when i ask for traffic. why dont it show a map? And i asked it for a business that iwanted to go with the cross streets and it gave me the closest business with the same name 🤔. And yall need to activate calling on the tap

author: ScottMc
title: Screen will flicker and destort
content: I bought it in February.  In September my screen started flickering and bottom gets destoted.  Not all the time, mostly when you ask it to do something.  My 1st generation Echo is much better

author: Amazon Customer
title: The Show Disappoints
content: I have owned Alexa products and recommended them. I was going to go with the Spot; but at Christmas time they had a sale. Sadly looks like for Prime Members that didn’t change. Amazon wasn’t as successful with this one. I have loved being able to ask and it tells me stuf; so it now being able to show stuff to awesome. The first one I got; I sent back and got a replacement. The replacement ended up with the same issue. Not sure why, but both of mine have ended up with a pop from the speaker. So bad I powered it down. I got frustrated and busy, to late to exchange or anything. First time I am truely disappointed by the Alexa line of products.

author: AJMF
title: great product.
content:
great product.
when i first took out of box, i thought is was a bit bulky, but the nice screen and deep sounding speakers make you forget how big it is.  i have it in my kitchen where i can run either music or amazon prime videos in the background.
- i wish it has a screen saver as to not burn out any pixels. perhaps somewhere down the line, amazon may upgrade the IOS.

i own the all three amazon products (the hockey puck, the tower, and now the echo show).  i am very pleased with its capabilities as i also have wemo switches throughout the house.

i am sure the product has more to offer and i am not using it to the fullest aside from the obvious, but as time goes on, i'm sure i will be very pleased.i would definately recommend to others and family.

author: Judy
title: BEWARE: iTunes playlist will not work on any Echo device
content: I love this except that I cannot sync my iTunes account to play on Echo Show or any Echo product. I have over 700 songs that I have mostly PURCHASED over the years.. I probably would not have bought this had I known! I would really like to be able to ask Alexa to play a particular song. I will not sign up for Amazon Music until I can sync my iTunes Playlist!  This is my reason for 2 stars. Otherwise it would be 5 stars. If you worry about being “overheard” - Alexa can be turned off completely at any time!

author: Vernon M. Battle
title: Great product. I love the house to house conference ...
content: Great product. I love the house to house conference with video. The Amazon Echo Show is positively the greatest invention of all time. I highly recommend the Echo Show to my friends and family. The "Jetson" (TV Show) future is now a reality.

author: chris jenkins
title: Broken after 5 months
content: I did enjoy this product but after owning it for 5 months it seems to be malfunctioning. It's been in my nightstand and hasn't moved since I put it there. The screen just flickers. It was nice when it worked.

author: Rugmuffin
title: Safety feature for "old" person and just plain fun.
content: Got it for Christmas.  I love Alexa.  I have to learn what key words to use to communicate with her.  This is like learning a "new" mini language.  It is really good thing for an old mind and in this case fun.  She already controls the IRobot, will control lights when I get the matching fixtures.  She is some"thing"one to talk to on cold, dark winter days when I might otherwise be talking to myself.  She is courteous.  I love question for the day and word for the day.  Try Alexa open the box of cats.  You can't help but smile.  There is a lot of positive affirmation available from her.  This is all good stuff.  She keeps my to do list and it works.  I don't always remember even if I write it down.  Alexa is growing, changing, all the time.  She might not be for a full techie person, but for those of us who are at the age to just enjoy life, she is great.  I got a couple of echo dots to put in other rooms in the house.  I am hoping that way if needed, all I would have to do is say "Alexa call ... "  I can't wait till she gets even more functionality and grow with her.

author: Charles R. Gross
title: Love it. Future looks great!
content:
I would give 5 stars but there are some annoyances, that may be my fault?

I can't figure out how to make the Show stop telling me that my sister is home or that she did something. I hate having a little person up in the corner of my screen with a 1 on it. I am OCD that way and I can't figure out how to get rid of it. Taping it just shows me who's there but doesn't let me clear it.

Video calling stutters for me and my sister. We are both on very good wifi and it still acts like the video calling in Austin Powers. Hope this gets much better soon.

Hated the screen for movies cause it was way too dim but I learned, from another review, that I can adjust it by sliding down from top of the screen. So added that star back. Still, the instruction book\flyer should have told me that this is how to adjust the brightness.

Audio is great and loud without cracking at max volume. Alarms are great for getting m up in morning and timing "everything".

Does anyone know how it chooses stories to suggest to me and how I can change them?

author: Gentry
title: My new best friend
content:
The Echo Show is my new best friend.

Seriously it's works as advertised and I'm still learning what it can really do. Quality, fit and finish is very good you can display it anywhere.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great for communicating with elderly parents living with us.
content:
Like the communication ability from room to room and can see a room while out of the house.
Dislike the setup instructions. There were pretty much none. What I did have started me out with the wrong app. All the rest of the setup was complete guess work. I planned to share the Echo Shaw's with spouse and low and behold there was no setup instructions for that also. My list of contacts came from where I ask. Not from my current list in my phone device. Many of the contacts that came up were from eons ago and not listed in any device or other app I thought they may have come from such as email account. I am unable to unlist these old contacts as I don't know where they originated.

author: Mr max
title: Very pleased - suits my needs perfectly.
content:
I’ve had an Echo Dot 2nd gen since they came out and enjoyed it.  With the Echo Show on sale, decided to get one.  I used to be tied into Amazon, but now I have Apple products, Roku, and (shhh the G word), but still thought it might be handy.  Turns out I love the show so much more than the dot, and use it a lot more too!

It was easy to set up, and to pair with Bluetooth speakers, but turns out the onboard speakers are as good or better than my various Bluetooth ones. I-set a favorite photo as the background, and mostly ignore the text messages.  I do wish we could program at least some of those ourselves.  I’d also like a built in monthly calender - i use just a few added skills as its too hard to remember the launch phrases.

For me, the benefit of the screen makes all the difference.  It’s better for me to see/read than just to hear.  I have it near my bed, but so i can see it when lying on my side or sitting on the bed (where i spend the bulk of my time).  I love using it as a photo frame, and while the lack of youtube is frustrating, I’ve discovered asking for content brings up acceptable videos from other sites, including cooking, animals, etc.  And, ican ask alexa to play a documentary and she does!  I mostly watch things on the show at night - otherwise prefer tv screen.

The primary use for me is music, relaxation sounds (with video now) and photo frame.  I am hoping for more video enabled skills - there are surprisingly few for how long the show and spot have been available.

Almost forgot the important use - one others have mentioned - the drop in feature.  My grandson likes to use it at night to sneak-talk to Gramma.  My kids can check in with me.  And, with the show in one room and dot in another, i can tell alexa to call or message one of them if i need help.  (I know about the my buddy app - for now i prefer the call/text built in feature.)

author: Jamie
title: Not good, not bad. Just....Maah
content:
I do not know anyone else who has an echo show so I can't use it for the video phone capabilities. If I could, I would probably give it more starts. Things that bother me.

1. If you are not looking at the screen, you can't see the light bar so it's hard to know if Alexa is listening to you. With the original model or even the dots, you could clearly see the light ring from anywhere in your room.

2. I use my show to set an alarm to wake me up in the morning. For some reason, the developers have decided not to put that information on the screen. You have to ask it if there is an alarm set. I would think there would be some information that pops up in the corner of the screen showing there is an alarm set and for what time. Nope, not unless you ask it to show you the alarm and then the information goes away after a minute.

3. I used my old Alexa to control my TV through the Harmony hub. Some command that worked with my old Alexa don't work with the show. For example, I use to be able to say, "Alexa, pause tv" and then "Alexa, play tv". The pause does work but when I say "Play", it wants to look up some random show on Amazon and start playing it. I did get the bright idea to say "Alexa, resume tv" and that did work.

4. You can't see messages as clear as you could with the standard device. The standard one has a light ring on top that you could clearly see from anywhere in your room. It was obvious there was a message waiting. The show, put's an icon on the screen to let you know there is a message. If you don't look at the screen, you won't see it.

5. There is a massive lack of ability to personalize the device. You have to have amazon accounts in order to do things. Like you can't change the background without uploading pictures to Amazon photo. I am not sure but this might be a prime benefit. I am wondering if I shut down my prime account, will it still work? I would have thought that you would be able to do more using the Alexa app to personalize the device. As of now, there isn't a whole lot you can do. Not a lot of settings you can change. Like I think it would be great if you could tell it to show alarm clocks on the screen at all times in the corner of the device.

My opinion...If you want a show really bad, wait to buy it when it's on sale. As of the time of this review, it's 159.00 when I got it, it was 149.00. If you can use it for the video capabilities, then I think it would be worth the money much more. Between my old Alexa and this new Show.. My feelings about it are really just...."Maah". Don't love it, don't hate it...Could live with or without it.

author: Larry
title: No Tutorial Needed for Friends and Family
content:
Setting the Alexa up is pretty easy but gets complicated when you are trying to add smart home devices.  My Hue bulbs could not be found for a few days but after contacting Hue support I got them going.

After setup though Alexa became a star in my house.  My friends came over for game night and were asking it to play music and view movie trailers and they needed no tutorials or anything.  I recommend putting this in a noticeable and high traffic place like a living room.  That way guests see it and can access it right away.

The smart home stuff can be difficult to sync but once the setup was done I slowly started using Alexa to control my smart home vs Siri because the voice controls were so easy.  There's no buttons needed just a "Hey Alexa turn on living room lights" and its done.  The microphone has a very good range too.  I can be upstairs and tell Alexa a command and 90% of the time it works without needing a command repetition.

The easy of smart home control with Alexa was shown to me when I had a family member house sit for me.  I added them to Homekit control but they told me when I came back that the Alexa controls were all they used.  That means no sharing users to allow a buddy to control your home.  Just tell them to ask Alexa and it just works.

My last praise is using Ring cameras with the Echo Show is nice.  The video plays well and I can't wait for future updates because now that Ring is part of Amazon there's got to be some new connectivity coming in the future.  I'd love to be able to get Ring notifications on my Show for example but I can wait for now.

author: Michael A Brannon
title: Quality product, but really isn't capitalizing on its potential
content:
The Show is a decent Echo that looks gorgeous and features a powerful speaker, but it could be so much more.

The problem is this: it can't play YouTube or conventional video formats. So the impressive large screen with great resolution is just going to be used to transcribe weather forecasts and news headlines 99% of the time. And that's a shame, because the large screen makes the thing bulky and takes up a lot of space on desks and entertainment consoles for no practical reason.

author: doctor smallbiz
title: Great with Cloud Cam, super audio player
content: Great product for all around use - I use mine mainly for Sirius XM radio, but also handy to get facts.  Works well with Cloud Cam.  Sound quality is surprisingly good.

author: Veni
title: My Quick review 🙃
content:
My quick review.
Works great, connect to my hue.
Speakers sound great.
Alexa helps alot on things i dont know like Spelling, defining a word, news, and keeps me updated on my task i set it up to do.
4 stars. Why?
I wish they added youtube and the amazon prime music is very limited on songs.

author: JAN
title: I love the Echo Show
content: The Echo Show Black is great.  I was a BETA tester for the original Echo, which I own and use in my office since the SHOW has taken number one spot in my kitchen. I also have several Echo Dots throughout my house. I love how there are many additional skills added all the time. Yep, I'm a big fan.

author: Sonia L.
title: Great!
content: Great for interacting with other devices and I love the fact that it has a screen that shows various information, notifications, calendar reminders, etc. Well done Amazon!

author: Shawna Berggren
title: I absolutely love this device
content: I absolutely love this device! We are a very Alexia friendly household, and we thought we would give the Echo Show a try. I am glad that we did, I would highly recommend if you are considering getting one.

author: P. Horne
title: Good but needs work
content: I love the visuals - especially for timers and task lists.  I have noticed that smart home interactions with Honeywell and Hue have more of a delay than with my original Echo.  I'm also not impressed with the video call quality -- they need to boost the brightness.  Also the contact integration is a disaster -- we need to be able to pick and choose the contacts we want shown, and just make the whole process more simple and intuitive.  Right now Amazon pushes random people from my Apple Contacts that I would NEVER video call to my device simply because they apparently also have an Amazon device.

author: Ms Pat
title: The best
content: This is the best one so far. I have two other type, but now I can see and talk to my grandkids and son who is in the military far from me. I refuse to by a new phone just to connect. All they need is an app. Lol.  Beside I can see and talk friends out of state.  Buy items off of amazon. Check my bus time. Everything it said  it can do it does,  Cooking is so much fun. Oh and the music is great,  Thanks amazon for the Echo show loving it  In Michiagn

author: Frederick Kelley
title: This device has needed to be factory reset twice.
content: Purchased 2 Echo Show and one device needed to be factory reset twice. It had a mic issue and a few days later had a screen issue.  Waiting for the unit to go belly up.

author: Ed Detlie
title: Not Very Well-Made
content: After buying the Echo Show four months ago, the video has started breaking up badly. I looked for support, but there is nothing that applies. There is no contact information, so I guess I am out of luck.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Try 2nd generation Show
content: If I were you, I’d get the 2nd generation now that it’s available. Hopefully they have the issue fixed with constant screen flickering that you have on the 1st generation.  But, other than that, the Echo Show is nice to be able to see recipes on the screen, watch videos or FaceTime on it.

author: Cor
title: Now love it
content:
I am an Echo user with 2 echo dots, 1 echo, 2 echo shows, and a Roav VIVA for the car.  Here is the problem.  I purchased my second Echo Show so that I could check in on my wife who spends much of her time in bed because of migraine headaches.  After some testing I found that when an Echo Show is connected to another Echo device even an Echo Connect it will output from the microphone a low level sound.  For example use drop-in on two Echo Shows and you will have to turn the volume up to hear the other person.  If you drop-in from an Echo to an Echo Show, the person speaking from the Echo Show will have a low Volume on the Echo.  The person speaking from the Echo can be hear fine on the Echo Show.  I have an Echo Connect on my phone.  If I answer with the Echo Show the person on the other end has a hard time hearing me.  If I answer on an Echo or Echo Dot the person on the phone can hear me fine.  One can make an Announcement from an Echo Show and the volume on all Echo devices will be fine, it is only when the Show is connected to another Echo device that the sound will be low.  The Echo Show if a fine device and I would give it over 5 stars if it were not for this problem.  I have spoken with support and sent feedback, but have not received an answer.  I hope someone will look into this matter and greatly improve the Echo Show.  By the way the Echo and Echo Dots have multiple microphones.  The Echo Show only has two speakers which double as a microphone.  Don’t misunderstand me, I like the Echo Show, it just has an issue.  I like that I can see my cameras and other things that you need a screen for.

Aug. 1, 2018
On my original review I gave the show 3 stars because of an issue stated above.  I called home this morning and my wife asked me if I could hear her OK.  I said, “yes, why?”  She said, “I answered using the Show.”  I told her I could hear her fine (I also have my phone connected to an Amazon Connect).  I had stopped using the show to answer calls because the other person could not hear me well.  Now the show is working well with the Amazon Connect!  When I got home I went into the den and dropped into the bedroom where she was.  The volume was great.  In the past the volume of the person speaking was low when two Amazon Shows were used for Drop-in.  Amazon has now corrected that problem and the Amazon Show plays well with all devices!  I can now set in my living room and control about everything in my house.  As my wife has medical problems I have Shows, Dots, and Echoes scattered around different rooms of the house in case she has a problem.  I am a big fan of the Amazon devices.  I am getting so lazy I may have to search for some diet pills or books.

author: Patty Miles
title: Love my Echo Show
content: I am very satisfied with the Echo Show.  I use it in my kitchen.  I have used it for music, watched CNN broadcasts, radio shows, looked up recipe suggestions, the weather forecast while I eat my breakfast in the mornings.  This was a great purchase and I am very pleased with it.  The kids love it as well and often ask for their favorite song and dance around the room.

author: Jimd
title: Very good quality and very helpful
content: I use this unit in my in=home office and it coordinates with the other two "Alexa" units that I have in the house. The additional information that it provides is really great.

author: JMB
title: Screens Flicker - Amazon will not make good
content: I purchased 4 of these. They are great except that after a few months the screens start flickering. The second one has started now. Amazon "IS" aware of the problem, Amazon actually will replace them as they go bad. The problem is, I don't want to contend with this for the next 10 years, SO I asked them to replace the known problem devices with the newer version that do not have this problem..........and I will pay the difference in cost. I'm not asking for anything free. The Amazon technician on the phone did his best to make this happen because he understood completely my request. He was NOT able to because Amazon policy does not make a way. SO, I do not recommend this product.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Pleasantly surprised!
content:
Great item. This is my first Alexa product and I’m genuinely surprised at all it can do - I like listening to music and enjoy seeing the lyrics play out.

Weather and sports and other miscellaneous things are a no brainer...I’m sure it will grow smarter over time too!

I want to get the smaller one for my bedroom now, and get more smart home devices! My hue lights work with this which is pretty cool!

Overall I’m not overly critical and enjoy the item, one star knocked off just because it’s not completely useful for certain questions. And sometimes goes off even when I don’t call it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great addition to the echo family!!!
content:
Great device.  I really enjoy the Echo Show and it's displays.  Can't wait for Amazon to get all the echos to talk to one another so
I don't have to go to one for an alarm and another for something else.  I think since they share the same app, they should both
be interactive with one another.  Still, great addition to the echo dot.

author: Raegun
title: Overall good experience
content: This was a gift from my mother in law. My husband and his brother also got one each. It’s pretty cool. I like that I can ask Alexa to play music while I’m in the kitchen. At first I was able to get YouTube on it but for some reasOn I can’t anymore, either because amazon deleted that app as a choice or maybe I’m not asking for the right thing anymore. Alexa hears me well when I’m downstairs, and sometimes too well when I’m watching YouTube and someone else has her and wakes theirs and mine up lol. The speakers are great! I hope to see amazon include more apps on her as they progress but I’d say overall the Show is a pretty neat device.

author: WillC1123
title: Best echo device I have owned so far!
content: Absolutely love my echo show! This Echo is used daily for morning weather and lights as well as our family calander for alerts and reminders. I also have been at work and had maintenance stop by at our place while no one was home and I was able to check in on them through the app and answered a few of their questions through the video call or drop in feature. If you can’t afford this model you can buy the smaller version or wait until prime day for the sale. I do recommend if you have a smart home or want to have one starting here is a great way to do it.

author: RPL
title: The best Echo yet, especially if you have elderly parents
content:
This was really worth the wait. I bought the Echo Show for my parents, who are elderly, and have a variety of ailments.  Since they have arthritis, and a few other issues, I didn't want them to go and answer the doorbell, just to find it's someone soliciting them to buy random junk. So, last year, I bought and installed the Ring Doorbell Pro in their house, which works very well.  The Ring Doorbell Pro is hardwired and not battery operated. After the skill was enabled, I could tell Alexa to show me the front doorbell and a video feed automatically pops up. You really need a good Wi-Fi router with the Echo show as the video will be jerky since the video is very high quality. If you have a good Wi-Fi router, the video comes up very quickly and runs very smooth. I thought the doorbell would launch the app on the Echo Show automatically, but it does not. You have to initiate the connection yourself. Hopefully this will be an option in the next iteration of this skill. I can think of a whole bunch of ideas for this skill to do, but for a very first implementation, it works great with the hardwired version of the Ring Doorbell Pro.

The battery powered Ring products do not work as great though. When trying to connect the Echo Show to a battery powered Ring device, I get a message saying something like, " The camera is asleep and needs to wake up and it could take 30 sec". This happens with my Ring Stickup Camera. So, if you want the best experience, you should buy the Ring Doorbell Pro instead of the battery powered versions.

One of my parents just came out of the hospital and sometimes just doesn't have the energy to even pick up a cell phone when we call.  So, we have another Echo Show, just for her, in drop in mode.  This has really worked very well for us since she does not have to fumble and look for her cell phone if we need to call and check up on her. Also, we use to call her cell phone, but then we would find that the phone was not changed enough, so the call would end prematurely, or the call would not go through.  All of those issues have gone away with the Echo Show.  If she needs to call a family member, that's just a voice call away as well.

Right now, she can use her voice to call up movie and TV shows on Amazon Prime.  Hopefully, Netflix, and other services, will also be forth coming.  But for now, the shows on Amazon Video will suffice.  I've outfitted my parents house with Homekit products from Philips Hue, Lutron, and iDevices, and all of them work flawlessly with the Echo Show.

One feature that I found by accident, that I have not found documented anywhere, is that if you hold down the mute button for about 3 or 4 seconds, than a user interface comes up that allows you to shut down the device entirely.  A user interface that's says "Power Off" come up.  Then you can either hot OK to power the device off or hit Cancel to go back to the main screen.  We use the timer function a lot for preparing medicine and cooking food.  When I set a timer, the Echo Show actually shows the timer on the screen.  Therefore, I don’t have to ask it how much time is left every so often.  I can actually see how much time is left.  This may sound like a small thing, but it's really very helpful.  You can even dismiss a timer with a swipe instead of saying cancel timer, or stop timer, when the timer goes off.

The Echo Show definitely isn't perfect.  Even though the camera works well, I wish it could swivel so that you can fine tune the position of it.  But all in all, for the scenarios my parents use it for, it works great for a first release.  The ability to check in on someone that's bed ridden, and can't move all that well, even to pick up a cell phone, makes this a great device to own.

UPDATED- (10/02/17)

Unfortunately YouTube is not supported anymore because of a disagreement between Google and Amazon.  Hopefully, this feature will be added back after an agreement is reached.

However, Amazon added a new feature to the Echo Show, and all Echo devices, that allows the user to call cell phone and landline numbers in the U.S, Mexico, and Canada for free.  You don't need to buy anything else to make this happen.  Previously, you needed to use one of the Echo devices, or the Alexa app, to make calls.  Now, you can use an Echo device to call someone's cellphone, or a landline.  This is great for those cases where video calling is not the best option.  When you initiate a call on your Echo device, the person you are calling will see your phone number show up on their caller ID.  They won't know you are calling from an Echo device.

You can either call using a direct number or using a name from your address book.  Therefore, you can say, "Alexa, call mom at home", "Alexa, call dad's cellphone", etc.  Or you can say, " Alexa call/dial 1-123-456-7890".  If there are multiple people with similar sounding names, Alexa will ask you to confirm which person you actually mean to call.  If you press the mute button on your Echo, then it has the same effect as pressing mute on your phone.  Meaning, you can hear the other person, but they cannot hear you.  While on the phone call, you can also tell Alexa to raise/lower the volume as well.  When you are finished with he call, you can just say, "Alexa, hang up" and the call will be terminated.  A phone call can only be made from a physical Alexa device.  I have found it does not work from the Alexa app itself.  But still, this is a great new feature that makes the Echo Show, and all other Alexa devices, worthwhile.  Knowing a person, confined to bed, can call you, at any number in their address book, really gives some peace of mind.

UPDATED- (10/11/17)

Alexa is the gift that keeps on giving.  Today, when going through the account settings to enable notifications for shopping, I noticed another option called "Your Voice".  When enabling this new feature, Amazon has enabled you to train Alexa to recognize specific voices.  Alexa really has voice recognition now.  After training Alexa to recognize your voice, she can distinguish who is speaking by just their voice.  To enable the feature, go into settings and click the "Your Voice" setting.  From there, choose the Alexa device that you want to train.  Then the user interface will lead you into speaking 10 sentences for the training process.  After the training session, it takes about 20 minutes for Alexa to process the voice print.  After that time, you can ask Alexa, "Alexa, who am I", and she will come back and say your name.

When doing the voice training, it's a good idea to unplug, or mute, any other Alexa devices in ear shot as they may respond to what you are saying.  Also, turn the volume of the TV, or any other device, to mute so that other voices will not interfere with the voice training.  In my household, this new feature appears to work very well.  When we ask Alexa to play music, she will play music from the specific person's Alexa account.  We don't need to specifically switch account anymore.  For voice calling, Alexa now looks up the person she was asked to call in the person who is speaking contact database, and makes the call to the correct person.  This was a great unexpected feature to find today.

UPDATED- (11/21/17)

YouTube is back on the Echo Show! Also, Vimeo and Dailymotion are now supported as well. If you ask the Echo Show to show you specific videos, it brings up a list of videos that match your request from YouTube, Vimeo, and Dailymotion.  You can then tap the video to bring up a mobile webpage that plays the video.  Telling the Echo to play video #1, #2, etc. also works.

author: d.b. aol
title: Highly recommend.
content: The show is pretty cool. I like the fact that I can watch my Amazon Prime in the kitchen with it. The response to “Alexa” is slow and sometimes not responsive as the old echo tower but so many other things you can do with it.

author: jak
title: good product.  Video phone talk is confusing to use.
content:
Very good product. Fun to talk to and get answers to basic questions like Weather, scores, headlines, movies, etc.
The music is great based on what you want to hear along with the lists and timer function.  The only issue is to do what is advertised on tv talking to someone while seeing them on the screen only works if they have an echo product also, which most people don't have.  Otherwise a great product.

author: btighe
title: I like it, Its in my kitchen, and I can ask it anything just about.
content: I do love it. Was easy to set up so far, but I wish it has a little more in the set up instructions. There is still a whole lot more I would like to be able to do with it and I have no idea if I can or not with it. But I really do like it.

author: Doc
title: Buy 2 books from Amazon re: The Echo Show & Alexa.
content: I haven’t used it for all that it can do; ie. interfacing with other systems like controlling lights or cameras but it is excellent with reminders for appts, timers, music, radio news, weather, alerts, watching Amazon Prime videos. Having the screen along with voice makes it easy to easy to follow along with info being given like music playlists. I also like being able to load my pictures from my iPhone & having them showing on the screen, in one minute intervals.

author: Donald R. Hays
title: The Echo Show, the future...now!
content:
I've only had this item for a few hours and already...I think it's awesome!!  I'm learning how to communicate to it and installing 'Skills'.  I'm sure Alexa and I are going to become great friends.  This is the future now.

Update: The longer I own it, the more I like it.

author: Maddie
title: It is self explanatory and super easy to use.
content: I have the Echo in my bedroom. I wake up and before I even get out of bed I ask Alexa what is the weather and news for the day. It gives me a few minutes to become awake and I'm already ahead for the day. Then I ask Alexa to play whatever music I'm in the mood for that morning. My grandkids have an Alexa and they call me and FaceTime on it. It is great.

author: amy
title: If you have an elderly parent please buy this!
content: My parents are computer illiterate and have a hard time with a smart phone but they took to this right out of the box. I purchased it for safety reasons. My mom fell in the middle of the night and couldn’t wake up my father for help! She laid there all night. If she had this sooner she could have asked Alexa to call me. My parents are now video calling their grand children and great grandchildren. For anyone that is home bound this device is a must have. I can drop in during the day just to say hi! “Check on them” etc. I wish amazon would offer special pricing for low income seniors because this has the potential of being a life changer!

author: Beverly R. Fawcett
title: Issues with connecting to WIFI
content: I love the Echo Show and it worked fine right out of the box at home.  However, after a few weeks it would no longer connect to our home WIFI. My husband spent several hours researching and trying to get it to reconnect.  Turned it off and on several time and turned the router off and on, nothing worked. My tap was connected to our WIFI the entire time with no issue.  Because of that, it seems odd that it would be a problem with our WIFI.  I contacted support, but nothing they suggested worked.  I ended up taking it into work, where it did connect to the WIFI, and it is now on my desk there.  But I really wanted it at home, so I will continue to use my very reliable Tap at home.

author: Eva Evans
title: new to alexa
content: in general I like this gadget. was disappointed to find out I can not play Netflix or watch my cable tv. disappointed to find out I have to pay extra for unlimited music through amazon and extra for kindle books or audio books to read my favorite author. disappointed with the selection of movies through amazon prime. what I do like is the alarm clocks, timers, jokes, news briefs and things to try with Alexa. there are a few times when I ask questions and Alexa doesn't understand what's being asked but I just have to choose the right way to phrase the questions. I will be looking forward to new features.

author: Barbara
title: Life-Enhancing Adventure
content: After experiencing an Echo Show that I gifted to my daughter, I bought five more. Four for gifts and one for myself. I have no idea how I managed before Echo came along. It's significantly life-enhancing. The speakers are amazing!  Listening to any song that comes to mind without moving a finger is very convenient. To research endless topics without consulting the computer is most welcomed. I am in the process of expanding on smart devices so I can take advantage of Echo Show's ability to control my home appliances remotely. I can't say enough positive about this amazing adventure.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love how easy the upgrade was from Echo 1
content:
Love how easy the upgrade was from Echo 1. Touchscreen is much easier than some commands, great video and better sound.
Helped another user set up Second Gen Echo, and really appreciate my upgrade.
Haven't found much to not like.

author: Crissie Allen
title: Would Love to Love The Show
content: I love the idea of the product and I love Alexa but I took my show out of the box when we moved to our new home July 18th, 2018. Not one month later my screen has strange wavy lines across it and is beginning to flash every 20 seconds or so. My show has been set up once and has never been moved and is already having problems. Hopefully this is a rare occurrence and Amazon can help me out. Because I love all of my Echo products.

author: BurnedBuyer
title: Then I saw one in a store and decided it looks MUCH better in person
content: I thought the pictures and online presentation made this look awful. Then I saw one in a store and decided it looks MUCH better in person. I'm very happy with this device. Great sound, high quality picture, and touch sensitivity.

author: Michael E Hess
title: To set it up requires a slide-down from the top of the screen. Everything else is pretty much intuitive.
content:
Still learning it's usage but am immensely satisfied with the performance so far. Really great for contacting others with the same equipment. Lots of apps on the Google store site with instructions. It sync's with everything else. The sound produced is equal to any Bose system and "Alexa" can hear commands for quite a distance away.
A DEFINITE "GET IT"!!!

author: Crystal M
title: Love the Ease
content: Love The Show! Bought one for my 80 year old mom and she loves it💗we can visually check in every day.  Some of my other sibling bought one as well so it’s a great easy tool to use.  I also enjoy the ability to ask Alexa whatever I need to know at the moment.

author: Brains
title: Simply great!
content: What a great piece of equipment! Loved it and still love it.If properly connected with google, pandora etc, it is so helpful. I will never miss another appointment. Great for people with memory problems.

author: JesRodTex777
title: The setup process is easy, but you have to search a bit to ...
content: I purchased the Echo Show for my mother-in law and she absolutely loves it.  We can check on her and she has another companions to chat with as well.  The setup process is easy, but you have to search a bit to give other users access to call or drop-in.  The video quality is pretty good when you have the lights on, but quality drops a bit in a room that is not properly lit.  I would recommend any buy this device to stay visually connected to friends and family.  The other Alexa features come across fine as well.

author: Christopher Laurent
title: No relationship with youtube makes this a brick - not ...
content: No relationship with youtube makes this a brick - not delivered as advertised. Bezos, get your act together. It's an open source world.

author: ktsmom
title: LOVE THIS!
content: I will definitely be looking for this to go on sale again to buy 1-2 more.  I love my Echo.  I use this every day - from good morning and get my weather and flash briefing  to good night, I am constantly interacting with Alexa.  Movie times, measurements, timers, reminders, news, you name it, and Alexa can help you.  Easy, easy to set up and get working.  My daughter bought one and now my granddaughter can call Mimi anytime and see me too.  We love it.

author: H
title: Very disappointed with the quality of the Echo Show and more ...
content:
Stopped working after five weeks!
Contacted their warranty service and after wasting 45 minutes, I was told I should pay $45 for them to send me an open-box replacement item! Alternatively, I can send them back the defective item, and they try to fix it!
Very disappointed with the quality of the Echo Show and more disappointed in their customer support!

author: F. Nelson
title: Great Alarm Clock
content: I am using the Show as my alarm clock as well as controlling the lighting in my bedroom.  I wake to music, then view my calendar for the day, and then listen/watch morning news stories.

author: Schwemma
title: Such a Handy Assistant
content: We loved having an Echo Dot so decided to upgrade to Echo Show to get the screen. This has made us love Alexa even more, we use her all the time!

author: LUCK
title: (Wo)man's Best Friend
content:
My millennial kids swear that Alexa is spying on the world and will take over all households someday.

But I don't feel that way at all.  Alexa shows me who is at the front door, lets me make calls, times my meals, tells me the news, turns lights on and off, plays music.  She is amazing!  I can even play games with her Echo show.

Hey wait - that's not what I'm typing!  Alexa...stop typing...ALEXA!

author: livetoread
title: We love the Echo Show
content: Shipped promptly and was exactly as described. We love the Echo Show!  As a plus, it keeps my son and his endless questions occupied!

author: Donna S.
title: Great Product
content: I bought 2 of these so we could talk to my 19 month old grandson but it does so much more.  My grandson goes to it and says my name when he's in trouble or doesn't want to go to bed:)  The list maker that connects to my phone is great plus I love being to ask questions without googling them.

author: Mom of 5
title: Love it
content: Still learning about the Echo show but so far we love it. My 9 year old loves to cook and especially with his Aunt that lives out of state and now he can connect with her and they cook together.

author: Dallas/Mark
title: I should have had this a long time ago!
content: I can't believe the quality of the sound.  This thing is unbelievable, and once it is setup, it works so easily.

author: Candice Heffron
title: Really great
content: I love it. I can make calls, check the weather, it reminds me of deliveries, makes my shopping list, plays music, gives me the news. I have it in the kitchen so I can look up my recipes and also tell Alexa to set a timer when I’m cooking.

author: Blondie S. Walker
title: My IMPECCABLE forever friend:Alexa
content: Love my echo show....LIKE having a FRIEND with me... impeccable technology...displays Important news, entertainment, music, spells, answers questions, weather & TONS MORE...Love it when I say:Alexa, good morning, Alexa replies with a good morning and What HAPPENED On this Day In HISTORY

author: T.M.
title: Recommend for Arlo Pro viewing!  Really handy.
content: Ok, well, we love playing our Amazon Prime Music on the show.  You get wonderful sound from the show with Lyrics.  We used it as a sleep sound machine last night.  The show can hear you from really far away. We can say "Alexa, show the front door", using our Arlo Pro.  Love that!  See who's at the door while they are ringing the bell.  We are using it to power the TV off and on and changing the channel.  Now, the bad part......  will not look up questions you ask from the internet.  Does not play Youtube.  We feel the Show can do more and the Google home knows more.

author: Endarkened
title: Absolutely terrible gift. Amazon ships this already tied to your ...
content:
Absolutely terrible gift.  Amazon ships this already tied to your Amazon.com account.  Not the end of the world but if you already own a few other devices is a real pain triying to determine which is yours and which you gifted.

PS A buyer should be able to gift an Echo.

I love the device but, registering takes only minutes why is it pre registered?  What benefit is it to anyone?

author: Geno-LT
title: Be sure to always say good night to her!
content: Just met Alexa. So far she's been very good about playing the music I ask for; occasionally will play a condensed version of my request, but when I stop her and add the word complete to my request she plays the unedited version. She's also quite competent with reminder alarms.  My next project is to enter a ToDo list.

author: SuiShop
title: The screen is on all the time !
content: The screen just won't turn off when it is idle.  I placed this in the kitchen and use it only when we are there, but I noticed that for the screen would just stay on with the colorful home screen, and the "Try.. Alexa.." message on the bottom, btw there is no option to turn this "Try" message off either.  I expected that the screen should work like a phone screen and goes off when it is idle, meaning I'm not talking to it, and no new notification for me to see.  This is very annoying for 2 main reason, 1: it is on all the time and consuming extra electricity for no reason, 2: you will probably see dead pixels on screen soon as it is unnecessarily on all the time.  Amazon Echo Team, what's going on?

author: Ed Hawley
title: The familiy is growing
content: My 4th Echo, 2nd Echo show, love the devices still learning how they work, and have one at my job as my assistant.  A very cool and product and getting better every day. Just watch out for the Alexa commercials........

author: Gulliver Traveler
title: Great for Selling You Stuff, But Not Much Else
content: I waited months to write this review hoping that Alexa would get better, but not much has changed. Here's what it can do. Turn off and on lights with the additional special plug adapters, tell you the time, jokes, and weather. It is best at selling you stuff. The music categories play music unrelated or so obscure to the category it is a waste of time. Alexa wants you to PAY for an Amazon music subscription just as it wants you to pay for movies, etc. And it will sometimes charge your account for these items without telling you. It consistently fails to work with most installed skills after a week or so. One of those skills is Amazon's own ring doorbell. This usually fails within one week. I can't get it to work at all now after having fail at least six times. All the other times, I was able to get it operating again. When you ask Alexa a question, you have a 50-50 chance you will get real information related to the question. Other times, Alexa goes off on some other random topic or it tries to sell you stuff you don't want or need. It is nearly impossible to get Alexa back to the present as it refuses to give up what it thinks you want. I installed a skill for my car which Alexa still seems to know is there (both the car and the skill) but while she thinks she is talking to the car as she used to, nothing is happening. Reinstalling the skill does not help. My cell phone app for the same car has never failed. I have worked in the computer and cell phone field, so I understand technology. This is NOT ready for prime time. It fails to deliver.  Amazon marketing has oversold this.

author: Big Ben
title: Screen Flickers After a While
content: I bought this unit in July, so have had it only 3 months, and the screen has started to flicker - constantly. Rebooting the unit has no effect. On searching for answers to this problem, I find a lot of owners are reporting this issue. Maybe it's a flaw in the 1st generation Echo, not sure, but it's very troubling for a $200 machine to have issues in that amount of time. Other than this, the basic function of it is great. Its a nice touch to have video and visuals along with the regular audio features of the echo. The drop in is handy - I did not not find it "on" by default, for those of you who are worried about surprise room-to-room eavesdropping. You must enable it on the device(s).  To be fair though, the major difference is the screen and that happens to be what is malfunctioning (seemingly pretty commonly) so maybe wise to wait until they perfect these a bit more.

author: sherwinm
title: amazon prime day deal
content: the price during amazon prime day 2018 was great. i bought 2 of the white ones. we already have the original echo. this one has not only a screen but the speakers are actually great. also, when playing music, it hears your commands a lot better/clearer and will respond better - even at a further distance. i have it set as a group and now i can play music throughout the house and on multiple devices.

author: L. Wheeler
title: It's A keeper!!!!!
content:
Absoultley love this sitting on my kitchen counter.
Shopping list
Music
Recipes
Calander
Grandchidren love talking to her..
Much more
Seems the Echo show sound quality is a little less when maxing out the sound.
I also have the Alexa Echo and sound quality is better than the show .

author: Daddy Bob Tucson
title: Alexa and the echo show do a lot of things, but unfortunately very few well
content:
I really, really wanted to love Alexa and the echo show... However my experience is mostly painfully frustrating. Alexa doesn't speak English, she speaks Alexa. And you better remember the syntax, word order, commands, etc... Another major frustration is, even though I have a very quiet house, Alexa is hit or miss (on both the echo and echo show-in different rooms) on understanding what I say. She often answers with seemingly nonsensical answers that have nothing to do with what I asked.

If you enjoy being led through recipes, she is pretty good at that. Some recipes even have video that gives you guidance through each step. If everyone you know has an echo show it might be cool to do the video call thing.

YouTube is NOT supported on the echo show. So don't expect to see music videos... Everything seems to be subscription based, Prime Music, Prime Videos, etc...

Another major frustration is I paused a movie and went to get something to eat and came back to Alexa back on the home screen. The movie timed out and I forgot the name of the movie. I could find no way to get back to it...

I'm going to return my Echo Show and get a tablet for around the same price which will do a LOT MORE A LOT BETTER.

author: Oliver Wang
title: Drop In feature is a game changer, fast developing ecosystem is one to watch
content:
I love this device because of the "Drop In" feature, even though pretty much everyone I talk to is concerned about the privacy issues. I consider this a non-issue. Amazon gives you total control over which contacts are able to use this feature with your Echo Show. In practice, it really feels like physically dropping by the house for a minute. It's funny how much of a difference it makes that the recipient does not have to physically find their phone or table and press a button to begin interacting with you. Already I'm using it to quickly chat with my son and wife before I get home from work, and with my out of state parents at any time. If you're worried about people "peeking" into your home without your knowledge or consent, don't enable the feature. You might as well be concerned about people peeking or eavesdropping through your phone.

The speaker sounds pretty darn good to me. It fills the room and has a decent low end for its size. It looks like if you are not a Prime member, you don't get access to the music library, so you will need to connect to your Spotify or Pandora account. it's a minor annoyance, especially since Alexa is not smart enough to simply use the account tnat you specify. You actually have to specify "Alexa, play top hits on Pandora".

The Echo/Alexa platform is developing quickly, but it's clearly a work in progress. It is a new class of device and platform and there are definitely going to be growing pains as the people spend time with it and the market responds.I would like to see better management of contacts, ideally directly through my Amazon account and easily managed via the Echo Show, the Alexa app, or in a web browser. Right now, you need to install the Alexa app on your smartphone, and it will find contacts on your smart phone. That's it. You can't create contacts, rename them, merge them, etc. I get it - Amazon is just starting to enter the world of person-to-person communication and hasn't been at it as long as Apple, Google, Facebook, etc.

I'm not doing much with the Echo as a digital/smart home assistant, but it's very exciting to see the beginning steps of a totally connected ecosystem. Already, I'm wishing that more things were directly controllable with Alexa. Like my Roku TV or Netflix. How great would it be if you could say "Alexa, turn on my TV and play the latest episode of Black Mirror on Netflix?"

author: T. Evans
title: Worthwhile tool
content: I have the Alexa Echo and Dot, but I like having my photos continuing displaying as the background on the screen. I do enjoy seeing the various snippets of information displaying too. Some dumb and no interest to me, but others that cause me to asking for more information.  Of the 3 Alexa’s I have, the show is my favorite and the worse one is the dot.

author: Carolyn Johnson
title: Wonderful device
content: I love my Echo. The picture,videos, movies and sound is awesome.  For the future I wish the Echo could Skype or FaceTime with other devices , such as iPhones and other android devices.

author: UpstateNY
title: Good but could be great. Alexa is still lacking and cannot answer too many questions.
content:
Good sound quality and video but I think Alexa could be smarter as she cannot answer a lot of basic questions and video options could be better as well. This should be capable of playing any video or movie that you wanted to see on it.
Overall is good but could be much better.

author: Joseph Scott Drake
title: First amazon Alexa product
content: Bought my first Alexa product on amazon prime day got the echo show for 100.00 dollars and for an additional 10.00 dollars they threw in the Kasa tp link. I have always wanted Alexa and felt this deal was to good to pass up. I got the kasa plugs connected to my lights so now I no longer need to crawl over my bed or walk around it to light my room, I have enabled a couple sporting news skills to Alexa so far and have used he for a radio and alarms clock. I’m sure there is a lot more you can do with the echo show but like I said I’ve only had about 2 days with it but so far it’s a very interesting product.

author: Christine A Lucas
title: Love my Show
content: Love this gadget. Sale was great and I have of course been hearing all about the Echo and how everyone who has it loves it. I was originally going to get the Look, but have not heard too many good things about it. I also got 2 buttons, so looking forward to playing games. It is really ideal if you have Amazon Prime. I see what you did there Amazon.

author: Scott
title: Love it. The screen is a great addition to ...
content: Love it. The screen is a great addition to an already great product. Use it everyday for all my Alexa needs.

author: Sandy
title: Drop in rocks for elderly
content: Absolutely love the drop in feature for my 85 year old mother.  She doesn't have to do anything, just follow my voice and then sit down and chat with me.  I then "hang up."

author: bbywillk
title: Great all around system.
content: We love our amazon show! It does everything we ask it too and has helped simplify our lives. The best part is we got ours on sale and bought one for my in laws. Now my children can call their grandparents whenever they want. We love the news function at the beginning of the day, the weather details, we actually use the timer quite a bit as well. We also watch shows while cooking. We almost always have music playing as well. We love it.

author: Quentin Moore
title: Best Echo available!
content:
The Amazon Echo Show is a voice-activated device. You can instruct it to play video content, play music, stream online audio, order products and services, and control home automation products. The Echo Show is the first device of its kind to feature its own screen, which in my opinion, greatly enhances the use and potential of this device.

I’ve been using this device for a few days so far. Below you will find some of my initial impressions:

### What I Like ######

Good build quality: The Show has a nice, bright screen that has good viewing angles.

Good sound: The speakers on the Show sound much better than the original echo.

Easy setup: Setup was extremely easy, mostly due to the Show’s touch screen. After making a few selections, the Show was up and running in no time.

Content suggestions: When you aren't interacting with the Show, it continuously displays content suggestions. I like that it will suggest videos to watch.

Video content: I like being able to view Amazon Video, video news briefings, movie trailers, and YouTube videos on the Show.

Video calling: Video calling works as advertised. I like being able to initiate a call with my voice.

Music with lyrics: When playing songs from Amazon Music, you can see album art and song lyrics on the screen.

Home automation: Like other Echos, the Show can control your smart home products. The show has the extra ability to display camera feeds.

On-screen apps: The echo can display my calendar, reminders, lists, timers, local weather, and more. Because of this, I find the Show infinitely more useful than the original Echo.

### What I Don't Like ######

The Show needs more functionality that leverages the touch screen. I trust that new skills will be added over time but I'm disappointed that more wasn't available at launch.

The Show should have an audio-out port.

I wish the Show could have a bigger screen option, a video-out port, and/or video casting capability.

The show should not be used as an alarm clock at this point. There's no backup battery solution at the moment. The display currently is too bright for a dark room.

The angle of display and the camera cannot be adjusted.

None of the Echos can answer all of the questions the Google Home can answer.

None of the Echos can cast video to a TV like the Google Home can.

The Echo Show is not cheap.

### How will I use the Echo Show ######

- Playing Music from Amazon Music
- Watching videos from YouTube
- Controlling home automation products and displaying camera feeds

# # # Bottom Line # # # # # #

The Echo Show is the best Echo available. It's also the best voice activated device available. The addition of the screen makes it infinitely better than any of the other options.

While display and touch specific functionality is limited at the moment, we can trust that both Amazon and 3rd party developers will add new functionality over time.

If you find the Show's price to be too high, the Echo Dot is still a great device. It's also not an expensive investment, should you decide to replace it with an Echo Show later.

# # # Echo Show vs Echo # # # # # #

If you are trying to decide between the Echo and the Echo Show, get the Show. You'll get better audio plus the potential for much greater functionality via the touch screen,

# # # Echo Show vs Google Home # # # # # #

If you want to cast video and audio, Google Home is the better choice since none of the Echos can do this.  Other than that, I recommend the Echo Show over the Google Home because it has more skills and it has a screen.

Yes, the Google Home can answer more complex questions. I just think people will use these devices more for consuming content and controlling smart home products than they will use them to ask complex questions.

I own both devices so I have the best of both worlds.

# # # Suggested Improvements # # # # # #

Add a physical home button and back button on the device and on a compatible remote

Add a camera that can pan and zoom and track faces that are talking.

Add an audio-out port.

Add a separate alarm clock module that is resistant to downtime related to software patching, software crashes, network outages, etc.

Provide a option for displaying video on a bigger screen via a video-out port, video casting, or bigger Echo Shows.

Add the ability to customize the home page with custom apps, custom news feeds, social media feeds, etc.

Add the ability to do image searches and 3D images searches

Ability to display my commute route using google maps, with traffic

Add Skype support and allow voice initiated calls.

Add the ability to stream live TV from a cable box, TIVO, or the internet.

Add official apps for SiriusXM, Netflix, Hulu, and YouTube. The YouTube app show allow you to log in and verbally access your playlists, history, subscribed channels, etc.

author: Steve Fernandez
title: The entire concept of this is great. I own an Echo
content: The entire concept of this is great.  I own an Echo, Echo dot, and Tap.  The speaker sound is very good.  I truly believe the Echo and Tap are a bit better as they provide sound in 360 degrees.  But this is still very good.  The screen is just the right size and very useful foe pulling video data when you need it.  My only concern is that I would love to "video chat" with people regularly.  However at 229.00, it is not as affordable to everyone as the Echo.  I am hoping they will go on special for Prime members soon.  Many friends and family members would love to have one.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best of show
content: We enjoy this so much. Love the screen and info that comes on from time to time. Makes phone calls using the speaker system and the sound is better than my wall phone.

author: Rabbit Hill Manor
title: Caution: device cannot access the Alexia App on the device screen.
content:
This device is a big disappointment. our family listens to long tail music such as classical and soundtracks.  the verbal interface on the alexia defaults to most played pop and rock and never understands our very specific requests, with music unlimited.  So I expected this device to be able to access the alexia app as a default so that detailed selections could take place within the app.  Customer service says the device cannot download and show the ALEXIA APP.  an echo screen device cannot access alexia app??????  Ny session with Amazon chat service was ramazinly distasteful.  No help and it took 45 minutes to get that answer.
Me: voice acces to music unlimited on echo show for my parents always plays wrong item. How to get the music app on the echo show?
You are now connected to Sumit from Amazon.com
Sumit: Hello, my name is Sumit. I'm here to help you today.
Thank you for being a Prime member.
Me: Sent my parents an echo show with music unlimited. they want classical, soundtracks, big band... not pop music. voice only returns pop tuens even to specific requests
Sumit: I understand your concern regarding Music Unlimited songs on your Echo Show, please do not worry i will try to help you out with this.
Me: why is not the alexia app a default on the echo screne?
Sumit: Wedge, may I know what commands you're giving to your Echo Show?
...
NEED MUSIC INTERFACE ON THE ECHO SHOW.
...
yes. it does not understand.. that is the point. verbal music access only works for mas pop music. must use app for classical. where is the app on the echo show screen
...
Gaddam: The application will not be available on the echo show Wedge
You will have to download the application on your smart phone
From your app store or play store
Me: what is the point of the screen on the echo show then

author: Dominic Martin
title: Echo Team - Keep Trying
content: Sending my Echo show back today. The unit was purchased to use at the bedside . The crazy thing would wake up at all hours through the night and light up the whole room, not to mention the oh so loved 'Things to try' nag that can't be turned off. Thanks but no thanks. I see a lot of potential in the device but the bugs need to be worked out and more control over what does and does not show up on the screen.

author: Michael J Fernstrom
title: Great product, BUT DON'T BUY THIS FOR YOUR WORKPLACE!!! COWORKERS CAN CONTROL YOUR HOME SKILLS!!! (for now)
content: While I love the Alexa devices, I would advise against buying one for your workplace until Amazon can change the home skills programming. I recently purchased this one for work to have on my desk for the photo slideshow and music and fun facts. BUT my lovely coworkers have found that they can control my home skills while at the workplace. They found that they could play music and turn on/off my lights at all hours causing lack of sleep and inconvenience. I reached out to the Alexa team, but as of now, you can not disable skills per device, the only fix was to unregister the device on my account thus defeating the purpose of having Amazon Photos and Spotify on my work device. If these skills were to be disabled per device, I would rate this device 5 stars, but since I can no longer use it at work, my Echo Show doesn't have a home currently, as I have these devices in all my rooms at my house.

author: Anastasia Beaverhousen
title: love all my echo products
content: love all my echo products.  This one is nice because of the screen and camera.  Good volume, decent sound quality. All of my echo devices can be glitchy at times:  not responding, losing connection, ect.  Having said that, they work well most of the time.  I love them.  I highly recommend.

author: Tristi
title: Was great until You tube stopped working.
content: This is currently not playing You tube videos which decreases the reasons to purchase it over a regular echo.

author: Clifford
title: Don't buy it yet!  The Echo Show needs refinement.  Don't buy until 2018 or 2019!!!
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player If you were thinking about getting an Echo Show, DON'T. It's not ready for prime time yet. I'm no stranger to technology or Amazon devices so I was very eager to buy the Echo Show. I have a Fire TV, multiple Fire TV sticks, multiple dots, multiple Echos, and home automation running for lighting, yada yada yada. THE ONLY REASON WHY YOU SHOULD GET AN ECHO SHOW IS FOR VIDEO CALLING. (and video calling still needs refinement) I wanted to set up one Echo Show for my distant relative in a care home so we can video chat. There are two approaches to do this. IF YOUR RELATIVE HAS A SMART PHONE BUT NO AMAZON ACCOUNT Setup an Amazon account for your distant relative and log into the Amazon Echo Show using their credentials. Before you do any calling from their Amazon Echo Show and this new Amazon account, you'll have to authenticate a cell phone number first. Well, that's not happening because I don't have access to their cell phone and they sure as heck aren't going to be able to set it up on their own. IF YOUR RELATIVE DOESN'T HAVE A SMART PHONE OR AMAZON ACCOUNT Setup both Echo Shows on your account and ship one to a relative. This will work but the auto-answer feature doesn't work. I work at a software company and we create iOS apps... the Amazon Echo app is RIDICULOUSLY limiting when it comes to managing devices. (see screenshot images) OTHER THINGS I WANTED TO DO BUT COULDN'T I CAN'T LOG OUT! I have to reset the entire device and watch the intro video show that DOES NOT HAVE A SKIP FEATURE and that video show is just a commercial - it tells you WAYS to use Echo Show but NOT HOW to use the Echo Show. STUPID. I CAN'T AUTO-ANSWER! I can't setup the auto-answer feature. The Amazon Echo app is not logical at all. I should be able to set "Auto-Answer" in the settings section for each Amazon Echo Show but the options are super limited. I CAN'T PLAY AMAZON VIDEOS ON IT! I can't even play movies from Amazon video. I tell the Amazon Echo Show to play a video, it says it will play a video and nothing changes on the screen. It's connected to my Amazon account but nothing is showing on the screen. Is it playing on my Amazon Fire TV at home? If it is, why the hell do I need a $229 Amazon Echo Show to do that job when my $49 Echo Dots and $180 Amazon Echos will do the job. Some other issues that show the Amazon Echo needs refinement... + I received a "Template Error" issue. The device didn't know what to do. I didn't know what to do. WTF? + HTML shows in the news section. WTF? This is User Interface 101, don't show code on the front-end... html showing on news Overall, I bought two of these Amazon Echo Shows and I was REALLY disappointed. Save your money, don't buy them. If you need to check on a relative, just get an iPad. For $390 (the cost of two Shows after tax and Amazon's $100 off coupon) I can get a iPad with a 9.7 inch screen delivered to my house so I can set up the wifi, and then shipped to my distant relative. I don't need to buy TWO devices to try to get them to talk to each other and have that fail miserably because they can't even auto-answer the calls from one to another.

author: Wdrop
title: Needs You Tube and ability to Surf the Web. Smart phones can do both
content: I love the calling features on Echo Show. Very handing to speak to family and friends if they too have a Show. No more You Tube, that's a thumbs down. Using timers, scheduler, reminders, etc...all good. Alexa does not surf the web, instead all skills need to be enabled. Apps are ok and all, but my smart phone & tablet can use both apps & web. Why can't Alexa to both? If not for the calling feature as I have more than 1 Show & Dots I would have buyer remorse.

author: Please try a different name
title: It's getting better all the time
content:
I am so in love with this technology and it just keeps getting better.  I can watch cooking videos in the kitchen or prime videos or listen to music or talk to one of my loved ones and set timers and control my lights and and and and...  all with this one device and it just keeps getting better.

Amazon seems very responsive to customer feedback.  I'm excited to see where this technology and the internet of things is heading!

author: William Holt Jr.
title: Alexa is a great new family addition
content: Fun and interesting. Still new to this product, and learning all the new features that Alexa can do. My 2 year old and 5 year old love finding their kid programs to view, fast and easy. I know with this being such a new product that there is much more apps to come in the future with better features too!

author: joyflute
title: Beautiful large screen!
content: I love my Show!  It displays my Prime photos of the day beautifully, tells me the weather, displays my shopping list, controls my lights, and answers a zillion questions!  The screen will turn off completely when I want to sleep.  Alexa doesn’t always understand what I’m saying, but gets it right about 90%.  Turning off the lights is a little worse, maybe 70% of the time she gets it done on the first try, so I do have to repeat myself a bit.  But overall the beautiful large screen makes up for it.  The customer service is excellent too; my Show stopped turning off the screen to sleep one night, and the problem was fixed by the next night!

author: taylor knight
title: I love my new Echo Show
content: I love my new Echo Show. I got one for my mom and I with the discount they were offering. The drop-in feature is really cool. Alexa is very smart and helpful. I love Alexis Easter eggs as well. Alexa also offers you special Amazon deals you can only get through Echo.

author: Hans W. Rudolph III
title: This is my Second Echo have a Echo Spot for living room close to my chair, order the Echo Show to put next to my bed!!!
content: This is my Second Echo have a Echo Spot for living room close to my chair, order the Echo Show to put next to my bed for books and watching Prime TV etc. It's so smart and work with my smart phone adding Appointment's right to my phone and Echo's very good for me because I have the start of demenissa and the echo's and smart phone have become my brain!!!

author: Pekovich
title: Looks great on my Echo Show Shelf!
content: Echo Show Shelf - For Amazon Echo Show When I first got it, I was worried I might knock it over. I didn't want to keep it on my table or a counter top, so I found a cool shelf to put it on. Its called he Echo Show Shelf.

author: StepOne
title: A device like no other
content:
What I like:
it has casual look to it(fits with my decor) with a really nice screen and great sounding speakers. As soon as you say "alexa" it's ready to listen. It's very quick with it's responsive.

What I don't like:
No YouTube. Hopefully the feature comes. Some skills ask for feedback. This should be left alone. It gets annoying when trying to open a skill.

author: Joshua W.
title: Great device but echo show skills are still lacking.
content: Great addition to the Alexa family, just wish it could use the screen more than backgrounds. Don't get me wrong I don't regret buying it especially for the primeday sale of $100 off sale price but for now the skills for the show are lacking.

author: Michael R. Peterson
