title: Used to love my Echo devices; now questioning the purchases
content: I have four of these devices.  Three are in my home; an Echo Show, a Dot, and a first generation Echo device.  My fourth device is in my office.  As a prolific user of Pandora, I was probably using Pandora more than any other music service.  Now, all of a sudden, Pandora has gone completely nuts.  Says I don't have stations that it just played for days prior to that response, and tonight I thought I'd try it again and it shuffled my Pandora stations.  Nope, not what I asked for.  I've checked some other online forums and apparently since about the 15th or so this has been a problem.  I've seen references to an update that screwed this up.  Someone even suggested a conspiracy to get everyone over to Amazon music, which for me is not too desirable.  I have found very little on there that I like.  That's why I use Pandora.  I'm not much of a conspiracy theorist, but this update was obviously a total whack job.  At this point, I can't say that I'll be promoting Echo to people who ask me about it, whereas before I was a huge promoter.  The whole idea of these kinds of devices is to customize your entertainment, and control certain things in your home, etc.; use it in whatever way you like and enjoy.  Well, if I can't do that, these are basically useless to me.  I have written into Amazon, but they have not responded, so either they are inundated with complaints, or their much ballyhooed customer service is not as advertised.  I'm extremely disappointed, particularly since it's turning the corner to holiday season and I was going to use this to have Christmas music and such playing throughout the house for gatherings, etc.  VERY DISAPPOINTING.

author: oo0oo
title: Nice, but could be much more. Hopefully updates fix this.
content:
I’m a longtime Alexa/Echo user, and Google Home, too, and have several smarthome/IoT devices, including the Amazon Cloud Cam, Foscam IP Cams, and Philips Hue lights, and various brands if motion sendors, switches and plugs. Having all of these prior to purchasing the Echo Show, I was really hoping for something special. I’m not completely disappointed, but I really hope Amazon makes improvements out of its own ecosystem (Echoeystem?!).

The screen is a nice size for watching a video or two, but not much more unless you have it on a table in front of you. This heavy base makes it nice and sturdy for a side table, but I’d not want this on a bar, island or table. Consider where you are placing this and the angle of viewing, as it’s not a tablet you can easily move around and comfortably watch any movie or lengty video without getting a neck cramp. The reason I purchased this was to make use of the Cloud Cam, and it works well for that. The camera connects quickly to the Show and I’m able to see where it’s pointed with ease. Unfortunately, you can’t pinch and zoom the screen unless you enable this under Accessibility Settings, which gives a large orange border around the screen.

For the sound, I have it paired to a large set of stereo speakers and the quality is decent. Bluetooth/3.5mm adapters work well enough. I wish this had a 3.5mm jack though, especially for its size. The sound from the Show’s speaker is decent for the size, and seems comparable to the Echo Dot (2nd Gen). It’s facing forward, too, so it won’t fill a room in the same way a Dot does.

The microphone on mine is horrible. I have it placed on a table directly next to me. It’s maybe 1’ beneath my mouth when sitting and approximately 2’ away in distance. I often have to scream ECHO to get it to respond when even the slightest background noise is present, including music/tv, kids in another room, casual chat between others, etc. I’m used to my other Echo devices which pick up the first time the Wake Word is spoken, or my Google Home, which is the same distance, but opposite table. I’m only aware of the front having a microphone as I don’t see holes, even pinholes, elsewhere on the device aside from the power port.

Amazon likes pushing information at your screen which isn’t really informative or interesting, and on par with a popular meme or something in the news. It’d be nice to have the ability to customize your default screen settings to show more than photos, time and temperature. Incorporating Skill Developers into Echo Show would be nice so I could say open up Hue and adjust lights, or open up a News/Media Skill and adjust the sources like I can in the Alexa app. This has absolutely none of that, although it’d be a nice update.

As for video, don’t get your hopes up until Bezos and Brin play nice. Amazon won’t play YouTube videos and uses Bing and Vimeo instead. A lot less selection on that front, but it’s not a device for lengthy viewing anyway.

My biggest peave is the screen shuts off at 5 minutes non-stop. If you’re playing  Amazon Music through your Show, don’t expect to read lyrics or see the displayed song/artist information or skip/back/pause, either. Yes, you can wake it with your voice, or by touch, but it’d be nice to have the ability to control my device and if I want the screen on 24/7, I should have that ability to use it with Amazon Photos as a digital picture frame. It works for that as described, but does power down for whatever reason.

There’s many things I’d change if I were a developer, but I’m not and didn’t buy this for that. I bought it for what was described, and it does everything said, but not as good as other Echo devices, or non-Amazon devices such as a Raspberry Pi and an old PC screen, mic and speakers using Alexa development tools.

Amazon, at a minimum, please add pinch/zoom without the unattractive border taking up 1/4 of the screen space. Add the ability to interact with Skills as you would with a tablet/phone. Please play nice with other companies. It’d be nice to have content outside of Amazon Video/FireTV type content and be able to say search for a HOWTO video on making Slime or something which Amazon doesn’t provide. YouTube does. Google is far superior to Bing (or A9) for searching. Kids use this, too, and it could be an educational tool instead of just a media output and data collection input. Please open to Developers or update firm/software. Thanks!

author: Alex P.
title: It is okay as a video enabled echo just not sure it has pizazz
content: I'm still on the fence with the Echo Show. Granted with the Prime discount at $129 it is comparable in price to the non-show Echo. However, it seems the only thing I'm getting is video communication with the other Echo show in the house. We do have the ability to watch the Ring video doorbells and it is faster at connecting to the doorbell than the ring video doorbell app on Android.. It is faster at finding a tile in the same room than the tile app on Android.  For those reasons I'll say this is okay. It can also allow you to watch Amazon Prime video but I can do that on our smart tv which is much larger. I guess it is letting me move the older Echo's into other rooms where they can provide some music (we have Amazon unlimited music) where we couldn't do it before.

author: S. Weaver
title: It's OK, it works for the most part.
content: Generally this iteration of Alexa is good, but with many caveats. One problem is that the background picture is way too dim. The reason for that is clear, Amazon wants their overlayed text to be the most visible and so the background is almost too dim to be seen. I have my Echo Show on the table right next to me, and facing towards me, still it hears my TV, which is positioned on the other end of the room, better than it hears me. In fact it regularly responds to the tv, but I usually have to repeat myself to get Alexa to respond. I made the mistake of buying some products early on that were advertised as being compatible only to end up with items that did not work well with the Show. In other words, the hype was high and reality disappointing. Hopefully Amazon will improve more on the consumer product and less on its spying technology - which is Amazon's main concern.

author: joe jarboe
title: Its great! got it mainly for watching my security cameras ...
content: Its great! got it mainly for watching my security cameras works great with Ring but the Arlo cameras are slow to respond if at all. I like when you play music you can see the word to the songs lot of nice fetchers on t.

author: C. Hennessy
title: FANTASTIC!!!
content: Just love the Echo Show!  Looking forward to using it to visit with my new grandbaby!  The features are great, love Alexa.  I also have a dot and with my Prime membership, I can now enjoy music in several rooms and the sound is great.

author: David P.
title: Nice but very poor voice recognition.
content: Good picture and sound but much poorer at voice recognition then my two Echo's.  Sometimes I have to hold it up and speak directly into it in order to get it to understand.  I even returned the first one thinking it was defective.  Second one is just as bad.

author: Pierre B.
title: ... from the Android market to make this Echo Show great. I didn't do my homework since the salesperson ...
content: I was expecting to be able to install apps from the Android market to make this Echo Show great. I didn't do my homework since the salesperson told me that it had it's own battery: it does not. I returned It the following morning. I hope the next generation will offer those features. I still believe it's an ok product.

author: Richard C.
title: Cool device
content: Cool device.  It does everything that Echo can do.  The advantage is the display.  You can show movies, photos, and videos on it.  While playing songs, it shows the lyrics.  When on, the display shows your calendar, and news, etc.

author: TiedTheKnott
title: We love the Echo Show
content: It reads to me while I’m cooking, answers my husbands goofy trivia questions, and keeps my 5 and 2 year olds happy. We keep in video contact with our families and have SO much fun with the Show. The reach and response are amazing and we’ve gotten one for both of my siblings, my parents, and my grandma. We love Alexa.

author: LadyGoat
title: Room for Improvements
content: I owned an Echo Dot, and for Christmas, my husband upgraded me to a Show.  I love my Dot, and it is fully integrated into my daily home life, so I had big expectations for the Show, and have to say I am somewhat disappointed.  The microphone on the Show, doesn't pick up our voices or understand commands as well as the Dot. Also, it's nearly impossible to give it commands if there is any ambient noise in the room, such as the dishwasher running.  The Dot is much better at filtering out background noises, where as the Show requires near silence.  You must use very specific wording with the Show to get what you want, which can be really frustrating.  I'd like there to be more extensive parental controls, since there is video involved.  My children love interacting with Alexa, but because the Show needs specific wording for commands, they have landed on some NSFW content that wasn't an issue on the Dot (and yes, this is when the parental controls were already engaged in settings).  The Show connects only to Amazon content, so you can't do a web search or access apps such as Pinterest, which is huge disappointment, since I store many of my favorite recipes on Pinterest.  I expected the Show to work more like a Fire or IPad, and I suppose that's where most of my disappointment stems from.  However, the video calling is great, since some family members also received Shows for Christmas, the connected home features are awesome, and the speaker really puts out some good sound.  Seeing the lyrics when playing music is a fun feature, that my kids like to do karaoke with.  Overall, I feel like the Show has room for improvement, but that's the same way I felt when I first hooked up my Dot, so hopefully, Amazon will take note of the Show shortcomings and improve it to become more fully integrated.

author: J Jackson
title: Screen image breaks up.
content:
Have had this 1st gen since July 2018. Last 3 months the image on the screen breaks up, flashing, flickering, rolling.
Called customer service., was told to unplug for 30 seconds and plug it back in (reboot) works for a few hours or days and  then screen image starts breaking up again.

author: Jason
title: Screen will start to flicker after a while - see picture
content: So, I have a mixture of feelings about my Show. It started out working great, I liked that I could ask it to use smart devices around the house, play videos, play music, and do a goodnight and goodmorning routine. Then, the screen started to flicker and it started not being able to respond to simple commands. In my picture I have an example of me asking my echo to divide 3,000 by 8. Its hard to tell because of the flickering screen but it responded with 3,000 + 8 equals roughly 375, it responded that way both verbally and visually. Which is weird because that's the correct answer to the question I asked, it just kept getting the question wrong. Also with a broken screen

author: K.G.
title: AN AMAZING PIECE OF TECHNOLOGY!
content:
so far so good. I bought 2 of these, one for my son's home and one for us just so we could visit and talk with our grandson whose 3 years old. They do facetime together on their iphones, but we don't have apple products. But it helps that our grandson is familiar with the process.
I think that as improvements are made, this could really help families that are responsible for taking care of an elderly parent. It really could allow that parent to have their independence much longer and allow their adult child to check on them whenever they want.

author: Sean05
title: ... luckily this was on sale got myself one and pretty happy with it
content: Been meaning to buy an Echo luckily this was on sale got myself one and pretty happy with it. not being lazy but really nice to control everything well mostly in the house.

author: MustangGTMan2008
title: Love the Show
content: This is my second Show. I have the other one in black. Now, I have 2 in the house and have connected as a group so never miss a beat with my music playing or if need to add to any list without a issue. Also being able to see the lyrics to music or watch Amazon Prime Video is great!

author: Reader 6
title: So much fun.
content:
We receivede this as a gift, and the fun we have had with it is unbelievable. The Echo Show is great.  This is an amazing way to get any music genre you might want. Just ask Alexa.  We ask for movies, and she gives us a list. She gives correct spellings when asked, and a myriad of topics that might pop into one's mind.
The greatest thing is the laughs she gives us. It is like having a brilliant friend that is also a top-notch comedienne always available.

author: Michael L. Paul
title: The speaker is fine, but the only reason for the video screen ...
content: The speaker is fine, but the only reason for the video screen is to request videos.. From.. YouTube. YouTube has been disabled yet again due to a disagreement between Amazon and Google. From what I have read, Amazon stopped selling Google products that competed with theirs and Google fought back by removing YouTube from Amazon devices. If there is no YouTube, there is no reason to purchase this speaker over any of the Alexa enabled speakers with no screen. It's not worth the extra money and I wish I had not purchased this. Sure, you can video call people with this, but I can do that on my phone and my pc. This is just a big disappointment.

author: John E
title: Waste of time and money
content: The Echo Show was purchased to facilitate video calls between family members. After four days trying to set up the unit, three calls to Amazon Technical Support, Apple and AT &T the Echo Show would not verify the mobile number to allow for the contact list to load. Based on a web search the failure to verify some US cell numbers has been present since 2017. The end result is the same. The problem is referred up to Amazon technical support but no fix is offerred. We will be returning the unit. In short the Echo Show 1 st generation is a waste of time and money. Not ready for “Prime” time. Additionally the Alexa app does not appear to allow for editing of the personal data on the account. This should be fixed.

author: jungleboyj
title: Great Home Assistant
content: I have been very happy with the capabilities of the Echo Show thus far.  The ability to control home automation, play music, create lists and everything else it can do is great.  The integrated speakers generate good sound and the display is good for watching videos.  I highly recommend the Echo Show!

author: Becca Egan
title: SO EASY TO SET UP
content: SO EASY TO SET UP! I didn't know if I would like the Show or need it in my life or not... but bought it anyway, as a way to monitor my pets when I'm not home. I LOVE THE ECHO SHOW! I set it up in under 5 minutes, and I am NOT a techie. It was SO easy. I am using it as a digital picture frame when it's idle and not in use. The speakers are great on this little thing! It works perfectly as a monitor for my pets. I called home and called my Great Dane's name and she came right up to the Echo Show and looked at me and wondered why I was inside this little picture frame! LOL! It is definitely worth the price, if you are on the fence and can't decide whether or not to purchase it. You will enjoy it from the start!

author: Oklamathman
title: A very nice addition to my Alexa family.
content: This sits by my bed and is perfect. I can't wait for some of my relatives and friends get one so we can use the face to face video. The only complaint is most of the alarms are not loud enough to wake me. Had to use the Sharknado one to work for me. HOpe you correct this. I like it that I can vocally set an alarm. Inquire about the score of my favorite mlb team. And I bought it on Prime Day and got it for about half price!!! Thanks.

author: Deedee
title: Having the Echo Show makes it super easy to "drop in" and see what/how they're doing
content: Alexa does it all - makes me laugh, turns on/off my lights, greets me when I walk in the door, tells me the weather, plays any music I ask her to, wakes me up, reminds me to do anything I ask her to.... I mean I could go on and on and on.  My dad bought my me, my brother, and sister all one of these for Christmas as we all live in different states so far away from each other.  Having the Echo Show makes it super easy to "drop in" and see what/how they're doing.  Just be careful where you put it because I had it in my bathroom while getting ready for NYE  in my robe and my dad and sister popped in.  Luckily I had something on, but it was very surprising..... I was like oh hey dad... lol.  I only had it for a few days at that point and didn't realize there are ways to control the settings so no one can drop in at an inconvenient time.  All in all, favorite Christmas gift and so glad my dad bought these!

author: QueenOfPlastic
title: The Echo Show is easy to hook up and easy to use
content: The Echo Show is easy to hook up and easy to use.  It always shows a few daily suggestions, hints, and tools to try with Alexa.  Using the drop in feature is a great thing.  But it can drive the pets crazy when they run into the room looking for you and you are not there.

author: bmxboy
title: Highly recommend
content: Don't listen to the haters this thing is amazing I love tech.  And this is definitely one of the pinacoles of tech

author: DDIGGS
title: Good screen size a good sound.
content: Love it.  Bought an Echo Spot just a few months before purchasing the Show.  Man what a difference the larger screen makes and the sound coming out of the speakers.  Even has a little base to it.

author: Mary B.
title: Haven't set up all features yet.  But so far, works as promised.
content:
The jury is out on this for me.  I have not utilized all of its features.
I have mainly used the Prime Music, and Peppa Pig videos.
I do like the fact that Prime Music picks songs and stations based on my library.
And you can set an alarm to this music.
 It can not handle to many words in the question.
And, if you want to shop...you can only shop AMAZON.
I asked it to look up a price on a certain site, all it would give me was Amazon.
If Amazon wants us to get rid of our other devices, then it has to incorporate their features into Echo.
It has to stay plugged in to work (I could be missing something).
Looking through Prime videos is cumbersome.
You can control your TV with his using the Fire stick.  Haven't done that yet.

author: Brook Hurd
title: Four Stars
content: I love the screen but the mic isn't as good as the regular Echo

author: Frances J. Wheatley
title: Love my Echo Show
content: There is only one thing I don't like you have to be in front of the Echo Show to see if Alexa will respond to you. Other than that it's great I love it.

author: HS Tulsa
title: Not ready for Prime!
content:
Originally I gavr it 3 Stars, but after a couple months still cant use music as an alarm tone and “ask alexa BS” still can’t remove.  Basicallt just avoid the Show, its appears the Amazon has abandoned it, new products and the Show has not improved since release.

Its a great product but only 3 stars because you can not use pandora or amazon prime music as the alarm sound.  No calendar view, what? You also can not remove the ticker information from the home screen because I want to see crap I don't want to see.  Amazon has a potential great product but it doesn't have the basic functions it should.

author: Robert M.
title: Everything I expected...and more!
content: This device was my 7th in the Amazon Echo family.  I wasn't sure I would like it, but as it turns out, it is my favorite so far.  It does all the things the other devices do, but with added video.  I love that you can customize the "desktop" with your own picture.  I also love the fact that I can integrate it with my security system and view my cameras.  I would recommend this device to others that like or have Echo devices in their homes.

author: CJ
title: it has some pretty cool ambiance skills
content:
Pros: solidly built, I can view my cameras just by saying "Alexa, show me living room", I can initiate a video call and monitor the room the Show is in by saying "Alexa, drop in on my Show" from my phone, it has some pretty cool ambiance skills, I can see my weekly schedule as it's being read by Alexa and it makes a pretty cool alarm clock.

Cons: simply put: it needs more skills to take advantage of the touchscreen, video capabilities, and camera. Right now, the skills are pretty limited and the ones out there are not taking advantage of this platform to it's fullest extent. Case in point, I can view my Ring Doorbell's camera but I can't answer the door through the Show. Another example, I can view my Dlink camera but I can't touch the screen on the Show to pan and tilt the camera. I'm not sure if the limitations are in the Show's software or the lack of initiative on the part of the hardware makers but for the Show to live up to it's potential (and to justify it's cost) we need more offerings specific to this platform.

author: cannoneer
title: Not super-high resolution
content: I don’t know what I had in mind before purchase but I seem to use it for reading the lyrics to songs. Seeing the result of math and spelling questions is handy. The screen dimming/ wake up sequence could be more dynamic.

author: Rick
title: The next best thing to being there!
content:
We are a long time Amazon family. We have had echo devices since they came out. Amazon's drop-in feature allowed our 5 & 7 year old grandsons to call us any time they want. When the Show came out we bought 3 of them, one for us and one for each grandson's house. And do they make a difference! The grandkids just have to says "Alexa drop in on Nana" and they can let Nana know that mommy is being mean to them! (hehehehehe!!) And my wife loves it that she gets to see her grandsons every day.

How awesome is that? Well, for the kids, not so much for mom!!!!!!

author: Binny
title: Nice concept, but the speakers on my Show are ...
content: "Powerful, room-filling speakers with Dolby processing for crisp vocals and extended bass response" I Think Not! Nice concept, but the speakers on my Show are truly horrible. I expected a lot more for the $150 price tag. They sound like some homemade speakers from a tin can. I have an extensive music collection on Amazon Music, but I cringe if I want to listen in the room where my Echo Show is located. The Echo 2nd Generation however, sounds great.

author: Terry
title: I am in love with Echo Show!
content: Love the Echo Show.  I have Amazon Prime and use it every day to listen to my local radio stations and hear Amazon Prime music.  Also my wife likes it for getting recipes while cooking, instead oh having to have them printed out.

author: Tiffany.l.g
title: I don’t know how we did life without!
content: What a beautiful product! We connect our Echo products through the house for surround sound and the Echo Show has spectacular sound quality. We use it as an alarm, a timer, we play games on it, have mini dance parties and drop in via the Alexa app on our iPhones to check on our babies when we’re at work. This photo is a screen shot of me checking in from work on my dogs at home. That one capability makes it worth every cent.

author: Mark R. Wolf
title: Absolutely amazing. The voice recognition is the best I’ve ever ...
content: Absolutely amazing. The voice recognition is the best I’ve ever seen...putting Siri and Google voice to shame. The amount of music you have access to, if you’re Prime member, is all you could need. Though a friend added Prime music for $3.99 and the library is incredible. Didn’t run into a limitation once. I have to mention the speaker output quality is amazing. In a large room and small the music was nearly perfect. I couldn’t recommend this product more.

author: Larry
title: Screens act up a lot
content: I have several amazon products and I will be replacing them all with Google. I have two Eco Shows and bought one for a friend and out of those three two of the screens flicker on and off.

author: Louise Garcia
title: For real, what would I do without my Echo Show?
content:
I was one of the first very lucky people to have ever purchased an Amazon Echo device (years ago). I think you had to be invited and put on a waiting list to buy the first device. I plugged that little tower with the swirly light into the outlet and asked it to play a song, and, wouldn't you know, it picked my favorite! I was hooked!

Fast forward a couple of years, and Echo magically transformed itself into a device with a screen! So, what did I do? Buy one for every room, of course!

The black color is awesome, but I decided to also try the white color, and it's just as beautiful. Plus, I think the light color goes well in places like kitchens, bedrooms, offices, etc.

Anyhow, you don't need me to tell you how nice all of the Echo devices are, but I had to tell ya anynow!

author: Maryanna b.
title: My music sounds so good now!
content: I bought this on a whim...I have recently purchased 5 hours and 21 minutes of Bee Gee music from Prime music and need to hear it loud.  This has such great sound. This fits my needs very well and I'm asking Alexa more and more as time goes on.  I like the news reports and local weather reports.  The selfie camera makes nice clear pictures.  I was disappointed that uTube was not available but have gotten over it.  Because I can play plenty of music in Prime music. I haven't watched a movie on it but probably will someday.  I am enjoying the music I love so much I just have to say that I am very happy with my Echo Show!

author: P. Aroh
title: So Much Fun to Use!
content: So much Fun to Use!  We haven't learned to use the video chat function yet, but are looking forward to being able to do that with our kids!  Alexa is a amazingly helpful and we like to be able to see the weather and news in the kitchen while we're cooking.  It's like having a virtual friend!

author: C. Lange
title: Horizontal Streaking problem "Get Me By FIX" Found. Exchange showed the same problem as the original.
content:
Had the same problem on my original Echo Show and the refurbished replacement that they sent me. The streaking effect in the picture shows up when and if it wants to. It didn't show up on my first one for a few months so I was out of the return or exchange time. Send it in for repair and got a refurbished Exchange unit. Unfortunately it started doing the same thing intermittently after a month or so. I really love the product and the concept but you have to get one that works without this type of issues that can't seem to be solved and are in all the Echo Show products. I have many other Echo products that work great but this one definitely has been a disappointment and a costly one at that.

Update......I have discovered that going into Settings, shutting off the automatic brightness, and reducing the brightness level until the horizontal streaking lines disappear seems to have stopped the the problem. Maybe this will help yours as well.  I don't see the point to sending this one in for exchange since the likelihood of getting another one with the same problem seems very high. It works well since I did this but only time will tell.

author: James
title: Alexa everywhere!
content: Alexa is the modern microwave. We didn't k how what we were missing before. Now that she's here, we won't live without her. I had to buy the show to work with my echo 2nd GEN. I love e that they'll link together and play music everywhere. No I need a few DOTS and the house will be complete.

author: AlyD
title: My high hopes were dashed
content:
I’m very disappointed in this product that I had high hopes for. Alexa does not hear me correctly about half of the time. Between the other half she gets about a quarter wrong such as, asking a simple question and she doesn’t know the answer or pulls up something completely irrelevant, literally just quitting out of listening to me after I ask a question, or quitting out of a timer when I ask how much time is left.

Edited to add: After leaving my review Amazon techs reached out to me via email. They gave me directions and insight on how to work with my Alexa to have it function better. Following their instructions, I did what was asked to help including having Alexa learn my voice. Now a week after taking those steps, my Alexa is just as unproductive as before if not worse. Things that are happening now include asking Alexa to play a show called Suits and literally everytime Alexa plays a playlist they 'think' I would like which is some weird song or artist I've never heard of or played music even relatively close to what I've listened to. Another thing, dismissing timers I have set with no warning or alert. Like today when I set a timer for my kids food that was cooking and wondered why 7 minutes seemed like it was taking forever and when I ask Alexa to show me my timer, she says there is none. So, now I can't even trust this Alexa as a $130 glorified timer.
